column13:
Stopped here after checking Yelp on a three hour youth football hiatus. Staff was very friendly. We started with their chips, salsa and guacamole. The guacamole was great. My daughter ordered the kids' menu macaroni and cheese- totally homemade and delicious. 
I had the grilled veggie wrap, little too much sour cream, but it was yummy. 
Husband had the BBQ beef and garlic parm fries/ he was pleased with both. 
My boys had burgers from the kids' menu- cooked perfectly, and the cod sandwich which was huge!
All in all we were so pleased with this place and we look forward to being back in the area for football so we can try them again!

A friend and I were in the area after a football game we went to, and were glad we came upon this place on Yelp! This place is awesome! We ordered the buffalo chicken dip, which was soooo good. I ordered the BBQ Bacon burger w sweet potato fries, best sweet potato fries I've tried ever, and had to try their homemade chili which was super delicious! I didn't get to try the burger because I had gotten so full, but it looked really good!

Let me just mention how wonderful Zuzu was with us. As soon as we walked in she was so nice. She made us feel like a couple of friends visiting a friend at work. She asked for our names and used them, which is unlikely when you go to a restaurant. Loved her bubbly personality. Overall, she is the icing on the cake to this restaurant for sure! 

If you are ever if the area, go check this place out.  Living out in Indiana, I would definitely drive the hour to have dinner at this place again and to see Zuzu!
Great food good prices and very good service.  FIrst time trying and pleased.  Well run family business.

Wow.  We were just looking for a casual dinner out...and this is bar food at its best!  Reuben quesadilla is totally genius.  Everything is homemade, lots of organic veggies....and a terrific burger.  Service was very attentive and we met the owner and his wife.  Great to support a locally owned business and we can't wait to go back!  Ogden Ave is a tough location since everything is a little bit old...but step inside and you are getting gorgeous high-tops, plenty of TV's, and a very warm environment.  It honestly takes a lot to impress me...French fries that were perfect, juicy burgers...everything we had was delicious.  We'll be back with and without the kids!!!

After car shopping late on a weeknight, we were STARVING.  I was trying to find a place to eat and my husband said "let's go to the adorable place we passed on the way in."  I had no idea what he was talking about, but in my low blood sugar haze, I just let him pick and we ended up at Bryan's.  This place was GREAT.  I have to say that I was completely jealous of my husband's fried fish and fried shimp platter, which was the star of the show.  I had a chicken sandwich, which was good, but not as good as fried things late at night.  The server was super nice.  She was doing a great job taking care of all of the people there, and there were a surprising number.  Seems like a great local establishment.  If we lived closer, we'd be there all the time.

Excellent all the way around. Our 9-year old said if there was such a thing as 5,000 stars, that's what they'd get as a review. We were looking for someplace last minute to watch the Cubs and grab some food (with kids) and this place totally made our night. From the second we walked in, we were treated like regulars -- our waitress even suggested an alternative for part of our order and we're glad we took her advice. Delicious food and perfect service!

I recently reviewed Bryan's.  We had visited on a Thursday evening, and though the food was not good the service and atmosphere was nice.  The owner has reached out to me.  In her emails, she really cares and wants to make our experience more positive.  With such a involved caring owner and chef I wish them well.  Please give them a try!

My sister and I came here on a rainy Friday afternoon for some appetizers and to check the place out. Its a smaller place but very cute and cozy inside . We ordered cheese curds, buffalo cheese curds, and spinach dip. The only thing I could say is that we ordered waters and we were one of three customers in there and it took a bit . But other then that , our waitress was very nice , she answered questions about the menu and was very pleasant . The prices were god for the portions you get. The buffalo cheese curds were my favorite, dipped in blue cheese! Plus Ive never seen them anywhere else so it was new to my sister and I. I would definitely go back for another round of those
Neighborhood place with a good feel. Had burgers for the first meal. Service great and friendly. Drinks also. I'd recommend this place to friends. Keep up the good work Victoria.

I felt a bit betrayed by the reviews on this one.  Five stars?  FIVE??  My guess is that this is a local favorite with loyal fans who are pumping the ratings.  BUT...

For a local place it's great.  Someone called the atmosphere cozy and I would agree.  The mood in the place was comfortable with everyone, especially at the bar, seeming very open and friendly.  There was karaoke last night and it was good karaoke.  By that I mean that it was just ordinary people having fun.  I've been to a lot of karaoke nights that are more like shows of semi-professionals.  Your ordinary shower singer would feel intimidated even with their Beer of Courage under their belt.  That said...

I didn't go here to be "where everybody knows your name....."  I was a stranger and went for really good food, as indicated by the ratings.

We were told that the fish and the burgers were the best.  I had the fish and it was most definitely not the best.  The breading was heavy and doughy and tasted a bit stale.  The fish - two pieces - was nothing to get excited about.  I substituted onion rings for the fries for a dollar more and was unimpressed.  Three thick rings that were just eh.  The cole slaw also was just okay.  The burgers looked fine and were said to be good when asked but there was none of that exclaiming that goes on when you're eating a really great burger.

They seem to have a really good selection of beers.  Service was friendly but patchy.  Might be that they were short someone because on a Friday night I doubt they'd schedule only one server.  

Only real negative was that they have a patio out front that people use for smoking.  They may as well have smoking in the restaurant for as much as the smokers passing through pollute the air inside.  Blech.

So in short....if this were my neighborhood place I'd probably be giving it five stars all day long because there was something about it that does inspire affection but it's not nearby so I have to look at it as in would I get in my car to go here?  Would I want anyone else who was searching for food to think this was the best choice?  The answer there is:  Doubtful.  It's okay but I wouldn't go out of my way.

This place is my new favorite. Zuzu was super nice and funny. Had us laughing all night. Favorite new Hawks place. 

Zuzu 43 is the shot to have! Waiting for the chicken to happen.

Going to be here for my game nights! LET'S GO HAWKS!

I cannot rate the food, we only stopped in for drinks.  Our server was friendly and, I was told, the place has really been cleaned up with the new owner.  Plenty of TVs around the bar area, but we had to ask for the Clemson vs Notre Dame game to be turned on.  It took a while before someone, apparently, found the correct remote to accomplish the task, not that the game was worth watching.  Free popcorn, but there was none available when we were there.

We will probably return to try a meal here.

4 stars for the food.

I've eaten at Bryan's several times now and I am completely in love with the fried chicken! I met the chef and owner's wife and here's what she shared that all servers should tell everyone on their first visit: it's fresh, never frozen and hand-breaded at the time of order. It came out crunchy, well seasoned and moist...I absolutely crave it. I also had their perfectly cooked broccoli and a side salad. As seasonally appropriate, they buy their vegetables fresh from local farmer's markets and have a rockin' homemade balsamic dressing. 

On the con side, the atmosphere doesn't fit the level of food. I would call it local-diner-meets-sports-bar. There are ample TVs, chotchkie sayings on the walls and a plastic picture menu, reminiscent of Denny's. There's outdoor seating that faces the automotive shop next door and Ogden. And traffic on Odgen can make it quite difficult to turn in and out of their parking lot. However, the kitchen and bathrooms sparkled. The place is well maintained and really clean - just not super inviting...

Considering their food alone, however, Bryan's has a tremendous amount to brag about. I think they need to do a better job of this. Here's where my decades working in branding are going to get annoying, but even their website doesn't give you a feel for their high-quality ingredients and preparation. Instead of telling us about the chef's food chops and their passion for quality, they published a vision and mission statement that focuses on a clean and safe environment...sports, TVs... fun and camaraderie. I guess that's what they've hung their hats on but I don't feel that's what makes Bryan's special. It's the food.

So all said, I will return to eat at Bryan's over and over... but I likely will eat and run and not linger.

Bryan's was a convenient place to meet for a work thing, but I probably wouldn't go again.  The server was very nice- recommending the burgers, so I ordered the sliders.  I was really hungry but they were fairly dry and unmemorable.  Eating companion's chicken wrap was ample and looked good.  OK spot for something  casual but meh.

Great place, good food and a very friendly atmosphere.  The staff goes out of their way to make sure you are taken care of and feel welcome.  
Well worth the visit.

Stopped in for lunch today.  Very friendly!!  Food was amazing.  I had the buffalo burger. I wish we lived closer, we would go in for Trivia night (I cant remember what night that is).  This will definitely be our new go to place for lunch!!  The owners wife was really nice, she also makes the deserts and gets all of the vegetables at the farmers market every Saturday!  Friday is Fish Friday, Monday is Momma's Meatball Monday, Tuesday is Taco Tuesday...that's all I needed to hear!  I love Tacos and cant wait until we go there for Taco Tuesday! Again, I only wish that we lived closer.

We came in the door at 11 and asked about the kitchen being open, they said yes!!! 7 in our party, ordered, all of us ordered differnt menu items, all where extremely  tastey!!! The service was phenomenal. Ate and listened karaoke, sung along and and laughed. Great atmosphere, strongly recommend.. also 4 different tv's... We are from out of state and was nice to find such a welcome experience!!!!

Stopped here after visiting Morton Arboratum with my infant grandchild. when we walked in everyone stared like they never saw a baby before, so we almost left. BUT so glad we didn't, owner and waitress couldn't have been nicer. Food was great.  Fried chicken was right up there with best ever. Pricing was very reasonable. Will come back next time we are in the area!
Holy s***. Best. Cheesecake. Ever. Food was delicious. Staff was delightful. If you want a good "homemade" meal - Bryan's is your place.

My wife and I dined here tonight around 6 with our 4 year old. I live in the area and had been to this place many times before new ownership. I always had found it fine but unremarkable. That's changed. The burgers we had were awesome. I'm not saying to make this a destination, but if you are in the area it's well worth the stop. Both burgers were cooked perfectly. I loved my olive burger and my daughter seemed to agree since she basically licked her plate clean. 

My only negatives are that it is a bar first. I knew with the Holiday and a lot of people not working tomorrow it might be a little rough with hard drinking and language and to a degree it was. The staff was very friendly, but there were only 2 of them so it was slow at times as they were also tending bar. I love craft beer and they had a very average selection. The one I ordered I really enjoyed but the Brewer wasn't listed. I asked the waitress and she didn't know. They served it in the breweries own glass and by the logo I was able to find it. Improve in that area and I'll be back for more than food.

Overall, good food. Friendly atmosphere. I'd just be careful, like any bar, you show up at a appropriate time.
Great food and service.  Very friendly wait staff.  Large beer selection.  Pizza and sliders were good.  Kid's Mac n Cheese is homemade but daughter still liked it.  We'd visit again if in the area.
Victoria's Mojito's made with fresh mint from her garden are to die for!!!  And good here is ALWAYS the best!!  LOVE this place!!  LOVE Bryan!!
Great service, Bryan is awesome! Love the food and atmosphere here, karaoke is a blast

We stopped by for quick round of apps and drinks. Although the initial service was slow enough to make us worry, Bryan himself (we later found out) stopped by to check and make sure someone had greeted us and ended up taking our drink order himself. 

Because we were there for 1/2 price apps, we ordered the sampler and a calamari. The food was very tasty - homemade onion rings were huge. The chicken tenders were juicy. The mixed drinks were great too. 

The restaurant had the expected issues of a 9mo old restaurants - mostly that service was a bit slow. But having Bryan stop by made a big difference for us, and we really hope his place does well!

Lauren our Server had a wonderful smile and greeting.  Bryan the owner greeted us and was all over the place ensuring every guest had a great experience. The food was outstanding especially the homemade Broccoli  Cheese Soup and Onion Straws.  The Onion Straws are freshly made and have an awesome flavor.
This place is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! .

Bryan and crew catered a fabulous meal for our event. The food was plentiful and yummy. Not your typical buffet with skimpy servings or watered down flavors.  They arrived on time and set up everything perfectly.  Food stayed warm all evening.

Fun & Great Place!

Stopped here for the first time after work for drinks and dinner and was very impressed.  Friendly staff that makes you feel immediately welcome along with well prepared meals and a good menu selection. Well worth stopping into. You won't be disappointed.
Great friendly neighborhood spot, good food too.  Annie and Kamila are the best.  Make sure you get there by 5 for Country Time!
Great food, great people, great location. I work at Bill Kay Buick GMC and the grill is open late AWESOME!

Its hard to notice on Ogden Rd , parkings on side of building and parking in back. Good food, good friendly service, great make your own combinations and daily specials .We were there for lunch, they have a nice neighborhood bar with a little of old time bar feeling.From signage theres a lot of fun things to do almost every nite.
Enjoy.

Excellent food. Chicken is to die for. Desserts are homemade and possibly the best I've had in a long time. The owner Bryan personally takes the time to make sure you enjoyed and explains the menu like its art.

First time visitor and would go back for more. Half priced appetizers was a plus and the food was great. There was only one server (the bartender) for both the bar and seating area at 5:00 on a Wednesday, so service was a bit slow. Otherwise, everything was great.

The food was very good.  It was one of the best burgers I have ever had.  The bun was toasted perfectly and the patty was cooked just how I ordered it, I was surprised how good it was.  The bar menu was adequate and I was able to find a few beers I wanted to try.  The atmosphere was about what I expected from a place with American in the name.  It was decorated patriotically (not over the top) and had a nice local feel to it.  If you go,  Get a burger!  Seriously, I got in an argument about how good it was.

Bryan's American Grille is a neighborhood gem. I eat here at least once a week and have never been disappointed. The service is outstanding, Camilla goes out of her way to make the customer feel welcome. The food is delicious, great menu with a wide variety of choices. Fast service if you are on your lunch hour and a place to relax after your work day. 
Make Bryan's a regular stop !!!!

A friend and I stopped in on Saturday night for Star Wars trivia. We were promptly seated by the hostess where we asked (always a plus!) Our server brought us an extensive craft beer menu as well as complimentary popcorn. 

We ordered the wings on recommendation and were not disappointed! I don't know what they do to them but they easily blow all the chains away. The potato skins rocked also. 

After trivia ended the bar became a little more crowded but you could still hear the audio of the hockey game that was on. I love bars that don't play music during a big game. 

There's a stage for karaoke that they do on Friday nights and plenty of flat-screen TV's with all the games on instead of just one game on like some places. 

The owner (Bryan) came out and met us. Very nice guy. Made us feel very welcome just like everyone else in there. It's a nice, cozy establishment where everyone is there just to relax and have a good time.

We hear the burgers are very good also. The only bad thing I can say about this place is that we lost at trivia but we'll give it another try on Thursday.
Get the fried chicken dinner!  Amazing.  Great staff, warm and friendly atmosphere - My first trip there will certainly be bringing me back - OFTEN!  So glad I found this place.

My wife and I decided to visit this place after passing it a couple of times. We walked in and were greeted with a smile and got a table immediately. The waitress was attentive and friendly. We ordered  the steak nachos; which was available in two sizes, she got a fajita salad, and I got a wrap with garlic Parmesan fries. The food was PRISTINE. The fries were piping hot, the guacamole was creamy and fresh, the steak was tender, and the romaine on my wifes salad was fresh and crisp. The owner even came out to say hello to us and gave us a free piece of homemade cherry chocolate cheesecake. (Heavenly) By the time we got the check I felt like we had robbed the place. The Quality is unbelievable for the cheap prices they charge . The best part about this place that you can take your family there mid afternoon for a very welcoming meal where you feel at home but, when the sun goes down you can definitely get together with your crew have a good time here. The bar was clean, they had a patio, there were TVs everywhere, and they even had a bloody Mary that had a MINI CHEESEBURGER on it. They also have a trivia night and karaoke. I will definitely be back here.

A group of friends came here one night for karaoke. It turned out to be a blast. The owner Brian was present and nice. He was slinging shots behind the bar too. Busy guy. Pretty good atmosphere, solid beers, solid food. Definitely recommend trying!

3 words...ORDER THE CHICKEN!  I no longer cook fried chicken at home, I come to Bryan's. That's saying A LOT!!!  Sure, they've got awesome burgers, fresh cut fries, buffalo chicken dip (WHAT?!), and an Italian beef sandwich that my son likes even more than a Chicago favorite chain (you KNOW who)!  Also saying A LOT since for all the time we lived in other states we had this chain ship the sandwiches to us just to shut him up. 

Back to the bar...
Nice family atmosphere before 8. Great fun with karaoke on Friday nights. Live bands on Saturday nights (meh). Sports on Sunday's. All among a great group of regulars and did I mention there is booze?!  All with free parking, casual dress, incredibly friendly staff, and plenty of seating. 

I love this place.

My first visit was on Thursday 1/28/16.  I had the beef sandwich, rings and a cup of chili.  I would say the beef sandwich is average, nothing special.  I did like the onion rings and the chili was good!  I would go back and try other food as well.  The owner Bryan, did come to our table to make sure we had a good experience etc, that was definitely a nice touch.
Excellent local neighborhood bar. Great food, drinks and the employees here are very hospitable.

I was there with two of my girlfriends on a Thursday  for an early lunch. I had not been there since the new owners have taken over. Despite having quite a few TVs in there it wasn't as noisy as I remember it to be. That's not to say that I don't think it could get noisy, especially on the weekends. However, it was a wonderful place to go for lunch. Everyone has said in previous reviews how friendly the people are there and I would have to agree. We all had hamburgers and they were delicious! I would definitely go again.
Great food!  Great service. Friendly staff. Family owned and it shows!  Great neighborhood atmosphere. Owner takes great pride in his establishment.

The food is great, nice stop for burgers and sandwiches! But don't expect to leave promptly. I come often during lunch and am always late getting back to work because there's only one server (two if you're lucky) at that time.  Try the bourbon burger (Shanahan's burger- from the old menu). That bourbon sauce is amazing!

So glad new owners came in and took over.  Great place to go with family (yep, kid menu) or for a date night.  American comfort food at its best.  Prices and portions are great.  Nice selection of wines by the glass and craft beers.  Lots of homemade items on the menu. Fried chicken is worth the wait.  Trust me on this one.  They have live music on certain nights.  This is one of those places that doesn't try to be something it's not.  It's on Ogden Avenue in Downers Grove and it seems perfectly content with its lot in life.  That yelpers is a good thing.

We had dinner and drinks here tonight! It was a great experience and Bryan is so friendly and inviting! The food and service was amazing! We had the potato skins and the onion strings as appetizers. Then we had the grilled cheese and tomato soup. Everything we so delicious! Will definitely atop in again!
Loved the Buffalo Chicken Dip. The nachos and spinach dip were only OK. Great service.
Outstanding neighborhood bar with great food! Bryan is always a gracious host and his staff is top notch! I absolutely love it there. Try the dry rub wings and the baked cookie for desert.

The drinks are great, food is great, and service is great. My friend and I came here one night after work on a Monday for $5 martini Monday! I got the Reuben quesadilla, sounds weird but honestly was delicious! Definitely will get this again. My friend got the fish and chips, really good and not a strong taste. Bryan came up to us while we were waiting for our food and took the time out of his night to introduce himself to us and thank us for coming! Now that's a business owner. Cannot wait to come back!

Party of five on a Saturday night. Started with the Buffalo Chicken dip, should have ordered 2. Onion rings are the best I've had in a long time. Fish & Chips were excellent and we all enjoyed our meals. They could have used an additional server because ours was swamped, the food made up for it though. We will be back.

Exactly what it says it is, your neighborhood place. And that's why I'm giving it high ratings. Someone else said, this is not a 5 star place. No, we're not rating on expensive, fanciness. I'm rating it based on what it is, and they're doing that well. A Cheers type place where everyone seems to know everyone. Waitress was giving hugs and Bryan himself came to the table to say hello and thanks. Great place for sports, a little better than your average bar food made in house, fun gimmicks at nights and free popcorn. What else do you need? If you want to rate it on fussy, expensive things, it's a 2. Go somewhere else.

I work down the road from here and this is usually my go to place for lunch. I have tried quite a few meals off the menu and everything always arrives hot, freshly cooked, and delicious. My absolute favorite is the Shepherds Pie! It's a must have! They've added their own little twist to the gravy the meat is in... While I can't finger exactly what that taste is its nothing short of awesome, served with fresh warm breadsticks or garlic bread. If you're in the area give them a try!!!
Everything was delicious and everyone was very friendly.  We will definitely come back when we are back in the area.   Definitely recommend the Cajun chicken sandwich and Cajun fries!!!

Went here for lunch on a Friday and sat at the bar.  Server/Bartender was very nice.  Food was excellent! BBQ Bacon burger is a must.  I'll be coming back with my wife to try their wings, and buffalo dip.  Overall, great neighborhood place!

Neighborhood feel with food take a drive for.  Had the Patriot burger, cooked medium, and loved the onion strings.  Came from Shorewood to meet up with some friends, good stuff!  Husband and daughter also raved about the Reuben and BBQ bacon burger

Another excellent meal at Il Poggiolo. The buccatini is very good as is the chicken Marsala with the best green beans I ever ate & perfect mashed potatoes. The appetizer are stellar as well. The staff is attentive and friendly. Only draw back is it's a bit loud when it gets busy but if you sit upstairs it's somewhat quieter.

I enjoyed the service very much here. We were not too happy with the way the oil and garlic" pasta was prepared- so flavorless. So we asked to have them fix it. They added more spice, a little spinach and it was much better.

They were very nice about the fact the dish was lacking.  

The wine selection was good but by the glass a bit $$, but I guess its Hinsdale? and that's what you get.

The decor was pretty and the mirrors on walls really added a cool look to the room.

My dad and I decided to eat out last minute on a Saturday night and this restaurant was wide open on open table for reservations. We rarely frequent downtown Hinsdale and really didn't have many expectations for this restaurant and needless to say we had a great experience. 

My dad and I sat at the bar and enjoyed our dinner there. The atmosphere and ambiance were great and something we really enjoyed.  We each ordered a glass of wine and our dinner came out very shortly after ordering. I ordered the Carbonara, I have eaten better before but this was very good nonetheless. My dad ordered a rigatoni dish which he really liked. The portions are not huge and what you should eat. Bread was never brought before the meal and we had to ask for it to be brought out, which wasn't until after we received our dinners. Not a big deal, just not the best service. The chocolate cake and ice cream almond dessert was very small and underwhelming, as well. Typically my family shares desserts because they are so big but this was not the case. 

Now that I know what to expect, I will most likely return to the restaurant. The dishes were very good and I enjoyed eating at the bar.

I found this place by accident and I'm very happy I did.  I walked in and sat at the bar, which is not crowded on weeknights.  Garrett, Chris and Henry all are very attentive and take good care of you.  The dining room is fairly standard for Italian restaurants but what I think sets it apart is the upstairs.  It's got a lot of personality and makes the spot look not cookie-cutter.  The bar area is quite elevated and cozy.  All of the staff thus far have been great both with attentiveness and recommendations.  Also the bread they bring is very good.  It's been hot every time and they bring cheese and Parmesan, just how I like it.  For those of you like me that need some guidelines when it comes to suburb portions, I will say the apps are probably in line with what you would expect, maybe a 6 out of 10 on the largeness scale.  The entrees weren't super huge but definitely larger than a city portion.  If you get a pasta dish, you will likely take half of it home but it's at least not some of the places I've been where it's a family style that should serve a table of six.

The fried calamari to me was just average.  I like that they bring you a marinara and aioli but it was nothing special.  However the burrata is outstanding.  Literally might have been the best burrata I've ever had and I eat it alot (including making various dishes at home).  They serve it with roasted cherry tomatoes and a basil sauce (they might want to add just a tad more of this) but the flavor and freshness was really amazing.  The carpaccio was very good, but I felt like it needed a little fat to bring it together.  Perhaps just a drizzle of olive oil.  Overall though, I'll definitely get it again.  I also tried a special pasta they had which was squid ink and lobster tail.  I should note that not all of their pastas are made in house.  I, personally, as someone who makes my own pasta very regularly, find it hard to compare dried pasta to fresh.  It's not flavor but texture that really stands out with fresh to me.  The pasta was legit.  I thought it was perfectly cooked and it had a few fresh veggies in there but really wanted the pasta to shine.  The lobster was grilled and a tad overcooked but not rubbery.  It was also served in the shell, which makes for a dramatic presentation but not always the easiest to eat.  My husband got the chicken parm.  He is a chicken parm connoisseur.  I only say that because he is typically highly critical of the dish.  He said this was one of the best he's ever had and the best in years.  The chicken was still moist but the outside crispy (not the bit I had but he assured me the majority was).  The sauce was the standout to me.  Typically I feel like restaurants focus on the chicken and the sauce literally just tastes like bland tomatoes but this had a ton of flavor both in the chicken as well as the sauce.  This is becoming one of my go-tos!

Last night I had a disappointing experience at Il Poggiolo. I'd heard mix reviews before the evening started but decided to go anyway to support a charity that was hosting an event there.   I was part of a large party that had a reservation made for 20 people which also included 3 young children.  The children behaved perfectly despite the obscene wait. While I can appreciate that it can take a long time to prepare and serve a large party I feel that waiting almost 2 hours is unprofessional.  When we placed our order we even asked the server what would be the fastest meal and after he recommended a pasta we all ordered pasta thinking it would come quickly.  It didn't. After waiting we immediately asked for our meal to be packed up because it would not have been fair to our children to make them continue to sit there asking them to continue to behave so that they could eat in the dinning room.  We eventually ate the pasta at home and it was okay but nothing special.   

 In this case I place fault not on the server but on the kitchen and the manager.   The person I assume to be the manager stood near the bar the entire wait staring at the dinning room and never once noticed that our large table with kids was the last to get served and that we waited forever. 

I would however like to say that while the server did not help rush our order they were polite throughout the evening.  I also feel the bartenders were very polite.   Again though while sitting at the bar while we waited for the rest of our party, the person I suspect to be the manager appeared rude with the way I saw him interact with the staff.  

I will not return.

I was very impressed from the time I walked in to the time I left. Nice decor, friendly, knowledgeable and professional staff. The yound girl that took care of us (tied back dark hair) was very nice and made excellent recommendations. The calamari, chicken marsala and angolotti (sp) were incredible. Definitely expect to drop at least $100, but for us, it was a nice date night and we would definitely recommend others to check this place out as well. Originally was looking to come here with a group for lunch on Sunday, but they are not open for lunch on the weekends. I was surprised that on a Saturday night, the place was pretty empty (considering they are in downtown Hinsdale).

Things started out well. A group of us was gathered near the front at a couple high boys for some pre-gaming appetizers and drinks. The appetizers were really good, but then again I rarely meet a bruschetta that I do not like. 

The dinner was also okay. Not a ton of menu choices but enough. My food was not to my taste, not very flavorful. My husbands food was also bland. Others at the table seemed happy, so maybe it was just us. Our server was nice and efficient.

Here's where things get strange. During desserts and coffee, someone starts yelling "last call". Mind you, this is restaurant, not so much a bar. There are a few tables filled, probably 30 people in the place, so fairly populated. Shortly after, the heat is off. Completely. No heat, no oven. It gets freezing in there fast. I did not think we were there past close, rather, that someone needed to get out at close, which mean everyone had to be out the door. It was strange to say the least. Our bill for 10 was over $1,000, we weren't loud, and we weren't the only ones there, so I'm not sure what was happening, but for just okay food I am in no hurry to get back. Which is a shame, because I really wanted to like the place.

Came here for lunch with the kids two toddlers. food was decent the menu options were not as Italian as I expected. Great portions. That homemade lemoncello was just ok. 
}
Food is ok (at best) and service is generally bad.  We also hosted a large party here and they tried to take advantage of us and overcharge on food and alcohol - to the tune of a few hundred bucks.
Enjoyed their short ribs! Good service, food and a wide selection of wines. This place is really nice and there was plenty of parking.

We went on a Saturday evening.. It was packed! Thinking this was a good sign.. We sat at the bar....Although the bartenders were nice.. Their services was not so hot.. as they were slammed, the bar area was little (they kept bumping into each other) and there was a annoying/ demanding waitress that kept 'needing' their attention-as apparently her drinks weren't ringing in...Food: sub par! I've had much better! Noodles over cooked... Braised short ribs.. Steamy hot and Falling part.. But not fresh.. More microwave hot... Especially for two entrees and 2 glasses of wine for over 100$.. I wouldn't visit again.. And would not recommended it... Looks to be to many great places in the area!

Authentic Italian food, great atmosphere and decor. Nice restaurant for friends to catch up on weekends, and very intimate during the week. This is a great restaurant for older people as well as it is spacious and easy to get to tables, main floor has no steps. Upstairs party room is very nice-- great place for private party. Highly recommend.

If you're in Hinsdale and in the mood for Italian, I'd go here. If you're in the area in general- I'd head 3 miles south and go to Capri in Burr Ridge.  The food here isn't bad...just nothing special. The decor is nice, the service good, but food doesn't leave me wanting more. Italian doughnuts were tasty, but not enough to keep me coming back.
One of my favorite local Italian restaurants. The arancini are excellent, and I've never had a bad entree. Hope to be back soon.

The Chilean Sea Bass was outstanding, nice atmosphere, the hostess, Katia, is wonderful...and the manager, Dan, gets the subtleties of exceptional "Customer Service".   
I'll be back!

Came here for Mother's Day. We will never be back here again. We had reservations for 30 minutes after the restaurant opened and we were seated immediately.  The place was decently crowded, a lot of people there for brunch.  We started by ordering a round of bloodies. I asked for a grey goose Bloody Mary, but then told me they pre mix their bloody Mary's.  Which I can handle, except for the fact that they couldn't tell me what kind of vodka they used (they think it's absolut).  My mother and sister (mother of two) were the reason we were out for brunch.  My sister was 6 months pregnant at the time so we ordered a virgin Bloody Mary for her. The waiter said all the drinks were coming from the kitchen where they were pre mixed so there was no virgin ones.  Fine. I'll go to the bar and get one.  The bartender just so happened to be pouring a Bloody Mary out of a premixed bottle and then adding vodka to it.  A virgin Bloody Mary shouldn't be a problem. He told me he couldn't do it. Then someone (who I assume was the manager) told me they had no more mix left because a group of older women were there drinking earlier and they consumed all the mix that wasn't already premixed....keep in mind this place has only been open for thirty minutes at this point....I don't like being lied to, especially when I give you my business. It's unfortunate. I probably would have returned. Food wasn't bad.
Great bartender but really charge a dollar for ice for every drink.ridiculious. Won't be going back any time doon

This restaurant has DELICIOUS pasta! I have thoroughly enjoyed all my meals :) It fits right in the downtown perfectly. I would highly recommend people coming in for lunch or dinner. They do accommodate larger groups. My only complaint is when we had a larger group, it was difficult hearing everyone. However, who needs to hear when you can eat!

Pretty good, I haven't had any reason to complain when here. But I haven't had any stand-out moments here either. The food is good, and I am a fan of the way they decorate the place; very warm and intimate, especially at night. Service has always been reasonably quick, and we've never had to wait long for a table (interpret that as you wish). Not the best Italian place around, but it's certainly not bad in any regard. Give it a shot, if you've got a taste for Italian and if you're in town.

Great looking place. Great food. 
Service needs work. Our waiter was not efficient. He took half a drink order and he needed constant reminding. We received our food but without other necessities, like salt/pepper, butter, toast, cream cheese, syrup, etc. It took him about three trips to get it right. No automatic coffee pours or water. Their system is off, lots of miscommunication and staff bumping into each other.  However, great food.

We stopped in for lunch when we were on a house hunting trip. Very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food.  We each had a salad and shared a sausage and pepper pizza.  The crust was thin, crispy and delicious. We enjoyed our meal and said we would go back in the evening and enjoy a glass of wine at the bar.

Went for lunch so can't comment on a larger dinner experience.  Very solid place and food served in a charming space.  Friendly staff and professional service make this a nice solid go to place for the near west suburbs.

What a great menu, the building was extremely clean and our service was fantastic.
We went to dinner as a group of 4 and everyone really enjoyed the food. The Ladies Loved the Speciality Martini's.  Garret went above and beyond to ensure we had a stellar evening.  We will be returning shortly.

We had dinner her last Sunday night.  We were starving and over ordered.  We started with grilled and fried Calamari, Meatballs, and a Flat Bread Pizza.  For our main course my husband got the Hangar Steak, my mother in Law got Grilled Salmon and I had the house salad with Grilled Steak.  For desert we had Nutella Gelato, Tiramisu and a cranberry apple tart.  What a meal!!!!  Everything was amazing, and enjoyable.  As we over ordered, the extras made delicious lunch the next day as well.  The staff was attentive and made our dining experience a special evening although it was just a regular Sunday night out.  Highly recommend!!!

Considering the many options for Italian food, I would rate this restaurant as being about average. The dining room and bar areas are classy and modern. Looking up to the ceiling, you will find unique light fixtures that resemble giant lamp shades. The service is friendly, prompt, and pleasant. After my first visit, I walked away quite impressed, having ordered the arancini and margherita pizza. Arancini is basically a ball of risotto, fried. It had a nice, crunchy texture to the outside; rich and creamy on the inside. 

At my second visit, I also ordered the arancini as an appetizer but tried the pepperoni pizza for my entree. The pepperoni pizza was extremely greasy, and I absolutely would not recommend ordering it. Also, for reference, the pizza is more than one person can handle. 

Overall, cocktails are good but not out of this world. 

This may be a nice place to check out if you are in the area but I wouldn't make a special trip for it.

I like the food very much and the wait staff have always been great.  
I've been twice on Thursdays (last was 1-15-15) when they have live music and it ruins the whole experience.  The singers are good, and in the right venue listening to them would be nice. The restaurant is small and the acoustics so loud that we had to literally yell to our table mates.  Yelling to each other becomes exhausting and doesn't lend itself to good conversation.
I will avoid Thursdays and enjoy dinner there on other nights.

Jerry Kleiner who owns some of my favorite spots in Chicago (Carivale, Gioco, Marche, etc) has done it again with his latest venture- this time out in the "Burbs". Yay! And it's actually in my town of Hinsdale. 

Il Poggiolo (the balcony in Italian) opened about 8 days ago in what used to be a silent theater in Hinsdale back at the turn of the century. Characteristic Kleiner touches are evident- the huge oversized red chandeliers, the metal and leather chairs, the bar reminiscent of Room 21 and Park 52, the eclectic decor of Marche. And scattered around the walls are pictures of Kleiner's various trips around the world (or so says the manager). 

Hinsdaleans are obviously in need of a good restaurant as this place was packed on a Monday night. We got there around 5:30 to enjoy a drink at the bar before our 6pm reservation. We chatted with the bartender, perused the specialty cocktail list and basically checked the place out. 

We were seated right on time and as per our usual- ordered a variety of things to split and taste being that it was a new place. 

For our appetizers- we went with the carpaccio and the meat antipasti plate. Both were good but the meat antipasti was the clear winner with three kinds of meat, figs, grapes and 3 kinds of cheese. 

Finally on to the entrees. We had the sea bass (served with skin and our least favorite as it was dry) the lamb chop special (delicious, tender, done perfectly) and the pasta with bolognese sauce (absolutely delicious!) We also ordered the risotto special of the day which came with figs and Gorgonzola cheese. It was just okay. 

The chef, Jim Kilberg, who recently was the chef at the now closed Via Ventuno creates some wonderful dishes. I was a fan of his there and now that he is just a couple a blocks away makes me a happy camper. 

The biggest issue Il Poggiolo has right now is service. They are still finding their way. The wrong appetizer came to our table the first time. There was a long delay in getting the right one (not sure if the server entered the wrong one or what). 

Three times people came to our table with food that was not intended for our table and had no idea where to take it. Flatware was removed and not replaced so we spent quite a lot of time just looking at the food on our table as we had nothing to eat it with. And finally- water and wine were cleared before we were ready to leave. All signs of a new place with some settling in time needed from it's staff. 

But for me, the shining moments of service in the evening came from a young man named Austin. I have no idea what role he plays at this place but twice he noticed something that was wrong and ran to rectify it long before we had to ask. Nicely done. And because of him- the other service glitches were remarked on and forgotten. 

Hinsdale needs a place like Il Poggiolo. Good food served in a classy ambiance right in the neighborhood. Give the service a couple of weeks to catch up and I think we've got a winner. You can almost hear the old silent movie stars who once graced this place clapping their hands and saying "Bravo"!

Four star food, two star service. I enjoyed my meal, but watching the servers lavish attention on other diners while we were often neglected left a bad taste in my mouth. Regulars should always be treated as such but all customers deserve a certain level of service that we didn't find here.

Came with my parents and sister, as the parents had enjoyed this place before. The space is okay, maybe a bit pompous but what restaurants in the suburbs aren't?

Calamari was toothsome with a crispy batter and killer homemade tomato sauce. Endive salad well balanced with candied nuts and sharp cheese pairing well with the slightly bitter endive. All the pastas dishes were very good, a light touch of cream on the rigatoni and sausage, decent seafood with the spaghetti and great bolgonese.

Was slightly annoyed they had no idea how to make an Aperol spritz. And again, the service! I had to get up and flag down a manager to get some extra silverware after being soundly ignored several times.

Decent food but inconsistent service doesn't convince me to return.

Finally, we had service as great as the food here. We had Sean E. who was FAB - we have been here several times and wanted to love this place because the food is so good. My husband had the Bolognese (which he says is the best ever), my 
mother-in-law had the butternut squash tortellini special, and I had Frutti de Mar (seafood including 1/2 lobster tail) w/pasta.

 All the stars were aligned last night because Sean and the food were a perfect match !

I don't know how often I'll get out to Hinsdale to eat, but Il Poggiolo is a solid recommendation in my book. 

Gorgeous interior, high ceilings, two floors of beautiful decorations. The large mirror in the main dining room diffuses the natural light streaming in perpendicularly from the window-lined front. Outside, classy cafe sidewalk seating. Inside, bistro casual with white tableclothes and butcher paper to protect it.

Their Insalata con Tutto, a Cobb salad with pancetta, was delicious and perfectly (lightly!!) dressed in an unobtrusive vinaigrette.
The hamburger with gorgonzola was tender and juicy, with sweet red onions that melted in my mouth.

And man, can they make a nice Italian coffee!

My hubby, son, and I visited on a cold winter day, hoping for a great experience since my daughter raved about this place.  We must have had a "bad day" experience - the service was sooooo slow and orders were wrong.  Avoid the lemon water martini.  I might go back only because the interior was beautiful.  Atmospherics were urban, unique, youthful.  Food was fun fusion - son loved his meal.  I'll give it another chance.

I've been here several times and I have had a positive experience.  The service is good and the food is very good as well.  The decor is nice and there is a beautiful bar to order a nice cocktail.  We have visited with both small and large groups and have been happy with the experience. I love many of the pasta dishes! I would come back again for sure!

What a neighborhood gem! Hinsdale has been overloaded with too many restaurants and im happy to see this one staying busy! We used to come here at least twice a week but do to my new job we can only make it out a couple times a month.  The food is spot on and the service is even better.  I have never been into a place where everything runs so efficiently.  I met the manager Giani back in the summer, which I think was one of his first days and to see him now work the crowd and staff is great. He doesn't seem to run around crazy like the past hostess/manager.  Also if your looking for a recommendation ask him he has never let us down!  In the colder months I wish the valet stand was closer to their door because walking in the snow is a little messy.  Looking forward to sitting outside soon!

A good choice but not an 'awesome' or 'must do' type of place.

Beautiful dining room with a high ceiling and interesting design. The food was better than average but not spectacular - that is not a criticism, just an assessment. Service was about the same, above average but not great.

For the price point I expected a little better. But, not bad.

I think I just found my new favorite Italian restaurant. Dare I say it's better than my former love affair with La Scarola? I went with one of my best friends, Kristina B., to celebrate her birthday and new job. She has been raving about this place for awhile now and wanted to share the yummy experience with me. I am not complaining at all. I fell in love...hard.

The decor and ambiance was what I anticipated for a posh town like Hinsdale. However, for a Monday night it was unusually crowded. The bar was packed and every table was seated. Given that it is an old theater, and the acoustics weren't the best, it was a little loud. We asked to be seated upstairs-- in the balcony. Il Poggiolo actually means the balcony in italian.

We kicked off our celebration with her recommendation on libations...the strawberry balsamic martini. Holy WOW was that an unbelievable drink. The specials didnt drive us completely crazy and we both opted for a pasta entree and started off with the fried calimari. It was absolutely delicious- full of flavor and nice and crispy. The garlic aioli was a nice touch with the lemon to squeeze over the octopus. We practically licked the plate clean! Next, for our entrees I ordered the Tortelloni con Ricotta e Spinaci (another recommendation from Kristina). It was absolutely superb. Bursting with creamy flavor and rich butter and sage notes. I had a hard time not finishing it off! Kristina went outside her comfort zone and ordered the Gnocchi al Pomodoro. It was like little pillows of creamy heaven. Just enough garlic, and they melted in your mouth. You didnt even have to chew!

For the dessert, we ordered the Tortino Di Mele (apple tart with vanilla bean gelato and maple cream sauce). It was a comforting, warm and delicious sweet ending to our visit at Il Poggiolo. I definitely will be back!
Eaten here 5-6 times. Each time food is fantastic, however they often have small portions. I recommend the pasta because it is hand made. Also the salumi platter is a great cheese and meat appetizer.

Compared to the other restaurants I've visited I think this place deserves 5 stars.

The food was good, best food yet that I'm writing a review for.

 This place is the type of food I'm willing to spend money for; it has quality over quantity and I'm alright with that whereas most people rather have quantity over quality.

So about the experience: it was pretty packed for only a 70-80 seat restaurant, smaller than a lot of restaurants out there. Open kitchen, small bar,  about 20 - 25 menu items. It seems like it was a season menu as in menu can change due to what is available on the market which is always a plus. Semi-open Kitchen, small bar about 10-15 seats at most. limited wine and beer list. 

I ordered the carpaccio, roasted purreed fava been soup, and 'carmella' - butternut squash and riccotta wrapped 'noodle' (actually pasta - like a hand rolled ravioli). 

The carpaccio was actually really good. it was thinly sliced sirloin with arugula, truffle mayo and olive oil. I normally not a fan of arugula because of the strong pepper note that is has but the olive oil and mayo really mellow of that flavor; over all a very simplistic dish.

The fava bean soup was pretty simple in it self; one note in terms of flavor, seasoned well. wasn't broke or grainy like most other restaurants would probably be. During the time I was eating it I was thinking maybe another herbal flavor like thyme would really work well with this soup; other than that it was fine.

My main entree the squash and ricotta ravioli was very sweet in terms of flavor, nice butternut squash flavor. Almost felt like a dessert and entree at the same time. The only problem with the food was that the ends where they sealed the filling were under cooked or raw. because that portion of the ravioli was twice as thick or thicker than where the filling was. It gave the overall plate nice texture eating 'al dente' undercooked pasta. Also wish the sauce was slightly thicker or had more of a sage and brown butter sauce. It tasted more like a chicken stock thickened with butter, and the sage was more of a garnish; having to actually eat the sage leaves to get the sage flavor - which wasn't really infused into the sauce.

Last note the dessert:
I had a taste at two actually. First the Fig tart. had like a licorice caramel on the place, with a vanilla gelato. The problem with this dessert was that the crust of the tart was super thick. Like 50:50 ratio to the filling. It was like eating a pastry crust cookie with the fig filling. It wasn't a good ratio, but the flavor of the tart filling was nice.

The other dessert was the tiramisu. Wasn't a fan at all. Worst of all the cream had gelatin in it. It was like eating a poorly made mousse cake. You basically can put a brick on that tiramisu and it would have held. The flavor was bad, When I think tiramisu I think of a strong coffee flavor. This had like an off star anise flavor to it. couldn't eat more than 2 bites to it.

Over all the service was great; my server knew what she was doing. Understood the menu, and cared for her customers. The food was great; I think the restaurant should pay a little more attention to the desserts other than that the rest of the food was spot on.

Paid about 45 dollars including tip for 2 appetizers, entree, and technically 1 dessert.

Didn't start off well. Was told they had valet parking when I made reservation. Lots of snow in street and very cold. Never saw valet.  I parked across street in an illegal spot. Walked through snow piles in fashion boots not snow boots. Once inside restaurant, Gianni told me there is a valet stand near end of block that services 3 restaurants. Would have been good to know when I called. He graciously called valet on my behalf and had them move my car. On to restaurant review. Nice ambiance and food selection. Food good not great,small portions, overpriced. Was there with a friend. We shared an appetizer, then each of us had a pasta dish, 2 glasses of wine, coffee and after dinner cocktail. Our bill was $145!

The Italian food is very delicious; we had the spaghetti and gnocchi.  Just not so much romantic.  We came on a Saturday night 7PM.  Families, couples, and a bar crowd.  Everything is together; bar, kitchen, tables, etc...pretty noisy when busy.  I'll definitely come back here if I'm in the area.  The prices on the menu are very reasonable too.

The food, drink, service, and ambiance of our entire dinner experience were superb, definitely on the high end of spectrum of the best high end restaurant experiences I've had over the years.

The food: Everything was excellent.  Appetizer (layers of cheese, sauce, and eggplant) and salad (various beets with extra fresh goat cheese (NOT the hard feta cheese of less nice places)) were excellent, but what was really OFF THE CHARTS amazing was the fresh pasta dishes.  The Caramela (butternut squash-filled FRESH pasta) was truly excellent, if you like a sweeter pasta dish as I do.  The chicken filled FRESH pasta with truffle sauce was off the charts if you like creamy more than sweet.  We even loved the little touches and extras like the excellent bread, and the kind of olive oil that is a slightly earthy green color like the higher end restaurants have.

The drink: The wine was excellent as it usually is at nice places, but the true STAND OUT was the lemon cello.  It was icy cold and tasted like fresh lemonade, even containing tiny bits of lemon pulp.  I don't know if they made it themselves or just doctored it up, but I've had a lot of chilled lemon cello out the the bottle before, but this was the best I've ever had.

The service: We were treated very well. The main server (Heather) was excellent, even when compared to the class of servers at high end places.  She was very personable and knowledgeable, and was the main act in a very well-orchestrated service experience that included what I I believe were four other wait staff as well, all coming into and out of the picture at the right times.  The word "prompt" isn't the right word, because that implies that we were wanting of something for a short period of time, and then somebody showed up to "promptly" fill our want.  The word "predictive" is more accurate, because our main server and all the support staff were always there with the right thing before we knew we wanted it... it sounds too good to be true but this was our experience.  This restaurant's pool of highly capable service talent is deep as well.  It wasn't just a talented main server with some goofy, mindless extra helpers.  The people who supported our main server made intuitive, thoughtful decisions... they didn't just mindlessly drop off and pick up things.  Too many high end restaurants give you a good main server but mindless support staff.  This restaurant doesn't skimp on any part of the experience.

The ambiance: The ambiance was excellent. I highly recommend a table on the balcony, where you can look over the restaurant and bar.  You'll be way up high, and when you look around you will notice that the details of the three-dimensional space that you will overlook in that restaurant is a visual treat.

We had a superb experience at Il Poggiolo, and I hope that you do as well.
good/great food, excellent service, a bit loud.  Never been disappointed.  Highly recco and it's nice to have a very solid Italian restaurant in Hinsdale.

Don't be fooled by the average star rating.  I almost skipped this place until I realized the negatives typically are highly personal (naming names etc.) and likely not objective.  It's one of the best restaurants in this part of the metro area.
 
The food is very good authentic Italian (not Italian-American).  Great menu with a wide variety of proteins.  Good service and a very attractive room.  Price is very reasonable given the high quality of ingredients and expert preparation.  Kids eat free on Sunday.
 
My only criticisms are (1) the wines are marked up too much for my tastes and (2) it took a while for the apps to come out, probably because the place was packed on a Sat. night so the kitchen might have been in the weeds a little bit.

Great service-attentive, yet not overbearing.  Service is what seperates the good from the great restaurants.  In the suburbs especially, finding  a well staffed establishment is hard to find.  

Il Poggiolo nails it every time!

Food...amazing!  Fresh and priced fairly for its top quality.

I never order spaghetti  in restaurants, but after seeing the dish on the table next to us, I had to order the handmade spaghetti.  I was not disappointed, nor was anyone else at our table.  The eggplant appetizer was the BEST I have ever had!!

The staff accommodated our growing party easily, and our waitress did a great job of handling our large group.  I look forward to sharing this find with friends!

I have been here quite a few times, and every experience has been fantastic. 

I love the decor, I love the bar area, I love the balcony... love love love it all!

I believe I've had something different each time I've been there - and ordered from the nightly specials a few times as well. To start, the foccacia they put on the table is outstanding. In the fall, they had a pumpkin soup which was amazing. I tried a pappardelle pasta with fresh mozzarella that was to die for. The skirt steak is great, with a delicious marinade/glaze - get it with polenta on the side, YUM! I adore the spinach and ricotta tortellini in the butter sage sauce - just a few of these and I'm full! I've had a few desserts here, all of which I've enjoyed - but the one I enjoyed the most was the most simple - on Saturday, I had nutella gelato - borderline amazing.

The service here is great and we always get treated well - there's no rush to eat and vacate your table, they encourage you to take your time and enjoy yourself.

PS - try the strawberry balsamic martini - best martini I've ever had!

PPS- the gnocchi is a must- literally melts in your mouth, no chewing required!

Meh--it's o.k. in an pinch--wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.  Need some menu adjustments.  Didn't have all of the ingredients mentioned in the menu in the dish.  new cook? forgot? 

It is a bit too ambitious for it's skill set.  

p.s lose the flavored olive oil--it tastes cheap

I had linguine with marinara sauce and meatballs.  The meatballs are dinky like the ones you buy in a sack at Costco and the sauce was awful.  I took the leftovers home and found my daughter eating it the next day.  She asked me where it was from because it was terrible.  But..... the service was very good, the wine was very good, and the appetizers were very good.

After writing a negative review, I was invited back by the Manager, who I think may be new, I'm not sure.
I had a much better experience this time.  We visited on a Thursday evening and by the time we left, the restaurant was full.  This is a good sign.
I had the salmon, I loved it.  It was cooked the way I like and was accompanied by white beans and asparagus.
I chose the fig desert and it was excellent.
I am impressed that this restaurant cares so much about it's diners and are willing to keep everything on a high level.
I would recommend you give it a try.

I really enjoyed my meal at Il Poggiolo when I dined in.  I had a take out dinner that wasn't quite as good as expected which is the only reason for the one point deduction.  I will definitely still go there in person as food was good and service was very good.

There is intense competition in the western suburbs for Italian fare.  Given the  great options that exist, I find it amazing this place is still in business.  I've been here four times, trying desperately to support a business in my community, but I simply cannot name one single thing that makes this place stand out.  

Service is just average.  The food is just average.  The owners apparently also own the sushi restaurant next door, which for me questions their passion for being a destination for a great Italian meal.  

Just "average" Italian food in a Chicago suburb should only get you as far as having an "average" hot dog.  Too many great options, this one falls too short.

Okay.  The poseurs still hang out here, even though the place has been open for a year and a half or so.  Was hoping they might move on.  However, I have to say that I gave Poggiolo another try this week.  Service was flawless and I had the best butternut squash ravioli I have ever eaten.  And I've eaten a lot of it.  This version was made with perfectly al dente homemade pasta, and was wading, not swimming, in a silky brown butter sauce.  

I am much more impressed with this place than I was when it first opened.  My first review is below.

Oh, the attitude!  Oh, the poseurs!  Oh, the crowd!  The noise!  Let's not even get to the overpriced food and drinks!  As P.T. Barnum said, "There's a sucker born every minute."   Given the crowds at this place, there are a lot of suckers in Hinsdale apparently willing to part with a lot of money to be shoved into a small space, eat mediocre food and sip much-too-pricey wine.

It really is too bad Hinsdale does not have much in the way of restaurants that are reasonably priced, serve quality food, have a liquor license and are family-friendly.  It's not that much to ask.  Il Poggiolo certainly isn't one of them.

Good lord.  This place has gone downhill, in a fast way.  Back in the day this place was a go to place.   Cold pasta and a fish entree, with a bartender server that was apparently aware of the poor meal is a non-negotiable.  I don't complain unless it's warranted.  Unfortunately, I tried to give this place the benefit of the doubt for months.

Overall it was a good experience.  I think there 's been a chef change since our last visit.  Anyhow, I am glad to report that the arancini remain excellent.  We had some salads that were uniformly not dressed enough but were otherwise tasty and fresh.  I had the arctic char which was nicely prepared but the accompanying pickled fennel was far too overpowering (sour) and the dish was quite unbalanced.  My wife had the gluten free pasta.  The quinoa-spaghetti was actually pretty tasty, nicely al dente, with a tasty creamy sun-dried tomato sauce on top.  Our daughter had the gnocchi with side of meatballs.  This was good.  For dessert, we shared the chocolate cake and the fig tart.  The fig tart was good, however, fresh figs would have been better than the dried ones.  The chocolate cake was just ok.  Service was friendly and attentive.

Ew. I'm soo pissed our lovely Chicago Mag rated Mexican place closed and we get this?!?!?! In typical Kleiner fashion, it's over the top, tacky decor with ZERO emphasis on food. I have been 4 times and NOTHING is good. NOTHING. I'd give some hits and misses if I could stomach anything.

One bathroom for that huge place. Dumb. The "other" owner walking around like he's the god damn President...dumb. Building a restaurant that large in a town where nothing makes it and people are more focused on homes and appearance. Dumb. Being rude to one of those exceptions who spends a shitload on dining out. Dumb. All around sucks, sucks.

I PROMISE you're not missing a thing if you don't go here. PROMISE!

Just moved to the neighborhood and decided it was time to try out an Italian restaurant nearby.  Two friends and me headed to Il Poggiolo after seeing the positive yelp reviews hoping it was our new spots.  Unfortunately, it was not a place we will be returning to.  We were seated promptly when we arrived but our waitress did not arrive until 20 minutes after we were seated.  This place is upper class on the restaurant scale and I got the vibe from the waitress that because we were younger than most patrons, we were not to be taken seriously or would not tip well so we were not worth her time.  The specialty drinks we ordered were the best part of the restaurant.  They arrived quickly and were delicious so if I do go back, I'll be sitting at the bar.  I ordered the linguini with clams and it was average and needed a kick to it.  Others with me ordered the chicken parmesan and it was a bit better.  The patrons around us were all middle aged or older and seemed to be having a better time than us.  Overall, I was disappointed with the service more than the food.

WOW!  My very first impression blew me away!  The decor was spectacular.  The colors invite you in and embrace you, the photos, the lamps, the GINORMOUS mirror...everything screams, "Hello!  Please come in and relax, enjoy some wine, enjoy the mouth watering cuisine, and have a wonderful time."

My experience continued to get better and better when I was seated and my server called me, "Miss," (which, clearly, I am no longer).  Big score there!  He clearly was knowledgeable about the food and the wine selection that Il Poggiolo has to offer.  He was very attentive and always made it a point to check on us, ask if we had any questions or needed anything.  In most places, this can border on obnoxious, but here, it was quite delightful.

The food........OH MY!  Not quite sure what to say.  I have had the good fortune to have tried multiple dishes and have never once been disappointed.  The gnocchi with pomodoro sauce left me with a very happy tummy.  It was smooth and tangy, full of flavor and spunk, but didn't leave me feeling like I had been over-garlicked.  The portion was large enough to fill me up, but not so much that I felt intimidated or needed to take some home (though I'm certain my family was disappointed at the lack of doggie bag...ooops, I ate it all!).  

I have also feasted on the sausage and pepper pizza, the osso buco with saffron risotto, and succumbed to the fig tart for dessert.  Not once have I been disappointed.  Everything - the atmosphere, the service, the food, the wine - ALL are amazing.  You will love it!

You MUST MUST MUST go!

Food is great and service is even better. All the workers are so nice, which makes dinner even better. The tonno appetizer is delicious and so is the arrincini. Go eat there and you won't be disappointed!

I have had the pleasure of dining at Il Poggiolo a number of time over the last year and it has been a delight each and every time.   From the stunning decor (classic Kleiner) to the tasty dishes, to the knowledgeable wait staff and cute informative hostess, everything has always been spot on.  

I have never been steered wrong by the wait staff when it comes to ordering, I am in love with the Octopus Salad and their thin crust pizzas always hits the spot (they have a specialty pizza everyday!!!).  If you are in the mood for pasta their Gnocci is out of this world, they are like little pillows of heaven.  

If you are ever in for lunch the two brothers serving are always helpful and always ready with a joke.
  
No beers on tap but a good selection of bottles and more wine than you can shake a stick at.

I would recommend Il Poggiollo to anyone who wants the big city restaurant feel but doesn't want to leave the burbs.  Lunch, dinner, brunch, drinks, happy hour, sad hour, who cares go get your dine on.

Last minute reservations equal a mighty fine experience. This place was awesome. It was noisy but I was able to hold a conversation at a table of four; plus who doesn't like overhearing some gossip at the table next to you. I ordered the fontina stuffed pork chop which was grilled to perfection and served on top of a bed of polenta. I have always hated polenta and this is not my definition of the stuff. I would call this cheese grits, but that of course does not sound as classy. The "grits" were money and they were gone in no time. My wife had the rock shrimp and saffron risotto and she liked it too. The wine list is extensive and not that over priced as described in previous posts.

+ Pork Chop w/ polenta
+In my favorite western suburb
+Easy to find parking
+ Olive oil

-bit cramped
-people watching was boring (minus the guy who sat at the bar wearing a sequined cubs outfit.
- Dessert menu seamed blah. I don't care is they are made in house. Offer up something familiar and buttery flakey

My husband went for an Anniversary Lunch today, wonderful food, server was new on the floor, first day.  We arrived a bi before the noon opening of the kitchen, so we enjoyed conversing and a glass of wine, ordered our food at noon and received it 1/2 hour later, mind you this was pasta.  When we asked our waiter what the hold was, his answer was sorry they made a mistake on the order and had to do it over, finished a wonderful meal, customer service sucked!!  Good customer service would say, can I at least offer you a cup of coffee for inconvenience, take 10% off bill nothing, very bitter about how this was handled, we have been yo many 1st class restaurants, most over apologetic if an error in order, nada here!!  Poor managerial customer service.  I know this restaurant has been here about a year and a half, frequent for lunch, mu husband asked waiter how long they have been here, first answer was don't know, then comes back with saying it has been there for 5 years.  Poor - poor customer service!!

Definitely 3-star. We're frequent guests during both light and packed times and the service and food have always been great. With a reservation we've never waited to be seated. Whitefish is especially good. Its a no rush atmosphere with service that arrives when expected.

Il Poggiolo is probably one of my favorite Italian restaurants. My family dines here about once a month so I've tasted almost everything on the menu. 

I recommend trying the specials. I once had a pizza with mango and mascarpone cheese which sounded so bizarre but I think about that pizza to this day!

I took my mom here after hearing good things, but was disappointed.  The food was good, but left unsatisfied and a little taken.  

1st, they were having problems with the fryer?  So couldn't have the Arancini, which is a particular fave of mine.  I was disappointed, but hey, it happens.  
For dinner, I had the Gnocchi al Pomodoro which was very good, and my mom ordered the braised duck in wine sauce which was also very tasty.  But here comes the part of where I felt like I was duped a little.  I asked our waiter to recommend a wine, which he did, and it was very good. my mom and I had two glasses each.  The problem is when I received the bill, I discovered it was about $15 a GLASS.  Now, I realise I should have asked the cost, however, whenever its that much the waiter should make a point of it.  If I had a chance to think it over, and was in the mood to splurge, I wouldn't have had a problem with it, but I had a bit of sticker shock when I received that bill.  I live on the Northside of Chicago, and eat out a LOT, and have never experienced something like this.  Also asked some fellow foodies, and they all said our waiter should've given us a heads up if its over $10 a glass.  I would recommended this place if it was based on the food only, but it was the service that left a bad taste in my mouth...so won't be going back.

I heard that the restauranteur who opened Marche was behind Il Poggiolo.  What happened?  Did he forget what he knew about good food, good spaces, and ambience?  

The main level dining room is so noisy that you have to scream your name at the hostess and then at each other during dinner if you want to talk;  but woe to you if you opt to sit on the way-too-hot upper level, where the service is very slow.  Plus, you get to walk up a narrow, long (over 20 steps) staircase, which is used by the servers who, balancing huge trays of food, are scampering up and down.    (This is a workers comp case waiting to happen for them, and for the patrons, a huge inconvenience if you want to go to the first-floor-only, one-person only restrooms).

The drinks are adequate (not generous), much like the wine list, but the food was a huge disappointment.  Barely fried calamari (so white we thought it wasn't cooked) with two unappetizing sauces;  a first course pasta that was scarcely sauced;  a hangar steak that demanded more tenderizing;  and fish that was drowning in so much olive oil that we thought the restaurant was named after an olive grove.  The side that accompanied the fish might have been good, but it was too gritty because the kitchen didn't rinse the sand out of the spinach before combining it with tomatoes, garlic, and barley (yes, barley).  As for our server, we had to ask for bread, but he neglected to give us oil or butter and we had a very long wait for our second glasses of wine.  

BTW, it's not cheap--just trying too hard to be pretentious.

Should be a 1 star, but add 1 star for the bartenders......

My wife and I went last Saturday night,we should have read some reviews prior to going. Anyway, we had reservations but decided to go early to check it out. We arrived about 20 minutes early and when we walked in we had to go through a maze of curtains before actually getting into the resto!! That being said we stood in the doorway for a few minutes before anyone even realized we were there so we just walked over to the bar. My wife ordered the strawberry balsamic martini and it was good, I had a grey goose with bleu cheese olives, also good. The bartenders were friendly and seemed to be busy but had enough brain power to talk to us which was nice. Time for dinner! I went over and told them we had reservations and the hostess asked where we wanted to sit. (I thought, shouldnt you have a table reserved for us??) I said anywhere is fine.

It was very cold last Saturday so we both had heavy coats, I said I would go back to the bar and get the wife and coats that were drapped over the bar stools by the way and we would be ready for our dinner. We waited nearly 10 minutes standing there by the kitchen wondering if she had forgot about us, so I asked another server to get our hostess. Unreal!

We march upstairs to our table. Our server came over and asked us if we wanted to start with a cocktail, ummmmmm duh.....there sitting on our table already...hello?????
Anyway after a few minutes, I ordered a bottle of wine, and lemme tell ya it was an expencive bottle. He brought it over and opened it up in an "OK" manner (I think he was a newer server) but really did not present it well to be honest but poured me a taste and we thought it has to open up a bit yet, so we asked if he could decant it for us. Oh boy.....he takes the bottle and leaves with it, comes back with it in a decanter, great, I just spent $100 on a bottle I am wondering if it is the same bottles I ordered!! I am very sure it was however, but should I have to wonder about that? That should be done directly in front of us.
Anyway, as he poured us a glass, I noticed that the decanter was the most disgusting, greasy, filthy, and down right made you wanna vomit looking decanter I have ever seen!! I didnt want to touch it that is how filthy this thing was. We ordered the calamari  and the parmesan cheese, for apps prior to dinner and the bottle of wine, both were good, but we did ask for the check and went to another place.

I am still in shock, this place should be on top of it for the prices they charge, come on $100 for wine in a decanter that looks like they store it in the mens room behind the toilet. No thanks, my money is green, it spends anywhere!!

This restaurant is mediocre at best. The seafood bisque was inedible (bland tomato soup that tastes fishy-- I sent it back) and the celery salad that I ordered was odd. At least it was edible. My husband's pasta dish was just okay. We won't return. The food did not live up to the atmosphere.

Very bad experience at lunch recently.  Resaurant was more than half empty.  We were a party of 6 and were seated promptly. That was about the best thing of the whole experience.  Service was inexcusably bad.  My mother requested butter since none is brought to the table for her bread.  We ended up having to ask 3x for butter, and then when they finally brought the butter, it was this incredibly tiny pat of butter about the size of your thumb nail!  We just couldn't believe it.  I had to ask for extra lemon for my ice tea more than once.  My brother requested a side of extra sauce for his pizza when he ordered, and had to ask for it again once the food was deivered.

On the positive side, their pizza's are very good, Very thin, crisp crust.  Bread is good and olive oil is provided automatically.

However, I don't know where management was, but no one inquired as to how our meal went, until the very end, when Molly our server did come to the table and apologized for the service but nothing was comped off the bill.  

Restaurant management 101, you should always have the hostess or a bus boy walking around, refilling water glasses, clearing plates, taking care of the little requests like the butter, or addiitional lemons, etc.
