If this was a LEYE restaurant the whole meal would have been comped.  I've been at a LEYE restaurant and not even complained, and management noticed something was amiss and immediately comped my lunch.  

I don't think we will ever return, just not worth it.

This place is ok.  I've had much better Italian at many other places.  For the food I think it's over priced and certain dishes are way too salty.  However I'll give it 3 stars for effort on their drink days.  Staff, well they are what they are...they could work on the customer service area.

Solid choice. Very good service, good Italian fare, and a bustling spot in quaint downtown Hinsdale. Part of a nice evening out. When full, the joint can get pretty loud. Parking is plentiful in the area.

Went to il Pogiolo tonight.  We had 4 people in our group.  We got there at 4:20 on a 
Wednesday.  We were the only people in there.  We ordered the arancini, calamari for
appetizers.  The arancini were still frozen on the inside.  The calamari were soggy.
After we ordered a pizza, and gnocchi with a pesto cream sauce, per our waitress
suggestion.  The gnocchi were gummy, overdone, with no taste of pesto!  The
pizza was dry.  The room was empty, and since we had a 2 year old with us, I
would of thought that they would of not put anyone close to us.  A young couple 
walked in and they seated them right next to us. The whole restaurant was empty.
They had to asked to be seated elsewhere.  The waitress was apologetic, but she
knew that the food was not up to any standards.  We got our bill, paid and left.
We will never go there again, there are too many restaurants now in the area to
go to.  Maybe the owner should be focusing on this restaurant, instead of opening
new ones.

I liked the atmosphere of Il Poggiolo and it's cool that it's in an old theater although surprisingly not that big of an interior considering.  It's in Hinsdale which is a town that represents almost everything that's wrong with America but that's another story.    The service was good and as an Italian I can say that to food was only OK.  didn't wow me.  Just that I expected more for the price in terms of quality.  However if you were a resident of Hinsdale, IL price probably doesn't concern you regardless of quality.  Just sayin'.   Also you might have to struggle a bit to find parking depending on how busy it is in town.

With the single door constantly opening and shutting and the open kitchen, this place attracts BUGS.  Though the bugs were preferably to the employees.  Never have I dealt with a ruder group of people.  I may have given it two stars if the food was any good but lo and behold, Il Poggiolo strikes out.

My guests and I visited this cute little place for an evening meeting... we truly enjoyed the food ... although if I wanted to be picky ...the tomatoes on the Caprese could have been more ripe,  other than that the food is very good.  We truly enjoyed every bite! Yes Very Italian.  I think Russ H was having a seriously bad day or perhaps somebody altogether not happy with a Mr. Kleiner.   

I will say, it's a place that may have you limiting your drinking consumption with the unreasonable amount of $15 per glass for bar wine, we didn't find it justifiable, especially in todays economy; then too at the table finding an otherwise cheap bottle being very expensive.   If I were to order top shelf wine I may expect to pay such an amount, but not even the Ritz Carlton Cafe in downtown Chicago charges that.  I hope they do well, a few tweaks here and there and they should be fine. The area needed a place like this!  The atmosphere is very comfortable too.

We'll give it another try.

I joined Yelp just to review this place, because it deserved it, unfortunately.

I'm a native of Hinsdale, but live downtown and love all the "Marche" restaurants (Opera, Redlight, etc.)  When I found out the same group was opening a place in the suburbs, I was so excited because they ordinarily have unique concepts and exceptional food.  

The place is decorated well, and its nice to have a large bar in downtown Hinsdale.  Fortunately, our entrees were good.  Not fabulous, but good.  

However, that is all the praise I'll give Il Poggiolo.  When I left the restaurant, I literally said to my dining partner, "They must think people in the suburbs are idiots."  

Most upscale restaurants downtown know that they will get customers that know what they're talking about, i.e. Foodies.  Thus, they cannot serve cheap, poor quality, or ill-prepared food.  However, Il Poggiolo did just that.  And it probably wouldn't take a foodie to figure this problem out.

As we ordered our appetizer and entrees, we ordered the tuna appetizer.  The waiter told us not to get it.  Shocked, we asked why and he informed us that he just didn't think we'd like it.  My honest thought was that he must not like rare tuna, as that is how most tuna apps are served.  Regardless of his warning, we ordered it.

He brought out a plate with what looked like catfood on it with some capers and drenched in lemon juice.  As we tried it out, we both turned to each other and said, "This is canned tuna."  As we're both young persons, we have had our fair share of sh*tty canned tuna, so we know what it tastes like, and it was just that.

When the waiter returned, we congratulated him on being right, and asked him "Dude, this is canned tuna, isn't it?"  He said yes, it was.  He explained that not enough people order it to warrant buying fresh tuna, so the chef prepares it canned and calls it fresh on the menu.

Honestly, if it had just been bad, I wouldn't have care.  But the fact that the chef obviously didn't think his patrons were smart enough to figure out that it was canned tuna was just plain insulting. 

Shame on you, chef.

I came here on a very cold night with my son, age 6. 
The two hostesses were really sweet and offered us our choice of seating. I appreciated that and we sat downstairs with a view of the bar and the door. We came early and I noticed that there were other families with small children in this section, which is appropriate. It is noisier downstairs and if you are looking for a quieter evening I would suggest going upstairs.
I love the decor of the place and found it to be really inviting and everyone we encountered was very friendly. Our waiter seemed very new and was "off his game" but he was very sweet and though he kept forgetting things (ie: our drinks, to return our credit card, etc) I am sure he will learn with time!
They had a good wine list and what looked to be a lively bar scene. At 5:30 on a Thursday the bar was filled with an older, after work crowd. 
We shared the lamb meatballs, which were amazing! I had a salad with dates that I loved and we shared a pasta dish that was o.k. Neither of us cared for the sauce, which was really sugary and the pasta was a little gummy. 
The apple torta for desert was amazing and more than made up for the sort of generic tasting pasta. 
I would definitely come back for that salad, the appetizers and maybe skip the pastas and try the entrees. The lamb was so good that I would love to try some of the meat dishes next time. 
All in all it is a great place that is kid friendly without being overrun by kids.

The owners, Peter & Dana Burdi along with the Kleiner team do not know good Italian food.  They are also extremely rude and arrogant.  Mr, Kleiner was having lunch there this week and was very arrogant and you would have thought he would appreciate guests dining at his restaurant.  Not the case.  Hinsdale is in desperate need of a good restaurant!  The food left you not satisfied.  The waitstaff was lazy and not attentive.  The Manager/General Manager never came by our table after I asked to speak to someone about my improperly cooked fish.  

I will never visit this restaurant again and I encourage you to do the same.

Decor is appealing, but the food is fair at best.  Prices are reasonable, but the menu isn't anything special.  I enjoyed the bread that was served before the meal , but the mushroom soup lacked favor, and I tried the Margarita pizza and the crust was dry and flavorless and the sauce tasted like it was tomato pasta straight from the can.

Il Poggiolo is one of the best Italian restaurants in not only Hinsdale, but the Western Suburbs. Its setting is chic and modern in historic downtown Hinsdale, the building was actually a silent movie theater for many years. The Hinsdale restaurant means "the balcony" in Italian and showcases fine Panini, salads, pastas and pizza. My recommendations are the sausage and pepper pizza and the pesce Panini and take advantage of the half priced bottles of wine on Monday.

This place has a very cool atmosphere, and welcoming staff... I made a reservation online during a very busy time and all worked out great thanks to the kind staff.  Service was great, food was fantastic, but it can get very loud... even when the place isn't totally full.  I would definitely recommend if you're in downtown hinsdale and looking to get some quality food from the old country!

It's about time Hinsdale got a real Italian restaurant!

The food is really good Italian... the decor is Kleiner, (which, while it's nothing new to me, is perfectly cool with me) and I feel there is finally I place that I feel is a destination restaurant.  While I usually make the trek into the city to dine, I feel this is a worthwhile choice NOT to.   Furthermore, It's a great place to meet friends and have a glass of wine in the evening.  Also, went to early dinner with my four year old and there was a fantastic children's menu, they brought crayons and they showered her with attention....  They obviously know the way to my heart... 

I'd go here for lunch (business or pleasure), for dinner (date or with kids) or just for wine...    My only complaint is that things shut down early... A western suburb problem, not exclusive to Il Poggiolo.  I'm a night owl, though...

This is a good restaurant... no "for the suburbs" caveat!

Rather than the usual Mother's Day brunch in the city (usually Bin 36) , my family is choosing to spend it here!  Stay tuned for review...
Love this place.  A little pricy, but the whole family loves it!!

Outstanding service. Terrific food.  The Lamb Shank is an absolute winner.  We celebrated my wife's birthday and the owner had a great table for us in the poggiolo.  (4-stars.  I would've given five however, I think the wine list needs to be expanded to accomodate more / bigger California Cabs & Chards -- no ability to byo either.)
So far, so good, for this new eatery. Place gets hopping and sometimes loud, too, especially on weekends. Food is priced well and competently prepared. Balcony was a nice touch.

I swear that most people eating Italian food in America are dolts and wanna-bes who have no clue what great Italian cuisine is really about. Few places do it right in Chicago, such as Coco Pazzo, Spiaggia, Piccolo Sogno and a few others. And most are knee-deep in big ragu, marinara, garlic, yadda yadda. And sure, the poseurs have the faux trappings, such as the great Tuscan/Bolognese walls (wallpaper, btw, not Venetian plaster) and an astoundingly handsome bar. It gave me great promise when I entered, but it took about 8.3 seconds post-bar review to realize that I'd seen this movie a dozen times.  I mean, c'mon, Kleiner has a signature to his restaurant designs, but don't owners ever sit across a table from him and ask, "Ummmm, since my checks seem to be clearing for your design, would you mind terribly giving me something I haven't seen e v e r y w h e r e  else you've done a job?" C'mon. It's beyond boring. It's become a cliche' for his design.  Let's not even enter into the only one bathroom issue for a restaurant that holds 150 or so. Maybe he has a Kleiner-DesignWerks catheter that he can market along with first course offerings.    On to the food: Someone else in these reviews mentioned the infused olive oil (once the bus and bread boy finally showed up). Lose it and opt for just a great olive oil. It reminded me of places that put lemon in table water. It's like a signal that, "Hey, our water tastes crappy, so here's a lemon."  Leave the option of flavoring olive oils to the customer, please.  Also, the waitress who was overstressed with two other parties to take care of my simple two-top, seemed preoccupied and almost put off that we asked about wines by the glass. We ordered the calamari, which was thicker-cut than I'd had before, properly prepared and served with a couple of great thin-sliced and deep-fried lemon.  Our entree' choices were goat cheese ravioli and (get ready for this) buccatini carbonara. The ravioli was good, tasty, pretty, overall a solid a choice. I resisted the choice of buccatini pasta as a carbonara, but was assured it was a huge hit, so I contradicted my basic instincts which are tempered by three years of living in Milan where I never--ever--EVER---would have seen a carbonara made with a big, doughy buccatini. Hell, I'd get laughed out of a place in Milano ordering that. My suspicions were confirmed when it was served. I had two bites and realized that this was just so wrong on so many levels. The waitress finally came to check if "All's OK, hon???" at which point I told her about my disappointment. She said she had it there when she visited Italy for two weeks. Perhaps in her two weeks she went different places than I found in three years. Who knows. Suffice it to say I thought it was less than its promise. Will I go back? Maybe for a drink at the bar, but I normally eschew places where half the bar is inhabited by guys trying to look like Tony Soprano, all in their appropriate uniform: Camp shirt, silk pants, "Mr. T Starter Kit" chains, and enough "rearranging their personal furniture" to make the Seven Bechka Brothers Moving Company blush. One final Kleiner note: The scale and execution of the north wall is off. The big circular porthole window was centered on the total wall width, not the visual center. How did the owner ever allow that to happen? You can't help but look at it and think, "Wow, I thought this guy was supposed to be some kind of Wunderkind, but perhaps he's just as much a poseur as those guys at the bar."  You don't have to be an architect or designer to see that something is visually wrong and this was clearly an unforced, avoidable error.

The food bar is fairly low in Hinsdale, but even so, the food is just OK (homemade pastas are best choice), service so-so, prices reasonable.  The actual space is gorgeous, but you can't eat space.  Lose a star for no corkage, but wine markup not so bad - maybe 2-3x..

Except for the Margharitta Pizza (I know I spelled that wrong) food was average.  The most annoying was after bringing 4 people there on my recommendation we were seated by the door and the bar.  We had to wear our coats during dinner.  My calls on two seperate days to the Manager have so far gone unreturned.  I wont be back.

I fully agree with Kitty K's review below which I think summed it up pretty well.   This place totally UNDERwhelmed me and right away we thought the place was a knockoff of Carnivale, trying to be like a "city" restaurant and it's just not working.   The waiter was awful and inattentive - everytime he spoke, it was like nails on a chalkboard.  Our food never really came on time and I hate it when the wine comes after the food is served.   The portions on my husband's plate were little (pork special with a scary looking pork rind on the dish) and I've honestly had better Margarita pizza at California Pizza kitchen.    Around 7pm they lowered the lights upstairs and it was too dark too see without any candles on the table.    The whole experience may have been a little better if the service was existent but it wasn't.  Save yourself a trip and skip this place.

Second time we have eaten here. Both times we thought the food was very good, and our service experience was excellent. It is certainly a great addition for Hinsdale. The only negative issue is that the noise level in the place is awful. We were a table of four on the balcony and the sound level was so loud that in order to hear another persons conversation at the table you actually had to lean forward to listen or to make yourself heard. What a shame that this spoils what otherwise would be a great place.

I used to be a regular here because it was right across the street from my old house. I moved to the other side of Naperville about 6 months ago and have been trying other Chinese take out places that are closer to my current home. Nothing compares to Taste of China! 

Tonight I ordered vegetable fried rice and egg drop soup. I typically always get chicken fried rice but decided to change up my order tonight and I am so glad I did! There were so many yummy vegetables in this rice, including broccoli, pea ponds, carrots, mushrooms, water chestnuts, YUM! Both items were still piping hot after my 20 minute ride home, another big plus!!!

They have the best combo fried rice hands down. I have eaten a lot of fried rice and I have yet to find one better than here. I order carry out several times a month from here and for a large 9.95 container of rice (which they fill to more than the max- they aren't stingy with the meat either) it is pretty worth it to me. That can feed 3 adults easily! I have not explored the rest of the menu much since I always order my fried rice. Maybe I'll do another review if I ever order something else. For now, go try that fried rice!

Awful! Completely disgusting. I went to go eat here with my friend and we both had a bad experience. She found hair in her shrimp fried rice and my beef and broccoli was less than appetizing. The meat they used was strange in texture and my food REEKED. It was so bad that I am at a loss for words to describe how gross it smelled. Even my friend commented on how horrible it smelled and she sat across the table from me!

Complete waste of money. I will never go back to this place ever again. No one was wearing a hair net and the girl at the cashier had her long hair just draping down even though she went back into the kitchen. Very disappointed. The stomach ache is not worth it.

This little store front takeout place has good fresh food. The place is clean, the service is fast and friendly, and very generous portions for a nice price. I also like that I can order all white meat chicken in my entrees.  Here is the caveat,  my order has never been 100% correct in the 20-25 times I've been there. Whether requesting hold the mushrooms and finding them included,  or just getting the entrees mixed up all together. (Such as ordering chicken Kung Pao and I get Szechwan chicken instead.) This place is located very close to my house, thus I'm willing to take the gamble over and over. You never know what you're going to get but it's generally good and always hot.
Also, make sure you ask for chopsticks, they don't come with the order unless requested.

We ordered carry out from here one rainy evening and got the following:

- Gon Chow Ngau Ho (standard, not terrible)
- BBQ Pork Fried Rice (same, pretty decent)
- Beef with Broccoli (POISON! Okay, not poison, but it was def funky)

Let's elaborate. Since I'm a lady, I'm not really familiar with the smell of a urinal. However, my boo informed me that the beef with broccoli did, in fact, smell like a urinal. It was weird and creepy and we didn't eat it. 

We called the place and they let us bring it back for a refund. Later, we asked our chef friend for potential reasons why the food would have smelled so bad. His guess was that the broccoli was probably really old, which is a better scenario than using urinal cakes as an ingredient. But it is still a little off putting.

So long story short, very standard carry out with questionably fresh ingredients. I've had a lot better. Wah wahhhhhh!
The worst! My friend wrote a review already but I just wanted to add that none of the employees were wearing hair nets and I found a hair in my shrimp fried rice. Gross!

Called and ordered delivery at 8:06 on Thursday night. They close at 9. At 9:02 I started calling them to ask where my order was. No answer. Writing this now at 9:30. No food. No call. No show. Didn't even bother to let us know. ** update**. Just showed up at 9:46 saying his gps isn't working. Expected me to pay full price for cold food. Never bothered to call and ask for more directions besides the detailed ones I gave while ordering.
Great food, fast delivery..but very expensive! I ordered the orange chicken and vegetable fried rice with baby corn and it was 28.00$

All I have to say is that the vegtable egg rolls are really good and that my gluten free wife did not have a problem with the chicken spring rolls. She also said that they were good enough to get again. I would like to comment further but those are the only things we ordered. The service was also good.
We have always gotten our Chinese food here (12 years)! We usually order Crab Rangoon, Egg Rolls, Potstickers and Sweet & Sour Chicken. We have never had a bad experience!

My wife had the cashew chicken, I had chicken lo mein. Her cashew chicken was pretty bland and had plenty of leftovers that will remain uneaten. My lo mein wasn't too bad, but it actually tasted better coldbthe following day. We also had Chix fried rice, which was probably the best rice we've had since moving to the area 5 yrs ago. Undetermined if we will be back.
This was our first time and we are believers. We will definitely order from here again!

Great food. Clean and open view of the kitchen. Efficient and high quality service. 

Cons:
Would like an option to ban all MSG from my account permanently.

Add brown rice option for health conscious consumers

I have ordered from Taste several times. The food is pretty good but they have gotten my order wrong about 1/2 the time. It gets old having to check my order before I leave the store. I mean come on, McDonalds can even get that right.

When we order Chinese we always order from here. It has never disappointed us. My only gripe is when Chinese  restaurants staple the carry out containers. Im always wondering if one got in my order. Yea I have issues
Bon Appetit

Okay, so I used to work here when I was in high school, so you have to take everything I say with a grain of salt, but the food here is pretty damn good. 

It's true that Taste of China goes a little heavy on the cornstarch, but what quick chinese takeout place doesn't? What really shines at Taste are their huge eggrolls, delicious crab rangoons, and phenomenal Hong Sue Chicken or Shrimp. 

The eggrolls are thick and stuffed with delicious cabbage, shrimp, pork, and soy sauce and always hit the spot. Kids come home and want Portillos. I come home and want eggrolls.  (P.S. They have a veggie eggroll if you can't do the meat)

The crab rangoon is also great: huge triangles filled with crab and cream cheese, guaranteed to melt in your mouth. Delicious.

Okay, Hong Sue. It's a dark brown sauce that is savory (and not spicy) and has no cornstarch. It comes with veggie like water chestnuts, carrots, mushrooms, snap peas, and bamboo shoots. It comes with a side of breaded *insert pork, chicken, beef, shrimp here* and is to die for with rice.  Seriously, my go to dish pretty much every time.

Overall, a very good take out place. Yes, the price range is a little high, but those damn eggrolls are what makes it worth it. :)

A pleasant surprise! We did carry out tonight after I realized it was far too hot and muggy to hold myself accountable for cooking. Our wait time was minimal; ready in 10 minutes. The portions are enormous, a large menu item is enough for 3-4. Ordered some staple items - eggroll, Hunan Beef, and General Tso's Chicken.  Sometimes I just want my standard Americanized Chinese food and Taste of China did a great job providing me exactly that.  Meat was REAL - with no odds and ends and all white-meat chicken.  Everything was yummy, well-packed, and hot when we came home.  Their staff was super friendly when I arrived and very welcoming.  The experience was exactly what I was hoping for and it seems as though Taste of China may just have become our restaurant away from Chinatown.
The food is excellent.  I have tried a number of dishes and liked them all.  A little pricey so I knocked off a star for that.  Service for take-out is very friendly.

Taste of China is delish..... thanks Rachel ray for always using that word.... Anyway, if your looking for solid above average Chinese food you came to the right place. I don't know about their other location down the road, but this one is strictly takeout.... If that's cool with you then enjoy some of the best crab Rangoon on the planet! I mean seriously the crab filling literally melts in your mouth! However i assume it probably contains about 300 calories per bite! The egg rolls are also kick ass not to mention they are huge. Sweet and sour pork was solid as well... Beware that the prices are a bit steep compared to other Chinese take out joints. I'm just glad the Nequa Valley High School crowd doesn't get cravings for egg rolls like I did when I used to get out of school for the day, or this place would be packed!!!!

I'm writing this to warn others to be careful, or really not to order from Taste of China at all, ever.  I thought it was a coincidence that I would have a  stomach problem after eating their food, but it  is not.  I am so sick after eating the food from there. NEVER AGAIN!!!  Maybe  Taste of China should throw away bad and old rancid  food!!!! Don't serve it to good paying customers... Horrible.
The Lo Mein was so salty it was not edible, and the General Tso's Chicken was not good either. It was to expensive for the portion that we got. I would never go back.
Very friendly and quick.  The food is pretty good too.  It is very pricey though, for what you get.  Unlike many chinese food places, the egg rolls are not that greasy.

Before I begin I should preface that I am giving them 4 stars on good faith. I wanted to give them 3, but I felt that unfair since the main reason was due to my dislike of something I ordered.

I have no issues with the restaurant itself or the staff. That was all fine. What you would expect. They were attentive and always pleasant.

I had their appetizers of egg rolls, crab rangoon, and candied rib. Those were all delicious. Some of the best I've ever had.

The prices aren't bad either for the portions you get. So that's a plus!

My issue was with the main course. The Gong Ho Chow mein. I did not like it. It tasted like Salisbury steak sauce poured over noodles. Too thick. I didn't eat much. But I was told their fried rice and sesame chicken are the best ever. I will need to try those next time I visit. 

So if you want Chinese food you can't go wrong here. I just wouldn't recommend the chow mein.

We have had 2 Gong Ho meals now; one dine-in and one takeout.

Dining in: Service is fast and attentive, and the food came out very quickly. We ate fried rice, chow fun, egg rolls, crab rangoon, egg drop soup, and chicken (orange chicken, maybe?). Everything was delicious! I didn't get to eat much of the chicken though, because my dining companions wolfed it down before I could get more than 2 bites!

Takeout: Wait, did you just say I can pick this order up in 10 minutes? How cow, that is FAST! Ordered favorites again (the fried rice, crab rangoon and what just might be my favorite egg rolls did NOT disappoint!) and changed out the chicken to general tso, since that is my hubby's measuring stick for any Chinese restaurant. The chicken's texture wasn't as mouth-melting, poppingly crispy as my all-time favorite from Shanghai (a little place in Emporia KS), but the breading was respectable in texture and the sauce is nothing to sneeze at... I'd order it again.

A tip though: everything reheats well EXCEPT the chow fun (it turns to mush as leftovers), so make sure that you finish that one while it is still fresh!

I've been coming to Gong Ho for years. I grew up in the area so and love coming back to get some good Chinese. Egg rolls are on point especially the sweet and sour sauce when you eat at the restaurant. Fried rice and orange chicken are delicious.  I get them every time and they never disappoint. If your looking for good Chinese come here and remember to order the lunch specials.

Our family have been going here for years, both dine-in and take out. No more, we have been here a number of times since new owners and just don't like the taste, quality any more. The egg rolls were found only because our favorite Lang Lee on 143rd street & Lagrange was closed and sold for condo development. I hate to say your egg rolls are now all shredded cabbage, NOTHING ELSE!...Why....because cabbage sells for pennies. Most Chinese rest. egg rolls are combination of pork, shrimp, etc. The taste of cabbage stays for HOURS!....The Mongolian beef  has fallen as a cheaper cut of beef, maybe the same as the chop suey, sorry lost our many years as customer as you have been informed dozens of times on this yelp a lone, not counting the return of food, loss of customers, etc. If you no longer care, close the doors, money is not to be thrown away for sub-par food.

The general tso's chicken lunch special! Rice soup and a generous portion of meat or veggies for under 10 dollars. I've been going here since a kid and they have always been consistent as well as very respectful service. I would highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a good Chinese meal!

Restaurant has new owners and you can definitely tell. The food is not as good as it was under the previous owner. My favorite dish #3 now has a lot of fat in the barbecue pork. They no longer reward faithful and loyal customers since 1987 with almond cookies and fortune cookies at the end of the meal and if you are five minutes past the lunch time hr, they no longer let you get the lunch prices. Me and my crew have been going there so long we had a special bond with the previous owners and the staff. The previous owners, who are older, understood how to treat long time customers and keep them. The new owner is younger and does not get it when it comes to keeping customers coming there. Cutting corners is not the answer! I have sent so many people there which will stop immediately. Me and my crew will be looking to go somewhere else.

Amazing lunch special
Very good house sweet and sour as the little sweet and sour packages are very gross 
Lots of chicken and decent broccoli portion compared to other places 
Fried rice not greasy
Egg rolls are just fine 
Thanks I'll be back

After a few days using yelp in Chicago, I'm really disappointed by its credibility and accuracy. How come this restaurant get a 4 star rating? First of all, the food is purely Americanized. When i asked for a Chinese version manual, The waiter told me their food are only for Americans. Ok fine. Then  a few dishes I picked were not orderable (then why put them on the manual ). Finally I got beef with broccoli, which you can find in any Chinese restaurant.  It's really really average. If you just want to fill up your stoma with sth, then you can go.

not good. bland..greasy.  the server brought out the food on a gross and dirty cart.
my sons mongolian beef was swimming in brown gravy w a ton of 5 star spice. my wife egg foo young.... brown gravy with no flavor. my daughters beef w broccoli... you guessed it flavorless brown gravy. 
I had black bean and garlic fish.... which tasted neither of black bean or garlic.
the rice was low quality, broken.... most likely old rice reheated.
not a good experience, pretty sure its this way all of the time.

I ordered four different large orders with meat and got four pieces of meat in each large order.  While I was waiting for my order, a customer was returning their food.  Two strikes and your out is enough for me. Money is too hard to come by to keep wasting it on more chances.

I have eaten here on 5 occasions - only to accompany someone else who chose the place to
 eat.  Always a very mundane experience.  The food is barely okay, not anything that would make me want to revisit this establishment.   Sorry.

After reading a lot good about this place I went here for a diner at evening. The interior and service was really good. I had wonton, chicken chow main with pan fried noodles and a sweet and sour chicken. Food looked nice and would be great for some, but taste was not as per my taste of Chinese food and I really didn't liked it, as it was too oily and not so good in taste.

I have been reading reviews on this place for the last couple of years and thought my wife and I should try it. Long story short, this will be our first and last time here. 

The egg drop soup is not very good. It literally tastes like we were drinking straight scrambled eggs. The beef in the beef and broccoli was very mushy and low grade. The sesame chicken was ok but nothing to write home about. 

Finally, as I was in the middle of writing the review at the restaurant our server asked what we wanted boxed up. We told her the chicken and rice but not the beef and broccoli. She said it heated up well, but we still told her that we would prefer not to have it. She pressed the issue for a minute more and then said that "we always order the same thing." We told her it was our first time here and she turned around and walked away. My wife and I all thought that this whole situation was quite humorous but uncalled for at the same time. 

At any rate, we will not be coming back here. We much prefer other Chinese restaurants in the area.
My whole family likes  this place it  has the best egg rolls and fried rice around. The rest of the food is ok too. The lunch portions are nice and cheap.
Really good food, great service and huge portions !

Good, fair-priced.  Told 15 minutes, but it was done sooner.  This actually wasn't good as it could have been hotter by the time I got home.  Very friendly staff.  Will definitely try and eat in next time.
Drove 45 minutes to get there ... Very pleased ... The lobster was the best I have had in a long time ... Will return!!! Service was outstanding and big portions!!! A must try!!

Being new to the area, I've literally been to every chinese restaurant in the area from DG to Hinsdale to Westmont to Naperville in my search for THE restaurant.  You name it, I've probably been there.  My requirements were simple.  Good food at a good price.  I wasn't looking for any fancy chinese food.  I just wanted your typical inexpensive generic chinese fare like orange chicken, sweet and sour pork, etc.  
I've come across a handful of good places during my search but the price was more than I wanted to pay.  Then my search ended.  I finally came across Gong Ho.  This is the WINNER!
Great tasting food at a great price.  Their lunch specials are amazing.

Love their egg rolls!  Perfect egg rolls with perfect sauce.  Too bad it's so far away from us...

Their lunch special is pretty rad, it's like $4.35 a person and you get either a beverage or egg roll.  Or maybe it's soup.  Or something.  We've done the lunch thing twice and I've gotten the vegetable "delight" with fried rice both times (with beverage).  We order an egg roll appetizer too.  So anyway, it's super cheap and you get quite a portion - I can never finish it but that could be because I'm stuffing egg rolls into my face and filling up on those.

I'm not a huge fan of Chinese food in general, and especially not for lunch but I discovered I make an exception for here.

The waitstaff knows their ish too.  Even through my rambling method of ordering, they seem to know what I want more than I know.
Best Egg Rolls around! Love this place. Super affordable and good food. Not too greasy, fresh and always yummy!

I tried many of Chinese food a friend of mines recommended this place. We  tried the Mongolian beef & sweet and sour chicken. Horrible I never thought you could go bad with Chinese food.  Not please at all. !! The food HORRIBLE

I used to really like this resaturant but the quality has really gone downhill.  The beef and chicken seem to be of poor quality...very mushy. This has happened the last two times we were there so there won't be a third visit.

Let's be honest: Gong Ho isn't going to win any culinary awards.  They aren't creating fancy new Asian dishes for foodies to fawn over.  It is just good, inexpensive, simple Chinese food.  In fact, it is my favorite Chinese restaurant because I like my Chinese food simple.  That is a big bonus for families with picky eaters like myself, though foodies and adventurous diners may not get a thrill out of it.

As far as the staff, I've been getting take-out there for years and it has never been an issue.  They are polite, efficient and communicate well enough in English.  When I asked them to make me a party tray of fried rice for work, they asked me what size I wanted: half or full tray.  It is not on the menu anywhere, but they were happy to do it.  People at work devoured it and asked me to bring two trays the next time.  I'd call that a success!

I love the Spiced pork with Noodles
Fantastic Egg rolls.

Wasn't sure I wanted to go to this place after seeing some of the reviews but the place was really good.  Food was very tasty, you got a lot of food for your money and the service was good. I'd go back for sure!!!

I have been going here for over 20 years...I live in Florida now and it is a must do when ever I go back to the area.  My family even freezes at and brings it for me here.  I LOVE the appetizer combo...sweet sour pork...fried rice.  Lunch Specials are a GREAT value!

I can't believe I didn't review this one yet!  It's exactly what you, I, or anyone would expect from a Chinese restaurant: tasty, affordable food!

Let me say this: there are only two downsides: 1) the decor - it looks like they've never updated anything inside the restaurant; 2) they don't deliver.  

But, at least you can call ahead and pick up your food, typically in 15 minutes or less - which is remarkable!  I can't recall a time when it's ever taken longer than expected, or where the order wasn't right.  Top notch service when it comes to speed!

We always order extra egg rolls because they're just so damn good.  I don't think there's anything on the menu I don't like - so that being said, I don't have a particular recommendation!  They've saved me in a few home-cooking dinner disasters in the past

I have been eating Gong Ho and my family has been ordering from here probably my entire life.  They are the best Chinese food in the area and nothing compares. Their food is fresh, they are fast and they have great service.  The fried rice is very good. I have never had any better pan fried noodles anywhere. Their seafood combination chow mien is also a favorite of ours.  

Gong Ho is my ALL time FAVORITE Chinese place ever.

I just started going to this place back and forth since summer and it has decent foods.  It wont be the greatest but it is quite affordable.  So if you are just looking to get some decent Chinese eats, and it's close enough, you may find this your go-to "take out" place.  

Since my first review,  I have been back since and I'm not sure if it's me or what but the quality of the foods hasn't quite match my first impression of it.  Maybe things tasted different when you get them carried-out instead of dine in (which I've only done once since the first time)? 

So far up to date, I have tried Chop Suey which tasted very bland.  And just today, I ordered a Combo Chow Fun and some sort of Fish Fillet in Black Bean sauce and Garlic and both kind of ended up looking the same and tasting the same.  They were very saucy and dark-brown and wasn't very flavored.  The only exception was the fish fillet which came out very salty! Now I know that most of dishes use the same basic ingredients or technique but I think as a restaurant, their cooking skills and tasting variety should be placed above of what I can conjure up at home.

So it's unfortunate but to keep up with expectations, I'm changing my rating from 4 stars to 3 stars.

Fantastic prices and the best hot and sour soup I've ever had.  You can't go wrong with the lunch specials.  One plate will fill you up - for a different take on the Chinese buffets that dominates these cross streets you can go with someone else and order 3 dishes affordably.  A friend and I can do this but yes, if you do you will still have to be rolled out of here.

The hot and sour soup - yes it is probably loaded with something I don't want to know about... but I don't think I've had better.  It is like when you like the knock-off fruit snacks better than the brand name ones even though the texture and color is a bit off.

Orange chicken is spicy but good.  Beef and broccoli is very hearty and full of flavor.  General Tso's sticks to your gums just right.  The main dishes rank high on value and pretty high on flavor for the price.

Cheap, quick, and tons of food for next to nothing.  One of my local favs!

Growing up this was a place my family visited and ordered out from frequently.  After moving away years ago I realized how lucky I was to have had Gong Ho so close. I had been struggling to find a place with the same quality and nothing was comparable. I've traveled from Aurora just to come back and know others that do the same from Plainfield and Joliet. Glad to have moved back closer so I can enjoy it more often again. Can't wait to order an extremely reasonably priced lunch special in a little bit here. Keep up the great work guys!

Great service, very attentive staff.

Typical american chinese food.  I like the ribs that came with dinner special.

Eating at Gong Ho, or, "The Gong," as it's referred to among my friends is nothing short of a religious experience. I constantly tell new recruits to the cult of The Gong that if they come with, and don't like their food, I'll buy it for them. No one has taken me up on my money back guarantee yet.

Why?

Because The Gong is incredible. That's why. They serve the finest egg rolls on this side of the Pacific, and believe me, I've tried many an egg roll in my day. Their potstickers are divine, and really, everything else they make is simply incredible. Their lunch specials are insane, and for $5 you can get enough to eat to send you straight into a food coma, especially if you add an order of potstickers on top.

Everyone who rated this place less than five stars, what's wrong with you?

Ok.  So my past review was five stars, but it now a one.  Just found out that the owners of Gong Ho retired and it was sold to new owners with new cooks and staff a few weeks ago.  One waitress stayed behind.  Everyone else is basically new.  When placing my order, new staff was not aware of what shredded pork was and had to go ask if they sold it.  Fried rice was tasteless, egg drop soup was bland, and all food was bland, made differently than normally, not with original Gong Ho flavor.  This place better step up.  Food was not good!!!  I am terribly upset.  I was a loyal customer for over 20 years.  My family had been coming here since I was in grade school, and we even knew the owners before the owners that just retired, and the past owners and all their staff.  Sadly, I will not be coming back.  My only other favorite place now in Downers Grove is take out only, Hong Kong carry out on Fairview.  I order from here weekly.  Amazing food and this owner has also been here since I was in grade school and the food hasn't changed.  It's delicious!

I had takeout, so I can't speak to the dining room experience. Don't make the mistake of going inside the main restaurant door hoping to get your takeout order. If you do accidentally step inside, go back out onto the sidewalk and head about 20 feet to the right. If this sounds like the voice of experience, you may be on to something.

The lunch specials are really quite remarkable values -- all of the dishes are between $4 and $5, and they are not small portions AND the lunch menu is available on weekends. I asked for my General Tso's Chicken to be made extra spicy, and they accommodated me. The food was fine -- not spectacular. This is not a Tony Hu restaurant after all.

If I lived closer by, I might eat here a couple of times a month from the lunch menu because it's such a fine value. But as-is, unless I'm in the neighborhood, I'll probably not make it here very often. I'm pretty sure many others will be happy to take my place.

Okay, let's set the bar here.  This is a review of a strip mall Chinese restaurant that is probably the cheapest Chinese food lunch option you'll encounter.

With those criteria set, this place is amazing.  No, it's not gourmet Chinese food.  But you can get a huge feed here of decent food, and it's hotter, tastier, and cheaper than Panda Express.  With sit down service!

Seriously.  Set your expectations accordingly, but just sit down, order a lunch combo, and be impressed as it shows up almost before you're done speaking the order.  Then eat and enjoy, and pay on the way out.

You get enough food for anyone, and it's cheaper than a buffet.  Even faster some days.

Egg rolls are a must!!!!l
Kind of an elevated food court experience but so tasty. Service is fast and courteous. Always refilling drinks and checking in to see how you're doing. We love going here. Their lunch specials can't be beat.

My dad would take us to Gong Ho since we were little so I had been going here for years and continued going every Saturday. I love their food and prices. They staff all knew me. One day I didn't finish my meal and wanted to take it home with me but needed sweet and sour sauce- they were going to charge me for it! I couldn't believe it.. I was so disappointed because I thought it was crazy of them! I'm a regular customer and always ate there and they were going to charge me for sweet and sour sauce?!? Ridiculous! I stopped going because of it
Nothing to raving out but it's pretty good. Lunch special are pretty reasonable. So it's better to go there and one of the busiest time to go too.

The perfect chinese dive.... almost!  

Cheap food..... CHECK
Food COMA.... if there are grammatical errors below...CHECK
You won't find the SLOWSKI's here.  Service was very fast and for a quick business lunch i was in and out in 25 minutes!


The good:

Great egg roll
Egg drop soup was above average.  Very "yolky" and not watered down like most places.
Fried rice had good flavor ( i prefer more veggies)

The ok:

The general Tso's chicken was just average.  The sauce was too sweet, i had 1 piece of veggie on my plate.  It was not spicy at all.

No refills on soda and meal did not come with egg roll.  Total out the door with tip was $10....

Cheap, delicious, fast Chinese food. The main word to take away from that is delicious. This can be an issue with a lot of Chinese restaurants as their food is just ok or worse. However, Gong Ho delivers on that part for a faction of the cost, about 5 dollars. I do highly recommend this place.

I love Gong Ho as well as my entire family. They frequent the place!!  The service is awesome and the food is phenomenal. The general tso chicken is out if this world - per my father. I enjoy the sweet and sour chicken. .it's my go-to meal. It's never disappointing. We have been going for about 10+ years. You won't be disappointed. They even have a party room!!  Great service. Great food. Great experience everytime.

I think we finally found that hangover chinese place. It took longer than a year but after some good trial and error the winner is Gong Ho for now. Lunch specials that are under $5 and so much fried rice that you can tell they had to scoop some out just to get the lid on. I have just begun to run through the menu but everything had been really good so far.

We did the general tso's chicken, sesame chicken, and a combo with bbq pork, egg roll,  and some rangoons. Chicken was crispy and still juicy - somehow impossible for takeout places to get right. The sauces were spot on and just spicy enough to keep me and my chili obsession at bay. Dark fried rice which brings me back to a small little chop suey place where I grew up took it over the top.

Check this place out for lunch cause you can prob fill up with whatever cash is between your car seats. This place is as sold as your gonna find for the price and the quality it up there too. Oh and btw the map on Yelp is way off so use your GPS to find it or you will never get there!

This is my absolute favorite Chinese restaurant hands down!  My favorite dish is the general tso chicken.  My family and I have been going to this place for 15 years!  Also be sure to get your Lapu Lapu on (tropical drink that arises hidden passions)... It's for two, but I know you're up for the challenge!

This place is overrated. I wasn't impressed with anything, except for the sauce for the eggroll. Ordered the appetizer platter, sweet and sour chicken, and beef egg foo young. None was as good as I expected.
I been coming here for years, great appetizers, great food, and reasonable prices! My kids love the food as well! If your in the area this place is worth the try!

This place would be Chef Robert Irvine's nightmare.  It needs a Restaurant Impossible makeover.  The decor is tattered, tacky and dusty.  First impression when we walked in the door was stacks of corrugated boxes containing fortune cookies (which we later found to be tasteless) and other supplies.  It seemed odd that this restaurant has no windows.

Food was inconsistent.  Wonton soup was plain, sesame chicken was crispy and tasty, but the Beef Kow had an off-taste.  Service was decent, but food is brought on carts that are noisy on the multiple floor surfaces.  Table clean-up carts are even noisier.

There are better choices for Chinese food in the area.

By far the worst service by the owners  ! The beef was old and I asked for meal to be replaced the owner laughed in my face and stormed yelling something out in her native language,I will never return or recommend !

We stopped into Gong Ho after attempting to go to Jameson's Charhouse across the street. They didn't open until 3:30... so we decided to give Gong Ho a try.

Here's what I learned while I was there...
1. It's cheap
2. It's cheap
3. It's cheap

Seriously cheap food. Decent food though. It's nothing I'd write home about, but for $11.00, my husband and I ate a pretty decent lunch. Highlights from the combination platter that I ordered included the fried rice (pretty tasty), crab rangoon, and the teriyaki beef. The chicken tenderloin was just okay, as was the fried shrimp. But for $4.35 I got a sample of 5 different menu items and the majority of them were pretty good. My only complain is that I wish they would improve the sweet and sour sauce since I tend to use that quite a bit when eating Chinese Food. Theirs was okay.... but there's room for improvement.

Is it the best Chinese food I've ever had? No. Would I come back? Sure!
Look no further...this place has the best egg rolls! This is the best Chinese food around! Easy pick up or dine in, always a great experience.
Great food love the egg rolls! The price is great too! Oh and the staff is very friendly!

4 stars for service - the best you can get from a "quick" sit down place
3 stars for food quality (A-Ok!) which is totally acceptable - if I were grading strictly within the realm of "American" Chinese restaurants (including those sometimes questionable buffet joints), I would give 5 stars... but hey I don't want people to forget this is not a "fine dining" establishment like another reviewer mentioned.
5 stars for affordability! Great place to go when you're desperate to eat out with your spouse but you don't want to spend $30.  You could easily get lunch for two for $10 or less.

Finger cuffs and rice candy where you can eat the wrapper. Crayons and little Chinese toys. Glass tiger in the entryway. These are all memories of when I was young and begged my parents to take the drive from Frankfort to Downers Grove for the best Chinese food evar! It seemed so far then. I still love this restaurant. I would still make the drive. 

The only thing that has changed is the fact now I can enjoy a cocktail with my amazing meal. I have never been disappointed and I can't get into details because I have tried the length of the menu. It's all good. This place has been around as long as my memory and to me that says they are doing something right. Like other reviewers state, the prices are reasonable especially for the quality. 

This restaurant will always be a staple in this category of dining for me. Give ti a try.

This place gets a 5 from me because of the one seafood dish I get every time I go.  For about $10 you can get shrimp, scallops, and lobster all in a man sized meal.  I have eaten at pricier restaurants that will give you a few small pieces of lobster, but this place literally will give you a tails worth of deliciousness.  The portion sizes are very big and you won't leave this place hungry as the entrees are enough to fill you up, even if you are a big eater.

Always great food and the waitstaff is very friendly.

This is the best Chinese in this area.  One of my measuring tools of a good Chinese restaurant is if they have good egg rolls.  Gong Ho has great egg rolls!  

If you go here and eat, the servers are very friendly and they have a nice dining area to relax and be waited on.   If you are in the area for lunch - they have GREAT lunch specials for a great price. The only drawback to this place (if you live in this area) is that they don't deliver while other places in the area do.  However, unless it is raining or snowing - I am going on for Gong Ho rather than get crappy frozen egg rolls somewhere else.

This is a small local Chinese restaurant.  Definitely not fine dining here folks.  The place is famously busy during lunch because of the great deals.  

Atmosphere: not super nice, but like I said above, this isn't a fine dining establishment.  The place is well suited to get people in and get them out.  

Service: I believe this is a family owned place, so you see the same folks there every time.  The majority of the people you deal with are OVERLY nice.  When you get to deal with them, it makes your day better.  There is one waitress who has a bit of an attitude and you always hope to never get sat at her table.  Overall, the service is incredible.

Food: For a local quick and easy Chinese restaurant, the food is great.  I am never disappointed with the food.  I moved to the area about 3 years ago and tried countless Chinese places and was turned off to each one on account of the bad food.  I tried Gong Ho and haven't gone to a different Chinese place since.

Price: out of this world.  Lunch specials start at 3.95.  I regularly walk out of there after lunch with a $10 bill for 2 people.  Dinner is a little more expensive, but they do have a good selection of family dinners that provide a whole lot of food at a reasonable price.

I would highly recommend Gong Ho if you are looking for a good local Chinese restaurant to eat in or take out.

I realize I'm in the minority here, seeing how most people gave it 4/5 stars, but I can't stand this place.  Let me outline why.

1) I had nasty hair in my food!  Not once, but twice!  I just cringe everytime I think of eating here because I visualize pulling long gooey hair out of my kung pao.  Not appetizing in the least.

2) The waiter was creepy.   He kept peeking at us from behind the wall.  It wasn't to check on food and drinks because he had just served us.  It was like he was secretly playing peek-a-boo.   Freaked us out a little.

3) The food wasn't even that good.  I'm new to the Chicago area, so maybe there aren't a lot of good Chinese restaurants in this area, but I would give this about a 5 out of 10.

4) It was filthy.  Again, not sure how things are in this area, but when my forearm sticks to the table cloth (or should I say plastic), it's never a good sign.

Overall, this place is a no-go for me.  If I really wanted hair in my food, I'll just make my own food and have my cats walk all over it.
Cheap and fast but kind of bland, and I sometimes feel rushed when I dine there.
I have not found a better Chinese place ANYWHERE. I could survive off their chicken and shrimp fried rice, egg rolls, and dragon & phoenix plate. Yum!

The food here is awesome the one star is for the service. Was there with several other people and our waitress was very very rude. We were made to feel like we were an inconvenience, that her having to wait on tables was ruining her day. I will never go in to eat there ever again. I have gotten take out several times and have not had any problems there.

We are not familiar with the Chinese restaurants in this area, but decided to stop here after we found it on our GPS.  Bad choice.  The food had a funny aftertaste and I think my chicken was either not fresh or not chicken.  Yuck!!  The people were all very nice except for the woman at the register when we paid the bill.  I guess we interrupted her.  The best part of the entire meal was my Mai Tai.  Very tasty.  Sorry, but the drink is not worth going again.
So GOOD! Love Gong Ho, and don't go anywhere else. The food is delicious and cheap, and if you eat inside the waiters are friendly.

the best egg rolls u ever ate !!!!
 cruise nite's on tuesday's by cozzi corner the it off to gong ho for egg rolls !!!!!!

   the best u ever ate trust me...........steve

I love Gong Ho.  The food is always great- it is Americanized Chinese but it is really good.  The service is fast and very friendly.  The prices for lunch are fan-freakin-tastic.  When my wife and go there on one of our date days (two out of the three kids in school) we make the drive from Brookfield to Downers Grove to go to Gong Ho.  
I ususaly order either the Mongolian Beef or Orange Beef and my wife usually gets the Sesame Chicken and an order of potstickers.  My dishes are just the right amount of spicy for me but they will jack it up if you like it real hot.  Her chicken is always tender and juicy and the potstickers are great.  I love their eggrolls too.  The big bonus: lunch for two including the app... under $15!!!!   The owner even gave us a wall hanging Chinese Calendar.  He is very nice!

Oh, I didn't already review this restaurant?  Man, shame on me.  I have to say, Gong Ho is, hands-down, one of the best Chinese restaurants I've ever been to.  Ever.  And who in their 30s hasn't dined at plenty of Chinese places during their lifetime?  The food here is excellent, I don't know what it is (it certainly isn't the MSG!), but everything I've had is DAMN tasty.  The orange peel chicken is phenomenal, and my dad swears by the Szechuan chicken.  The crab rangoon is awesome.  I'm tired of places that give you just a little bit of stuffing with a lot of shell, whereas Gong Ho stuffs the heck out of those suckers with tasty crab & cream cheese goodness.

I can't think of anything wrong with this restaurant.  If you're ever in the area and in the mood for Chinese, do not miss this gem!

How has this place stayed in business? Tried it 10 years ago and really disliked their food.  Tried it again tonight...flavorless.  Nothing stands out, not even the Won Ton soup requested by my son.  Won't be going back...only went because my favorite was closed on a Monday night and didn't realize that until the last minute.  My favorite by the way is New Chinese Kitchen, always the best!

I felt guilty for stopping here when my favorite Thai place, Thai Happiness, is just a few doors down, but I was craving Chinese. I went to the little takeout area and, on the advice of a fellow Yelper, ordered the Singapore rice noodles prepared extra spicy. I got a ton of food for $8.25 and it was really good - just not quite spicy enough for me, even with the extra spiciness added. I had chili garlic sauce at home, so I added that and it fixed it right up. The two employees I spoke with were really friendly, which I always appreciate! I'll definitely be back.

Gong Ho's been one of those places my family has gone to since I was a kid. The prices have remained mostly the same over the years as well as the quality of the food. I don't know any other place where I can get a full meal for under $5 that is as yummy as this. I recommend the lunch special #2, chicken tenderloins, beef teriyaki, rice and an egg roll all for the price of $4.25.  

I make it a point to visit at least once every time I am home visiting!

Very good chinese! A true institution that must be tried when in the vicinity.
After moving away I truly miss it.
Can be exceptionally busy on Friday and Saturday nights, so beware!
Everything is delicious and excellently priced.
A must try for sit-in or take-out.

The best egg rolls!  I have been going to Gong Ho most of my life and the food is always good and unbelievably cheap.  They have great lunch specials, but I also like the BBQ pork fried rice, egg rolls, and pan fried noodles.  Like another yelper below, I have many memories coming here as a kid so I could get my rice candy after our meal.  Out of the strip mall type chinese restaurant, it is hands down the best.

I love the variety here. After my favorite Chinese place closed down I tried nearly every Chinese place in the area. This one was by far the best!  My favorites are the Orange Grove Chicken, Orange Peel Chicken and Chicken with Garlic Sauce. For appetizers I like the chicken tenderloin, pot stickers and egg rolls. I only eat carry out so I don't know how the service is. I do like how they have a separate carry out entrance since that makes pickup quick and easy.

My wife and I tried Gong Ho tonight for the first time.  We both thought the food was very good and the prices were reasonable.  I had the Gong Ho special which I thought was a nice mix of meat (shrimp, beef and chicken) and vegetables.  My wife had the egg rolls and fried rice.  She loved the egg rolls but thought the fried rice had a bit of frying pan taste.  We will definitely be back as the value and quality of food is very good.

For the area, this is one of the better places to go for chinese food.  I bring my family and everyone leaves happy with their choices as well as with plenty-o-leftovers for the next day.  Personally, their hot dishes could be a little hotter, and I guess I could actually request that, but have learned that lesson a couple times when the chef took that as a personal challenge to cause me to combust!

Service ranges from OK to overzealous (almost pulling my plate away as I am taking the last bite)  

Anyway, a good place to go and enjoy a nice meal

My mother and I went there for dinner Everything was amazing! Great food and Great prices! By the end of our meal we were stuffed and even had A LOT of leftovers! Some of the best Chinese food around. Thank you Gong Ho!!!
Shrimp with lobster sauce!!!! Yummy

Gong Ho is a very budget friendly restaurant that has good food for the prices! I went there and got some General Tso's fish with white rice, an egg roll, hot and sour soup, and an almond cookie and fortune cookie and paid $6!!  Food was good, (I'm not going to over-exaggerate and be like "ZOMFG its AMAZING!!!!!") Its good food, fresh ingredients, and nice flavor...that's it.  I have read a few reviews of people saying it was sub par, this and that...but you have to realize that first off this is "americanized" chinese food.  Every single chinese restaurant in the burbs (with the exception of a few) are americanized...and ALL americanized chinese restaurants will be "eh".  (My opinion, 'cuz I'm asian and enjoy the authentic stuff...ie "sweet n sour chicken" is not a chinese dish) This restaurant however, has a better menu than 90% of the other suburban chinese restaurants out there.  They actually serve chow fun.  The chow mein is actually yellow egg noodles, and not those cheap little crunchy things that other americanized chinese places serve.  I'd like to think that Gong Ho is a nice bridge between americanized chinese and authentic chinese.  They have a lil bit of both, and mesh it together well.

If you want real authentic hardcore chinese, go down to wentworth and cermak in the city and you'll find amazing real chinese food there.  Gong Ho's food is made for the american palate, and for the price of the lunch combos it beats anything from your local fast food restaurant!  I walk out stuffed after having lunch there and only spent $6!  You can't come into this restaurant expecting 5-star quality food for less-than-fast-food prices.  I don't walk into Burger King and ask for 2 filet mignon burgers for $2.  Be realistic about your expectations and you'll see what I mean. =)

I just find it incredible difficult to order here. I have yet to get my order taken by someone who speaks good enough English for me to carry on a short food order conversation. I don't think it's their fault or mine, but maybe I should find a different place to get Chinese food. I went there yesterday and when I called ahead of time to order VERY simple order of pork chow mein, I was told that I was crazy because the woman didn't understand what I was saying. I went in there and told her the same thing. She shows me a plate of noodles and says which one. I showed her and she says ok, like nothing.  I chose the one THAT'S EXACTLY what I said on the phone. I didn't ask for the dish to be spicy or didn't ask for lo mein. What was the big deal? I didn't appreciate her calling me crazy because she didn't understand me. If you will run a business in Downers Grove, how about catering to your market and having an English speaking order taker? The food is just ok, not anything too great but I have not found another non-buffet Chinese food place nearby.

I am upping this because I went back and had the Singapore Noodle (spicy). I have not had one as good since I went to Singapore... burn your mouth good... people 2 tables away said they could smell it, the staff said they wondered if I ever had it before... that authentic & good.
This place is great! Very affordable. And the lunch selection is awesome with super affordable prices. I've been coming here since I was a kid and will keep on visiting this place!
This restaurant is brightly lit,quick service, fast good hot food. High quality,at a fair price. Will not be disappointed.

WHAT else can I say..This place is wonderful!!...Went there w/ my wife, and was really surprised!...nice. The egg rolls were good but the sweet sauce is that orange sauce which I rather like the other type of sweet and sour saucely..I had the mongolian  beef and my wife had the seafood delight...Also I had the hot and sour soup that was real good!!..S. The mixed drinks are really well made and only $3.50-$4.50..this place is vevery pennyrth ery affordable and wo
Nothing special at all.  Is there ANY decent Chinese food place in Downers?  Help!
Not good at all. Very bland. Greasy. The crab rangoon was 98% wrapper, 1.5% cream cheese and .5% fake crab. Hot and sour sop was tepid. Will not eat here again.
The best place in Downers Grove to get Chinese Food.
I've been going there since as long as I can remember.  My family and I have never been dissapointed because their food is always consistent.

This place is the old school.. I love the traditional items here...go-to menu items like fried rice, or eggrolls, s&s chicken..all of it is great. I grew up on GH whenever we ordered Chinese food and I miss it dearly. The dining-in experience here is great too. Every one of the waiters is great in their own way.

Good Chinese food. I don't think they have done any improvements or upgrades in here for 20+ years! The owner is a real Pill, she almost makes us not want to come back, very bitchy and cold. We always ask for Sue, she always is funny and very friendly- tip her well, she'll remember you!
This restaurant has delicious food, awesome prices, and a friendly staff. Although it wouldn't hurt to update the interior of the restaurant to further add to this already great experience.

I thought I was in for a treat after seeing all the glowing reviews however I was very disappointed.  Being a Chicago transplant, I am well versed in Chinese cuisine and this place was mediocre at best.  The prices were ok and they did have my order ready quickly, but the quality of the food was just not there.  The mushrooms seemed to come from a can and the food overall just did not seem fresh.  It was also slightly greasy as well. 

We have a current favorite place and we will be sticking with it..

I really love Gong  Ho. I have been there about three times and each time was very yummy. I love the crab rangoon appetizer, and their mixed drinks from the bar. Fog Cutter and Chi Chi drink are my favorite, stiff fruity, comes with umbrellas. And very very cheap ! I mean if you are trying to stretch a pretty penny, Gong Ho is for you. The quality is great I have never been dissapointed, I find the service to be very very great. They are happy and pushing carts around to make sure your table is clean and food comes out quick and in the order's entirity.

I love gong ho, they have decent Chinese food in large portions for a great price. Lunch specials are like FIVE bucks! Score! Their shrimp used to be better than it is now. But it's still worth getting something without the shrimp. :) Egg drop soup and hot and sour soup are great. Also, they are really friendly and accommodating! Also the almond cookies are great. I'm a fan!

This is the best deal in town!!  The service is superb, and the lunches include entre, choice of soup or cola, and your own pitcher of hot tea.....all for $3.95!!!  You can't beat it, I'm telling you!   The food is good and the portions are ample.  What a gem!!!! :)!!!
Great cheap lunch takeout specials! $3.95 goes a long way here!
Cracks me up everytime. Gong Ho. Restaurant. Good solid Chinese food. An extra star because they've been in business at least ten years.

I have been visiting Gong Ho several times a year for nearly 20 years. The food is ALWAYS delicious. The service is efficient. You can take 4 adults and 2 children for dinner for under $30. I have moved 3 times since first visiting Gong Go, and have tried several other Chinese restaurants over the years. I keep coming back to Gong Ho because I know it will always be good. The value is great, that is why I will go out of my way to always visit. You need to make sure you order an egg roll, they are the best in the land.

I had Pizza Track cater to my child's birthday party. I think we ordered a total of about 13 pizzas including specialty and regular topping pizzas. I was very impressed with the service, coordination, and communication throughout. Even though local owned, they are very professional and truly care about the customer's experience. Delivery was handled easily and pizzas were still hot even though they traveled 30 minutes to arrive. With about 150 people in attendance, several guests inquired about where the pizza was from and had countless compliments about the taste. I think the Chicken Fajita might've been the fan favorite. 

I have also ordered burgers from there on a personal occasion, and again was thoroughly impressed. I highly recommend this place for both personal and party experiences.
My first time here. Loved the menu so many choices. I ordered the hunter beef pizza on their recommendation I really enjoyed it. Look forward to trying their other pizzas soon. Great service.

Interesting take on pizza with South Asian/Mexican/Middle Eastern flavored toppings! Recommend the butter chicken pizza. Wings are pretty good too!! More of a takeout place than dine-in but overall a pleasant experience for our group of 5. Try the kulfi desserts as well!

We love the pizza and snacks from here! We especially love the chicken shawarma, butter chicken and sheikh kabob pizzas. The staff is always friendly and makes sure the food is served hot! This place is especially good at delivering large orders hot and fresh!
The hunter beef pizza is good. We were the only ones dining in and quickly realized this is not a sit down place. There is no service per se but I assume carryout is preferred.

I work nearby this place and go nearly twice a week for lunch. Their pizza's are excellent especially the "Chicken Fajita Supreme" and #1 is "Creamy Chicken Pizza." in my opinion. 

The burgers and sandwiches are just ok, not on par with the tasty pizza's. The gyro wrap is a bit salty with only gyros and onions in it (big portions more than enough to fill you up). I would have preferred a few more veggies in it such as tomatoes, lettuce etc. 

They also need to improve the "look" of the restaurant a bit, especially the bathroom (needs more lighting, a nice sink as well instead of that mini one.)

All in all, I would recommend ordering take out, and definitely the pizzas, they all have a slight Indian twist and are verry well done.

The pizza here was great, probably the best Zabiha Halal pizza place that I have been to. They have an interesting selection of specialty pizzas. Spicy seekh kabob, butter chicken pizza, and behari chicken pizza and many more. We went with the behari chicken, chicken fajita and Arabian pizzas. All three were great but my favorite out of these was the behari chicken. Definitely will come back to try some more.

Wow what a hidden gem. If your looking to get an adventurous pizza this is the place. I found it ok Yelp thanks to the great reviews. 
We tried both their butter chicken pizza and their gyro pizza. 
The butter chicken pizza was delicious. The unique sweet tomatoey chicken flavor on a think crust pizza with green peppers and red onions topped with cheese was a great combination. 
The gyro pizza was on par with other gyro pizzas I have had at Italian express and also very good.
For desert we had mango and pistachio kulfi. Wow so light and refreshing. The pistachio actually had pieces of pistachio in it. 
Give this place a try and be adventurous when ordering your pizza. And if you want it spicy be sure to tell them when ordering. You'll be pleasantly surprised!

Butter chicken pizza? Masala fries? Who would've thought that these things could be SO awesome!! I was very skeptical, but this place caught my interest and I was very pleasantly surprised. The butter chicken pizza is very tasty without being too spicy. The seasoning on the masala fries is great as well. I've never come across such a unique pizza place. Will definitely be a repeat customer.

Halal deep dish pizza!! SO GOOD!! We had the Meat Lovers, Bihari chicken, and Seekh Kabab deep dish pizzas, wow, just incredible! Seriously unique and delicious. FYI, one slice will seriously stuff a person of normal appetite, it is very heavy. Also, if you plan to come for deep dish, don't come as soon as they open, because it takes 2 hours for the oven to heat up. Even regular pizza takes 45 minutes. Highly suggest calling ahead to order, and if you need to have it as soon as they open, call the day before, he is very accomodating

I love love love this place. Everything I've had from here has been fantastic.the seekh kabab pizza is spicy but delicious, the pepperoni is so flavorful, but my new fav is the hunter beef pizza. I don't know how they come up with these unique combination of flavors that work so well together. It's genius.

In terms of pizza fundamentals, nothing to write home about, but not bad either.

However, what really makes this place stand out is there unique Indian inspired toppings. My favorite is the Bihari Chicken, which has something truly Chicagoan about it with the sports peppers side by side with Indian-spiced chicken. The variety of speciality pizzas ensures you'll never get bored and they are good enough to keep you craving it and coming back for more. Be sure to try the Butter Chicken and Arabian as well.

This is more of a take out operation so the dine in experience is more of the hole-in-the-wall variety, but food is worth it.

I love this place! Very close to my house and food is pretty good as well. Came here maybe 10 times so far.

Changed my review from 4 to 3 due to the fact that every time I order spicy anything they always forget to do it and charge me 1$ for it.

I've ordered from here twice and have not been disappointed.  The first time I got the Chicken Shawarma and second time Bihari Chicken and Chipotle Chicken Wrap. The pizza's were on point. Not only delicious but plenty of chicken and cheese. The wraps were okay. Good but nothing special.

I sampled their pizza at a fun fair - took it home and had it cold. It was so surprisingly good I had to take the family there and try at least three pizzas.

Their best pizza is the thin crust seikh kabob supreme. The combination of the spicy seikh kabob and the traditonal pizza ingredients is sheer genius. I am a huge pizza fan and accept nothing less than awesome. This pizza did it for me. I love thin crust. They have both thin and pan styles.

The gyro pizza is outstanding - and it blows away the gyro pizza that all the other places serve - these guys got it right.

Lastly, the pricing is very very reasonable. E.g the large seikh kabob thin-crust pizza was 12.49. 

The place sits about 20 people - not a restaurant, more like a small casual place. If you are a fan of good pizza you must try this place.

Edit: They must have taken the other review into consideration and souped up the seating area. It now has two comfy round tables that each seat a family of 5, and they have 4 small tables that each seat 2. So that's 2  5 + 4  2 = 18 seats.

Got a pepperoni, gyros, chicken pizza. I really enjoyed it and the wings were pretty good too.

Eat here if you want some new spins on pizza toppings
Excellent pizza- had the kabob one. Husband and I both thought it was delicious. I'll definitely be back for more.

This is our go to pizza place! Our favorite is Chicken Fajita pizza and the kids love the gyro pizza.  The service is always prompt and courteous and the food is always fresh, what else can you ask for?

My family loves this place. They go here all the time when craving pizza or just to give others a taste of their pizza. The meat is zabiha halal. Our carryout orders always are fresh and never feel too heavy. We typically get the gyro and pepperoni pizza and they are delicious. We will probably come here many times in the future.

Took the family here for dinner. We wanted pizza and just saw their add so we figured we'd give it a shot. At first we didn't think they were open because no one answered the phone. But then 2 mins later we get a call back from them. We asked them if they are open and they said 'yes.' Then we asked if they have dine-in and they said 'yes.' We were about 10 mins away but it took us about 20 mins to get there because iphone maps could not locate it. We had to then try through google and it got us there eventually. They said they opened up about 2 months ago.
The place was small and only had seating for about 10 people. Since we had 7, we pretty much took up all the seats and utilized the bench. We placed our order and realized that this was not a dine-in restaurant at all. There where no plates, napkins, silverware or glasses on the tables so we had to ask for everything individually.  Plus they had not highchairs so my 2 year old kept trying to get off the chair and run around.
We ordered 2 pizzas (1 pepperoni and 1 sausage), wings (BBQ) and cheese sticks. We asked if we can have the cheese stick first since they are appetizers.
