It ended up that the cheese sticks where the last food item to come out. However the pepperoni pizza was great!!! The pizza sauce tasted very fresh and the dough wasn't too heavy. The wings were ok but my daughter loved em. The cheese sticks were standard.
The owners seemed like very nice and sincere people but I don't think they understand what "dine-in" means in a restaurant. I'm sure I will go back here again in the future but it will only be for carry out.

I loved this place. The pizza was seriously good. They handmade their own dough in the morning. The owner and his son are really nice and it makes for a wholesome atmosphere. Normally I can't eat by myself in a Muslim owned restaurant - it just isn't socially acceptable. Here they're nice regardless if you're with family or not. They have an Eid special that is SO inexpensive - you get so much food... And you can save it in the fridge until Eid.

Went here for dinner last night and had a great experience! The staff was really friendly and hospitable. The food was great! We got the gyro pizza and some kind of chicken pizza and both were good. Good amount of toppings, and loved the dough which was crispy yet chewy, dunno hard to explain. Would definitely recommend.
Great zabiha halal place and great service. Went there with family and the pizza and burger  were yummy.

I thought the tacos were quite good and served hot. I appreciate food served hot and not held at temperature, under a light or microwaved. 

Qudos on the salsa, but be prepared it is Spicy. 

Enjoy.

This is one of the five or six places in the area that offer delivery through Grubhub in my area, so was happy to try it.

I ordered three tacos (steak, chicken, and carnita) and chips with guacamole.  The carnitas taco was my favorite, flavorful and extremely tender.  The chips were fresh, but the guacamole was a little bland, could have used a little more onions and cilantro.  I added some of their very tasty red hot sauce to it, and that did the trick.

The next time I ordered delivery, unfortunately due to a staffing issue, the order could not be delivered.  For future food runs, I have to keep this place in mind, since it is relatively close to home.

I've been going here last two months and this is THE BEST Mexican joint in the area, just on taste alone. 

They have awesome chicken and easily make better chicken burritos I could find in the Naperville/Plainfield/Bolingbrook area. 

Also they make amazing house salsa.

It doesn't make sense this place isn't rated higher. 5 stars all the way.

I love to get the steak burritos from here! I think they are much better than from El Burrito Loco. The steak is never chewy. My fianc also loves their pastor. Their prices are very reasonable! The place is not super big, but there is plenty of room to sit down and eat if you want.

Edit: I'm lowering my rating to 4 stars because this business always closes early randomly. It sucks when you want a burrito at 8 pm and have to go somewhere else.

Authentic Mexican food. The best beef tongue tacos!!!! Everytime I think about it my mouth waters! :) they have a really spicy sauce with their homemade chips that will come out first...compliments of the restaurant. It's on fire!!! you have to check them out. Hole in the wall. Order, eat, leave. Lol!

I have been coming here for years and didn't realize I hadn't reviewed it. Let me just say this food is legit. The steak tacos are my favorite. The food is always hot and fresh. The burritos and chicken tacos are also pretty tasty. I come here weekly for the chilaquiles or huevos con jamon as this is my child's Sunday breakfast treat. The service is friendly and prompt. Best Mexican food in Bolingbrook!

Was in the neighborhood for an appointment and figured I'd stop at this place, I'm always willing to try a new Mexican Restaurant. First impressions were good, place was nice and clean and the "hostess" was very friendly. I ordered 3 tacos (Pastor, Carne Asada & Chorizo), a Mexican Restaurant can't go wrong with tacos, if they do, something is horribly wrong. In the case of Tacqueria Coral, they hit the nail right on the head. All tacos had plenty of meat and the taste was spot on, my favorite was the Pastor. I probably would have given this place 4 or 5 stars but unfortunately it missed the mark on one point - food received in a timely manner. I placed my to-go order at 12:55 pm and didn't receive my order till 1:13 pm, to me, this seems a little long for 3 tacos plus another couple that placed their order after me received their order before me? I guess someone dropped the ball and I would have been okay with it if they at least acknowledged the fact that they missed my order and maybe offered some chips or a drink for my wait but they offered nothing. I'll be back when in the area and hopefully I can adjust their rating.
No longer called Panaderia Coral. Because they no longer sell pan de dulce. They are now called Taqueria Coral. Head on over to Gigante Bakery in Bolingbrook for you pan de dulce fix.

Behind a boring faade and signs all en Espanol, is a true hidden gem and tasty panaderia (that's Spanish for "bakery," you honky).

Empanadas the size of an infant's head.  A large infant's head.  Cookies the size of your face and what I'd call "a small C cup" on the muffins.  Don't forget the slices of cake that are more like slabs.

There weren't any bags in sight, so I asked the lady behind the counter.  Don't be fooled by the older Mexican lady appearance, she spoke sparkling English.  She handed me a tray and tongs so I could choose my pastries.

The signs weren't in English, but I knew what an "empanada" was well enough to purchase 3 (one was filled with what I think was orange marmalade).  I also picked out a muffin-y looking dessert.  The sign read "blueberry," but I think it was in the wrong spot.  I devoured this one before I got home:  it was shaped like a muffin, with a cheesecake layer on top and what tasted like a corn bread on the bottom layer.  I could've split this muffin with someone, but I didn't want to!  

If you aren't familiar with Mexican pastries, they are not super sweet and sugary.  The empanada I tried had a very mellow orange flavor and the dough had a coffee-cake like texture.  Most pastries are on the dry side and again, not super sweet.

For 4 pastries (3 empanadas and a cheesecake corn muffin thing), I paid $3.81.  This place is the real deal.  I definitely didn't expect to find something like this in the suburbs.  I thought I'd have to drive out to Humboldt Park for a flipping churro. 

They also serve Mexican food here; there were 2-3 couples in here.  I got a side-glance from one guy that clearly said, "is this white girl lost?"

Panaderia Coral is on the north side of Boughton Road at the intersection of Schmidt.  There isn't much else in the shopping center; there's a Middle Eastern grocery store and not much else.

Not sure if it's under new management but this place just went downhill. Went in for breakfast today and as soon as we walked in everything looked dirty... We decided to stay because we couldn't find anywhere else to eat chilaquiles. Our burnt tortilla chips were the second red flag, however, we decided to stay and try our food. Our plates came out and we noticed the tortillas in our chilaquiles were just as bad as the chips. We literally took 2 bites and decided we'd rather let $20 go to waste than to keep eating the food. The guy at the front noticed and did offer a replacement for the food instead of a refund but seeing as to how bad one meal was I was hesitant to try something else there. As a restaurant manager myself I could tell that the problem was the oil they were using to fry tortilla chips was probably old, hopefully they fix their restaurant soon. It'd be such a shame to see what was once a decent place to eat completely fail.
Excellent Mexican food - well worth the effort to find.

I found my own personal heaven this weekend. It's called Panaderia Coral. 

I got 6 HUGE ass pastries for $3.27. Seriously, I just about pooped in my pants when she told me the price... or maybe because I ate way too much spicy sauce. Dessert just got even sweeter. 

In addition to my pastry splurge I got 2 avocado tacos and and a veggie burrito. Both were D-lish but the tacos rocked my world. My BF got an egg taco and some other meat junk and the egg taco looked like the perfect cure to a hangover. A meal for 2 with left-overs was $11 and it was all dayum good. 

I'm sooo going back everyday. The only thing I was a little iffy on was that there's not an English translation for everything so I really only knew what  8 things on the menu were but maybe this will be my motivation to learn more Spanish food words... even though just knowing Jamon and Salchicha has gotten me pretty far up to this point.

Bakery/taqueria in a stripmall across the street from a Family Video and next to a funeral home.  Counter in back with large menu above and pastries on the left in openable glass doors for self service.  Was more here for the cooked food than anything else.  $20 got me a chicken torta, steak burrito, 2 al pastor tacos, and flan to go. 

Chicken torta was outstanding!  Sandwich had avocado, lettuce, tomato, and refried beans.  Never encountered big chunks of grilled chicken in a torta before.  Steak burrito had a seasoned-sour cream goodness to it.  Tacos were ok, were packed with a lot of big pieces of meat and onions, but the al pastor didn't have much flavor.  Same with the flan, aside from the honey on the bottom, as there was no flavor at all.

Burritos and tortas are a must try!  The flan, not so much.

Wondering if I hit an of day...  Went based on Yelpers.  3 ppl seated with food. 2:00 afternoon on a Friday.  Typical bakery.. But good if you are used to not so sweet goodies. I love them. There is nothing to control food dates on bakery. So.. Go for it. As far as the foods. Hmm well.. The horchetta is full flavored. Not watered down and rich flavor with a lot of cinnamon. The quesadilla.. Eww.  None of the cheese was melted. I paid $2.99 for one tortilla folded with unmelted cheese. Who's not thrilled?? This Girl!  I will however give a second try & update the review. Seems clean & nice ppl. $ is acceptable.

This little gem is straight out of Nogales or Sonoita or some such border town, as evidenced by the stacks and stacks of day old pastries, the retro looking menu board, the blaring Telemundo, and the obvious language barrier.  What am I talking about?  Chicago has a huge population of persons of Mexican heritage.  So maybe it's straight out of Chicago.  Welcome to Bolingbrook!
Anyway, I'm just now recovering from the rapture that the pastor tacos induced.  Perfectly seasoned pork, fresher than fresh onions and cilantro, and fantastic hot sauce.  I could have eaten maybe..... 10 of them.  Sloth is OK, but I will not be ascribed gluttony, so I quit at 2.  I will be back many, many times.

Our family stopped in for a quick snack here on Mother's Day. Menu is in Spanish with English translations. Order at the counter and the cook brings you the food. I wish I had seen the quesadillas before I ordered. Next time I'm going back to try the squash blossom quesadillas -- not something you typically see at any average taqueria. 

The steak torta was big and yummy, chorizo tacos and al pastor tacos both excellent. The guacamole was fresh and delish. Free chips and salsa and the cook brought us an extra yummy green salsa with chunks of avocado. 

The baked goods also looked yummy. We brought home some flan (since were were already full!) and it was super excellent. I highly recommend for an authentic, but not fancy, Mexican food experience. We muddled through with our limited Spanish skills just fine, though we're going to study up on the pastry names before we go next time!

The girls at work stumbled upon this place. Seeing the name you think it is a bakery but nope the also serve food. Very simple, nothing exciting here. 1 gal taking orders and serving and 1 cook. You can eat in or take out. Once you walk in you are greeted by the fresh smells of all the bakeries. Fresh breads, cookies, cakes yummy indeed. If you want any of these items you just grab a metal tray and some tongs and pick out what you want. The make special cakes also. 

As for the food. The girls said the steak tacos are the best. I went for a steak taco and steak torta. Yes they were correct. Steak is very good. the tacos are small, so for those with big appetites you will need a few. The torta was huge, kind of like a sub sandwich. ! other had a burrito and no complaints. Prices and service are not bad. This is a nice find.

The prices might be great, but the food is not. I wasn't impressed with the tacos or pastries. The tacos lacked real flavor and the pastries weren't very sweet. My brownie barely tasted like cocoa at all. Not a fan.
Great pastries, food is OK.  Awesome prices on bakery items.
Love this place...authentic food, and fun fresh bakery items made right there!  We eat here regularly.  Family owned...they prefer cash!
This is the best Wendy's in the area. I come from West Chicago and avoid 2 other Wendy's on the way for the food alone. The service seals the deal.

This place could be better and has potential.  Unfortunately, my concern is that The food I get never seem to be correct. I'll order one thing and get something else. We always wonder what surprise we will get in the bag when we get home. 

As for customer service, this also has potential. I'm sure with greater training they'll have more people wanting to come back for more of their food.

First off, it's Wendy's, it's not really 5 stars but I'll give it to them for the following reasons.
1. Place is so much nicer and welcoming since the remodel, even though it was closed while my wife was pregnant and she craved frostys; oh well.
2.  Never have had an issue with great crew, and product has always been consistent.  Occasional mistake, but such is life!  They've always made it right.
3.  Drive thru is on the rt 59 side; so naturally if traffic is loud I sympathize with those who have needed to repeat their order.  
4.  With steak and shake closed(thank god: location was terrible) it's the best place for quick/fast food.
5.  Finally, it's Wendy's, overall the experience, service, and location are good especially compared to some of the ones I've been to in my life.  Just trying to counter some of these reviews that do not take into account it's Wendys!

You want atmosphere and pricey food but good stuff etc; try burger local in Geneva!
Lots of room for improvement with staff friendliness. Poor experience due to rude employee interaction.

Decent food
Terrible service

Speak slowly when ordering and have them read back your order.
Slow service, rude weird new manager who insists on u parking so someone can bring food out, even with nobody in back of me. Then he comes out 1 minute later personally, weird.

This is the absolute FASTEST fast food that I have ever seen.  I am amazed at how fast they can complete a custom order.  I am not sure what this specific location does to be so fast - but other restaurants should learn from them.  

The quality is always excellent.  The speed is exceptional.  The services is efficient.  I would concur that they are not the friendliest service - but it's far from rude.

My wife and I were in the area for a short trip Saturday/Sunday and wanted pizza. We have tried quite a few other pizza places and wanted to try something new. We searched places around our hotel and, out of the nearby places, this place stood out on Yelp and other travel/review sites. I'm back in Springfield now, am happily eating the leftovers, and figured I'd better tell everyone else how good it is. 

The pizza: we had the stuffed pizza with sausage + mushroom. The sauce is very well seasoned, the cheese is amazing, and we really liked the bread-like crust. It was a good change from dense crusts or cornmeal-based crusts. 

The salad: it was really good. Romaine lettuce, eggs, carrots, radishes, and red peppers went well together. Everything was crisp and fresh. Home run here!
 
The dessert: As much as we liked the pizza, we were equally pleased with dessert.  Banana cream pie for me and carrot cake for my wife. Wowsers - they were fantastic! The banana cream pie was very flavorful from top (whipped cream + slivered almonds) to the bottom (crust, which was really good). The carrot cake was exceptional. The icing still kept a little tang from the cream cheese - something a lot of folks don't get right. 

The staff: being carry-out only, there were no tables or wait staff. We had a really good chat with the two employees while we waited for the pizza to be done. They were super-friendly and genuinely happy. 

The kitchen: I normally try to get a glance of the establishment's kitchen to get an idea of cleanliness. The only thing I saw on the floors and counter tops was....some flour. You can't help but get flour everywhere in a pizza place, but the floors, make tables, counters, etc... were all very clean!!! 

We will definitely come back the next time we are in the area. I'm hoping they still have the Boston cream pie next time, because I really want to try it!!!

We absolutely love this place! 

The pizza is top notch, and it's always consistent. The staff is very friendly, and our pizza is always hot and delicious! 

Their stuffed pizza is great. They don't skimp on the toppings, and when they hand you the box, it feels like it weighs 5 pounds. 

The thin pizza is as equally as good. The sauce is perfect. Tangy and delicious. 

The only downfall is they don't deliver. But it never bothers us that we have to pick it up, because it's so good!

It warms my heart to pick up a pizza  here and see Grandma in the kitchen making pizzas with the teenagers!  This is my favorite pizza in all of Chicagoland.  The sauce, crust and topping are all excellent.  Their regular crust is always abundant with toppings and cheese, so much so I think the box weights between 2 and 3 pounds and I can only scarve down 1-2 square slices.  Deep dish seems to be everyone's favorite but  I stick with their regular crust.

Make sure to pick up one their awesome, homemade desserts.  I really like the banana thing and their carrot cake.  The house salad with dried cranberries, blue cheese and toasted pecans is my daughter's favorite.

No delivery but they do accept credit cards now.  They are open at 4:30 Wed - Sun so you are out of luck for lunch or on Monday or Tuesday.  Sad face.

Awesome little place right next to another awesome little place in little Winfield...County Farm Bagels.  Both places are wonderful independent restaurants and deserving of their five stars.

We recently moved to Winfield and are so happy to have found a great pizza place a few minutes from home. Their pizza is wonderful, it's always hot when I pick it up & the sausage is really good. Their garlic bread with cheese is also very good as well & the desserts are great too.

Have been going there since 99. Would eat their pizza more often if they would deliver. Best in DuPage Kane area. My wife usually goes to pick it up to prevent me from buying their deserts.......................

This is the real deal pie. If I would tweak one thing, it'd be an ever so slightly crispier crust. But the sauce is killer and the cheese is generous and tastes fresh. If they have dessert left, you must try it! Banana cream pie and the turtle brownie are nomtastic.

Ordered a medium thin crust pepperoni pizza. There was a lot of cheese which I'm not a fan of.  I thought the crust was soggy. Wasn't a huge fan of the sauce.  I have since been told the deep dish is the way to go. So I will go back again.  The service was excellent and I thought it was reasonable.

THE pizza of the West Suburbs, I've grown up with Giannorio's, and thier cheese is second to none. Toppings that don't skimp or disappoint. 

In my town there are so many options within 3 miles. Nothing beats Giannorio's. The owners and staff are warm and friendly. The establishment is a quant gem of the suburbs, small but not to be underestimated. 

Great desserts, cold beverages, and classic square cut pizza that focuses on the cheese and topping. Very no frills crust, but that's part of the experience. They cook mighty close to the edge.

Try a pizza "well done" to add a little crisp to your pie.

GREAT DELICIOUS PIZZA.  I can see why this place is popular. We called in at 7pm for a pizza order and they said to pick up at 8:05pm. Ordered the classic pan pizza and cheesecake. When we got there, there were at least four other people waiting for their pizza. Crust was perfect and cheese and toppings were just delicious and mouth watering. They give a good amount of toppings on their pizzas. Their cheesecake was okay, I'll try the carrot cake the next time around. 
I highly recommend this place!!

After eating a lot of quesadillas and baked french fries while at CDH (trust me...it's one of the only good food items there), we had to get some outside food.  And no matter how much you're hurting, pizza will always make you feel better.  Especially when you're starving, which having a baby apparently makes you.  
Gianorios makes an excellent pizza.  It has perfect sausage, great sauce, tons of cheese, and a chewy crust.  I like my pizza crust REALLY thin so that was my only complaint.  If you can even consider that a complaint, really.  Either way, this pizza was a welcome addition to our hospital room.  I just wish it was deliverable...though my man was probably thrilled to leave the hospital and be a part of society for the amount of time it took to pick it up.

Best pizza in DuPage for sure. Definitely in my top 3 for all of Chicagoland. You can tell the ingredients are high quality. Also, the frozen pizzas are better than a lot of the pizzas from other pizza. Try the calzones. And it was always great to see Mama Gianorio back there. I grew up across the street so it was our go to for Friday pizza night for the better part of 20+ years. Moved away from Winfield almost 10 years ago and still haven't found anything that comes close to Gianorios, doubt I will. Still order every now and then, still as good as i remember it.

I have to take off one star for no delivery option. It's pizza, sometimes I want to be lazy.

Other than that, this place is awesome. Buffalo chicken pizza is amazing. Bacon great. Cheese top notch. Pretty much cannot go wrong here. I've tried some odd combinations and everyone still liked it. 

Making myself hungry now. 

If you live anywhere near here or even drive somewhat close on the way home, pickup some pizza and your family will love it.

Best pizza in the western suburbs...no! It's the best anywhere outside of Chicago. And most in Chicago!!It's a pity they're closed on Monday and Tuesday evenings. I've been a customer for 20 years. A very happy customer. The family's deli in downtown Winfield is also incredible!
Any pizza or dessert selection is a good one. Can't go wrong.

A friend visited us at CDH after welcoming our son into this world. She brought a pizza from here along with the most delicious home made sweets ever! The pizza was yummy and she raved about watching them make the pizza. Looking forward to going back even if it's just to pick up some home made goods :) Their lemon bars were to die for but honestly each treat was. Don't think I could chose a favorite!

The amazing deliciousness of Gianorios has been pretty well covered by the Yelp community. While I don't have anything to say that hasn't already been said, I do have another 5 stars to chip in.

We had the stuffed pizza for the first time last night, and it was so incredibly delicious! Love the sauce, the crust, and the abundance of tasty cheese. I recommend trying the carrot cake, too.

As another reviewer mentioned (or maybe multiple other reviewers), I can't believe how many times I've driven past this place without realizing it was there.
Love love love,Best place for pizza in town.You will not be disappointed.Just a simple ' to go' pizza place but they don't need all the frills here.The food speaks for itself.
Hard to find in the stripmall area, but worth the search.  Tried their regular thin crust and cheesy garlic bread.  Both were really good.  Will definitely go back.

Best pizza place in the western suburbs. My in laws even travel 30mins to pick it up. lucky my family and i live in town. I wish they had delivery and open earlier on Sundays so I can order it during the football games. But really the best pizza around.

This pizza is one of the best we have ever had. It's always hot. We love the crust on the double dough. We all fight over the outside pieces! The sauce is very tasty and has a homemade fresh taste to it. They are always generous with the cheese and other toppings. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was because delivery is not available and they do not offer any coupons . The reason I think is because it's just that good. They are always busy! Once you get hooked you won't care that they don't deliver or offer coupons. Kind of like the "Soup Nazi" on Seinfeld. You have the privilege to eat great pizza or get outta here! LOL- only kidding. They are very polite. But trust me they don't have to be polite because their pizza is just that good! You will keep coming back.

I was really excited because of all the reviews being so high. Ordered a regular crust half mushroom half sausage easy sauce. I thought that the sausage was of high quality and the mushrooms no problem there...however...light sauce should be for the whole pizza not just sections of it. Bit into a piece of mushroom and sauce spilled out upon my bite. I'm just not a fan of a lot of sauce and it should have been made properly. I also wasn't a fan of the amount of cheese on my pizza. Seemed light for the amount of money pizzas sell for here. Maybe I'll give them another shot in the future but to me it's not 5 stars. There are better options in the area.

Heaven on Earth. You will not be disappointed in anything you order. My top recommendations are the Stuffed Pizza (I would suggest Cheese only... It will get extremely messy with toppings, but to each his own), and the Carrot Cake. 

I'm not going to say I would die to get Gianorio's Pizza, but if they ever went anyway, I might have to go on an antidepressant. 

Angie is the owner, and she's fantastic. GO GET PIZZA NOW!

Crust is great , ingredients are fresh , only problem is sauce is a bit bland .  Needs more spice or garlic or something .  Really only tasted good with giardinera as a topping since it has some flavor to the sauce .
We finally found a worthy pizza place after over 10 years in the western burbs!  Not cheap, not fast, but damn good!

3 of my yelp friends had posted stellar reviews for this tiny, carry-out only, suburban pizza joint (*waves to Joe, Peter, and Pat* xD). So when I was hit with an undeniable pizza craving a few days ago, I turned to Gianorio's.

I called in and ordered the 12" stuffed cheese ($14.50 for the 9" cheese, $18.50 for 12"). It takes about 50 mins to prepare. When I came in to pick up my order, I was promptly helped with friendly service by the young man at the counter. I remembered that I had to try their carrot cake, so I selected that, along with their banana cream pie. Both were generous portions that could easily feed 2-3 people. The total came to $30. When I physically picked up the pizza, I was impressed by its hefty weight haha.

Now onto the pizza. For me, the flavorful sauce & cheese really elevated the pizza into awesome stratus. When I took my first bite, I was transported into my happy place. I may even have closed my eyes and made a few onomatopoeic sounds of appreciation lol. The sauce at first seemed sweet, but no, my tastebuds were tricked; it was more tangy than sweet. Perfect texture to the sauce too, thick and not overly chunky or runny. And of course the cheese was excellent, not bland at all. 

I was impressed that there weren't greasy pools leaking from the pizza considering the huge amounts of cheese that Gianorio's stuffed uses. Also, I was glad to note that the crust wasn't soggy, one of my pet peeves, though I'm lenient if it's leftover pizza. I noted a slight smokiness at times when biting into the crust, which I enjoyed. And even though I started out ravenous, I couldn't finish one slice, so big kudos! :D

Of the two desserts, I loved the carrot cake. It was the richest carrot cake that I've ever tried, especially with that satisfyingly thick layer of luscious cream cheese frosting. I liked how the frosting wasn't overly sweet either. This cake was perfect & moist, and I honestly can't think of how it could be better. The banana cream pie was good, in particular, the buttery thick crust, but I can make better so I'll pass on this next time.

EDIT June 2013 - Even after trying pizzas in Italy, I still think Gianorio's has some of the best sauce & cheese I've tasted. After returning to the US, I ordered a small stuffed ($14.50 for 9") and small sausage double dough. The stuffed was spot-on, but the double dough was too much bread for me. I wanted more sauce/toppings. The sausage was okay. I like White Cottage Pizzeria's sausage better. Next time, I plan on trying their thin pizza ;)

Tried this during my recent visit to Chicago. It was expensive but totally worth it. We were 4 people and we order large pizza which was enough for all of us. So in that way it's not expensive at all. I wish we have same place like this close to Indianapolis . Service was great and I guess they are in business for last 35 years, so no need to say more. Would love to try that again. Thanks!

If you're looking for an amazing pizza in the western suburbs (Winfeld, Wheaton, Carol Stream, or West Chicago). I now live in central Illinois, but any time it is the weekend (I have my big meals on the weekend), I am in the area, and I am craving pure euphoria/nirvana (pretty sure that doesn't make sense, but not much of what I write does), I head to Gianorio's of Winfeld. There is also a location in Lombard (which I have not tried) and there is a Gianorio family deli that is open for lunch M-F down the road. This review focuses on my one and only located at the corner of Geneva and County Farm!

Anyway, I have had Gianorio's before, but it was a few years back, and I thought it was great, but it wasn't really by choice.

A friend had it, and we got the standard sausage and pepperoni, regular crust. That was back in high school when my parents used to pay for pizza on the weekends. Now, I am grown up, with a bank account that dwindles because of my frequent Yelp excursions. 

I am now ready to drive and carry out wherever I please, not a slave to my fathers' coupon obsession (even though he never gets a good deal). Plus he eats dinner at about 430 pm everyday, and washes it down with a Busch Light, stay classy, daddy-o! 

.I get the whole early dinner thing if you wake up early, but I feel like dinner should be a reward for a job well done or a hard day at work. That's the way I look at it. I guess that's why I love food.

Anyways, in the words of a terribly named legume band (Black Eyed Peas) "I gotta feeling, that tonight's' gonna be a good night..." Well, weird black guy who has his voice digitized for that song, you were right, every night with Gianorio's Pizza gon' be a go-ood night. My goodness this pizza makes me want to get up and dance like Justin Timberlake. Don't even need a suit and tie to eat it (yay pop culture).

Consistency is key, and Yelp usually doesn't let me down. There are three keys to a good pie, no matter what type you order: thin, regular, double dough, pan, deep dish, or stuffed. 

Yes there is a difference between the latter two. Please do not offend my pizza sensibilities by not recognizing that. I get so upset. My psychiatrist and psychologist tell me not to get upset over things I can't control. Like pizza novices, but I digress. It doesn't matter if you prefer cracker thin crust, pan style, or stuffed...

The three things I look for that must be outstanding no matter what are they are crust, sauce and cheese.  


Gianorio's stuffed cheese and double dough are my favorites. I've also had the standard thin, pan, and calzones. I even took a frozen pizza down to my home in Paxton, but let's be honest. There is nothing like getting a pizza from Angie on a Friday or Saturday night. Her mom is usually there too. The high school students, recent college grads, and working women in the kitchen/oven area give this place charm. They're all covered in flour and sweeping up usually when I pick up. I would give them all high fives because what they give me is pure bliss via marinara sauce.

If you have room for dessert (I usually save it for the next night), I highly recommend the carrot cake. It's the best carrot cake I have ever had. They also have coconut creme and banana creme pie, brownies, lemon tarts, chocolate cake, and cupcakes! It's like finding $10 in your pocket when you wash your jeans...an awesome occurrence! 

Will I be back? Is the sky blue? Is Barack Obama a black man? Are the Cubs awful? All of these are questions that have obvious answers. Gianorio's, keep it up. 


My brother and I often reminisce about how different our lives would be without ever finding this place. Sure Lou Malnati's deep dish is great, Giordano's stuffed is solid, and Gino's East Meaty Legend is... legendary. It's about finding what you love and sticking with it. I am all for trying new things. But when a place like Gianorio's comes along and is consistent, the staff caring, and the service impeccable it's really hard to dial a different number on pizza night. I always beat myself up for not finding this gem to order throughout my childhood. I wish I found it sooner, I probably would have won the lotto or something life changing. Not as life changing as when you arrive and the smell of success engulfs your nostrils at Gianorio's Pizza. If this is what love feels like, then I finally know how to love.

P.S. I know I always go back and forth between stuffed and double dough, but I can't help it. I think I love one more, but it's like Grandma Gianorio puts here love and care into both pizzas equally. I am not exaggerating either. My only gripe with this place is that I can't have it every single meal of every single day. I know that when these small business owners go on vacation and I am in town I panic like Americans did with Sputnik!

TAKE COVER AND FIND ANOTHER PIZZA PLACE. No thanks, I'd rather eat tin foil.

Dear Gionarios,

I grew up on Giordanos stuffed spinach pizza ...we had one down the street.  Since then  I've dabbled with Nancy's and Jakes stuffed spinach.  I am sure there was an unremarkable UNOs, Ginos and Malnati's in there somewhere. Really, none of them hold a candle to the stuffed spinach I got last night ...at Gianorios.  Chicagoans say that they hate stuffed pizza, but bring out-of-towners out to experience the treat.  Huh?  Yeah thin crust, flatbread and artisan pizzas are awesome, but nothing can take the place of a stuffed spinach pizza ...it's the real "pizza pie"

Troubling thing, is that I have driven past this place 2,00 times over the last 15 years, and never gave it a second thought.  Unfortunately, the whole mall has always been run-down looking, hidden behind other stores and has poor signage.  I even did a dry run an hour before pick up, because I was not sure where this place was.

How was I to know the best stuffed pizza ever resides here??

I digress ...

I typically do not write a review after only one visit, but here it is:

Ordered 12" stuffed spinach ...and sorry, I got sausage on it too:

The spinach stood out, and had great flavor
The sausage had that tasty pop of flavor, that you want
The sauce was amazing, truly the benchmark from which all other sauces should be measured
The crust? Crispy where you want, gooey where you want and there was a tasty char on it
Cheese ...well duh whats not to love about cheese?

My pizza was stuffed and I ate it until I was stuffed, with pizza.  No clue what double dough is or how their thin crust measures up to what I am used to ...but I will let you know!

Signed,
Customer for life

Absolutely. Incredible. Freaking. Pizza. Tonight was my first time trying Gianorio's Pizza with the fam. We usually head to Rosati's, Nancy's, or Lou's. I am definitely a pizza connoisseur. I've had pizza from everywhere...the East Coast, NY, hole in the wall places in Chicago, Uno's, Nancy's, Jakes, Giordano's, everywhere. 

I read the outstanding reviews about this place and we decided to give it a shot. Let me preface this by saying, it takes a lot for me to give a place five stars. I am a pretty harsh critic, particularly when it comes to sizing up the quality of a pie. I'm a pizza skeptic. 

So many things go into my consideration of a good pizza. Crust, sauce, cheese, toppings. Not to mention service and freshness. Gianorio's Pizza excelled in all these areas. We got a regular (thin crust) pizza with black olives, onions, and green peppers. The crust was a tad thicker than most thin crusts, but absolutely wonderful with just the right density and crunch, baked perfectly. The sauce was savory and tasty, with herbs and spices. The cheese was also sprinkled with herbs and there was plenty of it, cheese, that is. The toppings were plentiful, no scarcity, and the pizza was cooked to perfection and was hot and fresh. 

The service was also great, even though they were super busy. This is one thing I will say some other places in the area lack. They were prompt, efficient, and friendly. No mistakes and the pizza was ready right when they said it would be. 

We will definitely be coming here for our weekend pizza ritual from now on. The pizza is truly heaven on earth, can't wait to order from here again! I would definitely recommend Gianorio's Pizza for a fantastic, delicious, suburban pizza experience!

Sorry V&V, you've been ousted as my favorite.

The grandma still works in the kitchen.
The sausage is awesome.
The sauce is the best in area, and no heartburn afterwards.
Greasy, but not overly so.
The crust, it's unique. Well done still has a bit of a chew to it.
They know you by name.

Just try it. But just know that the hours are wonky.

Was looking for a new place after I had a horrible experience at Caliendo's in Winfield. I posted a review already from December. Anyways...if you blink going down County Farm Road, you may miss this place. Tucked away in a mini mall, is this wonderful place called Gianorio's. I called for a carry out order to try them out. Very nice people, very hospitable, and humble, and appreciative of the business. Told them of the bad experience at the other place and they said to let them know what I thought about their pizza. Brought it home and my wife asked if I requested extra sauce and extra cheese. I said no....but it sure looked as I did. I could feel how heavy the pizza was when I got it but wow....lots of ingredients. Flavor was awesome. Price was great. Great pie. I will be back!!!

We must give this a
 four star ...99% of the time our pizza is awesome .. 
Also, when they tell you what time you can pick your pizza up, it is ready and hot ..
You need to try their new deli on Winfield rd... 
My husband & I love our sweets, cannot pass up one of their homemade desserts..
You can purchase one & have plenty to split ...   They are pick up only  ..
One of the best pizzeria's in the western suburbs
Amazing pizza and friendly service!   The stuffed pizza is super dense and worth a try, our family is a big fan of the regular pizza and probably orders twice a month at a minimum!
Our favorite local pizza place. Friendly staff and great regular crust pizza. If there's some red velvet cupcakes from their sister store (Gianarios cafe) pick them up!

Well, after my initial review, I decided to give Gianorio's a second chance. Good god was that a smart move! I made them repeat my order, so they got it right. When I grabbed my box of stuffed pizza, it was heavier than a phone book! When it came to the taste, it was incredible. The cheese is perfect, the sauce is amazing, and the pepperoni incredible. I'm not a big fan of the crust though, I still prefer Malnati's crust because it's buttery and they use corn meal. I will definitely be making Gianorio's one of my go-to joints for stuffed pizza. I'm glad I gave them a second chance, and I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone considering going!
Just ate there for the first time tonight. The pizza was as good as yelp said! We got a medium which was perfect for two big eaters.
The best. Period. The sauce to cheese ratio is unrivaled. The jumbo red velvet cupcakes are nothing short of heavenly as well.

After reading all of the reviews for the stuffed pizza, I will have to try it soon. I've only ever had thin crust at Gianorio's, and it has never disappointed in the many years I've been going. Mmmm pizza!!!
New best pizza place for us.  Had thin crust with sausage and calzones.  Outstanding!

Great pizza some of the best crust I have ever had! Pizza did cause a lot of heartburn in our house later on though! Really bad hours! So make sure you are not ordering to late. The hours are really only accommodating to the owners. We did get the wrong pizza last time we went there so we haven't gone back but it is always good!

Had the deep dish and regular crust pizzas... The deep dish was fantastic, among the best deep dish I've ever had! The regular crust is also a winner, has a delightful crunch but not over doing it. Would definitely recommend this place!

OK, I haven't had Gianorio's pizza in...over a decade? I still remember how good it was. 

I actually worked here when I was in high school - was the doughboy around 1997 - 1998, so if you ate at this place back then, I probably rolled out your pizza! This place is the real deal. Everything about it is good, starting with the actual pizza, and including the owners (does the same family still own / run it?). 

Anyway, I've had pizza all over the world, and I live in NYC now, but for me, Gianorio's will always be the way pizza is supposed to be.

Such a great hidden pizza place!! I've been going to Gianarios since I can remember and I've never gotten a pizza there that wasn't amazing. If you're anywhere close to Winfield I recommend trying giving them a call. You will not be disappointed!!

This is why we love Yelp. We just moved to the area, and wanted to find a local pizza place to try. Based on other yelpers, we tried Gianorios. It is fantastic! Just like other reviewers have said, Grandma literally works in the kitchen, she was making pizza dough the day we picked up the pizza.

And oh, the pizza. It's wonderful. High quality toppings (we had a 6-topping combo, and a sausage/pineapple/garlic pizza, and a sausage/pepperoni), the sauce is sweet and not too acidic, and the crust is great. Just all around awesome pizza, first place we've found that we like better than Gino's East.

And man, you really really have to get the Carrot cake, we will stop by after school now just to pick up some dessert.

lastly, a few older reviews say cash only, but they DO now accept visa and mastercard.

I have had pizza all over Chicagoland.  Grew up in the city with Gino's, Uno's, Home Run Inn, Giordano's, etc.  Have had pizza from every little place in the Western Suburbs and this place is hands down the best.

i have had it for several of my parties and now people from 25 miles away come out here to pick up this pizza.  I discovered this place when they first opened in 1988 and I had just moved about a mile away and have been going back ever since.  

In 24 years of pizza, every pizza has been fantastic.  And believe me, that is alot of pizza to get right. 

A couple of weeks ago, had a taste testing party against Al's Pizza in Warrenville.  Their pizza was really good, but Gianorio's was the unequivocal winner.

Keep up the Good Work Guys.  Also, love, love, love the Pepper and Egg sandwiches at the Downtown Deli.  Put them on the menu for every Friday.

Selene M.
I have had Gianorios a few times since my 1st review, and its just as unbelievable and tasty. Honestly, hands down, the best pizza ever!!!!!

Best pizza around in the western suburbs.  Cheesy garlic bread not bad, The red velvet cupcakes are great.  Service is great, price is average. Only down fall is they dont have delivery.  Would order here alot more if delivery was an option.

A quiet little tablecloth Italian place with a few outside tables and views of both the railroad crossing and firehouse. We had the thin crust pizza which had a tasty cracker crust topped with tangy, sweet sauce and quality cheese. It was delicious and one of the best pizzas I've had in a while.
Lived here for 20 years.  This is the best pizza in the burbs.

Don't know what has happened, as I had frequented this pizza place often, but got a pizza, cheese only, and it REEKED so bad of onion, I couldn't even eat it!

They lost my business....

This is a great family pizza place.  Take out only, no dine in and no delivery.  They are not open for lunch and they only take cash or checks.  They have regular crust pizza, pan pizza, stuffed pizz and GREAT calzones.  Everything is fresh and very tasty.

They also have a 18 inch jumbo pizza which can be hard to find.  It works great for us with all these boys!

EXCELLENT pizza!  The first time I picked up our order from here I hadn't realized that they also had desserts available - but that was ok, because they've got some available when you pick up your pizza.  The pizza itself is great - nice amount of cheese and toppings.  When we moved to this area we just ordered from the closest pizza place - but after talking to several other Winfield residents, Gianorios was always mentioned as the place to get pizza.  I definitely agree with the other posters that this is the best pizza in the area!

Best pizza in DuPage, hands down.  Dough is made from scratch, sauce is made from fresh-packed tomatoes, and the people working there are as nice as they come.  Pick up only, no delivery, no credit cards, closed Mondays and Tuesdays.  I recommend trying their calzones,they are spectacular.

This has been our go-to pizza place for a couple of years now. We wander away on occasion but always come back and wonder why we ever tried anywhere else. They can miss sometimes. I swear it's when Mama is not in the kitchen. Tonight we had the classic and a cheese and sausage and Mama was in house. It was just as five stars says: as good as it gets. The sauce has flavor. The dough is not too thin, not too thick, the toppings are generous and seasoned nicely. Only problem is the long wait on Friday nights. Always think we are going to order early but somehow don't.

Best pizza place ever!  Pan pizza is all I get, but I wouldn't get it anywhere else.  The sauce is sweet/savory.  The cheese is melty/buttery.  The crust is doughy and wonderful!  The owners are awesome people!!  Only thing, I wish they were open more often...but even perfection needs sleep.

Without a doubt, the best pizza in Wheaton/Winfield area. Great pasta and homemade desserts. An example of a well-run family business.
Take-out only. Wed.-Sun only

Probably the best option in Winfield/Wheaton.  VERY easy to miss this place due to its size (carry-out only) but don't pass it up.  Great crust and even better sauce make this a staple for me.  I recommend the regular crust pepperoni.  The home-made lemon bars and brownies are a good palette cleanser.  Credit not accepted.  Thumbs up !
Went today after reading all the good reviews. We were not disappointed, excellent pizza! Will become our new go to place.

We have eaten at this Wendys once a week for the last few years. The staff is courteous and we have never had a problem. Its may favorite cheap eats place for lunch, and I dont have to regret what I ate later. I love that they have so may alternates for Fries with their meals that more than anything keeps me coming back.. Wendys seems to get better and better with each change they make

I dont know who is making my food and packing it, but they are doing a terrible job.

Why? I get a junior bacon cheeseburger with no lettuce and pickles. I get no lettuce (good...) but its plain besides the burger, cheese and bacon. I also get 4 nuggets. I get no sauce even though I ask for honey mustard. Pease note it's all referenced on the screen. 

My advice, learn to read. It takes an extra 5 seconds.

Food was good, and we like their new sea salt fries better than the old ones, but the service - at least on this night - was painfully slow. Very disorganized.

I was a little taken aback by the price. I guess I don't look enough but a dbl baconator is $6, chicken sandwiches are $4, plus add in fries...it's not cheap.

They exhibit excellent customer service skills. They're always efficient and kind. My food is ready almost immediately even when I have a larger order. Attitude is everything and these employees certainly show that to their customers.

We had lived in the area for 5 years before venturing to this place. I was skeptical of all he reviews and very limited menu. However I was pleasantly surprised when we finally stopped in. Yes the decor is a bit dated and yes the sandwiches are a bit more than average BUT you get so much food!!!! 
The server was very patient with us and was able to answer all our questions with grace and delight. We didn't feel rushed nor like the new people. 
We had 3 different poboys and onion rings as well as beer.
Their huge mug of beer is $5!! My husband was all over it!
I think this is a cool place to go and it's definitely family friendly.

A local favorite.  The joint was filled with many older folks who looked like they'd been many times.  The rooms reminded me of an old steak house that had seen it's heyday in the late sixties - still OK, a bit kitsch, but you can tell at one time it had some swing.

Not sure why you wouldn't get the poor boy, loaded with garlic butterine.  It's their specialty, it's been on television, it's what everyone recommends.  I can see the novelty  of a sandwich dripping with garlic oil - it likely was very amusing in 1967, but now just lives on in a faded memory of good times.  If you get the platter it comes with an iceberg salad and backed potato.

Be prepared to be called "Hun", but get the sandwich, and enjoy.

There are places in the town you grew up in that will always be a staple of growing up in that area. Merichka's is one of those places. Very few people have lived a lifetime in Joliet and not visited at least once.

However, there are a few of those places that attract people from outside the area. Merchika's is one of those rare places that though not so convenient, or trendy, still manages to attract and bring people back from far away. 

The older part of the restaurant really helps bring you back to a joint that has been around since the 1930s. The simple table setups something your rarely see anymore and really hits home that this isn't a corporate chain, or some new take on some old thing by a fancy chef. You can tell this place was started by a few family members making something special in a small kitchen years ago and then sharing it with the rest of the world. 

Since I have moved away from the area I try to stop in about once a year on visits home. While I wouldn't right a review based on food I ate in the 1980s, I have to be honest, I have not tried anything else but the famed "poor boy" since I moved 20 years ago. Maybe someday I will, but until then, I haven't grown tired of this butter covered meat treat.

Heard a lot of complaints but I love this place.  It's really outdated (in a good way) so it feels like I'm walking into my grandmas house when I was a kid.  The food is really good.  Poor boys are the staple, but I think all of their food (onion rings, steaks, house salad dressing, etc.) is great.  If you're in the mood for a cocktail, check out the bar.  Great little spot with good tv's to kill some time before your table is ready.

After hearing the hype I succumbed to the haunting draw of this Joliet veteran. Merichka's makes me feel like I too can open a restaurant if I just collect enough Papa Johns garlic dipping sauce cups and soak bread and pressed meats in it. Falsely identifying their garlic oil, that my sandwich had apparently drowned in earlier that day, as butter, is a real crime. Second, I haven't known too many places that have a claim on deep frying packaged onion rings and calling them a specialty but Merichka's is that bold of a restaurant. As I sat, starring at a mound of fried disappointment and a sandwich that was saturated and leaking, I felt like even the most seasoned trucker would have been defeated.
Unfortunately after all this he left there $50 poorer, with a complimentary tummy ache and a girlfriend still hungry. Never again folks, never again.

I have been there twice in the last month. On one visit I had the chicken with American fries the taste brought back memories of Slovenian cooking I remembered as a young man . The next visit I had the Po' Boy it was great. I'm bring my family with me next time. I have to admit I don't have an ounce of Slovenian in me but their food is great.

Love it. I'm from Chicago originally, now live in California and whenever we go back to visit we have to stop for a po boy. I've learned to order it dry with the garlic butter on the side and with Swiss cheese. The bread they use reminds me of the bread at portillos, omg!! So good, so I like to be able to choose how much garlic butter so the bread isn't sloppy. If you've never been, you gotta try it, it'll be you're favorite too.

This place keeps getting better with age, always order the poor boy sandwich with home style potatoes with extra garlic butter. They also have a chicken poor boy that can be ordered regular or spicer. Another good choice is the yoder burger. If you are hungry order the soup of the day or the onion ring mushrooms platter.

So much hype for this restaurant. Some recommended I try the poor boy steak sandwich. The food was good nothing to brag about tho. The service in the other hand was below average. The waitresses were not very attentive to our needs. They were bothered when asked for a refill. Also who says "sure" after saying thank you. The waitresses need a lesson in manners. Would I go again? No!

I'm on the fence.  Growing up, this was my dad's favorite place & we visited often.  Many of my siblings now live out of the area, so following New Year's, we were looking for a place for a large family dinner and settled on Meichka's.

On the positive, I think the feed is decent. I wouldn't rate it as amazing.  Nobody is going to drive 30+ miles just to check it out.  But at the same time, if you're in the area, it's worth a visit.  Our table had a variety of different foods, including steaks & poor boys.  

I opted for the filet, my mother the ribeye.  Both steaks were cooked as we requested, medium rare.  The meat was good.  Again, it's not omgamazing, but it's a good & well-cooked steak.

One interesting note was "wagyu" on the menu.  The last time I had wagyu was in Santa Monica at $60 for 3 ounces.  Here it was $16 for 9oz.  I also noticed on the menu that wagyu was in quotes, so maybe it was wagyu-esque?  Either way, I didn't take the risk.

The food itself was 3 stars.  I knocked my rating down to 2 stars because service was pretty bad.  We waited north of 45 minutes for someone to finally take our order.  When the food did come, there was a few screwups.  Not surprising given we were a party of 10, but it took a while to get them fixed.

What is all the hype about?

"You have to try the onion rings". Yeah, they taste like some onion rings I could get from White Castle.

"Best poor boys". More like overpriced and not flavorful. Unless you like your bun dipped in garlic butter and leaking when it's on the plate. It was unappealing, but I tried it anyways. Not very good and I wish I hadn't for my hearts sake. 

Got a double baked potato with my sandwich that was by far the worst double baked potato I have ever had. 

The wife ordered a spicy chicken poor boy. Yeah more of the same. Flavorless and dripping in garlic butter. 

I spent about $50 to feel ashamed for eating here. I could have just drank some garlic butter and punished my heart for cheaper. It would have tasted the same.

This place is the bomb.com.  I read some of the bad reviews on here and have a few things to say to yuppie fucks.  1. Don't call it, nor compare it to a Po'boy, you want a crappy Po'boy head down to the bayou.  There is a difference between Po'boys and Poor Boys idiots.  

2. For those that think it is greasy etc.  go back to eating your sushi.  The sandwich is slathered in garlic butter what the fuck do you expect it to be.  The guy from Madison Wi. LOL seriously, your going to critique food, your from Wisconsin hahahaha go eat a block of cheese.

3. Final note your not going to find a better POOR boy around.  Try it with cheese and grilled onions, It is big, juicy, greasy, garlic buttery awesomeness.  The fries are fantastic, and so are the rings.  I have had the steaks and they are perfectly fine, but don't expect to come here and eat the same type of steak you would find at Mortons or Gibsons, of course on the other hand Merichkas doesn't charge 50+ dollars for a steak, so why would you expect the same results.  Joliet in my opinion is a extension of the south side, and just like hittin up maxwell street depot, Phils pizza, Vito and Nicks, or Freddies.  This is the place to be.  Enjoy my South Side friends, and to all you bad reviewers of this place, head back to the north side and eat your fuckin kale.  Go Hawks!!!!
This place reminds me of a WI supper club, but the food and service was very good. Two brothers beer on tap and a Poor boy dinner, definitely delish!

Have no idea what the hype is. Had the poor boys. The name fits; pretty poor. Didn't like the flavor of an overpriced, greasy cubesteak. It's like a heart attack on a plate.
Double baked potato...meh.
This is a place for people who know nothing about food or have tastebuds that don't work.
Garlic!! Garlic!!! Garlic!!! Best onion rings. Best cube steak sandwich. Yummy pickles. Just good food.

This is a casual but old school restaurant that takes reservations.  There was an interesting mix of people here including elders in their finest pink pantsuit and pearls, along with some middle aged adults in sweat pants.  The checkerboard tablecloths invite casual ensemble.  

The menu will expand your waistline tenfold.  The onion rings are a must; the small portion will feed more than two adults.

The "plates" come with a salad, a potato, and pickle slices on the side.  I recommend the double baked potato over the fries.

We each ordered a po' boy, one steak and one spicy fried chicken, cut them in half and shared.  The steak was tender and juicy, but underseasoned.  The buttery garlic bread made up for that though.  The spicy fried chicken was extra crispy but also in need of some seasoning.  The po' boy is not traditional New Orleans style; these are sandwiches on French bread, which I suppose you could loosely call a "po' boy."

I cannot stress enough how much food we ate.  I took the half of my spicy chicken po' boy home and ate it for lunch the next day.  I actually enjoyed it more reheated, since the sandwich absorbed some of the spices from the garlic bread.

The beer list is short but sufficient.  I had a Goose Island Green Line.

Prices are fair, and there is lots of seating.  The older folks and families make up most of the clientele.  Merichka's would be a cozy spot for a small party.

Our waitress was a total sweetheart.  My husband ordered chili, but as our food started to come out, we realized she forgot about the chili.  After seeing how much food we had, he was fine with that.  At the end of our meal, she delivered the chili to our table with a to-go container, apologized for the mistake, and took the chili off of our bill.  I thought it was an honest, classy move.
Classic place. I remember coming her to pick up poor boys in the mid 60's! It's still that freaking good!

Merichka's is a south suburban staple and for good reason. They're well known for their delicious steak poor boys, which are soaked in garlic butter and served on crisp buns with even more butter. I've only ever ordered a poor boy here, but I haven't seen much of a reason to deviate from that. The prices are fair, the staff is always extremely friendly, and the restaurant has a nice old school feel that is rare in the area. If you live nearby and haven't tried Merichka's, you're in for a great surprise.

Awesome restaurant ! Try the steak poor boy and twice baked potato! The furnishings haven't changed in over 40 years but that lends it a homey comfortable atmosphere. I've never been disappointed by the food there.

Been coming since I was little.  It has served consistent poor boys for over 20 years of my life.  It is heavy and loaded with garlic butter but oh so delish!  Never been a fan of the double baked myself, but most others get that instead of fries.  Over the years I have tried a few other items off the menu but always end up craving the poor boy with cheese.  We usually just order the sandwiches and share an order onion rings.  A true classic around the area with an old school feel and my guilty pleasure!  A poor boy also put me into labor with my last boy.

Not really sure what the hype about this place is. As a new resident of the Joliet area, I was instantly recommended to go here. It was terrible. Definitely got a weird vibe when my girlfriend and I were the youngest people in the place by at least 30 years.

I had the spicy chicken poorboy and man was it brutal. Living in the MS/LA area for 4 years, I am very familiar with po boys and what makes them good. This place has no idea. The bread I will admit had good flavor with the garlic butter. That's about it. The chicken was not very flavorful and extremely hard. The sandwich fell apart in my hands several times because the butter made the bread so flimsy. Not to mention the "poorboy" was literally just bread and chicken, with a few pickles. No other toppings, no sauce or condiments. 

If you want to eat crappy food that costs way too much with Joliet's senior citizens, have at it. I won't be returning.

This is one of must eats whenever I go home to visit. I grew up going to this place every few months and loving the grilled cheese and "kiddie cocktail." Now that I'm older I go for the Poor Boy. So tasty, drenched in garlic butter. Not at all healthy but for me it tastes like home. I definitely recommend :-)

I don't see what everyone loves about this place. I've been here a couple times and every time my food has been sub par. The decor also feels a little Country, which to me feels out of place in Joliet. Although that may have been what they were going for. But Joliet needs more restaurants so i hope it does well and I'm glad the locals swear by its food. I sure can't understand it though.

After reading mostly good reviews, I was hyped about trying this place out. But I have to agree with most of the neg postings here.

Steak poorboy: seemed like hamburger meat to me. Very greasy, which is fine (hence the garlic butter). But I saw many reviews say "extra" garlic butter. Wow their sandwich must be swimming in the plate. 

Onion rings: definitely home made. But compeltely flavorless. Had to dip/drown in ranch dressing...

Double-baked potato: I thought was very good. Some reviews claimed it was too dry. But what do you expect for double-baked.

Overall, very over-priced as other reviews say. For just my meal, $25 (tip included) was way too much for what I ate....  Won't be back again :(
Very greasy, prices were ridiculous for what you got and where you dined. Onion rings were great but too much $$$ My stomach was killing me several hours later, I will not be back.
Excellent Food, Excellent Service!!!  Been coming here for almost 30 years, and always perfect!!!  Highly recommend!!!

Although at 1st I thought it was way too greasy. Next time I'll ask for easy on the garlic butter. The FLAVOR burst was phenominal I love garlic in everything. I was hangry when I arrived but  heard so many good things. I took 1/2 home and Let me tell you the flavor magnafied After a few hrs. I'm not ashamed to say I woke at 3 am and ate the rest. I added grilled onions and mushrooms on mine easy on the cheese. Will go back again no question

I'm not old enough to have a Yelp account, so I am using my dads , I am 10 years old and I love all different kinds of foods. I had softball practice in Joliet and afterwards we were starving, and my dad suggested to eat here. When we walked in , I didn't know what to expect. Becky a waitress took us to our seats, she is VERY nice. Right away I thought  This place has GREAT service!!! Mirichka's has been open since 1933! Wow! There are only 2 good things about Joliet, 1 "Joliet" Jake  and his brother Elwood and 2 Mirichka's . Well that's what my dad says . First we ordered the mushroom and onion rings dish for our appetizer.Wow!! It was filling! Then we both ordered there famous poor boy. It had just a perfect amount of garlic butter , perfectly cooked steak and amazingly melted cheese, if you like pickles these are super!!! The poor boy has amazing flavor, and I had never had a poor boy before, and I am glad that I tried it!!! It's like a hamburger and a slice of garlic bread mixed together!  The dinning area Isn't  to loud , and there is also a bar area it is your choice!  I think that Mirichka's is a wonderful place to go eat if you are hungry, and in Joliet. We will be here a lot because of softball practice, so I have a feeling that I will be going to Mirichka's a lot , and you won't hear any complaints from me!!!

Actually went on Super Bowl Sunday for lunch, it was dead but the service was great. Have not been here for over 20 years but was surprised how good it was. Had a couple poor boys and they were great. Looking forward to come back in a couple weeks!
Historic Establishment. Very clean, very friendly staff. Very flavorful poor boy's, very tasty &  garlic heavy. They have a very popular garlic butter they use and also sell by the pound!
Onion rings & fried mushrooms are excellent!  Bartender is helpful with ordering & what's good !

I had been hearing about the amazing onion rings here for over 3 years. Finally, I got a chance to try them and they did not disappoint. Very crispy and delightful...probably some of the best onion rings I've ever had.

I had also heard of these po'boy sandwiches that they serve with garlic butter. This excited me... However, when I finally had it, I didn't know what to do with it.. I put the butter on the bread, it tasted OK but was missing something -- so I asked for mayo and some grilled onions, which helped bump things up a notch or 2. But, the sandwich fell short to the onion rings. 

They had weird coleslaw too..it was vinegar based instead of creamy.. I wasn't a fan. 

This is one of those places that has their regulars who have probably been eating here since the beginning of time. It's old school and they just do things the way they do em and don't make any apologies for it. When I asked for a glass of water to go, they seriously only had a tiny styrofoam cup. I asked for a larger to-go cup and she said that was their largest cup. HA..ok weird.. but, I'll take it.

Service was good and the place had a nice vibe. I'm bummed they only had brown t-shirts left in our size because I love their t-shirts. Oh well, maybe next time. :)

Just visited and hadn't eaten here on years. I remember their poorboys and couldn't wait to have one again. It pains me to say this but I was terribly disappointed. The meat was dry and completely flavorless. The double baked potato was the same- dry and flavorless. The server had an attitude too.

I have been wanting to try the poor boy at Merichka's for sometime. I had the opportunity last night. The bartender was very knowledgeable and made some good suggestions as far as different options went.  Over all the food was good. However I was charged $3.50 to have grilled onions and mushrooms added to the sandwich. Basically I had the poor boy platter which consisted of the sandwich, a small salad, a double baked potato and a coke. My bill was $23.50. The meal was good but not $23.50 good. At those prices I won't be back.

I have got to say, I don't know what any of the hype is about. This place was highly recommended to me by several locals as being the best place for a poorboy sandwich, and just good food overall. The place is sufficiency clean, and the staff curious and helpful, but the food just plain disappointing. The salad would have been good, except there was so much dressing it was a struggle to find the lettuce. The sandwich was mediocre at best. The bun was good, but the beef inside was dry and hideously overcooked and dry, and I assume in an attempt to cover this up, the sandwich was soaked, I mean absolutely drenched in grease. 

I guess if greasy slimy food and copious amounts of dressing are your thing than this is the place for you.  As for me though, I'm underwhelmed.

I have to say that I agree with the negative reviews as much as I do with the positive. For me, though, its about nostalgia. When I was a child my parents would bring us to Merichka's. Most likely because an unruly brood of 6 kids didn't much disturb the other patrons. Having said that, this joint brings back fond memories for me. So, while I understand that it isn't the best food, it is special to me.

Its all greasy, butter soaked, garlic infused and wonderful. The house dressing is uber tangy and the house pickles are super tart.

Used to come here as a kid. Same place. Very well kept over the years. Service is always good. Food is too. The filet is more expensive than other places but, a very good cut and generous portion! If you don't want to spend that much money? Go with the poor boy. It never disappoints. Want sample a beer before you buy? No problem, just ask. Gets a little loud at times because a lot of locals eat there. That in itself should have you wanting to check this place out.
Poor boys are awesome also I thought it was to much bread for me however if you love bread go for it. I would recommend this place

We liked Merichka's. It is old like us, but still cool, like us. LOL. The onion rings were really good and my poorboy sandwich rocked. Christopher had a burger, which was a typical burger. You can feel the history here. We will be back :)

I got the poorboy steak sandwhich and double baked potatoe and the sampler platter (onion rings, chicken tenders, fried mushrooms, and mozzarella sticks). So for anyone who doesn't understand what the sandwhich is, it is simplu a thin long ground beef patty on garlic bread essentially. The enfatuation the reviewsers have with is not understandable. The meat did not have any flavor at all really though they did use excellent bread and the garlicyness was good. But given the hype one would think there was something more to the sandwhich but there wasn't which is a shame. The potatoe was also very lack luster along with the sampler items of which some if not all were not made in house. Correct if I am wrong but the mozzarella sticks for example were identical to ones at numerous other location such as Sonic annd the freezer aisle.

Now for some why it has 3 and not 2 stars... the food did seem to have some potential, perhaps the ribeye sandwhich and the staff was great and the building is fun. Come and visit. The place has history and afterall most places deserve a second shot.

-This place is amazing.  I have never had anything but the poor boys, and I don't need anything more than that.  I have tried them a number of different ways (cheese, onions, etc) and have never had a bad one.
-Onion rings and baked potatoes are also a must try if you are into that.  The ranch dressing is pretty weak sauce, but the house dressing is awesome.
-This only gets 4 stars from me because I think the prices are a tad outrageous, considering that they r using cheap steak and bread to make these sandwiches.
Old school, classic, delicious. Bring your family here for their yummy poor boys!

This is the restaurant for a waistline-busting, penny-pinching homebody. Because you'll feel like you're at home, spend only a couple of bucks, and have to be rolled out.

Merichka's is no fine dining and they don't claim it to be. I haven't read through the reviews, but my guess is there are some negative reviews about the greasy food. If you're coming to Merichka's - guess what?! - it's going to be greasy. So go or don't go, but know there will be grease. You've been warned.

And when you go, do yourself a favor and don't go against the grain: get the steak po'boy. Extra garlic sauce on the side, with a twice baked potato. Oh - and try some of the onion rings.

The garlic sauce is a greasy garlic mess of caloric deliciousness. The twice baked potato is as big as your head. And for somewhere under $10, you'll have enough onion rings to feed a small army. 

But the sandwich! Oh the sandwich. My mouth waters thinking about it. The cubed steak is tender like butter (or roasted garlic, in this case) and the pickles are the perfect addition to the taste. If you eat all of it, you may have a problem. So in the case that you do have leftovers, pop them in the broiler and it'll reheat just fine.

And remember: this is a diner. It's a fun, low-key place with below average service - don't let it ruin the experience. Be prepared to wait on weekends!

Fast service; locals dine in often. Very old school food; great portions & specials. There were too minor a thing to complain about. I want to come back as often as I can. I'm super glad the boyfriend asked me to move here!
i love it been eating here since i was a baby gotta love the garlic butter getting kinda pricey but ill still pay it yummy

Amazing cocktails! The bar tender is great and can make just about anything. The yodel burgers are the most unique and delicious thing to order on the menu but everything is really good. Great place for groups friends/family.

Wasn't quite sure what to expect with this place. But my girlfriend said it's a Joliet staple, and she knows that I like old timey places. 

We went here on a Monday night and there was no wait. My first impressions of the place with that it was almost kind of like a supper club. Big tables, relish tray, and huge portions. We Both ordered the steak poorboy and it did not disappoint. Comes loaded with butter and garlic. So good!! The service was pretty good. I have had better, but I have also had much worse. They also have a really cool looking bar area (the tap room, according to their sign outside) that I would like to sit in next time I go. They even have PBR on tap!!! Very cool - I'll be back!!

Been here twice again since my first review. This place is still really good. Granted my knowledge of the menu is limited as all but twice I have had the steak poorboy which is their signature dish. But I am telling you that he quailty and consistency is here and they also have goos soups and great onion rings are among the best I have ever had. Treat yourself!

Good stuff!   We've lived in will County for 9 years and never made it to this place until the other night.   
It was great,  a bit outdated as the other posts say but had a good feel about it.   It was clean and that matters the most.    Big place inside that I was surprised by how much seating was available.   
We ordered the staple of the menu,  poor boy sandwich!!   The hype was right....  Amazing sammiches.   Garlic butter,  great bread,  and the meat was not nasty at all.   Perfect meal!!   I'm not a fan of French fries so I got baked potatoe and that was as you would expect.    Also we had a cup of soup and you can tell it's homemade and was great.

It's true: you can't go home again.

When I was a child I thought Merichkas was at the center of the culinary universe.  I've grown. 

My family went there after a funeral.  50 of us. The bar service downstairs was prompt.  This was the highlight.

Orders were taken upstairs.   Our salads arrived and it was lackluster.  Just iceberg with some red onion and 4 croutons.  No spring mix...no romaine added to the mix...no spinach.  No added color...perhaps cheese or carrot....tomatoes?   The dressing was home made in their defense.

Everyone at our table ordered a poorboy.  I can't believe I loved these as a child.  Good quality bread with a beef patty and sauted mushrooms, onions, and butterine. Maybe my palate has matured.

The twice baked potato lacked salt and pepper and was bland.  Fat needed to be added: sour cream, butter, cheese, anything! 

You place is clean and service was prompt.  Not my cup of tea anymore.

It's a nice little place if you take it for what it is. It's a place that is cheap food, with pretty decent quality served in an environment that reminds me of an old Wisconsin supper club. 

If you go here expecting Chicago Cut, Mastros or even Jack Gibbons, you'll leave disappointed. But you should have no reasonable expectation of those places. Merichka's is uniquely cool in its own right

There are no steaks over $30. They even have bone-in cowboy ribeyes and 28oz porterhouse. 

Again, the steak is nothing overly exciting or particularly special, but they cook it well and it has good flavor. 

The wife and I had a really solid dinner and drinks for $62. It's a fun place to go once or twice a year

To Giles S:  I believe I was there on the same day you were.  I remember my poor waitress having to deal with you trying to get a free meal by stating those exact displeasures to get a free meal.  I actually had to wait on my food because you were so absurd. I remember thinking you were ridiculous then, and I think you are ridiculous now.  This is a true story...you unnecessarily distressed a waitress over food she had no control of.  But I digress...your attempt to get free food notwithstanding, I offer my review:

I remember eating at Merichka's as a child.  My entire family thought of it as a great night out with great food and atmosphere.  I cannot be sure since I was there in the late 70's early 80's before last week, but I think the bread has changed.  I loved the bread years ago, and it seemed Jimmy Johnish last week.  Regardless, it was still delicious.  There is a nostalgia factor for those of us who dined there as a kid.  My southern Illinois wife loved it last week, and so did I.  She especially loved the double baked potato.  I have a ton of family memories from this place, and I'm ecstatic I shared my fondness for Marichka's with her.
I love this place hands down would give 5 stars but the prices are very high. I wish the prices were much lower so i could enjoy it more often!

Delish! Had a pork chop sandwhich with a double baked potato.... Although, the pork chop was weirdly placed on a regular hamburger bun. That's really the only negative thing I have to say about this restaurant. The pork chop itself and potato was great!
The service was ok, not bad and not fantabulous. But, no major complaints here!
Would go again!

Drove past this place for  a year. Finally decided to try because someone here on yelp recommended.  I had the poor boy steak sandwich . It was a very simple sandwich. Steak,  bun, pickle and garlic sauce. Very very tasty.  Im sure ill crave one again soon.
