The restaurant itself is quite dated, which is just fine. But the bathrooms are really in need of attention (not just a cleaning, but major updates and a deep, deep cleaning), and I don't like eating with a bin of bussed plates sitting nearby.

My husband never wants to come here, even though it's so close to our house. I could never fathom why, but now I get it.

So, maybe I ordered the wrong thing, or maybe it was an off night, but I really did not experience any magic when I ate at Seven Dwarfs...except for the abundance of Snow White Murals. 

I ordered the Mexican Skillet and it was meh. Waaaaay too greasy for my taste, not enough hash browns at the bottom of the skillet, and just overall not really impressive. My friend's son had the kids pancake which was a little sad. A thin little pancake with chocolate chips and whipped cream. Not as cute or creative as I've seen other places do for the kiddos. 

The service was really not impressive, especially when there was only 2 other tables in the entire restaurant besides my table. 

Seriously, I hate to bash this place when it's so old and has been there forever, but they really need to spruce up their menu or light a fire under the chef's butts to make some Snow White magic happen. 

I'll maybe give this place one more try.

What can I say. I went to this place for the first time ever. It was interesting to say the least. My two boys my husband and I sat at a booth right by the dwarf mural. It was very kitch but the furniture and decor looked like it needed a good scrub. The food was good typical diner food maybe even a bit better than most but I kept thinking that if the front of the house looked like this what does the back of the house look like. The waitress was a little slow, even though it wasn't gangbusters busy. Service and cleanliness is just as important as the food to me so I don't think I'll be back. Sorry.

moved here from AZ this is the BEST breakfast place we've found
BUT
 we r 70 and would like some quiet space
  many noisy kids and babies here on weekends
SUGGESTION  put the seniors in the smaller front area
 put the families with noisy kids in the BIG side room
 give us old ppl our own small space ;-)
looked online for the menu prices~~prices have gone up since it was posted!!!!!

have gone back several times!!!!!!!

We came here unsure if it was going to be good considering it only got 3 1/2 stars. After waiting just a minute or two to be seated we were greeted by a gentleman who was super cheerful and seated us immediately. Then soon after sitting the busboy came over to ensure we had enough table settings for all seated. And immediately after, a friendly waitress came over to ask for drink orders. They were kid friendly, because my kids got their drinks in a cup with a lid and straws. When I looked at the menu I saw a few entrees that seemed a little more pricy than expected and my kids having the expensive taste they have, they ordered breakfast entrees that were $9 each. I was a little taken back but when the food arrived (5 mins after ordering !! Wow!!) the entrees looked good. My kids got Ham off the bone with eggs and so many times when they've ordered ham off the bone at other restaurants it's been dry and disappointing to say the least. However after trying the ham here, I was convinced it was worth every penny! It was amazing!!
Now I don't NORMALLY write reviews, in fact this is my first, but my kids loved it SO MUCH, they made me write the review. I was more than happy to write it because the food was outstanding!! And pretty good coffee for a diner. Especially with the Hershey's Chocolate Caramel creamer!! Yum!

Disgusting. That is the only word I have to describe this place. The only reason I gave it 2 stars was because its a true family breakfast place--which we don't have a lot of in Wheaton. But overall, horrible. The food was awful. It was dirty. But if you need a loud place for your whole family to load up on, the come on down!

Dirty.  Bugs.  Someone I know used to work in the kitchen and told me never ever to eat there because the kitchen is dirty, and gets treated for roaches because it is not ever given a deep thorough cleaning.  And because it is not cleaned properly there are bugs (roaches) in the corners and behind stoves.  It's a shame because the food is ok.  It is convenient.  Portions are generous.  Prices are high for the quality of good you get, though, but I guess they think they can charge higher prices because of the area.

This place is a riot.  

The whole Snow White and Seven Dwarves things is just awesome.  It really is.  What a theme for a restaurant.  Is it Dwarfs or Dwarves?  We've driven by a couple of times and that's what caught our eye.  We'd probably never had a reason to go if it was called anything else.  The dwarf thing really works.  

The menu was full of variety but I settled on breakfast.  I had a cheese omelette (so boring, I know) but it was the really good poofy, fluffy kind.  Not the flat crepe looking kind.  The American cheese wasn't completely melted though (as you can see in my pho-to) and non melted American cheese really grosses me out for some reason.  It has to be melted.  Totally weird, I know.  I got hasbrowns as well and I'm trying to remember if I had toast or pancakes.  I'm thinking I had pancakes.  

It wasn't very crowded, we were there at a weird time on a Saturday.  Kind of between lunch and dinner.  The other patrons were mostly much older people.  Some guy was all freaked out because he ordered his sandwich on rye bread and insisted that whatever bread he was given was not rye bread.  Apparently, it was rye bread but they switched their old species of rye bread for a new one.  I don't think he was completely convinced...

Husband ordered the Mexican skillet.  It apparently had a kick to it because he was sweating profusely the entire time, wiping himself off with napkins.  It was gross, but it was also funny.  I kept taking pictures of him and sending them to my sister.  

I had water, husband had coffee.  Our entire bill was $16.42.  Whaaaa??  

And they were oh so friendly.  

P.S.  I want to meet Ryan L.

When the three of us walked in, we were warmly greeted by an older gentleman who treated us like regulars. I love the banter that comes along with an encounter like that. Sadly, that's where the fun ends. 

Once seated we start to look over the menu which was pretty broad and we all make some pretty quick choices.  French dips, burgers and Greek chicken. 

Here's the thing: the food tastes good. Especially the soup. Normally, I am very observant, but this was a high stress day and I didn't realize until after lunch how dirty things seemed. Smelled like dirty dish water. The waitress dropped utensils and picked them back up and distributed for use. So while I love an old school diner feel, I'd like to experience a bit more cleanliness.

What a great experience. 18 smelly runners on Saturday morning and the wait staff was very playful and appropriately snarky! Gerrianne was a rock star accommodating our request, especially the bag of ice for Bruce's feet. We all received individual checks, food came out hot, price was reasonable, staff was efficient. We never had an empty cup of coffee. I especially loved the playful Seven Dwarfs themed decor.

I've been coming here with my family since I was a little kid. The owners always greet us with such welcoming kindness. Yes, their menu hasn't really changed but they always give you generous portions and friendly service. I've never had a bad meal here! It does get busy some days, but they do their best to accommodate.

My boyfriend and his friend took me here because we were so sick of eating the same breakfast places constantly. Authentic diner experience and very friendly owners and staff. And the breakfast is delicious! Great pricing also!

A true staple in the western suburbs. I can not even begin to think of how many times I have driven past this place.  To be honest, for years I thought it was an abandoned restaurant.  There are many shops or restaurants connected so it seemed quite possible.  Then I heard someone talking about it.  One day while running errands in the area, my husband and I decided to finally give it a try.  It was in the middle of the day so I was not expecting too much of a crowd.  We walked in and were greeted by a very friendly worker who let us choose our seat.  There were plenty to choose from with only about 3 other families there at the time (although as we were exiting it definitely picked up). The food came out fast, coffee was just ok, and service was decent as well.  It is hard to give any diner more than 3 in that they are all kind of similar.  I also think there are other diners in the area that I would frequent before coming back here.  Partly because of location but mostly because of overall service and food.

Went for breakfast today while my car was being serviced at AAA car care. It was just okay. I ordered the gravy skillet and my husband had the French toast with eggs. The service was good and the owner very nice but the food was just Meh at best. Price was cheap but much better places to go. I wouldn't go back.

When I was a kid (lets say 40 years ago) this was the place to go for ice cream.  We used to go there all the time.  Haven't been there in 35 years.  Have gone 3 or 4 times in as many months for breakfast.  Excellent service and very good food. I would compare this to Juicy O or Omega in terms  of the type of food you will find.  Good food at reasonable prices.  Why have we gone back.  Its the atmosphere (cheesy but nostalgic) and the employees.  They are very nice to deal with.

Exactly what I was looking for on a day like today.   Hot black coffee, excellent service, and an interestingly delicious Albanian-style breakfast skillet.  They also poached my eggs which some restaurants don't!  Best waitress I've had in a long while; gave me a newspaper and had a great attitude considering it is labor day
Great place for breakfast or stick to your ribs comfort food!! Reminds me of the diners in New Jersey and New York.
Great place for breakfast!! Very fast and friendly service, and the food is delicious. I would highly recommend this diner

Dopey is a jerk. Happy needs to tone it down. Someone get Sneezy some Claritin already. Doc, Bashful and Sleepy are fine. And you guessed it Grumpy is my favorite. He's just misunderstood. 

I have a soft spot for old diners. I want to visit all of them. Especially if they have cute names or cute signs outside. The light up sign is so cute, even with some of the burned out bulbs. 

We stopped in for dinner one night and it was not very bust at all. Service was very friendly and both servers in the room stopped to chat with a few of the diners for a while--appears they were regulars. 

Our dinner was pretty average. He the BLT club and Me the Monte Cristo. Both come with soup or salad and we tried the Florentine Chicken, which is basically cream of chicken.  I did like the french toast bread on the Cristo and that seems to bring a promise of good breakfast so I might return for that. 

I loved the names of the Snow White Themed Desserts. The seem to offer some great soda fountain creations. I opted for the orange cream soda--orange sherbet mixed blended with soda water. It was just OK. I've had something similar at Tate's recently, but they used 7up and that was much better. 

Tons of Snow White themed decor/knick knacks. Plus several pictures of the owner with the Belushi Brothers (that was interesting). Clean interior, very dated decor. Family friendly.

I pass this little place all the time and this time I decided to actually go inside. The sign just screams, check me out.

Stepped in and felt I warped through time. Looks and feels like an old classic diner. Everything seemed clean and immediately I was seated. Smiles and kindness from all the staff. I never would have guessed that the name of the restaurant truly meant "Snow White and Seven Dwarfs"! Snow White paintings and decor everywhere! A bit odd but it didn't really bother me.

Ordered something simple, breakfast. 
Delicious. Large portions. Clean.

If you want to be treated kindly, get fast service and eat a good breakfast, well be sure to stop by.

Many years ago, when I was a wee lad my grandparents brought me to Seven Dwarfs restaurant in Wheaton to have ice cream with my cousins. I remember this visit over 20 years later, and have actually been here once or twice in the decades since then. But it wasn't too long ago when it was an early Saturday morning and I was interested in trying something different for breakfast that in searching I discovered they had a breakfast menu, and soon was scraping snow off my car to take a trip to the magical land of the Seven Dwarfs.

The inside has a big mural of Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. I managed to snap a couple of pictures of the mural while I was here. There's various other Snow White themed items found throughout the restaurant, mostly Disney merchandise.  The fairy tale theme is fairly noticeable with the decorations throughout the restaurant. But now it's time to move on to the actual food itself.

After scouring the menu at Seven Dwarf's I settled on a Mexican themed skillet. The eggs were well cooked, there was some chorizo sausage in it, various peppers and salsa.  I would say it was a little light on meat, and a little heavy on the salsa and veggies. The potatoes were crisp and tasted good. Overall this was a solid tasting skillet though as I mentioned a bit lighter on the meat and egg than some other places.

With my skillet I also got pancakes. These were fairly run of the mill pancakes, they were of average thickness and diameter. The maple syrup used was a little sweeter than normal and complimented the pancakes fairly well.

Overall I was pleased with my breakfast at Seven Dwarfs and would come again. There were no poison apples to speak of, service was quick, and efficient and soon enough I was singing "Heigh Ho" and on my way. I'll say this is an average diner and award it three stars. It's not a bad place to stop if you're in the area, and because of the Snow White theme would be a good place to take little kids.
Great food, terrific service, friendly, inexpensive, fast, a little dated looking but matched the theme well. In from out of town and will be recommending to local friends.
Five stars and cheers to their hilarious waitress Gerryanne (I think that was her name but I'm not certain). She was patient and friendly with three annoying lawyers/customers.

This place has an interesting decor. A little childish, a little Disney, and a little dirty. The wait staff was VERY friendly; in fact, our waitress aired out her dirty laundry and told us her life story, ongoing conflicts, and a offered a myriad of other random details about her sorry life to the point of being intrusive. She must not have much of a social life aside from the patrons that frequent this establishment. Poor thing. So sad.

The food was adequate at best. The chicken noodle soup was a huge let down.  In fact, the soup wreaked of body odor and chicken ass. The noodles were so mushy and flimsy they would barely sit in my spoon. I sent it away and didn't want to even venture into navy bean territory even though it was offered. Blech.

The chicken salad sandwich was passable, but had no flavor whatsoever. I wondered if other ingredients aside from mayonnaise and chicken niblets would help their cause? I make a better chicken salad sandwich than this place on their best day.

The bathrooms were filthy dirty and wreaked of feces and bodily juices. So nice to see the owners care about cleaning their establishment. We took a gamble coming to this greasy spoon and lost. Oh well.

Judging from the old-fashioned bulb-lit sign in front of this place, and the very dated decor, something tells me this place has not changed since the day it opened.  Not that it mattered much, because it really is a quite nifty little place to grab a bite to eat.

A little bit more about the ambiance.  The one whole wall is decorated up in a life-size Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs mural.  Also, every which way you turn, you are bombarded by statuary and pictures of the aforementioned Dwarfs.  After a while I got used to it and considered it quite quaint, but upon first entering, I found it very unsettling.  Little Dwarfs looking at you from all angles.  Shit, did that one statue by the door just move a little bit?

Service was decent.  Our waitress was prompt and courteous.  The host, who I am also going to assume was the owner, was also very friendly.  From the looks of it, they get many a repeat customers here (mostly older folks this particular morning) and he was at the door with smiles and hugs for most of the customers.  

The food was your standard family restaurant fare.  The highlight of my meal was the cream of chicken rice soup.  With its creamy texture, and faint lemon taste, it was to die for.  We both had burgers, and they were decent, nothing really earthshaking.  The portions were huge, so halfway through, I was full.  Which was kind of a bummer, since I really wanted to try one of their fountain creations for desert.  They have the old-fashioned soda fountain setup along the front counter, and I can bet some really tasty ice cream related treats are whipped up there.

We love Seven Dwarfs and are regulars.  The first time we tried this place, we were a little nervous because of the exterior of the building and even more nervous because of the interior.  However, now it's one of our favorite places to have breakfast.  I've never eaten anything bad here.  My favorite is the country fried steak.  The coffee stays full (which is high on my list) and I walk away full. Can't say enough good about it.
Excellent food. Awesome owners. Very friendly and welcoming atmosphere. My favorite local breakfast place b/c of what I said earlier and very reasonably priced.

Meh.

Waitress did not seem happy to have us there at all, so it was a bit uncomfortable.

The food was okay. We both had omelets. I had fruit instead of hash-browns, and the fruit was extremely disappointing. They gave me about 8 grapes, which didn't taste great, one small slice of cantaloupe and watermelon. The only GOOD thing were the pancakes my boyfriend ordered instead of toast.

We both agreed that we'd only return for the pancakes, if that.

Love this place for weekend breakfast, not very pricey, service is awesome and the food is great. My family loves going in this place because we can walk there from our house. We are now regulars here and couldn't have found a better place to enjoy our time together.

We moved here over a year and drove by this place with mild curiosity. Finally we stopped by for a late lunch.  The place was just OK with a faint smell of cigarette smoke. The food was average at best. The chicken soup had extremely soggy stars noodles. I had the hot beef sandwich, it was salty and the potatoes were instant. 

Overall, this is pretty much your ok diner with a massive menu - which by the way, no one knew what the (7) meant in the menu.

Love living so close to this place my son and I walk here and get our chocolate chip pancakes and eggs on a regular basis! I have never been disappointed by the service or food it is going to be our breakfast joint for years to come!!!

Every year my brother and sister-in-law threaten to take me to Seven Dwarfs family restaurant for my birthday. Every year I act brave and pretend that I wouldn't mind so they won't do it just to be mean. 

Honestly, it's not that bad, but it's really not good. The bacon was unrecognizable as real bacon. The eggs were ok, but how can you mess up eggs really. 

The service is ok, but not great. It's kinda like they don't care so much, that's the vibe I get. It's like one of those truck stop waitresses in the movies; gives me the feeling I'm bothering them. 

I wouldn't recommend Seven Dwarfs, there are better diners and ice cream places in the area.

We really enjoy going here at any time of the day. We are always warmly welcomed and the ice cream with the kids meal is always eagerly anticipated.
We avoid the salads, but the soups & sandwiches are always great. Typically we get half a Ruben & soup combo or crab Benedict. Great prices too!
dirty and dated. and I'm suspicious of a restaurant owner who doesn't know that the plural of dwarf is dwarves, not dwarfs.

We enjoy finding new places to eat when we drive around. This place had "character". We thought we would give it a shot. Food was good, but not something that would make this a "destination". If traveling through this area again we might stop in.

We go here regularly for breakfast and have never had a problem with the service or food.  Yes, this place is kitschy but in a fun, grandma sort of way.

My only complaint is that if I happen to sleep in and get there around lunch time  they have probably already switched to their lunch menu which doesn't include my favorite meal (biscuits and gravy skillet).  I kind of expect places like this to have their full breakfast menu all day.  But, on the grand scale of things that is a pretty minor issue considering they have either 1. just made me my skillet upon request or 2. suggested something equally as tasty.

I've been there 4 or 5 times in the past year for lunch and have never had a bad meal. 

The Navy bean soup is outstanding as is the fried perch. The baked potato was a little dry but wasn't bad after adding sour cream. The coffee is right on for a vintage diner and the service, especially the woman at the register was friendly and courteous.

 I highly recommend it, especially considering that there are very few authentic diners still in business.

If you like a nostalgic family owned restaurant, this is the place.  Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs line the walls. Even Jim and John Belushi (former Wheaton residents) dined at Seven Dwarfs.  I keep hoping Jim shows up as samurai waiter.  My wife and I like their fresh salads and dressings; we also like their burgers and soups.   The food is great, service is friendly, helpful and prompt.  Their ice cream creations are super.  Bring the kids!
Cream of chicken soup is delicious - huge menu and great portions. Staff is extremely friendly.

I admit the only reasons we stopped in is cause my fiance thought the name was cute.  Honestly, it wasn't too bad.  It was a typical dive diner.  It really reminds me of a place you go to when you are on vacation at a tourist destination.  Very friendly staff, and good food.  The milkshakes are huge (we had a chocolate mint) and the soup (chicken noodle) was great.

The sandwich I ordered was huge and I had to take some home.  All in all, it's a good place to stop by.  I will have to try breakfast sometime.

I have to give it four stars just because they serve authentic Kona coffee for breakfast with unlimited refills!

This was not my first choice for breakfast yesterday, and honestly, it wasn't even on my radar.  I was in Wheaton for work and I was with a group of folks, so I went where everyone else wanted to go.  

The coffee I just mentioned opened my eyes quick!  Our waitress (Sherry) was right on top of it, and was asking who wanted coffee practically before we'd even sat down.  Maybe it was because we were seated at one of the larger tables by the coffee machine, or maybe she was that good at her job.  I'm going to give her the benefit of the doubt and say she was good at her job.  Besides, she proved it plenty of times throughout the meal.

The owner (another reviewer said his name is Sammy) came by and checked on us, and stopped to enjoy a conversation with our group.  

I ordered the spinach/feta cheese omlette, and got my choice of pancakes or toast, and I went with the pancakes.  They were delicious, and tasted slightly different from the other pancakes I've eaten in restaurants of this type, so I'm pretty sure they make their own batter, and don't use some mass-produced restaurant supply batter.

The hash browns reminded me of the Ore-ida brand hash browns that my Mom would make for dinner.  This is not a knock on the hash browns, I was pleasantly surprised by this and it brought a smile to my face!  They were delicious and reminded me of simpler times!  (Yet one more reason to add the fourth star.)

If I'm back in Wheaton again, I'm sure we'll be back there for breakfast, especially if I'm with the same group.  That's fine by me!!!
Nice breakfast spot, a throwback kind of place.  Good portions and tasty omelettes!  The owner and servers were friendly, and the service was prompt.  Would recommend!

Dirty. Old. Run down. What is the appeal? Went for dinner to try it out. The bus boy hassled and brought coffee. This what got it two stars.
We waited for 15 minutes for a waitress. There were three waitress' on duty. One could have swung by to say hello or I will be with you shortly. Nope. I asked the hostess for the waitress, "she will be right over." Five minutes later, still no waitress. So I asked for my check for the two coffees and then the hostess said "she is coming, she is coming." by. That point I didn't care. We ordered a plate of eggs for my three year old because he has to eat, as kids do at that age. The waitress could have cared less that she so slow. She must not work for tips because she didn't care about service levels.  I get it when you are busy, but you have to organize the place into sections so a waitress doesn't run from one side to the other.

The food was bland. I could have made it better at home. The bus boy used the same towel to pick up food off the floor to wipe the table. The carpet is worn out and needs to be replaced. 

What is the appeal of this place? Was it owned by a Disney family member to make the connection to the seven dwarfs and snow white?
It was a waste of money and there are better breakfast options around.

So this place has been with me since my childhood.My grandparents can only go to the same two places to eat without getting scared of going out of the norm. Seven dwarfs is one of them.I hadnt been there in years but everytime my parents and I drive past with my BF we tease him that we are taking him there.He always says he wants to but theres no way in hell I would wanna eat there again.

So one night we ate dinner and wanted to get some ice cream.My dad was telling BF about the witches cauldron they serve (its like 10 scoops of ice cream) so we ended up giving it a shot.

We were seated right away.They place was old,dingy,dirty and just plain out dated but what the hell we sat down. The waitress ignored us for probably 15 minutes.Walking all around us to serve other people.Keep in mind there was maybe 3 other tables int he place so it was not that she was busy.Finally i said something and asked if we had a waitress she gave me the 1 sec. thing with her finger and perceded on with her other duties.Still not even water or our drink orders taken. After another 5 minutes of being a total B we said something again and she totally ignored us again!!! So at that point we were pissed and got up, put on our coats and headed for the door.She came running after us " I was just coming to take your drink order,were are you going". Seriously we sa there for a good half hour and got nothing but attitude.F the 7 dwarfs this place blows.

The place is OK at best with a very diverse menu but nothing really that stands out. They are known, however, for their ice cream which is pretty good. They have BBQ, Italian, Greek, sandwiches, wraps, full entres, breakfast, and more which leaves you with many options everytime you go, but the meal is never a knockout and this palce works best as a breakfast diner.

I love diners/family restaurants.  So after a hunger-inducing day at the DuPage County Courthouse, we made a pit stop at this diner we'd been by several times.

Oddly enough, I was not in the "egg mood", so I opted for a club sandwich on pita.  Nicely enough, you can opt to get your sammies with a side of fruit or fries, which made me feel better about my bacon-mayo goodness on my club.  Nothing too exciting, but it did what a club sandwich is intended to do...filled me up.  And I loved the soft, warm pita bread.  A nice touch. 

The menu was big with a decent assortment of breakfast, lunch and dinner options.  You'll likely find something to calm the beast of hunger within.

The service was fast and friendly.  She kept the refills on my pop coming, and on my partner-in-crime's coffee, luckily for us caffeine addicts.  (We're really nice people, but when it comes to a stoppage in the flow of caffeine, we can't take responsibility.)

Kitchy and fun, we'll likely be back for some comfort food after another day in the trenches of municipal court, DuPage style.
It is breakfast. Nothing fancy. Food is hot and good. Service is good. The owner us cheap and will not fix his sign outside.

We were hungry for breakfast food and were in the area and stopped in to eat. We were greeted very nicely and enthusiastically by the man up front. It was a wonderful change from most places. We also loved the fact that there is still a breakfast bar like in old diners. We hadn't even had anything to eat or drink yet and already loved the place based upon the hospitality alone. Our waitress was very pleasant and actually had a personality, which is often lacking in places lately. She was prompt and courteous as well. My friend has been ordering corned beef hash skillets for years and said that this was honestly the best on he has ever had! Food was great, typical breakfast food. Pancakes were wonderful. We will definitely be back! Thank you for such great hospitality. It's nice to see people so enthusiastic to be at work and taking care of people!!!!

This is a great family restaurant!  There are pictures of Snow White and her guys around the main dining room.  There's a counter that you can dine at as well as booths and tables for larger parties.  The breakfast food is yummy and there is plenty of it.  The staff is nice and accommodating with kids (hey that's my life right now!).  The kids' meals come with a mini ice cream sundae, so be prepared!  The fountain drinks are also a great treat for the grownup!

I'm only giving it 4 stars since you have to pass through the smoking area to get to the big dining room.  I don't care how much you clean, you just can't get rid of that smell.  If you want to sit at the counter, you'll have to endure, as it is in the smoking section.

I was really hoping that this place would be as awesome as the greasy spoon we left behind in our old neighborhood but alas it is not to be. The cheesy decor was promising, but the food was just not good at all, and I didn't even like the coffee. The service was fine and the post-church people watching was fun, but the food wasn't good enough to bring me back. I'll keep searching for another diner to love.

We stopped at this Seven Dwarf's inspiration diner while in Wheaton on Roosevelt rd. We were starving and had breakfast, hoping the food would be good because the corny look of the place. But because of it made it very interesting to me! There were crazy pictures all over the walls of Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs! Also at the counter area in front there were more Seven Dwarfs figures on top of the cabinets, on shelves, etc. It totally cracked me up! My husband had been here before in 1978 and said the place hasn't changed, and I believe it! Why spend the money if they are busy enough with what they have!? The chairs and booths really needed to be replaced, they looked ancient. But both our breakfasts were awesome, cooked to perfection, served fast and friendly. I loved the Albanian Skillet served with fresh Gyros- yum!! I can't really give it any bad marks, there was absolutely nothing wrong! Cheap excellent food!

The food is a solid three stars, cheap and tasty. The service is somewhat lacking though. No smiles, no checking in to see if everything is okay. No one should be surprised by what you get here, it's called the Seven Dwarfs for Pete's sake. It's not a place to take a date.

I've been going here since I was a little kid, but I still like it. Their menu has everything you could want (literally: it's huge!). They have great ice cream and food too. The only thing that I would say is that I hated the pasta sauce. The staff have always been friendly when I'm  there. My waitress tonight was really pleasant and considerate. The place has a really comfortable feel and is like a home. I would totally recommend this restaurant for families. I went to grade school really close to here and we went to seven dwarfs for I've cream after every Christmas concert, daddy daughter dance etc.

If not for the cute decor, I would not keep coming back here.  There is nothing setting this place apart from any other family restaurant owned by Greeks in the western suburbs.  That being said, I still like to come here after court in Wheaton when I am on a case with a former co-worker and catch up, so I am glad it exists.  And Pat E is totally right about the age thing - we were the youngest people in there by about 30 years each time we went!

A good ole fashioned diner/family style cooking joint.  Its not much to look at from the outside, but the menu is attractive and expansive.  Good pricing with lots of food.  Friendly staff.  Try this over Dennys anyday.
I always expected this place to be gross, but it was not. Completely reasonable breakfast in terms of quality and price.

In my opinion...this is a disney-like experience....It was the closest thing in IL.  We had our daughter dress up as Snow White to go to the Seven Dwarf Restaurant.  They were so welcoming and friendly.  We had great service and good "diner-style" food.  I encourage you to bring your Snow White there, so you too can have a "magical" experience.

Seven Dwarfs has been a fixture since I was a teenager, which was long ago.  And it hasn't changed, including the decor.  The food is pretty bland and forgettable, but the fountain treats (sodas, sundaes, malts) are worthwhile if you aren't counting calories. My favorite has the unlikely name "Little Princess" - hardly little and seems to have absolutely nothing to do with royalty.  The service is uneven; it depends on your server.

After having been treated very rudely at "The Verdict" restaurant down the street, my family and I were looking quickly for a restaurant to have breakfast for Mother's Day. Luckily we found the Seven Dwarfs Family Restaurant.  While they were no doubt busy, the host managed to get us seated right away going above and beyond to help us out.  We did not get the same high level of service at The Verdict.  The waitress at Seven Dwarfs took our order right way and constantly checked in with us and the food was very good. I highly recommend the baked oatmeal with brown sugar, bananas and raisins. I never felt like we were never being tended to as the waitress kept checking in with us all the time asking if we needed anything or coffee.  These folks were extremely busy and it was Mother's Day so the restaurant was packed to the gills, but everyone at Seven Dwarfs was on top of their game and they had enough servers/staff to accommodate the needs of everyone. I don't live in Wheaton, but I would highly recommend this restaurant to friends.  Deceptively looking on the outside, the service and food is immaculate.  I would definitely go Seven Dwarfs again.

This place is awesome for breakfast, or our other favourite, the late-night Witches' Brew (all different ice creams mixed together.) The staff can be a bit unpolished; this is a diner, but the prices are a bargain and the food for the price is quite tasty. I love the gyros and eggs. Too bad the neat-o 1950s sign is losing light in its neon tubing.

Yay for no more smoking section! That's the first thing I noticed when I walked in - nice clean air. The staff is super friendly and the food is fresh. I had soup and salad and it was really good. It was my first visit and I know I'll be back. Plus cops eat there so you know it's good!
huge selection, fair prices and pretty good food.....nothing exceptional, but a good value......it's also kid friendly.

I thought I would try this place out after driving by it a million times. The food was okay....there is an abundant choice of items to choose from all at reasonable prices. The service, however, is what makes me give this 2 stars. POOR service. Not a person to wait on us, then took forever to get the food, the service was covered in filthy uniforms (I mean DISGUSTINGLY filthy)....I mean, you are in a restauranty. I don't want someone near me looking like that. Gross. I don't think I'd go back, on account of that alone.

Pros:
Very friendly staff
Delicious 
Build-your-own
Interesting topping choices
Outdoor seating
Loyalty program app (buy 10, get 1 free!)
Published nutrition facts & reasonable calories

Cons:
Pales in comparison to standard Chicago thin crust pizza

---

Boy, not much else to say about this place. I love that I have a new option in the area for lunch. I usually get a build-your-own with shredded mozzarella and ovalini mozzarella, no meats, but just about ALL the veggies. 

I love that they have interesting toppings like artichoke hearts, basil, cherry tomatoes and roasted garlic cloves (which are REALLY delicious by the way). It's pretty quick, too, since the pizza is really thin.

This is more like what I would imagine "authentic" pizza would be, but commercialized, if that makes sense. It's very thin, a little floppy (you can fold your slice in the middle), it's light on sauce and cheese, not super gooey like a Chicago-style thin crust. But you can load up as much toppings as you like and it has a really nice crispy crunch.

I like that they have a small patio to sit outside when it's nice, though it's a little loud since it's right on Roosevelt, and with only two umbrellas, you have to place them strategically or fight someone over the shady spots.

I come here at least once a week and intend to keep coming back!

I tried this location again today but still not much changed. My hubby and I both had to come in to get a promo which was kind of inconvenient since they wouldn't accept it without him present. They had just opened and as I looked around, the place looked dirty. There were dirty tables (I'm assuming from the night before) and ingredients under several tables that had been dropped. One of them had a lot of ants around the food on the floor which made me question, if they're not clean in front of house, how does the back of the house look? I come from the hospitality industry so I feel that's important for guests. Pizzas were a lot better than MOD pizza so I would go here over there anytime though. Management was very nice and the team members were nice this time around too. One more star for the team.

This is a great place to go if you're in a hurry for lunch. 

My sister and I were in and out within 30 minutes. We both ordered the Meat Eater, one of their signature pizza's. It's topped with pepperoni, crumbled meatballs, red onion, mozzarella, and red sauce. I added giardiniera on mine and she added pepperoncini and jalapenos on hers. 

The pizzas are about 12" and the crust are thin. They're put into their fast fired pizza oven, so when they come out they're nice and crispy, except the very middle, that was a little soft. The sauce is a little sweet for my liking.

These fast fired pizza joints are popping up all over the place and Blaze is quite convenient for me. Plus lunch under $10? Count me in.

OK it's fast cooked pizza, if you want something different go order down the street at Gullivers that will take longer and cost more money.
I loved my pizza! For the price, taste and options it was really good. I will definitely be back. WAY better than most other pizza places.
Loved the different crust and sauce options as well as tons of meat and veggie options. I took my pizza home and it still tasted great!
Excited For This new Location
The individual pizzas are definitely enough for both lunch and dinner, wide variety of topping options, it's decent, fast pizza, what more to say.

The 2 takeaways that made this place better than their competitors:
1. Personalization.  They treat you as a person by addressing you by name when telling you about how to create your pizza and what you want to add when you get to the sauces, proteins, veggies.  
2. Cook times are not standardized.  There isn't a timed track since some toppings are combinations take longer than others.  They are primarily checking the bottom but they are at least checking the toppings to make sure they are done as well.

The price point is fair for the variety that you can have for all kinds of toppings.  I would highly recommend that they don't put as many toppings in the middle of the pizza since it is very difficult to eat with your hands.  After it is sliced, the point of the pizza slice is the middle of the pizza and it can get wet after ordering a pesto sauce, marinated red peppers, meatballs, or other toppings that don't want to cling to a hot pizza slice.  Still, it is fast food pizza so go in with appropriate expectations.

This is a good place for a fast and delicious pizza. It's had a nice atmosphere and it was clean. The service was good and my pizza was made fast. I got the BBQ Chicken pizza and I was not disappointed. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for a fast and easy place to eat pizza.

I wanted to like Blaze because it's in a convenient location for me. I came during the first week and ordered one of the pre-made options and they gave me a BOGO coupon to come back. I've tried almost all of the fast casual pizza places out there--Pie Five, UBuild, Presto--but of all of them, Blaze is my least favorite. 

I came back today for the BOGO and ordered the veggie (add sausage) and the link. The link was decent and reminds me of a pizza I like from another pizza place, but it didn't have near enough toppings. The veggie ended up being pretty soggy. The pizza will run you about $9. Not bad, but go to UBuild for the same price with a drink included. 

I really like the crust. It's super thin, but this could also be why it gets soggy if there's too many toppings.

Also, they're still working out new business kinks. I ordered a veggie and when they got to the veggies, they asked me if I wanted any veggies. I had to read the menu and tell her what was on it.  Overall, not bad pizza but not my favorite either.
They are fast in preparing the food and the pizza is very nice. They use flat bread which lowers the calories but still a very delicious pizza.

Blaze pizza is amazing and I wish I had invested in this place because it's going to be everywhere soon! 
Every pizza, whether it be a signature pizza or you build your own, is only $7.95. It's thin crust pizza made lightning fast. And no extra charge for extra toppings. Each pizza is made exactly the way you want it, and fast fired in only 3 minutes! It's subway speed and pricing, but gourmet pizza!

Blaze pizza has mastered the customized personal pizza.  For under $8 you can choose any combination of toppings.   Even cheaper options if you limit your toppings.

Blaze is my absolute favorite "fast casual" restaurant concept.  Ordering is straightforward, and the results are pleasantly predictable. 

Bonus points for options available to those allergic to cheese or gluten.   Their fake cheese and gluten-free crust are not bad.   (I prefer the regular crust and choices of standard cheeses, such as the gorganzola.   But good to know you can bring your allergic friend here and they wont suffer.)

The new Roosevelt Road Blaze location has some of the friendliest service I've seen for this kind of counter service.   Happy employees make for a happy experience.

We came for dinner tonight. OMG. After waiting in line for 35 min. yes it took that long. all 3 of my kids got burned pizza. it was so burned that they couldn't even eat the pizza. we paid 52$ for 6 pizza and half of them ware completely burned. the manager wouldn't care and give 1 free pizza for next time. what a joke, you burn 3 pizzas and give me 1 free.
The pizza is huge for the price and delicious. You can tell them to add extra like cheese and veg it was awesome and tremendous service I loved it.

Was looking to get some dinner at 9pm, many places already were closed.  I decided to try this place ands I'm glad I did.  Friendly staff,  fresh ingredients,  fair prices and delicious! I'm pretty picky when it comes to pizza (from NJ originally). I went with a build your own,  chose sauce,  cheese and fresh toppings.  I made a white pizza with a couple different cheeses and several veggies. They fired it up in the oven in a timely manner and I was out the door.  Had to sample a slice in the car & thumbs up!  Highly recommended.

Unmitigated disaster. First the app makes us go through the order twice before I give up and call it in. Then they tell me they don't take phone orders. The place gets great reviews so I put up with the aggravation of trying the app again (this time, outside of Yelp). That works, so I arrive there at 6:35, precisely the time I was required to check in. Tack on 2-3 more minutes to get the cashiers attention and after I do so, it's yet another 3-4 minutes before then they are even fired. 5 minutes after that, they out of the oven cooling down for 3-4 minutes before anyone thinks about boxing them. When that eventually happens, I'm offered both my pizzas and told to have a nice night...without either of the salads I ordered. Then, the girl takes several more minutes to make a couple of salads. 

I expected to be in and out in 7-10 minutes but it took more than double that.

At the end of it all, the pizza was mediocre at best. My wife's had no sauce and mine had way too much. The only good thing about this whole ordeal were the Caprese salads. In fact, they were some of the best I've had in recent memory. They were the only bright spot of this dark experience that I will never repeat.

Visited with two non adventurous tweens so we just had a traditional cheese pizza.  It was still delicious.  Everyone was very friendly.  It was clean and quick.  Would definitely go back.

Bonus was the free pizza coupon from the mailer!

A lot of ingredients to choose form and put on your pizza. I love this concept although the dough I don't like in these wood fire pizzas and would much prefer a thickness to it. Not a bad place though especially if you like veggies and meat in your pizza.

The food here is amazing! The staff was very friendly too when explaining how everything worked during our first visit. 
Frankly, 5 stars isn't enough.

I saw this place next to the wing stop and gave a shot. Was not disappointed. They make personal pizzas but they are really portioned out. I ordered a pepperoni one and while contemplating the meat head one. The cheese is great and the crust had a great flavor. The pizza itself is thin but for the price point and the ingredients it hit the spot. If you download the app you get a bunch of freebies like free pop or dessert which is a great reward. If you're looking for a quick lunch and use the app to preorder your pizza you just walk in and bam they put it in the oven and you're good to go. Next time I come I will try that meat head pizza. This is the perfect spot for a quick pizza with top notch ingredients.

I'll start by saying the service was magnificent. The line workers and pizza  oven valet's hustled their tale off...with smiles and intensity on a Thursday lunch in early November.  With their hard work (oh, yeah, free coupon) I'll give it another go just in case I caught it on an off period. However, this is definitely the runt of the litter or "little brother"  of the new three quick pizza restaurants near Elmhurst. The value and quality of MOD and Pie Five far outclass blaze. The portion and quality of cheese just isn't there and the value of what I spent on a pizza and soda to what I felt I received was well below expectation. Once again, because of the service I'll give it a #2 but the other two are well ahead on the pizza place hit chart!

Everything was quite mediocre. This seems to be the new trend in Lot of these chains that are popping up. Nothing was bad but kind of a soulless approach to food. The prices were OK, I suppose. I'm not sure why all these new restaurants are looking and feeling the same. Very forgettable.

Came here for the 1st time this past Monday the 13th around 6:30pm. It was great!!!! The customer service was a nice surprise. The pizza makers were personable and carried on a conversation. They explained the process and offered us extra sauce one the pizza once it came out of the oven. My guy even put my pizza back in the oven to get it a little more toasty- I didn't have to ask him to do this.  

Second visit today on the 15th @ 4pm a completely different crew and HORRIBLE customer service. No eye contact, no smile, were chintzy with ingredients, pizza was soggy. They acted as if it was a bother for them to make our pizza- a big inconvenience to them. The manager spent more time on the phone rather than ensuring customers were satisfied. I wasn't offered any finishes. When I did ask for a "finish", I was looked at like I had 5 heads!!! Not sure if I'll be back.

Ok here's an update to today's bad service. Just prior to us leaving, the manager of Blaze asked us how things were. I informed her of our experience today, which she apologized for. She did mention that they were down a person and that some "things" were going on just before we got there. She hoped that we give Blaze another chance- which I probably will.
Manager is super nice and went above and beyond. Really appreciate the great service here.
These pizzas arrre tasty,quick, and inexpensive. Definitely a good place to come for a quick lunch if you're in the mood for pizza.

Okay, think Subway (just in the sense that you go through the line and design your food)...but for pizza (and much fresher and refreshing)!  You get to personalize your pizza as much or as little as you want.  The staff are all wonderful and friendly and let you put every single thing on your pizza that you could possibly want.  You can get everything from spicy sauce to various cheeses like fresh mozzarella or feta.  The concept is great and it always comes out very tasty.  It's on the pricier side for "fast food", but the whole idea of this place is spot on. They execute it well and I've already been there twice and it just opened a couple of months ago.  Toppings are fresh, pizza is tasty, and people were nice.  It's not glamorous or the best pizza on the planet, but what's not to like for a quick lunch or busy weeknight dinner?

Usually pretty good but today's pizza baker was off his game.  All three pies were in various stages of burned.  Two of three were edible but the third was trashed.  I got a half hearted apology & a new pie.  I'll come back but word of warning, watch the pizza guy.
If you are on a gluten-free and vegan diet, you are going to LOVE this A LOT! If you have been missing pizza, you will love this even more.

It's a decent pizza for $8 - crust is a proper texture and taste which is a major plus because so many places do pathetic crust - my issue is with the way the pizza makers are told to minimally parcel the ingredients like they were gold - a meatball and cheese pizza with barely scattered cheese and ONE freaking meatball that they dissected into small slivers in order to spread across the pizza is shameful - for God's sake, charge an extra fifty cents and at least use three meatballs!!!!

Update: went back for a retry - excellent experience

I went to this establishment last night, and upon telling the young man I have never been there before, he took the time to explain how the whole process worked - he was clear and concise and very helpful!   Will definitely be back! review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

Went there on a Tuesday night to try it out for the first time. Staff was Very friendly. Picked out the pizza I wanted and noticed how skimpy they were with the ingredients, especially the cheese. When I asked for more cheese I literally got 3 more pieces. When my pizza came out of the oven there was spots without cheese, bummer :(. As I sat down to eat it, I really liked the crust, crispy, thin, how a pizza should be. Overall, I probably wouldn't come back unless I had a coupon, because you can get better flavors and better value at Pie Five or MOD.

To be honest not bad. Had the bbq chicken wth some modifications crust was good. Too bad so much competing around with five pie mod pizza u build it and others. Same concept but more expensive than others listed and only one type of crust plus gluten where as five pie has different crusts and costs less. Though everything was fresh and tasted well. Granted won't be in a rush to come back as many other establishments have similar pizza concepts. Maybe with a coupon.
Great! I liked the crust and pizza.. Staff were really nice!! Am giving 4 just bcs i think they should be more generous with the ingredients.. As if they were counting what they were putting!!

Daughter brought me here - loved the build-your-own concept, loved the thin crust - fast friendly service also a plus - will return! There are 3 Chicago locations of which I'm aware but all downtown - boo.  Bring one to Grand and Harlem area!

I've had better.  I ordered online, checked-in and still had to ask why they had not put my pizza in the oven.  To be honest, if I wanted a cracker thin crust, I would not be ordering these fast casual pizzas.  I can do better with a flour tortilla and my oven.  I won't be going back, because of the price, the taste and the service left a lot to be desired.  If I order a pizza online again, it is back to Aurelio's, where I know when I go to pick it up, it will be ready and will actually taste like a pizza.
The subway of pizza,s. Everyone has been there and it's okay but nothing  special.  You order a Individual  pizza and they make it in front of you.  Bottom line is its Ok but I have had better.
Love this place!  It is like a subway for pizza.  You are able to choose everything-crust, sauce, toppings, and finishes.  Great place to grab a quick lunch (or dinner).

Eh. I waited for 20 min because they had to redo my pie four times. In the time I waited they tossed probably 75 percent of the pizzas they made. Hire someone who can cook a pizza or you won't make it. The only saving grace is the lady expediting made it right several times over to everyone and was very pleasant.
My first visit and the pizza was greaaaat I highly recommend will come again check out there website for more details and information.

We went to Blaze on a Monday night around 8:30 at night. The place was dead, just my boyfriend and myself in line. We were greeted by a laughing teenage associate, with at least 5-6 other teenagers standing around awkwardly behind the line. We got through the process of building our pizzas, quite slow, but understandable as I know they have opened recently in the past month. The quality of the pizza was just OK, the crust a little soggy, but what you would expect from a fast service pizza place. The variety of toppings was plentiful, and everything seemed fresh. What left a sour taste though was the service, the teenager associates laughing and joking amongst themselves through the entire ordering process, despite us being the only customers in the restaurant. While eating, 2 of them stood in different areas of the dining room pretending to sweep but were standing in place, 1 with the broom and 1 with the dustpan, talking the entire time. The restaurant itself was spotless, there really seemed to be nothing left to clean. Would've been better for their image on service to send 3 of the associates home and keep the other 3 who actually seemed like they somewhat wanted to work. Overall, taste and service at Mod Pizza is much better.

I ate here once for a birthday dinner with a group about 8.
Food was good and the service was quick and friendly. 
Prices are above average for this type of establishment, but it is clean and has nice dcor and seating.

Me & my boyfriend came here on a whim and we will not be coming back. Before I begin our waitress is very nice and provided good service. 

Now, our drinks were watered down and mostly Ice. We ordered the blue crab artichoke dip app and regretted it immediately...it was watery, salty, lumpy with no flavor and the chips were very stale! We sent it back asap! We Waited for over 30 minutes to get our main course which left a lot to be desired. 

All together NO BUENO!

My daughter and I decided to stop in for a quick bite. We were seated immediately which was s good sign. Restaurant was modestly full at 7:30 on Tuesday. Our server Abigail told us what the drink specials are and asked if we would like one. We declined and ordered soft drinks. 
I noticed since we did not order alcohol she wasn't interested in our table. She arrived with the drinks and said be back in a bit for your order. At this point we were ready to order some calamari but had to wait for her return. We placed our order along with the calamari. I ordered a California burger my daughter ordered the chopped salad. Our calamari arrived along with share plates but guess what, no silverware. 
My daughter had to ask our hostess that happened to be walking by. The manager delivered our food but had to ask who ordered what, not his fault. My burger was just ok fries were not hot but that's what I kind of expected. My daughter said to ask for new fries but I'm the kind of person that will just deal with it . I use to enjoy eating here but noticed the service and food has been to standards we are use to having. My daughter said this was our last visit.

OMG ... Worst place ever .. 
Just got my to go order , which was Red Snapper Fillet .. No joke .. The smell was so bad that I had to drive with my windows open back to work.. I had one bite and it tasted just like it smelled ..  I'm not a picky person but this was really bad .. Will never go back .. Btw $18

When you come here should definitely have a beer or two their selections are great.  For food, I decided to order two appetizers and 1 entree.  I ordered the blue crab dip, I felt the cheese and sour cream overwhelmed this dish, you barely got to taste any of the blue crab.  I also tried the fried crab meat risotto balls again to much going on let the crab do the talking not all the sauce.  There sliders served with brie cheese and fresh chips was quite good.  Oh well looks like if I come back here would have to try different appetizers, at least the beer is always good.

Service here has always been good however the wait times seem to be always a little long - expect a wait especially around dinner time and weekends. Try and grab a seat in the bar if there is one! Food is good, good specialty beers if you like that sort of thing but I think it's a little over priced for what you get. We are on their email list and usually go when we get a coupon - makes it easier on the pocket book as everything is around $20 a plate.

Two words. Garlic fries. That's really all you need to know on your way in. We enjoyed some adult beverages, Bloody Mary for her and beer for him, while we waited for our appetizers. First up were the garlic fries, which were fantastic. Perfect amount of crispy-ness and excellent flavor. We also had the nachos. I loooove wonton chips, and these lived up to my dreams.
Everything is really good here and it's a good place to eat for the whole family. Pizzas, burgers, sandwiches, and apps are all excellent.

slow service, food was cold and the salad was brown around the edges. After mentioning it, the waitress bad attitude for the rest of the time. We were served a dirty wine glass and when they switched it, the new one had food stuck on it. Awful. I'll never come here again and will share my experience with everyone I know.

All I can say is never again. 4 of us decided to stop here for a quick bite before heading to soldier field for a concert. We were seated right away but when we asked for a few minutes to think about drinks, we were told the "clock is starting". We laughed because we thought it was a joke but were later told it was because of an upcoming shift change.

Being a little pressed for time we ordered our drinks and food at the same time. When the drinks came out, one of our party noticed a couple of small black things with wings floating in her drink. We spooned one of them out and realized they were tiny fruit flies. Since our waiter was nowhere around, we stopped another one and asked for a manager. Before the manager came over our waiter came back. We showed him the flies in the drink and his response was "ooo, I'll get you a new one". Minutes later the manager came over and apologized but offered no type of concession and really appeared as though this was nothing out of the ordinary. 

After we ate (I would add the food was decent but small portions for the price) we got our check and nothing, including, her drink was comp'd, however the waiter actually made a point to say they did not charge us for the drink with the flies in it. Irritated, we mentioned again that the flies were pretty disgusting and he explained that it is because there is an open window by the bar. Again leaving us with the impression that this is somewhat common. 

We will never return here but if someone else decides to, please take this advice, check your drinks and/or food for flying things. Disgusting!

A sizeable group of us (almost 20?) started a bar crawl here the night before Christmas Eve.  Although the Promenade was bustling with shoppers, the bar and dining area of Gordon Biersch wasn't that busy.

My friend made reservations very much in advance, to ensure they could accommodate our large group.  Surprisingly, the majority of our group arrived on time, with only a few stragglers.  Two girls were waiting on our 2 tables, but they definitely could have used a third hand to take extra drink orders, refills, etc.  Considering the size of our group, the service was pretty good.

I ordered the Lobster Shrimp Macaroni & Cheese which was alright.  I've had better lobster mac.  For $20, I was disappointed with the dish, but it wasn't terrible.  The sauce was thin and the dish needed more lobster, shrimp, AND cheese.

I tried the garlic fries - now those were fantastic!  

I like that they have their own beers;  I had the Pumpkin Ale (VERY good) and sampled my friend's Winter Bock (again VERY good).  I opted for the Vandermill Totally Roaster Cider afterwards.

The bar here doesn't have Malort, but I don't think that's really going to interest (or surprise) many people.  Actually, the bartender didn't even know what it was and asked me if it was a beer - "is that Three Floyds?" um, no.  Yikes!  Your suburban is showing, bro.

Overall I had a good time here, but I wouldn't strongly recommend it as a dining option.  A bar crawl at the Bolingbrook Promenade is a great idea though, and GB's brews are a solid start to the night.

I've been to Gordon Biersch twice and I approve. The first time I dined was with my in-laws to celebrate my big move and then I came back again with a party of 20 last night. The service was good both times (I had a few minimal complaints last night.. but I did keep in mind we were a large party and I think they did a nice job. The manager even came over to check on us and make sure we were enjoying our food and drinks.)

I must start by mentioning that the fish tacos are fantastic. I usually order them everywhere I go and the ones here are very good. Last night, I ordered the beer mussels and-- upon recommendation from the server-- the seafood cobb salad. The mussels weren't my fave but they were aight. The seafood cobb salad was so good. It had crab and shrimp in it with a jalapeno ranch dressing.

They offer their own beers, as well as a seasonal cider and select wine and cocktails. I went with the Vandermill Totally Roasted cider, but I had a few sips of my friend's beers and did enjoy them.

I don't make it out to Bolingbrook too often, but I think this is one of the best dinner and drinks spot there. And pro, you can go shopping right afterward!

Beer is delicious, the food is okay... the garlic fries and their (surprisingly good) tacos are the best part, the burgers aren't as good as they could be - mostly due to the mediocre quality of the meat.

Cool place, good sized restaurant and awesome looking bar. The place seems very upscale when you walk in but the prices are not much far off from your average chain restaurant. My server,(I think her name was Brooke) was super friendly and attentive. I am a waitress myself so I Really appreciate great service, and this place was very busy for a Monday night. They have awesome drink specials and when I went all of thier draft in house brewed beers were 3$ in any size! That's amazing!!
I ordered the CBLT which is a blt on wit a chicken breast and avocado mayo. This sandwhi has was on point, super delicious! The wait time was probably only about 10 minutes all together.
Overall it's a great place with lots of variety. Deffinatly will be returning.

This was one of my favorite restaurants until today.  Although service is typically slow, today was ridiculous.  We waited 58 minutes from the time we ordered our food until it was brought to our table, on a Sunday afternoon nonetheless.  Even our drinks (non-alcoholic) took forever and were brought out 1 at a time.   My husband was served raw bacon, it was dangerously undercooked.  When we asked for the manager her response was "would you like me to take it off your plate?"  There was no concern that we had been served such undercooked pork.  Yes, they comped his meal but the attitudes of our server and the manager told me this is routine and we cannot trust what is being served at this restaurant.

My friend and I stopped by to grab an early dinner after attending a wine tasting event at Binny's.  The service was great and I enjoyed the outdoor seating area on a perfect fall afternoon.  The food was ok but a bit pricey for the quality offered.

Great food.  Loud dining room.  Horrible service from our waiter.

We also had a coupon for free birthday meal.  Originally waiter said order anything you want and it would be free...then when bill came he changed his story and rules of the coupon were different.  Not cool!  

Might be a decent place for carry out, as food was very good.

Two stars because of the bait and switch regarding the coupon.

Gordon Biersch has had amazing service every time I have been here. They have a wonderful selection of beer and food that has all been delicious. At our most recent visit, our server, Warren, was absolutely wonderful. He brought us free samples because a loud group was near us and was very pleasant. Highly recommend!

I thought this place was awesome!! They have perfectly sized small plates and wonderful apps!! The highlight was certainly the tuna wonton chips--plenty of flavor and amazing textures. The service was very prompt, the drinks were strong, and the atmosphere was quiet but nice. Will definitely be back.

Bathrooms smelled like an outhouse.  Food was overpriced for what you get.  Restaurant smelled like old grease.  This place did not age well.....very disappointing.  They need to try harder with all the great restaurants in this area.

I came here with a work associate, and I will simply agree with yelp's description - "A-Ok".  This place has your average American food.  I've been to a few Gordon Biersch locations, and they all feel the same.  I ordered a basic grilled chicken sandwich on a baguette with garlic fries.  Those fries make it worth coming, good spuds.  Otherwise, on my last visit, we ordered the fried artichoke hearts that I felt were a bit too small in size and quantity to justify the pricing.  The sweet potato fries were nicely fried, but the added sugar took it a bit far.  I personally feel that the natural sweetness of the potato didn't need the extra sugar - if anything, a hit of salt could have made it a bit more interesting.  Their salads however are a decent size with chicken nicely tender and thankfully not overly cooked.  If you're a beer lover, I would give this place a shot considering that they brew their own beers, which scores points with me.  They have a variety of beers, if you feel adventurous, go for the sampler.

Great food; garlic fries weren't exactly garlic fries but still tasty. For a $9 Bloody Mary, I felt it needed to be more garnished rather than a half a piece of celery. The waitress was also very rude and seemed to have rushed us out even though it was very empty during the afternoon. She also did not bring my change back, she voluntarily kept my change without asking as a tip. Not once did I say "keep the change." 

The nachos were bomb though. Nice venue.

Wow..this is my kind of place. We've been here a few times before and it would easily be more if not for one of my favorite restaurants being literally feet away. Anyways..on to GB. I split the CBLT and Cali Chicken sandwiches with my wife. Both were phenominal but the CBLT is heavenly. Shit..so is the Cali Club!  My son adds that his cheese pizza was pretty damn good too. 

Beer. Had the 'brown'. No cutesy names here..just beer. The brown is caramel, toffee and a dash of bittersweet chocolate..and..awesome. Had to knuckle down to avoid a second.

Aside from the food and beer I like the seating options. We sat at the high top barside tables but they also have outdoor bar pull-up seats. If it wasn't for the Cubs game we would have sat out there. 
Cheers!

You would be better off eating at one of the many other GREAT restaurants in the promenade! I had a steak full of tendons/ligaments. I made a comment to the waiter and he took my plate and walked away without a word! Garlic mashed potatoes were dry and flavorless! Not worth the money or time!

Foray I've been here amd i like it !! Our service qas really fast and friendly. Nice food and appetizers for beer ! 
Dont miss it  guys !!! Come here !!!

$93 all in for two burgers, two salads and two beers...uh, no. We have given this glorified bar food restaurant third and fourth chances but never again. We ordered the Kobe burger- they're out of Kobe. Their pear and Gorgonzola salad was served with underripe pears, 5-6 Craisins, a few blueberries and wilted greens. The atmosphere is good, but watch your wallet and your intelligence- the ownership insults its customers to their face by offering crap food and making you thank them for it with their prices.

I've now dined (and drank) at Gordon Biersch about four times and it is consistently good, never mind blowing though.  We sample about five of the GB pilsners and each one was as good as the last!  

We ordered the blud crab and artichoke dip for an appetizer.  B+  It was very good and was served still boiling.  The taste was great, I could have used a bit more crab and a little more dip.  We ended up with 2 crostinis and an empty dip bowl when it was all said and done.  

I ordered a cup of the New England Clam chowder.  A+++   I am always amazed when I find a chowder that has clams as the main ingredient as opposed to potatoes!  You would think that this would be more the exception than the rule!  Literally 60% clam meat and seasoned to perfection.  I will be back for this yummy chowda preparation.  

Because we were pretty full by this point we decided to split the fish and chips with the famous garlic fries.  I will give the fish a C+, they looked like fish sticks.... perfectly straight and  all identical in size.  That always makes me nervous, fish should not look like it was extruded out of a fish stick maker!   The taste was acceptable though, and we ate about 40% of the fish.   The Garlic fries were pretty damn good.  I prefer the garlic fries at Firewater BBQ in Crest Hill, IL, but these were pretty good as well.  A

Our bartender was attentive and engaging when he had time.  They were tolerant of our loud presence and even participated in the ruckas a few times.  

I will be back and I can definately recommend GB to foodies and Craft beer Connoisseurs as well.

As the closest Ikea is in Bolingbrook, this is my family's frequent lunch stop whenever we're doing shopping there. However, after our last experience this weekend we will not be returning. 

The food and the beer is decent. The garlic fries are incredibly delicious. However, all of these good aspects of the restaurant mean nothing when you look at the awful service you receive. 

During an experience here last winter it was incredibly difficult to get ahold of our waitress and the food took forever. We chalked it up to it being the holidays and that they were busy. This past Sunday they were not busy, but we got the same treatment.

A family next to us who had sat down about 15 minutes after we had arrived received their food and had left before ours even got on the table. When we finally did receive our food, my dads chicken was severely undercooked. It was literally still pink on the inside. 

While I understand these things are bound to happen, the staff did not handle it well at all. They apologized and concurred that it was underdone, but did not take it off the bill. The full entree price was still on the check. It is common curtesy to take off something that could have made your customers sick. The mix of that situation as well as the awful service has left a bad taste in my mouth about this place which is why we will not be returning.
I love this place but they do need to bring back the pecan encrusted salmon.   It was their best dish.

My wife and I have frequented this restaurant / brewery many times and for the most part, the beer has always been consistently good. Now, they have many new styles to choose from as well as a "flight" where you choose 6 or more small samples.

The reason why I have given them a two star rating is because their food quality has been declining drastically over the past several years to the point where we have decided never to cross their doorstep again. 

For starters, my wife ordered the potato chips which were very tasty and season to perfection. I ordered the yellowfin tuna. Each time I come to this restaurant I order this appetizer and they do "okay" considering the preparation is never the same. This preparation had no taste at all. I feel I wasted my money. 

For her entree, my wife ordered the margarita flatbread pizza. Several of the pieces tasted like sand was sprinkled on top. We nave no idea what that was all about. I ordered the wild halibut, blackened. It came out like shoe leather. First, the waitress was a little belligerent when I was asking if they could prepare it this way; she didn't seem to understand what I was asking yet there were other blackened fish selections on the menu. Anyway, the fish was awful. It was extremely dry and over cooked. Kristine, the GM, took it off our bill. Actually she said she would, but didn't. So we insisted the server remove it.

Long story short, go for the beer but make another selection for dinner.

Pretty good beer as my girlfriend & I had a flight of all the beers.  We had the blue crab & artichoke dip which was very good.  I had the cajun fish tacos which were excellent and she had the california burger which was great.  I give it 4 stars on the food & drink.  However, the service was horrible.  We sat at a high top in the bar area which was half full on a Friday at 4:30.  Took forever to get our drinks, had to track down the waitress 3 times. Once to put our food order in, then to get the check, then to pay.  The manager was walking around and it appeared his only concern was to push chairs in.  I'm sure that's important.  Also, our table was never cleared.  Definitely not worth the trip.

Just when I thought Rock Bottom Brewery was good, I stumbled upon this place and it's even better.  

Get there early especially during the weekend.  It tends to get crowded during dinnertime.  I like the feel of this place.  It has a warm, tavern feel and it's a great place to dine with a large group.

I ordered their Lobster and Shrimp tacos.  Very good!!  We ordered their fish and chips.  My only complaint was they looked more like fish sticks than your typical fried cod. 

Overall good service and quality food.  I would definitely recommend this place!

For a chain-style establishment, the food quailty & service is top notch.  You feel like you're at a high-end, independent brewhouse.  There are hints of corporate oversight, like menus, cheesy table tents, etc, but overall the environment is great. 

We love to go for a few beers & dinner with friends on a path around the whole mall - they never disappoint.

I haven't been here in a couple of years but decided to stop in for a late lunch last Thursday.  I was pleasantly surprised on the quality of the food.  I guess that's why I've stayed away as the food was just ok.  Ordered the pan fried citrus chicken with the side of spaetzel and mushrooms.  Overall pretty good.  A little on the oily side but very flavorful. Also had the tomato bisque soup which was very good.  The dessert was a triple chocolate fudge brownie with chocolate ice cream on top.  Also very good.  So was the service and the ambience.   Strong selection of brews as you would expect. 

Cheers!

John

The beers here are great. Their food is pretty good although I stick to what I usually get here. The service isn't always great. I love coming here to get the crab risotto fritters, mushroom risotto fritters, and spicy chicken risotto fritters. The crab ones are my fave. I also like their garlic fries because they add real garlic.

Stood there for a few minutes and no one ever came up to the front to greet me so I just walked out even though multiple people saw me. Only giving A 2 star because I have been here before it was good

I used to LOVE this place.It was my favorite brew pub. They were the only brewery to make German style pilsners vs ales and their food was all excellent. Then something happened about a year ago. It might be due to it being bought out by the same company that owns Rock Bottom or just new management, I don't know. The food now is forgettable and it seems like they cheapened the ingredients in their beers. Their signature garlic fries are not even good anymore. Come on guys, is garlic really that expensive that you have to scrimp? I won't being going back anytime soon.
Excellent pasta and burgers. Crafted beer.

Chintzy burger! Wasn't even half the size of the bun! Had the $3 apple cider cole slaw, not even any apple cider vinegar in it!
This is our third stop here!
Really liked the garlic fries, but the lazy surly staff and lackluster food isn't worth another try!
I've got two $9.95 coupons for appetizers with an entree that won't be getting used!

Had a large party of people, and sadly we didn't make a reservation. We were told we had to wait about 45 min; which was fine due to we were waiting in more people. 1 1/2 later we were finally sat. I was just more upset that there was no communication with us about the wait time after. I had to go up and keep on checking on the reservation.
