I get it we had a large party and had to wait but the lack of communication was what made us all more mad. When the food came out it was all warm, the plates weren't even hot. The only reason we all ate out plates clean was that we had been waiting almost 2 hrs. I don't think we will go out of our way to come back to this place again.
Nummy, deLISH tasty food. Coupled with friends service equals delightful afternoon dining experience. Come here, you will not be disappointed. ;-)

It's unfortunate that I had to knock a couple stars off my original rating, but it needed to be done. Since moving away from area, I have not been able to make it out to GB in quite a while; so my boyfriend and I made a special trip out this way. The beer quality remains the same, but the food quality has drastically changed for the worst. The food no longer has a finesse about it that it once had, yet the prices still remain high. For example, my boyfriend ordered the steak frite and was completely dissatisfied with what was delivered to the table, he had it sent back. Nothing about the dish was as he remembered. A manager never came to our table despite our dissatisfaction which had to be painted clearly on our faces (we don't like to raise our voices and cause a scene). The only thing we received was an apology from the bartender (we were sitting at the bar) and a short explanation on how they have "re-engineered" a few items on their menu ... just awful. If it's not broken, why fix it. They replaced a traditional steak frite for an underwhelming steak with french fries on the side and no sauce on the steak or on the side. I had the California burger, also a disappointment from the previous times I would order it (and cold from me waiting for my boyfriend's food to come back out - my fault, but I didn't want to finish my dinner in front of a starving boyfriend!)

Ugh GB, no more special trips to visit anymore... such a shame. You will be missed for what you were.

Coming here on a Saturday evening was a bit of a calamity- this place was jumping and had a 45 minute wait. We didn't care where we sat, so when we heard the bar was open seating, we were able to sit immediately, and were still able to get the full dining experience.

This was my first time, and I wanted to try one of their own brews, so I opted for the Golden Export. It was light, not overly flavorful, but drinkable. 

For food, we ordered unhealthy and got the blue crab artichoke dip and the sampler platter. I was excited for the dip, since I love crab. There was good chunks of crab in there, and it was nice and hot, but I thought the flavor was a little too cream cheese/sour creamy for me. I also didn't note much in the way of artichokes.

The sampler platter had two kobe sliders, southwest egg rolls, garlic fries, hummus.... it was a LOT of food. All of it was good, but nothing was super memorable.

Service was pretty consistent and quick. The place has an open, but warm atmosphere. I'd like to come back when it's warmer to sit outside!

one of my favorites. 

marzen beer is always a perfect combo with the marzen bbq burger. 

my wife and i always went the the one in columbus ohio. the one in bolingbrook isnt quite as good, but still very tasty.

Gordon Biersch is small chain brewery with locations in many states across the country.  I was a regular at the Gordon Biersch in Miami and was thrilled to be able to go there for dinner after a trip to the nearby IKEA.  The menu is almost the same from what I remember three years ago.  

We started our meal off with beers--I got the Marzen, and he got the Oktoberfest.  The great thing about GB is that all of their beers are 1.5 liter pours.  However, the beer wasn't as good as I remembered.  Maybe it was an off batch, or maybe the brewer isn't as good at this location.  We ordered the crab and artichoke dip which is still amazing.  It used to come in a bread bowl, which would have been better because you run out of bread.  I ordered the blackened mahi sandwich with garlic fries.  The flavor was really great, maybe a little bit too salty, but the same as I remember.  If you love garlic, you will love the garlic fries--they are awesome!

The service was really good throughout our meal.  And we sat on the patio on a slightly chilly fall night, but there are heat lamps which made it nice.  The food is great for a bar, but the beers weren't so great, maybe they'll be better next time.

I never post on Yelp but I thought it was extremely necessary. Hence I am using my fiancs Yelp.  Brought her out to a late dinner here on Friday at 9:00 pm.  When we walked in I asked for a table of two, the hostess started walking me toward the back and proceeded to a table right next to the entrance of the kitchen where there is a lot of foot traffic from the employees. I immediately asked for a booth because there were only 2 booths occupied. The hostess said booths were only for reservations, so I reluctantly agreed to sit at a table near the entrance to the kitchen while there were at least ten other unoccupied tables and at least 8 booths unoccupied in the same section. We proceeded to wait for the waiter to greet us. 20 minutes goes by  and an older gentleman with gray hair approaches the table looking like he absolutely hates his life and has better things to do on this Friday night than to wait a table.  He never gives us his name. We order a bottle of wine and some waters.  Another gentleman comes to the table and sets the bottle of wine on the table and leaves after opening it, not even pouring a glass for us. Another 20 minutes goes by, meanwhile our waiter is liaising with other customers and chatting and laughing with his other tables. He finally comes to take our order. We order steak dinners. While I'm trying to enjoy my meal with my fianc, another waitress begins to sweep the carpet in the middle. While sweeping, she sweeps a half eaten piece of bread next to my foot as well as the dust from the carpet. I was totally disgusted and proceeded to stare at her while she continued to do this while I was eating my meal. She then sits down at a table, leaving the pile of dirt and food next to my table to chit chat with a couple she was waiting on.  We finished the bottle of wine and the meal and the waiter keeps ignoring us chatting with his tables ( that were sat at the booths after we arrived that were supposed to be for reservations only) and another 20 minutes goes by. Finally he approaches us and asks if we would like dessert. Reluctantly I said no just the check.  I proceeded to tip my usual 20% on a bill that was over $100 even though the service was unlike anything I have ever experienced in my life. I am a 29 year old male who looks very young for his age. I came to the conclusion that I was treated this was because they either thought I was young and broke and wouldn't make any considerable tips off of me or because they just didn't care that I was a customer trying to enjoy a meal with my fianc. If I could give below one start for this place I would but it's not possible. There is more I could say about this place but it's not worth my time to be on here. Should management read this and like to contact me my email is zacheryh88@hotmail.com

Everything here is so good! My personal favorites are: Shrimp & Lobster Tacos with Garlic fries, Blackened Fish sandwich, creme brulee and since im not into beer, their mojitos!!! Everytime I go there, I get really great, friendly service.

I came for a birthday a few weeks ago after not eating here for a few years. I was never impressed with it, but I definitely noticed the improvements this time around. We had a reservation for 11 people at 7:00pm and I was first to arrive. The host asked if I wanted to be seated so I said yes. He then came back and told me I had to wait, even though the table was ready. The friend I was with and I would have ordered some drinks, maybe an appetizer while we were waiting but ok, guess not. Food was decent, I had a chicken sandwich that was really good. I also had a started salad that was fantastic. We had 2 servers, but our party was still always lacking water, bread, etc. We told them it was a birthday so they offered my friend a dessert on the house and she chose Creme Brulee. She was then told they were out and then when she ordered something else, I got charged for it. They took it off, but still. It still wouldn't be my first choice to come here, but with the larger menu I definitely think they're going in the right direction.

Went there to bring my friend out to dinner for her birthday, it was a nice day out so we went to sit outside, they had all the heat lamps on so it made it really warm, I ended up saying something to the waitress and they turned them off. 

Food - I order a roast turkey sandwich with the garlic fries, fries were good, sandwich was okay. My friend ordered the chicken sandwich, kind of disappointed with the portion size of the chicken itself just by looking at it, I personally did not try it, it looked good. Just there was ALOT more bread then there was chicken, the piece of chicken was probably slightly bigger than 1/2 of the pieces of bread. 

Waitress - I cannot recall the waitresses name but she seemed friendly but didn't give our table her full attention, I ended up finishing my coke and didn't get offered a refill until we were ready to leave. There were two times throughout the meal that I couldn't find her to get a refill or ask for some additional ranch. She didn't bring the food to us, another waiter did. The waitress didn't come and ask how it was at all or even check up to see if we needed anything else, if we needed something we had to flag her down. Being the "dinner rush" time she wasn't very attentive, which it didn't seem all too busy to the point where she couldn't of paid attention to her tables.

Saw the Manger (I'm assuming that's who he was) of the restaurant laughing and joking with some of the staff at the bar, as a manager of a restaurant he should be walking around and introducing himself to tables and seeing how things are with the tables. 

Would I return?  - probably not... food was just okay, nothing I would absolutely have to go back for, especially with the service given.

Good service good food great beer. Went with my boyfriend for his birthday.  He loves there bbq chicken pizza. Their fried calamari app is lightly battered fried to perfection and never chewy. The garlic dipping aloi is better than the marinara and has a horse raddish kick to it. 
They don't have blue cheese olives the server said it was a health code issue.  He was very accommodating and gave me a cup of blue cheese so i could stuff them myself.  
I had the chef special pan seared cod. It was greasy and the kalmalata olives were pitted but there were still pieces of the seed and i bit down on one and thought I was going to crack a tooth.

Went back with a large group and got the same burger I had previously gotten. It was good but not amazing like it had been the previous time. My burger also came with about 10 fries total, which was quite a small portion compared to my previous visit. We were with a large group but our servers didn't really check back with us for refills and there were quite a few errors on the bill when it arrived. Still love the place, just wasn't as impressed as I had been on the previous visit
Food is good.  Service was good until it got crowded.  Then we could hardly get the waitress' attention.  So if you don't mind spending time to be waited on, eat there.  Otherwise someplace better.

So bummed by our experience here. The hubs & I had a gift card from my sister for this place for our 'mommy daddy date night'. I wish we would have just not gone..

Pros: crab & artichoke dip was absolutely  fabulous. Garlic fries were on point. There is the two stars...

Cons: service was absolutely embarrassing. The burger was bland and just inedible. It was not seasoned at all, total waste of our money. We saw our waiter maybe twice, didn't get drinks refilled the entire hour and a half. Had to ask 3 times for a check and saw him standing around making small talk :/ really horrible date night.

Went here after doing some shopping and I'm definitely glad we did! We snagged the last seat on one of their 2 patios. Our server was nice but a little awkward and soft spoken. We got the Hefeweizen and a marzen brewed in-house and both were tasty and gave me a good buzz. I ordered the peppercorn steak which came with garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. It was VERY peppery but that's to be expected. My boyfriend got the cioppino which was a Cajun seafood mixture in broth. It was spicy but very good. A lot of their menu items had a Cajun theme so I'll definitely be back to try some more items. All the dishes we saw on other diners' tables looked delicious!
Good Kobe burger. Good calamari. Great beer. I definitely recommend this place. The service is top notch.
Love the food here. Salads are out of this world from here and a great time had by all. I will be back!

This place is ok.  Someone else in my family loves it, not me.  The server seemed overwhelmed and the food lacks certain character.  It reminds me of Bennigan's.  

How do you offer pizza, but no Italian sausage?  When someone asks for sausage on the pizza, the entree returns with andouille sausage!!  Let the customer know the type of sausage served first.  At least the reordered pizza was complementary. 

The strawberry lemonade was too weak.  At least the server had he foresight to ask another server to refill our drinks.  

My daughter asked for lettuce with her sandwich.  She gets her food, but has to wait 5 minutes for lettuce to arrive.

Perhaps this was a bad day on my second visit to this place.  They are definitely better than Rock Bottom Brewery.
The food is pretty good here and they have a decent selection of beers. Our group enjoyed their salmon cake sliders and their wedge salad.

This place was pretty good. The food was alright. I got the southwestern egg rolls for an appetizer and that was decent. I got the bourbon chicken and grilled shrimp with the mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were good, but the chicken lacked flavor and was a little dry. My boyfriend got the brewhouse chicken and while his chicken was juicy and fresh, it lacked the flavor that the menu had promised. 

The only reason I gave this place 3 stars instead of 2 was because of the fantastic service. Our waitress was very nice and attentive, but not overbearing. It was like she had a sixth sense about when we needed something and she was there. She was super friendly. To be honest she was so nice even though the food was very average, we stayed for dessert. The hostess was very nice too. She greeted us with a huge smile and even though the patio was busy, she personally went outside to clear the table so we could sit down. Since I'm a sucker for great service I will go back and hopefully get something that tastes better.

My wife and I started with a 6 beer flight,
With a appetizer dinner evening. Fish tacos, grass fed beef sliders, and mini brats.  Super good to us.
We are not beer experts and loved them all.
Place was busy but received food quickly. Service was good and waiter was attentive. We'll be back for sure.

Used to like it a lot and came often for everything like full meals, appetizers and drinks and just late drinks. Food quality and service seems to be getting worse every time that I go.

I won't abandon the place just yet though. I'll just make my visits less frequent.

What a disappointment.  Had a confirmed reservation for 5 with high chair and they turned us away. Said they gave some person, who was really upset, our table.  Now they have two sets of upset customers. What were they thinking! Did not even offer a later table or wait at the bar. Just said we were out of luck. It's 30 some degrees outside and we have no reservation for diner. Now what are we supposed to do? Go home and wait for pizza? Very unprofessional and clearly out of their league. I see from other reviews, service has been a problem in the past.

Nice patio, beer is decent. The food was just ok, very pricey for what was on the plate. The waiter was incredibly distracted because he had so many tables. We were asking for suggestions and he just kept looking around and said everything is good. Not what you want to hear. Probably won't go back. There are just so many options available, why just settle?

We were there last night, 6 of us, not too crowded on a Thursday night at 5:45. Ordered drinks and appetizers from our waitress. The 4 appetizers came out and were delivered by another person. After a half hour, with appetizers eaten, plates empty and drinks empty, still no waitress. We asked another waiter for help, said he was busy, waited 5 minutes got up to find a manager for help. Finally the table was cleared, new soft drinks ordered and Waiter told us there was a shift of tables and each server was getting two large sections of tables which was too much for them to handle. So original waitress was somewhere else doing other tables. New waiter brought drinks then finally took our order for dinner. We waited for over an additional hour for dinner. Waiter said once it would be coming soon, "any minute now " he said. 15 minutes later he said it again, when we called him on it he said "if I go up there to look for your food, they will chop my head off!" He walked away. We noticed that there was a ton of food lined up under the heating lamps and nothing was being delivered. Now, after 2 hours total of waiting for dinner, nothing, water glasses were empty, no refills on the soft drinks. Sooo...we got up and left. I went over and told the waiter we were leaving, so I could pay for what we had, the 4 appetizers and the 3 soft drinks. He took me over to the manager, who said he was too busy to talk. REALLY! We just wasted over 2 hours for 6 people and you are too busy to talk? So I just walked out with the other 5. Never paid a dime. Never Ever will go back there again. They do not care for the customer. I have never walked out without paying before, but they deserved it.

This restaurant used to be better. My husband and I ordered burgers and the burger was so tiny on the bun. I ordered it medium and it came out medium well. I was originally going to order it medium well but so glad I didn't because who knows what that would gave been like! The beer is really good.  The crab risotto fritters are amazing. I recommend those!

I usually like this place, but last night it was not the best experience. Ordered off the Valentine's special menu. A big mistake. The portions were really scaled down. We watched the other tables receive regular sized portions and it looked like we were eating dollhouse food. 

Our watress disappeared and we saw her sweeping one of the areas on the other side of the resturant. Sweeping must of been on the to do list for the evening. Another waitress was sweeping the carpet  with a broom around us for about 5 minutes while the food was being served around her.

It took about 1/2 hour between the salads and the main meal. The resturant was not full so It was hard to figure out why it was taking so long. 

What we got of the food was good....but we left hungry. This meal with  3 drinks from the bar , 1cup of coffee and tip. $100.

It was a disappointing Valentine's dinner. Maybe stay away from this place unless you want a beer and a burger.

I really want to dislike this place for the restaraunt and a brewery concept chain but I really can't. It really delivers solid beers and food all around. 

Their seasonal beers are really high quality. The winter ale at 7.5% packs a good punch but is a smooth dark beer. The garlic fries are packed with a ton of garlic and it pairs well with the beers.

I had the special cod sandwhich and it was cooked to perfection. Flakey and on chibiatta bread which was amazing. Upgrade to the sweet potatoe fries. Lots of flavor and worth the $1 upgrade. 

They got dinged a star because the waiters are spread thin they had a tough time explaining some dishes. It is a busy place and probably $20-30 a person. Would recommend and go back.

My family and I went here yesterday for my husband's birthday. I forgot to call for a reservation so we had to wait an hour since it was a Saturday night and the place was crazy busy.  But it wasn't bad as there was a light show going on right outside on the Christmas tree. 

Our server was absolutely amazing.  He was very friendly, attentive and sociable. The Mrzen beer is so good. I got the grilled chicken and shrimp,  it was absolutely delicious, though the green beans were a bit over seasoned. Everyone else enjoyed their food as well.

And then or server was too kind and presented my husband with a slice of chocolate cake on the house. With a candle in it of course :)

Overall our time here was fantastic. Can't wait to come here again!
Sat at the bar.  Dirty Glass.  Bartender breaks a glass and barely cleans it up.  Dirty plates left in front of us while staff walks by.  Only thing decent about this place is happy hour.

The food and beer was good as always but the service was sooo bad this time around and the restaurant was empty since it was the 4th of july weekend. So there was really no reason for the waitress to take forever to get to our table. Dissapointed.
The Kobe burger with peppers jack cheese was awesome. The garlic Parmesan fries were the best I've ever had!!! Great service and the beer selection was also amazing.

I worked in the promenade from the day it opened in April 2007 until September 2013. I've been to GB 2xs. Both experiences were eh. I went for my 26th birthday with two friends and had the crab & lobster cakes. Came with a side of asparagus and garlic fries. Fries were great, the crab cakes... Mm. They weren't as together and crisp as I envisioned, plus flavor was a bit bland. Not worth the amount of $$. My friend got the steak frites and asked for it to be medium well, but, the amount of time it took for the food to cook and come out, it seems the steak decided that it wanted to be well done to the point of dried out. She is a lot like me, we don't like to send food back, but her sister (she and I had the same meal) made a good point- "You're paying for it."
The waiter was super nice, he seemed a bit overwhelmed, our diagnosis was that they were short staffed. Even the hostess was delivering food & drinks. Got dessert, it was fine. A brownie something. I requested pecans and for the ice cream to be separated (no one likes melt ice cream) and it was satisfying. BTW, I got the strawberry soda and it was good, not too liquored.

Our waitress was very nice, but this location is challenged.  Hostess was confused when we arrived and not on same page as the staff about available tables.  We did not get silverware or napkins.  We had to ask for them after our food arrived.  We were never asked if we wanted water and it was never brought.  One of our burgers was about half the size of another.  The waitress brought our checks before asking if we wanted a second drink or desert.  Very strange experience.  On the plus side, the one beer we had was good.  We most likely will not return.

The only thing better than the food here is the BEER! Their Martzen is amazing and we tend to keep a growler of it on hand (ya know, in case of emergency) and I LOVE the Martzen BBQ burger. The waiting staff is very personable, and the outdoor seating is perfect, right by the fountains. One of my favorite spots, hands down.

I ordered 2 items off of the happy hour menu, the pecan crusted chicken slider and the grass fed beef slider. Both were very good. The chicken in particular was amazing. It was tender, juicy, crusted perfectly and the pickle - onion - relish on top was a great move. The beef was good as well, served with dijon. Great place to have some great beers and great craft food to go along with it.

just returned from a celebratory family dinner   9 of us there    6 adults and 3 children. Historically the family enjoys this restaurant with no exception. However tonight  left a little bit to be desired.I ordered Ahi tuna steak and it was dry, my son in laws hamburger was dry, the mahi mahi sandwich  ( ordered by two people based on previous experience) was a disappointment. I also ordered the prosciutto sliders for appetizers and the prosciutto was too thick  more like bacon , dry and tough as well . THIs is the first time in years that I have been disappointed    On a more positive note the wait staff was as usual very nice and very accommodating. One of the plates ordered by  a child arrived at the table cold and it was immediately replaced with no hassle. Not sure what was the issue tonight  Possible a change in kitchen staff???  I have been to this GB many many times in the past as has  the other members of my family and we have had too many great meals and experiences to allow this to turn us away from this restaurant permanently. We will return and give it another chance   Hoping that this was just an off night as I am sure it was

I'll start off by saying that I am in the minority of my family in not liking this restaurant. The atmosphere, food, and service is all very consistently mediocre.

Appetizers --blue cheese chips. In general I love anything drenched with blue cheese but their cheese sauce left much to be desired. Also, their crab dip didn't taste as well as I hoped. They were both decent, I might order the chips again. 

Dinner-- I chose the Tuscan chicken pasta and I thought it was flavorful and tasted alright, but for $20 I was wishing I had ordered an individual pizza that my cousin next to me ordered for half the price. 
Their garlic fries are often raved about but I think they're WAY too garlicky.

Our server was attentive to our large group, and brought everything out as we asked for. No notable personality, but she did get the job done. 

Overall, unimpressed and not looking to go back any time soon.

Went there for dinner with some friends. I'll start with the pros: food was average, server was nice. Now for the cons: For a Tuesday night for three ppl it took over an hour to be seated. I'm not sure if they forgot about us. Once we were seated and ordered it took about 45 minutes to get a salad and two other regular entrees(not complicated meals). I usually go to restaurants in groups bigger than three so I would have to think twice about coming here especially on the weekend.

Food is amazing, service however is pretty bad. Slow, forgetful, and infrequent. The food makes up for it, though. Afforable options over a large, diverse menu and delicious drinks somewhat make up for how much our service was just dismal and disappointing.
Their food is OK but the price for the portion size is quite high. Their drinks are also pricy. Perhaps their lease in the Promenade is the reason for the inflate prices.

Been here before for dinner, was good but this time OH NO
Went there on a Sunday mid afternoon, not busy.
Service was slow, overpriced burger came barely defrosted when we ordered well done. Mentioned to the waitress, she said no charge and will have a new one made up for free to take home.
The same thing, came back raw, we said to ourselves, no worries -no charge.bill came, they charged us for a burger we didn't really want 
Manager said that is their policy
My policy is to not go there again and let people know that the cooks need to learn how to cook and the manager should honor what they say they will do.
Good food. Good service even when crowded. Pleasant comfortable ambiance. Some prices on the high side. Mahi with 2 sides (excellent!!) same price as some burgers !  Go figure

Well, I've been here two times, and yesterday was the second.

The service for the most part is pretty good, good atmosphere as well.

The food unfortunately the second time around was horrible!
1. My sister ordered a salad and didn't taste a dressing. So she asked the waiter's assistant if there was already dressing on it, he replied yes. So she asked if she could get extra on the side. 10 minutes later he came back with a dressing, that was most definitely NOT already on the salad. 
2. My mother and I ordered the chicken bruschetta that comes with asparagus. My asparagus tasted more like the grill than it did asparagus. Which is normally a good thing, but I couldn't taste the yummy asparagus I had eaten there before.
3. As I said, my mother and I ordered the same thing... although her food came out about 10 minutes later than the rest of ours, which I think made us all feel bad for eating in front of her. At least her asparagus tasted better than mine!

We were serviced by Matt, who was excellent. His personality was good, informative and he was pretty on top of everything. He even covered my birthday dessert : )

We went here for the beer really and everything we tried was awesome, nice place to come to after a long day of shopping lol the food was seriously over priced for american food but was pretty good, no real complaints and I'm sure ill be back!

Disappointed. Great service but bad food. Steak (certified Angus beef) bite after bite ended up on plate because I chewed and it wasn't breaking down. Like chewing a Cotten ball. This was NOT  good quality beef. In fact, it was the worst quality beef. I was embarrassed that I kept removing inedible chewy bites of meat from my mouth. Also, I asked for medium rare, and meat was cooked solid medium all the way through. I told and showed waitress (we ate at the bar) and she did not offer to take it back. Also, ordered Bernaise sauce that was forgotten. 10 minutes later it arrived totally congealed, firm, not a sauce. Maybe just a bad chef tonight. But, c'mon. Paid $78 bill (before 15% tip - because issue not with staff, but with kitchen) and will not be coming back.

The wife and I had a $25 giftcard, so we figured with the great weather outside in Illinois finally (80 degrees in May after weeks of snow and rain!), why not use up our giftcard on a date night?

All the all fresco dining was taken, so we took a nice booth inside facing outside.  It was bit odd for the two of us to take up a booth, but it let us sit next to each other, hold hands, and all that romancey stuff.  =)  Personally, I think the hostess sat us there since the Asian waiter was covering that section, but who knows.  I'm just glad he was a great waiter!

In our attempts to stay paleo, we got the following:

Sweet potato fries - Unfortunately there was a sugar coating on the fries, but otherwise it was paleo and delicious!  The big piece of rosemary added an interesting but perfumy flavor to the fries touching it... not all together bad, but surprising.

Turkey/mushroom meatloaf - Wow, this was actually pretty good!  Subbed out mashed potatoes for vinegar slaw, and the veggies were a cayenne pepper sauteed green beans.  Very tasty, and decently close to paleo as well (I'm guessing there was bread crumbs of some sort in the meatloaf, as it was waaaaay too tender not to have them).  Surprisingly good dish overall!

Seafood cobb salad - This was gigantic.  Seriously, bigger than your face bowl filled to the brim with toppings.  My only complaint is that the seafood definitely tasted canned or frozen (shrimp were flavorless, and crab was pretty salty), but the rest of the ingredients were great!  If they just dropped the seafood and knocked off $3-$4 on the salad, I think we would've been far happier... overall, great salad, the seafood just didn't add anything to the salad.

Verdict:  High priced ($40+ after tax and tip, no drinks), good food, glad we had a gift card here.  For a mostly paleo meal, we were pretty happy!  Prices are just a little steep for what I'd be willing to pay though...

Terrible service at bar. Male bar tender hates his job. Finally got a beer never a refill and never asked to take our food order. No one else at bar. 
We went inside for the air conditioning but they had all the windows to the patio open hot air blowing in. Explains why no one at bar. WE WILL EVER GO BACK!

Food was pretty good but service towards end is reason for 3 stars. I had lobster and shrimp tacos, calamari for appetizer. Calamari was slightly salty but still good with the Wasabi dip. I had the wheat beer (Heizenweizen) and liked it. It's like a Gumball Head. 

Main problem was waiting for my server to close the bill. Took 30 minutes to get the bill and close out. I'd give it another shot though.
Read menu carefully allot of things you may not like are in the food . Tacos are  Spicey even though waitress will tell you they are not

I dined here this past Friday night. It was busy but we arrived around 8 pm so we were seated right away. The first thing I noticed is that the dining area is very loud. A substantial amount of time passed before our server stopped by to greet us and take our drink order. The menu has some interesting items so initially, the wait time didn't bother me as I was having trouble making up my mind. I decided on the smoked chicken and mushroom pasta and my boyfriend ordered the GB beer mushroom chicken. We each ordered a golden export which was excellent. We split the famous garlic fries for an appetizer that we have heard so much about. The fries were crispy and delicious. I'm glad we ordered the fries to hold us over because our food took quite a while. Our entrees were just okay. Next time I come, I'd definitely order something different. Our waiter was polite and friendly but whenever he came to our table, he seemed to be almost running by. I don't blame the bad service on him necessarily, but more so the lack of staff on a busy evening.

Tried GB for the first time.  Kinda mad that I've been missing out!  This place is fantastic.  Great beer and great food.  We sampled a lot.  Had calamari and a flatbread as an appetizers,  the flatbread was incredibly good.  Wife and I shared a wedge salad and filet maddalions as entree.  Meat cooked perfectly with a great sauce.  Gastropub burger looked to die for.  Great kids meals too. Love the beer and good overall vibe with music too.

Food- Mediocre/okay
I ordered a chicken avocado club. Chicken was slightly dry. There was not a lot of sauce. Side order of garlic fries was a joke. I received about 10 fries. 

Service- Mediocre/okay
Everything we asked for took a long time to receive. I asked for ranch because the chicken was dry. By the time I got it, I had nearly finished the sandwich. Only good thing I can say is, my girlfriend spilled an $8 dollar mojito after about two sips and they replaced it for her and only changed her for one. That was nice. 

Atmosphere- Pleasant/enjoyable
Lighting was not too bright or too dark. Music wasn't so loud that it was distracting. Decor was nice and comfortable. 

Overall-
 I would not return to this restaurant. Food and service was not worth the price. However, the environment/atmosphere was comfortable. 

Side note- Beer was decent.

Had the best lunch here on their patio, drinks food and service were excellent, but I left my purse hanging on the chair and went home. Simon the manager went above and beyond looking up my number and calling me at home! Thank you!! Great experience, you've won a new loyal customer!!

First things first. The floors are really slippery. Proceed with caution.

For a brewery, GB didn't have many beer options. For a restaurant, GB had pretty standard bar food that, while good, was nothing to write home about. The famous garlic fries are flavorful, albeit oily. 

It always confuses me when a venue has an exposed kitchen, only to show the staff all standing around doing nothing. Perhaps it was only that way because we were there late on a weeknight, but it was a little... "why are there so many people standing around when I asked for water ten minutes ago?" Thus, I can't rave about their service, but our server was nice enough to offer beer samples before I committed to one.

We sat in the cocktail area and service was definitely slow. It took about 5 minutes to get seated (wasn't that busy) then about 15 minutes to finally get the drink I ordered. Food was OK nothing too special. The atmosphere is nice with the open spacing in the bar area and cute booth seating in the dining area. Not sure if I would come back to be honest. I will mention the margaritas are good and tonight they were on special for $5
This location was awesome! Super friendly and speedy service. Megan, our sandwhich artist will definitely be the reason for my return visits! She was great!

Subway is subway . The food here isn't any better or worse than the others I've Been to. I come here when I need a quick bite! If that's all you want then there's nothing wrong with this location! It's been pretty clean and the employees are respectable

My son got a nasty bone in his ham sandwich. I called and let them know. They asked me to bring the bone in, which I did. Never sent even a coupon to cover the sandwich with the bone...not good follow-up for sure!

Slowest service all the time- never have enough people working during busy hours- need at least 3 people (one for register and to resupply the counter and 2 to make sandwiches and keep line moving - this place would never survive in NY as a deli - so unbelievably SLOW!
Next to a flower shop that "ships around the world". Bathroom stinks. Real busy during the weekday lunch hours. But it's Subway, eat fresh! Plus they had outlets to charge my phone...i liked that.
The stuffed egg plant parmigiana is the best. Service is great. Never had a bad experience coming here. It's a must try. Pizza is awesome as well. Thin crust is amazing.

Our first time here.  Here's the bottom line: good food and service.  The owner stops by your table on a busy Friday night.    I had the Chicken Marsala and my better half had the Lasagna.  There are a couple of ways you can serve the Marsala.  One is to make a thick sauce with Marsala wine and pour it over the Chicken. The other has your Chicken swimming in Marsala wine.  They both work.  I had some linguini to take home.  The Lasagna is special.  One of the top five Lasagnas  I've ever tasted.  The portion could easily feed two people.  

The Tiramisu was superb.  You want your fresh lady fingers soaked, but not drenched in rum.  Discernable, but not overly so...just the way I LIKE IT. Light enough you can drop your fork through it.  

 Next visit, I want to try the Chicken Vesuvio and the Goosey cake.  Nice job Paul and Mike.

I hadn't been in for a while. We caught an early show and missed dinner. I called in a pickup order and grabbed a pie on my way home. The horror was opening and seeing they pie cut a small into 12 pie shape pieces and it was undercooked.

I requested a new pizza and now feel upset, as I wanted to have already had my dinner by 10pm.   The manager commented they have a new guy on the oven and it looked cooked. He was wondering why he cut into so many little pieces. He requested the old pizza back so he could see it and show his staff.

They probably had a really busy night and I just got in a bit too late. The replacement wasn't much better. For a thin crust, the bottom was doughy and not at all crispy. I'll reheat the other half on a hot pizza sheet for the desired crispy crust another day. I prefer when the pepperoni is on top of the cheese too. I won't cheat on Al's Pizza Warrenville parbaked again.

This place has really great Italian food. I went here for a company Christmas party and had the pleasure of enjoying the food without paying the bill. 

The service was great but right at the end the server failed to fill my drink for at least 20 minutes even after I asked her to. They were very busy so I under stand why she forgot. 

I felt the cuisine was authentic and the atmosphere was inviting. The lights are very dim so bring your reading glasses. 

They have great dessert. I had the peppermint red velvet cake. Just wonderful! 

Bottom line is I love this place. If you have a large party get pitchers so your glass isn't dry. Try it out!

First off we came for dinner and left before the meal due to a young child.  That said, we had order an appetizer, a small cheese pizza and a medium pizza.  The appetizer arrived promptly with our beverages.   After that we decided to leave and get the pizzas boxed to go.  The waitress was lovely and friendly and helpful.  However, what happens in the kitchen...apparently stays in the kitchen.  It took what felt like FOREVER!From order to box... It took 45 minutes.  Which if you have a small child, seems a longtime.  Luckily, we got out unscathed.

Now for the worst part.  By the time we arrived home less than 5 minutes.  The pizza was cold.  The box felt cold when we left.  Small pizza looked like it had been sitting.  Medium pizza needed reheating.  Hoping to find a good pizza place soon... Traverso's is not it!

Hubby had meat ravioli which was.outstanding. big pillows of meat in what looked like hand rolled pasta. Meat sauce was very good. I had gf pasta. Had avocado appetizer which was delicious . The bread was warm and tasted delicious

I dined at Traverso's with approximately 12 family members a couple of Sundays back.  Attentive service but I don't think anyone was very impressed with their food unfortunately.  I was having trouble deciding on a pasta dish and chose the chicken bowtie based on a recommendation from our waitress.  Bowtie pasta, chicken breast, broccoli and tomatoes in an olive oil/garlic sauce.  Pretty tasteless.  Even red pepper flakes couldn't save the dish.  I had a few pieces of someone's thin crust pizza.  Decent but nothing special.

How have I not ever reviewed Traverso's? I love this place!

Traverso's is as cozy as a golden retriever puppy, friendly as a golden retriever puppy, and as delicious as a...golden retriever puppy? No, that's not right.

But it's so good! If you like thin crust pizza, Traverso's is cracker thin. I love the white pizza but you can't go wrong with the other toppings. 

There's a dining room and a bar area. Both are nice, but I prefer the bar. It's a little dimmer and more cozy-like. Plus you can peep at the regulars at the bar and wish you were one of them. Who doesn't want a drinking crew at Traverso's? Woop woop.

The staff and manager/owners (not sure their rank) are always so nice and go above and beyond to make sure your experience is great. I love them like I love puppies.

Finally, Goosey Pie. Just get it, it's an awesome dessert.

I just ordered two entrees and a supreme special Pizza. The entrees were both excellent and filled the containers. The salad containers were so full, you could not get any more in them. The pizza was totally filled with all the toppings unlike others were you get just a few items spread out. The pizza was "the best" I have had. I was really impressed with the quality and absolutely getting your money's worth. I will be making
 Traverso a regular dinning spot for us. ;-)

Always good food and service. Been going to for years and not once has the owner missed checking with us to see how everything was.
It's a sure thing

One of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago area. Food, service, owners, servers and patrons are top notch! Have been going here for over 15 years with our family and friends. Thank you for the memories!

Best family owned Italian Restaurant in the Western Suburbs!!  The owners Paul and Mike make you feel like you are one of the family.  The Pizza is incredible, but on occasion I order Mama T's Lasagna.  They use their Grandmother's recipes. The other night our party order the Walleye, Lasagna, Chicken Vesuvio, Baked Mostaccioli, and a Bucatini Carbonara special, all were great.  Paul came by the table and told us dessert was on him.  The Tiramisu, Cannoli, and Goosey Cake were incredible.  My wife loves the Grilled Avocado, which is a special Appetizer. Service is great as well.

I grew up eating at Traverso's in Orland Park almost weekly...many, MANY, years later, no place has ever compared.  We celebrated our daughter's HS graduation there and everything was as it had always been--the best, authentic, home-made Italian food around.  My new office is in Naperville and I was absolutely thrilled to see the next generation has expanded to this location.  They are catering our tent at the john greene Polo Invitational (forgive the plug) and I can't wait to introduce the Traverso Family to the families I am grateful to serve.  I am certain they will form wonderful memories of great meals together as I still have all these years later.  Susan Bro, john greene Realtor, Naperville.
This is a great spot conveniently located a few blocks from home.  Great food and service is top notch, with ownership always personally stopping by the table to check to see that all is well.

This "Italian" is much like the kind I grew up with.  --before the US as a whole became more internationally traveled. Decent food for what it was, but not Italian in the real sense. It felt like a very homey environment though. Food served, much like I imagine my mom would have made, had she have known how to cook.  Sadly however, I grew up with a mother who cooked eggs in the microwave , so this was not even the "Italian" I was served at home growing up. --Italian in my house was Chef Boyardee. ;)

Judging Italian restaurants is tough for me. Am I rating it on real Italian (that I've eaten here and in Italy) or am I rating it on "American Italian"? This review is strictly "American Italian"; their food was so Americanized, they should just call it "American" and be done with it. ;) 

I give the food my husband and I ate 3-stars. The gluten free food my brother ate 3-stars and Wendy our waitress earned a 5-star. The fact that it is a family owned business is a 5-star. All together and Traverso's get's a 3-star from me.

We will be back for sure. Why would we come back for what I consider to be "A-ok" food that also happens to be 5 miles from my neighborhood? Because my celiac brother was able to eat a heaping plate of  gluten free fried chicken. His very first fried chicken since being diagnosed 2 yrs ago. He also was served GF bread and as GF breads go, he really liked his. 

I ordered the gnocchi with meat sauce. Would have preferred gnocchi with cream sauce but after having eaten a doughnut the day before, red sauce it was. Gnocchi was slightly gummy and a little too dense. They were not melt-in-your-mouth fluffy, like they should be. I still found them to be "A-Ok" though.  Meat sauce was made of very fine ground meat, definitely had a fair amount of sugar added to it and very reminiscent of my grandma's cooking. --Close enough that I could have sworn she was back in their kitchen! My own red sauce only has enough sugar to cut the acid and full of sausage and short ribs. Good enough to elicit a marriage proposal I'm told.  Theirs was too sweet and just not meaty enough with the very fine ground meat. Not bad, but nobody would propose over it. 

My husband really liked his spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast. I tried it as well. Chicken was cooked very well. Juicy. Had very nice flavor. His also came with polenta, which was completely swimming in sauce and just not visually appealing to me. --When it came out, I couldn't even tell what he'd ordered. I still liked it enough to steal an occasional bite from his plate though, but should I order polenta from there, I will be sure to ask them to only add half of their usual amount of sauce.

Wendy might be my favorite waitress I've ever had. I liked Wendy's attitude and humor so much that I'd like to take her to lunch just to keep listening to her speak. She was exceptionally helpful; very knowledgeable of the gluten free menu; very patient with our table's questions and stayed on top of our table's needs without being overbearing, all while delivering comedic comments. If all wait staff at every restaurant could be that fantastic, we'd all be very lucky people indeed. --She earned the biggest star of the night; although, my brother might say she tied with the GF fried chicken. ;)
Restaurant serving Italian classics. Since it is not a chain, there is a laid back feel to it which is not necessarily a bad thing.

It doesn't matter if you are from Naperville or remember the original Traverso's from the south side, you will love this experience.  The pizza is definitely top notch and the customer service is unparalleled in the area.   This is a real restaurant - not trendy or a fad- an establishment you will visit again and again.  

Take out is good too as is catering!!!!

Came here for dinner and sat in the bar. In my opinion the food/drinks are overpriced, and their cheesecake (that they are apparently known for) tasted like cool whip and sugar. $6 for a small square. Pizza thin crust wasn't bad, but places closer to us are similar/better, So we wouldn't go out of our way to go here. Hostess and waitress were extremely nice though. Had the garlic bread "loaf" and a cheesy crab dip for appetizers, the load was square pieces of garlic bread and the dip wasn't bad, a bit too salty but overall
Good. Probably wouldn't come back, not a bad experience but not a fantastic one.

I've had the pleasure of dining here twice and coincidentally, been seated in the exact booth on both occasions. The bf and joke that it is now "our" booth. 

After being seated by the extremly friendly host, we ordered our drinks. I wish I could remember our waitress's name, but I can't recall it. She was very friendly, attentive, and kept us "in the loop" about the status of our order.

My drink for the night was an Abita Satsuma Harvest Wit. I had never tried it, though I've tried four of Abita's other brews and I'm quite the fan. After a sip of the Satsuma Harvest Wit, I was pleased with my selection and I must have been rather thirsty, as I ordered another one almost immediately. 

For our appetizer, we selected the Spinach Artichoke Dip (bf's choice - he's a S&A addict). It's a large appetizer and I knew immediately I wouldn't be finishing my entree, that's for sure. 

I chose the Chicken Picatta for my entree, which was boneless chicken breasts sauteed in white wine and lemon, served over angel hair pasta and topped with capers (similar to the Chicken Limone at Luigi's, so it seemed). I had the choice of soup or salad with the entree, and I chose the mixed greens salad.

Our appetizer arrived quickly, however the entrees took quite a bit longer. It was Black Wednesday though, so I understand. Once the food arrived, I was correct in my assumption that I would not finish my entree as the portions are quite large. I enjoyed my meal as did the bf (he orderd the same thing) however we both agreed we didn't really care for the chicken. It seemed rather.... greasy? It wasn't bad, just not great. The mixed greens salad was fabulous.

I wish this place was a little closer to home, but it's definitely worth the trip and we'll certainly be back again. You definitely get your money's worth here!

I was just here last night, and I already can't way to go back. In fact, I left so full I could barely walk, and yet after I got home, wanted to open back up the leftovers and eat more! I am only disappointed I never visited earlier.

Immediately as we walked in, I was pleased. The hostess was very friendly, offering us a spot either in the dining room or the bar. We chose the bar, and it was a good choice. Everyone was watching the USA World Cup Game, and it was a great atmosphere. We were all starved, so we decided to start with an appetizer before our pizza.

We settled on the calamari, and I must say, it was hands-down the best I've ever had. Light fried crust and the calamari was so well cooked. Not rubbery; almost melt in your mouth good.

For dinner, our group of four ordered 2 x 14" pizzas. The boys shared (and finished!) a half pepperoni and half sausage. The fresh sausage was delicious and the cheese was greasy and fantastic. Us girls split a 14" with black olives, mushrooms and green peppers. The peppers were crunchy and the toppings were plentiful. To top it all off, the ranch for dipping was amazing! We ate about half of the pizza and split the rest to bring home.

The prices are a bit on the high side, but the food really was great. Our server was attentive, friendly and helpful as well!

Great service, great food, I love this restaurant. The staff is trained very well, the food is always consistent and it is always clean. The managers are great consistently walking around with a smile talking and joking with customers.

I ate here last night and will return because the food was fantastic, but our waitress on the other hand wasn't really that great. I had read a lot of other reviews on here and knew the service was going to be hit or miss. We got a miss. Hopefully next time we will have a little better service. 

My friend and I were not in a hurry, but the entire dinner took 2+ hours. Our waitress just seem preoccupied with tables other than ours. We initially asked for another minute to look over the menu since neither of us had been there before and after 45 minutes we had to ask the owner to send our waitress back over so that we could order. 

Now onto the food... I ordered the chicken parm and asked for the tomato cream sauce on the penne pasta. The chicken parm was good, not the best I have ever had, but good. The tomato soup that came as a starter was one of the best I've had. The tomato cream sauce on the penne was awesome. We ordered the brownie sundae for dessert and I was totally blown away with how good it was. There was this cream cheese topping that was to die for. It was warm and served with ice cream and whipped cream. Delicious! 

I had to ask twice for a glass of water and my friend had asked for a refill on her drink half way through the meal and never got it.  There were a lot of larger parties in there and it seemed like there were only 2 waitresses working which didn't seem like enough. 

Will be back based on the food alone. A bit pricey for the area like others have said, the quality of the food makes it worth it.
Great place to take the family. Always friendly and always delicious.

We went here for a date last weekend and absolutely loved it.

For an appetizer, we ordered the toasted avocado, which was great. Imagine an avocado lightly heated and decorated with bruschetta toppings. It was out of this world, so I hope they continue to offer it since it was a only a special for that night.

For dinner, we split the eggplant rigatoni dish (also a special). The waitress was amazing at accommodating our request to split the meal, even so far as splitting the salad that comes with it.

This place is great for a date night or for a night out with the family, but it's not too fancy. The prices were a little high for Naperville, which is why we split the dinner, but we really liked it overall.

We have been here 4 or 5 times. The food is wonderful! The service is terrible. We have 2 small children and when we sit down we always ask for bread and order the kids meals right away before we even look at our own options. Last time we had to ask 4 times for bread to ensure our son stayed quiet and despite asking for the kids' meals right away we didn't get them until our food was out. This is bad mostly for the people around us who had to wait for our children's food so they would be quiet. My husband also order 2 beers and asked that the second be brought with the meal. He didn't get it until AFTER our check. Again, with 2 children under 2 the people around us were the ones who suffered the most when my husband had to chug his beer while I tried to continue to shove food into my full children's mouths..

A good but not great restaurant.  Friendly staff, seated on time for our reservation.  But the food is consistently mediocre, which is especially a let down since you can easily drop over $100 for a dinner for four.  In our case, the beef was tough and the salmon was undercooked.  Perhaps the more traditional Italian dishes are better.   Been here a couple of times and disappointed both.  Serviceable, but not special.

I've been eating at Traverso's (orland park) since I was a toddler.  My extended family always met at Traverso's for birthdays and we ordered takeout several times a month.  I grew up eating their pizza and to this day it's my benchmark that I compare all other thin crust pizza's to.  

I moved to Naperville not even knowing they had a second location.  I was soon happy to be ordering pizza a delivery from my favorite spot.  Best pizza in Chicago and the Naperville location is spot on to the original.  Nothing fancy, just a really great family owned old school joint.

LOVE Traverso's.
I'd have to say our visits here on many accounts has been consistently plane. The staff attitude sets the tone for just a mediocre meal. I recommend the sausage and peppers appetizer and their pizza.
Last stop on my Chicago suburbs trip. Pizza is awesome I may never eat dominoes again.elegant decor and friendly staff as well

This was our second adventure with Traverso's.  

First time ordered out.  This time we dined in.  I really was hoping for an excellent experience so I could give a good review.  That is why I waited to go back & dine in.  

Gross and dirty will sum up my experience in total. 

We sat in a booth by some fake flower arrangements.  It hadn't been dusted in forever & there were cobwebs.  Gross.  For a restaurant that supposed does high volume, please clean up properly.  Your windowsills and fake arrangements included!  It's disgusting to see dust and webs as a diner. 

Onto the food, had some calamari.  It was drenched in oil...drenched.  We took a few bets and oil was just pouring out.  Again, gross.  There was no flavor except the oil.  Maybe put some grilled on the menu with less oil? 

We had a pizza.   It was SO salty...  We barely ate.  Got our check & left.  We did not complain.  Our server was decent & not her fault that the food was disgusting.  We tipped hep appropriately.  

Not a place id go to, or order from again given an option.  It's unfortunate because they're so close to my house. 

The menu reminds me a of an Italian version of Applebee's.  You don't need that much stuff.  Maybe that's why the food is barely edible.

We came to Traversos last night with a big group of children for our school's restaurant night (20% of our bill goes towards Clow School in Naperville). I don't normally subject myself to bringing 6 1st graders and 2 toddlers to a restaurant but this was all for a good cause. I wanted to leave a review because I was very happy with how the restaurant staff treated our big rambunctious group. Our server right away grouped everybody at our table into groups so that the check situation wouldn't be a nightmare. She then very calmly (over the dull roar of our boys) took our orders. The food was incredible. I had heard rumors of these magical raviolis and they did NOT disappoint. The pizza and pasta was also amazing. I am so glad that our school partnered with Taversos and we will continue to visit and enjoy this restaurant.

Traversos is one of the true values in the Naperville area in terms of Italian cuisine. I have never found the restaurant empty regardless of day or time.

One of the two owners, which I believe are brothers,  seem to always be on the job, ensuring everything is up to standards. More often than not one of them will come to the table and ask if everything is satisfactory.       Traversos has a modest number of menu choices, but executes them well. The wine list seems to have been upgraded. 

My wife and I dined there this past Sunday. The place was busy with one long family table occupied (10) plus a special party group in the back room. In spite of this our service did not suffer. I had a simple pasta dish and my wife ordered a customized pizza. Everything was done nicely and we got away without breaking the bank.

Portions are such that one often takes home leftovers. A recommended staple for neighborhood Italian food.

Great place, great people, just avoid the pizza.  

Have been to Traversos many times and have enjoyed each time until we tried the pizza tonight.  The dishes we have loved are bow tie pasta, cheese ravioli, chicken parm, and lasagna.  They have a very good craft beer menu.

This would be five stars if we had not had the pizza.  The crust is spongy.  The mushrooms are canned.  Both are pizza sins in my book.
Best thin crust sausage pizza in the world.  Extremely generous with the sausage.  Had to smile when a newbie ordered extra sausage.

I absolutely LOVE this place!! The gluten free menu is not only expansive, but the food is actually good - scratch that, it's better than good, it's GREAT! The bread tastes like bread and is spongy like bread - not brick-like. They even have gluten free fried chicken - and it is crispy and AMAZING! My fiance, who does not have to eat gluten free, even liked all the gluten free goods that we tried, and having been with me for so many years he's tried a great deal of gluten free foods and knows what tastes good and what does not. The service was amazing, everyone was friendly, the restaurant is super clean, inviting and has a nice, comfy family atmosphere. They even gave us a gluten free Goosey cake dessert on the house ... and it was yum-tastic! I live in Chicago, but will literally trek back to Naperville just to dine at Traverso's ... It's that good.

Excellent service ! Could tell it's family owned - servers really cared to provide delicious  suggestions . Since it was our first time there - they even comped our chicken wing appetizer !!! Will definitely go back!

Food was good. Calamari was cooked perfect I highly recommend trying. Had a sausage,Italian beef and giardiniera pizza, which I recommend the hot, mild had no taste.  Service was poor and u have to by baskets of bread for $3.00 to use the olive oil and cheese on the table. I thought that was wrong should have been complementary.

It had been a long time since I had been at Traverso's Restaurant. It may have even been when there was still a smoking section and Blagojevich was in office!

The inside ambiance, particularly lighting, is still great and the parking was ample. The bathrooms were in pretty decent shape as well. I sat in a booth on the bar side.

Since I had last graced this restaurant with my presence, they added a pretty nice gluten free menu. The chef really knows what he's doing. There are actually more than just two lousy entres. There's fish, pizza, pasta, salads and other things that I like and now will be able to eat like a normal person. There's a wide variety of sauces from which to choose for pasta.

The service was a tad sluggish, but nothing to fret over. The server, Kelly, certainly made up for it.

Incidentally, there was a strong wi-fi signal on the north side of the building where I sat. However, it was very difficult, at first, to get my Samsung phone to connect. I love free wi-fi in restaurants. It's sort of like having paper towels in the bathrooms, rather basic. After some finagling on the part of the owner or manager, I finally got my phone to display web pages consistently. I hope that the owners and management will stay on top of this.

I ordered the chicken piccata with gluten free pasta and a mixed green salad.  The portion size on the chicken was huge. Enough for dinner tonight and lunch tomorrow. I was especially fond of the mixed greens salad. I enjoyed mine with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. The salad comes with delicious medium size tomatoes and fresh walnuts. Out of this world.

If you have not tried Traverso's Restaurant in a while, then it's time to be reacquainted through some delicious meals.

Traverso's is one of my favorite sit down restaurants in the Western Suburbs and I've been going there since the early 1990's.  This place is off the beaten path a little, as it's not on Ogden Ave, 75th street, 95th street, or the Route 59 corridor in Naperville.  They feature Italian cuisine and our family eats there probably 4 times a year, and I wish it were more.  It's a very modern, darkly lit restaurant with separate bar area and is kid friendly (high chairs are available).  You can expect to see a lot of families here on any given evening, usually with adult males wearing golf or polo shirts, and the parking lot will be full of luxury cars built within the last 2 years.  Service is always consistent, and you will get good attention from your server.

Their fettuccini alfredo is an absolute masterpiece, and it simply does not get any better than this.  I always order it with grilled chicken and find the portion size to be well worth the value of $15 for the dish.  They hand make their ingredients in house, including the pasta, and the finished product is excellent and does not contain significant amounts of garlic (my preference).  Over time, I have had their burgers and Italian beef and both were excellent.  My wife and mother have had other various pasta and Italian dishes and have been very happy.  We usually order a pizza for the table, which also is excellent, cut in squares.  Bread and butter is complimentary, unlimited, and always arrives hot and fresh.  For dessert, they have a brownie, cookie & ice cream sundae called "goosey cake" which is to die for, and I am sure it's 100 calories per bite.

Every time we eat there, the manager can be seen making his way throughout the restaurant talking to regulars and asking if everyone's meal was prepared properly.  You'll know him as he has a very deep voice.

They did pull a fast on us over the last year or two - they changed their soda provider are serving generic cola now (not Pepsi or Coke) and I can tell the difference.  I probably should not be drinking soda anyway, so it's not affecting my 5 star review!

Do yourself a favor and try this place if you have not already done so.  But don't tell too many people - I don't want this hidden gem to become overly popular so that I always have to wait to get a table :-)

Had just moved to the Ville from River North and wanted to sample the local joints. Previously had ordered from little Italian and thought it was good. Ordered a large sausage and asked for it to be crisped up. What I got was a sloppy, no crust, soggy, salty mess that fell apart in my hands. For $30 (including delivery/tip) you would think you would get something better. Anyway, after that experience I went several months w/o ordering pizza from anywhere. My wife decided to cook more and I started eating better. Thanks Traverso's!!!

Few things feel better than finding a 5 star worthy pizza place close to your home. 

Okay, maybe it's only close if you don't get lost for 35 minutes trying to find it like we did. Man, did they tuck this sucker away. Google doesn't even know how to get there. 

I ended up getting off work early and really craving pizza; preferably from somewhere new, so I could yelp about it, but also close, so I could get pizza in my gubby ASAP. Traverso's appeared to be a bulls eye. 

It was about 8:30 when we got there and the place was packed. Our server looked really busy but she still took the time to come over and told us she'd be with us in a moment and I totally appreciate that... plus those extra few moments while we waited were spent well by perusing the yummy dessert menu... but you'll hear about that later. 

For starters we got mozzarella sticks and a Caesar salad and both were great. The mozzarella sticks were the kind that have the solid crisp outer shell and then you bite and cheese oozes and stretches out but is still stuck to both the part in your hand and in your mouth (picture the Selma Blair / Sarah Michelle Gellar kiss from Cruel Intentions with the saliva strand from lip to lip), it's cheesy perfection! The salad was good, too, and perfect for two of us to split before a meal. 

For pizza, we got black olives and mushrooms with giardinaire on the side... thin crust, of course. The pizza was delicious and perfect. It had ultra thin crust, it was crispy, had a good topping ratio, and they gave us a hot and a mild side of giardinaire. We finished the whole thing and took a carry out menu so I could hint to my family that they should start ordering pizza from here. 

For dessert, I was torn between wanting their carmel apple crunch and their goosey cake... we went with goosey cake because it's more fun to say. Wondering what goosey cake is? Well, it's like a dessert you would make for yourself if you were 8 years old with chocolate brownie cake with a chocolate chip cookie pudding layer on top and then it's both surrounded and topped with LOTS of whipped cream and chocolate sauce and a cherry. It's kind of like a dessert swamp and it's was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten! 

I can't wait for Tuesday when I order pizza again... with enough leftovers for Wednesday of course.
Can you say delicioso! So good every celiac persons dream come true food is great I've had no reactions( at least not yet) would've been 5 stars but service is a tad slow

In my second visit to this restaurant I brought my family alongside. 3 kids age range 15-8 and my wife. We were promptly seated in a booth near the kitchen. We asked to move to a different booth and the waitress immediately obliged. I can't remember her name but the waitress was awesome! She frequently checked in on us not being disruptive, but always keeping our glasses full and available for requests. The house special was all you can eat spaghetti w/salad or soup. That what I chose and the family had the signature pizza. The food was delicious! Pricing was just right and the ambiance of this place is excellent. I'm local so I'll be returning of often.
Love the food here.  Sometimes you have to ask for extra red sauce.

I can't believe I hadn't eaten here before.  Traverso's is a family owned restaurant that has been in Naperville for years.  Family owned!  I love supporting independently owned businesses and in the suburbs they are hard to come by.  

Service was impeccable!  Our waitress has been working at Traverso's for 15 years.  Amazing.  She loves her job, loves the restaurant, the menu, people and it shows!!  Her service alone will keep me coming back.

We had toasted ravioli, minestrone, field greens salad(my daughter said it was the best salad!), wedge salad(some of the best blue cheese dressing ever, its homemade and they sell it by the pint!), chicken parm, spaghetti with marinara.  All were excellent!  Even the bread was good.  I will be back to try some of the tilapia.

A classic Italian restaurant the focuses on freshness and quality.  The traditional dishes are very well prepared.  The Pizza is the best thin crust pie on the planet.  That is no joke!  Their Antipasto is outstanding.  Again fresh ingredients and careful preparation is their hallmark.  Great for families or a date night.  Highly recommended.
Best Italian food in the Western burbs. The restaurant is family owned & the ravioli continues to be hand rolled. Pizza is amazing as well as all the pasta dishes. Bring your appetite.

Let me start by saying I've been eating at Traversos for well over 20 years. My family has been eating there since back in Pullman / Roseland area decades ago. I've always been a huge fan of their pizza and food. I have to say over the past few years prices have gone up and I've been less satisfied with the quality and taste of the food.

Here's my complaints. You guys seem to change your garlic bread on a weekly basis, everytime I order it its different. I like the old style heavy garlic, now days one week its full of herbs, the next weeks its more of a wet garlicky bread the next week its a dry bread covered in herbs. The fries seem to change on a regular basis as well.

One my my biggest complaints is your meatball sandwhich and smaller serving sizes overall. You guys make the best meatballs you really do. Your meatball sandwhich used to be 3 or 4 heaping meatballs. Recently at there and there's these little ping pong ball size meatballs, it truly was pathetic and everyone at the table commented on it. Not only is it smaller serving for same price but smaller meatballs dry out unlike your big balls.

I'm very disapointed with the direction traversos has gone in the past several years.

Excellent food and service would highly recommend.  pizza is the best, also pasta very good.  Great home made bread.  Family owned business locals love the food and friendly staff.  Give it a try you will not be disappointed.

My favorite pizza in the burbs! It's SO good - I've never eaten anything else there. I have gone there for the pizza for 5 years and will to continue to for many more.

I prefer the ambiance of the bar to the restaurant, however.

Wanted to get a meal before hitting the movie theaters for Thor, and found most restaurants on a Sat night to be just too long of a wait.  Made our way here, and got seated in 5 minutes.  Excellent!

Service was super friendly, especially after we told her we just moved into the area, and she was happy to give us some suggestions and insider tips on who to know and talk to for getting into other restaurants as well!

Mozzarella sticks appetizers:  Made for four... for the pricing, we figured we get a few, but I think they served us 11 or 13 of these things... good God, I was full before the main food even came!

Traverso's Pizza - Thin crust:  When we want thin crust, we want cracker thin crispy crust... this isn't it.  It's a mix of thin/chewy, and is an excellent crust by all means, but not the perfectly thin crackling crust that snaps with each bite that we enjoy.  And the biggest no-no for any pizza for me: canned mushrooms.  Granted, it seemed like higher quality canned mushrooms, but the mushrooms definitely seemed overly moist with each bite, something that I find only happens when they've been soaking in liquid for too long.

No room for dessert, but the waitress let us know everything is homemade, so would be curious to go back for some tiramisu.

A great family joint, excellent laid back Italian-American style eating.

Verdict:  Would be back if in the area, and could see it being the kind of place you bring your kids to after a softball/baseball game or something.

There pizza is great. They wrote me a note about the experience and I appreciate the effort. They offered me a complimentary meal to make it up to me (no meal necessary) I won't except a free meal because my meals have always been good and that's not my intention when I write reviews. Order a pie and antipasto.

Everything is just okay.  I was not motivated to ever return though. Rather bland and mediocre everything. I had the "House Special Ravioli" which should've been called the "Nothing Special Ravioli". On the plus side it's family friendly, nice waitress and they have Chimay Ale.

I really like this place. It's family owned, comfortable and the food is quite good. They hire local kids to work there and encourage the local sports teams.

Nothing is the best, but everything is really good. Traverso's is a regular spot for us, the thin crust pizza is even better when you ask for it well done and extra crispy. Maybe not Vito and Nicks good, but really, really good.

I like the pasta, they have a weekly spaghetti special and their lasagna is pretty darned good. The room is comfortable, the decor nice.

Traverso's is the kind of place that you can count on, the kind of place that you wish you had in your own neighborhood

Excellent food and wine. 
The price was fair :)

It is just average.  Nothing special.  Their pizza is okay and really the best thing on the menu is the ribs.  Stay away from the fish.

The bread is wonderful and the desserts make up for the lack of any outstanding dish.

Very good Italian food and a very comfortable/cozy atmosphere, but also very expensive depending on the entree. Wait staff is friendly and attentative as well.

Also, they make a very VERY thin crust pizza, which is good if that's your thing.

I love how they've become a neighborhood favorite over the years. Tons of regulars are always in here. 

I've dined in plenty of times, but I prefer takeout. We get their Potato Skins or Buffalo Wings on occasion, both are solid. Their homemade soups are really good and their salads are pretty damn good too. The Antipasto is excellent, especially with their homemade Italian dressing. I just wish they cubed the meat and cheese instead of slicing it. It would work better for the salads overall Constancy. 

Their pastas are decent, but you could make better if you put in a little effort at home. Their pizzas good, but the crust is too thin. It cant handle a lot of ingredients very well. I'd recommend only getting 1-3 (maximum) toppings. If the pizza cools down a little bit, it tastes light years better than when it's hot. That's a personal opinion though...

To finish, I'll go back to my childhood. You MUST order the Goosey Cake. I don't know what it is about that damn dessert, but it's got me hooked like a meat head and affliction t-shirts. 

Traversos is a neighborhood spot that has been around, and will be around, for decades. Oddly, I just saw the original for my first time. I love having this location so close by.

***My little secret*** I use to take girls here in High School to "wine and dine" them...

I haven't been here for quite some time. We first became customers in Orland Park about 35 years ago I simply love their meat ravioli. Service tonite, Jenny was exceptional on an evening when a large party was quite troublesome. I will be back again soon.

This place was awesome. Amazing homemade soup, decent wine list, delicious beer that is brewed on site, fresh homemade bread baked perfectly and a great menu. This place seems like a hidden gem. Bar on one side, dining on the other. Our server was very formal and attentive. The rosemary infused olive oil was also amazing. Overall, definitely a place I would go back to and recommend to friends.

3.5 stars

If you're planning to come here on a Friday/Saturday night, expect a crowd as a sizable line was forming at around 6 and the restaurant and adjacent strip mall parking lot were completely packed!  Thankfully, I was there for carryout.

Despite the crowd, everyone there was polite.  Got a medium thin crust with bacon for $14.00.  First thing I tasted was a flavor of oregano and salt from the bacon, which they put a lot of on the pizza.  However, the saltiness was starting to become too much as it overpowered any other flavor I would of tasted.  

Traverso's seemed to be a slightly-higher class restaurant, judging from their prices.  

Pizza was good, but the best in town, which is an overused statement, might be pushing it a little.

went there tonite, had the chicken and bowtie pasta, salad, hot bread, ice tea too..
 chicken was awsome best i ever had, salad was better than olive garden [ and i love olive garden ]   bread was verry good and ice tea was excellent !!!!
    thank u for a wonderful dinner A+++++ all the way !!!!!  steve k.....

We were having a group of friends over and the plan was to order pizza. We wanted to try somewhere new and found this place.  The reviews seemed good so we gave it a try.  We needed the pizzas to come at a certain time so ordered early and just told them the time.  It was really close to the time and the pizza was really good.  Every last piece was eaten and I thought I had ordered enough to definitely have leftovers the next day.  I would say it was a success and I will be trying it again one of these days!
