Yelpers are really obsessed with authenticity, be it 'real' mexican food or 'legit' pita. It is annoying and most of the time stupid. That being said, I found traverso's to be authentic in its credentials as an italian restaurant. The decor was typical of many of the old timey places you find in big cities, and the clientele seemed familiar to the staff, and the servers themselves were friendly and helpful. 

The food was very good. We had the pizza, which was thin crust done very well. I also ordered a veal dish, because I am an abhorrent glutton who particularly loves the taste of young cow. The veal was tender and well prepared. The fresh bread, as many other reviews have stated, was totally top. I like. I love it. I want some more of it. 

If you want satisfying italian food and are in the naperville area, this is a choice which will make your taste buds sing with the same focused intensity of young Justin Beiber.
The best thin crust pizza in town.  Lasagna and ravioli are both excellent.  Sit down experience is great.  Chicken parmesean is soggy and not crispy, other than that most items I've had are good

Went there with out-of-town family, and now they ask to go there every time they come visit.

The pizza was excellent, loved the crust. The apps were great too. There's a great atmosphere as well.

Consistently good.  There's a wait on the weekends, but their food is worth it.  So many good dishes from their mouth-watering thin crust pizzas to their chicken vesuvio to their marsala and so many good pasta dishes.  There's a separate bar with seating, a dining room, and a private room for parties.  The owner/manager always visits the tables to follow-up on the meal.  Can't go wrong.

I really enjoy this place. I was born and raised in Chicago and the thin crust pizza here is as good as any I have had. The raviolis are especially good here too. The service has been attentive every time I've been here. I like the atmosphere of family owned businesses vs franchises and this place definitely feels family owned. Highly recommended.

When it comes to good food and good drinks this place is five stars. Large portions , tasty hot food, best pizza you will ever eat. This family owned restaurant is owned by two brothers who truly care about your dinning experence, they will cater to all your special needs. Traversos is truly a gem of a restaurant with service that is excellent

Reviewed by the Naperville 
~ Food Dude ~

Traverso's is often rated as the best thin crust pizza in Naperville...and it is!

Whenever, we we are in the mood for thin crust or we have out of state guests visiting, we end up going to Traverso's. It can get crowded on the weekends, but it is worth the wait. We will sometimes eat in the large bar area which is much less crowded than the restaurant area. Beware, if you have young kids, the bar seems to have some crusty, "salty" regulars. Thankfully, the no smoking ban makes the bar more appealing than in the past. 

This is a standard family restaurant, no real frills as far as decor. A lot of dark wood, booths, low lighting and waitresses that call you hon. I would be hesitant to go here on a date night, but if you have kids they are very accommodating. One of my favorite things is that they use paper tablecloths and give out crayons. Hangman, Tic tac toe, doodling are all great ways to pass the time while waiting for your pizza!

As far as their other dishes, especially their pastas, give it a wide PASS. For some reason, the pasta noodles are always undersalted, overcooked and mushy. We have learned this the hard way after ordering ravioli and spaghett a few times. Note to the restaurant, add salt to the boiling water, cook al dente,  and drain your pasta really well before serving it on a plate. Nothing is more unappealing than ravioli in a tomatoey, watery bath.

Pricewise, their pizza can be a bit more expensive than some places. However, we think the quality is worth the price. We like Traverso's pizza and plan on going back again and again.

We were heading out to Naperville for a book signing and I had a severe hankering for a thin crust pizza.  So I headed onto Yelp for a quick peak at what might be a good choice. After reading several good reviews for Traverso's we decided to check it out. 

When we first got there it was a little weird because the bar was stuffed with people, but there was only one table of people actually eating in the dining room. It took a few minutes for them to notice us waiting by the door - but once they did we were asked if we wanted bar or dining room. We chose the dining room - because the bar area was pretty noisy for a small place. 

We ordered a large sausage and mushroom. I asked if they could please make the crust crispy. Our waitress said, "Oh course!". I was pleased with her response. If you've read any of my reviews before you know I'm searching for the perfect thin crust CRISPY pizza near my home and still haven't found it  Anyway, when it arrived it was on a pizza pie tin and the pizza was on an oven rack. This is brilliant because it helps to keep the crust crispy longer. The pizza was piping hot, super crispy and not burnt. The cheese, sausage and mushrooms were all fresh and great quality. I wasn't 100% in love with the sauce but it was good. 

We then finished with the caramel apple crunch. It was delicious, warm, gooey and just perfect. 

Our waitress Wendi, was very good. She was attentive, checked on us often enough but was not annoying. She was helpful with the menu, told us about the wonderful desserts and told us to come back and try the homemade ravioli (which we will). She also gave us directions back to the expressway - that were perfect!

I also want to give a shout-out to Candice G. because of her review we chose Traverso's, and we're glad we did. 

I don't know when we'll next be in Naperville, but when we are we'll be back to Traverso's.

Verdict: Great, crispy thin pizza, give it a try.

And yes this is the same Traverso's that's in Orland Park, it's a family business. The family still makes the sauces and doesn't share the recipes you gotta love that.
Great appetizers and above-average pizza but at a fair $$.
The meal was good but not spectacular . The service could've been better. The server  seemed more involved with the other tables than ours. We always had to call her if we needed anything.

Traverso's has become my favorite Italian Restaurant in the area. Their lasagna is second to none, meat sauce is excellent, and I really like their pizzas. One other item we always order is the potato skins. You wouldn't normally review a simple appetizer like a potato skin, but Traverso's are amazing. I've become a weekly diner there, usually take-out. Though I love to go and eat the bar.

I have to admit that I'm rather surprised that this place got such good ratings! I literally live across the street and have come here many times - and leave disappointed each time. 

First we start with the deco and such all around - which feels like an out of date restaurant from the 80's. 
The service was pretty good - i've never had a bad experience.
I have had numerous things from this pace. First I tried their ravioli - which I couldn't even finish because it was so bad. I've also had the chicken parm - which is also lackluster. I've gotten pizza from the place a few times tool...and it's ok - not great...and somewhat overpriced - In fact over the last 7 years of living across the street, i've only gotten pizza from the place like 3 times. On a positive note my father says they have a decent hamburger
If i'm looking for pizza, I would rather drive a bit further and get Lou Malnati's or Giordano's.  
If you're looking for a good, not overpriced, Italian place in naperville, check out Biaggis or La Sorella di Francesca
great antipasto salad and chicken parm

I like supporting family owned and operated restaurants anywhere possible especially in the burbs where the selection is limited.  Traverso's is a nice cozy place with decent food at fair prices.   However they are plagued by inconsistent service.  I would like to give Traverso's a better review but their waiting staff needs to improve first.

Years ago, I visited this place when a local radio show (The Heavy Fuel Crew) did a remote broadcast. Now I heard of Traverso's but never actually tried it. Now you might see the "Naperville" location but if it's any further south it would be Plainfield or in Bolingbrook a little further east). If you're not familiar with the area, you have the following choices: 
1. Get directions before you go. 
2. Have your GPS ready to go and properly programmed. 
3. Be prepared to get lost, especially if you're not familiar with the area. Make sure your tank is full. 

So now you finally arrive. The place is pretty comfortable. The staff are very nice folks to deal with. I don't frequent this place much because I'm not in that area much. However, I would eat there if I was in the area. What I heard about Traverso's is that they have a solid pizza. I'm more of a deep dish guy myself so for me to endorse a thin crust pizza, it might be worth a try. Traverso's has a VERY good thin crust. The toppings are also very generous (I normally eat sausage and mushroom). The crust is nice, light, crisp but (here's the kicker) not overcooked. That's what gets me about thin crust pizza is places burn the bottom a bit much. That's not the case here. Next time (budget permitting), I may go with the Traverso's Signature (sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions) or add garlic. I might try a pasta dish next time should I not want pizza. My last visits have been takeout. Family owner and operated. 

4-4 1/2 stars from me.

Big thumbs up for Traverso's gluten-free menu. The best I have seen (and eaten) in the area. I have tried the gluten free meals at Olive Garden and Maggiano's, and they don't compare. Traverso's has many more options.

Review is for the Carry-Out Pizza Only - 3 Stars,  A-OK

Why just A-OK ?  

Well, the pizza was pretty good.  I liked the sweet sauce and thin crust.  The crust wasn't crispy though....it was mushy.  I guess I should have followed some of the other reviews and asked for 'well done'.  Ingredients were good, there just wasn't a lot of them.  Yes there was Sausage, and Mushroom....but not as much as you get from a Nancy's, Beggars, Giordano's......it was good, but there wasn't much substance.  Two people can polish off what they call a 'Family Size' 16" pizza.  Why, because it's so thin....I bet the whole thing weighed less than 2 lbs.  For $25 bucks....I want more for my money.  Again, good food, but too expensive for the amount of food you get.

we travel a good 25 minutes to get their amazing antipasta salad, delicious italian dressing and awesome crusty bread! Today we also tried their buffalo wings, which were great! Whoever packed up our "to go" bags neglected to add the celery sticks and great bread. Not a huge deal, but knowing how caring the owner is, I called there just to mention it, so they wouldn't forget items for the next caller. I have to say, the young girl on the phone was so sweet. She then put a gentleman on the phone who apologized profusely and bent over backwards because these two items weren't included! Being a business owner myself, I was blown away with his caring attitude. In this day and age, where most biz owners don't give a darn, it was wonderful to hear this. We will continue to frequent this family restaraunt, they actually care!
We have gone to big parties at Traverso's and they always did an excellent job!
Hat's off to Paul for keeping the South-side pizza thin and excellent.

This place has generously donated catered meals to my daughter's school for their annual Make-A-Wish fundraiser night.  Thank you!  They always supplied trays of rigatoni and sauce, salad and bread.  Basic stuff, but kids and adults all enjoyed the meal and it went a long way.

Five stars for their utter coolness.

This is a really good, family owned restaurant with great, thin crust pizza.  The pizza has a really good flavor to it and will keep you coming back.  Their minestrone is definitely a favorite of mine.

This family has been making pizza on the south side of Chicago for years as detailed at http://www.traversosrestaurant.com/ and have really kept up a great tradition.  If you are hoping to find pizza similar to the Traverso's in Orland Park or the former restaurant at 111th St, you won't be disappointed.

The only word that came to mind after eating here was Average.  Nothing to rave about, but also nothing to complain too much about.  I have had much better and much worse- in terms of taste, service, prices.

We went on a Saturday night at 6:00 and were pleasantly surprised to only wait for 5-10 minutes for a table of 4.  We had:
Thin crust pizza-  Good, but not as fantastic as some of the other reviews would make you think.  Other places in town- notably Vito & Nick's- are clearly better.
Lasagna- Not very good at all.  They list it as lasagna bolognese, which would make you think it has a bolognese sauce.  Incorrect.  It was a lot of noodles and a lot of ricotta, with some meat sauce on top.  Definitely stay away from this dish.  The caesar salad they gave with it was excellent.
Caramel Apple Crunch- Quite tasty.

Service was spotty.  The waittress was very friendly but disappeared for long periods of time.

All in all- not a place I would recommend as there are places very close-by that have better pasta and/or better pizza.

Years ago when everything around the southern side of Naperville was still corn fields, and Breckenridge was still being built, Traverso's was the first restaurant in the area, and it is still here - that says something.  My mother and I ate here 4 nights a week when my dad was out of town - pasta, minestrone soup, salad, and bread - these were the staples.  At that time it was a low key, not crowded place to go, we tried a few weekends ago to go for dinner but it just looked far too busy to wait (especially since my house is two blocks away).

Defintely give this one a try, it will surprise you with its plain brick exterior, can't judge a book by its cover.

As always, the pizza was amazing and the service was even better! We tried the white pizza for the first time and it was surprisingly good. Our server was a gem who totally treated us like regulars...even though we only get the pleasure of coming maybe monthly. Keep up the great work and we'll see you soon!

I like this place because the ingredients on top of the pizza are really big. Like big green peppers, onions and sausage. So you get a mouth full of yummmmm! The service is great  and the hostess is super helpful.

On my never-ending quest to find a decent pizza place in my new area, I decided to try Traverso's.  I had driven by the place a bunch of times and by the looks of the outside, I would believe their pizza should be pretty good.  Let me start with the good points first.

Good points - The pizza is decent, not great, just decent.  It is a little different compared to most places in the area by it being very thin.  I will not fault them for it being so thin as their menu does say it is thin.  The pizza appears to have used pretty fresh ingredients, just not many as I will explain later.  

Bad points - The pizza is way overpriced for what you get.  I paid $18 for a large pizza with 1 ingredient.  Crazy prices.  The pizza barely had any sauce nor did it have much of the additional ingredient.  The cheese looked like plastic.  It had no taste to it.  

I have had frozen pizzas that tasted way better than this one.  I was really hoping that this would be a good place for pizza being that it is so close to my house.  Unfortunately I have to keep looking for another place.  I will not order from them again, nor will I ever dine in there.  They could be great considering there is no good pizza in the area.  With those prices and the looks of their current pizza, they will never get there. I don't know what the other reviewers saw that I didn't.  A shame.

Yelpers said they had very good thin crust pizza.  We had a taste for pizza and thin crust is our preference so we gave it a try.  It is VERY good pizza.  Our previous favorite place was Connie's.  Compared to Connie's, Traverso's sausage tastes better and there is more of it on the pizza.  We also shared an antipasto salad.  It was huge with a light oil and wine vinegar dressing.  I know that I am going backwards here but the warm bread that proceeded the salad was very good as well.  We sat in the bar room which has a nice warm feeling.  We sat in a booth but the chairs at the tables looked very comfortable.  Unusual for a place like this.  We'll be back.

Great family owned Italian restaurant in Naperville! Very good Italian food. I don't know if I should share this review because it's our little hidden gem! It's kinda tucked away in the center of suburbia, unless you travel down Plainfield/Naperville Rd. you would never know it's there! Prices are good, the food is generous, the staff is always helpful and friendly. My favorite is the Shells and Sausage. Great place to take the family. They have a separate private room for small parties. As we had my in-laws 50th anniversary dinner there. It's also has a great little "neighborhood type" bar inside that reminds me of Cheers... everybody knows your name.

I love this place.  Especially that they make real garlic bread instead of forcing you to suffer with "bread sticks" like that national chain!

The marinara sauce is great -- got a nice zing to it for those that like things on the spicy side.

Excellent service, very attentive and knowledgeable staff, which was great. Appetizerss were delicious. Regarding entrees - my chicken parmigiana was soggy when it arrived and the sauce was just ok.  The other people in my party either enjoyed their entrees very much, or thought it was just alright as well.  Because of our delayed ordering and receiving process (on our end, because we had spent a good amount of time drinking, and on theirs because it was a busy friday night), I wasn't in the mood to have them fix the issue.  Well, my stomach wasn't anyway.  Someone else in my party notified the server of my soggy chicken and she came back offering dessert, and we decided to have some port.  They had a good wine selection, her input on the port wines were extensive and appreciated, they were also very delicious :)  The bill was what was expected (5 people, $200+), and I'd definitely try it again.
As usual the pizza was cooked to perfection...this is definitely the best thin crust pizza in the area...service is always friendly too.

So the other day I was REALLY craving biscuits. Weird, I know, but I just could not go on with my day until I ate some southern biscuits. Nothing came to mind accept KFC (hard pass), so I of course turned to my good friend Yelp. Low and behold 7 minutes away was Mr. Broast awaiting my visit!

I stopped in with the intention of only getting a side order of biscuits, but once that smell of delicious fried chicken hit my nose you best believe I was ordering a full meal. To make myself feel better, I went with a 3 piece value meal because it sounded like it would be a smaller option. I chose two wings and one breast and the meal comes with fries and a beverage (they have a fridge with cans of pop, water, etc.). The value meal and my side order of 3 biscuits came out to about $10.

I'm pretty sure the biscuits from Mr. Broast are sent straight from heaven. They are flaky, buttery, and have some sort of sweet and light glaze melted on them. UNBELIEVABLE. It's only going to be trouble that I now am aware of these delicious little beauties and that I live less than 10 minutes away.

The chicken is bomb dot com as well. The skin is crunchy and amazing and the chicken itself is juicy and tender. I ate 2 biscuits, half the fries and just the chicken breast they gave me and was more than full. Hubbie finished off the two chicken wings, last biscuit and rest of the fries. It's safe to say their chicken breasts are pretty huge and a meal like this is plenty to be split between two.

On their website you can place your order ahead of time and I suggest doing this! I popped in on a whim so it took about 20 minutes for them to get my order ready. Luckily, Mr. Broast is located in a strip mall with a ton of other businesses so if you do happen to pop in there's plenty to browse while you wait for your order. They also have tables, chairs, and a TV if you want to hang out in the restaurant.

Can't wait to enjoy Mr. Broast again soon!

Me and wifey had chicken on the mind, so we tried someplace new according to alot of good reviews.was it woth it???

the order...:  we ordered the 12 piece chicken and 2 sides with biscuits, the sides were seasoned fries,, and caliuflower  the rating on a 1-10  10 the best./.

CHICKEN:  strong bold and very SPICY taste ALMOST 2 spicy...very juicy...     8

Biscuits:    very awesome  flakey  with   beautiful honey butter melted in.........9

fried Cauliflower :   awesome......10   complete with many dipping sauces.

.................................................................................................................................

the negative  the pieces of chicken were 12  HOWEVER  3-4 of them were tiny wings and the price of  the 12 for 19 bucks was a bit pricey  

total bill 37.00  for this being a carry out,, this was very expensive and cannot recoomend the value to the price..  going out and sitting down i can think of 5 restraunts right off the bat that are cheaper with more food at higher quality..

service:  i DID like the lady  who answered very patient and explained everything great././


final score..3 and a haLF STARS..
Love it, I'm originally from the South so I love some good fried Chicken.  This place is awesome.

The food here is amazing, delicious and fresh!  The prices are fabulous, too.

Zinger Chicken Sandwich $6.50 - This sandwich is great and has a little spicy kick to it.
Gyro Sandwich Meal $8 - One of the best gyro I've ever eaten.  The meat was fresh and tasty.  The pita was pillowy.  The meal comes with fries and a drink.

Just okay. I think the Zinger burger is overrated or they just mess it up here. I barely tasted the sauce and parts of my sandwich were very dry. The fries are not as good as the other locations. Actually, the fries are pretty bad here. 

The gyros was average, it wasn't bad but it wasn't extraordinary. It was good enough to fill me up, but it's not something I'd go out of the way before. 

My favorite was the bun kabob. They add a desi style omelet right above the kabob which I really liked. However, they call it bun kabob but it tastes more like shami. For those who don't know what that is, it's beef and more "mushier" then a kabob.

Finally finally finally something worth while visiting and most importantly they deliver! Their food is fresh and a great selection of subs, burgers, chicken wings and more. I've visited here multiple times and they have great lunch specials. Give them a try, I would recommend it!

I'm glad this location is all the way in Aurora, cause the Zinger Burger is my kryptonite, y'all.  The Zinger Burger tastes just like how fireworks look.  Slightly dangerous but wowee so amazing. Yeah, I said "wowee." Deal with it.  

Somehow they managed to have the juiciest chicken breast ever.  It's all fried and spicy and laid out on a soft sesame seed bun. But oh wait! Then they add this crazy sauce that's like mayo but with the flavor and crunch of giardiniera!  The fries have perfect crunch and spice to them as well. Basically they are the perfect couple now that Bennifer is over.  

As far as service, I ordered over the phone and picked the order up.  The food was obviously freshly made, so I'd expect that if I just ordered at the counter, there'd be a wait. Totes worth it.

Is there an actual Mr. Broast, like a dude waiting to greet you at the door of the restaurant, perhaps in a chicken suit? 

I don't know, because I ordered from here through delivery.com: just wings and a biscuit. It did take every minute of the estimated hour for it to get to me, but was still hot upon arrival. 

I ordered "wings" (higher on the delivery menu) because I didn't see the "wingettes" (like drummies, I guess?). It was more food than I needed, and the wingette order is cheaper (obviously), so be aware of this. (If you are on their online ordering menu, you must scroll down much further to see the wingettes.)

Also be aware: for broasted chicken this is spicy! (These are not sauced wings like Buffalo Wild Wings, by the way, but breaded.) 

So overall, it wasn't bad, just not the meal I expected. Next time I'd be more likely to get the regular broasted chicken. They also have burgers, gyros and some other offerings that I wouldn't have thought of based on the restaurant's name. So read that menu carefully and then find out if Mr. Broast is the host with the most!

I was in the area last night with family and we decided to get dinner from here, we had a medium sized order (2 meals and a bucket of drumsticks) but it took them quite a bit longer then I expected to prepare it. The zinger burger wasn't that great compared to their Lombard location and had almost no spicy kick to it, I actually added a bit of hot sauce to it try try to get some tingle on my tongue.
   The above mentioned things contributed to the low rating but what pushed it over the top was the fact that they had no bathroom or even a sink to wash your hands, how can you not have those facilities as a dine in restaurant? To make matters worse was the fact that my 4 year old had an emergency and all they did was smile and apologize for not having a bathroom, they obviously had an employee bathroom and as a level headed person I completely understand that they don't want the customers using it, but any decent human being would make an exception for a 4 year old. I will not be dining here again.

We visit here regularly, and I'd actually give it 4.5 stars. The chicken has always been fresh and tasty, the prices are fair and service very friendly, Everything is cooked to order, so its best to call your order in ahead of time or expect to wait a bit. This is one of our "we don't feel like cooking dinner tonight" spots for the family, sometimes dine in, sometimes carry out.

I was very pleasantly surprised with the great taste of the broasted chicken. It's very juicy, yet with a crispy crunch! Upon receiving my order, I almost couldn't make it the 15mins home before I dug in!  It smelled soooo good! The wait is about 20 mins per order so I'd suggest ordering ahead. 
Had it on Wed & back on Friday! I may never eat regular fried chicken again!

6.99 philli steak burger with fries and drink. Not a bad deal. Everything is made fresh. fires are thick and not too oily. The sauces on the fries are good. A nice stop for fast food;) 

But watch out for the weight haha.

I would say this place is mediocre at best. The interior doesn't have a set theme and seems kind of dull. The colors in this restaurant are bland and isn't exciting or comfy. The man running this place was friendly and assisted us greatly. The drinks they have are all in one fridge. The food is okay. I got a burger that had a neutral taste and the fries taste like they came from the freezer. 

I wouldn't get out of your way to come here. This place is good for a one-time stop, but nothing significant or special for you to come here again.

First of all the pics in seeing on here are NOT at all what the place looked like when we walked in today. No long counter, no nice table & chairs, etc. must be new owners?! So let me start with the girl at the counter. Rude! No personality and not helpful one bit. It was like we were bothering her being there. Now the food. Just as horrible as their counter helps work ethic. I had a gyro that had pieces that were as dry and tasteless as rubber. My boyfriends "steak" salad was gritty like the lettuce wasn't washed and the meat was more like shaved beef. We will not be returning needless to say!

I placed an order on Yelp. I received the order confirmation email. I never received the food. When I called they were rude and never offered to fix it. They just claimed it wasn't this fault. 

Regardless of whose fault it is, I would assume a business would want to help. They clearly do not.

You know that favorite auntie who cooks the Bomb a$$ chicken? Every time there is a family event everyone requests her chicken? The wings here give me that lovely feeling.

When I arrived an hour before closing the place had a decent amount of customers-empty restaurants scare me, so I was happy. We ordered the 6 piece fried wings for $7.99.What I like about this place is the wings are large, and you get a LOT of fries, you can definitely share a 6 piece wing order with someone if you have a normal appetite.

The wings have a nice flavor and if you taste them right away they are really juicy. I ate one in the car that was juicy, but when I tasted another one 30 minutes later all the juicy yumminess was gone. The fries are good, but while my chicken was fresh, they fries were not. Everyone seems to like the fries, but you can get those same fries at Jewel(Orange bag, Jewel brand seasoned fries) I buy them all the time. The chicken was also good cold.

My companion said that the chicken was average, but he is used to eating overcooked TINY wings from Harold's. For the price,taste,and the amount of food given-This place is great. I did not go inside so I can't comment on that, but while I waited in the car I noticed a lot of people coming from the back alley, me being nosey I had to check it out, turns out there is an apartment building in the back and people use the alley as a shortcut.
Awesome experience everytime... Tried there Volcano burger for the first time and it was soooooooo good ...

So my biggest complaint is it takes way to long to get your food.  I recommend if you know what you want call ahead of time.  As for my second complaint it was way to cold in the place and I never complain about being cold I'm  a fat guy who is always hot...  Wings were huge and hot and delicious.  Cheese fries were ligit!!!  I can see coming here and just getting a  order of these fries best I have ever had..

The food was as expected because I eat at the lombard location all the time but the service was absolute crap. I get to the location and its a ghost town I order nobody in the restaurant and the lady says it'll take 15 min so I was alright with that. But other people walk in 10 minutes after me order and get there food first. THEY HAD AN OVERLAPPING ORDER!! so she gives the food that should've gone to me, to them. And when I asked about it they said it'll be right out. IT TOOK ANOTHER 15 MINUTES!!!!! It took well over half an hour for something that should've taken 10 minutes. After that I reordered another burger for home and she was rude. All in all I debated whether or not to steal money from the tip jar.

This is a difficult review to write.... I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally had the chance about a week ago.  It's a small chicken place in a strip mall, a few tables, but it is mainly carryout.  The person who took my order was very friendly and the prices were about on par with this type of establishment.  I ordered the Zinger Chicken Sandwich, which is what they are known for.  Please be aware this is not fast food, I waited about 10-15 minutes for my food to be ready.  The food was good quality and cooked just right, but here is where my review dilemma starts, it just wasn't my cup of tea.  The zinger sauce was disgusting and the zinger fries were just okay (like Arby's curly fries without the curl).  Now, I will admit that I'm a VERY picky eater, so that shouldn't dissuade from trying the place, it just wasn't for me.

I really hate writing bad reviews. I'm glad is not one. 
Ordered: the fried shrimp was the bomb. They were huge. I was expecting them to be the typical lame but trustworthy shrimp you get from anywhere else. They were not. If you ever tried Chicagoland infamous Lawrence's shrimp or goose island shrimp -then you will like these. I like the batter better with mr. Broast. I do have a drawback. I'm wondering since they didn't show up like the typical fried trustworthy shrimp-did I give them to much credit. I'll order again to let you know. Lol

Fried cat fish: EXCELLENT AND HUGE (trust my review with this one)no flaky batter. The fish tasted clean and really fresh. Will order more soon. 3 pieces doesn't sound like a lot but the fillets are so big, you will have left overs. 

Broasted chicken: my family says it's great. I wouldn't know because they make it tooooooo spicy and I can't eat spicy. They don't have a non spicy option and this's why they are receiving 4 stars from me. It's stupid. Not everyone eat spicy food. It's silly to believe that "spicy" s the majority vote. 

Fries: tooooooooo spicy. Ate one and almost had to go to hospital. 
The spicy food is even to spicy for my family members who eat spicy. 

Gyro: I must say I have never ever ever had a gyro like there's. I love gyros. 
So when there gyro popped up-It was looking shady. I didn't know what meat they were trying to serve me. The texture was crazy soft. Dude-hat gyro almost got tossed. I turned it into a science project. I had it laid out and inspecting it like forensics. I just don't eat anything. 
So my husband gets annoyed and takes the meat to taste. He def thought it was lamb. So I assembled it back together (lettuce/tomato/diced onion). I was going in folks..... THE BEST GYRO EVER. The pita was soft. The gyro meat was really tender tender tender. The set back-the sauce they say is tziki
Sauce tastes like mayo. I ordered the gyro again and requested that to be taken off.
Wow! That was delicious. The food was fast and hot. The fries were amazing. The price was reasonable and the place was quiet. I will definitely eat here again.

PERI PERI PLATTER! This place is cheap and honestly for the price, it's got decent quality food. The fries are fantastic. Although they have takeout, I recommend sitting in and asking for ALL of their homemade sauces (3 total and all of them are legit!). They have great fries, and their wraps and burgers/lunch specials are (again) a good value.

Ordered some food for delivery.   Was timely delivered.    The zinger burger was excellent.   Perfectly cooked chicken.    We also had a mix of peri peri chicken and Philly steak platter.   Liked the steak mix better of the two.    This platter is extremely spicy.    Had some baked chicken wins, which were good as well.   Will order from here again.   Worth a try if convenient for you.

Very very bad,  tasteless food. We order zinger burger it was nothing but Cole slaw in it. Gyros were taste less. Not even salty. Drumsticks were uncooked and smelled bad. Should try chill & grill in lisle. And for Mediterranean try pita ville in Naperville.

The service keeps getting better over time.   The food is awesome.   I haven't seen any desi restaurant in the area improve.  Maybe they're reading the yelp! Reviews?  

So good is still awesome 

Service is really improving... To be specific--- it's hit or miss on Sevice in the past... There is one guy always give awesome Sevice and another one who didn't.... The one who didn't ...seems to give better service now.... 

In short stop reading my post and go order from them!!

It's a decent local Z joint.
Zinger burger pretty good.
Chicken not bad
Always seem to be understaffed though

Excellent customer service.
Taste is really good.
The owner "Amir" wanted to make sure that my family had a great experience.
Definitely a five star... Hands down the best Zinger I have ever tried... Good homemade sauces !!
Ambience and Cleanliness is A + as well.
Give this eatery a try...  nice people good food.

Best broast i had in a long time. They provide the best sandwiches and burgers, not just broasted chicken. My friend recommended this place and i am really glad i tried it out. Great service. Excellent food.
Got carry out.  Chicken was OK but not great.  Mac and cheese was disgusting.  We had to throw it out.
Just an ok place. Like to pick some meals for convenience .Standard appears to be dropped as last two times food was not even acceptable and had to waste(dry ,overcooked wings,gyro).

It's a to-go place. You'll definitely not want to eat inside. The chicken itself isn't terrible. It's a full chicken wing. However, the front of house is shady, the menu is shady, and the prices are outrageous. It's expensive and it's sub par/average food. I wouldn't not recommend this place to anyone. Get your wings elsewhere.

I first tried Mr. Broast at the Lombard location, however, this location and its food quality, to me, are superior. In addition to the regular menu, this location offers scrumptious additions such as biryani and Bihari kabab, both of which are excellent. The Gola Ganda and the falooda are commendable as well. But if you're gonna go, make sure to try what is the star of their menu - the Zinger burger. A hearty sized portion of broast chicken breast served on a bed of delicious coleslaw, and you can determine what kind of heat you want on it, and they'll adjust their special sauce accordingly! Also, their broast chicken by itself is pretty amazing too, and a delicious alternative to good, old fried chicken. Their peri peri chicken burger and their Bun Kebab is awesome too...I'd DEFINITELY recommend this place!!!!
Great food, AMAZING service! This was our first time here and we were truly impressed! Definitely coming back soon

The wife and I stopped in for lunch yesterday and had a great meal. I had the Zinger Burger (actually a chicken sandwich) and the wife had a two piece dark meal. The chicken has a mild spice to it, by my Southern tastes. I will say, it is the best fried chicken I have had in the area. It is far superior to places such as White Fence Farms. The accompanying fries are very good seasoned fries. They were cooked perfectly. If this review were for food alone, it would be five stars.

Now, as for the facility itself. They desperately need to move or expand. The current space has no openly accessible restroom (I assume you have to ask to enter the kitchen to access one). Also, there is no effort at all to decorate the dining room. The addition of some photos or art would help. There also needs to be some music or a TV, it was eerily quiet in there. 

In summary, fantastic food served in a horrible space. Go try it, but maybe eat your food in the car!

Great food, great service. I come here all the time. I've had their fried chicken, which is flavorful and amazing, the zinger burger, which is a rich chicken sandwich, and their gyro cheeseburger, which has a full burger patty and plenty of gyros in it too. I think their burger patties are made from freshly ground beef, as it tastes a lot better than the usual frozen patties many places have. But overall, the food is delicious. And the fries are seasoned and tasty too. 

The wait is usually about 15 minutes, so I would definitely order ahead on the phone. The menu is online for viewing. Or, you can eat there too, they have sufficient amount of tables and it's very clean.
It was my first time at Mr. Broast and it was so good! The staff was very personable and the food was excellent! The recipe they use for the biscuits is so unique and addicting.

Order 2 Gyros sandwiches but they rung it up as the more expensive meal with fries and drink. Looks like they are still getting the place going as the wait was a little long, but to be expected for a new place. 

Gyro meat looked like the kind that is pre-made in a package and warmed up. Not the kind from the mystery meat wheel, which is what a gyro should be. Had some chopped sauteed onions and a small blob of the sauce. Portion was small and not very good.

Note to owners....go to Eatza Pizza or Goody's for a gyro sandwich. Shoot for that type of sandwich, otherwise remove it from the menu.

we were hungry and kids were tired.. called ahead food was ready and actually sat down had the food there. gyro burger was amazing. i have been few times and food is great every time. halal and close to the house. no more kfc  will be back again

thanks for opening in aurora/naperville
First timer! Peri Peri chicken sandwich is stunning! The bun, chicken, seasoning, fries all excellent! The only reason not five stars is it was a little warm eating in. I shall return!
Love this place and the quality of the meat is amazing!  Finally a good Halal restaurant around me!  Definitely recommend the southwest burger absolutely delicious!
Took my girlfriend for lunch. Poor customer service. Funky smell in the air. Food was ok. Nothing speacial about this place.Would never go back.

It was my first time here so I ordered the Zinger Burger. The sauce was amazing. I enjoyed the flavor on the fries which were also cooked perfectly. The service was great, the restaurant was clean and the food came out pretty quick. Will definitely be coming back!

Very good fried chicken--not too greasy, we enjoyed the light cajun flavor to the breading; they also give you a small side of garlic sauce which was also tasty!!  If you like buttermilk biscuits, you will love these.  They are very light and fluffy and served with just the right amount of butter and honey.  Allow about 15 minutes for the chicken to cook, so you may want to call in your order.  
The owner is very personable and willing to explain the menu and give good suggestions!!  Sure beats Culvers, Popeyes, KFC,...  Give it a try!  I think hospital employees get a discount if you come in with your ID badge.

Good food.  Clean place.  The Zinger Burger is actually a chicken sandwich so my husband was disappointed as he thought he was getting a burger.  He said it was good though.  I had the fried chicken and fries lunch meal.   Woe, the fries have a kick to them.  Something I wasn't expecting nor did I like them as I am not a fan of spicy food. 
The chicken breading was also spicier than my pallet enjoys.  The meat however was very good and moist.  
Be prepared to wait for your meal as everything is cooked to order.  
My recommendation, call ahead.  
We will go back another time and try other menu items as there were plenty to choose from.  I only hope the cayenne pepper or whatever they use is not in every meal.
Dude charged me $13 for 1 zinger  sandwich only and falooda .. i was hoping it getta worth it .. thats a CHICKEN SANDWICH! ! NOT A ZINGER !! 2 STAR FOR FALOODA .

Went there tonight,  I had 3 piece chicken meal,regular, my wife had 4 piece wing meal,spicy. Both of us judged everything excellent. Juicy, crispy skin, tender and hers was just spicy enough. Fries were meaty and just a little spicy. All was obviously fresh and cooked to order. Just a suggestion, order ahead because everything is cooked to order and does take 20 minutes. Girl at the counter who took our order was very helpful and patient since we had questions since it was our first time there. Price was very reasonable for quality and quantity of food. We will be going back.

Went there tonight. The Broast Chicken made me nostalgic and brought back all my childhood memories of Karachi. The broast was excellent and exactly as i remembered the broast from Mr. Broast in Karachi. Every bite was Yum! So juicy from inside and oh-so crispy and delicious from outside. Ordered Peri Peri Chicken Platter and Philly Steak Wrap. Very delicious! We are so glad we ordered from here. If you've got a craving for fried chicken or broast chicken, go to this place right away! They make amazing food MashaAllah !!!

Called Mr.Broast to order 10 piece chicken meal, first Mr.Amir the cashier refused to take my coupon which said for $19.99, saying that they are not honoring the coupon but when I told him that it would not expire till 8/15/14 only then he accepted the order on phone.
The food order process was the worst experience I ever had with any place.

My advice to them , do not try to lure customers if your coupon price is the same as the menu price.
Next , never say you would not honor the coupon when you have the validity date, the consumer bureau would not like it.

The owner replied with an apology and asked me to give the place another try.

Thanks to him for taking quick action.
Great food, great service.  Had them cater my daughter's birthday...they were on time, food was amazing, and overall great service.

This place is amazing!
Zinger burger is the best I've had in a long time, very flavorful juicy and fried golden brown (you can get it spicy/ regular), it beats KFC/ Popeyes any day! 
Also, coming from Philly, this is probably the best Philly steak sandwich I've had since I've been here (they also offer Philly steak panini which I thought was pretty cool). The Philly steak is not slathered with a bunch of mayo, I think they put just the right amount of everything in to make it nice. Fries are very well seasoned and similar to Arby's seasoned curly fries although these aren't curly, and in my opinion these are perfect (I hate bland fries, makes me feel like I'm eating straight potato.)
Note: if you have any problems to spicy foods, let them know ahead of time as they make everything fresh to order. Personally I don't mind the 7 minute wait time when food comes out incredibly fresh. I got my food to go, and by the time I got home, there was still steam coming out of the chicken, just amazing! 
Funnel cake is oh so sweet! If you ask them to make it a funnel cake sundae the way you see at street fairs, they're more than happy to accommodate you. We got ours with vanilla Ice cream and chocolate syrup! 
The people that work at this establishment are the most friendliest and welcoming people I've seen (girl behind the counter always greets me with the warmest smile). 

Facility: It's nice that they have a big screen tv up against the wall for everyone to watch and be entertained. The facility itself is kept very clean but the small space gives the appearance of it to be a lemon. (I know they're in a strip mall so it might be difficult to expand, but I only say this for ease of accessibility to use the restroom and to be able to dine in with larger groups). They do keep a huge bottle of hand sanitizer up at the front when you walk in which is pretty decent of them. You can tell that for a small restaurant, they're making a lot of effort to keep their customers happy.
(sometimes you can only do the best with what you have)
The nice thing is that they deliver within a 10 mile radius! So if you don't want to dine in, carryout is not your only option depending on where you live, you may be able to get delivery as well.

Quality of food was sub par. Cost was high for the quality and quantity given. Everything is obviously heated from frozen. Gyros aren't served off a pit they are strips like the ones from the stores freezer section. I will not be going back!

We just got back from Mr. Broast and it was so tasty that I had to write my first yelp review about them. We all got the Zinger Burger with fries. It has the perfect amount of spice. I had to stop myself from inhaling the sandwich because it was so good! I highly recommend checking this place out!

This place is awesome!  Chicken is really good and the special garlic sauce is great. The owner is super friendly.  Chicken has a little spice but in a good way. Check it out if you want something different then the franchise chicken joint.
Amazing food. The zinger burger is a must try if you like your chicken spicy. Lots of variety on the menu to make you keep coming back.
The wings are awesome with the BBQ sauce. Zinger burger is a bit overrated imo.  Fries are great.  It takes about 15-20 mins for your order, so it's best to call in your order.

My wife and I tried (I use that term loosely) this place a few weeks back. We ordered a chicken sandwich and a gyro with some sides to go. We were told it would be about 20 minutes which was fine since they seemed to have some orders building up. At the 40 minute mark I asked what the situation was with our order. Other orders had been coming in and going out so we thought maybe one of our items was just taking a longer then expected time to cook. Oh no, our food had been done 20 minutes prior and had been given out with another take out order! At this point we were starving and ready to leave so I asked for a refund. The lady at the counter was nice but the person she was talking to in the kitchen (possibly either the owner or manager) never said a word to us, only talked to her, and he made absolutely NO attempt to apologize to us. They did refund our money and the lady at the front counter did sincerely apologize to us which we appreciated. However, since our business apparently means little to nothing to anyone else in there, we will not be going back. It could be the best food I've ever tasted but if I never get it after I order it is pretty hard to review. So based on our service experience I can not recommend this place. We have considered doing a phone order and seeing how turns out but then again we don't want to suffer another disappointment.
Great food! I got the grilled chicken meal and husband got the gyro pita meal. Chicken had a bit of a kick to it and was great quality of meat!

Great to have a halal fast food joint right in the neighborhood. So far my wife and I tried and loved the zinger burgers, tandoori chicken burger, Philli steak sandwich and peri-peri. Tenders are a bit dry.

This place is great. The items on their menu are delicious and different, their Zinger Burger is definitely something amazing. The guy who runs the place is awesome too! Clean place, effectively run, great food, must try place!
This place is awesome! The PeriPeri Chicken wrap is absolutely fantastic. Thank you

The food at Mr. Broast ranges from above average to really bad.  The Peri Peri chicken is tasty, though truthfully I could do better on my grill at home.  It just isn't as flavorful as it could be.  The fried chicken is good too and is definitely a step above KFC or Popeyes.  The Zinger sandwich that they are apparently known for is really gross though, it's just a fried chicken breast on a boring bun with, as they described it to me, their own special sauce (tasted like thousand island dressing, gross) and a little bit of cabbage.  I had to scrape off the sauce and drench the sandwich in hot sauce to make it palatable.  The meat in the gyros is the same presliced garbage that comes in those kits at the grocery.  Why put something on the menu if you're going to half ass it?  The most notable thing about Mr. Broast are the lunch specials.  You get a wrap or sandwich with fries and a drink for 6.50 and the portions are generous.  Just be careful which sandwich you order.

Terrible customer service!  Arrived @ 9:45 PM, waited 5 to 6 minutes for someone to come from the cooking area only to be told the cooking area was ALREADY being broken down & no new orders could he taken. Well ... I guess the food is .... ? I choose to spend my money at an establishment true to their posted word of closing at 10 pm.

Great deli shop. So many better options than some of the other chain sandwich shops around here. Lots of veggie options. Nice, clean interior with a good amount of seating for a sandwich place. Daily soup offerings. Breakfast sandwiches are served all day, which is unusual and much appreciated. Quick service. I got one of the tuna salad options and it was delicious- fresh veggies, not too much mayo, and thick fluffy bread.

Decided to try the Halsted Street Sandwich shop in Naperville and was highly disappointed!  I'd assume that I ordered the wrong stuff, but then looking at few other reviews here, I don't think that's the case!  I ordered Chicken cutlet sandwich and I can almost guarantee you that A chicken sandwich at any Wendy's is about 10 times better than theirs!  It was a pre fried/breaded chicken piece tossed on an Italian bread and heated in a microwave!  Seasoning, cheese and if there was anything else on it, could barley be tasted! 

Tried once and done forever!  There are better places to eat in downtown Naperville!
Everytime im here i have a great sandwich. great music.

I was pretty excited to try this place; I was excited for it to finally open. However, it wasn't anything special. I ordered a turkey wrap, as it sounded good, but it was average. The wrap was flaky and didn't seem to be super fresh. There wasn't anything special about the experience at all. They have the same stuff as Einstein, but Einstein's wraps are fantastic. Halsted would be better if they are known for something--a sandwich or other item. I'll give it another shot, but I wasn't impressed.

Walked in on a Wednesday around noon wanting to try a new location for lunch and this place is amazing! My boyfriend and I order a chicken parm and the State St. Sandwich. The atmosphere is amazing and the service is quick. Took about less than 10 minutes for us to get our food after stepping foot through the door. They have a great arrangement of Sinatra playing in the background which really adds to the atmosphere of the place. The pricing is great and that's a lot coming from a college student!

I stopped in at lunchtime on a Saturday and we were the only customers...not a good sign. I ordered a Ruben and was disappointed.  It wasn't grilled, rather pressed in a panini grill which only toasted the bread and the contents inside were cold. There was only 2 slices of corned beef, looked like a half slice of cheese, a dollop of dressing and hardly any sauerkraut.  Very disappointing, I was hoping to see a great deli in downtown Naperville. Too pricy for what you get.

I have been eating at this place a few times a week for several months now, and I have yet to review it. I haven't reviewed it because the first time that I ate there, I said to myself,  THIS MUST BE A FLUKE, because most all the eating places in downtown Naperville are lame, unless you are willing to spend like $25 $35 maybe $45 for your lunch, and even then it can be a crap shoot. (You know this if you have read my other reviews). Now I would not say that they serve a sandwich as good as you can make at home, but for food out, the six or seven things I've tried have all been as good as I've had out, and this place is clearly in the top 3 or 4 lunch destinations in downtown Naperville. They have a large menu,  so its taking me a while to work my way through it, but so far so good,  I'll go back again, and there are few places to eat in the Naperville downtown that I can say that about. P.S. I wish they would start selling Gyros, I shouldn't, (and won't typically) drive 4-5 miles to get a good one.

Went in on Sunday.  wasn't super busy.  took about 10 minutes from the time we walked in until we had our food.  Ordered the cornbeef on onion bagel.  Wow it was soooo good.  The price was very reasonable for dt naperville.  The owner was in on the day we went in and he told us that if we like the corn beef that we would really like the pastrami.  he even gave us a free sample :).  he was a really nice guy.  If they keep up the quality like they did over the weekend I will definitely become a regular.

Great service! The place is a little scary from the outside but I'm glad I don't scare easily lol
As soon as I walked in the girls were so friendly and kind. I felt welcome and comfortable once I walked inside. 

The burger was absolutely hands down one of the best burgers I've had here in Lockport area. I would most definitely recommend this burger. If you can push yourself to look past the appearance of the place, you'll be pleasantly surprised!

Love love love. Here's why

1- despite the simple PDF menu online, there are all sorts of fun variations once you step inside their corner locale (which is in need of major upkeep, but that's on the landlord). The Star Wars sandwiches, the seasonal varieties, and...

2- the shakes. I can't say enough how awesome the shakes are. Between customizing from a huge flavor variety, pulling from their highly creative offerings, or finally slurping a chunk of topping through their oversized straws, you must get a shake. Current faves are pumpkin and the breakfast one (French toast?).

3- price is perfect. I got 3 meals and 2 shakes for $30, with some leftovers.

4- indoor atmosphere is quirky and cool, like your favorite dive bar. Hair metal trading cards, a massive local business wall, and the breezeway for summer chow.

Only minor complaint is the service, but this is dependent on the individual. The owner is always super friendly, same with the taller blonde who has been there forever. 2x in 2 weeks I've had the taller brunette with the lip piercing and she isn't unfriendly, but just looks at you like "please just order" even though they aren't busy. But it's a tiny flaw. 4.5 stars?

The Cobb salad is always fresh with avocado, hard boiled eggs, real bacon, cheese, grilled chicken slices and avocado ranch dressing..a good portion size..

Shakes are delicious per my kids

Read all the great reviews and though we would try Sizzles. The service was great! The soup was great! The burgers were over cooked and dry. I ordered the the breaded onion & jalapenos with a dipping sauce. There was nothing to dip except 5 coin cut jalapeno pieces and a mixture of fried bread crumbs. We found maybe 6 - 8 tiny onion slivers mixed in with the fried bread crumbs. We could not eat it and threw it away! The chef must have had a bad day!

I love Sizzles menu. They have great soups and a Jalapeno cold slaw as a special once. Hopefully that comes back! 
Salads are usually what I order, but everything has always been satisfying too. 

Chicago style feel with outdoor seating. You can walk here.

This is a great addition to Lockport and the owner is very involved in the community. The food is great, fresh and reasonably priced. Why go for fast food when you can get so much better for a tiny bit more and she puts so much more back into the community? Don't forget to try the soups. Yummy!

Had this place bookmarked for a little while. Had the breakfast burger and fried pickles. 

Burger: was ok. Would eat it again, but not to go out of my way for. 

Fried pickles: I would have preferred more crispy. Good flavor but kind of flimsy. 

Read some great reviews in their shakes but noticed they had the soft-serve machine. So shakes are not real ice cream. Awesome shakes, I'm sure. But I only like real ice cream shakes, so did not order. 

Service: Awesome, very friendly. Cashier asked how everything was mid-meal.
Sizzles is the best!!!  The food is so good and fresh! And the owner is hilarious. I just love seeing her in there and talking to her!!  :)

Sizzles food is very good. And their salads are delicious. My favorite is the Flaming chicken. Their beefs are quite scrumptious and very comparable to Portillo's I happen to like sizzles better. But my favorite part about sizzles is that everything is homemade.

Very good food! Burgers are great sizes and nice and juicy. Their cheese fries are to die for and their shakes are put of this world the only thing I wish was different is the parking lot it's a little small. I can't tell you how many times I was in the mood for sizzles and I ended up at Culver's instead cuz of the parking lot being packed

My friend was telling me about this place for the longest time. Finally on a lunch break, I went with my BFF and we both fell in love with the lady working the counter. She was so nice and helpful when we couldn't decide on what we wanted. She seemed super down to earth and was just so sweet that we had girl crushes right away. 

We ordered the bacon chicken ranch wrap thingy and split it with garlic fries. It. Was. Amazing. After seeing another customer leave with a milkshake we decided we needed one too. My friend got a malt and I got the best milkshake I've ever had in my life. Seriously I have been day dreaming about that shake ever since. I can't wait to go back and try some more stuff!

Great take out tonight. Jalapeo burger, bacon cheese fries (OMG so good) and the chicken bacon ranch sandwich. Yum yum yum. Always great service, always a pleasant and nice experience- affordably priced. My only complaint ......why haven't I had the ice cream yet? It might be yumminess overload.

I've passed this restaurant a number of times while heading into town over the past several months.  I saw a post on Facebook where customers had positive things to say about it.  Happy to hear it, I chimed in on FB that I would make the stop that evening and check the place out.  A person representing this establishment on FB even commented back to me on the FB thread about "seeing me later".

I pulled up behind the building and walked towards the entrance.  It is a very small place, I would consider the size fairly common for a hotdog/takeout place.  They did have a small covered area where I saw two (maybe three) small tables set up for anyone wanting to eat indoors (it wasn't a bad setup).

There is a number of items on the menu, including a large choice of slushes/ice cream/shake options.  All looked appealing on the menu.  It was after 7pm and I opted for the Maxwell polish (usually my favorite when going to a "hotdog" establishment).

The girl at the register was pleasant and took my order quickly.  The polish and fry was only $3.98 (really cheap in my opinion, Portillo's charges me about $8).  My order was ready quickly and I left with my carry out.  Arriving at home minutes later,  I opened the bag and started eating.  Into the first bite of the polish, I noticed it had a "water-logged" taste to it. . I opened it up to find it dried out on the end and really water/steam shriveled, with a lukewarm temperature.  It was not good.  I took a picture of it and texted it to my husband telling him I would be eating leftovers from the night before because my pick up this evening was terrible.  I threw the food away and didn't fret it, as it only cost $4 and the drive wasn't really out of my way.  Definitely won't order that again, but hadn't completely written this place off (we've all had a terrible meal somewhere, where we know others have not had the same experience).  Anyhow, minutes later the representative posted on the FB thread following up on my experience "I hope it was fantastic!".  I responded on the same FB thread that the experience was pleasant but the food I received.....was not good.  I even went as far as commenting that maybe the salad or beef would've been a better option and shared with them the picture of what they sold me.  (I certainly wasn't offensive in my post, just gently honest).  Sometime later that evening I got a FB notification from another employee (possibly the girl at the register), responding on the thread that my experience is "insane" and that their motto is to provide the best food (I wish I would've  taken a picture if this poor response).  Feeling as if this young lady was implying my post was untruthful, I responded to her remark advising her that "that is a great motto but most definately wasn't utilized when they put my food in the bag".  Being somewhat slided the next morning, I went back to my FB notifications to make a picture of the employee's comment to amusingly share with my spouse, I see they deleted the post entirely.  This was likely done to keep other customers from seeing it.  I was never reached out to by management in hopes to rectify the experience.

Unfortunately, I did give this place a try.  I hadn't written them off after the food I received was terrible (thinking maybe next time it will be better).  After the "that's insane" comment...eh, I won't be back. I feel  they really handled this situation poorly, even when the customer was overly understanding.

Best food I've had in a long time, big menu, Soup is wonderful, clean, great servers (they check every order for complete, correct orders, friendly owner who cares about her customers AND our community...i met her the first time I stopped in and it was like I've known her all my life, keep up the good work and the smiles on our faces
Great place, as far as fast Food goes, fresh and great, this is the place to go, everything is excellent, you can tell the owner cares about her business . I love the rice Pudding, just saying!

My kids 16 and 7 ask to go here all the time and I am happy to oblige. The wraps, salads, and milkshakes are awesome. Merv makes sure the customers are taken care of and always makes you feel welcome. It's a fantastic place to take the family and the text your order in. LOVE IT MERV!!! #shoplocal
Might just be the best place to eat in all of Will County. Try everything... and always get the soup.

Finally got around to trying Sizzles, as Lockport residents I am ashamed it took us so long! My husband had an Italian beef and cheese fries and I had a creamy chicken and rice soup and a "cranky franky" (hot dog with fried onions, jalapenos, and cheese) We don't have one bad thing to say! Great beef (which we are VERY picky about since my father is a Chicago butcher ;)) the soup was perfectly creamy, not too thick like some other places, and the fries were amazing.They have so many great and original items on the menu I can't wait to try more :)


*update after my 2nd visit* they need to sell that jalapeo ranch by the BOTTLE. SO. GOOD. Best fried pickles I've ever had.

Love this place! Went here a few times, the gal who is usually there (maybe she's the owner?) is fantastic, wonderful happy customer service. The egg burger is amazing, their shakes (malted!!) and their variety of menu items is impressive for such a small place. It's always crowded when I go. No surprise!

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE! I have never had a terrible or even bad meal here. The staff is wonderful and the food is awesome. I highly recommend the burgers or their fresh salads! The parking lot could use some fixing but that wont stop me from coming in!
Amazing food and the owner is the kindest, friendliest person I've ever met. Goes out of her way to keep the customers happy even if it means adding something to the menu. Highly recommended!

We came here on a recommendation from a friend, very glad we did! Super nice employees, fantastic burgers and great service! Ordered the Breakfast Burger with fries and absolutely loved it!
Fried egg makes everything better....

Great burgers, cooked to perfection and so flavorful. The star is the cheese sauce for the cheese fries, home made and it tastes like it, perfect. Have had hot dogs, Italian Beef, and ice cream fries, and burgers all delicious. 

Come on and in and see. Limited inside but its cozy. Outside has picnic tables.

I live in Lockport and found out about Sizzles right through Yelp. My husband and I decided to try it out for the first time yesterday. I had a burger and cream of chicken soup and my husband ordered a steak sandwich and cheese fries. My husband went by himself to pick it up, so I personally didn't see the place. He said it was small and there are only a couple small tables to dine in at. 

I opened the container that my burger was in, and was impressed with what I saw. They had a toasted bun, and then under the toasted bun was the burger sitting on top of a piece of regular white bread. They do this so the burger doesn't get soggy and the bun is still toasted! I've never seen this before. The burger wad good and so was my soup. My husband was extremely impressed with his steak sandwich, which came on garlic bread. He said it was probably the best he ever had and beats out Pops and Mickey's (our normal go to places). The cheese fries were also delicious. Can't wait to go back and try out other items.

I love the convenience of texting in my order and picking up 15 minutes later. I've had the Hawaiian chicken wrap and burgers. Both are amazing! 

The owner is very personable as well. She has an upbeat great personality.  We enjoy going in and chatting.

I am glad that there is finally something worth while in this location. This spot has been a revolving door of meh for so long. Now we have Sizzles and i couldn't be happier. They have a great hamburger and the sides I tried were on point as well. I have tried a couple different burgers and just loved them all. I also tried the onion straw thingy with jalapenos and that I could eat all day. I'd end up with the worst heart burn ever but it would be worth it. Now that I'm seeing other people's pictures of food I think my next visit will be wrought with "um...ah...no you go ahead of me" because I won't be able to decide on what I want. Do yourself a favor and get some Sizzles in your belly. Like now.
Good food. Good service. Very clean. I would definately go back.
Great place! Owner is super nice and customer service always comes first. Excellent food quality the chicken tenders and salads are the best I have ever tasted.

I had no idea what to expect when I came in but man am I happy I did. Packed with all the charm that you expect from a local small restaurant. The staff was beyond pleasant, excelent service, hilarious conversation, and very helpful with helping me decide what I wanted. The food was delicious, the burger that I had was cooked perfectly and was much better then you can get anywhere else in lockport. It really shows how much they care about the customers and their food. I also witnessed an attempt at the Chewie Challenge and the staff was having so much fun cheering for him, really made for a great lunch. Thanks alot for everything I will be back and I will try my hand at the Chewie!
Good Food, Great Service...Sides are enormous!

What a fun place. A hidden gem in Lockport. The onion fritters are terrific. My pizza burger reminded me of Dog and Suds. If you are looking good food with friendly service come here. Only criticism would be that the Coney burger should have the bottom bun instead of the bread and give the person a fork and a knife.

The food here is always great! I usually get a veggie wrap which is not on the menu but they are happy to make one anyway, and it comes out super fresh and delicious! Very friendly and helpful staff too.
Today. I tried the "Red Beef" again. It was great! The quality of the meat was good, with the cheese mixed in which I liked instead of the cheese slathered on top. Highly recommend.

I don't know how I've gone this long without leaving a review. I eat here all the time and love it. 

Like everyone says, the burgers are fantastic, but I almost never get them because there are so many other great choices. The Angry Bird (buffalo chicken) Sandwich is amazing. I eat a LOT of Buffalo Chicken sandwiches and this might be the best I've ever had. For whatever reason, I like the sandwich better than the wrap they sometimes offer. 

The other option I usually go for is a salad. They are really good, with generous amounts of the good stuff. 

A small, local place where everything is homemade and the owner is great. You really can't beat it.

I. LOVE.THIS. PLACE! The people that works at this place is what makes this place so awesome! I love their burgers and their bacon cheese fries are THE BOMB!!!!  I wish I would be able to eat here everyday. You can also call in your order and by the time to get there it's ready for you. Can't wait to go back.

Amazing!! Such a small place but the quality and prices are great. Not to mention the awesome employees. They make their ranch dressing from scratch and the cheese sauce too. Loved it all! Definitely a must try!!

Sizzles is AMAZING!!! I always make a point to tell people if they are not from the area but are looking for good food it's worth the drive! I love what Mervet is doing with the business! She does a lot of community outreach and gives back so much. The staff has always been friendly and they remember you when you come back. I'm amazed that she goes above and beyond to give such great customer service! For take out she will send you home with white bread between the buns so they don't get soggy (never seen that before but it's genius) also shout out to the jalapeo ranch that Mervet makes fresh for me!

I cannot say enough about this restaurant!  It is one of the best fast/casual I have ever been to.  It is fast food made fresh.  The owner operator takes every order and customer personally.  She has pride in her food, and her community.  She is never rushed, never rude and treats everyone like family.  All the food is fresh made including the soups and ice creams.  This is the type of local small business owner everyone should support and be proud of.  NICE JOB SIZZLES!
Being able to text in your order ahead of time for pick up is so convenient. Delicious food too and friendly service!

I came here with my 3 children for dinner.  It was a small restaurant that seemed more geared to carryout but you could sit along the wall against a counter or they had some tables in what looked like a screened in porch.  It defintely had a local vibe.  They even allow local businesses ti put their cards and flyers on the walls.  I was excited to try the food from such good reviews.  My daughter got a beef which she liked and I thought was good too.  The flavor reminded me of portillos.  My 2 sons ordered burgers.  One of my sons was ok with the burger and the other thought it was dry and overcooked.  I got a grilled chicken sandwich that was pretty dry.  It was not something I would order again.  I will come back again as I think it was just an off night.  They had some really neat looking burgers on the chalkboard behind the counter I would like to try.  The girl that took our order and staff was very friendly.

I have only been here once and only tried the soup, so this review is solely about the soup. I love me a good soup and am always in search of it. I have found my new favorite soup right in Lockport, IL! I tried the creamy chicken with rice and it was so yummy! They also had a mushroom soup at the time that I bet was equally fantastic. I have seen several Facebook posts about the ice cream desserts and am looking forward to going back and trying those, too!

I have been eating at Sizzle's since they opened and love their food. The salads, the soup, the shakes, the burgers, the chicken tenders, everything I've had has always been fresh and tasty. Today I used Sizzle's for catering for my daughter's 1st birthday. We had Italian sausage, Italian beef, salad, pasta, and a yogurt parfait. It was awesome. Everybody raved about the food, the portions were huge, the price was reasonable, and the service was great. Sizzle's is a godsend to Lockport. If you haven't tried it, you are missing out.

Sizzles just keeps getting better.  We order from here a lot and the food is all great. Best fried food I can think of anywhere(seriously try the mushrooms!).  My girlfriend loves the creamy chicken soup and even the salads are great. 

The owner Merv puts a lot of effort into Sizzles and it shows in every delicious bite.

Sizzles is hands down the best food in LOCKPORT!! I have brought multiple people here an they have been impressed by the hospitality and the amazing food every time. Do yourselves a favor an taste the flavor of sizzles. The chicken tenders dipped in that homemade jalapeo ranch with a healthy potion of chili cheese Fry's an topped off with any one of sizzles delicious  dessert!! A combination that will put you in a food coma that one could only  refer to as paradise.

I love this place! If you haven't been here yet, you will definitely not regret it. The food is very fresh, delicious and reliable. I'm always satisfied with my order and can tell thought has been put into it and not just thrown together like some other places. I also love supporting this business because the owner is so friendly, nice and cares about the community. I hope I can enjoys Sizzles for many years to come!

I stopped by on 7/11/16 and decided to try a cheeseburger.  One of my friends said the food and service were awesome.  I couldn't agree more.  From the moment I walked in I was greeted by the owner who I could tell truly cared about her business.  I felt compelled to write a review based on such a positive experience and a great cheeseburger .  I ordered the cheeseburger with cheddar and was surprised by both the quality and taste.  Thanks for the great experience.

I haven't reviewed sizzles?? Wow. Great place and awesome staff. This is not your typical fast food restaurant so be prepared to wait for your delicious food. Everything fresh and tasty. 
 The hamburgers are seasoned so well. The sweet chicken o mine salad is delicious. My favorite thing is the fried chicken bacon wrap. So good. They have soft serve ice cream and even that tastes superb. Go there you will love the food and staff.

Stopped in here yesterday for the 1st time. Having driven past several times, my initial assumption/impression was just another hotdog joint. My assumption was way off. The place looks a bit dated from the outside but was nice, exceptionally clean on the inside. Their menu contains a plethora of choices, sure to satisfy even the fussiest of eaters. While I waited for my food, the items that were handed out looked pretty darn good. Food arrived fresh/hot with good flavor & served with a friendly smile. The young ladies behind the counter were on the ball & very friendly/efficient. The chili cheese fries looked amazing, and are/were according to the fellow (I had to ask) that ordered them. Appears to be a family run small business that works hard, serving up quality food. I pass by many choices for food options during my day. I try my best to frequent the American small business owners whenever possible. These folks put their heart/soul into their business & it really shows here at Sizzles. These American small business owners that are earning it, should receive our support & our business. These folks work hard providing superior quality/service. By patronizing their establishments, we are also keeping the money in our neighborhoods. I choose to support places like Sizzles & other local American small business owners. I'll be back real soon..

Honesty, the food is just average. The fries weren't good, but the burgers are decent. I give them credit for opening this place up though. I would rather go here than McDonalds. At least I can call Sizzles "food". This place has potential. They really do. Add a drive thru and I believe they'll get even more business!

An awesome addition to Lockport. Great service, great homemade food, and a great selection. My toddler loves the chicken tenders, and I just had the best Beef I've ever had outside of Little Italy (maybe even better).  Can't wait to try December's new menu items.

I cant say enough how much I love everything about this place. The food, the service, the price, and the amount of food you get is all amazing!!! They are very helpful and willing to work with you on what you want or don't want with your food. If you have a suggestion they listen and might even use it and keep it as a menu item. 

 Now don't go in and expect to place your order and step over and be handed your food. This food is all made fresh and made to order. There will be a wait and because they want to make it the best and freshest for you. Believe me, this food is worth the wait! 

If there is any complaints about anything having to do with this establishment than that person is bitter, miserable and lacks excitement and joy in life that when experience something so grand they have to bitch about it just to make themselves feel bigger.
