While CityGate Grille is off the beaten path of the downtown Naperville restaurants, we think that's one of its positives aspects. We weren't sure what to expect after Riva left but we walked out saying, "Well done, CityGate Grille! We will be back!"

Headed over for dinner on a Thursday night around 6:30 pm. They had a good crowd in the restaurant and several people in the bar area. We grabbed two seats at the bar, and Katie had dinner while I had a few beers and some apps. Neil, our FAVORITE bartender, was working and took great care of us.

I love sitting in the bar, two large screen tvs behind the bar, good cocktails and cold beer (what else does a man need?). Its comfortable, and the redecoration of the joint looks great!

The tomato soup is FABULOUS, and Katie loved the mussels, salad, and especially the cobbler for dessert.

Great evening, excellent food, and warm/friendly service.

1 Baby Spinach 8.00
1 Tomato Soup 5.00
1 Mussels 10.00
1 Honcrisp Cobbler 6.00
1 Kim Crawford (choc martini) 14.00
1 Open Liquor 12.00
1 UFO (beer) 4.75

Total - $64.68

This place gets five stars for cool design but that doesn't make it a good place to eat. We had early reservations and were seated right away by a friendly hostess. The waiter however never cracked a smile or asked if it was a special occasion even though two of us were carrying gift bags...This was a birthday celebration for two people but they never bothered to ask. After drink orders were placed the waiter brought roasted garlic and a bowl of olive oil but no bread...Ummm...It took like ten minutes to get a small basket of pita wedges and super thin parm crackers to our table which also came with some sort of tomato (bland) sauce. They kept pushing drinks on us which I thought was weird until I got my salad. How can you screw up a Caesar salad? Well, you use store bought croutons, skip the anchovies and go light on the shaved parm. Oh, and you barely drizzle dressing on it. Bland and boring. A friend had the spinach salad which looked okay and my hub got the wedge salad with bacon and ranch which he loved. Our entrees were so-so. I had the gnocchi which was really rich and the sauce overwhelmed the dumplings. I ate maybe half. My husband got the steak with risotto which was bland and boring. 
The wine and drinks were top shelf however the food was sadly lacking. Will I go back? Probably not, there are plenty of tasty places in the area with friendly service.

I go here about once a month or so. It's one of my favorite places in Naperville: simple and tasty food, good service, and a nice atmosphere. If you're there after dark, there is a pretty view of lit-up trees and live music. It is a nice little gem tucked away in Corporate-ville. Once you arrive at the building (valet and lots of self-parking), go inside and turn left; the restaurant is on the main floor at the end of the hall.

I had a business dinner at the CityGate Grille and was disappointed.  The location is in the lobby of an office building off of Rte 59 and I-88.  It was a Thursday evening and our party of 12 were the only ones in the restaurant.

I ordered the mushroom flatbread for my appetizer.  It was borderline burnt and too crispy.  My 1st choice was not available so I had to settle for the pork medallions.  The menu did not mention that they were fried.  I found the dish to be too oily and salty.  I was barely able to eat one of the two medallions.  The service was a but a bit over the top and came across as trying too hard

I now understand why the restaurant was empty.  I will not be returning.

Stopped in at CityGate with a large group (10+) of mildly intoxicated friends.  We had called ahead about an hour before hand and our tables were ready and waiting.  As soon as we sat down, drinks orders were being taken.  Apps came out shortly after, and the main course, I had a ribeye blackened and it was amazing... seriously best steak I've had in a long time.  Service was on point all night, from start to finish.  The only problem I have, is that we live on the West Coast and can't go back more often.

After the manager made contact on her own and sent a rather nice letter and gift card my wife and I returned last Saturday for our 17th anniversary dinner.  Everything we ordered was very good.  I was very pleased with our second visit and would recommend it for dinner out.  The only suggestion I have is upgrade the water glasses to something different.  They are the same ones I have at home.

I have'nt been here since it was Riva. Once again it was top notch. Lobster Ravioli, filet skewers, Truffle mushroon flatbread. Every bite was perfect. It was exactly what was ordered & expected from the menu description. Super nice hostess & bartender. No attitudes due to the corporate location. I could'nt have a nicer experience.

well done citygate grille!

our friends came in as we were finishing up, looking for recommendations.  what else could we say but EVERYTHING!?

while everything was delish, my personal faves were the caprese flatbread (big chunks of grape tomates and loaded with fresh mozzerella, but barely braised!  not a melted hunk of goo at all...)...the baked apple crisp dessert was unbelievable and i'm not even really a dessert person...and, i'm a sucker for dates, but dates with chorizo?  wow.

my friend had the sea bass with this amazing sweet potato bake and a weird-sounding but so good brussel sprout slaw?!  yum!!

i feel compelled to say that everyone (except the reviewer who detests truffles) loved the truffle flat bread too.

the service was fabulous, completely attentive but not overbearing.

the prices were fairly reasonable , i'd say, especially given the quality.

i dined at sugar toad last night and while i commend them for their creativity, citygate blows them away.  even citygate's wine was better - conundrum?  my fave.  half price tuesday nights?  it's worth a trip to the ville!

the location is a bit odd like everyone said, but given i was staying at hotel arista, i had no complaints.

thanks for a great dinner!!

A pleasant surprise at Route 59 and 1-88! Very urban feel to the bar and a nice sized private dining room. We came for a late dinner Saturday night with 4 couples and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the live music. The menu is varied from pastas to scallops and veal chops but the winner of the night was their flat bread selection!  Several of the ladies opted for a salad and a flat-bread as their meal and they were not disappointed! The flat breads are crisp, buttery delicious and topped with a variety of offerings from caprese to mushrooms. Yum!  I opted for a lobster ravioli and it was sweet, succulent and just  the right size portion. The wine list was a very nice surprise with great selections and reasonable prices. All in all a great value and we will most definitely be back!
Loved it. The service was personable and attentive. The food was excellent and the decor and ambiance were upscale and still very comfortable.

I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Food was great. Wine was great.  ambience was great. The flatbread starter with smushed garlic, cheese and oil was excellent. The least expensive merlot was excellent and would be worth it at 2x the price. The petite filet was served with   Green beans and mashed potatoes. All were excellent in both flavor and presentation. Go there.

I can not believe that we have never eaten here until now. Tried it for the first time today. Oh My Goodness!!!!  I had the Chocolate Chip Belgian Waffle. Delicious!!! Everyone (party of 7) ordered something different and all loved. 
Great portion sizes and well worth the money. 
You have to go! It's a must!

Having read the reviews my family and I were excited to give this place a try. Being new to the area we are looking to find a replacement for our favorite breakfast hang out. Double Yolk will not make the cut. 

Service for us was slow and the server was distracted. Time for her shift to end was what I kept hearing her repeat to other customers. For me service when exceptional can make a difference in the overall experience. Keep my drink full. Check on me once or twice during the meal. It all goes a long way to improving the customer/server dynamic.

The real killer for me was the food. I ordered the Hungry man platter. Eggs over easy. Hash brown and sausage patties with a sausage link. I also got the pancakes vs toast. Everything was barely warm. One requirement is food must be hot! Warm at the very least. This felt like it had been sitting for 7 min or longer before it was served. On a positive note the pancakes were by far the best part of the meal. 

Overall all the customers seemed happy and the environment was clean and well represented. 

Update: My wife and I returned and overall the service was better. For the 2nd time in two visits we were seated next to the bathroom. Other seats were available but we were marched to the rear of the establishment. I didn't say anything but is this a coincidence or just incredible bad luck? The food was warmer this time but overall still nothing to rave about. Thanks for the invite back  but again I say firmly Double Yolk will not make the cut.

First time here at Double Yolk. For a Saturday morning it was busy but I was seated right away. Parking was easy. The place is alot bigger than it looks. Very clean and friendly staff. They put alot of effort to making it look very nice. Even the details in the ceiling are pretty cool. I was seated in the back by the Bakery counter.  I had the Huevos Ranchero. It's was okay not really authentic but everyone has there own style in cooking. It filled me up and I enjoyed it. The waitress was very polite and always had a smile :) . I saw large groups and they seemed to handle it pretty good.  

I based my 4 stars on parking, wait time, speed of serving, how food was cooked, and cleanliness. I did not really count the taste of food. I would like to try some other meals first. 

I will return again, but next time I'll try the Country Steak with gravy.

Good was just ok. I had the French connection  (French toast, bacon, one sausage link and eggs).
Waitress was attentive and friendly but the booth i say at wasn't bolted down and people kept bumping into it when going in/out of the hallway which was bothersome.

Went here with my wife and son on a Sunday morning. We got lucky and beat the church crowd by 20 minutes. Food is exactly what you are looking for in a local breakfast place. 

If you're not starving but want a snack to go alongside a coffee, try the sweet roll. It came sliced and pan toasted. I was really pleased.

Had a nice breakfast with good friends. I had a truckers skillet, over easy eggs, extra crispy hash browns decaf coffee. My husband and a meat lovers skillet, over easy eggs and biscuits and gravy. Both skillets came with 4 eggs each. My hash brown could have been crispier. My husband said the biscuits and gravy were okay, nothing special.
Over all good size portions. Good service. As long as you have that and good company... You can't go wrong. We'll be back.
I'm so disappointed server was so bad no refills my coffee pass us couple times with a coffee jar on her hand and was cold

Los Angeles breakfast joints need to visit the Midwest to learn how it should be done!

-Plenty of parking
-seated quickly
-coffee & hazelnut cappuccinos
-biscuits & gravy
-corn beef hash and it's Real (not from can)
-eggs cooked just right
-bacon crispy (perfect)
-toast just right
-seems great for kids
-priced right
-friendly & efficient service (5 stars!)

Any dislikes?
-A bit too much onions in my corn beef hash
That's my ONLY complaint and that's just a personal preference.

This place borders on 5 stars.

Solid breakfast and lunch place.

I've gotten take out here several times and I have also eaten in a few times. The servers we've had are wonderful, attentive, and nice. It always makes me happy when the server goes out of their way to make your toddler happy while dining out. The place has always been super clean, including the restrooms. 

I think my favorite thing would have to be that they offer biscuits and gravy as a side instead of toast or pancakes! I love this! Now, they don't have anything on my homemade biscuits and gravy, but it is a really nice change every now and then. I love the breakfast burger! If you can't decide, believe me get this and you won't regret it. Also love the healthy items they have available. 

Coffee isn't anything special in my opinion, but it is worth it if you want some. Just not the best.

Overall this is a great breakfast and lunch spot. I highly recommend!

The food was wonderful. I had a waffle that was crispy and had a slight vanilla flavor. My kids had eggs with a side a pancakes and bacon. The coffee was fresh. My only complaint was that the server was rude. She was very crabby and I felt like we were being rushed. Not sure if the food will be worth going back.

Double Yolk has certainly stepped it up a notch since my last review. On my first visit, my server forgot about my order and I waited 35 minutes for breakfast after placing the order. However, on the following two visits I had my food on the table in less than ten minutes each time.
And as always, the food is great! I fell in love with the "meat lovers skillet." The portions are quite large, I always end up taking half to go in a box. It seems to be a common theme here. Everyone walks out with a box.
If you have Gluten sensitivity or intolerance, you can substitute for the Gluten-Free pancakes. Some of the best I've ever had, but don't take my word for it. Come have a taste for yourself.
That 5th star will continue to elude them until they switch up the coffee supplier. It would be great if they carried someone local, maybe #intelligentsiacoffee

I went here for breakfast with my wife and daughter. The food was delicious, the atmosphere had a great diner feel with oldies music played at a perfectly enjoyable level, and the service was prompt and friendly. My 3 year old was complimented for her behavior and the server went out of her way to make my daughter smile. It was fantastic.

Just writing this and thinking about the experience we had makes me want to go back. I really enjoyed it here and am looking forward to going again.

The hubbie and I had a great experience at Double Yolk!

We set out to grab brunch at a place nearby that we haven't tried yet, and this place was a winning choice. It was about noon on a Saturday and the restaurant was pretty full but we still got sat right away (in a comfy booth too!).

Our waitress was very helpful and efficient. We had coffee flowing right away and she even made sure to grab some decaf for me (trying to cut down on my caffeine intake). The menu was huge and had everything you could want for breakfast or lunch. Making a decision was HARD. Especially since the menu had so many delicious photos of the food and I was super hungry. 

I ordered the avocado omelet (which included bacon and mozzarella) along with hash browns and a side of pancakes. It sounds like quite the hefty order I know, but the sides were included! It was all super delish. Hash browns were on point and the skillet was made to perfection. Plus, all that food was only $8.95! What a deal. Of course I ended up taking home half the omelet, a little bit of potatoes and a pancake - all of which made great leftovers minus the omelet due to the avocado getting brown.

Joshua B (husband) enjoyed the country skillet topped with biscuits and sausage gravy. I stole a few bites off his plate and I am definitely a fan of the biscuits and gravy, that's for sure. But then again, who isn't? 

We'll definitely be back to enjoy more of their menu!

Pro tip: They're more than happy to give you a to-go cup for more coffee :)

Met some friends here early on a Sunday morning. My friends got there before me and got the waitress to give me crap when I got there. Continued through breakfast. I thought it was great and would rather have an engaged waitress. 
I ordered the Denver skillet. Eggs sunny side up with pancakes. Unfortunately the skillet was a bit dry/overcooked just a bit for my tastes. Pancakes were phenomenal. Will go back.
Light, bright, clean, fresh, friendly, selection, parking, service, smiles, Theresa...happy!
I come here with my mom every weekend.  Food is fresh, coffee is fantastic. Best tasting food around.

Been to this place for lunch several times (both dine in and carry out) because it is near where I work.  Food is consistently good as is the service.  Their Reuben sandwich is one of the best I've had and I highly recommend it if you like Reubens.
This is a good choice for breakfast - nothing pretentious, just a nice, comfortable place for breakfast or lunch. The wait staff are all pleasant and take good care of their customers.

Really great food, large portions and reasonable prices.  We ended up here this morning after M whined that he was hungry.  I suggested Double Yolk, and after he reviewed the menu and salivated over the pictures from Yelp, we made our way over.

Upon arrival, we encountered a 15 minute wait, not bad at all.  After our number was the called, the gentleman at the register thanked us for our patience and told us to enjoy our meal. 

We were seated in a cozy booth, but next to the window, it was quite chilly.  Not a big deal, but come winter, it may have been downright uncomfortable. However, the back corner booth gave us a great view of the entire restaurant, so that's a plus.

Shortly after being seated, our server Betty arrived to take our drink order.  We both chose coffee and ice waters without lemon.  She returned with our beverages and we ordered:  the Country Skillet for M (eggs over easy with biscuits and sausage gravy) with english muffin for the carb-inducing side) and I chose the Philly Cheese steak sandwich (no mushrooms), with curly fries and the soup of the day (Cream of Chicken and Wild Rice).  As much as I wanted a beautiful skillet breakfast, eggs have made their way into my "can't eat this anymore without severe repercussions" list.  I don't care for pancakes, waffles, crepes, etc.... so I have pretty much given up on breakfast foods.

Looking around, the restaurant is modern, clean, and smaller than most breakfast places, but you can tell it is well run.  Busboys cleared tables immediately after patrons departed, servers keep the coffee flowing, and the attitudes of the employees were very pleasant despite a busy morning breakfast rush.  

My soup arrived quickly, and I quickly dug in.  It was thick and full of flavor.  This tasted homemade, and not some nasty, preservative filled Campbell's garbage.  The chicken and rice were amazing.  I could have eaten a bucket of this stuff. 

A few minutes later, our food arrived and M immediately said "Oh man" as a mountain of food was placed in front of him. I said the same (but silently) as I stared down at a delicious Philly cheese steak sandwich with the most beautiful curly fries I've seen outside of Arby's. We dug in.

My sandwich was amazing- a bit greasy but the slightly toasted french roll kept the juices from escaping for the most part. The fries were incredible: perfectly seasoned, good crispy exterior with a soft potato-y interior, and were piping hot.  A few slices of crinkle cut pickle were also provided, and they tasted way better than store-bought, jarred pickles. 

I only managed to eat half of my meal, but M was bound and determined to finish his enormous skillet.  I was certain he'd be successful, but he gave up with about a quarter of it left. Betty brought us some boxes and our check, and thanked us for coming in. After settling up with the gentleman at the register, we (slowly) made our way outside.

I'm definitely impressed with the food and the service provided here (Betty was amazing!) I've known about Double Yolk forever, yet I can't give a good reason as to why I haven't been here until today.  The prices are fair, the atmosphere enjoyable, and you will absolutely leave here in a food coma.  We will be back!

Very good food. I can't believe I've been coming here so often and so long that I never reviewed it. I usually get breakfast food like the hungry jack omelet, the French connection and the chorizo skillet and all have been very tasty and big portions.  Just watch out for their chocolate peanut butter french toast...very good but waaay too sweet.  But I also like their lunch as well like their chicken sandwich and panini.  Although their breakfast food tastes better. You won't leave here hungry!  All the staff is very nice.  Even on a busy day which is usually any Sat/Sun morning, you can usually get seating within 15 mins.  Also you can get discount certificates on www.restaurant.com so the food is a great value.  Try them out if you're in the neighborhood.

This was our first time trying this restaurant. On a bright summer Sunday morning, the wait time for a table was no more than a few minutes. Bad sign? Not quite. We were pleasantly surprised. Food was just fantastic, although it really took long to come out. Service was friendly. We will be back.

I've had everything from their skillets to home made corn beef hash, to their lunch sandwiches, panini's and coffee.  

Just about every single thing on the menu is good.  Always a pleasure to go here.  I am recently disappointed with the new menu though- not with teh choices- but rather the price increases.

This place was super crowded at 11am. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated(not bad!). I usually love breakfast place coffee and this place did not have a good coffee. The service was good. And food was tasty overall.

We went in on a Saturday morning/afternoon. Brunch time, maybe lunch time. We were seated promptly and received our drinks quickly. Our meal was good and we were in and out within an hour. Attached is a gelato shop which we would like to try at some point. 

The name behind "double yolk" is if you ask for 1 egg, you get 2, 2 eggs, you get 4, etc. So I guess if you want 3 eggs, you have to ask for 1.5 eggs.

On a side note, this restaurant is on restaurant.com, so you can save some money that way.
Delicious coffee. And wonderful breakfast sandwiches. The WiFi password is doubleyolk

This review is not about the food. The food here is pretty tasty. Our omelettes were fresh and our server was friendly.

However, when we got our bill, we were upcharged a dollar each  for "large" coffees. This made no sense. They own the cafe next door, the businesses are connected and diners are eating on either side of the french doors.  They should have put our coffee in a  regular mug and brought it to us. Instead they served it in  LARGE TO GO cups and upcharged us a dollar each. Not what we asked for....

Then, we were also up charged for 2 sides of gluten free pancakes. No where on the menu does it tell you there is a fee for gluten free this and the waitress did not tell us either.  It simply showed up on the bill. We would not have each ordered a gluten free side because our main meal was the omelette.  We simply wanted to try their "gluten free". When I brought this up with the hostess, she said they have received this feedback and they are working to update the menus.  She said the waitress was, "new" and that is why she didn't tell us.

So..... no menu listing, no warning from the waitress and we paid an extra $2 per omelette which is 24% of the cost of the entire menu item! So, overall we were up-charged $6 on the entire bill. Which is not a fortune, but on a $30 meal that is 20%, which is completely ridiculous.  The  hostess went to talk to the owner and he didn't care, he was unwilling to modify our bill or apologize for the confusion.

We won't be back.  This is not the service, we are looking for. It's not worth the hassle for a $30 breakfast!

Stopped in really quick before work. I only had 45 mins to spare and the server Jenny was awesome everything came out fast and easy and the food was great! I did ask about gluten free menu and they don't have a separate one the only thing that was verbally available was gluten free pancakes. They were a little dry but I have had worse.

This is my new go to place for breakfast food. This breakfast restaurant is right by my job, and they have good food, and great fruit. They're still not as good as Niko's Breakfast restaurant in Romeoville, but i will definitely be back here, because of three things. 1. They're customer service was good 2. The food was good 3. The price was reasonable.

I have been to this restaurant about 4 or 5 times since moving to the area in 2013. It is my favorite breakfast spot in the Aurora area. The food is always really good. I usually get one of there breakfast scramblers. They are HUGE! They cook all their food really well. The portions are really big as well. I have gotten a to-go box a couple times because I couldn't finish it all. I have never heard anyone complain about this place. There is usually a line so make sure you come early. They have a really talented wait staff. It is an overall fantastic experience at the Double Yoke! 5/5

Me and my daughters come here frequently. They have a great and friendly staff.  The food is very good.   They have a diverse menu so I've only tried a few of them but I love their chorizo skillet. It is awesome!!  I love the local quaint place to kick back and enjoy good food.

I tried Double Yolk on a recent trip to Aurora to visit friends.  We were looking for a kid-friendly place that had a good selection of breakfast/brunch items.  Double Yolk fit the bill.  

Although they looked very busy on first glance of arrival, we were surprised to find out the wait was only around 5 minutes.  It seems that they have recently acquired the space next door, which has opened up additional seating for them.  We were greeted quickly by our server and was asked for drink orders.  They had the usual selection of breakfast type drinks. 

Now onto the menu! They had an extensive breakfast menu with a little bit of something for everyone.  If you want to get allot for your money that doesn't skimp on quality, then this is the place to go.  The omelette that I tried was delish.  It came with a choice of hashbrowns or fruit and a choice of 2 pancakes or toast (tons of varieties of breads).  If you leave Double Yolk hungry, then you must have a huge appetite! I couldn't finish my entire order!!

Overall I would recommend Double Yolk! They have quick service and good food with great pricing.  Try it out the next time you are in Aurora!

This place is very clean, cozy and I like how bright it is in there. The service was great and everyone was friendly. I ordered the country fried steak with scrambled eggs and upgraded my pancakes that came with my meal to French Toast for $1.50. The eggs were perfect, gravy was good as well but the French Toast was eggy and pretty dense. My friend got the burger which was over sized, the bun fell apart and it was cooked well done (they didn't ask how he would like it cooked, which would have been medium rare). The bacon that came on the burger was unfortunately flavorless. I understand a breakfast place not having the best burger but I definitely expect the bacon to be good! Overall, a nice place with a great atmosphere.

This place is a hidden gem for breakfast.  Great food, great service and reasonable prices for the amount of food you get.  My wife and I ordered the French toast and country skillet.  The combination in the skillet was amazing while the Texas French toast much more than we could handle.  It was a party for the tastebuds!

Great country fried steak and eggs with hash browns or fruit and pancakes!  Good pricing and they except Rest.com gift certs! Also coffee is tasty, nice and string black or with cream!  Highly recommend!

When I find a breakfast place I like, I stick with it. Double Yolk is so close to home for me that it was an instant hit. Killer biscuits and gravy. I've had the country Benedict a few times now as well. 

The staff has been stellar and on point with every need being fulfilled. High quality of service. I could see where this place would be packed on the weekends with long wait times. But the food and service are worth it.  If I see anyone bawling over an hour wait for a party of six or more on a weekend morning...y'all need to go to IHOP or something. This place is quality. Just have some patience. It's worth the wait.

Prices are excellent. I heard someone complain on here and in a conversation that this place was too high priced. If you want cheap by a dollar or so, go to McDonald's next door. I've eaten at places twice as expensive and not as good in quality and service. So give that a rest as well.

Did I mention killer biscuits and gravy yet? It's usually the first thing I try. Because if you mess that up, the rest of the food is gonna suck. And it is primo here. 

Keep up the good work folks. You have a new regular.

Well... after a number of visits, I'm a super fan. Their NEW Gelato & Pastry Cafe is connected to their restaurant and is a cool addition. 

Additional seating in the rear of cafe. It's been a soft open for them the last 2 months. They make their own gelato and pastries. You can be served or have a meeting in there too.

I just love their creative dishes. They offer affordable specials during the week both lunch and breakfast, which includes coffee. You have to try the breakfast burger. Always a great deal when you can have biscuits and gravy for your side. Great healthy items too.

And just like the name says... except double yolks when ordering eggs. I certainly enjoyed the egg white sandwich with spinach and fruit this morning. #eatinghealthy

Double yolk came as a suggestion to me since I was going to be in the area. The atmosphere was nice and they were able to seat us in a timely manner. I liked how the menu expanded beyond breakfast with a wide variety. I ordered the Caramelized pecan pancakes with bacon and scrambled eggs. I thought the eggs were a little runny but the bacon had a good flavor. The pancakes were good but I've had better. Overall, the experience was a good one not great so I may or may not be back again.

Really great breakfast place! Everything I've tried is fresh and cooked the right way (not greasy at all). It's a clean and comfortable environment and the staff is excellent. I've been here several times (I like a cooked breakfast on the weekends AND I like being lazy :) and I've never had a bad experience with the the food or the staff. That level of consistency is soooo hard to find. 

I've not had anything other than breakfast but the lunch menus looks tasty. If you're looking for a great breakfast spot give this place a try.

I will not be back and I will not recommend this place to anyone!!!! My friend was treating me out for breakfast and I said let's try this place...BIG MISTAKE!!! My orange juice came out and after a sip or two I was stirring it and it had multiple black flaky particles in it. We brought it to our waitress attention and she says "sorry can I get you another one" I decline and take a water. Next our food comes out and I find long hairs in the plate of butter!!! I'm grossed out at this point and don't want to eat at all. This was shown to the waitress and she apologized again and brought out more butter. The manager never came to our table and only took off the hash browns that was on the bill!! I wanted to get up and leave but my friend was treating and I didn't want to make a big issue of it. I thought the service was horrible.  NEVER AGAIN and I was forced to give 1 Star to post my review!!

In my travels throughout Chicagoland I've reviewed many a breakfast joint, every now and then there's places that are nearby that managed to evade my detection for a long time. One such place was Double Yolk in Aurora, I passed by it one day, added it to my bookmarks for a future visit. 

Once I headed in the layout seemed very familiar, it reminded me a lot of a place I've reviewed prior to this called Mapleberry Pancake House. I was seated, given a menu and took some time to look over the menu. I eventually settled on a meat lovers skillet with pancakes rather than toast as the side. Within ten minutes my order was out and it was time to dig in.

With a name like double yolk I thought perhaps they gave you double the number of eggs ordered. There are a few other breakfast places that do that, though that did not appear to be the case here. There was a big egg pile towards the center of my skillet with meats, cheese, and the rest of the skillet below. There was sausage, ham and bacon in the skillet as the meats and all were tasty and they didn't skimp on the meat amount. The potato at the bottom was a little on the bland side but was crisper and more flavorful than most. The way the cheese and different meats blended together really put the "skill" in skillet. This was an excellent combination and overall this was an outstanding skillet.

The pancakes that came with my skillet were good as well. They were soft and had a good texture. Had some powdered sugar on top for extra flavor and a nice rich maple syrup to go with them. I'd say these were good pancakes as well.

My overall experience at Double Yolk was positive. Service was speedy and I was happy with my food. I'll recommend it, this is a review that's right on the border between four and five stars. The fast service and comfortable atmosphere will nudge it just over that line. So I'm five stars for Double Yolk and while I'm not egging you to try it, if you're in the area I'd recommend it for breakfast.

We came with a group of 8 on Memorial day after another local spot was closed. While expectations were mixed based on the exterior, we were pleasantly surprised with what we found. 

Specializing in breakfast, but with additional offerings, it's like going to a Denny's that doesn't remind you of sad Christmas movies, but I digress.

We were seated promptly and greeted with menu's that offered Swedish, German, and 'Merican pancakes. My better half had some Swedish lingenberry pancakes that were reminiscent of Crepe's and I had some delicious corned beef hash. Good, not great, coffee. A buddy had the Shamrock Benedict and it definitely won best breakfast for the group. A solid take on the old favorite and with corned beef hash to boot!

Overall, we were really impressed with this spot. Felt much more like a localish spot than a chain. Somewhere we'll likely hit up again.

I've been on the hunt for the perfect breakfast place in my area for quite some time, and really haven't found anything better than Double Yolk. It's kind of annoying, because in my mind, the "perfect" breakfast place is something like a Waffle House in the deep south- Filthy, cheap as hell, a dude with prison tattoos behind the grill, a waitress who is always ready to tell you her latest tale of woe... and amazing food and coffee to eat and drink while listening to it.

Well, Double Yolk doesn't have most of that. It's clean and well lit, I wouldn't really describe it as cheap (But it's not exactly expensive either), I've yet to spot any kind of prison tattoos, and all the waitresses are surprisingly pleasant, even when you show up super early. I guess the only thing that actually counts when it comes to a restaurant is how good the food is, and Double Yolk nails it. We've been here a bunch, and have tried a ton of stuff on the menu, and haven't ever been disappointed.

In fact, here's a tip for you- Biscuits and gravy can be added as a side instead of pancakes or whatever. I've never seen a restaurant do this, as biscuits and gravy are typically their own entree item. GET THEM. They're good, and essentially free with whatever you order. I feel like this has to be some kind of menu design oversight, but, you might as well take advantage of it.

The portion sizes here are insane, which I guess is good for 'merica and all, but I always find myself wishing they had some secret menu where you get half as much food for half price. I love the food here, but I hate that I always end up throwing half of it away while still walking out feeling stuffed. I guess there's worse things to complain about.

Oh, also, look around for signs in their window. You get a coupon for sending a text message to a SMS short code. Presumably this is to spam you with text messages, but I haven't had any issues. 

I wish they had real cream instead of those gross shelf-stable creamer cups, but, it doesn't seem like anywhere in the Aurora area serves real cream to go with your coffee so they're on pretty even footing there.

So, yeah, check out Double Yolk, you won't be disappointed... Unless of course you're like me and your barometer for how good your breakfast is going to be is calibrated solely to spider web and tear drop tattoos.

While in Aurora, we came here looking for breakfast. The servers were polite and quick. Atmosphere was nice. I ordered the eggs benedict which was good except my yolks were overcooked. 
My girlfriend ordered the eggs florentine. Same deal, good but with overcooked yolks. 
My daughter had a "scrambled omelet" with ham. Nice portion size. Everything came with optional sides which was nice to share. Overall, good food. If in Aurora again will try once more.
The food took forever and there was hair in my hashbrowns. Our server was friendly but I would not come back!

Not sure how this was voted #1 in Aurora. We had the Mexican Breakfast Bowls & were very disappointed.There were too many refried beans, too little cheese, & not enough flavor. We split a short stack (two malted pancakes) & were surprised at how rubbery they were. Not sure if they didn't add enough butter or if they mixed the batter too long, but they were not good & the syrup was thin & without flavoring, similar to sugar water. Even with the reastaurant.com certificate, we paid too much for the quality of food we received.
Good food and good Juice and good everything and Jouse was good  service and excellent customer service. Me  and my family definitely come back here.

Love love loooove this pancake house!!!!! I can't even count how many times we have stopped here!!! EVERYTHING has been excellent!!! We have even tried some of the lunch menus-- which was also excellent!! 

Friendliest servers anywhere! Makes the restaurant even better if that was possible!

My husband and I were lucky enough to stumble upon Double Yolk on our way home from a wedding over the weekend. We arrived around 12:30pm on a Sunday, I'm willing to bet we missed most of the regular Sunday crowd (luckily!). Our food came out in less than 10 minutes, it felt almost instant. I had the Eggs Benedict, which is usually a telltale dish-- I've found its easy to ruin hollandaise sauce, but theirs was fantastic. My husband got the Greek skillet, he said it's the best he's had, and he's tried quite a few! We shared a side of biscuits & gravy, I normally only have a bite or two (usually too heavy for my taste) but I love it & finished mine-- fluffier gravy and a very firm, buttery biscuit (yum!). The service was attentive and friendly, price was very reasonable. I wish we lived closer, we'd make it a regular breakfast place!

The attached caf next store has the best gelato I have ever had in my life.
The owner organized a demonstration for our Brownie Troop.  We saw how many different varieties are made.  Only fresh ingredients are used.  All the fruit varieties are made from fresh raspberries, strawberries, blackberries mangoes etc.  The chocolate gelato has Belgium chocolate added, the vanilla gelato has high grade Bourbon Vanilla added....every one we tried was deliciously smooth and creamy.  It is hard to pick a favorite as all are amazing.  After the tour, I brought home some of the beautiful pastries to share with my family as well as more gelato.  WOW!  This is a true European experience! Thank you to the owner Sal and gelato maker Tony.  They are so passionate about only making and serving the very best using only top ingredients. Try them out and you too will be hooked!

One of very few Yelp let downs. Not a good experience from start to finish. My husband ordered the steak and eggs and got an unseasoned burger patty. True to the name I ordered 2 eggs and got 4, all undercooked. I asked for the "biscuits" option that comes with the combo and got 1 tough, cold biscuit. Food was not good. Service was just average. Didn't seem like they really cared we were there and the place was pretty dead on a weekday morning. Couldn't wait to leave and would not come back.

Double Yolk is pretty good. It's really nice on the inside. It's clean and decorated well. The hosts and servers are really kind. The food is pretty good! It comes out quickly and made right. Just remember any time you order one egg, it comes out as two, hence the name of the restaurant.  The only dish I wouldn't recommend here is their eggs benedict. The meat was a little too chewy and the hollandaise sauce seemed a little off both times I tried it. Other than that, it's a good breakfast restaurant!
Absolutely fantastic food and service!  Their steak and eggs were perfect.  The service was very friendly and prompt.  Even though it was crowded, we were seated right away.  I can't wait to go back.

I drive past this place nearly everyday on the way to work.  I always told myself to give it a try some weekday a.m. I'm off.   So, since the preferred destination of Ari's Kitchen was closed,  yesterday was that day.   Since I also was having surgery at night & had to stop eating at 10 a.m., I  figured I'll try it & make on big meal out of it.  

I walked in to a very clean restaurant around 8 a.m.  The only other patrons were a older group of guys, probably a coffee klatsch (sp?).  I was promptly greeted & placed in a booth.  The hostess asked me for my beverage of choice before I could even get my jacket off, which was appreciated.  My large Diet Pepsi (minus points for not having Coke in my opinion) was fresh & tasty.....which is VERY important to me as a fountain pop snob. 

The menu was pretty big with lots of great sounding options.  I tend to stick with omelets & hash browns when I go out.  However today, they had a 'truckers skillet" with 2 eggs, onions, peppers, ham, bacon, sausage.  As an avid carnivore, I ordered that & a biscuit to neutralize the grease that would soon hit my stomach.  

The skillet was very good.  The eggs were soft & fluffy.  There were plant of  meats (though the sausage appeared to be just slices of links), veggies & cheese underneath.  All in all, a very tasty & satisfying skillet.  The biscuit looked really tasty but was rather pressed and dense for my liking & was a bit of a letdown.  

Service was very good, as one would expect when they are 50% of the places patrons at the time.  My Diet Pepsi glass never got close to empty.  The check came & was for $12, excluding tip.

All in all, good service & very good food for a good price. I'd give it 5 stars but the biscuit was a letdown as was not having Coke products. Then again, as one of my favorite comics says, you can't have everything because where would you put it?

I've been a regular patron here since it first opened. Recently, a new menu was implemented with higher prices, of course. Then today my friend and I noticed that when we ordered 2 eggs, there were 3 yolks instead of the usual 4, hence the name "Double Yolk". We were told that they had cut back and this is now the norm. Also, I think they changed to a cheaper product for bacon. The slices were smaller and it definitely had a different taste.  So, at the same time prices were raised, they have switched to cheaper products and practices.  I think I'll eat somewhere else from now on.
Been here a few times and can't complain. So far haven't been disappointed in their breakfast. It's tasty and fast. The service is enjoyable. The orange juice is freshly squeezed and delicious.

I live very close to Double Yolk and we have been twice now. I would say my overall experience has been a good one, and the people I have gone with have enjoyed it as well. 

We have had very good service each time, the food was hot, server was friendly and the wait to sit was nothing out of the ordinary for a small breakfast place on the weekend. 

I enjoy Double Yolk and look forward to visiting them a lot more!

Texas French Toast... I'm all for it. 
I totally plan on returning.

The wife and I try to eat at different pancake houses and this is the best in the Aurora area. I had the country skillet, my wife had the veggie skillet and my brother had the Greek skillet.  Very big portions for the price of the skillet.  The prices here are very reasonable.  We will be back.

Unfortunately second time someone in my house has gotten really sick after eating here. I'm a regular here and generally no problem. I got sick a few weeks ago after eating here, but wrote it off to coincidence, but my wife just got really sick and coincidence is no longer a factor. I knew that things were going a little down hill, but this is last straw. Time to find new breakfast spot.

Listening to the BF again I ended up at another place I strongly disliked and the food in my personal opinion didn't have a bit of love. I ordered the extremely simple Denver Omelette meal and subbed the ham for turkey. I added American cheese to the eggs and glazed strawberries to the pancakes. The eggs and potatoes came out first, I started breaking them to look and make sure they'd used the correct cheese, but there was none so I sent them back at the same time she returned with the pancakes. The pancakes were blah and the glazed strawberries were served cold...I would never serve a cold glazed strawberry on pancakes. Anyway, when the Omelette came back it was the same eggs that I'd broken open to check with cheese added to the top of it. So I just sent it back. This place is a joke. During check out when asked what I thought of the meal I informed them I didn't enjoy it and I was asked if I was the one with the Omelette. I replied yes and this woman had the nerves to say I removed the Omelette from the bill. I replied I would hope so since I sent it back. We were still charged for the pancakes and cold glazed strawberries. Yuck!
I love the pancakes ,some of the best around. They are busy but the wait is never very long. Staff is friendly and place is clean. Great place all around.

My new favorite place for breakfast/brunch! We arrived on a Sunday @ 2pm. We were seated right away. Our waitress was very attentive. Food came out in a decent time period. They serve really big portions. Their pancakes and hash browns were delicious!! You get a lot for your money! I just wish they were open a little later in the day.
Mmmmm my stuffed french toast was perfect I love the amount of strawberries too! I love visiting this place before hitting the outlet mall!

This place is ok. They are pretty average. Husband got the trucker skillet (he said it was good) and I got a sausage and cheese omelet with a side of fruit and chocolate chip pancakes. FYI I paid an upcharge for the chocolate chips and they were just sprinkled on top with some syrup. Disappointing. Then I eat a grape and had to spit it out, seeded. Who does that in a restaurant? Not a happy diner. (At the register I voiced my opinion and she said every place does that with the chocolate chips and that I should have requested them in the pancakes not just on top. I told her most breakfast places put it inside so I felt I didn't have to. Nice attempt to make me feel like a moron. Fail!)

So driving by a little strip mall restaurant wasn't really appealing to me but it was rainy and I was too lazy to drive.

This place is truly a hidden gem. I had the shamrock benedict (corned beef instead of canadian bacon) and it was delicious. The benedict sauce was perfect not too lemony or eggy. The English muffins were great too and able to handle eggs and sauce. 

The service is great. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. Plusses all around. 

Don't be discourage but the smallish interior. They turn tables extremely quick. So don't be a snob like me. Stop by and have a good, hearty breakfast.

We've been here multiple times and have had the same issue with the hidden upcharges and a particular server named Shurley. One time she forgot our side of fruit yet still charged us for it. Many other times, I had request substitution for the skillet and did not end up getting what I had asked for.  And she always came up with excuses about how we didn't order it the right way and did nothing about it and acted as if she was irritated. We were being super nice as she was an old lady just doing her job. Anyways, I don't want any more hassle so we won't be back again. There's a another great breakfast place down the street, Ari's kitchen, that we'll be frequently visit instead of double Yolk now even if it is a little farther for us. Customer service is a lot better and they don't up-charge us for coffee like we've been up-charged us here. Hope this place improves because the food is decent.

Great breakfast spot and right around the corner from my house so it's definitely our go to when we want breakfast out with the family.  Their skillets are delicious and so are the pancakes, yummo!  My partner loves the eggs benedict.  The service is fast, friendly and the prices are affordable.  Stop by, you won't be disappointed.  I've never had lunch there but I'm sure it is delicious!
Double Yolk is one of our favorite places to eat! We love going here! They have great food for great prices. We always get their skillets which are big and yummy! Love this place!

Let me just start by de-bunking all of these negative reviews: My husband and I have eaten here several times, and we have never waited more than a few minutes for our food, the servers and the hostess have never been anything but warm, friendly, and prompt, and the Owner is one of the nicest men you could meet. I was getting angry reading these other reviews!

Double Yolk is a new, and welcome, addition to Aurora. They have an extensive breakfast and lunch menu - and I heard a rumor they may be serving up dinner a few nights a week in the near future. Double Yolk offers traditional breakfast food that is consistently delicious. It's also the most affordable breakfast we've had in the area - let's just say since it's opened we've abandoned our usual breakfast spots. 

Please don't be swayed be these haters - check out Double Yolk and I know you'll enjoy the friendly atmosphere, bright space, and scrumptious breakfast food, or I'll reimburse you, okay not really, but you won't be disappointed!

The food is really good. The prices are avg or a little higher - but I think the area is expensive to operate in. There are a few real duds in their wait staff. If you get a dark haired lady that talks like she had a big dose of lithium, you're in trouble. The owner is nice. The service is slooooow, so be prepared to wait an unreasonable amount of time sometimes. I'll give them 4 stars for their food, cleanliness, and quality. I think that's worth something around here.

Several positive developments on the breakfast front for us. Anyone that has read a breakfast review of mine before knows of my quest for homemade corned beef hash and ding!, ding!, ding! Double Yolk fits the bill. (You can really tell the difference.)  So in addition to them having this leg up going in, I've gotta say, I also loved Sweedish pancakes and Amie loved the spinach-cheese omlette.  Once we could be seated (a 10-20 minute wait on a Sunday morning is to be expected if the place is good!), the menu was pretty extensive, the service was prompt and friendly and the ambiance not too loud.  

Bottom line is that just about all bases are covered here.  Especially with reasonable pricing, the only reason I can't go 5-stars was that the coffee was pretty bland and the accommodations and process for those waiting to be seated is clearly inadequate.  A counter for solo patrons would be nice too, but otherwise this place on the northwest edge of Aurora/North Aurora is a real keeper and highly recommended.

This place needs some kind of organizational training.  We arrived and were seated immediately.  Our server came over and asked if we wanted coffee.  We said no and we're ready to order our beverages but she said ok and then left.  5 min later she brought water but then left again. It took about 15 minutes to get our drinks.  We then placed our orders.  Two kids meals: the silver dollar pancakes with bacon and the scrambled eggs with sausage. Then the two adult orders:  a broccoli and cheese omelet and a breakfast burrito.  The silver dollar pancakes arrived with the sausage instead of bacon.The scrambled eggs came with no side.  The breakfast burrito had ham in it which was not stated on the menu.  I feel like it would be much better if service was on point and the menu matched what you were brought.
We  had the avocado omelette, Swedish pancakes and German pancake.  These items were prepared as good as they could be.  The food was very good, reasonably priced with prompt service.

I used to drive by this strip mall every day until I switched jobs... Now we never get by this way.  We just happened to accidentally go this way and see the Double Yolk one day.  I've been wanting to try it out ever since!

It's nicely decorated and quite inviting inside.  We were told there was a 10 minute wait at 11am on Saturday morning, but it was just a few minutes.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  

We both had a skillet and shared an order of Potato Pancakes.  I'm picky about my cakes and these looked quite eggy... I must say they were really good!  They had a nice flavor of onions and garlic!  There were 3 large cakes to a serving, so we left with extra!

I had the Country Skillet which had Hash Browns, Biscuits, Sausage Gravy, Scrambled Eggs, and Mozzarella Cheese.  The hash browns were nothing special.  I'll go back some time to try their Home Fries.  The Sausage Gravy though was pretty good.  My bff and I judge places on their gravy!  Just for that we'll be back!  I liked the combination of this skillet!  The boy had the Meat Lovers Skillet and really liked it.  

We're looking forward to stopping in again to try some of the other really good looking things on the menu!!  We had a ton of leftovers to boot!

My best friend and I decided to try out this quaint little new diner near her house and my work one morning.  We had heard nothing about it, only saw it when it was closed as we were pulling into the parkinglot for karaoke at JJ's one night.  On our first visit we were impressed, and by now (too many visits to count), I can safely say, this is our favorite spot for breakfast.

The first time we walked in the door, the cute hostess with the british accent showed us to our table with a smile, the waitress got our orders exactly right and the manager (owner?) visited our table just to be sure everything was fantastic...which it was.  

By our second visit, almost the entire staff recognized my friend and I, asked us about our week, and treated us, not like guests, but members of the family.  We were hooked.  

The menu is not to be passed over in this review either.  In addition to the friendly, warm, inviting atmosphere, the menu is diverse, unique and delicious!  Favorite items of this sweet-toothed girl are the Tarimisu Pancakes and the Crazy Monkey Belgian Waffle!  (Come on, how can you not smile with a name like the Crazy MonkeY!?)  

My honest opinion: if you are looking for a place to meet with a friend, bond over some comfort food and have a gigantic cup of hot coffee (with flavored creamer if you so desire), this is the place to go.  If you are looking for delicious food, and fast, friendly service, and to still have enough money left over to go shopping over at those outlets, THIS is the place to go.  

Oh, and BTW, I'm the Mayor of the Double Yolk on Foursquare! (as of the writing of this review anyway...until someone steals it!)

I hate to give a bad review but I just picked up breakfast from here and It was disgusting to me. It tasted old and the phone operator was friendly but I asked how I could get certain ingredients in my meal and instead of recommending a like ham and cheese omelette and add mushroom onion,she put a ham and added every ingredient separately which cost 3.00 extra when she cpuld of recommened a cheaper way like I asked.this was the first bad experience I had there and customers dont like when you take advantage of them throwing all the extras on the check to make your ticket average higher.I worked in food and people come backore often if you look out for them.so is it worth it to loose a customer,and I asked her what would be the best way to get the ingredients I wanted and then on top of that tasted lile it was old potatoes and biscuits
Great pancakes, great skillets that aren't overloaded with cheese, good coffee and good prices. Like most breakfast places it does get very busy on weekends, but is worth the wait.

I have been here a handful of times since it is so close to us but everything I've tried has been mediocre at best. Scrambled eggs, corned beef, Mexican skillet, Swedish pancakes either to dry or too bland...  I've finally given up and decided to drive a little further for a breakfast I will enjoy.

I'm definitely a "regular" at Double Yolk! I moved in the apartment complex across from Double Yolk about 7 months ago, and this restaurant has become a Saturday morning usual for my fiance and I. 

I can't help but order the same meal every time I dine at Double Yolk for breakfast (the Denver Omelette -- HUGE omelette that is the size of the whole plate!). It is not because they don't have any other good food, it is because this is SO good, that I crave it all the time!

The staff at Double Yolk is extremely accommodating. Roxie is a server whom has become part of our positive experience in dining! I was so excited to bring my family and show off this hidden gem of a breakfast restaurant!!

FYI-- When they say "DOUBLE YOLK", they are NOT kidding! Their omelettes, and even pancakes are HUGE!!!

This is the second time I have dined here and I have been impressed enough to give 4 stars. The service here is some of the kindest in the area and I am very grateful to find this breakfast/lunch place. I never leave here hungry. Not horribly expensive, but not cheap either. I believe it is worth it since you can taste the quality in the food. Fruit is always fresh and perfect and breakfast is definitely the best meal served here. I will be back again for sure.

It is a rare treat for my husband and I to be able to go to lunch together.  So when we do, we try to make it someplace special (Maggiano's, Mexican, etc.).  But this particular day, he was begging me for some breakfast food.

Far be it for me to stand in the way of someone else's craving!  So we drove the five minutes from his work to Double Yolk.  Neither of us had been there before, and it's not likely either of us will return anytime soon.

We were seated right away, and they seemed to have a healthy lunch crowd, which was good for them.  It didn't slow our service down at all.  Our waitress was really nice (remember this for later), but the food was lackluster.

My husband got the french toast, and it came with a side of eggs.  I ordered the veggie omelet with pancakes as my side.

We also got a sweet roll on the side, and that came out first, like an appetizer.  She asked us if we wanted it toasted.  It sounded strange, but it was really delicious.  This actually saved my meal for me because...

...two bites into my omelet, I noticed a long, black, nasty hair in my food.  It was ENTWINED and BAKED into it.  My appetite for anything else was gone at that point.

Our waitress noticed something was wrong and I told her about the hair.  She was really, really apologetic and she felt awful.  She offered to make me a new one, but I was pretty much grossed out at that point and just wanted to leave.  She ended up taking it off the bill, which was really nice of her.

Overall, I am still really disgusted, so I likely won't be back.  There are better (and cleaner) places in the area to try.

Really coming to like this place! My mom and I have been here for lunch a few times and it was okay. We did like the healthier options though. My husband and I went there for breakfast today and I will say that their breakfast is 1000 times better than lunch! I had a skillet and pancakes and it was so hard to stop eating it! It was all delicious! Our server Meagan was very attentive and friendly! I will definitely be returning for breakfast again soon!

I've been here several times now, don't let the strip mall location turn you off, food here (at least that I've had) has been excellent. 3 cheese omelette a couple of times, and eggs Benedict a couple off others. I took one star off because their wait area is a bit small, and the wait today too long, both probably due to their brisk business. My kids love the malted pancakes as well. In short, excellent food but could probably use more space.

I have been here several times and never had a bad experience.  The service is quick and friendly.  The food is excellent quality and quantity for the price.  This is a must go place for anyone looking for a good place for breakfast food, but they also have great non breakfast items as well.  This place does get busy quickly, but it's worth the wait.

When we have the money this is our Sunday breakfast spot. Admittedly if you go at peak times there will probably be a wait but the food and service are worth the wait. My wife likes the skillets while I switch between the short stack and Belgian waffle. I also prefer my bacon crisp so all I have to say to them is "burn it" and they get it perfect.
Love this place! We're regulars and the service and food is always on point! The staff is extremely nice!

I've had nothing but positive experiences at Double Yolk. Sure there's a ten minute wait to be seated for breakfast on the weekend, but find me a breakfast place that has no wait, and I'll show you a horrible place to eat breakfast.

Our waitresses have always been friendly and helpful, and our food has always been hot and scrumptious. I highly recommend the Texas French Toast, and when they ask if you want whipped cream and powdered sugar don't even hesitate to say yes!

Great breakfast atmosphere, and great food. You can't go wrong!

So far, I've visited twice now and I love coming here for breakfast.
Typically, I don't eat breakfast... I drink my white mocha as my breakfast. But this place makes me want to have some decent food in my stomach in the morning.

The southern omelet is delish and so is their swedish pancake with a side of lingenberries.
The servers are always so nice and my coffee cup is always full.

I'm a definite regular as I work close by. It's a clean, friendly environment and I've never once had a bad meal here. My absolute favorite is the chicken avocado melt but have tried dozens of other things that I have enjoyed as well.
I have been here many times and have always had a great breakfast.  Food portions are huge and service is quick.

Fabulous Resturant!!!!! All dishes are amazing for breakfast or lunch! You order one egg and get two. Skillets are great large portions good for splitting. For lunch I suggest the Rueben or clubs. The cooks are great at what they do. You will not be disappointed.

Some of the best pancakes I've ever had. My so raved about the Pumpkin pancakes too. I had the Chorizo skillet which was very good. Lots if crunchy hash towns. Needed a bit more cheese IMHO but otherwise was excellent. Coffee is sort of meh, but I expect that at places like this.

Outstanding restaurant 
Committed to excellence
Creative menu

Let me preface by saying I am a breakfast junkie.  Among my favorite places are Cracker Barrel and Original Pancake House (Walker Bros).  Or I should say, it WAS.   This place rocks.   The pancakes are HUGE plate size and taste great!!  Not too fluffy, nice malted flavor, actual normal maple syrup (not like Cracker Barrel with the natural stuff) and the portions are also MASSIVE.  Yes as the name hints, 1 egg = 2.  Sausages are almost the size of a jumbo hot dog.  Swedish Pancakes are FANTASTIC (they taste like 49ers Flapjacks.... Mmmmmm).

I am not shy in saying this is the best breakfast spot I have ever been to, and I have been everywhere.... I seek out Waffle House whenever possible, and I avoid I HOP and Denny's like the plague, they suck.  Double Yolk, is relatively inexpensive, as I ate fro about $9 with the coffee, served in a big mug good creamer too.

I cannot say enough, AWESOME and NOT CROWDED on a Sunday after church, very clean place, can't beat it!!!!
Delicious breakfast place! My mom is obsessed with their sausage links and I have only had good experiences!

Reggie rocked the linguine and clams!!

Heard the thin pizzas ruled at Armand's so I took the word of others and went for the entrees. 

Julie, at the bar, was sharp, friendly, and attentive. She did what many don't do...silently pays attention to details, I.e. Bread butter water, is order correct. Two stars just for her. 

Caprese salad served with and aged balsamic. Nice flavor generous for two. One more star if the tomatoes had been farm market. 

But the linguine and clams!!! OMG!!!! Delicate clams buried in al dente linguine with a balanced and flavor filled olio sauce. Really fine...mighty fine. 

Thanks Armand!

Such a disappointing experience.  Requested the lasagna in two containers, for the two of us.  Arrived in 1.  Seeing that it appears to be cooked in it, I understand.  No dings for that.  Asked for dried crushed red peppers. There were none.  And of course, only one fork, as the note was obviously not read.  The lasagna serving, while large, wasn't well spiced and was a bit watery.  Below average flavor.

Not off to a good start.  We then tried the thin crust pizza with sausage.  The sausage was quite good.  Nice flavor and texture.  As good as it was, it couldn't overcome the overcooked crust or cheese, or the taste of burned crust.  A surprisingly poor performance, for a Saturday night.  Clearly, the "A" team was on break.  However, at these prices, neither my buddy or I will be risking good money after bad.

When dining in a few months ago I experienced great food and great service. That is why I didn't lower my review below three stars. 
  Tonight I ordered out and was disappointed. The thin crust wast thicker than it was previously. We also ordered the vodka sauce which was ok but very small and dry. The worst however was pasta fagoli soup which was so thick when I turned it up side down it stuck to the container! It tasted burnt. 
   All and all the pizza is still fantastic and I would order it again. However, I won't stray away from pizza when ordering next time. Which is a total bummer.
The Best. First time Here the Aroma of Baked Pizza fills the air. Great Service , Ordered Pizza, the Best thin crust pizza Ever!!

I was excited when I saw Armand's was opening up. I knew there was a location in Elmhurst but I'd never been. 

We got the Elmwood Park Combo - Italian Sausage, Italian Beef and hot giardiniera. Yum. The crust is chewy and the toppings packed with lots of flavor. 

They have tons of beer on tap and if you go on a Thursdays, their beer is half off. Come on! You can't go wrong with that. Pizza and beer!

They have daily specials on food and drinks, I'm not sure what they all are but you should go check it out.
The pizza is pretty good. It's not the best I've had but it is definitely above average.

Excellent lunch over the weekend! I was in the mood for something new so I decided on Armand's Victory Tap. It's located on the edge of the Yorktown Mall in Lombard. 

I walked in with my husband shortly after they opened. There were a few groups that walked in at the same time but we still had great service. Our server (Staci) did a fantastic job!! 

She welcomed us right away and brought us a list of drink and food specials. We were able to take our time before placing our drink and good orders. Armand's is known for their pizza but we both ordered sandwiches--great choice. I ordered the Beef Marc Antony sandwich--filled with a large portion of Italian beef. I could not believe the portion size--great value. The sandwich had a great flavor. My advice would be to make it a fork and knife sandwich! 

Our server boxed up the rest of our meal and promptly cleared our table. I will be back soon to try the pizza or another sandwich...next time I'm saving room for a homemade cannoli!!

Visited the location in the Street's of Lombard. Wasn't overly busy on the Sunday night we visited. The staff was friendly and attentive. We sat at the bar and the bartender and manager on duty were great.

We asked the bartender for assistance since we never been to an Armand's before. Obviously the easy choice would be pizza, so the we asked about other items on the menu. We landed on starter soups (chicken noodle), baked ziti and fresh cavatelli with vodka sauce. All great choices!

Definitely need to go back to try the pizza.

The menu has a nice variety of appetizers, salads, sandwiches, pasta dishes, and pizza. We had wings and pizza. The wings were OK but I prefer them breaded. The pizza was really good and the the 12" thin was plenty for two of us. The service was good. Prices were reasonable. The ambiance was good. It's a casual setting with a dining area on one side and high tops and a bar on the other side. There are a few large flat screens throughout. We will definitely go back again.

What an excellent neighborhood feel pizza joint in a local mall.. The food and atmosphere are wonderful! Started with the delicious house salad and a cup of the hearty tomato basil soup topped with fresh grated Parmesan and ribbons of fresh basil.  On to the pizza, the Elmwood park classic with Italian beef, sausage and giardenara, Wow!  This is an excellent pizza, original and so satisfying.  Thursday's are also half price beer night and they offer a wonderful mix of tap and bottles.  Small intimate dining room but I always eat right at the bar. Wonderful staff and all of the menu offerings are really well made and delicious! Do not miss this place!

Cute place.  I've heard so many good things about their pizza, but my husband and I sat in and decided to try the beef sandwich.  Food portions are huge here, and service was great.  We both thoroughly enjoyed the sandwich.  There was enough to take home for lunch the next day, too.

The only downside was the fact that the place is really small inside.  If it's busy, you may be waiting a long time to get a table.  It might just be better to take the food to-go.

Next time, we will be trying the pizza.
Pizza like I grew up with. Unique wonderful crust,server mike is excellent.Fresh ingredients,  And  old fashioned  frank Sinatra  paying in the background.

Armand's is  by far my favorite thin crust pizza - we've been eating at Armand's since I was a little girl at the Grand Ave. location in Elmwood Park...I'm not even sure if that one is there anymore.  After visiting the Elmhurst location for many years, we recently discovered a new Armand's in Yorktown Center - whooo hooo - what a find!

The place is small but so cute - it looks like a tavern you might see in the 40's-50's with pictures of movie stars on the wall.  The menu has all the signature Armand's specialties...the Stuffed Artichoke being one of our favorites.  I really liked their extensive drink menu and tried the Bourbon Grapefruit and Basil cocktail and really enjoyed it.  

The pizza is delightfully thin and ridiculously crisp, topped with fresh ingredients and the perfect amount of cheese.  You can feel and taste the cornmeal on the bottom of the crust - which is what sets Armand's pizza apart from the others.  This might be the one place where I could eat an entire pizza all by myself!  

Aside from the very sparse outdoor seating area - there is nothing lacking at this newest outlet of a suburban Chicago institution. They should do very well in this location, I know we will be regulars.

Great Lombard location! Food is excellent, service is excellent. Sausage and peppers appetizer keeps bring me back. Pizza is awesome and the location by all the Yorktown restaurant  off of Butterfield Road!

I have been coming to this location for about a year. I am a big fan of their food.  The service is top notch with a special nod to the bartender, Mike. However, lately I am concerned about some changes, especially with the pizza. The crust is now thicker, less cheese, skimpy on the ingredients.  What happened  ? The climate is uncomfortable with little to no AC. I think other customers have noticed also as they are not as busy. SAD. I hope they read this and react.

It's a nice little Italian joint that seems to have lost it's  calling. The pricing seems average for a fairly large sandwich, yet they skimp on the fries. The presentation of the chicken parm sandwich was excellent (the roll was superb) but the chicken itself and the accompanying sauce left a lot to be desired. Staff is friendly; nice beer and wine selection.

I'd never been to the Armand's in Elmhurst, but I was really glad to see a sit-down pizza place open at Yorktown. 

It's outside at the Shops on Butterfield, next to Tom & Eddie's. It's not a big space, neatly divided with about 10 tables on one side and a bar and high tops on the other. Black and white tile, Edison bulbs, pictures of 50s movie stars, a big chalkboard with the specials on it. Looks very nice.

I think they're going for more of a classic Italian restaurant vibe, which I appreciate, but ... here's my first nitpick -- there aren't really appetizers, per se. There are "small plates" and salads. The small plates include clams, bruschetta, a fresh mozzarella plate, calamari, and then things that are basically small entrees -- ribs, sausage, even chicken parmesan.

I mean, I have no problem with this, but I feel like there should be a few more appetizery things, mozzarella sticks, fried zucchini, maybe some toasted ravioli? In any case we started with the ricotta and crostini plate and there goes another nitpick -- it was a generous portion of whipped ricotta with four weenie little toasts.

Now, they did serve us all the complimentary warm bread we wanted, so that filled out the plate, but why would you serve a large portion of spreadable cheese meant to be eaten with bread and then only put four little toasts on the plate? Surely the toast is the inexpensive part? 

But the ricotta was delicious, and the bread was pretty tasty too. So there is that.

We also got a 14" thin crust with pepperoni, and it was delicious. The crust was crunchy-crispy and the cheese was nicely browned in spots, which I dig. All in all a very tasty pizza.

Service was reasonably good. We stuck with water this time but they do have a full bar and decent beer list.

Guys, if you add toasted ravioli or similar starters, or even just put more bread with the ricotta, we're likely to be back. And I'm sure there will be some carryout in our future.

I like this place. The wait staff is nice and attentive. The food is good and old world Italian. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the size of the restaurant is too small. We heard our table neighbors whole conversation which was not rated PG or PG-13. We had our kids with us. They're not little kids, (10-17) but I mean, they got a whole new lesson on the birds and the bees. I totally understand that this was not the restaurants fault other than the size of the place. My sons loved the pizza and I loved the pasta. My husband had the eggplant parm, it reminded us of this old Italian restaurant in Berwyn where a little Italian lady cooked. Armands is the best kept secret out here in Lombard.

Started at the original one 40 years ago and this location was like a flashback from the past missing the old waitress' and music but the food was just like it was over the last 40'years for my family. Best pizza around

What a nice surprise! I wasn't sure what to expect, but I wasn't expecting the food to be as good as it was. First, the margarita pizza is delicious. Thin yummy perfectly crispy crust, olive oil bottom, not greasy, fresh basil, fresh mozzarella, fresh tomato. So easy to keep going until you're about ready to burst. Tried the chicken Parmesan - very good! Couldn't help but notice the tempting looking entrees others ordered. Everything looks very, very tasty. What's nice, is their prices are low for the quality of the menu items. We also had a huge portion of tiramisu that was just delightful! For $30 we had a 10 inch pizza, an order of chicken Parm, iced teas and dessert. Servers are sweet and friendly and very helpful! A great choice if you're in the Lombard/Yorktown area and hungry. The place was packed for an early dinner and the noise level was loud, but not too loud.

Was at the one at Yorktown mall Lombard , Mike bartender was fantastic , had the pizza was great , the atmosphere was extremely inviting , and the food was great , 200% recommend this place , the menu was not over whelming,also most places attached to malls are usually not that good , this was all that plus,  looking forward to next time ,

Visited Armand's for the first time tonight we are hooked! Delicious pizza, and atmosphere. 
We had the ricotta and crispy bread and the portions were very generous. Awesome dish. We can't wait to go back to try the other dishes. Service was excellent  ! 

A Winner! !

My husband introduced me to Armand's. Upon hearing I'd never tried it, his jaw dropped. "You've never had a thin-crust Armands or a stuffed artichoke? We HAVE to go." We came in for lunch a few months ago and I was instantly hooked on the crispy, crunchy thin crust. I ordered the lunch special pizza w/ roasted red peppers and sausage. It also came with a salad. We also ordered the clams and artichokes as an appetizer. Like I said before, their pizza is great. If you enjoy thin crust, then I definitely recommend giving them a try. The lunch special is the way to go as it's a pretty decent sized individual pizza and you also get the salad to go along. I will also make a side note not to come here if you're on any time of time restraints. We'd arrived at 11:15 and didn't make it back to work until almost 12:45. There was a party of 10 that got here well after we did, but their pizzas were all put into the oven before ours. I ended up being late back to work.

We gave them another try this past weekend when the Armand's in Wheaton was closed. (Side note, the one in Lombard *IS* open on Sundays, as opposed to the Wheaton location which stays closed all day.) My husband's family came over so I left the ordering up to him, but we ended up spending $70 for two pizzas and a salad. It turns out that you're charged for each topping an astronomical amount of money. They have "recommended" pizza listings but if you order a 14 inch 1856 pizza, you'll end up spending $8.25 on toppings alone (+$15 for the pizza) and $10 for a 16 inch (+17 for the pizza.) I definitely understand charging a surcharge for toppings as opposed to a cheese pizza ,but I think these prices are way too high. I think it would be nice if they put prices next to the "recommended pizza" to make it more clear. Also, I actually the simple pizzas were better anyway. Try the Uncle Mikes! It's my fave.
