I have to say, my tortas was excellent, just the correct amount of steak, lettuce, tomato. Rice was moist and the beans...the beans just melted when I took a bite.

Taco was double wrapped in soft flour shell. I should have asked if they had corn. Shell was a little too soft but not enough to lower the rating by a star.

Burrito was good sized, hot and stuffed with enough steak to be a very good value.

I didn't order chips and salsa so I can't comment on those.

Worth the visit if you're in the area.

5 star food and service, 4 star decor. Just stop in, seat yourself, the waitress took our order and the food came out, literally, in less than 2 minutes. Scary, but it was delicious. Hubby ordered the combo, 2 chicken tacos & 1 chicken quesadilla. I ordered 1 chicken taco and 1 ceviche de tostada. Great authentic food, good price. Will definitely be back!
This is our favorite local authentic Mexican spot for the best meal and a great price. Service is always friendly and food comes out fast.  The guacamole is outstanding!

Last night was my first trip to Arnadas Tacos. I can't believe I didn't come to this place sooner! A hole in the wall restaurant in a strip mall, I didn't expect much when I walked in. The service was quick, the prices were very reasonable. The restaurant itself was busy, but clean. The chicken is great, and they have a number of food items I haven't had since I lived in Texas. Their salsa is very good, and on the spicier side.

Al pastor. I should stop here. It is done right and delicious. 

I've been coming here for a while. They have the best tacos around. Don't miss the al pastor. They make them on the spit and are incredible. Salsas are fresh and delicious. I'd drive 20 miles out of my way for this place.

I thought the food was pretty good; although, it was a bit too salty.  

I ordered:
-Guacamole, salsa and chips
-Horchata
-Taco (1 tongue/1 steak/1 pastor) combo plate which included rice and beans

The guacamole was $3.50 and such a large serving that we almost couldn't finish it between the four of us.  The salsa was good, not spicy in any way though.  The horchata was like liquid ice cream...good, but sweet.  The tacos were fantastic, well except the pastor which was extremely dry and hard.  I loved the tongue and steak tacos with a good dose of verde sauce and fresh lime juice...oooow wee, yummy!

We went on a Friday night at 6:15 and we had three available tables to choose from (out of about 14 tables).  By the time we were wrapping up around 7:15, there was a line out the door for to-go orders and every table was taken.  

In addition to my order above, my husband got three steak tacos and our bill came to $17 bucks without tip.

Being a resident of Aurora, I have a large selection of Mexican cuisine. Out of all the taco joints in the area, I have to say Aranda's is my favorite. 

What's to say that hasn't been said. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed!
The chicken burrito was amazing. The derive was also really good and the price was decent. I love coming here for lunch with my friends. I definitely recommend this place.
Very disappointed.  The service was very friendly,  but the layout is confusing and food was mediocre if not bad.  Will not return.  Better Mexican elsewhere!
Really good, authentic Mexican food.  Steak tacos & burritos are my favorites.

If you want tasty Mexican food in the Oswego, Montgomery, or Aurora trifecta this is a great place to go.  

The food is fast and seasoned well.  Any given day of the week there will be a line in the waiting area.  I've dined in a few times and the waitress was very nice.  It was only uncomfortable 1 time; when the entire restaurant stared at my family and I as we took a seat.  It was as if we looked out of place to them.  It didn't mess up the taste of my food though, so it's all good. 


They have AWESOME Tongue Tacos!!!

Dinner for 3 including soda and horchata is usually under 20 dollars! Can't beat that.

Amazing tacos in a strip mall! Love this location better than the Jalisco's on Galena. It's in the Jewel center so parking is a breeze. Great variety of Mexican fare. Also a great selection of vegetarian options during the Fridays of Lent.

This is my favorite place to get Mexican food! Their asada tacos are delicious and their beans are so tasty. My food is always ready quickly. The restaurant is clean and the staff is so nice and friendly! The prices are very fair as well. I just ate here twice in the last 4 days!

Was there almost 10 minutes and was acknowledged once and was told she would be back. She proceeded to attend to other tables and was never acknowledged again by any other of the staff. I simply walked out and don't think they even noticed I left.  Perhaps the food is great, but I never got to find out. Was a Sunday afternoon at 12:30.

I love this place!!! They have the BEST horchata, and Guacamole!!! And seriously, it's one place that I haven't had anything that tasted bad!!! Service is great, really friendly, decent prices, and food tastes great!

This place is by far and away the best authentic Mexican place in the far west burbs.  The food is to die for and the staff is always attentive and deliver service with a smile.  I have been approached by the owner on multiple occasions asking how everything was and thanking me for my business.  They are truly appreciative of my business as well as other patrons who frequent Aranda's.  

My personal favorite, the carne asada tacos.  I get to Aranda's at least once a week as the food is addictive and the price is spot on.  My daughter & I ate for $12.50 and left stuffed.  You cannot go wrong with a visit to Aranda's!!

Great tacos and tortas.  I practically lived off of tortas when I studied in Mexico, and these really take me back!  Its affordable, almost always crowded (which is a good sign for these small hole in the wall types of places) and never a let down in the taste department.  Arranda's consistently good food keeps us coming back for more.  Even my three year old loves the food there!

Possibly the best and most authentic taqueria in Chicagoland, and yes that includes the city, and yes I have been to Pilsen, Little Village and everywhere in between.  THIS PLACE IS WORTH THE DRIVE FROM CHICAGO,its just THAT GOOD!!!

Aranda's is one of my favorite place to go to for Mexican food in the suburbs. I love their tacos, tortas, rice, guacamole and chips. I haven't had one bad thing there. 

There is a new taco place is literally in the same parking lot, I've tried them, and they don't come close to Aranda's. So I wish them luck, cause they need it. Aranda's is here to stay!
Fantastic authentic Mexican food.  Affordable, friendly & quick service.  Large selection.
Love this place. Steak tacos with onion and cilantro are my perfect meal here. Ultra cheap good food. Nice people. Small inside, so don't expect to bring a big crowd.

HALLELUJAH AND PRAISE JESUS!! Finally a place where I can spend $8.00 & not feel ripped off. I love this place due to its extensive menu options. Whether I'm in the mood for a Chicago style sub or some southern style fish fry, this place has it all. I don't give too many 5 star reviews but this place earned it. From quantity, quality and value you can't go wrong. Plus their open late (12AM weekdays, 3AM weekends). I only eat halal so this also gives it another star. 

My meal was a feta Philly cheesecake. It came with a hearty portion of fries & dabbs of succulent/savery meat, perfectly wrapped in a  HOT deep fried bread :)

Awesome service, nice manager and great food.  You looking for some prompt friendly service and fresh variety of food... This is the spot. Better then JJs fish off boughten rd if I had to compare..   Nice and clean restaurant.

This location has an extensive menu, but I get the impression that the number one seller by far are the chicken wings. While I was waiting for my food, several people came in and that's all that they ordered.

I've been here many times. Mostly because it's open late, and the only other option is McDonald's. They have a wide variety of stuff like hot dogs, burgers, philly cheesteaks, chicken wings, etc. The hot dogs come with ketchup and lettuce (along with other ingredients). That should tell you something. With the exception of the deep fried philly cheeseteak which is really good, everything else I've had there has been pretty bland.

Gyros sandwich was super dry. Hot dog had ketchup and lettuce. Some of the fried foods are pretty bland. Mozzarella sticks are super bland. BUT if you have had a couple of drinks and you want an extensive menu of just OK food, this is the spot.

Not steak but Philly steak. Not a bad choice but driving by the sign caught my eye and I could taste a skirt steak sandwich, but nooooo. Any I do not like Philly steak because of that crappy cheese wizz stuff but they don't use that. They have a delicious Philly steak sandwich! First one I ever liked. Huge menu of burgers also. Cool lemonade and smoothie selections also. Came back next day cause that's what fat guys do when they find a new place!!!
Awesome. I love the variety of items on the menu. The hours are great. Friendly staff.

They have an EXTENSIVE menu so this review is strictly for only what I have had which is two items


The super fish taco is excellent and a perfect size, I wasn't a fan of the pita bread they use but outside of that - no problem

I had the shrimp basket, overall all not impressed. It was bland and just wasn't what I was expecting at all. 

I plan to go back again - I mean its convenient and has a huge menu, why complain lol

Tip - Make sure you get your sauce/ketchup before you leave because they do not give out condiments for take out, so if you don't have it at home or wherever you decide to eat - don't forget!

I like this location, they do happen to have a very large menu So obviously my experience with the food may differ, but I usually order just a regular burger and chicken wings which always tastes fine to me and I love their lemonade, it is like no other! I usually get the strawberry lemonade, I recommend you come and try for yourself!!
I never heard of this place before and found it on "Around Me".  It was great.  Fresh bread, great tasting food, and the lemonade was awesome.  We found a new spot. Well done Baba's, well done.

There's always a long wait, even with take-out.  I guess it's a good sign that they're busy, but it can be a pain.  They have a sign saying you don't have to wait if you're picking up ordered food, but they only have one guy running the cash register, so you HAVE to wait for him.  So far I've tried their Italian beef, which is ok, Don Walkers is much better for those, as well as the onion rings, which are frozen and prepackaged here, but fresh cut and delicious at Don Walkers.  However, I can say that they make a terrific Philly Steak sandwich!!  Just make sure you take off the limp lettuce first, as it has no business being there in the first place.  Like I said, don't get the onion rings, their crinkle cut fries are really good anyway, and most sandwiches come with them anyway.  Their lemonades are also quite tasty and have myriad exotic flavors to choose from.  

I am also glad to see a new business taking root in Northgate, as that poor decrepit shopping center needs new money, business and is screaming out for a make-over. FIX THE NORTHGATE SIGN ALREADY, AURORA!!!!

Do not go here I placed a order for 2 philly steaks meals I waited 40 minutes and my food was still not prepared requested a refund and left not worth my time or patience never going back! If the app didn't request a star they wouldn't have got anything
This place is awesome for some american halal food. The Philly steak great. Pizza puff a plus.

*NOTE - Review is for Aurora location, which is not listed*
I've been there 3 times total, don't think I'll go again. Food is decent, nothing special. The first time was soon after they opened and the whole experience was decent, but again, nothing special. Second time I placed the order 30 minutes ahead of time and had to wait in a long line (even though there is a sign saying you don't have to wait, but there is only one person on register, how do you not wait?) and when I finally got to the register they hadn't even started my food, so I had to wait. Third time I placed the order ahead of time again, and the place was empty when I got there. As I got up the to the register the cashier got a call on his cell phone and WALKED AWAY to take the call. So I had to wait about 5-6 minutes while the cashier walked around the back, talking in a language I couldn't understand (don't know what the call was about) before they finally came back and took my order, which again, was not done. Both the second and third time, the cashier seemed like they we're annoyed that I was there to make an order, like I was interrupting their day. So average food, on top of horrible service, means this business won't be seeing me again. Hire a nice, friendly cashier and maybe a second register for busy times, and you could get a 3, maybe 4 star review. I was disappointed, Aurora needs some more good, quick, local joints.
Decent food....hot fresh wings even on a busy night....the wings are ALWAYS fresh....stays open past 12 am.....good gyros....
The food really is not that great, last time I went it seemed that the frying oil was old, and my food had zero taste. I would not go back again.
I recommend the strawberry lemonade. Great food, great serving sizes, great lemonade and great customer service.

Really impressed by this place! Came here for a combo BDay for my wife and sister-n-law and left surprised by this unassuming local competitor to Chili's and Applebees.

From a previous review, someone complained by a 'small' beer list. I completely disagree as it was enormous and they had numerous specials as well (specials of the day and specials of the month).

My wife ordered the Fig Pizza and by Chicago standards, it was unique. The crust made the pizza but the toppings complemented a sweet and salty contrast (Fig against cheese).

My buffalo shrimp appetizer with the siracha sauce was done to perfection. Although only five shrimp were served with the dish, they were extremely tasty and satisfyingly large.

Our other companions ordered burgers and sandwiches which equally looked good.

Can't wait to visit again on Tuesday nights when they have whiskey flights!

I would put this place at 3.5 stars but rounding up just because their service is outstanding.  Both times I was there for lunch on a Sunday.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  The place is dead at 11:30 but I was told that there is a park close by and once the kids are done with sports a bit later in the day, it gets crowded.  They have a ton of TVs as well.  The wine list isn't great but they do serve in a chilled wine glass, which I thought was great.  The place is rather large but I do recommend sitting at the bar. There were regulars both times I was there.  

The chicken quesadillas were decent but they are with barbecue, which was sort of a strange flavor in a quesadilla.  The sliders were average to above average.  The pretzels are actually good; many of these frozen pretzel type of things taste like cardboard but these had a good texture and came with three dipping sauces.  My favorite was the beer cheese but there was also a spicy mustard and chipotle butter.  The chicken fingers were above average.  They had good flavor and were super juicy but the breading was a bit too thick and kept coming off.  The fries were nothing special.  Overall, bar food that is elevated and superior service.

Great place with good prices. Service was a little slow for us - we waited for over 15 mins for a beer when it wasn't crowded. However the ambience is great. Hard to find bars these days where music isn't blasting, was nice to be able to have a conversation 
 Good drink prices

Update: 

Came back to see if menu was developed. Many more choices now and menu looks good. I lowered the rating however because although the food wasn't bad and there are more options, Thor liquor selection is poor, their beer selection is poor, and their sizes for beers are very random and almost, weird.

Great service. Tasty food. Nice tap list. What else do you need to know? Try the wings with the sweet IPA siracha sauce. So good. They do fresh cut fries. Alicia the bartender was able to have them make the fries with  Parmesan truffle on top. Great hospitality at the bar by Alicia.

Next Round's food is very good, especially the chicken tinga nachos, fish n chips, cuban sandwich and wings.  Not to be missed!  Nice beer selection.  Friendly staff.  Plenty of TVs.  I haven't experienced any typical "new restaurant" issues.  Check them out!

Went there last night and had the hot wings and Cuban sandwich. Both were good and wings were really big.fries were good and beer was nice and cold..had a pretty big beer list but just had a Stella...nice looking place...

I came here for dinner one night with a friend. It was a new restaurant in the area and we heard they had a good beer list. That was not a lie, they do have a nice craft beer list. They also have good food! I had the pulled pork sandwich and my friend had the mac and cheese. I would probably go back just for the mac and cheese, that was so good! The pulled pork was good too. They have plenty of TV's scattered about if you want to watch a game. The service was overall very good too.

Went there the other day.  Wow, very good food, very good service, great on tap micro brew beer list that had some stouts on it and not all IPA beers. Wife had a margarita and it was made well.  Definitely recommend this place.

I go here all the time. Bartenders there are very attentive and with 32 different beers on tap, how can someone pass this place up. I've only had a few food items from here, but I have been impressed with food thus far. I recommend people come check this place out!

We came for dinner for the first time and were really impressed.  Our waitress, Allie, was extremely wonderful and really made our experience an enjoyable one.  I can't thank her enough for directing me towards the BBQ pork Mac and cheese dinner (which wasn't even on the menu).  As an appetizer we had the pulled chicken quesadillas which were smoky and delicious.  Friendly service and great food.  We will certainly be going back.
Service was great but I don't think I'll come be going back.  Just stepped in for a drink.
They have the best wedge salad anywhere. Gourmet pizza is very good. Good drink specials. Friendly waitstaff.
Peach Beer! Who could ask for more? Had the kale and artichoke dip - it was delicious. Cuban Sandwich is the best since Florida. Everyone should come and check out this great new restaurant!

Much different from Roundheads and Another Round...almost more sophisticated and quieter. I had a great Ruben and my wife had boneless wings and they both were delicious.  A little slow to get served,  but overall,  a good experience.  However,  for those that are familiar with this chain of establishments,  you're either going to like the quiet or be bored with the ambiance.

We have permanently put this place on our rotation list of regular places to go. I love the contemporary decor (that stays true to the Blackhawks color scheme.) They have a fantastic selection of beers/ciders on tap (32 to choose from. Try the Peach) and their wine menu is perfect for picky palettes like mine (try the Smith and Hook Cab.) While we were initially disappointed that Next Round didn't carry their families signature pizza, that disappointment was quickly overcome once we tried some of their hand crafted food. While not your ordinary pizza, the fig and prosciutto is EXCELLENT, as is their black and blue burger. Make sure to save room for the Skillet Cookie as well... it is delicious! It is obvious that a lot of painstaking thought and care was given to this menu. It took a little time but the end result is a well rounded list of fresh new offerings that has "something for everyone." Additionally, the service is great and the bartenders definitely know their stuff. Next Round took a gamble to set this place apart from their other restaurants and we think it will pay off... we really enjoy this place!

Dark, oddly set up bar with fair food & not so good service. I had way higher expectations & seeing I live very close was hoping it could be my go to bar, but no thank you. Redhouse down the street is much nicer if you're looking for a new bar in the area.

I liked this place and will return to try some other items.  Stefanie was our server and delightful!  I had the pesto burger which had goat cheese on it as well.  I believe the patties were pre-formed which is why Next Round doesn't get 5 stars.

Really a great place to go eat.  We have been here a couple times and decided to have a party here based on the food and conversations with manager Carly.  All the food was really good, Carly made the party stress free and Ashley was awesome as our waitress.  Highly recommend!
Delicious kimchi soup.A must try. Thai curries are amazing as well. Good place for vegetarians.

Probably the worst Chinese, Thai we have had in Naperville. Panda Express has better fried rice and ragoons. They gave us curry fried rice instead of Thai we ordered. I told her this and she said no it was right. Told her to take it back. Someone else came out and we told him and he agreed it was wrong and would get us the Thai. Meanwhile daughter tried her salmon and said it "tasted like lake water." I tried it and gagged. Awful! Got our new rice and guess what, it was Chinese style and yet again not Thai. 

We won't be back.

Had Jin 28 for the first time, got it delivered. Not impressed.  

I ordered the seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll, and shrimp tempura. $24.21 including tax, delivery & tip.

Spicy tuna was not very spicy... It was actually pretty boring. Shrimp tempura was ok, better than the spicy tuna, but again nothing exciting.

The sushi rolls were pretty small, which I knew based on the piece count provided on their menu... But there really wasn't much fish in each roll.... And I was not very full after eating them.

Only positive is that their seaweed salad ($5)  is a decent size compared to restaurants in Chicago.

Most likely I will not order again. Not bad but not great.

Well that was a mistake. We should have realized something was wrong when walked in at 7pm on a Saturday night and the place was basically empty. The only thing I can say positive is that the egg rolls were good. 

The crab Rangoon was bland and had no crab flavor at all. They were all cream cheese and onion.

The chicken satay was equally bland. What they called peanut sauce was actually coconut milk with so little peanut sauce as to be only coconut flavored sauce. If you are going to advertise peanut sauce, buy some peanut butter and add it to the coconut milk. Otherwise, just call it coconut sauce.

The Singapore beef was raw when it first came out and overcooked when it came back out.  That is a sure sign of a lazy or incompetent chef. 

I have been to Thailand, Malaysia and Singapore and what I ate here would only be found at the lower quality hawker stands.

There are so many other places in the area that are so much better that I will not waste money at one that is this bad.

Nice and cozy atmosphere. Good service and attentive wait staff. Had a couple of their Chef Special sushi rolls that were smallish in diameter for the price but tasted pretty good. Sushi places for me are all about the creativeness and size  of the rolls, the quality of the fish and the green tea. It was creative, but small. Quality was good. Hot green tea was not. I might try it again

I wish I remembered what I ordered for lunch!  I recall it tasted like the standard restaurant faire from many other Asian restaurants.  Service was good and prompt.  Think I might've ordered a noodle dish of sorts?  I tried going on the website to look at the lunch specials cause that's what I ordered from...I just can't remember.  However, the crunchy roll I ordered was excellent. I do remember that much!  Would come back again as its fairly close to the office and driving through the neighborhood relaxes me to and from.

As another reviewer mentioned, you get what you pay for. While shopping one Saturday afternoon, a friend pointed out this restaurant. She isn't one to make decisions so when she does, I go with it. Menu looked good, and they had a lunch special. Done.

We both ordered the vegetarian lunch special. It supposedly came with soup, salad, and the sushi rolls. We got the salad, no soup. Ok, no big deal. The sushi came and it was dreadful. My friend didn't even finish hers. It was chewy and flavorless, and no amount of wasabi or soy sauce could help it. We just were not fans and left unhappy. I'll be skipping this place in favor of anything else in the area.

Muh. I eat here fairly frequently, but Jin 28 has been somewhat inconsistent lately. Kung Pao beef, panang curry and crazy noodles are usually good, but I went with old fave Thai cashew chicken today...blah. Sauce was weak and the pineapple was mushy and seemed straight-up canned (at least veggies were fresh). Since this place isn't incredibly cheap (app of crab rangoon plus the chicken dish was ~$17), it was pretty disappointing today, and I know they can do this dish better. 

I know I will come here in the future out of convenience, but I hope I can expect the consistency that I always took for granted before.

This place is great, especially the sushi. I get delivery all the time and they are always earlier than what they promise. Some of their food is definitely better than others, but that's to be expected when you have food from different cultures in the same place. Nothing I have tried would be considered "terrible"  but some of it is just meh. Their Panang and Red Curries are good but not the best I've had. Mala Crispy Tofu is soooo good. The Sweet Potato Rolls are heavenly! I dont eat meat so I can't comment on the quality of theirs, but everything else I've tried has kept me coming back!

Stopped in for some takeout, and ordered barbecue pork fried rice and egg rolls.   It was delicious! The atmosphere was really cozy and inviting. I am looking forward to a return visit for dinner soon!

This one time, my mom suggested a lunch spot in Naperville I've never been to.....whaaaaaaaat?! I need to up my game.

Jin 28 is great for a lunch date! They have a different special each day which is awesome. For 12:30 pm on a Thursday in downtown Nape this place was a pleasantly quite and relaxing find. Now mind you, it took forever to find a parking spot but I blame that on the holiday season.

My mom and I each ordered from the lunch menu - 2 sushi rolls which included your choice of miso soup or salad (for only $6.95!). With plans to share the sushi we ordered 4 different kinds: the avocado, salmon, sweet potato and crunch roll.

My favorites were the sweet potato and crunch roll, but all were pretty good! If you've never had a sweet potato sushi roll, definitely give it a try. It's my new favorite anywhere I go. The miso soup was also delish. Sounds like something you can't mess up, but oh you can. I've had some pretty funky miso soup in my day, so I'm happy to say Jin 28 does it just right!

This wasn't the best sushi I've ever had, but I also ordered some pretty simple rolls and for the price it can't be beat. I'll definitely be back to explore the dinner side of the menu and try some specialty rolls. I feel a 5th star coming in the future!

I've been ordering online from them for quite some time. I enjoy their food and the variety of menu items available.

The jalapeno spicy chicken fried rice is incredible! All white meat chicken (you can select different meats), slices of fresh jalapeno, and quality fried rice. 

The pot stickers (6) were just okay.  I'm pretty sure they were frozen and then deep fried. Parts of them were oily from deep frying but the edges were dried out like had been freezer burnt. The sauce that accompanies them is decent. 

On one particular order, I had spent enough to get a free California roll (6 piece), so I gave it a go. I've graduated from the novice sushi rolls so I can't say it was anything exceptional, but it was well made and fresh.

The Chicken Tom Yum Goong Soup was... different. I'd never tried it before, but I figured since I like almost all of the ingredients(chicken, fresh mushrooms [yuck!] in a tart lime broth and lemongrass, hot chili, lemon juice, cilantro and coconut milk) it was worth a shot. Not sure if it was the coconut milk (never had it before)  or the lime broth, but my tastebuds wanted none of it. Sad, because this is a $7 soup as it's meant for two.

The Sweet and Sour chicken is quite delicious; I love how they incorporate pieces of chopped bell pepper in the sauce. It gives the dish a bit more depth than the standard pineapple most places use.

The Orange Chicken wasn't too bad. I found that it had the right amount of heat and sweet, and the breading was crispy enough (it softened a bit due to delivery, but I won't hold that against them)

I'm eager to try their sashimi (I don't know how well it would travel if I order delivery) so perhaps I'll venture out some time to try some, as well as Kamikaze and Crazy Tuna rolls, and many of the Maki.
I love their smoothies!  Also, edamame is really well prepared. Good delivery service as well.

How can every good Asian restaurant in Naper be closed for "remodeling"?? --Something just seems rather suspect about that...According to Grubhub, Jin 28 was my best/closest option for Asian. With a small face and large hazelicious eyes pleading for tempura and miso, I caved. After having eaten here at least 6 times now, I find that each experience causes me to like it less and less, so I will review it now --before another experience whittles it away to a 1-star.

Curry. --a gelatinous abomination.  I'm quite certain it came from a jar. It had a "solid" feel to it and it clung strangely to the chicken and onions. I gag just thinking about it.
 
Mapo Tofu -- Watery. And it claimed to have tofu and ground pork but there was no ground pork to be found. No flavor depth at all. All I could taste was jalapeno. A huge disappointment. My husband's is definitely better and I once begged him to never make me mapo tofu again. --so take from that what you will.

Wonton Soup. --the tiniest wantons I have ever seen. Two in my whole bowl and they were each the size of a grape tomato. Mostly just watery broth full of julienne vegetables. I would never order that again.

Sushi --it was fine. The flavors were fine. But still "meh".

Miso --the dashi was a little weak and the tofu pieces miniscule. 

Tempura was fine. I don't know that you can screw up a fried vegetable. My kids jump on tempura like monkeys on cupcakes and Jin 28's was no different. Everyone snatching the broccoli. We had shrimp in ours as well. Long, limp, skinny "jumbo shrimp". --"limp" anything is just a huge turnoff to me. So... a big no thank you.

It took care of the craving my child with the hazelicious eyes had, but I'm pretty sure my 6th attempt was my last.

We went for sushi at lunchtime. The sashimi was freezing cold, as were the salads. Premade, waiting in the fridge for customers to order it? That seemed the likely explanation.

The fish in the spicy tuna roll wasn't going to make me ill, but the batch was set to be discarded before the next day (I sure hope so, anyhow). There was one piece of sashimi that had started to turn.

I may try the spot again, but definitely not for sushi.
Tons of options and quick service. I definitely stop by here as often as possible!

Let me preface the fact that this was not the original restaurant that we were planning on eating at, but kind of glad that it worked out that we did! 

Reading reviews ... one thing in common, stay away, or even run away from the Pad Thai... GOT IT!  Almost makes you want to order it to see why it's so bad!

The kids meal is nice and inexpensive.  A little on the unhealthy side.  Wish they offered less fried options and like a veggie side of broccoli or beans or something, for 5 dollars, can't really complain too much though.

Hot and Sour Soup - actually pretty decent here.  No complaints and I am a hot and sour soup snob!  

I ordered the chicken and lobster sauce.  When I read that I could have chicken instead of shrimp in the traditional shrimp and lobster sauce dish, I was ecstatic.  Sometimes I just don't feel the shrimp, but want the yummy sauce.  This was pretty yummy as well. It was missing something in terms of flavor, but it was okay.

My husband got the Lard Na.  Huge plate, looked good, he didn't complain, and ate his leftovers for lunch.  He said it too was just missing something in the flavor, maybe a little more salt.

Either downtown Naperville is getting crazier in terms of how packed it is, or I am just getting older ... hope it's the not the latter, but there was no wait, food was decent, service was good, so if everyone else is booked, give this place a try.  I can't vouch for "bad" pad thai though ... still makes me curious!!  HA

I love this place. Our usual Chinese place is going down hill so we've been trying different places wi5h little success. The shrimp dumplings are really good, the fried rice is really good, and the pad see ew is amazing, perfect tofu, perfect sauce. New usual delivery place.

Grub Hub's pickins for my area are SLIM yall, but tonight I really really really REALLY needed Chinese food so I decided to chance it and order from Jin 28. Great success!

I was a little worried because the menu is extraordinarily varied and MASSIVE, and I always feel like ya can't be good at everything, ya know? Like why does this restaurant do Thai, Chinese, sushi...? But I didn't panic and pressed on - I ordered potstickers, orange chicken, the BBQ pork lo mein, and a philly roll for my husband and I to share. GrubHub estimated our wait to be 50 mins and I patiently (crabbily... I was hangry) waited for the food to arrive. 

75 mins later, I was like turbo mega ultra starving and getting angry when our door finally buzzed. My husband went to answer the door to find a small Asian man running toward him shouting "SO SORRY SO SLOW TONIIIIIIGHT!!!" He thrust the food at him and off he went. Well, points for presentation, I guess.

The food was all packed neatly and smelled delicious. The potstickers had a weird texture (I'm used to steamed or pan fried, these were like straight up deep fried), but the sauce that accompanied them was delightful. The orange chicken was good, but nothing special. The bbq pork lo mein was DELICIOUS. Thick, well-cooked noodles in a delightful brown sauce with assorted veggies and a generous portion of thinly sliced, well-flavored BBQ pork pieces. I could have eaten just this as my whole entree, but we were sharing, dammit. The philly roll was shockingly good for delivery, and I would totally venture into more exotic sushi selections for our next order. 

The food here isn't cutting edge or trendy or memorable, but it's well priced, well portioned, fresh, and they deliver. On some nights, that's all I need to be happy. I'll definitely add Jin 28 to the rotation.

I used to love jin, but as of late, I am totally over them & have been boycotting their bitch asses! Seriously. I ordered my food and when I got there 12 mins later/paid, that's when they decided that it was a good time to get started on making my food. Ummmmm. F- and eff you.

All the employees were standing around socializing and guess what?! ZEROOOO other customers!!!!!! During lunch time! On a Saturday. In summer. In downtown Naperville. Tells you something ain't right.

Hey manager, make my day and turn my negative experiences into positive ones. BAHAHAHA that'll be the day! No Jin employee gives a daayyyuuummmm

---------RIP Jin28--------

Terrible! I'll never eat here again!

I ordered the chicken pad thai, mild, and with no bean sprouts. I didn't realize "mild" meant "totally flavorless" and that they don't put any vegetables at all in their pad thai.

The chicken is very bland, as well, and oddly hard to chew... not just dry, it almost tastes like it's some sort of super-tough chicken breast substitute? It even looks rubbery. 

The noodles are awful - they're all like 1-2 inches long and totally stuck together. I ate a few clumps and gave up. It's just gross; neither the lime wedge nor tablespoon of dry, clumpy peanut bits helped at all. The portion size is great, which is a huge shame because it means I'm just wasting a ton of food now.  

The egg drop soup is thin and I think I'm tasting sesame oil in there. It's not terrible, but I don't want to finish it. 

The crab rangoon is flat, squishy and tepid. Very oniony, but not awful. I'll probably finish these since they're tolerable. 

One of my friend's rolls had a hair on it! Ew!

Huge waste of my money, and I was hoping to treat myself today :(

This is my favorite sushi place in the entire world (okay, I haven't been all over the world, but, you know). It'll always be in my heart.

You seriously can't beat a sushi place that offers options for $10 Mixed Vegetable Maki that ALSO includes miso soup and that salad with amazing dressing. AND if you go at the right time, they have happy hour as well, where everything is 40% off. That's crazy amazing. And their food never, never disappoints. When I lived in Naperville, any time anyone wanted to get sushi, this was my first suggestion. 

Even better, they deliver, and the delivery charge isn't very high, so there's no excuse not to tip this angelic company very well. This place is the absolute best and I'm currently dreaming of it right now.

Really like this place. They have all kinds of Asian, so if you like sushi, someone else likes Chinese, someone else again likes Thai, etc., this is the place to go. I've never had a bad meal here, the service is excellent and the prices are very, very reasonable! Plus I've never had to wait for a table- a scary thing in some folks' estimation, a good thing in mine. I HATE waiting.
Sometimes really good and sometimes really bad. It's unfortunate.  Good atmosphere in the restaurant.

This place is basically a typical Chinese restaurant trying to boost the income by offering variety of different Asian foods where they aren't, at all, good at. I can guarantee you that eating sushi in this place is a totally rip off. 

Sushi is ridiculously small. All the ingredients are extremely small that you can't even find them. It says white tuna, but where are they? it is not as big as pictures. It is so small. I'm sure they have a decent Chinese food. My rating is solely toward the sushi and the restaurant's business strategy. 

Hope that helps!

First experience here was a takeout.  Mongolian beef was so salty it couldn't be enjoyed.  I add salt to everything but this was ridiculous that it was ever served to a customer.  $28 for two entres was no bargain either.  We would have had a better tasting meal from the Aldi frozen food section and a microwave.

I really enjoyed my order from Jin 28. I ordered egg roll-rangoon combo (what a great idea) and Mala Crispy tofu (add broccoli) with brown rice. It was delivered very fast, food was still hot. The tofu was so very tasty and spiced to "medium" just right. Large portion, good value too.

This is my first time ordering take out from Jin 28.   I had ordered mini crispy shrimp rolls and the jalapeo spicy fried rice, added chicken to the dish. 



I usually eat at phat noodles (shout out) for spicy fried rice, all the time. However, I decided to try this place upon someone's request. 

First of, the spicy fried rice are far different from the traditional fried rice that I have had with carrots, peas and other veggies.  At Jin 28, their fried rice had big round jalapeo,  green and red  colored green peppers,  white onion, and basil. The other ingredients that were included were fried egg and crushed pepper and of course white meat boneless chunks of chicken. The chicken was well cooked. I was impressed actually because the basil made it seemed really good with the flavors and for me personally it was not too spicy but still good to eat again.  The rice were good quality not to tiny as in other places. 

The second thing was mini crunchy shrimp rolls. These were eight pieces and the we're just shrimp inside mini spring roll sheets and nope there were no veggies inside. The shrimps were cooked and lightly flavored, which made them yummy.  If you eat when  they are cold then the shrimp rolls are not too crispy so eat while they are hot.


Lastly, I was served with many sweet and sour sauce and soy sauce plus a fortune cookie.

Orginally, I had planned to order just spicy fried rice but ended up having to order extra because the Jin 28  has a minimum order of takeout of $10.00. However,  there is no regret of ordering the mini shrimp rolls.

So far the first impression of this place for food was good.

I had heard raving reviews of this place and being an endless lover of thai food dives, I hurried in.
The atmosphere was just how I prefer my thai venues, like an oddly decorated, southeast Asian cafeteria. My waiter was prompt and perfectly attentive! They had a massive menu with tons of options (even for my picky diet ). I ordered my all time thai guilty pleasure, Pad Thai, no eggs with tofu! I was mildly disappointed when I receive my dish. The noodles were undersauced and underwhelming. The tofu was ill prepared. It was good enough, but who wants a meal deemed sufficient? 
Perhaps their other items would be better. If I was in town longer I would give it another try!
Like sushi??? Ok, don't come here then. Smashed up tuna??? Then I asked about it and they said that's how tuna comes? Hmm...

We ordered small Pad Thai,large Kung pao, miso and wonton soup, some sashimi and 2 rolls (crazy and crunch rolls). The pad thai tasted like it was made with tomato sauce not tamarind, kung pao had exactly 10 small pieces of beef, soups were ok, sashimi was not fresh, the squid was rubbery, and the rolls nothing to write home about. The Crazy roll was too loose and it fell apart. The soy sauce was extremely salted and the egg rolls that we got free with the coupon were dry and soft, like they were microwaved...
We won't be ordering here again and my search for a good pad thai continues...

This place isn't for your college roommate who studied abroad for a year in Beijing,  and now mocks your pedestrian affection for sweet and sour chicken.  Your aunt who lived in San Francisco for ten years before her divorce and now claims to be an expert in wasabi won't be impressed either.  But Jin 28 does provide conventional Chinese food options that will quench your hunger,  as well as better than average sushi,  including my favorite,  the Kamikaze Roll.  The service can be spotty at times.  Conveniently located next to Hagan Dasz.

Mediocre food, bad service. We had out of town friends with a 17 months old daughter. When asked for plain noodles with butter for her, the server said they could not do it and we had to order a soup with noodles instead. The Green Curry and the Panang curry were pretty much the same.

Food was fantastic, Seating was quick. The only thing was our server seemed to forget about us and never checked in on us or filled our drinks or anything. But the food was phenomenal! 5 Star for Food, 4 Stars for Service.

I'm in the area for work and they deliver to my hotel, which is super convenient.  Because of this I have ordered from them several times (long trip), and it has always been good.  The sushi rolls were solid, and the nigiri was a show stopper.  I especially enjoyed the scallop nigiri.

I have since moved onto the Thai side of the menu with similar results.  The pad Thai had a really nice and bright tamarind sauce, but it totally lacked heat.  They may have missed that I requested spicy, which isn't too big of a deal.  The Tom Yum Goong soup is amazing, however.  I really can't get enough of this.  It, too, could be spicier, but the flavors in that soup are incredible.  

This place gets a strong 4 stars, and is highly recommended.
Everytime I go I get the dragon sushi platter and every time I'm impressed.
Sushi was mediocre. The seaweed paper was chewy. Honestly I've had better sushi in Iowa. No I would not recommend this place plus it was pricy. So not worth the money.

My review is based off of eating sushi and salad here, 4 times within the past month.

I can't say enough good things!  Their lunch special (two sushi rolls of the lunch menu and a soup or salad) is perfect for a quick lunch!  Their ginger dressing for their salad happens to be the kind I LOVE (sweet, salty, creamy and gingery) and although they make their Philly rolls a little different than I'm accustomed to (they use lettuce and no avocado), I really enjoy them!

Try this place!  You don't have anything to lose!  :)

They brought the wrong dish for me, and for a table of four, each dish was brought out late. Overall mediocre food, not worth the Naperville prices. They should stick to one cuisine not so many that they clearly don't know.

First time lunch diners today.  I got a noodle dish and hubby got sushi rolls.  We both commented we really liked what we ordered.  Mine had lots of flavor and portion was generous.  Mine came with soup which was tasty.  Hubby had soup too, I tried his and would have enjoyed either.  Lunch specials are reasonable.  We will be back and invite our friends.

Came here for lunch while in the downtown area and was unimpressed. The restaurant was only half full but only 1 waitress and we waited 10-15min to order. When the food came, my friend's came first and I sat there for another 5 min before mine came. He had the Chicken Pad Thai and the chicken was still cold from the freezer, the sauce on the noodles were way over the top and too saturated. I had the Vegetable Pad Siew and the noodles were burnt and had way too much salt. I was chugging the water just to finish the dish. The food was cheap, our check for 2 was $13 but I wouldn't come back unless there were no other options. For the same price, I'd walk a few blocks down to Kuma's for much better food.
This rating is wrt taste, food quality, serving.

Bangkok thai was closed to decided to try jin 28...... Very sad to give a bad review....

Ordered delivery one night- which I must say was an easy process done online and everything was delivered nicely. Unfortunately- the food kinda sucked. Quite possibly the worst pad Thai I have ever had, even worse than the time I attempted to make my own pad Thai when I first started cooking many years ago. We did not eat those leftovers, as we did not eat these leftovers.... The basil beef we ordered had one small piece of basil in it and was smothered with bell peppers. I thought for a second I ordered steak and peppers? I was so confused. Was nothing like the Thai dish that I expected and have had at other places, including freakin Thailand.  Thai red curry was okay, but again, way too many bell peppers in it what in the world?!  The only thing that was pretty good was the sushi we ordered. 

All I wanted that night was good pad Thai and good Thai curry. Very very disappointed. Oh and quite overpriced for the quality!!

Quantity over quality would accurately describe this place. I mean wow, they have Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese...the list goes on, I'm pretty sure there is more than that. Curries, noodles, rices, fried rices, sushi, pho, bento boxes...etc. It's a lot of stuff. It's all good, not fantastic but good. I feel like they stretch themselves a bit thin.

I had beef pho, which was pretty decent. The beef was kind of blah. But the presentation was nice, lots of veggies to go into it and the broth had a great flavor.

If you are with a group of people and everyone wants Asian food but no one can decide on which kind of Asian food, this is your place.

I'm not sure what happened with this place and GrubHub, but a month into ordering there the restaurant stopped accepting delivery orders. What sucks about it is I really enjoyed their avocado maki rolls. The tofu miso soup wasn't tasty at all though. The vegetable leaves were too big, and the broth was bland. But the maki rolls were the best. The only thing I didn't like about this location was the delivery guy never waited on the person to pick up the order. He'd drive up, give the order to the receptionist and before someone could come out to get the food all you'd see was this guy's taillights. He did that at least five times. I guess he felt like he got his tip so why bother hanging around. I never went to the actual restaurant. I did call one time to find out what the ingredients were in some item (can't remember why) and the cashier started screaming about he didn't know and hung up the phone. 

Customer service is clearly not this place's strong point. But because I loved the food I kept ordering there for awhile longer. Now that it's not on GrubHub, I have no use for it.

This is a nice little place in downtown Naperville. Chinese, Thai, and sushi. We had an excellent lunch here of All 3. First, the egg drop soup was superbly done. Had a touch of sesame oil which made it super tasty. Then, crab rangoons that were just about perfect. Thai fried rice was good, next time i will ask for spicy which i forgot to do. Crunch rolls of crab, very good, and also Gen, Tsao chicken with regular fried rice. All very good. The place was kind of empty, I don't get it. The prices are not bad for Naperville. Service was good, although it can be hard to understand your waitress. They have liquor.

I was surprised to see so many bad reviews.  I have been to Jin 28 many times and I have never had a bad experience.  They have great lunch specials and they deliver. Servers are always polite and accommodating. Any of their sushi rolls are good. Love  the tempura. The only "complaint" I have is that I always have to ask for my food to be made "extra spicy" but that's just me.  We've tried their egg rolls, crab rangoon, Mongolian & Szechwan beef, General Tso's chicken, Chop Suey, many of their rolls, Miso soup, watermelon & cantaloupe smoothies, and of course their rice/noodles.  Anyways, we've never had a bad experience with any of those dishes.  

We like the atmosphere and it's located in downtown Naperville so it's a nice place to take your family after shopping and walking the river walk.

Overall they are pretty good. Me and my friend ordered sushi ( sweet potato roll and crazy potato roll) and two main dishes ( Beef pad see ew and chicken Panaag curry ). They have a very extensive menu. And they do most stuff "OK". It's good, but not amazing. I have been there 3 times so far and would say it's a pretty good place to go to if you're craving Asian food while in downtown Naperville.

Wow. Just wow. 

This has to be my favorite sushi place in Naperville. The servers are incredibly attentive. The interior is clean and beautiful. The menu is straightforward. Most importantly, everything was fresh and beautifully crafted. I begun with a seaweed salad, followed by a cucumber roll and sashimi. Unagi (eel), Tako (octipus), and Ika (squid). 

Please, do yourself a favor and give this place a try. Also ask questions, as the servers are more than happy to help you out.

I've ordered from here a few times. Their Thai curry dishes and noodles had good taste and portions. I liked being able to have choices such as Tofu or Veggie chicken to put in them. The lemongrass soup also had a nice flavor to it. Their delivery fee is a bit high compared to other places.

ate here on a whim with my uncle. i tried their pad thai, my uncle says is okay but i didnt like it so much. I think im just spoiled by gumrai thai and their pad thai.
My uncle got a combo maki sushi, he said it was okay but he's had better.
i also got a mango strawberry tapioca smoothie and it wasnt that good. i dont think its made with fresh fruit.

One question: Why is the pad thai pink?  My theory: They use sweet and sour sauce perhaps? Or they don't know what pad thai is?  Either way, for Asian food to be this restaurant's "thing," they are a far cry from that.  

I am not Asian nor a culinary expert, but I can safely say I'd prefer my home cooked Asian food than here.  In fact, I'd rather have a pad thai TV dinner than theirs.   To top it off, their sushi is cheap, which speaks for itself.  You get what you pay for.  

I gave this place a few chances and it was never consistent.  Bad sushi, terrible pad thai, and inconsistent when I ordered their orange chicken (part of it was hot, the center of it was cold).  I tried all three of their cuisine types: Japanese, Thai, and Chinese and all were bad.  

I gave Jin 28 more chances than it deserved.  I will not be returning.  There are other sushi restaurants in the area with far better quality and care.

Worst customer service ever. It wasn't at all busy and we were 1 out of 3 tables.  They got our order wrong especially when my friend gave very specific instructions on what she didn't want.  The items came out staggered even though ordered on time.  Best part is there was a hair in the food.  We tell them and they take it back and then come back with the hair strand arguing it was none of theirs.  We all had dark brown hair and it was a blond strand.  Instead of apologizing then we had to hear these lame excuses.  They do not understand customer service at all.

I've dined in and ordered delivery here several times. In nearly all instances the food took exceptionally long to be delivered or even brought to our table. While the menu is extensive, the quality is sporadic. I've gotten cold entrees (gasp), and I've had delicious beef with broccoli. Sadly the negative customer service and subpar quality out weigh the few positives this place had. I would not recommend this to other people. Go elsewhere. (Oh, as I write this I've been waiting over an hour and a half for a simple delivery order.... I called several times just to be rebuffed by the gal answering the phone). As I write the number of stars keeps declining. Epic fail Jin.

I contemplated not posting this review, but I'm still in disgust. I ordered 2 maki rolls, and so did my mate. They were good, no complaints there. As, we were waiting for our bill, my fiance quietly said, oh sh*t, and told me to move. As I, looked over my shoulder, I saw the largest cockroach EVER! Like, the hissing ones that you've seen on TV. We didn't cause a commotion, no one else in the restaurant knew what was going on, but we called the first worker that we saw. He grabbed a napkin and squished it, so GROSS, it was! Where he killed it, he never came back to clean up the remaining residue. It totally ruined my lunch, and as I type, I want to vomit in my mouth. They quickly brought us our bill, and made their disclaimer, that their restaurant was clean, and that they sprayed every morning. I'm not convinced! That cockroach was not afraid of us, which further let's me feel, that it was "a regular". I'm just thankful, that we didn't order anything from the kitchen, although with bugs, it probably doesn't matter. Not, that we were looking for a discount, but no one even offered. Just Beware!!

One word. TERRIBLE!

My husband and I went in on a Saturday night for a date night, and only 1 of us got to eat dinner.

He had sushi rolls, and I ordered Orange Chicken. Unfortunately, that's as far as I got.  My chicken came out, and was lukewarm at best. My husband tried a bite, and his piece was actually COLD! 

I complained to our waitress, who seemed completely clueless and was unsure what to do. I told her I wanted a new order. My husband completed his meal, and I just wanted to get out of there.

I flag down the waitress again to cancel the order, and she said the meal was done, and said she'd bring it out to me. When asked if I was still expected to pay for it, she said YES! 

I had it removed from our bill and left, hungry.

I really liked this place and am quite surprised at the reviews here. They do not mimic our experience at all! The FIL made reservations here for dinner and while I love all Asian food, normally a place that promotes sushi, Thai and Chinese in one spot usually means a jack of all trades and master of none... but not the case!
We were waiting on someone that was running way late, so we went ahead and ordered apps and drinks. The eggrolls were decent, but the Shu Mai were incredible. I contemplated ordering them as part of my meal as well!
For our meals we ordered a hodge podge of sushi and dishes.
The stand out item was definitely the green curry. It was not spicy and very very flavorful and good. Would order this again without question. 
The rolls I picked were the Triple Tuna and the Cherry Blossom. Tuna is my hands down favorite and so I really liked the Triple Tuna, but the Cherry Blossom was nothing remarkable to me. The Mexican roll was good as well with lots of cilantro on top. However, all of the sushi was fresh and delicious, there was nothing that I wouldn't eat again. I was also very impressed with the unique rolls. Lots of combinations that I have not seen elsewhere, which is what I always look for in a go-to sushi place. Creativity is key to a good sushi chef. Of course, all the standard fare was available as well though. 
Overall, I was very impressed with the place. The service was good and upon hearing that I was getting married in 2 days, they gave me a cute little purse hook that was wrapped with ribbon. A very unexpected, but appreciative gesture. I would definitely return here next time we are in town.

Such good food and great service. I loved the kids option. It was a big portion good for two kids. The sushi was delicious. I've dined with them before and tried their lunch special which is a really good deal. I'll definitely be back.

Jin 28 was okay. We stopped for lunch after a book signing at Anderson's Bookshop down the street. It looked like an independent business in chain restaurant land.

Service was attentive and not overbearing. Spider roll was fine. Not great, not bad. 

Curry entrees were large. Lots of chicken, lots of vegetables. 

Prices reasonable.  

Nice, clean modern decor. 

Street parking or one of the public lots.

I order Sushi on a Sunday a threw 90% out, It smelled. I order Gyoza and it was dry and inedible. The egg rolls where dry/tough and you could tell they where frozen out of a box. Honestly, I spent $47.00 and $15.00 was eaten. I will never go back ewwwww!

pad thai-eh it was red/pink in color...i've never had that kind of pad thai before but no i wouldn't get it again

orange chicken-perfect outter crisp to it, i would def get that dish again

This has become one of my favourite places in all of Naperville and I can already tell it is going to be the kind of place where I bring everyone I know. I have already brought a few friends in here and they are always happy to see us.

They have lunch specials here that you cannot beat and the food is delicious. Not to mention, you get more than a decent amount of food. The staff is super friendly and attentive. The service is fast and I love that I'm typically in here for less than an hour from the hours 12-3 on a week day. Last week, I went there THREE TIMES. I just crave it all the time and since it is so cheap and fulfiling, you almost cannot resist!

One of the coolest things was that when I went there with a friend for lunch on Valentine's Day and they gave us these really rad purse clips. I love having these things on me and it was such a thoughtful little gift! Check it out!
Order online often, delivery guy is always friendly! Great food! One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in Naperville!

Went here last night. Amongst our group, we had panang curry, basil fried rice, vegetable egg rolls and 3 different sushi rolls. 

The best sushi was the yellow river. The crunchy roll wasn't that of a typical "crunchy roll", meaning it didn't so much have the crunch as it had toasted panko sprinkled on top...just so so. The Godzilla roll was good although it had pretty much the same flavors as the crunchy so a bit un-memorable. 

The overall experience was good as the food for the price met our expectations, however, there were some glitches... First, I ordered vegetable egg rolls and on the menu it states that it comes with peanut sauce. Okay...peanut sauce is a staple in Thai foods so that combined with the fact that it's on the menu, you'd think it would come! When it didn't and I asked our server for some and she said "they don't have that but that she can bring curry peanut sauce." Bless her for trying, but I couldn't help but think what the??? Referring to this same waitress, I really do feel bad because I think the whole strange experience with her was due to a language barrier. My aunt ordered basil fried rice with tofu and vegetables. The waitress didn't get the vegetables part, but she later took the plate back and said she would quickly cook up and add in vegetables and apologized. My uncle had the panang curry with brown rice. It looked delicious and he said it was so since I didn't try it let's assume it was good. 

I liked this place-will come back. Unlike so many Naperville places, this is a small and intimate setting which can be so hard to find. Wish there was outdoor seating but oh well. I think one thing they have going for them no doubt, is the fact that they deliver. Can't wait for those chilly winter nights when I don't have to leave the house for sushi!

Another just average Asian restaurant in downtown Naperville. I split a roll with one other person, and it was pretty good - a tempura shrimp roll topped with white tuna and spicy mayonnaise. Mild tasting, but pretty good. My entree was Szechuan beef...and this was really missing something. I like the veggie mix - baby corn, bell pepper, and bamboo shoots - and the meat was tender, but it didn't have something. I don't know if it needed more...salt? More MSG? Something like that? I dunno. It just wasn't all that good. 

I would say a 3 or 3.5 for the sushi, and a 2 or 2.5 for the beef - I'll be generous and say 3 stars overall. I might go back...but I'm still on a half-hearted search for reliably tasty Chinese in the suburbs, so I'd try elsewhere before returning. I honestly think Joy Yee is my favorite, although I haven't been in ages.

We order their delivery once every two weeks and we absolutely love it. Their sushi is really great, it's hard to believe you can get quality sushi delivered! Our typical order includes crab Rangoon, California Roll, Mexican Roll, Orange Shrimp, Mongolian Shrimp, seaweed salad.... Always very satisfied with the food.

I had the sashimi and a Mexican roll- both we're excellent! My wife had the Thai Chicken and she wasn't as impressed but she's not writing the review! :) 
I would definitely come back for more. 
The tapioca smoothie was good too.

I've come here with friends before with friends. I enjoyed my meals well enough. During the summer, I came down to visit and was starving. I came to Jim 28 to eat and wait but instead of seating me as asked she led me to the back to order. I thought little of it until after I received my food in a to go container. I explained that I'd intended to eat inside the restaurant but she refused me. There was a couple there and a family seated as I left. Besides myself and the the groups the place was completely empty with a lot of available seating. I wasn't inappropriate, rude, or poorly dressed for the atmosphere. I was not welcome either.

Food is good but I guess make sure you come with a group.

We've eaten at Jin 28 several times.  It's a small place that is centrally located in downtown Naperville, but it's never very busy.  That may be because the service is a bit uneven.  The staff obviously care a great deal but seem to be untrained.  We were seated before a table was cleared and it took quite awhile before dirty plates & silverware were removed.

The sweet & tangy pickled vegies brought before the meal are delicious.  We also liked the sushi special we ordered.  The menu has a wide variety of Asian dishes including typical Chinese as well as curries.  It's a good choice for a small group of people who have different tastes when it comes to Asian cuisine.

2.5 stars. Decent food; some dishes seemed overpriced considering the portions.

I feel like Jin 28 would do better if it was more of an Asian fusion restaurant with strikingly beautiful, creative, unusual dishes. Instead it feels like they just happen to serve standard Chinese, sushi, and Thai dishes all on the same menu.

When our order of the Old Country Tofu came out, we found that the tofu had gone bad. Thankfully they were quick to replace it with a new one. Flavor was just okay.

At the end of our meal, someone different from our waitstaff thanked us for coming and gave us a $10 gift certificate. He wasn't very clear about what it was for but we're assuming it was an apology for the tofu. I appreciated the gesture and it'll probably cause us to return and give them another chance.

I was impressed that they had a vegetarian dragon roll available, but I found its flavor to be lacking. The maraschino cherries on the top were interesting but I didn't like the overall taste. (Could be that I'm spoiled from a mind-blowing equivalent I had in Seattle which was also $10.)

I came in here for a quick snack with Jeff and was actually pretty impressed with the vegan options on the menu... any place with veggie chicken (however much like tofu it tastes) is good in my book! I had the spicy jalapeno fried rice (minus the egg) and some avocado roll, and it was very tasty. It's good to know there's a good place downtown that's got me covered.

We love this place and drive into Naperville at least once a month to eat here. We typically order the house salads, Pad Si Ew, Sushi and Shumai....all delicious. The service is great and the pace just perfect. I saw some negative reviews here and in three years, have never had a bad experience, always wonderful. Great spot for lunch or dinner....have never had to wait.

I am sorry but this was just awful, my pad Thai was this pink color and they uses firm tofu.  The crab Rangoon was soggy and it just tasted all together old, that is the only way I can describe it.  Just an all together bad experience.

I ordered from here today through the order online option, GREAT FAST SERVICE! I recommend this option, as it went VERY well. As far as the food, AWESOME. Great taste, plenty of food, fast, hot. JIN 28 WAY TO GO

Came here with the significant-other unit and our niece. We were seated a short while after arriving, so the wait wasn't bad. We ordered some sushi and some fried rice to share among ourselves, with some green tea and a sapporo.

Service could improve, but it was a busy Saturday night.

It's well appointed, good representative menu, sushi was fresh tasting (no fishy smelling/tasting rice).

I would come back again.

We showed up with 4 kids in tow. They were very nice about it.

I had panang thai meal and it was great....just great.

 they let me to the extra hot pepper seeds home.

Great online ordering system, it doesn't look very pretty but it works and they have always gotten my notes through the system on any specific ways I want my food prepared. 

Sushi is decent quality, and their panang curry is delicious!

They have a good selection of smoothies, nothing special, but its not always very easy to find a place that has tapioca available for the drink.

Great atmosphere and the service is attentive and professional.

Have been here twice for lunch.  I am at a loss as to why this place isn't busy.  The food is delicious and the service is attentive. The crunch roll and egg drop soup are two of my favorites.  The lunch specials are value priced and generously portioned. My husband and I both brought food home.  We will be back!
Best Pad Thai in town! Just a cool gem tucked away. Great ambience and even better food!

So my review of Jin28 is a dual review.  The only reason I found this place was because I downloaded an app called grubhub on my iphone.  It finds all of the local food places around you that deliver.  You look at the menu, order, and pay through the app. 

 So what does Jin28 look like?  I have no idea.  Are they nice on the phone?  Who the hell knows.  What I do know is they have a bomb ass menu and they deliver.  The food was good.  I eat pretty clean and I splurged for an old school favorite General tso's chicken and a spicy tuna roll.  The chicken was all white meat...no fatty gross grisle chunks.  The sushi was great.  Best of all, my lazy azz just pulled my phone out, blipped a few key strokes and the magic sushi man was at my door in 45 minutes.

If I could find a little bridge that I could live under with a power outlet, I would order all my food delivered there and make the driver's solve three riddles for ever increasing tip amounts.

btw their prices are very reasonable.  The end

Jin 28 has fantastic food that is fresh and well made! I had the crab rangoon and various sushi and every bite was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!!!!! The people are so delightful over the phone and the food is made with love, style and flare! 
You have to add Jin to your week! 
..............................And I can say that it's just sinful that they offer delivery!

Pretty ticked off. I ordered lunch through grubhub. We just moved out to this area and i was excited to find a new sushi place. I spent $31 on lunch to be delivered, I called and requested a side of spicy mayo. When they got to my house they told me I had to pay a dollar for the spicy mayo. Really?! I've never had a sushi restaurant charge me for a quarter sized cup of spicy mayo. Not to mention I didn't have cash on me which is why i paid with a debit card, so I had to go to my car and search for a dollar in coins... That's bad customer service. I work in the restaurant industry, that spicy mayo probably cost them 10 cents, if that!

Devoured my Jin 28 grubhub delivery order and I needed to write how amazing the food was. I got the Shrimp Tom Yum Goong Soup & classic Eel Cucumber Roll. Must haves. Thank you Jin 28 for a delicious lunch!

An Asian restaurant with an enormous menu (a little too big I think). I ended up ordering the pad thai and a bubble tea when I first came here. The pad thai looked discolored and tasted nothing like pad thai. It was very bland and unseasoned. The bubble tea was excellent but honestly, what restaurant could manage to mess up something so naturally delicious?

I have been here two times now and both times the food and service was excellent. Last night we had our company holiday party here and they were very accommodating to our large group. Everyone seemed to liked the dishes they order and from what i saw it looked delicious. I ordered the pad see ew and it was superb.  Will definitely be coming back again.
This is one of the best Thai places I have tried, and I have tried quite a few. The Crazy noodles combined with the Panang Curry are an excellent choice. Their portion sizes are great also.

Delivery options in the suburbs are just dismal. You get 2 choices: pizza or some variation of Asian. 

I get it, you live in the suburbs, what do you expect? But come on, I am willing to pay all of the delivery fees for my laziness. Lazy tax! I will pay it!

RARELY do any businesses of any kind deliver for FREE any more, so let's get on it, 'Burbs. More delivery options 'cause we're paying for it anyway.

That said, delivery is pretty much the only reason why we've ordered from Jin 28 as much as we have in the past. They deliver. And it's not pizza.

But all the dishes we've tried have been merely "meh." 

The Pad Thai is passable I guess, if you've not had Pad Thai anywhere else ever before. Pot stickers, fried rice, sesame chicken, General Tso's and all the standards? All of 'em, "meh."

It's food. That you do not have to cook for yourself and another human will bring to you in exchange for money when you are tired and lazy and in the middle of a Breaking Bad marathon you just can't tear yourself away from.

Yep. That about covers it.

(Oh, and their website says "Free Delivery for all Naperville Downtown Customers." Not true.)

This place is great. I've been here two days in a row for lunch. I was looking for something different in downtown Naperville and thought this looked interesting. The menu on the door had reasonable lunch specials with Chinese, Thai and Japanese  (sushi) selections. The decor is upscale. Food tastes wonderful. Service is attentive and friendly. I will be back.

This is my favorite thai/Japanese place!  

I go here a lot with my BF and the atmosphere is very nice and quiet with pretty decor.

The food is delicious.  They have a fresh sushi bar which is always a bonus.

I personally am in love with their big bowl of udon noodle soup with shrimp tempora. The service is always friendly and very attentive.

They also serve alcoholic drinks which are on the sugary side, but still yummy.

M scoup not bad.  BUT, their sashima is really bad----the fish went sour already!!!

When we brought this up, the manager said: ''Ok, i will give you a 10% off"--- I think she took this matter too lightly.  Your customers could be posioned bc of the raw fish that have already gone bad.

The waitress was very friendly.  

Don't go there!!

This place was fantastic. I did not order sushi because I'M IN FUCKING NAPERVILLE. All you morons that rated the sushi badly, it's your own damn fault. Where is there an ocean around here? C'mon you idiots.

I went with my family and my brother-in-law's family and we got mostly thai and chinese. it was great. good service. whatever

i can't wait to get back to San Francisco and have actual sushi
Delicious! Great lunch special for $6.95 which includes entree, hot and sour soup, choice of rice, and a huge eggroll!

I can see why this place currently averages 3 stars. There's many positive things about Jin 28, and an obvious one is the beautiful decor. They have a great location in downtown Naperville, and the vibe feels very nice.

We ordered smoothies, crab rangoon, and a chinese dish (which I can't recall) but I do remember them all being pretty good. I wish I could have tried the sushi but I probably wasn't feeling it that night. 

I'm docking two stars for service and a bit of a pricey menu. The staff was pretty attentive toward the beginning of our meal and sort of slowed down and forgot to give us our check. Or they were too busy trying to close down the restaurant. Either way, it took us forever to leave.

Enjoyed the variety available on this menu - Thai, Chinese & Sushi. Something for everyone here. Excellent waitstaff that made wonderful recommendations. Very reasonable too!! Great sushi rolls, tasty pot stickers, crunchy tempura veggies and an interesting wine list. The sesame chicken was too sweet and almost resembled a BBQ sauce bath.  This place was very reasonable! We'll definitely try this place again in Naperville.

*Another Update* We made it back to Jin 28 and had a better experience.  Our server was helpful, my husband enjoyed his Thai dish, I loved the Shiroi Brown roll and the kids got their usual Udon noodles.  

*Update*  I was pleasantly surprised to receive a hand written note and credit for future order after our less than perfect experience last week (described below).  I hadn't planned to revisit Jin 28 but I keep thinking about the hot and sour soup and after such great service recovery, I'll consider it again.  You should too!

***SLOW DELIVERY***
So I wasn't wild about Jin 28 when we dined in but when faced with requests for sushi, Pad Thai and fortune cookies by my family members, I thought I'd give it a shot.  I ordered online - pretty straightforward tool.  Received confirming email saying delivery would be 1 hour.  After 75 minutes, I called to confirm the systems were working properly and was told another 20-25 minutes.  In total, our food took 2 hours.

Beyond irritation with the delay, I had requested plain udon noodles in the notes as there wasn't a way to order them.  They were not included in my bill or with my food.  

The diverse menu is a plus.  The hot and sour soup was above average and a nice thickness (not slimy like it can be some places).  The egg drop soup was also very nice.  We enjoyed the flavor of the noodle dish though the noodles themselves were a bit doughy.  The sushi rolls were just okay - the Mexican was not spicy, the philly roll very thin. 

I love the one-stop-Asia-shop concept, the execution just isn't there...

Always a treat to go to this place!  Definitely have to save room to have both dinner and dessert!

The menu makes it a challenge to decide what to order. It always helps going with a group of friends so we can sample each others' dishes.

Recommended:
- Shrimp and crawfish fondeaux for an appetizer
- Baked crab mac and cheese
- Stuffed shrimp (very huge and filled with crab meat!)
- Shrimp creole and grits 

For dessert, the server brings out a tray to show what desserts are available, which makes it very very hard to decide!  They are big enough to split. The creme brulee and the praline bread pudding have been my favorites. 

Highly recommended place to try if you are a lover of both Cajun cuisine and seafood!

WARNING: PHONE AHEAD...I REPEAT... PHONE AHEAD.  The wait if you don't make reservations is long (45 minutes to an hour).  Also, if you're claustrophobic or don't like crowds, don't consider coming here.  There's no space really from one table to another.  

Pretty decent menu.  Started off with some calamari and alligator.  LOVED the deep fried alligator  (It tasted like chicken tenders).  Breaded and seasoned nicely with some really good sauce.  The calamari was not...it had pieces that were good and then these pieces that were soggy and tasted like breaded sardines.  The marinara sauce had a weird fishy taste to it.  

The entree I ordered was the halibut and crab meat.  WHAT A JOKE!! Got the halibut but didn't see the crab meat.  The crab meat was lumped like small pearl onions.  Stupidly deceiving.

Really not good.  I would recommend several other places over this.  Go to Red Lobster or something.

The lobster bisque at Zoup is better.  The gumbo here didn't really taste like gumbo.  I ordered the Andouille sausage gumbo, and there wasn't even 1 in there... No sign of sausage at all.

We went to this restaurant last week. They have thousands of choices and the service is good. 
Recommend!!!

I love this restaurant! The menu has lots of options, there's plenty of seating, courteous staff. The fried catfish and shrimp is my favorite...except when I'm dieting since I'm sure that's a 4000+ calorie meal given it comes with french fries! So, this time, I ordered the cedar plank salmon which came with asparagus. A much more healthy option and delicious. Unfortunately, I had to get a desert-the banana pudding, my favorite! Now, I will say it's a bit on the expensive side in my opinion. For my strawberry lemonade, side Caesar salad, salmon, and banana pudding, the bill was almost $50. If you're on a budget, you should go during the lunch hour since they seem to have some more reasonable prices for their lunch specials.

A top pick for date or hanging out with the girls.  Get the Swampthing it gets you just where you need to be. Great Creole food for about$20-$25 a person.  You can order full menu at the bar instead of waiting to be sat during rush hours.
