We have the worst waitress in the building. She is ruining my experience. We have been sitting here waiting and waiting for appetizers and this serveless  waitress hasn't even brought us a bowl of soup. She brought us the wrong drink, wow there's a surprise. The other waiters wont do anything about it. The so called manager came over and kept apologizing
Matt gave excellent customer service from the time we arrived to leaving!!! Great tips for ordering drinks and food!! I would bring a group of friends here anytime!!!

I recently visited Pappadeaux in Westmont, Il. When my guy and I walked in we were greeted promptly and was given a wait time to be seated. The wait time was longer than expected. When we were seated the waiter was very friendly and had alot of knowledge about the menu. Also as a complimentary treat for waiting so long the hostess sent over a live band to play some jazz for us, it was beautiful. At the end they gave me my dessert on the house. I would definitely recommend going to this restaurant because the food was amazing,the atmosphere was laid back,and the service was great despite the long wait time for our table.

I wish I could give a 3.5 but I will go with 3. After driving by for year, my family decided to go for my dad's birthday last weekend. They don't take reservations on the weekends but my mom was told when she called that they take call ahead. They don't. We tried and they said you just have to come in so we got there around 5 and it was a 35 minute wait for 4 people. 

It was extremely crowded and very loud. We were wary to be honest. After about a half hour, we were seated near the Windows. Our server was friendly but seemed very busy. We started with the calamari, but I don't eat it so I can't comment. My parents split the Greek salad and it looked good and I enjoyed the wedge I ordered. Bread was warm and delicious. 

For entrees, my dad had the cedar plank salmon, my brother had the medium fried shrimp entree, my mom had the halibut special and I had the plain halibut. Everyone enjoyed their food, I think next time I would ask for mine to be blackened and maybe add some capers or something. Dessert was pretty good, they have a lot of options and everyone got something different. I know it's all fresh seafood but it also was a little pricy for some of the menu items. 

I took stars off for the dirty bathrooms, the loud and crowded atmosphere and the no reservation policy. If someone else wanted to eat there I would go back, but I wouldn't suggest it myself.

Love this place for American style seafood. Prices are reasonable & menu is consistently good. Started with usual, bowl of Lobster Bisque $14-Chunks of Lobster and very flavorful. Tried the Moroccan Salmon & Shrimp Entre $24-which was phenomenal. Very buttery & served over couscous definitely recommend this meal & the restaurant in general.
Great experience sat right at the front door, Carrie the waitress was on point. Great job had a blast

Was continuously packed on Father's day, no matter what the hour, but I like that they will SMS you when you're ready to be seated. For us it took about an hour. Pretty good seafood for the area, but they are heavy with the salt (specifically their soft shell crab, and the shrimp on my halibut dish, which was otherwise good). I actually liked the dirty rice that came with the crab even more than the crab. I also found their Gulf oysters to be creamy yet pretty bland. Maybe it's due to the June season? The bartenders are friendly, and will dole out water, iced tea, or sodas for free while you wait.

It's a lively and bustling environment with great dcor. You may want to make reservation. It's the midwestern access to Southern or New Orleans cuisine....or seafood in general that's not just Red Lobster. Service was a bit slow but it was very busy. 

Foodwise, the portions are fairly large enough to be shared. we enjoyed the trio sampler to start. I tried the redfish on the had shell and frankly, I didn't like the texture/taste of the fish, shrimp and the scallop that it came with. It didnt tast very fresh maybe. The boy had the classic alexander mahi mahi dish which was pretty good. the dirty rice was sooo tasty. Maybe I just dont like redfish.  

Dessert - The bread pudding can be shared by 4 and very hot. It was more pudding than bread but it's not a bad choice.
Best Seafood ever ! I loved the chilean sea bass , this restaurant is  always full but the staff does a great job with customers.

I went here for my 21st birthday dinner. this is always my place for special occasions. there never disappoint and the service is by far the best of all the places i have gone to. the food is incredible. i cant say a bad thing about this place. im looking forward to my next visit!!
I love coming here for the lunch, gumbo and side salad for $11. Can't beat it! Excellent service as well. Dan at the bar is so attentive and kind! Love it!

I absolutely love this place!!!

I lost count of how many times I have been to this place for lunch dinner or just beer and oysters. 

You cannot beat the lunch specials and happy hour they are fantastic. 

During the year they run specials. I waited a bit but my and my uncle got a seat on 2.99 dozen of oysters night. We ate 6 dozens we had oysters coming out of our ears. 

I love their dirty rice and their Diablo sauce on any piece of fish. One time I had lobster and it was fantastic. It can get super crowded so be patient.

Where do I start. From time of arrival I had prepared myself for a wait. The parking lot gave me a picture perfect view of what we were walking into. We had a party of 25 and everyone arrived on time 6pm. By 6:45 we were seated. I didn't enjoy the both style seating with such a large group. It is a pain scooting in and out for people exits and bathroom breaks. 

Our server came to the table quickly to introduce himself and others that would be attending to us.
He worked his way across one side of the table then the next for drinks and appetizers. We waited close to an hour for the appetizers and only one side of the table received their drink orders. The other side drinks did not come to almost 30 minutes later right before our meals, along with the lemon for my water I had asked for over 5 times. When it came, they brought 3 bowls full. Everyone enjoyed their's except for one person in the party that had a watermelon mule. I was disappointed with my large order of calamari. It was cold when it arrived at the table. I barely touched it and decided to enjoy my salad instead which was perfect. 
Shortly thereafter our meals arrived. I ordered the sampler platter with the catfish. The plate was filled to its capacity ( A+) everything was delicious except for my catfish. It was over fried. Someone ordered the Pappadeaux Platter and it looked like a feast for for four. Everyone enjoyed their meals. There were many to go boxes on the table! Yet, when the dessert platter was presented before us everyone ordered. Everything on there was ordered between the group. I myself ordered the banana pudding to go. I loved the little mason jar it was placed in. I'm sitting now waiting for my bill as I finish my review. 

Overall, I cannot say if I would attend again considering the service we reviewed, especially for the price of my meal. Cold food and poor service is not acceptable. I understand large crowds can slow things down but a restaurant of this magnitude should very well understand its business and to staff their establishment accordingly. They have a good thing going and with a few adjustments could be great. I would then give five stars. 

One more note before I go. One of the guests in our party asked if they honored military and he was told no and the smell of the ladies bathroom was repulsive. I was told the men's bathroom wasn't any better.

So upset!!! Called 3 days in advance and made reservations for this weekend only to arrive and be told they were not accepting reservations for this Saturday. It's ridiculous that all of the staff members are not aware of this!!!! Drove over an hour to get to the restaurant and then told we would still have to wait 2 hours to be seated!!!! Unacceptable!!

The ambient mood here is mellow and relaxing even if it is a typically loud restaurant when busy.  The lighting, decor, and food is definitely appealing and provides an atmosphere that made me feel like I was some place more exciting than Westmont.  This was my first visit to a Papadeaux and I left impressed and ready to return.  I ordered the "mixed seafood grill" which includes two skewers of fish e.g. salmon and vegetables.  As somebody who strives to eat clean and lean, I happily enjoyed this and a salad with some extra grill shrimp.

In addition to the tasty food, the service was spot on.  Before I could finish my drink, the waiter would have another one ready to replace it.  Needless to say, I will gladly to return to this delightful spot and look out for it if I am ever back in Dallas or Houston or just want some good seafood/dining experience out in Westmont.

Goodness gracious did someone say.. overcrowded, loud, and just gone down.  

Now the food is always good so therefore, I am rating it a solid 3, but the overall environment in my opinion has gone down.  This used to be a place I would want to go on a date to, now, I barely want to go at all let alone think I will experience a romantic atmosphere.  

The last few times i have gone the food came out waaaaaaaay to late or not correct.  

I will return because i do adore the place but they need to do something in the realm of marketing, staff training, and overall hiring!  

Sigh.. step your game up Pappadeaux before you lose a customers.. 

Signed.. a customer with one foot out the door!

Maria K was the manager that night and she was amazing. Here is why:It was around 8pm on a Sunday night and the restaurant was PACKED. I mean, literally, packed and you couldn't see an empty table if you tried. We were a party of five and we were seated near the windows. As the night progressed, we realized it was very cold and started to put our coats on. Every time we wanted to mention it to the waiter, we would wait but then forget as it was just that busy. Another family seated near us was saying how cold it was as well. At the end of our meal, we noticed Maria K the manager talking to the other family. We then added our two cents. After she finished with the other family, she came to us. She was not aware of the problem but later found out that another manager or employee had heard that people complained about these particular tables. SHe was very apologetic, very personable, and very kind. She discounted the meal and still had a smile on her face. We were very grateful. She was very honest and that is what we respected about her. Next time we will do as she advised and tell her BEFORE it gets too bad. 

The food was amazing. My family devoured the mussels. They didn't have straight mussels on the menu (the one on the menu comes with chorizo). But we asked that they make just straight mussels. My family said it was awesome. I don't eat mussels so I really couldn't comment but they loved it so much they were drinking the soup at the bottom of the pot. 

Calamari was a good 3 stars. My lobster was awesome. I did not care for the sides nor did I finish them. Others had the fried shrimp and they loved it but the large is HUGE so be aware. You can order small, medium, large. My brother didn't care for his dish and I am not truly sure what it was. 

The service is what sold me about this location. We had been to the other pappadeaux in Schaumburg/North suburbs before it closed down (it had a buffet too) but this location is definitely a whole lot better when it comes to service. Thank you Maria K for making our visit awesome and for taking the time to listen to us.
Some of the best seafood you can get in the greater Chicagoland area! great selection. Great service.
This was a great experience. We Took all three of our kids and ordered a ton of different dishes. They tried everything and it was all delicious.

I have come an abundant amount of time. The place is fantastic. All the staff are friendly and polite. Michael the manager is an outstanding worker. Mike the bartender is polite. The bald gentleman is lively. The halibut was perfectly seared with the macadamia nuts. Added a great flavor. The broccolini was a little drenched in butter but not too bad. A very light meal altogether. 

A must try is the new crab Mac n cheese. This was rich but I thought it was suitable for one person. So good. The lobster caprese is eh not worth the money for the amount of lobster. And too many onion.  I want to try the salmon and octopus. Sounds outstanding.

Last night was another extremely packed night... Ugh... I guess it only means they have solid loyal customers ... 

We got here around 6pm thinking it won't be as crazy... But hell no... It was crazy busy... Parking lot was full... My BF and I were already dreading to go inside...

It's like going to a club at this joint .... damn... 

By the time they got our names... They said it's a two hour wait... Double whammie... Bar is full and a two hour wait time... 

We were like Hawks waiting for patrons to leave their spot at the bar... After a 40 minute wait... We finally got a spot... 

By the time we were almost done with our dinner.. We got a text that our table is ready...  Say Whaaaat?! 
This was at 8pm lol

Service at the bar was outstanding though.... Gabe our bartender, was very professional, and on point with the draaaaanks.... Woooot wooot...

I ordered two large swampthangs... My BF ordered a Manhattan, some daiquiri and beer...

We ordered Mediterranean calamari... Way better than the traditional calamari coz it has a lil kick... 

We ordered a bowl of seafood gumbo, we ordered Shrimp and scallop pasta and redfish Pontchartrain....

$164 later we were full, satisfied and quite tipsy....
We tip good and we will be back...

I love me some Pappadeaux ....

Excellent, fresh, wonderful seafood in a great atmosphere. You can very easily imagine that you're  in New Orleans at a favorite local fish place. 

No matter the time you come, it's always crowded and noisy here. It's always filled with large parties celebrating some family event or another. 

The restaurant deserves five stars. I only rate it four because the wait staff needs some serious training in efficiency and courtesy.

One of favorite spots! Me and a gf decided to go yesterday (you know, to treat ourselves after a HECTIC work week). The only con is there's always a wait but "all good things come to those who wait". Plus I LOVE the text message feature. I don't have to stay close by anymore or keep up with that dang gone buzzer! 

Never have had a bad meal. Our server was so DOPE. Kady/Katy (it was loud and I didn't wanna keep asking her Kady or Katy? Lol). There's another server who is really bomb too. I didn't see her yesterday (they come and go) but her name is like Leelay or Laylee. Very attentive. When servers are like that I forget they're at work and I wanna be like "pull up a chair and have dinner with us". So damn friendly these two. Anyway, we both wanted to try s'thing other than the seafood platter/Pappadeaux platter so she (Kady/Katy) explained in mass detail how all the food we were interested in trying is prepared (damn! Do they go to sous chef classes first???). Anywho, the red snapper and butternut risotto was DELICIOUS. I woke up today like  I have leftovers!!! I'm saving the banana pudding for Ballers and Power (whichever is first). Anyway, can't wait till my next visit. Me and Guy go about 1/mo...first time leaving a review tho

After a thunderous, rainy Monday night with a mediocre movie screening on the company tab, this dinner was the rainbow after a storm. The restaurant was rather empty and most patrons were seated in the bar to catch the ending minutes of the Stanley Cup final in which the Blackhawks won. 

For two of us, we had the appetizer trio, crawfish etouffee, and Cape Cod Bay mussels. The trio consisted of mini shrimp and crawfish fondeaux, fried alligator, and hot smoked salmon. The fondeaux was hot and creamy. We dunked several thick slices of bread into that steamy bowl and there were still plenty of leftovers. The size of one piece of fried alligator was similar to popcorn shrimp. It was crispy and juicy. The Atlantic salmon was medium well and prepared with a creamy maple mustard sauce. It had a slight spice but the meat was exceptionally tender. 

The crawfish etouffee came with dirty rice that consisted of chicken, pork, and chives. The crawfish is deshelled and cooked in a thick brown sauce with tomatoes. It was well seasoned and extremely flavorful. I would definitely repeat this dish on my second visit. The Cape Cod Bay mussels came in a huge pot filled with thick slices of adouille sausage. The contents were drowned in a white wine sauce made with lemon garlic butter. The mussels were fresh and fatty. It was refreshing and well marinated, but my attention was drawn by the broccolini prepared with butter broth. The greens were so crisp with notes of broccoli and asparagus. I could have easily finished the side by myself if I didn't have to share. 

Prices are a little high with this Creole eatery but the service was exceptional. I will eventually return when I am in the area again or if there is a certain event to celebrate.

The food here is pretty amazing...the crowds not so much. Dinner time or weekends it's complete and total pandemonium. Hour waits are typical...ignorant people reaching over you at the bar while you're eating to get deal of the day slushy drinks.

Go during off peak hours and save yourself the headache.

I forgot how good this place is!! I have not been to a Pappas since I first moved to Chicagoland. It was a welcomed surprise.

We got there early, so we had no problem getting a seat, however, later it was packed (on a weekday!). Needless to say, you may want to make a reservation, It was holiday time, but you never know.

The drinks are definitely pricey for the suburbs, so that wasn't a perk. However, the food is great. A little salty, but overall really good. It's hard to find Cajun/Creole restaurants in this area. They have a variety of different dishes to choose from, most of it being seafood. For the price, the value is great. I ordered a dish that had shrimp, a nice portion of Mahi fish, scallops, and crawfish. The sauce was so good, just right amount of spice. I also love the dirty rice.

Our waiter was really nice and honest. When we asked his opinion of certain dishes, he gave us his honest opinion. It was busy so towards the end so he wasn't around as much. But overall service was good.

I'm glad there are still Pappadeaux restaurants in the area, and I can't wait to go back!

Best food ever.  Start off with the crayfish and shrimp fondue then the lobster bisque which is thick with chunks of lobster and then my favorite meal, salmon Yvette. If you have  any stomach left, which I didnt,the praline cheesecake is out if this world   The swamp thing drink is the best and you get the huge glass for a $1 up charge
Great place for a large group.  A lot of fried food.  Good atmosphere. Nice to sit outside.

Whenever I come to Chicago I always have to stop here. The service is awesome, I love the atmosphere, and they always have a special goin on. I came to Chicago with my friends and they have never been. They really enjoyed the food and they would come back again.

My husband and I celebrated my birthday yesterday with excellent seafood, drinks, dessert and service! We arrived around 1:00.. and it was crowded and noisy, but it quieted down a bit after lunch rush. Our thanks to John.. who goes by his last name on name tag.. forgot the exact name but it rhymes with "turtle". He was friendly, helpful and entertaining. Thanks John! Your recommendation of the bananas foster cheesecake was excellent.. and I did not mind the Bellini either! Made my birthday fun!

Pasta is the new seafood.

I've been here four times and all four times I've gotten the Mardi Gras pasta.
I've tried samples from other people plates. but nothing has won me over except the pasta. Love the flavor combination of the sauce and pasta with the combination of shrimp/craw fish/andouille sausage

(Tip: you save about $9 if you get the lunch version of this.(11-3pm) same size pasta but 4 less shrimp and a few less craw-fish)

I've been wanting to try this place since forever. The place is always packed and they don't take reservations. We finally tried it, waited about 30 min at the bar. The place is Huuuge! 

I was disappointed in my meal, don't remember what I ordered (some fried fish), but everyone else's meal looked so much better. I think I just ordered the wrong thing. It came with a side of fries, which was probably my first mistake. The other dishes with rice and all looked much better.  I had the cheese oysters which were good, a bit too cheesy though...nowhere near NOLA style. I liked that they had the jazz band playing live going around to the tables. That was entertaining and I felt I was right back in NOLA. 

Prices are up there, I think I just ordered the wrong dish. Will try again one day, just don't want to spend all that money again so soon.

We visited on a super busy Sunday night/Holiday weekend. When we checked in they said the wait was 45min to 1 hour which was fine with us as we weren't starving. Luckily for us our wait was less then 20 minutes! The restaurant was packed, but we had a great booth in the bar area. Our server was super nice, but obviously slammed. 
They offer a super decent kids menu, including grilled chicken and rice and also several fried fish and seafood choices. Our under 8 bunch was satisfied with the selection. 
I had the lobster bisque, which was amazing as other reviewers have stated. I also chose a house salad, which was really fresh. Props to the waiter for letting me know their French dressing had blue cheese in it. It was tasty, but may have bugged me if I didn't know.
My husband had a massive serving of seafood kabobs that were also delicious. He had a hard time finishing it, but was determined to be in the clean plate club!
We skipped dessert as we were so stuffed, but the tray of yummy was sitting right next to us and was hard to pass up!
Overall, we liked our experience there. I would try it again on our next trip to Westmont!

I love this place this is a family friendly environment. The food is always consistent every time we go. I wish I lived closer we would be there every weekend. The servers were cool as a fan and they made us feel at home. My toddler is a wild thing but our server quickly gave him something to do and he was quieted quickly. Lol I wanted to bring her home!

I have passed by this place but never knew anything about it. My boyfriend and his parents went to celebrate their birthday Saturday evening. We showed up around 6:30pm and the place was packed to capacity. We had to wait for 2 hours which was something i disliked but to be expected on a weekend evening including how packed it was. Luckily we were able to share a couple seats at the bar to grab some drinks and order a appetizer thank god! The 4 of us shared the Trio appetizer (i can't remember name) it was delicious! We each grabbed enough to get a taste and hold down the hunger.

FOOD - Appetizer to our main meal (in which we all ordered something different, all looked delicious and we all agreed tasted how it looked). We also ordered a treat at the end. I ordered the Mardi Gra's special cheesecake. It was a huge piece and tasted great! The amount of food i my plate was filling, im a big eater and was able to eat it all, but i feel for many it could be too much. I also enjoyed the food presentation. 

DECOR/ATMOSPHERE - My favorite! Dim lights! The amount of people there, the place was kept up nice and clean. Down south style especially the night we went, made me feel like i was somewhere in Louisiana. 

$$$ - Pricing was about average for seafood. And i felt i got my money worth with food. 

STAFF/SERVICE - There was plenty of staff around which is great! There was plenty of bartenders as well and all were nice and polite and attentive. Our server did a well job not keeping us waiting long in any case and helpful to ask if we had been there and helping us through our first time.

This place is amazing!!  The alligator appetizer is a must get!! The food is seasoned to perfection and its fresh! It's pricey, but well worth it. I tried their signature drink and it did not disappoint. I like how they are full of variety. They have fresh cold options, fried options, and saut options. I would recommend this place to anyone! 

They give free dessert of your choice if it's your birthday! The key lime pie is delicious!

Con: I tried the salmon appetizer and it wasn't that good. I can see where the chef was trying to go with the sauce, but I think it should be off the menu all together.
DELICIOUS! Wonderful crab legs and also able to work with a gluten-free diet. Drinks were amazing too! Busy place but will certainly return.

I love Pappadeaux! I eat there regularly.  In Dallas and Chicago.

Lobster Bisque is the best.  About a half lobster tail's worth of lobster in the bisque.  Flavor is beyond words.

Fried seafood platter is my thing and there's a wide selection of many different fried seafood platters.  Pure heaven.  All of it is fantastic.

Highly recommended!

One of the most authentic Cajun-style restaurants not actually in Louisiana. From the appetizer to the dessert, nothing can top this! 

I have eaten at Pappadeaux's several times, and it remains my go-to restaurant while visiting Chicago!

You'd see me every other week here during the crawfish boil season. Yes, I love the Cajun flavored crawfish. And could have two orders alone by myself.

Have been here many time for the happy hours and for the Oysters. You could expect more stronger floavered food if you order spicy shimp, dirty rice, or even the alligator nuggets. I think those are overly salty for me but some of my friends just love them. 

During March to May, we just go for a dozen of Oyster and a few pounds of crawfish boil. Then a mojito or Purple Voodoo and share a dessert which usually fairly big portion. Take  you time to eat up the food and chat along the way.

Services are friendly and quick. It has been always crowded so all the waist stuff are almost running around to get everyone servied. So remember to stop them to ask what you want. They usually come back very quickly.

Enjoy!

This restaurant is really big. As I was having lunch, it made me feel as though I was somewhere else (like Louisiana).  Really nice decor and vibe here. 
There's quite a bit of options on the menu and they have a decent lunch menu too. I really wanted to try the fried alligator as I've never had it before. I didn't know what to expect. It had a taste somewhere in between of a catfish nugget and a chicken nugget. It wasn't bad at all. Glad I tried it!
For my entree I had the lobster and shrimp salad. It had big pieces of sliced mango and avocado. Yum!  This was a tasty salad.

Great seafood! We had the fried alligator for an appetizer and it was delicious! My husband had the pappadeaux platter and it had SO much food on it he couldn't even finish it! The seafood gumbo was amazing! I had grilled shrimp that was so good and very good catfish fillets! The waiter was very good and always kept our drinks filled!

Had a large group here on Sunday.  Everything was great.  The group really enjoyed the fried alligator appetizer.  The shrimp and crawfish fondue was also amazing.  Everyone enjoyed the entrees which included the halibut, sea bass, salmon, catfish, redfish, shrimp and a few others.  The portions are quite large and with having the earlier appetizers, we were all too full for dessert.

The atmosphere was fun and the staff was great.  We were lucky enough to go at a time where they were accepting reservations and that was nice.  Wish they could offer that at other times too.  The patio is a great place to hang out.

Again, everyone and everything was really great here.  Keep it up and we'll be back to try another time!!

Dinner was excellent! My waiter Alex was superb! Didn't mind spending the money because the food was well prepared and service was timely.

I will return and will ask for Alex because a good server is hard to find!

Tables to close as I was bumped 1/2 of the time during dinner!

This is my favorite restaurant in the north Chicago suburbs. Well, actually it used to be the 
Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen in Arlington Heights, but they closed that one and this one will have to do. The seafood is ALWAYS delicious and the prices exactly where they should be.

I always order (I'm sorry, but it is so good) the grilled mahi-mahi with Alexandra sauce. Oh my...I salivate just thinking about it. And no trip to Pappadeaux's is complete without a side of blackened scallops on a bed of dirty rice. Oh snap! I love this restaurant so much. All of it...the entire menu is amazing. Dollar for dollar it is the best seafood restaurant period.

Loved the atmosphere - lively group.  Great specials but unfortunately after dropping a lot of money on dinner I got extremely sick afterwards.  My guy and I had the same dishes but for some reason I got ill and he just loved what he had since he didn't get sick.  I will try them again but I will not have the Whole Lobster like I did on Friday.

I'm shocked that I'm just now writing a review for them. I'm ALWAYS in here! Either for drinks, parties, lunch dates, or a dinner night. I pretty much get the same thing. Pan seared frog legs, the shrimp po boy, chicken linguini, or king crablegs. The swamp thing drink or baton bellini. Although I've tried several other dishes & drinks. My favorite time here is Mother's Day. My family and I go and it's always about 20 of us. The wait can be VERY LONG, but it's definitely worth the good time we always have. I've never had a horrible server here, they're all pretty accomodating too. Check them out if you haven't!!!

We used to go to the Schaumburg one before they closed the doors for good. Finally had a chance to visit the Westmont one and it didn't disappoint.
The place was awesome, had a 'homey' feeling to it and we were seated right away for a Saturday lunch. 
Started with the alligator appetizer which I have missed for years and introduced them to my kids. 
Had the grilled seafood with veggies and the portion was more than enough for me. Our server was very attentive and we didn't even have to ask for refills of water.
Will certainly come back again!

So glad we got a chance to visit this place on a quick trip to Chicago! The food is amazing, the place is jumping. People were coming in groves. We got there around 1pm an were seated right away and good thing we did because we wouldn't have been able get seated after that. It was only me and my husband but we ordered almost everything on the menu lol we couldn't resist. Fried alligator was amazing, calamari was perfectly breaded. My husband got the catfish and I couldn't stop picking off of his plate lol i got the Carribean lobster. Amazing. And we also got the oysters. They were a bit gritty, i think they just needed to be cleaned better. But they were still good. And we got the dessert trio... That sweet potato pecan pie.. Sweet Jesus. Someone's grandma had to have made that. All in all, this will be my first stop next time we travel anywhere Midwest or down south! Must go!

We usually have a drink at the bar while waiting for our table. Creative and tasty specialty drinks, I had a TX Rose, a spicy, not too sweet but fruity treat. We usually just get a bunch of small plates/appetizers instead of full dinners. The gumbo has a spicy little kick, very good. The crawfish bisque is a rich and creamy delight. Iceberg wedge splits nicely for two, rich and creamy bleu cheez dressing and bacon. Salty but yum! We highly recommend the spring rolls. Red beans and rice with generous andouille slices, reliably good. Crab Mac n cheez was rich, cheesy, and very satisfying. On Friday evenings, there's live music from a roving Dixieland jazz combo. It's a fun, busy place with great seafood and drinks.

Trying to finish off this Swamp Thing... Food was DELICIOUS!!! Service was Excellent!!! First visit to this Pappadeaux restaurant and it exceeded my expectations.  Although it was crowded (totally unexpected this for a Tuesday evening) we were seated immediately and the food arrived within average timing.  Enjoying dinner with daughter, husband, and grandson; they each REALLY enjoyed dinner and the service as well. We had the crab fingers, jumbo sea scallops & shrimp, shrimp po boy & lobster bisque, and pan seared tilapia with augratin potatoes.  No complaints and Glad I'm not driving. O and this particular Pappadeaux is in a ritzy area..

Had a wonderful dinner here! Our waitress Syreeta was wonderful. I told her I had allergies and the manger came over and discussed my allergies and assured me it would be taken care of. I have never had someone do that for me. 
The kitchen printer malfunctioned and missed half of our order. The manager Brady came over right away and apologized profusely. He offered us salads or more appetizers. He also wanted to pay for our desserts. Our food was delicious and cooked to perfection. Brady (manager) came up after our meal and told us he had comped our entire dinner. We had 7 people in our group. He went above and beyond! Cannot say enough about the management and staff! Excellent!
Great food but the place gets busy so get there early.

Update- so portions got way way smaller than before.  They brought out our appetizers,  dinner,  drinks,  soups,  everything pretty much within 2 minutes of each other..... which meant the tiny table was crowded and barely any room to move around.  Who has an "ask for the gluten free menu" and then have no gluten free menu?  Yep you got it,  this place!  It's ridiculous,  at least if you're offering a gluten free menu, Give an option of rice noodles or any noodle that is gluten free! ! The same with the gator, grilled non breaded gator. So thanks,  in order to enjoy a small tiny teeny portion of good Ole Louisiana Creole food,  I have to pop like 5 allergy pills just to survive!  Lastly you go to enjoy New Orleans style music,  and we're listening to something similar to v103- until we're walking out to leave this place where they start playing New Orleans style music!  

Not coming back again,  that's for sure!

This is my mom's favorite restaurant so we always make sure to visit when she comes into town. I've been here 4-5 times and it never disappoints (although I typically stick to the same order). 

Tonight, we started off with the Shrimp and Crawfish Fondeaux, which is absolutely delicious and perfect on the garlic bread it is served with. I ordered the Atlantic Salmon Yvette, which is what I usually order because it is delicious, HUGE and is consistently my favorite! My mother's go-to order is the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette, which is jumbo shrimp stuffed with cheese and jalapeo and wrapped in bacon... Enough said! 

Dessert consisted of the Key Lime Pie and Turtle Cheesecake. Both ok, Key Lime Pie is better, but I would recommend just eating more of your main course than saving room for dessert. 

Atmosphere is really fun with live music traveling around to entertain tables. Our server was great with tons of recommendations. He was truly there to make sure we enjoyed our meal and our experience!!

Where you wanna go? Fo' Sho, it's gotta be Pappadeaux!! sweeeet, nailed it. 

So yah, not from these parts but when I fly in for some meetings, Pappadeaux is on the short list of favorites. The menu is absolutely amazing. There is just a ton a great choices on there that can get you some of the best seafood that I have ever had here. I normally go with the Blackened fish but this time I had the crawfish Etouffe by recommendation and am very glad I did. If you go with the platter for $4 more it comes with a huge portion of fried crawfish with some dips. I found the fried version very light and crispy with a great soft but chewy texture. The Etouffe (which I know I am spelling wrong but am unsure how to spell this amazing find) is basically simmered crawfish in a light gravy. Served with rice, this is a true find. 

If you are really hungry, give the calamari a try. They are lightly battered in a seasoned coating. I believe they are soaked in buttermilk or something since they are chewy and have a ton of flavor. Some of the best I have ever had. 
Overall, great place to have a nice dinner and even better for a business dinner. Recommended
Exceptional food And service. Huge menu. Alligator was very tasty. Not sure why shows as two $$ though, more like $$$$.

Food is good, but the portion size is smaller than the location in Naperville.

If it is the same chain ( I believe it is) then the food and service should be consistent. If I have the choice, I would go to Naperville.

I can't tell you the last time I waited 2 hours for a table for dinner.  It's probably never happened, because no place can possibly be that good.  Last night I finally crossed that wait off my bucket list- my girlfriend demanded we come here and wait, and seeing it was her birthday I felt necessary to accommodate her wishes.  This place is good, but I sure as heck would never wait 2 hours again to eat here.  It's good, solid food, good service, and a great bar, but no reservations and high prices mean this place is only for someone else's special day :)

They have a huge bar, and they seem to specialize in big, fruity, tropical drinks.  I stuck to bourbon, my GF had a Cosmopolitan. Our bartender was cool enough, and the people watching made the time pass fast. We ended up ordering a plate of oysters Pappadeaux for an appetizer while we waited.  They were pretty good, not amazing, but definitely good.

By the time we got a table after 2 hours, our server was awesome- I think her name was Alexis??  She got our orders in quick, had some good suggestions, and kept the drinks flowing.  I ordered redfish, my GF had salmon.  Both were really good, but honestly, the bill was like $150. We had an appetizer and a few drinks at the table, too, but if you factor in the bar bill before we sat down, this was close to $200.  

Between the cost and the wait, I don't think this place is that awesome.  Don't get me wrong- the food is really good, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is circus-like, but I'd be hard-pressed to come back here given the wait time and prices.

I love this place! The food is always super amazing and it's always a good time when you go with family or a date and the live band is there sharing their voices and instruments. Makes you feel good while you eat. The place can always be busy which is good for business and horrible for your appetite. Lol but it can be worth the wait. Sometimes the waiter/waitress can be hit or miss here. And the seating can be a little too close for comfort but otherwise this place is a fav. Please try the fried alligator and a swamp thing while you wait for your main course!

One of my favorite seafood restaurants. Food is fresh. I had the fried seafood platter, with catfish. I enjoyed the fried shrimp, stuffed shrimp, and crab cakes. Fish was not super impressive. Quantities were large.

Visited Sunday nite. Very busy spot! Most disappointing was lack of service. Our server was just not attentive! Never brought our drinks finally we just cancelled two of them.  Never brought our bread or waters - had to ask food runner to bring when appetizer was brought out. 

Dishes were pretty good. Lots of flavor in the linguine with shrimp and on the rosemary chicken. ..delicious. Crab legs were ok..only one tiny wedge of lemon with them - asked for more and had to ask again towards end of meal as they were never served. Didn't like that. Disappointed.  Skipped dessert as we figured it would take  forever to order and receive.

Pappadeaux has always been a favorite place to celebrate our anniversary; however, this time the clam chowder was exceptionally salty, which Michael, our waiter, said has been the same recipe from the beginning of time.  Michael, although very busy with customers, was very attentive to our needs. The high point of our meal was the cream brle, topped with a lit candle to celebrate our 17th wedding anniversary. Thank you Michael, God bless!
The staff  was wonderful. Needed a quick gift order for a friend.  The TO GO reception  Michelle was so helpful, actually ended up buying  more items from her suggestion. This place rocks!

Had my Valentine's Day dinner here tonight with my husband and daughter As always, food, drinks & service was excellent! The filet w/ Carribean Lobster! Bass is very good and the filet of catfish. Of course I had my shrimp cocktail & crab cakes. For drinks, the "Swamp Thing" was recommended and it was Excellent! Thank you to "Maria".
Highly recommend for a romantic date, great for family celebrations.

This is a very randomly located restaurant, off the 83. There are no other business surrounding it so the parking lot is very spacious. My friend and I went here for lunch on a Saturday and it was pretty packed already. I think if you go for dinner, there will definitely be a wait unless you make a reservation or beat the crowd. 

I went here specifically for the alligator meat! The waiter said it tastes like popcorn chicken except it is a little bit more chewy and that is exactly the description I would give, too. The alligator meat medium size is enough to share between 2-3 people. It also comes with shoestring fries and a house special dipping sauce.

I also tried the jambalaya but it wasn't anything special so I would skip this. My friend and I also shared the seafood grilled platter and it came with dirty rice and a skewer of assorted seafood and veggies. It was good but the only thing I really enjoyed was the alligator meat. I would definitely come here again for a nice dinner with people who like seafood. And definitely, try the alligator meat!! You won't be disappointed!

Went here with my boyfriend just this past Sunday. 
We made reservations at 6:30, checked in at the door just before 6:30 and they said they'd text us when the table was ready. It was probably 6:45 by the time I walked up to check with the host. We were sitting right in front of them but we never received a text, so their system may not have been working. Regardless, hosts were very nice and apologetic and sat us quickly. 

Service was a bit slower, but our server was very friendly and knowledgable and we understood that she seemed to be running quite a few tables so it really wasn't a problem at all. We also made Pappadeaux our only plans for the night, so we weren't in any rush. 

I must point out- this is the second time I've been to this location and both times, the servers have been out of this world. They've been extremely friendly, professional and knowledgable. I would not hesitate to return. 

For dinner, we enjoyed blue point oysters (we ordered a half-dozen, but the kitchen made us a dozen on accident- happy mistake!), fried crab, a 3 lb. Maine lobster, a bit of beer and wine and for dessert- the creme brle! 

Everything was fresh and delicious. Also, our server had our dessert taken off the check since service was slow and our bar drinks often took a bit of time to reach us. It was very nice and thoughtful of her.  

Overall, 5 stars! I'll definitely be back.

This place is hard to get into for dinner and especially on weekends with waits of 90 minutes or more and they don't accept reservations after 3pm. Another couple we met suggested we get there early, so we met at 4:30 and were immediately seated, but literally 10 minutes later the waiting line was out the door. 

The food is very good and we shared appetizers with the other 2 couples.

We hadn't been to Pappadeaux in nearly a year. We love the New Orleans flavor angle. The dirty rice goes well with just about everything. They let us order off the lunch menu, which was plenty of food sharing appetizers and each getting a salad. (The wedge with blue cheese, bacon and tomatoes is fantastic) My wife's side salad was only $2.50 more.

There are good options for non-seafood eaters. 

We thought the service was very slow. Faster service would turn more tables. Live band was great but it contributed to a pretty loud noise level.  We all decided to find a quieter place for our next meal together. We'll go back, hopefully sooner than the last time!
Absolutely love this place. The salmon dishes are awesome. The boudin sausage appetizer is incredible and the touffe is phenomenal. The pricing is good and desert is great as well.

I really enjoy it here but what keeps me coming back is the great service! The food could be fantastic but the great bartenders are what makes or breaks an evening. I love the soup and the fried alligator. I frequently go to New Orleans so I'm picky about cajun cuisine. I'll be back soon! Thanks a bunch!

I love this restaurant. The Chicago area needs more than one! I have frequented the locations in Texas. The quality and service here is just as good as the southern locations. Vito was our server on this most recent visit and he was a joy. It was my mother's first time at any Pappadieux location and it did not disappoint. The restaurant offers fresh fish in a Cajun style. I had the red fish with crab and lemon butter sauce.  My mom had a Mahi with some yummy topping. We had dirty Rice and spaghetti squash. We also had the fried alligator just for kicks and giggles. This place has great drinks. We both had more than enough leftovers for a second helping at home. If you go on a weekend be prepared to wait but it is well worth it.
Worst service I've ever had, And it is not the first time I had this bad service, Food is good but I won't be back.

We haven't been here in a long time but I'm so glad we decided to go again. We had oysters on the half shell, crawfish etouffee, cheesy grits and whole lobster with melted butter. All the food was delicious but the crawfish etouffee and cheesy grits were fantastic!
Excellent meal and service here!!  I had the Chilean Sea Bass and it was prepared perfectly!  The waiter was attentive and very professional. One of the best meals I've had in a long time!
Food is DELICIOUS!!! Service was awesome. Beautiful environment as well. Drinks were super fresh. I will be back!!!!

Luv luv luv this sea food kitchen.. Let me start off by saying they never did me wrong.. So fresh so tasteful.. Full of flavor down to the alligator fried just right so luv this appetizer trio has my mouth watering.. Did extra alligator instead of the Salmon.. Yummy.. Cant wait 4 the main course

I come here on special occasions, whether it's a birthday celebration or GNO.  The atmosphere is always vibrant and the food is amazing.  The Shrimp Montaj is not on the menu but it's to die for.  Your choice of 3 or 5 stuff crab shrimp w garlic mash.  It's yummy.  The Pina colada is very good. Prepare to wait since they do not accept reservations nor are on opentable 

For desert try the pecan cheesecake, it's delicious.
Great restaurant. The seasoning is to die for! The only problem is the wait is always long but its worth it.

Delicious!! I ordered the trout with a spinach side and it was absolutely amazing. The prices are a little high, the waiter was very informative and recommended some sweet, tasty wine to me. Absolutely amazing, and I guarantee next time I'm back in Chicago, I will return again.
What everyone else said! The food is always well flavored and on point. The service is always amazing also!
Great seafood! This place is always busy so that says a lot. My favorite dish is the fried shrimp and fries(classic. If your coming on the weekend beware there is a wait. It is worth it though. Enjoy
This is the best!   I love the live lobsters and the staff is great!   Very weak wine & bourbon selection.

Yea the place is busy , to me that's a good sign . It usually means the food is good . And the food is good ! Portions are huge ! Prices are appropriate. Louisiana,Cajun, seafood . I don't know about the alcohol, cause I can't pay 10$ for a drink . It's about the food . And this place is fine fresh seafood! When people like Stan Makita , Frank Thomas , and some of the old Cubbies visit , it's gotta be good , right ?

I went to this location last night with friends and our waiter had a nasty attitude. His name was Kam. After waiting longer than expected for just water, he reported they didn't have any bread left because it's a busy night and they ran out of it. His exact words were "there's no bread left but you have crackers right there on the table". He was rude and didn't check on us to see how we were doing after the food came. I usually have a great time at Pappadeux but not on this night. I see I will have to request my server from now on. I'm in the service industry myself and I refuse to deal with people like Kam.

I have never had a bad meal from here, I especially like the Chilean sea bass and the lobster tail! The service is pretty good understanding that the place is super big. I always go for lunch and never dinner and it's usually pretty full...

Second time here. Amazing experience again.

Greek salad was delicious and very unique. A great place to start. Only comes with 2 shrimp even though it's for 4. Good amount of ingredients other wise: green peppers, chives, capers, pepperioccini, tomato. Really lovely salad.

Calamari: cooked just right -not chewy. Nice sauces. Has fried artichoke leaves too.

Clam chowder: really good. Has bacon but bacon doesn't over power the clams. I'd like to say it's amazing but I have this thing against bacon in chowder. It's s pet peeve but this was a very solid contender for best chowder ever. 

Oysters on the half shell: they were the ones that come with the shrimp. It was an app that came with a half dozen oysters and shrimp so I'm pretty sure they were the golf oysters and not the blue point. They were perfect! Yay pappadeux! Big and juicy, lots of lemon, mingoinet was nice (werchester sauce flavor plus onion and vinegar), and customizable cocktail sauce. This oyster experience was a 9.8 for me. They came with a little bit of the oyster juice and the meat was separated from the shell. Only reason it's not a perfect 10 is bc I prefer a brinier oyster and I play favorites which makes being a 10 nearly impossible.  

Drinks:
Texas rose: cucumber, basil, sweet, martini style, pink -girly but grown up
Frenchman street spritz: refreshing and fruity

Service was spot on. No complaints at all -she was laid back, polite, and efficient. Not as chatty as others but I personally like that. 

All star work here. Can't wait to go back.

Outside of a steakhouse, my favorite food. Any fish blackened with a topping of Alexander sauce has been my go to for over 10 years now. The dirty rice is the best in the business. If you want to have a meal that will blow you away, start with the shrimp and crawfish fondue! 

The atmosphere is fun and relaxing, especial when they have the love music that will play tableside. A very colorful dining experience for sure. 

If you like a frozen drink, you have to try a Swamp Thing! Trust me.

Plan on a half hour to 2 hour wait on weekends.
Absolute one of my favorite places to eat! All the food here is amazing not to mention the amazing cocktails! The banana pudding is a MUST!

I chose Pappadeaux for my birthday celebration in lieu of doing something at home.  I remembered that it was expensive and only invited family members that could afford it.  It is truly expensive but the food is very very good.  I would not make this a regular dining experience, but every now and then for a special occasion it is worth it.  The service was excellent.

First off I came with a group of 7 around 4 & it was dead! Which was awesome because we had the waiters full attention! Customer service, checked!

Half of our group ordered Coxinha's... how could we not? They were rich in flavor & rice & beans on the side were the cherries on top! Their alcoholic drinks were also woowza! Let's just say the first few sips had me talking about a storm..we left the loudest group. It was a great environment. 

Also the peppers they have in the jars, gosh they were something else! Definitely had me coming for more.. Brazilian's really know how to spice things up which I can definitely handle & LOVED with my rice & beans. 

If ever I was stranded in Aurora this would be my pit stop. It's a must.

I was dog sitting in Aurora one night and wanted to try something different. I've never had Brazilian cuisine so I was curious to try it. We went for the stew and it was absolutely delicious. I love that they have all different types of sauces to add but it didn't need much! After we kept eating it, we grew more and more addicted to the taste. We got one of the appetizer combos and liked some of the things and didn't like others. The service was decent but we didn't feel like it was well explained to us being beginners to the cuisine. 

I would definitely come back to try more menu items or to eat that stew again.

Very good, local eatery! My boyfriend and I went on a Friday, about 8pm. Luckily we got to sit right away :) 

We ordered an appetizer of fried balls, the cheese one was good. We also split the steak rolls! Delicious! 

We shared key lime pie for dessert, very creamy. 

Service was great, very attentive. Will be back!

If you're seeking authentic Brazilian cuisine, stay away!!  The feijoada Was very bland and seemed like it was few days old. The rice was not prepared as a Brazilian rice should be properly prepared. Tasted more like minute rice.  The chicken in the coxinha tasted like it came out of a can, a can of cat food.  The only thing that was a saving grace was the mini coxinhas which were tasty. There are not many Brazilian restaurant out there, and even less that are not the big steak houses. Hopefully they can turn themselves around. Simplify the menu focus on quality and work on the presentation!

My friends dropped by here for dessert because we were interesting in having key lime pie.  They were very generous with the slices for $5.  They even plated the pie and drizzled cream on top for a beautiful presentation.  This key lime pie was sweet but missing the tart of a traditional pie, but I still enjoyed it very much.  The texture was thick pudding and very creamy. 

It was late on a Tuesday night and there were no other customers in the restaurant.  I thought it was cool that they had motorcycle racing on TV.  I'll have to come back sometime and try their main menu.

Free street parking on New York can be easy to come by, but if not then there's the casino parking lot on Rivers to park in.

I felt like a tourist in Brazil with their nice menu with PICTURES for each item. Very interesting, learning Portuguese language. The pictures were really helpful, easy for me to decide what to order :)

Very nice and colorful decorated restaurant with their traditional touch of Brazilian. Didn't expect to see this in the heart of Arora. It's a small restaurant so only one server was there. He did an excellent job gave us the best service. He was so sweet and friendly, very knowledgeable about Brazilian food but he is from mexico :)

Our party of 3, ordered a few different kinds of drink to start. Mom ordered a Brazilian beer called "Palma Louca" $4.50 and it was very good. it's a light beer so I loved that. I had a glass of Sauvignon Blanc from South Africa/2013 $7.59 and the last drink was my favorite "Caipirinha" $9.99 this  drink was so delicious and refreshing with their fresh ingredients : Alcohol from sugar cane ( cachaga) mixed with a lot of lime, sugar and Ice.

We all enjoyed the food. We had limited time before the show at the Paramount theater so we didn't order appetizer or dessert but only the main course was perfect for us.
I loved my dish "Beef Stroganoff" sweet curry sauce with tender beef worked well together, a crunchy taro fries and white rice completed this dish beautifully. 

If you would like to experience some Brazilian culture and have a great authentic Brazilian food, please check out U Samba? Cafe. This place won't disappoint you. Enjoy!

Went in to sample Brazilian food for possible review on my blog. The table service was good. The food was good, but something was missing that I recalled in the food I had in So Paulo, in Recife, at Taste of Brasil in Oak Park, and at Brasil Legal in Chicago proper. It was weird that the cook made rounds at all the tables, except mine. Big determining factor for whether I would blog about U Samba.

The chicken in the coxhina frango was flavourful yet had a creamy texture. The same was the case with the empada. Although I ordered the empada with cheese, it came with chicken. I really liked the empada, though. The pastel with chicken was my favourite snack. I ordered the estraganofe frango (chicken stroganoff) and got estraganofe carne (beef stroganoff) instead. Rather than show out, I ate all of it and it was surprisingly tasty.

If you're out near Aurora and want to try some Brazilian cuisine, U Samba may be the spot for you. Nice experience, but Aurora feels too "Deep South" for me to return.

Small, but the food is excellent.   Clean, great service and good prices.  The caipirinha was incredible.  My wife and I are definitely going back.  I always like to try new things.  Trust me, GO AND TRY this place.

Got the fried balls sampler for an app. It had 5 different varieties of flavors -I honestly could hardly tell the difference, only liked the ham & cheese one. The rest were honestly not that flavorful and interesting. Ordered the chicken stroganoff. The sauce had decent flavor, but the chicken was tough, dry, & overdone! Ugh. My other party ordered the Bife a rol (steak rolls). The sauce on top was sparing and sadly the only flavorful thing on the plate. I understand Brazilian food isn't spiced like Asian cuisine, but there's an important distinction between good, subtle flavors vs. mild, bland ones. The food was overwhelmingly on the bland side, and table spices aren't enough to cut through it. Customers shouldn't be required to add on hot-hotter peppers to make everything taste better. Dishes are supposed to be flavorful as-is. They're not. 
After 1 beer, 1 juice, 1 app (10 tiny flavorless balls for $10.99) & 2 dishes, the total was over $63. Not in a hurry to pay that much for consistently under-seasoned food.

This was my first experience with Brazilian food, so in all fairness I'm not sure if I don't like Brazilian food or just the food at this cafe. My overall impression, and that of my wife was nothing was particularly flavorful, yet nothing was distasteful. I compared my meal with what I would expect in a very good military chow-hall; it was food.The service was very good, and since I'm not sure of why I didn't care for the food I'll lay down 3 stars. Good luck U Samba Cafe.

I've only had their food delivered so I can't speak for the restaurant itself (it looks kinda small when I've driven past it) but I really enjoyed the foods! Everything I've had has been new to me in one way or another.

I recommend their cheese ball thingies. It's been a while so I don't know the name but they were very tasty.

Mostly everything from here that I had was deep fried and delicious. Order and enjoy!

Wow. This was so flavorful! I hadn't had Brazilian food before so it was fun to try different foods. We started with the coxinhas-a fried potato dough ball filled with chicken-that were delicious. We ordered yucca fries. I love yucca so this were a guaranteed good thing. They come with bacon. Then we moved on to the feijoada--black bean, three meat stew. If there were enough room in my stomach I would have been finished every bit. They came with collard greens and rice. As if that weren't enough--we ordered coffee and what I call flan. It was so creamy and we savored every bite. The coffee was REALLY strong, but that's what I was hoping for.
The staff was so nice and they seemed happy to explain and recommend anything to help us.  The manager told us he has imported all products or gets his contact to ship products from Brazil. 
Try it!

* Service was friendly and attentive
* Authentic
* Freshness/quality good, protein prep needed to be a bit better
* Flavors were OK - no major complaints, but not overly inspired.  A few components of both dishes felt like an afterthought.  

Not every dish needs to be a star, but recommended, or, the 'most expensive on menu' plates should impress.

We really want Samba to do well - very nice ownership, a welcome addition downtown, and we do love central/south american -- but our first experience felt mediocre.  We will give it another try!

This was our first visit to U Samba.  The service was pleasant and attentive, but most important, the food was delicious along with being reasonably priced. The Sampler Small appetizer was perfect for a delectable start. Feijoada for two was more than enough to share, and was a tasty delight. The fried collard greens were a highlight of this dish. Don't forget dessert; we loved the tartness of the passion fruit mousse and Torta de Limao.  This Authentic cuisine in a family-owned local establishment deserves a return visit.

Small Brazilian restaurant in Aurora downtown. Great place to hang with friends or family. It serves typical Brazilian family-favorite dishes, differently from the large and popular Brazilian steakhouses around Chicagoland. I strongly recommend the place for a better taste of Brazilian most traditional dishes. 

We tried the 'coxinha, empanada and bolinho de bacalhau' appetizers (chicken, beef and fish salty fried pastries respectively) and they're very good. Kids also enjoyed having them. For the main entre we had the Full Size 'Feijoada' (stew of beans with pork) which comes served with white rice, colorful bell pepper vinaigrette, sort of green collard with bacon salad and farofa (toasted flour) on the side. The feijoada portion was good for 3 people with all sides included. We'll come back for sure.

Very good appetizers; we've ordered them to go in quantity for parties and hosting at home instead of buying frozen at the grocery.  This is very much a family business so I think the service is very personal - and not at the level of a professional wait staff.  (The red wine was served cold!?)   Prices are very reasonable.  This is not a steak house but I've had the excellent steak sandwich and tried most of the hot sauces and love all of them. Desserts are also excellent.

Went for the for time today and loved it!! I am from Brazil and this food is very authentic. I finally found the perfect place to feel a little bit more at home. Highly recommend it!!
PS: service is also great! Nice family.

What a gem. Homestyle Brazilian food that deliciously reminds us that there's more to Brazilian food than giant steak platters. Coxinhas(chicken croquettes), couva da mina (garlicky sauteed greens), Bobo de camaro (shrimp in a coconut sauce), so delicious, affordable, and flavorful. Transports me to Brasil. I love this place so much and Aurora is so lucky to have it. Obrigada pela comida, U Samba!

My girlfriend and I decided to check this place out one Friday night.  I am glad we did!  Great food, happy and attentive people, hot peppers, delicious desserts...how could you go wrong?!  Worth another trip.

Was excited to try this new place downtown Aurora. We ordered food to go from work. It was delicious!! We tried various things & they were all prepared fresh. The chicken was tender, & the breaded then fried chicken breast was crunchy & not soggy at all. The lime pie was absolutely amazing. Would highly recommend.

This is my favorite restaurant in downtown Aurora. It's great for families and also for a grown-ups' evening out. Every time we've eaten here, the food and service have been outstanding. 

If you go on the weekends, order the feijoada (black bean stew) - it's unbelievably good. The collard greens are so perfect. You also can't go wrong with any of the appetizers. The sampler gives you a taste of some of their more popular appetizers so that you know which ones are your favorites on your next visit (spoiler alert: the ham & cheese churros. Oh my goodness). On their cocktail menu, I've only tried the caipirinha - it's delightful. 

If you are stopping for dinner before a Paramount show, make a reservation and leave plenty of time - when things get busy, the food can take awhile. It's worth the wait!

Just had the pleasure of dining in at U Samba. We were greeted right away and sat quickly. Our server was a delight, answering all of our questions we had since Brazilian food was not something we had tried before. We ordered an appetizer of mini coxinhas, two small orders actually, one savory and one sweet. The bacon and cheese came out first and was amazing. I vowed that even if I didn't like anything else I would return for these. The second was a mix of cheese and a derivative of guava, not two flavors I would normally pair together, but to my surprise they worked so well that I found myself a little sad when the cup the were served in was empty. The main meals (a stuffed gnocchi dish for me and the Steak rolls for my husband) were filling and delicious. I opted to finish the meal with a slice of prestigio cake. Please do yourself a favor and get this cake! It's chocolate with small amount of coconut center. My only downside was that it took me so long to try them. We already know we will be back in the future.

My husband and I went last week for dinner.  Small place, but clean and appealing. Service was attentive and friendly. Ordered beef rolls. Came with fries, rice and beans. I can do without fries. Would rather beans and rice be seasoned and mixed together as they were kind of plain for our tastes. Husband got the special, beef, carrot and onion mixture. His was sort of plain as well and seemed to have been cooked earlier. He felt the same about the fries. My salad was the out of the bag kind....very ordinary with out of the box croutons. Really, i can pass on that! We really wanted to love this place, but...just missed the mark for us. There is just too much competition out there in the restaurant market to be so-so.

Awesome place! The food was great. It exceeded my expectations! The only suggestions that I would have for improvement is that being Brazilian myself, I expected the salad to be served on the same plate as my dinner (I'm being picky)  and that the fries would be like my grandmother made them, freshly cut and pan fried. I also would've loved to hear more recent popular music from Brazil and not the standard Brazilian songs that you hear whenever you go somewhere "Brazilian" in the U.S. I guess it's because I crave the Brazilian connection. The experience itself was like being home again, though, I left the restaurant feeling as if I had gone to visit someone's house. Everyone there was so friendly, that we were even having conversations with other tables.

Will definitely go back there again to try the feijoada and bring my whole family!

Never tried Brazilian food before and it was DELICIOUS!  They have a great selection of food and even give you the option to buy one of of most of their appetizers.

My husband and I got a couple to split and everything we tried was great. Not to mention the staff was incredibly friendly. So excited to have this place open in Aurora.

U Samba Cafe is a nice surprise not far from the Hollywood Casino in Aurora. The ambiance makes you feel very cozily nestled in a small cafe in So Paulo or Rio. We started with Cheese Bread and Fried Polenta. The Cheese Bread was light, but not very exciting. The Polenta was nice and crisp and tasty. For entrees we ordered the Beef Steak with Onions (Bife Acebolado) and the Shrimp Bobo (Bobo de Camarao)  Both were excellent and nicely presented. We finished off with Prestigio Cake ( Chocolate Coconut) and Passion Fruit Mousse, as well as chocolate and coconut Bon-bons. All were great!  We had Guarana Antarcticas to drink to top it all off. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive and the chef/owner came around and asked about our meal (thankfully one of us spoke Portuguese!!). Great night that brought back sweet memories of Brazil. We want to come back and try some of the other dishes. Overall, a nice culinary adventure.
What a nice surprise! We were traveling through and stopped for dinner. Had some great, authentic food, be sure to try the peppers!

Very good! Nice family run business, food was great, clean atmosphere & friendly. 
Only minor complaint is the limited menu options, but what they do offer is great! Will definitely come back

Having visited Brazil, I can attest to the authenticity of the food and drinks here. It's wonderful to get Brazilian food in my city! Try all the appetizers, the grilled chicken, and the desserts. On the weekend, get the fejouada, a stew of pork and black beans with farofa and rice. Delicious!!! As an added bonus, it's a cute, clean restaurant run by a friendly family who will teach you some words in Portuguese!

Awesome authentic Brazilian food, great service and good price! What else can you ask for?
Must try, deliciosa comida!!!!!

What I liked:
Gnocchi was soft and delicious
The rolled steak was flavorful and the sauce was delicious 
The sangria was strong and flavorful
The special naranha drink was delicious
The server was friendly and helpful  
The placemats are colorful
The hats the servers wear are perfect for the concept
Collard greens were very tasty

What I disliked:
The door opens directly to the small dining room- freezing out everyone 
The motion detector light at the front   
Kept flashing on and off
The dinner napkins are small and speak loudly to very cheap and not functional.
The salad is ugly lettuce and supermarket croutons. The dressing is served on the side in the smallest ramekin I have ever seen- half ounce?
 No specialty dressing? Like a brazilian?
No just stuff like casear, ranch, blue cheese. 
The appetizer sampler was just edible
Twice the manager tried to deliver
food to the wrong table

Summary:
Convenient to the paramount theater
Hoped for specialty brazilian- found 
Mediocre concept confusion.
Tried it.
Won't be back

I was so excited.  Something new and interesting in Aurora.  Everyone was nice. The place was decorated appropriately. Some of the table items were cheap, but I get that.  Invest in the food.  WE came for the food.  Lots of listed appetizers. Unfortunately, one of the traditional items (pao de queijo pequeno) , they are out of.  It's cheese bread. How are you out of cheese bread?  Ok.. fine. We got the kibe and coxinhas (beef and chicken stuffed croquettes). They came with a side of chopped peppers in vinaigrette. The only thing that helped them from being a bland lump of fried dough were the peppers.  The two most interesting looking entrees are only offered on the weekends, so we choose the bife a role (steak roll with carrot and bacon) and the breaded fish.  Everything came with a pile of plain white rice, a bowl of bland beans, unseasoned fries, and a salad (iceberg lettuce with a few tomato pieces) 
It was all so very bland. No spark at all. So much looked like cutting corners. Everything was edible. It was ok.  But we won't be going back.
A brand new restaurant that felt like it was the last week open.
$35 was a high price for what we got.

A casual, reasonably priced family restaurant. I committed the resturant mortal sin by walking in 12 minutes before close on a Friday night and they were so sweet and received me like I was family. Really sweet Brazilian family. Since I have Celiac, my options were limited but I ordered the Espeto de Xixo, a mignon kabob with bacon and veggies. Oh man, the bomb.com. Def coming back with friends.

First experience with Brazilian food and it is delicious.  They have many small appetizers that are very good, you could easily just eat a dozen of them and call it a meal.  I've been there twice now - 1st time for the Friday & Weekend Special Feijoado which was very good, I especially liked the pepper/vinegar salsa that comes with it.  2nd time I had the unstuffed gnocchi, also very good but a little disappointing that it doesn't come with anything besides gnocchi (like bread or side salad).  
I think a lunch menu would be a welcome addition.  Still new so only a dinner menu - which means dinner prices at lunch hours.  Also, wine or booze of any type would be good.  A frosty brew with Feijoado would fit right in.

What a fantastic and exotic cuisine. My only knowledge of Brazilian cuisine is  the Brazilian steak house where you feast on meat after meat after roasted meat.  U Samba cafe explores southern Brazilian cuisine with luxurious sauces, melt in your mouth stuffed gnocchi with Italian roots and black bean and pork stew, only available on weekends, with a rich and complex sauce.  The owners are eager to share their cultural knowledge of what they cook and are helpful in navigating the menu.  Definitely save room for dessert. The flan slowly dissolves in your mouth in a creamy stream and the lemon pie is creamy and just a little tart to accentuate the citrus flavor. We will return to try other menu items in the near future.

I tried Feijoada for the first time at USamba today  and I must say it is one of he best I've ever had.   Congratulations to the chef!!!  Elaine (the owner) put me into Lemon Dessert -  it is my favorite now.  Wonderful atmosphere!   They make you feel at home.

This is a completely charming small restaurant in downtown Aurora.  The food was wonderful and quite authentic.   We had the Feijoada--which tasted just as good as we remembered from trips to Rio.  The lime pie was hit and the sangria and the caipirinha hit just the right notes.   The personal service by the family also felt very Brazilian--full of humor and warmth.

The cafe has really brought Brazilian home cooking to Aurora. I've eaten here 3 times already, the food is absolutely delicious and cooked with love. The wait staff is always welcoming and extremely attentive.

So happy to see a new restaurant open up in this location!!  I was very sad to see the Comfort Zone close down, so this will help us get over their loss.  

First off, if you are thinking this will be similar to Mexican food, or those weird Brazilian steak on a stick places, you are in the wrong place.  U Samba has very traditional Brazilian dishes, and a very cozy, family feeling, probably because it is staffed with the chef's family members!  This cuisine leans on the side of comfort food.

My wife and I were celebrating my birthday and decided to go with 3 of our friends, and we were able to try a few more things that way.  We started with some appetizers: risole (kind of like a steamed bun with ground beef, but lightly fried), coxinha (similar to the risole, but with shredded and seasoned chicken, almost like a dumpling filled with chicken soup flavor!), and yucca fries with bacon.  All of them were terrific and got our mouths watering.  

Once again, if you are thinking really powerful or spicy flavors, this is not that.  This is more like comfort food.  

For the entree my wife and I split one of their weekend specials, the Feijoado (Brazilian Black Bean Stew with 4 different meats). If you've ever had a french cassoulet with duck confit, it's kind of like that, but with different kinds of pork, instead.  It's a rich blend of black beans, black sausage, pork, and seasonings, served with white rice to pour it over, a lovely and refreshing "vinegrette" that was more like a dice of veggies in vinegar, which helped cut through the richness, and a side of a chiffonade of collard greens lightly sauteed with bacon, and a bowl of powdered seasoning with bacon bits to sprinkle over the dish (which we ended up putting on everything, using it like bacon fairy dust that made everything taste better!!).  It was wonderful!!!!  Hearty and flavorful, but not too rich.  This is like the food my old chefs used to reminisce about, the kind of food that gets people into cooking in the first place.   But make sure you go on the weekends for that dish, as it is only available then as it takes longer to prepare, much like cassoulet.  FYI, we split the 1/2 order, so make sure you get your portion size right.....we also had just a little bit left over to take home! :)

We also tried our friends' dishes of stuffed gnocchi (typically thought of as a traditional Italian dish), potato dumplings stuffed with white cheese served in a creamy tomato sauce - DELICIOUS. I love gnocchi, and it's great to have a place close by to get it freshly made!!  Our other friend is a little less adventurous with his pallette and went with the breaded and fried chicken breast plate, which he was very happy with and enjoyed.

I was also able to try their Guarana Antarctica, which is a traditional Brazilian soda. It was very refreshing and tasted a little bit like ginger ale, but sweeter.  

For dessert we had to try a few things, as well, as one must do when celebrating their birth.  We went with the chocolate bonbons, which were VERY rich and gooey, almost like a cross between fudge and icing.  We tried the Brazilian milk pudding (think flan), which was delightful and also rich when paired with a decadent syrup.  The coconut bonbons were enjoyed around the table, and our Puerto Rican friend commented that they reminded him of something he grew up with.  I think everyone's favorite, though, was the lemon pie, which ate like a key lime style pie. 

Overall we very pleased with our meal. The price is right, around $25-35 for two people with sodas, apps, entree and dessert!!  The young boy who brought our sodas was a bit timid, and the servers may need some practice and fine tuning, so don't expect 3-star service, but it is a genuine family restaurant vibe that is very friendly, inviting, cheerful and accepting, and the food is just as comforting.

This place is a Do-Over!  Again, again and again!  I wasn't expecting much, so walking in I was pleasantly surprised to see the diversity of the clientele and the quaintness of the restaurant. The staff was friendly and very attentive.  I had the Bife a role and was very pleased with the flavor and tenderness of the steak. The husband had the Feijoada and was very impressed with it.  Neither of us had ever tried collard greens and now we are definite fans of it. For desert we shared the Brigadeiro de colher (Brazilian hot chocolate) and I can't get it out of my head!  It was also nice to know that they have a quick menu for those who have theater plans. Loved the food, staff and atmosphere...yes, I do recommend this place. We will be retuning soon!
Great food and a very friendly staff!! It is definitely an awesome culture to experience!!

They take reservations. Very helpful wait staff, took extra time explaining all the items on the menu. Great home cooking, i.e. comfort food Brazilian style. Cook/owner came out and interacted with all of the tables. Great experience. We will be going back.
Everything was amazing! The food was all so fresh and perfectly cooked. The weekend specials are delicious

We loved this place!  Enjoyed a couple of appetizers and the special for the evening, beef stroganoff.
