I wondered how stroganoff would be Brazillian, but I didn't have to be concerned . . it was simply delicious.  So pleased we have this offering in Aurora.  The coffee is to die for, and coupled with the lemon pie . .perfection!  Look forward to future visits!  Oh . . and the decor is adorable . . used to go to Comfort Zone, and you wouldn't know it was the same place.  The owners are delightful and so accommodating.

Never having tried Brazilian food before I have nothing to compare this to, but the food was really good. I would best describe it as comfort food. I had this beef roll thing that was rolled beef filled with different vegetables with a sauce, kind of reminded me of a beef stew. The portions were generous, and the prices were definitely reasonable, came with a salad, fries and beans. I would also add that the service was great and more than accommodating. I would definitely recommend trying this place out if you're looking for a good, casual meal. I'll definitely be going back and trying more.

U samba? Was very good, the chicken and beef croquets were fantastic. I wish it was open at 3am cause I would be stopping there after a night of drinking and get some of the chicken ones haha. The Brazilian soft chocolate is something that will satisfy all your fat kid fantasies. 

Just a disclaimer for all the ignoramuses ; this is not a Mexican restaurant so don't expect the same flavors!

I was very excited when I found out that there was a new Brazilian restaurant in town.  The restaurant itself is very clean and the food is more like family style, and tasted very good. The food was not salty at all, in fact it was right on.  The portions were large enough and the price was very fair.  The owners were super nice and friendly, it was a pleasure to eat there. I certainly will be returning.

A really wonderful addition to the Fox Valley restaurant scene.  We went there for lunch today and everything was terrific! So very fresh and flavorful.  We split a assorted appetizer plate: kibbe (seasoned ground beef meatball type thing), coxinha (chicken in a mashed potato crust), and Pastel (a cheese filled pastry).  All 3 were great, though the coxinha was my favorite.  We also had the steak sandwich and grilled chicken sandwich.  Again, extremely fresh and well seasoned on a delicious brazilian bread roll.  Super nice staff and owner.  Will definitely be coming back
Stopped here for lunch. The food was DELICIOUS! Had the stuffed gnocchi. Be sure to sample from the wide variety of appetizers. This restaurant is an awesome addition to downtown Aurora.
Great  food have to go back.  What a great new place in Aurora.  A nice change  from all the taco places in Aurora.

The Food needs a lot of work, a friend and I waited far  too long and nothing was seasoned or salted. The desert was not what I expected, and was kind of let down. The service was really chaotic and things on my bill were a little jumbled. My server was very sweet, young brunette girl 16 ~ 17 maybe. She WAS very accommodating and sweet. But as for the place it was clean and had super nice decorations. But I went for some good Brasilian food with my friend was pretty disappointed along with me. :(

Of course you can be like everyone else and get your Honeybaked ham for Easter or Christmas...but I have discovered the joys of their year-round lunch counter and there's no turning back! Get that sweet and savory ham (or turkey!) on a fresh, fluffy croissant, or how about marble rye bread! No need to wait til the holidays!!

If you don't want a sandwich but a whole ham is too big of an investment they sell ham by the slice, packaged in the refrigerated area. A good option for a fancy meal if you don't feel like cooking. 

Any time is a great time to ham it up with Honeybaked!

This HoneyBaked Ham is located in a strip mall. The place is kinda small, but great to stop in for lunch. This location is open year-round.

There are individual entrees you can purchase, or family entrees to take home. They also sell some of their own products like mustards, sauces, and soup mixes (the pea soup mix is SO good!). Their take home hams are super yummy too - it's their specialty, after all.

This place is an excellent option to pick up a full family meal if you don't want to cook for Easter, Thanksgiving, or an ordinary weeknight!

I really like this place! It's a tiny store in a sort of easy to miss location, in the strip mall that houses Schmaltz's Deli and Mario Tricoci. 

I've come here twice for Thanksgiving food. I always have a Thanksgiving potluck for my staff at work, but Turkey Day dinner is too much work to cool twice, so I take the easy route and get food here. Note I don't say CHEAP, just easy - this year I bought two turkey breasts (one smoked, one roasted), a container of gravy, a container of stuffing, and two bags of rolls and it was 75ish bucks. Steep. But the turkey is so moist and incredibly delicious, especially the smoked one. The sides taste relatively good for being frozen. The rolls were fresh. And I didn't have to do a damn bit of it myself.

The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and I will continue to come here and shell out maybe a little more cash than I would like to get delicious food I don't have to cook!

Go figure, I have reviewed this place and updated it, only to find my reviews have totally disappeared.

So, I will try again.  I looooooooooooooove  Honey Baked hams.  Now you can purchase small prepackaged slices of ham, both boneless and traditional.  I find by doing that I do not waste a whole lot of ham.  Perfect for just 2.  They also have slices of both kinds of turkey.  The packaging can also be used to freeze any you might have left over.

With expiration dates into 2015, I was able to buy sweet potato souffle for the holidays.  They also shared that they are coming out with 3 new sides in time for the holidays.  So, I may just have to risk an incredibly long line just to try the new sides.

I have also discovered their delicious BBQ sauces.  I was shocked at just how good they are.  The ribs are fall off the bone, juicy, and tasty.  20 minutes in the oven, purchase a couple of sides, and dinner is served.

So, you can go to buy ham, turkey, ribs, side dishes, sauces, desserts, and sandwiches.  Everything covered?
Disappointing. There is an unpleasant odor when you walk in. I should have walked out then. I ordered a ham sandwich. The ham was very dry. I won't go back to this location.
Excellent ham sandwiches! We had (free) coupons, but they never hesitated to accept it. A bit on the smaller size, but tasty!

Can't beat the ham and the convenience of them cooking it for you. You just have to let it thaw. Only complaint is the line. If you are going to pick up your ham for Thanksgiving or Christmas or Christmas Eve, make sure you pick it up 2 or 3 days before or else you'll be stuck in line for up to an hour.

What happened? 
This store used to be a great catering choice for my company. Everyone loved the ham pasta salad, which we ordered as a side for our sandwiches. The last time we ordered, that was gone and replaced with an oily pasta salad. Ok, things change. This time, we received our catering with each sandwich in a separate bag, double knotted. Do you know how long it takes to undo 20 bags to be set out? And we ordered a pasta and potato salad side. No utensils or serving spoons. We also ordered a dessert tray. Half of it was crumbled, the heavy cookies were on top of the lemon bars ... etc. Horrible. 
What happened?

We stopped in to pick up a couple of sandwiches.  This was late on a Saturday.  It looked like the store was about to close for the day.  We were told we could get the sandwiches made any way we wanted.  The bread was still fresh (even at the end of the day).  We got a classic ham and a roasted turkey sandwich.  The turkey could have used a little more mayo but otherwise the sandwiches were good.

FABULOUS!!!

Started with the Jalapeno Bombs appetizer - tempura fried Jalapeno stuffed with spicy tuna and cream cheese - out of this world delicious!!! And don't worry, it's really not that hot.

Dancing Eel Makimono - BBQ Eel, avocado, tempura shrimp, cream cheese, kanpyo gourd, mango sauce, unagi sauce, unagi sauce & spicy mayo - to die for!!!

Drunken salmon - smoked salmon. Fresh salmon, ikura salmon roe, tropical mango, cream cheese, daikon sprouts, sweet onion & mayo - great!!!

California Maki

Philadelphia Maki

Una-Q

Loved it all! 

Great service!!!

I used to live in Boulder Hill (right near the shopping center where this is located), so I was stoked when this place popped up. Loved have sushi nearby--scratch that not just sushi, but SUSHI DELIVERY near me. Score!

I mostly have gotten rolls off the menu, since that's my main preference. Had pretty much all the standard fare, plus 1-2 special ones we try each time we go. Everything is pretty good. It's not my very favorite, but they hold their weight.

Other than sushi, I always get a miso soup and if with a group we get the Gyoza a lot- both are tasty.

Service-wise, sometimes it's really slow to get sat. Even if there are open tables sometimes there will be 1-2 employees standing around, but not playing host/hostess. It can be a little frustrating. But, once you get a table, the service is usually quite acceptable.

We live in Plainfield now, but we still head out that way every few months to eat there, so it does have a good draw.

My friend and I came here for lunch at 3pm on a Sunday. It was empty which was nice. I really like the decor and they made the benches festive with pillows. 

I ordered a few things

-Edamame- Very fresh and delicious with the right amount of salt
-Plain Fried Rice- The rice alone was ok but it came with this sauce that made it great 
-California Roll- These were ok but not great, the reason for the 1 star deduction. 
-Caterpillar Roll- Amazing, perfect, I loved it. 

Overall good experience! Would go back!

The sushi at Sakamoto is good but not my favorite.  One thing I've noticed is that the average rating for a non-chain restaurant in the far north, south, or west suburbs, is significantly higher than if you put the establishment in a more established area.  So, for Oswego, Sakamoto is probably in the top 10 non-chain restaurants in the area.  But when I factor in the poor service, uncomfortable seating, and food, it's A-OK and nothing more.

The decor is trendy and the setting is intimate.  The tables are uncomfortably close to each other in this tiny space, which was very busy on a Saturday evening.  When we walked in, I noticed a few 4-top tables near the window.  It was not as crowded in that section, so I asked if we could be seated over there.  The hostess (think Linda Yu in white go-go boots) was snippy and said it was "reserved."  Regardless of the table's status, why the attitude?  We were then wedged into a table next to another couple.  We didn't talk much during our meal; who can be relaxed and have any sort of banter when you're practically cuddling with strangers?

If I had to, I'd return during a less busy period and hope for a table where I'm not literally rubbing elbows with strangers.

We ordered several rolls (below).  They were all good, and honestly I would want to come back here if I had a sushi craving since it's fairly close to home.  

Spicy Crunchy White Tuna --- This was not spicy at all.  :(
Phoenix (spicy salmon, tuna)
Green Turtle (with avocado and mango)
Paradise (salmon, tuna, red snapper)

I don't mind driving a little bit out of my way for something I really like.  That being said, I can see why locals like this place.  In an area saturated by chain restaurants and tacquerias, Sakamoto is a welcome addition.  

Say what you want, call me a snob, but I would rather make the trek to another nearby suburb (or the city) for excellent sushi in a more comfortable environment.
The rolls and the wudon soup was good. Taste was just as most Japanese restaurants. Didn't see anything special.

I have eaten at this restaurant many times and while the food is always pretty good (while its not the best quality in the area), the service is normally OK at best...but today it was exceptionally bad. It was a Saturday so it was pretty busy. Upon arriving, the hostess just stared blankly at us. She walked away and didnt come back out for a few minutes. She whispered that it would be a long wait and left us standing in confusion. Fast forward to the meal. When our food was prepared, the chefs set it on the glass counter. There it sat for over 20 minutes as our server neglected to pick it up and deliver it. Definitely will be avoiding this place until this staff is turned over.

I hate when the few negative reviews are the accurate ones.  Snotty hostess, sub par food.  It's almost as if they weren't sushi chefs at all.  The rice was not sushi rice, the rolls were extremely loose, and the flavors were just off.  Nothing was bad but I can get better quality in the end cap at jewel.  Clearly all these 5 star reviews don't know what quality sushi tastes like.  Our order was $100.  The hostess acted like we were some hobos off the street begging for water.  I'm contemplating declining the charges I'm so upset about the whole experience.   My son is recovering from surgery and all he wanted was sushi.  This really ruined it.

This is our go to sushi place in the Oswego area. The service has always been polite and efficient.

It's even better now that the nail place next door moved out and I no longer have to breathe in chemicals with my rolls.

Sushi has always been fresh and the miso soup is delicious! They have several rolls made with mango and they are very refreshing.

One of the worse customer service I ever experienced. Went in and ordered take out tonight and the owner act like she was doing me a favor by taking my order. When I went back in to pick up my order she just looks at me goes to the back and bring out a brown paper bag hands it to me and walks away. All this without saying one word to me!! Good customer service goes a long way and she has LOTS to learn! When I went home my mother said that was the reason she stopped going to this restaurant. I had no idea. First and last for me! And the dish I had was not good at all (salmon dinner). No flavor just was not seasoned at all.

I was extremely disappointed in my service.  I asked for a refill on my drink and was refused by the Manager because it was too late.  Mind you the waitress never came by to ask me for a refill.  my glass was empty for 30 minutes.

The quality of the food was so so.  

i also felt the staff was really rude.  I wouldn't give them my money.

there are plenty of good sushi places in the area who are much more friendly.
Absolutely delicious. My husband and I love sushi and make it a goal to try as many places as we can. This is going to our top 5. Not to mention the waitress has beautiful eyes
best japanese food I have had in the entire area!  we love to come here for the sushi and the hot food too!  My go to when I just need sushi

Love this place! Favorites are Red Zebra roll and White Dragon roll. 

My favorite appetizer is the philly crab egg roll. 

Always phenomenal service, great food.
The go-to sushi restaurant in Oswego, and because of that I've pretty much tried every roll they make and like them all. Super fresh food, friendly staff, and cool interior.

We're done trying with this place. We typically do carry out. They used to deliver, but that isn't an option with their new menu. The teriyaki chicken we ordered came to us hibachi style with no flavor. It was chewy and gross and a lot of tendons, so it definitely wasn't a breast. We added a side of teriyaki steak for $5, and got 4 pieces of meat. We asked for extra teriyaki sauce and got soy sauce. The California roll was hot, and the avocado very mushy. Not fresh tasting at all. We've had problems with the quality of this place going down over the last year, but I think we're done. It was nice to have good Japanese food that delivered. Now it's mediocre (at best!) pickup. We're halfway between this place and domo, so if I need to do pickup, I'll just go there. Very disappointed!

My husband and I discovered this wonderful little sushi restaurant in Oswego today. It's in a strip mall in the out lot by the Home Depot. Not much from the outside, but once we entered, we knew we found a neighborhood gem. The restaurant is nicely decorated, very clean and quiet...I'd say a trendy space where you can actually enjoy a dinner conversation.  Our server Megan was very friendly and attentive. We started with shrimp tempura and miso soup. The tempura was so light and flaky. The only negative from my whole dining experience here is that there were just three shrimp tempura in this appetizer. I thought that was a little too skimpy, 4-5 yes, but three just seemed a little too little. The miso soup was flavorful and a good size.  My husband and I shared two specialty maki and two regular maki, Red Zebra, Dancing Eel, Alaskan and Spicy Crunchy White Tuna. These rolls were presented beautifully and artistically with rose petals and a fruit carving. The fish was extremely fresh and the flavors just exploded in my mouth. I savored every bite. I highly recommend the Red Zebra with spicy tuna, yellowfin tuna, super white tuna with unagi sauce and tobiko (fish roe) and the Dancing Eel with bbq eel, tempura shrimp, avocado, cream cheese with a mango sauce, unagi sauce and a spicy mayo. Both of these rolls were outstanding.  Our first dining experience here was so wonderful that we determined this little place surpasses Kiku in Naperville and Chef Soon in Woodridge.  Sakamoto IS that good!

I'm a vegetarian and I love this place! They have a nice selection of vegetarian options. I love that I can order online. I work right down the road , when I get off They have it ready for me and I take  it home to eat.

I'm traveling for work by myself so I figured I'd try something different and review as I dine, so here goes!

I found this little gem in a strip mall nestled among all the corporate giants and food chains.  Don't judge a book by the cover because the whole in the wall look from the outside is actually very warm and welcoming on the inside.  

The sushi menu is large, and the first thing I looked at caught my eye and I ended up ordering it.  The "smokey samurai" has smoked salmon, fresh crab, cream cheese, and avocado wrapped in rice and fried in tempura batter.   It's then topped with snow crab, two sauces, and bonito flakes.   When it's served, the flakes actually move almost like their alive.  It's really cool!  The roll was delish, the combo of sauce leaving almost a spicy bbq flavor lingering in my mouth.  Really tasty, cooked very well, and served beautifully.  I also had the house miso soup and it was also very good.  Nice balance of flavor and good fresh tofu.  

At this point I was pretty full, but the very helpful and friendly waitress offered desert.  Banana tempura with vanilla and coffee ice cream.  Sold!  This thing was huge!  The banana was the hero, as it should be.  A nice ending indeed.  

 I almost hope I end up staying in this hotel again at some point so I can come back here and try more food!  If you find yourself in the area check this place out, it's earned it's high rating.
Great sushi. Awesome lunch special. Always worth it.

Food was good, music kinda loud. Waitress seemed to take forever to get payment. Random blonde sitting at desk by entrance, assumed was employee but didnt do anything, didnt greet, didnt seat, didnt accept payment, didnt serve. Why was she there watching people, kinda frustrating to be watched but not helped when waiting to pay check.

Fresh sushi. Fave is godzilla. I like to ask for no fish eggs though. Personal preference. The fried rice is delicious and full of flavor. Always friendly service. My husband never thought he would like sushi and he craves Sakamoto all the time. They have a few things for kid's too if they don't like sushi.

I used to order or eat from here at least twice a month and was never disappointed with quality of food. However they are supposed to be a delivery as well as pick up and have it on their store doors and website yet have no delivery drivers anymore. So when you place delivery order, they actually call and say you need to pick up. They give you a rehearsed speech as to why they can't deliver because no one wants the position and they tell you they have had a hiring sign up for a month with no luck. Sorry but not sorry, if you say delivery on website and on ur store door you must deliver to your customers. No longer a customer now
In the neighborhood, so we go for date night every once in awhile.  Great decor and relaxed ambiance.  Excellent sushi and bento boxes.  We love the miso soup and salad.Great service.

Absolutely delicious! Everything I have ordered from here has been excellent. Took my kids for hibachi and the filet was tender, not chewy. Fried rice was excellent! ! We did the vegetable one ad there were tons of veggies. Love it!!

Completely unexpected, quality sushi joint with a quiet clean atmosphere. The location is almost secretive and it's just begging for traffic driven by word of mouth when discussing nearby "good sushi".

Typical loaded rolls with sensational naming conventions but quality and taste reign supreme - surprisingly good.

In the retail jungle off 34 get some good sushi.

My favorite sushi spot and close to home! Always great attentive service. Sushi always tasty, we can put it down. I love salmon dream! There miso soup is tasty on a cold day. Decent prices as well as far as sushi goes. I feel like i'm there at least once a month! Try it out.

I have only ordered take out but I love this place so much!  Every roll I've had was wonderful. Their vegetable egg rolls are delicious and come with a really yummy sauce. When they package everything for take out its so cute and neat! Highly recommend the mango roll!

Meh.  Below average sushi, average service, price not commensurate with quality.  If you like over-priced low quality fish, way too much rice, and prefer over-sauced rolls then this is the place for you.

Very good sushi! The food presentation is very special. I had the sashimi deluxe and could not believe how nicely it was presented. Very creative. Good service and nice ambience. I will be definitely coming back.

The sushi at this place was alright but priced VERY well for the quantity you get.  I've definitely had better flavors in places around Chicago. (4 stars)
However the nail salon next door vents fumes into the restaurant so the dining experience was spoiled by this. (minus 1 star)
We still come here a lot and this place still is great.  James is a terrific sushi chef.
Very fresh sushi and their teriyaki chicken is great too.

Love this place, date nights always end up at Sakamoto sitting buy the sushi bar. Always get the teriyaki chicken, shrimp or scallops so I really can't recommend anything else. But we always watch the sushi platters go past us and they all look delicious (and look like artwork).
I never liked Sushi, Until this place. Great food, great atmosphere, servers are friendly and knowledgeable. Earned a life customer.

I ordered the filet mignon center cut which was cooked PERFECTLY.  The steak itself was simple, just salt from what I could tell, but it was cooked so well and the meat was very tender and soft.  The mushrooms were a great accompaniment to the steak, and the fried rice was delicious. 

I would definitely go back for the steak alone.  One of the better cuts I've had in the area especially for the $24 price point.

I have tried this sushi place once and loved it! Some sushi is just alright and very few actually taste super yummy, well this is one of them!

I had gotten out of night class a bit earlier so I called as soon as I could to place a pick up order. I had 20 minutes before closing and they made it happen. I was very happy because I thought it might be too late, and it took me 15 minutes just to get there. 

When I arrived my food was all ready, I literally walked in, paid, walked out. Super fast. 

Upon opening my meal it looked very tasty, wonderful presentation and the flavor were good. I ordered a version of the rainbow roll and shrimp tempura. I will certainly be going back to this place for more.

Yelp comes through once again!  Great little sushi place with a creative attitude. Seeing that it was a popular place, we made reservations for 6p; however, that didn't turn out to be completely necessary. We were promptly greeted, taken to our seats, and drink orders taken. Our edamame came out fast, as did our rolls. We had the Firecracker, Smokey Samurai, Tropical Tuna, one I forgot, a spicy veggie, and a mango veggie. Yeah, we went a little overboard, but it was oh so good. Great service, presentation, and they even offered us a military discount. What's not to love?  If you like creative sushi rolls, this is your place. Thanks to Sakamoto for supporting our military!

This is really the only choice for sushi in the Oswego area & its not half bad! We were seated quickly but after a long wait, our server finally took our order. I got the 2-roll lunch special which included soup or salad and 2 rolls from a list of about 18 for $12.99.
I opted for the miso soup which was very good! My girlfriends both got the salad but I was unimpressed that both bowls came out messy, with dressing dripping down the side. For my rolls I ordered the spicy crunchy (tuna) roll & the shrimp tempura roll. When they came out the server did not explain to us which rolls were which, as is customary. Both rolls were yummy and fresh but nothing to write home about. When were finished our server boxed up our leftovers and even gave us extra salmon & spicy mayo upon request!
One other thing: the sushi chefs were working at a counter not too far from us and the constant sound of the knife hitting the cutting board (chop, chop, chop) got annoying. I could understand if they were doing it for spectators to enjoy but it was behind a counter. Very bothersome during lunch conversation!

This place exceeded my expectations! Bf and I went here on a random friday night. No special occasion, we just wanted sushi. We ordered drinks- i got the mango mojito (pretty good) he got some sort of "special" tea. We also ordered an app- the veggie egg rolls which were tiny! But delish. For dinner I got shrimp habachi which was good, brown rice wasn't the greatest. The shrimp was excellent. Bf got sushi- california rolls and another one with some sort of mango sauce which was amazing! He said the sushi here was the best he ever had!! 
What made this visit special was our server, Christina. She asked for my ID when I ordered my drink & noticed that my birthday was last Monday. At the end of our dinner she surprised me with a complimentary ice cream sundae complete with a birthday candle! I was so excited, especially because we didn't even come to celebrate my birthday. It was unexpected and totally awesome of her to go out of her way to do that!! It's little things like that make a restaurant experience extraordinary. We will definitely return soon :)

Sakamoto is my favorite local place to go. It's small, but the interior is always decorated nicely and clean. I love their spicy crab egg roll for an appetizer. We try something new every time we go, but you can't go wrong with their shrimp tempura roll and crunchy California roll. I love their unique specialty rolls as well. Make sure to order a glass of wine because the prices are reasonable and the servicing nice is generous. I always recommend ordering a couple different rolls and sharing it with whoever you're with.

The sushi fish itsef......not very flavorful.
Also, things are covered in dripping sauces,..........eeew. WAY too much. And, you should let the diner add that final topping as needed.

Ingredients in the rolls seem to have been sitting around a long time, awaiting assembly as needed. Pot stickers were really greasy. And the doug was thick, almost pierogi-like.

 Fried rice was cheap tasting; like a cheap chinese restaurant. This was americanized corrupted "asian" food......trying to appeal to the everyman/blue collar worker.  The place is laid out poorly and makes it seemed more cramped than typical sushi/urban seatings where its common for people to be close together, the floorplan doesn't make this situation OK. Its not the right layout.
Got the sashimi 15 piece special. Fish was delicious and fresh. Wonderful presentation!

Awesome, which is shocking considering it is in Oswego. Step away from Friday's and the Olive Garden and get some real food instead of some chain restaurant garbage. I've been here at least a dozen times and the service is just as on point as all of their menu items.
This place was absolutely amazing.  Everything was very delicious.  The service was fantastic as well.  I will definitely be eating here again before I head home.

I went here with my kids... This is NOT a kids place. I kinda felt like I walked into a small town bar and was from out of town... I'm pretty sure the music stopped. That said, they do have a kids menu, so take it as you will...

I love Sushi places, this one was just okay. It was fresh and all but the prices were very high and the portions lacking compared to others. Again, it was not bad, but it was not great. The host and server argued when we came in over where to seat us for about 30 seconds before acknowledging our group. This was also a kids issue I think.

Here is my BIG Gripe, the place smells a lot like a nail salon since they are next to one and I think share the air system.  This gave me a nice headache. 

If you go, get takeout... Or go someplace else if you can find it.

This is our favorite sushi restaurant in the Oswego/Montgomery/ Yorkville area. We go regularly and they know us by now. We usually get served our favorite drinks right after being seating. Haven't had a bad experience, long wait, or mediocre food yet!

Oswego is generally plagued with a dismal selection of corporate chain restaurants....Sakamoto is a total prize in the jungle of lame eateries surrounding it. By far the best, freshest and most visually appealing sushi in this area. The inventiveness of the rolls here is awesome not to mention the care that is taken in the presentation. My only gripe is that I was served a mixed drink with flat soda which I returned. The food and service soon made me forget about this small oversight. 

It's a super small place yet pretty hip for the area and very comfortable inside. One real plus is that they do indeed have a kids menu as well if you bring the kids with you. That's always good. 

The rolls aren't inexpensive as most of the ones we had were like 14-16 bucks a piece but the quality was there so well worth it. Can't wait to head back soon!!

Amazing, I love this joint! 

Mexican, Godzilla are probably my favorite rolled sushi. All sashimi is delicious. Hibachi and teriyaki dishes are great! The hibachi fried rice has this smokey, awesome flavor. Definitely my go to sushi joint? 5 Stars!!!!

It is so hard to find great sushi in the suburbs. This place was the best!
They have all the Japanese beers available (Sapporo, Ichiban and Asahi) and plenty of Sushi rolls to choose from.
Everything was really fresh and the staff was great (very adept, communicate well, and knowledgable of their menu)

If putting wasabi in my soy sauce is wrong, then I don't wanna be right. Alright let's be honest, I've came here 4 times I think and everything you walk in, there's this lady with a dead looking expression on her face.  I mean you don't have to jump for joy when your customers walk in but at least smile a lil bit. The waitresses are always the best though. Excellent customer service everytime, although they do happen to manage to ask me how everything is, everytime that I had a mouth full of sushi lol. It's all good though.  I haven't tried everything from the menu yet but everything I've tried do far has been great. Come through just don't expect a smile when you come through the door.

I and my family will never go here again.  Ever.

Arrived at 4:30 pm on a Friday.  Stood at the door with my daughter.  Asian woman with deadpan face across the room asks how many in our party.  She turns to get the menus.  Turns back and looks past me out the door it seems.  We wait for her to tell us to follow her.  She continues to look past me and then at the dining room and then past me again.  She walks a few steps into the dining area looking around.  We wait to be asked to follow.  She finally looks at me raises her shoulders and twists her face into an irritated look.  If you can imagine "WTF!" translated into a physical motion, you know what she did.  I turned around and left.

Here I was about to drop $100-$150 on dinner for three and an owner of the business (I am assuming she was an owner) effectively says "WTF!" when we failed to telepathically understand we were to follow her.  I won't be treated that way anywhere I go.

It's a shame, because we only live 2 miles away, regularly eat sushi, and we had been here 2-3 times before.  The person seating us has always been noteworthy for their lack of polite customer engagement (notably so) but, previously, it was just the deadpan look, not the rude attitude.  And no, I can't confirm if it was always the same person doing the seating.

The sushi has been ok in the past, no complaints.  So, if you do decide to go and risk being treated like dirt, you'll probably have a fine time.   Typically, the person who has sat us was not the person who waited on us.  The waitresses themselves have always been nice.

But good sushi and nice waitresses do not trump knowing my money is going to someone so rude.

On the other hand, the people at Kiku's recognize us on arrival and have always offered a welcoming greeting.  I'm not saying Kiku's is always perfect, but we've been going there regularly now for 8 years and except for the high cost of sushi we'd gladly eat there 3-5 times a week.  Another good place we've eaten sushi was Moshi Moshi.  We've gone to every sushi place around this area.  All of them have been at least ok, just Kiku's and Moshi Moshi stood out for us.  But can't recommend anyone be treated like this at Sakamoto.
Just moved from Chicago to the burbs and Sakamoto lived up to reviews. It rivals any neighborhood sushi place in the city. Creative rolls, great ambiance and pleasant service.

We love this quaint neighborhood restaurant. Not only do they have amazing food but the service is always EXCELLENT. I debated writing a review because it only has about 10 little tables and I don't want my secret spot to blow up.... but they deserve the positive review.

I'm a big fan of Sakamoto. I've gone with my husband for their sushi a couple of times, and they have a large selection as well as some cooked dishes as well. I recommend the crab mango temaki if your are looking for something sweet with the sushi.
Sushi is always great! I have not had a bad roll yet. I use to be nervous to experiment with new rolls. But this place never fails to be delicious. I highly recommend.

Best sushi around!  I have been to several sushi restaurants and this by far is the best!  A Hidden gem in Oswego!  I go twice a week!  Friendly staff but small space, they need to expand.  You won't be disappointed!

Love the atmosphere and the service was great!
They have a great lunch special, 2 or 3 rolls of maki that comes with a salad or miso soup.
Although the place was kinda quiet, our sushi was made fairly quickly.
Both my rolls were tasty and didnt have too much rice.

I definitely would come back here or recommend this place to a friend

I have been here about a bazillion times and only just now am writing a review.

I am something of a sushi pansy. I'm not really a fish eater and approached sushi with much trepidation.  I do enjoy shellfish and veggies, so I'm a maki roll girl.  So I'm posting that disclaimer up front - I can't comment on the fish here.

However, what I have had has been wonderful.  Love the Spicy Crunchy Cali rolls and the Spicy Philly Crab roll.  They also have a Crab Mango roll that looks and tastes like a bite of summer.  

Their other menu items are fabulous as well.  The teriyaki steak and mushrooms has always been a big hit among the non-sushi eating members of my dinner party. and I dream at night of that Philly Crab Egg roll.  So, so good...  

The place is a bit small but nice- intimate.  Cocktails are fabulous (Japanese Sex... OMG) and they have a nice little selection of hot tea.

If you are budget conscious - and I am -and like maki rolls,  hit them for lunch.  They have a two rolls and a salad (ginger dressing to die for) for $9.50 and three rolls is somewhere close to $13.50.  Split that with a friend, order an extra salad and you have a very reasonable sushi lunch!

So in love with this restaurant! I go here about once a month and it is always consistent in quality, service, and yumminess!!! I mostly get sushi, I love the alien feet but they are all to die for! The hibachi is great too.

Sushi was decent. It was ... basic at best. , fish was fresh. Presentation wasn't on point. The steak was awful...If there were no other options while I'm craving sushi in the area I'd go back...but there are other options so I'll be trying them. The establishment itself is tiny! It's not a very comfortable place to sit down.

I love Sakamoto, its a great place to go to during the week and on a weekend. There are not any other places in the area for sushi, but this place really is good. My new favorite from their menu is the Tropical Tuna, with mango sauce and mango in the roll...it truly is to die for.

This Sushi is definitely the best on the block. Can't wait to go back. Its a smaller place not really a place to take kids because of how small it is. The wait on a Saturday night wasnt bad, the front desk does seem a bit disorganized. We got Eric as our server he was wonderful. He recommended a few things of the menu and they were all great! Try anything you'd want chances are it'll be delicious!

Best sushi place I have found! Fish is always fresh and the plating is always beautiful! Try the smokey samurai roll it is spicy smoky crunchy sweet and creamy! The spicy tuna tartar appetizer is amazing they slice the avocado very thin it is delicious I highly recommend this place!
We love that we can get good sushi in Oswego! Super friendly staff and tasty drinks. Support this local restaurant. You won't be disappointed :^)
Wow this place is a gem in Oswego.  It's a nice dine in date night place.  Inside looks upscale, sushi is delicious.

Yes! Just found out they now deliver within a 5 min range. This might be dangerous since we have gotten delivery twice within the week. There's not many sushi restaurants in Oswego and this one is by far the best!

This is my go to sushi restaurant. Usually do online orders for their pick 3 lunch special. Never have I ever been disappointed! The sushi is excellent quality and I have never been less than highly satisfied and full. The only con is when you dine in - they simply need a bigger space. Other than that I am a very happy and satisfied customer!

Cute and small restaurant - 15 min wait on Friday evening at 7.  Great service and atmosphere- but could be a little bigger. Food was ok, have had better sushi - in Naperville. But convenient location - in front of Home Depot and behind McDonalds and around many shopping stores.

Two coworkers of mine and I decided to stop In for our lunch break. They were both talking about sushi nonstop that day, so this was the closest place we saw. Since I'm on a low carb diet, i was hoping they'd have something I can eat since I can't have rice. We sat down, and ordered. My coworker ordered two rolls-a Philadelphia and a shrimp tempura. My other coworker ordered a large soup bowl with tempura veggies and shrimp. I ordered a sirloin steak with veggies. The server asked me how I wanted the steak cooked, I said medium rare. I also told her not to include rice with my dish because I couldn't eat it so she asked if I wanted extra vegetables instead of the rice, which I said yes to. We then sat there drinking our water for 43 minutes... Yes 43 minutes! By the time we had gotten our food it was already time to go back to work. We contemplated taking it to go but we were so hungry we finished our plates in less then 10 minutes. My steak was actually dry and wayyyy overcooked and underseasoned, not even close to medium-anything! She also ended up charging me for the extra vegetables that she asked if I wanted instead of the rice, which wasn't much but still. Needless to say, boss lady was pissed when we got back for taking over an hour long lunch. I don't understand why it took 43 minutes to get our food when the restaurant was only half full.
This place was so good!! The quality of the food is amazing the staff was very friendly as well.

Sakamoto makes you feel like you are at a fancy downtown sushi restaurant, even though you're stuck in suburban Oswego! We love it here and are big fans of the Godzilla roll and Crunchy California roll. We have tried plenty of others, but those are our two favorites. Alien Feet is yummy too! Still want to try the Mexican roll. Prices are very competitive, and the quality is superb. 

Bonus- they deliver!!! When half your family wants sushi, and half wants pizza, get both!

Small restaurant but best sushi in the area. The rolls are good. Shashimi entrees are a good value. 2 people will be $50-70. The staff is friendly. Service will be slower on the weekends. I come for the fish and it's Grade A. I've been here about 5 times and it keeps getting better.
An absolute jewel! As close to having sushi in Japan as I've found almost anywhere. Amazing.
Best Sushi in the area! I have tried multiple places and no one can top this one. Not only is the atmosphere very welcoming but the sushi is delicious! You will not be disappointed.
No better way to start the new year at our favorite sushi place. The food is always excellent.

Great food!  Did not disappoint!  The Godzilla is amazing.  I've been to some "high class"  sushi restaurants and this place adds a new touch to your standard sushi.  Very small inside,  but it's never packed.

Just ordered from here for Valentine's day and it was great.  The service on pick up was slow but have to keep in mind everyone decided to stay in so that's on us lol.  They may need to disable the website from taking orders next year to be safe but my wife and I love this place and will keep going back.
We love this restaurant! Their sushi is fresh and their service is good. We also like their dumplings and miso soup.

Walked in and asked sushi chef to make us 3 roll special. He did. Had to take a picture of it. It was wonderful. The tastes of the different rolls were awesome. Beats out of Chicago. It was one of kind experience.

Wow, I have read ll the reviews and I am left to wonder if the place I went to was the same place that everyone is raving about. I eat sushi as often as I can (usually every week) in almost every suburb in the area and while some are really bad and I wouldn't return to them and some others are so amazing that I want to eat there every day, Sakamoto was no where near the top of my list. It wasn't at the very bottom either but it was very close. 

I went in the other day for lunch, no one else was there at lunch time which should have told me something. I sat at the bar and ordered 10 pieces of Nigiri sushi - the very basic, salmon and tuna, to see how they prepared them. When the piece of salmon doesn't extend over the ends of the huge clump of dense rice, I know there is a problem. Either the chef doesn't know how to slice the fish properly or they are told to cut smaller pieces by management to save money.  When they do that and still charge what they charge, they have immediately lost my business. 

Maybe the other reviewers judge the quality of their Nigiri by the size of the clump of rice but I prefer to judge it by the actual piece of fish (salmon, tuna, yellowtail, etc.) that I am paying for. 

Another issue I had was because no one else was there the waitress literally stood next to me at the bar and watched me eat and kept talking the the chef about what was on TV. She also tried to engage me in a conversation when I was trying to eat. Very bad customer service and even worse having a TV showing some daytime talk show garbage. 

I would rather drive to some place nice like Kiku in Naperville and pay the same price for a much larger piece of higher quality sushi than eat her again. Every time I drive by there I wonder how they are still in business.

My husband and I were here for the first time this afternoon.  OMG!  Everything was fabulous.  We had sushi, sashimi, and a couple rolls.  Everything was SO fresh, and the plate was a work of art - just beautiful.  Service was great by our waiter, Anthony, too!  It's not often you find a place where the food and service are both crazy-good, but we did today.  We can't wait to go back.  Highly recommend the sushi scallops and the sashimi salmon.  Yum!

I was so excited to see there was a sushi restaurant so close to our house!  My husband won't come near sushi, but I like to order and pick it up for myself when he's not around or we will stop somewhere else for him!  I ordered a variety of rolls, which were all delicious and seemed really fresh!  My only slight complaint was the girl working as the hostess - she made some strange comments to me and just had a weird personality.  But, the sushi was great and I look forward to dining in next time with girlfriends!

Came to Sakamoto for the first time today. The lunch specials are excellent! 12.95 for your choice of three full rolls and Miso soup. It was a lot of food. The sushi was fresh and very delicious! It did take a while to get our food but definitely worth the wait! It's a nice location to being that I can enjoy some really good sushi and not having to travel to Naperville to get it. Definitely a top spot.

So glad to have the best sushi restaurant, so close!
Been here numerous times and it's always fresh, delicious, and great service!
Even valentines day, when there was a line out the door, the service was fast and the food was excellent!
The green turtle is the best roll! The mango sauce they use is addictive.

Yummmmmm! This place was a nice surprise from Yelp. We went by reviews and decided to stop. It was small but sheik, romantic lit, entertaining at the sushi bar, and great service. The plum wine after dinner was sweet. The sushi is beautiful and tastes great. Give it a try for a nice change to the pallet. My hubby had the scallops in teriyaki and they were tender and delicious.

I've been going here since it opened and I LOVE IT! (With as many times as I've been here, I've only had a few lunch/dinners that were a little off, but I think it was because they were just SUPER busy.)

I love to go for lunch because they have awesome specials Mon-Sat. Sushi Rolls+ Soup or Salad, or Hibachi+ Soup or Salad. My favorite roll is the Spicy Philly Crab (which I haven't come across at any other sushi place I've been to).

Their fried ice cream is amazing- if you have room, I would definitely get it!

Since when did Oswego get all fancy and get a Sushi restaurant? 

Based on its location of being right next to a nail salon, I wasn't expecting much seeing as there aren't many restaurants in the area. I tried Sakamoto on a Thursday night. When we first walked in, there were only two others seated at a able and some lone dude at the bar. Soon after the entire place filled up. I'd assume we beat the dinner time rush.

Miso soup was somewhat bland, but I'm use to really salty types. What I was most impressed with was the portion sizes of the roles. The price and amount made for a sweet deal. This was definitely your average sushi and nothing mind blowing. Be prepared to wait a bit for your sushi to be made. Saki fan? They've got a good selection of that too. Service was on par from my single experience. I would definitely go back if I'm looking to get my sushi fix!

Picked up sushi here for my husband the other day. He called it when I was coming home from the movie. They told him 20 min. I got there in 20 min and still waited 40 min inside. I get things happen but they didn't even say sorry. Sushi all in all was good. We have ordered there before and probably would go back. I just thought they were rude

Welcome to the 21st century, Oswego!  You've got sushi!!

Not too long ago, Sakamoto came to town and is located in a strip center in front of Home Depot on Route 34.  I've been wanting to try it for some time but finally had my first opportunity last night for dinner.

The atmosphere is very trendy and pleasant albeit small.  There is even a very small bar area as you walk in so you could stop for a cozy drink if that was all you wanted.

The place may be small but the menu isn't.  Sakamoto specializes in sushi but also features warm dishes for those who aren't quite ready for sushi.

We started with a very tasty Tempura combo appetizer ($8.50) which featured shrimp and vegetables.  Tempura comes with a light fried battered coating which was done perfectly to my taste.  

For our entrees, my dinner partner was one of those who prefers a warmer, cooked meal and ordered the Yaki Udon with Beef ($13.50), which is a Japanese noodle dish with generous portions of meat and vegetables.  It had a very slight "kick" to it that was just perfect.  She loved it and I sampled it as well, and agreed with her assessment. 

I went with a combination of two different sushi entrees.  The "Godzilla" ($12.00) was delicious!  It combines Shrimp tempura, cream cheese, avocado with crunchy sprouts. Next I went with the Chef's Choice of 7 pieces of nigiri sushi ($16.00).  It was also excellent and I would highly recommend this as well.  

We normally pass on dessert but as we had not stuffed ourselves and still had a little room left, we splurged and tried a wonderful tempura banana dessert that had 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream and had caramel and chocolate sauce lightly drizzled over top.  Sinfully delicious that capped off a terrific dinner.

We each had some wine with our meals and a garden salad came with both dinners.  The salad was nothing special and considering all we ate for dinner, could have easily been skipped.  Our total tab was $71.00 plus tip.

All in all, we both were very pleased with our choices and look forward to our next visit to Sakamoto!
Never tried sushi before, but went here anyways. All I can say is I love it!!!! Combo fried rice is awesome. We tried 5 different sushi rolls and we loved them all.

Great food and great service! We started with the Philly crab egg rolls, which were amazing - like a spicy version of crab Rangoon in an egg roll. We got the Godzilla, Lobster and White Tuna rolls and all were delicious! It was a bit pricey - $80 for two of us, but other than that no complaints! We will definitely be back!

I love this place! My husband is not, how shall we say, "food adventurous". He loves his Americanized Chinese food, the more fried the better. I wasn't feeling well and was craving miso soup. He reluctantly agreed to order from Sakamoto only if he could get the ribeye. For my $2 miso soup ($4, I ordered 2), I acquiesced. I also got a California roll, Philly egg roll, and pork dumplings. All were AMAZING. I wasn't expecting much for my husband's delivery steak, but it was a PERFECT medium, and tender enough to be eaten with the included plastic silverware. We will definitely order again!
Food is awesome, but the service is always terrible. They act they don't care if you are there or not. I've been there by myself and with a group of 8 and the service was just as bad both times.

LOVE - LOVE - LOVE this place!!  The food rocks.  I was only going to give it a 4 star because it's small and sometimes you have to wait a good bit to get a table, but i didn't think that was fair, their business, food and staff really are awesome. 

My fav is the fire cracker, it's a spicy tuna.... YUM.
My favorites are the Dancing Eel, Godzilla, Boston and Spicy Tuna rolls. Sakamoto is delicious every time.

My wife and I enjoy the brisket sandwiches here. Fries and fried zucchini  are also good. What keeps me coming back is their Hot & Spicy BBQ sauce.

Nice place to eat in. Service has always been timely. Would like to explore menu a bit more but the brisket is just too good.

3.5 stars (side note: yelp, seriously consider half stars!)

I here for lunch at least three times a week. My favorites include: the tacos, pulled turkey sandwich, and the kabobs. The tacos are great, my preference is for the beef brisket tacos, but the pulled turkey version is also good. They used to have a bbq chicken taco, but it's off the menu now, which is kind of a bummer. The shrimp and chicken kabobs are also good, a little on the expensive side for a regular lunch item. The pulled turkey sandwich is great when paired with sweet potato waffle fries. Overall, solid lunch spot!

I recommend trying the Patio!  When it comes to ribs there are so many variations and many people like them done differently.  What I like about the ribs at the patio is that they don't just fall off the bone.  They are tender, but you do have to bite a bit to grab the meat off the bone.

Many places use a tone of sodium and brine to make them so tender that they fall right off.  If you like it that way go to Portillos.

Keep in mind, this is a fast food place.  It isn't a fancy sit-down restaurant where they are serving you......you don't have to tip here.  The prices are pretty low for good ribs.  If you think this is too expensive, go to Portillos.

Nothing special. I had the Italian beef (beef was fatty) and sweet potato fries while hubs had half a slab of ribs (very tender) and pulled pork (chewy). Overall, we would come back, and try something different.

After being a regular  at the location in Lombard I decided to try some of the other locations!  I had the kabobs at the other location so I decided to mix it up this time and went with the pulled pork. It was amazing very tender and I added a little extra BBQ sauce because I like mine soaked in it. The service was good and this location is just as clean as the Lombard location.

Went here because smash burger across the street went out of business and I was glad that we chose his place. I ordered the bbq bacon cheese burger double meat on a pretzel bun and it's so good! Sweet potato fries wasn't that sweet but the sever recommended the honey mustard as the dipping sauce and that was a great advice. Very good food and can't wait to have it again.

Pretty good really, for "fast food" sort of. My salad and Mac n cheese came out super fast, due to that my only ding is that the chicken was very dry. If you get the food in less than 5 minutes you know it has to be cooked ahead. But really pretty tasty and a good alternative to a McDonald's or Burger King. I will try it again.

I gonna say the new designs and the architecture were awesome but its probably the only pros here....

The restaurant is new and BIG!  When you walked in, they have an area to see their big menu, after that you head to the counter where you can place your orders and their staff will bring you the food to your table

Order ribs, salad, and a burger.  Food are average, but over priced!   I am very picky with BBQ and ribs....the ribs are very very DRY....not impressed at all!!!
Best BBQ in a drive thru!! Tons of sides & options:sandwiches salads nachos ribs and the best greek pita wrap around
The Patio is one of the top BBQ places in Aurora, I love their service and the quality of their food! I'm definitely coming back.

I haven't had anything that I didn't like here!  U can count on consistently well prepared offerings. The menu is quite varied. Besides the better than good food, the service is always helpful & pleasant.  I think the price is a good value for what u get. The crowds can be a bit overwhelming on the weekend, but it's part of the ambiance.  Drive-thru is also available.  I appreciate that the place is clean & the service is prompt.

The place is roomy and the food is great! My favorite is the chicken kabob dinner and I replace the rice with steamed broccoli. The burgers are amazing too! My 10 year old loves the chicken and rice soup and usually orders a cup to go along her kinds chicken tenders. She says it's the best chicken tenders she's tasted. I had to take a bite of her tenders and they are yummy! The chicken is moist, the bbq sauce is the best! The location is great too. Right next to Fox Valley mall. After shopping you can just go grab some lunch right after. The staff is friendly and place is clean and the food is great.

Me and my boyfriend are happy to have them by our house. I've known about The Patio since I was young and we like coming here every once in a while to change things up. They have a big menu selection so that's nice. The spicy chicken sandwich is good and the half chicken is pretty good too, to name a few.
Quick fast service. Love the look of the interior. But Alittle worried on why food is so fast here.

Food is so so, cashiers are not very nice. Ribs are horrible ! Chicken is average , spaghetti has a weird taste, atmosphere is very good. The place as a hole is solid C . But they do have pretty decent verity of food .

This is their newest location, and I was just able to check it out for the first time. Wow! They did a great job. Still delivering the same great bbq, with a really modern look. Definitely worth checking out when you're in the fox valley area!

I'm a huge fan of The Patio!  And so when they opened up on Route 59 I was one of the first to come here, and wow did they wow me!  The place is GINORMOUS!  It's almost unfathomable that they actually built their own building from scratch here with so many vacant buildings to choose from.  But regardless I am pleased with the results.  This location is ultra modern and sleek with clear glass outer walls so that patrons can sit and feel almost that they are outdoors on a patio!  They must have consulted a feng shui expert because the decor tables and chairs include a wonderful mix of metal, stone, glass & greenery.  LOL!  Just my observation that this location puts you amazingly at ease.  

We recently went on a Friday night after a concert.  The place was packed!  Having already eaten dinner before the concert we just decided to stop in for a "midnight snack".  Although I have had many different entrees at The Patio I have never had their onion rings, fried mushrooms and fried zucchini before but they were all what you would expect.  Yummy comfort food at a good price.  

Almost every table was taken and it was a very lively night.  The staff was on their toes and very helpful in removing empty dishes.  Overall a fun place to dine, simple and casual with value pricing.

Last minute mother day plans! My mom and I saw it and she said 'Lets eat there!' We walk into the restaurant and get into line. The line goes very fast and the service is great. I order an Italian Beef, and my dad and mom order burgers. For Mother's Day they also give single roses to all the women which was very sweet. We are sat down quickly with a preference given to a booth and our food comes out nice and warm within 5 minutes. 

Now it may not be the best BBQ restaurant, but the nicest BBQ restaurants are limited. I enjoyed the large dining space, quick service, and a lot of variety on the menu. Great for groups!

Really enjoyed their ribs. It was surprisingly empty when I arrived, but the BBQ here is better than any other I've tried in the area (including Q-BBQ , Gemato's & Smokey Bones). The best ribs in the area are still Famous Daves. Not saying much, but they're not too fatty & full of flavor. They've got a decent selection of other dishes like salads as well, so it caters to those seeking a lighter fare. Service took a while to get to the table, which I didn't get b/c -like I said- there was almost no one there. Gawd knows I'm not in the South, but overall, not bad.

I've been there a half a dozen or more times now... and I have to say that I like it.

It's fast food done well.  I've been to other locations and usually they are too noisy for me to enjoy my food.

It literally will take 10 minutes to figure out what you want to eat though.  As the menu is an entire backlit wall.

I tried the ribs once, and as a picky rib connoisseur, I have to say that I was impressed.

My usual is the pulled pork sandwich.  Sometimes they skimp on the BBQ sauce, but there is some right at your table to indulge in.

I had the BBQ Pretzel burger and felt that it wasn't my favorite.  It almost tastes like frozen patties.  It might not be, but that's what came to mind when I bit into it.

I know I will be going there often as a quick and easy meal choice.

The Patio is great for an inexpensive, fast casual meal.  The restaurant focuses on BBQ and that "patio" atmosphere, but there is more than just BBQ if that's not your thing.

My favorite thing at the Patio is the Monterey Jack Chicken sandwich.  The chicken is consistently a big portion and very tender.  I always slather on extra "hot and sassy" sauce, which is provided by the bottle at the table.  The fries are monstrous portions, ideal for sharing, and the macaroni & cheese is both creamy and cheesy.  For about $3, this "side dish" is a generous portion.

The line inside was long, maybe 6-8 people deep, so they had a girl taking orders in line to assist the counter help.  There's a menu posted on the length of the wall, which is easy to read and convenient.

When I ordered, the girl asked me, "do you want the regular or the loaded?"  I asked her what the difference was, and I could tell by her hesitation that she really didn't know.  It would help the line move faster to have someone do this job that is better acquainted wiht the menu.  I ordered the 'loaded' anyway.  

Patio is a welcome addition to the mall area, currently chock full of family-oriented chain restaurants and stuff that just, well, sucks.  I'm happy to have this place nearby.

Nice clean interior, very open and modern. This is sort of s fast food bbq joint that also has Italian beef and salads. I ordered a half slab of ribs which came with one side. Overall tasty meal. Will come back.

Poison food there. 
My mom immediately she done with her food she get sick. 
The ribs and fish tacos was horrible! 
I should talked with the manager
The food and service were top notch, as always! Our server was awesome! A++ experience!

I ordered ribs with fries. I was a bit disappointed because the flavor came from mostly the sauce they smothered over it rather than the grill/charcoal flavor from actual barbecues. But it was still filling and the price was reasonable around $10. The atmosphere was very impressive. Very clean and the atmosphere had lots of sunlight.

Honestly, if you want to go to the Patio for atmosphere but not for the food, you will like this place. Unfortunately I won't be going back to eat below average overpriced food. My wife ordered 1/2 slab of the bbq ribs and I went with the 1/2 chicken oreganato plus 2 hot teas. Price came up at almost $40.  The ribs were not tender at all and they did not have a smoky flavor whatsoever. The bbq sauce was good but it didn't matter. The chicken was tender but not much flavor to it. The sides that came with both meals were just ok. I should have read previous reviews before going to this place. I've learned my lesson. Famous Daves is the best place for ribs hands down.
The restaurant was so clean.  The food was fresh and cooked to perfection.  Wide selection in their menu.  All the employees were so friendly and helpful.

Had dinner at the Patio at Rt 59  &  New York St. Aurora, last night. Food was very good, ample servings, and very reasonably priced.  I  had the BBQ Meatloaf  Dinner  & my spouse  had the fish tacos. The meatloaf  was 2 thick pieces, with mashed potatoes  and bread. The tacos  were pleanty to eat and take  one home. Note sides are extra. The service was very  quick and pleasant, server made sure we had all we needed.
All things considered,  a very good experience.

I remember visiting The Patio in Darien years and years ago for some good old fashion BBQ, so it was a bit nostalgia when I first saw the construction of this Aurora/Naperville location. However, when I stepped into the brand new established I was bit taken aback at how nice the dinning area was. There a few areas to sit in and a plethora of TVs to keep you entertained while waiting. This made for a really enjoyable dining experience as me and friend enjoyed our food with some NBA playoff basketball. 

Strangely enough, I didn't go with ribs for my first time back. Instead I opted for the roasted chicken dinner, which at $11 (with a drink) wasn't a bad deal at all. Included was half a chicken, coleslaw, a healthy portion of mashed potatoes, and roll. 

The chicken was cooked to a good temperature, not too dry while maintaining a nice crispy skin. However, the chicken didn't really have much flavor and needed a bit of help from the BBQ sauce  on the table. The coleslaw is mayo based, but had a nice crisp to it. The mashed potatoes were super creamy and buttery. This was probably my highlight of the meal. The roll was a bit stale so it remained relatively untouched throughout the meal. 

Overall, I think the establishment is a good additional to the the area. The menu is pretty vast, while still offering a specialty item (the ribs) to draw in people with specific cravings. The seating area is comfortable and really nice. I will give the food another chance, even though my meal was relatively average.

This location of the Patio opened right by the Fox Valley Mall. It's definitely not the ideal location for al fresco dining, but if you like exhaust smells it might be just perfect!

Not that I sat outside on my visit. It was in February so the fam and I saddled up to a booth right next to a fireplace. I can't say there was a ton of heat emanating from there, but it was a nice thought.

If you care to cross reference this review with my other review for The Patio in Bolingbrook (yo, girl), you would know that I love that location. I think this one has potential to be just as great, I just think the staff needs a few months to get their act together. It was a little rough but I have good faith. 

I will say that their salads are kind of tiny but really expensive and their ribs are pretty good. As always, the Greek pita is off the chain.

I'll be expecting great things from you, Patty!

Didn't have high expectations due to other reviews, but gave it an honest try and was impressed. Brought the whole family here. Generous portions for everyone. Adult meals were pricy, but well worth it. They have a wide variety of meal options, something for everyone. Loved sitting by the fireplace! Lots of room between tables. Staff was friendly. Will definitely be back.

First, I gotta say I dig the retro-50's architecture and interior design, perfect for this kinda food.
But. I've been going to these places for years, and frankly, didn't give a shit. The food was okay, but not worth going out of my way for. Stopped going there for a long time. Then one evening it was a little late and the Patio was the only thing that was open in the vicinity, so the Wife and I stopped in.
Wife-unit eats only Chicken Breast. And it's gotta be cooked well done on the verge of burnt. I can't stand White meat poultry for the most part, with a particular aversion to boneless, skinless chicken breast. Usually dry and tasteless. Why Bother?
So she orders the Chix sandwich  with orders to cremate it, and I swung with the Beef tenderloin Kebabs, RARE.
So the food is delivered to the table, and it looked yummy. Even my wifes plate.
The Beef was extraordinarily tasty. A great plate for a modest price. Easily on a par with Outback. 
Wife was gushing about the Chicken. She offered a taste, and I was shocked!
Even though there was a considerable char on the outside, the filet was juicy, tender and actually had considerably good chicken flavor.
What the hell kind of magic was going on in that kitchen?
I'd order that Chicken in a heartbeat, and that's saying a lot.
On the way out, I noticed an older fella in shirt and tie counting cash out of the register, and I approached him
"Are you the boss?"
"I'm the Owner!"
I proceeded to tell him just how much I hated Chicken Breast, but how absolutely delicious his rendition was. Like a good Greek proprietor, he kind of grunted with "yeah I know" understood, but a tiny "Thank you" without a smile. (Years of Greektown experience has taught me the temperament of Greek Restauranteurs, and I know my compliment registered with him, dont ask me how, but I did)
We've been to some of the other Patios in the area, and the Chicken has not disappointed ever. A great casual feed...

I've been to a Patio before, I think in Bolingbrook and it was a long time ago. I don't remember what my thoughts were on the food from back then. I was around the Foxvalley mall area this weekend and decided to give the Patio another chance. 
The restaurant is new and its huge! When you walk in you have an area to view the menu, after that you go to the counter and place your order, then they bring your good to your table. 
The young man who took our order was not very friendly. Never greeted us and made ordering kind of awkward. 
I got a kabob meal with rice, my son got a brisket sandwich and my boyfriend got the ribs. My food was just ok, nothing out of the ordinary, my son enjoyed his sandwich but my boyfriend did not like his ribs at all. They were very dry and did not look good at all. 
So we will never go back. Our meal was very over priced and not good at all. The restaurant is nice and their outdoor seating area is very nice but I won't be back

I've been here twice and it has been a middle-of-the-road experience both times.

The BBQ is ok. We've tried various things, chicken, ribs, pulled pork, brisket, etc.

Most of it is just ok. Kind of bland on seasoning and sauces. The only really memorable things were the grade school cafeteria-style seating and serving-ware, and how the fries kept coming to us cold, even after we complained.

Eh, s'ok. Go if you're not picky about your BBQ. It is technically still edible food.

Good food but horrendous service!  Girl in drive up was rude and lacked customer service skills.  Had a coupon that she wouldn't take because I was .20 cents off from the order being $25 I ordered another fry then she forgets the coupon all together and charges my credit card twice.  Clearly she lacks intelligence.  Watch your receipt they charge wrpng.

Thought this place would be legit.  I ordered the half slab with brisket.  The food looked good but ribs were tough and both were not hot and barely even served warm.  Service is fine and the place is very nice.  Too bad the food just isn't great especially for the price.

Underwhelming at best. Went here yesterday for a late dinner, hoping for some good BBQ. The guy behind the register who took our orders seemed like he hated his job and made no effort to be friendly while taking our order. He seemed irritated that I didn't spit my order out at him like I had memorized their gigantic menu. We were only seated for a short time and our food appeared, which was why I found it odd that my beef brisket and mashed potatoes were stone cold. If that wasn't bad enough the brisket was tough and had no flavor. But it got worse, as I found a black hair in my food. Needless to say I lost my already diminishing appetite. 

Will not be returning. Find somewhere else to satisfy your BBQ cravings, this place is not worth the money.
Good food, affordable, and quick service.

Went with my parents and it cost us $40 just for the three of us for three sandwiches three fries and three drinks which we thought was exceedingly high. The sandwiches were actually really good. I had the beef brisket and enjoyed it thoroughly, the meat was really tender and blended well with the sauce. The bun was fresh, and added to the flavor. 

The fries are incredibly bland and could really use a new recipe because eating through them was an actual struggle. 

The wait time was really slow, took 25 minutes from the purchase to getting food on the table which seems long for a fast casual restaurant. 

Overall great sandwiches, but the shortcomings of this restaurant will most likely make me not return to eat inside, but rather a place to stop and just pickup a sandwich

Easy ordering at the counter, food carried out by a server in a respectable amount of time, food is fresh and comes in large portions. Not sure what's not to like. The inside of the restaurant is really nice while having a very casual vibe. They have a few tvs by the bar which the husband liked. I had the barbeque chicken breast with a baked potato and veggies. I really liked that it tasted homemade, no frills. The chicken was cooked well and the barbeque sauce was yummy. The veggies were tasty (no doubt soaked in butter, and came in a huge portion. My baked potato was, well, a baked potato, but it made me happy. My husband shared his ribs which were a little on the scrawny side but had potential. It's a good place to take the parents for a casual lunch/dinner so we'll probably be back.

Beef brisket is a winner here! Sandwiches are filled with meat to the max. The fries are good and so is the baked potato. Great ambience for a "fast food" restaurant. Going through the drive thru you should check your order to make sure you received what you ordered.

The food was just fine. But the service was horrible. They forgot half our order twice and we finally had to go up to the counter and ask someone else for help. Wait a couple years so they can hire people who know what they're doing
So I have been wanting to try this place for awhile. The ribs were really dry. I'm picky about BBQ. I was not impressed at all.

Wow! What an unbelievable transformation. The Patio has been a staple for great BBQ since 1977. This being their sixth location is truly a triumph to that. Beautiful reconstruction and a much needed facelift. Looking forward to their outdoor patio come spring. Wonderful menu that you've come to enjoy. I was their first customer opening day and went with the always enjoyable Pulled Pork sandwich with Coleslaw. Wonderful Tropic and Black fresh brewed teas are available.  Beer. Wine and dessert counter,  will get my attention next visit. Look for their coupons on the Cover of your local Clipper Magazine.

I used to go to The Patio in Lombard all the time and am ecstatic that one has opened here in Aurora.  We went on opening day at lunch time and it was surprisingly not very busy.  I assume this is because they did not have a ton of advertising about what day they were opening.  
They have a large illuminated menu when you first walk in so you can decide what you want before getting in line to order.  Their best known for their BBQ but they also have several American and Greek choices.
I got the beef brisket sandwich which was tasty but not as good as their pulled pork.  I got a side of fries and dipped them in their BBQ sauce which is a MUST!  My boyfriend got an Italian sandwich that came with Italian sausage, beef, cheese, hot & sweet peppers on it.  Both were hearty portions which gave us leftovers. Total was about $18 with my Clipper Magazine coupon. (front cover, this weeks issue)
I also got a fresh-brewed Peach tea to drink which was scrumptious :)

The environment here is awesome!  Very clean and modern looking.  They have a fireplace and a full bar with seating.  The patio itself looks very large but unfortunately doesn't have a lot of scenery.  Many businesses have failed at this location so I hope The Patio can break that trend because it is an awesome addition to the area!

Consistent American fast food with a sit down flair.  Pulled Pork sandwich, fries, the chicken breast Greek pita is outstanding the Jamaican Jerk grilled chicken salad is good too.  Ribs smell awesome.  Satisfactory service.  Walk up order and they bring it out to you!

The location is nice and the interior is good , too. Cantina style, which is fine. Their staff on the front door is very nice, welcoming and helpful.

But their food is just not my thing. I had pulled pork taccos, which was good, not great. I had quite a few big chunks of meat in the pulled pork, that I didnt like. The dish I picked was BBQ Taccos and they come with either chicken and pulled pork. You get three taccos. I wanted to try 1 chicken and 2 pulled pork, but apparently that is not possible. Its either the one or the other. That was a little irritating. Come on, they are taccos, cant be that hard to put one thing on one and the other on the other two.

The worst were the fries. To me they have a very bad flavor, a weird sour taste. I couldnt tell if it was the potatoe flavor or if they are using old/bad oil. I just know that flavor wise they were the worst Ive ever had.

I might come back and try a different dish, but fries, no thanks
We went there and had great service and great food at a reasonable price. No complaints here.
Awesome food combined with a casual but exceptionally nice atmosphere.  Loved the BBQ chicken sandwich with waffle fries.  Yum!

My boyfriend and I came here to check out what all the hype was about. He'd like to give it one star, I'm giving it two.
We got pulled pork sandwiches, a side of chicken fingers, Mac and cheese, and sweet potato fries. I love pulled pork and I thought it was ok. I'm not a fan of sauced BBQ but I didn't find the sauce offensive. Boyfriend hated the sauce because it was too bland. Chicken fingers, French fries, and sweet potato fries were all generic. The Mac and cheese stunk IMO. It was made with penne and not elbow macaroni and the sauce--might as well have been jarred Ragu. Was definitely not homemade. 
In my opinion, this place isn't worth the hype or the wait. I much prefer Sharko's down 59 were everything is homemade and a hundred percent better!
Tasty, fresh food. Clean and in a nice environment. Large place, great for meeting with friends without any rush of having to leave your table after finishing your meal. Love El Patio!

I used to live in Orland and loved to get food from The Patio. I'm glad one opened near me! Their fries are always fresh and delicious. I usually go for the pulled pork sandwich which is great. Their Greek salad is good too.

Our family has only gotten food that was ordered from the drive up. Sandwiches and salads. Most of the food has been enjoyable.  Don't order the Julienne Salad! Inferior deli meats and cheeses in small amounts! Hard boiled egg with green yolk. Rock hard tomatoes.  Mango chicken salad is very good. Burgers are average fair.

I decided to finally try this place, and I regret not coming here earlier. Like other reviews said, the decor is really cool. Our group ordered sriracha bugers and chicken fajitas. The burgers were great (the sriracha/mayo was unique). Best was the fajitas though... so much food for the price. I'll definitely come back soon and encourage you to try it out too.

The smell when you walk in the door is intoxicating...  The staff is very friendly and quick. We ordered the Italian beef and the pulled pork sandwich and they were absolutely delicious.
