The orders have a lot of food so come with an empty belly.  We didn't get to try dessert since we could barely breathe since we were so full, but they looked mouth watering.

My daughter wanted to write her first yelp review at 12 years old so here it is.....I noticed there was outside seating, so obviously the place already lives up to its name of "the Patio".  I liked upon entry the  menu is on a curved wall, and it's big and easy to see. There were a lot of selections but not too many that you couldn't easily choose.  Our food came out pretty fast, and the food was pretty good. We got the cheeseburger, chicken kabob, baby back ribs, sweet potato waffle fries, and fish tacos. The kabob was juicy but didn't have too much flavor, the ribs were good but i still like Portillos ribs better. The sweet potato fries were good. The cheeseburger was tender. The fish tacos didn't have enough fish. You could barely taste the fish, actually. The cost was $45.00 with a 15% coupon that we got from localflavor.com. The place is clean and has a nice open area, it's very spacious.
Nothing spectacular or disappointing.  Consistently good ribs.  Can't go wrong with a sure thing.

If you want to eat what you order, eat there. If you go through the drive thru, you will NOT get the correct order, no matter how simple. I tried to order 1 tamale boat with extra cheese and extra sour cream. Pretty freakin simple. I had to tell her 4 times i only want one, she kept repeating back 2. And i got zero sour cream, no cheese on the chili, and one single small cup of cheese on the side. Almost opposite how i ordered. They cannot hear at the drive thru sign. Three visits and I've had to go to the window to order and they STILL get it wrong everytime, so the sign not working is clearly not an excuse.

CUSTOMER SERVICE IS EVERYTHING. ITS 2015  and if you think that you can just do a crappy job and it wont catch up to you, think again. 20 years ago if I wanted to complain, I had to drive back there. Its 2015, and Now I get to write a bad review while eating my chili, sans sour cream.

Tasty eats that are quick. Friendly and clean environment with a huge menu with something for everyone. Wife, son and I all have been here and some of their other locations as they are consistent and good. Cost is more than others but you get wait you paid for.

We tried the patio today. It was our first visit. One person in our party ordered 1/2 ribs with chicken    It came without the ribs. One ordered meatloaf.  It was lukewarm.  I had a beef brisket sandwich.  The meat was tough and cut too thick.  I realize others rave about the food and we are willing to try a second time. Wasn't impressed with our first visit. Could be us .....or just one of those days. 
 Prefer Baby Back Blues in Plainfield.

This is probably one of the most over hyped food chains in the Chicagoland area. I had a manager that enjoyed going to The Patio because it was so close so I had the unfortunate experience of trying many things on their menu. Literally nothing here is above average. Maybe the hot dog? The food here is on par with what I got in the High School cafeteria. Im giving it one more star because of the atmosphere. Its stylish. Defiantly overpriced for what you get and the quality.

Now that the construction on Rt 59 is coming to an end we will definitely be going to the Patio more often. The staff is very nice and the food is always good and affordable. We went because of a fundraising night and really enjoyed our meal. thanks

I've actually been here again, since it's close to work, my co-workers like it, etc.  This time, I had the chicken ranchero (?) sandwich, fries & pop.  The whole meal was excellent!  $11-12 for chicken samich, fries &  pop is still a bit too much money in my opinion for essentially a fast food joint, but it was good.

My office had carry out service today.   Three out of 4 of us will not return.   Food was mediocre at best mainly due to the use of poor quality ingredients  and certainly over priced for those ingedients.  The grilled cheese consisted of nothing more than Kraft single knock offs on soggy bread and they forgot the fries on kids meal even after confirming our selection.  The fries we did receive were crispy on the outside and  tender on the inside but expensive.   The Julian salad had loads of lunch meat and veggies, however,  the raspberry vinegrette beared closer resemblance to pancake syrup.  Their chile in the tamale boat delived a slight kick of spice while the tamale its self consisted of mainly low quality corn meal.

Very nice restaurant for work lunches. Lots of seating and very friendly staff. The food is a tad expensive, but so far I've been pleased by what I've gotten. I don't drink, but that there's also a bar here and I think others will find that being a perk. Still working my way through the menu, but so far I really like this place and I hope it stays awhile unlike its previous tenant.
I was so excited to order their nachos, described as being topped with "Monterey Jack and cheddar cheese" and saddened to receive a pile of chips dropping with nacho sauce. How cheap, and gross.

Went for the first time Saturday night. I was rather disappointed. We ordered three appetizers (mushrooms, bbq nachos, rib basket), two bbq bacon burgers, and one chili dog. The ribs (dry rub) were pretty good, as were the mushrooms. The way the nachos were made basically created a single layer of "nacho" chips followed my lots of dry, plain tortilla chips. I don't know how you can make a burger with cheese, bbq sauce, bacon, and grilled onions taste dry, but they managed. The burgers were very "well done" and a bit crunchy, and the bacon was overcooked with a burnt flavor. The french fries were dry and bland as well.

To top it all off, my son had a chili dog, which he said was ok. He started to eat his pickle spear and noticed it had a couple of bugs on it. I pointed it out to one of the servers walking around the floor. He looked at it and took it to the manager. Then he returned with three new pickles, with no comment from either the server or the manager.

Aside from the buggy pickle, the food was just OK with nothing really standing out.

On the plus side, the decor was spacious, cleanly, and the people were friendly

This place is great! I don't look for much when I go out to eat, but I expect quality food, reasonable prices, and a clean atmosphere. 

This will be my new go-to spot for casual dining. My wife and two kids went here last weekend and shared a number of menu items. The pulled pork was tasty. My kids loved their fries and mac and cheese. They also split the chicken tenders and enjoyed them as well. We also split an order of mushroom and zucchini for an appetizer and the charbroiled chicken kabobs. 

When we stopped in the place was busy. The service and staff were friendly and efficient. Food came out piping hot and savory and the ambiance was probably our favorite part. It's very family friendly if you're thinking about bringing kids.

We like The Patio by Yorktown but this one has lots of kinks to work out. Waited for food in the drive thru for more than 25 minutes ...completely unacceptable.  We order the same things at Nicky's and Portillos and never have waits like this. Better options in the area that we will stick to for now.

I have no idea who will give less than 5 stars... Seriously though?! 

This place is amazing!!!!

I was apprehensive to even try this place out... 
3 stars?! Hmmm

BUT my BF and I wanted to try out a different restaurant with a patio...

So... Here we are, Saturday night around 7:45pm... Valet guy was nice...

I thought to myself... I love this kinda restaurant... It's huge ... It's not a strip mall kinda restaurant... It's on butterfield road... You really want to swing by and check it out....

My initial impression when I walked in... Wow!!!

I love the grande entrance... Like a restaurant inside a 5 star hotel

Intimate, inviting and romantic

We opted to go to the patio and sat at the bar 

Jen, the bartender was extremely nice, attentive even though she was so busy... 

We ordered the following:

Burrata $9.59 - 5 stars

Misto di mare $25 - seafood - oh so fresh shrimp, calamari and scallops - 5 stars

Costollete di maiale $25 16 oz bone in porkchop, grilled polenta -- cooked to perfect medium - 5 stars 

Carlucci coffee $10 -- with a presentation -- 10 stars 

Torta di cioccolato $8 - 5 stars

Patio Setting is so romantic

Everything about this place is perfect tonight...

Friday night.. As long as you order an entree, you get 2 glasses of wine for a penny...

That's a sweet deal... We ended up paying only $85 plus 20% tip

We will be back... I love this place!!!

I'm not sure how this place is still open. My husband and I dined here recently after years of not having been. I had hope but It was worse then I remember. The service wasn't just slow, our server was rude. The food was nothing spectacular either. 

The only thing good about the meal was the glass of wine I had but it was nothing I couldn't buy at Binny's.

Three stars is all I have for you, folks. 
So, instead of going downtown for an anniversary date night, we decided we'd try Carlucci's instead. We've been to a Yelp event here & loved it so, why not, right? Wrong. So, so wrong. 

We had reservations but because the Sox game was coming on we decided to sit in the bar to watch the game. That was probably the worst decision we made. There was literally five people in the bar so we sat right away. 

We were greeted & given menus... Shortly after that we were given a wine list. It's Friday and penny wine night so you'd think she would've prefaced the conversation with.. "Penny wine night is house wine only". Nope that wasn't the case here. I ordered a glass and was surprised at the $9 charge.. whatever I should've asked I guess. 

We ordered oysters & it came with some type of tomato sauce on them.. not on the side, on them. Who does that?! I had a pasta dish which was okay but nothing great. 

Service people, the service was awkward, slightly rude and I was left with the feeling that I won't go back. The only reason they're getting three stars is because of the pasta dish. 

Sorry Carlucci, I don't plan on returning..

Horsesh*t service on a Friday night in the bar area. Had such a great time during a prior Yelp event that apparently we expected too much. No mention of the "Penny Wine" Friday special from our preoccupied bartender (cell phone) until after we placed an order for two glasses of Pinot Grigio. Only then ($15 later) were we informed of the special for which was so loudly applauded. 

Apps - A half dozen of the Blue Point Oysters sounded well enough, until the morbidly paired "sundried tomato puree" came into the picture. To make things worse, they were served sans lemon and cocktail sauce. WTF?! Weeks later, I have absolutely no recollection of what I ordered for dinner. I do recall a mish-mosh of bland seafood prompting our immediate desire for an overpriced check.

Instant fail at Carlucci. After reading some other Yelp reviews, it appears that they're caught in an unfortunate downward spiral...

This is my 400th review, so you know it has to be fancy. And nothing says fancy like Carlucci. I mean, Bill and Guiliana eat here, so that has to be fancy, right?

You know I met them once. Twice actually, but they won't remember if you ask them. And they didn't actually tell me they ate here, it was on an episode of their show. Unless they just pulled one of those random stunts of showing an exterior of a different place to fool you like how the Kardashians use fake house exteriors for their homes. Wow, you'd think I watch a lot of these celebreality shows, but I really don't. Also, this has to be one of my biggest distracted reviews in awhile. 

But again, it's my 400th, so I get to be fancy, which brings me back to Carlucci.

The interior is just beautiful with wood trim everywhere. We were seated at the loveliest table in the restaurant with a perfect view of the courtyard and fountain. Sidenote: I came here during a private event in the summer and got to experience sipping cocktails in the courtyard. That is something not to be missed. If you can come back during the warmer months I highly recommend sitting outside.

The service was very friendly and kind. And the food was marvelous. I don't bring that word out all that often so enjoy it. 

We had a round of drinks. I had some kind of ginger whiskey bourbon cocktail. Y'know, because I'm a ginger and I have to. It was so strong I'm still buzzing from it three days later. TBH I don't recommend it because all you could taste was alcohol and nothing else.

We had a couple of caesar salads that were the best I'd ever had. No joke. They grill up the prosciutto and wrap the romaine in it which is just lovely. They also throw on a few grape tomatoes and croutons, and drizzle a (I'm guessing) housemade dressing and shaved parm over the top. I would eat this as a meal it was so good.

Next, my wife and I shared a couple of pasta dishes that were both delicious. I'm not going to go on about them because you should choose what you like. I'll just say this. Everything I've ever eaten at Carlucci has been good, and I'd definitely return for a special occasion or fancy evening out. It's on the easier side of pricey, but that's to be expected. This is not the Olive Garden. I would definitely recommend you try it, and if you come visit me I'll take you here for a fun night out.

I had gotten a chance to sample a few of the items having attended this place a few months ago for a yelp elite event. This review however is based on my own experience.

Lucky for me I came on Wednesday ($5 Martini) during happy hour (4pm-7pm) I set at the bar. After ordering a Mango Martini I end up picking up one of the Happy Hour apps while at the bar but moved to be seated at a table.

Cast Iron Shrimp/Jumbo Shrimp -  Jumbo Shrimp Sauted with Garlic, EVOO (Extra Virgin Olive Oil), Parsley, Capers and Lemon Juice with Toasted Ciabatta Bread. These were AMAZIG. Loved this. The EVOO and Lemon Juice was a tad salty on the Ciabatta. However they worked great on the shrimp. The Ciabatta were toasted but had a nice Smokey flavor on them. Although I started at the bar. It was a little bit depressing watching the bartender working so hard...also he was a over worked which meant slow to come to me and quick to leave without chatting. So opted to be seated in the regular dining area. 

Bread - I basically had two baskets worth of bread by myself. I basically blame the EVOO and Parmesan cheese. I believe there is three different versions of bread they serve you. Plan, onion/garlic and one with tomato on top. All of them are great.

Peach Bellini - Picked up my second drink however despite being buzz and could care less the grade of alcohol at this point. I did enjoy the mango much more then this. one despite noticing a stronger poor in the Peach.

Linguini Bobonato Con Parmigiano - Spooled Tableside Inside a Fresh Wheel of Parmesan Cheese with Prosciutto di Parma and Fresh Basil. I tend to not really like red sauce pasta as much so this is basically how I ended up ordering this. I was able to get a side of Parmesan  crusted chicken added to accompany this dish. Although I wouldn't do back flips for the pasta. I want mind coming here again to try them more from the menu.

For some odd reason the place a mix of busy and empty at the same time. (two private parties that were section off but only about 3 tables out of 20 filled in the dinning area.)

My coworkers and I had a meeting in an office building right next door. We wanted to engage in a little "team building" (otherwise known as "drinking") after the meeting so we came here. It is a very upscale place -great for a "date night." -Or drinking with coworkers. But I digress. The waitstaff was super cool and friendly and we ordered a variety of drinks and appetizers. Also, a few of my coworkers ordered entrees. I tried one -an alfredo pasta dish that was very good. I also liked the appetizers very much (bruschetta, calamari) and was happy they had bottled Lagunitas. A very good experience -if in the area, I would return for dinner!
This is a good Italian restaurant... Very elegant and the service is great... I had an awesome time and I'll be sure to visit again... Great for date night...

It was unfortunate that a excellent dinner was ruined by poor service.  Our waiter - Auturo was more interested in the larger tables then us.  He lost our salad order, which the management comped.  During our whole dinner he never stopped at our table.  It was always a question in passing, as to how our meal was, but not really stopping to check.  He was quick to point out at the end of the meal that if we had to pay for the salad and the wine which we had a certificate for the actual cost of the meal.

The restaurant was not really too busy, which I might have taken as a reason that our service was so poor.

If and when we might go back, we will make sure that he is not our waiter.

Decided to walk to a restaurant from the hotel. I'm from California and I walk in to the eagles playing hotel California so I knew it was going to be good.  Had the bartender order my food. Linguini. Epic flavor not heavy perfect.  Kelly was the bartender along with Jenny who recommended the food they were both pleasant very engaging and felt like a regular here. If your in town this is a must visit.  The martinis are big fantastic and perfect.

Just had my baby shower at Carlucci and it was just wonderful!!  We enjoyed everything and don't have a single complaint and can't thank the staff enough for the attentive and accommodating service!!  All bases were covered and everything from beginning to end ran so smoothly.  All of the servers were so fantastic and helpful, and the attention to detail was outstanding. The food was DELICIOUS!! 

I definitely recommend Carlucci as a place to go for special events or even just dinner for a delicious meal, beautiful ambiance, and outstanding service. Everything about our event was not only right, but above and beyond.  They are wonderful.

What happen to the Monday $5 Pasta???  One of my favorite restaurants is changing.  New management, new chef, new menu.

While the quality is still there, it feels a bit different.  We went there on Monday, expecting some of that delicious and very attractively priced $5 pasta. Unfortunately we were told there was a new chef and the $5 pasta went away.  Of course they still have the same pastas on the menu, so that couldn't be the reason.  Hmmm?

We opted for the pizzas.  The portion of these is much too large for one person to eat.  Had we been told in advance, we might have ordered differently.  However they were good.

It looks like most of our favorite dishes were still on the menu.  That's a good thing.

I was expecting to really be blown away, and I would nearly have given this place a 4 but overall the food was just not that flavorful. The pasta was not homemade the sauces were not out of this world homemade. I had the chicken parm which is a HUGE portion but overall I have had better. 

The service was very good and overall you cannot go wrong, but I have had better Italian food.

Pulled in at lunch time to find cleaning crews blocking all handicap spaces cleaning up from some outside fest held in green.  Spoke to hostess to complain thinking manager would have come over to explain/apologize. Never happened. Had to request to speak to her.  

Wouldn't want to be the owner of the restaurant and have such a site in your parking lot greeting your guests.

Very strange experience leaving a very poor taste in my mouth (clich ).

I definitely enjoyed my meal at Carlucci.  They have a great outdoor space.  It's an extremely nice place to go for a nice meal.  The food is very good - the pasta is perfectly cooked and very flavorful.  I had the gnocchi dish, which was awesome.  My husband had something that was similar to carbonara - it was well cooked and rich, but on the bland side... It definitely needed lemon or something.  We also had the calamari, which was delish!  On Thursday nights, you can bring your own wine without a cork fee, which we are very excited about because the markup on wine is so high at restaurants.  I come from a place where BYOB Italian places are a dime a dozen, so it also makes me feel like I'm home.  They also have a some really nice spaces for private parties.

On the other hand, I think that the service is pretty slow, though, and the prices are pretty high.  If I'm going to drop that kind of cash on a restaurant, I expect a certain level of service.  If it were 25% less and/or the service was 30% better, my rating would be higher.  I don't think I'll go back, and I don't think I would tell people they should definitely go, but it's a decent choice for the area.

Our first time to Carlucci's and it was amazing. The interior is absolutely gorgeous and we even took a stroll outside to the patio. Wish it was warmer, because it looks like a great place to have fun! FYI Music on Saturday nights!

From our appetizers to the desserts, everything was full of flavor and the presentation was beautiful. First time ever having seen pasta being served table side in a hollowed out block of cheese!  I highly recommend this dish and at a price point of 16.95, its spectacular.

Our server Brian answered all our questions and had some great recommendations. Wanted to order everything , but there was only 3 of us. 

The manager KD was very cordial and was very personable. Felt like we were friends forever !

Thank you Carlucci's for a wonderful meal !

See you again 
The Nelson Family

I was lucky enough to enjoy a recent Yelp Elite event at Carlucci, where I've never been even though it is just down the street from me. What an experience! My husband and I will definitely be back.

My first impression of the restaurant was elegance. This is absolutely a spot that I can see myself coming to for a fancy meal with my hub or a fun patio and drinks evening with my pals. The indoor seating is divine, very richly decorated and sophisticated, but the outside patio is beautiful! A large fountain and bistro tables give it a European cafe feel, and there is a bar set up right outside for close access to drinks.

During our event we were served a plethora of appetizer options, all of which I tried and all of which were amazing! If you're in the mood for some rich and authentic Italian, this is a great spot to hit. My favorite dish was the pizza, and the red sauce was also delicious. I can't wait to try a pasta dish next time I'm there.

My wife had the roasted half chicken at an early dinner yesterday, and I ate the leftovers a half hour later. We ere both sick from it all night... Food poisoning.

Update... The management staff contacted me and was extremely professional. She explained their rigorous food safety protocols, and frankly I was impressed with how they handled the situation.

I suppose this could happen anywhere, but how they handled the issue made this establishment stand out as being top notch. Adding back 3 stars to my review, and I'll be back again.

Food 1
Service 3
Tuesday night party of 3
All three entrees were just ok.
My business partner ordered the 3 pasta sampler. He said one was ok. The other 2 were inedible. His plate was cleared and all that was asked was " would you like a to go box" 
They just don't have their act together.
Examples:
Valet parking sign at front door but available parking within 10 feet of door. Why have valet that night?
No specials on Tuesday night 
Front doors filthy
Hostess sitting with valet boy in foyer 
Patio seating not ready 
Focaccia bread just average but with two different toppings
Pepper shakers instead of fresh ground
Price points for entrees at about $20 requires a few amenities.
Never saw a manager 
Avoid this inconsistent mess.
Dont waste your time. Terrible service. Bland food. Hi priced. Just don't. They really need to step up their game.  Used to be good and classy.

I was craving for a good pasta but coming to Carlucci was a bad decision.
I ordered 'Radiatori' which on the menu it is described as: garlic cream, grilled chicken, roasted red peppers, broccoli.
This pasta is overwhelmingly cheesy, I could see the bottom of my plate was full of creamy cheese sauce which was very muddy. 
Every single bite of this pasta tasted very bad, it was a mix of bitterness (maybe because of the garlic) and super cheesy taste. My mouth was full of cream and I could not enjoy the grilled chickens and the broccoli because of how overwhelmingly the cream and the cheesy taste was.
The service was good. On that day the chef actually ran an experiment of  a new dessert and the server serve me a complimentary dessert to try.
I really appreciated the complimentary dessert but unfortunately I could not give a good review for the dessert. This dessert is similar to panna cotta with a taste of goat cheese, with figs and (maybe) a bit walnuts on the top. The taste of the dessert was extremely extremely sweet.
Both the pasta and dessert was not enjoyable at all. 
Sadly, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
This place has changed a bit. The menu is very limited and on a piece of paper. Prices are up as well. I was there last night and it wasn't busy.

Best place for NYE in suburbs.

Went with a group of 4, all in our mid 20s-- very impressed. 

Live music/dancing was a surprise and so much better than DJ and sloppy drunks.

Buffet was on point. Great food all night.

Champagne toast, party favors. 

Manager, staff, and service were fantastic. 

Will definitely be bringing a big group next year! Happy 2016!
We came here for a Yelp event.  A very nice, classy place.  Private rooms.  A nice outside area and good tasting appetizers.

A solid 4 stars 

Had drinks and an app on Saturday at 8 pm

We ate at the bar which had a nice live band. They were loud but that's to be expected with a live band. 

We ordered a french martini and Bellini which were both very nice. The hummingbird martini was not good. It tasted like licorice.

We ordered the burratta -it was solid. It needed more of the pesto it came with or salt and pepper on top. We were at a bar table and didn't have any salt and pepper. I had a flavor crisis lol. The bread it came with was so good!! Buttered lightly and obviously made fresh. Loved it. The tomatoes had a nice vinegar flavor. The dish was a solid 3.5 stars. 

Service was very nice and we were attended to not too much but not too little.

We loved the ambience.

The building is easy to find but kind of hard to get to. They have vallet but also plenty of parking. 

They also have plenty of rooms for private parties.

Everything was terrible and the food was just alright. Our server took our wine order to only card me after he brought it and rudely asked if I was 21. We were greeted after 7 mins of other severs walking by,and the hostess was rude as well. I wanted 25 mins for a refill. 
Our salad was not split when we asked it to be. I had to get up myself to receive the olive oil I asked for. I wanted again for lemons with our fried calamari, like why wouldn't that just come with it? We waited another 25 min for our entree when the restaurant was dead. We almost cancelled our entree because we were so frustrated by the service, food and professionalism. Just a side note, there were flies everywhere.

My wife and I came here for dinner on our anniversary as we had a gift certificate, and they let you bring your own wine.

We sat out on the patio which was really pleasant, and we enjoyed listening to the 2-man cover band that was playing by the outdoor bar.

We started with calamari, which was really good. The pasta we had as entrees wasnt really anything special though. Everything was well prepared and tasted good, but it just didn't have much wow factor.

Our server was also a little inattentive despite only seeming to be responsible for 3-4 tables.
Just sat down and was told there is no way the chef here will make Chicken Parm! Are you serious? An Italian place without an Italian staple?! Last time here ever!

Great experience on a Saturday night. We were told they have a new chef. Outstanding. The seared scallops were perfect, and though I was a little hesitant at first of the fungi with honey and pasta that came with the scallops, it was delicious. Recommended. 

Also had the Pasta Bonato Parmagiano. Another winner. Rich and creamy and excellent. 

The flight of gelato flavors is also highly recommended. I loved them all, and the portions definitely require sharing. Reminded me of Florence. 

Our server Juan did an impeccable job. He recommended the scallop dish (with fungi and honey) and it was spot-on. Great service overall. 

The only reason I am not giving Carlucci's a full five-star rating is for loudness. When the band started in the bar, the restaurant was not unaffected. It didn't bother us all that much, but a romantic and quiet dinner would have been difficult with the music so loud. We were told it was a special Halloween event. Fair enough. And I'll mention, the five-piece band was VERY good! 

We'll be back. Thanks, Carlucci's.

Good Italian food, excellent service. A very convenient location (cross roads of I 355 and Butterfield Road). They have specials on different days which are worth checking out. My favorite - Friday - 1c wine!

One word: AMAZING!!!  Where to start?  
1. The setting is beautiful.  It's clean, classy, and romantic.  There are a couple of private rooms that can be used for banquets (think small weddings, etc.).  There is an awesome courtyard complete with a bar and pretty fountain.  My friend and I enjoyed a glass of wine on a bench in front of the fountain-lovely!
2. Food was great!  I especially liked the calamari.  The breading was light and not heavy!  
3. The manager was so helpful and friendly.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the hostess was cold and made us feel a bit unwelcome.  Other than that, I highly recommend!

One of my favorite meals is the pasta served in the cheese block. We go here on special occasions. It's very filling-so instead of getting the appetizer of it- get it for your meal. You can order it for the amount of people you have. You can not go wrong- it is fantastic. Great atmosphere here. The staff is always excellent too.

The staff is outstanding. Wine was great. My opinion of the food is mediocre. I was not happy with the Cesar salad. Little dressing and the wilted leaves had not been pulled out. The diver s plops are a good choice - however I would ask the waiter to tell the chef to get rid of his salt shaker

Would be 2 stars if not for the outdoor area.  Penny wine night is a joke...super gross wine that you instantly know will give you a wicked headache after more then one glass.  Pasta tasted like it was from aisle 8/frozen section of jewel.  I'd go back for normal wine on the patio during a nice day though.

It was really nice outside. The scene was very nice. My only complaints were we walked in to the area to get a table and no one greeted us for over 10 minutes. I had to walk in to grab a waiter to have someone help us. Once we got our table the waiter was very nice and attentive though.
Overrated. Food just ok. Service was not the greatest. Our waiter had no personality and was not very attentive. Too many restaurants in the area to choose from. Will not go back.

The patio here is great... they have half price wine nights and a band that plays in the summer... food is a bit pricey for what you get but totally worth it.  The pastas and sauces are elegant and fresh. 

Complimentary valet is a nice perk. Restaurant tends to be fairly packed but wait staff and management is highly accommodating.

We showed up to this place wearing street clothes, looking for a place to have a late dinner.  We were in the area, and this place is open till 10:30.  Even though our attire was much to be desired, they treated us as though they didn't notice the t-shirts and jeans we had on.  Aurturo M was our waiter, and we ordered right away... Drinks came right away... KD was the manager on staff, and when the lamb shank special I ordered ran out, they offered desserts on the house without is even complaining.  The presentation was incredible, service was beyond excellent, and we will be back... On Fridays if you order a dinner entree, you get up to 3 glasses of decent wine for only a penny!! Brook is a fabulous bartender !

First time there. Wasn't impressed with the service.  Our waiter was not attentive at all, had to always get his attention just for water. They screwed up our order. He was however very attentive to the table next to us of about eight men, seemed to be regulars. 
 Food wasn't anything to write home about. Just really disappointed :-( .
  The only positive was the entertainment 7th Heaven was amazing!

Service: I read many of the reviews before choosing this restaurant & many said the service was sub-par.  I am here to tell you the service was top notch.  Each round of food and drinks came out one after the other! It was all perfectly timed and Kelli was a fabulous server as well as the gentleman who kept our waters filled, took our plates away and had great conversations with us.  Probably the best service I've had in awhile.  I dislike waiting too long between courses or for the bill-it makes me feel trapped!  So, great job Kelli!

Food: The food was great as well. We started with the meatballs for an appetizer.  My son ordered a caesar salad, but he did not enjoy it, because it was roasted.  (That is probably the one dish I would avoid) The eggplant parm dinner, chicken parm and chicken piccata were all excellent.  I also ordered the red sangria which was HUGE and tasty!  I would definitely recommend this place for a night out!

Went for Valentines Day. Made reservations well in advance and still was put in the "overfill" room. I would've rather sat in the bar. The waiter was indifferent and didn't even ask how the food was. Overall the food was ok. But not worth the price per entree. The menu is very limited. The martinis were very good. In the summer the patio is very nice. But we've always experienced bad service. Probably will give them another try. But I will be more specific where we sit.

I have been here too many times to count. I had my daughters bridal shower here 8 years ago and I had my sons rehearsal dinner here 3 years ago. I have lunch and dinner here. I have been to a yearly fundraiser banquet as well. It used to be my favorite neighborhood Italian restaurant. 

About two weeks ago we decided to have a nice holiday dinner with friends. The atmosphere is so pretty here during The Christmas season. They decorate so tasteful it compliments their rich wood decor. 

After being seated we were given new menus. Unfortunately finding only a couple meals that were familiar. The manager was a making his rounds checking on tables we pointed out that we noticed a lot of new menu items. He said they have a new chef so they changed up the menu.  He said they were getting mixed reviews and had not updated their online menu. We all were happy to try new menu meals. The appetizers were also different. We were told there would be 4 risotto balls in our order. There were three. Another appetizer had the same issue. Luckily with friends it doesn't matter we just shared. The meal was ok. Not our typical experience we enjoyed over the years. The food was ok I think they tried to be more upscale serving rabbit and quail. Not really what we were looking for. The pastas we ordered were on the cool side not much flavor. It was more like they were throwing ingredients together to create something different that didn't blend well. They also changed their bread basket. Just plain French bread.  Not even warmed up. 

The manager said he would be back to see how we liked everything but he never did come back. We just would have told him that the wait staff needs to know the menu better. Also we would like more of their main pastas back. 

We will give Carlucci's another chance in a couple months. We are not in a hurry to go back. Please bring back at least more of the old pasta dishes. 

As for a previous reviewer the Rancic family did dine here. They were friends with the previous manager.

Have you checked out the new menu at Carlucci? Tonight I'm having mezzaluna salad along with mini eggplant antipasti. But I'm really happy with Stufato Di Coniglio...braised rabbit and beautifully al dente pasta. K.D. And Carrie are the best. Oh and the wine...great recommendations.
I really enjoy coming here for the happy hour. Great deal. Wonderful bartenders. I've never had bad service and the food is great. I enjoy the outdoor patio in the summer.

Carlucci staff was really attentive and friendly during our meal, but I was a little disappointed in the pasta dishes. The atmosphere is pretty nice and everything and I would definitely give it another shot, but stay away from the ravioli.

Update: I went back not too long ago and had one of the salads. The salads are definitely where it is at. I was originally a little nervous when my dish came out (I got the Caesar salad, which comes out in a block of lettuce with procciutio on top and the chicken along the side), but it was actually really good.

What a difficult place to review! Service casts a dark cloud on this place, making me give less stars, but I'll review both separately.

POSITIVE: FOOD! The food here is delicious. I've been twice for lunch and it's been great. We ordered nearly every appetizer, and all are flavorful and a great start to the meal. The salads are a great portion for lunch, and the pasta always smells delicious. It's hard not to stuff myself during lunch!

NEGATIVE: SERVICE! My goodness - don't come here if you want prompt service! The first time I came here, I had to state my order two times before finally pointing out what I wanted to a very puzzled man who could not understand me (I'm born and raised in the area, folks. No accent here.). What felt like hours...actually were. It took us TWO HOURS to get through lunch the first time I was here. The second time, 1.5 hours. For a restaurant in a prime location for businesses, they need to firm up that 1.5 to .75 to allow for commute time, otherwise they'll be losing business.

I hope to be able to provide improved reviews in the future - working within walking distance ensures I'll be back for business.

This review is for a post funeral lunch for 25 people in a private room.  Overall, I thought it was just ok.  The food was plentiful but it wasn't served really hot.  So the room temperature pasta entrees tasted just 'ok'.  The appetizer pizzas were really good.

My suggestion is for the servers to serve the head table first. In the case of a funeral, the widow should have received her food first.

I do appreciate the server bringing my son a special request of plain spaghetti.
Recently hosted two bridal shower luncheons at their Downers Grove location.  The food and service were outstanding.  It was a pleasure working with Sharon.  Can't wait to host the next one!

I hate writing a bad review because everyone has a bad night, but Carlucci's was just too terrible tonight not to say something. The lack of service, followed by the poor service, followed by the just mediocre, cold food made for a miserable experience. Drinks were slow and then never offered again, waters sat empty, two out of four of our entrees came out at the same time as of our salads but 20 minutes later we still hadn't seen our waitress to try to correct anything. I could go on, but it was just all bad. She finally appeared and fumbled through an apology and never showed until we asked for the check. Manager never made an appearance but did comp drinks and give $20. He was making the rounds in our section apologizing to other tables on our way out. Regardless, with all of the other great places in the area, best to skip this dud.

That was the worst experience ever. I've been here for my cousin's wedding shower and food was good. We came here today for a business lunch. Service was slow. House cab, TERRIBLE! We ordered a glass of Meritage; it came served with a glass full of fruit flies. They replaced our glasses of wine. Lunch was then served with a curly piece of hair. The Manager came over apologetic but scared. He said he "comped" our lunch, but that was the most EXPENSIVE comped lunch ever...$120 later.  Food was not even good for those that got non-contaminated food. Not sure if I'll ever come back.
Most items are good but some things can be improved upon. Good spot for drinks and apps at the bar. Clean and a nice staff. There are not  really any entrees that stand out and wow you.
The service sucks (consistently) but the food is good and the specials are great! That is why we return.

Service was a solid 3.5 wouldve been a 4 had we not had to remind for the birthday girls first drink and ask for butter for bread and sugar for coffees.       Place is clean and beautifully/festively decorated.    The menu seemed a bit limited 3 chicken dishes tops.   All at $20 plus range.    Im not a huge eater and even after having a couple slices of bread I finished my dish no problem.    That being said I thought it was a little pricey for what it was, nothing spectacular, my chicken breast was actually a little tough in areas.    Would be willing to try again with a big group since location was right off the highway at 355 & Butterfield.

This place is just as great for a romantic night out for two or a large get together! Fantastic service, consistently fabulous food, and the atmosphere is truly wonderful. Gorgeous bar & bar area separate from the main dining area which is nice, then there is a huge round room dining area as well as a stunning patio during the summertime (if it's warm out- you should TOTALLY sit on the patio!) Wine list is substantial and they typically have dinner specials weekly and seasonally. 

Garbanzo puree soup and ravioli have been my favorites, although the chicken picatta and steaks are really nice too.  

I wasn't a big fan of the canoli (gasp!) but everything else I've literally ever had here has been 5 stars and well makes up for that ;-)
This place went done hill. I ordered grilled calamari it was so rubbery. You can tell it was frozen fish. Other Italian places in the area. Bar tender brunette was not friendly at all.
Good area i liked the style of it alot.. Food is ok but service is absolutely the worst.. They need to improve it.

1st time customer from out of town.
Excellent service, waiter was attentive.
Excellent  Salmon entree  for dinner.
Definitely one to come back to.

Took my two daughters to Carlucci's on Thursday, August 6, 2015 for a special occasion and we were very disappointed. We sat out on the patio because the weather was perfect, however, the service and food did not match the ambiance. I ordered the scallops and my daughters ordered pasta. The scallops came with a very small amount of green beans that looked like they sat under a heat lamp for an hour because they had the appearance of being dehydrated. Every single scallop had some grit with every bite as if they weren't properly cleaned before cooking and they were lacking in flavor. We had to continuously wait for wine and water and silverware. They served bread and oil before we had plates or silverware and we sat there for a long time. Then later - after dinner I was still hungry because of the dried up and small amount of veggies served, that I ordered an appetizer pizza and once again it was served on a table that had no plates and it took several minutes for the manager, Brandon to return with the plates. Oh - I had to send the pizza back the first time because it was under cooked and doughy. 

On a good note - my daughters' pasta was delicious but the service, scallops, and pizza were below average at best. I have been there several times and I have received  outstanding service and delicious food so it was quite shocking that yesterday was such a disappointment. The worst part - when I asked the manager if he was short handed he said he wasn't and when I told him all the issues we had (he knew of many of them because he had to serve our pizza and get someone two times to fill our waters and bring us plates and silverware) he did not apologize. I'm not sure if we will go back - hopefully it was just an off isolated situation because they have an excellent reputation within my group of friends but I will think twice before revisiting.
Horrible service, mediocre food. That's all I can say about this place. Will never be back! I'll stick with Maggianos or Rosebuds. That's what service and good food should be like.

We were in the area and decided to stop in for dinner.  We ordered the cast iron shrimp which were mediocre, the burrata and prosciutto which were tasteless and just not very good. The waiter was very nice and attentive. He offered to switch out one of the three appetizers. We chose to try the meatballs which my boyfriend said were just okay. We decided to give it one more shot and ordered the homemade gnocchi and the lobster ravioli. We had two bites each and just asked to get it wrapped. I have to say that the service was great, but the food needs work. We will not be returning.

Went there for new years party. Had a group of 10 people ranging in ages 30-36 and we were easily the youngest ones in the entire restaurant. Pretty boring night.  Food was good though. I would go back in about 30 years when I'm 60 and I would fit right in!

CUSTOMERS BEWARE! My car and another were broken into while attending a wedding party at Carlucci in Downers Grove. Meanwhile two valets were standing around inside talking to the hostesses.  The responding officer said that he'd covered three break-ins there himself in six weeks, who knows how many other break-ins have been handled by other officers. When I told the restaurant staff that they have a security problem, the valet told me it wasn't his job to watch the parking lot.  There's clearly a pattern of break-ins at Carlucci and the restaurant is at best unresponsive or indifferent.  Why not have idle staff walk the lot when you know your patrons' cars have been broken into?  The manager on duty did his best to handle the situation, but there's clearly a lack of communication at the management level across shifts and the "not my problem" attitude of the valet only served to further deteriorate the incident.

In fairness, the party was quite enjoyable until the police showed up.  The food was good and the waitstaff was professional and clearly enjoyed their work.  Unfortunately, it's not nearly worth the risk.  If you go, do not park on the side or in the back.  If the front lot is full, just keep on going, even Olive Garden is preferable to a break-in.

This place has a great atmosphere and reasonably priced.  Food is served table-side for some dishes.  I tried the Caprese with my friends and we loved it.  They have a decent selection of wine too, which is a nice touch to a good dinner.  We had a couple of pasta dishes that were a little bland but overall the food was delicious.  I would go there again.

We got married there this past October and we couldn't have picked a better location. Not only did the great staff work with us from the beginning to end, but throughout the night they were wonderful to our guest. I received so many complements about the food and the drinks. I can't believe how much food we got at such a great price. 

I believe the name of the room we were in was called the Fountain room and it was gorgeous. The staff was great with helping my wedding party get the place together for the big moment. I wanted a small, intimate wedding and that's what we got. 

The food was impeccable and my guest got to take home leftovers. The kids loved the pizza. My nephew said that was his favorite part. The linguini pasta dish severed in a wheel of parmesan cheese was outstanding.  I couldn't finish it so I was happy to take it home. I recommend this place to everyone for any major event. Especially weddings. Thank you again, Sharon.

I made dinner reservations for Sunday, 5/22 at 5pm for a birthday celebration. We arrived and were seated by the hostess with a see-thru skirt and she was clearly wearing a black thong. It was a beautiful night out and we asked to be seated on the patio - she informed us no tables for 5 were set up and didn't offer to set one. The restaurant was empty. We were given the menu - we had to ask for a wine list and cocktail menu. The waitress was horrible - we had to ask what the specials were and for bread and for parmesan cheese, salt and pepper for the olive oil. It took about about 15 mins to get our drinks, after we asked someone to check on them. The food we ordered was good for the most part. One order of pasta came dry with no sauce on it, so we had to track down someone to bring some sauce.  The desserts were not good at all. We ordered 3 - all of them were mediocre at best - chocolate cake was very dry. Our waitress was non-existent we had to ask anyone we could find for the bill and then again to pay the bill. The manager was walking around filling water glasses. Another table of 5 were seated next to us and unfortunately had the same terrible service, they still hadn't ordered or received their drinks for about 30 minutes, they requested to speak to the manager. We will not be returning to this restaurant - that used to be good.
At best meh.  Food was ok but I've had better from Olive Garden.  Presentation and service was pretty poor.  I'm really not picky.

What the Hell Happened? I suggested having a birthday party here for a dear friend. Three of the people drove in from the city for this affair. It was a Saturday night and the dining room was mysteriously only half full? Our waiter must have just come out of plastic surgery to cover up his lobotomy scar! It's hard to remember the last time I had someone this ignorant! We ordered our drinks and they came in 10 minutes time. That was all well as we were waiting for the bday girl to show. We ordered a round of appetizers at that time. One of our guests asked if the corciofi fritti were the hearts. He told her they were fried. Right! The apps came 20 minutes later and we chowed down. We had to ask for the waiter to order more as the plates were clearly not going to be enough. That is where the shit started to stick to the fan. They cleared the table and brought the second round. But no one had a dish or silverware. At that point I had already asked for a drink and bread for the second time. So I turned around and took what I needed from the empty table behind me. As we were enjoying each others company I thought that it was about time for our waiter to show his face at our table. I knew what he looked like because for the last half hour he was licking everyone's ass at the next table. Never wanted get up and punch someone, but this was the time to do it. I asked for a drink for the third time and he told me he put it in already. Is that supposed to mean something to me? I at the same time asked where the bread was. Guess what. It was in as well. He took my order and the two ladies next to me, but was stretching his neck looking over at the next table. He stopped taking our orders and went to that table. WTF people! I got up and he saw me, so he came back to take the rest of our orders. Now I get the same thing every time I come here. Porchetta. Don't know who was in the kitchen that night, but was soon as they put it in front of me I knew something was wrong. The pork was hard. I even gave some to my friends just to make sure I wasn't crazy. The were 2 onions, 3 carrots and a plop of mashed that looked like they couldn't spare it. Now I would be well on my way to happyville by now but I was still on my first drink!!!! So yes, I was alert and annoyed! When we were finished eating, they cleared the table like we had never been there. Then Lino decides to make another appearance. Doesn't ask if we needed anything or if the meal was ok. He asked if we wanted the check. (So much for the birthday cake) I told he I would love the check and how about that drink. It was brought out by him and was not on the check. I would have paid for twenty of them if I could have drank them with my fucking meal. Not to be rude! But there are about 40 restaurants that I have to pass to come here that I have had zero problems with. That's for everything C! it's been nice. 

Note: There was a band playing in the bar. We parked it there for a while. The bartender was excellent and she even brought out a piece of cake for my friend. hats off to her!!!

We ended up having to leave even before we ordered dinner... First I want to say I'm not that person nor are my husband and I that couple.. We dine out frequently.  Let me also preface it wasn't the server or the foh fault at all... However we started off with the bocci ball appetizer and it was cold in the center... Got another one and again if was cold in the center... The manager came over and apologized and offered to buy us drinks which we accepted.. We decided to try our luck on a salad... We chose the pear salad... If was tasty but the lettuce was brown... So we sent out back and decided to leave to go somewhere else.. We were hoping for a much better experience and may try it again in the future but needless to say we were sadly disappointed

Had a great time with my team that won our volleyball league and got gift certificates to Carlucci's. Then the bill came and shit got real. They refused to honor our gift certificates because we used them on a special night, WHICH THEY HAVE EVERY NIGHT. We would have been happy to only use one of the two gift certificates, but the GM, Genti Mesi, refused to take either of them.

He treated us rudely, wasn't willing to compromise at all, and lost 7 customers, all within 10 minutes.

I strongly suggest you think twice about spending your money here when the foods is so/so, the service is slow, and the management is inconsiderate and rude.

Everything was excellent. We had the meatball appetizer (the name in Italian sounds much better), which was outstanding.  The lobster ravioli in vodka sauce and the porchetta were both great.  It was Valentines dinner, and the service and ambiance were perfect.

OK, I just ate there tonight so this is as fresh as can be review...

Staff-  Good.  4 Stars

Ambiance 3.5 Stars.  Not the best, not the worst, not romantic but nice.

I ordered butternut squash ravioli...sounded really good with crushed amaretto cookies sprinkled on top.  Only problem was when the ravioli came (it looked delicious) it turned out they forgot the filling.  I got a bunch of empty pasta that looked like butternut squash ravioli.  How does a cook not notice the ravioli is empty and send it out of the kitchen???

The staff was very appologetic and nice.  I have to say I would try this place again and hope for a correct dish based purely on the proffesionalism of the staff.

No, I did not opt for a replacement meal...I have seen the movie "Waiting" so I know what happens to food that is sent back.  Not that these guys would do that but it grosses me out.

I was so excited to try this place and someone suggested it for a GNO because they have a penny wine special. They offer a few different wines at a penny a glass up to three glasses with the purchase of an entree excluding pizza. Okay, sounds good. Got there and they poured our first glass then took about a year to come back for a second pour and to take our orders. At one point I realized I didn't have a water glass and the bus person was all kinds of huffy about getting me one. Also, my friend next to me never got a second pour or refill on her water glass. I was also missing a place setting but never attempted to flag down a set and just used a friend's fork. What. Why. A place with cloth napkins and mood lighting should notice these things.

We had about sixteen people there and they placed bread on the table once. We sat forever after placing our orders to actually get the food. Oh, and it's ala carte. I was never even asked if I wanted a salad or soup which for the price of their pasta should be included. 

At one point I looked at my friend and said "I'm writing my yelp review in my head and we're slowly losing stars as the night wears on". That's pretty sad but at that point I was at three stars. Then the food came and my pasta was bland, blah, uninspired. I asked my friends how they liked their food and one had the gluten free pizza and said it was terrible. The calamari was chewy. The chicken pasta was rubbery. All this for roughly 18.00 a plate. Then it went down to two stars.

Three hours later it was time to pay and leave and the waiter said he wouldn't split up our checks. I realize it's a pain for them, especially with that many people but please. I guess he changed his mind and split them. He stood at the head of the table and called out what people had having no organization to the orders. That's also how the food came out which sounded something like this, "who had the eggplant pasta", etc. More on par with a fast food place than fine dining.
Needless to say I won't be coming back Carlucci. I'm afraid your penny wine idea didn't work. It got us in the door but I know several that will never come back due to poor follow up.
Margherita pizza is so yummy!

We have been going to Carlucci's for some time.  Always enjoyed our experience except last night.  There were six of us. Bit was extremely warm in the restaurant.  Our table was so dark we had to use flash lights to read the menu and bill.  Service and food was not good at all.  Not sure what happened here but it makes me very sad.  It is a beautiful place.

Great summer place - went here with my wife while on a business trip - service was fantastic. There was a live band playing outside - great atmosphere. And it was bring your own wine night on Thursday

The service and attitude of the employees at this location is horrible.  They are RUDE!  I called one of the girls out in the banquet area who had a mouth and attitude and told her she was rude.  She replied to me, "Really, you think this is rude, you have no idea how rude I can be."  I honestly can't imagine it being much worse...but if that was a warning...  I wouldn't go back there.  In the service industry, service is everything.  They don't understand that.  Also, when you are working for tips, I can't imagine you're too successful!  Go to Brio down the street for good Italian food and great service.  Save yourself the aggravation!

I visited the restaurant for a business meeting and the alternate of the restaurant was appropriate for a business meeting. Good service and good food. I ordered ravioli with lobster and shrimp in vodka sauce and it was absolutely delicious. Price were reasonable and they have a decent wine list. Will definitely come back for another meeting or to try something else.

Myself and 10 other family members went here for easter. The servers were extremely friendly and helpful...However the food is where we had an issue. 3 people got the French toast. One persons was burnt to a crisp, another person's was basically toast with apples on top, and luckily the third persons was great. 3 of us also ordered the chicken parm. All 3 of us agree that it was basically noodles and chicken with tomato paste. No seasoning AT ALL. Another person ordered meatballs, another a chicken dish, and another veal. 3 of us originally wanted the crapes,  which unfortunately they were out of. Oh yes, and the bread before the meal...we got enough bread for each of us to have 1/2 a piece. When we were ready to pay the bill it took our server 4 tries to get our bill correct. We had random stuff on the bill such as a beet salad and a kiddie cocktail, both of which none of us ordered. Make sure to check your receipt before you pay!! Feels like a scam is going on!  I was also kind of concerned about the way some of the staff was dressed...I felt like I was in a strip club. The one bartender was wearing a white lace dress that came JUST below her butt cheeks, and was completely see threw. I mean if she hadn't been wearing underwear and a bra (which was clearly visible) it would have been x-rated.

All in all I would not return. High price for horrible food. Would have been a better idea to go to IHOP for brunch. We won't be back.
I think food is not so bad but is for sure overpriced, and the service is horrible, really bad experience

The bar is fun, but has a bad odor. Smells like a sewer pipe needs attention.
The food was the absolute worst the night we were all there. And several people commented that the quality had declined.
Server stated the cook was off that night.
Managers were trying but fell short. 
We will never return!

Went here for Mother's Day and won't be back.  No one told us that it was a buffet only for the day.  No one mentioned that when the reservation was made, the banner outside does not say Mother's Day buffet--we had to ask the server.  The food was okay--nothing spectacular.  The bill for the four of us was astronomical  and the server expected a 20% tip which wasn't included in the bill.  The server was basically useless but still wanted a huge tip. This place is ridiculous!

I just had an event here in the Garden Room for 70 people. The event was for a Memorial luncheon for my sister. I can't begin to say enough about the staff, the food, this restaurant. From start to finish - everything was perfect. The staff knew the purpose of the event and every one of them was respectful and two of them came up to me to give me a hug. 

We had a video playing and couldn't figure out the technology. One of the managers brought his own equipment from home and came in early from his shift (half a day early!!!) to make sure that we could play our video.

The event coordinator, Sharon, has got to be one of the sweetest people I have ever met. She did everything we asked and then some. She was there the entire time but respectful of our privacy as well.

If I could give this restaurant 10 stars, I would.

Best suburban outdoor patio in Chicagoland. We love the food there and service is always impeccable. They also have great daily specials like Wednesdays $5 martinis, BYO-Vino on Thursdays,  as well as Monday - Friday $3 & $5 Appetizers in the bar and rotating live band entertainment every Thursday and Saturday night which is even more fun when it's outdoors on their patio. Carlucci is one of our family's first restaurant choice and highly recommended.
It's pretty good for business lunches but the service in the bar is awful. Don't done here for a quick lunch!

Bad service. My friends and I went to watch a band last weekend and I felt like we kept being harassed for being outside without reservation and when we told the waiters(more than one) that we will order an appetizer and drinks they disappeared and never came back with the menu. We decided to leave cause it wasn't worth the headache. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

I want to give 3.5 stars.  I would give higher but my friends food (chicken) came underdone.  Not acceptable for chicken. The management was very apologetic,  removed item from bill & offered entire group of 10 free dessert.  Fortunately my friend did not get sick or my review would have a much different tone.

If I could give 2.5 I would. It's just... Meh. Pasts was Ok, deserts were tasty, vino good, service was good but slightly over zealous manicuring the table. Not bad, but not great. Too pricy for what you get.

My friends and I have been coming here for penny wine night on Friday for a while now.  (Yes, I said penny!).  We've gotten to know the staff by name and they are always so generous when we come in.  

I setup a larger reservation for a friend's birthday a few months ago.  When we got there, they had a private room ready for us.  We were just expecting a table, so this was a great surprise and totally made our night! 

This type of service, great food, penny wine, and special events that Carlucci provides definitely keeps us coming back!

Just had a gals dinner there on a Friday night.  It was definitely not what I had expected as I've been there before for an event and everything was great!

My Father got married a 2nd time a few years back.  His reception of about 25 people was hosted at Carlucci's in a private room.  Everything was great from the food to the service.  We were very pleased THAT time hence the extra star that I would not have given for my recent experience.  

Fast forward to now............

I often have girls night dinners out to give everyone a break from life.  I wanted a place that offered a selection and had a nice atmosphere but was affordable so I picked Carlucci's.

There were only 5 of us.  Two of us are pregnant so not much liquor was going to be ordered.  We were seated at a huge, half circle booth that kept us pretty spaced apart and therefore we had to talk pretty loud to have a conversation which I'm sure annoyed the other customers sitting within ear range.

Bread was brought to the table with no butter, no oil, no cheese, no plates.  We had to ask.

Appetizer was ordered (fried calamari) and took quite some time to get out.  It was good.  Cooked well and good size portion.

Dinner was ordered by everyone.  Couple pasta dishes, a salmon, and I had the 
Pesce al Cartoccio which is the tilapia, shrimp, finfish and veggies baked in parchment paper.

The gals that had pasta (2 with Bolgnesa - 1 with the Sunday Gravy) said they were "ok".  Nothing special about them at all.

The gal that had the Salmon and I both had the same opinion about our meals..... Bland!!!!!  Nothing at all that I would order again and seeing as how we are both the pregnant ones, a nice meal would of been the highlight of our day!  Instead I ate about 6 bites and packed up the rest for my not so picky husband.

As for the service, there was the server, and then the busser/backup server.  Too many times we were left with empty glasses of water and soda.  Too many requests were left unfulfilled like a couple missed pop orders and lemon for our meals.  It become comical how many things we went without or how long it would take the server to realize "Oh hey didn't you ask me for such & such like 10 minutes ago?"

It was not the night I had hoped for and I left apologizing to everyone for choosing such a disappointing dinner spot.  I will never go there again nor will any of my friends as it was a very dissatisfying experience.

Ehhh, Carlucci. 

The atmosphere and lovely Christmas decor makes me want to love this place, but the service and the food quality has me think twice. We went here saturday night for dinner. Our reservations were for 6 at 7:30. The restaurant wasn't all that crowded upon arrival, but we arrived early and sat in the bar to have a drink while waiting for our table. The bar decor and service was the best of the night-- really put me in the holiday spirit! Too bad it was followed up with the dinning room experience!

Although our waiter was friendly, he was slooooooooow. My boyfriends drinks were constantly empty as we're others at our table. We ordered a bottle of white wine, no chiller was brought to the table to keep it cold :( We then ordered several appetizers- the calmari was good, the rest were just ok(cheese balls and mushroom app). However, It was a bit aggravating that the one app we were all enjoying was bussed away before we were given the chance to finish it.. Another strike Carlucci!

Then came dinner... Many at our table were eying up a special entree-but to their disappoint our waiter informed us the restaurant was out of that dish and many others. I ended up settling on a pasta dish that I could have made at home. It was extremely bland and for $16.95 came with no meat, shrimp, etc-- was just penne, white wine, spinach and mushrooms. 

When it came to dessert--huge disappointment. Being a group of chocolate lovers, we were all looking forward to the chocolate dessert on special. Surprise surprise, they were out. So we asked for the chocolate lava cake--a carlucci staple on their dessert menu- also out! Really out? On a Saturday at 730 during the holiday season? You would think better preparations would be made. 

Needless to say our group ended up spending over $400. We still left a 20% tip even though the service wasn't up to par, but hey, tis' the season. Just hopefully our next group outing will be to a more worthy establishment!

I had dinner with my husband last night at Carlucci's and the atmosphere was beautiful.  We sat with a view of the patio (it was too humid to sit outside).  

The artichoke appetizer was amazing, but a bit overpriced for the two artichokes that are given.  We also had the zucchini fritti which was pretty bland.  We ordered the whitefish special and the house specialty linguini.  The whitefish was extremely sweet and the linguini was pretty good.  The linguini comes with a fun presentation in a parmesan cheese wheel.  That was the best part!  Overall it wasn't bad, but wasn't great either.

Wow. I drove by this place many times and finally decided to stop in for dinner with my husband. Our food was delicious. We've tried many Italian restaurants and this one by far is one of the best. Staff is very nice. The restaurant itself is very cozy.

My husband and I tried Carlucci for our anniversary, and we really enjoyed it!  We sat outside on the patio and had a great time.  Our waiter was friendly and helpful, and service was attentive - we never had to wait to have wine, water or bread refilled.  The penny wine night is a great promotion - when you purchase an entree you receive up to three glasses of house wine for only a penny each.  We both enjoyed our pastas.  I tried the seafood ravioli (could have been larger) and my husband had the eggplant parm (huge portion!)  We would recommend Carlucci!

Great atmosphere, classy place.  Ordered the 12oz meatball for an appetizer because I had to see what an almost pound of meat-a-ball looks like.   Solid 12oz of amazing well done ball.    Everything else was at least above average and the service was worth an extra couple bucks for the effort, rare I know.

Must try their food and sangria.
Went with friends for drinks and starters, everything was delicious.  I can't believe it took me so long to try the food.  

I will definitely return.

Met some co-workers after work for a birthday celebration.  Happy hour has a great appetizers menu that was reasonably priced.  Had the chips, salsa, guac as a starter.  Ordered, flautas and quesadillas.  Flautas had a great presentation and were pretty tasty.  The chicken quesadilla were pretty good.  Had plenty of chicken and just the right amount of 'kick'.
The homemade tamales were covered with mole', but my coworker thought they were pretty authentic.  The place is well decorated and quite large.     Outside on the patio the have heated lamps for the chilly fall nights.  Ideal for large parties or groups.
The waitress was attentive, not always patient.  As soon as someone placed an order, she darted of before anyone else could order which made her come back several times.
Will definitely try it again for dinner.

Certainly a unique place for a meal with some ethnic cuisine.

We were disappointed they didn't have paella available on the night that we visited. It is worth nothing that they only serve that on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Perhaps I missed out on something that would have made my visit better. I probably won't find out any time soon.

We ordered a couple of appetizers to share at our table, and they were probably the best part of the meal. I ordered several different kinds of tacos for my main meal. Some were better than others, but there were those I didn't care for at all as well. None of them were your typical tacos. They had choices like lamb, duck, lobster, and other interesting options. You can imagine why some of the tacos didn't really work. Overall, the food was pretty good though.

It was something different, but not a place I would frequent.

We came with a groupon for brunch, which was perhaps our first mistake. The decor is absolutely darling and looks like something worthy of downtown Chicago. The chips and salsa they serve initially were very good, with a variety of salsa and tricolored chips that were tasty and fresh. The waitress we had was very knowledgeable and peppy, which I appreciated! Our table ordered the chilaquiles, pancakes, tacos, and chicken and waffles. The tacos were really the only thing anyone liked, as the potatoes and beans were heavy, as were the chilaquiles, pancakes, and waffles. The waitress recommended churros, which were yummy, and I think we ought to have taken her advice when we ordered entrees! My tacos were very tasty, so I will need to come back again for lunch or dinner and try what this restaurant is really good at. It definitely has potential!

I wanted to love this place the moment I walked in. The decor is super cute (big animal heads) and the bar looks very capable (we were there for brunch). It might be better at night. Our waitress was great - friendly, spirited, capable. The food... ugh. I ordered chilaquiles, which usually is some variant of corn tortillas cooked up nicely with eggs and chile. This was a pile of fried corn tortillas (greasy) holding up 2 over medium eggs covered with red and green vinegar sauces. Maybe that sauce was supposed to be some kind of salsa but it basically made everything inedible. The potatoes on the side were the frozen, mealy variety. On the advice of the waitress, we ordered churros for dessert. Super sweet cinnamon sugar fried dough (well, I was expecting that) with yucky chocolate and caramel dipping sauces. Stay away from that. Overall a disappointment because the food isn't great and the decor can't compensate.
Not bad, I would try it again. It has a nice Latin flare.  I wish they had dancing.

Bought a Groupon which let us taste several dishes at this place we had wanted to try but kind of pricey. Bought 2 chicken tacos for my son which he liked because the chicken was soft and the Tinga not spicy. Hubby got the torta which he said was not that great. I got French toast AND chicken and waffles. I liked what I had and had a lot to take home. I just forgot to mention to the server not to use cantaloupe since I'm allergic. The server, Anne S., was excellent!

I've only been here once but it was fantastic! Our server was very polite and funny! We had the fishbowl Sangria special for $19 and it was delicious, for four people we each got 2 glasses out of it. I would highly suggest getting the Sangria, the mango flavor was delicious! 

For dinner, I had 4 tacos for about $13, with no sides. This restaurant is a little pricey but not outrageous. I would probably come back on a week night when they have specials. 

I had short rib, pastor, pollo, and ground beef tacos. The pastor was really spicy! The pollo was definitely the most mild. The meat in the short rib taco was my favorite! All of the meat was high quality and wasn't fatty. 

I've driven past the place many times, I'm glad I finally stopped in! 

My friends recommend the empanadas!

After driving by this place so many times, finally got a chance to dine at Barbakoa for lunch.

The place was almost empty but there are several big rooms/areas which swallow up diners. That's OK.  There are large tables, smaller cozy table as well as outdoor seating.  Also it looks like you can dine at the bar if you wish.

Big menu- lots of tacos, appy sized dished and well as some entrees.  My group mostly chose the tortas. I had the beef short rib which was tasty but messy.  It was dressed with delicious guacamole but also quite a bit of beef fat ( I guess?).  It came with fries with chimichurri which was a nice touch.  Portion was huge for $12.

One of my dining partners had one of the taco samplers. Next time I go I will order that- much lighter but according to her very tasty.

Looks like they have daily drink specials so this might be a great evening spot to go.  Fast courteous service. 

Bill for 5 with just a few soft drinks- $100.

I'll be back.

Great spot for a date night!

The second you walk in the door you feel like you are on vacation. The food will take your taste buds on the trip you are craving.

I recommend Chef Dudley's Shared Tasting Menu. The tasting menu gives you the chance to taste a little bit of everything on the menu and gives you options to choose how much you want to try. 

For just $24/person (must have at least two people) we sampled two guacamoles, two salsas, four different types of tacos (each person gets four tacos) and one chef's dessert. We enjoyed everything we tried but the different types of guacamole were my favorite. 

The tropical drink selection was great. I got the Pomegranate Ginger Habanero Mojito and my husband enjoyed the Clooney Margarita (comes with a taste of celebrity tequila on the side). 

Stop in and enjoy the vacation you have been craving.

Went there to lunch with some coworkers and I thought the food was good.  I would go back and try more of the tacos as that was the original reason why I went there.  I got lured in to get the lunch special which was good but I should have gotten the tacos so I could try a few of them.  I got the short-rib taco special which included guacamole, salad and beans.  All very good but I want to go back and try some of the other tacos.

The only reason why I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is because of 3 reasons.
1.  The food was a bit too salty, gave me a salty after taste for a while afterwards (now I am over sensitive to this because I do not eat a lot of salt)
2.  The tacos fell apart, they should be double wrapped to prevent this
3.  The tacos tasted good but not amazing.  Look at my other reviews to see some of the taco places that I have been to as I love tacos and I am always looking for a great taco place.

I would check them out again as the food was good enough to try again.  Plus they have a great outdoor space

WOW!!! That basically sums up my visit to Barbakoa.

I arrived with my brother and our friend around 10:30 on a Friday night. The place closes at 11, so we kind of felt bad coming in so late, but my brother, who had been there before, prepped us on what this place was about.

Our waiter was a nice guy. We were ready to order right after being seated, but he disappeared for about 10 minutes... I guess they wanted us to stay past closing?

Anyways, we all wanted tacos, and that's what we got. I ordered the pollo (which I said like a gringo), short rib, and hongos (mushrooms, cheese, and poblano peppers. I also ordered a side of the wood-grilled vegetables, which were topped with fresco cheese and a balsamic reductions.

My dining companions ordered different types of tacos, so I can't really comment on them. I will say that my brother ordered the carne asada tacos, which looked amazing!

That being said, my tacos were excellent! If I were to rank them, I would say that the chicken was my favorite, followed by the hongos and short rib.

The tacos are priced from 2.50-4 dollars for a single taco, or 9-15 dollars for four, depending on which meat/seafood you choose.

Everything was so good. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant, as well as the food. The food came out quickly, and was enjoyed in the same manner.
