Our waiter was impressed that my brother and I each downed 12 tacos, as well as my side of vegetables. That's not a lot of food for me... I probably could have ordered 8 more and still not be completely full. I like being not fat, so I stopped.

All in all, an excellent establishment. The waiter came back at 11:05, when we were about done, and apologized that the kitchen was closed and that we wouldn't be able to have dessert. That wasn't a problem; I felt bad because we came in so late, but we got out of there as soon as possible.

I can't wait to go back. I love how such a simple food like tacos can be so good. The prices are a bit high, but since this is a once in a while place, I'll pay a bit extra.

I've been to Barbakoa a few times now and I absolutely adore this place! The ambiance is chic and relaxing and the food is delicious. Plus, they have awesome specials every day of the week!

Barbakoa's chef is very knowledgeable and does a great job pairing together different unique flavors. These are all the amazing offerings I've tried (so far)...

- Empanadas
- Lobster taco
- Shrimp taco
- Carne asada taco
- Slow roasted pork taco
- Guacamole trio
- Mushroom taco
- Ahi tuna ceviche
- Shrimp ceviche
- Four different types of salsa
- Churros with chocolate and caramel
- House margaritas
- White and red sangria

While everything I tried was tasty, my standout favorites by far is the shrimp ceviche, guacamole, carne asada taco, the churros and the house margaritas. You seriously can't go wrong with those options!

Service has been stellar each time I have dined. Prices are fair and their specials are hard to pass up. Off the top of my head I know they have half off wine on Tuesdays and fish bowl cocktails on Fridays!

Their locations is super convenient being right by the highway. They have a couple different private rooms, high top tables, lower tables, half booths, a full bar, and a beautiful patio with a fireplace. Definitely give Barbakoa a try! It's a great spot for a date night, meal with friends, or even just drinks (but good luck trying to avoid such a superb menu!).

Just get a whole mess of tacos.

Seriously, don't hold back.  They're small so have five.

Very good time at this place.  Drinks are excellent, food is outstanding.

Eat the tacos, yes, but they also make homemade tamales which are also out of this world.

We've been 3 times so far - last time was for brunch.  I got a big plate of chilaquiles which was very delicious and tasted like what my old buddy from Jalisco used to make for me.

Just go there and have fun and don't over think it.

The good...the food is very tasty and was served very swiftly by very courteous staff. The bad....nothing is complimentary, not even chips and salsa, and its all a bit overpriced. The ugly....the salsa you have to buy amounts to a few tablespoons, im serious, no exaggeration....a few tablespoons. I was not impressed with their business model,  we won't be returning.

I loved this place! Not only the location, decor, and service, but the food was AWESOME! I can't think of any other tacos that I've had in my twenty seven year eating career that were better!

The waitress let us know that it was Cerveza Tuesday! Corona for me and two cocktails for my friend! She went with the Clooney and another one that I can't remember. She even offered me a sip but I decline since I was staring at the tacos.

We ordered to share and it was awesome. We shared every plate except I had the shrimp since I ordered those on my own. Skip the shrimp, but I have to say the carne asada was my favorite!

Others we ordered: Pork pibil, al pastor, short rib, rajas con queso and we even started with guacamole!

I cannot wait to be back. I want to go again...like right now!

Best TACOS EVER!

First time here...

Tacos are amazing and authentic! Very flavorful and a great variety for a reasonable price.

They have drink specials too every day of the week.

Great tequila and the service is really outgoing and attentive.

Highly recommended!!

Came randomly while on a business trip. Came in to the restaurant and was asked if we had a reservation. Very interesting becuase we came into an empty restaurant on a Saturday night. It should be packed on a weekend! 
I ordered the salmon which was on the special. It was raw. Uncooked. I told the waiter and waited 10 minutes to get neither Uncooked raw salmon. Just ended up getting the chicken. It was ok. Nothing special. Tacos were very dry. Guacamole with tortillas was good.. But how can you get that wrong? 

Overall. Very disappointed. Wouldn't recommend

Came to celebrate a friends Birthday and what a great experience not only the service but the food and overall experience.  I will definitely be back with friends and family. The visual decor is super beautiful

Need to get away from the city but would still like to be wine and dine. Then this is the place for you. The music will make your feet move and the environment will have you feeling romantic specially with the nice cool lighting. The service will also make you feel special - our server was very logical with the menu and full of energy. I enjoyed the portion but for some it might be too small. The mini taco filled me up - flavor a were bursting in freshness! Would absolutely go back and  take someone special with me.

Stopped in here for a bite to eat. This place advertises itself as Latin cuisine but I'm not sure what they mean and I'm pretty sure they don't either. Menu items were heavy on taco variations. They did have a couple menu items. (Empanadas) but it is heavy on tacos.
Upon entering, it was pretty early and only a few were dining. The "Host" decides that he wants to place us in an almost empty restaurant in an open booth right next to a couple of girls. There must have been at least 25 open tables and he decided that this would be a good spot? Only if we knew the other people because we would have been rubbing elbows. Stunod!
OK, that's out of the way.

 Our server was nice and he was knowledgeable about the menu. I had to order salsa with chips which is always complimentary in Mexican restaurants but here they charge you for a small basket of chips with two shot glass amounts of different salsas. That is called a money grab. It's also 9 bucks for a small house margarita.

We ordered various tacos. Their tacos are about 70% size wise of a normal taco. I don't know where they get their tortilla's, but they were the smallest I'VE EVER SEEN. A three bite taco.

As for the taste of the tacos themselves.........yawn. Nothing special at all. I have had better, much better at a much more reasonable cost. This place is not inexpensive.

It is a nicely decorated place inside, just wish it was better on the food + pricing.

Others may like it more than me. I can't recommend it. I live in an area where I can get this type food much better at a better price.

Cheers to All

What can I say? I'm a sucker for upscale Latin fare  so needless to say I HAD to try this place out. I knew right away when my friends suggested a girls night that I'd have them come here. Now for the review:
Everything from service to atmosphere and drinks is 5 stars. The margs are made fresh and to order; I was pleasantly surprised when I asked for a half sweet marg and they didn't blink an eye. Love the music they have playing and all of the decorations. That's probably why I'll be back. Only reason I gave them a 3 star review was due to the food. The portions were small and bland. I ordered the short rib, chicken and al pastor taco and none of them were delicious. There where no salsas that came with them or even anything out on the table. My friends ordered the donuts for desert and sent them back due to them being hard and flavorless. The server rocked it though because he took them back and suggested the churros which the girls liked. 
Overall come for the comfy, fun atmosphere, decent drinks and good service but don't get too excited about the food.

Omg ..., this is a must try place. If you are in the Downers Grove area. You must come and try this place. I just bumped into it. No regrets. Will be coming back. Luis the waiter was excellent. The ambience is perfect. Ground beef tacos and the Thai shrimp tacos are oh my goodness delicious. Mojitos  are to die for. Not stingy at all. And as a beautiful gesture they brought a churros desert for my friend's birthday!!!

We went using a groupon and could not imagine paying without one.

Only place ever that has a chicken taco I don't like.

Steak torta is mostly bread. Steak tacos are better than torta but still wouldn't go back.

No sauce offered...sauce is a must.

Tacos from fire it up restraint make these taste like nothing...guarantee you'll agree if compare.

I've read great reviews on yelp and found this restaurant on groupon so I thought it was worth checking out. 

I made a reservation on open table and we were seated right away. The food and drink menus were a little overwhelming. I think everyone could find something they would enjoy. 

I ordered a beer to go with the appetizer. The BBQ pork rib bites or "pig wings" are a must have! The portion was a reasonable size and the meat was full of flavor. I will defiantly order this again next time. 

They have a wide variety of tacos and other entrees. I ordered three different tacos--had to save room for dessert! 
Camaron- This was my favorite taco...plenty of sauce and filled with flavor. 
Short Rib- This taco had plenty of meat but I thought it was a little salty. 
Baja- This taco was ok but needed a little sauce or salsa. 

I look forward to trying some of their other tacos and entrees. I ended the meal with the chocolate cake with ice cream. It was a little rich but very good! 

I was happy with our overall visit. The service and speed of dinner seemed right on point. I think I will go back but only during their happy hour.

I had been wanting to check this place out for a very long time and yesterday was finally the day. My friend had a surprise 30th birthday party for his wife here. We were told to get there by 3 pm sharp and we were all there on time. We were escorted to a back room that was beautifully decorated, had a fire place and it was very private  for our group. My friend had ordered our menu for the night which was printed out for us. It consisted of chips with 2 different kinds of guac and 2 different kids of salsa for appetizer. Our entree was tacos, 4 different kinds. We got carne asada, hongos (mushrooms) vegetarian rajas and al pastor. Our side was beans and rice and for dessert we got to sample different kinds of sweets. 
I tried one of the guacs which was delicious! The carne asada tacos were my favorite and my Casa Margarita was deliciousness in a glass. 
My only complaint would be that the service was not so great. We had to keep going out of our room to grab our waitress. The service was slow and they weren't very attentive. 
Overall this was a great place to have a Sunday afternoon party at. The restaurant is very nice and the food and cocktails were good. My boyfriend and I can't wait to return and try the rest if the menu.

My husband and I love coming here- great drinks, guacamole, and tacos! They have regular drink specials and allow you to order individual tacos rather than requiring you to get three of one kind- bonus! 

My go-to tacos are the carne asada, pastor, and pollo. Delicioso! Plus they have tasty churros for dessert :)

Decided to take my mother out for dinner after work on a Monday to try Barbakoa. The customer service at the door was excellent and accommodating. Once we sat down being that it was a Monday night there weren't many customers in the seated area. However, the waiter never showed up to give water, chips or take our order for the first 15 minutes. 

We then decided to go to the bar. There we sat and ordered the $5 Margarita special. 
Talk about a drink! That drink was a very potent margarita. There we received our food in a short time and had excellent service AT THE BAR. Taco's were $2.50 - $4 depending on the meat. I especially enjoyed the steak and pollo tacos with the corn. Shrimp tacos were awful! 

When we got the check, the bartender took off our drinks for the inconvenience and the bill was $35 bucks for two with drinks. I will be returning to the BAR ONLY.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!! I have been here many times. With friends, my 10 year old, and fianc. Every experience has been very unique. There's so much to try and so many ways to order which makes it worth going over and over! My personal favorites are the Pina Guacamole and Raja Con Queso tacos. The service is incredible. The wait staff is very knowledgeable on the food they serve as well as the origin of the ingredients. I would definitely recommend this. Oh and definitely try the tastings!! You'll have tons left over and get to try a variety of menu items
Amazing tacos and service!!! Will be back again.  If you are looking for good food and drinks this is the place!

We came here for lunch it was both of our first time here. The atmosphere was bright, bold, clean, and chic. The colors certainly stood out. Funny they had colored deers head on the restroom doors. I thought the food was pretty good. We had the tasting uno which consisted of 2 salsas, 2 guacamoles, 2 tacos each, and one dessert.  The salsas were ok we had the tomatillo Serrano and the red one. For the guacamoles we had the traditional and chicharron which the chicharron was my fav out of the two. As for tacos we tired: pollo (nice and tender), pastor (kinda dry and pineapple piece was to big), falafel (ok), and shrimp (small pieces cut in half and sauce was too sweet). The dessert we had churros with dulce du leche and chocolate dip nice ending.  The cocktails here are good I had the pomegranate ginger habanero mojito (highly recommended it was delicious) and Caramelized pineapple mojito (too sweet for me), my date had the house margarita (good) and the classic mojito (yummy). Oh and they have outdoor seating which is great on sunny days.

As we entered at 6:45 on a Friday, the bar was crowded and the restaurant was fairly empty. I asked the hostess if there was a special bar menu, and she said no, all the same menu. So we sat in the restaurant, where we read on the menu that there were happy hour specials until 7:00. Our waitress told us those were only in the bar area.  We stayed in the restaurant but we were irked because it seemed to us that the hostess should have acknowledged the happy hour specials in the bar, when I asked. The food we had was good, as was the service at the table. But the hostess was disingenuous.

Thank goodness we only live about a mile from this place because after downing one of their Friday night fishbowl drink specials, my wife and I were too hammered to even think about driving home. Luckily by the time we walked home, we sobered up enough to grab the other car, drive back and get the SUV. 

Damn that was a lot of sangria. Those things should come with a warning label. BTW: We got the pineapple and it was seriously tasty. And it didn't taste like cheap bathtub liquor that burns more than it tastes good. So it went down smooth and we didn't even realize we were getting lit till oops, surprise, we were.

As far as the food? Eh. I've been here twice, once for a yelp event where we got to sample a little bit of everything, and neither time was I very impressed with the food. Last night I tried the short rib tacos and the duck tacos. The latter which were pretty good. The short rib? They were just dry and not very flavorful. We also shared the tres leches cake for dessert. It was good, but not the best I've had. We also grabbed the pineapple guacamole, which sounds (and costs) a lot more than it's worth. You get a small glob of the stuff with some diced pineapple on top. I remembered liking that a lot more when we came here for the Yelp event a year ago. 

Kelly, the hostess was super polite, helpful and friendly when I called to inquire about available outdoor seating. Unfortunately they didn't have the real patio open for the season yet (which she didn't actually tell me) but they have kind of a screened porch thing on the opposite side, which is where we sat. And truthfully, after that Fishbowl, I don't think I could tell the difference anyway.

Great service, great drinks. Mediocre food. I think I'd come back for some patio drinking and maybe a snack, but other than that I'd skip it.

I moved from South Florida and had not had Latin for a while, my sweet friend knew this and he made reservations here and surprised me! Yay! This is not your traditional Latin cuisine, they had some variations on traditional dishes and I thought the worked very well.  I love the set up of the place, the decor is really great and the service was friendly without being intrusive. 

We started with drinks and an appetizer. I ordered a margarita Fuerte, and the alcohol amount was just right. He ordered a Moscow Mule and really like it. They also had 'Nojitos' which is their Mojitos but without the spirits. (Great idea!) 

The pia guacamole was amazing! I don't know why I never thought about putting pineapple in the guac, but it is delicious. We ended up doing a tasting tray, and it was more than enough food for both of us! It was really fun trying out the different dishes :)

I also had the churros for dessert, and they are heavenly. Chrunchy but not burned and just soft enough. You can put as much caramel or/and chocolate on them as you want. As a churro lover, I approve! :D

We are going back for brunch this week and I'm looking forward to updating this review!

@barbakoalatin #downersgrove First time here and why did I wait this long to try it out.  Cute decor, great selection of food and lunch specials $12 2 #tacos #soup or #salad and choice of #corn #rice or #beans.  My friend n I shared our tacos so we each got #beef and #shrimp can I say delishhhh and I forgot a side of #guacamole   The meal was filling and I loved the different flavors of #sweet and #spicy w the #shrimp.  And the tenderness if the beef and be sure to ask for the green sauce for some #spice. #Peruvian #Mexican #tapas #foodie #foodporn

My Motto: Eat at the bar and you can't go wrong.

I did just that! I ate here Tuesday night. partly inspired by the $1.50 taco's (and by partly I mean 99%) and the $3 select draft's (Stella Artois Cidre  was the pick for that night....apple cider and no I didn't spell it wrong CIDRE lol) which I thought was pretty good as it was my first time trying it) Tried 6 different tacos they were overall good and each one had its own flavor. One was a little dry. The decor is pretty chick, It kind of feels like Will Smith "Welcome to Miami" music video. So grab a shot of tequila and enjoy your stay. 

Arrachera Asada - Despite coming hear mostly for Taco Tuesday. This is my fav dish.

So I went there today with my daughter for lunch. I ordered the $12 lunch special in which you get to choose from either 2 tacos, 2 tortitos (not sure what this is) or tamales. Tacos come in four different available fillings which are chicken, short rib, shrimp or fish, I chose the 2 short rib tacos. It also comes with a choice of one side (I chose the white rice w/poblano peppers) and tortilla soup or salad (I chose the tortilla soup) and a side of guacamole. Everything was really good except the short rib needed more seasoning, something a little salt took care of and the tacos need to be doubled up because they fell apart really quick which was annoying. The white rice was great and  the tortilla soup was even better. Great filling lunch for $12. They give you chips and salsa as well. We ordered the churro dessert which came with 2 different dipping sauces. Nice ending to a pretty darn good lunch with my daughter.

So, after half a year I've decided to come back to barbakoa. It's been a half year of lots of stuff with becoming an Elite '15... 

I loved my food the first time here I really did. But the fish hook just was unacceptable. Anyhow, I called at 9:45 very late and talked to Xavier and referenced the fishhook he immediately apologized and was profusely sorry for no one reaching out to me. Thank you Xavier for your kind and professional service. 

I ordered the trilobites bites which were grilled calamari loops, jumbo scallops ++, U-60 shrimp eh, and a sort of orange chicken style breaded cod. If they rid the breeding and focused on the  scallops this dish would be top notch. It had guacamole as a dipping sauce. The lobster tacos had a nice style minced lobster meat. You could definitely see the lobster cuts and taste the freshness.

The churros were not too greasy just perfect with the chocolate dipping sauce. I'll gladly return.

My fiance and I got terrible food poisoning after getting some fish tacos here. Nothing says I will never be back like stomach cramps all day long and nausea. This place needs to check freshness and expiration dates. Making people sick is not ok.

Yikes! It's been a while since we visited Barbakoa and the experience was less than pleasant. We were seated by what appeared to be a MIT, who wore jeans and a white button up, while donning diamond studs in each ear. He truly meant well, but needs a serious polish to fit the restaurant vibe.  

My bestie and I ordered a mixture of tacos, corn, brussel sprouts and a tamale - all which should have taken 12 mins to prepare and get out the kitchen. Our tacos took 37 minutes. Mind you the restaurant was half full at this time. 

Our server, who was inundated with a 20something top and several other tables checked in randomly but walked past us several times when we tried to flag her down. We stupidly ordered desert after the lengthy wait for dinner and Barbakoa kept their promise again - 19 minutes for churros. When we asked our server about desert she said I'm going to comp that for your long wait, which at this point was a low ball gesture. 

Not sure if this place changed ownership but your current quality of management, service and efficiency output is beyond horrendous. 

Hopefully you can get it together because your food is decent.

Came here at lunch time on a Saturday. Chose to eat here over honey jam cafe to catch up with an old girlfriend. 

Starting off with the hostess, 10 minute wait. Ok, she tried sitting me and my friend in the back. Next time she should ask if we have a preference. We chose the bar area instead. She said ok, ill have to check in with the server. We ended up seating ourself in that area.

Atmosphere, very pretty inside. Bar like. Neon animals hanging on wall. Velvet booths/high stools. Cute. 

Anyways, let's get to the tacos. Pricey. Small. Lots of options. No sides come with.

Ordered the falafel, ground beef, and chicken. You can't do the 4 for $9 if you wanna mix your tacos. That was pretty lame. Even the sever said that was a downfall.
Very small tacos, but pretty ingredients in side. Definitely with they were bigger or they served chips and salsa. Was hungry a few hours after. Slammed 3 tacos.

Charged me for seltzer water too, without mentioning it. Downfall. 

Wouldn't come again for the small tacos. Maybe for a weekend night with friends. But can get pricey!



Update: Came here on my birthday and server served me free churro a with chocolate and Carmel dip. Churro were so sugary though. Awesome free treat to try!

While I'm not one to normally repeat restaurants, this one is an exception. I've been here twice prior in the previous year but decided to lay low for a while so I wouldn't get sick of it. Smart choice. Because when I came back today with a friend I noticed there was quite a bit of additions to the menu!

Background: Barbakoa is the lovechild concept restaurant brought to you by makers of Buona Beef-- which coincidently is what Barbakoa used to be!

Decor: Eclectic, colorful, yet refined and bright. Lots of windows, and lots of Birds of Paradise plants. Deep cherry wood tables, and comfortable, colorful leather chairs. Porcelain molds of antler heads dipped dyed in wonderful neon hues. 

Food: If you're going to go here, don't order ala carte! Go for one of the tasting menus. We opted for the "Tasting Dos" which for $29 gave us the choice of 2 guacamoles, 2 salsas, 2 ceviches, 4 tacos, 2 sides, and a dessert platter. In actuality its less than $29 because if you check into yelp you get 10% off!

A) Guacamoles: We opted for Traditional and Pina. Traditional hit all the right notes. Pina on the other hand, was a disloyal mistress that tantalized your taste buds with the pineapple, teased with overtones of and lime. left you in blissful habanero agony, and swore to never to do this to you again with after notes of cucumber. Yet for some reason, Pina was addictive and despite KNOWING what she did to you, you did it again and again with each bite. 9/10, 9/10.

B) Salsas: Morita and Arbol. Morita, despite being a 'mild' salsa, is much more than your "girl next door". Morita is smoky, and alluring to any palate. Her flavors smoldered together with the fire roasted tomatoes, and keep you wanting more. On the other hand is Arbol. If Arbol was a zodiac sign, Arbol would be a Scorpio. Arbol is spicy-- nay, Arbol is the definition of spicy. Arbol is hot, but curbs the fiery dance on your palate with notes of sweet pineapple. Luring your tastebuds into a false sense of security, before igniting the fire and heat that comes from the roasted tomatillos. 10/10, 10/10

C) Ceviches: Shrimp and Amarillo Mixito: Shrimp Ceviche was exquisite. Mexican gulf shrimp bathed in passion fruit-rocoto aj leche de tigre, tied together with choclo, red onions and cilantro. It's said if you close your eyes as you let the passion fruit rococo aji wash over your tongue you'll hear angels sing. Try it. Amarillo Mixito; the controversial union of octopus, shrimp, yellow aji leche con tigre and toasted cancha, with beckon with a "come hither" to only the most daring taste buds. Amarillo's spice palate is not for the weak. 10/10, 9/10.

D) Tacos: Pollo, Lamb, Cameron, Rajas con Queso. All tacos on in house made corn torillas, or sub for bibb lettuce. Pollo was juicy, yet kept your taste buds guessing with the contrast of the clean fresco to the smoky tinga sauce. Lamb; slow cooked and marinated, with complex red curry. Cameron; a favorite. Asian slaw, tamarind-morita salsa on top of tempura fried shrimp. EXCELLENT. Rajas con Queso; it could easily turn be vegan in a heart beat. Fire roasted Poblanos, cubed potatoes under a respectable portion of manchego. A beam of light from the heavens spotlighted on this taco as I ate it. 7/10, 8/10, 9/10, 10/10.

E) Sides: Elote, White Rice: Beautiful, clean, modern presentations. Piping hot with the perfect amount of spices and cheese. 9/10, 8/10.

F) Dessert: Fresh churros with chocolate and tres leches dipping sauce, a scoop of dulce de leche ice cream atop candied peptias. The chocolate sauce I did not like. Tasted straight of out a hershey's syrup bottle. The churros while fresh, were coated with WAY too much sugar (spent a lot of time brushing sugar off; our table looked like a sugar factory explosion). But the ice cream atop the pepitas was the STAR. For the ice cream alone the dish gets a 10/10!

Service: Our glasses were never empty, and the service was always timely. But nothing above and beyond that stands apart from the crowd. 4/5

Notes: (1) Tons of excellent Vegan options! (2) Baby changing station in the bathroom is AMAZING (See pics). Not the ridiculous plastic fold down table. 

TL;DR: Get the tasting menu or DON'T BOTHER. Get the full experience! Tasting Dos is $29 pp (minimum 2 people) + Get 10% off with yelp check in. Spicy means 911 is on speed dial; proceed with caution. Get: Shrimp Ceviche, Pineapple guac, Rajas con Queso and Cameron tacos. Tacos can be made with bibb lettuce to low carb. Menu constantly changing, come back every year-ish.
Great Sangria! the food was great too. Went there for after work and had a great time

A bustling Latin American restaurant in the 'burbs which is not worth the trip.

Service: very sweet but VERY VERY VERY slow. Had to wait 15 minutes to order our drinks. Got our apps before our drinks. Never checked on us after entrees were delivered.

Food: YAWN. We got the four different salsas which each were pretty one-dimensional. Not much depth or flavor to each. For example, the habanero salsa was just hot and had no other flavor. I was super excited for the guajillo chicken but it had zero flavor - add some salt or pepper at the least?

Drinks: read creatively but they all seemed to pack WAY TOO MUCH sugar into each. My smokey margarita was more sweet than smokey.

I met some girl friends here for a birthday dinner. I called ahead and made a reservation for four women and a high chair. When I talked to the girl on the phone she told me they had a $1.50 taco special. I asked if it was only good at the bar and she told me no, you would do it throughout the restaurant. Sounded like it was going to be the perfect night. 

Fast forward to that Monday night and we get the the fairly empty restaurant for our reservation. The table isn't ready and there is no high chair. They seemed confused by my second request for a high chair.

When we asked about the specials for the night we were told there was a special on mojitos, which we all jumped right in and ordered. When I asked about the taco special, I was told it was a "bar only deal". I told our waitress that the girl on the phone told me that it was throughout the restaurant. That was partially why we chose the restaurant. She kind of shrugged it off.

Some of the tacos here are pre prepared, so you cannot ask for ingredients to be removed for dietary reasons.   Most of the tacos we at were yummy. The lobster taco fell short. For $6 a small taco, you get mostly cabbage.the bill adds up quickly since tacos are $3-$6 each and the average person eats about four (and an appetizer like guacamole, salsa or ceviche). 

They did bring out a free birds u dessert, so that was a plus. 

Don't think I will be back for a while.
Very unique tacos the falafel taco was on point as well as the lobster would definitely go back good atmosphere a little crowded on weekend but I suppose that's a good sign for business !

The food was fine, but the portion sizes are very, very small. In addition,the pricing is not commensurate with the amount of food you are getting. 

However, the worst part of our party's experience was the service. We had called in advance to see if the party's checks could be split. We were told this would be possible. When asking our server of this possibility at the end of our meal, however, our server instructed us to write our what we ordered on the back of the total check for everyone. After doing this, we were then informed they could not take more than 6 cards for one order and we would have to figure out another way of paying for the food.

This entire process took about an hour to complete after receiving the check and the wait staff was of extraordinarily little support. If we took the effort to see if splitting the check would be possible in advance and are then told this is not possible, the restaurant should at the very least be slightly more helpful. 

An overall disappointing experience and I do not attend to ever go back to Barbakoa.
Don't eat here if you like food with flavor or good customer service. Our waitress maybe came to our table twice. Terrible.

They have a nice menu, it was a tough decision to choose over so many good options. In the end I decided to try the tacos because this seems to be one of their main specialties. 

I ordered the 4 piece taco meal which alone was $13, however I thought Tuesday's were $1.50 tacos but our waiter failed to mention that. Maybe it's just for the bar area. Anyways, I just wanted three tacos (chicken, pastor, and baja), but he said I can only get the 4 taco meal with one or two kinds of meats so was a bit disappointed. So I ended up getting the 4 taco meal with chicken and baja (fish) tacos for my choices. 

The tacos are small, but they do fill you up. The Baja fish tacos reminded me of the Cheesecake's Factory's fish tacos. They tasted very similar - they put a bit too much cream sauce on them though. I really liked the chicken, they were really moist, juicy, and had a nice flavor to it. The tacos were topped with cilantro. I wanted a side of beans and rice, but thought that would be too much so I just got the side of rice which was fine. It came with cheese on it. I noticed a lot of things on the menu have cheese on it. I wanted a veggie to balance my meal and those even had cheese on it! 

My friend and I also got the pitcher of Sangria - pomegranate and blood orange which is made in-house. It was pretty good, tasted like regular sangria. It wasn't that strong but didn't really need it that strong with a whole pitcher. Maybe if you wanted a glass though. 

Overall, it's a little "americanized" which I expected to begin with but I wanted to try it. Would I come back often, no - not for those high prices. The total bill was $60 something for 4 tacos and rice we each ordered and a pitcher of sangria. It just isn't worth it when I can get better tacos for $1.50 somewhere else! It's mostly a hip place for people to hang out after work or on the weekend. It has a nice lounge vibe to it. However, compared to other "americanized" Latin restaurants in the area (ehemm Uncle Julio's), I would recommend this one. The food was pretty good, but you just pay a little more. 

Another note - the parking lot is very small. Some people parked in the other lot, but you risk being towed.

We love Barbakoa!  It is such a cool vibe at night and has delicious tacos!  They have a $2 taco night (Tuesdays in the bar area).  They also make some delicious cocktails and margaritas.  We have also dined outside.  We have hosted large parties (my husband's birthday was at least 15-20 people), which they were happy to accommodate with a reservation.  Then, we also came for brunch which was awesome!  I will say that it does seem pretty overpriced, but we've come back enough times that we obviously think it's worth it.  If you're in the mood for a Latin vibe in the western suburbs, I'd highly recommend it!

I'll give this place a solid 3.5 (margarita) /4 (food and service) stars, and see why it hits 4 stars for many people. With hopes of trying it again I rounded up to 4 stars. It was the kind of place my hubby and I immediately agreed to try again. Why? One reason is location, the other is quality of menu items we did try. We popped in tonight after furniture shopping (because who doesn't need a margarita after that?). We sat at the bar because it's where I decide on the caliber of bar tenders and atmosphere. We consider ourselves margarita lovers. Favs in the burbs are Oak Parks Maya del Sol and Geneva or Glen Ellyn Toda Madre. Their margarita menu was interesting. We tried three-the Casa Maragarita, the Aphrodesiac, and the Barbakoa. All use an agave hector sweeter that left a very earthy honey flavor aftertaste. The Aphrodesiac was too tart and we didn't enjoy it though our bartender did offer to adjust it for me. They do score points for quality and presentation. If I could get same drink with simple sugar I think it would be a winner. Hubby tried the tuna ceviche which was very nice. I tried the chips n salsa-very nice. Fresh and hot and salsa as described in menu. I had to try the churros and they were outstanding!! We will go back for one of the nightly specials. Service was excellent and ambience casual and well done. Looking forward to eating our way through the menu!

I came here with my family for Mother's Day brunch and we had a great experience! Definitely a breath of fresh air in the suburbs, and a great departure from your standard chain restaurant.

Food: B+
Great Latin fare. We had two vegetarians in the group so it was nice to see that there were several options for them on the menu. they started with the spinach and cheese empanadas were perfectly fried and came with a delicious chimmichurri sauce. They also shared a variety of the vegetarian tacos which were good, but nothing special. 

Between the meat-eaters, we tried the pozole soup and the cubano sandwich. The pozole was a special for Mother's Day Brunch and had a great flavor, but there was very little pork in it. I did appreciate that it came with a bunch of fresh garnish on the side. The Cubano was delicious and came with crispy chimmichurri fries which were a highlight.

The presentation of the food was wonderful as well- everything looked great.

Service: B+
Our server was not particularly engaging, but the pace of service was appropriate and there were no major issues.

Atmosphere: A
Beautiful, colorful restaurant. We especially liked the natural wood tables.

We would definitely come back here- this I a great place for a big group as well!

Sometimes this place is great, sometimes it really struggles to work. Their house made margaritas are amazing, when they remember the tequila. Go on Thursdays when they are only $5! I've been 3 times, and have had the awesome, friendly waiter, the over-seller waiter, and the waitress who had more important things to do than help us. 
Their tacos are great, and I love their half roasted chicken and chimichurri fries! Their steak was a bit bland. 
Atmosphere is really great- very urban, hip, cool. 
Oh, and their chips and salsa are below par. You also only get like 2 tablespoons of smooth salsa (I'm guessing from a jar). 
I haven't given up on this place yet, but I'm not clammering to go back either...

Terrible service   Wait was too long. Food choices were minimal. Sat in the covered outdoor area it was freezing. Would never come back.  Waiter had no clue what to recommend. It was so loud you couldn't even talk

My husband and I came to Barbakoa last night for our Valentine's Day dinner. We had reservations and were seated right away. Our waitress greeted us just seconds after we sat down with water and a little introduction to the menu and specials since we were newbies. She was very, very nice and knowledgeable about all of the food! 

Within minutes, we ordered our margaritas (of course!) and selections for the small plates. Since everything on the menu is meant to be shared, we decided to get the traditional guacamole, crab ceviche (a V-Day special), two empanadas (though we ordered one veggie empanada and one meat empanada, and received two meat empanadas instead), and pork in verde tamales (but in a red sauce, not verde sauce? Still good, though). After we finished these dishes, we ordered the carne asada tacos. We did not order dessert, but received two complimentary chocolate covered strawberries after receiving our check. 

Everything tasted very good, though we were a little taken aback by how small the portions truly were! The tamale order included "4" tamales, however it was more like "2" tamales cut in half, and the order of 4 tacos was actually 4 taquitos - really tiny little tacos on tiny little corn tortillas. For the cost of each plate, we expected to get a little more... Which is why we had to order the tacos in the end, because we weren't full from the previous shared dishes.  

Overall, it was a good experience, but this restaurant was way pricier than somewhere we would normally go. Maybe we'd go back for a special occasion if we happened to be in the area, but I can't see us returning on just any Saturday evening unless it was just for quick appetizers and drinks.

I was excited about this place for tacos and tequila. Decided to check it out on a whim without reading through the reviews. First thing I noticed.... The parking lot was empty so I had to check their hours to see if they were open. They were... Which means either this place sucks or its super expensive. My boyfriend and I sat outside. A good runner served us water. Waitress comes up- let's call her mumbles. Honestly, we couldn't even understand her name because she was so quiet and depressing (which is worse because the music is loud).  Her service wasn't necessarily bad, but it just got awkward. No smiles. No enthusiasm. But then- my tortilla soup sucked, not my favorite, and she didn't come back to check on us until my boyfriend was completely done with dinner. Our tacos were super soggy as if they sat out for a while so they ripped apart wen we tried to eat it. We would have ordered another drink but our waitress never checked on us (which remember the restaurant was empty).

Just totally awkward experience and way too pricey for that type of service.

This place is amazing!  The tacos are so authentic and delicious!  I asked the server for some recommendations on which tacos to try as they all sounded so good.  I ended up getting the carne asada, chicken, pork, and short rib.  There wasn't one that I didn't like.  We went on "Mojito Monday," and therefore had several mojitos - they have classic as well as flavors (strawberry, raspberry, blueberry, pineapple, etc.) - all very tasty!  Our server was friendly, attentive, and helpful and the (indoor or outdoor) atmosphere of the restaurant are both great!  I highly recommend Barbakoa!

The ambiance was great, the food was good. Our server was average, she could have been a little more attentive,  but she was very  pleasant. We were having a great time until they turned the lights on a half hour before close. We felt like we were being kicked out and it really ruined the experience.

Went here for the first time for a friend's birthday and had an overall good time. The staff was friendly, and out waitress was especially nice! It was Taco Tuesday, so most of our party ordered a variety of tacos, which I found to be just okay. We had shots of tequila which happened to be Patron, and ordered Tecate which was the special. I have to come back here and order a cocktail, and another dish to potentially up my rating :)

15 minutes later still no service, nor greeted by our server. The place wasn't even busy. When we got up and left the host was just standing there on his phone, he didn't even acknowledge the problem. Highly upset!
A Great place to eat at. The Clooney Margarita is the BEST!!!  Everything we had was awesome !  Our waiter Christian was very attentive and knowledgeable !  I will be back !

If I want to rate this restaurant based on the Tamarind Glazed Short Ribs we had last
night -- they would get 5 stars for sure....

Unfortunately, my rate is based on the full experience.

Entire experience is 3 stars...

Our bill was $109... With a 30 groupon... We paid $79 plus 25% tip....

What did we order?

We had:

1. Chicharon guacamole $8 - good
2. Lamb, oyster, duck lobster tacos $18 - very good
3. Salsa combo $3.50 - meh
4. Tamarind short ribs $24 - amazing
5. Pork tamales $8 - very good
6. Hot hate tres leches desert $8 - good
7. Spice & ice cocktail $9 - my BF loved it
8. Aphrodisiac cocktail $11 - love love it
9. Kentucky bourbon 2 orders $12 - my BF said its ok


We sat at the bar.... So we can watch the Bulls game.... We were seated at the very end corner which was fine.... We can watch the game which was perfect.... 

Our female bartender was kinda slow.... Not getting us water when we asked or not checking in on us not unless we call her.... Grrr.... 

She gave us a check not checking first if we want dessert.... Hellooooo? 
Isn't that a given? to ask? Clearly not customer friendly....

Another drawback is this guy.... I'm assuming he is the owner... Short skinny Caucasian guy...

Two feet away from us.... Like we have plague or something.... Duh.... Just talked.... Not even said HI... Just said and I quote.... "When we built this restaurant.... We wanted the ladies to have space to put their purses... So they have actual space at the bar to eat....So we put these hooks right under the bar close to your knee..... "

I was looking at him in disbelief like.... 
Do you think we are deaf? 
Or do you think we are stupid? 
I mean, why was he like emphasizing words like we are retarded?! Ohmygod!!!

First off.... My purse was not bothering any other guest and clearly not bothering me since it's right in front of me....

Second of all.... The nicest way that he could've done it.... Is to just tapped my shoulders.... Maybe apologize for disturbing our dinner... Maybe say... "Miss... I'm sorry to bother you guys, I'm not sure if you have been here before but we have a purse hook under the bar if you want to use it "

That would've have NOT offended me at all....

Clearly his theatrics was just annoying and definitely buzz kill.... Gaaaaaaaaah!!!!

Sooooo after his stupid spiel .... I told him.... "So is that a hint hint wink wink.... You should've not wasted so much of your time..... "

As I put my not so common expensive Louis Vuitton bag on the purse hook... My BF accidentally knee-d it and it fell on the dirty floor.... Shit... Those hooks don't work Mister!!!!

The only salvation of this place last night.... Is this super friendly African American tall guy... I'm not sure if he is a bartender or a bar back..., he is super friendly .... Showed us a display of the desserts ... 
That's the kind of customer service they need .... Friendly and sincere... These other girls at the bar looks so phony.... Ugh

Never again .... I will miss you Tamarind Glazed Short Ribs.... But you alone will not be enough to bring me back here.....

Yup, we liked it.

It's a fun place and the different Latin flavors/influences means the food is fun too.

We went with our BFF's, sat on the enclosed patio (all the windows open) and enjoyed the beautiful night. Adam was having some Five Rabbits and the ladies loved the Imperial Margaritas!

We had the Trio Guacamole to get started, they were all good, The Pina (with Habanero) was my favorite, really liked the Chicharon too (with crispy pork is what the menu says.. I say PORK RINDS will give you a better understanding of the flavor/texture) .. after those two,  the traditional seemed a touch bland.. but still good.

We skipped over all of the appetizers because we were hot for tacos and a couple of the larger plated servings (Platos) to share.

We ordered a big ass plate of tacos.. four types, 16 in all. Lisa was full before she tasted them all.. I, however, was just getting warmed up.

So, for the tacos... we had the specials; Cactus and Lobster along with the Pastor (pork) and Camaron (shrimp). The waitress said that the Cactus was her favorite (so did the server) but we thought they were just OK. the lobster only comes with three, so we had to add an extra just to keep things fair (I am NOT sharing) and the lobster was tasty but a bit lacking in the lobster department... I liked them better than some of the others. The pastor tacos were excellent, the pineapple really added to the flavor. The shrimp tacos were a big surprise, the tamarind flavoring gave these awesome tacos a flavor that had us all thinking about some Chinese orange chicken... but in a really good way. They were the favorite at the table.. and I'm not a big fan of shrimp. Go figure.

For our main dishes (shared): 

We had the Entraa Asada. Skirt Steak prepared Mexican style.. the sauces and sides were excellent, the steak was done perfectly.

We also had the Paella Valenciana which had pork, chicken and artichokes. My friends mixed the almost raw egg up into it after I took a portion. This was good, not inspiring, but good. We all particularly liked what the chokes brought to the table.. flavor and texture wise.

Everybody was stuffed and groaning.... so we ordered dessert. We couldn't decide on what to get, so we got the sampler. That was a good move. Everything was delicious. Strangely, the one thing that we weren't excited about surprised us.. the passion fruit cheesecake... it was very good and we all had a bad attitude about it going in.

The ladies both had the (After Hours?) cocktail.. this is basically an espresso martini using tequila... they liked them although Janet thought they were a little strong (is that a bad thing?) Adam also ordered an aged tequila that was meant to be sipped.. so he did. He's sophisticated like that.

One of the really positive things that I take away from our experience, is that we were often surprised and sometimes delighted. The service was very good, we liked the waitress and the server's... we were well cared for. It's not quite a five star experience, but it was an excellent one and we would all go back again in a heartbeat.

Barbakoa is an interesting spot. Nice dining room and lighting highlights the artsy decor. We went on a Taco Tuesday night and ordered one of all of them, also tried the tamale and the guac. The flavors were very fresh. I liked the thai inspired fish taco and the carne asada is their recommended one. Pretty good.  Lobster was unique too. The tamale left much to be desired--too much masa and I'n not even a latina but I know too much masa when I see it. The side of guac was good topped with chicharones. I have to say even thought they try to be out of the box --nothing really jumped out and shocked me as a wow taco. Also a mexican inspired place with salsas that were forgettable is unfortunate.  I love the look and the idea of a twist on Mexican and the bar is cool and hip looking---but it's almost like too many flavors hit you all at once and everything tastes the same. A+ for the effort for having a unique menu and A+ for service---our servers were wonderful ---really nice guys. . Plenty of parking.  I'd go back for the atmosphere but because of the pretty pricey menu which made every effort but was short on wow factor I give it ,apologetically, 3 stars. I wish I could give it at least one more :-(

Came here on a Saturday night for dinner.  The place was packed, but we did see some empty tables outside.  I asked the hostess if we could sit outside, and she said no.  Not that they were reserved or anything...just "No".  I thought that was kind of weird and rude, but oh well.

Once seated at our table inside, we decided to go with the Tasting Dos menu and red sangria.  I hated the sangria.  I felt bad about hating it, because all the other tables around us seemed to be enjoying the sangria, but I hated it.  It tasted way too sweet, and we didn't get much fruit in ours.  Outside of that, the food was extraordinary.  We went with the traditional guacamole, the morita and serano salsas, the shrimp and tuna seviches, pork pibil and pastor tacos.  Everything was so delicious and fresh!  The meat for the tacos was so flavorful, and the marriage of ingredients in the seviches was tantalizing.  We even had a tres leches cake at the end.  There was so much food, but I ate it all because it was so good!  

Our waiter was outstanding.  He was on the mark with all of his recommendations, and was very attentive.

This place is a nice latin fusion restaurant in the suburbs. Parking is tight but they do have a valet. Restaurant ambiance is dim lit and the bar area has  Tv's incase you want to catch a game. Personally I feel as if the drinks are on point but the food is average. I do recommend the skirt steak or going in on 1.50 taco Tuesdays. They do have a side bar with a lot of windows to give you an outdoor feel while still enjoying heat or ac in the summer. Wait staff was incredible and offered sufficient advice.

I work in the area and always drive by and have been wanting to stop by for awhile. We did tonight and it was really busy, we did not have a reservation so our wait was about an hour on a Saturday night at 8. We sat at the bar and had a drink while waiting. We had the margarita furtes. Absolutely amazing nice and strong but still very well balanced. Once we got seated we started out with some guac and ceviche. We also got some tacos my favorite was the pork pibil! Our server was Johnny, extremely knowledgeable of the menu and very helpful with his suggestions. It was a busy night so the wait time for the food was a little long but that is understandable. Will definitely be returning more often

Me and two more girls decided to have a nice dinner here when we were craving a nice Sangria. First, this is a cook place to have a drink for the least.  Very nice bar, a lounge area and two separate outside sitting area.

We got the Pina Guac, Fish tacos, and Paella. And definitely a pint of passion-ginger Sangira for sharing. High recommend the Pina Guac which is rich and fresh with the perfect combination of sweetness of Pineapple dices and spicy kicks from the jalapeno. This time I tried different unbreaded fish tacos still didn't meet my expectation. The Paella was a real treat.  Fresh meaty seafood with the just right seasoning. The rice could be a bit more cooked since I like the golden brown crust on the bottom. It was delicious anyway. We finished every bit of it.

The desert is one of my all-time favorites: flourless chocolate cake which was 3 mini ones just for three of us. Heavy, sweet, and unavoidably guilt taste.
 
We were really happy with our waitress who was happy and seemed enjoying her job very much. Definitely a nice place to hang out with a glass of Sangria. Don't forget to checked in on Yelp to unlock 10% discount!

My three friends and I came here for dinner last night. I made our reservation on Open Table for 5:45. We were sat as soon as we arrived. I initially found out about this place when we came to look at it for a potential shower venue. I loved the decor, but ultimately we decided that the room was too small for our group. However, I definitely wanted to come back to eat! We had a great experience!! We sat in the bar area at one of the high-tops, perfect atmosphere for a Saturday night! The music was at a good volume level and everything was very lively! 

For dinner, we decided to do the tasting menu - which I highly recommend! We did the Tasting Tres menu. There was plenty of food, and we got to taste a ton of different stuff!

Guacs: Traditional, Pina, Chicaron- All were very good! My fave was the Pina and Chicaron! 

Salsa: Morita (mild), Serrano (medium), & Arbol Pineapple Salsa (spicy). I actually thought the Serrano was hotter than the Arbol, but they were all tasty!! The Arbol Pineapple had just the right amount of sweetness to balance the heat. 

Ceviches: Shrimp and Tuna - they were both very good, but the Tuna was fabulous!! Such great flavors!!

Tacos: Short Rib, Carne Asada, Baja, and Pollo. All of these choices were amazing. IF I had to rank them as my favorites, I would say Short Rib, Baja, Carne Asada, and Pollo. The first three are are a very close tie, as they all had soooooo much flavor!! You probably cannot go wrong with any of their choices!!

Sides: Sauted brussel sprouts with Manchego cheese and pequillo sauce, White rice, fresco cheese with epazote, Wood-grilled vegetables with a balsamic reduction and shaved Manchego cheese - all three were amazing! Even the rice, I was like, how flavorful could this rice actually be? Well, it was really really good. The brussel sprouts were ta-die-for. 

Dessert: Not sure of it's actual name, but it was a little piece of heaven. I am the pregnant one of the group, and I definitely at the majority of it- it was an amaretto soaked cake of sorts. WOW! 

This is one of the best meals that I have had in the burbs in a while!! The drinks were also beautiful - my friends got mojitos and margaritas - beautifully done! Our server (Juan) was great! He was on top of everything and paid just the right amount of attention to our table during our visit. Can't wait to come back!
The absolute best tacos!!!!!  The Barbokoa and Carne Asada tacos are phenomenal..  The best I have ever had!!!!!  Salsa's are just as good, as well as, the churros and chocolate....

This place is definitely great. love the music the  services was phenomenal really liked our server. The dessert was really good. I really like there drinks. The smokey margarita is my favorite. The server was very informative and super sweet. I will definitely come here again.
I come here every Friday. Every time I bring someone new and they are amazed! They never disappoint me! The food, service and drinks are fabulous !!!!
Loved the shrimp, steak, and lamb tacos! I also recommend their pork burrito. Will definitely be coming back.  Service was great and food came out pretty quick too!

Great food, spotty service.  I came here after hearing rave reviews from friends.  We were here on a Saturday around 7 and it wasn't too busy.  There were more people here when we left.

We had a reservation and were seated promptly but it took awhile for a server to stop by and that was the way it went the rest of the night.  We ordered drinks and waited, food and waited, asked for the check and waited.

The food was good.  We got the guacamole and salsa with pineapple and it was tasty!  We got tacos and the chimichurri fries and had some dessert too.  I had the flourless cake and hubby had the cheesecake.  Everything was good and just the right size.

The music was loud and the bass was booming and it seemed like it got turned up around 7:30.  At first it was ok for talking but towards the end it was just too loud.  So waiting for the checking, dealing with the music wasn't the best way to end our meal.

Delicious Mojitos! Tacos al pastor were my favorite! The doughnuts were a fun treat,  my kids enjoyed decorating them! Service was excellent, Juan was our server! This is now my new favorite restaurant !!
Queso fundido was on point! All salsas and guacamole's were pretty good too. Save room for dessert though.

Came here for taco Tuesday. Oh and what they fail to tell you when you walk in on Mondays or Tuesdays that if you sit in the dining room tacos aren't $1.50. They try to scam you by putting it in really tiny print on the chalk board. So make sure you sit in the bar area on Mondays or Tuesdays if you want $1.50 tacos! This place is just OK. Overrated & overpriced in my opinion.
Love to get a sampling of all their dishes. Fun to share and to graze. Their mojitos are amazing. Fun date night. Or a night out with girls. The atmosphere is fun too!

Great food and great service! Shout out to Adrian - attentive and courteous server. Steak and eggs were delicious... But my fav was the chilaquiles with carne asada!  YUMMY!  We ordered churros and it took awhile to come out... So the mgr. took it off our bill...what a  nice surprise.  Used a Groupon so the value was great.  Would definitely recommend.

I am not a fan. Will never be back. I would be surprised if the establishment makes it in the next few years. I rather go to Los Burritos Tapatios!

1, the menu is way too confusing. Actually it is all pretty mis-leading. I don't think people want to try or think THAT hard just to order some tacos. People want to come relax and chat with their party, not decode the menu or listen to a long spiel from the waitress on how to order, which ultimately made no sense anyway lol. It was very difficult to order because of the layout of the menu, the different combos make no sense, and we had no clue as to the portion sizes (maybe they should put some images of the food/portions on their menu and simplify it a bit).  I just ordered tacos and a margarita because I didn't know what was going on and my boyfriend ordered a mixed bag and hoped for the best!
2, more on the waitress, she rambled off the menu spiel super fast. She was really unhelpful and unfriendly. Totally not what you would expect, even for a tapas type of place.
3, the margaritas are tiny and over priced. Tapa margaritas? You can get a bigger, better tasting/less expensive margarita at Pepe's! 
4, the tacos were very bland! Apparently they don't use any salsa? Not sure where the cheese was. And they were super soggy with chicken juice. Had to eat them with a knife and fork because they fell apart. The taco consists of a thin mini tortilla with bland pulled chicken smacked on top. Can't say it wasn't moist, though lol! They charged me like a dollar for a small cup of sour cream which is bogus considering the prices and ended up not needing it because the food tasted heat-less/spice-less.
My boyfriend's Tamales were pretty big (strange, considering the size of the taco) and also bland except for this bbq-like salsa? that they poured on top which had a bitter flavor (ew). He and I agree his was just not tasty either.  Can't remember what else he got, but I assure you, we were not impressed. I think we just ate everything because we were really hungry and figured we had to pay for it anyway so we might as well finish eating it. No joke.  
5, Over-Priced!
On a positive note, the atmosphere was neat and the host (manager?) was pleasant.
Love love love this place! Great staff and great food! Don't like how you have to pay for chips and salsa. Think it should come with especially with the prices here.

Very energetic, modern, positive atmosphere. Started off with drinks. My wife had the sangria flight which alone on presentation is nice. Tasted good. Being a craft beer snob I had to have their exclusive Two Brothers BPA (Barbakoa Pale Ale). Very smooth pale ale not found anywhere but here at restaurant...not even at Binnys or Brewery! 

We began our meal with trio guacamole...pineapple guacamole was my favorite. Tortilla soup was spot on. Wife had tacos Al pastor and I indulged in a combo of fish and shrimp tacos. Tacos are small but stacked! You get 4 little tacos so I had 4 more lol of short rib aka barbacoa...very succulent!  Potato side was good too! 

We had no room BUT I was not leaving until I tried the homemade stuff your own donuts dessert. You literally get 4 small tubes of fudge, caramel, guava, and raspberry to stuff your warm fresh donut. I loved this! Skip lunch and indulge on all the small plates they offer!!! Enjoy!

We came for brunch and ordered 

Sangria Trio - It was okay, but I'll try other flavors next time.

Guacamole Trio - This was good, bit not rave worthy.
 
Steak and Eggs - My guy asked for medium, but it was more medium well, but it was still tender.

Baja Tacos - First time having fish tacos and they were pretty good. Just a bit bland.

Pork Tamale - good flavor, but I'm not a big fan of tamales.

Our server was laid back and nice.

Overall, not a bad place to go to try or just to have drinks and some appetizers with a group of friends or for date night.

I love this place!  The ambience is so classically Spanish........perfect!   I have dined here at least 3 times and have never been disappointed in the service, food nor the drinks.  The food is very exquisitely prepared and yummy, the service is A+  and the mixologists know what they are doing when it comes to mixing drinks...perfect....Lenny is my  favorite bartender.  He is very friendly, good on food recommendations and he keeps your glass filled.

It's a pretty cool place to get Margaritas even if they are a bit on the pricey side.  The place is very attractive in typical Jerry Kleiner way.  At 7 pm on Friday night, the bar area was hoppin' but restaurant area was not that crowded.   I would stick with the Margaritas though... I tried a Mojito and it was way too sweet.  The food is just meh.  Tacos were disappointing, small and lacking in flavor/texture.  Chips/salsa/guacamole were ok.  Ceviches were good - the Peruvian mixto with leche de tigre was especially good.

I've been here 3 times. The margaritas are great. The food for the price is just alright, over priced in my opinion. The reason I gave it two stars is due to the lack service. 

Last time a few of my friends went there for dinner and advised the waiter prior to ordering that we would like our checks separate. Usually this is never a problem at any other restaurant. The waiter said that he will be right back before saying anything else. 

After about 10 minutes a waitress came and notified us that they cannot split the check due to their policy. I would think a manager would come out and notify us about their policy. 

We orders some appetizers and a few drinks and skipped on dinner. 

Will not be coming here again.

Was their this past Saturday had reservations for 6:30pm for a party of six. Everyone's first time their! We had the tasting 4 and everyone ordered different things from the menu. We started with the  three types of guacamole the chicharron was my favorite. The shrimp ceviche was delicious I had never had it with sweet potato. I had chicken, rajas con queso, shrimp, & fish tacos. The fish and shrimp were the best. For dessert we had chefs choice churros with chocolate and dulce de leche for dipping. Drinks were small for the price but very good. The waitress was very attentive she explained every thing off the menu. The dinner didn't come cheap but it was worth it.

Finally after passing this restaurant many times on my way to the gym, I decided to go with one of my friends. It was a slow Monday night and we sat at the bar  Lenny the bartender was so great, every drink was freshly made and he really knew he stuff. Probably will try to make it out there every Monday as much as I can.
Pretty good place with a cool vibe. The prices were a little high but it's a fun place to come on occasion.

Everyone I work with absolutely raves about Barbakoa. Honestly, I was a little underwhelmed after all the hype. The food is spicy, but I felt the few things we tried lacked a real complexity of flavor. The restaurant is beautiful and the service was great, we just prefer food that doesn't make us sweat through our shirts.

Good brunch! I got the chicken and waffles and the quality of the chicken was insane. You're not getting chicken tenders, you're getting a serious chicken breast. It was so juicy and delicious. I loved every bite. The waffle was a little soggy, but I got over it because the chicken was so good.

Drinks are great and almost always come with a side car. I love a good restaurant that doesn't try to cheap out on the alcohol.
This was a great first experience. Food was spectacular, margaritas were made perfectly and service was great. Our waiter, Jonathan was very knowledgable and very friendly! Thank you!

We had the best meal and a wonderful time last Saturday, the waitress was helpful and friendly. we got all authentic appetizers, drinks and entrees. my girl really love their ribs, and the steak is out of this world. If you really want authentic Latin food, this is the place.
Amazing.     everything is amazing,  get the barbakoa margarita and tasting menu

Nice little latin fusion addition to Downers Grove. 

A friend and I stopped in to visit her boyfriend, who had just started working there, and to grab a few drinks. We ordered house margaritas and some chips and salsa. We got four different kinds of salsa with the chips, my favorite....the habanero one. Duh. 

A few margaritas in, we decided to order an order of tacos to share. We ordered the Barbakoa carne asada tacos. Skirt steak, chorizo, asadero cheese, onions and their green salsa called guacasalsa. The guacasalsa didn't do much for me, I poured some habanero on them. They were so GOOD! The combination of chorizo and carne asada is always on point, this definitely hit the spot that night.  What didn't hit the spot is that my amiga and I went home and headed directly to the bathroom. I don't know if we got food poisoning or if it was the agave nectar in the margaritas (she researched that and found out that a lot of people cannot process it correctly). She had gone back a second time and had the same problem. 

That didn't keep me away though, usually it does, but not me, you know...me and second chances. I'm a sucker for them. Anyways...the second time I went back for lunch, we had the tacos, a pork tamale, and the chopped Barbakoa salad. All were so delicious and I wanted more! The waiter had told me that it would be one of the best tamales I've ever had. I wouldn't say that but it was very tasty. I had forewarned my co-worker before we went there so we were both just waiting to see if we needed to use the bathroom. Nope....no bathroom visit needed that time.

Since then, I have gone back multiple times. I haven't had a margarita since and I've had no problems....so I'm guessing it IS the margaritas. Bummer. I love margaritas. 

If anything, I would definitely recommend the Paella Valenciana. It's full of flavor and they add a ton of chicken and pork. Perfect sharing plate if you're willing. ;)

Minus one star for the service, pricing and parking. I just think, for the portions you get, it should be a tad less expensive. As far as the service, I would NOT sit in the bar area. Our "waitress" took our order and then we never saw her again. We had to keep asking for water refills and to top it off, we even had to ask for the f'n check after waiting 30 minutes for someone to come around. And by ask, I mean, me going up to the bar and asking the bartender for it. The "waitress" was too busy chit chatting. BS. When she finally noticed that I was over by the bar paying the bartender, she came over, gave me attitude and handed me my card. HA! Woosah ran through my mind a million times at that moment.  Parking? During a busy time....Good luck. 

Anywayysss....see for yourselves and let me know. ;)

I cannot believe this gem has been in Winfield for 3 years, I definitely have to make up for lost time. Where to start? Everything was amazing! I got a cup of their cheddar ale soup with bacon, my goodness I was actually sad when I took the last bite {I'm such a foodie}. The flavor was excellent and the bacon was the perfect complement. I also got the Jack cheese covered pretzel- yuuuuuum. It was huge, and smothered in cheese. I got the apricot habanero dipping sauce. It wasn't my favorite (disclaimer I'm not normally a sweet/spicy combination), but if you like apricot and spice I'm sure it was perfect. My hubby ordered the salted and cinnamon pretzels, he devoured them both. 

Overall, we will absolutely be back. The location itself is very small, don't plan on eating there (although there is a cute little bar top area with about 4 seats). But it's clean, organized, and super cute. I did read on the sign that they close early if they sell out, so plan to get there early. We went around 2pm and the pickings were running out. I can see why! To top off this perfect rating, everything we ordered was only $12. Such a reasonable price for all of the food we received.

ok, that's as good as it gets here.  Firstly, you want to get here as early in the day as possible, for two reasons:  one, they will sell out of the special of the day if you get there after 2pm, and two, the pretzles get dried out the longer they sit under those heat lamps, so by 2 or 3pm, they are hardly worth eating. Dunking them in the soup doesn't help even.  Honestly, I don't think I ever had a fresh pretzel that wasn't sitting around all day there.
Ok, next, the soups are very good. I would go there for those alone, but its a better value to purchase pretzel and soup combo.  Just now I won't go there unless its early in the day so the pretzel isn't dried out, I hope.  Think Aunt Annies pretzels, they are hardly worth eating after they have sat around too. 
So there you have it, a typical suburban cafe that's sort of good.

Yep, all the good reviews and recommendations by friends were right. This place is delicious. My family ordered a classic salted pretzel, a parm garlic pretzel, and an Oreo cheesecake pretzel - all of them were amazing. 

I can't wait to come back and try a soup with the pretzel! This place is pretty awesome!

A great little place with delicious food. You usually have to wait in line but its worth it. They close when they run out, but its nice to know the food is that fresh. They have regular pretzels, stuffed pretzels which change daily and are amazing, and soup. Plan to take them to go and find somewhere else to eat as there is only a couple picnic tables to eat outside (its way too small to eat inside). We have taken our lunch and sat in a park in Winfield.

I'm done with Gnarly Knots. The food is very good, different and worth the drive. The problem is that unless you can show up when they open, there is a good chance you are going home hungry or at least without what you came for. I drive too far for the disappointment.
The food really is great, you just can't count on it.

Soooo close to 5 stars, but I just can't give it! I just wish their selection was a teeny bit larger, but I get it. They are a super small joint that specialize in a few amazing things. 

Came here one afternoon with the family (my hubs and toddler) for a quick lunch. I'd been wanting to try this place for a while so we decided to trek on over. They had garlic and cheese pretzel for the Daily Special. I wasn't too excited about it but my husband and I each got one plus a cup of soup. We split the pretzels and soup between us and our daughter. The soup was extremely hot. Like, this was going to give me 3rd degree burns if I even got a little splash on me. Give the soup a few minutes to cool down because it is worth it! It wasn't excessively salty like most restaurant soups. It tasted homemade - delicious!

On to our pretzels. They were scrumptious and every bite was a perfect ratio of pretzel to cheese. It came with a marinara dipping sauce that was unique and fit the pretzel perfectly.

It was a crisp & sunny afternoon so we grabbed a spot on one of their picnic tables in the back. I think there are maybe 3-4 tables so not a lot of seating - and only outdoors FYI.

Overall this is a great little spot! I am going to be back in here whenever I'm in the vicinity.

So we had it in mind that we would purchase some pretzels and have it as a snack after a trip to the park.  Hahaha--Who were we kidding.  The aroma of fresh baked pretzels made us dig into the paper bag as we were driving away. And my four year old son proclaimed "These are the best pretzels ever!"  

The space is small--like a pop up store small. But on nice days you can have a seat outside on some of their deck chairs and enjoy them.  

The day we visited there was a small line--about 5 people but it moved quickly.  I got the stuffed pretzel fo the day--Monterrey Jack Cheese and a plain salted.  The dough has that nice pretty brown crust and very soft chew.  The stuffed pretzel was stuffed with really good mild cheese and an automatic fave.  They offer dipping sauces but since we were on the go we will have to try the sauces next time. The Apricot Habanero sauce and Creamy Mustard sounded really good. 

They also offer soft drinks in their cooler (and my favorite Pelligrino!), pretzel chips, soups, and you can pre-order mini pretzels and giant pretzels too.  So cool that so much goodness comes out of a small shop.  Super friendly service.  Reasonable prices.

Came with a friend and noticed the line out of the door 10 minutes BEFORE they opened.

This place is one to keep as a friend on Facebook as they are always coming up with new fantastic creations!

Im blessed to have this just up the road from my house!

Get there early as some menu items when they are depleted, you gotta come back another day!!

This place is top notch!

Yum! This joint is pretty darling. We drove up from Naperville on a weekday near opening time to see what all the fuss was about. The location is great, the place is super clean and well organized, and they offer just enough on the menu. 

We had the salami and provolone stuffed pretzel, as well as the garlic/parm and Monterrey Jack pretzels. I ordered two dipping sauces (creamy mustard and apricot habanero), both of which were pretty meh, but didn't set me back much. To round out our meal, and potentially entice the little one to eat a bit, we ordered cups of the broccoli cheddar soup and tomato bisque.

The pretzels were really delicious. The stuffed one was awesome. The other two lacked a little flavor, but were tender and moist- obviously freshly made. Soups were too thick and not blended down quite enough, but I appreciated having it to round out the meal. We sat outside on the deck on a gorgeous day, and that made it all the nicer. Looking forward to coming back for one of those Nutella stuffed ones. Uh, yes please!

Somehow I have forgotten to chime-in with my numerous visits. I have enjoyed every stuffed pretzel to date. Finally made it in for their Thursdays special, the Italian Beef and their Cheddar Ale soup is a must too.

Remember to grab a pack of pretzel buns for the ultimate burger.

Great stuffed pretzels. Savory ones and desert ones. Good size large enough to share. Today I am waiting for the gyro stuffed and cheesecake stuffed.  They both sound delish.  Limit s quantities so need to get there early. And there is always a line. Small shop but great food. I have tried the birthday cake one , it is a special order item but well worth it if you are celebrating a special day.

About a month ago I planned on spending my lunch hour running errands until a friend of mine asked if I wanted to go to Gnarly Knots for lunch... I quickly changed my mind as I've been wanting to check this place out.  I knew it was in Winfield, though never seen the place.  It's right in downtown Winfield near the train station, hospital, etc.  It's a cute little place for sure!  Simple menu here...pretzels & soup.

They have a "pretzel of the day" and "soup of the day" ...the day I was there, it was Italian Beef.  I have to say this thing was AMAZING!  It's a large pretzel stuffed with Italian Beef and very filling! That's all I needed for lunch!  There are also regular "daily" pretzels for sale, my friend ordered the hot dog pretzel, also day old pretzels on clearance, pretzel bread, pretzel chips, etc.  There is even an interesting dessert menu...which I need to try one of these days when I'm allowing myself a "cheat day"!!!  Oh wait...they sell cookies too, which looked very appealing and I was very tempted, but declined.

As others have mentioned, there are only two seats indoors, we ate in the car...which was totally fine, but this is definitely a "to-go" place.

I. Love. Gnarly. Knots.

What's not to love about this fabulous little shack o' deliciousness? It's small, it's local, it's fresh, it's active on social media, it's owned by people who have the cuuuuutest French bulldog, and most importantly: they do one thing, and they do it really, really well. 

I had first heard of Gnarly Knots through Facebook, where they advise eagerly awaiting fans of their weekly specials and up and coming offers. Maybe I'm a giant nerd but I LOVE this idea. It's what roped me in. Every week I watched the Facebook page for a flavor I couldn't live without, which was when I wanted to dive in and try one of these famed pretzels. Unfortunately, the hype is real, and so are the lines to wait for these special pretzels. So I went with a backup plan, and when I was on vacation in a weekday, scurried over to try the deliciousness with no wait!

It really is kind of a shack - a teensy tiny shack that would be pretty easy to miss if I hadn't been stalking it for weeks. I parked, climbed the stairs, and walked in to the smell of fresh made pretzel heaven. I ordered a Monterey Jack stuffed pretzel and a cinnamon sugar with cinnamon creme dipping sauce. My order was ready in .000034 seconds and I jumped in the car to head home and eat.

Typically, pretzels aren't my favorite foods, but I tell you these are pretzels done RIGHT. Soft, fresh, warm, chewy... They're perfect. The cheese stuffed pretzel was loaded with gooey melted cheese and was a salty, decadent delight. The cinnamon sugar pretzel was a perfect sweet ending to my meal, and I could have eaten about four of the cinnamon creme sauces. So good.
