I came back this past weekend just to ensure I was appropriately in love with this place and tried their Italian sausage stuffed pretzel dog with provolone cheese and a side of marinara. AMAZING. But the most amazing?! Their PRETZEL bread pudding loaded with apples and creme anglaise! Brilliant, innovative, decadent, and addicting. Who knew pretzels could be so much fun?! 

If all you know of soft pretzels is movie theaters and baseball games, do yourself a favor and get over to Gnarly Knots. Let them elevate pretzels for you and change your mind for good. And also try to spy their adorable pooch while you're there, because the only thing in my world that can make a 5-star establishment better is a love of cute canines!
Sometimes they run out of the daily special before you can get there. This is the only reason for the 4 stars vs 5.

Honest review: really good a lil expensive though better then the mall execution problems though. There are tables and seats outside and u can eat inside to but there are only 2 seats. Never had a bad experience just think they need to work on making the special pretzels taste better  
All in all good nice cute spot to come with the family 

Buffalo chicken pretzel: the pretzel texturally is really good not soggy not to hard. The filling was really good there was alot of chicken but since they fried it it became really soggy like mush like u know when u eat can vegetables and u can squish them  in ur hand and they completely  disintegrate. So they should have grilled it or panfried it The dipping sauce was also really good i ate all of it its that cant believe its not butter with buffalo sauce. I just wish they would fill the whole pretzel up cUse when u finish ur left with alot of pretzel

Cookie doe pretzel :this was really could i was skeptical because alot of people use cheap chocolate thats not that good but it was really good. It was really like eating cookie doe from a bowl. Again they need to fill the whole thing up with the ingredient because u end up with alot of pretzel left over n a dipping sauce would have been perfect.

Italian pretzel provolone cheese with marinara sauce: picture a gormea pretzel dog. It was really good the spices on top were really delicious wish there was some on the bottom or more on top. The actual sausage was really tender. It was a plain sausage i wish it would have been a spicy one. They needed to grill it because i think it tastes better if they cant grill it then panfry it for some texture. Regarding the marinara sauce it was cold they should have warmed it up it was a really plain sauce nothing special alot of oregano 

Pretzel bread pudding: the texture of it was good not to dry could be a lil more moist though. when i was eating it i didnt see alot of apples in it. The sauce is like a cinnamon bun with cinnamon in it though i didnt really care for the sauce on it wasnt my favorite i was expecting something really amaizin and different wouldnt order again.

On the ambulance that I work on, a coworker told me to stop over here while in the CDH area. We tried to go while on shift but they were already sold out for the day. So today my fiancee and I were in the area and I stopped in. We ordered the Garlic and Cheese stuffed pretzel, a cinnamon pretzel, and a special dog pretzel for the little pup. It was worth the wait and everything I was told to expect. 5 Stars.
Deeeeee-friggin-licious! Soooo good! The hours are perhaps the only minuscule downfall but I appreciate the freshness that comes from this amazing place!

Stumbled across this little pretzel oasis.  What a cool little joint.

Fresh made pretzels daily, when the sell out, they close.  Each day they have a different "stuffed pretzel" among their normal rotation.  On Saturday they have one sweet special and one savory.

We missed out on the daily special (they go quick) so we ordered the garlic Parmesan.  That's a good pretzel!  We also tried the sweet option, which was a pretzel bread pudding.  I don't recall the exact flavor, but it was great!

Definitely give this place a go when you're in Winfleid.

I used to live down the street when they first opened and we are here almost every weekend. The soups, the pretzels and the bottled root beer. The corn chowder is amazing, not sure if it's seasonal. I drive 30 minutes to come here now and get a quart of frozen soup to go.
What a great pretzel place. Unique and creative options, friendly staff and delicious

Great pretzels, I love the Mac and cheese pretzel! But I've tried many different ones and all are very good. I only have one bad thing to say about this place it's very overpriced for a pretzel went there the other day just got a pretzel no dipping sauce or anything and it was over $7. It was super tasty but not sure if it was worthy of being over $7

I seriously can't wait to come back here! I've only been twice but that was enough for me to totally fall in love! These pretzels are no freaking joke!!! They are huge and every dollar spent is WELL worth it! Perfect amount of crunch on the outside with the perfect amount of melt in your mouth awesomeness on the inside! I almost hate this place because they have ruined pretzels for me forever because I'll never be as satisfied as I was here, that's just a fact, hate they are a little far for me, but won't stop me! I'll be back, I'll go for a drive! Small, like very small place so take your treats and leave, eat in the car. I very highly suggest this place to everyone, and if you live close, lucky you my friend! Use and abuse that privilege

Be prepared to wait in line! I came shortly after it opened and there was already a trail of people out the door. The building itself looks like a small house and is located across the street from Central Dupage Hospital. On Saturdays, there are rotating pretzel specials. And better yet, the soup is discounted with any pretzel purchase. My boyfriend and I tried the bacon and cheese, sugar cookie dough, and garlic parmesan pretzels and we happily scarfed down all of them. We will definitely be back!

Really the best pretzels you'll ever eat. The daily special is a great lunch option, but I suspect they're about 1200 calories, so more of a splurge for me. The pretzels are great, but the soups might be even better. 

Locally owned place putting out a great product. Nice workers, too. Spend your $$$ here!

Gnarly Knots is a hidden gem! We discovered this place through a family friend and have loved it ever since. 
1. The pretzels are absolutely fabulous and are very unique! They even offer sweet AND savory pretzels. My personal favorites include the Cookie Dough stuffed pretzel and the Bacon Mac and Cheese stuffed pretzel. 
2. The only problems with this place are that there are limited amounts of their "specials" for the day, so we have to wait in line for about forty minutes to insure that we receive those specific pretzels. In addition, it is very small with limited space to wait indoors, so if the weather is not cooperating that day, it might not be the best time to get a pretzel.
Overall, I would definitely recommend Gnarly Knots. The pretzels are delicious and they will indeed satisfy one's sweet tooth!

It's been a while since I wrote a review.  But after stopping by the place today, I couldn't resist.

Do you love pretzels?  Do you love dipping sauces?  Do you love meats stuffed inside pretzels?  Then this is the place for you!

For the same price as a pretzel at the nationwide chains, you can get a hearty and delicious pretzel plain, or with several toppings.  They do daily specials of pretzels and soup.  All in a quaint location.  If you're craving a pretzel, this is the place to go.
This place is awesome!! Soup and pretzel were amazing! Can't wait to go back!! Cute location with place to sit outside. Guys were very nice and helpful!

The stuffed pretzels at Gnarly Knots are awesome.  I had the Pepperoni Pizza for lunch.  The regular pretzels are thick, maybe 2-3 times the size of those mall pretzels, so the stuffed pretzels are even more monstrous.  It came with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.

I also tried the Cinnamon Sugar pretzel, which wasn't anything special.  It needed more cinnamon and sugar!  The savory stuffed pretzels are the star of the show here.  

They also give out free mini pretzels on National Pretzel Day - who knew there was such a thing?

Bonus points for stocking Blood Orange Pellegrino in the cooler.

I feel like this place is sort of in the middle of nowhere, but it's not.  The business is located in an old, charming white house, near Central DuPage Hospital.  Their hours are really limited, so you have to go during the day or on the weekend.  So if you have your heart set on the day's special, get there early in case they sell out.

There are 3 stools inside, and some picnic tables around back.

If you love pretzels, you need to come here!  The thing is, it's hard to get a good pretzel.  Really.  Then throw in a 'stuffed' pretzel.  Wow!

So it's a tiny joint in Winfield that has some out door seating and two bar stools inside.  But from what I have seen and experienced, it's hard to even make it back to your car once you have to goods in your hand.

They have your regular slated pretzel, which, if you know anything about pretzels...t requires yellow mustard!  These pretzels are tasty and just the right amount of salt and chew on the 'skin' of the pretzel.  You can purchase cheese dip and other dips.  The cheese dip is good.

They have a few other pretzels that have some cheese on the outside of them, great as well.

Now the 'stuffed' pretzels....they serve a fixed stuffed pretzel menu every day...one kind of stuffed pretzel each day of the week.  The bottom part of the pretzel is what is stuffed.  The Porker is lick your lips delicious, Jack cheese stuffed is amazing....

On Saturdays they have a 'wild card' stuffed pretzel that you can get hints about what it will be on Facebook.  

It's not just a pretzel!!!!!

So..my review is probably a little overdue. My husband and I have now been here several times and we will continue to return. 

The first day we went here, it was a "pretzel dog" with an italian sausage. He got an oreo cheesecake stuffed pretzel. We have been back a handful of times, but that visit remains our favorite. The italian dog was just the right amount of juicy and delicious.

Other pretzels we have enjoyed include: tuxedo white chocolate cake, bacon/tator tot, italian beef, gyro, meatball/mozzarella, and caramel apple stuffed. They were all delicious. 

Follow them on Facebook and you can find out what their special stuffed pretzel is on Friday, for Saturday.

I should've taken pictures of the two pretzels we just devoured (cinnamon with a cinnamon butter dip and the Italian stuffed daily special), but they were gone way to fast.  The guy at the register was extremely friendly.  I wouldn't complain a lick if they decided to open up back home in Louisiana.

This are the best stuffed pretzels ever.  I had the cinnamon sugar today.  I did not cared for it it was too tuff to chew or bite into it.  I love the Italian beef it is amazing. It comes with beef juice on the side and hot gardinera it is a meal on its on.  The pulled pork with grilled onions is delicious.  The French onion soup is ok a little too sour for me.

My first Saturday experience was a pleasant one. Apparently the line started to form at 10:30 but our group didn't make it until 11:30 and weren't too far back in line. 

Once the doors opened, things seemed to move pretty fast. My only complaint is because the shop is so small, crowds had little room to move while waiting for their food.

These specialty pretzels are totally worth their $6 price tag. Considering these were my first stuffed pretzel, I was surprised to see only the bottom was stuffed. But I can't blame them, stuffing the entire thing would be a major pain in the ass. 

The beef brisket was phenomenal. I seriously want their brisket recipe. This thing was stuffed full too, no skimping on the meat. 

The Oreo cheesecake was really good, not sure if I'd get it again. I love cheesecake and maybe it was because it was warm, the cheesecake had a different texture but the taste was definitely there. 

I also tried their original pretzel chips. They were average. Less salty than the ones you get in the grocery store but I'm happy to support local businesses.

A PRETZEL RESTAURANT! This might actually be my definition of heaven. As soon as I saw this place come across my Yelp feed, I bookmarked it for a visit. Yes, I actually drove about an hour round-trip to eat a pretzel, and it was totally worth it.

First let me say that I love the whole idea of this place. I checked out their website shortly after seeing it here, and their story is great. A true little community support success story. It is nice to see, and I feel even better to help support that too.

A little about the place - I see that it often gets quite crowded, though we didn't have that issue during our visit (around 12:30 on a Saturday). There were other people there, but we didn't have to wait in line and they had plenty of hot fresh pretzels ready. They have two parking lots available, so plenty of space, though the restaurant itself is very tiny. It is a walk-up establishment with a tiny indoor waiting area and a counter for eating that only seats about 2-3 people. It is a converted house, so most of the space is in the back for cooking the food. They do have a few tables outside though, if the weather is nice and you want to "dine in." I think they probably get much of their business from CDH, which is right across the intersection.

They have a variety of tasty pretzels (obviously) but also soup, cookies, and pretzel buns to go. Check out their menu or their Facebook page for their daily specials, since the pretzels available rotate each day. They also have special stuffed pretzels on Saturday. My husband and I both tried the classic salted pretzel, with jalapeno cheese dip. It was great! The size is generous, and it is served warm. It isn't overly salted, and tastes delicious. I'd definitely like to go back to try their other types, especially the stuffed, but wanted to stay traditional for our first visit. If you love pretzels, you've got to try these guys out!
I love this place - food is always hot, fresh, delicious, and very very filling.  It's great if you're in the mood for something different.  Staff is all very nice and friendly.

It's been a gnarly day so I figure why not go to a gnarly knot. I've seen all these reviews saying how great it is so I wanted to check it out myself.

It's a very quaint place in downtown Winfield. Walking in I can see how tight it can be on a busy Saturday with a line around the building. It's great to see them having such great business from local entrepreneurs. Plus, they are looking to expand so I look forward to that. Now let's get to the good stuff.

Their pretzels are enormous. Very soft, fluffy,  crispy. Just the way you want them to be. I had the cinnamon sugar which I was really impressed with. Plus I had a side of Nutella, so how does it get much better. My girlfriend got the salted pretzel with a side of nacho cheese. I was impressed with how good the cheese was and both sides were only 50 cents each. I also thought the prices on the pretzels are reasonable considering how much you get.

I know I'll be back again to try their specialities like the cinnamon roll, caramel apple and their other daily specials. It's like having a pretzel party in my mouth.

There are some places you see on Yelp and make it your life mission to visit within a 7 day period. After seeing Heidi K's review on the 3rd, I knew that I'd need to make a visit stat. I talked to one of my friends whom, much like me, is always down for a good road trip. We decided to head here this past Tuesday. 

I was already aware of the mnimal seating from prior reviews but it was a nice day out, so at the very least- I knew we could just bask in the sun and hang out on the curb.  We were fortunate enough to grab the one and only patio table right as someone else was heading out. Woohoo!

I ordered the french onion soup and the POTD (pretzel of the day.. I just made that up) which was salami and provolone. I asked the girl working what her recommendation was on sauce and she said the mustard. My friend ordered the cheese topped with nacho cheese, as well as a soup. Our total was around $18 which I thought was a good price. Also, the girl working was really friendly. 

My pretzel was heaven on earth. The dough itself was perfect and the salami inside was sooo good. The mustard really complemented the pretzel well and I ended up using all of it. I honestly could have ordered two mustards that's how good they were. 

They list their daily pretzels and soups on the website, so make sure to check it out. I also found out from perusing their site that they will be on Chicago's Best soon. 

The only docked star is they REALLY need a bigger place soon. We came in around 1 PM and there wasn't much room to stand to wait for our pretzel. Hopefully they're so successful that they expand to a 2nd location soon!

Gnarly Knots has been on my radar for about the last 8 months or so. Due to their hours, I was only able to check them out on Saturday (and that goes for repeat visits in the future as well), which was a bit of a headache.

You see, unlike the size of their pretzels, GN and its lot are small. It took me a few attempts to park. I first pulled in to find no parking. So I left and came back about an hour later and managed to snag the last open spot. 
Then there's the shop itself. Folks, there's no dining in here. There's a picnic table out back, a small bistro table near the door, and a tiny bar with two stools right when you walk in, but that's it. Grab your pretzel n' move along. The line was out the door but luckily it moved fairly quickly. 

Once inside, I noticed today's specials were the oreo and cheesecake pretzel, and the tator tot, bacon, and cheese pretzel. Say what?!?! Oreo and cheesecake in a pretzel? Bacon, tator tots AND cheese?! Sweet mother of jesus... why have I NOT attempted to visit here sooner? I knew immediately the tator tot version would be my choice (the cheesecake wouldn't have sat well with me. *sigh).

After a few minutes of standing in line, it was finally my turn to order. I ordered the above mentioned special and a bottle of water. The total came out to a little over $8. Quite the sticker shock, but I quickly got over it and paid. I received my pretzel (hot and fresh from the oven, nonetheless) and made my way back to my car.

I opened the bag and once I saw the size of the pretzel, the price tag justified the product. Fans of Auntie Anne's, take note- those "pretzel perfect pretzels everytime" don't stand a chance to Gnarly Knots. First of all these pretzels are HUGE. They are stuffed with delicious goodies. They are thick, soft, chewy, and bursting with flavor (depending on what you get, of course). Secondly, if you neglected to eat the pretzel the day you purchased it (blasphemy!), its rock hard structure could easily be used days later to ward off a carjacker or rabid animal attack. Okay, maybe not, but I wouldn't rule it out completely.

Gnarly Knots has won me over; hands down they have the best pretzels ever. It's too bad I'm not in the immediate neighborhood anymore; although a hop, skip, and a jump better suits my waistline and wallet, anyway.

How does such a thing occur and work so well?? Large, delicious pretzels filled with ooey goodness like lemon cookie dough and Cajun chicken (two pretzel options-savory and sweet)! The lines moves fast, the menu is simple with 4-6 kinds of pretzels to choose from. It was perfect for a day you crave a hot soft pretzel and even better that the pretzels are excellent quality. They also have a soup menu so you can make a proper meal out of your stop. If they add homemade lemonade for the summer (hint) I'd become a regular pretty quickly. Do check this out for yourself, it is worth the stop and will likely be a hit with the kids as well.

Amazing service and one of my favorite spots growing up in this area! The dipping sauces are my favorite and always such a tough decision on what one to have. I would come here all the time after school or on the weekends.

Every day of the week they offer a different stuffed pretzel of the day and soup of the day and there are yummy pretzels with toppings  (garlic parmesan, jack cheese, salted and cinnamon) along with awesome dipping sauces. Wednesdays they have a yummy pretzel desert that changes from week to week.
These guys love to push the pretzel envelope and I couldn't be happier to have them nearby!
They are a family favorite!

I had been meaning to check this place out for a while now. Well the stars aligned and I took my chance. I ordered the Italian beef and the cinnamon sugar with a side of the cinnamon creme dipping sauce. 

Italian beef - this thing was delicious, loaded with very tasty Italian beef, it came with a side of hot gardinera and au jus. I would highly recommend this pretzel to anyone. 8/10

Cinnamon sugar - this one on the other hand was quite bland, even with the cinnamon creme dip. I am a huge fan of cinnamon raisin bagels. I wanted this to be the cinnamon crunch bagel from panera, lots of flavor on the top and tiny pockets of cinnamon goo throughout the pretzel. What it seemed like was a standard pretzel that someone dropped in a bucket of cinnamon sugar topping. I would give this a 4/10 

Would I go back? Yes, but only for the daily specials and to try the soups.
Went to this place the day they opened and it's been awesome to see how much they have grown. Awesome service and very friendly.
Fantastic pretzels and great customer service. What more can you ask for?! I will definitely be back for more.

I finally got to try one of these amazing pretzels. Last time they ran out before I could have one. Which is why I don't give this place 5 stars. They need to better meet demand of their customers. Otherwise the pretzels tasted great. I was fortunate enough to try their bbq beef briscuit stuffed pretzel. They seem to have a different special for each day. I highly recommend you try them once. Just be sure you arrive as early as possible in order to get one.
We love this place! Have had a bunch of the pretzels and all of the varieties are really good. Line can get a little long and there's no seating (except a picnic table in back) so be prepared :)
Sometimes you just need a pretzel fix. They have sweet and savory, stuffed pretzel specials daily, and soups too. Great spot to hit if you're in the west burbs--snack or meal.

Tried this place because I've been on the search for a great pretzel. It is a total artisan place. Pretzels and soup-that's it. I tried the chicken Parmesan with the dipping sauce. Sauce was fab! Pretzel was really yummy. Next time I will bring it home and pop it in the oven. Creamy chic and rice soup was popping hot and yummy! Pretzel croutons included. 
Grabbed a fall/winter menu to have the specials on hand. I will buy a frozen quart of soup for my freezer.
Great home made pretzels , worth the visit

As a native Pennsylvanian, I feel uniquely qualified to love pretzels. I spent 24 years in the Philadelphia area, at least 23 of which were pretzel-eating years. These Gnarly Knots pretzels are something that would be appreciated back East, and not just here in the Midwest where we are pretzel-deprived.

The way the shop works is, there are everyday offerings and one special, stuffed offering each day of the week. I had scoured the website to learn the schedule, as well as that the shop produces only a limited batch of pretzels each day. I now understand that Gnarly Knots has a Facebook page as well, so that's another good source for updates. 

We made it on brisket day, and before the shop ran out, so we enjoyed one stuffed pretzel and two Bavarian (regular) style. Perfectly crisped on the outside, perfectly fluffy and doughy on the inside...these pretzels are something to write home about. 

The space is quite small, but I appreciate that I could at least get in and out with my babe in her stroller. I don't think they have a restroom, so of course I had to take my son out to pee in the nearby woods while we were there.

My sister says four stars for the lack of an eat-in area (there's just a tiny bar with two stools). But in fairness, their website clearly tries to dissuade customers from lingering in the tiny space, so I can't really blame the place. It is what it is, so I say five stars, but it would be nice if they could someday expand to include at least a small dining area. I look forward to going back on pepperoni day and cheeseburger day to enjoy the other stuffed pretzel masterpieces.

Awesome pretzels and soup!!!  But it's very location challenged. They're doing pretty well with the space available but it's still very small inside with poor and limited parking.

I'd probably go more often if it wasn't such a logistical chore to get in and out of the place.
I live close by and stop often. Soups are great. Stuffed Italian beef pretzel was wonderful. Fast service and friendly.

Always a great experience. I like how they have a unique daily pretzel-- keeps things interesting. I used to go when I had a week day off... then found out I can make it on my lunch break. I'll be going more often.

One of my favorite sandwiches is the Italian beef and their Italian beef pretzel sandwich is one of the best I have ever had.  If they're not on the list as one of the best Italian beef sandwiches in the Chicagoland they should be.  Cheddar Ale soup with the surprise of bacon garnish is magnifique!

I'm not gonna lie the food is pretty good there. However I think that they are a tad overpriced. I feel like those prices should be someplace like downtown Chicago. Who knows, maybe I am wrong but I have a hard time spending that much money on a stuffed soft pretzel.
I tired their birthday cake stuffed pretzel and it wasn't that great.  It was super heavy and it seemed like the cake batter stuffing wasn't cooked all the way and it was really dense.

Yummy.  this little gem is awesome. Great pretzels and variety. I bought two frozen soups for later. Plain salted shows you the true pretzel,and it is delicious. Got a cinnamon sugar one, too. Salty and not overly sweet. Cool black t-shirts for sale.  Cannot wait to try the stuffed spaghetti and meatballs pretzel and pretzel dog still warm in the bag. We will need to move back to the area just for this place.
Really good pretzels!!! Came in here 10 min before close and the pretzels were super soft and not dry.

I absolutely loved this place. So unique and delicious. I try to get the daily special whenever possible. The Italian Beef stuffed pretzel was by far my favorite, so far. 

Make sure to get there early if yoy want the daily special though. They typically don't last too much longer after peek lunch hours.

Yes, everything posted here is true: this place has amazing pretzels. Their stuffed pretzels are really stuffed to the point of overfill. But, OMG, they are tasty. There is always a line outside the door before it opens. Oftentimes, they do run out of their daily stuffed pretzel before closing time.  I wish they were open later...till 6p, so that we can eat their soups and pretzels for dinner.

We have been here twice now.

All I have to say is UH-MAY-ZING. Truly.

Our first visit was the pork burrito stuffed pretzel. I have to admit, when I read that day's special I was not impressed. In fact, it didn't sound appealing to me at all. But, we were dying to give this place a try and we weren't sure when we'd get another opportunity to get there (it's probably about a 35-40 minute drive) so we went.

And I am SO GLAD we did. I tried that pork burrito stuffed and it was .... no words. Just fantastic. The flavor was excellent. Everything about it was great.

This past weekend we stopped in for the chicken parmesan stuffed. It, too, was delicious, but so far that pork burrito remains the #1 choice (but, I've only been lucky enough to try 2 of the many kinds they make...).

We've also tried the chocolate croissant pretzel as well as the lemon cookie. Both were also very, very good. But, for the price -- I'd almost rather buy another stuffed and forgo the dessert.

Can't wait to go again -- I've got my eyes on the gyro, italian beef, bbq brisket and reuben stuffed!!

Amazing. We were out that way for something else and I decided to check what was nearby on yelp. Gnarly Knots came up and after seeing the pictures of the gigantic pretzels I knew we had to go. Omg. So good. I got the Black Forrest cake pretzel. There was a big chunk of chocolate cake with chocolate frosting and cherries. My son got the regular salted pretzel and my husband got the pretzel dog. The pretzel dog was really really good too. It's almost an hour from home for us but I think we will probably try to make it out here more often to try the others.

It was our first time visiting Gnarly Knots.  After seeing a spot on Chicago's Best and all the reviews on here, just had to try it.  Was not disappointed!

I love small, local businesses that do what they do, well!  It's near downtown Winfield, in a small house that is buzzing with people.  I can see why.

It is tiny, with no indoor seating, but really cute.  You get what you want and go.  They do have a picnic table, maybe 2 outside, but I'm sure most people eat it in their cars or take it to go.  

They have a limited menu and a special stuffed pretzel of the day.  They say get there early, because you might not get one if you get there too late.  We got there in time to get one of the special Monterey Jack cheese stuffed.  OMG was it good!  That little bit chewy on the outside, tender on the inside and it seemed like there was a pound of beautiful, gooey cheese inside.  It really was perfection!

We also got a couple Pretzel Dogs.  They put the jumbo beef hot dogs in there.  I just loved it.  I bet they have dipping sauces for these, but when you're a newbie and overly excited about everything, we forgot to ask or look, but even if there are sauces, they were delicious without anything at all!  I just looked at their website.  They have sauces.  Big dummy here. 

We shared one of the cinnamon sugar pretzels.  This was my least favorite and only because I felt like it was missing some icing or something.  And again.. probably my fault for not looking around.. cause I'm a spaz like that.

It's obvious they use quality ingredients and put a lot of care into their product.  If it wasn't hot, today, I would love to try some of their soup, sometime.  I bet it's just as good as their pretzels!

Will come back, for sure!

My expertise with pretzel eating was limited to Auntie Anne's and Target, so I had high expectations coming in.  Today's (Tuesday) special wasn't something that appealed so I went with the cinnamon sugar instead..a can't miss.  I also had a bite of my sons standard salt pretzel.  
The dough in both was very good.  Fresh, soft and warm..a trio that every pretzel should have.  The cinnamon sugar cover was a tad lacking.  Don't get me wrong, it tasted fine, but there wasn't enough cinnamon or sugar for my liking.
We also got one of the big monster cookies.  That was pretty awesome.  Chocolate chip with pretzel chips..you get the sweet and sour..the best of both worlds.
Gnarly has a lot of interesting daily specials that I'd like to give a whirl.  I'm thinking once I do, my rating goes up.  Cheers.

Hell yeah!  This place does one thing and one thing only and they do this one thing better than anyone else!  P R E T Z E L S ! !

They've expanded their menu so their daily pretzel of the day changes more frequently and that is a good thing.  Pulled pork stuffed pretzel?  Yep!  Cheese stuffed pretzel?  Yep!  Italian Sausage stuffed pretzel?  Yep!  A Vienna beef dog wrapped in pretzel dough?  Yep! You get the picture.

They also do a variety of soups.  I hear they are quite good but for me it is all about the carb laden stuffed wonderment of a pretzel that gets me every time.  Don't forget to get a side of mustard sauce made with creme fraiche.  Delicious!

I love seeing the line outside the door on Saturday mornings.  During nice weather, it takes on a carnival like atmosphere with folks tossing footballs and frisbees.  You cannot help but smile when you see that!

As others have noted, this is a little house and the kitchen takes up pretty much all the space.  So grab your pretzel to go and thank the pretzel God for creating this wonderful little indie place.

Dang this place is awesome. I don't think I've ever eaten a pretzel that hasn't been from a chain store and I'm loving it! I wasn't feeling a stuffed pretzel so this review will be for their unstuffed ones.

I got the cheese topped and cinnamon pretzels. The pretzel itself it as good as it gets. Huge pretzel so you get what you pay for and texture is perfect. My only wish is that the cinnamon one had more cinnamon-sugar on it.

Along with the pretzels, I ordered the nacho cheese sauce and cinnamon creme sauce. I wasn't a fan of these. I don't know if they make it themselves or not. Nacho cheese was pretty typical but the cinnamon creme tasted like sour horchata to me. It wasn't a bad sour, like they added lemon juice, but it was just kind of odd in that sort of dipping sauce. I think the pretzels taste the best without the sauces.

I'm definitely curious about their stuffed pretzels. I'll visit sometime again and try those out. Also, I heard that they sometimes serve pretzel croissants! Oh, I need to try that one.

Side note: I think it's funny that people complain about how many pretzels they make and their odd hours. Yeah, it's weird, but they aren't a chain. I also think it makes them more popular to only have a limited amount of stuffed pretzels. It's smart of them. Not saying I know how businesses are run, but I can see why they do it. So how about we stop complaining about it and keep supporting this local business? Maybe they'll have better hours if they had more money for a bigger location.
So glad my physical therapist recommended this place. The pretzels are huge. They are a whole meal and can be shared by two people. Had the garlic and plain. Very tasty. Highly recommend.

It's a must have!! Only open 11-4 a day if you are interested in the daily pretzel get there around lunch time they do sell out!! I have had most of the pretzels, few soups and ordered the stuffing at thanksgiving. The stuffed pretzels are a pretzel
Sandwich concept one will fill you up! 

My favorite pretzels - 
BBQ Beef Brisket (wed special)
Gyros stuffed 
Cheese Stuffed (Friday special)
Hot dog (Friday)

Soup
Cheddar ale
Garlic mashed
Clam chowder 

Sweet stuffed
Pumpkin pie stuffed
Cheesecake 

All of them are great you cannot go wrong. The sauces on the side are generous enough and all yummy we love Nutella and nacho. The staff is also very nice and helpful!

Best pretzels and soup and cookies and everything else they make!
You can't get a pretzel this good anywhere else. 
Soup is so good and only $1 extra when you get a pretzel. 
Don't forget to grab a cookie from the counter. They are so good!!!

Great pretzels and love their rotating options.  Need to get there early if you want one though as some guests buy pretzels by the bag full and they have a limited amount.  Dessert pretzels are worth trying!  Very friendly staff as well.

Gourmet stuffed pretzels offer a different and unusual change for lunch; they're a great alternative to a sandwich or a burger. Gnarly Knots has a nice selection of soups to accompany your stuffed pretzel, too. Very tasty.

This is a mainly a takeout place, but they do have a few outdoor seats for when the weather is nice. And they only offer a few types of pretzels each, so check their menu ahead of time. Because they only make so many per day, they almost always sell out. Thankfully, the solution is easy: Just get there early!

Another small local (Winfield) business that bests competition from bigger rivals and chains.  Who knew that a pretzel could be an entire meal, and a gourmet one at that!?

I'm partial to the stuffed pretzels, and the rest of the family seems to prefer the more traditional ones.  The soups have been very good too, as have the pretzel dogs.

The way this place works is a bit "different" though:
1) Expect a bit of a wait when they first open.  They are popular, and since they have been known to run out, sometimes there is a line out the door and into the parking lot.  Even when it is 10 degrees out...
2) This is a small house with a "pretzel kitchen" inside.  Don't expect a dine-in experience.  While there is a bathroom (our 4yr-old had an "emergency,") it is clearly not intended for public use.  The design is, quite simply, "Get your pretzel and head on out!"
3) The menu is simple.  The specialty pretzels and soups rotate - check the Facebook page for details.  Basic pretzels are always available.
4) Shockingly tasty!

This place was Awesome! My wife and I are at the Ronald McDonald house for the next 3 months and we are going to be frequently visiting this place. The chicken parmesan pretzel and cinnamon pretzels were great!

The food is very good and I like the selection but their supply plan is questionable.  You can only order a minimum of 6 of their daily special, even paying 3 days in advance.  Selling out before closing time is understandable but not being able to preorder 5 to-go seems counterproductive.
My first visit was just at closing time (as they suggest on phone), to get 4 of the daily special since I couldn't pre order that morning.  It was the pepperoni stuffed one, which was really good.  They did have a small number of (daily) stock left.  Not sure if they are banking on the exclusivity and word-of-mouth of short supply, but that certainly doesn't keep them at the top of my food choice since there's no certainty of getting any product.  

The service is decent and I feel the prices are in line with the uniqueness of the product.  My 3 visits must have been off peak hours as I've never waited in line or seen more that one other customer there.  I have heard of the lines but have not experienced it myself.

Ive been back twice since and the food is very good.  The italian beef as well as the gyros stuffed are great and really filling.  Had the cheddar soup with the italian beef...too much food but a great dip for the non-stuffed part of the pretzel.  Some day I'll get there for the brisket.

Gnarly Knots Pretzel Co. just happens to be REALLY CLOSE to Central DuPage Hospital which just happens to have pretty terrible food (CDH, not GK).  After a day of surviving on ice chips, water, and then jello, I was phening for some real food.  And not of the hospital variety.  Enter Gnarly Knots.  And a sister-in-law willing to pick it up and bring it in (thanks, Jess!).  As soon as she walked in the door I was handing over the baby and mangia'ing on some HUGE delicious pretzels.  The daily special was the stuffed cheese one and it was amazing.  The stuffing ends up being in one section of the pretzel and doesn't go throughout the whole thing, but the pretzel by itself is awesome too so it works out.  The cheese dipping sauce (because apparently I like to dip my cheese in more cheese) was kind of spicy but it was also really good.  Next time I'm in the area (hopefully not because I'm at the hospital) I will certainly be stopping by for another try.  I NEED to have an Italian Beef stuffed pretzel and a cinnamon sugar one too.  Though hopefully I'd do it in two trips...guess we'll see how rational I am next time I'm there.

Great pizza pretzel and lemon chicken noodle soup. Picnic table around back was perfect.

Check 'em our on Facebook to find out what the pretzels of the day are.
Mercy this place is delish!  You cant go wrong with the pretzel dog.  Outstanding!  nom nom nom
I don't get the hype. I tried a pepperoni pizza pretzel and it was ok. Definitely not something I would wait in line for. I like the pretzel chips but you can get them at Standard Market.

Stopped here today for the first time after hearing good things about it. My boyfriend and I each got the Jack Cheese Stuffed pretzel, he got a side of cheese sauce and I got a cup of tomato basil soup. It was REALLY GOOD! I love soft pretzels and would eat them every day if there were a healthy way to do so, haha. They were very filling (it's basically like eating a sandwich for lunch). I wish I could stop in there often but I live about 45 minutes away, and my work schedule doesn't allow me to get out there when they're open. I will go back someday though!

Best pretzels in the area! Our only problem is that they are not open late enough, and the only way they can solve that is by making pretzels through out the day. When we come here, the staff is friendly and their pretzels are always amazing!

Garlic mashed potato soup. Amazing!

I feel like there is much room to improve, and that's a good thing! I was impressed with how friendly the people were in the shop and with the overall presentation of the food.

The pretzels are fresh and hot. We tried the Bavarian, cheese and pretzel dog. The pretzel dog was AWESOME! I had a mustard cream dipping sauce with it which was light flavor and went well with the dog. The cheese pretzel tasted just like the Bavarian pretzel, just with crunchy cheese on top, which didn't affect the flavor. And the Bavarian was a good size, good flavor and just enough salt.

Gotta go back sometime to try the stuffed pretzels, but it's a little difficult with the limited hours.

Amazing!  I've tried several of the specialty pretzels, meatball, Italian beef, cheese stuffed and honestly every single one has been my favorite.  They have awesome, huge, over the top pretzel buns that taste incredible.  Whether you get a regular pretzel, specialty pretzel or pretzel buns you won't be disappointed.  They guys have mastered the art of pretzel making.  Best damn pretzels you will ever eat!
I'd heard about this place for a while but hadn't had the chance to try it until we had an unexpected trip to the hospital close by. WOW...they get it done. Simply delicious!!!!

The only reason I am giving it a three is because although my son and I both loved our pretzels, I found a piece of plastic netting (or something) inside my Italian Beef pretzel.. I have worked in food service and think both, that this is disgusting, and it seems to have been either be part of a hair net or part of what was holding ingredients before they went into the pretzel. yuck. 

That said, the pretzel was good enough that I will try again. I hope they also pick up production (not an easy task, I'm sure) so they can accommodate customers rather than restricting how many pretzels we can buy.

Also there really is almost no seating so I would plan on carry out, especially if it's not a nice day.

I will try again and, if they do fine, they might earn a star back.

Consider this review incomplete... but I'm a big fan of the standard pretzels they already have.

Driven here by a Yelp email, I drove by after work to see if they had any pretzels left. As it turns out, they did, but none of the pork-flavored specialty pretzels that I was hoping for. Instead they had three standard pretzels and two pretzels roughly the size of a large pizza at Lou Malnati's.

I'm a rational guy, so I got two regular pretzels. Auntie Anne's is nice, but in the end they're little better than something you might get in a can; these pretzels might have had beer in their batter, for all I know; that's how much yeast was in them. And the outsides were perfectly leathery, while the insides weren't tough at all; soft, warm and awesomeness in a knot.

I had two toppings; a hot cheese topping that was nice and spicy, and a mustard-creme fraiche cold topping, which stepped around my dislike of mustard by being both mustardy and sour.

If their stuffed pretzels are anywhere near as good as their standard pretzels, the 5-star rating will stand.

Now THAT is a real pretzel! It was a Friday, so I got the pretzel dog with a soda. The hot dog was thick and juicy, no skimpy wieners here. The pretzel was crispy and incredibly soft, which are both absolute musts for a soft pretzel. $7 wasn't too bad. But, really, I have to pay for mustard? With a hot dog, that should be included. I will return for a cinnamon-sugar and probably an Italian beef one of these days.
BEST place ever. Just go try it, you won't regret it! (Unless they are sold out for the day because that does happen, lines can be out the door but worth it).

Best preztle I have ever has hands down!!!! So lucky it's so close to me !!! Had the chicken par  stuffted preztle it came with a sauce everything was delicious!!! Can't wait to try the other flavors!!! It's good for pick up and leave only

Watch out Auntie Anne's! Best pretzel I've ever had! I had the garlic Parmesan and the fianc had cheese topped. Both were perfection. Can't wait to come early next time and try a stuffed pretzel or a pretzel dog!

This is always a treat for us. Their garlic Parmesan pretzel is so so good.  We always end up getting there close to closing so we usually miss out on the special pretzel, but even their regular 4 are worth it!

The little lady had a number of places bookmarked for us to try while we were in the hospital for the birth of our daughter. The first solid meal she could eat came from Gnarly Knots. Since we'd never been there before our order was WAY too big. We got the special of the day (Monterrey Jack stuffed), a parmesan garlic, a pretzel dog, and some creamy tomato soup. All of the pretzels were excellent. The hot dog inside the pretzel was HUGE, almost too big (that's what she said). The soup was good but not great. I'll definitely go back, as I really want to get my hands on the Italian beef stuffed pretzel (Thursday Special).
Greatest pretzels ever! Sauces were awesome too! Highly recommend

Got the Cuban Stuffed pretzel today.  The outside was crisp but the inside was warm and soft.  It was filled with slow roasted and thinly shaved pork, honeyed ham, Havarti cheese, mustard and pickles...YUMMY!  The staff was quick and friendly.  The pretzels are served hot and fresh!  Can't wait to go back.  Definitely a little GEM in downtown Winfield.
Tasty! Not the best pretzels ive had but they were still great! Love the idea of it! I had a pepperoni pizza pretzel i believe...

Let me start off by saying that I am STUFFED right now. I had the Bavarian with cheese and the medium sized tomato basil soup and it came out to be a little over $5. That is an amazing deal for the amount of food I had. I'm in a delicious food coma right now.

This place is just down the street from Central Dupage Hospital.  If I was working in the area, I would come here all the time, it was that yummy.  I wish they had better hours though.

If "Eating the best stuffed pretzel in the universe" is on your bucket list, ya for it because this place exists and you know, cross that  off! 

It would be awesome if the pretzel was OK and the stuffing was ya know, awesome like stuffing is. but what's absolutely mind blowing is that the pretzel itself is by far the best salted doughy glory  I have ever eaten. then they stuff cheese into it and say "have a nice day" and your all "nice?! this is is up there with my wedding day!" because cheese and pretzels are the perfect match. 

Thanks for giving me something to obsesses over, Gnarly Knots.

Been awhile since I was here. Tiring of El Molcajete. They are using lower quality of food and it shows. So came here for takeout today knowing I was gonna pay more. A LOT more. I didnt like that. But you know what?  Their food quality is very good now. Didnt have to wait  long, nd the food was gr8! Still 29 bux is high for a 3taco dinner, a burrito and a order of guac & chips. Hence only 4 stars not 5. It was margarita day special since it was Tue (also Thur) 4.99 for a short margarita, not a bad price. Still it warrants me revisiting. Wish I had a menu,alas they didnt give me one when I picked up. By the way their guac was awesome- you could taste the lime juice in it. Very fresh.  Definitely worth stopping

I left this place very confused.  Based on the reviews I had high expectations, but felt the food was... eh.  

First off the chips and salsa were just okay.  The salsa was a more "liquidy" style, not chunky... Which I've had before, but the flavor was... Different.  Not inedible, but it didn't WOW me at all. 

For the appetizer we ordered the Queso Fundido with chorizo on top.  When it was brought to the table I immediately had reservations.  It looked like plain melted cheese with some Chorizo on top.  Went to take the spoon to put some in a tortilla, and the cheese was barely melted.  Like the spoon cut through it.  I figured it would be more gooey.  

On to the meals.  I ordered the chimichanga dinner and my partner ordered the enchiladas suizas.  Both of them had their Adelita sauce on top.  This sauce was super confusing.  It was a tomato based sauce which is fine, but it didn't have any seasoning typically found in Mexican cuisine.  I had assumed this was cuisine from a specific region in Mexico (if you've had traditional Mayan cuisine, it's SO different from your typical Mexican fare). We asked the waitress what region this food is from and she had no idea and then commented that she'd never seen these dishes prepared this way either.  Anyways, the sauce ruined the chimichanga for me.  My partner didn't like it on the enchiladas either.  

The rice was okay.  There was a flavor in it that had an almost licorice type flavor.  Wonder if they used anise... Strange thing to put in Mexican rice IMO.

Only thing on the plate that was decent was the refried beans. You can taste the lard in them which was good.

Overall, it was a blah experience and I don't intend to return here.

We came here for a late breakfast when we had a craving for a Mexican breakfast. Again: huevos rancheros are right on! Not on their menu but they will make them for you. 
Service is great and food comes out quickly!

First time eating here. Got the taco dinner. The tacos were pretty good. I gave 3 stars because it tasted like good tacos in America, but not authentic Mexican food. If I could've given a half star I would've given 3.5. Overall pretty descent. Unfortunately not any good Mexican cuisine in the area so this is the best of the worst. I would eat here again.

My husband and I ate in - the service was AMAZING.  The waiter and waitress both filled up our drinks quickly and were very personable and funny.  I ordered the enchiladas.  I have had better, but they definitely were not bad.  My husband ordered some kind of skirt steak with a sauce.  His meal is something that would make us return! Mmm!

Our family and I really like this place for a quiet/calm dinner.  Its usually not too crowded or loud and has always been yummy no matter what we order.  The chips and salsa are so wonderful and fresh!

Awful service, awful food. We always wondered about this place so we finally decided to try it out. I wish we hadnt, it was a waste of money. We were the only table there yet our waiter was running around frantically and disappeared often. He told us they had a drive thru that was busy....it wasnt. We know because we were the only ones there so it was easy to see he was lying. He forgot to bring out some of our food and we had a hatd time getting his attention.
When he came back outside he ignored us and went to go watch the soccer game on the TV, we had to yell at him to get his attention.
The amount of food they give you and quality compared to other mexican restaurants, this place is awful. Go to burrito parrilla instead, much better food, economic, and amazing service. 
We were the only people there so clearly other people know this place is awful too.

Hidden gem. Ive probably driven past this place a million times. Was bored of the tired menu at La Mex and decided to stop and roll the dice. Gained a new customer for life. I got the chimichanga dinner and my fiance got the taco dinner. If you like char-broiled carne asada this is the place. Chips and salsa are great too. Cant wait to explore more of the menu.

This place never seems crowded but the certainly should be. Always fresh food with good service. At times on the slower side but again...Fresh...

Great tender and flavorful Carne asada.
Good authentic Mexican food at a relatively low cost.

I moved to Plainfield North about 6mths ago, and we were on the mission to find a good AND authentic Mexican Restaurant nearby.  One of our go to favorites had been "Uncle Julio's" in Lombard (besides driving to Pilsen - 'Nuevo Leon' or Little Village in the city).

After suggestions from a few neighbors, my family and I tried two of them in Downtown Plainfield -- what a huge disappointment!

Another neighbor suggested "La Adelita" so one day while running errands out that way, we decided to try it.

As I walked in, I was pleasantly surprised. Although the floor plan is like a previous fast food place, the owner did a nice job with decorating the restaurant. White linened tables (makes it look a little fancy) beautiful Mexican murals on the wall, and there is a small bar.

My only feedback and constructive critism would be to the owner?/host -- when people walk in, greet them with a smile and the show them the typical Mexican warmth that the culture is. Don't look so serious!  Life is short!  Show a little happiness and be friendlier.

At any rate, I ordered the "Chiles Rellenos" (Poblano stuffed peppers), which is my favorite Mexican dish. We also ordered steak tacos and steak tortas. Everything was great!!! The food, rice, beans -- the salsa? Eh...it's good but could be better. Maybe you should fire roast chiles, garlic & tomatoes and make authentic Mexican salsa/chilito? :)

We also ordered "Horchata" (rice water) to drink and after one sip, and by the taste of it and making it from scratch myself, I knew it was authentically home made! I asked the host/waiter and he confirmed.  It was delicious and a must have!!

To wrap it up, I would definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.  It is very good.

However, my nearest favorite place is still "Uncle Julios" in Lombard -- their "Carne Asada" dinner dish is out of this world!!! As well as their chips and salsa which i always buy extra to go.

I tried to use the drive thru tonight and waited 5 mins no response at the speaker. I drove up to the window and saw people working. I knocked on the window and even honked still no acknowledgment. What is the point of a drive thru if you don't respond to customers?

Always great service, and good food. Posole is tasty and has lots of "add ins."
Guacamole is very good. I always order by phone "to go" and the meal is  ready on time and piping hot.
Super friendly... Consistent food... Probably your best choice for Mexican in Plainfield.

Once I get a craving for Mexican, there's no going back.  This restaurant, being in the middle of Plainfield, makes it really close to home and far surpasses my other favorite Mexican spots in the area.

The chips and salsa kept coming; although I'll admit that the salsa was very watery and they could've done better.  It wouldn't keep me away from this place though, because my chimichanga was so good!  It was served with refried beans and rice, and I ordered mine without beans.  I was impressed that the waitress came back to our table to check whether or not I wanted beans in the chimichanga as well.  I didn't, I forgot to ask for it without, and I was very grateful she came back.  It was perfectly fried and stuffed with shredded chicken.  The only thing that could've made it better would be more cheese.

We were warned about the enchiladas my husband ordered that they were "spicier than hot sauce," and the waitress hesitated as my gringo husband ordered.  Nope, he wanted them anyway.  Results?  Not that spicy.  We were puzzled about why the spice level was made known to us prior to ordering.  The chicken soup was a big portion with large chunks of chicken and veggies.

We ordered a pitcher of the house margaritas, although we didn't finish it.  The margaritas were just okay.  The food is the star of the show at La Adelita.

Our total for 2 entrees, 1 soup, and a pitcher of margaritas was $45 before tip.  Most entrees were around $10-14.  Without the margaritas we could've had a delicious, filling meal for cheap.

It wasn't busy at all on a Friday night, only one other group was seated in the restaurant when we walked in around 6:00 p.m.  By the time we left, there were 3 more tables full.  It isn't intimate or cozy at all in here, there aren't any booths, so it's definitely not recommended for a proposal, date night, or something else where you might want to impress someone (unless it's with a chimichanga).  Good for locals who love Mexican food or families looking for a casual dinner.

Now this is fantastic Mexican food. This is what Friaco's wants to be, and hopes you think it is. If you're reading Yelp reviews trying to find a sit-down restaraunt to eat good Mexican food YOU SHOULDN'T LOOK ANYWHERE ELSE. 

That being said, I don't eat here enough. I have a young son so taking him here is a disservice to THEM. Or you, if you're eating there. This place is too good (in a good way) to bring my tornado of a family. 

Everything I've had here has been good. Ownership and wait staff is SO friendly and helpful. Margaritas - not a drink I always enjoy out because of the markup - is worth it here. Fresh, BIG, and strong!

We've only been here once but the chimichanga was fantastic!  And if you've never had one, imagine a giant burrito and an egg roll getting married and having a big baby.  Reasonably priced and pretty fast too.  Give it a go!

We had a Girls Night Out after meeting in Plainfield early last Saturday evening and based on Yelp we decided to go to La Adelita. We were so glad we did! Everyone was pleased with their food and drink.The Margaritas were superb. Chips and salsa tasted homemade. The fish tacos, quesadilla and fajitas were all excellent!  The food was served piping hot. The service was great--friendly, fast and everything the way we ordered. The atmosphere is casual and family-oriented. The prices were reasonable. We hope to return soon.

I really enjoyed this little Mexican (former Wendy's) drive through restaurant. The food was not bad, although it seems like an Americanized version of Mexican. They have a full bar and 2 tvs that make it seem more like a basement bar than a restaurant.

We went in on a Saturday afternoon and we were the only ones in there which made it a little bit awkward, but we managed to enjoy our lunch without being bothered.

I'm not sure if I'll be back here because for cheap Mexican I much rather go to a small taco joint, but this is convenient for the drive-thru!!

Ordered a steak taco dinner and an horchata. Loved everything. Rice and beans had good flavor. Steak was good and tender. Tortillas tasted fresh. Horchata was delicious. Looking forward to tasting other dishes on their menu.

Would have given 5 star rating but I found it to be a bit pricey.

Hands down favorite Mexican restaurant. They can have a to go order ready in 2 minutes and it's delicious. Great margaritas and authentic food. I recommend this place to everyone I know. Love that they also have a drive thru.. makes grabbing a quick $2.50 taco super easy!

Food is homemade. You can tell someone cared about making your meal fresh.  Place is super clean,  friendly staff, reasonable prices.   To me, it was kind of like someone from another state moved in and is making Mexican food. . Not a bad thing.  But different from what I'm used to. Again,  food is good,  but there's something different about the flavors that you'd typically expect to get in the Plainfield/ Joliet area.  Give it a go though!

I've passed La Adelita about a million times, and always thought to myself "Hmm one day I shall stop on for some tacos!" Well that went on for about two years before I made the trip in. I really wasn't missing anything. I tried al pastor taco's. Nothing about the taco made me think I would ever go back. I really wanted to like this place. The tacos weren't nasty or anything, just bland and very forgetful. Nothing about this place seemed like an authentic Mexican restaurant, and when I want Mexican food I do not want the American Version of it.  If you're looking for some kick ass Mexican food head to Yoli's tacos on Broadway in Joliet. That place is sooooooooo good!! And the flavors are on point!!
Simply the best Mexican Restaurant in Plainfield/Naperville/Joliet area. Food is delicious and service is excellent.
Love this place great food great service . Nice big menue to choose from. I highly recommend this place fir lunch or diner.
Very good food. Vegetables tasted fresh,  shredded beef wasn't mushy or gross.  Salsa was fresh,  chips were a little stale though
I've been here a few times and food is delicious and service always spot on.  They have shredded beef which I love. Good here blows La Mex out of the water.

Pretty much since we moved to IL almost 5 years ago we have been seeking some good Mexican food. We're getting closer to the mark, and La Adelita was a strong addition to the "plus" listing. 

Tucked inside what was clearly once a Wendy's is a nice little restaurant with exuberant murals (and a TV turned up to an exuberant volume -- at one point we asked our waiter to turn it down a bit, and even after he did it was still quite loud...). The menu is so large that it takes some studying. Drinks included horchata (my favorite, a bit on the sweet side here) and sangria for my mother, which she enjoyed. 

We ordered queso fundido with poblanos as an appetizer; usually queso is more melted (as in liquidy) cheese, but this was sort of stretchy white cheese with the roasted peppers on top, served with tortilla chips, rather hard to wrangle. My dad and boyfriend took charge of chopping it up while the other held the rest at bay (as stated, it was a kind of stretchy and funky texture), then doling it out onto chips. It tasted really good, just awkward to eat!

The food was really quite excellent. I ordered a combo that ended up including beef, chicken, chorizo and a serving of crab legs splayed on top, all resting on a nest of tortilla chips in what looked like the traditional stone bowl. A LOT of food, two people could have handled this (though it looks like more since it is piled atop the chips, which get soggy from the heat/moisture).

It's not a huge place, so I would try to arrive early for dinner on week-ends. Definitely a place to return to!

La Adelita has some great authentic Mexican food.  The menu is super long, so they might benefit from cutting down.  

I go here for lunch during the work week, but for the past year, the construction traffic has really hampered business.  I really hope they're able to stay in business because the food is really fantastic.  

The chicken soup is spicy and really quite filling.  The burrito suizo (my favorite) will cure what ails you.  Like other Plainfield restaurants, I hope that solid restaurants like this will survive the construction.  

If you're in the area, I would recommend.

I'm not sure why the reviews are are so positive... I tried the chicken burrito dinner and it was the soggiest mushy dog food of an excuse for food. Literally I picked up the burrito and orange water was just pouring out of it making the shell fall apart and basically had the burritos contents all over my lap. Might give it one more try as the reviews seem to suggest it has gotten better...

I've given this place plenty or tries and I really wanted to love it because of the convience of the drivethru but like most other people posted it really Americanized Mexican food. But the pozole they have there is the best in the area by far!! So if your looking for pozole come here! So there is really nothing wrong with the food I was just looking for something more authentic.

This place is great. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, the service is great, and the mural of the Asian bartender in a saloon is great, hahaha.  Really, though, the food is delicious.  Best taco salad in the area!

This is the real thing.  Service was great, food was delivered to the table fast and was delicious.  The mole sauce and burrito and the seafood soup guacamole were tasty.  I recommend this to anyone who likes Mexican food.

The best Mexican food and margaritas in the area! Plainfield's hidden Gem!

Tuesdays and Thursdays are half price Margarita Nights!

Probably, the best Mexican food I had in the Joliet-Plainfield area.

The restaurant itself is nothing fancy,the place used to be a Wendy's and have their own Drive thru, which is rare for Mexican restaurants.  The service is OK but the food, man... Really Good!

I had a vegetarian enchiladas and Wow they were really good!!. I've been there around 5 times and every time the food it's been great, tasty and fresh.

I hope the place can keep the consistency of the taste and freshness.

This is a good place if you don't want taco bell. The few times I've been here the food is usually very fresh, but lacks flavor. Taco Burrito King is just a step above but further away in Channahon. I come to La Adelita when I don't want to travel. Overall this place is okay but leaves much to be desired if you're looking for true Mexican fare.

Went here with a group of coworkers and we all had a blast! The food was great and the service was excellent.  Plenty of authentic Mexican choices and the chips and salsa are great.  This place is a hidden gem.  Definitely recommended!

One other person here said it was one of the best Mexican places in plainfield.  Sadly this was true for me as well.  The other ones are way worse then this place but that still does not mean this place was any good. 
Lets start, I ordered a steak burrito and a pastor taco (i always get a pastor taco).  The burrito first, i asked what comes on it she stated beans, lettuce, tomato and cheese.  I asked for a Steak Burrito no beans. What i got was with no beans but had sour cream loaded on it which i can deal with but the steak was cold and unseasoned no flavor.  The amount of lettuce in the burrito was enormous I could only think that its used as a filler. The burrito as a whole was cold and needed to be drowned in salsa for me to put it out of its misery.  The Pastor Taco now, pork was dry onions were over cooked and way to much pineapple(really overwhelming).

Delicious fresh food. Awesome margaritas. Reasonable prices. This is our go to place for authentic Mexican food in Plainfield! Way, way better than the bland food at La Mex in Joliet. Plus, the staff is always courteous and friendly. Used to be an old Wendy's, which is perfect for those nights that you just want carry out. You can just drive up to the drive thru and pick up your food without even getting out of your car! We take our dogs with us when we go to pick up the food, and the owner always gives us a cup of the shredded beef to give to our dogs as a treat. Very nice touch! :)

Highly recommend!!!!!!
Great food, tastes so authentic at good prices. Very simple layout but prompt and friendly service. My first choice for Mexican food when I want to stay close to home

If you haven't been there for a while - go back!  I wasn't impressed the first time I visited over a year ago.  The food was good, but the atmosphere was lacking, TV was blaring (as someone else has mentioned), and service was so, so.  

Went in last evening for carry out and ended up staying for dinner.  The decor was charming, TV barely audible, food good like last time, and service  was excellent.  Learned that Tuesday and Thursday are 1/2 price Margarita nights :).  Good Margaritas, too!

For being located in a former Wendy's, they did quite a nice job of decorating.

Service on a Friday night couldn't have been quicker.  

Chips and salsa were good, although for my personal tastes the salsa could use a bit more onion.  Guacamole had too much cilantro in it.

My wife order steak tacos - the steak was very tender and flavorful.  I had the fish tacos which were absolutely wonderful.

Again- the wait staff was super fast and polite.  Drinks never went empty, food was delivered in under 10 minutes,  

We'll definitely visit again.  I only wish they offered these tacos ala carte.  I'd rather my $ go to an extra taco rather than beans I won't eat and rice I barely touch.

The family and I have been to this restaurant several times- not because it is spectacular or necessarily memorable but because it is close and has decent food.  

It has been a few months since we have been here and I must admit that I forgot to rate it at the time of attendance. However, I do recall the salsa and the rest of the food being acceptable.  The salsa verde is spicy for those that need to know and do not want to be surprised by the Verde Enchiladas- spicy but good flavor.  We have had a few different items from the menu and all were good but unremarkable. The nachos are messy but good, the enchiladas are passable,and the fajitas have good quality meat/veggies (the veggies are a little undercooked for my taste but still good). 

The service is great and the establishment is very clean. They are great with kiddos and for those that are not so great with kiddos there is a full service bar.  

The family and I still consider this restaurant if no others come to mind first.

We were planning on using one of our restaurant.com certificates this past weekend but after we sat down and showed the waiter our certificate he informed us they were no longer accepting them.  Bummer!   He wasn't exactly nice about it either, so we left.   There are simply WAY too many choices out there to be treated like that.    

And sorry, we WON'T be back :(

I LOVE La Adelita. Its nice to have an authentic Mexican restaurant that offers a drive thru! It makes call in orders so easy. I have yet to dine inside but have heard its nice inside. 

The food is really good, one of my favorite Mexican restaurants. Price is good and you get a ton of food. 

We have ordered their nachos, quesadillas, cheese enchiladas, burritos and tacos as well as beans & rice all was excellent! They are very nice employees as well.

I highly recommend trying it out.

I love this mexican restaurant. You can sit down there or take out,which I've never ordered takeout. The waiters are nice, I always order the steak fajitas they are so bomb! If you want extra guac or something,they'll give you a ton extra on the side which is nice. There horchata(cinnamon rice drink) is absolute fire doe. one time we were there near closing hours and gave us the whole pitcher at no extra charge. If you want authentic Mexican food in Plainfield this is the places to go.Dis place is good af

After the third time we went there are usual drinks were are on the table before we sat down! The service is great and appreciated. The food is awesome and authentic. It has become a favorite dine out.
Mediocre at best. Runny salsa. Watered down margaritas. Place was empty on a Friday night. Service was ok. But not overly friendly. Kinda like , "I'm hear because I need the job."

A decent and authentic Mexican experience in Plainfield.  I really enjoyed my fish tacos, and guacamole was delicious! The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant is small and cozy. Next time I plan on sitting on the patio with a margarita!
Good stuff maynard!

For being in Plainfield there food is pretty good, and I like that they have a drive thru, I can pickup food on the way home. Also they have the best horchata around compared to other nearby mex rest. Overall pretty good.

One of the best Mexican restaurants around Plainfield...I take that back the it's the best!  The staff is super nice the food is good, hot, and served up fast.  Their margaritas are delicious too.  Definitely recommend checking this place out.
Had the fish tacos and they were excellent. I was also impressed with the rice, organic tomatoes on the tacos, and overall service. Place looks very nice too.

It's not the best Mexican restaurant by any means, but this is not Chicago. This is the suburbs and, unfortunately, this is as good as it gets. The caldos aren't good, the rice is okay, and the flautas are okay. The asada is delicious, but not in tacos. Overall it's good, and I do recommend it to people here locally. But if you are a taco fan like me, take the drive to Chicago and go to Tio Luis. Or at least Los Comales in Aurora.

La Adelita is the closest food to authentic Mexican food that you will find. They have so many good choices it is hard to decide which dish to choose. They specialize in Mexican seafood and it is to die for. There  steak is also very good. If you ever want good Mexican food go to La Adelita!

Nice restaurant in Plainfield, Illinois. Definitely will return when I make my way back to this area. Steak Torta was very good--and they came with very good and well seasoned french fries. Clean and well stocked bar. If you can get by the obvious fact it used to be a Wendy's location you'll be in for a nice treat.

Three Stars is A-OK, and that's exactly what this place is, A-OK.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Hot chips and salsa....not big, chunky salsa......but good salsa for dipping.  The Guacamole was very good, with big chunks of tomato and the right amount of onion and cilantro.  

I had enchaladas stuffed with very tender shrimp and smothered in garlic red sauce.  It's the typical mexican restaurant presentation with refried beans and rice, a little lettuce/tomato on the side.  

What keeps me from giving 4 Stars?  Well, I guess it's the paper napkins, plastic cups.....and the service.  Service was OK, a little slow.......this place is good, just not great.  The menu has a little of everything, so no matter what your preference, you'll find it here.

This was the best Mexican food I've had. Every component of the meal was great. We went on a Saturday, so I tried the Carnitas... Simply awesome. Service was excellent. I rate them higher than Front St, Friacos, La Mex, Las Palmas, and La Cabana.

I love this mexican restaurant. You can sit down there or take out,which I've never ordered takeout. The waiters are nice, I always order the enchiladas they are so yummy! If you want extra sour cream or something,they'll give you a ton extra on the side which is nice. There horchata(cinnamon rice drink) is absolutely delicious. one time we were there near closing hours and gave us the whole pitcher at no extra charge. If you want authentic Mexican food in Plainfield this is the places to go.
First time. Chips and Salsa very good. Margs very good. Food and service good. We will be back.   Keep up the hard work !!!!!
Went there when it first opened. I waited at my table for 20 minutes and NO ONE came over to wait on us. NEVER WENT BACK.

I think I've eaten at every mexican food place in Plainfield in search of good, authentic mexican food. Up until finding this jewel, i've been disappointed.  This is as authentic as it gets here in Plainfield. So far I love this place and it's definitely our regular mexican food place in town!

La Adelita is the closest food to authentic Mexican that you will find.....period!! They have so many good choices it is hard to decide which dish to choose....It seems that they specialize in Mexican seafood ....i had the Shrimp and squid Fajitas which came with Rice, Beans, Guacamole and fresh Corn Tortillas...My son had one of the many steak dishes and loved it.....If you want to escape to Mexico for a couple of hours and enjoy Quality Mexican food..... visit La Adelita....They also have a Drive thru which may come in handy....
I like the wings. The lunch special for $10 bucks is good. The place is pretty clean and if you call ahead you don't have to wait for your food so long.

Poor Customer service, Terrible food, very pricey for cheap quality. Hate the seating too.
Not enough seating for big parties.
It just took 20mins for the 2 kids working to get me a Large Fry and a Reg Drink at 12:30 in the afternoon. Not worth the wait.....

The wings are delicious. I really appreciated being able to order 4 flavors for our family pack.  The fries (ordered extra crispy) were crisp and well seasoned.  Our hungry teenagers were extremely happy with this selection.

We purchased a coupon pack from Metea Valley High School athletics that contained a coupon for 10 wings free with the purchase of 20 wings and 2 drinks.  So we ordered the Bulls Double Pack - 20 wings, 2 drinks and 2 fries.  When my husband went to pick up our order, he was told he couldn't have the 10 wings free.  Hello... we just ordered 20 wings and 2 drinks.  And the coupon was for a charity fundraiser.  Then the guy behind the counter took the coupon without giving us the 10 wings.

The wings were TINY, about 2 bites each.  The fries were cold, over-salted and tasted like they had been sprinkled with sugar.  We would have complained about the guy taking the coupon, but since we won't be going back, it doesn't matter.
Wings were delicious and customer service was excellent. Fast service too. I'll definitely be coming back.

I placed a large boneless wing order for my New Year's ever party online and received an email confirmation.  However,  when my husband arrived for pickup he was told that the order had not been placed, and wasn't provided a clear explanation of why not. My husband called to tell me what happened and put me on the phone with a worker who just told me that the order had not been placed because they could not honor the price advertised on the website. 

He also told me that they called me about this and I just didn't answer.  I checked my call log, and I had only one missed call and no voice mail about this (Seriously?).  I told him that it was simply unacceptable to not leave a message about this, and was not offered any sort of apology whatsoever.  Since  I wasn't  interested in fighting with this worker over the phone, I just told my husband to leave and that we would figure something else out. 

Nonetheless, we were absolutely furious because we were left scrambling at the last minute to get food for our party. Thankfully, we were able to get pizzas from Lou Malnatis down the street right away.  However, poor service like this is unacceptable. There is so much competition with so many great food places in the Naperville/Aurora area, so we will NEVER be returning to Wingstop.

TINNYYY WIINNGGSSSS.  they should cost a quarter of what they do,  because they are about the size of a quarter.   Veeeery slow service as well,  and they don't really serve you.   They just put them on the counter for you to go get. 2 stars because the sauces were actually very good.   I just eat wings too much to put up with this.

I love Wingstop wings and they are perfect for when I'm going to hang out with the guys! Tons of delicious flavors and the boneless wings are just as delicious as the bone in! My only complaint is that the wings are relatively expensive and at the location that I was at, the staff was incredibly rude. I ordered online and when I went in the staff informed me that the coupon that I intended to use was not valid at that location. Luckily I threw enough of a fit that they gave me a discount anyway but I felt very offended.
