I work at MOD Pizza and at MOD we do everything in our power to make the customer happy, even if they have a coupon that we don't think is valid. The customer is always right and if you are completely unable to give the discount then it is important to give the most sincere apology. Wingstop has delicious food but man is the customer service poor.
I almost got stabbed here once, but I also found a phone case so it was okay. The wings were decent

ZERO STARS! AWFUL!  I waited in the car with my sleeping kids while my husband ran in to get some wings real quick.  After TWENTY minutes I went in to see what was going on.  The girl at the register kept looking at me from the side, clearly aware I was upset as she was taking an order.  When she was done I asked how much longer it would be, cause it had been 20 minutes. She looked behind her, and took 1 of 3 bags, then handed it to us. Didn't say a word.  I gawked at her and said has that been sitting there this whole time???? She shrugged me off, turned back to her register and actually said "I don't know, I don't notice when they bring the food up, I was taking orders". No apology, nothing!  I asked then who's job is it to give people their food? ! She didn't answer me. And the poor guy that had ordered before my husband was still sitting there waiting for his food.  That girl was a twit.
delicious wings done right. No complaints.

Good wings. Great hot sauce. Terrible fries. 

I've ordered from here a handful of times and have always been satisfied with their wings. The bone-in may be a bit small, but the boneless are a nice size. I really enjoy their blue cheese dressing, not so much on the ranch, both are home made. 

If you've really got that craving for wings and are nearby, this is a good place to go to. Or you can sneak them into the movie theater across the street ; )

Love this place! Boneless wings were bigger and juicier than BWW. I loved the Garlic Parmesan flavor. Fries are great. Soda is especially good. Love that you don't have to tip. Cheaper than BWW too. Will definitely be back!!!

So, this place has great food and all, but the people who work here are literally slower than frozen molasses. The guy behind the counter reminds me of a scared dog with his tail between his legs, and his voice backs the theory up. I can barely hear this kid, and then he turned around and screamed in Spanish to his co worker that was 6 feet away, just fine. Doesn't brother me spanish, at all, but the volume difference, that's rude. I'd rather have him scream at me than me not be able to hear his little squeaks. Be warned this location doesn't close at midnight like all the other wingstops. Sunday thru Thursday they close at 11, weekends at midnight. Bs total bs. The whole thing with wingstop is catering to the night owls of the world, with still having a good food option. Have also gotten sick from here, so not entirely sure about the food safety precautions being taken here. Needs must, eh?

I'm just reviewing the service. I don't eat this kind of good, but my family will. Was told it would be a 14 min wait. Which I think is still pretty long. Turned out to be 25 min. Came in at noon on a Sat. After us it did get crowded and many got their food before us. I guess the boneless wings take longer? Anyhow be warned this 'stop' is taking a while!

I have never eaten here since moving out to the suburbs so my favorite wing place was Hooters (I really do like their wings!) And a place in Rockford. I'm impressed!! I had the mild and the BBQ both of which were mid-range on the spice scale regular wings. They do offer boneless wings, chicken fingers and chicken patties as well. Now I'm not a fan of B-Dubs just because none of their sauces stand out... they are all kind of blah or burn your tongue off. I think the BBQ here had a little zing and the mild had a little and I mean little kick to it. The young woman behind the counter was great and really patient about my questions and really did offer helpful suggestions. The only reason it only got four stars is I guess im cheap but 8 wings fries drink and ranch for like $15ish bucks? Yikes!

Tonight I did an online order for 10 Louisiana rub traditional wings.  A regular order of cheese fries and two sides of ranch dressing.  The confirmation email said that my wings would be ready in 25 minutes, so I waited a few before heading to the store to pick up my food.  I got there promptly at the time they said my order would be ready.  I walked up to the cashier and we made our transaction, and she reached over and grabbed my bag from the counter.  She was a very nice lady and everything went well, she seemed overly excited and told me she was just eating ice cream.....um....ok, hope you washed your hands before handling my food though.  I got home and opened my wings and they were cold and swimming in grease.  The fries were cold and the seasoning on there was caked on.  The cheese sauce was cold.  Maybe this is my fault for placing an online order and showing up on time rather than early.  Maybe they should invest in some sort of heat lamp for to go orders so that they stay warm.  I have visited other wingstops and love the louisiana rub but I have never experienced cold food, the only reason that I wanted to eat here tonight was because I was really craving their delicious fantastic ranch dressing.  That was cold too!  Hooray!  I don't think that I'll be back.  I'm a bdubs fan, regardless that I have to pay a tip, at least I know that my food will be hot and that the crew is being supervised enough to not be eating ice cream in the back.
Wings are great and the late hours help too. I defiantly like them more than BWW, as there wings aren't as wet and seem more flavorful.
Better than BW3, by far. The fries are delicious and perfect and fresh cut. The wings are cooked with some evil crack sauce or something. Yum.

I love the French fries. They taste like they are seasoned with a sprinkling of an ever-so-slight mixture of sugar and salt. May sound bad, but makes them delicious! The wings aren't as meaty as other wing places (Rings & Wings). But, great tasting/seasoned wings.
Reasonable prices, fast friendly service and great wings. Love the garlic parmesan.  You have to try the fries...they season them with salt and sugar. Yum!

I saw this place driving by and checked Yelp for reviews and decided I had to try it.  I had the boneless "wings" (chicken strips) meal with fries and a drink.  When I see boneless wings, I usually think of chicken nuggets in wing sauce, these were chicken strips in wing sauce, no big deal but it was different than what I expected.  I ordered the wings hot, but they weren't that hot, more like medium.  I didn't like the sauce that much, it was just ok, but it tasted more like a pepper sauce than wing sauce.  The fries were fine, but a little undercooked.  I definitely like the boneless wings at Buffalo Wild Wings better and they don't cost much more.  I'd go back to try again, but I wasn't that impressed.

These guys make great wings for sure!!! One thing I tried was their beans and I was thoroughly impressed. Its a must try for anyone. I also like you can get beer there, not  a big drinker by any means, but having the option for a cold brew with some wings is always nice.  Four stars for sure!!!

Beware!!!  To start, We loved this place...Close to home and their wings are better than anything we've had outside of Chicago.  However, after we place an online credit card order,  we've had over $2000 of unauthorized transactions on our credit card charged to Texas addresses.  We're very careful of where we use credit cards and compartmentalize credit card use exactly for this type of scenario.  

The card was cancelled and we're not liable but I called their Corporate offices located in **drum roll* *Texas to let them know that there might be a problem with their credit handling procedures.  I talked to a manager named Thomas and when i relayed what had happened he chuckled and said thanks for letting us know.  No "sorry that happened" or "can I take your info so we can investigate this."  To me that speaks to a total disregard for customers.  So, be warned when using Credit cards at this location.

I was expecting a lot of flavors.  Perhaps it was because I brought them home, but they seemed smaller than the wing's i'm used to at other venues.

Pricing is decent

Atmosphere is great! I'll have to try it a 2nd time, the closeness to the neighborhoods is what keeps this a 3-star.

I like their wings and fries although it is all extremely greasy.
Will continue to order from this place.
Give them a try.
I love Wingstop!  They beat Buffallo Wild Wings for sure!  Their fries are the best and the ranch dressing too!  We usually get the lemon pepper and cajun!  YUMMY!!
The sauces are pretty good, but the seasoned fries are kind blech.  The service is just ok, they aren't overly friendly but it's a pretty good alternative to BWW.

We've ordered practically everything but the pizza.
All their sandwiches and combos are really good. I don't like that you have to order the fries separately, they should be included.
I order them through GrubHub. They deliver in an hour, between the estimated time of delivery.
The food overall is always tasty, never had any issues.
The Tiramisu is AMAZING!!! OMG! Theirs is the best I've ever had.

We order pizza here pretty regularly. It seems to be hit or miss with how it tastes. I don't understand why there is so much variance, but on a whole it is good and we keep going back. It is pretty easy to find coupons and they also give you coupons when you order pizza.

I used to like Rizzotti's pizza I think they change their game though. Their crust is paperthin now and it is too thin nothing but a soggy mess. Thin and crispy is good, But too thin and soggy is horrible. A small two ingredient pizza was $18 bucks not worth it.

I ordered a pizza from this Rosati's and my daughter picked it up. She was told that the cheese was a little brown and that she should call back if she wanted a credit. It was an awful pizza. The cheese was very brown as was the crust. I can't believe they sent her out the door with that admitting it was over cooked and charged her full price! I called for the credit which is towards our next purchase. I asked why she was charged in the first place when they told her it was "brown" and was told that some people like it that way. So I asked if they typically make it that way and was very rudely told well if they ask us to! With a rude sigh! I never asked for a "brown" pizza and this location is out of the way for me to return to. So much for customer service!

Very disappointed. I called and ordered a double deal for two 14 inch pizzas for $16.99. I added 3 toppings total to the two pizzas and the total they quoted me on the phone was $28. This seemed a little high, but I figured I would check it out when I went to pick up the pizzas. After I paid for the pizzas they handed me a receipt. Sure enough, I had paid $20 for the two pizzas before the toppings instead of $16.99. I explain to to the man at the register that the coupon was for $16.99 and asked why I was not informed I would not get the entire discount. He claimed that the coupon was 3 years old.  However, there was no expiration date on the coupon so it should have been honored no matter how old it was. And to top it off the pizza was average at best. I worked at a pizza place for 6 years and know how to deal with customers and these people have no clue. I will never order from this place again, especially with the number of great pizza places in Naperville.

Fantastic thin crust.  

I almost always get the sausage/onion or Sausage/Green Pepper

Very glad this place is here.  Coming from Franklin Park, I was nervous about Naperville's quality of pizza

DO NOT confuse this place with the weak-ass Rosatis on Ogden near Eola.  Different ownership group and the one on 95th is wildly better

As soon as I stepped it I felt like the people that worked there care about my experience and pizza. I ordered pick-up and it was right as they took it out of the oven. They even showed it to me and I was amazed. My family really loved the pizza. The best Rosati's by far.

I would like to give you a review of the Pizza, problem is they never delivered it!

Warning: Do not order on line, it apparently doesn't work
Warning 2: Don't trust the Order taker who tells you the pizza will be there in a couple minuets when you have already been waiting an hour
Warning 3: Don't try to talk to the Manager, who tries to play stupid about your order, which for him, probably wasn't too much of a streatch!

Placed order online at 7:04 with email confirmation.  Called at 7:58 to find out what was going on with the order, the girl who answered said she "just checked and it will be there any minute" .....apparently not any minute in the near future.

Called back at 8:15 Spoke to the manager who said they never received my order, I stated why was I then lied to about 15 minutes ago...silence.....silence. 

At that point I hung up and will NEVER order from this place again.  Fortunately there are a lot options and Rosati's will never be one of them.

Lesson Learned:  Call them if you want to play your order and then cross your fingers that you don't get the Incompetent employees I had to deal with and just maybe you will get your oder

In this day and age where customer service goes out the window Nick at Rosati's Pizza is my knight in shining polyester armor today!  

While hoards of angry teenagers grumble about empty stomachs I rushed through an order on GrubHub anxious to stop the madness.  Ribs?  Check.  Fries?  Check.  Pizza?  Check?  Fried cauliflower?  Oh yes!!  Up pops a coupon for a free appetizer.  Yum.  Fatty in me says add mozzerella sticks.  Coupon says add free app in special instructions.  Easy enough.  Under mozzerella sticks I write free app.  Click and send!  Doh!!  Special instructions FOR the entire order!!  I just charged myself an extra 5 bucks.  Great....  

Minutes later Nick of Rosati's Pizza on 95th has resolved my issue.  Driver will come, cash in hand, with the funds to reimburse me.  Sweet.  Problem solved and now that we are suburban yuppies I will rely on Rosati's to get me out of these spur of the moment sleepover nights/starving children problem in a jif.  

Thank you Nick!

Kindest people I've dealt with. They screwed up my order and gave me a new one. I was surprised I didn't have to put up a fight. Not only the best pizza but I'm glad they have good people behind the business. I'm already a loyal customer and will Definitely will continue to be. Thumbs up!
Great pizza but don't bother ordering from them on the web.  They charge you $1.25 extra just for doing that -- never heard of such nonsense before.
Love this place, always been a fan of Rosati's. Tends to be our go-to thin crust pizza place (when it's open). Sausage and mushroom is a great combo!
I love this place... The pizzas are amazing and the service is wonderful. I will definitely come here again.

Taste in decline but customer service is up. An year back they were rocking with newly remodeled place and great tasting fresh curries but no more. The food has become so bad that i have decided not to go there again. One positive thing is that they are providing much better customer service. 

My advice to them - u fit in that "Fast Indian Food" category where we dont have much competition in Naperville....get ur old cook back and capture the market before customers go away elsewhere

Decent place...renovation has been done well

Rava Dosa was good .they can do better than serving cold chutneys from the refrigerator ...

Will try more dishes in near future

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE! The staff doesn't know items they have. They mess up with your orders. Double check your order. I had same experience for the second time. And the manager is RUDE! BIG NO NO TO THIS PLACE!!!!!

Nasty and disgusting!  Flies all over, incompetent staff, and the bathroom didn't even have toilet paper!  Gross, I ended up trowing my food out, after seeing their hygiene, I decided it's best if I don't eat here.  Pass this place by!

I like the food but the service is the worst i have ever seen in any restaurant. As if they give the food for free. I don't know about the min credit card policy they have, i ordered over the phone for an item which was less than the min credit card value. When i gave my credit card card he asked me for cash and he behaved as of he is giving for free.

This place has completely changed!! Inviting decor, no more open kitchen, no more smelly interiors and great food!!

Seems like there has been a management change or something- they just shut down one fine day, no warnings or no communication- at least that's what most people I talked to, said. Then they reopened one fine day and viola, what a change in the appearance. 

The food remains good even now. The veg biryani is wife's fav! My kid likes the set dosas and chole bhature. We have tried their pastries and they are really good. I really liked the paneer chilly I had yesterday.. 

On the flip side, the front desk can be managed so much better. The guy is doing a good job, but needs to build a connection with the customers so they ll wanna come back and feel they are getting personalized service. Friday evening was a mess.. Too crowded and long wait times for the orders. Also the veggie puffs were really a disappointment.

But overall, some really good items in the menu. Will keep on trying the rest of the veg menu.

Order anything in meat and it comes swimming in OIL! Appetizers are cold making me think it's all been frozen for weeks. I also had pepper fry goat which was full of only bones and undercooked meat.
UNHEALTHY, TASTELESS AND A RIP OFF

VEGETARIANS PLEASE BEWARE

If you are ordering togo, please spend the extra 2 mins to check the surprise you have in the bag. I ordered a Paneer tikka masala but they gave me Chicken tikka masala. When I called them, the chef was acting ignorant. 

I told him that I would never ever go to any of his 3 restaurants in Chicago area.

Super slow service. Be prepared to wait for at least 20min for a simple dish as Masala dosa even if half of the restaurant is empty. 

This has happened twice that I have been to this restaurant , it seems that they have only one person working in the kitchen even on weekends.

Bad food. Long wait times. Staff seems to dazed with limited idea of what's going on.

Not sure why this place is still open.

Good and taste wise I would rate it 7.5/10
Now speaking about customer service wise... I wish we could give -100, I know I'm being too harsh! But for customer service I would give them 1/10.  
FYI - just be prepared to spend good amount of time to get your food! More like 30mins plus..

Food is excellent. Which is why they get two stars. 

They really need to learn a faster process at this location...something is not right. Me and this other kid waited there for 40 min for a takeout order. My order was very simple-one small chicken curry & 1 small chicken kabob. We must have watched 4-5 families come in and order long after us and get their food(which were all high orders)eat it, and leave before my food was up. 

I still just don't understand that.

This place is still there surprisingly 
Service is beyond HORRIBLE!! 
Dosa takes 30 mins min and takes several reminders

Second visit here in a single month. The Ceylon paratha with mixed veggie korma in coconut curry  from first month pushed me to give it a second visit.
The four stars from previous visit is pushing me to give two stars this time else just one. 
It's 1 pm, the prime lunch time. The tables are unwiped, open cans for used dishes overflowing, vinegar bottle on table are sealed, news journals and magazines lying on floor. 
I finished my average tasting rava masala dosa forcefully. And the last bite introduces a tiny hair in the sambhar.
Disappointed by the below average quality of our other items - egg puff, papdi chat and chicken lollipop too. 

First impression was a wrong impression.

Very unprofessional customer service. Guy who takes phone orders has no phone etiquittes or customer service skills. Will bring the business tumbling down. Food taste, quality and quantity have gone south. Will not order any more food from there. Many of my friends already have this restaurant on banned list.
They've definitely gotten better so I'd recommend you go there now. I like their noodles and chicken lollipops but have been happy with everything I've gotten there so far.

Chicken Tikka massala was wonderful. Butter Naan was equally outstanding. All for $10, which is pretty reasonable. Other reviewers have complained about wait times. I waited about ten minutes but there was only one other order ahead of me during a weekday lunch. I will certainly be back.

Very poor food and service. .go there only at your own risk. Ordered a vegetable jaipuri - which turned out to be a Poor tasting dish with  cabbage (!!!???),carrot and corn.  On  raising the complaint the staff was unapologetic and nonchalant.  If there was an option for 0 star review, I would have happily rated it as such !!

Just hard to imagine some body trying to sell Vada, Dosa without Coconut Chutney  The guy who took the order probably didn't even give a thought about how any other combination would not be any good and didn't tell us that they ran out of coconut chutney. Good part is they agreed to cancel the order, yet to get the refund though - blame it on the system  Suggestion to the owners - if you really care please have people trained on the authentic combinations on native dishes or atleast tell the customers that you ran out of it.

The first time I ordered the lamb biriyani here it was amazing!  That was on a Tuesday about 6:30pm.   On Friday at 6:30pm I ordered the same dish.   It was disgusting and I am proud of my digestive system for being able to handle it.  The meat was hard and chewy and black!!!!   It was old .... And quite frankly I believe it was the same lamb biriyani they had made that Tuesday.  In hind sight I realized that most of the customers here are vegetarian and meat is probably not one of the most popular dishes and therefore not replenished in a steadfast fashion.   No more Hot Bread for me - I will leave it for the vegans of the world.   Stick to what you know best and don't waste your time on meat dishes if you are not going to out forth an honest effort.   Cheat and you will lose.
This place looks closed as of March 14, 2015.  Good riddance.. It was filthy the one and only time I stopped in.  I think hard about one star reviews but yeah this place deserves it.

This pops into my head often enough that I have to ask: What's the deal with the bulk use of styrofoam containers at Indian restaurants? 

It's possible I missed a memo somewhere along the line, but the last I'd heard, styrofoam was a real negative point against the planet. Not that I'm reviewing Hot Breads' conservation efforts or anything, but just in case that's a thing that's important to you, you should know that regardless of your order being dine-in or carry out, your food and drinks will come in about a million different little styrofoam take-out containers.

Anyway, I would love to be reviewing Hot Breads with a higher rating, as the food was good, but I can't ignore the almost flagrantly filthy interior. When I'd first walked in I guess I didn't really look around. I saw a table already eating, there was someone walking out with take-out and I'd made a bee line for the menu board and pastry counter. It wasn't until after the rather difficult ordering process where I needed to find a table for myself and saw that every table was egregiously full of filth. The floors. The seats. The tables. All wet with large puddles, heaps of trays, food chunks everywhere -- it was unforgivably gross. 

I can understand getting busy, but for the level of dirty that everything was, there's no way it could have gone unnoticed by the people working as their counter and kitchen overlook the dining area and it was fairly obvious that the mess had likely been piling up all day. We tried to ask for a rag, but both workers walked away, so we grabbed some napkins, wet them with water from the soda fountain and tried to wipe what truly was a repulsive mess off the table (I honestly think the last table to sit there had a baby that spit up on the table and just left it, and the still pulled up high-chair soaked in rice and another runny, milk-like substance that had been dripping onto the floor could be used as evidence). Truthfully, I kind of wanted to cancel the order right there, but my partner would have been crushed as he'd already fallen in love with the heavenly aroma of delicious Indian food in the air and the pastries looked unlike anything we'd had in an Indian dining establishment before. 

I feel bad to even have to detail this part of the experience, but it's something that I would've appreciated knowing about prior to going in and something I can't in good conscience not mention. I worked in restaurants for 15 years and never saw this level of destruction in a dining room and I don't mean to sound high-and-mighty, but this was a dining experience that could have been a great one, yet was marred by an uncanny level of mess and blind-eye on the employees part. I felt disrespected as a customer that they would allow anyone eat in that environment. //endrant//

The ordering process was extremely difficult and much was lost in translation. My partner and I are pretty familiar with Indian food - he's eaten it several times a week for the past decade and I get a few doses of dosa a month, but the menu was confusing, the man behind the counter spoke extremely fast and with a very thick accent to the point that 60% of what he said couldn't be deciphered. He mentioned a few things and after each of them we just said, 'yes, we'd like an order of that,' and specified that we definitely wanted the veggie uttappam, but he just nodded and didn't write anything down. I didn't feel confident that he actually got our order or listened at all, so I did a repeat of what I thought we ordered, this time he actually did write something, but he didn't write down any of the food I was saying - at that point I just gave up, tacked on a Chai Tea and a mango lassi and sat our asses down (after we wiped our table and chairs). 

Or food came up, and besides the drinks only one thing was recognizable as something we ordered and that was the masala dosa, which was good, but a bit skimpy on filling and while the dosa was made fresh, the filling was hardly even lukewarm. We'd ordered two Indian puff pastries but they gave us two slices of cake instead. At this point I had to interject since the whole reason we'd come in was for a pastry and not what looked like slices of old wedding cake. They took the cake back after a few odd looks and let us order a pastry with a bit of hesitation. It was all very strange. 

The pastry itself was buttery and delicious, but the filling wasn't fresh tasting at all. Our 'poori with chole' was good, although I know that never in any of our ordering conversations was 'poori' an item mentioned or ordered. I did actually really like this dish, but I still think I would've preferred the uttappam that we originally ordered. 

I would consider going back if I'd heard there was a major change in the overall state of the facility because the food was something I'd have again, but otherwise...

Ordered two veg entrees and paid. 10 minutes later they told me they were out. Ordered two more things. After I waited 30+ minutes waiting for my food I noticed how dirty and unkept the place is. Asked for a refund and left. They never refunded me after checking my card bill.
Very bad service with too much waiting time. Taste of the food is not even good. Taste of the food here don't deserve too much wait time. I will never prefer to go this place.

Not a place I recommend ordered a chaat took 40 mins and later when I went and asked for my order they completely forgot the order I placed. Worst possible experience to have... I can't give minus rating here so had to select one ...sucks...

Dont get deceived by the name of the place. Its a Indian restaurant which is not limited to bakery.

I ordered some lamb dish (lamb curry and lamb chettinadu) and chicken(Chicken pepper) starters and I was not at all dissapointed. The lamb curry was spicy and I could feel the taste of India in it.

I also got a fruit cake. It was also nice.The ambiance is certainly not the best but its a good place to relax and have some home food.
Food took forever...and I'm not kidding...it took an hour to give a order of 2 entres!! Horrendous!! And after 45 they told us one of entres is not even available. Stay away!!!

Generally speaking, I hate to write a negative review, but my experience there very very very bad. I would not recommend sitting there to eat...the place was filthy....I'm surprised the health dept hasn't shut this place down. 
I usually go there to pick a bakery/dessert item, to go. But I called ahead and placed an order over the phone, and I stated, when will the food to ready and I was told 15-20. I said, I will be there in 25 mins and the guy stated, 'no problem.' I got exactly 25 mins later and my order was no where to be found. The guy told me its being 'wrapped' in the back...about another 15 mins later, I'm being told, they accidentally made it extra spicy and they are remaking my order. Then they proceed to ask me about my order all again...this tells me they never made my food to begin with...so now it's 40 mins since I placed the order and I asked the guy, what's going on and his response was, just relax...WHAT!!!! Your telling me to relax. As he is making it, he requests me to, pay first, so in case he gets busy, I can just grab the food and go. I said, 'no'! His response, "you don't trust me?" So I proceed to pay via credit card and he tells me his machine is down & demands, CASH ONLY. I stated, make me my food, I will inspect it and I will pay you. Ok my food is done and he tells me, $18.50. I was puzzled, everything I ordered adds up to $14 plus add some tax. He stated, food plus tax plus tip is $18.50.  I stated you earn tips. I paid $16. 

I will give you 2 stars for good food...but everything else was subpar.

Hopeless customer service. The restaurant is unclean. Better take to-go. Had masala dosa the first time I went and chicken biryani the next. Potato masal was was below average. Oily dosa. Chicken biryani was good though. Thats why it got 3 star from me else it would have been 2.5.
Amazing Special Chicken Briyani which is topped with Chicken 65. So yummy!  Excellent chai.

The food is generally good.
Service is very bad. 
I have ordered Biryani which is delivered to them from other location. I have ordered take out Biryani and it took more than 30 min for the staff to pack it in the styrofoam box.
When I peeked in, I found the delivery guy and another staffer eating their lunch with hands all over the food they are serving guests.
It was SOOO Gross...
I just walked.
It will be nice if they maintain hygenity and be little service oriented.

Pastries are good. Chicken 65 is good. Chicken special briyani used to be good not any more... Now everything taste blend here. It use to be my frequent destination for spl. chicken briyani and now I no longer go to this place. It is not clean and the food except cake is not good at all. My recommendation is only for cake and chat items no food/carryout.

Good - Cake, puffs and chat items
Bad - Everything else.

Items on the menu and the price looks very attractive but you get what you pay.

Biryani is not even worth it. Just a mix of colored rice and whatever meat you choose.
Rest of the items we tried were also below par. 

Not worth it.

I wish I could review this twice - one for their bakery section and one for the Indian restaurant that they also run from the same space. If I could - I'd give the bakery 4 and the restaurant a 3, here's why -

Bakery - The pineapple pastry is just too good and other pastries are also always fresh and good. Their biscuits and cakes are also worth trying. 

Restaurant - As far as the Indian restaurant is concerned, this is your classic biryani takeaway joint that can be trusted for that ultra-spicy Hyderabadi biryani taste and a fast-food version of chicken 65. The other stuff is fine too but I'd only try the other things if I am too lazy to go elsewhere for them and would rather get my entire fix of Indian takeaway from one joint.

The reason why I still go here is the fact that's its an all-day place and though the seating is pretty limited, it does the job when you're late for lunch and too early for dinner after catching that afternoon flick at the theater close by.

This place is managed very unprofessionally and perennially understaffed. Good luck if you get what you are looking for. If the place is busy, they cannot manage the order sequence. If you show some dissatisfaction, then the staff is outright rude. These guys are rogue. Your best bet is when the place is empty to get some decent and respected service. Their Schaumburg branch is well managed. The south indian dishes are good. But I dont agree on the ratings given to them for Biryani. I too am a big Biryani fan. But their Biryani is no match to Paradise Biryani in Schaumburg.

I found the food to be pretty good for a "fast food" kind of spot.  Very spicy and fresh.  Generous portions - we could have ordered half what we did and it would have been enough.  Very small and quirky - piles of stuff around the walls and tables and the floor not very clean.  But good for a quick South Indian fix.
Small restaurant for Indian food, mostly takeout. Love the chicken special biryani here. Pastries are good but nothing to brag about.

I was eager to check this place out.

I asked for some Chilli Chicken or some of the other Chicken dishes -- Chicken 65, etc. 

And at 4:30pm on a Wednesday afternoon, they had none. They weren't planning on cooking any either & they close at 10p. 

They had some lamb dishes @ $6.99. So instead of trying the lamb, I just picked a few pastry items with veggies & curry chicken for $2.00 a piece & left.

I believe this may be a Bakery (as stated). They cater to orders & have fresh curries, etc for lunch, but rarely for dinner or late afternoon.

Have any of you folks seen the same experience or dishes running out?

Hot Breads is a hidden gem!  They have a lot of the stuffed Indian pastries that are good, but the star is the special chicken biryani.  The normal chicken biryani is quite good here, and the special is the same thing with some tandoori chicken pieces added.  It's mouth-watering good.  However, I need to warn you.  If you are a card-carrying member of the clean plate club like myself, you'll pay for it later.  If you finish this dish, you may as well just go home and pass out, you're useless.  I've now learned to immediately take half of the food off my plate and put it in a to go box (make sure to get some sauce to take home also).

Very good takeout place for Hyderabadi dum biryani. I am a big fan for their Biryani and order a takeout mostly. The place has a limited seating space. They have eggless cakes for people with egg allergy or vegetarian folks. The price is right and quantity is good.

I've been there just once and had their Veg Puffs, and they were truly sub-standard. They were just rolls of yesterday's leftover veggies baked in oily puff pastries.
Service was friendly, though.

So my husband and I have been wanting to try this place for a while now and we finally decided to yesterday and honestly I must admit it wasn't what we expected it to be. We both ordered masala dosas and though the dosa tasted fresh and crisp the masala inside was tasted very bland and flavorless as well as the white coconut chutney.  The sambar and red coconut chutney weren't too bad. Not sure if we would go back again ..if we did maybe we would try something else..but for now our favorite masala dosa spot in the neighborhood would definitely be Chutneys on Brookdale Rd.

I LOVE Hot Breads!  It's a bakery, but I go for the delicious southern Indian cuisine.  It's super casual and only has a few tables, so I usual get take out.  The chole is the best and the dosa., yummy!  I crave southern Indian food sometimes, not the North Indian stuff that's much easier to come by, and this place hits the spot.  Don't let the appearance fool you, it's delicious food, I've never even had the baked goods!

If you crave Indian food on a regular basis, like me, then this should be one of your stops.   This is not a buffet place.  Its a bakery.  But what I love is that it is perfect for a small Indian lunch.  A savory pastry and a masala tea and you are set.  You got your Indian fix without pigging out and without spending too much.   And then you can grab another yummy treat to take home with you.

Anyone looking for that spicy, hot chicken briyani should seriously visit this place! I love love Hot breads special chicken briyani..the spiciness of chilli chicken blended with the spices of briyani makes it a unique flavor! Those who are immune to spiciness should definitely try this...well, if you are a person who cannot tolerate spicy foods...warning stay away from this briyani :)

They have excellent customer service too!!

Went there for the first time. Excellent service and great food. I was really surprised about the prices which is very reasonable. Their Dosas and Uthappams are awesome. Will certainly visit them more frequently.
Great place for a special chicken biryani!!!
Good Biryani, chicken and mutton dishes pick up point. Seating in not great. Tastes very good if you like spicy food.

Extremely Rude Service! The restaurant waiter started yelling at me in front of my baby. I simply asked him to taste the sambhar and he said "I cannot allow you to taste it and you need to get out!" After simply asking why, he started screeming at me and he was out of control. I asked him to call the manager or the owner and he refused to call anybody, told me that I need to get out and I was not allowed to eat in the restaurant. Then he said that people like me are not invited in the restaurant and I should have not dared to come into the restaurant!
Have never had another bad experience and have continued to eat here! pick up is definitely the way to go though!

I love this place. An absolute gem in Wheaton. Their food is consistently very good. I've never had a bad dish there. But one of my favorite parts is going to get the food. The entire family is there (after school), helping out around the restaurant. It's awesome.

Opt for carry out or delivery. Only two tables and it can get very crowded at certain times of day with people waiting in line to pick up their orders.

Trust me. Check it out.

You gotta love a Chinese joint where you're called "my friend." You are greeted with "What can I get for you, my friend?" and when leaving you hear "thank you my friend, have a nice day." China Star, you are indeed my friend. Especially when I'm hungover.I don't know what it is about Chinese food, but it is my instant hangover cure. Seriously. I've eaten everything under the sun sworn to "cure" a hangover to no avail. Enter China Star. All I need is an order of their chicken fried rice and an hour later, I'm golden. But, I do love this place no matter how I'm feeling.

This isn't a fancy sit-down-and-eat place. They do have a few tables but one of them seems to serve as a "desk" for the owners' young children, who are adorable by the way. Sometimes they will even assist customers, grabbing a can of pop or extra sauces. Speaking of which, if you love fiery flavor, ask them for a side of the hot pepper oil. Seriously. That stuff is incredible, and a little bit goes a long way.

One of my favorite dishes here is the Pepper Tomato Chicken (or maybe it's Tomato Pepper Chicken- I tend to be dyslexic at times). It's exactly like Beef Pepper Steak at most Chinese joints, only with chicken. 

As Dan B. mentioned, the steamed dumplings are quite fantastic. The sauce served with them really brings out the flavor of the meat inside. Another favorite are the fried scallops (I'm not sure if they still have them or not- I didn't order any on my last visit). They also have a few sushi items on their menu, however I haven't given those a try and most likely won't, as I'm particular about my sushi. 

The best part about China Star is the food portions are enormous, and it's cheap. They will charge you a small fee though if you use a credit/debit card for purchases under $10, or thereabouts. 

I no longer live in the immediate area, so I don't get to enjoy China Star as much as I'd like. I've tried multiple Chinese food restaurants in the area, and nothing compares to China Star. Hands down, it's the best Chinese Food in Wheaton.

Stopped for the first time after a long day which included taking a family member to the hospital. Got there at 10:10pm, and didn't realize they were closed until I walked up to the door. But the owner ran over and opened the door. I said "That's ok, I didn't know you were closed", but he said they were open, and took my order. They were all very friendly, and even asked me if I had a long day. I must have looked tired. Anyway, the food was delicious. I love Chinese food, and I tend to judge Chinese restaurants not only by the main dish, but by things like good broccoli, good fried rice, and good egg rolls. And they were all great! Not to mention the big portions. The friendly family owners were just the icing on the cake.  I will definitely be back.
Edit: went back a couple more times in the following week, all good!  It's my new go-to place, even though it's a bit out of the way.  It's worth it.

I love this place for Chinese. I think it has the best Chinese in the area and the prices are reasonable. It's not a restaurant where you sit in its more I take out place. What else I really like about it is that it's all family run. Even the kids help their parents out. It's really nice to see a family working together. I feel good after I go there because I know they all work so hard and I like to give them my business.

The owners of this restaurant are so, so friendly, and there are always a few adorable children hanging out watching tv, doing homework, and (once) riding a tricycle around the waiting area. They do have a couple of tables, but it's primarily a takeout place.

My two qualms: I've noticed that their shrimp is not usually clean (you know what I'm talking about here, right?), so I've stopped ordering it. Also, with some of the breaded and fried chicken dishes like sesame or general's, there is too much crusty breading and not enough meat. However, the chicken in the sweet and sour chicken always seems fresh and delicious, so I'm not sure what's up with that. I don't know enough about the preparation to know if these dishes call for different types of chicken.

Their fried rice is great, especially veggie. My son loves their bean curd (tofu) and veggies, and we like their noddles a lot too. Potstickers are decent, crab rangoon is okay but not the best. 

Portions are generous and prices are reasonable. Whoever answers the phone can always understand me on the first try, a nice bonus. We go there a lot and they often throw a free soda or egg role into our bag. Also, how can you not adore the lady who calls customers "my friend"?

I've been going here for years and have never had a bad experience, the food is great and the staff is very friendly. Yes the restaurant is a dive so don't plan on dining in (there's only 2 tables) but get over it and enjoy the food!

I tried it before and wasn't crazy about it, I figured I'd give it another go. The chicken was super, super pink. When we called to let them know (we even offered to bring it in so they could see it themselves) the woman said it was supposed to be pink and wouldn't hear us out that we were concerned. Um...what? Last time I checked chicken isn't supposed to be pink?! So, ended up paying almost $20 for pink sesame chicken and unflavored noodles .__. (at least the delivery driver was nice!)

This place is a hidden GEM! Best prices and amazing food! I'm pretty picky when it comes to Chinese food, but this place is great. A must try is their pan fried dumplings, these are handmade not the ones you can buy frozen at Jewel, and have great taste. Their pork friend rice may be my favorite fried rice dish. Their traditional Chinese food is very good and their more Americanized dishes are good too. Best Chinese food under $30 for 2 in Chicago

Let me start out with we are in here probably 2 times a week.  

The service is awesome.  Sometimes you can't understand them on the phone but they understand you just fine and food always comes out right.  We have been trying to find something that we don't like as if its a challenge.  But we just can't.  They have an enormous menu.  Back to the service, it is family owned and operated yes the kids help out there.  They are always polite and everything is my friend.  They remember us and always add in the extras that we like.  Their Orange Chicken is awesome. Oh and if your a value oriented diner this place is for you.  You get two meals out of one of their combinations.
Perfect place to get Chinese food!

Good example of "don't judge a book by its cover."  This is small and somewhat run down little restaurant on busy Roosevelt Road in Wheaton.  I suggest you carry out since they only have two tables and it's pretty crowded in the main room with supplies and a bunch of other random stuff that looks like it needs a home some place else.

That said, this is a fantastic option for Americanized Chinese food in the Western burbs.  Large portions and the quality is above what I've found elsewhere.  They use all white meat chicken (I dissected a couple of pieces, yep I did too) and they aren't stingy with the other ingredients.

The combo fried rice was fresh tasting and and sported large pieces of chicken and shrimp, etc.  I also tried the Spring rolls. The orange chicken my daughter had some of the largest and juciest pieces of chicken I've ever seen in this dish (hate this dish by the way, who thought up this bizzaro concotion of flavors?!)  The spring rolls were good but I've had better yet still for the price and freshness, I give them a thumbs up.

This is a family run place so cherish it for what it is.  Yes, children of the owners were there but I found it endearing.

Bottom line, place could use a good clearing out and cleaning but the food was an incredible value, was hot and fresh and did I say huge portions.  And, Dan the hot dog man loves it too so you can't wrong!
Dependable, tasty take-out standard Cantonese food, right in the neighborhood! I call ahead on my way home. Friendly folks, too.

I had a great experience with the China star in Wheaton illinois. My only problem is that they were not clear about the amount of food. There was way too much. Also I was not able to substitute dumplings for crab rangoons which made me sad. Otherwise delicious and nice people.

This place is amazing. Yes, I agree the outside or inside doesn't look like much but the food is incredible and they are some of the nicest people you will ever meet. My family and I have been living in the Wheaton area for 6 years and we have NEVER gone anywhere else for Chinese food! If you look past the look of this place, I promise you will not be disappointed... we have basically had everything on the menu!

If I could give them 4 1/2 stars, I would, but since that's not an option - they get five since we like them! They are always very polite, super quick, and food is good and consistent. I wouldn't say it's "knock your socks off" food, but it's always good, and that doesn't vary. We have both picked up the food, and had it delivered. As others have mentioned, it's a whole family affair. The kids are cute and help out. I once even had a kid go with on a delivery order for us and came up to the door with (I think) her dad! We live pretty close, but delivery has never taken more than 25 or so minutes from time of ordering. We usually get two or three large dishes to share, and that's more than enough food for my husband and I to have several meals with. They typically throw in a few egg rolls for free too! We order fairly regularly, and don't have any reason to stop.

Ordered sechuan chicken, what a mistake. Rubbery, did not look or taste like chicken..  greasy, no flavor and not hot/spicy. Also got chicken fried rice which was old, tasteless, and bland. The only good thing was the white rice.  Will not be returning.

I love their fried dumplings, but everything else hasn't quite met my expectations. In all fairness I previously went to a particular Chinese restaurant for 14 years before I moved,  so I'm a little biased. Prices are good though. My husband likes their General Tso's and their fried rice isn't too bad,  so I'm willing to keep trying new things at China Star.

Great neighborhood Chinese restaurant! The portions are generous and the pricing is great. When you pick up your order you are handed a free can of coke - the number of cokes seems to vary... I think it may be for every $10 you spend? This place is run by a great friendly hardworking family. Occasionally you may see the son helping at the register or answering phones and the little girl coloring in a corner with a grandmother. 

I am a big fan of the pork fried rice. The box comes FULL of meat and packed, overflowing as soon as it is opened. *Warning Mom, there are peas in the fried rice! 

The Crab Rangoon has a super sweet filling. 
The steamed dumplings have a sausage-like filling.
Fast food quality, slow service. They say 10 minutes every time I call ahead but when I arrive it's another 10 minutes. Take your time getting there
Absolutely great food. Made as ordered.  Very friendly service. They add freebies on larger orders.

Sometimes the best food isn't found at a fancy sit-down restaurant, a lot of times it's found in small little "hole in the wall" type eateries. And with China Star located off of Roosevelt Road in Wheaton this is definitely the case. China Star is a tiny little take-out place with a few tables set up for dining in if you're so inclined.

I've had a fairly diverse set of offerings from China Star over the years and I figured I'd cover the basics. They have both regular menu items, and if you order around lunch time less expensive "lunch specials" that include various entrees, rice, an egg roll and a fortune cookie. If it's lunchtime and you're not planning to bring food home and share it with others then the lunch special is definitely the way to go as it provides plenty of food for any one individual to eat. The lunch specials are generally inexpensive (around 6.00) so the value here is tremendous.  

 First off is the General Tso's chicken served here. It usually comes with broccoli and rice. The chicken they use is well cooked pre-breaded chicken with a very thick and decadent general tso sauce. While others have expressed their complaint that this is a bit too spicy for their tastes, I find it to be the perfect blend of sweet and hot having just the ring tangy flavor in the sauce to even out the flavor.

Next off are the pot stickers also known as steamed dumplings. The one's served here at China Star are the best I've come across. A tasty sausage like meat is inside of a soft breading. These are absolutely fantastic and are as good as the entree itself. I've also had a variety of other dishes and appetizers including crab rangoon, and other chicken dishes all of which I've enjoyed but the General Tso's and pot stickers are definitely my two favorite dishes here.

Overall China Star is my favorite "hole in the wall" Chinese restaurant. The quality of the food here is excellent and the prices are low. If you're in the mood for Chinese takeout I highly recommend it.
The place may be an eye sore but the food is good and you get a lot of it. For 10 bucks I have 2-3 meals

Food's is generally Ok. However tonight Mongolian Beef was hideous. About 90% of the dish was sauted onions and the rest beef. Onions just overpowered flavor. I had to throw it away. It was uneatable.  Come on. You can do better than this

I ordered from here for the first time and it was excellent! The food was awesome and it was extremely fast delivery! It was kind of a big order and they threw in extra food for our group! Our delivery guy was so nice! I would say it was a great experience over all and I would highly recommend it!

The China Star is second to none in the western suburbs...especially when it comes to Chinese food. I love this place. Truly. And I've have never had a bad experience. Most delicious dishes made with love that are served hot and fresh every time. Sweet and sour chicken is my jam. And their approach to customer service is fantastic - full team effort all around. If you're jonesing for Chinese, this is your joint - no doubt!

It's not the best but definitely the second best in the area. The food is good and fresh and they give you MASSIVE portions. Like, leftovers for 3 days. The owners are so incredibly friendly and want to please each customer. They do a great job of that. I wish their food wasn't quite as greasy but it's still good.
We've been eating here for years, and we love it. You get a TON of food! The staff is really friendly, and they even remember us. Great for take out, but too small for dine in.

Can't beat the food and price value of it!

This place makes me almost as happy as seeing LeBron and all his championship rings!!  This is my go to place when it comes to take out, quick Chinese, casual meals, and even some catering needs.

The food here is pretty good, but let's not go in with the expectation of some sit down restaurant.  It's Chinese take out and so long as you keep that in mind you'll get what you want, and it's pretty darn good.  So the food... it's Americanized Chinese, and it's take out, so stick to the main dishes and I'd steer away from the sushi.  A dinner portion (about 9 bucks) can probably feed two.  It's sometimes a bit heavy on the sauce, but it's expected.  When it comes to soups, I'd go wonton here over the hot and sour.  All in all, it's good stuff and you can't find anything close when it comes to value.

The venue and service.  It's a take out place so unless absolutely necessary, there's no need to eat in there.  There's two tables, and I don't think more than 5 people ever eat in there.  The service is good and they always watch out for the customer.

Overall, I already go here a lot and I'll keep going here so long as the food is good.

China Star is in an unassuming strip mall. It has a couple of tables inside but it seems like nobody eats there. They typically order out. They are your typical grungy cheap Chinese food restaurant. I have had orders of beef with various types of vegetable. The beef came out very tender and the vegetables were decent. You'll pay somewhere between $5-10 per dish depending on the size you order. As long as you keep your expectations low to medium, the food is decent. They do give you a lot of food for the amount you pay for. The shrimp fried rice is so-so. The shrimp they serve is good but it doesn't come seasoned and the rice is kind of bland.

My husband and I have searched for years to find a decent Chinese food restaurant in our neighborhood. We were happy with Jasmine Cafe, the food was delicious, although it did not have delivery. We were sad to see the last time we went that they are closed. 

We ordered China Star II at a work function recently and I was not disappointed. The egg rolls were big and crispy. We ordered the Sesame Chicken and Beef and Broccoli, along with an order of Fried Rice to share among a group of five of us. The portions were great for group sharing and we even had some leftovers (which were just as delicious reheated!)

The only reason I do not give this a five star rating is because of the crab rangoon. It was way too sweet and not crispy enough for my taste. It may have been suitable as a dessert, but too overpowering to eat more than one.

My husband and I are ordering tonight and I am anxious to see if he likes it. i myself am looking forward to some more of that sesame chicken!

It's all right, I guess. I come here often enough when I want fast Chinese take-out.  The portions are large, the food is decent, and it's pretty darn cheap.  They make it very quickly.

The owner's two children are usually helping, and they're relatively entertaining tykes who will beat each other up if one wants to give you the receipt and the other one thinks he should be the one doing the job.  I'm talking kicks and everything.

The dining room is not really that.  It's got two tables, and the waiting area is small and rather grubby.  But most people get the take-out.

There's a good lunch menu with smaller, cheaper portions.

All in all, it has good food in low-price, large-portions.  Worth going to just for that.

my wife and I have been eating here for years, I think the ownership has changed (or maybe just the staff?) over the years, but the food has remained consistently good, with large portions, and low prices.  The General Tso's, Orange Beef, Mongolian Beef, and Crab Rangoon are all favorites of ours.

I'm absolutely amazed. For the 60 seconds I was in for a pickup order I can't recall having a better experience or impression in a while. This is a family owned business, VERY friendly and welcoming as you walk in and you're left feeling appreciated. I'll be honest that the crab rangoon wasn't my favorite, but it's definitely worth the $4 and I'd order it again. (Edit: Prior to posting this review I microwaved them and they were pretty good at 4:30 AM!).

First of all i do like the little family that runs the place... kids are too cute ... the first few times i went there  , the food was amazing...then it was very good, now , it depends i guess on who is cooking , it can be hit or miss..their white rice is the best i have ever had  ..prices cannot be beat , so i will go back from time to time ...  plus it is 3 minutes from my house
One of the hundreds of Chinese takeout joints in the area well at least 20 or so. Menus are all similar to each other but overall one of my favorite cheap Chinese takeout joints in the area.
As good as American-Chinese takeout can be.  Fast delivery, big potions, good service.  I love this place.

Been back here a few times since my first review, and I'd like to add that actually, they claim they don't use any MSG in their cooking, so my last review was somewhat inaccurate. However, I am pleased to report that subsequent visits have not disappointed, in either portion size, or consistent quality. The Hot & Spicy Chicken - yum, but very spicy. =)

Food is good, but way to much of it, it's almost a turnoff because of the huge amount that they give you, but I guess if you don't mind having leftover fried rice for two days and then throwing the rest out its o.k. They are very fast and friendly.

Delicious reasonably priced food, great service and comfortable booths. Our new go to spot

I noticed the owner? Manager? Was very attentive and active walking around and making sure people liked their food and experience, always a good sign.

Will be back

This is a very popular restaurant and I can see why. The staff is super friendly. The food is tasty with very generous portions. I asked for thin and crispy potato pancakes and they came thru!  We're definitely coming back!

Great home cooking, tons of food at a decent price, and excellent customer service. Went for the first time around 10:00am on a Saturday after seeing some good reviews online. No wait and we were seated right away. The place is a little on the dirty side but is nicely decorated. Our orders were taken shortly after we were seated, and we got water almost immediately. This place is not interested in helping you count calories, they pile food in front of you. This place has the most moist and buttery biscuits in their biscuits and gravy, it is a must try. Their crepes were really good too, I got the dessert crepes. The waitress warned me that it was a lot of toppings, and she was right(see picture) but everything went together nicely. Just wish it was fresh fruit instead of processed. No real complaints, we got 4 large plates of food for under $30. Will be back. :)

The wait staff are very pleasant. If getting a booth, get a window seat- the tables are adjustable. Our waitress was very attentive, but not overbearing. The food was good. I was not pleased with the front of house nor the booths, however, and are why I don't think this place is for me, and won't be bringing my family back. If pressed, would only do takeout.
Place seemed busy when passing it on the way to work, so figured I'd try it on a day off. Very cramped inside. Couldn't fit my party of three and 2 other small families in front of the register/checkin without completely blocking waitresses and the front entrance. While waiting, staff showed familiarity with other people coming in, which was nice, but then proceeded to seat them before us and another family, who showed up earlier. Booths were really small, as in a skinny person noticed how close the fixed table was to them. Our polite waitress noticed this, and moved us to the window, where the tables can adjust. Food was nice, but the booth seats were solid wood, and not ideal to have a relaxing breakfast.

Great value and have been happy with both visits. I was heading to Gray's Mill for lunch and noticed $6.95 lunch specials and $6.45 qts of homemade soup. Unfortunately or perhaps fortunately South Moon at Gray's Mill was closed until tomorrow. 

So heading back home took me here for a gyro, fries and soup just $7.95. I upgraded to onion rings for $1 more, worth it too. They put red onions on their gyros, which were a little over powering... I'll need a tic-tac or three.

Tana was my server and was very fun hearted. I look forward to another breakfast soon too. Can't believe how long it's been between my visits. 

I got soup to go and might need to go to a 5 star, if it's as good as they claim. Homemade Split Pea and Cream of Chicken on the same day... don't see that often. Also they have Chicken Noodle daily.

I was hungry and not feeling well and had to drive an hour plus into Chicago so when I saw this place I made a uturn and grabbed food right away. It was much better than expected. I ordered the country fried steak and the creamy chicken soup and it was really good! I love eating at diners but usually the food quality is about average. This place is better than average and the service was prompt too. The best part was the price for lunch I was able to get a hearty serving of steak, potatoes, veggies, bread, and soup for just under $12. I don't know if I'll ever be in the Aurora area again but if I am I will definitely grabbed another meal from here.
Nice family breakfast and brunch, opens from 7am-3pm, they have breakfast specials starting at $5.95, good coffee and the service is super nice.

Great local breakfast spot!! Friendly service with hot yummy breakfast! They offer a variety of breakfast specials and their coffee is fantastic.
If your in the area and need a great place e to stop...stop here...you won't be disappointed

Went here for a family brunch on Sunday. Great food and good service! We had 3 kids and the food came out very quickly. Service was on point. I had the egg Benedict with fruit. Great portion for the fruit and nice eggs Benedict. The English muffin was great, good portion of hollandaise, salty ham...very tasty!

Tried this place last week because it's super conveniently located & we wanted to try something new (we usually default to Pomegranate Cafe).
Overall a great experience. We were seated pretty promptly and comfortably. Orders taken and the food came out JUST in time...the 2 year old was starting to get restless...Quick! Throw some food at her! Everything tasted great. Only regret was that I always forget to ask for my hash browns "well done" when I'm unsure of the restaurants standard. 
Sole critique would probably be that we did wait a bit long, a couple times for drink refills, otherwise it was tasty, affordable & comfortable.

Upon arrival they gave us cold coffee and proceeded to ignore us. We waited 30 minutes and the waitress just stared at us and the manager could not compare this woman to do a job. I will never return to this place.

And for some reason in order to post this review I had to give at least one star. I would have given no stars.

Every Sunday after church we wish we knew of a great neighborhood eatery for breakfast or brunch. 
We had driven by Maxfields probably 100 times but never stopped. I am so happy we took a chance this past Sunday!  We had wonderful breakfast options, portions, prices, service and the taste was so great! Not like the standard chains... Our server Rhonda was very welcoming and attentive. You can tell she takes great pride in the product and company as well as the joy she finds through providing midwest hospitality!

Of all the local breakfast places, Maxfields has the best food for the best price. I've been here a dozen times with my husband, and we frequently bring friends and family to join us. No complaints, only compliments! Gyro and eggs is my go-to!

I went to this restaurant with my family and a few friends after spending several hours at a fall festival at a nearby garden nursery.

We were all hungry, and Maxfields looked like it would hit the spot with some comfort food. 

I'll start off with the positives:

- It had a cozy atmosphere. This restaurant reminded me of your neighborhood diner people congregate at on Sunday mornings.

- The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

- The prices were extremely reasonable and the portions decent. You're not going to break the bank eating at Maxfields.

Now the bad part:

I ordered a roast beef wrap with french fries. The roast beef just didn't taste right (I can't put my finger on it). Further, it was soggy. I ate about 3/4 of the first wrap and called it a day. I ate the rest of my french fries - which were good.

I also ordered cream of chicken soup. Normally, the soup comes out before the main course. Maxfields wasn't any different. The problem was that about a minute after the soup came out, my roast beef wrap was served. On the plus side, the soup was good. I just wish I had more time to eat it.

My family and friends who were with me seemed to enjoy their food. I don't remember them complaining about anything.

I really wish Yelp offered a 2.5 star option. I'd happily give Maxfields 2.5 stars. 

If I ever go back to Maxfields I will order something else and update this review accordingly. I'm always willing to give a business a second chance.
I always enjoy the gyro two eggs and French toast :) always on point and I enjoy it fast service

This place was great! I live close by but never went to it out of habit of going to Blueberry Hill nearby...but not anymore! This place has better quality food (Blueberry Hill has slowly been slipping) and a great breakfast selection. Our waitress was funny and attentive and I never had to ask for a coffee refill because she was always there with a topper:) More people need to discover this little breakfast jem! Will definitely be going back.

Wow, what a wonderful place! Some may feel the outside seems dated, but the sweet paintings on the window shows the charm to come as you enter. The place was hopping but the pace of the meal was perfect. Our server, Rhonda, was a delight and the food was hot and delicious. Not to mention well priced. Definitely a place to frequent! Glad we found this diamond in the rough.
This is my go to breakfast spot in the area. Great specials. Very friendly service and owner. Awesome food. Love the biscuits and gravy and corned beef has skillet. Great hash and pancakes.

We tried this place a few times because it is very close to us. The food was ok, the coffee was stale and cold.  The hostess at the front was a very friendly younger gal, but the waitresses were not personable at all. They seemed in a bad mood every time. No smiles. We felt rushed and it was not even busy.
Nice neighborhood cafe! Food is pretty good, especially the waffles, an ad service is friendly!
The servers were very helpful. The food was great, and a very reasonable price. Biscuits & Gravy just like home. Definitely coming here again!

My daughter and I go here for breakfast a few times a month. The food is always good, good size portions (we always end up with a to go container), and every one who has waited on us has been great! Just an overall nice place to have a good sit down meal. If you are in the area definitely check this place out.

I've been eating here for nearly three years. It changed owners a while back but I think the food has actually improved. I particularly love their soup. The clam chowder is my favorite. The staff is always very friendly and attentive. The French fries are very well made. This a great spot for a quick, delicious lunch.

I really do enjoy our Saturday afternoon brunches at Maxfields.  I love that when we arrive we are greeted like friends and treated as such.  I love that the food has never disappointed and I can count on consistency.  I'm a make it or break it type of girl and if I'm not happy, I'm not coming back.  I keep coming back. The stuffed pepper soup, the tortilla soup, the pork chop breakfast, the strawberry cheese blintzes, every skillet on the menu, the omelets...always very pleased.  I'm a realist, and I'm looking for really good food, in a welcoming environment, at a reasonable price; I found it and I will continue to patron this wonderful establishment until otherwise.

This place should be on kitchen nightmares...Taste like poor quality food cooked in a home kitchen ...Raise your standards and more customers will come..when someone asks for melted cheese on hash browns you put cheddar not American cheese slices
My husband and I go here often.  The staff is always very friendly and the service is always fast.  You won't wait for anything here!  Very good food.  I would recommend Maxfields to anyone.
Great club sandwich,  delicious hot chicken noodle soup.. Great prices very nice server

Pretty decent family restaurant. Came here for breakfast for the first time with my family. Coffee was good which was a good start. Our server, Jenny,  was very sweet and attentive. She kept the coffee topped off & checked on us often. Everyone's food was delicious, no complaints. Unfortunately It was kind of hot where we were seated & the table was small. Overall, nice restaurant & I would definitely return to try their lunch menu !

What a shame you let your best waitress quit to keep your worst! I won't be back. I only came here to see Jenny! Too bad food was good and some service was good. Bad choice by the owner. For those that know and love her I will be going to Mothers to see her.

I can't say enough good about this place. Been there many times and they never disapoint! The homemade soups are out of this world, get a quart to go for six bucks!! You can customise your order without any problems. everything can be made to go for the office, or on the way home. Staff is friendly. Don't mistake this for the past dumps that were there! diffrent owner with a great attitude. Can't wait until he is open for dinner!!! And the shlup that complained about his hash browns, all you have to do is tell them what kind of cheese you wanted! They are not mind readers!!!! So stop by today and tell your friends....

By far the best Mexican food in the area! The menu is small and there is typically only one man taking orders and cooking, but the wait is worth it as your food is cooked fresh and is delicious every time! Everything my friends and family have tried has been very good. The steak burritos are a favorite. I am a chips and salsa snob and these are crave worthy; fresh, hot, salty, perfection! The guacamole is incredible too; made fresh and with the inclusion of sour cream which is sort of unique. These guys know how to cook and deliver a quality meal every time.

Burrito Place is as downscale of a Mexican restaurant can be for a suburb like Downers Grove, but the food is solid, which is what really matters. My one complaint is that for place which has a definite low-budget vibe and is in an aging strip mall, the prices seem high.

I decided to get a burrito, which I figured was their specialty. The man who took my order (the owner?), quickly began preparing my food. The order of layers in the burrito was pretty standard... refried beans, steak, cheese, tomato and lettuce. I was supremely grateful that they didn't include any rice, ala Chipotle. I consider it a waste of valuable burrito real estate. 

I must say that the burrito was tasty, but at $6.50 was about a dollar more expensive than similar counter service Mexican restaurants in the area with nicer decor. Maybe they could drum up more business if they sold their food at below-market rates. I know I'd come back more often. Still, that burrito was pretty darn good.

I have been giving Burrito Place alot more business lately and sharing my experience with others. I will admit for a small taco shop these 2 guys kill it in the fresh game. I have not had a bad meal here. I have not had a cold or overcooked meal here. I usually dine in cause I enjoy watching the fellas work their kitchen magic. If you speak spanish the cook has some great stories while he is on the grill. I love their food but the stories are just as good too...LOL! 
Their red salsa has a slight garlic kick to it but no big deal once you drizzle it over the tacos.

My suggestions
-3 Steak Tacos with Fries
-Steak Torta with a side of jalapenos and carrots
-Chips & Guacamole
-Burritos

Their milkshakes are REALLY REALLY BIG and one size!!! So you better drink that last. Its delicious!

After hearing some hype about the food here, I gave them a visit. There was only one guy doing it all and only worked 1 order at a time. There were a few in line, so I took a seat and waited to place my order. Owner had no personality and not certain he even speaks english. He brushed off any conversation that wasn't related to my order.

I got a couple tacos to go. When I got home the tacos had been rolled up like a burrito and honestly didn't blow me away. Should have held off on the lettuce. Salsa had no heat and was blah. Perhaps I'll try dining in and get a burrito next time. Certainly not much to their menu and there are better mexican restaurants nearby that are a better value.

I am literally here on a weekly basis. Personally, I think this place serves the best tacos around, not to mention their freshly made chips. Plus the guy who works here is super friendly and even gave me a Spanish lesson once. I walk in now, and he knows who I am. Couldn't ask for a better local place for when I need a taco or two!

- close to home 
- call for pick up, no problem with language 
- super friendly nice guy 
- gives me free chips once in a while cause "he just made!" 
- omg chips, amazing 
- tacos are killer. Like real meat. Huge. 
- Tortas are wonderful 
- ok everything is great 
- my hubby, son, or I go min once a week 
- winner!!!!!!!!

My favorite Mexican in the area! Have been going here for years and can't get enough. The chicken quesadilla is amazing and there salsa is to die for! chips are always warm and salty. Overall excellent food! Would recommend carry-out as there are not a lot of tables. SOOO SOO GOOD!
Fantastic!  A hidden gem. Huge burrito. The jalapeos and carrots are hot!  Definitely a great place for authentic Mexican food.
I love the burritos here- not fancy but very good and clean. Love the fresh salsa and the owner+ people working here are always really friendly you can tell they take pride in this food.

This is a store front taco joint with a limited menu so you won't get an umbrella in your drink here.  They have Taco 's, Burrito's and Tostada's  and not much else except for the best damn tortilla chips I have ever had, the steak taco were pretty good and I would definetly come back here again, especially for those fresh made chips and salsa.

I tried Burrito Place for the first time this weekend with some friends from out of town.

The cook was very efficient and had no problem with our special requests. Just the right amount of cilantro was used in the sauces. Small sides of pickled veggies were included at no extra cost.

Warning- their salsa is HOT; beware if you are not a spicy food person. If you like your salsa tangy- then you will be very happy.

I felt that everything we ordered was tasty and I was able to buy lunch for 4 adults for under $20.

I really like this place. Whenever I go theres only one guy that does everything and he's really nice. Everything is made fresh, cooked to order.  There is even a regular kitchen oven/stove that he uses to prepare food. My favorite is the avocado torta but the vegetable burrito is a close second. The burrito has lots of vegetables like zucchini and broccoli. My boyfriend has had steak tacos and steak burritos and loves them. 

The chips are fantastic. They are fresh, literally right out of the fryer into a paper bag. Like other reviewers mentioned, the salsa is pretty spicy, but I like it. And the horchata is really good. I get it at least once a week. I'm slightly addicted. 

I changed my review from 4 to 5 stars because of how friendly and helpful the guy in there is. He remembers us and even noticed that we walk there, so he packs up the food extra secure for our walk home.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in Downers Grove. Service is great! Their chiles rellenos are out of this world!!! My mouth waters just thinking about them and they're not spicy hot.

I've driven past this place for years and decided to stop in for a steak taco dinner with rice and beans after reading some favorable reviews on here. Big mistake!! When I walked in I was encouraged because even though it's a small place there were people sitting down eating, but that's where the positives end.

First let me say the steak tacos were decent, but the taco sauce (red) tasted like it was out of a can, the rice tasted like the kind that come in the bag that you just add water to and microwave. But the worst part were the refried beans.... They were the driest, thickest and most bland beans I've ever had. Maybe they were having an off day when I went but I won't be back to try it again, there's too many other Mexican joints in the area.

Consistently and successfully producing a high quality product for over 20 years.   Owner/ cook takes your line order and personally cooks authentic Mexican faire. No extra charge to have the small TV turned on ;)  no frills, simply good burritos  and tacos.

We only recently discovered the Burrito Place, but have returned there several times already as it is that good!  My favorite is the vegetarian burrito with fresh avocado.  They cook and prepare everything fresh and to your taste when you order it.  The burritos are large enough to fill up even the biggest appetite and healthy enough to enjoy relatively guilt free.  Served up with a side of peppers, carrots and onions to add as desired they provide meal that keeps me coming back.  Service is always friendly and the prices are tough to beat.
