We get are burrito fix there all the time. Hey it's not 5 star hispanic cusine it's the "Burreto Place" for god's sake! In any case a good burrito.

The real deal, so if you are not ready for authentic Mexican food, prepared as it should be, Taco Bell may be for you. Very small dining area and exceptionally clean kitchen area. If you don't care for onions be sure to tell them "no onions" when you order.
this little place has been around forever. the owner is very kind and can accomodate anything you order. a perfect stop when you want something fast and yummy!

This is my go-to Asian spot in the suburbs. If you dine in, you receive a free pot of hot tea and homemade almond cookies. 

I've been eating here for years and have had a lot of different things they have on the menu. My favorites are potstickers, Mongolian Beef, Cashew Chicken. These are my go-to items at any asian place but Fu Yuan makes them better than anyone else.

The family that owns it are really nice people. From what I can tell, the father cooks and the brother and sister help run the front of the restaurant. They are always polite and I enjoy seeing a family that works so well together for so many years. 

Dine in or carry out - some solid take out and not to be missed.

This place is awesome for a quiet meal. I've gone here and gotten Moo Goo Gai Pan, Chicken Fried Rice, all types of soups, and even Szechuan Pork/Chicken. The Chicken and Broccoli is awesome, too.

They serve hot tea which is awesome when it's freezing and sitting by the door. It's cheap too, which is nice. If you don't need/want a lot of flair, I would go here. Wok N Fire has some Chinese options as does Sushi Mono. Those are pretty pricey, but this is a good choice if you're poor. LIKE ME!

We're new to the area, live right down the block from this restaurant and were hoping it would be good. We were very disappointed. We did take-out on 9/15/16 - beef & broccoli, chicken fried rice and a couple of egg rolls. Very basic stuff. The quality of the ingredients was poor - beef was tough and flavor overall was just not very good. Fried rice was under-cooked and mediocre. I see many positive reviews for this restaurant, giving them high ratings. I don't get it, folks. The food is terrible. (Try Dragon One on Roosevelt in Glen Ellyn - not as convenient to Wheaton customers, but much, much better.)

I'm not familiar with the Korean offerings at Fu Yuan. I know very little about Korean cuisine and the restaurant's menu doesn't translate the Korean dishes into English descriptions. Instead, most of their menu is heavily slanted to American tastes: Sweet n Sour pork, Mongolian beef, Szechwan shrimp, Hot and Sour soup, egg rolls, etc. Judging them along these lines I think it's a great little restaurant.  It's very inexpensive, the food is above average, the dcor good enough and clean. On the down side, the service can be a little manic since the waitress, Chi, rushes terribly as she tries to cover too many bases at once. When they're busy I think this is a real snag. But if you can forgive them for this, it's a great little restaurant with great prices!

I wasn't a fan. :( The noodles were mushy and did not have any flavor. Everything else I had was just kind of flavorless or bland. I was disappointed, I always heard really good things about this place.

Arrived at 540pm. We did receive water and tea right away, never offered any other drinks. Ordered an appetizer that came 50 minutes later, luke warm. Our dishes (from tea and soup and cold app) piled up and had two napkins between five of us. We watched while others seemed to be getting their food. At an hour and fifteen minutes, we decided to leave.  We asked for our food to be put in to go boxes if it was actually being made, if not the bill for what actually came, the soup and cold app. They advised it was almost done, it was not. We should have cancelled it instead of still sitting there with very hungry children and a crying baby. Order to go if you want food from there but don't eat there.

I've only ever got the jajjangmyun and jahm-pong here, and this is definitely the best that you will find in the west suburbs. Fu Yuan also gives you a kimchi side dish before your food comes out and it is delicious. It isn't your typical kimchi side dish but it is always a favorite at the table when I come with friends or family. At the end of the meal they also give you nurungj, which is a tasty snack, and is the first restaurant of its kind that I've seen do this. Overall, I really enjoy the jajjangmyun and jahm-pong here, and will be back.

It is refreshing to see a restaurant with Chinese-Korean food in Downtown Wheaton. Though I admit I've had better, this is a great restaurant to dine in.

I came on a Tuesday night and there was plenty of seating. The servers were courteous and attentive, and got our orders in quickly. The food did take a good amount of time to come out, but it wasn't anything to complain about. 

The food was on point and fulfilled the cravings that I had for this style of cuisine. The tangsuyuk (sweet and sour beef) was crispy and held quality flavors. The overall taste of the jajangmyeon (black bean noodles) that I ordered was a bit bland, but very satisfying. I cleaned out all of my plates and bowls, and felt good about it.

With a reasonable price and food that gave me a taste of home in California, Fu Yuan is a restaurant that I would definitely recommend for this style of cuisine.

Good service.
Tried Jjajangmyeon.
Small portion for $9, noodles were way to soggy.
Definitely not Korean standard jjajangmyeon, but good enough if you're craving it.

Well... I haven't really been here in over 10 years. I remember as a kid coming here when it was less than 5 tables and before they "expanded"the dining area. It's come a long way since then. Just saying that I came to this restaurant after a 12 hour drive from Virginia to eat some good Chinese food says a lot. 

The trip was well worth it. Obviously I didn't come to Chicago just for Fu Yuan... but I'm glad I came. 

My table ordered jajjangmyun, jahm-pong, and kahm-puungi. I personally had the jajjangmyun. It was very good. But what I really remember from the past was the kahm-puungi. This is a "sesame chicken" style of chicken that is spicy. It's kind of like General Tso's but so much better. 

I don't know if they still have it but if they do, ask for it "bone-in" style. I remember that being amazing. 

Anyway, it may just be nostalgia, but it was a good place to have a good lunch/dinner.

Consistent good food and kind service.

Spicy hot and sour soup is without a doubt the best I've ever had.

This is the best Korean-Chinese restaurant in western suburbs. Only down side is that if you've a big order, it could take a while. But they do take pre-orders. My favorite is Pork TagSuYuk with sauce on the side.

Fu Yuan is a small chinese restaurant located in downtown Wheaton. It seems as if they've been around forever!

I've been here a few times. I remember having the chicken fried rice, as well as moo goo gai pan on another occasion. Good Egg Drop Soup!

The prices are fair, the food has flavor, and it doesn't feel as Americanized as other Chinese restaurants in the area. They must be doing something right, because they have been around forever!

A nice, quiet spot to dine in downtown Wheaton. If you are looking for good Asian food, I would recommend here or Pad Thai Etc. down the road. I've never been to Wok N Fire, so I cannot comment on if they are on the same level.

The best Chinese food in the area without a doubt. My problem is I  Just cant order anything other than the moo goo, always  incredible!  But Miss Eastwood just loves her hung su chicken, and little E. Thoroughly enjoyed her kung po chicken. All the soups have fantastic flavors, hot and sour, egg drop and treat yourself to some sizzling rice soup. Before I finish with my extra long diatribe I want to say  in closing........Fried rice , never had better.
The service is good and clean. The food I've had better. I tried the korean style jjampong and jjajang with kampoongki. The kampoongki was really good but the noodles had a lack of taste to it.

What a disappointment....after reading other posts my friend and I were very excited to visit. I made a 5 pm reservation on Friday night. ONE waitress for the entire restaurant! It took us one hour and forty five minutes to get out of there! Food was cold...they don't even set knives at the table! Awful experience! Everyone I know will ever go there...

I tried to order orange chicken and the guy said something about them not deep frying chicken. Made me order the sweet and sour chicken which was utterly horrible. It tasted worse than chicken mcnugguts at McDonalds. You would think an old Chinese place in downtown Wheaton wold be so much better. At least the inside

This place is GREAT!!!!

After ordering, I decided to just hang out and chat with an older gentleman that was waiting for his food as well.  We were both offered hot tea (on the house) on a freezing cold and snowy day.  Our wait was very brief and the tea made the time pass well.  

The food tasted very fresh and there was a lot of it.   I ordered the Seafood Jam Bong and the Chicken Lo Mein with pan seared noodles.  Both were fantastic.  

Fairly priced.  

I will absolutely come back.

Fu Yuan is my favorite Chinese restaurant in the area! The mister and I come often, but lately we've only had time for take out. When you dine in make sure you allow plenty of time because there are only 2 people working the floor most of the time. They are a bit slow, but they also have a lot of take out orders to handle. The food is definitely worth the wait. My husband loves the Kung Pao Chicken and I love ordering the Schezwan Chicken. On occasion we'll order an appetizer, edamame or crab rangoon which are decent. They serve soup with their lunch/dinner specials and they are both delicious: hot & sour and egg drop soup.

Fresh. We had chicken chow mein and General chicken. Fast friendly service. Hot tea. Water refilled. Plenty of leftovers they boxed up for us. Reasonable at $22 plus tip. 

We will be back.

I get the Beef and Broccoli every time at every Chinese food place I go. This is the first one I've felt compelled to yelp about.

Like other reviews I 100% agree, Super Fresh taste.  Sauce is light and flavorful, the beef is a better quality then most and the vegetables still have snap.  Fu Yuan has become my go-to Chinese spot.

The price might be a dollar higher then other places but well worth it for the quality of food.

Could have 5 stars if they stepped up the interior.

I have been coming here for 10 years. This place is the real deal. The food is fresh, fresh, fresh and the sauces are excellent. The lunch specials are  great and very reasonably priced.  Not a fancy place but very clean and the food is great.  Every time I am there, half the customers are speaking Chinese or Korean.   That is a good sign to me.

Who knew there would be such a treasure of authentic Korean-style Chinese food so close to Wheaton's campus?

Tip - if you're looking for the authentic stuff, only order off the back of the menu (which is written in Chinese and Korean with some rudimentary, sometimes unhelpful transliterations and translations.

I heard our waiter speaking both Korean and Mandarin to customers -- very good sign!

Tang su yuk (sweet and sour beef) - very good (had the beef though they also offered pork)
Seafood jajyangmyun - very good
pork jajyangmyun - OK.  i ate some leftovers later and they were tastier... maybe the sauce needed to simmer longer?
ro ji something (spicy chicken) - delicious
pork fried rice - excellent. absolutely delicious, tasty, juicy pork in between well separated, fluffy kernels of fried rice.
kimchi - meh. maybe i'm just not a fan of this style of shredded (western) cabbage smothered in chili sauce. but it was free so i shouldn't complain. Again, I think we were given this because we ordered the real stuff.
free rice cake dessert - pretty tasty. and free! by this point we were pretty full!

service - slow but very friendly and helpful. the one server refilled tea as needed and was great at suggesting things once he figured out we were there for the authentic stuff.

ambience - not bad. seemed very clean. plain and simple. combination of booths and table seating.

price and portions - i don't know what others are talking about. entrees and noodle dishes are mostly under $10 with some of the nicer meat entrees running up to $12-16.  if you go family style, you can easily get away with less than one dish per person (e.g., 4 dishes between 5 people) and still have plenty to eat and end up spending right around $10-$12 per person incl. tax and tip. 

A fantastic find in the heart of downtown Wheaton for those looking for authentic Korean-style Chinese food. Thanks Yelp!

Reviewers who complain that it is Americanized Chinese  - must not have bothered to look at the back of the menu which is all authentic.  Those who complain it is neither Korean nor Chinese - Korean-style Chinese food is a real authentic cuisine style (really a variant of Shandong style Chinese cuisine)...  folks who actually know about Chinese food OR Korean food would both know this.

Great food, great service, and friendly prices. Have been eating at this restaurant for over 15 years. The ingredients are fresh and the food is always awesome. Sometimes they are short handed on servers but be patient, it's worth the wait. Parking is great and there are plenty to do in the area within walking distance. They have lunch specials, dinner specials and the best soups ever. You can't go wrong with this place.
Best food ever!  Staff is so nice and eager to please.

I have been going to this place for over a decade - pushing two decades soon. Before my time, they used to be a smaller hole in the wall with strictly take out, which has since been expanded to the sit-in it is today. 

This is a review for their Korean-Chinese food. The owners are Chinese, yes, but they grew up in Korea and so they speak perfect Korean and cook the most fantastic Korean-Chinese food. 

Great jja jang myun and jjambbong, which are the only two dishes we eat here anyways. The kkampoongi is not too fantastic, so don't expect too much when you order that. 

I can't really speak for the Chinese food. It's all very standard American-Chinese food. Mushu pork is good as is the Mongolian beef.

i have been splurging on this place as of recently.
maybe the food gods are trying to tell me to make room in my food budget for this place.

the only thing i get for takeout is:
shrimp and veggies
plain fried rice -  rice that is fried with egg, onion, and carrots.
yummy for my tummy.....and your tummy too.

This is the only place I have been able to find Korean Chinese food. The jjajungmyun was delicious!  I have no idea how they make it (if it's actually hand-tossed like in Korea), but it tasted like the real thing. The only sad part was that the prices are so high that I couldn't get the typical jjajungmyun/tang su yuk combo. Next time... maybe I'll splurge. :)

I got it to-go, so I can't comment too much on the service. We didn't call ahead since we wanted to get a good look at the menu, so we waited 30 minutes for our food at the restaurant... It wasn't too bad though, and I think worth the wait since they're the only place I know with Korean Chinese food!  Also, they gave me kimchi relish/slaw for free. Yummm...

OK, so I have been coming here for several years, and have formed some strong opinions about Fu Yuan. Generally, it is one of the places I prefer to go to when I am craving Chinese in this area. In fact, it's probably my top choice. I'm not saying there isn't better Chinese out there...I am saying that I get Chinese food in the Wheaton/Glen Ellyn area about two-three times per year, know what I like here, and just don't venture out to a potentially questionable new place when I know I can get what I like here.

Long intro over, lets continue.

My favorite thing here is the Twice Cooked Pork. It is always really delicious...really, really delicious. If you like spicy, you will need to order it extra spicy. A few other dishes I have had here are fine, especially ones containing pork or beef.

The vegetable based dishes, even ones like beef and broccoli, can be disappointing. It has long been accepted by me that most green vegetables here will be overcooked and on the soggy side. Now, I love my veggies raw and crunchy, so maybe it's just my personal opinion that they tend to be soggy...but to me, they do. 

Egg rolls aren't terribly good, but the fried rice is. Hot and Sour soup is average - not great, not bad.

Here's the thing, it's inconsistent. When it's good, it's great - I'd give it a five. When it's not so good? Let's just say we've actually thrown it out mid-meal, and I hate wasting food. I've almost always liked the sesame chicken and beef and broccoli. When we've ventured to some of our other go to's when it comes to Asian cuisine, not always a hit. One that comes to mind was we got a lo mein that was soupy. Not just moist, but literally floating. Not that it's a huge deal, but they are closed on Sundays. Everyone deserves a break, but when Monday is looming and cooking seems like a pain, they'd get more business if they were open. They also don't deliver. Again, not a big deal, but for the lazy days they get out voted by places that do. I really wish I could give them a higher rating, or if I knew the secret to when the food would be good versus the alternative. We've tried them a number of times and can't seem to figure out the right equation. Not totally writing them off indefinitely, but not the top of the list to revisit either. If someone knows the secret to their good times to go, let me know!

I'm not feeling this place anymore. The Kung Pao chicken wasn't spicy whatsoever and contained mushrooms which were not welcome on my plate. The Mongolian beef was fatty/chewy although the flavor was good so if I did order again I'd get Mongolian chicken instead. The garlic chicken was ok. Nothing was bad per se, just blah.
We have gone here for over ten years. Tonight they gave us the wrong food for the first time. We paid for moo shoo pork and got a second chicken dish. Disappointing.

I cannot believe I've never yelp'd about Fu Yuan. I've been a fan for a long, long time...over 10 years! My little sister is also a fan & when we have a slumber party we usually treat ourselves to some take out from this little diamond in the rough. 

The place is on the small side which is the complete opposite of the portions they dish out. We often have leftovers and this yelper loves that. Our favs are the sesame chicken, fried rice, schezuan chicken, potstickers & crab rangoon....or pretty much anything fried (obviously...duh). They also have lunch specials Mon-Fri which are very reasonable and not skimpy. Specials are served with fried rice & and eggroll and in the $6 range if I remember correctly. Sadly, I do not work close enough to take advantage of these specials anymore...

The service has always been great. The same family has owned this restaurant for years and they are super friendly & accomodating. If you are looking for an affordable, tasty meal...look no further!

Fu Yuan is as good as it gets! I grew up in Wheaton and this is the one and only place in and around Wheaton that my family and I have ever gone for chinese. (25+ years!!) I compare all Chinese food to what they serve at Fu Yuan and nothing seems to hold a candle to them. No joke. 
We just moved out to Lombard and while that isn't too far from Wheaton..we are on the search for some great Chinese food in our area and everything we have tried is terrible....because of course I am expecting the deliciousness that I grew up on!

Anyways! SO worth it- 5 stars all the way. 

Enjoy~!!

Fantastic little place! I avoided it for the longest time because it seemed like just a hole in the wall restaurant (even though those are usually the best). I was really skeptical, the place is small and old it looks like it's the same size as the Dairy Queen from the outside. But the food is amazing, seriously. I've never gotten anything from here I didn't like. The vegetables are always fresh and the tea is always hot. The prices are very reasonable and you get a lot of food. They seem to get a lot of take out orders here too, and there are always at least a handful of patrons inside. My favorite dish would have to be the vegetable fried rice. Always good never waivers on quality. And you can always ask for no MSG in meat dishes which is a good thing right? 

The only downside is service is a little slow so don't eat in and be in a hurry. Its a tag team duo in the restaurant which I am guessing are the owners. They are as nice as can be and really try their best to make you happy! It's worth it though I promise! Also beware that in the summer the air isn't always on, sometimes just the fan with the door open.

I am extremely picky about Chinese Food and where I eat. I am also originally from Los Angeles where there are restaurants on ever corner where there are several variations of Chinese food. This place by far is my favorite in this area and I am here on a regular basis. It is also the only place that I know of which serves a Korean version of Chinese food. The food is always fresh and cooked well. The two people who run this place are always polite and friendly. I highly RECOMMEND this place and tell everyone I know to eat here.

Ps - TO THE HATERS - Sorry but not every place you go is an all you can eat buffet. Next time stick to Ground Round.

The food here is really good, made with the freshest available ingredients. They have awesome menu, as some of the dishes are fusion dishes- korean chinese. The price is reasonable considering you walk away with loads of leftovers. It is the best chinese place, and although it may look a little run down on the outside, they will make you the best chinese food you'll have ever tasted.

The service is on the slow side, as it is a family run restaurant, but I think it is the wait that makes the food taste even better :)

This is my favorite all time to go for chinese food

Mediocre place and I'm not sure we should call it Chinese.

Yes it's Chinese food and yes it's Korean food.  As far as I could tell most everyone seemed Korean, not Chinese.  It doesn't hurt the quality of the food, but... what's the point?  If I want sit down Chinese food I'd like some more authentic style Chinese.  If I want Korean food I'd rather go somewhere with a full Korean menu.  It just doesn't seem to satisfy when it comes down to any cravings.

The venue and service.  The interior is getting a bit aged, but it's well maintained and it's not always well lit.  The service isn't great either, but the last two visits I've stuck to take out only to avoid this.

Overall, edible, but worth a  rare visit and even then I'd stick to take out.

I've driven by this place alot but never thought much of it.  It's a long/narrow structure (with the entrance being the short side) and a dining area that runs 2/3rds of the way back.  It's clean and nicely decorated.

I came in with a friend on a saturday night.  Service was a tad slow but It wasn't anything to worry about.  Seems like the service staff is just the owners, husband and wife.  (This is a guess on my part).

Anyways, the menu isn't overwhelming but covers all the standard dishes.

The lunch/dinner meal combos are a great value.  For under $10, price varies among dishes, you get your entree + rice + soup.  We ordered crab rangoon as an appetizer and each of us had an entree. All in we got out of there just over $30 including tip.  Awesome deal.

Now the info you're wonering about the most: the food.  It was excellent.  It must be noted the food (mongolian beef and shrimp+veg) was flavorful and fresh!  No excessive oils or sauces like you find in other chinese restaurants.  I was pleasantly surprised since oily/greasy chinese food is typically the norm.

You won't find a rare dish or crazy awesome service.... just tasty food with good service at a great price.

Highly recommended.

Wow...My wife remembered this place being so good when she was younger so we decided to order it for carryout. No online menu so just had to guess what to order and prices. Brought food home..probably worse Chinese I have ever had, fried rice reminds me of Panda Express, sweet and sour chicken, smallest chicken breast ever, and not 100% but pretty sure egg rolls are frozen and fried. Will never go hear again and we ended up throwing it all out and making a frozen pizza. $40 I will never see again.

As far as suburban Chinese places go, it is quite good.  One thing I like is that the dishes are always made to order; if I call for carryout, they tell me to come by in 30 minutes and when I do, everything is piping hot and fresh tasting.  Much better than calling other places and being told your order will be ready in 10 minutes.

Service can be a little spotty at times, but the food makes up for it.

My husband have been coming here for years and love to food.  Even if it takes a little longer when they are busy, it's totally worth the wait!!  I wished we still lived down the street!  I love them and this is the only place we go for Chinese food.

Par NONE..this is the BEST Chinese food I've ever had. Everything is so fresh and tasty. The owners are super sweet, they always remember my order and even add a little extra of the items I love. I've brought loads of people here and have never once heard a complaint so if you're in the mood for some AMAZING Chinese food GO THERE NOW!!! Don't walk, RUN! You'll thank me :]

Pros: 

1. Tried 2 dishes, Mu Shu Beef and Chicken fried rice. Both were hella delicious!

2. The service area appeared clean under the dim lights. 

3. Standard pricing. We only order 2 entres and total came out to $21 including tip.  

Cons:

1. Hella slow service. Actually no service depending on where you sit. We came here on a Sat. night. Only 2 people working. The place was 1/4 full. We sat by the door and received absolutely no service the rest of the night after receiving our food. We had to go up to the server every time we needed something.

2. Decor could be updated or more inviting. 

3. Loud. 

Summary: This place is better for take out.  That's what most people that came in there did.

Wow. I'm really surprised by these reviews. I've been to Fu Yuans many times over the years, and the food and service have always been less than average. This time, I ordered take out. Mongolian beef and orange chicken. Both were inedible and nothing like what I was expecting. I never imagined Chinese food could actually be badly prepared and mace, coming from a place that has been in business for so long. By far the worst Chinese food I've ever had, and I will not be coming back. I'm not even Chinese and I could make better Mongolian beef and orange chicken than them. The sauces were basically water, and the orange chicken wasn't even fried! It was chicken in a water sauce that had no flavor! Disgusting doesn't even sum it up.

The fried rice that comes with a lunch - light, flavourful, and sprinkled with green onions and yellow bits of egg - it is the most beautiful fried rice I've seen at any Chinese restaurant. The lunch special is affordable. 
BUT don't order the pot-stickers - the price is ridiculous and they are awful - apparently deep-fried and bland - horrible bits of pork with what appeared to be TAPIOCA beads as filler (I hope.)
Worse still, they cost almost as much as the meal! For six of these puffs of garbage! The price I was charged was also a dollar more than on the menu! Disgusted, I paid the bill and walked out. This is my third visit. I will never return.

Good food, good prices!  It is never too busy in here, which I always enjoy.  I just wish I didn't live so far from it, because when I did live near, I was here at least once a week.  Damn those gas prices!

Overall-
Cleanliness:  A
Food:  A
Presentation:  A
Prices:  A
Service:  A
----------------------
Grade-  A

Terrible Terrible Terrible!  Sorry, I have nothing nice to say about this place.  One star is the lowest I could rate it.  I read all the reviews before going and thought why not give it a try.

Well, upon arriving, there was a group of 30+ people leaving....this was a good sign at first...no long wait for food, and it must be good since there is a huge group of people...gosh was I wrong!!

The table of 30+ people was never cleared off the ENTIRE time we were there!  I mean come on!! Disgusting to sit through an entire meal and have someone else's food just staring at you.  Just makes you think of what the kitchen looks like...yuck!

The food was terrible.  Both my husband and I have stomach aches and the kids didn't even eat their sweet and sour chicken...which was WAY over fried. There was hardly anyone there and yet it took forever to get served.  The servers werent friendly at all either.

This is my first rating on Yelp and I'm sorry that it has to be a bad one...but I really would never set foot in that place again.
Average suburban Americanized Chinese food - need I say more?

So anyone who reads my reviews knows I'm in search of decent Asian cuisine out here in the west burbs. And if you don't read my reviews then perhaps you should. Anyhoo.

Our buddy Vince was coming over to watch some movies and hang out. He lives in Wheaton, us in Lisle so he was going to grab the grub from this Fu Yuan place nearby. Skeptically, and rightfully so, I assumed it would be more of the same. Weak, cookie-cutter food trying to pass itself off as Chinese. 7pm arrives, as does Vince, and we're ready to watch "Love At Stake" and eat. 

I ordered the Mongolian Beef, my wife the Lemon Chicken. I was expecting, at best, something edible. So I open the box and take a bite. And another. And a third. And dear baby Buddha was I happy. I wept, fell to the floor and violently shook from happiness. The Mongolian Beef, while not spicy, was sweet and succulent. Delicious, fragrant, had those crispy rice noodles... not too many scallions. My god, everything I could want from a Mongolian Beef. I ate it slowly, purposefully. I wanted to savor every bite. I even left a little bit to finish late that night... it was that good.

My wife's Lemon Chicken was alright as well. I'm not a huge lemon guy so I can't say it was great. But overall I love this place. I'm ordering again for sure. With Mongo Beef like that I have to.

Wow. Just wow.

My in-laws took my husband and I there to celebrate my husband's birthday. My in-laws had dined here before, many times, but my husband and I were newbies.

I picked up the menu and while trying to decide what entree to order, my father-in-law suggested that we order a bunch of small plates to share, to try as many different dishes as possible. He said that's what he typically does when he goes, and I was happy to comply.

I can't tell you how many plates I tried (probably too many), but I can tell you that every single one was simply delicious. The stand outs in my mind are the portobello fries, risotto of the day (yes, they have a different kind of risotto they feature nightly), and the bacon wrapped scallops.

Our server was very nice and was extremely well-trained/familiar wit hthe menu and wine pairings to complement the food. She checked on us often, always making sure we had what we needed, and updating us on when our next plate would be ready.

The place is pricey, but I think it's more than worth it. The food truly is wonderful.

Adelle's was.... weird.  Not in a bad way and there is nothing wrong with that, it just seemed like a lot of things did not make sense.

It started almost right away when we pulled up.  We saw the sign, pulled into a lot, and didn't see Adelle's.  We were coming from the west, so the "walk around to the other side of the building" sign at the east end of the parking lot wasn't terribly obvious - even if we were being oblivious.  Parking was not a problem in this lot (or the lot we later discovered to the east which is probably Adelle's actual lot) and there was plenty of street parking on a later weekday night.  Parking could potentially be a problem during a weekday due to the train station and nearby apartment complex, but existing signage seems like it would relieve that and I can't speak from direct experience in the area for other times of day.

So - around the building and in - we were greeted by a friendly smile.  We were immediately led to our seat in the dining area and may have been only 1 of 3-4 tables overall.  One thing that was absolutely impeccable and consistent was the service.  The greeter was nice and efficient, the waiter was extremely knowledgable and professional, the busboy was prompt and accommodating, and the manager stopped by to check on us.  If my review was based on the employees and service it would be an easy 5 stars.

More strange-ness in the building though.  I don't totally understand the decor.  it is semi upscale modern industrial minimalist with nice points, but seems to have a little bit of a confusion of styles.  It works, but in some ways it feels a bit "pop-up".  At our table in the dining room there was an "interesting" music selection for a more fine-dining type restaurant being mostly overpowered by the admittedly better lounge music from the bar area.  The two tracks were distracting at times, but music preference can obviously be a little nit-picky.

Adelle's did have a nice beer selection (and it looked like a nice wine selection as well).

The menu is very creative with smaller plates, tasty appetizers, and full entrees.  Everything looks to have prime ingredients and preparation on a carefully thought out menu of creative dishes.

-We started with crab deviled eggs.  The deviled recipe was a little heavy on the mayo, but I'll call that preference and give a pass.  The flavor and texture was otherwise great, but they could have used a little zing that was surprisingly not provided by the roasted capers.
-We also had the pork belly fried rice.  This was tasty, but lacked something as well.  I think a runny / over-easy egg would compliment much better than the fried egg the dish had mixed in.  Though tasty, the fried rice portion came off more like your average chinese restaurant pork fried rice.  The pork belly was good, but didn't do much to "wow" me.  Presentation was good, but eating might have been better if the pork was pre-cut into strips.
-Next we had the chicken and waffles - typically a favorite of mine this was only OK and a bit strange.  The waffles and chicken were both prepared perfectly, but the combination of sauces provided for kind of a strange flavor.  I'd have preferred to be able to select the sauce and quantity myself, but mainly the hot sauce portion was a little strange.  I liked the heat, but the flavor made for a strange palate with the syrup and white sauce.
-Finally we finished our meal with a lobster risotto with a couple of fried shrimp on top.  The risotto was cooked perfectly and the dish was presented well, but the dish mostly just tasted like cheese.  Yes, this was rich and tasty - but it could have had anything in it and I wouldn't be able to taste much of a difference.
We saw a tasty bread pudding and flourless chocolate cake on the menu and had to limit ourselves so we stuck with the flourless chocolate cake.  It had an amazing ganache and a bit of creme and fruit to dip in, but the actual cake itself was more dry than most that I've had.  It was worth eating, but mostly just OK.

Adelle's mentions that they are a "from scratch" kitchen - they make just about everything on your plate in-house and I can definitely dig that!  The ingredients were all fresh and everything was prepared nicely - there was just a missing "pop" of flavor or anything to make the dishes stand out.

In the end dining at Adelle's was a pleasant experience.  The staff wowed us, but the food didn't.  We did eat well (read: a good quantity of food) and had leftovers, but at roughly $50 per person I expect to be a little more impressed.  Things like the conflicting music or the dry cake aren't really worth complaining over - they should just be taken care of already at that price point.  This may be a bit spoiled, but with the bar set relatively high by other nice/fine dining in the western burbs I can't quite make it to 4 stars, but to be fair it was very close.  I wouldn't mind giving Adelle's a shot again, but it may be a while before we make the rounds.

Beautiful restaurant nestled near the tracks in downtown Wheaton. The decor is upscale and cold but the clientele is dressed in all manner of ways, so don't feel required to look fancy. The menu is simple but reliable - I had a delicious flatiron steak adorned with blue cheese and dressed with fries, and a fun "black cow" dessert consisting of a cold glass filled with vanilla gelato, a bottle of root beer, and snickerdoodle cookies. It was like deconstructed childhood, and I loved it!

If you haven't gone to Adelle's, you are missing out.  Over the years, I've  enjoyed the atmosphere, the food and the great service. The restaurant is large with a nice bar area and outdoor patio.  The parking lot is small but there's street parking as well.  Tonight we were seated in a little alcove room off the main dining room. It was perfect for our party of six. There was a lazy susan in the middle of the large table so everyone was able to reach the shared plates.  Adelle's has a nice wine list and tasty cocktails, but tonight we brought two bottles of wine and paid the $20 corkage fee. They will decant the wine for you, too. Two of the six of us did order cocktails and beers from the bar.  Miguel was our server, and although he didn't introduce himself upon greeting us, I made sure to ask his name.  Better than "hey, you"!  Our group started with four small plates.  The portabello mushroom fries had a crispy coating with a smoked sea salt while maintaining their juiciness and the truffle aioli was amazing. The meatloaf sliders are grilled and served on mini brioche buns with a tomato jam and crispy potatoes on the side. This is always a winning dish. The fish tacos were tempura battered fish served with a crispy slaw and a jalapeo aioli. Yum!  My favorite, though, was the hot chicken and waffles. This was perfection...light and fluffy Belgium waffles topped with crispy and juicy chicken tenders with a blue cheese aioli, sriracha cream and a hot honey drizzle.  I could have eaten the whole plate. The chef gave us a complimentary order of the gnocchi with chorizo tomato sauce and parmesan. Such a nice touch!  For dinner the two guys ordered the meatloaf with a bordelaise sauce and garlic potatoes.  One gal ordered the salmon special and the other the panko herbed whitefish. My husband had the ribeye and gave me a large piece to taste. It had great flavor, but had a lot of gristle and was chewy because of it. This is the reason I didn't give Adelle's 5 stars this time...for the meat left behind on my plate that was not digestible.  I had the grilled romaine with boursin cheese, pancetta, cranberries and a buttermilk vinaigrette and the tuna sliders, one of the small plates, for dinner. The grilled romaine salad had flavor and texture going on and was very good. The two tuna sliders were seared rare and served on mini brioche buns with a ginger wasabi mayo and crispy slaw.  So tasty. We ended the meal with lattes and cappuccinos and a few gelatos. I had the pistachio gelato served with a chocolate sauce and toasted pistachios and two little chocolate chips cookies on the side. The gelato was so creamy and the chocolate sauce rich and velvety.  It was another wonderful dining experience at Adelle's, and Miguel and the other staff provided attentive service.

Great food, ok service!. We waited 10 minutes for the waiter to take our drink order!

For appetizers I ate like a king:
-Meatloaf Sliders
-Chicken & Waffles

I recommend both of these very highly!  For dinner I had the Scallops with Andouille sausage and sweet potatoes.  I could not find the Andouille so my guess it was probably crushed.  We sat outside on a saturday night which was probably a mistake because of the mosquitoes and the slow service.  It was packed!  Next time we will probably sit inside!  The hostess was very friendly and the parking is pretty easy.  There is a parking garage down the street which is safe to park in, the machine is confusing since no parking spots show up.  Everyone just parks here anyways.

I'm willing to give it another try since the food was really good and the waiter did bring out a free dessert for my wife's birthday.  Always a nice touch!

What a treasure of a place to find in downtown Wheaton. The atmosphere is outstanding and dinner was one of the finest I've had in years.  I would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for a great date location as well as a perfect place for couples to meet where they can talk in a gorgeous dining room or a spectacular bar with live music.
My skate wing was overcooked and the salad that came with it was too complicated but I enjoyed myself and I'll go back so it's only fair that I bump them up a couple stars.

Just could not align with the Zagat rating. We are fans of Ivy nearby in Wheaton. Have been wanting to try this place for date. I am going through chemo and date nights are even more important these days...
1)the bar is nice, live music and decent selection.
2) dinner-two salads, two entrees, three drinks, one dessert =$133. Normal bill for us. Salads were ok-nice portions but nothing popped for us. I had filet with mashed garlic and veggies-the vegetables were so overlooked my husband didn't want me to take any leftovers home. Hubby had fish tacos and tuna tartar, nicely done. We split the Red Velvet cheesecake-we were very disappointed. The sangria was also not our favorite-tasted like plain red wine, lots of ice with sliced fruit thrown in. All in all, ok but not amazing.
Amazing atmosphere and yummy desserts. The outside patio is a really nice set up for groups. However, the entres were a little bland for my taste.

I haven't been here since they moved from their College Station location.. boy have I been missing out. I was surprised by the atmosphere, it's much nicer inside than I expected.. I was thinking it would feel more "strip-mally" (Is that a thing?) The menu is excellent, The food was 5 star quality.. service a touch sketchy, I was -thisclose- to 5 stars... I'll go back and try again

**A "small plate" is an appetizer, right?

Well in my world it is. There were four of us and about 7 different small plates that we wanted to start with... we negotiated and whittled the list down to four:

Duck Confit Gnocchi - OMG light and delicious!
Grilled Meatloaf Sliders - Loved them, I traded a little Risotto for a little more of this
Chilled Thai Lobster Spring Roll - Just the right touch of thai and you can still taste the lobster.
Risotto (I think it was shrimp) Light and creamy, consensus was that this was some of the best Risotto that we have had.

For dinner I ordered the Filet.. Boring you say? Well let me just say this: Pesto Mashed Potatoes. The steak was delicious, cooked perfectly and I loved, loved the potatoes. 

My wife, Lisa ordered the Andouille Crusted Scallops, she loved them.. but got to love them the next day too... **because apparently the small plates are more than just appetizers.

Janet ordered the Pork Tenderloin Schnitzel, loved it! She said the braised red cabbage and lemon butter sauce set the whole thing off just right.

And Adam got the Grilled Blue Cheese Crusted Flat Iron Steak, came with fries. and he thought it was delicious.

We eat out together a lot and this was one of the best all around meals that we've had in a while.

My companions shared the Turley Howell Mountain Zinfandel

Service slipped on my initial beverage (he forgot my diet coke.. no biggie) but then I sat empty for most of the meal and had to ask for more.

We ordered coffee and a couple of cold desserts (pecan pie and some sort of mousse thingee, see pic) The desserts were excellent, it was too bad that by the time they finally showed up, our coffee was long gone. 

I remember when they opened at the old location.. I was bummed that Cochon Sauvage was gone (a little french bistro) but we were pleased with Adelle's and felt it a worthy replacement. They were very good and we visited several times, somehow they got lost in the shuffle as we kept trying new places.

Adelle's, we've been missing out. You are back in the rotation.

Went to previous location and loved it as well as newer location.  This is a favorite date night place for us. The mood of the room sets it up for a nice quiet place to enjoy. An added benefit, we can talk and not have to shout.  
Twice we have been seated in the extra area overlooking the fire place. Romantic touch we loved! The service on our visits has always been attentive, but doesn't interrupt and keeps a nice pace.  All the servers are always well informed of the menu and what works best with what.  

Our most recent visit we took all the server's recommendations and we were not disappointed.  We started with the portobello fries that were fresh, hot, and very tasty!  I choose the clam chowder that was warm, buttery, and hit the spot.  My partner ended up finishing it because we like to share but it was tough handing over. The special was the risotto with lamb chops.  You can get a large portion w 5 chops and a very large portion of the creamy cheese filled risotto.  We both decided we wanted this and decided to split the huge portion. The risotto had plenty of cheese and butter plus mushroom and peas. Amazing! It also was caramelized on top with blue berries. The sweet fruit was an interesting compliment to this.  The chops were cooked perfectly and generous.  
Use the warm bread to sop up extras! This will not be leftover for later! 

After this, we could not say no to a lengthy dessert menu and split the key lime pie. Home made w a graham cracker crust. 

Wine list and choice of beers both in bottle and on tap are plentiful.  I went with their unsweetened iced tea that was refilled as needed. But my partner was able to find an IPA on tap to enjoy.  

Looking forward to visiting their patio soon!

Fine American Food. (cha!)
Adelle's is 5 stars in each dimension: ambiance, service and food.
An amazing restaurant tucked away in Wheaton. I'll be back. Maybe next time I'll sit in the cool bar area. (cha again!)
5 stars... yow, bill
Love this place. Great food, good beer selection. I don't care for wine but the selection looks amazing and the staff seem to know a lot about it. Incredible service. Go try it soon!

A foodies delight, I go to this place to be inspired when food is just tasting the same everywhere and I am tired of everything. 

Always something new to try and an all around strong menu. Carefully selected wine, craft beer, and cider... And this is one place we always stay for dessert. 

Prices are reasonable, service is great, what more do I need a few miles from home?!

Probably our favorite restaurant in the western suburbs. Don't drive into the city and pay out the rear for parking. Just stay here, go to Adelle's. The cuisine is creative and the menu always has awesome new fresh seasonal additions as well as stuff you love to come back for. Amazing wines. Inviting atmosphere. They earned the awards displayed on the front door!

Not sure where to start with this place. Drinks... amazing. The bartender makes a killer old fashioned. Tuna tar tar... check, equally amazing. The scallops were cooked to perfection, like butter not chewy gummy bears, and I also tried the paella of the day which had chorizo and shrimp. I'll be back. Be ready for upscale dining and higher end prices that are well worth it.

Bacon wrapped scallop small plate was amazing. Pear and date bruschetta delicious. Shrimp/crawfish risotto wonderful. Also tried a little of the short ribs and skate special. The short ribs were like butter and I cut off a piece with a spoon it was so tender.

I highly recommend Adelle's. You really can't go wrong.

Food was pretty decent - service not so much. I really enjoyed the gnocchi. Waiter was rushing us the entire meal and was not very pleasant. It was a shame because we spent well over $100 for two people, but bad service can really bring down the experience.
This is a regular place for my friends and I to celebrate special occasions. We love the menu and the ambiance. The service has always been wonderful.

Based on the reviews I was hoping Adele's was going to deliver a little more than the lackluster experience I had.  We called ahead to see if they had the baseball game on so we could come in before our reservation to watch a few innings at the bar. We were told no problem. When we showed up it turned out they couldn't get the game after all grrr. 
     Once seated on the nice patio outside I noticed the wine list is fairly limited for the by-the-glass options. They do however have $200 plus Joseph phelps full bottles on the tiny menu?  
     The cheese plate was ok. Nothing very exotic or aged. Just standard cheddar, non aged manchego and Gouda. My other app, bacon wrapped scallop had undercooked bacon and an unseasoned scallop on top a pure of cauliflower with a sauce so sweet it shoulda been a dessert.
     One of the entree specials was a Monchong fish from Hawaii.  I never heard of it but was told it was a translucent very white fish. I'm fairly certain I was served swordfish. My fish was not white and had the texture of tuna fish. I asked a friend of mine who lives in Hawaii if she had ever tried this fish before and was told she never heard of it. Now I know why. 
     Other entrees were the chicken breast; fairly standard with a potent lemon caper sauce. And the sliders which looked ok but I didn't try em. 
     I had heard nothing but good reviews from Adelle's so I was surprised at our less than average experience. Add to that the 1 hr plus wait from app to entree. Overall pretty disappointing.

Decided to have my baby shower at Adelle's and it was wonderful! I want to first say that the service was excellent! The staff always asked if we needed anything and was very attentive to our needs. The owner Debbie was accommodating for our selections and let us choose two different entrees which worked perfectly for both families. The whitefish was delicious and chicken dish was great as well! The room fit around 35 people and was a very nice space and comfortable space. I will be recommending my friends and family to host parties there in he future! Thanks for a wonderful experience!

I'm so pleased that we finally made it to Adelle's! I've been eyeing it for date night ever since we moved to town, but we love movies so much, that often nice dinners are forgone in favor of spending time at the movies. 

We sat on the patio, and it was such a perfect night for it. Our server (Colleen, I think?) was friendly and attentive. 

I had the Parmesan breaded chicken breast, which was the tastiest thing I've had in a long time. I will be dreaming about tomato butter sauce for many nights to come. My husband had the bleu cheese crusted flat iron steak with sweet potato mash subbed for the fries, and he enjoyed it very much. For dessert, it was tough to choose between so many tempting options. We ended up trying the peach mango crisp, and I'm glad we did. I wouldn't mind going back just to try other desserts sometime. We also had cappuccino and espresso, and the espresso was especially impressive.

My only complaints are: 1. The music was a little loud at our table. Toward the end of our meal, there was some nice romantic music like I'd expect to hear, but in the early part of our dinner, I heard more twangy country than I'd like (unless I'm at a ribfest or something!) and 2. a couple of the servers (not ours, thankfully) were wearing fragrance, and it bothered me every single time they passed by. Yes, I have a very sensitive sense of smell, but they should definitely be trained to be fragrance free while serving food.

Pretty good job, Adelle's! We'll surely be back.

Food is excellent.  We had parmesan chicken and salmon.

Be sure to check yout bill carefully,  esp if you're a larger group and drinking. We had $50 of extra charges on our bill: coffee tea and desserts we did not order.
We greatly enjoyed our evening at Adelle's. We loved sitting on the beautiful patio and we enjoyed everything we ordered. We will definitely be back.

Our first time dining at Adelle's and we loved it. Hostesses were friendly as we checked in w/ them but we were early and were meeting friends so we started with drinks at the bar where we were met with bartenders that were friendly and knowledgeable. My husband was impressed w/ craft beer list while I was surprised at the lack of choices of white wine but did find one I enjoyed. 
Our friends joined us and we were seated at a intimate corner table for 6. ( although next time I want side wall private booth). Our waitress was a hoot. She had the perfect waitress profile down. Knowledge when asked, laughed and smiled with us but not intrusively, timing down to perfection. A few of us ordered entrees while the rest shared small bites. All were delicious but the standouts were the portabella mushroom truffle fries, the bacon wrapped scallop ( but found odd only one served but was able to add additional at a less pricey cost) tuna steak sliders and the fish tacos!
We hadn't wanted the evening to end so we shared an amazing salted caramel ice cream w/ chocolate chip cookies and a delicious cup of coffee. Dessert was large enough to share and of course our seasoned waitress topped it with a candle a smile and 6 spoons. Perfection and one we'd like to repeat soon!

Excellent all the way around. The fish tacos, chicken & waffles and the gelato were among the highlights. Knowledgeable server who made great recommendations. Definitely will return when back in the area.

For fine dining you expect ambiance, quality service exceptional food especially on mothers day.  not here.  we were put in a dark back room with 6 tables.  I had to flag down the waiter several times, plus he didn't understand anything we were saying.  for the price I could have ate at Jamiesons or Outback with much better service , prices and quality.  The food was average, nothing special very overpriced..  I could have made better mash potatoes with flavor and cooked the green beans. skip this place for sure.  very very disappointed on a special occasion

We had a fantastic experience at Adelle's from start to finish.  Our good friends are weekly visitors to this Wheaton gem and they raved about the food and staff everytime we got together so we made plans to meet there for a weeknight dinner.  This night happened to be 1/2 price wine so we indulged in a few bottles of a delicious and light Pinot Noir.  

Our server, Johnny was so knowledgeable, very attentive without hovering and gave us some great recommendations on the vast menu.  We started with Wasbi Green Beans - one of my favorites and something i have ordered at several other locations but I have to say, Adelle's does the green bean so well - right down to the delightful sauce with a nice amount of heat.  And the order was HUGE!

For dinner, I ordered the Short Rib accompanied by brussel sprouts and a sweet potato gratin.  I'm not a fan of sweet potatoes so Johnny suggested a replacement of mashed fingerling potatoes and they were fabulous with hints of bacon, cheese and sour cream.  The ribs were delicious, tender, juicy and generous - I could only eat one of them because I was savoring the brussel sprounts and potatoes.  My husband ordered a soup of the day and appetizer risotto that he thoroughly enjoyed.  Our friends encouraged us to save room for dessert and we decided on the bread pudding which was excellent.  

The restaurant is beautifully decorated with ecclectic touches of whimsy throughout - I especially loved the garnet red glass lamps and lampshades in the main dining room - a perfect example of the wonderful suprises that Adelle's has in store for you.

Great restaurant. Love the local craft beer list. I've had dinner with wife, couples, and kids there and always felt like it was the right setting.  We have also had several Christmas parties there.  They have great private rooms for that as well.
Really nice experience tonight. Lovely hostess greetings, good waitstaff, and present owners. Enjoyed all our food as well.

We were here about 2 weeks ago & had one of the worst dining experiences to date. We choose to be seated on the patio because it was a lovely day (around 6pm). We sat there for a good 15 minutes before our waiter finally greeted us & asked what we wanted to drink. Flash forward another 10 minutes & he brings us our iced teas yet I noticed him tending to other customers that arrived after us because they ordered more profitable drinks (alcohol). Anyways, he doesn't return until another 10 minutes to get our dinner orders. We ordered the bacon wrapped scallop appetizer, gnocchi, the parmesan chicken & the pistachio crusted salmon. 
Let me warn you right off the bat that the bacon wrapped scallop is probably the most horrific thing my guests & I have ever received at a restaurant... The scallop was not fresh & the 'almond sherry' sauce it came with was sickly-sweet like a dessert that my entire table was absolutely disgusted with. 
The gnocchi was pretty nice, nothing really wrong there.
My company thought that the parm chicken was ok, but WAY overworked & smothered in sauce. 
My salmon was not fresh (seems to be a theme here), and again sickly sweet (seems to also be a theme here) with barely any seasoning.
It's pretty clear to me & everyone that I was with that this restaurant is hiding the ingredients by almost everything having a crust or being topped with sauce. Uninspired, lazy & a real lack of culinary taste. 

If the food wasn't bad enough, after we received our entrees we never saw our waiter again. After 20 minutes of being done with our entrees, I had finally had enough. I went inside to get the check because all we wanted was for the experience to be over. I explained at the hostess station what a terrible service we endured & to just be given the check. The male owner apologized & said he would be comping the bill..not necessary I told him but he insisted. While that was appreciated, we absolutely will never return. I gave an extra star for them taking care of the bill but based on food & service alone it's 1 star.

Every dish was delicious... Service was excellent, she talked with us and made sure everything was to our liking. We did small plates so we could share and try a little bit of everything. The risotto was excellent! We are happy to have found this place in our search and will return.... Tuesday night no cork fee. Only thing we could say if maybe the portobello fries had different sauces to dip in instead of the one..... Probably our fault for ordering it last

Hubby took me out on a romantic dinner for my birthday, and I chose Adelle's based off of it's good reviews and decent prices.
We were so pleased! 

Ambiance: Dim candlelight and white tablecloths, cozy fireplace, and overall relaxing and intimate atmosphere.

Service: Our waiter was on top of everything; the host stopped by to make sure we were good; our food came out fairly quickly as well as our drinks. No complaints at all.

Food: Delish! I had the daily special pasta, and my husband had the bleu cheese steak entree. We also enjoyed some great fresh margaritas. 

Prices: It was the perfect in-between for us since we didn't want cheap, but we couldn't break the bank, especially if we wanted a few drinks. For two entrees, three margaritas, and one dessert, it was just shy of $100 including tips.

* Bonus: they brought out a special dessert for me for my birthday, and the waiter was kind enough to get a photo of us before we left. 

Highly recommend Adelle's and will be returning in the future!

We live close by Adelle's and stop in on occasion. The food has been consistently good in the past, and the service uneven. Unfortunately we had a bad experience yesterday and that is what's driving this review.

My wife and I went to Adelle's last night for dinner. I checked opentable and there were reservations available all evening. I decided not to make a reservation and we arrived at the restaurant at 7PM. The sun was setting, temperatures were cooling off, so we requested a table in the main dining room. A quick scan showed at least 4-5 tables open in the main dining room. The Maitre d said that we could have a table in the bar or on the patio. Well, that's not what we requested, but we decided to take a table on the patio.

After being seated on the patio we waited 10 minutes for waitstaff to greet us and offer menus/drinks. When our waitress arrived I asked about beers on tap, and she said she would have to get a beer menu from the bar. That took another five minutes. She then took our drink order and disappeared. Another 10 minutes passed and our waitress was nowhere in sight. After 25 minutes of waiting for drinks - we had not placed a meal order - we decided to leave. 

On our way out I did another quick scan and saw more open tables in the main dining room. We explained to the Maitre d what had transpired and he asked to "make it right" by seating us in the dining room and personally serving us. No thanks. While the food is good at Adelle's there are far too many options to tolerate that kind of service.

I wish that I could give 5 stars. We live nearby, therefore would love to support this business, however, after the fifth time of disappointing service, we will not be back. Let me be clear, the food is good, definitely has that homemade factor, but not great. It seems they don't change their menu that much. The desserts are my favorite since they do change seasonally. However, I don't understand why the service is so bad. There's a college down the street with smart kids who I'm sure would do a spectacular job with service! Why hire incompetent people who lack the persona and knowledge of the menu? Or is it just Adelle's not training their staff properly? I don't know. All I know that if they improved, it would probably be one of the best restaurants in the suburbs. Instead, Fire and Wine is the way to go!

My wife and I have been to Adelle's on many occasions and have never been disappointed. The kitchen puts out consistently delicious food regardless of what you order. Service is attentive without being overbearing or pretentious. The bar has a nice selection on wine, beer, and liquor to accompany all phases of your dinning experience.

If you like risotto (and if you don't what the heck is wrong with you??) you NEED to get to Adelle's NOW!  Okay, maybe make sure they are open first...or just camp out on their patio with a lawn chair & sleeping bag as I intend to from now on.  Oh, and homemade soups...if you like those, then this place is simply WOW.  And bread pudding...one of my fave desserts & the chef here hits it out of the ballpark!  And, and, and...!!!

The ambience & decor is beautiful (more on that later).  We've been quite lucky to visit a number of restaurants lately which look fancy, taste fancy, give incredible service, but don't have that stuck-up attitude - and I'm happy to report Adelle's fits that description.

The hubs had the risotto of the day & I kid you not, I wanted to shout, "Hey! What's that over there?" so he'd be distracted long enough to switch plates.  It's not that my pistachio/honey/shallot crusted salmon wasn't good...it's just that I think anything else pales in comparison to their risottos.  We've also tried 2 of their soups at some foodie fests (the corn chowder & the cream of mushroom were both swoon-worthy).  The only disappointment in the food category was our calamari appetizer - it wasn't in the fryer long enough so the breading was a bit soft & came off very easily.  It came with a tasty dipping sauce & a little salad which were both good.   We finished off the night with two desserts, the Pistachio White Chocolate Bread Pudding & the Salted Caramel Gelato.  The gelato was darned good but the bread pudding was the definite winner in the dessert death match.  It was even damn good cold this morning for breakfast.  Yes, I actually managed to NOT devour the whole thing the night before. ;-)


Yes, they do have wine by the glass, it's just listed on the specials menu your server will give you & not on the big regular menu which does have all the bottles of wine they have.  I like how they have a variety of wine & food price points as well.  The glasses of wine ranged from $4 - $12.  I tried an $8 Chenin Blanc from South Africa that was wonderfully crisp with nice fruit notes (sorry, that's about as descriptive as my limited wine knowledge goes...I just know what I like!).  

It was a bit too humid to dine out on their lovely patio so we sat inside & were pleased to see a whole wall of large windows so we had a perfect view of the patio.  Once it became dark outside the little twinkle lights outside on the shrubs & trees looked so romantic.  They do a fine job with perfect mood lighting inside, too, and I saw a few fireplaces as well.  They have a room off to the side for larger groups and parties (there was a wine tasting dinner going on in that room while we were there) and they also have one big inset booth with screens that close for even more privacy.

Everyone, and I mean EVERYONE here was genuinely friendly.  The hostess, the gentleman who filled our water (and those water glasses were never down more than a 1/2 cup before he was refilling them again), the busser, our server, all the other servers, & the chef - they all said hello, answered questions, when they saw we had the check and/or as we were walking out some would said thanks for coming in or have a nice evening, etc. - it was just a fabulously pleasant experience.

Just had dinner here again last night , and as usual, very good. I'm shocked by some of these negative reviews, we go to Adelle's regularly, and it is consistently very good. The risotto is something to behold. I like risotto, but here, it's the highlight of my meal. Told my wife next time I want a double helping and salad, and in good. I am presupposing  that some of these poor reviews have more to do with some individual not liking a particular dish, not on the quality,more preparation, or taste. Adelle's is great for a nice meal, I suggest trying it because in five years I've never really had anything I did not really enjoy. One of our favorite places,Mary it, and try the risotto! Last nights was crayfish, shrimp,spicy butter sauce, and pineapple......to die for!

Come early, parking's tricky. The portobello mushroom fries and the duck confit gnocchi were what saved this dinner. The service and the rest of the menu items are nothing of note. It's really too bad, we wanted to like this place. Had a cute little courtyard and the ambiance of the restaurant was lovely. I had the short ribs, my brother had the grilled bleu cheese crusted flat iron steak, and my husband had the grilled beef tenderloin filet. The short ribs and filet were insipid and the steak was overdone. Our server's service started off as promising but he didn't bother to check on us to see if we liked our selections and then pretty much ignored us until the end. Will not return!

Well, well, well. My, My, My!!!

This was our first trip to Adelle's in Wheaton. It was our anniversary and had a nice evening planned so we were looking for the perfect restaurant to compliment our evening. WE FOUND IT!!!

I read the great reviews on Yelp before choosing Adelle's, and was a bit nervous that the restaurant wouldn't live up to the hype. Boy did it ever. 

As soon as you walk in you notice the beautiful decor and the serene atmosphere. We were seated promptly and then greeted by our waiter, John, who should be in the hall of fame for perfect waiters. He was friendly without being fake and was sincere about making our evening as perfect as can be, He was very helpful with the selections and knowledgeable about the entire menu. His tastes and descriptions of the food were spot on.

Now for the food. We started with the small plate risotto of the day which was a duck confit, sweet corn, goat cheese and a blueberry butter sauce. OH MY GOODNESS! John was right- this plate is to die for! I was so sad when the plate was empty. It was as perfect as could be. The chef changes the risotto daily so I can not wait to go back an try another. This risotto is equal to Gordon Ramsay's quality. The tastes were perfect together. Now I'm sure you want to hear more- 

In addition to the risotto we had a house salad, a beet salad and a gazpacho that was out of this world. The gazpacho was honey dew melon, watermelon rind (for a crunch) lemon and a hint of jalapeno for a touch of heat at the end-all served cold of course. fabulous!

The plates were a good size but not heavy of too much. Perfect. John had recommended a blend for a wine which was light and fruity with a hint of dryness at the end.  I wish I would have written it down, but I will the next time I go back which will be very soon.

The entrees that we had were the flat iron steak with blue cheese (cooked to perfection) and finger potatoes, which my wife could not stop eating even though she was getting full. I choose the pistachio crusted salmon (light and flaky) with a spinach salad which was again, out of this world and sweet potato mash.

The night was perfect we are still talking about the food and experience the next day, so a sure sign of a great time both food and atmosphere!

Don't hesitate--GO NOW!

It pains me to give Adelle's a poor review but the Mother's Day prix-fixe special missed on many levels.  The menu was a mix of buffet and entree.  The buffet included staples like cheese and fruit, a soup, veggie quesadilla's, deviled eggs, and rolls.   It would have been acceptable for a hotel but not Adelle's.  It just had a feel of "let's see if this works".  As we were halfway through our buffet appetizer course, our entrees arrived.  Were we being rushed or was the staff and kitchen just not used to working on a buffet schedule?  The waiter couldn't have been less concerned about our comment on the timing.  On the plus side, the entree's were excellent as usual.  The pot roast was fork tender and was all meat (no fat).   Everyone else seemed to enjoy their entrees as well.  Sadly, our appetizer plates remained on the table throughout the meal. Again, the staff seemed to be unaccustomed to working with a buffet.  The dessert table was straight out of a Costco warehouse.  The cream puffs lacked any taste and the little pastry cups needed a knife to cut.  

So we'll look elsewhere to celebrate Mother's Day and visit when they offer their standard menu.  That way we know we won't be disappointed.

This was our second visit to Adelle's. We were actually supposed to eat at Ivy but I wanted a guaranteed great meal so we changed last minute. (Not that there is anything with Ivy, just haven't ever eaten there). This visit did not disappoint!  Our server, Johnny, was great!  Very knowledgeable on the craft beer list- which is quite respectable. He gave excellent recommendations, the risotto was phenomenal, I'm sad it's not still there!  Dinner was great and although the there was no room for dessert, we went for the bread pudding anyway. Consistent with our previous visit, Adelle's is great and we will be back!
Best risotto I ever had!

We just had an event at Adelle's over the holiday weekend and it was as good as ever.  The staff is fantastic and Debbie will customize anything to make your event exactly what you want it to be.  The offerings on the menu are always fresh and plentiful.  This is always a great selection for an intimate dinner or for a large party.

Tonight was my first time at Adelle's. We went to hear my guitar teacher (Kevin Brown) who was playing live jazz (every Thursday night, 7-10 pm). We weren't able to swing a fancy dinner tonight so just went for dessert and the live music. 

What a great date night! We loved the music and got a great table and could just chill and relax. We were treated SO well by Miguel- what a great waiter. We appreciated the attentiveness of Miguel and the hostess too. 

The desserts were truly top notch. The bittersweet chocolate mousse was the best I have ever had- I loved the combination of the mousse, fresh whipped cream, raspberries, and raspberry sauce. It was delectable. You really need to try it. My husband couldn't pass up the warm rhubarb crisp with the vanilla bean gelato- he loved it and thought it tasted very fresh. We also ordered the warm blueberry buttermilk white chocolate brioche bread pudding that had caramel sauce, whipped cream, and creme anglaise, at the recommendation of Miguel. (Yes, if you're doing the math, we ordered three desserts for two people!) We shared that and really couldn't finish it even though it was very tasty with so many rich flavors. The size of these desserts are generous which isn't usually common at places like this. But all three desserts were truly delicious but in the future we will only order two. :) 

I've not tried the dinner menu yet but definitely I give Adelle's five stars for the excellent live music, great service, and awesome desserts.

We had a really outstanding meal at Adelle's last night and can't wait to recommend it and come back. We tried two of the small plate specials - a perfect summer, spinach salad and the risotto special. We were pretty sure this was too much food for two people but had a hard time restraining ourselves from licking the plates. For main entrees, we had the hoisin glazed duck breast with cherry sauce that was very nice and the fat was well-rendered. The leek and peapod salad was imaginative and delicious. We also tried the meatloaf and my husband enjoyed it with the spicy ketchup.

Our waitress was lovely, kind, and offered good suggestions without lingering too long. We both agreed that the neutral, contemporary ambience makes for a nice mix of business, casual, but can be romantic as well. This would be a great place for a business or political luncheon.

We started out saying it's probably one of the best meals we've had since moving to the suburbs, but quickly decided that statement doesn't do Adelle's justice -- it was a great meal, city or suburbs!  Can't wait to come back and try the patio. Thanks for a great anniversary dinner!

have eaten there several times and always enjoyed the food, the ambiance as well as the service. My favorite spot is the cozy and pretty patio - love it! In the winter time enjoy the fireplaces!  All the main dishes my husband and I had were well prepared and tasty; however I think Adelle's excels with their beautifully presented and extremely delicious small plates. My absolute favorites are the Chilled Thai Lobster Spring Roll and the Tuna Tartar.

Sometimes we just go there for an impromptu bite to eat in the beautiful bar sharing several of the small plates and having a glass (or two!!) of wine which makes for a very fulfilling experience.

I love this place!  The food is great, many gluten free choices for me to eat!  The staff are wonderful, always providing great service, from the patio to the dining room to the bar, the atmosphere is great.  I love the chicken breast with the lemon caper sauce along with just about any fish special they put on their menu!  The soups change and are all very tasty and well seasoned.

I have brought many friends there over the years and all have raved about their experience and food, last night was no exception.  I had 24 join me for dinner, and it was, as always, perfect!

Amazing experience! While we requested to sit outside, they could not accommodate our request on a Saturday night. However, after dinner we asked our waiter, Nick, if we could move to the patio area (by this time the crowd had died down) and he gladly obliged. I had the red sangria, and, while the bartender said it was "sweet", it was more dry...exactly what I wanted! 

We came as our dining club, Dining Divas, so we all ordered appetizers to share. We had the tuna steak sliders, regular sliders, calamari, and gnocchi. Everything was awesome! As my entree, I ordered the andouille topped scallops over a sweet potato hash, and it was so delicious. The scallops were cooked to perfection, and the hash had just the right amount of heat. So good! I will go back!

Adelle's is a symphony of wonderful and delicious. What a hidden jewel in the western suburbs. I have had many meals here and have NEVER been disappointed. The chef is truly remarkable and highly skilled. Even if I read a menu description of a featured dish and don't really like one or two of the ingredients, I trust this chef to make me change my mind. He does every time! I have become more open to tryng new dishes because the flavors and nuances of his cooking skills and creativity is truly phenomenal. You will not be disappointed at Adelle's - it is wonderful every single visit.

Wow!!  Adelle's knocked it out of the park last night!  We left feeling both happy and well fed!

To start, our waiter, JP, was excellent.  He was helpful with the menu and suggested a great bottle of wine.  Throughout the course of the meal he was attentive, funny, and easy to talk to.  We really appreciated the level of service and professionalism displayed by the Adelle's staff.

The food was also delicious!  We split the charcuterie plate and portobello mushroom fries to start, both good.  I had the Andouille crusted scallops for my entree.  To.  Die.  For.  Seriously!!  I'm pretty sure I will be dreaming about it for weeks to come.  Dessert was also wonderful, we split a truffle brownie and some dark chocolate mousse and cleaned the plates.  Do not leave here without dessert!

We were dining out for our anniversary when we visited Adelle's.  We didn't mention it to our server but after we ordered cocktails and a bottle of wine on a Wednesday, he asked us if we were celebrating, and we shared our special occasion.  Adelle's gave us each a glass of champagne on the house, yum!!  We weren't expecting it, but it was a wonderful gesture.

We have definitely found a gem and will be back for dinner and to try out their patio when the weather warms up.

After hearing so many people rave about Adelle's, my husband and I were excited to try it out a few months ago.  And it was an ok meal but it wasn't what I was expecting.  We started with the portobello fries, which were very good.  Our entrees fell a bit short.  The short ribs themselves were very good but the sides were flat.  I was disappointed that the brussel sprouts seemed to be just steamed or boiled without a lot of seasoning.  I was underwhelmed with the andoille crusted scallops and the "hash" underneath.  I wonder if we had an off night or if we ordered wrong.  

That being said, we've come back already to enjoy the bar.  I really like the atmosphere and the bartenders are always friendly.  My husband loves the beer list as they regularly offer a lot of local beers on tap.  We've also enjoyed dessert while sitting in the bar and have loved everything we've ordered.  We'll definitely be back.
