went for dinner, of course risotto, are you nuts?  IT WAS INSANE GOOD.  and too bad that combo will not be back, but exited to try a differnt version.  the beet salad was fresh and flavorful.  I had scallops, they were like butter.  Hubby had white fish that was so delish, i kept sneaking tastes.  Good wine options, even by the glass.  So full for dessert, but we did get chocolate cake and it was fabulous.

Great service, delicious food (risotto, pan seared chicken breasts, flat iron steak, and brioche bread pudding),  and nice ambiance. Not a fan of the $14 beer. Wish I could give a 4.5. 

Definitely a must try.

I've been to Adelle's many times.  My family has come here for holidays, family parties, and just a night out.  In all those times I've been to Adelle's, their food, service, and atmosphere have never disappointed. 

They have many delicious choices on their menu, and they have specials that change daily.  I am not usually big on "fancy food", but there are many items on Adelle's menu that I love. They have a great bar too. 

The best part of Adelle's is that even on a budget, you can have a really nice meal.  Recently, I took my mom out to Adelle's to celebrate Mother's Day.  We sat in the bar and ordered 3 appetizers and we both got a drink. Our bill was only $50, but we got the fine dining experience. I would have spent the same amount if we had gone to dinner at some crappy chain.

 The appetizers were very filling!  We got the meatloaf sliders, pear date bruschetta, and a salad.  They had a decent list of craft beers, and you can make your own flight!  I got to try 3 different appetizers and beers all in one night.  Perfect for someone who can never decide what to order because too many things sound good!

The atmosphere is great too. This place has something for everyone.  They had live music in the bar, and they had the Hawks game on.

Whether you are just going out for a drink, or you want a really nice dinner, Adelle's is your place.

Wonderful food, wonderful service at every level.  We had reservations for 7 of us and seated at a lovely round table per request with no issue.  Several of us were early and enjoyed some cocktails in the lounge  --before our scheduled reservation time, the hostess (owner) came to invite us to the DR when we were ready.  From then on our server (Maryanne) took wonderful care of us....paying attention, not intrusive, helpful suggestions and professional.  The meals are outstanding.
All of us enjoyed our food, the ambience and care provided to us by the staff and owners.   It is a gem!

I recently went here after reading good reviews and word of mouth. Our server was rude, inattentive-leaving us with empty drinks,never once asked us how our meal was,and took forever to even come around to our table-and the restaurant was not very busy so it wasnt like he didn't have time. I'll spare him by not saying his name, maybe he had a bad night, but he certainly payed more attention to the other tables around us and we were more than nice to the guy.
 
I read good reviews about the meatloaf so I decided to try it, not my cup of tea and I would not order it again.

My girlfriend had the Parmesan Breaded Chicken Breast, which was very good, 

 I was disappointed that the poor service ruined what should of been a special dinner.

What wonderful service!  Adelle's staff did a great job with the multiple accommodations for our party of 9.  Our group involved food allergies, a low sodium diet AND a birthday celebration.  We all enjoyed the food and relaxing atmosphere. Thanks Adelle's!
Great restaurant! Great atmosphere! Food is good, menu options are great. Price is average. Parking convenient. Highly recommend!

Not flawless, but very, very good.  I would go back for the portabello fries.  Dipped in light crunchy breading and not greasy but moist on the inside, they reminded me of the old days when we used to pick and pan-fry fresh morels.  So good.  The garlic-mayo dipping sauce though was too thick and garlicky for me.  I'd have preferred something lighter, maybe a marinara, something with a bit of acid.

My green salad was very good, especially with the optional chevre cheese added.  My salmon entree was good too, but the fish was nearly raw in the middle.  I don't like fish overcooked, but wasn't prepared for sushi either, so I saved it and microwaved it for lunch the next day.  That turned out just fine.

Although it was too hot to sit outside on this visit, we have enjoyed the patio other times.  I'm always ready to return to Adelle's and I love that it has a solid menu that pleases a variety of people.  I heard that the restaurant is relocating in the fall and I've got my fingers crossed that they can maintain the welcoming, small-place feel of the current location.

My wife and I had dinner at Adelle's and really enjoyed everything.  Nice patio and great food.  We had the tempura green beans "awesome" and fish for dinner.  Both the white fish and the salmon were excellent.  We will be back again sometime soon for more.  Definitely give this place a try, the train can be loud on the patio but its a solid place to eat.
Good food but terrible service and attitude.  Too many other good places out there that respect your business.

My first time at Adelles and it lived up to expectations. It was a warm evening so we sat outside on their patio. The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated. As you've always heard you can tell how good a place is by it's bathrooms....ok so I don't usually talk about a men's room but this one got my attention in a good way. Anyway the food was very good,  the menu had some very interesting choices along with some typical american fare. We had salads and small plates which were all good. The service was great, friendly staff, food delivered quickly. The only thing I could say in a bad way is that the prices were a little on the high side for suburban restaurant. Check it out, you'll enjoy!

My boyfriend and I went to adelles last week on a Saturday. 

First we had to wait 10 mins for the waiter to show up and say hi and get our drinks. She gave us the menus and then another 20 mins went by , until she came to take out order.
We waited over an hour for the food!!!!! That is totally unacceptable. I don't think I've ever waiter this long to get the food. The waiter only came by once to apologize and said the food should be right out. .... 30 mins later and it's still not there. 
Once it got there, the food was good. Ill give them that much. It was really good. But definitely not worth the wait.
I'm not going back there . First and last time.

I like adelles - like to go for a drink and appetizers.  Never terribly impressed with their entrees and  desserts.  They do best with appetizers.
We went the other night again - pretty good service, good drinks (waiter suggested a beer flight to my husband - which he appreciated)
We had appetizers - one shrimp dish was toooo spicy.  then we split an entree of pasta - great taste - chicken and shrimp.  They should have left out the shrimp - too dry.
I think that is my general experience at Adelles - they raise your expectations with one item and then mildly disappoint with another.  Too bad they can't be consistent with the "great" experience.

The buffet had a couple good items but when my dinner came I only took a bite and had to send it back. Over priced and the atmosphere is like a cheap cafe. I went with my mom and grandma there and neither of them enjoyed their meals
Large portions, delightful presentation, and very attentive service! Beautiful place!

Absolutely fantastic food, service and atmosphere. I would give this place 6 stars if I could. Their menu changes based on foods in season. It is one of the only places I know that tries to serve local, in season food, or at least sustainable if not. For example, hey so not buy endangered fish not do they buy from the big fisheries, but real fisherman instead. As a vegetarian this means a lot to me. The other three eaters at the table are meat eaters and all loved their meals. We all agreed it is one of he best restaurants we have tried in years, and they eat out all the time in Chicago and Naples, FL. I was excited by how many vegetarian options were available, and almost everything on the menu was very creative and original. I loved the portabella fries and the two salads I tried. Cannot overstate how much I loved it. Oh and the beer, wine and cocktails menus are very well thought out. I love beer and the options they have here are fantastic and creative as well. Way to go Adelles. Thank you for offering something different and tasty. And thank you for putting options on your menu at all price points. A "small plate" is $7-10, and could easily be a meal at least for me. We did not go cheap on our meal here, but a $15/person bill could be achieved here if you wanted. We will definitely be back!

Tried Adelle's for the first time last week, not sure exactly why we have never been but I have been on a mission to explore some new places .

With the glowing reviews Yelp and otherwise my expectations where high. 

All & all things where OK, food OK, service OK, atmosphere OK.  I expected more. 

Nothing was bad but all things considered nothing makes me want to rush back.
Best food in Wheaton and possibly the western suburbs.  The wine list is also fantastic.

Adele's is quite simply the best meal I've had in a long time.  It deserves all the accolades it gets.  We had the mushroom fries and they were delicious.  I had the hoisin duck (and I normally don't like duck) and the missus has pork and spatzel.  Every time I took a bite of hers or mine, that was my favorite dish.  The dessert fell flat...I can't even remember what it was is was so forgettable.  Even the bill....100 bucks without tip but including appetizer and alcohol, was more than reasonable.  We will definitely be back and the sooner the better!

We were here for Easter Brunch with family. A great spread! The chocolate dessert was my most favorite. Never eaten anything like that before.

They had a hot entree and the rest was the cold salad buffet and other warm appetizers. The ambiance is very elite and overall the experience was delightful. Great food and great service!

Went back to Adelle's over the weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  Couldn't have made a better choice.  The food and drinks are superb.  The bar had a nice crowd with a good jazz band.  

What topped off the night was somehow Adelle's recalled from last year the date of wedding anniversary...and bought us a round of drinks on the house.  What a nice touch and classy place.  This place never disappoints...ever!

Looking forward to going back.

First time my girl and I went we had a really great time and my review was 4/5 stars (because I like to visit an establishment a couple of times before making a definitive rating). Last night we went to celebrate her birthday and not only was John (our server who I also raved about back in May) an amazing host, his knowledge of the menu and wine pairings make even a novice epicurean feel comfortable in their choices. He also remembered us from our visit more than 7 months ago! Debbie, the owner, greeted us and really has a passion for giving those of us in the suburbs a fine dining experience without the hassle of driving to Chicago. Bravo Adelle's. We'll be back.

First off, the atmosphere at this eatery was fantastic.  Very nice and quiet and not too much.  The cuisine was absolutely incredible as well.  My dad ordered a pork tenderloin that was to die for and I ordered a salmon dish with postacchio crumbled on top and a delicious coconut-curry sauce underneath that was perfectly subtle.  Not only was our dining experience fantastic, but we had the great fortune of talking with the chef himself!  Boy, what a treat!  It was amazing to see how passionate the chef was about making delicious food..  I would recommend this restaurant to everyone and anyone interested in an amazing dining experience!

"Pork and beans." That's what they call it. 99% of the contents of the can consists of beans. You'll be lucky to find one tiny morsel of pig in there, and yet "pork' gets top billing. 

Adelle's fare is certainly more upscale than pork and beans, and the three small dishes we ate last night were certainly pleasant, but they weren't what we expected them to be. 

The Adelle's sign itself smacks of prairie style architecture, and while the inside was pleasant, it wasn't prairie style. They also couldn't decide the level of lighting in the room. Once you got used to the low level, they'd lower it again. Either have good lighting or turn it off, please. Besides, the three small plates we ordered deserved to be seen clearly as works of art.

First small plate: the baby spinach salad. What little spinach we received was fine, mixed with spring greens and a orange-thyme vinaigrette. But there was much more: "trio of fresh berries, oranges, toasted almonds, oven-dried goat cheese." The first plate seemed more about the berries than the greens. Not much goat cheese and the thinnest-sliced almonds I've ever experienced. Pretty nice, though I wish some more baby spinach would've been included in the baby spinach salad. 

Second small plate: cheese and fruit plate. The daily menu lists each of three cheeses, along with a final line about candied nuts, crackers, and toast points with blueberry and honey dipping sauces. What arrives is a gorgeous plate of food, with a few problems. There was little actual cheese. It was decent, though mostly lacking in bite, but the amount itself was very small, especially since cheese got top billing. Two, there was fruit. In addition to what was listed, two slices of watermelon came, and guess what else? More berries! Lots of 'em! Along with many, many grapes. 

It was an impressive-looking plate, but it was way too busy. Imagine an artist-in-training painting a still life. The teacher wouldn't want so many different types of food as the object, as it can distract from the theme. And the theme was supposed to be cheese. But again, it was fruit. I got a full week's supply of vitamin C and a big helping of antioxidants with all of the blackberries, raspberries and grapes. 

Third small plate: "Moroccan lamb chops, saffron-preserved lemon couscous, golden raisins, spiced almonds, arugula, Harissa sauce." As you can guess, this plate wasn't about the lamb chops. Though they were delicate and tasty, both of them were small. But there sure was a lot of couscous on my plate, and I can't say that I liked it. It had a different mouth-feel than the couscous I've had before, and had little flavor to it. The few almonds had no spice; the concentrated Harissa sauce packed a major punch. At least there were no more berries. 

So what I ordered was a salad, cheese and lamb chops, and what I got was berries, a few greens, berries, a little cheese, couscous and a little lamb. Adelle's should either re-think the proportions in their small plates or change the names of them. 

That's my big complaint. But we'll be back. Why? Because most of what we tasted was quite good. Because they have a large selection of plates. Because we had fun trying to find the one person that was using a black napkin instead of white. (Black cloth napkins are an option, and when asked, our server told me that one person in attendance uses black. So if you were at Adelle's and saw two people glancing at your crotch, nice to meet you.) 

Why else? Because we received swift service, especially early on. Because the bar looks pleasant and they offer jazz twice a week. And because our small plates were actually reasonable in price. (We chose not to drink, but on Tuesdays, you can bring your own wine without a corking fee.)

I look forward to raising the number of stars to four next time, if Adelle's puts the pork before the beans. Or call just it "beans and pork" already.
Consistently great food, properly prepared. Plenty of choice for all diners.  You can tell when you are in a place which really takes pride in their service and product - that's Adelle's.

Yesterday we had my daughter's bridal shower at Adelle's.  The food and service were phenomenal. A little warm, when asked they turned down the AC.  Somehow we miscounted and had one more person than confirmed.  No problem, they quickly took care of this. The choices offered on the banquet menu were plentiful and my only complaint is that they where so tempting it was hard to make a decision.  We decided on 
 FIELD GREENS, fresh strawberries, goat cheese crumbles, toasted almonds, raspberry vinaigrette and
OVEN ROASTED CHICKEN BREAST, over grilled garden vegetable risotto, grilled asparagus, lemon-herb butter sauce.  We received many compliments on the food. I wish I had given previous showers held at home there.  Kudos Adelle's!!

I'm not sure what it is about this place, but the staff sure thinks a lot of themselves. The food is great however the service is much to be desired. Since they've moved, it seems like it has taken a turn for the worse. 

The coconut rice pudding is delicious, the beet salad is enjoyable, the watermelon salad offers a nice surprise in your mouth, and the lobster risotto is phenomenal. It's a shame that this place has gone from a great restaurant to a place that I just don't want to go to because of the staff and service. I've dined at Adelle's seven times and I cannot say I will be back for my eighth.

My husband and I decided to actually celebrate Valentine's Day for a change since this is our last year as a twosome (we're expecting our first baby in April), so on a whim we made reservations at Adelle's since it wasn't too far and had some decent times available for reservations.  I don't know how we have lived in the suburbs for this long without ever hearing about this place!

They offered a prix fixed menu for the evening and everything we had was absolutely delicious.  We kept eating off of each other's plates and couldn't decide what we liked better.  The risotto, as other reviewers have mentioned, is absolutely divine.  For entrees we had the seared Hawaiian Tuna and the Skate, both of which were tender and flavorful.  Even the salad was extraordinary  - a delicious combination of berries and citrus fruits wth a lime-cilantro vinagrette.

Dessert was a trio, and I could have eaten two plates full of that bread pudding.  I didn't even think I liked bread pudding until I tried this.  I am still thinking about it and probably will be dreaming about it until we can get back there and have it again.  Hope it's still on the menu!

My husband and I both agreed it was the best dinner we'd ever had in the suburbs and our new favorite "date night" restaurant.

This is a restaurant deserving of a foody destination. Inventive, fresh, delicious. Have been here several times. Nice atmosphere, a quick stroll from the Wheaton train station. They have live music some nights. The bar area has a fireplace and nice atmosphere, with great appetizer options, although the bartender (female) who has been there both times I have met up with friends is rather cranky. Service in the main restaurant is excellent.
Very impressed with the food.  Risotto, whitefish, Portobello fries and charcuterie all great. Service was good as well. I see myself returning in the near future.

Fantastic craft beer selection and great American gate makes this the best spot in Wheaton.  The only rub is that the menu seems tired after a while with very little change.  I would recommend any of their risottos as they are delicious.  Go early and grab a beer or drink before dinner as they have a nice bar area.

We went to Adelle's about an hour or so before they closed on a Sunday evening.  At that point, it was just us and maybe two other tables.  

Our server was very nice and attentive.  I'm glad I asked what is in their Meat Loaf as it turns out it has pork and neither of us eat pork. So we both ended up having Pan Seared Chicken Breast which was quite tasty.  If there hadn't been a peach pie waiting at home, we would have surely entertained the idea of one of their desserts as well.

 A return visit will definitely take place at some point in the future.

I attended a Bridal Shower "Tea" at Adelle's yesterday..At first everything was very nice, service was great servers very attentive and pleasant. 
Soup was served - was tasty, but different amounts in each bowl some more-some less than others. 
Then the finger sandwiches were served. They served family style the same quantity of finger sandwiches on each plate (4 egg salad, 4 cucumber and chicken salad cherry tomatoes) , regardless of number of people at table(table of 6-8 rec'd same amount as tables for 4-5). I over heard the larger table ask for additional sandwiches and they only brought cucumber sandwiches and egg salad. I overheard the server tell them he will bring the "warm sandwich" - ham and cheese as soon as it is ready. (He passed that request along to person in charge and they said those are gone)..The larger table didn't even receive one of every selection each- that is very poor planning! The tables were set up even some empty seats, so why the shortage of food??! Plus this is a restaurant, why couldn't they accomodate? 
Ok, it was a "Tea" it was a bite to eat, not meal. 
The worst part was when the restaurant opened at 4pm and Hostess started to seat people and they were escorted THRU the middle of the room where the shower was going on or out to the patio so the door was opening and closing(not softly either) along with clanging of water glasses(the shower was until 5pm)! How unprofessional was that, people were trying to hear what the bride-to-be was saying, who the gifts were from, etc!
Let me say, that I can overlook most things, but this was just ignorant and unprofessional and people from our two tables nor I will NOT be visiting this place ever again! It was first and only time! 
I feel bad for the wonderful ladies giving the shower and them not aware what was going on and probably paid a decent amount for the afternoon!

I've gone to Adelle's for years and absolutely love the place, whether for a quick bite in the bar, dinner, or a group for dinner and/or party. Great atmosphere, great and very knowledgable staff, very accommodating if you need a change to a meal due to allergies or dislikes. They always want you to enjoy the time there.
Live music several times a week/month.
Great wine list with some great specials (1/2 bottles and/ or no corkage) on weekdays.
A must "go to" place!!!

I was expecting more for the price point.

The ambiance sent mixed signals.  Quite clearly, the intention of the dining room was high-style.  However, the music, the service, and the menu left much to be desired.  We began with two martinis under the blaring speaker which developed sounds from Big Band music to baby cries and crowds cheering.The service was lacklustre.  The specials were pre-printed but the server mumbled through them anyway.

I chose the lamb shank.  Honestly, lamb is one of the hardest meats to ruin, but you can over-cook and then microwave it.  Congratulations Adelle's, you screwed it up.  The lamb was moist but stringy. ($25)  Although plated well, the sides were uninspired with plain mash potates, oyster mushrooms, and steamed brussel sprouts.  The greatest advantage was the sprig of fresh rosemary, which had the only pleasant aroma on the plate.  (No rosemary was detectable in the lamb.)

My dining partner had the Adelle's trio of mini-burgers appetizer for his entree. ($14!) They came with fries, which were horribly over-salty, chewy, and soggy.  Clearly, they had not been fried at the right temperature since they were incredibly oily.  The mini-burgers were fine, but I've had better in a pub.(at $7)  They were topped with noxious mini-gherkins (weird flavor).  They came in three varieties.  In deference to the high class decor and pricing, they were served with piquant and inventive dipping sauce. Wait, no they weren't. They were served with ketchup. Just ketchup. From a bottle. 

In short, the menu of Adelle's is totally uninspiring, poorly executed, and not worth the price.  The martinis were good. ($10.50/ea)

Six of us had a great dinner at Adelle's.   From the special October Fest burgers to the Andoille scallops there were six clean plates at the end.   The service was excellent and we made our concert with a few minutes to spare.

Three of us went here for dinner tonight. Our visit was nothing like our last visit when we liked this place very much. All of us could not finish our meals because everything on all of our plates was heavily drenched in butter the food had no taste all you could taste was butter. Don't order the white fish here the cook leaves the skin on witch makes the fish taste to strong (fishy) all places can have a off night I would like to give this place one more try

I can say that the service we had was spectacular.  The atmosphere was cozy and not so fast pasted like other restaurants.  The menu was awesome, having the ability to change side orders for the entrees was especially pleasing.  Finished the night off with a slice of Red Velvet Cheesecake, it was the right texture, great flavor and enjoyed by both of us.  I look forward to many more visits,  thanks John for the great service.

This is by far our new favorite spot in the suburbs. 

The decor is pleasing and tasteful, very nice color combinations. The staff and the owner are very nice and assist you in any way they can. The food and drinks are also great! They have an outside seating area and the inside. There's a separate lounge area as well! 

Highly recommended!
The food is very good unfortunately on this our third visit the service is just not up to fine dining standards.  It's clear from the wide variance in reviews our experience is not uncommon.

We returned with friends for dinner. Huge disappointment.  It's always an embarrassment when you bring other people to a place you thought was good and it turns out otherwise.  On this trip we decided to skip appetizers so we would have room for dessert.  At our table of four, no one was happy with their entree.  We had:

Wiener Schnitzel ($23) - This consisted of two smallish pieces of meat.  The meat was tough and the breading was greasy.

Parmesan Crusted Chicken Breast ($21) - The chicken itself and the mashed potatoes were OK.  The onion rings were greasy and VERY SALTY.  The menu said "grainy Dijon mustard cream sauce".  We could find none of this on the plate.

Fennel Crusted Pork Tenderloin ($23) -  There was a strong horseradish taste to the dish.  The menu did not say anything about horseradish in the dish.

Osso bucco ($26) - This was the smallest portion of osso bucco I have ever seen.  The meat was dry and tough.  There was a layer of tough fat around the outside.  After trimming this off, there wasn't much actual meat left.  This came with a small apple bratwurst and risotto.  Why would you put bratwurst on an osso bucco dish?

Oh, well.  We were looking forward to our desserts to save the meal.  For dessert we had:

Key lime pie ($6) - This was good and the best of what we had.

Warm fruit crisp ($8) - It wasn't warm. The person that had this commented that the fruit crisp at Cracker Barrel was better.

Warm bread pudding ($8) - This was warm and was OK.

Turtle brownie sundae ($8) - The brownie was more of a piece of very hard fudge.  It was so hard it was almost inedible.  I left 80% of it on the plate.  After finishing I noticed a HAIR on the side of the bowl! Yuck.

Adelle's was a huge disappointment for all at our table of four.  It was a combination of poor food, food that did not match the menu description,  confused dishes (osso bucco and bratwurst on the same plate.  Risotto with pineapple. Cinnamon with scallops.)  Adelle's also feels like it is overpriced for what you get.  $32 for flat iron steak!  I don't think so.

Our server was good as was the food runner.  The busser was OK but water glasses were not refilled.

Bottom line: We probably won't be back.

I'm really impressed with Adelles. Kind of a random selection on a Sunday afternoon, based on one diner's previous visit, I am looking forward to a return trip for more of the same. 

We started with a couple appetizers - portobello french fries and a cinnamon scallop dish. I requested the fries...like a fool, I read "french fries" and assumed it would be just that, but with a little mushroom. As if portobellos are shavable like truffles. Instead it was delicious "sticks" of mushroom fried in almost a tempura batter, and served with a heavily garlic aioli. The aioli wasn't needed, but the mushrooms were very good. The scallops were...fine, but honestly, the cinnamon thing wasn't quite needed. I don't know if I'd do this again, but they were fine. 

We each had salads - I had an arugula salad with shaved fennel, pine nuts, radish slivers, and some baked feta. Really nice and refreshing, with a light vinaigrette and some mandarin orange garnish. The feta especially was interesting, a little browned and shrunken down by the baking, first time I've had it that way. 

After agonizing over entrees (I was in the mood for beef, having been unable to get a reservation recently at Gene and Georgetti's), I was swayed to the risotto of the day by the waitress, and I was really happy about it. Perfect risotto, topped with a mountain of crab and lobster, garnished with two nicely cooked, non-gritty scallops, and drizzled with lemon dill sauce. Only two, minor complaints - one, more lemon dill sauce. It was awesome. And two, the dish included just a couple sun dried tomatoes, which I didn't think really fit. I ended up picking the out pretty easily. I didn't try them, but others enjoyed a pecan crusted salmon, which was reportedly good, but a undercooked in the middle (nothing the microwave couldn't fix for lunch the next day, apparently), and a steak, which was also reportedly good (and the pooch appreciated the small leftover portion). But man, the risotto...I made the right choice. 

Desserts were also good. I split a blueberry bread pudding with caramel and creme anglaise. The bread pudding was solid, not runny and the caramel was really thick and "caramelly tasting" (which, not all is, unfortunately). Just tasty all around, and a generous helping. 

My entree was available in both entree and appetizer portions - I had the entree portion, but I would return for an appetizer serving of the day's special and those mushrooms and be pretty happy about it.

Well, well, well; what have we here? A little bistro with elegant food, wine, and desserts so decadent that you feel like a Buddha when you leave. 

If you're on a date, come here. 
If you're making up after a fight, come here. 
If you're trying to impress a client, come here. 
If you just want a quiet and interesting meal where you and your significant other can simply reconnect, come here. 

That's what we did tonight and we weren't sorry. This is not a particularly fancy place. But I think it's the entire package that gives it panache. On Tuesday, you bring your own bottle. 

As to the food, please remove your calorie counters from your computer area, close your eyes, and get into this food! We each had an opener: a mushroom risotto with cilantro, scallops and a warm lime butter (drool); the other was spring rolls with a super sweet lobster. Both were great. 

We nixed the salad and evilly plotted a shared dessert. There are nightly specials here, but they have a pretty nice standard offering too. I loved the 'am I seeing red hot' seared scallops that came with a sweet corn and yam hash and grilled fennel. My guy had pork that glazed with Bourbon and with a melted cheese pot and swiss chard. 

Okay, right about then, we were groaning inaudibly. It's not that we downed both dinners, but the food was great enough to savor it nice and slow. Thank God, the coffee came-eth. 

We nibbled on dessert: blueberry bread pudding; with whipped creme, a little bit of fresh coconut, and pineapple. 

I'm surprised the suspension in the car didn't give way when we got in. But we have a super care package for tomorrow. This was out first time here; it was lovely and mellow. Our waiter was most excellent. 

Isn't it also lovely that there are Tread-climbers for nights such as this!

This place is much bigger than the one in Oakbroak. Menu is a little bit different too. They dont have Hercules which is my husband's favorite and the only reason why I am giving them 4 stars.

They do have outdoor seating too. They are conveniently located near other steakhouse, hotels and business centers.

If we dont want to drive to Oakbrook, this is our go to pour house :)

We live close-by and the 20% off coupon motivated us to give it a try!

The food were OK, got the ribs and taco I want...but the food menu were only half a page while the beer menu were 12 pages lol but its a bar food restaurant we knew that coming in :)

Its a newly hyped restaurant...

The good...
Beautiful indoor and outdoor space
Attentive servers (our server came by three time to check in with us while we were picking out drinks).  We went on a Saturday night so it was packed both inside and out!
Have a party room 
ALOT of TVsssss!!!

The not so good...
The rib we ordered was a little dry...
The meatloaf we ordered was a little small...
The sandwich ordered was a little spicy but the menu didnt state it was spicy lol
The bar-food price is fine but the beer price it a little too high....

Very nice new establishment.  The staff was friendly and our waiter, Gus, was amazing.  They have 96 beers and 8 wines on tap and are eager to help you find those you will enjoy. The outdoor seating area is very nice and included televisions, heaters, and fireplaces. 

The food was very good, although the menu is a bit limited.

First thing we noticed upon walking in was an odd smell. Maybe like fresh paint? It was strange and off putting. It was 3pm on a Saturday, so not busy. Yet it took about 30 minutes to get drinks. Food came out relatively quickly. It looked great, but didn't have a ton of flavor. Buffalo chicken dip didn't taste much like buffalo, more like sour cream. Pour House burger didn't have a lot of flavor either. The fries were good though. And they have a large drink selection.
I know this place is still new, so maybe in a couple months I'll come back and give it a second try. But for now, not a fan.

We came here for lunch and I was impressed with the recent remodel (previously a mexican restaurant). It's very appealing inside, with cozy curved booths, banks of TVs over the bar (not too loud, a plus!) and a delightful looking patio. The beer selection is really outstanding of course, the lunch menu less so. I had a Thai chicken wrap and side of salad: $13. Pretty pricey! And I was sadly surprised that it was not in a rice wrapper as I expected, but a tortilla. I will never get used to the midwest definition of a wrap - that tortilla bit surprises me every time. And not in a good way. Anyway, this tortilla assemblage was tasty, with marinated chicken and veggies, fortunately not soaked in dressing. I like that the beers can be had in a smaller size as well as the pint. Just right with lunch. Our granddaughter (2 years old) had a wonderful lunch! A nice bowl of macaroni and cheese with a large side of fruit. She was very content with that, for which we were grateful. My dining companion had a huge burger with (okay) fries - she couldn't eat it all, so if anyone has a large carnivorous appetite it looks to be easily satisfied here. I wished for more meatless options, myself. I think I'll come back for dinner - this place seems to me to be better suited for that, atmospherically. Also, it would be a great place to come and watch a game. Oh, one other point - there's a large round table near the patio door and a tiny space to squeeze through to get to the booths. It made me uncomfortable to squeeze through there and I would have hated sitting at that table in the awkward traffic pattern. Really noticeable and should be changed.

Visited Old Town Pour House for dinner on Sunday night. It was a nice day so we sat outside on the patio. The place is brand new and has a nice modern design. The patio was nice but there wasn't enough shade from the umbrellas and there were also a lot of flying insects everywhere. Our server was prompt and courteous and made a few suggestions on drinks and food. I went with a local brew. They do have an extensive beer list. Was bummed that they ran out of GumballHead. Food wise we had the buffalo chicken dip for an appetizer and I went with the meat loaf. The buffalo dip was good. I found the meat loaf underwhelming. The carrots and peas looked like they came straight out of a freezer bag. Service was good. Not sure I would return for the food. Maybe just to have some drinks sometimes.

Service and food ate great.  Try the chicken sandwich. ..

They have 96 bears on tap from across America.

This was my first visit to this location. I've only been to the oak brook location once as well. I found the menu to be pretty basic. Small. The beers are plentiful if that's your thing. I had the clam chowder, it was odd. Lots of ingredients make it too chunky. The clams weren't fresh. My friend had ribs. She found them too smoky. They were rubbed with something and had very little sauce.  It wasn't hard to get a table at 7pm on a Saturday night.  I found the interior very cold and industrial. There seems to be a nice patio so maybe summertime will be nice outside if you don't care that the food isn't above par.

Amazing food. Fantastic atmosphere.  Great drinks.  My new go to place.

Loved the the short rib, buffalo chicken dip was really good.  Beer selection awesome.  

Our server was very friendly and explained everything we asked on the menu.

Huge outdoor patio seating.

90+ beers on tap! Do I need to say anything more!?! Ok I will.  Our services was stellar from the moment we entered to the moment we left.  I ordered the fish tacos and they were out of this world.  Our waitress made some amazing beer recommendations and my husbands burger looked great. He ordered the siracha burger and devoured it so it must have tasted as good as it looked.

Over priced for beer and food  based on quality and quantity.  Not that it was bad, just nothing special. I had a couple flights of beer - 8 varieties and nothing I would order a pint of to drink.  Short ribs were decent but over priced for the size of the entre.  Anastasia, the bartender may want to try being a princess since she wasn't interested in working to hard. She gave me a menu and took my order but that was the last I saw her until I flagged her down for the check.  I was able to get the attention of another bartender to order the second flight and a couple others for questions I had.  My advice is to walk across the Parking lot to Granite City for basically the same quality but better value and service.

We stopped by for lunch today. What an array of beer. I was impressed, because it was not the same beers that most other pubs offer.
We ordered an appetizer and 2 beers to begin.  
The crab fondue was amazing. We truly enjoyed the blend of crab and cheese with  a baguette for dipping.
I am giving 4 stars instead of 5, because I was surprised at our bill. We had a total of 6 beers and 1 appetizer and our bill was $67 before tip.  The beers were under 9%, so I was surprised at the $8/$8.50 price point.  
Overall, we had a good experience, just surprised at the price.
Great food, fantastic beer selection and great wine.  Great place to dine or watch a game.

They have a lot of beer and a full bar. That said, I don't drink. I went for the food, and it was excellent. The food ranged from comfort food (meatloaf) to trendy (buffalo shrimp) to burgers. Our waiter Marcel was great and attentive, keeping my ice tea full. I will be back.

Meh, the food quality was decent but just the portions were ridiculous for the price - a ball of meatloaf with some mashed potatoes along with some peas & carrots for $19?? Maybe they charge so much for the decor of the place , which is to be fancy and high class? I'd probably just go for the drinks - for $3 you can get a small glass of beer . Otherwise, I'd probably won't eat here again considering the price for the small portion.

5 stars for this new restaurant in Naperville area! 96 beers, 8 wines on tap and also a choice of 5 different mule types. Gus our server was knowledgeable and attentive, and the atmosphere was modern and cozy - inside and out. The menu boasts a unique selection so be ready to try something new. Overall I would recommend!

Smoked wings are a must!!  Service at the bar was efficient but felt a little loose via the committee approach. Overall very good experience and will be back when in the area. Good place to watch a hockey game!
Great place to grab a quick bite and have a beer, modern sports bar with great staff and large outdoor patio (w/ heat lamps)

Tried this out for the first time tonight. 20% off coupon really motivated the group of 4 of us to go. Overall, the food was good and the service was decent. We got a tasty veggie burger (it did not fall apart, as most handcrafted burgers do) and meaty clam chowder soup. We also got some flights of beer and a few Manhattans. The cheese curds, which we got as an app, we're off hook!!! Now you might be asking...why the 3 stars? Price. With the 20% off, everything seemed reasonable...but without it...I won't be returning for more than one drink on a random night. The restaurant is fairly new. I hope they'll reconsider their pricing, as there are lots of options right there in the same parking lot. My wife said it should be 4 stars...price put it over the top for me.
Did not eat here but did notice most beers were I'm the 8$ range, to expensive for me! Cool looking place though
Nice atmosphere, ok food... disappointed that at 5pm on a Friday night they "ran out" of Pinot Grigio.

Go for beer not food; or not at all.  Glorified bar food. Bbq Chicken salad mainly fatty pieces of chicken.  Pourhouse (i.e. Regular) burger cooled off waiting for ketchup, then on final bite small piece of bone in ground beef jars tooth.  Still a bit sore.  Ranch dressing not creamy but watery.  Samples are $3.25-4 listed;but when rung up all as $4.  Full glasses are filled 2/3-3/4 equally overpriced.

Good burger house perfectly cooked & a very fun atmosphere.  Beer selection is obviously their specialty & they don't disappoint, a lot of good quality beer to choose from.  Duck confit nachos were awesome, but the serving size is huge, you'll want to share.  They are still working out the kinks with the kitchen , our meals arrived at much different times; other than that a solid place.  The place is fairly loud, don't expect an intimate conversation.
Great food, super clean, great service!

The food and drinks were fabulous. Unfortunately,  our bartender was very rude and moody and we found the drinks and beer to be way over priced.  A basic Cosmopolitan was $14.50!  This isn't  L.A. Aside from that it was a nice atmosphere.
Terrific addition to he Naperville dining scene. HUGE beer selection. TVs everywhere, even on the patio. Surprisingly the food is pretty darn good too. Get the short rib.

Impeccable service! Michael was wonderful in taking care of our draft on 08/30 and the entire staff was great at getting our food out to us even though everyone ordered at different times! Michael was awesome at letting the girls know what was in drinks and food. The prompt and attentive service in the private room was something we couldn't have gotten anywhere else! Thank you!

Don't bother.  This place was a waste of time and money for us.  Bad, slow service with an unfriendly server, limited menu choices, overpriced food.  Our meals were not even good.  they advertise their fries as these special fries with parsley and olive oil, but they were just regular ol' fries.  I don't even drink beer so I don't care about the beer.  We just tried this place since it's new in our neighborhood.

Also, the only kind of soup they have is clam chowder; they should consider offering something more common that most people like, like french onion or minestrone.  Only about 3 appetizer choices, all overpriced.  

Very disappointing.  We will not be back and will not recommend it to friends.  Come here if you really love beer.  Otherwise, skip it.

I have to start by saying the service was great. The beer selection was okay, however, compared to competitors such as Yard House, which also offers a extensive selection of craft beer, the beer selection could improve. The sours and Imperial IPA offering was very limited.  Regarding the food, I can only speak to the Duck Confit Nachos. The duck was rather plain, however, it was accompanied by a variety of fresh complimentary ingredients. I have to rave about the house pickled jalapeos, which in my opinion was "the" accent to the dish. The cheese sauce fell far from expectations and resembled a simple roux. It needs more character.  If a second visit is merited I'd probably stick with their signature burger per the description. Let's only hope it executes well. Cheers!
Good place to watch sports at the bar. Love the duck nachos!  They also have great mule drinks. Don't like the way they do a bottle of wine. Just order glassses.
The food was ok but I would stick with the oakbrook or downtown location. The service is very poor here and even the server was very rude. It's a shame cause the outside was really nice looking.

Stopped by the other night and was thrilled with one of the best Beer lists in town. Thought that would be the highlight, but the spare rib with shrimp and grits were spectacular. I've gotten tired of sports bars with bad food and good beer or good restaurants with bottled beer. New favorite place :)

It's always $9 beer night at the Pour House if you want a beer served in a pint glass. Otherwise you pay $8 for a 13 oz. beer. They claim the beer tastes better in the small tulip glass, but we know it's just profiteering. The appetizer and service were good. Lots of TVs for watching sports, but the beer prices will keep me from going back.

Needed late night meal. Found this place..
Food was good, had a pour house salad.
Too many beers to choose from. They enjoy helping you choose.
Nice people. Good experience.
Well worth a repeat visit.

Our family wanted to try this new place out and went last night. It did not disappoint. We sat outside on the patio, which had a fireplace, flat screened TV's, and decorative lights overhead. The food and service was excellent. Will definitely go back again. One important thing I would like to add, which doesn't occur at a lot of restaurants in Naperville...they actually took a reservation for 4 people! Yeah!

I had a business lunch here.  The greeter found my reservation and got us seated. Beautiful atmosphere and decor. They had an impressive number of beers on tap, unfortunately since this was a business lunch we could not enjoy any of them so I'll have to return. Our server did not seem to be very knowledgeable about many items on the menu.  The food we ordered was tasty, well prepared, and a good presentation.  Nothing had an impressive flavor that makes you want to return for the same dish or try something new.  They are in a location with stiff competition and I think they need that in order to survive. The food was solid enough to make me return and give it another try.

My family and I went to the Pour House for my brother's birthday.  Out of my party of 7, 4 people were disappointed with their lunch.  The main complaint was the food was delivered either cold or somewhat spicy (not described on the menu for the short ribs).  I enjoyed my salad but was surprised there was an up-charge for the bread that arrived with it.

went here 3 x over course of a week staying nearby. Beer selection good and have some good local stuff there (e.g. Solemn Oath 'Pain Cave'). Food was good 1 day then at best average the next visit. Although serving staff seem friendly enough they simply are not attentive- twice we sat at bar and had to flag down other servers and in one case the front door girl in order to get the check/ service. Once when sat at a table it was 10minutes without a server coming by so we ditched. Could be much better if some effort went into customer service

First time visit to newly hyped restaurant Pour House - menu reads amazing online and reviews were great .... here's our assessment, but only in our opinions as foodies, as there were both positives and negatives, but hoping they work out their kinks.  

The Positives
- Beautiful indoor and outdoor space
- Attentive servers
- The meatloaf is some of the best around, flavorful and cooked very well, and great red eye gravy

The NOT-so Positives
- Incredibly slow bar service - us, as well as several tables we could hear around us had issues with beverages arriving.  One table had their 2nd drink arriving after they finished meal and obviously no longer wanted it, with server suggesting it could be "dessert".
- Drink inconsistency - ordered signature Cucumber melon martini - first 2 arrived green, last arrived red with server stating "it was a different bartender".  If it's one of their signature cocktails on the menu, shouldn't *all* the bartenders know how to make the same signature drink?
- Fried Pickles - too salty, especially w/ salty ranch dressing and very greasy - soaked up the extra grease of one piece that saturated a cocktail napkin
- Short-rib Dinner - $24 dinner which is one of the most expensive on the menu, mine arrived as literally 95% gristle, side of grits were incredibly bland and tasteless and gritty (not in the good way), shrimps were straight out of a grocery store pre-cooked fish department, with zero seasoning or flavor.
- Meatloaf side dishes - supposed to be Yukon Gold, but clearly russets as they were as white as rice, dry and a bit musty in flavor, carrot/pea side had way undercooked carrots to the point they were almost raw.
- Portions - seem to be the right size unless you need to take home leftovers, but their plating eludes to the fact you are getting appetizer sized portions on enormous plates.

In the end, I am not one to want to send food back and this was probably only the 2nd time I've done so, but the shortrib dinner was just incredibly awful.  The manager was nice enough to comp the shortrib meal in looking at it and realizing it was "not their standard", but assured us the "Executive Chef and two sous chefs" hold the highest of standards - may have been easier to believe had he tucked in his dress shirt and wore big boy shoes and not gym shoes.

Undecided on returning .......

First time to this location, they are only one month into making this a superb location for food and drink! We enjoyed the pretzel bites and buffalo chicken dip for appetizers. For entrees we had salmon, short ribs, barbecue ribs and chicken Caesar wrap. The ribs were on the burnt side. We also sampled the bread pudding and peanut butter cup. The pudding again was a bit overdone. Our server was present but not always aware-especially regarding drinks. Having someone walking around with a water pitcher at all times would be beneficial.

The beer selection is great but the food was terrible.  We were encourage to order the clam chowder by our waiter.  The soup was thin and watery and the temperature was luke warm.  The fish tacos lacked flavor and originality.  Stick to the beer and eat somewhere else.

I was very excited to try this new restaurant! They have an amazing beer list and cool ambiance inside, and probably the best patio in Naperville with TV's all around. I had the smoked wings to start and then tried the Pourhouse Burger which both were delicious. Friendly and attentive service topped off the experience. Can't wait to go back and catch some football games there in the near future!

Date of my visit: 13-August-2016
Time of my visit: Very, very late dinner

Full disclosure, I have been a regular here for a few years, so I will be a bit bias, as I know what's good, what's not, who is a good server and who is not.

Right of the bet, stay away from fish fries, not the best thing on the menu.  Chicken fingers on the other hand is the best thing on the menu (I promise, I will review them at a later date).

My girlfriend and I came here after a movie.  We decided to have something other than chicken fingers.  We ordered an appetizer (half an order of stake nachos, see the picture attached).  Even at half and order, it was hard for two people to finish them.  It was loaded with stake (I must say, pretty generously), cheese, salsa and topped of with sour cream and guacamole.

I ended up ordering full slab.  I opted out for fries (but if you have never had their garlic mash potato, that's a must!).  The ribs were outstanding, not the best I have ever had, but the taste wise up there.  The way I judge ribs is by bbq sauce, how it's prepared (smoked, baked, etc.), how the meat falls off the bone, chewiness of the meat, overall quality of the meat.  And yes, not being a food critic, I can tell.  The bbq sauce was good, the meat did not have any fat on it, it was not falling of the bone at a first touch, but was not hard enough to where it was hard to bit into it, it was just firm enough.

On to the service, as I always say, it's a big part of the restaurant experience.  Today, our server was awesome!  She was very attentive, very nice, checked up on us, refilled our water and got a very nice tip because of that.

Overall, reasonably priced for the area.  If you are in Wheaton, IL, definitely a must try.  A sold A+ in my book!

For delicious bar food this is the place to go. It's a family style restaurant and bar with lots of TVs, music, and outside seating. They have a large drink selection and a very full menu.

The nachos are amazing and huge. Definitely don't order them unless you are hungry.

The best thing on the menu and what is talked about the most are the chicken tenders. They come with honey mustard sauce on the side and it's a perfect combination. The platter comes with fries and a starter (either salad or soup). It's a lot of food.

They also have amazing burgers, sandwiches and salads. Definitely a good place to go with family or friends.

Food was subpar at best. I really wanted to like this place but was quite disappointed with BOTH meals i had there. Ordered what they call pork medallions but turned out to be nothing more than a VERY dry butterflied pork chop covered in sauce. It was so dry had to send it back. I then decided to order the prime rib. That was probably the worst piece of prime rib i have ever had. It was very dry and extremely tuff. Really couldn't even eat it, but didn't have the nerve to send back a second dish. My friend had the pot roast sandwich and said it was just 'ok.' Nothing special. On a side note, our waitress couldn't have been nicer. She was very nice and pleasant. I'm really sorry to say, i probably won't be returning any time soon.

I love the food, but during my lunch today I looked up and was in the path of the most disgusting dusty fake plants ever!! If this is right next to me.... I can't even imagine how the kitchen is!! Even the air cleaner filter is soooo gross!! Geezzzz... Clean your restaurant please!!! 
Won't be coming back here for a while!

On a Wednesday night, there was a 20-minute wait.

"But this is the SUBURBS," I moaned.

This isn't Schaumburg, Geneva, or some other upscale downtown suburban spot.  But Village Tavern is a local favorite, and the secret's out.  I met some friends here who live nearby, and they were not surprised by the wait at all.  20 minutes was bearable, but I'm still shocked that this casual Carol Stream spot had a wait at all.

Yes, it was worth it.  The Chicken Tenders are massive, but looking around the restaurant, supersize me portions are the norm at Village Tavern.  I only ate two chicken tenders and had a lot leftover for lunch the next day.  If you're a fan of Chili's chicken crispers, these taste exactly the same.

The rest of the menu has a little bit of everything - burgers, pork chops, salads, soups, sandwiches, there's even a fish fry.  It's all top notch comfort/diner food.

The interior isn't anything special, but it is a comfortable environment for families, to watch a game, and it was fine to grab dinner and catch up with friends.  The service was OK, we tried to order drinks but they never came.  Our food came up pretty fast and by then we were fine with the missing drinks.  This is one busy restaurant and, aside from the missing drinks, the waitress we had was pretty attentive and split up our checks without us asking.

Probably one of the best options in Carol Stream!

I love this place.  They have awesome bar food and its just an overall good time.  I have been here a few times but most recently in January.  We got some bloodies, chicken strips, and played slots.  Doesn't get much better than that!  Our bartender was super nice.  PS the ranch is awesome!  And you need to try the chicken strips!

Don't forget to check in on IG for a "free gift".

We went to Village Tavern (VT) this past Saturday night, after debating between VT and another local place downtown Wheaton. After reading the reviews on here, we decided to give VT a try.

We got there around 6:30pm and it was really crowded. The wait was about 45min for a table, however we were able to snag two bar spots right away. We actually prefer to sit in the bar area, so this was a major win. 

Our bartender was super friendly and considering how busy she seemed, she was very attentive and was happy to serve us. We both ordered drinks and took a few minutes before dinner. The place was getting more and more crowded, but it seemed like they were handling it well. I noticed back by the kitchen, the cooks put the food up on a ledge where the food runners grab it. Well what I noticed was that it seemed like food was sitting there for a very long time. I'm not sure what the reason was, but it was concerning. None the less, we decided to order dinner.

She went with the "world famous" chicken tenders and I went with the dinner special, which was the prime rib. I'm a huge prime rib fan, and even though it's not a steakhouse, this place seemed to me like the type of place that would have phenomenal prime rib, it just had that feeling. Unfortunately I was WAY wrong.

Our food came out after about 20-25min, which was to be expected. EVERYTHING was cold. Her chicken fingers, her fries, my prime rib, and mashed potatoes. EVERYTHING. Also, I had ordered my prime rib medium, which is typically a pink center, and it came out well-done. There wasn't an ounce of pink, it was completely dark, dry, and honestly terrible. We didn't want to be a pain in the butt, so we just ate a few bites each and decided we were done. 

The bill came and with tip it ended up being around $70. I must say, I haven't been that disappointed in a long time. We had read such great reviews on this place and came in with such high expectations, and they completely disappointed. The only reason it's getting two stars is because the waitress was friendly, and because they had a couple slot machines in the corner which was some fun (even though we lost). 

I'm not sure if we just caught this place on a bad night or what, but I'm not sure we'll be back. The food was terrible, mostly because it wasn't even close to warm, and my prime rib was as dry as can be. Disappointing to say the least.

We've eaten here plenty of times but had our first take out order tonight. It took over 40 minutes for a burger, chicken parm sandwich & chicken fingers to be ready. I get home to enjoy dinner with the family all to realize after a few bites of my burger that the bottom of the bun is moldly!! I was immediately grossed out & threw the entire meal away. I'm extremely disappointed & it made me question everyone's else's dinner too

Winner, Winner, Chicken Dinner!

70% of the current 170 reviews talk about chicken...and I will too!

I was in the area for an event and got out kind of late. Being that this was only two blocks up the street from where I was. I figure I'll try it out. Came in after 10 pm. Notice the all you can eat fish fry. I hadn't ate at all that day. So my attention when I ordered the fish was to put them out of business.

Fish comes with a salad or soup. I asked for the Caesar salad. Was told it was an extra $1 (call it being cheap but was a little irked by this) Salad was kind of big but I guess with all you can eat pushing something out this size is to slow a few people down. I ate about half my salad before the fish came out.  LARGE size portions so much I had to take one fillet home and didn't even ask for a 2nd round. (hit's imaginary table in defeat)  So kudos to them. Due to not being that satisfied I decided to check out the yelp and notice the mention of chicken tenders in all the reviews so got an order to go. 

Service was nice and fast overall. So no complaints there.

Food wise I didn't care for it. The battered breading for both the fish and chicken were okay, but both items had the same problem to me. The meat part was to chunky. I wouldn't say tasteless just didn't have a great taste that made me want to order it again. I had to keep dipping my fish in the tartar sauce. (I usually just eat the fish without) Not to be mean but Gortons frozen beer battered fish had better flavor to me. I didn't try the chicken right away. So having to reheat them the next day they became soggy. Due the large chunk size I ended up putting in the microwave probably a few seconds longer than normal to make sure they were hot all the way through but might have dried them out. (it's white meat so it was already dry) I will say I would love to try out the nachos something I also didn't know they were famous for until after.

My girlfriend and I LOVE this place. We're both off on Mondays and we choose to spend our day at the Village Tavern.
The food is great, the atmosphere is relaxed and Breanne is always very friendly, upbeat and gives great service.

My boyfriend suggested this place so my coworkers decided to try this place for our weekly lunch. We were seated right away and our waitress was very prompt. I got an order of their world famous chicken fingers. You get 6 HUGE chicken fingers. I could only finish half of it. I thought the food was great  and for the environment, it was a great trip away from work.

First off I'll start by saying that the customer service was excellent. Our server Gabrielle was very friendly. The Diablo shrimp, endorsed by Gabrielle,  was fantastic. The sauce was reminiscent of a light alfredo in texture but in flavor there was hint of sweet with a nice spicy kick swirling in a beautiful Orange color. The shrimp was very fresh, plump, and flavorful. The chicken fingers are made Halal chicken breast. I  could taste the difference. They had a lot of flavor, very tender, and  fried to a perfect golden better. The loaded baked potato that came with it I was just as good. They gave us so much, I think I Tapped Out after about 15 to 20 minutes. I am So...... looking forward to warming this up in the morning. Hats off to the chef!!!
Chicken Tenders are always delicious!!! You get so much food that I get 3 meals out of my dinner! Dine in and take out are both amazing

I have been here several times and had pretty good experiences. Today my family arrived around 530. We had to be seated on the patio next to a beehive. There where so many bees out there we couldn't really enjoy our meal. Which is another story. After ordering. it was 50 mins yes 50 mins until we received our food. We ordered nothing complications. Just chicken tenders and a tuna sandwich. My mother ordered a bbq sandwich which she was brought a meatloaf sandwich which we sent back. Today was very poor service and I think we will not be headed back anytime soon

For the longest time, I avoided this place because the name just makes it sound like it won't be kid-friendly.  I was wrong.
We've went on Saturday for lunch and although there were a lot of people, the space is pretty roomy and there were plenty of places to eat.  I haven't checked out the bar area, but it looks roomy as well.
I tried the fish and chips platter and wow, it was pretty hefty.  Huge pieces of fish in a beer batter of some sort.  Delicious and very filling.  I couldn't finish the plate which doesn't happen often, unfortunately.  It was still good the next day with a little nuke.
I also tried the shrimp diablo.  Nice big pieces of shrimp in a fairly mild/medium sauce.  It was pretty yummy.
They have a little kids menu with some crayons.  There is a connect the dots and some other kid activities.  Plenty of tv's, although certain seats don't have the greatest viewing angles.  The servers and staff are all very nice from what I've seen.  Both times I've went, we brought in our stroller, and everyone was very accommodating.
This has turned into a nice family lunch spot for us.  I'm glad I checked it out, you should too!

Delicious food. Their chicken fingers are particularly tasty, cooked and battered to perfection. Great family and comfortable atmosphere. My 3 year old and 1 year old girls love going here for lunch. The bathrooms are nice and easily accessible. The staff is is pretty friendly. However, I did ask for a side of BBQ sauce and was charged 75 cents for it. Not a big deal but it would have been nice if the waitress had mentioned it when I asked. It's always been packed when we went, which I always view as a good sign.

Let's face it, you go to VTG for the awesome chicken fingers and the drinks. Other than that, it doesn't stand out. Servers are usually pleasant but sometimes you get the complete opposite. Every food item is consistently mediocre. One huge bonus is the multitude of tvs playing every sport you could ever want to see. Great place to meet friends or take the kids and still be able to watch your team live. They do have daily specials from apps, entrees, drinks, and desserts. I can appreciate that. Beware you will wait up to 45 min on a weekend night. Friday is fish fry and Saturday is prime rib.

Terrible service, inexperienced cooks and extremely loud TVs.

Went there tonight for the first time, as it is near my husband's business. We were seated immediately (GOOD). Our waitress recommended the burgers, so I ordered a cheeseburger cooked well-done. My husband ordered the pork chop meal. Our food was served in a timely fashion (GOOD). I only ate half the burger--it was charred crispy on the outside and rare, under-cooked on the inside (BAD); served on a fluffy sesame seed bun that immediately fell apart into many pieces as soon as the burger was picked up (BAD); and they serve the burger dry, no mayo, no mustard, no ketchup, nothing (BAD). The fries were blah--what you get at a cheapo hot dog stand. My husband enjoyed his pork chop and au gratin potatoes (GOOD), but the carrots were very mushy, over-cooked and tasted the same as canned candied yams from Thanksgiving (BAD).

In the meantime, our waitress only came by once (BAD), right after our food was served, before I even noticed how raw my burger was. After that, she forgot about us (BAD), never came back to re-fill our soda (THE WORST!!!) until after we had completely finished our meal and were sitting there awkwardly waiting for the bill. Once we got the bill, we had to sit there awkwardly again for another 15 minutes, waiting for the waitress to process our payment. 

Terrible service and cooks that failed the How To Cook Burgers 101 class. Will NOT go to Village Tavern again.

It took 40 minutes for food to arrive. It was cold when it arrived. Informed the waitress. She said all she could do was give us a free dessert. Seriously? Won't be back anytime soon. Many more restaurants in the area to choose from!

Village Tavern is just okay in my book. I was first introduced as a tween; then I spent a couple of nights a week here in my mid twenties, and enjoyed the food on all of my visits.  I just recently visited after a long hiatus and I can see that not much has changed about VTG.  It's still dark, crowded, and smells of old grease. 

I tried the new Nacho Burger (cooked medium).  Much like the rest of their menu items, this burger was dripping with so much grease, it caused the bottom half of the pretzel bun to fall apart. So I had to go the fork and knife route.  I will say it was a tasty burger and cooked to my liking, but eating it with utensils was a bit of a turn off. 

The Chicken Fingers are alright, I'm not a huge fan.  I've enjoyed the Chicken Diablo, many of the soups, BLT, hotdog (yes a hotdog), wraps, fajitas, etc.  Pretty much everything except fish, ribs, or bbq. There's a little something for everyone, and it's all good stuff if you have an iron stomach and a short ride back to your destination.

My favorite? Honestly a full order of the nachos, with ALL of the meats, and all of the fixin's.  It can be expensive with all of the additional meat add-ons, but trust me it's the only way to go.

Maybe I'm spoiled from growing up in the area, but VTG is just an average spot with average food.  It can be a fun place to come, have drinks and watch a sports game if you're bored with B-Dubs.  It's worth a try if you're in the area.

The village tavern is an average restaurant. I wouldn't say there's anything too special about this place, other than their reasonable prices. I particularly like their chicken Caesar wrap, but more often than not the chicken quality is not the best. The interior of the restaurant could use some major updating. You won't leave disappointed but you probably won't be impressed either.

I've lived in Carol Stream a long time and this is a go-to place! You are never disappointed at the Tavern. 

Of course the Chicken Fingers are wonderful...as most people remark on. The portions are big! Sometimes I just get the soup of the day and the Chicken and I end up taking home some.

Wait staff is attentive and service is fast. And this place is always busy...it amazes. me. 

Another great service of the Tavern is that they are great at posting their specials on Social Media. So you may have Facebook on, it's getting close to lunch and THERE is the soup of the day. Makes you hungry.

I highly recommend Village Tavern for food, service, pricing, and atmosphere.

I consider myself a connoisseur of chicken fingers. That's pretty much all I would get whenever my parents would take us out to a restaurant. I could tell you which place had the best breading, which place had the stringiest meat, and whose honey mustard sauce was the most disgusting. So trust me when I say that Village Tavern has some of the best chicken fingers that I've ever had in my life. 

For $10 you get a platter of huge pieces of chicken breast, coated in a fluffy batter and fried to a golden brown. I often asked for my chicken well done, so I could get my crunch on. The fingers come with a side of their famous honey mustard, which is good. But not great.

I'll tell you what: these always gave me a wicked case of heartburn after I ate them and more than once almost triggered a gallbladder attack. #worthit

Please put a plate of these on my Dia de los Muertos ofrenda.

Updating my review and giving them one more star. They aren't quite a 5 star place and this is only beacause the service was not good again. 
My bf and I went in for a late dinner. I ordered the London broil with mashed potatoes and he got the shrimp. My meal was very good, the meat was tender, the sauce very flavorful and it was the perfect portion. My bf could not stop saying how great his shrimp were. I also ordered the dreamsicle martini which was delicious. I really like this place, if only the servers were nicer and more attentive.

This is the review for the Chicken Fingers ! And boy.. those juicy succulent battered babies were so delicious! 
They were quick for a carry out order (~15 mins) and is located not even 2mins from my home, so yes -- I'm a happy girl!

Please note that all of my reviews are relative to the type of place that it is.

This is not a 4 star gourmet restaurant.

It is worth 4 of 5 for bars that serve food in the area.

so....
The chicken fingers and nachos are always a hit.  The bar is big, and caters to a slightly older crowd. Not a bad spot to watch a game.  The service is usually good, as well as the portions.

So......friday nite fish fry....YESSS. After a long wait..ugghh....we were good and hungry and this place did not disappoint! Portions are generous (can u say 5 lb baked potato?) the dinner salad is fresh, fish is crispy and delish and nachos are baked with REAL cheese and fixings...no room for desert. Servers r friendly too. Big screen TVs to keep up with favorite sports. Great Friday nite hangout.

This was my second visit here in the past two years. I live in Arizona, but travel to the area to spend ime with family. The food here is pretty good, portions large and service is fst. The major drawback is that the staff is not very nice. Note to Nikki: Nikki, if you don't like working in a restaurant servingcustomers, you shoud quit! Stop being such a grouch! Bailey was nice in an artificial way, but much better than being grouchy.

Wow! Best chicken fingers ever! (friends dinner). Also loved their "all you can eat" fish fry on a Friday night. (and yes you can take home what's left on your plate.) Big, juicy, battered (not breaded) pieces of Cod. Batter was complementary to the fish and not overwhelming like in some places where you hunt to find the fish hidden in all the breading. We had a birthday in our party of 4 adults plus 5 kids ages 4 mo. to 13.  They brought out what looked like a quarter of a chocolate cake! Enough for at least 4 people, lol! It was moist and flavorful with tasty frosting. Our service was great and patient with the kids usual antics. I think they are open till midnight as we didn't leave until then as we were enjoying ourselves so much.
After moving away a year ago I still dream about the chicken fingers (and sauce) at Village Tavern and Grill- they win for best chicken fingers!

If you like the finer things in life then definitely come here & try the fried shrimp with their honey mustard sauce.  

The restaurant is located in Carol Stream, IL & looks cool from the outside.  It is a nice brick building & doesn't look like some hobo shanty.  The restaurant is pretty big & has has a lot of comfortable seating.  My friend & I came here & he ordered the chicken fingers & I ordered the fried shrimp with a side of honey mustard.  

The server was very friendly & kept checking on our table to see if we needed anything.  The food was awesome as well.  The fried shrimp was piping hot just the way I like it & it was seasoned good.  It wasn't bland or dry it was just right.  The honey mustard was also phenomenal.  I have rarely tasted a honey mustard better than the one that they have here.  The restaurant was very busy when we went in for lunch but it was still nice & clean.  

Overall the prices here are pretty good & so is the service.  The food was awesome & I would definitely come here again if I was in the area.

I have been here a few times. The menu is pretty big, and the chicken fingers are outstanding! Not to mention, the ranch dressing is perfect. It's a good atmosphere (always crowded when I have been there.)  Lots of tvs - good place to watch sports.

Definitely a good spot that we will visit when we go to the suburbs.

We've lived in Carol Stream for almost ten years now, and hadn't stopped in this mini-chain until recently. As it turns out, it's a good, local alternative to Chili's or the now-gone Applebees.

I had the lobster roll, which was the special for the month. There's some mention about the owners of Village Tavern and Grill being from Boston in the restaurant, and so I sort of imagine the recipe is from that part of the country. It was more creamy than lobster-y, if that makes any sense. 

My wife had a chicken sandwich, which I vaguely remember being good, and we shared potato skins. These were quite large and very greasy, but a good deal. 

Overall Village Tavern and Grill a solid place to go for neighborhood-friendly bar food.
This place is great. Everything is good. And seriously the biggest plate of chicken tenders I've ever seen. A mountain. And so good. Perfectly breaded and tender. You can't possibly finish it all.

Come for the food
Stay for the eye candy...

Seriously, the fish fry and chicken fingers are to die for. Service can be sketchy even when slow, and it has been for years. They still can't make a decent hush puppy, it's always under or over cooked. Still a great value.

I love the food here, don't get me wrong. Especially the nachos and the chicken tenders. However, I recommend going to any other location except this one. The service here is terribly slow. Waited over 30 minutes for the main course. Ridiculous. Idk if it's the kitchen's fault or our extremely inattentive waiter. He never refilled our drinks even once. Seriously, I love Village Tavern & Grill but this location is horrible service wise.
Chicken fingers are to die for....a must try.  Fish fry is delish also.  It gets very crowded, might have to wait but it's worth it!

Favorite place to eat, my go to for anyone who isn't from carol stream or Schaumburg area. I love the chicken fingers! Instead of honey mustard I get ranch but it's to die for!! And the potato skins are awesome, my advice get a half order because otherwise you just bring home wayyy too much left overs and ask for loaded fries with the chicken fingers! Yum so good

Literally just had the worst service ever in my life. If I could do zero stars I would. Our server didn't even check on us (which we had to ask another server to get her) until 15 minutes after our food and was so rude and impatient. And she was serving on two waitresses too. Manhattan's is better across the street. The mashed potatoes are embarrassingly out of a box and my sliders tasted like gross White Castle sliders.

We've been going to The Village Tavern for several years and we can consistently count on excellent service and exceptionally good food! Our favorites are the loaded nachos, Ruben with fries, chili, fried fish and more... It's all good!

So, we have lived in Wheaton for 1.5 years, and still hadn't visited the Village Tavern and Grill. Why? I don't know, I guess we're change averse. I have no good reason. We got there at 4:30 on a Saturday because... we were STARVING and had decided it was late enough for dinner. Thank goodness we were there so early, because by 5:30 when we left, there was a relatively long wait. 
Our waitress was great. I wish I did things like...remember peoples' names...because she deserves to be recognized for being a good waitress, but ...alas... I don't. So anyhow, service was great.We were told their tenders were great, so we ordered the sampler platter to try everything. Of the sampler we liked everything except the quesadilla, but I think that's because we don't really love quesadillas... so...there's that. The tenders are amazing. So, it's probably what I'll order next time. Onion straws? Yum. Potato skins were good as well. 
 We both ordered the chicken dinner, which was on special for $9.99. It included soup or salad, but with beer cheese soup we both got the soup... It was very good but very heavy... so if it's beer cheese soup day, just a forewarning, it will fill you up. The chicken was extremely good.
