Portillo's will always be bae. I mean, like seriously... There's hardly anything that could ever even keep up with this fine-ass establishment of freaking good food. I'm reviewing this just from memory of when I had it several weeks ago, before moving to Duluth, MN.

You know, there are no Portillo's here in Minnesota. Boo.
Portillos, you are my life. Double cheeseburgers + fries. That's all. Oh and cake-shakes for days.

I would give this a 3.5.
Many ppl have been recommending this place for their Italian beef sandwich.
The inside is really nice, so much decor everywhere! A very retro style restaurant. 
We had ordered the Italian beef sandwich, Chicago dog, classic ceasar salad and the chocolate cake shake. 

The only good things were the Italian beef and the chocolate cake shake. Italian beef was an overall good sandwich and very tasty.  The chocolate cake shake is good - they literally blend the cake in ice cream!!! It tastes exactly like choco cake that you drink!
However, the ceasar salad and the hotdog were not that great. The salad was drenched in so much dressing I couldn't even eat it.  The hot dog was not impressive and not that tasty compared to other ones I've eaten in San Antonio or elsewhere. 

I would recommend this place for the Italian beef and the choco cake or the shakes.  It's also really nice inside too!

I absolutely LOVE Portillo's! The Italian beef is to DIE for! It's the best when ordered dipped, my preference. If you don't like it as sloppy, you can order it with extra gravy (Au jus) instead. You can also order it dry, but I'm not sure why anyone would order it that way...seems pointless.

The self-serve cafeteria-style always results in quick service and fast food prep. I always get a chuckle of the funny quips the staff uses when they call your number. Entertaining.

This place should definitely be on your list of places to eat if you're in the Chicago area!
What can can I say that everyone else have not mentioned. This place is legendary. Go and enjoy one of the best restaurants in the country.

Love, love, love Portillo's! And of course, it's a must on every Chicago visit. Over the span of 4 days, I successfully convinced my boyfriend to have two meals here. On both visits, I ordered their burger: charbroiled 1/3 pound of juicy beef with mayo, lettuce, a tomato slice, sliced red onion, pickles, and ketchup on their freshly toasted old fashioned style bun. I really love the simplicity of their burger and yet being able to taste the freshness of the everything from the beef to the toppings. I tried my boyfriend's Italian Beef, the signature sandwich Portillo's prides itself on, and it too was warm, hot, and with the peppers, a perfect combination of meaty with a zing. 

I also had to order their fries--so delicious! On my first visit, I tried a strawberry milkshake as well and it was also super yummy. I'm not sure you can go wrong with anything here. They also have their ordering system down pact. We arrived during the lunch crowd on a busy Friday afternoon, but the friendly staff takes your order in abbreviations on a paper bag before you reach the counter to speed up the process. Even with the crowds, the wait isn't bad at all and it seems that this place has learned to maximize efficiency. Can't say anything bad about Portillo's and definitely can't wait to come back!

When we were cruising on Ogden in Naperville looking for lunch-spot candidates, Portillo's was a strong contender and a safe choice.  As my hunger level was rising, I have lost my capability to generate other alternatives.  

I had a little bit too much coffee this morning, so I decided to order a bowl of chili to for "detoxification" purposes.  Well, a bowl of chili wouldn't be enough, how about an order of Chicago style dog to tag along?  

I wish I had another stomach to scuff down an Italian beef sandwich with hot peppers.  My mind was willing but my flesh was so weak.  

That bowl of chili was quite alright, but hubby's tuna sandwich was delicious and well-crafted.  Portillo's offers many meatless options, so bring your vegetarian friends!  

I was trying to log onto their free wifi, yet it constantly flagged so 4G on my cell was the way to go.  

What was the deal with people trying to order from the drive-thru during the lunch rush hours?  I would be gladly get out of my vehicle, talk to a person face-to-face, and avoid all that hassle.

Portillo's is always delicious. I've been to this location twice now-- one of which was a late-night visit when they were about to close. I must say that I've never seen a Portillos empty until last night. It was great! However, this is an anomaly. If you come during one of the peak times, there will be a wait and a line of cars wrapped around the building.

I recommend the beefs hot and wet. Even though it's not the #1 best that I've tried, it's a really great option. Their char-grilled burgers are also on point. And don't forget the chopped salad either..  you really can't go wrong at Portillos.

A Chicagoland staple - I had a great dining experience and had a Chicago hot dog, Italian beef sandwich, fries, and chocolate cake. It was was filling and the order was pretty quick and accurate. 

I've been to several Portillo's locations and have never been disappointed.

How can someone give this place a bad review??? They have a chocolate cake shake on the menu!!!!
Unless you had some outrageous awful experience... and I don't think I've ever had this at any Portillo's I've visited!!!
This location is the closest to my home.  I've dined in and taken my food to go via drive thru.  I'm honestly not sure how the people standing outside taking your order makes the process easier for the customer, though it probably is for them...so you best know what you want when driving up, and sometimes you will have someone approach you before you even see the outside menu.  

Orders are always accurate here.  If the drive thru is backed up, they will have you pull over to a spot and will deliver your food on foot.

One thing I still need to do is sign up for that free chocolate cake on your birthday promo!!! Seriously... on it!!!

I've had it with the drive thru here! My god, these people just cannot get it right. 

1) The last four times I have done drive thru, I have not recieved straws for any of my drinks.
2) Order a chicken sandwich no mayo. Get a chicken sandwich with ONLY mayo. 
3) Order a chocolate malt. Given a clumpy chocolate cake shake with a huge ball of cake mess sitting at the bottom.
4) Order a salad. Pull over in the spot and wait 15 minutes for it. 

So done with Portillo's it's ridiculous, we'll be taking our business elsewhere after repeated mess ups.

This location always seems a little more chaotic than the others nearby. It "vibrates" a little higher, and not in a good way.

Today I was waiting on a cup of coffee. And waiting. And waiting. After almost ten minutes, I asked a man behind the counter if he could check on it for me. It took three people to finally figure out how to get me a cup of coffee. 

It was only after I made my way to the condiment station that I realized they don't stock the cream and sugar there, which resulted in another trip and another wait at the counter, trying to get someone's attention. Really ... isn't that something the server just asks, especially if they KNOW it's not offered in the self serve condiment area? 

Too much work for a simple cup of coffee, but well in line with the slightly out-of-control vibe of this place.

I'm not from Chicago, so when my bf said that Portillo's is well-known for serving Chicago's favorites like the italian beef and hot dogs...I was all for it! Who comes to Chicago without trying their food anyway? 

I got the italian beef with sweet peppers (I should have gotten hot peppers!!) and it was delicious. Definitely a favorite and I can see why everyone loves it. It's so simple yet so full of flavor. It goes really well with the cheese fries. I don't usually finish my fries, but this time around I did because they were soooo good. 

I also got a hot dog, which included mustard, relish, freshly chopped onions, sliced red ripe tomatoes, kosher pickles, and sport peppers that was piled onto a perfectly steamed poppy seed bun (yes I stole that from somewhere) with the recommendation of my bf. However, I'm no fan of hot dogs and sadly, Portillo's hot dog tasted like a regular hot dog to me. I also got the chocolate cake shake and wasn't a fan either. It was like someone chewed up lil bits of cake and spit it back out into a milkshake. I didn't like the consistency of how it felt going down my throat...SORRY CHICAGO!! But I do LOVE your italian beef. 

We came here for dinner on a weekday night and although there wasn't a long line when we ordered, it did take a while for our food to be ready. No complaints though, with such a popular spot serving great food - it's bound to be packed. We were going to get chocolate cakes to take home, but the line grew longer and we were just like 'screw it...next time'. I will be back for that cake!

Words can't express how tasty their hot dog and beef sandwich are! True Chicago food!!!

Also their beer is very cheap! $3.25 for a huge one! 

I'm so stuffed and didn't spend much at all!!! Yum!!!

2 words. Italian beef. 

Oh wait, 2 more words "with hot peppers". 

Oh screw it, fries with cheese on the side.

I LOVE portillos! I get it at least once a month. Even when I'm not even hungry and I pass it on my way home, I will order a side of onion rings with cheese. Best fries hands down in suburb area, but on the other hand I have a huge bias towards crinkle fries. It is a perfect combination of slightly crispy but with just enough potato in the center. Why don't more chains have crinkle fries?! 

Personally, I think Nicky's has SLIGHTLY better hot dogs and Tom & Eddies has SLIGHTLY better burgers, but I love the fact that you can't go wrong here- there is something on the menu that pleases everyone and for a great price! The salads are also delicious, especially the chopped salad or Caesar, which are my go-to. The food is hot and smells delicious, and forever a staple for the Chicago area. I get so excited when I get Portillos, that I can't even stop for a moment to take a picture.

When it comes to drive throughs, the line is always fast moving and the people taking orders are quick and friendly. They have never messed up my order once and with the amount of people that go through everyday, I am very impressed!

Each Portillo's is just a little bit different.  This is the first time I've seen a Portillo's where they have a separate counter area just for the salads.  So if all you are ordering is a salad, you can step up to that cash register and order and receive your salad there.  No need to get in the long line where everyone else is ordering their meals.  If you are ordering non salad items AND a salad, then you order at the regular counter and wait for your number to be called for the non-salad items.  And then through the magic of technology, the salad makers will receive your salad order and they will make it up and call your number at the salad counter.

The food we had was delicious, as it is at all of the Portillo's I have eaten at.  All of the employees were very friendly. This restaurant has a nice mix of booths and tables.

For a fast(er) food chain, Portillo's really has my heart!  I hadn't been in awhile so I found one close to the office and headed over.  Little did I know there was a drive thru and real people taking orders instead of through the automated speaker.  Service was great and super prompt.  I ordered a hot dog, burger, onion rings and a shake.  The dog didn't speak to me too much this time around.  However, the burger sang to me and just right there would've been enough.  Adding the strawberry milkshake made the meal even more awesome.  Of course I would come back!

Worst drive through, every time I come here the old people in the window  are completely rude.
Last time I asked for more ketchup after she gave me 5 packets for 4 lrg fries and 2 onion rings.  This time they ordered me small drinks instead of large, I offered to pay to get them larger- like I ordered- same two people in window argued with me instead.  Nice kid outside  said just giver the large.  Uggg no ketchup.

im a NO FRILL kinda guy when it comes to me and MY dogs. I boil em up and serve em with some wheat bunsbu hear but lemme tell u get the FRILLS
get the FRILLS
they putinf like chili n whatbnot on your dogs if you ordet em likebthat nowbthays creatice who woulsve thoufht of tjay stuff
next they gonnabhave sole sort of indiam food dogs now tha5s juts
this ia good dogs
eat here alot

What a weirdly awesome place! By 11:30am, almost every table in the restaurant was full with happy customers. Food was prepared quickly and with great taste. Everyone working (and there were a lot of them!!) had a smile on and was happy to help. We tried the double cheeseburger, Italian sub, hot dogs, and chicken tenders and were very happy with all of them. I'll definitely go back.

Yep, this is what I was most looking forward to on my trip back home!  It definitely is still my absolute favorite eating establishment!  Best burgers ever (grilled), amazing crinkle fries with a side of ooey-gooey cheese sauce, loaded Chicago hot dogs and Italian Beef sandwiches with peppers... I will probably visit Portillo's at least 3-4 times on my week long visit!  Oh, I have to also mention the chocolate cake (and the chocolate cake shake isn't bad either).  Yes,  I will gain weight this week! :)

This was my first time having a Chicago style hot dog. It was good and the service was great. 

I went there for lunch. I was able to comfortably eat and make it back to work in time.

Hot dog: yum 
Italian beef: yum
Salad: yum
I have not had one thing I didn't like about Portillos..ok well maybe the long ole lines it takes to get through to get your food, but it is so worth it and they have this whole drive through thing down.

Don't get me wrong, I love Portillo's. The ones in Elmhurst, Downers Grove, basically all around the area are top notch. The food is always incredible. Bacon cheeseburgers, beef and cheddar croissants, chocolate cake shakes... The food is the best. And the drive thru experience at Portillo's is typically a marvel of fast food buying. Two lines, employees outside taking your order, checking your order, taking your money - in all types of weather - it's incredible.

Everywhere but this Portillo's.

Our order is seriously wrong every single time. Sometimes there's no cheese sauce, sometimes a whole sandwich is missing, sometimes an ingredient we didn't want on a salad is there in droves. And while some of the employees are incredibly awesome, some are so rude I want to scream. My favorite is when I ordered my husband's drink (he hates ice, so I always ask for no ice) and it came to me with ice. I handed it back to the guy and said "oh actually I'm really sorry but no ice in this one, please. And actually it was a large not a medium." He hands it back to the girl inside the window and says "she ordered with no ice and you got the wrong size." The girl looks at him and says "what does she WANT?" And he replied (still trying to be polite as I'm literally sitting 3 feet from her) "she needs a large Coke, no ice." The girl responds, in the nastiest voice ever: "well, I don't care, because she's NOT gonna get it." And proceeds to give me a large Coke, still with ice. I just left, to avoid reaching through my car to slap her. I called corporate later but because I didn't know her name, they blew me off. 

In short, I love Portillo's and will continue to eat there... Just never when I'm in Naperville.

Arguably the best burger in town. Excellent crinkle cut fries. The chopped salad is delicious as well. Not sure how they keep the drive thru line together but they keep the line miving. A staple for fast food. Consistently very good.

This review is being written 6/5/2016 for the Portillo's Hot Dogs, 950 E Ogden Naperville, IL

This is an OK place if you're in the neighborhood and want hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches,and the like.

Note that this was a family business but was sold to a venture capital firm (Berkshire Properties) in 2014.  Mr. Portillo bought back the real estate and leases it to Berkshire.  Berkshire is in charge of all operations.

Lately, the portions (fries, noticeably) are smaller than before.  Service is still OK.  The salad ordering area has much less business than previously.  I've gotten sick twice eating the salad with the cold chicken on top so I'd skip that.  Prices have also increased substantially.

The parking lot can be be problematic as it's a bit too small during peak times.

Worst drive in operation anywhere.  Hot dog and fries and after a 10 minute line they aren't ready and make you park off to the side. This is not an isolated incident, read the other reviews too. Never again, there are many other options.

I've been to this location many times, and it's pretty much what you'd expect if you've been to other locations. This review is a mix of the food and the delivery service I tried tonight, Takeout Taxi. I've been good about bringing my lunch to work all week, but tonight my inner fat kid was screaming for "bad" food.  Nevermind that I have a wedding dress to fit into... sometimes you gotta do what you gotta do.

I placed an order for a hot dog with everything, an Italian beef dry with sweet peppers on the side, and a small order of fries. I'm a tiny lil' thing but it's amazing all of the food I can eat. I guess my metabolism hasn't given up on me yet. *knock on wood* Anywho- so I place my order online, and was given an estimated time of 75 minutes. It didn't take even close to that amount of time. No sooner than I clicked "submit", my phone rang with a Takeout Taxi rep, who was confirming that I just placed my first order. She said delivery would be $1 cheaper; I'm not sure if it's because it was my first order or my proximity to the location I ordered from. Nonetheless, a buck's a buck. I'll take it.

My food arrived 15 minutes before the promised time. The driver was super nice and friendly, despite turning into the wrong parking lot. He joked and said I have to promise to order more often so he doesn't get rusty. I assured him I would (I'm so tired of grubhub - plus there's lots of great options). 

The fries were still a decent temperature, despite the delivery involved. The hot dog was made perfectly. I was disappointed that there wasn't any celery salt, but I don't remember Portillo's ever using it. Otherwise, it was a good hot dog. The beef was dry as I had ordered it. I'm not a fan of dipped or juicy beef; by the time you try to eat it, it's falling apart everywhere. And in my OCD world, that's no bueno my friends. The side of sweet peppers was abundant; it was certainly more than I needed. Overall, I was a happy camper. 

While I don't eat Portillo's often, I've never had a bad experience with them. The only downfall is no matter what time you visit, it's always busy. I guess that's a good thing from a business standpoint. But to the consumer, it can be quite aggrivating.

This Portillos was actually great! They put on tons of hot peppers and ensured the beef was drenched in the gravy! They also asked me what I wanted instead of the soup I ordered because they didn't have my soup anymore. They gave me a large instead of a regular. The place could use an update compared to other Portillos and some of the workers seemed bored, but the food was great. The chaser was really pleasant.

What is there to say about Portillo's that hasn't been said?  

The food is fantastic.  You can't go wrong with an Italian beef (with hot peppers, of course), the beef & cheddar croissant, hot dogs, cheese fries, etc.

Like most locations, this Portillo's is a madhouse during lunch time.  I made the mistake of coming here around 12-12:30 during the week.  Parking wasn't too bad, aside from the crazies trying to park and get out of the lot.  There were spots available, but nobody drives through this lot with any concern for others' safety.

Once inside, it's packed again.  It doesn't take too long for orders though, and the employees working behind the counter are fast, accurate, and friendly.

I've gotten in and out with more ease during the crazy lunch hour at other locations.  It could just be me, but the inside of this place seems significantly smaller than others.

I have been coming to this Portillo's location for about 9 years since I work right down the street. I usually visit about once a month, and I've never felt compelled to write a review - until today. I will start off by saying that the food is always fantastic. Never had a problem with the food. Then again, I usually stick to the Chicago basics when I order (hot dogs, beef sandwich, occasionally a chopped salad) so I really can't say much about the other items on the menu. So I give them 5 stars on the food - that's a given. However, the service there is less than desirable. Today was national hot dog day, and so I figured that there would be a bit of a wait. So I actually delayed my lunch hour until 115pm, hoping that some of the lunch crowd would be gone by the time I got there. I walked in, and there were 3 lines for each cashier. Each line was abot 4 or 5 deep - no big deal. A guy came around and took my order while I waited in line (which is SOP for Portillo's), I went up to the cashier and paid. My reciept was stamped 116pm. I ordered 2 hotdogs and a small fry to go. Simple order, shouldn't have taken long. I waited and waited. Watched as other people got their food, many of which were behind me in line. Asked the girl at the window how much longer, she said another minute. Then 5 minutes went by. Finally, my food comes across the window. The time: 128pm. Unacceptable. There is no reason why my simple order whould have taken so long. No apology from the girl at the window either. I gotta say, for as much as I love Portillo's, not sure if I'll be back to this location. 5 stars for food, 1 star for service = 3 stars overall.

I probably should be giving them five stars but I just feel like I have to reserve that for my top 20 restaurants of all time. This place almost makes the cut though. A pretty famous local chain that is definitely worth going to for Chicago favorites that are difficult to find elsewhere. Things like the Italian beef and Chicago hot dog. The latter, particularly the jumbo dog, is just flat out better than other hot dogs. I'm not sure what they do to it or what meat they use but I loved it. And that's not even talking about the toppings which are not overwhelming but perfectly complement the dog. 

The fries are also great and crispy but also nicely warm and soggy in there too, in a good way. The large is only twenty cents more and worth it. 

Parking is plentiful here even though the place is huge and always busy. They do a great job with the drive through with multiple poor folks outside taking your order, taking your payment even with a credit card, even in the dead of winter.

First time I had Portillo's was in California, now that I've moved to the Midwest, I finally decided to give Portillo's a try at its birth place.  

Well, I gotta say, there's a reason they're a chain right?  Everything taste the same as it does in California =P   I got Italian beef with hot pepper in a french roll with extra dipping on the side. If you like gray, get extra gravy to dip in.  If you're getting to-go, I would suggest not get it dipped; otherwise it'll be extremely soggy by the time you bring it home. 

The maxwell hotdog is the way to go.  Charred hot dog with mustard and grill onion on a toasted buns.  Ahhh, it's making me drill just thinking about it.  The hotdog is made out of beef and it's extremely juicy when you bite into the crunch exterior.  Be careful thought, can those juices can burn you hard. 

Service... well... they got 2 lines to move the line fast, but the people at the front are not very helpful at all.  I asked for 2 sides of gravy, only got 1.  When I asked for extra gravy, she rolled her eyes at me and I waited extra minute just got it.  I'm not sure why an extra gravy would take so long, but I guess it did. 


Tip: Lunch hour can get pack, so be patient while waiting for your food!

Worst portillo's ever. Do NOT go there today especially drive-thru. Go the the one (Has a Barnelli's too) on Jefferson Ave. also in Naperville instead. Anyhoo, today we ordered a shake, soda, cheesy beef croissant,  2 burgers, fry and onion ring. One person took our order on paper, a second repeated our order on a headphone microphone,  a third put a pink tag on our car, a fourth collected our money. The fourth person apparently did not look at the tag. Charged us $20.26. I said, that can't be and handed her $40. To which she RUDELY replied "you don't have 26 cents?!?!". I gave her 26 cents, she gave me $20 back. No receipt.

We get to the window, the staff asks about our drinks. We say large Coke and a vanilla shake. They give it to us and ask us to pull to spot 2.

Another staff member brings us all of the correct food we order then snatches it out of my husband's hands as the staff at the window is screaming "bring that back!!!!".

10 minutes goes by and the fourth lady from earlier comes to the vehicle questioning us "did you pay me already? How much?"
I reminded her what happened. She asks for more money and I say "Forget it, we want a refund as the shake is melting and the food is God knows where at this point".

We got a refund and drove away.
Going down hill fast.  It took more than 20 minutes to get a hot dog today.  Food quality slipping too.

Worst Portillo's I have ever visited!  I'm writing this as I'm still waiting for my food at the drive thru, it's only been twenty minutes at 5 pm.  Many customers are complaining and leaving without their food etc...  I'm very surprised, as they usually do a good job at most locations?  Even the girl at the drive thru window was bad mouthing the restaurant, it was crazy!

Overrated. 

Place is put on such a pedestal by Chicago-land area people it is sickening. Put it this way, arguing Portillo's with them is like arguing about Jordan - impossible, and definitely not worth your time. 

Look, the food is good but there are specialty burger, beef, and hot dog places with better food. However, the fact Portillo's serves them all is very convenient.

Portillo's has killed the hot dog and sent it to heaven. I had the jumbo chili cheese dog, which was not as "jumbo" as I had expected (I'm looking at YOU, Sonic!). But it turned out to be plenty of food, at a more than reasonable price. Yum. Just...YUM.

I don't like the portillos franchise at all. Hotdogs and burgers seem to always be burnt, and the salads are always unnaturally soggy. The staff never seems to be in a particularly good mood either, which just tops the cake with the bad experience

I am a long time lover of Portillo's, especially the Italian beef with hot peppers, and if they get the order right at this branch, it's wonderful.

However, getting the correct order through the drive-thru is a major ordeal, and frankly, not worth it.  We have had our order wrong on multiple occasions through the drive-thru over the years, but today was especially bad.  We ordered 2 Italian beefs with hot peppers, a Caesar salad, a grilled vegetable sandwich, and a large order of fries. One person took the order, the other relayed the order back to the cashier, another took our money, and another told us to wait in parking spot 1.  Each person confirmed our order each step of the way, and each time, it was right.  

After waiting 10 minutes, we got our food, and the guy who delivered it asked, "did you get a salad?"  We answered "yes" since we indeed got a salad.  He took off, but when we checked the bag, it contained only one salad with chicken, and nothing else.  It took us another 5 minutes to hail back the delivery guy, and after another few minutes of him running back and forth, he finally took our order again, and we got our food 10 minutes later.  We quickly checked the bag and went home since we were starving.

When we got home, we noticed several big problems:
1. The Italian beefs were correct, with hot peppers, but one of them was dipped, and the other, inexplicably, was not dipped, and was very dry.
2. The salad was not a Caesar salad.  It was something with romaine lettuce, 2 cherry tomatoes, and a hard boiled egg, and nothing else.
3.  There was no salad dressing provided with the salad.
4.  The large order of fries was, in fact, a small order of fries
5.  The grilled vegetable sandwich did not contain any grilled vegetables.  It was a croissant filled with some lettuce, a few slices of tomato, onions, and mayo.  Since this was our first time ordering this, we didn't know if this was supposed to be the "grilled vegetable sandwich," but whatever it was, nothing was grilled about it. It did not taste good at all.

Given years of experience going to this Portillo's, these are a few tips when going to this branch's drive-thru: do not go while it's raining since it seems to be create havoc with the drive-thru, do not go during the lunch or dinner rush since they will get something wrong with the order, and really carefully check every single item in the bag before leaving.  It can get kind of hectic, but park after getting your order and take the time to open each package and check that everything is there.  Or, just go to the other branch of Jefferson to avoid frustration.

What's not to like about Portillo's?  Consistently good food.  Portillo's sandwiches have become our standard for judging all other restaurants.  Order a burger  somewhere. If it's better than Portillo's it's a very good burger.  Same for hot dogs and Italian beef.

This place is fast food without being "fast food". When you go though the drive through during busy hours, be ready to wait a bit for your food. They have a few parking spots dedicated for you to wait. The food itself is pretty good but a bit pricy. They are known for thier hotdogs, but to me they are just meh... Thier hamburgers are much better than their hotdogs IMO.

As far as I know there's nothing like it in the CA Bay Area, which is a damn shame because Portillos is pretty rad.  If I'm wrong then please aware me.  I had the Italian beef sandwich with sweet peppers.  It reminded me of a philly cheese steak a little if I had to compare it to something.  At the drive thru, people stand in line to take your order.  I've never seen this before.  The staff were all friendly as hell and the food was delicious.

Very casual pizza type ambiance where you order at the counter and you wait for your food on a tray before you sit down. 

We had Italian Beef subs (like a French Dip) and Chili Dogs.  Yummy, but fast foodish.

I love this place so much, however whenever I go there, there is always a long line, and I get it it's super good but there should be more people. But their food is way past 5 stars long with their chocolate cake shake. If you have some time go here!!!
Good food, great service! The rare instance my order was wrong, the service was no-hassle and went above and beyond expectations to fix it. Good job, Portillos :).

The last couple of times I've used the drive through here I've had a bad experience. Portillos drive-throughs often are slow but sometimes I just can't help myself--I need a hotdog. This time I thought I'd lucked out because there was hardly any line. I placed a simple order -- hotdog with no onions and a small fry.  The person taking money couldn't get her change machine to function. I smiled and told her to keep the change since I was in a hurry.

Then the person leaning nonchalantly against the takeout window said, "Do me a favor; go park in spot 2." Uh oh. Portillos has tried to speed up drive-through service by creating parking/waiting spaces. If your jet has ever gotten stuck in the "penalty box" after landing at O'Hare (usually when you have a narrow window to make a connection)--you know what I mean. So I parked in the penalty box, umm waiting spot. And waited. It was 20 minutes before my order was delivered with a perfunctory "sorry for the wait." And after all that the fries were mushy and underdone.

The chocolate cake is amazing!!! I'm not from the area, so for others like me a slice of chocolate cake is a must have. 
The burgers are great also, have the homemade feel to it, and a side order of cheese sauce is a must to dip ur fries in. It's all yummy!!

Yesterday's experience terrible.  Phoned in order for out of town guests in for Super Bowl who never had Chicago dogs or beef.  Restaurant dead, but line at carry out.  Seems more than 1 catering order not filled so staff pulled to make orders leaving rest of  carry out customers to wait in line with no acknowledgment.  Result was 20 minutes later given bags of cold, soggy, tasteless food with an attitude.  Second time in 2 months have had atrocious service with a bad attitude.

Dear Portillo's,

Stop being so delicious that I want to give you all my money in exchange for food items.

Sincerely,
Everyone
Yummy food. Very clean, good service and great tasting food. Why go anywhere else when you want fast food?

I eat here at least once a week as I do work 5 min away and there always seem to be a attitude problem with the order takers or the guy at the drive through window. 
Today I had faxed in a order for me and 7 of my coworkers and went and picked it up. Got back to work and I was an Italian beef short. I called them to tell them about it and the manager on the phone was not helpful and asked if I was sure that I had placed the order at that store when I told her I had the receipt from that address and I was there physically and called the number that was on the receipt. I just don't get it.

The food is always delicious and consistent. Today, I ordered the usual chopped salad. Sometimes it takes longer than expected, but today it was very quick despite being the lunch rush.

Bradley, the cashier, was exceptionally pleasant and friendly. Having worked food service myself, it is my biggest pet peeve when cashiers/servers are rude (ie yawning while greeting the customer, texting in plain site, or just blatantly agitated). On second thought, the only thing worse than a rude cashier/server is a rude customer (which everyone in the food industry knows there are plenty of them) so kudos to Bradley for maintaining a positive attitude; it goes a long way. 


But seriously, the food is delicious.

Never fails! Food is always good. Their onion rings are my favorite! We have never had a mistake or mix-up with our order, and our wait time has always been reasonable. Great variety, great shakes (chocolate cake shake is classic, but their strawberry shake is worth a try!), no other Italian beef like it!
Awesome tasty food with plenty of variety. Fast food Chicago style.
Awesome Chicago style hot dogs and Italian beef sandwiches.  Chocolate cake shakes are also delicious.  This has been a family favorite for years.

I got their Italian beef, dipped, with mozzarella and sweet peppers (as everyone recommended).  I also got their crinkle fries with cheese!

Right when I got my sandwich, I sat down and when I opened my sandwich bag, my entire bag was soaked because the sandwich was dripping like a shower.  My sandwich bread was entirely soaked through so much so that I was grabbing meat to eat, and the bread was falling off.  The meat itself was OK, and the cheese and peppers added some flavor but overall not very good.

Overstuffed and soggy, it was like a poor imitation of a Philly cheesesteak.  Next time (if I ever come back) I will get the dip sauce on the side.  They should allow you to order it "skinny" like Potbelly's so it's not so overstuffed and difficult to eat.

The fries with cheese sauce were good though!

Portillos, you still haven't figured out how to make the drive through work, you have failed me again as I wait in spot 4 after waiting in the drive through line for a simple beef and fry, 9+ minutes and counting since I placed my order and paid

I stumbled across Portillos when I was driving past on a Saturday and saw a long line. I figured it had to be good. I ordered their Italian beef sandwich. It was really good. One of my favorites for sure. I'm going to be eating here once a week while I'm in Chicago.

You know, it's a Portillo's and at this point they're almost like an Applebee's or Chili's. The food is okay. I got the bacon cheeseburger here and it was just all right. The evening I was there, there was a horde of tweens, screaming, leaving their trash all over the place and of course, just generally acting like idiots to the exasperation of the staff and the ire of me. 

Aside from that they charge for hot peppers on an Italian beef sandwich (not just this location but all of the Portillo's locations.) 
Who the fuck does that in good conscience? 

Seriously, Dick Portillo, how do you sleep at night knowing that you're doing the equivalent of charging for cheese on pizza? You may be able to get away with that kind of shit in your Arizona or California locations but in Chicago?! 
Punch yourself in the face.

Been going to Portillos for decades- this location is always off, mistakes long wait times, and horrible turn access
It is not the usual planning and training  that are at the other locations

You can tell that Dick Portillo is no longer around. For the second time in less than a week I have had a horrible experience with the drive-through. I didn't post anything after the first incident because hey, I've been to this location over 100 times without a bad incident. However after tonight's incident it's time to bring it to their attention.  The first incident was on July 7th at 11am, there was none of the order takers standing outside you just ordered at the menu and pulled around to pay.  It literally took 10-15 minutes to go from the order menu to the payment window.  Two cars in front of me left before paying (this locations drive-through doesn't have a cement barrier that prevents people from leaving the drive-through), I stayed in line as I had a friend from out of town that wanted a beef sandwich.

Tonight's incident was similar except they had a crew of five people standing outside working the drive-through line (an order taker who writes your order on paper, a second person who takes the paper and calls in the order, a third person who takes payment, and two people to bring food out to the cars in line).  I placed my order and again waited almost 10 minutes to get to the payment lady (mind you there were only six cars in line which normally is nothing for this location).  Finally, I get up to the second window and am told I need to park in a waiting area.  I ordered a simple hot dog and a polish, no drinks, no fries, nothing but two basic menu items.  That's ridiculous.  If anyone from Portillos wants to look into this my order number is 68, order date was 7/11/2015, and the five digit number was 40377.

What's not to love about portillos?  Everything tastes awesome, employees are always quick, kind, and smiling, and it's fast and filling!  These guys have good food figured out!  I always pretend like I'm going to try something different but who can resist a jumbo dog with all the fixins and cheese fries?  Not this guy.  Not ever.  And don't forget my chocolate cake.

Went through the drive-through at this location and they certainly have a system, but it is nowhere near as efficient as the downtown Chicago or some of the other cook county locations.  I got my usual breaded chicken with fries and a drink and had to go park in one of the drive-through wait spots for a long time.  I appreciate that they make things to order, but at the lunch rush, why????

I MISS THIS PLACE SO MUCH!  We moved from Chicago and now I can't find anything that remotely even compares to this italian beef. Their chi style dogs are also so good!  One of my first stops when I am in Chicago is Portillo's. 6 inch beef, dipped with moz and hot peppers. Sometimes I'll get the juice on the side. I crave this place all the time. They are ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS packed. But they have people in the drive thru who actually meet you at your car to take the order so you don't have to wait to get up to the window. There are usually 10 cars back in the drive thru and 2 lanes going. It's a little crazy but oh so worth it! We even had it shipped several times and it's still so good!  But I wish someone would just franchise this place and have it all over the country. No one does italian beef like Portillo's. Just sayin.  I think my mouth just started watering writing this review!!!

My first visit to the neighboring Chicago area and when you're visiting Chicago, you must have a chicago dog! My friend and I went here, both for the first time. It was busy and a nice employee helped us with our selection for dinner and how the restaurant flows. She suggested a jumbo dog to be split, fries, and their famous chocolate cake. We ordered to go and were quite disappointed with everything overall. Their dog just tasted like a beef frank and wasn't very jumbo for two people to split. Their fries were ok and their cake, I guess for a faster food type of place, wasn't too bad. I am still a big fan of Costco's hot dogs and would rate that better than Protillo's dogs. I'm not sure what the hype about this place is, but maybe we need to try their other menu items such as: burgers, salads, shakes, etc.

Stopped here on a Thursday at 3:45 PM. My order was just a large cheese fry and a drink. When I got to the window they asked what my drink was. Then I was told to park in a waiting spot for my large french fry. Took over 10 minutes to get me a fry....

Reviews about rude manager Toni Salerno are so true. Ever since she started working at this location this place has gone to hell in my opinion. Food is always cold, bathrooms are filthy and drice thru sucks. I phoned in a to go order to be picked up at the drive thru AND I still had to wait 40 MINUTES for my food. Everyone in line got food before me. I don't like giving business to an establishment where the manager thinks he/she is better than everyone. Screw this location til she is gone
How can you go wrong with Portillos.  Changed it up by getting a cheeseburger instead of the usual beef dipped.  Left there feeling full.

What a fun place, just packed and it never stopped whole we were there at lunch. Double lane coming in for drive thru and a 40 person line at the counter. They move you fast, easy menu a hot dog, Italian sliced beef sandwich , fries , drinks and a few other items. Step up give the order they write it on a paper bag and away it goes , must travel through a dozen hands , 30 employees making food atleast. You don't wait too long and a paper bag is handed over to you with a thank you. Navigate yourself to the condiment kiosk and find an empty table. Bring on the freshly baked bread, paper thin sliced slow roasted au jus covered roast beef and topped with sweet chili peppers, piping hot crinkle cut fries and a monster sized beverage. Pure heaven I will be back, wow good food assembly line style, quote fun

OMG.
what is NOT to like about portillos?
still good food.
mouth watering.
delish.
CHOPPED SALAD. (NO CHICKEN OR BACON)
LARGE FRIES.
this is all you need to know.

Chicago dog is great. Cheese fries are delish. OMG. The smoothie was one of the best I've ever had. It was a mix of all three flavors (strawberry, banana, and mango). Holy smokes it was good. No wonder the drive through is overrun. I wish I lived in Chicago.

Why all the hate for this location?

Like any Portillo's you get the same great greasy fare in this location. Who can turn down an Italian beef (dipped) with hot peppers or a Chicago dog or a charbroil cheeseburger? C'mon it's our native Chicagoan food.

I like the location because they can handle big orders with no mix ups. Plus they're pretty fast.

The one downside is entering and exiting onto Ogden Ave. It's an equivalent of hell, so don't even try.

It's not the greatest location but this Portillo's definitely deserves more credit than it has been given.

My favorite place if all time! As soon as I land my parents know to take me here before going home! 

Awesome service, friendly staff, clean, delicious food served quickly at a low cost! Really can go wrong with anything on the menu! 
Must have: chocolate cake shake, onion rings, cheeseburger, hotdog with everything, fries, chopped salad, and can't forget the Italian beef!  Oh man now I am hungry!!!

Portillos never fails to satisfy. Their cheese fries (specifically the cheese itself) is AMAZING! I've had the italian beef and it's yummy. Only think is how soggy the bread gets with the beef.

I had the double burger with cheese on Saturday. It's HUGE. Definitely worth 6.25 (cheese is 70 cents extra. price of burger w/out the chees is 5.55). I shared the large fries w/ my bf.

This place is great. They also have a drive through for those lazy asses like myself.

NOM NOM I love this place. So good and cheap!
Big Italian beef dipped with hot peppers, cake shake, and cheese fries. 2000 calories of pure heaven

Obviously, it's a Portillo's. I'm a die-hard. Anything from here will do. However, this location is NOT one of my favourites. First off, they weren't even playing Jazz music, but some horrible Jack Johnson crap that doesn't belong on the Portillo's airwaves. PUT ON SOME JAZZ AND LET ME SCARF DOWN MY BEEF, PLEASE!

The service here is GREAT. The guy inside taking my order was high energy and willing to throw around some fun conversation. Who wouldn't be excited being surrounded by scrumptious food ALL DAY LONG?! The woman handing out the bags of deliciousness was also really friendly-given, I was one excited Portillo's receiver. NUMERO UNO FAN!

I get a slew of things; this last particular visit, I did Gravy bread w/ hot peppers, a large fry and a chocolate milkshake. I always pour my fries on my beef/bread/or dog because it just feels right. I am dying to try the beef and cheese croissant. I have heard amazing things about it and after my eyes fell upon it, I knew it had to be mine as soon as the opportunity presents itself next!

Check it out if you're jonesin' for some amazing food and are in the 'ville.

Maybe it's just because I haven't lived here all my life, but I have NOT understood the Portillo's thing. Every time I pass this location or the one on 59 (or any other), I see the line of cars snaking around the building and think, "Are those people nuts? They're sandwiches!"

Well, my boyfriend and I were in that line just the other day. I was convinced to try Portillo's once more (first time at this location). I wasn't especially impressed by their burgers before, so I decided to go with their beef sandwich, and onion rings. 

This was the best choice I've made so far. I ordered it dry, which made it a little too dry I guess, but who wants a sopping wet sandwich, especially to go? I don't get it. I guess it's a cultural thing. Ahem. Anyway, still tasty enough, and the onion rings were excellent.

The "man on the street" ordering system does get things moving, though I felt bad for the person standing out there in the heat wave (likewise when it's zero degrees in the winter and they're outside). 

Overall, still don't think I'll be rushing back, but at least I can give it a little more hometown respect.

Pretty amazing stuff.  I had a  Chicago dog w/ everything and a chili dog w/ cheese and onions.  Only things I disliked were the 1)pickle spear because it was off-tasting and not crunchy 2)onions, which I wish were more finely diced because they were a bit overpowering.  
My bf had the italian sausage and a chocolate milkshake.  The milkshake was awesomely cold and thick.  It was a great way to end the night after the Chicago Auto Show.

The hype is real, Portillo's is da BOMB!

I ordered a Hot Dog with all the dressings! The Celery Salt really stuck out and enhanced the flavor. The pickle, the relish, sport peppers, mustard, etc etc ~ Mmmm! I just want to eat these everyday!

The Cheesefries... I don't even like cheese... they were sooo goood! I just kept eating them. And the fries! Crispy, potato-ey, perfect!

I sampled my friend's Big Beef sandwch, now there's some good beef!

The only thing I didn't love was the fact that my poppyseed bun was soggy, only about half of it was still bread so it didn't hold together great. Don't get me wrong, I'll still eat it, given the chance, any day! But soggy bun, a no no for me.

Having visited several other Portillo's locations and having already reviewed them, I didn't expect that my visit to the Portillo's on Ogden avenue would be different enough from their other locations to necessitate a separate review on its own. After having my hot dog, I was incorrect in this assumption.

The hot dog I received came on a standard poppy seed bun, what made this bun a little different than most was the fact that it was soggy having been steamed for too long or incorrectly. The condiment application was uneven, there was very little relish or mustard but lots and lots of onions. The pickle was the standard thick cut one used by other Portillo's locations. They applied sport peppers, but this was not long enough to have pepper in every bite.

Overall, this was a very sloppy hot dog. The uneven amount of onions, combined with the soggy bun. What makes a Chicago hot dog great is tasting every single component of the hot dog and properly complimenting the sausage without one flavor overpowering the rest. The pickle and onions completely dominated the taste of this hot dog .As with anywhere that you eat at a variety of factors such as when you go, who prepares your food, and other variables can all be significant factors in the quality of your food. However, as it stands this is my worst experience with a Portillo's hot dog yet.  Portillo's can definitely do better than this.
Beef and a dog, nothing better!
Their dipped Italian beef is a nice lunch for $4.65.  They continue to be a well oiled machine here, and can handle any crowds Naperville wants to throw at 'em, including carloads of HS students.
I had the beef hot dog with everything. It was really good! Hot dog had that crunchy casing which pops in your mouth as you bite into it.  The wait for my food was pretty long for a fast food place.
Beef, dipped, hot peppers........perfection!  Best Italian beef sandwich in the world.  Yes, the world.  I have had Johnnys, Bueno Beef, etc.......Portillo's rules!
Food is good but they manage to screw up my order every time I go. Drive through is slow and long.  Dick Portillo is a psycho path and a prick. Google it.
Can't go wrong here!  A ton of choices and not a bad item on the menu!  A family favorite for all ages!!

This is just for this portillo's location! 

The food is great like all portillos. However the people who work here are just the worst. We came in and ordered 3 beefs, and a fry to share. Paid and walked over to the other counter to pick it up. They had roughly 8 people in the restaurant. We waited and waited. After 15 minutes it was ready. The fries had sat, finished for all 15 minutes. At other locations it takes 3-4 minutes even when you have 30 people in front of you.

It's Portillo's, what do you want? Their food is amazing, and is ceremoniously the first thing I eat whenever I return to the Chicago area from traveling. I'd effortlessly give nearly all Portillo's locations five stars, but this one is a major hassle to get to because of its location on Ogden. It's both hard to turn in to, and hard to turn out of. I'm not sure you can really blame the restaurant for traffic, but, just be aware that if you go during rush hour and need to either turn left in or turn left out you'll be in for a wait.

The perfect Chicago Dog (I get the jumbo for my ideal protein to bun to condiment balance) at a very reasonable price (south of  $3 for the jumbo chi dog).  Throw in a cozy setting (nice booths, little hexagon tile floors, lots of windows), cold schooners for $3, and a collection of people to watch that rivals any airport, and you're all set for an idyllic luncheon treat.  I NEVER visit Chicagoland without at least one visit to a Portillo location, simply outstanding.

I've only been to the drive through of this one but my last visit I ordered an Italian beef, dipped, with mozzarella and sweet peppers, a Chicago dog with everything on it, a chocolate cake shake, and fries with the cheese dip.

If you get your food to go, you should expect that the dipped IB and the hot dog are going to be fairly soggy, but that's just the price you pay for ordering it to go. All of it tasted just as good as normal, but it was messier to eat which makes it difficult to eat in the car (I can't wait until I get home). I finished most of it before I got to where I was staying about 2 miles away.

As much as I absolutely adore Portillo's, scratch that, as much as  I am absolutely ADDICTED to Portillo's, my experience on the 26th or December was not a good one.  First, I went into a line around 6, I knew it was going to be good but darn it I wanted my chopped salad.  I went over there asked for 1 chopped salad, a diet coke no ice, and a small fry (for on the long ride I had to go home).  So I am in line for 10 minutes, which is fine because it's PEAK dinner time on a Friday night.  So I went through and finally got to the window where they tell you either to park or give you your food.  I kid you not, they asked me to get out of my car and get my food.  At first I was hesitant because I thought they were joking but she was holding out the food so I throw my car into park and get out of my car walk three steps to get my food.  I shook it off, but was a little miffed because I had to pick up my food out of my car in a drive through.  What ever its not the end of the world we live in a first world country where some people are lucky to have a meal. I went to go grab some of my fries because I hadn't eaten much because of a busy work day.  They forgot my fries. I was upset, yes but not that upset because I knew it was peak hours and having worked in a cafeteria I know how hard it is to get orders right.  Thinking they didn't charge me I shrugged it off and ate my yummy lemon poppy seed muffin which they did not forget and it was nice and warm.  As I got to my destination I quick looked at the receipt and saw they did charge me.  I am not going to make a fuss over 2 dollars guys but I am a little disappointed this is the first time I have had any issues with my favorite fast food restaurant.  I went to the location on Jefferson literally right next door to my work during same hours same busy day and they got my order right, same order.  Portillo's is amazing and I won't let this experience keep me from eating here.  Just a little disappointed that this happened.

Any Portillo's will give you the same great food.  Why would anyone go anywhere else for a hot dog or Italian beef?

Food is ALWAYS hot and service quick.  The smoothies this summer were addictive.

Keep up the good work and I will always be a follower.

Pretty good hidden eats here!  Lumpia Shanghai was a bit on the pricey side, however it was so fresh.  Meat was really good and not dried up inside like other places I've been to.  

Loved the BBQ skewer platter with rice and side salad.  The skewers were super flavorful and tender.  Don't sleep on this place!  A great option whenever you're hungry and at H-Mart.

Lady behind the counter was super nice as well.

Mabuhay! 

What a disappointing experience at Mabuhay yet again! :-(

2 orders of LaPaz Batchoy (tasted more like Pork Mami) and 1 order of Chicken Mami, on a Monday around 3pm...took 40 minutes for the orders to come out!!!!!  Seriously! What's happening behind those curtains? 

I am reaching out to my Kababayans. Please read the other reviews and start evaluating the service you are providing your customers. 

Mediocre food, SLOW service, messy/chaotic store front. Please, start changing things around if you would like to have a successful business.

BEWARE if you are eating out with young children! The wait is HORRIBLE! 

God Bless Pastor!

This is my favorite place to get Filipino food in the area. The owners are very friendly. I love the comfy atmosphere. I always order the pork sinigang. My boyfriend likes the sizzling sisig. It was soooo Yummmy!!!! I definitely recommend this restaurant.

I frequent this food court and have always noticed the inconsistency of this place. Why is this place constantly closed more so then the other places around it. This is not a good look Filipinos! Show that you can as hard if not harder then your competitors. So disappointed.
It does take a while to get your food, but he food itself, though not the best, isn't bad by any means. The lumpia is pretty average, but the pork bbq is quite palatable.

Okay.  So I've been here three times and ordered only crispy pata, lumpia and sisig.  My first review would've been five stars because everything was cooked just perfectly and was flavorful.  The second time I ordered, the stars would've been four because the sisig was lacking ingredient(s).  Now that I'm actually reviewing, I have to give it only three stars because the sisig was charred and near flavorless.  I'm not sure what happened to the quality of their food but I'll probably never know when they get their act together because I may never come back for a while.  It's a shame...

Super H Mart food court win!

Order anything from Filipino spaghetti to sizzling sisig! They take credit cards but have a minimum of $10. 

I ordered longsilog from the all day breakfast menu for $7.50 and a giant turon for $1.50.  Calling the turon giant is an understatement. It's the Big Mac of turons. Don't be a fatty like me...share it!  Great garlic fried rice. Even fried egg tasted "Filipino." Longonisa made just how I like it, crispy caramelized skin on the outside!  Got a complimentary but anemic cuchunta with my turon.

How could some restaurant like this stay on business! Food takes forever, almost an hour waiting! Mediocre, nothing special and bit pricey too. I'm sure this will close soon if they don't change the management. Only one person on the counter that takes order and cooks too, wtf!

Food is good but food takes forever... Today when I was ordering my food the lady that took my order was wearing latex gloves with oil and food stains on it. I thought she would takw it off since she's handling money but no she had it on at all time... Suprisingly she still had it on when she went in the kitchen and "prepared" the food. I know she didnt change the gloves since they have the same distinct stains from the previous gloves.. This made me squirm.. Halo halo is decent... 3/4the of the cup is pure ice and the rest are jello..  Bottom line is they need to keep an eye more on cleanliness and upgrade some dishes...

I found this Filipino food joint inside the HMart in Naperville in a food court.  So why the 2 stars?
1) Slow service 2) Food is ok. 3) the man didn't know how to make change.

There were 4 of us and we ordered a side of lumpia (filipino egg rolls), 2 orders of the bbq sampler (bbq chicken, shrimp, and pork on a bamboo stick )with a side of rice. Since this was a food court type setting, I tried to pay for the food and was told to pay later on after we eat. Ok? I could easily just meander over to HMart after I chowed. Oh well. The man came out with two little stryrofoam cups of chicken arroz caldo, and two kutsintas topped with toasted coconut ,and 3 sets of plastic utensils rolled together in a napkin.  Remember that there were 4 of us.  The arroz caldo and kutsinta tasted as it should have, nothing special.  He then disappeared into the curtain. Meanwhile, there were two other customers who waited.  15 to 20 minutes later, he came out with the bbq sticks. We asked for another set of utensils.  He took the orders of the two customers and disappeared again.  We finished eating our dinner, no lumpia, and no extra utensils. It must've been 35 minutes since we put that order in.  We cleared our table and no lumpia! When that lumpia finally showed up on our table, it was dripping oil.  I didn't even bother to eat it. 
So I go to pay for the food and this man forgot what I ordered. He wrote the order down as I talked.  He fidgeted with the cash register and his phone for a couple of minutes.  The situation turned awkward as I waited there.  I pretended to be interested in reading their menu to let him know that he can take his time.  The man looked at me and smiled, " So you ordered 2 bbq samplers and a side of lumpia?"  "Yes," I said. He answered, "So how much change do I give you?" I stood there and tried to do the math in my head. I had to tell him how much change to give me? whoa? Do the owners not realize that the restaurant business is cut throat? So why hire a guy who has never worked with money and customer service.  

I won't be coming back. Best of luck Mabuhay.

Whenever I go to Hmart, I try to stop by here each time.  I usually have a woman or a young guy helping me.  I always get my food to go.  I order my food before grocery shopping because I know it takes time to cook food.  This isn't a turo-turo (food ready to eat a la Panda Express); they cook the food when you order it.  Their Pancit, 2 Pork BBQ and Kutshinta combo is a steal at less than $10 and their Lumpiang Sariwa (Fresh Lumpia) at 2 for $3 is delicious and inexpensive!  And the turon is delicious too!  Too bad this place is a bit far for me to drive so I'd be coming here much more often.  I grew up with Pilipino food and I can cook it too.  I usually do not order pancit unless it's made really well and they make a real good pancit.

They accept credit cards but I believe it's only for minimum $10 orders (I'm not 100% sure on this).

I was really looking forward to the relatively new Filipino restaurant that opened in Super H Mart's food court.  I like the thin, crunchy textures and light flavors of Filipino food and had high hopes for Mabuhay.  Unfortunately our experience there was much less than satisfying.

There were 3 of us who ordered and it took 45 minutes to get my food and 55 minutes for my girlfriend to get hers (even though we ordered the same thing), while they completely forgot to make our friend's food - she ended up buying a pastry from H Mart for her dinner.  When we finally got our food it was actually pretty good, if lukewarm, as if it was just sitting in the back the whole time.  They weren't busy at all, but the explanation I got was "We are very busy," with no apology, refund or any kind of real customer service.

Maybe it was a bad day for them, but I personally will definitely avoid this particular restaurant in Super H Mart's food court.

Am visiting Naperville, this was close to my hotel! Got some stuff at HMart and it started to pour really hard! Tried this place! Service is so poor, waited 30 minutes for a simple order of pancit bihon! The place is in a total disorder and looks very messy and dirty! My pancit was over cooked and so salty!! It was a waste of time and money!

The food is great. I ordered the party size pancit bihon and it did not disappoint. Service however was not good. I went up to the counter to find my tray of food ready for pick up, I was glad that it was all set to go as I was in a hurry. There was a man seated behind the counter ASLEEP. I started calling out "hello", no response. Thinking of switching to the mother tongue, "tao po", still no response. Shouted, HELLO! Unbelievable, still no response. I'm starting to think either this guy was deaf or he might be dead, should I start calling 911 instead. I see a lady behind the curtain in the kitchen, "hello?" Also no response. Don't think I am soft spoken in calling out to these peeps. I think of all the other yelp reviews who criticized this place for having deficient service, now I know what they mean..and still Mr. Sleepy on the chair sleeps on. Finally a guy whom I presume was the cook shows up and rings me up, he had a wonderful personality, it's just too bad the other peeps he works with leaves more to be desired when it comes to customer service.

I will be making my weekly grocery at H Mart tomorrow. Thanks to the initial review, I will definitely avoid. I will give one star for the proprietors embarrassing review. But I doubt they care.  Meaning expect a new business in less than a month.

Disappointed. After trying the excellent Turon last week, I was looking forward to a great breakfast. I ordered the Longsilog and while the (sausage) was good, the rice and eggs were extremely greasy (and unappetizing). What might have been passable at $4-5 was not at $8. Also, the picture wasn't even close (what's with 1 tomato slice instead of 3?) Service was less than friendly. Probably won't return. I will be looking for the Turon elsewhere.

Been here 6 times at least. I'm a traveling consultant home on Thursday and on Friday we have made a habit of a day date on Friday while kids are in school.  This place is legit. Very fresh seafood and prepared with care to please the customer. We always split the lunch sushi special and an order of the ramen with CHICKEN (best IMHO).  Honestly never had a bad meal... every roll has been delicious.  
Staff is very nice and welcoming (despite us getting there 30 min before afternoon siesta) and the sushi chefs always yell out as we leave ty for coming.
We trust this place so much that I ordered a mass amount of Cali rolls for the last super bowl party 2016 and asked for them to be cut thinner for a party of that size. They couldn't be anymore accommodating and the rolls were a hit to guests normally used to fried whatever.  
If you are in the area hit this place up you won't regret it. Solid western suburbs sushi.
This place is absolutely amazing!!! Not only is the sushi excellent, but the service as well.  The crab roll was so tasty. I can't say enough good things about this place.

Yum. We've ordered takeout from here numerous times, and it's all been delicious. Fresh, tightly rolled, pleasing presentation, and a fine balance of ingredients. We've never eaten in, but the dining room has a lively ambience, perfect for a date. The young man who hosts is polite and professional. And I appreciate seeing the chefs behind the counter expertly rolling the sushi. Our #1 sushi place in the area! So happy this is here for our sushi cravings.

This restaurant has the best sushi! Even if we live in Chicago, we always go to this place because the food is that good. They also have a full bar, so it's a plus. Their fishes are always fresh and the restaurant itself has a great ambience too. They always welcome us with warm service. We would highly recommend this place.

This place is great. It's very close to my neighborhood and the selection range is large. The atmosphere is wonderful. The music is excellent. The wait staff is polite, and the service is good. The waitress accidentally served one of our rolls to another table - but that turned out in our favor so it was fine. The Supreme platter was delicious and so was the rainbow roll! Great place. I'll be returning it.

I can not express how much my boyfriend and I LOVE Shu's! This is always our first go to when we have a birthday or special occasion place. I do no think we have found any better Sushi in the area. The service and Is great and they always remember us!

I just don't understand all of the 5 star reviews on here. I was really excited to try this place out after seeing how many Yelpers enjoyed their experience, but mine was completely different! I am going to start by saying that the service here was excellent and I would hate to undermine any of the waitstaff because they all did a great job. Where my 2 stars come from is the food. 

I tried the combination tempura appetizer, 2 sushi rolls, and the spicy chicken ramen. The tempura starter was extremely disappointing- it literally had zero flavor...not even a pinch of salt. The sushi rolls that we ordered were ok in regards to flavor and quality of ingredients but they were rolled so loosely that they were impossible to eat without having them fall completely apart. This seems like an amateur mistake. Lastly, the spicy ramen brought the heat-but that was it. It was another exceedingly bland dish with an over-cooked egg and very little chicken to be found.

What a great jewel in Oswego! Great upscale food, lots of variety, great prices for sushi...clean and great atmosphere, perfect place for Japanese food! The ramen wasn't bad either.

Service was great!

12/30/15
Another great experience at Shu's Sushi! Food is awesome! Great service and atmosphere!

This sport was empty when we went, got one appetizer,  2 rolls and some tuna, they brought out everything one at a time which drives me absolutely crazy, bring it out all at once... One person finishes there meal before the other gets there's, who wasn't to eat like that? The sushi was just okay but I wasn't expecting much. Pretty pricy too for what they give you. Service was okay, it's casual spot, nothing fancy, nothing special.

Fantastic food we had the Philadelphia Roll, The Shrimp Yakisoba, Shrimp Tempura and Crunch Muffy.
Wait Staff was fast and attentive.

Went in last night on a lark and left totally surprised on how good this really is. Very clean Japanese styled place with staff being very attentive, suggestive and fun. You can see the owners putting a lot of love into and by the reviews so far, it's paying off. 

Starter was Ox Tail Gyoza suggested by the owners wife. Perfectly cooked, just enough sear  and not what I was expecting.  
Main course was another special suggested by owner; Crunchy Spicy Crab. This was a lightly fried tuna with shredded crab topped with fish eggs over pressed steamed rice. Very spicy indeed and was forewarned it was and should be prepared. 

At the end I wanted something for lunch tomorrow and ordered Chicken fried rice, very large portion for the price.  Sampled some before I left and enjoyed it.

Service, water was always topped off without asking, a very limited beer selection but the crafted cocktail list was solid. 

For demographics; a nice variety of people in the place. Good for a date night but also good for a group of folks. A solid take out business too as I notice a steady stream of people coming and going.

Next time I'll sit at the sushi bar and give a few items a go.

The food was exceptional, staff was amazing and very kind! A tad expensive but sushi is always a treat for us. Stuffed mushrooms are awesome, really love the spicy mini lobster roll also. They surprised my best friend with fried ice cream for her birthday and sang as well...so sweet of them. This was a great first impression and we will definitely be going back.

Give them a shot!  The food was awesome, the service was incredible and the pricing is right where it needs to be!  

Great job guys, keep it up.

No Wonder the reviews are so great here. Wow. The sushi was high quality, beautifully done with service that made us feel like we were friends of theirs. The atmosphere was comfy, large space and very well done. We had the Tuna Poki, a few rolls and the Flaming Fire roll or something. All were very fresh tasting and awesome to look at. The kids menu items were great too, our son had the teriyaki chicken one. 

I can't wait for us to go back.

Decided to try this place after seeing it on Yelp! Glad that I took the time to check it out ... it was very good!  Started with a friendly greeting from the Sushi Chefs as I walked in!  I ordered the Crazy Dragon Maki Rolls, which were EXCELLENT!  Beautiful presentation and incredibly tasty.  I also ordered the Chicken, which I assumed would come out in the typical cubed Hibachi style.  Instead, it came out as whole chicken breasts with sauted veggies and fried rice.  It had a teriyaki flavor which was great and came with Miso soup and salad with ginger dressing.  

I recommend checking this place out!

This place is really great! They have a huge menu full of tons of different sushi rolls and other options of food as well. Every time I've been in the restaurant, I've been the only customer. I hope more people find out about this place so it stays in business! The sushi is really great and a breath of fresh air after having the same rolls over and over again at Sokomoto. Our waiter was extremely friendly. Can't wait to come back!

I love this place. Stylish decor, strong cocktails, fresh, tasty food beautifully presented. Four stars just because slightly awkward service and my filet wasn't medium rare as I ordered it, but I will definitely be back to Shu's.

Chicken Fried Rice is very good, ask for Yum Yum sauce if you're a fan of Sakamotos.

Had 2 rolls, spicey moki mono and Kiss of Fire.  Moki was very good and large pieces.  Kiss of fire was excellent.

Atmosphere was pretty neat though not the greatest booths.

Awesome all the way around. Food is delicious and service by Young is always with a smile. There are 3 sushi restaurants in Oswego (I've been to them several times) but Shu is hands down the best. I look forward to going there and hope that more would check them out despite the road construction. It's worth the minor detour. Love it!
We had great food and service. Our waitress was new & did a great job. Food was delicious & very friendly atmosphere loved the decor too

BEST SUSHI EVER. The chef is phenomenal, the seared tuna was fantastic, the kiss of fire is by far my favorite.  There is no reason for me to have to go all the way to naperville for good sushi. 

We had a great waiter, he was very nice and was very knowledgeable about all the sushis and he knew exactly what you would like. I highly recommend Shu's Sushi. It was outstanding. They are very hospitable and very helpful. Five stars all the way guys . I will definitely be coming back!

After searching for a good sushi restaurant for my boyfriend's birthday dinner, I came across this 5 star Yelp review. After browsing through pics, I immediately made the decision to come to SHU's. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by the host and give a table. Our server(whose name we didn't catch), was the most attentive and friendly woman. She checked up on us and gave us some help in choosing our entree since it was our first time. The sushi was EXQUISITE. All the rolls tasted like they were fished in the back room. It was THAT fresh! You could taste all the flavors in the signature rolls, we had the Green Dragon and Green Turtle. We will most definitely make the 45 minutes drive to this place soon in the near future!

Stopped in Friday night about 730 pm and we were seated right away.  The menu looked great and we were ready for a cocktail and had questions for our server. The place was moderately busy.  So we waited.  And then we waited some more.  Another couple arrived and had water on their table and a server right away. I tried to get someone to acknowledge us and was completely ignored.  When another group arrived and was served right away we had enough.  Waiting for 15-20 minutes when you are famished is not a good time.  So we left but my wife did let the bartender/manager? know why and she responded with a weak " sorry".  
We headed down rte. 34 to another sushi restaurant and they salvaged the night with prompt and attentive service. Shu's, we will never be back!
Coming up on a year open already and we've been here since the beginning. Never disappointed. Keep up the great work!!!

Superb! We had the Kiss of Fire and The Oswego Maniac and dessert was exotic bomba ..get the Shu Mojito, it rocks!

The Service was outstanding! We will be back soon

What a pleasant surprise. As you walk in the door the sushi chefs, waitstaff, and bartender all greet you hello! The decor is very sushi modern with exposed beams and hanging lights, a huge departure from the previous tenants of the space (sillypots lol). Fresh & clean, this place is perfect for sushi. 

We tried the Maki Moto, a basic collection of their Maki Rolls with miso soup and a huge salad, and was very happy with it. The salad was fresh, big enough to share. The miso soup was simple, salty, and good. Some local sushi restaurants can have that fishy, old taste, but here at Shu's, it was fresh, light flavors all around in their rolls.   He had the Blue Lagoon that has little scallops resting atop, basically, a spicy crab roll, and it was awesome. The scallops were light, perfectly cooked, delicious.  

Only complaints:

1) We had very attentive service, albeit a bit novice. The waitstaff seems very young and inexperienced (read as awkward), though I can't complain. I was a terrible waitress once, so who am I to judge.

2) The booth tables are too low and the booth seats are too high. This makes for a posture perfect dinner. 

**Otherwise, my new sushi joint.**

Very Impressed! 

Details
I always have issues with new restaurants poorly put together that open. This place was on point the entire time. Very classy yet comfortable even for my children. The staff was very friendly and knowledgable but not over bearing. There cocktails looked amazing and were flying out of the bar.
Food
If you do not like sushi, this place has a ton of really good options from ramen noodles to chicken teriyaki. By no means is this just another sushi rest. But if you do like Sushi your in luck! Its incredible. Everything we had from the Volcano, crunchy Muffy, special spicy tuna (all cooked) specialty rolls, to the sashimi dinner were fantastic. The menu copies Sword Fish which is my favorite but now closer to home! I highly, highly recommend this restaurant! 
Do yourself a favor and give it a try! I don't give 5 stars very often but given location, food, and service. It's worth it!
We're here again, about once every 2 weeks. This place is awesome! Specials, different items on the menu, great service, great atmosphere. If you haven't been here.. .your missing out!
We had a wonderful meal. There wasn't a thing to complain about.  Every thing looked great,arrived promptly and tasted great. We plan on going regularly.

This is my family's favorite restaurant in Oswego.  My teenage son who in the beginning didn't want to go because he is not going to like sushi (although he never had sushi before) went there and ordered a nice ribeye steak (great selection of non sushi courses), after a few times going there he just orders Sushi now.

Great owners and always great service.  My wife and I are known by a first name basis and are always welcomed with a sincere hello.

you'll love it.

Came here as a last minute Valentine's Day date, since I'm a chronic procrastinator and we were trying to eat slightly healthier.  We wanted to try a new place & thought we'd give this place a try based on the Yelp reviews.  We're so glad we did. 

The place is kinda smaller and you'd probably drive right past it as it's in a strip mall with Ace Hardware and a bunch of other stores.  We had reservations at 7 and arrived just before it.  We were greeted warmly and seated immediately.  Every employee we passed on the way to our table was very warm, friendly, genuinely saying hi.  Nice start and touch! The place has a good overall decor and we were seated in a corner booth.  The only thing I'd change is make the place a little darker to add to the ambience & give the booths padded.
