The booth we were sitting in was all hard wood but we had some black leather seat backs and cushions to aid our comfort.  

Our waitress for the evening was Rebecca and she was the best!  Extremely warm, genuine, friendly, telling us what the best rolls were, what to stay away from, etc.  We were seated & she took our drink order after a few minutes.  Kelly had a mango martini which she loved.  I had a Cap'n & Diet and it was very good.  We perused the menu, though I had an idea of what I had wanted by looking at the reviews, pics and online menu.   

We ordered the poke tuna appetizer & then had 4 different maki rolls:  the Kiss of Fire (I'm a man.  Sushi.  Flames.  How do I NOT order this?), the Green Dragon, a Caterpillar roll & the Lobster Mountain (a VD special).  Rebecca said we chose excellently!  Always good to hear. We waited maybe 5 minutes before the appetizer came out.  It lasted maybe all of 5 seconds.  The rest of the rolls came out about 10 minutes later.   Everything was extremely fresh, tasty, bigger than we normally see at a sushi place and priced about the same as most everywhere else.  We loved every bite of all of them.  The Kiss of Fire had some hot spice in it, which this gringo isn't a huge fan of, but its wasn't enough to really deter me or not have a few more pieces.   For us, Swordfish in Batavia is usually the bar for our sushi.  We had mentioned this to Rebecca as she had asked what we thought. & she said that the chef actually came from there!  How awesome, yet funny!  We ordered just the right amount of food as it was almost a struggle to finish it all.  We asked for the check and it came within a minute or 2.  I gave her the credit card & we were good to go.  As we left, Rebecca smiled at us, waving while the rest of the staff all smiled and said thanks for coming, have a great night, etc. 

All in all, some very minor decor dings for me but we loved this place & will gladly go back for more!  Decor was nice & clean.  Service, both from our waitress & others, was warm, friendly, prompt, etc.  Our glasses were never empty, nor close to it.  Food was excellent, right up there with the best we've had in Illinois!    We'll definitely be back & hopefully have Rebecca as our waitress again!
Stopped with two non-sushi eaters.  They had good choices too.  Lots of good food.  Worth the stop!

Tried to eat here last night after reading all the good reviews, but left due to horrible service. The wait-staff was obviously having some horrible, catastrophic problem. We were served our water after a 10 minute wait, and after 20 minutes our drinks still had not arrived, nor was our food order taken. Had we not been so hungry it would have been quite amusing to watch our "waitress" rush from one spot in the restaurant to another, shuffling papers and muttering "oh this is crazy" whenever she passed our table.
Crazy indeed!!!!!! 
After having a wonder Mexican meal next door, we walked back past the sushi bar and noticed diners that entered when we had still had no food on their tables. Sorry Mr Shu- NO food is worth that kind of wait!

Great place..great food.
But what makes this place special is the hostess/owner Yoong ( I am sure the spelling is not correct)
She make the guest feel like long lost friends. Really amazing.
The Chilian sea bass.....worth dying for....pair it with the Happy Bride saki !
I forgot the name ...but for dessert try the chocolate covered ice cream balls. Baseball size filled with sorbet..
Fresh, fresh, fresh!!! This was a total shock to me that this far from the city I could get sushi this good! Super fresh and super good! Service was fantastic too! Presentation was excellent!
Crazy good. Very friendly. The location is further out than you think... Make sure you don't miss it

My husband and I had a great date night here! He's not big on sushi or rolls, so we got 1 roll (cooked) and ordered noodle dishes. We got the Green Dragon roll. Highly suggest it!  The husband got udon, and I got spicy ramen - AMAZING! Having visited Japan once myself and my husband numerous times, we found the food and flavors very authentic. They actually made my spicy ramen SPICY, and it was glorious. The service was ok, our waitress seemed to forget about us and it wasn't particularly busy. BUT, the Chef noticed and came over and took our orders. He seemed very pleased with our picks and did a wonderful job hand preparing them. 

I'm so happy we have a spot like this in Oswego! We'll be back for sure!

Up there with Taka Sushi for best sushi in the 'burbs.  I wish I had taken a pic of my Chirashi.  Very beautiful presentation, with plenty of care to the quality of the fish.  The maguro had no tough fascia in it, unlike many suburban sushi restaurants which use too much of the filet.  My wife ordered the Scary Spider Roll, which was made with both black and white rice, black and red tobiko, and soft shell crab.  With the sauce drizzled over it, my toddler thought it was cake!  Kind and attentive wait staff.  And they had a couple of interesting grill items, like grilled octopus balls and oxtail pot stickers.  The gyoza dumplings were fresh, not frozen.  All in all, I'll be back.  And I can't say that about most suburban sushi.

My favorite! A great attentive staff and an amazing selection of high quality sushi, as well as traditional favorites. Not much else to say, I have been here many times and they have never disappointed!
This is the BEST sushi place ever!! We love it! The food is beyond fresh and the service is amazing. Try the "Kiss of Fire"!!

We enjoy doing date nights and particular like sushi. Decided to try new spot and noticed this place had a solid 5.0 rating on Yelp. They did not disappoint. We sat at the sushi bar. The chef surprised us with a little appetizer. All the food was great. Especially like the tuna flight. All of it is very reasonably priced especially considering the quality food. Thank you very much. We will be back!

Decor surprises you when you walk in. Quite alot of space and proper Japanese decor. 

Had the edamame (ask for it angry) and couple of rolls. Very well done. Will bring the family back and try some of their dinner items. 

Wish this place success!

Best sushi in the area, very unique and delicious dishes, not your average sushi. Everything on the menu us great, great service and perfect place for a date night. Oswego and Yorkville by far the best sushi restaurant, even the kids menu is great

Food here is fantastic! Always fresh with large menu. We eat here quite a bit. We use to go to sakamoto but feel the food and selection is so much better. Young is always very nice and accommodating. She is always friendly and makes you feel welcome no matter how busy they are. I always order the bento box sea bass and it is outstanding. Prices are excellent for the amount of food you get. Thank you Yung for making me and my family feel so welcomed we we come there.

I still can't believe that we have this great of a sushi restaurant so close to home. We eat here at least once a week and everything we've ever had has been outstanding!  My husband's fave is the Tuna Gone Wild, my favorite is a Tuna/Avocado/Cream Cheese roll with black rice (special request) and we ALL love the Bacon Scallops.  Amazingly friendly staff here, too!  We love everything about this gem.

The sushi here is outstanding!   The service was a little  slow starting  but that is totally understandable on Saturday  night. Extremely clean the decor is contemporary and welcoming.

The server Alissa  was pleasant and professional (super sweet). She apologized  profusely for the long wait times.  We tried 7 different  Sushi rolls and all were superb. I highly  recommend this restaurant!

(Today they could have used quite a few more hands. .there were long wait times)

Great remodel and wonderful atmosphere 
Everyone is INCREDIBLY friendly from the wait to the chefs...Very accommodating  
Wild volcano sushi was incredible.
Kiss of fire was delish, as well,
Kids loved the Ucki noodles.
Definitely best sushi place around the area, but still relatively unknown

Not sure how this place got 5 stars. The service was good, restaurant is nice but sushi not great at all :(. We had the bento box with

Spicy tuna
Shrimp tempura
Eel and cucumber

For the second one 

Spicy tuna
Calamari one

As well as turtle

They were all tasteless :(( I hope this place improves since it is very close to our home.

Easily the best sushi in the area for miles - not kidding. Nearest sushi this good is Swordfish in Batavia and they are neck-and-neck for quality.

Spicy Tuna roll is amazing - love the wrap on the outside - wish more places would do it this way. California Roll is also best of the best on quality. I haven't gotten much into the specialty rolls yet but they sound good.

Price is a little higher but not outrageous considering the rolls are easily twice the size of other area sushi places. Lunch is a fantastic deal - 2 rolls, salad and soup for $10.

Decor is great - completely re-done from Silly Pots. It's very chic and easily outclasses the strip mall it's located in.

Please support this restaurant and keep it open. I've tried all of the other places in Oswego and down Rt. 59 and this blows them all out of the water.
The atmosphere is good but food isn't that fresh. Service was slow, I didn't get the menu 10 mins after I sat down. Some of the comments here are probably fake.

Okay, this is our third time here. and this is overdue. The design of this place is really modern (once you step inside......the outside doesn't do it justice) . Clean lines. Very tidy. Its kept very meticulously clean. 

Its location WILL fool you into thinking "uh-oh.....strip mall sushi" to anyone who is used to going to nice places........ but I assure you the chefs and their knives are quite skilled and the fish and other ingredients are extremelty fresh. 


The presentations are very skillfully displayed, and therre is a variety of eating styles catered to with their menu. American-ized dishes that involve tempura/frying and sauces are available, but more "home style" seaweeed/fish/rice combos are also there.  

The service is very good.  Greeted with well wishes....coming and leaving from the staff/gang there. The wine/beer list is "OK" but don't expect anything really fancy or a miracle.

 If one of the serving ladies reads this, I was a little embarassed to say anything, cause you're so very helpful in guiding/explaining...... I will tip you even betterr if you chew some minty gum.........she had a little bit of bad breath.......but  NOT a big deal. Again......Your service is still great, informative, prompt, thoughtful. friendly !!!!!!!

The photos that are here for you to see are extremely accurate!! !!!!The food is lovely on the eyes. it looks just like what you see. Exactly. I love that about this place.

Im a little worried that they might struggle because I haven't seen it crowded yet...........and they REALLY deserve to get people who know or appreciate high quality sushi without paying downtown prices.  Its not "cheap" sushi, but it isn't over the top, either, But VERY good people working there, as mentioned. Please support this local small business and pass the word on facebook!

Short story - SAKAMOTO is the place to go. It's fresh, quick, and real sushi.

Long Story:
We apparently went on a busy night, but that's not really an excuse. Three times the waitstaff said "Oh sorry, we forgot about you."  That's not so good, but for a new place it might have been okay.  Food-wise, is was soooo slow to arrive and overall it was meh. Not as fresh as I would have expected, and flavors were over-stated. For example,  I started with the tuna flight and some of the pieces tasted fishy and had that slivery slime when the fish is starting to turn.

We ended up leaving after almost 2 hours without having received our main course.  We called Sakamoto from the car for pick up (less than a 5 minute drive) and it was ready when we arrived.

Bottom line:  this place has a long way to go.  I"m not sure if all the 5-star reviews are from relatives or from those who don't know better, but if you're looking for a legit sushi place in Oswego, go to Sakamoto on Rt. 34.
Since I moved to Oswego 1 1/2 ago I've been missed the good sushi of the city. Not anymore creative maki rolls and excellent quality. Very tasty!

Me and my wife love sushi and we always explore new variants. We went to this one few months back on couple occasions. It was Friday night and I decided to take my wife out before we went to meet friends at the bar. We ordered bunch of rolls. All of them were presented nicely on plates and we're delicious. Our favorites are kiss of fire, black dragon, golden drsgon, green dragon......all of them are good!!! Server was njce, polite and with smile. She made sure our glasses were not running dry. We will be back soon. Check it out and you won't be disappointed.

Tonight was our first time here and I must say that everything was phenomenal! We had the crunchy spicy tuna, the white sox roll, and the wild volcano.  They were all delicious but the crunchy spice tuna was a pleasant surprise...it was a deep fried sticky rice topped with the spicy tuna #Yum. On top of the fact that the staff were all so kind from the hostess, to our waitress, and even the owner stopped by to check on us! Great dining experience and great food! We will be back soon

So amazing to have such a great sushi place close to home. While we have favorites in Batavia, Wheaton and Naperville it's nice to not have to travel when you want sushi. Sakamoto is not bad but it's small and cramped and the manager is less than friendly. We've been to Shu's twice now. I agree about the table height vs bench height but it's doable. 

Love being greeted as you walk in the door. All staff is very attentive. Both times we've been in a woman, I assume to be the owner/manager, stops by the table to see how things are. Our first visit there we were served by Rea. She has a wonderful sense of humor and is attentive. The second visit we requested her and she remembered us. Great service. 

Now for the food we've experienced:

Sake flights. They have two to choose from. They are $12 a flight that include three generous portions. The flight will last throughout the meal and pairs nicely with the sushi.

Appetizer: Ahi poki tuna. Hands down one of the best things I've ever tasted. Tuna tartar sitting on a bed of lightly salted sliced cucumbers. It is then encased in the thinnest slices of avocado I've ever seen and drizzled with sesame oil. I'm talking "last meal" good.

The rolls I've tried so far are wonderful. One favorite is the Crispy Spicy Tuna. Tuna served on a crunchy pad of deep fried sushi rice. Something I must order each time in addition to something different so that I can try them all.

My husband prefers the regular sushi. His "sampler" has included: Toro, Red Snapper, Scallop, Scottish Salmon, Sea Urchin, Tuna, Unagi, Yellow Tail and Sweet Shrimp served with the deep fried shrimp head by request. It is not inexpensive but worth every penny knowing that it is fresh.

If you like sushi, do yourself a favor and try Shu's.

I visited Shu's last night with 2 friends.
First - I have been to this location when it used to be Silly Pots, and you would never ever know when entering. The restaurant has a great modern feel to is, with a wonderful atmosphere. We sat in the booth and the only complaint we would have is that the space between the bench and the table (height-wise) was too narrow. I know that this is a typical arrangement for an asian style restaurant - just a heads up for people who need a bit more space for their legs. They do have regular tables as well.
Their menu right now is quite extensive, and the servers are good at helping you choose.
There were a few very minor glitches. I had to wait for a wine glass and a soy sauce dish when they only brought two to the table after we were seated - I guess they don't get a party of 3 very often ;-)  The staff is young and likely new, but absolutely polite and friendly. With more experience they will continue to do a phenomenal job. Our waitress came to our table after we already ordered our drinks, and asked if there was one wine we'd choose from the menu, which one would it be. I was thinking they were doing research in order to improve their menu. Little did we know, that one of my friend's boyfriend called in and ordered an appetizer and a bottle of wine for us! The staff handled it great and it was such a pleasant surprise for us.
The food was simply amazing. Unfortunately we came for a very late dinner, not realizing that the restaurant closes at 9:30 on weeknights. We didn't get a chance to try out a dessert and were unable to place a to-go order for our significant others as the kitchen was already closed when we asked.
That only means that next time we will be there extra early and allow plenty of time to try out all of the things we didn't get a chance to taste during this visit.
It is great to have a restaurant of such quality in Oswego, and especially on this side of town, away from the major shopping areas. I really hope more people will give this place a try and ensure that Shu's will stay in this location for the long run!

Gave it a second chance and back to Sakamoto I go.  I have never eaten in the restaurant so I can not comment on table service however the to go service and timing needs work.  The first time we ordered to go they gave us a 25 minute pick up time and upon my husband getting there he had to wait an additional 30 minutes.  Last night we ordered with another couple for to go and same thing happened.  I called and ordered, she said 25 minutes and my husband had to wait an additional 30 minutes?!?  On top of that he said the restaurant was completely empty so there was no reason the food shouldn't have been ready.  I have never had that happen and Sakamoto and we order fairly regularly.
Awesome food, great staff, good music, very clean, friendly!  Sushi is high quality and fresh!!! Be prepared to be impressed! Shu is the owner and he is present every time I've been.

My soon-to-be hubby and I get sushi quite often. This place exceeded our expectations! Great environment. Excellent service. And, the sushi was outstanding! We are very particular when it comes to sushi; because bad sushi is just the WORST! It's safe to say we've found our new favorite sushi place tucked away on the border of Oswego/Yorkville. Enjoy!!
Service with a smile!  Lovely people.   The sushi is BEAUTIFUL and tasty!  Funny names for dishes as well.  We get the Sushi A for a nice sample with soup and salad.
Well, yelp reviewers come through again. Great atmosphere, service and food. Two lunch specials and we were stuffed for about $25.

Haven't been the biggest fan of sushi, usually went either the wife because she wanted to try it. Shu's changed that!!! Great tasting meal. We will definitely be back. Very friendly and very delicious.
Delicious food, cozy atmosphere, wonderful service and staff.  Thanks for coming to Oswego!
Second time here.   As good as the first time.   Crunch muff and Crispy spicy tuna are very good.   Our server Zack was great.

AWASOME Sushi! Sunshine was a great hostess and had great recommendation's! As a pilot I have eaten sushi all around our great country and Shu's is at the top of my list! Great food and a great staff! This is now my go to spot for great sushi!

This place has quality sushi, even when they aren't very busy.Don't be scared by the lack of customers at lunch...you will still get quality food. The vegetarian sushi is surprisingly good (try the sweet potato roll!) and I also had a shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and california and they were all good. The hostess is sweet even though she's working on her english. Doesn't make you feel weird like other places.

The only reason this place doesn't get five stars is their seats are kind of uncomfortable. It's just a little cloth over wood.

Otherwise I would highly suggest going here!
Awesome! I'm a big fan of ramen and Maki. Nagazaki is very good. The salad dressing is so fresh and sweet.

One word - amazing!!!   We had the bacon scallops to start with, and they were fantastic!   The Oswego Maniac had just the right amount of spice couples with salmon.  The entire staff welcomed us, and Sunshine did a fantastic job making recommendations.    We are new to the area - and have found "our" Sushi bar!!

What a great sushi place! Great quality and great tasting. I think people might overlook this place because of its location in a run down strip mall, but when you walk inside it is beautiful and the staff is friendly. They also do take out!

First time for us and we had a great time! We promised each other that we would try something new with every visit. Sushi was fresh and service was very courteous and quick. We will see you there next week. Can't wait to go back :)

I waited to write a review after my wife and I had dined here a few times. Shu's has consistently served us excellent meals. High quality that rivals other snooty sushi places without the high cost and attitude. Have tried several menu items and all were very well prepared and flavorful. Recommend highly.
The food was excellent, service excellent (Zach) . nice cozy atmosphere ,  and a good bang for buck. Give it a try you won't be disappointed!
Went here in lue of my normal sushi place and trust me when i say, "best sushi I've had hands down." The presentation and everything was the best you could receive all for a very reasonable price.
It didn't last long, it's already out of business, but it was fantastic.  I loved their spicy sushi, and heavy octane beer.  I was sad to see it go.
I've never been here, but I like the picture it makes me want to actually come here to eat at some point

Pretty damn good!  I ordered carryout for lunch, bento box with crunchy California, shrimp tempura, and sweet potato rolls.  Everything was very tasty, and I shared some bites of rolls around the office with good reviews.  We will definitely be adding this to the office lunch rotation.
Great sushi, cool atmosphere, nice service from servers. They need a happy hour or some specials!

Chef Shu does it again!! If you have not stopped by, please make sure you make a point to make the trip. Have you ever had great service and top notch food in the same visit? It's few and far between, but Shu's is the establishment that does both every single time! I have officially included Shu's in my monthly expenses...yes it's that good!! Make the trip, it will be worth it!

First time but definitely not the last! Not only was the sushi presentation fantastic, it was delicious too! The dining area was nicely decorated and very clean. And the staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to make us fee welcome!
So glad to have a great sushi place close to home.  Ordered take out and everything was packaged really nicely.  The ocean drive was a favorite. Definitely give this place a try.

Wonderful place, cool atmosphere, great service. We had the miso soup (yum), cucumber salad (dressing was amazing!). My husband had spicy tuna and spicy salmon rolls; said they were great, with just enough heat. I tried something different, the Blue Dolphin roll. It was really good. We will be going there again!

Incredibly friendly waitress, hostess and even the chefs!  Great food and drinks. Looking forward to coming back. Had the bacon wrapped for an appetizer and it was excellent. Staff wanted nothing more than our complete satisfaction.
Food and service are very good. A great surprise in Oswego. They have a wide variety of roles and the seafood is very fresh

So happy to have awesome sushi (and more) so close! My toddlers loved the seafood meat noodle soup (forgot name), steamed spinach w peanut sauce and mochi ice cream balls. My husband ordered 3-4 fancy huge sushi rolls and we devoured them. I absolutely loved the mushroom (shiitake?) rolls. All fish was very fresh and tasted great. Staff was so friendly and did their jobs very well. We love sushi, are kind of snobby when it comes to quality :-), and are soooo pleased Shu's came to town! And the fact that they are so kid friendly means wel'll be back often.

We grabbed take out because I wanted to eat in the comforts of my own home and wow! We ordered white sox roll, spicy tuna and crunchy muffy, so amazing! When I went to pick up the staff was so friendly and decor very clean and modern. We will definitely be back to dine in.

First time trying this restaurant. I read the reviews here, and decided to give it a go for lunch. We will definitely be back. We have been loyal to Wild Tuna in Naperville for many years, but wanted to try local. We have been to Sakamoto in Oswego several times, and it was ok. This place is fabulous! Fresh seafood, great rolls, and excellent service. So many places don't make it in our town, unless they are chain restaurants. Please visit Shu's and help keep it in business!!

Fairly new entry to the Oswego area for sushi that will compete on very even terms with my previous fav, Sakamoto. Stopped in for dinner on a weekday night around 7 and place was empty, which is never a great sign. Three in our group, we ordered 6 assorted rolls based on our server's suggestions to try out as well as dinner salads. Salad was delicious, with just the right amount of ginger dressing and very fresh lettuce and other add-ins. The rolls were....well, very, very delicious and expertly prepared. We enjoyed all 6 & I wish I could remember the names but I leave it to my daughter to do the sushi ordering when we head out to eat sushi since I'm kind of a novice at it. The decor is very comfortable and everything in there just felt clean & that great care was put into designing the place. One other very appreciated touch is that there is good spacing between the tables so that, unlike Sakamoto, you're not sitting directly next to other patrons as if they were in your dinner party. Server was terrific & very attentive (yeah, I know--- I said the place was empty so maybe she was just trying to keep busy...)  :)   I'll give her the benefit of the doubt as she was very pleasant & her service seemed very genuine.

Highly recommend it and while we still like Sakamoto for the food, I believe we'll be stopping in at Shu's a LOT more frequently when we look for sushi!
Amazing place. Hidden gem in oswego! Dirty old man plate was the best i have ever had! Good for kids and date night. Great service.

I was visiting friend of mine from city and decided to try this new sushi restaurant that was just opened in the neighborhood. Our whole dinning experience was wonderful. They had a wide variety of nigiri's and Maki selections along with specialty appetizers. We started off with tuna flight appetizer and it was very fresh and presentation was amazing. Move on to main dish I picked nine pieces of chefs choice nigiri along with the rainbow roll. The nigiri was one of the best I ever had. It contained perfect balance of rice and fish altogether. Rain bow roll was very delicious as well. My friend ordered ribeye steak dish and spicy tuna roll. He also was satisfied with his food and we both had a great time catching up with great food and drinks. Btw they had a full bar with wide range of wine choices. It was nice to find such authentic Japanese restaurant out in the burbs with great food and ambience. Definitely will be back when I'm up there again. Looking forward to try many of their other specialty rolls next time!

went for lunch. waiter was very friendly and greeted at the door.. the menu is really large with so much to choose from I went with the nigiri lunch special and added a spicy tuna roll and for an app had an oyster shooter.   the food was excellent. the oyster shooter was great and I was happy to see it on the menu as it seems to be rare around here.. the spicy tuna roll had great flavor and spice. the nigiri was great and tasty.. presentation was first rate..   you must try this place... we will be returning often., dont let the strip mall look outside and construction stop you. inside is really nicely decorated... my dad had the white sox roll which I also tried and it was great as well... over all very happy and will be having my parents birthday at the resturant soon!

Get your self in here soon. Far and away the best Sushi around. For starters we have the angry muscles. Absolutely outstanding. I had the New Orleans roll and our friend had the I Oswego maniac roll both were excellent!  For dessert, the Green Tea Ice Cream is very soothing.

My girlfriend and I love this place. Attractive girls, delicious food and affordable beer. What's not to love? 

We try to eat something new every time we go to Twin Peaks and we have yet to be disappointed. They have a ton of TVs so it doesn't really matter where you sit because you will always see one. The manager is cool and we requested a game to be played on the big tv in front of us and he played it! 

I would rather go here for a game than anywhere else. Beer is the same price as any other place but it stays cold and it seems to taste better when it's 29 degrees lol.

Went there for dinner with my friends and received terrible service. We had someone take our drinks and had them right away. But we were pretty hungry and we had to wait for more than 40 minutes before our waitress could even notice our existence. She was serving people right next to us but never asked us what we wanted to eat, if we were doing fine, NOTHING!!!

The worst part is we had to stand up and literally wave at her to get her attention and we asked for the check because we did not like the service and mentioned to her that we waited for so long and no one asked us what we want to eat. She was totally unapologetic and she got our checks and just left. WORST SERVICE EVER!!! We walked into the Buffalo wild wings right across which turned out to be great.

I live down the street and usually will go only when my roommates do, which is every other month. Only complaint I really have is the service is very slow and they forget orders all the time. Not sure if they're overwhelmed or just not component, but it's rather obnoxious when I order a basic burger with a beer, and the burger gets over cooked or comes out a sandwich. If you do go in, ask for Emily. She's the best!

Atmosphere is really cool tho. I enjoy coming here for sports and a quick drink after a movie at the theatre. Plenty of TV's and usually always have all Chicago teams on, even the Cubs for some reason.

Food is average. Menu is plain and not a lot of variety. My favorite it the Hangover burger and onion rings! Their beer is always below 32 degrees and served in a tall frozen glass. 

P.S. If you take your girlfriend here, she will hate you after. Lol

There is a variety of casual sports bar themed places in this general area, but I won't list them all here.  At a co-workers suggestion, a group of us came here during the week for some drinks and food.

Two people in our group commented about the small food menu.  The menu is typical bar food:  fried appetizers, burgers and sandwiches, salads, etc.  But overall the variety was far less than similar restaurants nearby.  You really can't go wrong with chicken tenders, mozzarella cubes, and fried pickles though.  There's cold beer and a full bar too.

I had to laugh at the "man" and "girl" sized beers.  It's smart marketing, as only the most confident of man would dare order the "girl" size.  Yes, it's sexist, blah blah blah...but seriously, you know what kind of place this is by the name "Twin Peaks."  Despite that, families can safely come here.  The waitresses wear short shorts and crop tops, but it's actually less revealing than what most women wear to the local pool.

We had a great server who returned to our table frequently to check on us and handled our drunk co-worker with a good sense of humor.

Twin Peaks is OK.  I wasn't impressed by the food or drinks, but it's an alright place and a decent watering hole after work hours.

Full on annoyed. I haven't gotten terrible service in a LONG time. Even if you look at my past reviews most have had nothing to say about terrible service. Reading my previous review from this place ...IT WAS ALL FOR SHOW. These hoes do not give a flying fuck about you unless you have a dick. A girlfriend and I came here for drinks since I'm right around the corner from work.

We only had 1 order of man sized dirty blondes which were great per usual but our waitress sucked. Katelynn walked past us not once not twice not even three times but a fourth time when I had my credit card ready to be billed 20 minutes ago. To add insult to injury it was going on a 5th time but my friend threw the bill
In her face as she attempted to walk by.

Unbelievable, and of course tending to the male population first. I am always a great tipper and it was going to be 20% till this occurred. Totally ruined my perspective of this place. Over it.

I met one of my friends here for dinner recently. He suggested we meet here; not sure why he picked this restaurant, but here goes nothing.

Place was about half full when we arrived, and we were seated promptly. We took a few minutes to decide; there's nothing special about the menu. They have  typical bar fare, including sandwiches, burgers, and hot dishes (i.e. pot roast, fish, chicken, etc.) If you aren't aware, Twin Peaks offers eats, drinks, and scenic views. The latter refers to their scantily clad dressed waitresses, a la Hooters or Tilted Kilt.

My friend ordered the blackened tacos with a side of broccoli. I ordered the grilled chicken and shrimp combo, also with a side of broccoli. He enjoyed his dish, as did I.

Our service was a bit slow; not sure why it took so long to make some simple dishes. Waitress was nice; I kind of feel bad for the waitresses who work there, but I'm guessing they make decent money, and they choose to work there. I guess I could never wear what they wear and be comfortable. Although I don't know when I would ever be comfortable in short shorts and a shift that shows my stomach. I guess that's a #guyproblem.

Total was 26 and change. A bit pricey in my opinion for the amount and the quality of the food. I don't really have anything negative to say about the place, but there's nothing that great about it either. Very cookie cutter. Would I go back? Possibly, if I had a coupon or something.

Clientele was heavily male, as expected. Lots of golfers were dining in when I went there. I guess going to Twin Peaks after golf is a thing.

Extra 1/2 star for them holding onto my credit card and not losing/using it. Always good to know I can be stupid and trust strangers.

Not sure I agree with many of the negative reviews for this place.  For my first time at TP's I met a buddy at the Warrenville location.  Almost Immediately I was impressed with all of the TV's, there must be AT LEAST 100 here, at least inside as there are a handful of TV's outside as well!

Right away I was greeted by 3 easy on the eyes hostesses upon my entry.  I sat over at a high table section for 2.  There isn't a bad view because every direction is a sports highlight on TV or a TP waitress which isn't bad at all!  My waitress, Keirsten, was great!  I never had to ask for refills as she replaced my drinks when they were low, even during the busy Friday lunch hour.  You will want to ask for Keirsten's section if you want good service!  I never had to wait for anything, and she always made sure we didn't have any issues.  Again, I'm not sure why this place got any negative reviews about the service.  Maybe it was former employees?

Now let's get to the food......surprisingly really good!  Maybe they worked out their kinks now as this place has been operating for a year now.  I ordered the Buttermilk chicken sliders for appetizers which were phenomenal!  Batter Fried Chicken and thick cut bacon seasoned with brown sugar, red chili flakes and smoked paprika served on honey butter/jalapeno gravy buttermilk biscuit?  These 3 sliders were ridiculously awesome!  Who wouldn't want to eat chicken like this?  Probably people who frequent KFC and Popeyes!

Next came the house salad with Honey mustard dressing.  Damn, its better than your average house salad!  I can eat a salad everyday if its this good!  For my main meal, I ordered the B.E.L.T sandwich and fries.  Bacon, Fried Egg, Pepper Jack Cheese, Lettuce, Tomato and Cilantro Pesto Mayo! Yes, Yes and Yes!  This is a really good sandwich!  Only thing is that I wish it was triple layered!

The Fire Fries that came on the side.....OUTSTANDING!  I'm not sure what spices are in the fries but they are one of the best tasting set of fries I've ever had!  Believe me if you know me, I've had a lot of fries :)

Why you should come here: The Service, the Atmosphere with the 100 TV's and the Quality of Food at reasonable prices.  Forget Buffalo Wild Wings, this is the Ultimate Sports Bar!

If you are undecided about coming here, give the place a try you wont regret it, especially if you are coming for a sporting event.  You will be surprised how good the food is and the beer which is served at below freezing temperatures!

Having been to the other location in Wheeling, i just had to go here and compare this place especially after it was highly recommended by my brothers and cousin... This place has its high points-like a much better atmosphere and service was quick! The B.E.L.T. was good!

My wife and I are big fans. We went in on a Saturday noonish. We were seated immediately. We were asked as we were seated if we had been there before. I had, however my wife had not.

As we looked through the menu, we were about to order some chips and queso when the manager appeared and said he heard my wife had not been here before, he wanted to welcome us and had brought over a plate of chips and queso. Nice move!

We decide to get a flavor for their specialties. For another app, we ordered the Billionaire Bacon. It was good, not as exceptional as the description would indicate, but good.

We both got the Bacon Burger. Contrary to what some others have written here, we found it excellent. I prefer mine medium rare, she prefers hers burnt beyond what a good forensic scientist could identify. Both cam out prepared exactly as ordered and were great.

While we didn't have any beer this time around, we did take note that the have a thermometer hooked up to their draft beer that consistently displays on a large sign the current beer temperature which the sign brags is always below freezing (it was).

Service was excellent and the server explained things very well and was very attentive. We generally don't do desserts, but our server suggested trying the sundae. After about 2 maybe 3 seconds of arm twisting, we spilt one before leaving.

Both my wife and I will be recommending this to friends.

Went with my husband and a business partner on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't very busy. The service was very attentive. We had a Triple Play appetizer. Loved the warm chips and the guacamole. The cheese sauce and the bean dip were ok. I had a chicken sandwich and a side salad. The sandwich was good and the salad was great, lots of varied greens. My husband had the Sicilian sandwich and he said it was fantastic. We sat inside but the outdoor seating looked really nice and there were outdoor heaters.

Great experience! I stopped in for lunch and beers. I've been here a few times and it's usually too crowded to sit at the bar. I was able to sit at the bar today because I walked in shortly after they opened. 

I love the welcome by all the servers when anyone walks in. It's nice to know the staff appreciates everyone coming in. The team at the bar was awesome!!! They wrote the girls name down and had it in the cup with the tab. I usually forget names so it was nice to have the names there. Ayanna, Ashley, Emily were a fantastic team! All the girls came by an introduced themselves. They kept our beers full and were available when we wanted to order food. 

Loved the food!! I've always had something different but the food today was my favorite. We shared the blackened chicken quesadilla and the ranch chicken sandwich. The food was delivered hot and quickly. 

Overall- awesome experience! Friendly & accommodating staff with great tasting food- I will be back soon!!

Kinda sad that this place doesn't have a better average review :( I'm not one to be offended by restaurants like Twin Peaks, so I was just excited when another restaurant finally opened in this location. Each time we've come, the servers have been extremely helpful and personable, always giving great suggestions when I can't figure out what to order! Last time we were there, we had the kiddo (good variety of kids menu!) and a random waitress came up and started talking to us. Although our waitress was awesome, this other server asked if it was ok to give kiddo ice cream...just because :) I seriously can't say enough about the service we've had here ;)

Typically we'll start with the mozzarella cheese bites. I think they're coated in panko, and they're absolutely delish! The quality of cheese they use is very stringy and a great melting cheese. Usually this is a burger place for me....they don't have an extensive menu, but the things we've had are good! The hangover burger is nice and juicy and has great flavor. One time I did opt for the BLT (was a special....I don't think they currently have it on the menu) which was again delish! Both have always been paired with their mac and cheese, which has a good balance of cheese. 

For the beer lovers, it seems like this is a total beer place. They have a temperature gauge of the current on-tap drinks. They have an extensive drink menu....maybe we'll try that another day :)

I hope their reviews increase, because they've treated us well each time we've come out!
I highly recommend their turkey smash w/ bacon and guacamole.  Plenty of TVs for game days.

I went here with a co-worker for a quick meal and beers.  The beers were very cold (as advertised by their real-time beer temperature meter), the food was delicious and our server, Nicole couldn't have been more attentive or charming.  In general it was a good experience.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the area! I always sit outside on the patio with Stephanie, Kyrstyn H, or Dallas and they all consistently show me a memorable experience. Great new menu items, improved recipes and fun cocktails! I had the Sicilian sandwich and a liquid marijuana to drink

Came in to watch football today had Chyy again but on the floor this time instead of the bar. 
 Excellent service,food, and of course cold beer. Will be back again soon!

I absolutely LOVE this place!

The food is fantastic, drinks are even better and the "scenic views" are spectacular!

Go for lunch/dinner because the food is great.
Go for a game or drinks after work because their isn't a single bad seat in the house.

My wife, parents and I all went on Sunday 10/18/2015 to watch the Bears/Lions game.
Everyone from the greeters (at the door) to the assistant manager (young female, didn't catch her name) to our server (Stephanie) were friendly, helpful (great menu suggestions from Stephanie) and seemed happy to be there (not common for this "type" of establishment.

Yes, the "gimmick" is attractive young women in revealing outfits...a.k.a a "breastaurant".
If thats you're thing you WILL NOT be disappointed.
But even if that's not for you...give this place a shot as it's much more than just that.

The boy's dad got us tix to the Wolves game, so we needed some pregame fuel! It was guys night so we needed a place that was fitting of the theme... The boy's dad wanted to check this place out since it was new and we hadn't been there yet.

I had the Sourdough BLT with Creamy Tomato Soup & Mashed Potatoes... I can't say that I was overly impressed with the food. It wasn't even really average. It was bland and lacked seasoning.

The boy ordered the The B.E.L.T. Burger with Fire Fries & Mac n' Cheese... I'm not sure what makes the Fire Fries fire, but he had the same comments regarding his food that I had about mine... Bland... 

Our server was... Well... Weird... I get that they are supposed to "be nice" to the boys. Our server sat down at our table for almost the entirety of our stay! She talked to my father-in-law so much that I thought she was going to ask for his number! It was absotively creeptastic! We will not be back. Even the boy and his dad said she was way over the line.

Been here for 2 hours with a party of 9. They won't seat us. There's a big table in front open but it's been on hold since before we got here. 

Good job, Twin Peaks management!  Hope that empty table earns you the money of 9 big, fat, hungry, thirsty guys. 

Hostesses Sara, Allie and Paige and manager (big white guy) just didn't care at all. On the way out they offered to kick out people, despite the big table still being open.

I've been here twice and most recently, yesterday, on Valentine's Day.  Hey..don't judge me, it was my wife's decision.  Anyways, I like the place.  They don't have much of a food menu here...the majority are app's and hamburgers.  Their drink menu isn't overly extensive either but they have a respectable number of beers representing all of the different styles.  Most come here because it's a decent place to have a beer and catch a game.  Yeah, there's also the obvious reason why guys enjoy it, but aside from the Peaks you've got a million large tv's  and they open the garage styled doors when temps condone it.  The outside terrace offers extended seating and a large firepit.  Cheers.
Had s great time with Nicole as my server! She made my experience fun and never had an empty drink!

Absolutely love this place! The girls are fantastic. my boyfriend and I come here all the time. I don't feel like I'm getting any less attention then the guys who come in. The beers are super refreshing. The menu has a good selection, if you do end up here try the Texas style philly. It has the right kick of heat.

The girls are great, the food is delicious (especially the newer Turkey Avocado Smash Sandwich!) And the beer is always cold! So glad that Twin Peaks is going back to its old sexy ways! Definitely coming back more often again!

Dear Yelp - please give us .5 star ratings...I'd be down for giving this place 2.5 stars, though I gave 3 stars for the politeness of some of the ladies working at this establishment, but really leaning toward something in the 2.5 range rather than 2.

Before continuing, in the defense of this place - we happened to come here on a night a very important Blackhawks game was on tv.  Now that practically the entire state of Illinois has hopped on the Hockey Bandwagon, every eating/drinking establishment is packed full for these games!  I didn't go there FOR the game, though I was down to watch since I was there catching up with a friend over food and drinks before catching a movie at the Cantera 30 across the parking lot.

We got here probably before the game started, we didn't know what time it started but the girl at the hostess desk said 55 minutes for a wait, took my name & number and said they would text me when our table was ready.  I really like that text feature places have adopted.  She suggested waiting at the bar which was 99% full already but we decided to make our way over for a drink...this is when things started to go wrong.  I'm pretty sure we were the only two girls AT the bar...totally crashing that sausage party going on, and clearly we were invisible to them as they served males coming up to the bar AFTER us as we stood there forever waiting... then we decided to move to the corner of the bar, waited a little longer till finally we got waited on.  

Just a tip here for the ladies who work at these kinds of places...I totally get that your tips are made off these guys who come in and drool over you, but put yourself in our place and give us the service we would like to receive too because we also tip!  I tip on service, and clearly the bartenders weren't up to par.

After getting seated we literally waited another half hour with our empty beer glasses for our waitress...I knew this because the text came in at 7:30 and by 8:00 we still didn't get help.  I walked back to the hostess stand as I experienced something similar a few weeks ago at another place in Oak Brook and said nicely "I get this place is super busy, but we have been sitting at our table for a half hour now and no one has come up to our table"  The staff member was super nice about it and said...I know we're busy but it's still unacceptable and got our server over to us immediately.  She apologized and thought we already had a server because we had our beers (which were at the bar) and something about table reassignment... after that she was super sweet the rest of the time and very attentive.  We ordered a few more beers, a few honey badger shots and three appetizers, one which was free for signing up on their email list.

Again, not the BEST experience, but I didn't walk out of there with a bad taste in my mouth since those big mugs of beer (man-sized) were reasonable, the food was decent, and the service got better after a rapid decline...they were busy and since they are fairly new, maybe they just don't know how to handle this crowd.  I'm not sure...I'd probably come in here again, just not on a big sports game night! :)

I meet up with a couple of friends yesterday it was my 2nd visit there and the staff was top notch the drinks was ice cold food was good I can't wait till my next visit there and our server was the best beautiful personality.. Great job

Definitely returning. My server was excellent. Treated me and my family as if we were VIP. Alaya was my server short, and dark hair. So respectful for the environment she works in. The food was good but the ice cold beer was even better. We will be back thanks again Alaya for making my afternoon.

I like the concept, I was just hoping for more, done better.

I had pretty high hopes for this place that touts itself as a lumberjack (sorry, lumber-'jill') version of places like Hooters and Tilted Kilt.  Because honestly, how can you not compare them?  The plaid flannel and khaki short-shorts uniform is a fun [read: hot] idea, but I visited on a night when the entire waitstaff was wearing--get this--bunny outfits.  As in, Playboy.  Normally, this would send over-sexed dudes like me into a frenzy, but the rabbit ears, poofy bunny tails and other mismatched apparel seemed wildly out of place.  One server even had an ammo belt (?) as part of her get-up.  Dining here felt more like a trip to a Lovers Lane lingerie store and less like an outing for beer and food.

Despite being seated quickly, our server took forever to welcome us and was generally slow to act in getting our orders placed.  Other tables were getting talked up quite a bit, whereas our waitress had no time for such trivial chit-chat.  A teensy bit of innocuous pseudo-flirting wouldn't hurt your gratuity, just saying.  Also, the menu is tiny!  Not physically small in your hands, but my easy-to-please friend and I were appalled at the limited selection.  Bar apps, sandwiches, burgers.....and not much else.  Vegetarians, you're on your own.  Want something besides a salad?  Good luck.

Perhaps this location is undergoing some growing pains, but given that they're a chain, these issues shouldn't exist in all honesty.  That said.....

The venison chili was incredible.  Very hearty, peppery, and plenty of meat.  All it needed was some cheese & onions, and it'd be damn near the BEST cup of chili I've ever had, no foolin'.  I ordered the Twin Peaks sampler, which came with buffalo chix strips, breaded pickle chips, and mozzarella nuggets.  Pretty standard fair, although it was nice to see mozza bites in something other than extruded 'stick' form.  It also came with ranch, blue cheese, and marinara; being a fancier of sauces, I appreciated the abundance of dipping choices.

My buddy got the chicken and shrimp, which he proclaimed good.  The steak fries that came with it were notably great, as they were dusted with some sort of southwestern seasoning.  The beer was cold, and reasonably priced, I thought ($5.75 for a 20oz mug of their weissbier).

Mediocre menu selection and subpar service doesn't leave me aching to return.  In my opinion, Twin Peaks falls somewhere in between Hooters and Tilted Kilt as far as 'breastaurants' are concerned.  In ascending order (from bad to good), it looks something like this: TK -- TP -- Hooters -- Brickhouse.  Tilted Kilt is far-and-away the worst of the bunch, and Brickhouse still reigns supreme.  So essentially, Twin Peaks runs in the middle of the pack.

Would return, I guess, with some hesitation.

Service wasn't good.
I feel like the waitress hate this place.
Table was super dirty and they took a long time to clean it. 
Food wasn't that good either...

The eye candy is ok for the suburbs but the food is horrible! I work in the area sometimes and I love the "breastaurant" idea. You'll find some cute girls here but the 3 times I've been here I haven't wanted to finish my food and had no interest in taking it with me. It's bland. It's basic, it's worst then basic bar food. 

Because I like breast, I've come back here to try it again. I REALLY wanted to like it but the main entrees suck. Even simple things like a burger w/ fries. =( 

If this place had great wings like hooters or even decent food, it would be awesome. It looks the part but just doesn't cut it with the food.

First time here. Great experience. Our waitress was super amazing. Refilled drinks without us asking, very attentive, explained menu items; not to mention having a great personality. The manager came to welcome us with a free appetizer and even brought our food out. 
The cheese bites and chips and queso were delicious. The philly cheese steak was kind of bland , could have more seasoning , but not bad. Chicken tacos were moist and flavorful. Will totally be back.

Live there... . After work casual drinks. A rocks pour is a single and service is getting worst every time we go :/ 
Coming from the service industry.... Over charged is the normal and zero comps.
My first time to The Man Cave.  Good food, locally sourced. Clean and classy. Celeste and Georganna bring charm and wit to the scene. Lovely. Look forward to my next visit!
The girls here are super nice!! Celeste and Klaudia were great! Always made sure our drinks were full and the food was good.
Food is ok. I really come for the cold beer. Its served at 29 degrees! Food is just ok.

Went out tonight with a couple friend and the service exceeded expectations. Our waitress Ashley did an excellent job. The food and drinks are amazing. Would highly recommend you go eat here for a guys night out.

Ice cold beer was all this place had going for it.  My buddy and I went to a local wing joint on Saturday but they were packed and there was zero chance to get any food. We decided to drive down the road and give Twin Peaks a shot. The idea of scandalously clad woman was the main driver but we were also hungry. We were greeted relatively quick and taken to our booth. There were tvs everywhere you looked which made watching the packers cardinals game enjoyable. Our server arrived and that's where everything took a turn for the worse. She was sweet but her acting felt forced. We ordered a few beers, a man size and a lady size...poor marketing in my opinion. 

She recommended the billionaires bacon for an appetizer. It was decent. It was cold and greasy which was ok because it's bacon, but the presentation was piss poor and the portion was pathetic. We finished our beers and our bacon and continued to wait for our server to place our entree order. We waited and waited some more. We noticed a good amount of standing around on the line by the service staff. It seemed they were there more for the social aspect than to actually do any type of work. Once our server finally realized we were still in her section, she graced us with her presence! 

We ordered chicken wings(green chili Parmesan and ghost pepper for sauces) and the Chicken Ranch sandwich. The food showed up remarkably fast. The lack luster presentation was to be expected but I had higher hopes for the flavor. The wing sauces were decent but the wings were almost under cooked. There was zero crisp to them and somewhat slimy. The chicken ranch sandwich was bland and disappointing. Our server decided to grace our presence roughly eight minutes into our meal. She never once asked about the wings(of which I had only eaten three of the twelve), but she did ask about the sandwich. She mentioned that she had it once and it was not good and she would never order it again....thanks for the heads up!

I did notice what looked to be a manager wandering between three different points in the bar; the host stand, the well area, and the kitchen line. Not once did I see him stop by any tables or speak to any guests at the bar. I decided he needed to know about our experience and approached him at one of three places, the service well. I explained to him that I didn't want anything for free, I just needed him to know about our poor experience. After a brief conversation, I returned to my table and waited for our server to bring the check. The manager stopped by and apologized for the service and food and took the entrees off the check. As generous as that was of him, it's not enough to make me return. 

If you don't care about food or service quality and you are going for the "entertainment" than this is the place for you. There are similar concepts that at able to do it all well, this isn't one of them.

At first we thought it was the service that was so messed up but actually its the management that is dropping the ball.

Poor front of house seating organization, waited 45minutes for a seat when 40% of the restaurant seating was open

Bad/unusual bar tab policy, paid cash and they still wanted to run a credit card

Food orders incorrect, Forgot the meat for our appitizer

Servers are sweet, cute and full of fire, but the place is managed by amateurs

A new take on Hooters and the Tilted Kilt. Typical pub fare except with the coldest beers. Being the "cool" uncle and having a beer with the nephews. 
I really wish that yelp had a font in the voice of Tim Allen from Tool Time doing his caveman voice, because this place celebrates your inner caveman. Is it a place I would take my mom? Well yes, but that is only because my mom and dad used to take my brother and I to the Playboy Club as kids. Is Twin Peaks as classy as the old Playboy Cub? No, but times have changed and the Club was 60's to 70's chic and Twin Peaks hits a vibe that appeals to today's youth that isn't offended with young ladies dressed as " Lumberjills". Heck, Victoria Secrets even has a nationally televised underwear....I mean "fashion show".
The food is comfort food with a risqu theme. The beverages follow the same theme, and all seems rather tongue in cheek and in good fun. Is it a 5 Star gourmet restaurant, no; but it's a great place to watch a game with the guys (and girls not put off by the costumes). The decor is a mountain or cabin theme, beer is colder than ice cold (29 degrees) and they have theme nights that follow holidays and even sporting themed events. 
So, if your a fan of "Hooters" or "Tilted Kilt" types of "breasturants"give them a try. Easily offended, my recommendation would be to avoid Twin Peaks.

Dated concept and just ok food but the girls are nice and it's not bad just for a beer. Don't go to Twin Peaks for incredible service ... most of them are newer and get no training however they are very nice, energetic and young. As a female, I enjoyed it there but the concept is a bit dated to me. The food was better than I thought but overall, I probably wont be back.
Awesome place! Great food, great service and coldest beer in town. Will go again and again!

Love all of the Twin Peaks locations. Awesome food - always fresh and made from scratch. Our wonderful server Stephanie reassured us  Billionaire's Bacon is a MUST! Tried it on my burger - AMAZING! Thank you Steph!

Got dragged here by my office mates and it was surprisingly a good time. The food was much better than most sports bars or other 'breastaurants'. Good service and cheap beer. The service was great and yes, the girls are pretty.... cant really review a place like this and not mention that. Overall if your looking for the sports bar atmosphere with a lil sumthing extra, this is your best bet.

Gotta say the service sucks here! It's slow and slow and really slow. The concept of having a sense of urgency doesn't exist here. Taylor doesn't suck here. She's cool. That's about it. The food offerings are mediocre. My 2nd visit here was even more disappointing. The strange mix of taxidermy & 90's music & sports bar theme & ski lodge doesn't help either. Overall, I give this my first official "fuck this place of douchery" award. I wish I would have gone to Rock Bottom for bad Bloody Mary's next door.

I went here on Friday night with a group of friends for my birthday.  The place was absolutely packed with people, so it took about an hour to get a table.  Once we got our table everything was much improved.  Our server was absolutely awesome, she was attentive and quick with the food and drinks.  The place is new, so I was expecting some hiccups with the service, but everything was great.  If you don't know, the place is sort of like Tilted Kilt or Hooters, except with Northwoods lodge feel to it.  Young, attractive women serving cold beer in short shorts and revealing tops.  If this is your thing, check it out.

The food.... Several of us got the cheese cube appetizer and I would highly recommend it.  You get a huge serving and the cubes are really good.  I got the chicken fingers with fries and they are very good, although pretty standard fair.  The only item on the menu that really needs help is the burger.  No one at our table liked the burger and I've had the Twin Peaks burger at another location and it was the same.  It's a very thin, grey, frozen patty and it definitely needs some work.  If you are going to cater to males in their 20-30's you should have a killer burger and this one is below average.  Everything else on the menu is great, just avoid the burger. 

The bathroom... In all my years writing Yelp reviews I've never once mentioned the bathroom, but here it goes.  There is a 3" gap around the stall doors in the bathroom, so you better not be shy if you are going to use a bathroom stall.  I checked with some of the females in our group and the women's bathroom is the same way.  They literally might as well just remove the stall doors and have you do your business in front of everyone.  Hopefully this is something that is being fixed.

Anyhow... in summary.  Great service, cool atmosphere, great food (except for the burgers) and odd bathrooms that need some work.  I will definitely be back here.

First off I will say I was worried to bring my wife and kids inside a breasturant but it wasn't as bad as I thought but wheatnights and prudes may see it different.  

Very nice place lots of TVs good drinks.  Tried a Tom Collins for the first time.  It was excellent!!!  Ordered the Hangover Burger it was great but had one big complaint.  The burger patty is extremely to thin and small for the bun size.  It explains why they never asked how I wanted it cooked. 

I would also say it's a little over priced for what you get that's why they didn't get 4 stars.

"There are few times in life when a meal is so expertly crafted and planned that it's nothing short of genius." The TP menu is comprised of numerous meals like this. They have a great selection of beer on tap,  but I frequently wash down their tasty food with their delicious house brew. 
The service is always fantastic.  The staff is always courteous and friendly, frequently checking in on their patrons to make certain they have a fantastic dine in experience. The entire staff is great, but if you ever get a chance to be waited on by Ayanna, or served by her at the bar,  take full advantage of that opportunity, you won't be disappointed. She always goes above and beyond to ensure that the customer is having the best possible experience. She is very sociable, outgoing and will likely put many smiles on your face.  I cannot say enough good things about her. She must be part owl cuz she's a reallllllll hoot! ;)

Mojito mojo going on at Twin Peaks. Maggie is the shiznit!

Weather forecast is 27.4 degrees (beer temp) it's the beerpocalypse!

Good food but slow and horrible service and the place wasnt even busy. 

Food was good but the service overshadowed everything. Appetizers came out way after we got our main meals. Our bill was all wrong. Not sure if this was all due to our specific waitress. Once seated we waited quite a bit to get helped, and again they werent busy and had what seemed to be plenty of staff. 

I never write reviews, ever. My experience was so poor I was motivated to write this review.

We read all the reviews and we're skeptical about going here.but after our visit, we will definitely return. 
We were seated right away, the waitresses were all great especially Ashley. She tended to our every need, was extremely nice and fun to talk to. 
The food was very good, the beer was very cold, it was an enjoyable experience.

Well the atmosphere is cool, sports bar in a lodge etc.  the menu is not very descriptive, 3/4 of us didn't get what we thought.  I ordered a side of green beans got a bowl of bacon with 2 greenbeans. Beers were cold, server was not good, no ketchup till we were all almost done.
Katie was great. Very friendly and fun. Our food was great and she checked on us all the time. Request her if she's working.

Came here for the Mayweather-Pacquiao fight and paid $20 cover, which I thought was reasonable. The decor is nice and new and there are TVs EVERYWHERE which makes it perfect to watch sporting events.
Drinks: i ordered a mint julep since it was derby day and was told they didn't have the ingredients to make one. I settled on beer but the bf got a Bloody Mary that looked nothing like the picture in that it lacked all the fixins (no bacon, no pickle, etc.) his second mixed drink had little to no booze in it and when he ordered a Makers Mark Manhattan the server returned with a shot of Makers Mark. TRAIN YOUR BAR STAFF BECAUSE THEY SUCK! Beer selection was mediocre and they didn't even have a beer menu so you had to just look at the taps and try to pick one (if you could see them from where you were seated). 
Food/service: I asked our server if they had boneless wings and she told me they did but then came back after I ordered them to tell me that they do not but could toss chicken strips in wing sauce. It seemed like she really didn't know what was going on. Anyway, I got the chicken strip basket tosses in green chile Parmesan sauce which was decent. It came with steak fries that were REALLY good! The bf got mozzarella cubes which were also tasty but the marinara was weird and gross. After lunch our server left and we got a new server Paige who was bubbly and friendly, unlike our original server who was an airhead who got uncomfortably close when she spoke to you. We stayed for hours so we ordered a steak salad later in the evening that was disappointing. The dressing was sour and the steak was tough. After drinking and eating all day we only dropped about $80 for both of us so I'd say it's very reasonably priced!

Not what I experience during the weekday but I sat at the bar. The girls were friendly and the food was what I expected. I brought my son back to celebrate his 15th birthday Sunday, Waited 15 minutes for a waitress to come up to tell us that she didn't know who was serving the booth we were seated. The music was  too LOUD, I HAD TO YELL TO THE WAITRESS. 
All in all, the girls were pretty, pretty unfriendly, but pretty non the less, and my son enjoyed himself. Definitely the tale of two experiences, weekday versus the weekend.

I have stopped in here a few times to try different food options that are offered.  The staff in general is friendly and upbeat.  My most recent visit here was specifically to order the blackened chicken quesadilla.  The last time I ordered it I was impressed.  The flavors were great, the mixture of chicken, beans, corn, and cheese was spot on.  The salsa that came with also paired well.  The most recent time I had the chicken quesadilla, that was not the case.  I felt like I was eating a tortilla stuffed with nacho cheese.  It was just overwhelming and not enjoyable.  The salsa was also missing.  The price point on the food is reasonable.  The portions are larger so I share with my wife.  The burgers, chicken sandwiches, and fire fries are pretty good.  There are tv's all over, they are in the booths, outside, and cover wall to wall.  Definitely a great place to catch a game.  I like the cold beers, but occasionally I get a dirty glass which is hard to see until the ice thaws and the beer is pretty much gone.  The mugs are brought to the bar already frozen, so not even the bartender would know if the glass is dirty.  Maybe a little attention to cleanliness by the dish washers could help.  I will return for other items, but not for the quesadilla.

I agree with Robert C.....amateurs. The food was ok, but the girls need better training, and way less makeup. It was like they were trying so hard, it came across as fake! 
For the prices, the portions weren't very big. Ie: 10 chips with the queso dip? Not much on the menu either.
The place is really cute, decor fun and many TV's. What I couldn't stand, were the way the waitstaff would come over and sit down with us. Excuse me, my spouse and I enjoying our conversation...we didn't need a 19 year old bimbo, boobs smashed up to her neck, draped in cheap jewelry, to sit down with us and ask us if the beer was cold enough. And I wasn't even drinking beer. 
I hope they make it because I never like to see a business fail...but we won't be back again.

Good service- we were seated right away and it was a UFC night.  We got our food at a decent time.  Our server was very nice.  

Menu:  very few selections.  I got the shrimp basket, but received only 4 pieces of shrimp and the rest are fries. 
We will most likely go there again!

We ordered take out wings cause we will never dine in these places again.  When we got there, 30 min. after placing the order - we find out the order was not put in.  So we waited another 20 min. - no "I'm sorry" - just free, 50 min. wings.  What a joke.
Anna quit awhile back and my husband and i didn't like that. She was an awesome server and last time we were there it was not the greatest service that we have gotten from this specific twin peaks
Very friendly staff. .. food is... what u expect... great place for sports and drinking

So the "food" here is "exactly" what you would expect and wow are the folks here friendly !!! They really go the extra mile to make sure you are taken care of.

Sarcasm aside this location is clean, well run, and the staff is very good.  I do really like the TVs inside and out, I think I will watch the March Madness tip off here...

I love this place! The girls are such sweethearts, it's always packed but they seem to keep up just fine. Tons of TVs, beautiful girls, cold beer, great food!!! I was also surprised at how family friendly this "breasturant" is, any time I go I see a mom dad and their kids enjoying a meal.

We got there and said we have 5 people and the hostess said it would be over an hour so she suggested a table for 4 and we could pull up a chair. There was more than enough room at the table for the 5 of us so great job hostess. Gotta say the talent here is top notch...10 times better than hooters or tilted kilt nearby. Truthfully I didn't know this restaurant was this type of bar but I didn't mind :)  I don't drink much and when I do, it's usually a Foo Foo drink. I got the Stout Colada  beer and it was delicious.  We all liked our food. We got double cheeseburger, Philly cheese steak, and skirt steak. Klaudia was a good waitress although she missed our drink orders a couple times but no biggie. It was kinda funny though...she asked one of my friends if he wanted a refill on his Angry Orchard and he said yes. 10 minutes after he still didn't get a refill and she came by and and asked him if he wanted a refill again...oh well she was nice so we weren't complaining but we made a joke about it.  If you get fries, make sure you ask for ketchup and look at the bottle :)  ton of tvs so definitely good for watching the NCAA tourney.  Prices weren't bad.  Nice place and we'll be back. Don't know when but definitely  bikini week in July!

Food is good and beer is served nice and cold which is a definite plus.  Been here a few times and enjoy watching them bring out the shot ski...SHOT SKI SHOT SKI!!!  The servers are fun especially if certain songs come on then you might experience a cool line dance!!  Plenty of seating and great outdoor patio seating!!!

Only issue is if you come in a small group.  Twice we've had a group of 2-3 and the servers tend to gravitate toward the larger groups/tables to work their tips, which is understandable, but don't forget your other groups.  Had two trips where it took 25 minutes to get a drink for someone in our group who arrived late and then 20 minutes to get our check because we couldn't get any service.  Another trip was on a slower night and the server forgot to put in a food order...just something you can't overlook.

Hopefully they have a talk with the servers and get them straightened out.
Great lunch! The fish tacos were very good and were recommended from the bartender. Lexi was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu and the draft selection. Nice place to watch the game.

Incredibly bad food and worse service. Heard two waitress's talking about a customer, they were using incredibly offensive, racial language and when I commented I was told by management to mind my own business. I paid my tab and went to the men's room and was accosted by a bus boy. Never had such treatment in my life.

Went there for lunch with my brother. I ordered the B.E.L.T and he ordered the pulled pork sliders. Overall the food wasn't too bad, but the service absolutely sucked. It took almost 20 minutes to get our beers and my brother ordered a side of fries that never came. The talent wasn't that great either and for such a slow service, the place was mostly empty with girls just standing around hula hooping. I would not recommend this place.
The food and beer are ok. I will say that our service on our most recent visit was disappointing. The bartender was too busy flirting with the manager behind the bar  and forgot our drinks twice.

My wife and I were visiting the Naperville area and were looking for supper. We stumbled across this place. Twin Peaks is not in our area back home so decided to give it a try. We were a little surprised by the scenery but it was one of the few pluses. The food came quickly and was nothing to write home about. It was filling but no real flavor. Lots of games to watch if you are not distracted by the "scenery". Even if Twin Peaks built one near home, we both said that we probably won't go there.

Wow i am so speechless!! Our bartenders kreanna and ayanna are the best bartenders i have seen in along time. They catered to our needs very well. They made our experience to twin peaks memorable.. Thanks again!
Great food! The coldest beers around! Service was excellent! And I was pleasantly surprised of the "scenic views."

I came to twin peaks last night with one of my girlfriends. It's across from the movie theater so we decided to check it out. The layout is big and decorated very well, it feels cozy! Cynthia was our twin peaks girl and she did an awesome job. She's very conversational, friendly, and attentive! She seemed to be really down to earth, you definitely want to sit her. We didn't eat much but the drinks are pretty good and crafty. We didn't feel pressured to order but Cynthia was suggestive. of course I can't forget to mention the frozen mugs for drafts!
this place blows.....horrible service...i waited like 20 mins to get a beer one afternoon...it's a bunch of young girls with daddy issues surrounded by a bunch of middle aged guys with mommy issues.
It was ok but it was kind of small imo. The waitresses were cool as always. Just came in to watch all the sports on their TV's. Overall it is a cool place to hang out but it is far from where I live.

Came in with my fianc his friend and I. Was seated right away.  Our waitres was Gina and she was great! Very attentive and polite not just to my friends but me also (unlike most "breastbars") she provided us with exceptional service and made us feel very welcome. She made our drinks by request which was very impressive! The food was amazing ans the drinks were nice and strong. We were here on a tuesday night and it was not too crowded. Will definitely be returning and most definetly getting the fried pickles!!

Slow Service
Slow...slow....slo.....lo.....w
had to ask the hostess to get my drink that was sitting on the end of the bar for 
1/2 hour?  she brought over the bloodymary without garnish, she dropped the glass
infront of me and proceed to walk away eating the bacon that garnished my drink!
My Waitress was not busy...watched her socializing with men at bar.

this was the 2nd time here, there won't be a 3rd.

Best place ever! Came here last week for dinner and drinks and couldn't have asked for better service! Maggie was great and recommended excellent beer, appetizers, and dinner! The 29 degree bud light I had was excellent and the mozzarella bites were awesome! Maggie was an awesome server and look forward to the excellent service and great food again soon!

I wish I could give this place ZERO STARS!! I'm going to preface this by saying that I was not expecting a fine dining service experience. That being said...I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO Twin Peaks in Warrenville, IL. The only good thing there was the cold beer and decent food. So...It is Saturday afternoon, not too busy at all (7 tables sat and 3/4 full bar). First, they were out of the 2 draft beers that I wanted, nice job GM. Second, it took 10 minutes to get us 3 beer...again, not busy at all. Third, it took 20+ minutes for the waitress, Breanna i think, to take our order. Fourth, multiple times the manager, and waitress were in the kitchen f'in around and texting on their phones and there were 2 waitress sitting on the expo area. Fifth, we were waiting 15 minutes for our waitress to come take our payment and I finally had to ask the host to tell our server to stop texting and come get our payment. Sixth, I asked to speak to the manager, he came over and we were talking and the waitress comes over and starts arguing with me at the table. Finally, after talking to the manager and GM, we were walking out and the waitress is waiting at the host stand and gives us bitchy and condescending goodbyes and remarks. I am so tired of shitty service...why is it widely acceptable to be on your cell phone as a server or bartender and not attend to your customer. Why is it so hard to be able to go out and get good service at a restaurant in the burbs. Utterly Ridiculous!!!

A group of us tried this place for the first time, and I was frankly just not impressed! The chili was awful, the salad was gross and already turning.
