My other friends had the fish tacos and a regular cheeseburger, which were pretty good. The service was solid but nothing special and the tvs outside are hard to see because there is way to much glare and light pollution. Overall decent food, cool setup, and awful TV viewing if outside. Wouldn't  visit again.

Came in on a Tuesday night and was served by Dallas. She was very attentive and checked on me several times throughout the night. I had the Chicken Fried Chicken which was very good. Great Service and Food! I will be back.

Staff is great and very friendly, walking in Krista was very helpful and answered my questions about specials and what she liked on the menu. Then sat me at a booth as I requested! Will definitely be coming back!

We were biking around the area and noticed this restaurant.  Very nice appointed with Adirondack furnishings, lots of TV's, outdoor seating.  The waitresses are mainly for the men clientele.  Shannon was our waitress who was very friendly and we felt very welcomed.  The appetizer of cubed cheese is delicious and the best around.  I had the trout and it was good with the fresh mashed potatoes and some really good veggies.  My husband had the fish tacos and said they were really good.  The best thing my husband said was the COLDEST of beers in a frosted glass.  Jason was the Manager and was very attentive towards our needs.  First they said that the mashed potatoes would take 40 minutes to make.  Jason came over and said it would take maybe 10 minutes.  I was impressed with trying to please and having the food ready as it should if it is on the menu.
We will be back..

Worst service / dining experience ever.  Constantly looked for waitress, having to remind about drink / dinner orders, meals were wrong, drinks never came, sold items that weren't available. Went there for my buddies birthday and i regret it. Took 15 mins to get drinks, 35 mins to get appetizer, 50 mins to order meal... altogether we got 4 drinks, 3 meals, 1 appetizer and took 2 hours... Only thing that was accurate was my bill. If you decide to go regardless of this warning, only see Ashley. She ran our meals, drinks,  corrected orders, military/cop friendly.  If I ever decided to go back it would only be for her service. My suggestion is to clean house and have her manage the training. Btw to my server I gave you 15% for your service in the hope that the tips were pooled and some of that would go to the server who actually serviced us and was not just a half naked cashier.
It was ok. Nothing was particularly bad, it just isn't worth the hype. The food is decently priced, the beer is cold. Eh. Tattooed, pierced servers (all female fortunately) in small clothes...

Doesn't this place suck. Where do I start- to be fair it is nice inside- its new, and i get the sense nobody goes there. empty on a Saturday night so we had plenty of room. Menu is incredibly limited, but somehow our server didn't know a thing about it. Beer/wine menu limited, even so, the first 3 I wanted weren't available. My guest ordered pino grigio. Server went to bar, came back said they didn't have it. Who has a 10 oz or 22 oz bear choice? So, limited food menu, limited beverage menu, poor service, and the hooters/tilted kilt copycat outfits just not that big a deal.
First timer. Paige and Annie started off strong but got busy and its just like any other Fridays / Applebees location with tight shirts.  Attractive staff, but coukd have been better.

I just left twin peaks in warrenville. I sat at the bar for 7 minutes, no one said a word to me, so I left. The bar was pretty full, but the dining room was pretty much empty, and there was plenty of staff. Very disappointed, but I will just go spend my money elsewhere.
Did not have malt vinegar.
New business location. Infrastructure was new ! We had our table in heated outdoor patio area. Overall experience was good. Food is OK-kind. Hot wings and beer were excellent !
Asked to put the Hawks game on one of the 50 TV's, waited over 30 minutes and they never figured out how to control their own TV's. Epic failure.

Nothing special here, just another "breastaurant" charging too much for food and beer in exchange for getting to look at scantily clad tattooed young women. The hostess was very friendly. The decor is good, more than enough TVs and the outdoor area looks like it will be fun once the weather warms up. The signs on restroom doors " sit to P" and "stand to P" made me chuckle. One note on restrooms---why aren't the stall doors flush to the frame? Not a comfortable sight when you walk in restroom. 

Food tasted good but was over priced for what you got, not a value. Beer was $4.75 for Miller Lite, not a value. The beer temp meter is great, it's fun to see it getting colder. We actually ordered our rounds based on temp--"we will buy when it gets under 27 degrees". I was surprised for all the marketing around 29 degree beer how often the temp was over 31 degrees. 

The server was friendly but struggled to be attentive. Her and a few others sat with an employee that was off the clock for long stretches leaving us waiting for refills. She also complained every time she got a new table, leaving us thinking she wanted us to leave. The kicker was over hearing the conversation she had with the table next to us about taking oxy and how she has a birth control implant in her arm---how does that come up while waiting on the table? It was enough to get us to pay and go. Maybe if we saw a manger at anytime of our visit, the staff would have been more attentive. 

Overall it's average, if in the area, I might go back but wouldn't make any more special trips to go there.

Management was terrible. The temperature dropped and my friends asked if they would turn on outside heaters. If they couldn't no big deal but the manager came out to us with an attitude. Pretty much called us liars when we said they hadn't been turned on all night and left us with a bad taste in our mouth...other than the food. The women seem bullied by male staff and are forced to be rated before each shift(according to our waitress) the drink list was short compared to other breastraunts...if you want to see hot girls without the uncomfortable staff and crappy food go to tilted or hooters...twin peaks is a downward slope of nastiness...

So yesterday was my 25th Birthday, I had a party of 5 with me and came to twins peaks to celebrate for dinner and to check out the new restaurant. We arrived around 5pm when the pub was not very busy. None of us were carded at the table even though we were all 21+. We ordered a sampler appetizer platter and received dirty app plates. Had to ask for new ones from a server that was not ours and by the time we got new CLEAN plates we were done with the platter. One of my friends with me ordered the fried steak and the server asked how he wanted his steak cooked and he replied medium. About ten mins later another server (not ours) let us know that our server messed up and the steak could only be made well done. He said he would try it anyways because he was hungry. He received the fried well done steak and didn't like it so sent it back immediately, he ordered something else instead. All four of us were done eating by the time he received his new order. The new order he loved but ate alone. The manager came over to talk to us because we asked (the sever never asked if would like to speak to a manager after the issue and the manager didn't take the initiative to come on his own when he realized he had to make a comp at our table) he was not friendly by any means with no professional manner. He did try to fix the situation by comping some items. He never once came back to check on us later throughout our visit to see if everything else was fine but instead pulled the originally server that we started with (that had no menu knowledge) and just gave us a new server who knew what she was doing, The manager never even came over to tell us he was switching out our server either.  The new server I believe her name was Bambi, she was the server that our original server kept pulling over to answer our menu questions in the first place, she completely turned out experience around! It was my birthday and all I wanted to do was have a good time and Bambi definitely made that happen for the second part of our visit. I would suggest her as your server if you want to get the best experience, She was very knowledgeable about the entire menu and picked up the slack of the manager that was on duty last night. Overall the food was decent but the cheese bites were DELICIOUS! The girl that was running our drinks to the table was also very rude to us and it didn't help that it took 10-20mins per drink to get delivered. I know that it is a new restaurant but the first server and our second server, Bambi, gave us two completely different vibes for my birthday celebration. Our plan was to stay longer there and drink but with the delay on actually getting the drinks to our table was kind of a buzz kill so we decided to go else where to finish celebrating. I think the servers should be tested on their menu knowledge before actually taking tables on the floor so other tables do not experience what we did. There was a party that walked in with children under the age of 10 years old while we were leaving and the staff dances "twerks" every hour in the middle of the floor, kid friendly environment??? I would use your best judgement when bringing your younger children into this establishment. 

I was going to rate this place a "1 Star" based on our experience but the only reason that I gave this place "2 stars" is because the amount of effort our second server put into our table to make sure she turned our visit around. 

Probably not returning and if we do maybe a year from now so that all staff knows what is going on.

I have been here 4x now since they have opened. Unfortunately, the quality of my experience here has lowered with each visit. 
In fairness, I would much rather come here than a Tilted Kilt. The TV selection and overall restaurant atmosphere is superior. The food is also better. 
I would like to see some form of beer special. 5 bucks for a miller lite is a bit pricey compared to Hooters, BDubs, and The Kilt. 
Unfortunately, my worst experience came in my last visit when my waitress was complaining about her tips from previous tables. She sat down and told my table, "if you tipping less than 20% you ain't never worked in the service industry or you just plain cheap." I thought that was a but inappropriate for a waitress to tell her customers...this was in the first 10 min that we were there. 
So overall, great TVs, please get a beer special at some point, decent food, and teach your waitresses that this is a restaurant and not some strip club in N/W Indiana. 
Thank you.

The most sleazy excuse for a 'sports bar' I've ever seen.  Young women in provocative outfits fawning over the customers with no shame.  It is like a glorified strip club disguised as a sports bar & grille.  There were literally 25 young women making their rounds around the restaurant sidling up to the customers for various small talk, every time I turned around there was a woman in my face!  It's too bad because it looked like a nice place with several big screens for sports and decent food, but I don't go to sports bars to be continuously confronted by scantily-clad young women for conversation.
A big thumbs down

Can't even rate how the service is. Never got a table after 2.5 hours of waiting. This place doesn't know how to turn tables or accommodate 6 people in a reasonable time frame. Left without ever sitting down.

Good Service. Fair prices. Great neighborhood bar.  Went to watch the Steelers game .. they have 1.50 burgers..beer specials, cool atmosphere and lots of tvs.
Crowd is fun and I would definitely recommend a try if you've never been here.
Good Times!

Looking for some Friday night Karaoke a friend suggested Mullens. 
We arrived around 8:45. Karaoke was due to start around 10:00pm when the Hawks game was over.  Mullens is an official Blackhawk bar so don't come in here to cheer for the Dallas Stars lol.
TONS of TV's with multiple games showing. 
We sat ourselves in the bar area. Greeted promptly and served quickly, with a great attitude. 
When we arrived it was not too crowded but as it got closer to 10 filled up quickly. Once the DJ set up, the line formed and the list grew to about 20+ singers.  If your looking to sing multiple times forget it. Not a bad thing though. The DJ Wayne "The Wayniac Show" was excellent at being fair and not allowing sign ups under friends to sing more frequently.
The crowd age average seemed to be '22-25' or college age with some of us older folks sprinkled in.
We ordered food later which was good.  The brisket nachos were huge and good. The cheese curds were typical as well as the pretzel with cheese. We also got the Reuben and it was good as well. 
Overall it was a good fun night, good service, good food, fun crowd and atmosphere.
Food - typical bar food average. 
Service - slightly above average. 
Atmosphere - slightly above average.
*Oh, the bathrooms were clean and smelled clean. The previous reviewer about the restrooms must've come at a bad time.

Ehhh, I'm really not a fan of this place. It's popular because it's right off Warrenville Rd by a bunch of major offices like Navistar. I wouldn't come back here unless my coworkers wanted to go again. 

The inside is pretty spacious. They have a big open space for late night dancing, and a small stage for a band. I can see how the night life might be fun.

However, the food is really NOT GOOD. I don't think I've been to a restaurant where I've had food that's more bland. I had the corned beef and cabbage plate. Seriously; couldn't you at least add some salt and pepper to the meals? 

Also, service was pretty awful. We were there for an hour and a half for lunch, which is wayyyyy too long for a lunch hour. The waitress rarely came by, and we all had empty water glasses for a while.

Not my cup of tea.

Thought it was excellent. Plenty of TVs and some nice draft beers.  Hostesses great you at the front door, which is a pleasant surprise these days.  Nice stage area, so live music should be nice.  Hawks were on. 

Had the pulled pork sliders. Very good. A little coleslaw, ala memphis style, would have put it over the top. Wings were good as well. Well done with combo buffalo sauce and terriyake.  Nice touch.

No problem with the coupon at all. Alexis, our server, was top notch. Great service.  I really liked the place.

Absolutely disgusting. About a year and a half ago this place used to be my "Thirsty Thursday" hang out. Hadn't been in a while and we all went for lunch yesterday. First off, the place was dead so that should have been a hint. The whole restaurant smelled like mold. It was sticky and cold and just felt so gross. We were hungry so we stayed. It wasn't until I went into the bathroom that I literally threw up from the smell. It smells like someone took a dump and rubbed it on the walls.. and what do I see when I walk in the first stall? CRAP smeared on the walls! I was disgusted and I immediately told the hostess and her lack of caring made me want to run out of that place ASAP. I will NEVER step foot back in this place again. I would not be surprised if it gets shut down soon. Stay away from this place.

Food 4
Service 3
Facility 1
Wings were very tasty 
Burgers were very good 
Beer was cold

Most parking  lights were burnt out.
Patio tables looked like they were dropped from a plane. The metal was shredded 
Where the umbrella pole went into the table.
Overall the general cleanliness and maintenance was very lacking.
I wouldn't bring my family here.
Very good food and service. Was there for lunch and not busy. Good selection of drinks and food choices.

The dollar burger deal on Sundays is pretty amazing, it's pretty big and only a dollar, and good too, standard beer list, not too expensive though, they have a good plastic cup deal, I've also had the sub sandwich/salad lunch weekday deal, and tried the tots, all solid food options, I live in the city, but all my suburb friends really love it and go all the time

Good live music venue!!! Our waiter , John was fantastic , even when it became crowded he stayed on top of our refills and always asked if we were ok. 
The food is wonderful. We had the pretzel with beer cheese and mustard . Best beer cheese ever, after tasting it i made sure to order a side with my fries  i had the fish n chips as my meal. The beer batter was nice and light , i hate when you have nothing but batter and can hardly taste the fish!!! And their tarter sauce is amazing i had to get two bc i also dipped my fries in it lol

Not a bad little joint. Good food, ok service, and not really busy. Beer selection isn't good and always muggy inside. Sat myself twice cause nobody was at the front to greet me, which is very annoying looking like an idiot waiting for someone to greet you. Sliders were awesome and just enough to be considered a meal.

I come here on Sunday's now for Pittsburgh Steeler games, as they have at least one dedicated room for their games that includes a big screen and surround sound.  From this standpoint alone, the place is A-ok in my book.
My buddies and I tend to go for the $1 hamburger with 50 cent topping.  The burger is 1/3lb and you can't go wrong for the price.  They always have great beer specials as well as well rounded beer menu with at least 60-70 choices.  
The folks who work here, and this is based on 4 or 5 visits now, are extremely accommodating and pleasant.   
If you're a Steelers fan and reside in the area, be sure to stop by on game day. 
Cheers!

My friends and I have been coming for Trivia the last couple of months and my co-workers and I come here pretty frequently too. The atmosphere overall is really good. The servers are decent and the management overall is O.K., nothing too stellar. I've tried a variety of their foods here and overall, I think their wings are pretty good which are half off on Weds during trivia night (you can try the bourbon sriracha flavor which is not listed on the menu), their pretzel app is pretty standard, the meatball app is pretty good too, the quesadillas are well made, but the killer is that their nachos are not that good. Wide selection of beers as well.

However, I do have one terrible memory at this place. This happened when they advertised a Two Brothers Brewing event at Mullens for a specific date (listed on all posters). And it was listed for a Monday, which I thought was weird. So I ended up calling Mullens the next day to confirm the event, which they did and said the date was correct. So I gathered a group of friends to come out and take part, but upon arriving, I was informed that the event had already happened on a previous Friday... Even though the posters said it was Monday and I had called to confirm. Heart breaking. I ended up speaking to the manager who ultimately offered me and my friends free Two Brothers Bumper Stickers that they passed out during the free event anyway. 

Overall, nothing to die for here. Food is decent and all and its a nice atmosphere and a unique location. But due to the occasional subpar service, I have to get it 3/5.

Drove by this place so many times wondering what it was like.  Now I know.  Went on a Sunday for lunch and got the $1 burger ($.50 per topping). Let's just say I created a masterpiece. As others have said the service nothing to write home about.  But I think it is just average nothing horrible.  Beer list was decent and the burgers were delicious.  We will definitely come back. This is the kind of place that hides in the background but is always delivers a decent meal and tasty drinks.

The food was decent, the service was horrible, not a formula that inspires a 2nd visit. 

We came here on a Sunday night because we heard of their patio and the great $1.50 burger special. 

Our first clue into how this was going to turn out was the fact that all the guests on the patio only had drinks and no food! It was not crowded nor did it seem to be understaffed. Yet it took ONE HOUR to be served 3 burgers, 1 salad and 1 wrap. When we asked where our food was, the only answer we heard was "I had a big party before you, it's coming!" Never, an "I'm sorry can I get you anything while you wait." At the 45 minute mark, we approached the "manager", who was less than concerned and had zero sense of urgency.
 
Food finally arrived. The burgers were good. The wrap was plentiful, but the MULLEN'S BLEU CANDIED WALNUT salad was pitiful... only anemic iceberg lettuce, and barely a tsp of walnuts and cranberries. Not too mention the order of the famous "Mullen's applesauce" never appeared.

As were we leaving the manager, (literally) dropped a bag of the applesauce on our table as an attempt to make right. It was a very poor and half-hearted attempt. To top it all off the applesauce was EXPIRED.

We all have restaurant experience so we understand things happen, but there was never a genuine attempt to make things right or give us a reason to come back.

I wonder if Jim Mullen even know's this place uses his name. If he did, I would hope he would have a much better sense of quality control.

We came back today for Bloody Mary's and lunch. I'm so sorry we did.

First of all, we walked in and picked out a booth to sit at. It was well over five minutes before a waitress finally approached our table. She was nice (I've forgotten her name) and was quick to bring us our drinks and take our order. 

The Bloody Mary's were good but you can get bigger ones for much cheaper elsewhere. They do come with a shot of Miller Lite; they call it the "Hangover Helper." However, I was not hungover so I didn't drink the Miller Lite. Miller Lite is foul, anyway.

I ordered the "Big Jim's Reuben" and chose fries as my side. The bf got a "Mullen's Wrap" with tator tots. While it sounded good in theory, we were both disappointed with our choices. The bf took two bites of his wrap and refused to eat more. He said it was terrible, especially the chicken. I tasted a piece of chicken and agreed; it was dry and flavorless. He said it tasted like dog food. 

As far as the reuben goes, I was very disappointed. I've had a better Reuben at Arby's. The corned beef tasted off and the sandwich was entirely too greasy for my liking. I only ate a quarter of it. The fries were lukewarm at best. Some were burnt and others were soggy and undercooked.

We managed to have our waitress take the bf's meal off our check. Now I wish we would have done the same with mine. I brought home leftovers but I honestly doubt I'll eat them, as my stomach is unbearably upset right now. The only decent food we had was the Spinach Artichoke Dip appetizer, but it wasn't the greatest Spinach Artichoke dip we've ever had and was almost $10 alone. No thanks.

As we left, the bf said "Well, this place is off my list." I couldn't agree more. Obviously after living in the area for almost 18 years, there's a clear reason why I've never been here up until recently. We won't be back.

Always enjoy Mullins. Whenever I'm in the area I make it a point to stop by. Usually a business lunch with colleagues. Today was an early dinner with my son. He loved his wings. My Santa Fe salad with chicken was great. Friendly staff served up our order quickly. Looking forward to coming back.

Fellow Yelpers, 

We decided to try Mullen's due to Trivia night. Three of us ventured in and had to wait for our fourth so we ordered drinks and an app. The nachos were head scratchingly covered with TONS of iceberg finely shredded. Seriously, the biggest mound of shredded lettuce I have EVER seen. My husband loves all things nacho and on the way home he was actually listing ways Mullen's could have "Irished" it up and made some really killer nachos. While they tasted OK, there just wasn't much to it beside some soggy chips and lots and lots of lettuce. 

Our fourth arrived just as Trivia was starting, at this point we had only seen our waitress maybe 2 times. She didn't seem terribly busy, just very distracted. She was perfectly pleasant when we did see her but it was so far and few that we actually wondered if she left at one point, or at least I did because I kind of notice these things. AND, to be fair, it doesn't really take much to please me when I am dining out. I don't need a ton of attention, so I really can't complain because she was nice but she did screw up our bill. We didn't say anything because we were amongst friends and we just worked it out...but still....

WE all ordered pretty straightforward stuff: Steak Sandwich, O Patty Melt, and two of us ordered the Beef Short Rib Sandwich. I usually like to copy the descriptions straight from the website, but I can only see the apps.....strange.

Not one of us mentioned our food as we were eating it, except to say that we loved the tater tots. Guys....the tater tots were awesome! Crisp on the outside and perfectly cooked in the middle with just the right amount of salt and pepper.

Our craft beer enthusiast friend seemed ok with the choices of beer, but I know other places have a better selection. The rest of us ordered soft drinks and or Arnold Palmer's so.....those were fine.

I wouldn't dissuade you from going to Mullens, truly, it is a nice place with ok food. BUT....but...with Warren's Ale House just a hop skip and a jump away I struggled with what to share. Mullens Trivia night was fun but the food was just ok. I would go back for Trivia and maybe for another app but I think I will eat at Warren's ahead of time. 

IF you are so inclined to visit the website: 

http://www.mullensbarandgrill.com/lisle/menus/full-menu/

I am writing this review based on service, mostly.  

We were at a wedding ceremony up the road and had almost 4 hours to kill before the reception at Danada House.  We walked into Mullen's at 3pm on a Saturday to find a very friendly and accommodating woman at the front desk.  I told her we may be having lots of people showing up to kill time and she suggested we reserve a few tables, but then realized the entire back Pool Room was unoccupied and a party wasn't supposed to arrive until 8pm, so it could be all ours til 6pm!  I texted the Bride and MoB and let them know we had plenty of space, EVERYONE can come!  

The girl who helped me got a hold of our very own waiter, JoHn.  JoHn was AWESOME.  So nice and ready to serve, he came with suggestions on food, took separate CC for all tables and handled our group of about 40 or so with no problem!  He was super attentive and professional and personable.  We really appreciated his service and wanted him to know it.  I told JoHn he'd be all bells and whistles on YELP.  Hi JoHn!  Congrats on being the best waiter we have EVER had!

**and the short rib sandwich was amazing, per JoHn's suggestion (of course)
We had a great time last night!! Don't remember our bartenders name but she was very friendly and kept us entertained. It's a great neighborhood joint!

Another Tuesday night for Open Mic night hosted by Geoff Matson and it was perfect. Great service by Katie on the patio, great food and excellent sangria.

Love this place

After our first poor experience at Mullen's, the owner contacted me directly through Yelp and offered me a chance to come back for what amounted to a free lunch and a free dinner (sans tip, of course - I covered that) for myself, my wife, and my daughter.

This was really great of them and I appreciate it! The customer service outreach really was fantastic and made me feel appreciated as a customer.

We went for dinner and things went really well. The food was made well and quite tasty. The service was really friendly and on-top of everything. It was fairly busy but our refills were timely and our server was pretty much constantly available. The staff as a whole were friendly and made faces at our 2 year old to make her laugh.

My wife and I were both very impressed!

Based on the dinner and the customer outreach I would have re-rated Mullen's from a two-star review up to a four-star review but I thought we would wait until after also doing lunch just to give it a good and well-rounded review.

We went on a slow day for lunch, with very few other people in the restaurant, which was surprising since it was right around lunch time and with all the businesses in the area we expected it to be pretty full.

Well, the food was good and I definitely suggest giving the wings a try for lunch; they're really tasty! My wife enjoyed her burger and my daughter ate most of her cheese quesadilla with tater tots, which is a true endorsement from a two year old!

But again, it was slow. Surprisingly so since it was so empty. The wait staff was all friendly and willing to help us out if we needed it. They weren't rude so much as they weren't really available. Refills didn't show up, check-backs on the food weren't done, and I had to ask for our check 10 minutes after we'd finished (my wife had even taken my daughter out for a walk at that point since the little one had gotten a bit restless by then).

We'll definitely be going back. The customer service was great and when you order the right thing (not the fish and chips, essentially) the food is decent. With this being so accessible (we live just down the street) I'm sure we'll go grab dinner there again some time!

For lunch, though, we'd rather drive a little farther away and save a little time.

I think, too, that our family isn't exactly what the restaurant is looking for. It's probably a great sports bar if that's what you're looking for, whereas we were looking for a great restaurant. It's a good restaurant. Just not great.
Good food - fun crowd - blue collar America ! Large - well light , clean , professional staff - live bands - always a good time ! GO HAWKS!!!!!!!!!!

We hosted a surprise birthday party here for 50 guests and they were fantastic!  Due to terrible service at another location we made a last minute change to this location and they were incredibly accommodating for our large group. Even helped in coordinating the surprise. I didn't personally eat much but the staff was great as was the band that was playing!

The place has recently re-done their menu, and I've been pleased with the choices here.  The food is pretty good for a bar, and the beer selection is better than most in the area.  The prices are also fair.  

As for the ambiance, it's a great place to watch a game, there are plenty of TV's everywhere.  It's in a convenient location where there are not a whole lot of other restaurants, and during the summer their outdoor area is a good size (if not set up a bit awkwardly).  I've had mostly great service here, and when it was slower they were usually sure to apologize.

I would (and do) come here again, and would suggest it to others as well.

Horrible service tonight!   Horrible!    Our waitress basically put us on the back burner all night for a large party in the back room.   Not sure why she had at least 5 tables in the bar plus a large party in the back room.   We would have ordered dessert but got tired of waiting for the waitress to come back.  It was over 15min between visits at one point!  The table next to us had his credit card in the folder for about 10 min at least waiting to cash out and leave.   

I'm disappointed a 1 hour dinner turned into two hours easy. 

Two hours of my time wasted for food that was just ok at best.   

Find a better place to go!

Oh, Mullens. I literally work in the office building directly behind Mullens, and so maybe my review is tainted due to proximity to my job? Or maybe it's just the most meh bar in the history of meh?

The drinks are okay, but unpredictable. Sometimes a little weak, sometimes they'll knock you over. I don't often drink when I'm here, because I'm usually here with coworkers and alas, I like being employed, but the times I have, it's been underwhelming. The service is fine, but the food is very expensive for very VERY standard bar food. Last time I was there, I got a Mediterranean salad that was ok, but my colleague got potato skins that looked like little brown grease boats. The interior is cute enough, they sometimes have obnoxiously loud live music if that's your thing, and they have a great patio for summertime, which is a plus.
Food was just okay. Nachos had minimal cheese on them. Order was wrong and food had to go back.

Possibly the worst Buffalo chicken sandwich I've ever had.  Overcooked and the flavor was just plain bad.  I seriously hope it stays down.  Unfortunately, I was there with a group of colleagues so switching it out wasn't really in the cards.  

On the upside, the service was great (thanks Allie B.) even though we had about 9 people at the table.

I met up here with a couple of friends for a few drinks.  It was definitely my type of bar.  It was laid back, not too many people, not super loud music, but not a dive bar either.  I didn't eat but my friend said their food was good.  Prices were similar to other bars and we didn't have to wait for a table.
Love the outside eating area but, the waiting staff forgets about the customers outside!  Not cool!!

A friend and I ate at Mullens a couple weeks ago, I have gone before for the live bands and drinks but never have actually sat down and ate. Im giving 3 stars because the atmosphere is great, the drinks are good, and the bands are always fun! But the food is nothing special at all. It's crappy bar food and overly priced crappy bar food at that. I usually don't go to Mullens often, I think I have been there 2 or 3 times in the 5 years I've lived just 5 min away, and it will probably stay like this.

While their food usually gives me cramps, they are close to work so we go over and drink.  I ordered chicken fingers and a bloody mary.  45 minutes later, i had my chicken fingers but still no bloody mary.  bloody mary came ten minutes after that.  Sorry i won't be back.
Average food. Decent beer but a great atmosphere. Worth a stop for a snack and a few drinks

I like it here. It's become my casual go to place during the week.  I like their food.  The portions are big and shareable. It's fun to just hang out and have a good time with friends.  

Last time I was there, the waitress was not great.  She even seemed like she was trying to get rid of us and we were about 12 people.  She started moving chairs that we had around our table as if it was closing time and there was still at least 3 hours left in the night. 

Overall, it's great.  The outside is nice and large area to sit in and the people are nice.  

Been back many times and will go back many more .

This place is bad.  The guy who does karaoke is useless.  They have karaoke but apparently all of the friends of the dj have dibs on the first songs....   And unfortunately it's bad quality.  Meanwhile, I tried to sing a song and the dj told me that I won't sing for at least 20 songs or more.   He was also rude in the process.  Won't be coming back for karaoke night or anything else.

For the area, Mullens is really my go to spot. It is a big space, good specials, plenty of parking, and lots of TV's for watching sports. It also has a big patio for warm days. I can recommend this place for any get together, especially large groups. Much easier to get to and enjoy than anywhere in Naperville.

Decent atmosphere and staff were friendly and prompt, however I found the food to be extremely bland.  A friend has the pot pie biscuits and I had the steak sandwich.  After the first few bites we both looked at each other with disappointment, claiming our meals looked much better than they tasted.  Even my tots had no flavor.  Disappointing indeed!

I would HIGHLY recommend Mullen's Bar & Grill. Not only is their food outstanding, but their staff is so friendly. Additionally, they truly care about their local community. They recently donated to my Breakthrough for Brain Tumors 5K team for the second year in a row. They are SO GREAT!

Was here with about 8 colleagues for a casual dinner Monday night. It was a pretty lousy experience all around. 

Our server could not remember a single drink or food order so it was an auction every time she showed up to to the table. "Who had the Guinness?"  When asked what single malts they had she responded with "What's that?"

The food was all around bad. Tough pork chops, bad fish and chips, and the menu was limited to anything that you can make from Sysco truck ingredients. No malt vinegar for the fish and chips. A bar with an Irish name that serves fish and chips with no malt vinegar. That makes sense. 

So, if you can get past the awful service and terrible food this was a great place for dinner.

If I had to use one word to describe this place it would be: Loud.  It's not that the music is too loud or anything, it's just a loud space.  I had a very difficult time having a conversation with the people at my table, which is sort of the reason for going out.  They do have a back room that I've sat in that is not nearly as loud, it seems to just be the main room.  The food here is very good and the prices on both beer and food are very reasonable.  Staff is friendly and the servers were prompt with refills.  I don't know what it is, I want to love the place, but I just find it okay.  It's not a bad place and I'll probably go back at some point, it's just not my favorite place to hang out.

Mullen's is just your standard American bar food joint.  

I went here for lunch with a couple of colleagues, and the food was ok.  For their draft special, they had 312.  Sometimes I find draft specials can come out a little flat, but the 312 was fresh and bubbly.  If it wasn't during work hours, I might have had another one.  I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap with tater tots.  The wrap was good and spicy, but the tater tots tasted like they were fried in old oil. 

The service was pretty good.  Our waitress was attentive, but not overly so.  Our food came out promptly, and she brought the check quickly...all things you want when doing lunch on a work day.

I have only been to Mullen's once and it was in the main objective to get beer and wings. Let's just say that I was able to accomplish both on my visit!! Since moving into the area we have been looking for a wing place that wasn't Buffalo Wild Wings or Hooters and we have tried quite a few places but had a hard time finding any that were reasonably priced. Finally read about Mullen's wings on Yelp and decided to give it a try one Sunday afternoon. I was pleasantly surprised with the selection of beers and beer specials along with the wings. They were plump and delicious and of course the have Wing Wednesday, which we will be going back to often. It had a good atmosphere also, both inside and out. We sat out on the patio which doesn't have the best view (the road) but at least we go to sit outside drink a beer and eat some great wings.

I'm not sure why it took me 13 years to step in here, but this place is a decent bar and grill. There's lots of tables and space and a nice pub environment.  I had a nice medium-rare 1/2 lb two topping (mushrooms and avocado) build-your-own burger for $8.95 (with fries).  My colleague had fish and chips which he liked for for $11.95.  I liked the quick and easy parking for a weekday lunch, and it looked to be a good place to consider for a casual group outing.  They also apparently have live bands on Saturday (no cover) from 10pm - 1am.

I really wanted to like this place...and came here several times after work with friends for drinks but I just can't. The food is really bland and greasy. And the atmosphere is that of a trashy college bar (Which don't get me wrong that's a great time in college) it just doesn't make sense here.

I can only rate it on the alcohol service. Mullen's is like a golden beacon of solitude after a hard day at work. Usually when someone wants a beer after work, it's met with, "Wanna go to Mullen's?" 

For a bar, it's okay and nothing special. Standard sports bar atmosphere. Let's just say the close proximity to my workplace helps a lot. I wouldn't make a special trip to drink here.

Service was friendly and fast. We never waited around for another beer and the waitress didn't get pissy when we split up the check with plastic and cash.

I like it because it's a chill place to grab a quick beer but there are better places in the area.
Decided to come here for.dinner.  I ordered the chicken pot biscuits.  Only ok.  Tasted like frozen veggies mixed with cream of chicken soup...not a homemade taste at all

A friend of mine invited me to Mullen's for the Tuesday night "Open Mic Night".  Being we are both musicians, he thought it might be a great idea to try out several of our songs from our new project, in front of an audience.  Wow, what a mistake.
First of all, I'm not crazy about "Open Mic Nights".  Truth is, there is no audience.  It is mostly musicians just waiting to get up on stage to play.  And they are really not interested in what you're playing, they are just interested in their own music.
And, there is always a clique, always.  There are always a group of regulars there, who think they're the best, and they really don't want anyone else to show them up.  Believe me, Mullen's was no exception.
Don't get me wrong, Mullen's has a really nice stage, and a great, great, sound guy.  He was probably the most experienced and accommodating.  
We sat and listened, (and suffered ), through several acts.  Even though some of the acts were downright terrible, everyone had ample respect for the musicians; listening and clapping.  That is, until we got on stage.  Once we got on stage, the clique decided to talk as loud as possible, obviously not treating us with the same respect they did everyone else.  It was completely horrible.  They even got louder as the music progressed and escalated, obviously trying to undermine us, and the music.  It was absolutely the most rude and disrespectful behavior I have ever seen at an "Open Mic". 
Needless to say, if you are a musician, DO NOT EVEN BOTHER WITH MULLEN"S.  What a complete waste of time, unless of course, you are part of the Mullen's clique of Justin Bieber, Miley Cyrus, and American Idol wannabes!
And trust me, you would be much better off with a drive in the country, setting up in a cornfield, and playing your music out there.  It would be much more liberating, and definitely much more appreciated!

I find myself in a rare situation where I'm lacking any inspiration about what to write. I had an overall good experience but nothing stood that would make me want to come back. The service was good, the food was good, the prices were good, atmosphere was good. But no more or less. In the end, you won't regret going here but you won't want to go out of your way either.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. To be honest, I never even made it in the front door. My family was in from out of town a few weeks ago. We were looking for a sports bar so we could watch a basketball game that started at 11 AM. Mullen's opens at 11 AM so we, along with two other people, stood out front waiting for their doors to open. A couple minutes after 11 when they had not open the doors, I called from my cell phone and told him there were people waiting to come in to watch a game that started a few minutes ago. The person who answered the phone basically said oh okay and hung up. Then we heard someone come to the front door and unlock it, but this person never opened the door to let us in. Didn't even look outside. There are no windows in the doors, so they could not have seen us but since I just called 10 seconds before they knew we were there. We all felt this was so incredibly rude that we left to find another place. They lost seven lunch customers, and I will never even consider eating there again.

This place runs because it has a late night liquor license that allows them to serve when other bars and restaurants are shut down.  Every waitress, bartender, food runner, etc.. in the 5 mile radius ends up here after their shift....blowing their hard earned tip money. 

The food sucks, drinks are marginal, soapy taste in beer mugs, and menus are sticky. 

I gave them an a extra star since they have quite a variety of musical performers & their staff is pretty friendly.

This is probably one of the only places to eat lunch at if you work in the Naperville Road/Warrenville Road vicinity.  I work there once in a while and when I do...Mullens is my choice for lunch.  They have AWESOME Pot Roast Nachos as well as tater tots as an option with your meal, also awesome cheese fries!!!.  

If you live in the area you can almost always find coupons in the "Clipper" magazine.  

I've also been here on weekends to see bands.  I like this place more for eating and drinks...not so much about the bands.  There are beams and all kinds of obstruction if you're there for the live music so the set up isn't so great.  But, they have bands on the weekends and that's a plus too!

I'm visiting Illinois and the hotel sent us to this restaurant.  We sat in the bar area so we could watch Monday Night Football.  There were plenty of tv's so we could see the game from any seat at our table.  Our waitress, Andrea, was fantastic!!!  She was very attentive, always quick to bring us another beer and had a wonderful personality.  She even spent time with us helping us get a taxi.  We enjoyed talking with her each time she came by the table.  The food was enjoyable.  I had the Turkey BLT, and it was a great sandwich.  Lot's of turkey and big pieces of bacon.  My husband had the pulled pork sandwich and he enjoyed it very much.  His only complaint was that the roll the sandwich came on was a bit soggy from the meat.  I would definitely recommend this place and we will most likely visit again while we are in Illinois.
thank you to the manager who personally wrote me to clear up the misunderstanding and invited us to visit again.  much appreciated.

Went here on Friday after work for a friends birthday.   My wife and I each ordered the fish and chips.  Fish was very good.  Thick pieces of cod.  Fries were tasty.  They had $3 Dos Equis lagers for their beer of the month.  

Our waitress was new (3 months) and she did a great job. We all had separate checks and moving back and forth from the pool room to our table must have been confusing to her, but she kept up.

Birthday girl had a good time as did the rest of us.

This place is not good. The service sucks, the ambiance is terrible and the food is not good. The 2 stars are only for the patio. I do not think I will ever come here again...maybe just to drink. Our server Emily was really nice but overall the place is not worth your time.

Was there with a large party on Wednesday night.  Service was attentive, and I was a bit worried with the reviews on the food but it was very good.  

Did order the nachos with pot roast meat - and these were good - huge plate piled high - had leftovers even with a large party of 10!  They were mild which was fine.  I ordered the Chopped Salad which was a good portion and tasty and fresh, not unlike one you'd find at Portillo's or Buena Beef - but was slightly less "chopped" than those.  Good selection of beers on-tap as well.

Three others ordered the Fish and Chips and said they were very good.  Waitstaff did have to be reminded about a beer order a few times, but other than that - a good time!

I'd like to pause and give a massive High-Five to the sky for the ever so tasty creation that is nachos.

Let's rewind this a few clicks and get to the real source of our nacho infatuation. Mullen's. A friend and I met up for a casual drink to catch up and drink up. The oh so typical standard. When she picked Mullen's, I honestly had no clue where it was. Mistake Numero Uno.

Parked right off of I-88, it's a perfect hub for a relaxed pint or a full on after-hour cocktail. It's sort of a bar where anything goes. From the wooden booths to the plentiful bar tables scattered throughout, there's an assortment of places to set your pretty booty down and get comfortable with the likes of everyone else in the neighborhood. From suits to jeans, beers to shots...are you ready?

We stuck it out for the night and had beer, but what sold me...was the Pot Roast Nachos. Did that come out right? Nachos with pot roast meat instead of chicken? Oh yes, that is very right. 

A hugely different take on a bar staple, this is a serious MUST if you are planning on getting pub grub while filling your neighbor in on a work schedule or bitching about your floor smelling like cat pee. 

In all fairness, the menu had a whole long list of foodies that sounded pretty great and filling but I'm going to come right on out and say that this will forever be my local hub for getting nachos in Naperville. Okay, technically it's Lisle...but whatever.

All.Of.Naperville.

Well done, Mullen's. You scored big-time with the pot roast nachos and uber relaxed place to slink away for a cheap drink.

Just OK.My dewars and water was served in a tall water glass? Obviously not a seasoned bartender! Then later shift came on about 4:30pm and I got a decent drink in the correct glass. Had wings that were OK..typical bar wings. Prices high for the food. Artichoke dip app is $10?? Waiter was very attentive but no personality and don't think he spoke much English either. Not a big fan but close to work for a quick cocktail but would go somewhere else for dinner

Had the err, pleasure of spending the weekend in Naperville for work.  After unsuccessfully trying to go elsewhere and finding it closed at 10pm on a Saturday we came to Mullen's due to it's proximity to our hotel.

We sat at the bar and got some drinks which were either flat (the Shiner Bock on special) or in my opinion over priced (I'm at a dive in the suburbs, come-on!)

The food was below average bar food.  I got a burger with mushrooms, onions and blue cheese.  Way to much blue cheese on the there.  Also I am not a fan of frozen, pre-made burger patties but I was super hunger and it was food.  The bbq chips did not taste fresh and were over loaded with spice.

The service was just ok, we had to wait a bit and ask for the check and also had to flag someone down to ask for waters.

There was a man with a guitar playing all of my favorite songs with a decent voice, so that was a plus.

Sadly if you are in the area, you just might not have any other options!  Not the worst, I just would go in with low expectations and maybe you will be surprised!

This is a fun place. We went on Saturday night to catch an eagles cover band. I had reserved a table over the phone with Steve. Super nice. He was super helpful too. I had asked him about the view, the crowd, if there was dancing, etc. I think I probably talked to him about three separate times regarding our reservation.  

The beer was really really cheap. My husband could not believe the bill when it came. They were having specials on Dos Equis and the Blue Moon girls were there.  I had a couple of the pom margaritas.  Those were awesome. We also ordered 2 dozen wings.  Oddly enough though the cheesy garlic wings were a heck of a lot spicier than the "shock and awe" ones were.  

I was really surprised the place was not more crowded.  I would definitely try to go back.

It's your average sports bar. What upsets me about people complaining about bad service is that there is a trick. I have never had bad service here and I never will. When the waitress comes to your table and asks what you would like to drink. After giving your order, ask what there name is. Strike up a bit of a conversation. I guarantee the service will be much better.

So about the place. Drinks are a bit expensive. Food is really pretty good for the average sports bar. Burgers are very good but the best sandwich is the Pittsburgh Cheesesteak. Granted I have not had an original Philly cheesesteak sandwich but if it better than this it must be fantastic.

They have a huge room where you can have parties. They do a pretty good job in that area.

There is also a separate area for families to sit.

They have bands on the weekends.

On Saturday 9/15/12 a group of us had our 25th High School Reunion here. We reserved there room and had one of there appetizer packages. We had about 20 people (so a small affair).  The FOOD was really good. -- Pizzas, Hot Wings, Mini Sliders (burgers & pulled pork).  The mini burger sliders were so good, they both came on pretzel buns.  We had our own waitress for the event and they even extended our time in the room.    The room also has pool tables, foosball, a few video games & a juke box. We did not end up using them, but it was nice to have! 
I would recommend Mullen's for a party to anyone!  The prices are reasonable and the staff was soo very attentive.
Attended a fundraiser/Halloween party. Food was good, pizza was a nice surprise, not your typical crappy bar pizza. Server made her rounds every 10-15 minutes. Clean bathroom. No complaints!

This place it pretty cool!  The food is good and the drinks are good.  One time we had a disinterested waited, but every other time was great!

A friend of mine has her birthday party here every year and they are always accommodating and we have a great time!  They must be doing something right if she keeps going back year after year!

I wish I could give zero stars.  My son performed with his jazz band, at Mullen's, a year ago.  They took $10 from us, for a recording, to be delivered to us in the future.  The music teacher never received them, nor did we receive it in the mail.  I have spoken to the manager on duty FOUR times.  She has promised to have someone call back.  NO ONE EVER CALLS BACK.  They took our money and they do not care about following up.

We stumbled upon this place during a road trip and we were very hungry.  Although the place was very loud, (a magnificent 20piece band was playing jazz) the food was incredible!!  THIS is pub food??  WOW!!  My husband and I had the chicken tenders meal.  Beautiful, home cooked!  The jazz was loud, but amazing! 
The waitress was very, very nice.  Bottom line, great service, great music, great food.  We'd go there again in a heartbeat!!

I don't go to Mullen's for the food. It's fair. Nothing more.

The reason I go to Mullen's is because a group I belong to meets there on occasion for dinner meetings. We usually have a group of 15 to 25 people and have the back room reserved. The room has a projection screen and PC Projector that can be connected to a laptop for presentations. The room also has two folding doors that can be closed to block out the noise from the restaurant / bar area. And believe me, it seems to get very loud at times.

The service has always been good for our group. Serving a group of 15 to 25 people is a task in itself. Kudos to the servers who have to keep everything straight. Sometimes we only have one server.

For our last group meeting, our organizer said in order to reserve the meeting room we had to had to commit to a menu and a room charge (instead of ordering individually like we use to do). No real biggie with the change, just good info to know for future reference.

So, Mullen's may be an okay place to go for a group meet up, but not so much for the food.

Great service. Great specials. Great space. The bartenders and servers are always eager to please their guests, plus they off an industry discount to anybody that works in the bizzz. Good specials too.

I've been here several times, and it's just okay. The food is standard bar food, but not my favorite. Really, the only reason I come here is to meet up with a group of friends who frequent the place.

On my most recent visit, the first guy at the bar (looked like a manager) had NO clue what the specials were, even though he offered to get my drink. The female bartender relieved him  and took my order. I paid my tab right away, as I was meeting up with friends. 

We were placed in the back room, where there was (sort of?) a private party going on. They were clearing the buffet, but a meeting was still going on. I felt intrusive to say the least. But we persevered. 

The server was slow, and MIA when she was needed. She was nice enough, but disappeared after half our table had departed, so we waited for 10 minutes after asking a busser to send her out(10 minutes more than when we started looking for her). 

As far as food, it's ok. I had the app sampler and it came out mostly cold. The mozz sticks were not gooey at all; the onion rings were caked in cooled oil (bleck); the buff chicken tenders were pretty good albeit tiny; the southwest egg rolls were (actually quite decent) the best thing on the platter. Some of my pals had tater tots, which were overcooked for sure. 

Meh.

Mullen's is what I like to call a "comfort place."  It's layed back, has good food, live entertainment, and friendly service.  

Love playing Bags?  They got 'em outside.  (Talk about chillin' like a villain after work with a beer in hand and a bag in the other.)

Last time I was there, I had the Buffalo Chicken sandwich.  They did not, by any means, skimp on the chicken.  Their burgers are tasty and they have a number of beers to drink along with it.

Stop by and enjoy, you won't be disappointed.

I'd like to give this place a better review with their ridiculously cheap specials. 1/2 drinks on Sundays, how do they get away with that?

I'll tell you how:

Went in there last night after driving all the way down there to eat at Mapo, which you should check out. Just to down a few beers and then make my way back east. The waiter was kind of weird, he seemed pretty nice but the females in our party thought he was a little too touchy feely. Sure, that's a little weird but also they're a little FOBby so they might just be overly sensitive. 

It took 10 minutes for me to get my first beer. The place wasn't busy since Sunday Night Football was winding down, maybe 3 other tables besides ours. Granted there was a martini order but 10 minutes? I shook my head at a missed field goal kick and the waiter apologized for being so late with the drinks. Also, there were some fans there and they were just way too loud for a suburban crowd, why do they yell loudly when there are 25 people in a bar? It just makes you look like an a-hole, especially when you're by yourself and no one is cheering with you.

Pros: Irish Pub atmosphere, Spanish-Artichoke Chicken sandwich was par, nice balance of TV screens for sports.

Cons: Service was lacking BIG-TIME.

I'll give it another try....sometime.

I believe this place has potential to be a decent bar & restaurant, but not without some major changes.

I've been here four times, mainly because my coworkers seem to like it:

The first time, they messed up my order.
The second time, the service was somewhat slow and inefficient.
The third and fourth times, I got sick from the food. (I'll spare you all the details.)

First, the good.  This place has a surprisingly broad menu; in addition to the standard pub/grill food, they have choices like hummus, individual pizzas, and a veggie wrap that includes rice, wild rice, and some spices I couldn't identify.  If you have a vegetarian in your group, they'll dance a jig and not having to order the nachos or the quesadilla!

Lots of parking, large outdoor seating area.  Standard pub-type decor, stained glass (but no "flair," so there aren't bizarre things stapled to the walls), flat TVs mounted to the walls.  Darkish.  

It's hard to hear your dinner companions, and we were a group.  Which is where the trouble started.  Our waitress had been working there two weeks and was totally unprepared for a group of 12 (which mushroomed to 17).  We'd been told separate checks was OK; she seemed unclear on the concept, and insisted on actually collecting credit cards to be sure no one walked out on her.  And of course she confused our orders (couldn't remember how many beers people had; may have added one extra; missed an onion rings for fries substitution after verbally confirming it).  One guy never got his beer and ended up drinking someone else's.

She then had to have us rewrite our order, and then completely recalculate our ticket.  At which point she needed to ask everyone whose was whose as she hadn't written down names and couldn't match the orders to the credit cards.

The guy who ordered one beer had to argue with her to pay his $2.50 and leave.  The rest of us waited 20 minutes while she did the math, then came back with our tickets.

For groups, the restaurant adds an automatic gratuity, and while we paid it, I'd be very surprised if any of us added to it.  It's a shame; it was a nice place and it could have been a good experience.

It's a 3-star sports bar. Pretty cookie cutter. I think they have a few more beers on tap than the average bear. That's about it.

I almost dinged Mullens a yelp-star for the cranky, little zombie-girl who brought us our drinks... or the crappy Bull losing again... but bah, whatcha gonna do.
peace.... yow, bill

Mullens is absolutely disgusting! The food made me and my whole party sick! It arrived to the table undercooked and cold. The service was terrible, it took 10 mins to get drinks while I watched the bartender  laughing away hard at work, not. When I complained to the management about the food and the length of time it took to get my drinks, he simply said I'm sorry and walked away unconcerned. He didn't care. The bathrooms are disgusting and smell horrible. Mullens is horrible

I end up here a lot for lunch, as my office is close by.  The best I can say about the food is that its decent American fare.  I pretty much stick to the buffalo chicken sandwich and tater tots (yes, I am one of those people who often orders the same thing at certain places - sacriligious, according to my husband).  But the true reason for a 2-star review is the service.  Its so ridiculously slooooooow and I've never had one experience there when its been any quicker than slooooooow.  And I've been there A LOT, like I said.

I can't comment on Mullens' evening festivities because I get enough of it at lunch, but I have noticed signs for live music and drink specials.

You won't find this city slicker in the burbs too often but when you do you DEFINITELY won't find her at Chili's, Crapplebee's, Bennigan's or TGIFuggetaboutit . .. .

When presented with lunch spot options on Sunday, I immediately vetoed the usual suspects.  Luckily, I could see Mullen's from my Hilton Hotel window.  Although it IS a chain, I was game (especially since I dig the one in Wrigleyville). 

Mullen's was absolutely dead Sunday at 11:30 but the service wasn't.  Our waitress was quick with the drinks, orders - everything.  We started with a spread of wings.  Although the "Shock and Awe" were my personal favorite, I found all varieties to be FABULOUS.  The Bloody Marys were nothing to sneeze at - ALMOST as good as Murphy's (but not quite).  I was super impressed.  For my meal?  I went with the Italian Beef sandwich (please note:  I did a long marathon training run the day before so I am not a complete fatty-boom-batty).  The sandwich was GREAT with a nice side of au jus.

Mullen's was a complete suburban surprise - i would come back for sure.  Like it's famous wing sauce, Mullen's truly shocked and awed me.

Went here last night for St. Patty's and for a Birthday party.  Crazy fun, but man was it packed.  The waitress did an awesome job in keeping up with all of our orders, drinks, and craziness. 

I was a bit confused when I got there.  Had to pay $10 for a wrist band, that as far as i can tell didn't do anything.  There wasn't drink specials, or free beer, or anything.  But they did give us a ticket for 1 free drink.  So the way I figure (and i'm not good at math, so bare with me) I paid $10 to get a $5 drink....   

Now it wasn't a cover charge, because initially I just walked in and the guy checked my ID - and i didn't get a wrist band.  The group I was with asked what I was getting for my "free" drink, and that's when I went back.... should of never listened to them. 

Good food and great service.

I was PLEASANTLY surprised by my visit to this Mullen's in the sticks -- surprised because I had been reading a handful of reviews complaining about stuck up or disinterested servers but everyone I encountered Monday night was pleasant, helpful and quick to get me anything I wanted.  

I have visited several other Mullen's in Chicago (and it's strange how every one has a different personality dependng on where it sits.!) This was a relaxed, chill vibe like you might expect being out in the sticks, with a handful of people taking advantage of the bags on the patio. 

I was very happy to learn that Monday is half-price pint night and I proceeded to take a tour of an impressive number of the 20 brews they have on tap. 

I always order wings, no matter what Mullen's I go to because that's what you do. If you want variety, that's what the umpteen sauce choices are for. And of course TOTS. I want to see them work those tots a little more. What about some nacho tots? 

Mullen's delivers everything you want in a sports bar in my opinion. This one is also football-field size or something approaching....

food items are decent, and every time I find a good beer on their list, they 'just ran out' or are 'switching it out for the next seasonal'. The kicker for me is when they have a DJ come in. They pay money to have some guy come in and blast the exact same crappy music as I'd get if all the drunks were pumping money into a juke box. I've been driven out the last 2 times I was there for this nonsense.

I try very hard not to be a snob about a restaurant. When a server makes a mistake or the food is mediocre, I'll shrug it off and assume maybe an off night. This was, hands down, the worst dining experience I've ever had. Just God awful and I'm embarrassed I brought my in-laws to this place.

First - the service was terrible. Our two servers  were more concerned with making sure the table behind us had working controllers for the bar game then providing accurate drink orders which we're served in very slow intervals and often delivered to the wrong person. We were there for 2/2:30 hours - we literally saw the opening pitch of the White Sox game and saw the game concluded before the check was dropped. We weren't even greeted for 20 minutes after sitting down - 40 minutes to bring out 2 appetizers - buffalo wings. Drink orders were late and wrong and entrees came out after 1:30 of sitting there. 

Second - the quality of food was awful. Martinis were small and again, paaaainfully long to get. We order 312's, the special, she shows up with Miller Lights and gives us an explanation about how she can discern which beer it is by the look and those were definitely 312's. They weren't. My sister's burger was raw, my other sister's meatloaf was inedible and the mashed potatoes that came with had the taste of powdered mashed potatoes. Fiance's burger was burned and the fries - yikes. 

The front desk sat us in the bar - which wouldn't be a bad thing - if not for the blaring 90's rock played and birthday party behind us. Not at all what I had in mind for entertaining the in-laws and I'm sorely embarrassed I made them sit through that exercise in patience. 

My biggest regret was not leaving after waiting 20 minutes after the first round - we would have gone to any other restaurant in Naperville. My second regret was not getting the manager - I didn't want to make a scene in front of my family but I'll never be back. Never. 

If you like this place - more power to you. If anyone ever asks me where to eat in Naperville - I shall always end my recommendation with 'whatever you do, do not go to Mullen's'. 

To the staff at Mullen's - man - you guys have ways to go espcially judging by the other reviews (which also cite the slow service). You need to better educate your servers and run your restaurant much faster. And honestly, tell your hostess to not flirt with the bouncer as paying customers leave instead of saying 'thanks!' or 'have a good night'.

Wandered way west tonight for a private birthday party for a friend and I have to say that this place did a very nice job.

Mullen's (named after Jim Mullen's, the Rogers Park cop who was injured in the line of duty back in 1996- I think he is a family friend of the owner) serves some typical bar food along with the likes of pasta, meatloaf and steaks.

We were in the private party room which was really something.  For $50 you can rent a room with two pool tables, two dartboards and a fireplace and have food served to you at the tables or in a buffet line.  It would be a great place for a work outing or other private event.

The service was great- they had easily 4 of the nicest servers waiting on us- running to get our drinks from the main bar area and alerting us to when new food was out (appetizers, entrees and dessert).  There was also an attentive bus boy  who seemed to be invisible until you put your plate down and then it was quickly whisked away.

In addition to the room we were in, they have a number of other dining rooms, an outside patio area for al fresco dining as well as a spacious bar that has live music on Saturday's.

In reading some of the other reviews- it looks like this place has found it's service legs and the problems that others have mentioned have gone away.

For those of you city dwellers- Mullen's has two other locations that will save you from packing an overnight bag to visit them- the original Rogers Park location on Western, and the Wrigleyville location on Clark.

Great place to watch the Bears game.  FREE wings at halftime and there was plently of food.  Would not recommend this place for kids if you are concerned about the language they may hear.  Bear's fans can get very colorful :)
I will return again and again.

Mullen's is the place for sloppy Joe's and tator tots! The Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is also pretty good. 

But here is the deal....dont expect good service. The servers tend to be pretty slow and lunch seems to be the worse. If you're going simply for the food, you're in good hands. 

Eat, Live, Love. 
JR

My wife and I took our two teen boys there for dinner last week and were not disappointed.  They happend to have a live jazz band playing, our food was quite good, the decore was nice and the server we had gave us perhaps the best service we received anywhere this year.  We don't often go out of our way to provide positive comments to management but we found the manager that night and talked about the great service.  This place is a bit out of the way for us so we might have come back for the food but after the great service, I'm confident we will be back.

I've never had any problems at Mullens.The bartenders are always friendly and nice. The place is very loud, but I usually go outside, so that's ok. They have more choices on beers and they also have good pizza for late night hunger. Overall, I like Mullens.

Not a bad semi chain.  Went here on a Friday night to wait out traffic.  Good crowd, kinda busy.  The staff was cool, laid back.  Food came out quickly, good quality.  I got some potato skins and a steak (well done, cook right and quick), I really enjoyed it.  Might not be the best place for kids.

My rating is based on my restaurant experiences, not the bar. I've been here plenty of times for lunch and dinner. The interior is typical "Irish" sports pub (considering it was a Mexican restaurant long, long ago, that's no small task), but clean. They have a gas fireplace going during the winter, which is a nice touch. There's also a dining patio with a dozen tables.

Food is above average for a sports bar, both in taste and quality. I'm partial to the bbq pork, buffalo chicken, ruben, and Mullen's club. The fish and chips is usually good, and the pizzas, surprisingly, have been uniformly good. Side salad is definitely above average and a decent size. Beer selection is ok, and the monthly beer special is usually something above average (i.e., not Bud Light) at a small discount. 

Most of the service staff seems to turn over with some frequency. However, there are some who have been there for a number of years, and it's common to see the manager out on the floor checking on guests. Service is usually good, dipping to average once in awhile, but always friendly.

Essentially, swinging in here after the White Tavern at 1.30p, we had expected it to be packed. 
That expectation was not reached. 

The party had sat down at the bar and got one of the best bartenders we've had in ages. I can not speak any ill to her at all. Katrinia, the Russian pianist and all, was fabulous. Quipping back to us as well as adding delightful insight to general ridiculousness that we were discussing. And a looker. 

At the bar, after you've sat there long enough, you notice little things. Like waitstaff coming by you and making the effort to introduce themselves to you and nodding even afterwards and making eye contact with you. The other bar'ers are rad as well. From an enthusiastic saracstic dick named Dave to an owner of a logistics firm that will goad you about why the White Sox suck (I guess this area is a Cubs hotbed?) to making comments about how bad your unwashed body smells and your overall appearance.

Katrinia, the doll face, helped this guy out. We started off with some stellar Goose Island Matilda that packed a punch that knocked out your shoes and 8 bucks from your wallet. Bbbbut! She'll help you out by asking her manager if you can snaggle some Stella glasses and other freebies. I guess that's what you get when you sit at the bar for a solid 7 hours. 

I would go to this bar every weekend if it was closer. And I had more money. But, Sundays are fundays. 25 cent wings, no matter how horrible they may be, are a solid pick up. 

Repeat, repeat, repeat....after I shower.
$12 dollars for a Sam Adams?  Seriously? And then saying the 50% off that is a special?  That is insane!

I attending a private 30th birthday party here is the reservable room.  The room was very well setup, it had several tables, curtains over the doorway, TVs on the walls and an overhead projector to show personal sideshows.  The projector can in handy during the party!  The servers were very attentive with drinks and cleaning the tables.  The food from the kitchen for the party was well enjoyed by everyone.  After the party everyone migrated out to a closed off patio area that had table and several sets of the game Bags.  Great place, great service, great beer, great food.  I'll be returning. Cheers!

This place is not bad, but not great either. I have never had a problem with the service but, I only sit at the bar. The specials for beer and wings used to be awesome, now they are nothing to get all charged up about. As far as the food goes, I have only eaten the wings here. I like them alot. Not amazing, but they are very good. The wings here really fix my wagon.
Great place to watch college basketball or any sports food is good and the atmosphere is awesome

We went Friday night 9/21 for a beer, a snack, and to check the place out.  When I looked at the menu I realized I was at the place where I had ready the review about the Pot Roast Nachos, and HAD to try them.  OMG -- they were delicious!  The place had a fun atmosphere, we had a great waiter, and the other guests were friendly, but the tip of the iceburg, I have to say, were those unbelievable nachos.  We will be going back Monday night for the Bears game for sure!

I finally had a chance to try this Korean gem in the Western suburbs of Chicago. First, this restaurant is located in the food court area of the International Mall.  Even though I live quite near this area, I hadn't ever gone in, but surprised to see it's quite popular among the East Asian population, especially on the weekends.

We went on a weekend for lunch.  Service was very friendly and despite being cafeteria style seating, our food was delivered to our table.  Food was placed in nice china and the presentation and plating was beautiful.  We ordered bulgogi, vegetable pancake, and sides of kimchi.  The food can be described as modern, clean, and traditional with a twist.  The bulgogi was beef and was very tender and marinated to perfection.  It was topped by apple, sesame seeds, and watercress (I believe).  Just a lovely combination of flavors and very sophisticated.  The vegetable scallion pancake was also tasty, served with a soy sauce mixture.  Kimchi was great, and we were served both traditional cabbage kimchi as well as the daikon kimchi.   

The prices for these dishes was a very good value.  You'd be paying double for not even that great food at other Korean establishments in the city.  

The food is actually too good for the venue it is in, in my opinion.  Hopefully, with continued success they can expand and maybe even establish a bigger niche for their delicious creations.  Unfortunately, it seems many people in the suburbs don't like trying new things (i.e. old white people) and that's why the restaurants suck so much in the suburbs versus only a few miles away in Chicago.  Hanbun is definitely the exception!

Great job!  I'll be back to try some new dishes and definitely will be carrying out for lunch too.

Four of us came to International Mall's food court for Sunday brunch and upon walking in you immediately know you're in for a real deal authentic mealy meal.  

The two in the know parked up in the longest queue which serves up authentic Taiwanese breakfast so I let them do their thing knowing I would be the lucky beneficiary of their reliable decisions.

I chose Hanbun looking for Bibimbap and Vegetable pancake both which delivered to great tummy success.  The bibimbap came with chicken and was good but not all that hot, still quite tasty.  The vegetable pancake was outstanding as was the accompanying tangy soy dipping sauce!

Check it out, will not disappoint.

I finally had a chance to try this place.  They are 4 or 5 other restaurants in this development.  They are similar to the restaurants in Assi & Super H.  Hanbun is a tiny little restaurant smack dab in the middle.  They have 9 dishes to select from so it shouldn't be too hard to select an item, 

They have very limited hours from 11-3 (lunch time).  Evidently they do other food services in the evening, but don't have the hours listed so I'm not sure if it's open to the public.

I had the jjajangmyun which is a Korean & Chinese style noodle with black beans, pork belly (pork fat? Not much meat) and seasoned vegetables.  The flavoring was some type of soy sauce.  I later added a spicy sauce to the dish and mixed it in.  This made the food much tastier.  

I wanted to try the bulgogi but they were all out.  Hanbun is a very small restaurant.  Jennifer was very friendly and very helpful telling us about the different dishes available.  I can't wait to go back and try some of their other dishes

It's good.  I would recommend going

Here's what you should know:

-  it's inside the international mall.  It was hard to find, so park in front of the mall and it's on the first floor.

-  it's like a cafeteria inside.  The first floor of the mall is mainly just food and reflexology. May not make a difference, but it is surrounded by about 4 other food places.  

-  compared to the other food places, Hanbun looks the nicest.  The others don't really stand out as much

-  the menu is really easy, as they only have about 6 items.  Easy to see what they ha e and what you want
