-  they are super nice.  The 2 ladies that were working were very helpful and both spoke very good English.  That helps because some of the other places aren't as helpful and don't speak great English

-  overall the food was really good.

Went for the tasting menu, what an intimate & fantastic experience! I was a bit unsure about the ambiance and fine dining, but Dave & Jen were so warm we had an awesome time! The food was beautiful and delicious. We even got a mini tasting of various types of kimchi after we mentioned one of us is a kimchi fanatic. Well worth the price!

Is this a baby step in making the International Plaza truly international? I sure hope so. 

With limited Korean selections nearby, my lunch mates and I were excited to learn of this new addition. Four of us gathered and paid a visit on a random Wednesday afternoon for jjajjangmyun, pork buns, roasted rice cake with sweet chili sauce, and bibimbap. 

I had the jjajjangmyun which is a bowl of rod-shaped noodles with black bean sauce, pork belly, chives, and cucumber. Unlike the other jjajjangmyun that I've had before, Hanbun's black bean sauce was much lighter in color and I wasn't sure if mine actually had black beans in them. The contents had a stronger soy sauce flavor instead. Also, the pork belly was mostly minced fat. Normally, I am a huge fan of pork fat but this one left me wondering if there were any lean meat at all.

With that said, this is a good start but I do anticipate some slight tweaks.

Made the trek out to Westmont from Buffalo Grove at my wife's recommendation on our day off and it was well worth it! 

In this day and age where every new restaurant is all about the "create your own" phenomenon, and you have to concoct something with given ingredients, It's refreshing to run across a place that knows what they make well and your only job is to let your mouth savor the taste and for your stomach to rejoice. 

We started with the Toasted Rice Cake skewer: the texture was perfect, a slight crisp on the outside and perfectly chewy underneath.  The sweet chili glaze and puffed amaranth complement this to perfection.

The Korean pork bun with coffee scented pork was so tender and the steamed buns were perfectly made.  Usually with these types of pork buns, I just care about the meat is, but the white kimchi and scallions make the flavor profile really something else.

To top it off, we had the Korean Ramyun: the broth was very well flavored without being too watery or salty, a very nice balance and perfect texture to the noodles.

The owners were so nice and service was excellent.

We will definitely back to try every item on the menu and repeat the ones mentioned above.  Definitely a hidden gem and I'm sure this place will be getting glowing press soon.

Loved it.  Please open up a branch in the north suburbs...

Had the greatest meal in a long time at this Korean restaurant last night. Chef Dave and his fianc Jen run their restaurant in an Asian food court in Diho Market, International Mall. However, this CIA trained couple can turn up the talent at their Chef's Table dinners. Our group of eight brought several wines to accompany the meal. The place is byob.. I highly recommend making a reservation for a group of 6 to 10 people before these young chefs talents are discovered by the masses.
The owners are so nice! Customer service is awesome. Very new and clean kitchen. The buns are pretty fantastic. The sticky rice cake are spicy and delicious. The ramen is great.

It is a gem indeed! My son and I went there today for the first time. The food was delicious and the owners absolutely gracious. When they found out that I eat vegetarian, they even offered tips on how to order variety of Korean dishes vegetarian! Will certainly go back. Also, they had the best vegetable pancakes that we had tasted so far.

4/12/16

Came there again with my five year old girl.

She loved the pork bun and they remembered me! So happy.

They gave me two soups complimentary ( they remembered I like their pork kimchee soup). The other soup was devoured my my five year old who drank every last bit of it!

Thank you HanBun!

Great option in the west suburbs which is severely lacking in Korean food. It is definitely a more modern twist on Korean classics but delicious nonetheless. I enjoyed the jiajiang noodles and the bulgogi the most, which is quite interesting topped with apples. The rice cakes with gochujang sauce were also simple but tasty. Hanbun is probably the only legitimate Korean restaurant in the area but the food is great so I will be back!

We loved the unique interpretations at Hanbun. The interpretations were not so far off that you wouldn't recognize it but the dishes were very much inspired. Some of the dishes actually seemed better than the original/traditional dishes. Reasonable prices and beautiful presentations. The restaurant is part of a mall-so not fine dining but the food is worth the stop.

This is the BEST Korean restaurant in the Chicagoland area. I love that the taste is authentic, AND there is a creative twist at the same time. I hate watered down Korean fusion restaurants, and this is NOT one of them. The jjajangmyun, ramyun, and pajeon are my favorites but you really can't go wrong. I've tried everything, and I wish I lived closer so I could come regularly. I also had a tasting menu experience here, and it changed my life. It was the BEST tasting menu I've ever had, and it was so wonderful to actually talk to Dave and Jen (owners). They are what makes this place so special. You can tell how much they care about the food they are making. It feels like you're right at home :)

We had an amazing and belly-bursting meal here. One of the best Korean foods I have eaten. Dave took some everyday ordinary Korean dishes and really refined and distilled it to pure clean flavors. The best jajjang myun ever. Can't wait to try the juhnyuk (dinner) tasting.

Two stars for the food and one for service.  I tried a few dishes and felt like the chicken in the spicy Ramen needs thirty seconds more to cook.  The dressing in the salad came with bulgogi was too sweet.  Other than that it is OK
I'm so hap, hap, happy, I don't have to drive to the city for my Korean fix!  The Kalbi is great.  Bulgogi:  Awesome.  The Jja jang myun was great too.  I've been going in, and tasting each dish.

Though in a unassuming food court, the high level cuisine could stand up to downtown restaurants.  I ordered the ramyun noodle soup, which contained the most tender chicken I've ever had.  It was all white meat, which I usually hate since often it's dry.  Not so at Hanbun.  Also, the broth was smooth and full of flavor.  

As an addition, I ordered the pork belly bun and it was great.  They asked if I wanted a side of their personally created habanero sauce as an accompaniment.  I thought that would taste weird with pork belly, but accepted since the sauce was on the house.  It turned out to be just the right combination.  The owner/chef clearly has a progressive vision to his cuisine and it works.

Also, A+ for service.  The young woman at the counter was friendly, helpful and smiling.  Also, despite being a food court, she delivered my order to my table and came back later to see how I liked my meal.  Good restaurant service at food court prices.

The only drawback is their limited hours of 11am - 3pm and closed on Mondays.  At least that was their schedule last time I was there.

I have lived in the Chicagoland all my 27 years - my wife and I love searching for the best foods (e.g. BBQ ribs, Korean food, etc.), and hands down Hanbun was one of the best Korean food Chicago has to offer!

My wife is Taiwanese, so we like to go to the food court that Hanbun is located in. We've been there several times to get Chinese food, but never stopped by Hanbun until recently.

Now, my wife prefers Hanbun then the other restaurant next door that we use to go to. Unfortunately they close at 3 PM, as we found out when we visited during dinner time to have dinner there.

Overview: ($10 meal with a 4.5/5 star experience)
I was traveling in the area with some friends and family. They all wanted to check out this new Asian cuisine place. I personally am not a big fan of Asian food. However, I always enjoy trying new things so I figured I'd give it a shot. The location is warm, inviting and features thoughtfully crafted Korean food staples. A stand-out dish was their vegetable pancakes (vegan and gluten-free!). I'm not even vegan but this dish was both surprising and delectable! The location has intriguing raymun and noodle combinations and boldly stands out against its competitors as artful. The other locations around them cater a bit more towards fast-food palettes. Each item I tasted at Hanbun had savory flavor and engaging texture. Service was hospitable and inviting. The location is casual and relaxing. When I am in the area again I'm excited to return and try additional items. They just might make me a fan of Asian cuisine and push this up to an exemplary five star review. (Definitely getting more of those veggie pancakes)! 

The Food: (Score 4.5/5)
I got the Veggie Pancakes ($5.15) and Toasted Rice Cake Skewer ($2.25). The vegetable pancakes have a criss-cross mix of crunch and smooth veggie flavor. Spritz it with the soy sauce and this was a great winner in my book. The toasted rice skewer had a crisp texture on the outside along with a tangy sauce. Meanwhile the inside was chewy and full of flavor. I also tried a couple of other items such as the Black Bean Noodles from my family and they were delicious, but less memorable. Ultimately great food possibilities and I look forward to trying other dishes/sides when I return.

The Service: (Score 5/5)
The woman at the counter was smiling, engaging, and conversational. She went out of her way to provide for her customers. She walked out from behind the counter to each customer with a bright demeanor. The positive attitude and attention to detail were appreciated. 

The Location: (Score 4/5)
Tucked into the International Mall, Hanbun is smack dab in the center. You may not see it at first because you have to circle around the elevator. The stand is nestled in between many other Asian food stops. It's hard to rate the location of this Korean eatery because the dining area is the mall's responsibility rather than Hanbun's. The food stand itself stands out, but the mall's dining area is nothing fancy. All in all it's a fine casual place to relax and eat with friends or family. Clean tables, TVs are mounted on the walls, and bathrooms are kept up to standard. 

Conclusion: (Final Score 4.5/5)
Food with great texture and surprising flavors, service that goes above and beyond, and a casual family/friendly location. Right now they are only open until 3:00pm, but I hope that changes to include dinner in the near future. I look forward to returning when I am in the area. Wouldn't mind seeing experimentation with more vegetable options (my preferred taste), but for a place that is fresh and new they have some great "modern" ideas that pit them as worthwhile stop against the surrounding fast-food Asian kitchens. Check it out, definitely recommended.

I'm giving this tiny food court stall 5-stars because of the innovative Korean influenced dishes and the utter value! 

Tucked in an otherwise tired food court, Hanbun offers fine dining excellence at food stall prices. Although you'll recognize Korean favorites, be prepared for a delightful culinary twist. 

Example: the Pork in the Korean pork buns  have a mild coffee scent and is paired with white kimchi and scallions which take it to a different level. The ramyun has a perfect poached egg which when broken adds an unctuous richness to the noodles and broth. 

CIA trained Chef David Park has some solid culinary cred: Alinea, L20, Takashi and Aviary and it shows

As a disclaimer, I have very little experience with Korean food. I had some previous obligations that brought me to the Oak Brook area, and thought I might stop for lunch on the way. Based off of the previous reviews I had read on Yelp, I thought that I would give Hanbun a try. For individual dishes, other reviews may be more in tune with what you may be seeking. 

Service: I am not one to usually mention service, as I care far more about the food I am being served as to the manor in which it is presented to me. The only time I will usually make an exception to this, is if the service is above and beyond what is expected. I will say that the service there was incredible. The two individuals I spoke with were friendly and cordial. Those I worked with really gave me the feeling that they wanted me to enjoy their food. It felt as if I was dining at someone's home, and they were genuinely excited for me to enjoy their food. 

Food: I had ordered the vegetable pancake, 2 of the pork buns, and a rice skewer, all of which were fantastic. The value was absolutely insane. What I ordered could have fed both my wife and I, and I had spent a little over $15. The quality/freshness of ingredients were fantastic. Something that I would not commonly remark on is leftovers. I had an appointment and had to leave before I could finish, but the food was still fantastic when I had reheated it when I got home. While that may sound trivial, I find think is important to note because they do offer carryout services. 

Overall: This is one of those restaurants I want to keep as a secret, because I can bring people who have never been, and they can have that same sense of surprise that I had. If I would work close to the vicinity of this restaurant, my wife would soon divorce me as I would rapidly become obese, and she would find remnants of the rice skewers in my folds. Places like this become destinations, not just pass-by stop ins. Hanbun will quickly become a place I recommend to others.

Tried Hanbun and was impressed.  Small limited choices but often times that is a good thing because it leads to freshness. 

Went with the ramyun and pork bun.  Pork bun was on point and the ramyun was good.  Spicy and flavorful.  

People working there were helpful and genuinely seemed appreciative for your business.

Outstanding! One of the best meals I have had in a long time. Chef Park is crushing it! We had one of his special small group after hours tastings, and it was nothing short of spectacular. Will be back over & over, and can't wait to try the regular menu.

The food here was very underwhelming. I tried the crispy rice cakes, pork bun, vegetable pancakes, and jajangmyun. The crispy rice cakes were simple, but good. The pork bun was ok, the pork was a bit flavorless. The vegetable pancake was bland. The jajangmyun was a little bland with a slight sweetness. While none of the food was bad, it also was not as good as I was expecting after reading a rave review of them in the news paper. If you want good Korean food, there are many other places to go for much better flavor. The lady who took my order was very kind. The owner and his wife were busy fraternizing with a friend to even acknowledge anybody else around them. While I don't expect them to have a full conversation with me, a nice smile or hi would go a long way when you see somebody in line to order your food, instead of a blank stare right thru the person. Oh well... It was worth a try Han bun (one time)... I won't be trying to schedule the dinner that I tried to schedule last week anymore. I'll just cook my own Korean food like my mom taught me.

Have been here 4 times in the last month and will be back.  The only gripe might be menu is a bit limited but food far above the surrounding food court competition and on par with a restaurant though not that traditional Korean.  Or at least what I find in most Korean places ... To be clear really good food.  And don't be put off by the dead strip mall vibe from the entrance!

So to the food short rib Kalbi plate awesome and pairs well with salad and their rice/barley mixture.

Pork buns outstanding ... Just get it.

Like the veggie pancake though a bit indifferent to the rice "tubes" with chili sauce.  

 Soup/stew yummy though like most dishes might be a bit more heat than you might anticipate. 

The bimbibap (I can't spell it) very nice mix and like everything you can taste the fresh ingredients and thoght a spent on texture.

Also big fan of black bean noodle dish but I usually end up with Kalbi which I hear might be replaced by a Bulgogi ... But if good no problem!

Lunch on a Sunday. Incredible food, extremely fresh ingredients, beautiful presentation. Randomly picked three things off the menu and all were delicious. I don't think you can go wrong with anything they make. Korean pork bun was awesome. Very nice people running the restaurant made the visit even better. We will be back, many times.
Get it while you can!  Who knows how long a place like this will be around?  A small menu but highlights include the vegetable pancake and the jiajiang noodles.

I came here with my mom.  We split the pork bun, rice skewer, and ramyun.

Everything was delicious.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, and offered to answer any questions.  

I'll be back to try other things!

This is my favorite Korean place for a quick bite to eat. They're ramen and Blackbean noodles are so good. You would swear this place had its own restaurant. It's just two Badass people with a dream to make amazing food and they're doing it you guys. Come visit and have some great food. Pork buns are the bees knees.
This place is rock solid.  The Pork Bun is pretty good and the jiajiang noodles are even better.  It might be my favorite jiajiang noodles in the whole Chicago area so far.  No joke.  Check them out.

Ironically 'hanbun' translates to 'one time,' and I sure won't be back after the one time.
Disregard all the shill posts by the the owners' friends.  All false.  The claims of 'authentic korean food' this place most definitely is not.

I tried out their jjajangmyun (black bean sauce noodles) because I felt it would be a good judge of the stall's food.  
When I picked it up, I was a bit taken aback because: 
1. the bowl and amount of food was tiny for the price paid ($9) and 
2. I saw instant ramen noodles and
3. there was no banchan (sidedish).  Not even danmuji (yellow pickled radish; large pack costs few $) which is always paired with jjajangmyun.  I won't even go into the other paired sidedish of sliced raw onions in vinegar with dipping black bean sauce. 

I gave them the benefit of the doubt and proceeded to take my first bite.  
First thought that entered my mind.  This is not fresh, made from scratch jjajang sauce, and it oddly tastes very familiar.  Second bite, and it hit me.  I was eating my favorite instant jjajangmyun noodles that I buy all the time from H-Mart for ~$1.25.  Unlike other instant jjajangmyun packages which come with a dry powered packet, this particular instant jjajangmyun package used by hanbun comes with a sauce pouch that just needs to be warmed in hot water.  This is the reason why the little vegetable cubes in the sauce are perfectly cut, soft, and processed consistency.  

I don't know if this is hanbun's food concept to resell ~$1.25 packages of instant noodles for $9 and call it fusion korean food?  Either way it's beyond overpriced.  Did they really expect no one to figure that out?  That's their prerogative I guess.  
What boggles the mind is that they would choose to go this route with a food stall that they obviously spent a good chunk of money on.  
Korean food is so easy to make.  Jjajang sauce is so easy to make from scratch.  It takes at most 30 minutes, including prep and clean.  Traditional jjajang sauce needs meat for that flavor, usually cubed pork or seafood.  The traditional jjajangmyun noodles can be bought at H-Mart dry in a box.  The least that could be done to the instant noodles was add some slices of seasoned pork belly to the top and call it fusion.  I see hanbun's vegetarian jjajangmyun claim because the sauce pouch doesn't contain any meat.

I saw some of hanbun's other offerings being eaten by people.  The jun (pancake), are you serious?  The food portion size was so small especially for something so inexpensive and easy to make, I felt bad for those people.  Again jun is so easy to make.  Mix a flour batter, mix in veggies, add meat and/or seafood, and fry up on the griddle.  Material costs easily under $2 for a huge meat or seafood/veggie jun, more like $1 for a veggie jun.
In the posted picture of the jun, it's painfully lacking ingredients.  It's mostly fried flour batter.  Vegetables are cheap.  Be a little more generous adding to the mix.

It's not my business, obviously just voicing my opinions, but this business model is not sustainable.  Hanbun will get the first time customers who are curious to taste a new food stall's food.  The key is to retain those customers and make them regular customers.  I really don't see that happening because the prices are slightly steep and customers just don't get much quality food for the money paid.  The food portion size to price ratio is horrendously skewed in favor of the business.  People want to feel like they got their money's worth.  
The cost of food materials is mostly cheap.  Adjust the profit margin down a bit and give more food. 

To a non-Korean, the concept of banchan (sidedish) is an oddity and a treat. With all the trays, throw in a dish or two of something simple and inexpensive to make (there are tons to choose from).  Make your customers happy, and they'll be back.  Spend some time researching authentic recipes and offer real made from scratch dishes.

Maybe hanbun's concept is serving tiny portions at high prices or boiling up some instant noodles and calling it fusion.  In that case I apologize and take back what I said.  But also realize you are not in the middle of Michigan Ave or somewhere in the Loop.  You are in a chinese food court so cater to your customers.

Food is delicious! I had the Korean tradition set and pork belly bun! It is hard to find a good Korean restaurant around the west suburb of Chicago! This restaurant is definitely one of the best!! Definitely will come back again!

We went to Hanbun just this past Saturday for a late lunch/early dinner, and got to try out the Korean Ramyun, Black Bean Noodles, Toasted Rice Cakes, Spicy Rice Cakes, and Pork Bun.

Just to give some background, I lived in Japan for a while and became a bit of a ramen eater (ramen snob?). I know authentic Japanese ramen fairly well, but not Ramyun. I tend to run my mouth off about ramen, so I'm going to do the same thing for the ramyun! 

Korean Ramyun - holy hell was this delicious. Super thick, beautifully salty and spicy broth, which I was surprised wasn't pork broth, but actually chicken. The noodles were great, perfectly cooked, which were right in line from what I'd expect from a good Japanese ramen place, all the other ingredients were great as well, especially the chicken, and I was glad to see that ramyun likes the egg in the bowl trick as much as ramen does. Those bites and slurps with the runny egg yolk are so decadent. Glad I now know how good ramyun can compare with ramen.

Everything else we had was amazing too. I used to have black been noodles every so often when I lived in the city, at places like Cho Sun Ok. Usually they struck me as kind of plain before, but this version is fantastic. I enjoyed it just as much as the ramyun, which surprised me. The toasted rice cakes were wonderful. Texture was great, the sauce and the little bits on top of it were delicious. Spicy rice cakes were delicious, with a great chili sauce and fish cake balls (I love those things). And the pork bun was awesome - I don't think I've ever had a version with kimchi in a pork bun, and it went really well with the tender, delicious pork. 

My wife and I live fairly close (well worth the 20 minute or so drive) so we'll be heading back soon. Looking forward to trying the kalbi plate - there's no way you could possibly hope to find short ribs at a Korean place in Chicago for the 12ish bucks here. Cho Sun Ok, which was my go to place that I thought was cheaper than most (like Chicago Kalbi) is expensive in comparison.

Go here. You'll be thankful you did.

Do you know how difficult it is to find good Korean food in the city, let alone the suburbs?? I work near by and I frequent the plaza where Hanbun is located quite often. The plaza doesn't look like much from the outside, but once you enter, you're greeted with the sweet aroma Chinese and Korean cuisine. Hanbun is stands out from the rest with its modern decor. The menu is small and simple with staples that won't let you leave hungry. After talking with the owners, Jenn and Dave, this is their first business.They recommended the toasted rice cake skewer, the black bean noodle and the Korean plate. All three dishes were fantastic. I will definitely be back to try the ramyun and the rest of the menu!

By far the best Korean place in the area. I had their Kalbi plate and it was really good! The Kalbi was really tasty in addition to the greens and barley rice. They accept credit cards which is absolutely a breath of fresh air. Plus, the lady who also took my order was extremely nice and friendly too! I am definitely coming back. :)

Living in the city I am spoiled with delicious food. In suburbia you really have to scour for those hidden gems. Well Hanbun is definitely a gem. It's homemade Korean comfort food - how can you go wrong with that? I've been here twice in the first week they opened. I had the kalbi, ramyun, pork buns, rice cakes, Korean table, and pancake. Everything was delicious! Chef Dave has nailed it with his well thought out menu and has set the bar high. Hands down the best Korean food in the suburbs. Once word gets out this place is going to be a hot commodity.
Best ramen Korean goodness this side of the Mississippi! Original, delicious, and worth every penny. I'll be back soon
Everything was so delicious. This place is a hidden gem. Korean Pork Buns = slurp! The Ramyun broth was very flavourful.
The food is great and price is decent. I would definitely return. I tried rice cake skewer,  pork bun,  vege pancake,  and seafood noodle.  They are all quite tasty.

I was in the area yesterday and decided to check out this new eatery since I've heard a lot of great things about it.  First of all, as a Korean, I can honestly say I appreciated the chef's take/style on his version of Korean food.  The vegetable pancakes, the BBQ spare ribs, and the black bean noodles were superb. The dishes were incredibly savory and cooked just right which was extremely important especially since some other Korean eateries tend to overcook their food. I was tremendously impressed with the chef's style/technique in his cooking.  You can tell that a lot of heart and skillful preparation was put into his art.  Lastly, the prices were extremely affordable (average dish $8) and definitely worth the money.  

I can't wait to go back and try the other dishes in the menu.  I highly recommend this place and encourage others to check it out.

We tried a little bit of everything and enjoyed every bite. Fresh, perfectly cooked, deftly seasoned. The best Korean food I've ever had. Talented, friendly, family run. I dream of the scallion pancake...

Jennifer and David created a one of a kind "juhnyuk" dinner for our group of six.  They curtained off their cooking area in the food stall in the International Mall for our private party after hours.  It was phenomenal food and gracious service.  David crafted 8 courses, each a delight to taste and sight. David embellished the Juhnyuk Tasting Menu on their web site with new twists inspired by the fresh offerings available from local markets. His use of herbs, tender spring shoots, and flowers showcased unique flavors and eye appeal. Not only was each dish delicious, but the progression of dishes was perfect on the palate.  The entire juhnyuk meal was extraordinary!

My favorite Korean BBQ place! The food is spot on! The chef has an incredibly ambitious and impressive background for such a young guy. You gotta check this place out! 

-Authentic
-Delicious
-Really affordable
-Clean
-Friendly staff 
-Yum yum yum!!!

Soooooo good.  I have been here twice and the food has been amazing.  The pork bun is very tasty, kimchee is flavorful, crisp and beautifully presented.  My 6 year old is obsessed with their veggie pancake.  The staff at this location are also very nice.  This was only my 2nd time there but the young lady remembered me and my baby.  You must try this place, you won't be disappointed.

Best Korean food I've had in Chicago! Four of us shared a bunch of things on the menu and every item was delicious! I also haven't been that deliciously full in a while. The toasted rice cake skewer had the perfect consistency. I probably could have happily eaten a dozen of them, but that wouldn't have left room for the other amazing dishes! Basically, whenever anyone took a bite of anything, they would make that crazy "mmmMMMMMmmm" sound and their eyes got really big. Can't wait to go back!
I enjoyed R Subs butt the place was so cold inside I felt it was snowing in there no heat

Usually, I don't stray outside during the workday, but being just down the street, I thought I would try FS. I arrived after 1 pm to beat the lunch crowd. I ordered a turkey and cranberry sandwich, I**got** some kind of turkey barbecue. I waited almost 15 minutes while the workers showed no sense of urgency, spending their sandwich-making time in conversation. They were friendly, but s-l-o-w. And I wasn't the only one looking at my watch while waiting for my order. 

The combo special - sandwich, chips, and drink - was just shy of $10. Too expensive for my budget. Wonder if that turkey and cranberry sandwich was any good. Probably won't be back to find out.

Haven't even tasted the sandwich and I already hate this place. Tried their online ordering and when I got there I told the girl I had a mobile. She gave me my sandwich (I should point out I watched her lay on a thick layer of "I don't give a f#*%" attitude to the mom ordering in front of me. So, as instructed by the app, I try to enter my number to get the rewards, she closes the transaction as I'm entering and says "you can't enter your number cuz you paid in advance". I ask her why use the app if you can't get rewards? After a beautiful roll of the eyes she says "I don't know", in the tone of "why are you bothering me?" 

Great first experience firehouse. You are well on your way to shitty service. I doubt there is any way I'll enjoy this sandwich.

Update:

The sandwich was a sloppy soggy mess. Bread was not toasted ( I was under the impression the meat gets steam heated and the bread gets toasted. If I'm incorrect they should consider it, because I could barely pick it up). Good amount of food for the price so they get credit for value, but about a quarter of the sandwich had no meat, clearly the one making sandwiches cared about it as much as the girl working cashier. There are just too many other good choices to bother with them again. It's a sad day in your business when the Subway a half block away gives you better customer service.

I like coming here for their subs. My favorite is the Italian. With hot sauce makes it even heavenly. 

Customer service is decent. They greet you as you walk through the door. I do feel a little awkward at times as the ambiance is just that. I'm not sure how to really rate chains anymore so this is going to be very basic. 

All in all the food makes for us to keep coming back. There's just something about the quiet atmosphere that I makes the atmosphere awkward. But it's ok. Not here to party.

Great place to grab a salad or sandwich. The chili is good, too. I like that the Coke machine has so many variations. We were sad when the Steak and Shake nearby closed, but now that we've discovered this restaurant, we have been stopping in weekly for lunch or dinner. Even though we are gluten and dairy free, we have options! The manager is great and makes us feel like regulars right from the start. For $20, this is a good place to get a meal for two.

i dont normally review chain resturants.. but i came here twice due being around the area for class.. first time service was somewhat awkward.. the way the worker talked to me to take my order .. i had ordered the meatball sub the first day and the firehouse sub the second day.. both times the service was slow when it wasn't busy.. took like 15 mins to finish making a sub.. the subs was eh.. didn't like the meat ball sub.. the meat ball was very mushy.. then firehouse sub was ok

If you are in a rush, beware. I waited almost 10 mins for my sandwich, and it wasn't even that busy. The #1 Hook and Ladder was delicious. However, I got take away and it was a bit soggy after unwrapping. 

Again, the sandwich was dang good though!
Food is good - service is good- place is clean - love the drink options- but a little overpriced !

I've only been to Firehouse once before, in Wheaton.  It wasn't a very memorable experience but I thought I'd give them another chance. 

My normal sub from almost anywhere is the Italian,  or some variation of it. Today I thought a meatball sub would be appropriate,  given the damp, dreary weather and my inability to warm up. I places my order: a medium meatball sub on wheat. The cashier asked if I wanted a regular meatball sub, or sweet and spicy.  Guess which one I chose. I also grabbed a bottle of water, naturally. 

While waiting for my food, I inspected my surroundings.  It has your typical firehouse theme going on, and there's a large selection of hot sauces to top your sandwich with. For those who desire a side of diabetes, obesity,  or cavaties with their meal, a Coca Cola Freestyle machine is available to satisfy your sweet tooth or spike your insulin levels. The tables looked clean, even during the lunch rush.

Once my order was ready, an employee called my name. He was rather quiet and had to repeat it before I hear him, even though I was at the pick up counter. I opened the container and was pleased.  The sandwich looked good- the cheese evenly melted,  and a healthy dash of red pepper flakes on top of the cheese. The first bite? Holy hell, where's the firehose? This baby was spicy! And I loved it. The sweetness of the sauce was equally pleasing. I was also glad to see I received a pickle on the side.

I'm glad I decided to give this place another shot. The prices are fair and the food was delicious. It's close to both work and home, so there's no doubt I may become a regular here.

The Engineer is my favorite sandwich around. I love how you can try different hot sauces and they are rated by level of hot. The owner seems to always be working... Restaurant is very clean and customer service is great. If you haven't stopped in, give it a chance. The sandwiches are great!

Love this place. I love the meatball sub. They have a sweet/spicy sub that's great but I prefer the regular sub. The brownies are amazing. They also have the pop machine with every juice/pop you can think of.

Wow! Glad I heard about this place...I placed an online order for 3 sandwiches at 11 (placing an order was super easy and fast.  You don't need an account or give your payment info - which is usually what takes forever to set up) by the time I stopped by to pick up my order it was nice and ready all I had to do is pay.  Food was really good - medium sandwiches were pretty good sized and my Engineer sandwich was nice and toasty warm.  Will definitely order from here more often.

1. Quantity of meat was lacking esp for the premium price. (except meatball)
2. Beware Online Ordering-our special instructions did not appear on receipt & was not processed (replicated issue to verify & notified company of issue-no response)
3. Quality-taste of meat was great for the meatball & pastrami. The STEAK WAS INEDIBLE, DRY & CHEWY
4. Company does not stand behind product & would only comment that their subs are med 8" large 12", but DIDN'T ADDRESS QUALITY CONCERNS w steak or QUANTITY OF MEAT (I even provided pics that clearly identified concerns)
5. STEAK WAS INEDIBLE--had to reiterate as we had to throw out & company failed to respond
*not sure if it was the staff preparing that did not provide acceptable quantity that 3 of us agreed
Great subs. Quick and courteous. Loved the beef and cheddar brisket. Cookie was a little too chocolatey...but who complains about that?

Haven't had any issues with the quality of the food. However, I use Grubhub for most of my delivery orders.  I've had no problems with ordering in the past, $15 minimum (mo issues). On Grubhub they still have $15 minimum listed but they do phone orders only now.  When you call they tell you that you have to order $40 worth of food for delivery.  My work was ordering from here almost every day until that.  I've contacted Grubhub and neither Firehouse or Grubhub have corrected this yet.

After reading some of the other negative reviews I think I'll stay clear for now on.

Great hot subs, if you get the large it might get a little pricey.  I keep coming back to this place because Im crazy for hot sauces especially the really hot ones.  Their hot sauces are ranked 1-10+ and there's more then 30 of them.  Must try if your in the area

I've only had their vegi sub but have had it multiple times.  Each time the sub has tasted great with fresh vegetables.  I am not sure what kind of sauces they use but it tastes pretty good.  They are a bit on the experience side but they definitely beat subway's quality and taste.  I would recommend this place if you are craving a sub or looking for something different other than  Sunway or Quiznos.

I could eat the hook and ladder every day if my wallet would allow it. Not to say it's too expensive but just that I'm usually broke. 

The staff is always very nice, the food is always fresh and hot, and I freaking love the drink machine. One of the best sandwich options in the area and I hope one comes closer to my house and not just near my work, although the entire office loves when we order from here.

This blows subway out of the water!! Having the meatball sub with sweet and hot sauce. #&*! $ my mouth is on fire but it's so good. I will be coming back more often!! The pice not bad for a sub and got the firehouse hot sauce bottle too that looks like a fire hydrant, which is really cool. And the love the fact that they give back to the community. Awesome theme and love the pix and mural and the used fire equipment all around the space. Ditch subway and come here!!!

Not bad! The Italian is pretty delic. The place was clean and the employees friendly. I would go back. Definitely a better option than JJ's if you're looking for something relatively fast (8 - 10 mins) and warm.

I am so excited that a Firehouse Subs opened closer to where I live.  The first time I tried one of these was at their Wheaton location and I loved it.  I haven't been back just because I am never in that area, but I frequent this area a lot and I know that I will find myself here again.

Everyone was really friendly and they made sandwich suggestions when I couldn't decide what to order.  The sandwich I had was delicious and their cherry limeade, which was one of my favorite things before was great here too.  They also have one of those fancy touch-screen pop machines that you can select any combination of beverage that you could ever want.
Subs are good. Fast food.

One of the better sandwich chains out there. The food is always nice and fresh. The drink machine is really cool (you can pick from 100's of options and really make your own drink). It is a little expensive for a sandwich, but they do have some really tasty sandwiches. The staff is always friendly and shop is always clean. I'd go back, just wish they were a little less expensive.
The subs are good and priced about the same as a jersey mikes. I like the variety of meats and sauces.

I'll be back, over and over. 

This place is right outside of my hotel, so lovely. Turkey Sub, hot. MY GOODNESS. 

Service was great, 3 young men all very helpful.

This Firehouse is across the street from a Jimmy John's and located close to a Subway,Quizno's and Corner Bakery . All of those are better than this.
The employees looked depressed when I walked in. 3 out of 4 tables in the restaurant were occupied by a single person waiting for their food to be done. Nothing at all unique about the menu. The sandwich took FOREVER to make. Nothing unique about the taste. And, worst of all, it was expensive. 
They need much quicker ovens, excited employees and sandwiches that are unique. If you're going to survive in Naperville.... you better step up. 
I've been to just about every restaurant in Naperville (say what you will) and I was especially disappointed with this one- and I almost never write reviews on Yelp, let alone negative ones. I think it was the price for what I received, really.
Solid and unique sub. Very tasty. Only reason I didn't give it five stars is that about a quarter of my sub was almost meatless. Im sure the kids will love the pick your drink Coke machine.

Just moved to the area and could hardly contain myself when I saw a Firehouse Subs was just up the street from where I live. This is such a nice alternative to other sandwich shops like Subway, Jimmy Johns and Potbelly. The sandwich meat is steamed and the bread is fresh!  Sandwiches are warm and juicy. They also have a loyalty card in which you get a free sandwich after 10 purchases (you have to buy the combo). Last but not least, they have the best pickles!  You will not be disappointed and I always make sure to take friends here who haven't tried it before.

Leave it to firemen to know what it takes to make a great sub:  soft bread, fresh ingredients, and plenty of character.  The sub was one of the best I've had (watch out Potbelly's) and the ambiance was just right.  Oh, and you know that change between your total and the next dollar up, they make it easy to donate to a charity, only if you want to.  These guys are worthy of your next craving.

Better than most sub places in the far west burbs. I was surprised it's a chain, as I'd never heard of Firehouse Subs til they started building this one at 59 & McDowell. 

Subs come in medium or large, most being hot subs, and available on white or wheat bread. There are 2 cold subs available, tuna and white chicken salad. I got the white chicken salad, which was really good. It came with lettuce, onion, and tomato. 

Their kids' combos are less than $4 and come w/ a drink, dessert, and a cute little fire hat. They have Hot Grilled Cheddar Cheese available on the kids' menu, but can also be ordered by adults for $2.79. Gotta remember to ask them to butter it next time. You shouldn't have to ask for grilled cheese to be buttered, but this was very plain and dry.

My fav part of this place (besides being founded by firemen - I have firemen in my family) is their non-profit. They have the Firehouse Subs Public Safety Foundation which provides much needed funds to fire, police, and EMS departments to assist with life-saving equipment and training their departments might not otherwise be able to afford.

Oh. My. God. After eating a Firehouse sub, I don't know if I'll ever return to Subway or Jimmy John's. (Though I have never been to Jersey Mike's, so I can't compare it to that...yet.)

First off, I'll say I'm really picky about my sub bread. A common problem I find with other places is that their bread either gets really stale or flaky pretty quickly (especially since I'm a slow eater, by the time I get to the end of the sandwich I usually end up picking the meat out and just leaving the rest of the bread), or it's like a french bread kinda roll that's hard to tear with your teeth. But the Firehouse bread? PERFECT! They toast it, which I usually don't prefer at other sub places, but since it's very lightly toasted I don't mind here. And then the meat is prepared in these steamer things, so it comes out nice and warm--a great treat for when it's like 35 degrees outside!

The employees are all pretty friendly, they yell "WELCOME TO FIREHOUSE!" when people walk in the door which is hilarious. I love it. And they also took the time to describe their subs and menu, which I appreciated.

I got the Italian sub and I don't know what it was about that one, but....wow. Just wow. I've never had an Italian that good. I know it sounds so cheesy, but just thinking about it is making my mouth water...it's too bad there's not a Firehouse closer to me :-/ Will definitely be back if I'm in the area!

The sub was mediocre.  I had the hero, which for the price was not very good.  It was like a toasted Subway sandwich, but for more money.  The space is cramped and a little confusing on ordering.  It gets busy and people don't know where to stand in line.  Also, they have the flavored coke machine, but it only has one dispenser.  There were up to 6 people waiting at lunch to fill their drink. Not a smart choice for a busy place.  The wait after ordering was about 10 mins, which can be long if you have a short lunch. Service was okay but for the price and taste I'll go somewhere else.
Mmm...Big Hawaiian Pork Sandwich ("limited time") is the real. Lots of Hot Sauces to try on your chips. Cherry Limeade and ESPN. Yes! Will be back.

Loved this place!  The decor was fun and cute (the tables have dalmatian spots)!  I walked in and the employees all had a smile on their face ready to help.  Since I looked like I had obviously not been there before they explained what subs were some of their best and most popular.  My sub was brought to my table very quickly after I ordered it.  It was so good and one of the best subs I've had in a long time.  There was a great portion of meat, cheeses, lettuce, and veggies on it.  Normally sandwiches get the shaft on their portion of meat but I didn't see that lack here.  While I was there a family with two small children came and sat near me.  The kids get the cutest little plastic firemen hats as souvenirs!   I will definitely be back for to try a different sub soon!
The best sub sandwiches ever.  And finally they have one in Illinois!!!
Nice clean establishment with a friendly staff. Got a Ham and provolone on wheat . They steam there subs which is really nice and unique.

Probably the best sub I've ever had. Saw an ad for this place in our homeowner's association newsletter, saw the good reviews here on Yelp, and decided to give it a try after picking up our daughter from preschool.

Yes. This place rocks. We were here around 11:45 on a Friday, and the place was packed. The line snaked back from the register, through the tables, but it moved very quickly. The best part about the ordering experience is that, as soon as you are done, you get to sit down and they bring your food out to you.

Also, like the Wendy's across the street, they have one of those super-fancy coke machines that dispenses something like 3,000 different varieties of Coke and Coke products. Diet Vanilla Barqs? Yes please. And for the kids, as the other reviewers noted, they have plastic fireman helmets to wear.

As for the subs, I ordered the Turkey Bacon Ranch and loved it. The bread was nice and toasty but not overly crunchy, and the meat, cheese, bacon, and peppercorn ranch came together in a heap of yummy deliciousness in between. My wife got a plain old roasted turkey breast sub (she really liked it), and our daughter got the grilled cheese. My only gripe with the kid's menu is that they don't have any "healthy" options for drinks other than water. Apple juice or milk would have been nice. The closest thing to juice they have is Hi-C. No thanks.

Finally, they have a huge selection of chips. Whereas Subway seems to have cut back on their selection of chips so that now you can choose between a flavor or two of baked lays or a bag of cool ranch Doritos, the selection at this place spans almost the entire length of the counter. Color me impressed.

I will definitely come back here when I'm in the mood for a sub.
The philly cheese is off the chain!
I will never have another sandwich after I ate here! Get the brisket it's amazing! And the Gawain pulled pork yum! I'm about to gain ten pounds cause I'm addicted!

Best - sandwich - I - have - ever - had! Ever! I got the beef and cheddar brisket. I ordered the medium. If I had known how good it was going to be, I would have ordered the large. Absolutely amazing. I will be back.

We live across the street from this place, so we were REALLY excited to see Firehouse Subs coming...there's a Subway and Jimmy John's within rock-throwing distance, so it was nice to see something new coming with REAL grilled subs. But I feel like the sandwiches are overpriced, given the amount of meat you get on your sandwich. It's good, but not great. Better than Subway? Yes. Better than Jimmy John's? No. But you can't compare the two, since Jimmy John's subs are cold. Either way, I'd rather drive across town to Jersey Mike's.

Sit down Jared/ Justin Tuck and all that think that subway is good.  This place got  good subs!  What makes them unique is how they prepare their subs.  Rather than melt, bake and nuke the subs they actually steam the meat with the cheese!!! EXCELLENT!!!!  My favorite one is the Engineer - Turkey with melted swiss and mushrooms.  BTW, we need more in the city!!!

I visited Firehouse subs for the first time this week and it is a step above similar sandwich places.  

I had the 12" chicken on wheat bread with Provolone, lettuce, and BBQ sauce and it was very tasty and filling.  The meat was plentiful, the cheese was just right and melted perfectly, and the bbq sauce added the extra flavor that the sandwich needed.  I also had a bag of chips and made a million trips to the soda fountain so that I could mix and match my soda flavors.  Being able to create and try various flavors was a blast and I felt like a kid again.

My mom had the 12" beef brisket sandwich which looked good as well.  She really enjoyed it.  The brisket was flavorful with a bit of a smokey taste and was tender.  The beef wasn't at all fatty which was very nice as well.    

For dessert, I tried the brownie which was very dense and chocolaty, not dry at all.  I think I would get it again for sure.  I also tried a bite of the lemon cookie which wasn't my favorite, but was a nice change compared to the usual sugar or macadamia nut cookie offerings.

The prices are a bit high when compared to similar sandwich places, but the quality and service really is better.  I have a hard time spending a bit more usually and I think it's worth the investment here.
First time ever at a Firehouse and I will be back. Great sub and very friendly staff.  Probably the best chain sub place I have been to.

We love the Firehouse Sub place that has open near us in Naperville...it is nice to have an alternative to Subway...I like trying different sandwiches and try to have a different sandwich each time...I like to order online and go pick it up..Also like the big Coke machine with all of the different flavors.

I like Subway now and again, and Jimmy John's is okay as well, but Firehouse Subs here has definitely got them both beat.  This was my first visit to a Firehouse Subs, and it was very impressive.  The place is clean and bright, the staff is friendly, and all the food that we tried is exceptionally good.  The chili was in the league of best chili I've ever had.  The Coke machine is neat too; there are a ton of combinations and flavors and I ended up having a raspberry Sprite while the other person in my party had a lime Coke.  Too bad I don't live closer to this place!

Much better than subway. Friendly staff, nice decor and plenty of TVs to watch sports during lunch. 

Been there twice and enjoyed the Hook and Ladder sub and I can't remember the other one.

After hearing a lot about how great Fireshouse subs were, I decided to give them a try.  Boy was I disappointed.  I ordered a steak and cheese sub.  It was the worst sub I ever had.  It was bland, the bread wasn't toasted, and it left a terrible after taste.  The meat was low quality.  There was a lot of fatty parts I kept pulling out of my mouth.  My husband ordered the corn beef brisket and said he would never order it again.  Also, the customer service was not the best.  I will remain a customer with Subway or Jimmy Johns.  If you want a great tasting sub, don't go to Firehouse.  You will come out better making your own or going someplace else.  We had to wait fifteen to twenty minutes on subs that tasted horrible.  I want my money back...  If you like horrible, low-quality tasting subs, go to Fireshouse.  You will get what you paid for.  I also believe some of their reviews are posted by people who own and work for the company.

Went there with my family and was disappointed. You pay too much for what you get. In particular, the Steak & Cheese was a joke. I understand most sandwiches don't look like they do in ads, but this was so far from the picture on their menu it was funny. The peppers and onion were lifeless (no color / texture) and the sandwich itself was small. I was really looking forward to the fancy coke machine, but that too was a disappointment. Their signature cherry limeade did not taste anything like lime and was like a very very strong cherry kool aid.

I'm giving this place 5 stars because they make cemitas.  And there are not a lot of places across the US that serve cemitas. Besides that, I enjoy their food, I enjoy coming here, the family running the place are nice, and I know they work hard. 

So, here's a little 5 star bump for making cemitas!

Handmade tortillas, well seasoned food, not greasy or heavy like other places. Their food is so flavorful! 

I ordered quesadilla dinner and hubby ordered taco dinner. We were both so impressed, as we were hesitant to try suburban Mexican restaurant food because it usually does not taste authentic! Marmellys is the real deal! The food reminded me of my grandma's food when I used to visit her in Mexico! Salsas, as most reviewers stated are so yummy and on point! Ask to try their salsas but make sure to have tissue on hand because they come with a kick! Super flavorful nonetheless! I tried their churros, tamales and even a Mexican ice popsicle! Yes I went overboard haha but it was so worth it! 

We have been searching for a Mexican restaurant in the suburbs and we found our place. The owners are so kind and we're happy to explain what some menu items were, we got a little insight into their native Mexican state, Puebla! :) We will definitely return. Thank you!
Friendly service, and great tasting food. Ask for the spicy salsas from behind the counter! Had fun trying the different flavors!!!

Alright, here's a tasty Mexican restaurant on the south side of Westmont. Plenty of tables to stop in sit down & feed your cravings. I ordered myself a Carne Asada Torta & for the wife she wanted beef enchilada dinner. I'm sorry to say they don't serve ground beef so i had to get her steak also - not that it's a bad thing oh no she said it was delicious and I must admit my steak torta was loaded & very tasty also.
If you find yourself in the neighborhood of South Cass Ave. & 60th St. with a taste for some south of the border home cooking you got to try Marmelly !

OK, it's a $7 - $9 / plate Mexican Restaurant, not a 4 Michelin Star Restaurant.  With that in mind, the tacos, chili rellenos, enchilada mole, fajitas we just had were really, really good.  Everything is really fresh (you an watch the chef cook the food)!  Salsas and sauces tasted fresh and flavorful.  Truly, no complaints.  I recommend it, especially if you are hungry and want a nice, fresh, meal in a simple setting.  (It'd be nice if they sold beer, but no big deal.)

I drive by this place all the time and finally stopped in to see what it's like. I ordered a veggie burrito, with frys and an apple soda. 

The man who was working was very helpful, and even though what I wanted was off menu he didn't skip a beat. Everything was super fresh, and tasty. He even made us chips from tortillas on the spot. The burrito had fresh cilantro, onions, cheese, rice, beans, and avocado. On top of that the salsas he offered were homemade and amazing. I had to fight my self not to steal the bottle. 

I'm only sorry I waited so long to eat here, do yourself a favor and go there now!

They have things here, I've not seen in menus in this country, and I live in Aurora! I had the huaraches, which is like like a long sope. The dough is so good! My date had a pambazo, which is a torta with a deep fried chile bun. Guacamole is great, salsa is great, salsa is on point. I love this place.

I Yelp-searched on the way home from work and was 2 blocks from here, saw the strong reviews and took a chance.  Really really nice couple runs it, they named the place from parts of each of their kids' names.  They happened to have a fresh batch of tamales:  best I have ever had!  Also tried one each - chicken and steak taco- really tasty, well seasoned and nice fresh corn tortillas.  So glad I found it, and the owners are so nice I felt the need to help spread the word!  Check it out!
Best Mexican food I have ever had. Everything we have tried there is absolutely amazing and the people working there are incredibly nice. I would recommend this place to everyone in the area

Checked out this place on a whim and man was my intuition on point with this one, the man who greeted us was kind and polite and had no issues showing my boyfriend which options on the menu were vegetarian friendly. 
I ended up getting a torta, nothing special but it tasted amazing. All the ingredients were fresh and could tell it was prepared that day. Loved how they used a whole chicken breast and not a chopped up one. 
My boyfriend ended up with the vegi burrito and because of the fresh veggies it was a hit.
Awhile we were eating the man up front made up fresh chips and some kind of green salsa. By the end of it we were both full and couldn't move. 
It's good on the pocket and the stomach, we will definitely be going back.

Stopped by for some breakfast.  Ended up getting the Chicken Mole Enchiladas.  They were some of the best I've had.  My buddy got a burrito and he said the same.  The owner was very nice, told us how he cooked everything fresh for us and you could taste it.  Fantastic hidden gem here!

Menudo was huge and en pointe albeit quite spicy even for someone who loves heat. Chicken mole enchiladas were just ok. If you've ever had real Oaxacan food, this dish was far from it. Beans were wonderful. Rice very bland. The green sauce was good, the orange and red tasted pretty similar - the latter a little hotter. Neither had much depth of flavor. Stomach hasn't been settled since the meal. Overall disappointed after reading the rave reviews.

I had the chicken Mole dinner with rice and beans. It was very good and I would definitely come back here specifically for that in the future! I live in Chicago where we have a lot of authentic Taqueria's. I wasn't sure what I'd be getting into out here in the suburbs but the chef you're really knows what he's doing and makes it very decent meal at a reasonable price

... Have order tacos,tortas, tostadas,burritos. So far 0 complaints! 
Food is awesome, salsas are great ! 
And it's only 5 minutes away !

I love tacos. I am something of a taco connoisseur. I love these tacos. They are so good. Small but they pack a  punch. I can't speak for anything else on their menu other than the margaritas (We'll get there) but if you want good tacos, you won't be disappointed here. 

The staff is always very nice. They are authentic Mexican. Not that I'm trying to be rude, but I like when I feel like my tacos are being made pretty much the way they were meant to be. Every single person who has every served me here has been extremely nice and goes out of their way to make sure that I am satisfied and taken care of. 

The margaritas are larger than you'd expect and pretty cheap too. That's how I like my margaritas.  I drink a dew of those babies and before I know it I'm dancing to the Mexican music that's playing overhead. Just kidding there isn't enough room to dance.

I stopped by here to pick up a couple of beef tacos.  They were fully loaded and good.  I'm not sure if the Chili Relleno burrito (stuffed pepper) is actually on the menu, but they were able to make one for us.  They were opened late on a Friday night and there was Spanish karaoke going on in the back room.  It sounded like they were having a good time.
Love coming here after a late night in downtown Aurora.  Food is on point.  Servers are VERY friendly and there's always Spanish Language karaoke!  Get the tacos, they are delicious.

Good food, good service, all around great Mexican food!  I'll totally be back - only missed 5 stars because there is nothing that took me by surprise or knocked my socks off!  But still - totally check it out!

They make a delicious pambazo!  Its similar to a torta, except that its a chorizo and potato sandwich and the bread is dipped in a red hot sauce beforehand.  Something about the potatoes that made it awesome.  Also liked the chicken enchilada dinner plate, though the pambazo was the standout!  I thought the rice and bean sides were unexpectedly tasty, which I don't say as much.  They even include some fried chips and salsa for carryout orders!

Discovered this place only recently, but I've eaten there nearly every day since. The food is delicious, the service is good, and the prices are good, as well. I've tried quite a bit of the menu and liked it all, but I especially like the chicken tacos.

This place is in a great location! Right in downtown Westmont, very easy to get to, and they have there own parking lot.  I came here in a Friday evening with my little guy. We planned on eating here and bringing home some for my husband. We also told the lady we would be dining in but wanted it "to-go" since we wouldn't be eating everything that we ordered. 
First we walked in and it was clean, smelled amazing (if you like BBQ) and very inviting. They had a pretty good variety of food/meals to choose from. We ordered the burnt ends dinner-meal and full slab of ribs-meal, both came with two sides. We choose fried mac and cheese, French fries, broccoli salad (mix), and corn bread for our sides. The French fries seemed a bit of a joke, very little amount and looked like it was the end of the batch, very greasy, and I ended up throwing them away. The other sides were pretty tasty. 
The burnt ends were very delicious, not dry, just enough bbq sauce. The ribs were a bit dry but if you put enough BBQ sauce on them they were decent. 
I would love to come back here while I'm in the area for lunch or a little earlier in the day. 
The employees here were very nice. I could tell they have a lot of regulars that come in here by the way they talk to customers. That made me happy and to see older people come in here and be greeted/talked to like family. It makes you feel warm and good inside to see that people love their job and treat people so good.

So I was a member of their old stamp program (earn one stamp for each meal purchased, and 10 gets you a free one)
I had 2 sandwiches free (enough stamps for them) and 6/10 for their platters club in stamps...
I went in to exchange to their new phone number email club and what did I get?
1 Free sandwich and a coupon for $5 off
BOGUS!
SCAM ARTISTS do not care about their long time customers!

i judge every bbq place in America by Phil's Best Butts of Alabama in Eufala, Alabama.

 The problem with most bbq sauce is the sugar. Sugar doesn't usually make bbq sauce better but rather masks the true taste/quality. it can mute the spicy sauces and I think it is what happened here. In this instance, it is not necessarily a negative. you can still taste and second punch delivery is in the after-taste of the spicy. it works! nice move.

brown paper towels on the wooden spool stand at tables says "you want to eat, and we are serious about it, too!"

I ordered the pulled pork bbq sandwhich (some bbq sauce already on it but I gotsta drench every time in sauce after first bite at any bbq joint..it's just my thing)  5oz. of bbq..and it comes with 2 sides..I chose the corn on the cob (they are the short ones) and the fried mac n cheese balls. the mac n cheese inside was ok and the fried balls were crispy and tasty and overpowered the mac n cheese taste a bit. hard if not impossible to make fried mac n cheese balls that don't taste this way.

the mild sauce tastes smokier than the spicy. the bbq seemes smoked taste but I did drench it with the mild bbq sauce prematurely. good! POUR DAT SAUCE LIKE PANCAKE SYRUP. 

Thanks ?Kaylee? for the Patience in explaining a few menu items to make the order what I wanted from the experience.

worth your time to go here, as the locals said.

The ribs are ok/ good, which means better than franchises like Famous Daves and Dickey's (or whatever it's called).  But, I'd love Uncle Bubs to tell me the ribs they win contests with are the same ribs the serve at their restaurant.  They serve babybacks at Uncle Bubs, who wins contests with babybacks?  The ribs pull right off the bone and they do have good flavor,  but they should be better.  If you're going to put up your credentials, serve the same damn thing that won you those credentials.  It's like McDonald's winning a hamburger competition serving USDA PRIME Angus beef.  

I do love their cornbread - it is very very good.  Their mac-n-cheese ball is plain and bland.  The Brunswick stew is personally, too sweet, but I appreciate their effort. 

Now, the Burnt ends are a joke.  They need to get their ass down to Austin, TX to see what a burnt end is (or even St Louis).  What they serve are cubes of dry brisket slobbered in sauce.  Look at the enclosed picture, how many ends do you see burnt?  More so, you can tell by the burnt ends the brisket isn't worth trying. It is too dry, it should taste like meat candy, not hardened steak.

Anyway, this place is about as good as it gets for this area. Which is why Chicago isn't known for BBQ.

We ordered the BBQ platter for 2. I believe it was around $24 before tax - such a good deal and just another perk to being in the suburbs. 

The sampler includes 3 spare ribs, rib tips, a quarter pound each of pulled pork, brisket, a wing and a thigh, cornbread, and your choice of 2 sides. 

Good food at good prices. We'll be hitting up uncle bub's whenever a BBQ craving hits, that's for sure. The cute disposable bibs are an added bonus!

Amazing caterer for any event!!  We recently contracted Uncle Bub's for our daughter's wedding at Hoosier Grove Barn.  As an Event Planner, I must say that this is the only caterer I have contracted and never received a complaint. All of our guests have complimented the meal and staff.  The food is A+ rating and plentiful.. a plus to have wedding guests go back for seconds.  Mark Link runs the events with a professional and hard working staff.  The compliments have been amazing and to share this review to others contemplating this caterer... do it!!! Well worth every dollar you spend to have the quality of food, timeliness, professional service and an amazing hard working staff!!! Kudos to Mark, Jerry and his team!!  Bonus for your vendor referrals ...DJUj (Jim) and Jolie Photography (Max)!!!!

To try out the award winning BBQ sauce,we visited this place today..
I am so impressed with the interior and service. We had Uncle Bub's Sample Platter with fried Mac n cheese,hand cut French fries and corn bread. The platter includes 3 BBQ back ribs, pulled pork, BBQ sliced beef brisket, rib tips and BBQ chicken. Everything tasted wonderful, BBQ sauce indeed deserved to be awarded. Chicken wings were very tender and juicy. We did tried there ice cream as well..

I'm big into BBQ, from smoking my own to trying different spots.  I've been to barbecue places all around the county, the south being the best I've had but up in Illinois, this is a solid BBQ joint.  The ribs are fall off the bone and have the tenderness you crave.  The brisket had a thick pink smoke ring, tender yet crisp on the exterior.  My girlfriend had the pulled chicken and thought it was great!  Obviously the sweet tea was perfect as well.  

If you're going to get BBQ around the area, this place is the way to go.  You can expect good service and great food.  I know I'll be back.

We had Uncle Bub cater for our wedding the food and serving staff were great, although dealing with Marie who is in charge of the catering does sloppy work. There were plenty of mistakes made when dealing with the invoice. Other then that it was great!

We recently tried out Uncle Bub's and will definitely be back. I had the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries - so delicious and mouthwatering. My fiance had the southwest fish tacos. He also had the cream of mushroom soup and very strongly proclaimed that it was the best soup he ever had. Everything was amazing. Their wall of hot sauces was pretty cool too. 

Great service as well!

Decent bbq but I wasn't bowled over. My pulled pork was good but the sauce was very sweet to me. The dude had brisket, again nothing wrong with it but we have had better.

This might be a good place to take kids, because when we settled in to wait for our food a guy came over to do magic tricks. Which is fine if you have a five year old with you, but for two adults decompressing after work it was a little weird. He did decamp when our food arrived, though. 

Overall, a serviceable choice, but I still prefer Q in Naperville if dining in the western burbs.

Average at best. Cool restaurant but from what I tried (chicken, ribs and brisket), it was all just average BBQ. Also, I did not like how they drowned my brisket in sauce. Let me do that if I so decide. I never had the chance to see how it tasted out of the smoker... All I tasted was BBQ sauce. I will not rush back here.

They catered a friends wedding a few weeks ago and it was PERFECT. Pulled pork was my favorite and I was later told it was actually better catered than when it's ordered at the restaurant. Never been to the restaurant location but I'll have to soon because I am starting to miss it already. OH and the ribs tasted even better at the after party at 3 am :)

Horrible ! Came here on good hopes based on other reviews. Ordered two lil sumpin sumpins and an onion blossom to start. Beers were skunk and onion blossom had no seasoning. Cancelled out dinner order based on the appetizer and beer. Restaurant was vacant upon entry which should have been a sign. Super disappointed.

Have had UncleBubs a few times now and always yum! Enjoy the platter with some fish and it feeds 3 people plus you get a nice assortment. Add some beer (which they do sell) and some dessert and you're good to go for a FULL evening. 

Not super expensive and they cater long distances. Once a year they have customer appreciation event and offer cheap options, plus their sauce, for cheap. Enjoy this over the place near i55 just saying!

Had this been the first time that I had dined at this restaurant it would of for sure have been the last.  When we arrived at 5:30 there were less than 6 tables seated in the restaurant.  We placed our order and over 15 minutes later our food arrived.  My dinner platter was completely cold.  The balance of the food was warm, but obviously my food had been ready for a while.  
There was also a wedding tasting couple in the booth next to us and when the manager went to speak with them and discuss the menu she turned around and rolled her eyes.  Managers went past us without once asking about our experience and we were dissatisfied with the entire experience.  Some tables had servers and others did not?  What are the expectations for this?  Thank goodness for carry out as this is the only way I will ever be back.

This restaurant is hit or miss. Sadly, this visit was a miss. The three meats we tried: pulled pork, sliced brisket, BBQ chicken, were over cooked and very dry. My brisket slices were black on the ends and I could not chew them. I left over half the meat on the plate it was so undesirable. The sides were tasty. 

On other occasions we've eaten here and been thrilled with the food. The 3 stars are an average of a 1 and a 5.

Our company has had a pig roast customer appreciation event every year for the past 19 years. We usually have over 500 customers that attend. This year, we were recommended to use Uncle Bub's from one of our employees who had tried their food at a family get together.

I'm so glad we took his advice because I can not even express how thrilled we were with the service and the food from the on-site pig roast they provided.  

In prior years, we had done all the serving of the food and busing of the tables ourselves.This year, Uncle Bub's took care of all of it.

 We received so many compliments from employees and customers regarding the service that we were given and how great the food was.

For the first time ever, I actually received e-mails from customers thanking us for the wonderful food.

One customer said "I just wanted to thank you for such a wonderful night. I still can't stop bragging  about your awesome spread"

We will definitely be utilizing them again next year!

The BBQ RIBS TIPS were really good. I also tried their creamy corn that my son has which was also good. They have homemade Cole slaw too.   The burnt ends and pulled pork is what my family tried.  Lots of left overs because they have large portions.   Great place for Q food
Great place...pricy for a rib place but worth it. I would come again if I want to spend the money....
I've visited Uncle Bub's a few times over the years and always enjoyed the food. Portions are healthy and good. Wish they had more low cal drink options though.

Best bbq in all of Chicagoland!
The savory tender deliciousness of Uncle Bub's Award winning BBQ, the craft beers on tap, the fried mac and cheese.

Sunday they sometimes have Beef Short rib, a hidden gem menu item. Think a perfectly seasoned pot roast just falling off the bone... yeah, it's that good.

Hate the green beans though, nothing wrong with them, just not a big fan of green beans. lol 

Family friendly atmosphere and they do catering for large events, weddings and gatherings. I plan on using them at some point for an event. 

Beyond the outstanding bbq food experience,  the owner Mark and his staff are so friendly and personable, no wonder there is such a huge loyal following including my loved ones and I.

I know what dinner is going to be tonight!

If I could give a negative star I would. This place was probably the worst restaurant I've ever been to. Walking in, we weren't greeted or given any direction as to where to sit. We walked around and asked an employee if we should seat ourselves and he said "sure". After sitting, we waited at the table for a few minutes, expecting a server to come with menus/water, and after nobody came, my husband got up to look for a server and found "the front" of the restaurant where we discovered a walk-up counter. Still, no welcome, how may I help you, anything. We stared at the menu while the cashier stood there like a statue. After making our selections, we got our drinks from the self-serve fountain machine, which tasted moldy and sat down at our table again. After a few minutes, assuming we had to pick-up our own food, my husband walked to the cashier only to be scolded by the statue that we didn't take the wooden pig shaped table topper with the order number. Well, we were never given any instructions so how would we know? Sat back down, and food came shortly after. 
I had ordered the beef brisket, which I knew would be a disaster just by looking at it. Meat was cold and dry, very evident that it had been sitting for awhile. Clearly it was not freshly cut  for my order. Cornbread - cold. Deep-fried mac & cheese nuggets: only 2 and were cold, tasteless and lifeless. The broccoli salad literally looked like something you'd find on the street in front of a grocery store in New York City at the end of the night...and it tasted like chemicals. My husband also mentioned his mashed potatoes tasted like it was from a box.
Not once did a server come by to check on us, which infuriated me even more because the place was pretty much empty. It appeared that maybe 2, 3 tables at best were occupied by other patrons. The rest were EMPLOYEES eating among the other tables. 
Finally, the server asked if I wanted a box, I just told him to take it away. He got a manager, and she asked what was wrong. I expressed the horrible service and food we received and she apologized but didn't seem surprised about my comment - as if this were a common thing. Either that or she didn't care, but perhaps a combination of both. She was nice enough to refund a portion of the meal, and the cashier statue came by our table with cash. BTW, her nails were FILTHY, like a mechanic's. 
It was really disappointing, especially since Uncle Bub's was allegedly known for their awards and have been featured on a few TV shows. Next time we'll go to Chuck's. That's always a sure thing!

Just not working.  I am not in the restaurant business but I would think hot food is served hot and cold food cold.  Seems logical.  Not here.

What I did like is that there are 3 doors you pass through to get into the restaurant.  I like that, no one gets blasted by frigid air on a cold winter's day.  There are markings on the floor to direct you to place you order and then find a seat.  There are daily specials.

Now the reality.  We ordered 2 pulled pork sandwiches and one beef stew special, served on noodles.  The stew was very thin, likened to Lipton soup by the person who had ordered it.  She took most of it home.  She did like the corn bread.  I found the pulled pork was not served hot and there was just too much bun for the amount of meat placed on it causing it to taste dry.  I did add BBQ sauce, didn't help much.  The other person who had ordered the pulled pork tried to eat the meat, but couldn't even do that.  She tried 1 French fry, and passed on the cole slaw.  She ended up just wrapping the meal in the paper that it is served on and had nothing to eat.  The 2 fried mac and cheese balls that I had were the best part of these 3 meals, but again, I thought they would be hot.

This was a big fail.  In reviewing the other reviews, it appears that this is a hit or miss type of place.  BIG MISS today.

However, if you are so inclined, try it for yourself, you may get lucky.

I use love the place  went last Sunday my wife had birthday reward  and she could not use it because it was 1 week . Had prime rib  and Barque  sampler and prime was over cooked and my sampler wasn't good either they gave $ 25.00 back !!

I mean no disrespect to all the Yelpers who love this place, however, I'm not sure how the heck they have 3.5 stars overall! Grant it, it's not in Chicago, where there is some world class bbq, but it's close enough that the q should be better. We went with a group of 8 peeps and no one was impressed.

The chicken was relatively flavorless. The brisket was good, but very dry. Pulled pork was ok, kinda meh. The ribs....bad. They were dry and meatless. I'm sad to post a negative review for this place because I really wanted to like it! And by the way, don't bother getting the mac and cheese balls...that is, unless you like fake tasting Kraft mac and cheese. If that's the case, you're gonna LOVE IT! The green beans, again, totally flavorless.
