On a better note, the hubs got the pecan crusted catfish. He thought it was A Ok. Not spectacular, but certainly not bad. I think someone thought the cornbread was decent, but others, not so much. And the bbq sauce....can anyone tell me what the difference is between the mild and spicy?? I couldn't tell one bit. I kept using different bottles on the tables to see if there was something wrong with me....well, that is definitely questionable, but not the point. Ha! I still could not distinguish between the two bbq sauces.
Its all good at Uncle Bub's !! Love the burgers and the feel. Had some fabulous Cream of Potato soup.  Yum. Great staff.

Great BBQ!

Walking up, you can smell the hickory smoke emanating from the Southern Pride smokers inside.  This makes me go from hungry for lunch to a crazed man who needs a BBQ fix.

The building is great, you feel like you are outside with shacks around you.  The staff was some of the best I have had the pleasure to order from.  They instantly knew that we were new to Uncle Bub's and were quick to answer any of our goofy questions such as "why kind of smoker do you guys use?".   The atmosphere and vibe you get here is very welcoming and fun.  It makes you comfortable, wanting to kick back and stay for the entire day.

The food is amazing, but the first place trophies from competitions around the US can explain that better than I can.  They have tons of them scattered about the building.  I would suggest you try a little.. or alot.. of everything on the menu, i really enjoyed the fried mac and cheese as a side though.

The specialty beef ribs are monstrous, but during my first visit, they were regrettably dry, sinewy, and exceedingly fatty. An obvious disregard of the ideal "low and slow" technique, the excessive connective tissue made the ribs extremely difficult to enjoy. While the rub and house BBQ sauce were a well-paired accompaniment, it was just too hard to surmount the major deficiencies in the $20 plate. A side of Burnt Ends disappointed much the same...fatty, with a texture similar to cow tongue, and NOT f***ing BURNT! Another obvious rush job at this local smokehouse. If there were any positives, the creamy vinegar-based Cole Slaw was on point, the fried Mac n' Cheese balls lived up to the hype. In keeping with the sides, the cornbread was dry, but a sweet and buttery finish kept them afloat. Mashed potatoes were boring, something I'd steer away from with other more appealing options. All in all, Q in LaGrange is looking to be the odds on BBQ favorite. More bang for your buck, and worth every cent.

Discovered Uncle Bubs at the famous Naperville Ribfest a couple years ago.  I  frequent here from time to time.  Good old fashion BBQ!

My TOP 5 recommendations:
1. PULLED PORK NACHOS - oh boy, need I say more? An appetizer fit for a mass feeding. It has a layer of crispy crunchy tortilla chippies, with a generous heaping of their slow roasted pulled pork, topped with refried beans and jalapeos and drenched with cheese.  Not the gooey cheese but like the dipping stuff.  Liquid gold! 
2. BURNT ENDS -perfectly charred and super moist.  Topped with a bit of their BBQ sauce.  Order this as a sandwich or on it's own.  It won't disappoint.
3. CHICKEN WINGS -deep fried paradise.  Their wings are spot on. Cooked crisped on the outside but then you bite into them and the meat is moist and tender.  Probably the BEST wings I've had ever.
4. BRISKET - it just  melts in your mouth.  You don't even spend time chewing it up.  It's that good.
5. DEEP FRIED MAC AND CHEESE- it's not an entree but it certainly is one of the reasons I love Uncle Bubs.  Breaded mac and cheese deep fried and served hot to you so when you bite into it, it just pops with good flavor and hot cheese....hawt.

I can't write about this place anymore because it just makes my mouth water.  Come check out this place.  They cater too!!! Great for summer parties or just parties in general!
Great and authentic BBQ.  We have been eating here since it opened and it is always fantastic.

I have eaten at Uncle Bubs since its very existence when it opened in Westmont. I don't necessarily consider myself to be a barbecue aficionado but I am very big into barbecue food and tried many many different places across the United States and in Illinois. With the more places I try I appreciate their food even more for still being one of the best. I know that barbecue is like pizza and a lot of other foods were everybody in different parts of the country have their own preferences as to which type is best but I would still encourage you to get Uncle Bubs and give it a try.
After moving away a year ago, Uncle Bub's wins a place on my list as the lunch place my husband misses the most!

Uncle Bub's is the best! Him and all his staff were AMAZING at our wedding. They really went up and beyond the call of duty...including reasonable prices and great recommendations for other good vendors. Thanks to his recommendation we saved a small fortune on liquor for the reception. I plan to use him again for my baby shower coming up. 
Also, don't let the name fool you! We had a very nice reception and Bub's was able to make the presentation very elegant. I had reservations about BBQ for a wedding but everyone is STILL saying that it's the best wedding food they have ever tasted!
You can trust the owner to give you the best price and best service possible. We often go back to eat at the restaurant when we're in town. I can't rate him high enough!
Uncle Bub's catered our wedding. Many people said it was the best wedding food they have ever had. There were plenty of leftovers. Well worth the money.

The ribs are a 5 in themselves! Fall off the bone deliciousness. Definitely award winning! Great meal combos, you get two sides and corn bread with the dinners which can be a combo of meats: brisket, rib tips, pulled pork, pulled chicken, etc. the Mac and cheese balls are really good! They changed some of the sides recently, but I miss some of the old sides. I haven't tried the burgers yet. Have some old fashioned soft drinks, red cream soda, green river. When our son was a newborn, Uncle Bub's take-out was the comfort food we needed! Now we love that we can take him and just chill in one of the comfy booths.

We worked with Uncle Bub's Catering for our June 2015 Wedding. My husband and I were so pleased with our wedding day because of the hard work and efforts of Bub's staff members. Mark and Marie, who coordinate many aspects of the day, were so kind and helpful. We were on a budget, and they did their very best to ensure that our wedding budget was kept in check. Also, Uncle Bub's worked with us to help make sure every detail was in place from start of our cocktail hour all the way through our reception. Marie is a fantastic event coordinator and planner; she is organized, attentive, helpful, and enthusiastic. We felt very secure on our wedding day knowing that we need not worry about any minor details. 

On top of amazing catering logistics, Uncle Bub's delivered on its quality BBQ for our wedding. We chose to do a buffet with Pulled Pork, BBQ Chicken, Mac & Cheese, Salad, and other items. The pulled pork was delicious with great buns; I was also akin to the delicious potato bread rolls. I highly recommend you eat these and then sneak some to take home! :-) Our guests said they loved the food! The food was prepared and served well. Jerry, the captain, was attentive to us and made sure we were happy with the entire night. The staff was excellent, and we can't say one negative aspect of the night! 

The entire experience of planning our wedding was wonderful because of the tireless efforts of Uncle Bub's. We cannot say thank you enough! They truly did a fabulous job, and we HIGHLY recommend them. Go for unique food at your wedding and choose Bub's because they are amazing.

Uncle Bub's has be a staple for me for the past 15 years. I even turned it into a verb with my family and friends: "let's go bub'n" would be the way I sugessted very solid BBQ beef brisket sandwiches for dinner. The sauce is finger-lickin' awesome. Last time I went there, however, the meat wasn't as tender as I'm used to. I hope it was just a fluke, because I can't afford loosin' my favorite BBQ spot.

The food was very tasty, but the meat was over cooked n dry that I didn't eat it.  We tried the sampler platter and enjoyed the chicken, pork ribs and their corn bread, Mac n cheese and mashed potato. Texas girl looking for a great BBQ place and disappointed to see the brisket was dry. I'll definitely try it again let's see if it was a bad brisket day.

I recently made it in for their 17th anniversary specials and I have had their food since at several BBQ events this past summer. (First place Rib Fest Chicago, while being filmed for Anthony Anderson's Food Network show, Eating America.)

The hiccup from 2011 is certainly forgiven and they certainly can feed the masses. I'll need to give their ribs a try in house soon, as everyone deserves a second chance. I never did hear anything more from Stuart?
Solid BBQ. Counter service but attentive at the table. Unlimited fountain drinks. Reasonably fast. Good deserts.

We have carried out and eaten in at Uncle Bub's. Even the way they package the to-go meals is stellar! We have had salads, various meats and sandwiches.  The sides are awesome, and the staff is always friendly and prompt!

We would highly recommend Uncle Bub's!  We ordered a whole roasted pig for a party we were Hosting at our home.  Great customer service, easy ordering process, and the delivery was on time.  Great presentation and taste.  Great Job!

This is the second time we have been here and this trip was definitely better than the first. While it's an eat in restaurant it's definitely a middle of the road restaurant for food quality but has great and courteous service. The veggies are good, amazing greenbeans and corn. The bbg sauce is tasty as well. The best parts were the generous ice cream coins, butter soccer playoffs and Hot men with warrior beards

Loved this place! It was my first time, and I loved the appearance from the outside and dining inside! I'd say one of the best bbq places in the area! I ordered the St. Louis full slab ribs and got cornbread and two sides (fried Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes)! The mashed potatoes were alright. The ribs were delicious and the spicy bbq sauce was good! Also I loved the fried Mac and fried Mac and cheese.The customer service was phenomenal! They are really welcoming of new customers!

This was mediocre at best. Overpriced and overcooked food with poorly prepared sides. Pretty dismal and not too much good to say about it. Most of one of the sandwiches ordered was fat. Not sure how you'd qualify this as an award winning bbq joint. I'd recommend trying dickey's on 75th street if you're looking for quality slow cooked bbq in the area. Exponentially better than this "award winning" joint.

Uncle Bub's is one of those places I could have sworn I've reviewed before. I've been here quite a few times in the past decade or so. You might be asking, what is Uncle Bub's? Well, Uncle Bub's is a barbeque joint in an old wooden building in downtown Westmont off of Cass avenue just a little bit South of the train tracks.

Immediately noticeable with a cartoon pig on the sign Uncle Bubs is well known to almost everyone who has passed down Cass avenue in the last decade or so. Many years ago I stopped in the first time and have been back well over a dozen times since. 

Uncle Bub's is an old wooden building and as soon as you pull up you'll smell the food coming from within. Once you enter the building it's really more like an old house with a front door and then several halls where the seating is located with an order counter hiding in the Southwest corner. I'll go over the good and the bad with Uncle Bub's and allow you to decide for yourself whether it's worth stopping here.

We'll start with the positives. Uncle Bub's has some pretty excellent sides, the fried mac and cheese balls are one of my favorites. Originally you got one huge ball of fried mac and cheese, now it comes in several smaller fried balls. The BBQ sauces at the table are tasty. They have Green River in their soda fountain, compared to some other local BBQ places they have adequate parking and quite a few places to sit. And their food can be excellent with a nice smokey flavor.

Now let's go on to the down sides of Uncle Bubs, first off the consistency. I've had chicken, pulled pork and many other things here. Sometimes there's a great smokey flavor grilled into the food, but more often than not it's lacking. Sure, you can cover it up with BBQ sauce and have that overpower the flavor, but then you're missing something. It seems like sometimes stuff is left to smoke a lot longer than others.While there's lots of seats, they can be uncomfortable to sit in with wooden hard booths. This isn't a problem for a short time, but I've had orders take a while and it's just not a place you want to be spending 40 minutes sitting at.

This eatery with a cartoonish pig for a mascot is a place you can go hog wild with excellent appetizers and competent barbeque. When busy, the long wait can turn your visit into a bit of a boar and the due to the hard booths it's not a comfortable place to wallow around and wait. However, this shouldn't HAM-per you from visiting. My feelings on Uncle Bub's are mixed and I don't mean to swine about the place. It's always clean, well maintained and never a pig-pen like other restaurants in the area. The quality appetizers will make you squeal and that's no hogwash. It's a good place to stop whether you're a dude or a babe, the prices are reasonable so whether you're rich or pork you should be able to afford the food here without breaking your piggy bank. So I'll give Uncle Bub's three stars, it's snout the best BBQ joint in the area, but it's worth visiting. Oink you very much for reading.

Not worth it. Haven't been here in many years because last time the bbq was not good enough. This time we went in because the sign outside said corned beef special on Fridays. The corned beef was so disappointing and extremely dry I'd be surprised if they even made the corned beef. It tasted like store bought deli. My husband had the catfish that was not tender or flaky. The only part of our dinner that was any good was the ranch sauce for our onion blossom and the corn bread muffin. The beans seemed semi homemade and the potato salad was homemade but so bland. The cream of mushroom soup was very good. Wish it was a better dining experience. We didn't even take home our leftovers.

Great food. Great Service. Great Atmosphere. Great BBQ for Chicagoland. I've traveled the country and have had BBQ all over. Of course this isn't as good as Texas, BUT for the west suburbs it's a good place to go with some friends. Appetizers are great! The onion blossom was good!

I don't know, maybe I've just been spoiled from going to BBQ places like Hog Wild and Chuck's, but this place just couldn't compare.  I ordered pulled pork with "homemade" mashed potatoes and gravy.  The pulled pork was ok but not any better then what I make at home in my crock pot.  As for the homemade mashed potatoes you could tell they were made from a potato flake powder.  I could of overlooked all of that but the service was a disaster.  I was there with my boyfriend and another couple.  Our food came out while we waited about ten more minutes for the other couple's.  We didn't eat until their food came out (not wanting to be rude) and by the time their food showed up ours was cold.  Bummer.
The ribs were terrible. Very dry and overdone. Not much meat on them. I would not go  back.!

My husband and I went here for dinner tonight.  I ordered half a slab with potato salad and baked beans.  He had the 2 meat platter (pulled pork and chicken) with potato salad and fried mac and cheese.  I enjoyed the ribs!  They had a great crunch on the skin but a little on the dry side.  I thought both the pulled pork and chicken were tender.  The fried mac and cheese bites were our favorite side.

We'll definitely be back when the BBQ craving rolls around.  Good food and service!

What is not to love about this place? It is sinful that is for sure. From the fried macaroni to the BBQ pulled pork..everything is delicious. I have had the vanilla milkshake, the cheeseburger, and other items and uncle bubs has never failed to be delicious but definitely not nutritious.

I can't believe I haven't been here before! 
Really really great BBQ.  Split the belly buster, wings and steak tips for a client lunch the other day.  Everyone raved.  If you're in this neighborhood,  DO it!

We hold bbq places to a standard set by a resturaunt, South Moon Bbq, which is very high. We were not disappointed here. 

The selection is excellent, if not somewhat confusing. My wife had the pulled pork, I had the hot links and we split a order of burnt ends. All were excellent, including the sides and cornbread, the later the only think lacking in the aforementioned place.

While this is quite a bit from our house,  we now have another bbq place to choose from and will be back.

For the longest time I had only ever enjoyed Uncle Bub's BBQ at Chicago festivals and some random concerts held in the city close to that park off Lake street.  Every time I looked forward to having Bub's BBQ and it was always a treat.

Then one day the possibility of having lunch here presented itself while on the way to Aurora for some outlet shopping.  My dreams of a five star barbeque meal were shattered.  I'll refrain from the play by play.  We ordered a bit of everything.  Really.  Four dined and shared everything together.  Everything was pretty average, as good as stuff purchased from your corner char house.  I was bummed.  I also thought for an afternoon meal, an afternoon with steady business, the table should not have been so sticky.  But this observation has more to do with how or what they use to clean off tables.

With a family, the place can be a fun time and a point of interest for photos sake.  But if seeking serious barbeque, I have to admit you'll have to keep looking.  Or as I shared earlier, seek them out at festivals.  It's where their A game is presented.
Chicken -amazing! Ribs-amazing! Wish I lived closer I would be here every day. Service staff was attentive and friendly. Great job guys!

My hubby loves BBQ and we've tried our fair share.  So off we went to give Uncle Bub's a try.  We had several sides along with the brisket.  We almost always order pulled pork but decided to give the brisket a try.  The brisket was okay but we both felt it lacked some seasoning and could have been tenderer.  The bbq beans were nothing special and the mac and cheese needed to be more cheesy and creamier.  I know everyone has their own criteria of what is good BBQ but there are definitely better BBQ joints in the suburbs.

Let me start by saying that the quality of the food at Uncle Bub's is great.  My wife and I tried a few items at Uncle Bub's. We both thought that the brisket and pulled pork were delicious.  We also enjoyed the side orders with our meal that we selected.  Our biggest complaint was with the portion size of the meat that you're given on a sandwich.  This is not your generous Uncle! I don't live too close to Uncle Bub's so I can't say that I'd go out of my way to visit this uncle.

We wanted to give this place a try after having not been in a bit. We ordered the baby back ribs, St. Louis ribs and rib tips. We had a sample of the burnt ends which was really good.  The ribs were fine. The cornbread was dry, the mashed potatoes were good, the beans were decent and the broasted potatoes were also very dry. The friendly service was a nice welcome. I would definitely order the burnt ends next time. They were very moist.

We just had you cater a birthday party and we received so many compliments on the food!  Everyone loved it and asked where we catered it from. There was not one person that was dissatisfied. I would use you again!
Amazing customer service, delicious food (the Mac Momma was out of this world!), and unlimited fountain drinks. Plus table service and a clean restaurant. Definitely will return.

Ribs, burnt ends, and pulled pork were tasty. Coleslaw and corn a bit bland for my taste.
Service was friendly and eager to please. Manager/owner seemed genuinely interested in customers.
Order and get your own soda area is a bit crowded.
Solid local place.

We have eaten here before and thought we would give it another try. We were there on a Thursday evening around 6 pm. Although there were no customers we had to wait for them to take our order. We sat at a booth but as my wife sat on her side her feet kept sliding. There was margarine all over the floor under the table! Her shoes were covered in margarine. She had to clean up and sat on my side with me. Our food came after 10 minutes. My sandwich was barely warm and the meat was dry. I had the broasted potatoes and they were just blah. The corn on the cob had been cooked too long in water and was bland and mushy. My wife felt the same about her sandwich but enjoyed the fried macaroni and cheese. The decor in here has a down south feel but the food fell short again. We will probably not return again.

The food was decent here but nothing wow-worthy.  The portions are definitely quite large for the price but the quality of the food was ok.  Me being my usual greedy self ordered the 2 meat dinner which comes with two 5oz meats of your choice along with 2 sides and cornbread..I know it's a lot for one person but how can you resist sampling everything?!  I ended up ordering the pulled pork, brisket, green beans, fried mac n cheese, and cornbread.  The best part of the meal definitely was the fried mac n cheese balls.  Some parts of the pulled pork and brisket were tender while others were more dried and burnt.  I was satisfied with the green beans since they had a nice smoky flavor.  The cornbread was pretty good except I wish my piece had corn kernels in it.  Overall the food was mediocre but nothing exceptional about it.

Uncle Bub's was one of the preferred catering vendors for our wedding venue. It was coincidental that we just happened to already have a love for Uncle Bub's! Everything from start to finish was PERFECT! The staff, setup, and food were all awesome! We had so many compliments from our guests about how much they enjoyed the food! We loved everything they did for us and are so thankful we had Jerry there as our captain - he was absolutely amazing. We had an immediate connection with the owner, Mark, and he was genuinely invested in the success of our event. He also recommended Prestige Liquors for our beverages and they were incredibly easy to work with - together they made the food/drink seamless for us! Their team, from the beginning, was instrumental and we can't thank them enough!

8/2/14. I have eatin here before and has always been good-vg. After two bad BBQ experiences I needed a bbq boost and was not disappointed. 
  Full slab of ribs, cobett-o-corn and mashed pots....
  Ribs-Excellent, just enough tang, did not overwhelm the meat
  Corn- sorry on this. forzen cobette? We are in the middle of a great corn season people!!! (ate it anyway, love corn) How about serving FRESH corn for a few months out of the year?
  Mashed pots- nothing great but just ok, prefer scalloped pots
  The ribs made up for the negatives.
   There were no leftovers and my plate was clean.
   I'll be baack.

I wanted to like Uncle Bub's a lot. It's nearby, has plentiful parking and has a fair amount of positive buzz from the usual outlets. The problem is simply that the food is decent, but not great. I've enjoyed a few pulled pork sandwiches here, but the rib tips were somewhat disappointing (not enough smokey flavor for my taste). The fries are pretty good, though the potato salad could have used some more zip via seasoning. Of the sides I've tried, the fried mac and cheese was my favorite (two hush puppy-sized balls of deep fried deliciousness).

I'm not crazy about the table BBQ sauces here, but that is obviously a matter of personal taste. I think the portions are reasonable for the price. The restaurant has a very strange layout, making the path to the counter less than obvious from the door. To their credit, Uncle Bub's has done its best with signage (on the floor and wall) to make the best of the unusual floorplan.

I really like to support local independent restaurants like Uncle Bub's. I just wish they would step up their game a little bit.

Ok my father lives down the street from here and I figured I would give it a try for the second time. 
I had the rib dinner this time with a side of mashed potatoes and fried Mac n cheese. 
The ribs where over cooked and dry with little taste. and the cheese balls were also hard and dry. I wanted to love this place but just keeps letting me down.

This is the only barbecue restaurant I will ever recommend. The food is delicious and not fatty. The side dish of fried macaroni is so very good. The prices are better than others and they don't mind if you ask for extra sauce. They are very nice and that's becoming hard to find lately. I also love that they have Green River soda. Skip all those other barbecue restaurants because this is where you want to be.

My company had an outing where Uncle Bub's catered. I normally do like pulled pork sandwiches but usually when things are catered, the side dishes are always mediocre at best. However, Uncle Bub's was not the case! The pulled pork was good (as it is hard to screw up pulled pork), but it was the sides that amazed me! Normally I do not like beans but they had a really good bbq type sauce on the beans. The best part of the meal was macaroni. I could have eaten a whole dish of macaroni for my main meal. It was DELICIOUS and so cheesy! The corn bread was decent. I'd like to go to the actual restaurant itself one day and try more items on the menu.

GREAT FOOD! Ordered brisket & herb roasted chicken for 15 people to go. Everyone loved the brisket. And the herb roasted chicken was fantastic. I am still craving it.  When I placed my order they helped me come up with just the right amount of food for 15.  I had enough food for a meal for 2 left so they were right on target with their estimates of how much to boy. 

There was a little confusion with the order when I picked it up but the manager took it as an opportunity to make a bad situation good.  He went above & beyond to satisfy me & make everything right. I left a happy camper.  I will definitely order from them again, this time with extras to freeze & use later.

I have eaten at Uncle Bub's on numerous occasions and have never been disappointed.  I would not suggest that it is the best BBQ I have ever had, but is certainly good and stands out among the fray.  The building has that classic BBQ vibe but is not over done or cliche. 

For the food, I would always recommend that people select the Pulled Pork or Chicken over the Brisket at Uncle Bubs.  I feel like the Brisket is slightly less flavorful than those other options.  The ribs are always good and I enjoy the racks as opposed to the rib tips.  Fried Mac and Cheese is a must, mainly because it is fried mac and cheese.

In terms of service, Uncle Bubs is hands down amazing. A few years back I utilized them to cater a corporate event with 40 people.  We did not do the pig roast, but simply ordered a bunch of different food.  The staff member I spoke with at Uncle Bubs was more than willing to help me determine how much food I needed. Upon arrival, I asked the man who delivered it if it looked like it would be enough food as it didn't look like as much I was expecting.  He reassured me that it was and left.  While the event was going on, we were running quite low on a few of the options, but it did indeed look like we had enough.  To my surprise, in the middle of eating another driver showed up and dropped off more food to quell my concern. They always seem to be willing to go above and beyond to make their customers happy.

I will be a customer for life!

Delicious ribs,  awesome prices!  Was able to share their sampler plate,  bowl of chili,  and be satisfied. Their pulled pork is mouthwatering,  ribs and rib tips equally delicious.  Love how you can order and they bring you the food afterwards.  Kids menu has a fabulous selection.

Went there on a Saturday around 1 or 2 for a late lunch and we were so disappointed. Nothing, and I mean NOTHING, tasted fresh.

Pulled pork was just OK; I've made tastier pulled pork at home in my crock pot. Mashed potatoes tasted like store-bought instant spuds. Green beans were definitely from a can--I know because I eat the stuff at home sometimes. The corn bread was dry and blah.

The service was great, both at the counter and at the table, but because the food was so disappointing, we won't be coming back.

This place is the bomb.  Best BBQ I have had in Chicago hands down.  I have lived and traveled through the south extensively and I know my BBQ, the food here is excellent!  Wait staff was attentive and atmosphere was very good.  The first time I had Uncle Bubs was at  a work function and everyone loved it.  Not exactly BBQ, but the pot roast was the best I have ever had.  This is a must for anyone in Chicago looking for authentic southern BBQ.

The nicest thing I can say about this place is over priced garbage!!! I've been a few times and have been less than impressed every time! The brisket was tough and dry, brisket should fall apart and melt in your mouth. For $13 I expect more than 6 small cubes on an oversized bun. The bbq sauce was lame with limited options. You want good bbq? Drive a few extra miles and hit up Qbbq in Lagrange. Worth the money and offer a good selection all of witch is tastey!  The best bbq in the area however is in naperville. sharkos is OUTSTANDING!! Maybe uncle bubs could take a few notes!

Just enjoyed a bacon burger with baked beans and fried macaroni and cheese. Great food. I was very impressed by the staff. Very courteous and friendly. I'll be returning soon to check out the BBQ ribs. Great customer service, great food, great music, great atmosphere. Earns a great review. Nice work uncle bubs.

I've been here to eat lunch before and had catering for a company function and I remember it being a lot better than it seems to be now. Just had lunch this week with some clients and had the brisket dinner with baked beans and green beans for my sides. Plenty of brisket with the meal no doubt, but as a huge brisket fan, I can tell you this was likely the least enjoyable brisket that I've ever had. It seemed way over cooked and very dry. It was actually pretty flavorless and I doused it in spicy BBQ sauce to liven it up. That didn't help as the BBQ sauce was not spicy and was also pretty flavorless. The baked beans were passable, nothing extraordinary, and the green beans were.......green beans. Corn bread was fine but if I go back I'll definitely be trying something else.

I adore their taco salad, made with delightful pulled meat in a taco shell bowl. Their pot pies are also worth the trip into the restaurant. Try to stay away from the prime time dining hours because seating is odd, with long benches that can seat 10, but if you are party if 2 you are SOL. We have noticed over the years that their portions have gotten smaller while their prices have continued to rise. Too bad they can't do one or the other instead of both at the same time.
This is a nice place to go for a friendly, very casual dinner, that won't break the bank.

The food is mediocre at best. Often room temperature or cooked quite sometime before you have ever arrived or ordered. Soggy fries, too much sauce on ribs and pulled meats. There are better options for lunch, dinner, and take out.

On friday June 5,I decided to pick up food instead of eating inside.What a mistake!!!
I ordered the nacho plate and I received about 40% less pork than if I ate inside.I also ordered a corn dog with french fries.The corn dog was good BUT the french fries were horrible! About half the fries were rock solid,probably sitting under a heat lamp
for a long time.To top off this, there was only a small handful of fries.Let me point out,
I picked up my horrible order at 11:20AM.The lunch crowd had'nt arrived yet.I'm still a big fan of Uncle Bubs,BUT I will never ever order a take out again!!!!!!!!!!

 PS I ordered a drink and I did not received it.But I WAS CHARGED!!!!!!!!

Very disappointed. I've been coming here for 15+ years and after last night's dinner I doubt I'll be back. 

Cheese fries horrible. Looked like they scraped together some old fries and threw them on the plate. Hardly fresh at all, barely any cheese. Ugh. 

Brisket was miserable. No char, no flavor. Looked like it was cut on the slicer, kinda gray in color. Very off putting. Cold and fatty too. 

I'm not sure what happened. Uncle Bubs used to be good. Always came for family get-togethers, birthdays and graduations. Sadly I'll not return. It's like they just gave up and don't care about their product. Nothing tastes homemade or fresh. Canned and bland.
Quite sad.

This had to be the worst bbq I have ever had. I had the 2 meat dinner with brisket and ribs. I also ordered burnt tips. Everything was so dry I think I would have rather eaten shoe leather. The coleslaw was bland and the cornbread was flavorless. The fried mac and cheese was ok but everything else was nearly inedible. I don't know how this place has ever won an award. I rarely post reviews like this but this place earned it.

This restaurant is perfect the place is known for it's award winning barbecue sauce and you can clearly tell why. The last time I went the service was perfect and the waitress even asked if she wanted her to refill my drink wanted. when your supposed to get up and get it yourself. So the service is perfect. Now on to the food I had a pulled pork sandwich with French fries, and Mac and cheese balls. They all had a very good flavor overall and their food doesn't taste like other restaurants food so if your looking for a place to eat go directly to Uncle Bubs you will definitely get your money's worth.

While I usually get Uncle Bub's to go (great for when friends are coming over and having time to cook just isn't in the cards) and have to say that their food is always top notch. There is a lot of BBQ available in the Chicagoland area and Uncle Bub's always is near the top of my list to suggest. The way they cook their meat, the love they pour into their BBQ. It all shines through!  

The interior is very roadhouse inspired and is great to go with friends or family. Plenty of room means there's usually easy seating to be had unless they are running a special (when they do run them - look out! There's going to be a line.)

A friend of mine had the ribs a few years back and said they were good so a group of four of us decided to give it a try. Our food wasnt hot when it arrived, it warm at best. I feel like a good judge at a bbq place is how the brisket is so i ordered that. The brisket was lean but it was also tuff. I also feel that if a meat is smoked good you should see a nice deep pink/purple smoke ring which gives it a great smoked flavor that you dont even need to put sauce on. However, both mine and my friends briskets lacked this. It tasted like a beef roast that you cooked in the oven then sliced and poured on some sauce. Also their mashed potatoes tasted like boxed potatoes. No restaurant should serve boxed potatoes in my opinion. Overall very disappointed and doubt well go back seeing that there are much better bbq places nearby.

We came to Uncle Bub's for lunch last week and I was pleasantly surprised; the food was delicious. After reading the reviews I was hesitant to try it but I'm glad I did. I got the rib tips and they were very good; my director got the wings,BBQ and buffalo and she liked them both. I tried one of her buffalo wings and it was good; loved the buffalo sauce! I am definitely going to come here again for lunch!!

We were so happy that we selected Uncle Bub's BBQ to cater our daughter's wedding reception! The food was amazing, the service was outstanding, and the planning was a breeze thanks to Mark & Marie.  From the menu, the staff, the linen's on the tables, setting up and taking down, Uncle Bub's took care of everything we needed. (They even suggested the venue we used since it is very difficult to find a venue that allows you to bring in BBQ and cook onsite.. Oak Brook Bath & Tennis Club )  Mark & Marie were both so easy to work with and our Event Capt. Jerry kept everything running on schedule and smoothly the day of the wedding.  Our servers and bartenders were great too - they made sure our guests ( about 150+) had everything they needed at all times.  They even put together to-go boxes and wine for the bridal party to take back to the hotel for some late night snacking after the reception.  Honestly, from the planning to the actual event, it couldn't have gone any better.  We had Ferrara Bakery ( from Taylor Street ) cater the cocktail hour and sweet table and Uncle Bub's staff took care of setting everything up beautifully.  At the end of the evening, their staff packed up everything ( including the decorations ) so neatly we didn't have to do a thing.  What a wonderful and professional group of people! 

Our daughter and her fianc' didn't want the usual "plated hours ahead of time-over cooked-over-priced-chicken-steak wedding food" that 99% of wedding receptions serve. They also didn't want their guests leaving at the end of the reception searching for a fast food drive thru because they were hungry. We have all been served that fare at a wedding - watery soup, bland green salad, chicken that is cold and rubbery or a steak that is bloody and tough thrown on a plate with a few lukewarm vegetables. This was not the case with Uncle Bub's.  The food was grilled on site and basically went from grill/smoker to plate.  The roasted chicken was AMAZING, the pulled pork was so delish, and the burgers were hot & fresh. Baked mac & cheese like you'd make in your own kitchen, two kinds of cole slaw, corn bread, and baked beans rounded out the offerings.  Everyone was raving on how good everything was, how much they enjoyed being able to pick as much or as little as they wanted, and the ability to go up for seconds! It's been almost 3 weeks since the reception and we are still getting compliments on how nice it was to go to a wedding reception that you didn't leave hungry, wasn't the typical wedding reception meal and where you actually enjoyed the food.  I would recommend Uncle Bub's for anyone having any type of event, small or large.  They make everything stress free so you can actually enjoy yourself with your guests and their staff can't be beat.
Thank you Uncle Bub's!

This place used to be a go-to joint for me and still is.  The prices were cheap and the food was excellent.  The manager was on the ball and the staff was good.  A total five star place.  Then they started winning the Naperville Ribfest and then they moved all of their prices up and reduced their portions.  Food was the same - excellent; but they started getting a little greedy.  I'll be honest, I still go there and speak very highly of it; but you have to realize, I was on board with these guys back when they were just a little hole-in-the-wall place across the street from Holy Trinity.

I had lunch at Uncle Bub's with my family yesterday afternoon at about 1pm on a wet November Saturday. The restaurant has a reputation for outstanding BBQ, so I stopped in to see what the hype is all about. 
 If this is award winning BBQ, I'm afraid the judges had less than enough experience to derermine that conclusion. I ordered the BBQ'ed half chicken which was served as if it was cooked the night before and the BBQ sauce did not look any fresher or tastier. The table had two dispensers of Mild and Spicy BBQ sauce, but neither made the chicken any better. The sauce that was cooked on the chicken was almost hard laminated on the meat. One of my sides was the fried Mac and Cheese, which were two 1  1/2" balls that looked like fritters but were ok at best. But only two? Com'on? The other side was mashed potato's which were just ok. 
My wife and one son had the bacon burger which also were ok at best. 
 The real disapointment was what my youngest teenage son ordered, the bowl of chili which tasted bland and and needed all the BBQ sauce it could take to make it have a appetizing flavor. It was far from good. 
 I took my family to the restaurant really wanting to enjoy a good meal, from what was said to be a great restaurant. I left there pretty disapointed and hope that this wouldn't be what others think is a great meal. It's not. 
On the bright side the wait staff is friendly and service is good. But that's just a small part of what makes a restaurant good. What's on the end of the fork is what makes me want to come back for more. This place didn't satisfy that need for me or my family.

I've said it before -- people sure are picky about their BBQ. When someone says a barbeque place isn't "authentic," what do they mean by that? I think all it means is that place doesn't happen to serve the type of barbeque that you've learned to like. There's so many regional variations on the meat and sauce - Memphis-style, Carolina-style, Kansas City-style, Texas-style - that you can pretty much take your pick. 

Uncle Bub's is probably closest to Kansas City-style BBQ in that they slow-smoke a variety of meats with a dry rub seasoning, with sauce served on the table. Is it authentic? Who knows, unless you've actually eaten BBQ in Kansas City? Is it good? If you define good BBQ as being moist and falling-off-the-bone-tender yet still flavorful, then hell yes, it's good! The barbeque place right by my house is decent enough, but if Uncle Bub's opened up next door to it, it would be no contest! 

I've only had the pulled pork here, but it was so good that I'm dying to go back and try some of their other smoked meats. Uncle Bub's BBQ sauce tastes like it uses a combination of vinegar and ketchup for its base, so that probably makes it closest to the Carolina-style sauce, if we have to put a label on it. All I know is I liked it, and others obviously do too, since their sauce has won first place at the Naperville Rib Fest and the Nuggets BBQ cook-off in Nevada. The sides are just OK - I had the corn bread and baked beans. Definitely try the pumpkin bread pudding with brown sugar butter sauce for dessert!

The dcor is very casual and "countrified" - wooden picnic tables with plastic gingham tablecloths and rolls of brown paper towels for napkins. The ordering system is kind of confusing - first they told me to wait after I'd ordered, then someone handed us a number and said they'd bring our order to our table.  Having someone to explain the system would have been nice.

I'll definitely visit this place again when I'm in the area!

Ordered over $40 dollars worth of items from the window as one single, stand alone person. Took them 10 minutes to realize I intended this to be a to-go order, then proceeded to make me feel bad about it AND walk back to the window to make fun of me to coworkers... Whoa. Hey. I can see you. HUGE pet peeve of mine. I realized after leaving that they have a small side door for carry out orders, so I caused my own confusion, but there's no need to be rude... Ick.

Also, $47 dollars for two meals and an appetizer is INTENSE for BBQ. At Q in Naperville, you can get that for much less, and a myriad of fun sauces, and it's to die for. 

Uncle Bub's has just one sauce but it is really, really good. The fries were super soggy (takeout order, so they may be really good in house) and the fried Mac and cheese I got was a tiny portion and very flavorless - I think a different reviewer said it best when he noted that the fried breading on the outside shouldn't have more flavor than the Mac and cheese inside - but it did.

The rib tips we got to share were a huge order and incredibly delicious. We each got sliced brisket in our meals, and it was dry and tough, definitely required a lot of extra sauce to enjoy it. My fianc enjoyed his baked beans, but we both would skip this place again unless we were in the area and craving BBQ.

Excellent! The pulled pork was delicious, the burger was really good, mashed potatoes were great along with the baked beans and coleslaw! Also, get the Mac and Cheese balls! And dip them in the hot bbq sauce! :)  Thanks Stacy! You were super helpful and friendly! Thanks!!

There's plenty of good BBQ places in the area. As it relates to the western burbs, Uncle Bub's is hard to top. I've been eating here since 1998, although there was a period when I was unable to go there. However, I've made my way back a couple times of recent and here are two key improvements:

1. RIP TIPS!!!!!!  They are now on the menu. I gave them a try & was VERY satisfied. If rip tips are your thing, you're safe ordering them here. They do serve them dry so you can take their house sauce or add your own should you decide to do so. So many places can't do them properly

2. Smoked Prime Rib is a once in a while special. When I got mine recent, it was outstanding. No bone and around 12 oz.. Mashed potatoes & gravy and green beans went well with it. Too bad it's not a weekly special although I probably wouldn't be able to eat it weekly. Like the whole hog on Thursdays, the Prime Rib also sells out when it's on the menu. It's fit for a King (or Queen for that matter)!!!

My Tommy Nevin's experiences are pretty neutral. I've never had a bad experience but also never truly had a memorable one either.

Like other Yelpers have stated, the look of the bar/restaurant itself makes you anticipate a hearty comforting Irish meal with accompanying beverages. In reality, it's a pretty typical pub. Average beers, full bar, and standard food.

They have a bunch of TVs and are apparently an Iowa bar, so I met up with some friends there recently to watch the game. At 11:30 am we were pretty much the only people in there, but it did pick up as we creeped into the afternoon.

Service was great and they had some sort of bud light special. Like the ladies we are, we all ordered a Bloody Mary and a side beer to go with it. It's a personal habit of mine to order cheese curds whenever they're on the menu, so I got some for the table. Accompanied with ranch (as they should be), these curds were really good! Most of us also got a bowl of their French onion soup which was very tasty. Lots of cheese and very flavorful.

Again, there's nothing bad about TN's, I just kind of want more out of such a good lookin' establishment. A-OK place to grab a drink because of the atmosphere, but not my first choice in the area.

WONDERFUL PLACE TO HOLD A SPECIAL EVENT! We selected this restaurant instead of a handful of others in the area because of the vast amount of private space provided, the great food, excellent service, and their endless flexibility/openness to our big ideas for the special day! Jared, the events manager was SO helpful and let us go to town on decorating and fulfilling our every idea! Jenny and Karl were our servers and they couldn't have been better! So sweet and attentive for the entire 6hrs we were there! They let us come hours in advance to set up and decorate everything. They allowed us to hang signs, banners, and even use the TV to play music along with a photo slideshow. I swear, anything we requested, Jared and the rest of the staff were on it! No restrictions about decor, staying in a certain area of the restaurant, special requests, etc. - Unheard of!!

We had a mimosa bar with different juices and fruits, which was wonderful! We really wanted private indoor/outdoor space, so we went with the library room and adjacent terrace, which ended up being perfect! We did presents outside, which allowed for everyone to spread out. The outdoor bar was great for the dads/fianc to hang out during the party, too. All of the guests raved about the food, which was excellent and endless!!! Everyone went home with to-go boxes, which our servers graciously brought to each table without us even asking! 

I could go on and on, the bottom line is that if you're considering this place for your event, then definitely book it!! Out of everywhere we researched, Tommy Nevins was by far the best! They will assist you in having the event of your dreams!

You didn't miss the mark. You took a big steamy turd on the mark. 

You will by no means ever see me there again. Why in the world would I go back? Did you read my review or do you just copy and paste your responses? You place is terrible and there are a million other like it that do a much better job. Honestly, why would I return to a place that did nothing to make me come back? Why? Please respond.

Tommy Nevins is the perfect any day type of bar where you can come in and immediately feel at home. With great deals on food and drinks every day of the week it just makes sense for a make shift dinner date or just an evening out with family. We have come here with large groups and just groups of two and every time the staff is extremely accommodating and happy to serve. The bartender Justin is extremely attentive to every one and is great at creating drinks while making customers feel important! 

The food is also phenomenal and overall very well priced for the amount of food you get! I highly recommend the nachos and their cod father sandwich are to die for!!!

Stopped yesterday to try the place out considering my husband and I always drive by. Beautiful exterior and interior of the resturant, besides the design of the resturant we had exceptional service. Jenny, our server greeted us instantly with a smile and tons of energy. She helped us decide what to order since the menu is full of options! I had the donegal beef stew, and my husband had the Juan Too many Mac and cheese. She recommended the apple crumble dessert and it was amazing. She constantly kept refilling our waters and offering us more beer. I don't often write big reviews but this place deserves it! We will be coming back no doubt.

First time there the other night. We sat at a high top at the bar. A very drab and unenthusiastic and frankly dishelved waitress served us. She was gone for very long periods of time and was clearly not in the right profession as she appeared to care very little for her customers. The restaurant was empty at 630pm and stayed that way. 
The food was drab as well. We ordered the loaded nachos, cheese curds and calamari. The chicken on the nachos was so extremely dry it was embarrassing. It was a basically disppointing dish but the waitress never came back anyway.... I wouldnt have served it. 
The calamari was old and kind of freezer burnt. Tasteless and thrown on the dish.  
The whole place gave me the feeling of being dirty, not clean. I didnt go to the bathroom but Ill bet it wasnt the cleanest either......

Reviewing the Bloody Mary at Tommy Nevins...

New menu at Tommy Nevins now includes a customize your own Bloody Mary with a list of available options including pickles, two kinds of cheese, sausage, salami, buffalo wing, hard boiled egg, a cheeseburger, celery, carrots, olives, and bacon.    I decided to add ALL items.  Glad I did.   

Our server did grumble about my fully decked out Bloody being a PITA and that it would take 10 minutes.   Easy solution...I just ordered a beer in the meantime.   Excited for a social media worthy Bloody Mary I enjoyed a light Pilsner anxiously waiting my creation to arrive...

When it did, I was admittedly a bit disappointed.  All of the glorious accoutrements were skewered but served on a plate next to my beverage, left to some self assembly.    I get that such a concoction may be difficult to carry but come on Tommy Nevins, take pride in your Bloody Mary's.   You have something on the menu that will cause Bloody Mary enthusiasts to drive to your restaurant.   Make the experience special.   Be proud of the Bloody Mary you serve!   

The drink itself was above average, I do prefer a bit more spice in mine.   I did not dare ask for a spicy version after I ordered all of the toppings.   

The toppings were mostly excellent.   The mini cheeseburger was juicy and delicious.  My egg was a bit over cooked - had the greenish ring inside but no biggie.   The chicken wing was great.   The only disappointing topping was the sausage wheels... A bit tough and hard to chew.    

A manager came to our table half way through my Bloody experience and congratulated me on being the first person to order one of everything for the bloody.   I couldn't tell if he was being sincere and wanted to see the creation or if it was a "hey guy, we made it for you this time but I'm letting you know you're the ONLY person to do this so far and it's a PITA for our staff".   

Again I say Tommy Nevins: embrace your fully loaded Bloody Mary.   It's special.   Two suggestions...

1. Serve it with a snit.   A shot of lite beer on the side.  
2.  Give the fully loaded beast a name on your menu.   I dunno something like "The Tony" has a charming ring.  ;-)

This is a very basic review for a very basic place. We went here on a Friday night, we were driving by and were in a rush and the parking lot wasn't very full so we decided to give it a try. As other posters here have said the interior of the place makes you expect a great experience, it feels very English pub like with the dark wood etc. 

But then it gets to be a basic pub experience with the service and food. Our waitress was nice, friendly but not very knowledgeable about the menu. I had one of their NBC beers, ahh not so good. They did have a special on Grey Goose vodka which my lady really appreciated. I had the nachos to eat, they use that cheese sauce like Cheese Whiz, not real cheese. It was ok at best. My lady had a chicken wrap which she said was dry.

Overall it's just ok,

Some friends and I got here for a get together in the back room. About 20-25 people total. The poor girl (only one) was our waitress and said she was very understaffed. She ran around to take drink and food orders. She was very rushed and seemed rude. Again, this might not have  totally been her fault considering they were very understaffed. It took at least 10 minutes to get a beer. The spinach artichoke dip was good.

This was without a doubt the worst service I have ever had in my entire life. My best friend was in from out of town so I was really excited to try somewhere new for lunch. When we got there nobody even acknowledged the fact that we were there. No one sat us at a table or told us what to do. Finally we decided we would just sit at the bar. 
After waiting about 10 minutes the waiter/bar tender came over and asked what we wanted and we both ordered drinks. After drinking my beverage for a few minutes, which took 10 minutes to receive in the first place, I turned my cup around and noticed that there was lipstick on the glass and I wasn't wearing lipstick. I told the waiter and he threw down his order pad and grabbed my cup, dumped it out, then walked away to make me a new one. It wasn't until I got my new drink that he apologized but he had an attitude. 
Once we got our appetizer we asked him for some marinara sauce. It took another 15 minutes for him to bring us the marinara sauce but we were so hungry we had finished the entire appetizer by then. The food all tasted really good which is the only reason I'm giving them any stars at all. 
 
Another thing I noticed while there: 
There was a couple sitting at a table next to the bar having lunch. The wife of the couple had to keep coming up to the bar to order food or drinks and to even ask for the check because the waiter wasn't doing his job. 

I would really like to come back to try the food again because the menu looks really awesome but they need to train their staff better or something because I have never felt so unwanted at a restaurant before. And make sure your dishes are actually being washed... Lipstick. Ew.

Stopped by tommy nevins hoping for a tasty pint of guinness and maybe decent bite to eat. Got the pint - cheap a** small pint for $6. Ordered onion straws which were tasty - breaded, deep fried & served w spicy sauce. Then ordered the flat bread - queue the scary music - which looked OK when it arrived. Lots of chunks of veggies including cubes of fresh mozzarella. Was looking for melted cheese. Sauce was balsamic vinegar. This is key because that's what wound up on my shirt on the first bite
 The g*ddamn chunks fell right off the flatbread because there was nothing to hold them on. Whatever it was, vegetable chunk or mozzarella cube, absorbed just enough balsamic vinegar then followed the law of gravity to make a nice big stain on my shirt.  On the first bite! The only way to eat it without stuff falling was to hold the flat bread perfectly level. Even then a bite sent chunks everywhere. After 2nd bite i quit and ordered the steak chunks. I couldnt take another stain on my shirt! The steak chunks came with guess what? More onion strings except no sauce this time. The blackened steak chunks were tasty but the whole dish was so dry! Plus bare - steak chunks & onion strings. Could use at least some garnish - maybe a leaf of lettuce? So overall OK but for the cheap a** pints and the ninja flatbread. If management reads this i challenge them to eat the flatbread wearing a dress shirt and a tie.  And no bib! Good luck.

DO NOT COME HERE FOR AN IOWA GAME. This is an "Iowa bar" but they had no one working They had one waitress for the entire bar of 80 people. Sweet girl by the way we felt awful for her. Management did nothing about being short staffed. First time I've been here and we'll NEVER be back.


Spend your money elsewhere I would've rather gone to any other bar than watch a game here. I would give it 0 stars if I could.

My wife and I went there last night at 530 for dinner and a drink.  We got there and it was completely empty, that should have been a big hint.  My wife and I both ordered the $5 burgers.  My wife also ordered the French onion soup.  That came out fine.  Her burger came out cold, and mine was not made I ordered.  In addition there was an extremely long wait time for the food.  These were burgers it shouldn't take longer than 8 minutes!  When my burger finally came correct it was about 30 minutes later.  I was never even asked if I wanted a second beer.  Bad service in the kitchen they are extremely slow, and even let people walk through to go to the bathroom.  We will never be back.  Naperville is a community where people make great money and the majority of restaurants and bars get that.  Tommy Nevins does not and it appears it won't be open much longer due to lack of customers we saw on a Saturday night 


Perhaps the most concerning aspect of this review is the lack of any response from Tommy Nevins.   I have seen an individual from Tommy Nevins respond to several reviews but not this one.   Evidently they think this type of poor service is acceptable

This is a very large spot, gigantic enough to fit any size group. We came at lunch time, seating was quick. The service was fair, although the complimentary bread came after our main meal was served. It was nice and quiet. The menu is huge and has a good size "Irish" type offerings. I tried the boxty - but it was not what I had imagined it to be. It was definitely filling. The beef stroganoff was decent. Will have to visit again to try the other choices.

My husband and I come here all the time and have never had a bad meal nor a bad experience.  We normally come during the week for dinner and always sit in the pub area.  The waitress that we have during the week is always amazing and because we are frequent visitors, knows us well.  We came in tonight, a Saturday night, and had Liz as our waitress in the pub area.  She was fantastic and the food, as always, was delicious.  My husband and I know that we will always get great service and great food here.  i would highly recommend this restaurant!

This review is solely based on the bar area. It is a pleasant, and calm area to be in. Very mature crowd and not so pricey. There is plenty of beer on tap to choose from and the specialty drinks are typical with a different name. There is always help if you need it and I enjoy the theme of this location. Bricked fire place, leather couches, tall and spacey bar area, and good looking servers/bartenders. :)
New menu with good choices in appetizers. Food seems much improved from previous visits. Plenty of good servers tonight. Worth another try if you've given-up on Tommy's.

Came on a Sunday afternoon during a Bears game with a Groupon in hand. The clientele was def suburban mom and dads probably trying to escape their screaming teenagers. 

The 'Irish' food was extremely average and the drinks were decent. Service was pretty slow for our food order. I would definitely not eat here again but would maybe swing back for a drink since the atmosphere is pretty lively. 

Meh.
I love this place! Black Hawk Fans are here. For bar food is really good, my favorite is the blackened Steak Bites, I can eat two of those in one sitting. The burgers are good too.

Horrible, bad service and the food also pretty bad. We ordered an appetizer that never showed up. Soup that took forever and then came out cold. The waitress blamed the cooks but I'm guessing she just forgot about it and it sat in the kitchen.  Finally Shepards Pie that was 95% potatoes, no carrots, no peas and "Where's the Beef. 

On the good side the manager apologized.

I'm done, because this place is 0-3 with me. This was my third try at Tommy Nevin's, after two previous visits that I would have rated 1 or 2 stars, but this was the worst of the three.

Today, we were seated in a booth along the back wall. In the 15 minutes or so that went by without anyone coming to at least take a drink order, we saw one table (that was seated after us) order their food, and another table get served. So after we saw the waiter come onto the floor twice without acknowledging us, then disappearing for another 6-7 minutes, we moved ourselves to the bar so that we could actually receive some service. We told the lady at the front who seated us, and she apologized. After reading all of the other reviews on here, that seems to be a common theme.

At the bar, we ordered a water and a Diet Coke. The Diet Coke that came out of the bar soda gun looked nothing like Diet Coke - it was light brown and flat, almost like iced tea. The bartender tried a sip, made a face, and dumped it. He just laughed and asked, "Do you want something else?" During our meal, we saw a staff member come in with 12-packs of different sodas that I assume they just ran out to buy, because something was wrong. The other times I was here, someone I was with was served a different beer than he ordered, and the second time I went, they were out of two beers on tap I wanted. So unfortunately, drink issues have been a problem every time here.

Finally, the Chicken Spinach Melt I ordered was good, at least the half that had chicken on it. I had to take two full bites into both halves of my sandwich before there was any chicken. Four full bites of just bread and cheese. At least the fried cream cheese balls we got for an appetizer were good, because that's the reason we went.

So, yeah, not coming back.
Great fish taco and chicken taco!  We also loved the cheese curds.  Monica was our server and did a great job!  There were 9 of us and it got a little crazy, but she was really great!!

I hate writing a "basic" review but this place is just basic.

It has all the potential of greatness but the bitchy yoga pants wearing servers and bartenders make it just not worth the effort.  

Pricing is a bit elevated but I'm a cheap - fk

Basic beer selection
Food is never impressive
Interior dcor is well done

I've been in this Tommy Nevins several times and without doubt, the service, food and experience never change.  I really like their 'meat & potatoes' style menu.  They also have a huge starters (app's) section.  From their regular menu I'd recommend the Ballybunion Club or Bourbon BBQ Salmon.  Both are hearty plates, decent serving sizes and fresh food.  Price-wise I'd say they're very comparable to most restaurants in their genre.  Based on at least ten visits I would also vouch for good service on the restaurant side.  Or as my dad would tell you, this is one of the few places where the waitress remembers to put the slice of lime in his Diet Coke.  I'm at 3.5 stars here.  You can't go wrong with the food.
Cheers.
Went there for a late lunch when in town. Classic pub food. Good enough to check it off.

We come here every once in a while because we love the steak bites. There's always open parking and we can usually find a good bar high top. Last night's visit was the best we've had yet. Our server, Liz, was awesome. She was very friendly and attentive. The food came out really fast and was delicious. We didn't have to ask for anything like we normally do (place settings, menus, salt & pepper). The tables were set up very nice last night as well which we've never seen before. Only reason I give Tommy Nevin's 4 stars is because their food is inconsistent. It's always good but the seasoning on our food is never the same.

I've been here numerous times due to Groupon deals, but wouldn't come here without one. Don't get me wrong, the food is pretty tasty, drinks are good, and I've experienced some ok service as well. However, nothing really stands out here...except for my first experience here.

St Patrick's Day, 2011. We were new to the area, and our friends all wanted to come here. On a whim, I called two weeks before St. Patty's Day and asked if they'd take reservations. I was told yes, even after questioning several times, and was told to rest assured that our spot would be saved. I made reservations for 15 people...yes one-five...and happily exclaimed my plans to all of my friends. We arrived ten minutes early and were told - nope. No reservations are taken on St. Patrick's Day. I calmly said, surely there is a mistake, I made reservations weeks ago. "Nope." I was rudely, no, rude isn't even a strong enough word - HORRIBLY turned down. And the place was packed (re: why I reserved tables). I was shaking I was so mad. I told them I had  15 people, but they clearly didn't care, so we took our business elsewhere.

This experience, and the multiple rude people (hostess, manager, etc) that I dealt with that night left a taste so bad in my mouth, my husband was shocked when I agreed to go back with a Groupon. Again - everything is good here. Just good. If you have a deal, definitely go. Otherwise, there's better English food in the area!

Went there today for Mother's Day brunch.  Arrived at about 12:30 and, seeing all the empty tables, I knew this would be a bad experience.  And they did not prove me wrong.

For 34.95, the selection was sparse. Scrambled eggs were hard.  Ham was dried out as it had been sitting in the serving station too long.  There were two empty bowls of cocktail sauce near the shrimp and I had to suggest they add product.  Croissant rolls were hard.

I have to say the prime rib was good!

But the service was bad, too.  Rarely came to refill coffee. We had piles of dirty plates on our table.  And maybe I am being too picky but servers in T-shirts?  On Mother's Day?  When they are charging $34.95?  And then they add 20% gratuity!  At a substandard buffet brunch.  Drury Lane is $40.  And a far better value.  I will never go back.  Neither should you.

I would sum up my experience as "Slow Service, Great Food"
We came here for an early dinner after the Naperville Winter Ale Fest.  I'm assuming they didn't expect to get a crowd in from there after the fest or something because it seemed like they were short handed or we just had a slow waitress.
We ordered the cream cheese balls for an appetizer and they were awesome cream cheese balls filled with bacon.

I had the amazing "Royale With Cheese" Pulp-Fiction Style...it was SO good!!!  And for a side I got tater tots.  My friend ordered the corned beef and that too was super tasty! There was no fat on it at all...I would definitely go back for that alone.

The service wouldn't hinder me from coming back here because the food was so good so maybe we'll have better luck next time!

If your looking for a cold beer and a good burger this is your place. The new GM is really making some changes! The Bloody Mary bar is awesome on Sundays and unlimited wings on Thursdays. I have never had trouble with service as others have reported.

So for the second time in the same day my girlfriend and I sat down and waited 10 mins before having a waitress come to greet us. I recommend maybe looking older than 20 years old to be treated properly at a restaurant I guess. We watched a family be seated after us and get their drinks before we were talked to. Food is pretty good.
Ordered Flight of Sliders and 1 Taco. Perfect fill for the night. Food was hot, fresh and very tasty! Went on a WED night, sat at bar, good service -not too busy. I'll be back for more!

This place used to have good food, but it has deteriorated over the years.  In addition, it's not well managed.  We came in one night for dinner, drinks, and a Blackhawks game; however, the volume of the game was so loud that it was difficult to enjoy our time.  We asked a few times to have the volume turned down just a little, but they refused.   :-(

Wow, what a difference a few years makes. This used to be a go to place. Last night, a Saturday no less, there were less than a dozen people in the restaurant side of the place. The bar was only half filled and it was the first night of the Cubs/Mets game. That should have been a warning but we didn't think about it at the time. What a mistake.  From items listed on the website that are no longer served to incompetent servers this place needs to either replace their management team or just close and put it out of its misery. We ordered the nachos to start off with. No flavor, cheese that looked and tasted like cheese wiz not the "beer cheese" that the server said it would be. Chips were not fresh and the jalapeos weren't even spicy, like they sat around for a few days. Next up was fish and chips which, at an English Pub, you would think would be outstanding. Not so much. No seasoning, no flavor. Really disappointing. Also had the buffalo burger with bacon. Again no seasoning, no flavor. Either they ran out of salt in kitchen or the cooks don't have a clue. It is time for a Robert Irvine type of intervention. Don't waste your time or money here until they fix the problems.

The food here is decent.  I guess it's a really great place to watch sports... One of the trendier spots in the naperville/plainfield divide.  

I can't say this is my favorite spot to do dinner and drinks but it's not my least favorite either.  I always think the service here blows...and the music/television is so loud you can't even hear yourself think...   Just not my cup of tea, personally.

Nice service during Blackhawks playoffs. Had a side of place for patrons not interested in the game as no tv as there were alot people on other side not eating but watching the game. Kept both of us happy. I was able to relax and my friend was able to go back and forth get his fix of the game as the Blackhawks had strong lead on game 7 vs the Ducks. I had mac and cheese. Plain version. My friend had cheese curds. Nice warm food for cold night! 4 stars for great service,  refills and great food. I ate here before few years ago and had great experience with server and great food. Seems they changed the menu since last time I was here. Next time I am in burger mood I will definely try their different protein burger selections from chicken, beef, bison and what others I forgot. Alot customization is possible even offers gluten free bun or even pretzel bun which I always like with my burger. Thumbs up for that ability to customize unlike some places! 

4 star not 5 because it was soo cold inside ha. I know May 30th it was 40 ish degree outside unusual for this time of the year.

Average pub food, service was lacking.

Tried the cream cheese balls, didn't have much flavor to it.

The Irish dip was not bad. Roast beef sandwich with aujus.. The best part of the meal was the potato chips..fried and sprinkled with Lawry's seasoning. You can't really mess that up.

Beef and lamb stew was ok, meat was a little tough.

Irish coffee = disappointing. Apparently Chili's has a better one.

Our server took our order. As I guess he forgot about us, cuz 10 mins later he asked if we were ready to order..so I guess he forgot to tell the kitchen.. so we waited a much longer time for our food, and we were sitting in the booth closest to the kitchen too.

For the price we paid, you're better off somewhere else.

We've always had a great experience here.  Drinks are cold, food is hot--nothing incredibly exceptional but we left happy.  Th steak bites were good as an appetizer.  And the fresh baked bread is phenomenal!  The last time we dined in we took 3 loaves home with us!

I moved to the area about 3 years ago and remember going to Tommy Nevin's and being satisfied with the service and Menu (even had good Ribs, now discontinued). In the recent months (not sure exactly when) they've changed the menu to be "simpler", yet the quality of the food as degraded quiet a bit. 

The last 2 occasions, they were out of some Irish staples like Lamb Stew- you'd think an Irish pub would not be consistently "out" of Irish food. Last time, I got the Shepard's pie and noticed it was very dry. I asked the waitress to bring me a side of the gravy which is suppose to be in the pie. She came back and said they were out of it. I then realized that the "chef" made my Shepard's pie without an essential ingredient and just hoped I'd be too stupid to notice. The poor waitress realized what had happened, and tried to help me but there wasn't much she could do. On another occasion, my order was messed up twice before I finally got my entree. No one offered even a 10% discount for the unacceptable wait. I could have made the argument that my meal should have been paid for, but I was happier to not waste another minute and move on with my life.

If you want to go have a beer and watch some sports, this establishment is fine but it seems they have some work to do for it to be a good dining experience.

Just finished with an extremely disappointing lunch -- involved the manager -- and he insisted I was wrong.  

Full story: Ordered a veggie burger.  Was delivered a turkey burger.  When I pointed out the difference, our server checked with the chef who assured her it was a veggie burger. 

So I was presented with the bill -- paid in full and tipped as customary.  Then asked for the manager -- told me it was a veggie burger.  From where I asked -- and was told US Foods.  I also told the manager it was terrible.  He offered to take it off the bill (already paid) and I declined.  Mostly because he wasn't listening.

So I checked from home -- US Foods web site -- it was not a veggie burger (they have a 3 grain veggie burger -- with visible corn and beans -- not the same as was delivered to me).  Rather, the burger I was presented was a turkey burger -- off white/ slightly brown in appearance.  

So moral of the story -- will never, ever eat here again.

Hmmmm... Nice staff. Food was good but not great. Ambiance was ok. Other patrons were mix of families and low key local solitary drinkers...

Now what I expected... But might be dif for a real dinner. Fine for a side drink, but but expensive for it...

We went with another couple on a Saturday around 11:45 AM.  We were pretty much the only patrons at the time.  Our waiter came to our table and took our drink order about 5 minutes after we were seated.  My hubby ordered a Goose Island Sofie, the server brought the bottle and no glass, that was a little annoying.  I ordered the chicken and spinach sandwich with the seasoned fries.  They were both very good.  The chicken was a little dinky but I wasn't that hungry so it was fine with me.  My husband ordered a reuben and thought it was ok.  We had a groupon which made the meal pretty reasonable.  I'm not sure I'd return, it was ok but there are other, similar places I'd rather go to.

We went on a busy Saturday night and had to wait maybe 20 minutes.  The place is very loud so it's difficult to have a conversion.  

We ordered the pretzels.  I like my pretzels a little denser and not so light and fluffy.  Actually they were more like bread sticks than pretzels. The were okay but I've had better.  The spicy whiskey mustard dipping sauce for the pretzels was really good.  I ordered the pub salad.  It's a generous sized salad served with warm bread.  It was missing the asparagus and had way too much red onion otherwise a good salad.  My dining companion order the Blarney Bacon Burger which he really enjoyed.  His only complaint was the french fries were greasy, soggy and disappointing.  We both like fries that are crispy.  

The beer menu is decent.  We had IPA's with the pretzels and then switched to $4.00 Guinness pints that were on special.  The service was okay.  I was expecting it to be more of an Irish Pub and not so much regular pub food.
Marginal. Had the fish and chips, handful of frys fried in old grease. Fish was good but again, fried in old grease. Not my favorite place.

My husband got FOOD Poisoning from a chicken sandwich there. He became violently ill for several days . When I brought this to the management attention several times , they wouldn't even have the courtesy to call me back . Terrible way to handle a business .if you want to get sick and have nobody care I recommend tommy Nevins !!

This used to be a great little neighborhood bar and restaurant, but over the past year and a half the service and quality has slipped terribly.  The last time we were in there, me and two friends sat at the bar.  Whenever we needed another beer, the bartender was no where to be found because he was standing talking with his friends or flirting with the waitresses.  The only upside is that the side we were on had a private birthday party going on and I think they added some of our beers to their bill.  I guess it makes up for the numerous times they have overcharged me for beers at Nevin's Brewing Company.   Plus, they had one side of the bar closed down for a birthday party.  They wanted to show some dumb video of old TV shows and commercials (REALLY?!?!) while the NCAA Basketball Final Four was playing.  They shut all the TV's off except one so they can sit there and watch old sitcoms and commercials.  

Another time my son went in with his teammates and coaches.  He waited an hour and a half for his food and it never came out.  Got up and left.  

If you're coming in for a beer, don't expect good service, let alone any service.  It is a shame because this used to be our go to place, but the service has gone downhill so bad, it is tough to go in there.

So I came here after okay a God-awful round of golf. So yes, I was a little miffed. And hot due to the weather and thirsting for a cold pint of suds. 

I knew I'd be passing by Tommy Nevin's on my way home so made a mental picture of how good a pint would taste. And I mean I could feel it as I motored into the parking lot, which was packed as always though it was only 3 pm on a Friday.
