I go in to the bar which is only 40% full as the patio area was packed, grab a seat at the bar, make eye contact with the bartender and then pffffttt....nothing. For one, two, three, four and more than five minutes. Nothing. The bartender vanished to the other side of the bar where he did not serve anyone but put glasses away and chatted with the other bartender who was off shift. Not cool. 

Finally he saunters over and takes my order. The beer was fine. But the service horrible. 

As for the food, I ordered the smoked salmon flatbread. Mixed review on this one. The flatbread was cooked but not crispy; kind of like a Boboli out of the bag but not run through the oven. It shoud have been toasty and crispy but it was neither. The topping of smoked salmon, cilantro and tomatoes with a drizzle of something that tasted like it may have been sour cream was good but it required more flavor. I added some Tabasco and it was okay. If the flatbread had been grilled over a flame and crisped up the dish may have rocked. 

I'll give Nevin's another shot because the bartender getting off shift when I arrived was fine to look at and seemed like she might know what she was doing.
Stopped here for a quick lunch.  We ordered the pastrami on rye and a I had a rueben everything was heavy on the salt.  Beer selection okay.  Nice pub ambiance.

My daughter and I went there for lunch at 12:30 and the place was nearly empty, which should have given us a clue. As soon as we sat down the server told us they were out of CO2 and could not serve pop until  we waited for them to get back from the store with cans!  We put our order in and it took far to long.  This was odd to me given the place was empty! Anyway, they brought our food and the buffalo wrap I had was good, but the fries were these little tiny pieces that looked like they were left over from another meal. My daughter had the chicken BLT, which she liked, but the same issue with the fries! I also ordered a red sangria that had way to much ice and had very little fruit. My fault for ordering a Spanish drink in an Irish pub I guess? Overall I gave it two stars instead of one because the main meal was ok.  I have been there before and it was better then.  I do not plan on going back and do not recommend this place anymore.  Too bad as it was a nice place at one time!

I have been twice in the last year and only get to eat here when I visit my old college friend! The first visit was delicious and the service was terrific but after coming in last night, I won't be coming back because of our rude server. She acted as if she had to leave and kept bothering us when we were going to sign our bill. Everyone that knows me by now knows how service is the one of the most important components of eating out. 

I hate to give this place only two stars because of our rude server but the food was quite delicious I have to say. My friend and I ordered their cream cheese balls which was heaven to my mouth; it  consisted of cream cheese with bacon bits fried in little balls... Then as my main entree, I ordered their chicken spinach melt and honestly, I didn't even finish it because I was already so full from those savory cream cheese balls!

Wow Tommy... WTF happened to you?!  I realize that it's been a few years since we've seen each other and maybe I haven't exactly missed you... But... WOW!!!!  Just wow...

My entire life has consisted of finding the best Irish Pubs, the perfect pour, the tastiest cider, the most delectable Celtic fare, a place where people don't necessarily remember me, but always treat me like one of their own even if I haven't been there in a while.  Someday I'll open my own place... 

I moved here in 2005.  A couple years later I found Tommy when he was still new, pretty, and exciting.  The service came with a smile and the food was even good!  I took friends there a few times and he was even a stop on my First Annual St. Patrick's Day Pub Crawl!

Tommy quickly fell off my lineup though... The service and clientele has gone downhill.  Everyone is in such a hurry to do something or go somewhere that service is no longer personalized to you.  Refills get forgotten and orders are frequently confused.  It used to be nice that the bar and family dining are separated.  Now, no matter where you go, it's loud, rowdy, and you can't hear the person next to you trying to talk to you.  The "new" clientele seems to be douchey!  They won't hesitate to bump into you or push you out of the way when just walking by or to get a bar seat or table even though you've clearly been waiting longer. 

The boy wanted to take me to meet some friends of his recently.  We thought this was a good central location and I figured that some of the issues they had the last time I had been there would've been cleared up.  Boy, was I wrong!

We sat in the family dining area purposely this time so we could hear the conversation between the 4 of us, but that didn't work like we had planned!  We had to talk pretty loud to hear each other and we had a long conversation before our waitress finally came over to take our drink orders.  We went ahead and gave her our appetizer order while she was there since it seemed as though it might be a slow night!

We received our drinks we got our appetizer and when she came back to take our dinner orders... Eh, ok whatever.  The Spinach & Artichoke Dip wasn't the best I've ever had.  It was pretty oily and liquidy.  There weren't nearly enough Garlic Toast Points to finish off the dip with.  Maybe it was because the dip was so thin... I dunno, but it's not something I'll get here again!

The boy ordered a Classic Pub Burger with Cheddar Cheese and added Bacon and a side of Hand Cut Fries.  He asked that there be nothing else on the burger.  Of course, it came complete with a salad on top!  He just tossed it aside as usual when people don't listen to him.  He said that all in all it was just ok, nothing to write home about, but not terrible.  He is a burger junky and seriously tries to order them wherever we go!  If it's nothing special... It's REALLY nothing special...

I had the Corned Beef & Swiss sandwich with a side of Seasoned Fries... Tommy's secret recipe should really just be kept secret!  The corned beef was fatty and stringy!  This was the worst representation of an American Irish tradition I've ever eaten!  At this point we've seen the waitress twice though... It's been a while and we wanted a second adult beverage (or 5!), but we knew we weren't getting one!  I didn't bother sending the sandwich back.  I just ate the fries and waited until I found the right moment to flag her down for our checks.  

It's really a good thing we were there for the company more than anything else.  The atmosphere, the food, and the service have gone so far downhill over the years that Tommy has become a major disappointment!  Tommy, you've been removed from my little black book!

This place has a solid menu and is worth a visit. The atmosphere definitely has a good "buzz" going on, so don't be fooled by the full parking -- the restaurant is pretty spacious and is ideal for groups.

I recommend the Jalapeo Cheddar stuffed burger with fresh cut fries.

For a bite, or a Lite, give it a try.

3.5 to be exact. I didn't have any food, just drinks and dessert. 
 
Pleasant surprise when we walked in, the place is warm and inviting, not like other pubs. Half lit and half dim. The bar is pretty big and they have plenty of seating. 

Anyways, the friends decided to check this place out for their gluten free menu. That's always a plus! Not to mention their regular menu, very extensive. I'll have to make the drive to check out some pub grub.

I tried their chocolate chip cookie with vanilla bean ice cream....downerrrrr. The cookie was too hard that I got tired of stabbing it and left it. The ice cream was good though, that didn't need to be stabbed. ;)

My husband and I have been here a few times now and have enjoyed ourselves each time. They have a good beer selection, although I have yet to try any of the Nevins beers. We have sat at the bar each time and have always had great service. The food has also been good - I've had both nachos and burgers. Since it's pretty close to where we live and we always have a good time, you will definitely see us there again.

The setting is like an old, deep wood, burgundy furniture and fireplace type of place, which sets the bar high for a comfort meal. But I wasn't prepared to be let down like I was.

The beer menu is nothing to write home about, so we just went with a Guiness. They'll have your standard Shock Top, Smithwicks, Heineken, Blue Moon, and Harp, like every bar has. They did have Two Brothers and a Stone IPA, for the craft enthusiasts, but nothing that you felt incredibly compelled to order because of its uniqueness.

We ordered the sampler platter to start, which had some "steak bites" (literally pieces of steak cooked well), some time of corned beef taquito, wings, cheese balls (cream cheese and bacon, breaded and fried...not as incredible as you'd think), and onion straws. The food wasn't bad, but it just tasted bland. I'm glad it came with four dipping sauces.

I ordered a fish sandwich w/steamed veggies and my husband ordered a bowl of french onion soup with a side of tater tots. The fish sandwich was very large and plentiful, served on a ciabatta roll with tarter sauce, lettuce, tomato (standard). It was so large that I did not finish it. Partially because I was full on the Guiness and appetizer, but also because it was just ok. Definitely not the worst, but certainly not the best. It had a spongey texture. But it was huge, so I'll give them props for that, because there's nothing I hate more than ordering a fish sandwich and getting something that is fast-food sized. The steamed veggies had nothing on them...no butter, no salt, no pepper, nothing. If I wanted to have microwaved plain veggies, I could go buy a bag at the grocery store and accomplish the literal exact same flavor. My husband's soup tasted pretty good for a few bites....TONS of cheese, which may have contributed to its oily flavor/texture. He commented on the oiliness after a few bites, and I thought he was crazy. But he pushed it away from his place setting after eating half and said he couldn't eat anymore without feeling like garbage. I attempted to eat more of it and quickly realized after a few bites what he was getting at. It was a bit heavy. It didn't taste bad, but something needs to be scaled back. Oh, and the tots were good. 

After three beers, an appetizer, a sandwich, soup, and side, the meal was about $53. Not bad for a dinner out with drinks. We didn't take any of our leftovers home, because we decided that we had no desire to continue eating our food. The dream was over. We were full, but not very satisfied. Truthfully, everything tasted like it was frozen and not fresh, like chain restaurant food but slightly worse. This spawned a heated debate between my husband and I in the car ride home, about what constitutes as a chain restaurant (more than 1 location? 3 locations? 10 locations? What is the true definition?). It was the meatiest part of our night.

There was ample room for people...there was no wait for 7:30pm on a Wednesday night, in fact there was plenty of room. Our server was attentive and friendly, the noise was fine, so no complaints on service or ambiance. Truthfully, the bar next-door looked very happening. In the future, I could remember this for a get-together. They did have a decent whiskey selection...I guess I would hope so, for an Irish pub.

The food was bland, soggy fries and overpriced.  For some reason they kept switching between crazy dance music to classic rock,  it was really annoying to have quite rock music and then screaming loud house music every other song. Our waitress was very nice and attentive but there was some staff hanging around the bar yelling and taking shots. We will not be going back.

Well well well, I couldn't wait to write this review.........

We went there last week, our table was approximately 6-8 people, so you'd think there'd be some attention to the needs of such a big table.......... well if you did, YOU THOUGHT WRONG. We ordered as many rounds of drinks directly from the bar as we did from our extremely overwhelmed waitress.  We had to, when you wait over 10 minutes for your waitress to come around and she never does.............

One person at the table was drinking their special beer on tap, I think it was Stella.  Well, after about 3 of them he was informed they ran out and he had to order something else.  

My wife is pregnant and called ahead to see if they had non alcoholic beer, such as Sharps or the like.  They informed her they did and with that, we made the plans to go out.  She ordered one and on the next round was informed they were out and she would have to order something else.  She said no problem...."what other non alcoholic beer do you carry"?......... to the response of "NONE",....... did i mention the we called ahead and my wife is pregnant and that we chose this place because they informed us over the phone they had non alcoholic beer for my wife??!!!!!!!!!!

If i didn't know better, I would say they place was having financial hardship; they were running out of things left and right and it didn't seem they had adequate staff scheduled to handle the customers and it wasn't super busy.  It just seemed like a business that was completely out of sorts and really made no attempts throughout the night to fix it.  In my opinion, when a table is consistently ordering from the bar, it's a big indication our server needed help and it never came.

Every single person at our table all vowed to never come back here, it was that ridiculous.

After reading all the crap reviews on Tommy Nevins I decided that I had to hop on here and put in my 2 cents.

I haven't really had anything bad from this place (except the soups aren't anything to rave about). Everything i order is great. Fish sandwich is good, Pot roast Boxty is amazing. Calamari is amazing, not too chewy, just right (it includes some tentacle pieces so if you are squeamish stay away!). I haven't anything bad to say about this place. 

I have read a lot of reviews that complain about terrible service but I have never ever had an issue with that. I used to work in a restaurant and I understand things get busy. I feel like the majority of people who leave Yelp reviews end up complaining about the service while they haven't an understanding of how things operate in a restaurant. I do give more leniency to places especially when I notice that they are slammed. If they are busy, just understand that it is probably for a good reason. 

Drinks are very nice, and made well. Especially the long islands! They have some decent drink specials throughout the week and also food specials. 

Go forth and give Tommy Nevins a shot. Unless you're a babbling baby and then go to some other location that you can complain about.
It's simple ....... Great good. Great service. Great atmosphere  We've been there many times and never a disappointment   We'll be back again.

My husband and I went on a Friday night without a reservation, as we were trying to get some conversation and food in, before we had to pick up our munchkin! 

We had to park in the neighboring parking lot, no big deal for us, but just to draw an image of how busy they get.

We were told 45 minutes of waiting or we can eat at the bar, we opted to wait, and had drinks in the waiting area.  When we were seated (about 20 min), our waitress was polite and was eager to share what she liked on the menu.  My husband had a Reuben and I went for the prime rib (yummm) and were were happy with the service and price.

Some cons: The route to the bathroom is a bit intrusive in my opinion. You have to trek through the kitchen if you are seating on the left side of the dining room.  Also the table layout looks as though my 2 year old was in charge of that.  Usually larger booth tables are against the wall and then smaller tables, it was opposite of that.  

Some other points: It gets LOUD!  I was sitting next to my hubs and felt like I was screaming.

We won't be back for dinner unless we go with a large group but we might go for a lunch or mid day meal!

Stopped in after work for a beer and quick bite. This place has never really been exceptional but now it has really reached a new low. The food is ok but the part that really gets me is that it is a pig sty. Booths are filthy , seats full of old food, walls in the booths are dusty food splashed on them - no telling how long since they were washed. And then the flying critters - gnats, mosquito or something. And the service is a second thought and not very friendly , no personality. It could be so much better if any one who runs it had a clue. Felt like the inmates were running the asylum. Who's in charge ? Replace them

Tommy Nevins you have been on the radar for quite some time, and why it took as long to drop in is flat out cray.

A gaudy, large and loud looking establishment right off of the ever busy Rte 59 sits a fine little Irish pub. This fine little pub casts no judgment and is home to a full dining room, a bar and a back bar room where if you want to play darts like you're an international pro...key words to remember...there's no judging. 

I made the journey in on a weekend afternoon looking for something small for lunch and a drink. The more important piece was the drink, but food always is a friendly companion. Inside you are immediately greeted by the host (ess) and given the availability can choose on which side of the joint you want to dine and drink. For this visit, we sat in a big, dark booth that was comfortable and in perfect view of the many flat screens. Welcome to football season where golf and nascar get the big eff you.

The staff came round quickly to drop off the menus which are quite full and unexpected for such a place. Expect to find pub grub but also themed pub grub. Bangers and Mash...it's on the menu. Bread Pudding...on the menu. Others include large and filling sandwiches and a wide variety of salads.

Kind of glad it took ages to pop the Tommy Nevins cherry. When we came it was quiet, but there is definite potential that this would be a fun place to rock a beer or a jack d shot on a night out. Prices are reasonable but what sold me is the overall vibe inside.

Chilled to the max. Sit down, shut up and have a pint.

Went to Tommy Nevins last night with my boyfriend. It wasn't the first time I've been there and it defiantly won't be the last. I love the ambience of this place. It's a home away from home. I love the decor! Last night I got the Irish boxty which is to die for. The meat and vegetables are cooked wonderfully and there's a pancake what more could you want.  
We have been there plenty of times and have never had a problem with the service. Every server we have had is always really friendly. 
Since I have been there many times I do try to change what I get to keep it fresh. I have never been disappointed with my selections.  They do have pretty good drink specials durning the week, I lately have been getting the long islands they are really tasty!
I don't understand why some people are writing bad reviews on this place, it's a great place to come with a loved one or even a group of friends. 
I can't wait to go here again.

We stopped in for lunch on Sunday.  We had been wanting to try it for a while and finally got the chance only to conclude that we should not have wasted our money!
There were only like 3 groups of people in the restaurant when we arrived at prime lunchtime.  That should of been our clue to run for the hills!  You would have thought that the service would have been faster due to the lack of customers and more attentive, but it was like a ghost town in there!

We ordered the cheese balls which sounded like they should be delicious, but they were nasty and came with some unidentifiable dipping sauce....marinara? cocktail sauce? ketchup?  The balls were basically all cream cheese and lacked the other ingredients as stated in the menu description.  I ordered the corned beef and Swiss cheese on marble rye.  The bread was super greasy like it was sitting on the griddle in a  pile of grease.  The cheese was a giant glob on the sandwich and the corned beef was cold!  Not really sure how they heated my warm sandwich and the corned beef was neither shaved or thin as stated on the menu.  I also ordered the seasoned fries with my meal and they were soggy.  Some of the fries were hot and some were cold!  They were also kind of greasy and the seasoning was nasty!  It was like someone dropped a shaker full of seasoned salt on them.  The other sandwiches that my family had were just as bad....my husband had the steak sandwich which did not impress him as even being steak!  My son tried the American favorite macaroni and cheese.  Whatever the one cheese was in the dish had bite and had a strange aftertaste.....it also had a glob of melted cheese across the top of the dish!  Maybe if you are coming for traditional Irish beer and you are super intoxicated the food is worth the trip.  Otherwise the bar area and dining area were cool looking, but the food is terrible....don't let the cute exterior lure you in!

I wish I could give these guys more stars, but there were so many things wrong with our order and no attempt was made to compensate us.  The service at the Frankfort location is better, but this one is closer to my house so I come here more.

Brought my kids in for lunch on a weekend after soccer games.  The place was pretty empty, so we got seated right away.  Our waiter was a real nice guy. I always appreciate when a waiter is nice to my kids and won't show disdain for two young kids with Dad :)  The ordering process was fine, but when it came to get our appetizer, things went downhill.  I ordered the loaded potato soup, and the kids wanted the basket of chips.  The soup never came out and the chips ended up being a basket of french fries.

I ordered the french dip, and we had one order of mac and cheese and one hot dog.  Of course, order envy set in and the kid with the hot dog wanted the mac and cheese.  So I ordered a second mac and cheese, and waited.  And waited some more.  In fact, we waited about 20 minutes for the 2nd order of mac and cheese.  We did finally get it, but it was awfully long in coming out. 

I guess my frustration was that when the check came, there was a charge for the soup, along with charges for the 3 kids meals.  I mean, you'd think since I never got my soup I wouldn't be charged.  Even better, since I ended up having to order a 3rd kids meal, maybe they could have comped me for either missing the soup or for the wait on the 2nd order of mac and cheese.  I don't know, maybe I'm just being picky but I think it would have been a nice gesture on their part.  After all, what's an order of kids mac and cheese cost?  Maybe .50?  They charge $5 for it, so the margin is healthy.

I'm sure I'll be back as I like the food and the bar is fun, I just wish they could get the kitchen act together.

Just tried Tommy Nevins out for the first time.  Went on a Saturday with husband and 3 kids and the restaurant was dead.  However based on the availability of seats they tried cramming us into a table on top of another.  The server came to the table quickly however brought my husband the wrong beer.  The menu had a decent selection along with a Gluten free menu but the food was so bad.  My husband was the first to say how bad his food was and I quickly agreed along with the same from the kids.  We are not picky people and genuinely just enjoy not having to make dinner.  I actually thought the food was so bad I had to write a review.  We will not be back.

We sat at the bar, the wait staff and bartender were more concerned with speaking to each other than the guests. 

Cheese balls definitely had cream cheese, not enough of anything else. The corned beef on the Reuben was very good but all balled up in the center of the bread (not spread out evenly), the rye wasn't toasted enough either. I would have liked Dijon mustard with it but I didn't see the bartender again until I was done. Seasoned fries were soggy and not hot. 

Over all disappointing, we won't be back.

Well I think I was expecting more walking into this place. I had driven past it SOOO many times and always said WOW that is an awesome building design!

Finally tried them out on a Friday night last week a little after 6pm for dinner with the boyfriend. Not too bad on the wait I think it was about a 15-20 minute wait. Sat at the bar and had a drink while we waited. A LITTLE high on the drinks we had if you ask me but MAYBE that is Naperville? We got seated in a both against the wall which was a bit private. That was nice. I just had to have them wipe down the table though because it was a bit sticky. 

Looked at the menu to see what I could actually eat. Decided to have a burger with the peppered bacon (no bun) and a side Caesar salad. Not too bad. I actually liked it. Now not sure yet if I would take the drive back out again to try something else.

I think I was just too hung up on the layout and a bit too many loud kids that night. I think since the building is SO pretty I thought the inside would be just as nice but it was a typical restaurant/bar TO ME. 

Maybe I need to try them on a Saturday night when they have music. I hear they do. Do they??

CHEERS!!

lunchtime was a good time to visit. service was fast and friendly, the place was clean but we weren't impressed by the food. they had overcooked my husband's salmon  and my 'montie toastie' their version of the montie cristo was only good with the accompanying raspberry sauce. otherwise it tasted really sour. 

they own the nevin's brewing company down the street and their food is so much better.

We started with the Chicken Spring Rolls since they sounded unique.  Good fusion of flavors.  Nice flaky shell filled with grilled chicken complimented with tangy buffalo and blue cheese dipping sauces.  We would order this again.  For dinner, my husband had the Chicken Pot Pie which had a neat plate presentation with the puff pastry atop the chicken, veggies and creamy gravy.  I enjoyed the Pecan Crusted Tilapia with whipped sweet potatoes and asparagus.  Good portion size for the fish, cooked well.  I look forward to ordering this again.

The nachos made with potato chips with peas, carrots and beef were interesting... But that is the Irish for ya. 

Seems like a nice place, but I'm not really into the bar scene. I'd go again if asked.

Been going to Tommy Nevin's for several years but the past 3 months the food and the service has gone completely down hill. My food is never what I order or cooked to what I ask for. They're completely understaffed; last time I ate there (dec. 20) it took 4 of us an hour and a half to eat lunch at 2:00 in the afternoon! The drinks were wrong, the food orders were wrong and it took about 20 minutes to ask for our check and pay it. The server was busy running around with other tables so it was understandable but extremely frustrating. Probably wont be returning for the food anytime soon.

As a late night hang out for drinks and darts its a great place!

4 of us went for week-after-St. Patrick's Day dinner on 3/24/12.  

We ordered the $15.99 mixed platter of appetizer.  OK.  Not great.  The cheese balls were delicious.  The beef pieces were awful - too much garlic and tough.

I ordered corned beef and cabbage; husband ordered fish and chips; other lady ordered grilled chicken and rice; other man ordered the Irish sampler plate.

My corned beef and cabbage was TERRIBLE!  The meat was good.  However, the vegetables tasted like my husband's mother (terrible Irish cook) boiled them for 4 hours in about a tub of water.  There was no spice or salt added.  I didn't even eat the veggies.

My husband's fish and chips looked awful - fries were limp and cool.  Culver's serves much better fish and chips for 1/2 the cost!

The other lady in our group thought our waiter was surly.  When we were leaving we saw that EVERY OTHER TABLE HAD BREAD and we did not get any, despite spending about $100.00.  We didn't ask for it, but we should have gotten it.

Atmosphere is alcohol-centered, punky-yuppie sports bar with below average pub food.  It is about as Irish as McDonald's is Scottish.  Irish in name only.

DO NOT GO!

The noise level was VERY VERY LOUD.  This was at 5pm.  Wondered what it was like on St. Patrick's evening.

Sunday trivia night makes parking a huuuuuuuge pain but you can park at the strip mall across the street.

Their appetizers are  big enough to eat as an entree. Chicken quesadilla is a winner!

I am a HUGE advocate of comfort food, and this place really hits that sweet spot on cold winter Chicago nights, given you can make it there in one piece. I digress.

As Irish as this place seems, there are some food items that do not seem so Irish, such as BBQ Ribs and BLT Sandwiches. However, if you stick to the comfort food section of the menu, that is where you are going to find the most Irish-esque food. I recommend the Shepherd's Pie and the Bangers and Colcannon items. The Bangers and Colcannon consists of Irish sausages and colcannon potatoes, both of which are loaded with flavor. Honestly, the rest of the menu does not seem that Irish, but given I am not Irish, I may not be the best judge of authenticity at this establishment. REGARDLESS, the food they make here is awesome. 

It is a great place to chill. They have a pretty solid beer selection, and for those who need gluten-free food, they have a section in their menu that adheres to your needs. 

Overall not a bad place, but the place seems REALLY Irish without having a full-blown Irish food selection.

Been there 3 times before ok. But got groupon thought oh they are going to be real good. So wrong. 
1. Waited almost 15 minutes to be waited on. Place not busy. Many empty tables. Couple that came 10 minutes later got waited on before us. Got drinks and placed order. 
2. Almost 20 minutes later.. Spouse got salad no soup for me. Husband done with salad.   Waitress reminded of soup. Soup comes when other couple got food order after their salads. 
3 Husband liked burger. I got corn beef sandwich very dry, Pickle best of meal. 
4 Last straw /bill $2.60 had nothing smaller than $20. Waitress says do you want any change back? No I want to give you  almost a $20  tip. for lousy service.
Bottom line will never recommend or go there again. Almost 1hour  and a half wasted.

After driving past this place about a thousand times, I finally had the opportunity to eat here. This place is huge. It looks big from the outside, but even bigger in. The setting is very standard and very Americanized quasi Irish pub, hardly authentic.

For a place that advertises itself as an Irish pub, there are surprisingly few options for Irish fare. There were the standard bangers & mash and of course shepards pie, but it didn't go much farther. I did have a non-deep fried monte christo type sandwich which was amazing and the other girls seemed pretty happy with their choices as well. The seasoned fries weren't all that impressive. They were all short and a little over done. 

The server was nice, but extremely slow. We shared a few jokes about what she could be doing as she walked right past us without stopping but two or three times. The prices are ok, 7.99 for the sandwich and reasonable drink prices. It's a nice place to hang out, but for authentic Irish and good service, go elsewhere.

Solid all around just like the one in Evanston (which I grew up going to). Solid craft beer selection, could be bigger but not bad. Layout of the bar and restaurant is excellent so it's easy to get a decent table or spot in the bar without feeling crowded and the place does get packed on weekends so this is a good thing. They have a nice outdoor seating section too. They have a section where bands play but as I said it's big enough that you dont have to be drowned out in conversation by bad cover versions of songs you wish you never loved if you dont want to. I've only had the burgers which are very good as are the fries. I recommend the Irish Handcuffs which is a drink in each hand. After that all will be right with the world.

Standard Pub Food, Exceptional Execution

My wife and I had been here a few times before but had only ever stayed on the bar side. So beyond a few appetizers we hadn't really explored the menu. This time we went specifically for a nice, sit down dinner. We weren't disappointed.

STARTER: We started off with the "Warm Artisan Pretzels" which were done differently than we had expected. They weren't overly seasoned and they weren't at all salted. It was just good-tasting bread with beer cheese and spicy brown mustard dipping sauces.

MAIN COURSE: The presentation of the food is as enticing as the food is good.  You almost don't want to eat it at first, as you will destroy the layout.  My wife indulged in the "Guinness Beef Tips" which she really enjoyed.  I was waffling between a few items and finally settled on the "Mum's Best Toasty". The title says it all and the moniker "Grilled Cheese on Steroids" might not be as appetizing. Creamy guyere and parmesan cheeses oozed out from between thickly sliced sourdough bread not only toasted but with cheddar, gouda, and provolone cheeses baked into the outer faces. Tomato bisque was included for dipping and is definetly needed to break the sometimes overpowering flavor of the sandwich. The idea of grilled cheese and tomato soup has been done a hundred times before but not quite like this.

ATMOSPHERE: No matter how contrived the exterior looks, the interior is much more tastefully done. The layout is simple but effective and allows those not into watching sports and schmoozing with fellow patrons to enjoy a nice, peaceful meal.

SERVICE: Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and accomodating.  What more do you need to know?

Now that I know what I was missing with the dinner menu, rest assured that I won't miss it ever again.

I'm not sure what to think of this place.  Is it an upscale Irish Pub, a bar, a restaurant?  I'm not quite sure. If you want to see what is happening there, don't rely on their web site because they don't keep it updated and they don't put much on it in regard to events, specials and promotions.  Is it because they don't have them or just don't want to let you know about them?  It's just not my favorite place.

#1 This is NOT a real Irish pub. It's located in a faux-victorian strip mall in the far flung reaches of southwestern Naperville on Route 59. Sure they serve some drinks and stereotypically Irish/UK fare, but if it is authenticity you are after, do yourself a favor and get the heck off of Route 59!

#2 This place DOES have some great food. I'm a sucker for appetizers, and this place has a couple of delicious ones. We ordered the harp strings (beer battered onion rings, sliced into quarters so you get little inch-long fried onion goodness) and the cream cheese balls (cream cheese rolled into balls with bacon and scallions, and deep fried). If I wanted authentic Irish, I would have been pissed, but because I wanted good food regardless of where it came from, I was happy.

For dinner I had the very un-Irish BBQ Rib and Popcorn Shrimp platter. Delicious. The ribs were tasty, sweet, and fall-off-the-bone tender. The shrimp were nice and plump, and crunchy without being overly breaded.

My daughter (almost 3) had the chicken fingers and loved them (she's a very finicky eater), my wife had the fish and chips and enjoyed it, and my mom had some sort of corned beef and swiss sandwich I think. There were no complaints.

Desert was good, but seemed better on paper than in the execution. I had the Bailey's creme brulee, and my wife had the cookie sundae (which was big enough for about 4 people... seriously). Both were good, but not great. We attributed this to the fact that there was a little too much Bailey's going on in the sundae (could have benefited from a scoop or two of vanilla in addition to all the Bailey's ice cream), and the creme brulee as also lacking a little something. 

So there you have it. If  you've ever been to the Claim Jumper, it's a bit like that, but with an Irish theme instead of a western theme. Seeing as how this place is smack dab in between our house and my mom's house, we're probably going to be meeting here often... which won't be such a bad thing.
Eehhhhhh. Decent beer selection, my father loved his burger, but everything else was distinctly mediocre.

I can honestly say I've never had a bad time at Tommy Nevins. There extensive menu is one to see. They have your normal Irish/comfort food along with other unique sandwiches and appetizers.
 
    The BBQ Gouda melt is a must. Grilled chicken, melted Gouda cheese, BBQ sauce(fantastic) on a pretzel bun with your choice of Fries, Season fries, veggies, fruit, coleslaw,or baked beans. 
 My favorite appetizers would be the spring rolls, bruschetta, dublin publettes and the steak bites. I've yet to find a place that serves tiny pieces of steak, perfectly seasoned as an app. 

  The staff are amazing. The waitresses in the bar have kilt skirts with black socks and black shirts. Everyone matches and is in uniform. It is very easy to spot those working. The dining room side is an all black uniform. The bartenders are in all black as well. Very friendly staff. I noticed a lot of customers come back as often as I do. That must say something about the place.
  
   They also have a private room which they call the Library. The library is a great place to hold parties. (Birthdays, wedding showers or even business meetings)
   
   The patio is a great place to hang out during the summer.  One night out there is was a little cold but our waitress turned on their heaters and it was perfect. 
  
   I also noticed many golfers come over because it is right next to the Tamarack course. They hold a TOMMY NEVINS golf outing every year.
I have also participated in their bag tournaments ( held during the summer) 

   They have drink specials everyday. Also, they have food specials over the weekend. They are not your normal food specials. They really seem to take their time when choosing them. You can't go wrong with ordering a special.( They have great wines to pair with their meals as well) :)

   The parking lot is a little small but you can always find parking in the strip mall next door.

   One thing that really impressed me is that they have no problem calling a cab to take you home. I've seen people leave their cars in the lot and the bar tender called a cab company and they were safely brought home. 

   If you are looking for a place to have drinks, dinner, watch UFC, watch sports, make new friends or celebrate a birthday I definitely recommend Tommy Nevins.

Stopped on St. Patrick's Day during the evening and thought the experience was just average.  The restaurant side wasn't very busy while the bar side was crowded as expected.  Bar staff was very attentive and ambience was nice and comfortable around the entry way (leather chairs by the fire place).  I've had the fried egg burger on a prior visit and really enjoyed it, but this time my friends tried their wings with bbq sauce which they felt were the average run of the mill frozen wings covered and cooked in the sauce of choice.  I'd go back on certain occasions however parking is very limited directly around the building and most times you will park across the lot by other businesses.

Was there back in March 2014 (about my 50th time visiting since it opened)...took 20 minutes to be approached for our first drink.  One of the waitresses actually spent 90% of the time we were there sitting in a booth talking to her visiting friends (only occasionally coming out to clear a table of glasses).  The female bartenders seemed more interested in texting and/or talking with only one young male customer than even noticing the rest of us. I was so put off by the rude service that  I spoke with Mark the General Manager several days later (after leaving a voice mail about the horrible service).  He asked that I send him the pictures that I took showing the server in the booth visiting friends all night.  I sent them as requested, and he never ever bothered to call or write me back in spite of me asking several times if he received me correspondence.  The bottom line, when this place first opened it was fantastic...one of me and my friend;s favorite places to go.  It has gone completely downhill in service, and none of us ever want to go there anymore (and I haven't since). It is clear no one is at the helm or holding any workers accountable for anything.  You're MUCH better off skipping this place altogether for one of the more friendly restaurants/pubs nearby.  They don't appreciate your business here...and it's too bad.

My husband and I have a special place in our heart for this place.  We won't go all year, then we will go 2 weekends in a row during the Oscar movie fest at the AMC theater down the street.  We usually have about 3 hours to kill in the middle of each day of the movie fest (5 movies in one day is a little much so we skip the 3rd movie of each day).  Tommy Nevins is the perfect place to kill that time.  We usually get several drinks, appetizers,and a sandwich or burger to split. We get one of the cozy curtained booths near the back.  Once we let the sever know we are going to be there for awhile for several rounds of drinks and food, they relax and are attentive without being annoying.

This place has become part of our Oscar movie tradition and I think we'll back next year!

I wish I could give a 1/2 of a star. The only redeeming quality of the meal I had was the pickle. I have been to Tommy Nevin's before and really enjoyed it - Michelin rated it is not, but it's decent enough grub. 

Last night we were seated and it took the waiter at least 15 minutes to get our order for dinner. We had to ask for bread to be brought to our table. The waiter said "I need to put an order in." For bread. That's supposed to be brought to every table. 

The majority of the food was not great. The fries were cold. My cheeseburger which I asked to be prepared medium was so badly burnt and charred on the bottom it was inedible - I only ate the top of the burger . Politely told the server about the burnt food who said he'd remove it from the bill - apparently his version of removing from the bill was to discount the burger 50%. 

Every single table around us was complaining about their service and quality of their food. If this was my first time, I would never go back. I'll still probably never go back. Too bad, it's a great location, but there are too many other places to go.

This place is seriously the WORST. The service is terrible and we didn't get seen by a server till over 20 minutes after sitting down. To make matters worse, the server and the manager were both incredibly rude. The manager was so disrespectful I can hardly believe it. I am 24 and I look young. I have an out of state ID (I was home in IL visiting my folks).The blonde haired manager condescendingly told  to me I had a fake ID and that he was kind enough to return it to me though if I went anywhere else in Naperville it would surely be taken. I tried offering my 3 credit cards, my military ID, my graduate school ID and my insurance ID but he was too cool to listen. He told me "It doesn't matter, I will never serve you a drink here". I was too upset at this point to argue with his attitude. I almost gave him a piece of my mind about blindly accusing people. He wasn't even willing to listen to me! However, I got up and left and will take my business elsewhere. I would do yourself a favor and avoid this place. Bad service and bad management.

I've been here twice, overall I think it's pretty good. Both times I've gotten pretzels as an appetizer, they're served with 2 dipping sauces (cheese sauce and whiskey mustard) but the pretzels are small, there's only 3, so that could be a problem if you're with 4 people, haha. I've ordered a burger both times too, apparently they've won lots of awards for their burgers, I think they're really good but not "Chicago's Best Burger". The French fries are really good, but you don't get a lot.

The service was absolutely horrible.. I wish I wouldve read the reviews on YELP before I went to this location.  Thank god we had a Groupon!  I think the server asked if we needed a box 8x, never asked how the meal was or if we needed refills, etc.  She was very short and seemed highly annoyed from the second she got to the table (which was after we were sitting there for about 5 minutes)  When I ordered another beer she responded "ok, do you need a box too?"  HORRIBLE!!!  The food was good.... I just couldnt get over the service.  The bathroom "lobby" is rather tiny and the vodka/lemonade tasted more like vodka/tonic.  I dont think I will be returning.

This used to be one of the "go to" places for my family and me, but every time we go back, they seem to take the best things off of their menu. We just got home from there and will not be going back ever again. The fresh baked bread was cold. The olives in the martinis were old and tasteless. The pot pie was salty, watery and the chicken was over cooked. The mac n cheese was gritty and way over priced and the wedge salad was as pricey as a meal. The fish and chips portions have shrunk by half the portion size as in the past and is of far lesser quality then they used to serve. The two best items I used to order (like the fried chicken and the bangers and mash) are no longer available. 

The service was incredibly subpar due to the fact that we started out with one waitress and then had a new one all of a sudden that had no clue what we ordered from the first waitress.

It is very sad to say, but my family will no longer be returning to this place that seems to only want to cater to the drunken beer crowd than make good food.

We ate there the other day, and were disappointed. They changed their menu, and If I had known how many items they deleted, I would not have bothered. They were not a bargain to begin with, and now, you might as well go to some fast food place, and get filled up for your money. The food is nothing to write home about, and the portions are skimpy. It seems that they opened another restaurant down the street and are abandoning this one. I haven't heard anything good about the new place either, and will not be dining at either establishment!

Went out for Sunday lunch and sat in the bar.  Very clean, great service, and great food for a great price.  I am definitely a fan and will definitely come back.  I had the french onion soup and a chicken sandwich that had a spinach artichoke dip on the sandwich and it was awesome!  I highly recommend this place.
Empty on a Friday night... and still had trouble getting a drink at the bar.

Been here a bunch of times, and for some reason the place just seems to be too "manufactured".  Nothing is really wrong here, but it is like the Irish pub with no feeling to it.  No Craic.  Draft beer selection is OK, food is OK, service is OK, but more often that not, I'm settling to go here.  A little pricier than it should be if you ask me.

Let me start by saying my girlfriend is obsessed with Mexican food, we try and find new places on a weekly basis. Volar was very satisfying. 

Margaritas were phenomenal, food was acceptable, and the atmosphere was on point. The tacos were good but nothing special. The service was acceptable. The chorizo stuffed jalapeos were amazing and enough to make me come back. 

Check this place out if you are in the Plainfield area.

Overpriced pretty food. The salsa was excellent but that's about it. El Pastor terrible and tasteless. Chips were stale. Everything looked good until we took a bite. 
The margarita was ok then the second one came and it was basically kool aid.
Prices are double food should at least be good. Go to El Habenero on essington. Margaritas are not the best but the food is "the best" especially the El Pastor tacos.

I wanted this restaurant to be so much better than it was. It started out great...

We had a 7pm reservation for 6. We were sat promptly outside on a prefect evening. It was not crowded or too noisy. 

It took about 25 minutes to get the first round of great margaritas.  They were worth the wait!

Fast forward to 8:45. We are finally eating our food. Thank goodness they didn't bring out the tortillas for the fajitas because there was no place to put them. The table was still filled with empty chip basked and unfilled glasses. 

The best looking dish on the table was the red snapper, which takes 45 minutes to cook. (They won't tell you this, so I'm offering it up.)  At least I believe it was the best looking. It was hard to tell because they failed to replace some burned out lights, so you couldn't see anything.  My now over cooked steak would have been much better had I been given a steak knife. I didn't dare ask. It wouldn't have showed up anyway. 

This place has potential. They just need better service.

My brother recommended me this restaurant I decided to come with my family. we ask our server jose for a suggestion definitely he was right! the guacamole, queso fundido volar, queso dip, pulpo ala parrilla, parrillada, carnitas, bistec ranchero and chiles rellenos. for drinks we tried the cantaritos and margaritas. food and drinks were delicious. great job Jose! we definitely be back!

Patricia, our waitress, was amazing! Food was good also. However, the bartender decided to charge $80 for 2 pitchers of Sangria. When the bill came, we were unpleasantly surprised. So, if you decide to dine here, ask how much things cost before you have to go to the bank and take out a loan.

I personally am not big into Mexican food. I have only had a few things i really enjoy. However, my boyfriend is. So I picked this restaurant due to curiosity. I started the meal by ordering an horchata colada. I love horchata. But this drink..not too much. We ordered the queso dip (a thicker melted cheese) with chorizo. It was very good. And for our entree we went with the carne asada. The meat was cooked perfectly! And I am particularly picky when it comes to how my meat is cooked. They give you rice, beans, tortillas, peppers, lettuce, guac., and a cooked whole green onion on top of skirt steak. Overall the food was delicious!! I finally have a Mexican dish I really enjoy. The only negative thing I have to say was that I wished our server was a little bit more speedy with getting drink replenishments and our check. But I won't take a star away for that because that's why you decided what percent you should tip. The food being ready was perfect timing.  Definitely give this place a try!

I love all of the food I have eaten here. The spicy pickled veggies you get at the table are delish! I am also happy to see they have a peach margarita, because not many Mexican places do, and it's my favorite. I usually order the carne asada because it is reliably tasty every time. This place is not usually very busy, so try it out next time you are looking to eat in downtown Plainfield. One negative, although it's pretty minor-- I found the outdoor seating to be very uncomfortable for some reason, so if this would be an issue for you, sit inside!

Great atmosphere though the lighting was almost too low. Joanne was our server. She was friendly and helpful and made me a terrific margarita (Regina). I had the carnitas, absolutely delicious, tender and perfectly seasoned. The salsa and warm tortilla chips were excellent as well. Prices were reasonable for quality, expect to spend $18 per meal, not including drinks. I will definitely return, as soon as I find someone to try the grilled octopus appetizer with me!

Overpriced mediocre food.  The Salsa was good but everything else wasn't.  The rice and beans tasted like reheated leftovers, definitely not fresh and it was over salted.  The fish tacos   were almost 'okay' but the fish portion is very small.  I left almost everything on my plate.  You get better value and better tasting, fresh food at Burrito Parrilla Mexicana in Naperville.
My husband and I tried it for the first time, and we had a great experience. Their margaritas are delicious. As was the food! Will definitely be back.
Awesome margaritas to share ... Great service .... Very romantic atmosphere .  Our food came out very quickly and was great!  Will be back !

Volar is one of our favorite spots in Plainfield! We frequent it regularly. The food is fantastic and beats any "traditional" Mexican places around. The moment you taste the chips and salsa you sense the meticulous care the chef puts into everything. The salsa is made on site by roasting the various vegetables and blending them together. The flavor that creates is out of this world or maybe from Mexico ;) They are always so nice to give use some salsa to take home! 

We love the portions and not so big that you'll need to take bags home. The tamales are my favorite and have the perfect masa harina to meat ratio. So many place dry them out while Volar keeps them moist and flavorful. You must try the mole' even if you dislike. Theirs is very approachable and is so smooth you'll want to dip everything into it. Other great dishes are the Carnitas, empanadas, fluatas and tacos. I wish they had lenga tacos ... they would nail them if they did. 

The staff always has a warm welcome and take pride in what they do. The restaurant itself is pretty large and the wait, if there is one, is minimal, so go today or this weekend and enjoy so great Mexican fair. In the summer they have a patio soooo margaritas in the sun! Keep it up Volar!

Let me start by first saying the food was good, but dang it was expensive. My husband ordered the enchiladas and they were $14, I got the appetizer chicken quesadila for $10 and shared that and a "side" of rice with my daughter for $4. Yes, a side of rice for $4 and honestly it was no more than the size of a deck of cards in a small dish. We also ordered the queso dip which was tasty, but in no way worth the $8 price tag (maybe worth $5). We also ordered a margarita and one beer and our total was $60. I had looked up their menu online before we went and there were no prices, I should have known.

Don't get me wrong, I am all for paying for good food and good service, but I can go up 59 to Burrito and get more food for half the price. And, I think Burrito has better food.  

We won't be going back.
The margaritas are probably the best I've ever had, especially the organic strawberry one. The food is always great. Definitely my favorite Mexican place around!

Wow, ordered a $15 burrito that was DISGUSTING and not edible. I'm not a picky eater and I could only swallow one bite. I even told my waitress that I couldn't eat the meal and she just said sorry and never offered to replace the burrito. My dining companions ordered a mojito that was cloyingly sweet and their meats were incredibly salty. 

I run a large food instagram account with over 600k followers and I would have been happy to take a picture of my meal and share my comments like I do with so many other restaurants, but instead I came home hungry and upset about paying $15 for nothing. 

Honestly, this is terrible customer service and they lost my business for that $15 burrito.

Came in last night again. Another good experience. The enchiladas really are very good and I love the refried beans and rice they come with. I think it seems like the salsa has changed a little but I really liked it. We did not get the pickled vegetables on our table so I don't know if they're still doing that. We went right at 5 and were the only table in there but by the time we left it was filling up a bit.

We have been here twice. The first time was okay, not great just okay. The second time we came was during a car show in the summer. We brought a group to get drinks and some appetizers. I went in and told the hostess we would like a table outside, and was told those were first come first serve. So some of our party went outside to wait and I went to the bar to order drinks, I waited over 25 minutes for the drinks because they didn't have enough glasses and kept having to wash them as they came back from other tables in order to complete our order. We didn't complain, waited patiently and paid close to $70 for just drinks. The rest of our party had waited for an outside table, and we finally were able to sit down with our drinks and discuss getting some food. 5 minutes later, a  hostess or manager comes over to ask us to leave because another party complained that we had a table with just drinks and they (the other customers) didn't think we were waiting as long as they were! ARE YOU KIDDING ME??? WHAT KIND OF HOSTESS/MANAGER ARE YOU??? WHY ARE YOU EVEN BOTHERING US WITH SOME OTHER PERSON'S DRIVEL? 

I explained that the hostess had told us these tables were first come, first serve AND that we had waited over 25 minutes for the table. She said the girl had made a mistake. You know what? You needed to handle that with her for the next time, NOT ask us to leave after spending $70 for mediocre drinks. We will never, ever, ever, be back.

Great experience!  We had Alfonso as our server and he was excellent. Servers were attentive and service was quick!
We had the empanadas for an appetizer and they were so good! The complimentary soup is really good and unfortunately I ate it all and didn't leave enough for room for dinner.
My husband had the skirt steak medium rare and said it was extremely tender. 

We will be back! Give it a shot!

Got there just before 7 tonight (Friday) and no one else was in there.  We decided to go in anyway.  I have bought better, fresher chips from jewel, and the enchiladas were terrible.  Nothing tasted fresh except the salsa (which was good).  My husbands steak was ok.  The only bright side was our waitress.  She was very sweet.  We won't be back.  It is overpriced and you can go almost anywhere else and get better food probably for a cheaper price.

Was not highly impressed. Food was dry so when I asked for a side of sour cream was charged $1.50. It was dark and loud but no one was in there.... Waiter seemed to be very confused. (First day?) but wasn't being monitored by anyone. Had a bite of someone else's food and theirs was just okay too. Hopefully they've improved in the last couple of months, I would like to try it again

Food was good,  but not outstanding.  For the price, the food should be outstanding. 

Many of the previous yelpers complained about the service,  4.5 stars for service,  once you get seated.

Drinks are expensive,  but are huge, still the size doesnt mean they are worth the price, just more ice.

Parking on a weekend night is an issue.

A party of 6 or more can make reservations,  Still you may need to wait.

If you come later, like 8/830 you'll likely get seated quickly.

My friends and I all live in town, and our husbands/boyfriends are all firefighters with busy schedules. It's hard to find a day when we all have off from work. The one day we could find, we decided to try out this restaurant in town.

The food was pretty good, but it took a half hour to get our drinks and to even get our orders taken. Mind you, the place was not that busy; many other restaurants on Lockport were much busier. After we ordered our food, it took roughly 45-50 minutes for it to arrive. When it came, the waiter handed my friend's husband a scorching hot plate without warning and burned his hand. 

At this point, we had been at the restaurant for almost 2 hours and just wanted our bills so we could leave. Waiting for the bills was another fifteen minutes, and even getting our bills paid took long.

I'm very disappointed that we wasted our one night all off together at this restaurant when we could've gone down the block for the same, if not better food and much better service.
Great place! Went there last week and loved it. Food is delish...and salsa is the best I have had.  Waitress was so friendly.

Volar has to be the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. They have the best homemade tamales, better than the ones you get down in the city in Pilsen. They don't have a ton of the massa on them, which to me is a waste. They were so good we ordered a 2nd round of them. The carne asada and the steak in the tacos were both so tender and flavorful. Again, nothing like I've ever tasted before down in the city even at the most authentic Mexican places. We had about 3 helpings of their homemade salsa. The chips were fresh. The guacamole was outstanding. Everything we ordered we pretty much licked the plates clean. We had a few margaritas. Each one you could taste the flavor and feel the alcohol in them. I can not wait to go back. I live in the city and its worth the drive every time.
Magnifico! In Plainfield - it's about time! Caritas were perfect, Tres leches cake was amazing! Service impeccable!

There is a ritual all Californians who move to Illinois do... We are always on the hunt for good authentic Mexican food. Volar is a new restaurant offering "Authentic Mexican" food. They are in the  "soft open" phase. The good news is there were lots of people  trying the new eatery. It's a tough market in the downtown Plainfield area,  so it's nice to see the response...I never got the chance to review the seafood place the building housed a few months ago! 
Great overall experience. They have done a nice job of remodeling. Exceptional  service, We never had a water glass get more than a few sips out of it and it was refilled. The chips were served warm and had lots of good corn flavor, the salsa was good and had just enough heat for Illinoisans! We "Calie Girls" prefer it a bit hotter! They had a nice selection of Margaritas... We tried a few...and then  a few more!
The food is good, the refried beans are made in-house and delicious!  There were a few food issues that I'm chalking up to being new, such as the enchiladas, although delicious, they either had too much or not enough sauce. The overall food quality and taste was good with generous portions. During our meal they gave us complimentary items to try, some chicken soup that had great flavor,  a Chile Relleno that had good flavor and consistency, but was a bit oily, and dessert, a cheesecake that was yummy with perfect texture. I'm cheering for them to succeed! I'm going back, I think they have the chance to get the 5th star on my next visit.

LUNCH 89.00 including 20% tip.  What?!
Breakdown:
3 women
2 Medium (24oz) frozen Margaritas @ 19.00 each!! Expected them to be AMAZING at that        price. Tasted mostly of sour mix and were not blended very well.  If there was alcohol in them, you could have fooled us.  
1 Iced Tea
1 tiny bowl of plastic looking (and tasting) queso
2 burritos (two of us shared)  

The food was average. Definitely not worth the price tag.  
Left with the feeling that we had just been robbed.  So disappointed.

Went to this place last night for the first time. Atmosphere was very nice. The wait staff seemed enthusiastic and eager to wait on us. They were very attentive throughout our meal. 

The margarita I ordered I had to send back as it was very bland and tasted like just a mix. After they added a shot of grand mariner, it looked like a margarita and tasted like one. And my husband had 2 Modelo beers. 

The waiter brought us some complimentary Mexican vegetable and rice soup which was the best I've ever had.

We ordered the 3 homemade tamales for an appetizer which were bland and lacked seasoning. However the mole sauce was delish!

Our entries were the steak fajitas and the shrimp with Diablo sauce. Both of which were very good. 

That being said and all we had to eat and drink, the bill was $100. 

All in all this is definitely far more expensive than the food and drinks we had. We will NOT back.
Overpriced. Poor service. They brought us the wrong food. Forgot that we ordered more drinks.
The steak fajitas were excellent! Ice cream  dessert was also fantastic, a little pricey but good restaurant.

My dad and I decided to try them out because we were craving Mex for lunch and we were not disappointed! We also wanted a nice patio to sit on and enjoy the day.

The chips, salsa, and queso were all great! We split the burrito suizo which was also awesome, especially with steak. Very flavorful! 

I had a fantastic tasting strawberry-banana margarita that also looked great. For that day it was the special for $5 too! Can't beat that for the quality is was.

The best part was our waitress Jenny! She was so awesome! She always checked to make sure we were okay and was very friendly. I hope she's there when we return.

I'd highly recommend eating here! :)

We visited this restaurant for the first time late on Mother's Day. It was pretty busy but the place was clean & the service was great. We had to wait about 10 minutes for our reservation but the hostess apologized at least twice & kept checking on us during our wait. Everyone in our group loved the food they ordered & we had a complimentary dessert of dulce de leche cake with chocolate drizzled cinnamon chips. I ordered the chimichonga suiza & it was really delicious! The portions are very generous too. The chips & salsa were AMAZING! The drinks didn't seem to have much alcohol in them. My husband had a "medium" margarita that was HUGE, I think it was $16. I had the much smaller $5 special mango margarita, it was just ok. All in all, it was a good experience & we will definitely return for the food!

Feels like vacation over here! great salsa and an assortment of fun drinks. Ask for Eric as your server. Free chips n salsa, spiced carrots and sopapillas(dessert)! All food made in house. Rec the chorizo empanadas!

Food is great, service is slow, they do make food to order.

So if your going with a big group make sure you bring your tablet for the kids to keep them occupied.

EXCELLENT, fresh food!  Front Street was always our go to for Chimichangas. Not anymore!! The food was great, the prices were awesome and our server Alfonso was helpful, knowledgable, and spot on!!
I can't say enough good things about Volar!!

Dinner was fantastic!  This is a new restaurant in a building that has been cursed since Lombardo's pizza closed.  I had the Carne Asada and it was perfectly cooked.  The accompaniments were delicious as well - especially the green beans and cactus.  Amazing flavor!  My son loved his steak tacos, and the fresh chips were perfectly salted.  The complimentary dessert was most welcome, although I was stuffed.  

Drinks were fantastic - the Poloma could be my new favorite drink, with white tequila, lemon, lime, and sparkling water.  The frozen margarita was pricey at $16 (medium, just under a double margarita), but it was tasty.

It's obvious the owners and chef take pride in the food - thoughtful touches and great presentation.  It might be a little expensive for family diners, but they have other equally tasty options in the area.   

We sat outside, and it was well appointed.  The live palms are a nice touch..  The front steps could use some lighting, for safety and ambience.   if there were outdoor heaters, a MUST in the midwest in my opinion, I would have given it a "6"!  

Hostess, server and busser were all very attentive.  The decor inside is tasteful, sophisticated but playful.  Lighting is great.  I can't comment on the noise or temp, as we ate outside, but it seemed comfortable.  

My final assessment was in the restroom.  Yes, I am one of those people who judge the "cleanliness" of the restaurant (and in theory, the kitchen) by the care taken in the bathroom.  A+!

Food was great, just had an issue with my change. I was suppose to get $11.08. I got back $11, asked for the rest and was told I got it all back. Lucky I gave a $3 tip on a $48 bill. Never has happened to me before ANYWHERE else. NEVER going back!!!

We waited about 15 minutes to be seated only to have to wait 15 minutes more before someone noticed that we weren't being taken care of. Once a server was assigned, we found her to be fantastic!
We ordered the grilled squid appetizer which was pricey but good. 
The drinks were good but way over priced for what you got. 
For dinner my husband got chili rellenos (his favorite) and asked for them to add beef. They came with the beef added but very little cheese. He was disappointed. 
I ordered enchiladas with mole sauce (my favorite) and was shocked at the very tiny "enchiladas" made with small corn tortillas. You get 3 in all and each one was about 3 bites and barely any sauce along with 1/2 T of sour cream. For the price we paid I was expecting something of higher quality and taste. I wouldn't mind the smaller portion if each bite were amazing. 
The chips and salsa were really good though. And the surprise dessert was a nice treat. 
Not sure we will return. We were hoping for much better.

Food was really good.  I had steak tacos and my hub had a ground beef burrito.  The appetizer queso fundido a volar was a joke.  A bowl of melted cheese with some weird meat on top.  I think it was supposed to be chorizo.  Had the five dollar special margarita. Not sure it had alcohol in it.  If it did then well made,  it tasted great.  If not,  that explains why I didn't feel even a little buzzed.  Service was pretty slow.  No refills.  Some owner looking lady asked me if I was done with my drink.  When I said yes she took the glass and left without asking if I wanted another.  Ummm ok.  I over heard her say "well it's 9 o'clock" when a bus boy asked her something while he had a handful of glasses.  Felt like it was time to leave.  We clearly weren't getting anymore drinks.  Not sure I'll go back.  Kind of expensive and plenty other great options in the area.

I stopped in last nite and really liked this place!

The food was really tasty, and my Carne Asada cooked exactly as I requested.  It came with potatos, rice, vegetable which were all seasoned nicely.

The bartender was very friendly and efficient.  I enjoyed her Margarita, frozen Raspberry flavor.

The complimentary dessert was a good touch, fried tortilla strips with cinnamon and whip cream.

There are very few times I can say that I walked out of a very busy, "just opened" restaurant and had a PERFECT experience, but this was certainly one of them. They did a wonderful job with the decor, both inside and out. I was scared to see if we would be paying them for that in the prices, but was surprised to see they are pretty reasonably priced, although I will only be enjoying one of there delicious margaritas on nights when it's the special.. 

 The chips were the best I've probably ever had at a Mexican restaurant. They were warm and crisp and perfectly salted, served with fresh salsa and spicy vegetable salsa- both wonderful. Our entrees were even better. The meat was very tender. Our service was very impressive. It was truly a team effort. I don't know if it was just because it was Cinco de Mayo, or if we will be getting that much attention regularly, but let's just say my water was always full and the salsa and chips kept coming.

 I really hope this one makes it. I can't wait for it to me my summer spot on the patio with hopefully lots of margarita happy hours to come!

Not a great experience. 
Food was OK. Full of oil.
Bathrooms were filthy. 
Servers will only smile if you order drinks.
Ordered fajitas which came with just 2 tortillas. You feel like begging for food.
The food here is fabulous! Best chips & salsa I've ever had, great margaritas too! Very nice decor inside, very welcoming! Go check it out!!!!
Have been here now a few times and still love the food, drinks and atmosphere. Great place to watch the Blackhawks! Any of the specialty margaritas are always a great choice!
Amazing salsas and pickled vegetables! Wonderful atmosphere and always great food and drinks! Try the carne asada it's truly mouth watering!

I really can't rate this. Very disappointed.  Was seated in a corner. No one came to our table to give us chips or salsa. As we waited a big group was seated who were given water chips and salsa right away.  Then the hostess asked if our server came yet. We said no waited another 10 min and walked out. Unbelievable poor service.

I will start out with the service was great. However I do not agree with the other reviewers saying the food was great. The salsa had a weird consistency. I ordered fish tacos which were pricier than nearby competitors. I asked for them to be spicy, given the salsa not living up to usual standards. When they came out, I was highly disappointed. Not only was there no seasoning whatsoever, but I could definitely tell they were not fresh. They tasted watery like they had been thawed too long and almost going bad. The margaritas were pure mix, no tequila. I will definitely not be returning.

My husband and I visited Volar during cruise night. The patio was very busy so we opted to sit inside. It is spacious and plenty of seating without feeling squished. Our server was very nice, our order was taken quickly and our food came within a good amount of time. I didn't feel rushed at all. the quality of the food was top notch! Out of all the Mexican restaurants in the area it was the best we have eaten yet. I would absolutely return. The only negative thing I have to say is the prices are a little high. I would expect them to be slightly lower. But we enjoyed it so much that we will be returning again.

Food was ok, nothing to write home about. Waiter was pleasant and attentive. At the end of the meal I told the manager that the water tasted bad like it came out of the water hose. She said it comes out of the hose squirter from the bar and she was kind of like "oh well". The margarita tastes like it came from a bottle mix rather than made from scratch. My husband though loved the hot carrots and salsa, those were good! Kind of up in the air if I'm going back.
Food was good but salty. Pricey but quality was acceptable. Service was friendly and fast.

Went early on a Friday night. Was seated immediately. Wait staff was very attentive. Menu is not what I would describe as "authentic" Mexican, but I was in the mood for anything. Started out with ceviche as an appetizer. It was very tasty, but was served in a tortilla-like shell that was difficult to serve from. I ordered a burrito suizo and my fiancee ordered chicken enchiladas. The waiter got her order mixed up, She received the enchiladas rojas instead (supposed to be a "special" red sauce). Neither one of us was impressed with the food. Her strawberry margarita was also only ordinary. Unless I hear that things have changed, I'll stick with Front Street Cantina in Plainfield.
We thought we would give it a second try, since our first was shortly after they opened. The food brought us back, which was good on both visits, but the service was so slow again.
Overpriced poorly-seasoned "authentic Mexican" food and terrible service. Margaritas tasted like they were dumped from a can. Would not recommend.

Tried Volar for dinner with wifey and the little one.

Atmosphere:  Really nice.  This place has seen several restaurants and I'm glad someone finally made it look like an actual restaurant as opposed to someone's house.  Diego Rivera artwork is a bit cliche, but whatevs.  At least there wasn't the one where the Aztec warrior is holding his fallen lady friend while kneeling.

Service:  Average, although I wasn't expecting anything too stellar with them only being open for just over a week.  Staff is friendly and professional.  Our food did take a touch longer than I would have liked, especially since they weren't too busy.

Food quality:  Standard comp. chips with salsa.  They were ok.  I won't claim some were stale, but let's just say some were crispier than others.

Drinks were ok.  I had a classic lime margarita on the rocks and wifey had a pina colada.  I'm not sure if the mix was house made or from a bottle.  With this type of supposed higher-end gourmet Mexican restaurant, you do expect the drinks to be kick-ass!  There was no drink menu, which I guess is ok, but it's nice to give the customer something to go off of.  Even if certain types of tequila upgrades were mentioned, that would have been a step in the right direction.  Their base tequila is Cabo Wabo.  I upgraded to Don Julio, which did enhance the drink somewhat.  Pina colada was ok too.  A bit creamer and more coconuty, which we like.

The soup, "sopa de fideo," was tasty. Wifey ordered the tampiquena/carne asada which came with rice, beans and guacamole.  I had the taco trio which also came with rice and beans.  Little one ordered chicken fingers.  Carne asada on its own was above average.  Well cooked and seasoned.  As far as caliber, it reminded me of Lalo's.  Another good comparison would be La Quebrada or even Don Rafa's.  My tacos were good too, slightly above average.  I liked that I could mix/match my trio, so I ordered 1 "Al Pastor" and 2 carne asada.  Again, from a quality perspective, think of the aforementioned places....even think of burrito parrila in Plainfield, just to give you a local comparison.  Same type of quality and delivery.  

It's kind of a shame, because when I think of super gourmet, over the top tacos, there's a few things that has to make them special.  Every bit of that taco needs to be outstanding.  It all starts with the meat, which here was above average.  That's where it ended though.  Tortillas were standard corn that you can get at Meijer and the only other toppings were onion and cilantro.  Some of the best gourmet tacos I've had (think Bien Trucha, Barbakoa, XOCO, Frontera Grill, etc.) take it to a whole other level with unique sauces, cheeses, meat blends, homemade tortillas, or other unique toppings like a special fruit or slaw.  

The sides were below average.  Rice was meh and the beans did not seem fresh.  They were either made from scratch a while ago and left to sit or from a can.  Not sure, but they seemed pretty dry/sad.  Again, so much opportunity with making unique sides.  We didn't order a dessert off the menu, so I can't comment on that.  Chicken fingers were ok. 

Value:  This really is the main reason why my review is on the lower side.  I keep calling Volar "gourmet" and my expectations are such, because that's how they're priced.  For the type of quality that they put out, it's over-priced.  There's nothing wrong with charging as much as they do, but when you charge $3-$4 for a taco, you better bring it!  Same thing with the tampiquena.  That entree was over $16, which again, not ridiculous if it's delish overall, but I can get the same thing at those other places for significantly less.  Honestly, if they want to last more than a year, prices have to go down and their identity as a standard, fairly good Mexican restaurant will be valid; or they have to REALLY step up the quality, variety and delivery of their food.  We only had 2 dishes, so I want to be fair, but I really doubt that the other items are on that higher-end gourmet level and our two choices were the exception.

Miscellaneous:  I always appreciate places that can pull off quality and be kid-friendly.  Aside from the chicken fingers, they had quesadillas.  A couple more kid options would be nice.  
The owners appear to be the same that own Capri (also in downtown Plainfield).  Not saying that's that good or bad, but just an fyi.
