Recap:  We're celebrating 10 years this month as being Plainfield residents and we want nothing more than success for the businesses that open up, especially restaurants and especially downtown.  Unfortunately, Volar just missed the mark with a big disconnect between what they charge and the quality of the food/drinks (I didn't mention earlier that they have a 24 oz margarita for $18.  This is the bigger version of what I ordered and again, definitely not worth that price.).  We'll see what the future holds for them and if they evolve.  I hope so, but we probably won't return.
The food is good, the restaurant is very comforting, the service is awesome , I will definitely be coming back

I really feel bad about giving only 2 stars because the food WAS good and I want to support my downtown Plainfield businesses, but the poor service is inexcusable.

Me and my friend decided to check this place out yesterday. After reading the yelp reviews, we were a little bit skeptical based on other's comments on the poor service, because my friend did have some place to be later--but we decided to give it a shot anyway.

We were greeted by the host who asked us if we wanted to sit outside or inside. We saw outside had a few empty tables so we thought we would be seated right away. Nope, the hostess told us it would be 5-10 minutes before our table was ready. I thought that was a bit odd as we waited outside with literally 3-4 empty tables staring us in the face. Kind of annoying, but whatever.

Once we were finally seated, it took quite a bit before someone came up to us and took our drink orders. It took even longer for him to come back with our drink orders and our chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were very good. The chips nice and salty and the salsa was unique..not sure how to describe it. We then ordered the empanadas for an appetizer (2 of each), the cheese and pepper tamales, and the enchilada dinner (red and white sauce). Side note: the enchiladas dinner and the enchiladas rojas were both 14 dollars even though the dinner comes with 1 more enchilada? I was confused about that.

The time it took for them to bring out the empanadas seemed like forever. Both types were tasty. They come with sour cream and guac which was nice. We devoured them quickly and were ready for our entrees. 

It took what seemed like forever for our entrees to come out. We kept seeing food being brought out thinking "this HAS to be ours" but we were disappointed when they took it to a different table. I didn't keep track of time but it must have been over 30 minutes. I understand that you might be busy, but at least have your staff communicate to the tables that the kitchen is backed up or something. Hire more people in the kitchen, or more servers. This was unacceptable and really kind of ruined the mood as my friend knew she needed to leave at a certain time. 

By the time our food came we had to ask for the check and boxes right away because we didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for that. I must say the food was very good, but I had to scarf it all down within 5 minutes so I really didn't get to enjoy it. My favorite was the enchiladas verdes. My friends tamales were also very good. Surprisingly, the rice and beans served with it were also pretty good--and I don't usually like refried beans.

I would be open to giving Volar another chance because I know that they are still new and working out the kinks. Hopefully, they figure out their issues because I do see potential in this restaurant and I would hate to lose another downtown Plainfield business.
Slow service for overpriced mediocre mexican food. It has a high end pretentious feel that is embattled by its marginalized food and options. So expensive for what is being presented.

Excellent soup, fantastic pickled vegetable medley and the best salsa in town. Not a traditional tomato based salsa-unique in the area. Chips are made on site- fresh. Entrees good I liked the homemade tamales served with a couple of sauces. The staff is friendly, service is quick. Would recommend Volar to anyone in the area. Good prices- comparable for the area. Go- you'll be glad you did.

Went there Saturday night.   Great food and good srvice.  Hopefully this one can make it.  There was only one other couple in there at that time.   It was on the early side though.   The el pastor chimichanga was delicious.

Delicious.  Picky about Mexican Food and we were impressed by the food and decor.  We ordered medium margaritas and that may have been a mistake.  They are gigantic.  Wished i had brought my snorkel.  I suggest that you order sides of pico de gallo as it's very flavorful.  Tacos were beast and fish tacos were tender and fresh.  Salsa was a roasted masterpiece.    Dare to eat the carrot/cauliflower accent as it is delicate and spicy all at once.   So loving our home town right now.

Food was ok. Ordered appetizers of potato empanadas, steak quesadillas, queso fundido. Food didn't have a lot of flavor. Beers are bottle only which is fine by me but may matter to someone else. The complimentary flan was frozen. Cold in the center. I expected fresh. The decor was updated and nice. The service was attentive and nice. Been open 3 weeks so let's see what happens.

We went there with high hopes as we have heard several good reviews.  Lets start with the drinks.  My beer was served to me warm and the margarita my wife ordered was basically crushed ice with tequila and salt.  Moving on to the service. We asked to sit outside and there were 3 open tables, but they tried to shove us in the corner next to a blaring speaker and a bus boy table.  After moving tables, we waited for 12 minutes before anyone even came to the table to take our drink order.  We had to ask the manager 2 separate times for the waitress to come take our order, and we ended up placing the order with the waiter in a different section after our original waitress quit and that order still came out wrong.  Then the overpriced food came out and we ate it as fast as possible because we wanted to get out of there.  We had to ask the manager a 3rd time to get the bill.  After paying much more than we should have for the meal, we enjoyed the rest of our night down the street.  
If you're in the mood for tasteless margaritas, warm beer, and overpriced food, Volar is your kind of place.

The food was really good. I'd give it 5 stars. We had beef fajitas. Nice taste. Beans and rice were good. Great guacamole. Corn tortillas were yummy. The salsa is like a fire roasted garlic tomato flavor. Very good. The reason I give it 4 stars is presentation and service. Took 7 minutes to get a waiter to our table. Then they were out of Blue Moon. The salsa is served in a tiny bowl. I need more salsa than that! When my husband ordered a second beer, he was not brought a fresh glass. I hope they clean up these types of issues because the food was good. Maybe a touch pricey, but we split a meal.

Finally!  Plainfield now has a truly terrific Mexican restaurant that raised the bar.  Great salsa, great jalapeos and carrots, great entrees, and a nice little dessert just because.  Welcome to Plainfield!

We decided to try Volar a new restaurant located in Downtown Plainfield where we live for our 13 Anniversary. Atmosphere was pleasant, the staff was attentive yet excessive about clearing you dishes. Tamale appetizer was authentic and delishes! We had Red Snapper was plentiful & delishes! Almost enough for two! But head & bones included so be careful. Had Margaritas which were good but pricey! A large Margarita was $42 so beware. You may ask for drink prices before ordering. Desert was amazing and light! We will be back overall the owner made us very happy and he was very pleasant on our special day!

A wonderful new addition to downtown Plainfield.  For starters, we ordered the Queso and added spinach.  It was delicious.  My husband and I both ordered the carne asada tampiquena.  The steaks were tender, well seasoned, and perfectly cooked.  The tortillas were obviously handmade and delicious.  Beans and rice were perfect as was the mole sauce on the enchilada.  The kids both ordered Chimichangas and they loved them.  The decor was relaxing and comforting.  We will definitely be back soon and often!

Ordered the "Shrimp Diabolo" . The waiter asked if I was OK with "hot" food.  Not a problem.... that's why I ordered it.  Although took a while to get the food, and all was good until then, "Shrimp Diablo" was "shrimp Nada spice-o".  Not only not spicy hot,  but lacked any type of spice. Told the waiter, and he apologized. Came back later and said patrons had stated previously that the dish was too hot, and the chef had toned down the sauce and that I wanted heat, I needed to request. Question: Why call a dish" Diablo " and then expect to ask for heat?  Put it on the menu and then deliver.

My husband and I had dinner on a Saturday evening, 5:30ish.  He had carne asarda and I had the shrimp with diablo sauce.  I have to admit, the food was really, really good.  We were abit pleased at the atmosphere of Volar as the last time we had dinner at this address it was the prior Mexican restaurant which closed maybe 2 years ago.  It was pricey, but on our first visit, food was really, really good.  We plan to dine there again very soon!!

Having recently moved to Illinois from California, I have been in search of a good Mexican restaurant since I arrived here.  I was super excited to see signs for Volar when they were getting ready to open, and wasn't disappointed.

My husband and I came on a Saturday night about a week after they opened.  There were plenty of tables full, but we didn't have to wait to be seated.  Our waitress was very attentive and was able to answer all questions we had about the drinks and menu items.  The chips and salsa were great.  We both got margaritas.  They were good and as far as alcohol content goes, they will creep up on you so watch out.  They don't taste like there's much alcohol in them but we definitely felt it midway through our second round.  I ordered the chimichanga with chicken and my husband got the burrito suiza with chicken.  Both were amazing.  The beans and rice were on point..beans tasted very fresh and rice was perfect.  Neither of us was able to finish our massive burritos.

They didn't have a drink menu, so we had to ask what the prices were before we ordered.  Menu items were reasonably priced..not super cheap, but reasonable for the amount and quality of the food.  For both our meals and 4 margaritas, the bill was about $65.  We will definitely be back to Volar.

Food is amazing, very flavorful. Each meal comes with salsa & chips to start off. Then they bring you soup! The soup is very good as well. I ordered a Carne Asada that came with rice, beans, cactus, & sliced potatoes. They also bring you a complimentary dessert. Great service & food. Will be back with the family!

Horrible.  We waited until the kinks would be worked out, they aren't.  Bad food, bad service, bad drinks.  I asked the waiter for a margarita that wasn't too sour, he had no clue.  Said ummmmm the house one??  I stupidly took his advice.  All sour.  The bartender was drinking behind the bar- unprofessional.  The high chair was covered in filth.  The food was not good, like a take out joint.  Taco Bell is better for the money.  This place was expensive.  Save ur money- go ANYWHERE else for a better meal and experience.

Went there for lunch. We all really liked the food. Street tacos, fish tacos, tamales and enchiladas were all very good and we are picky when it comes to Mexican food. Saw comments from others on the service  and agree on it being a bit slow and unorganized but not bad. Biggest issue was the prices. They are fine for dinner but they really need a lunch menu.  Quite pricey for four of us for lunch and we only had water to drink and one soft drink. I'll be back... But not for lunch.
Volar is great upgrade from the last Mexican joint. The food is high end. I particularly loved the steak burrito.

Dinner was so good and the staff was  funny and very attentive  I felt like I was actually  on vacation  they had the Mexican music going and their $5 margaritas were so good  I will definitely  be returning
Food was delicious.  Service was awful and the manager is totally in the WRONG business

Everything done perfectly. Staff very attentive, menu explained, service top shelf, you are well cared for. All our meals were perfect, very tasty and a lot of food. Prices very reasonable for all you get, for food & drink both.  Its a small menu with plenty of variety and what they do, they do it right.

I came to La Barra tonight for my parent's wedding anniversary. It was my first time here since before when the place was called "The Grotto". 
The entrance is very misleading when walking inside; the white walls and floors made me think it was carry out only. Then when I turned the corner, that's when it looked like an actual restaurant. 
The service we received tonight was very good. The waiter was really nice and humorous. The manager even stopped by our table and wished my parents a happy anniversary! 
The food was not what I expected. I was expecting larger portion sizes. The chicken saltimbocca for example was WAY TO SMALL of an entree. We were a table of 6 people sharing a 6 inch sized piece of chicken. It got very awkward very fast. If you're planning to sell a tapas style restaurant , make sure to have enough food for tables 6 or more. Or at least offer to cut it up for sharing. 
Throughout the dinner, refills were never an issue. Our waiter was always prompt with coming by and doing things for us without asking.
Near the end of the night, the manager was nice enough to give us complimentary dessert, completely surprising our parents. 
Overall, I do reccomend this place to others, but please make sure that if you bring more than 4 people with you, good luck sharing the food without people compromising.

Biggest Problem: Terrible Service 

I wanted to like this place, I really did. I am a long time fan of La Briola and have been wanting to try this place forever and unfortunately I was disappointed. I think they have a lot to work on and it could be a really great place but it's just not there yet. 

Initially after we sat down, a server did not come by for about 10 min. Too long in the restaurant world. My husband and I both selected our beverages and what we would eat and had several conversations before anyone even greeted us. As the meal progressed he also never asked us if we wanted a second beverage though our glasses were empty for quite some time. 

I ordered 2 small plates for myself and my husband ordered the burger. Now I understand quite well that when you order small plates, the food comes when it's ready. However, the server did not deliver that message at the time of placing our orders like he should have. Any other small plates restaurant I've been to always does!! He also should have taken into consideration that though I ordered small plates, this was all I was eating so why wouldn't my husband and I want to eat together....?  My first dish came out quickly and I was done with it, and beginning to digest before we saw anymore food. Awkward. 

Our server seemed like a nice guy. Generally, I felt bad for him cause it was clear he wasn't getting the training he needed from management. 

Food: 
Mediterranean Muscles (w/ red sauce): They were decent. However, NO BREAD. I mean come on, that's just muscles 101!! If you are serving muscles, you have to include some nice crusty grilled bread to soak up all the delicious sauce at the bottom of the bowl. Nope. I ate it with my fork. Or tried to. 

Asparagus with fried egg: horribly under seasoned. It was bland and lacked any sort of seasoning or finishing. It needed to be hit with some salt, cracked black pepper, maybe even a little chili flake and finished with a good quality olive oil.

America Burger: my husband said it was no different then any other similar restaurant - nothing special.

Nice patio on the pond. Pretty restaurant.
We ordered the Russo thin pizza,which was tasty w/a crispy crust, but there was a shortage of Italian sausage. The pizza sauce was noticeably good.
The antipasto salad was very good & generously sized for 2.
We will return to try the pasta.

Really tasty arancini. It's too bad that I asked for the sauce on the side for my beets, but the sauce came coated all over the beets was really disappointing. Thank goodness I stopped and asked for utensils and napkins before leaving with my snack and good for me that I don't live near here because I probably won't return for the very slow service.

They set the "La Barra" pretty high

This was nice, we went in the late afternoon and they weren't too crowded.

We ate family style, so we ordered a bunch of appetizers (we treated them like small plates.... there's a difference..right?) a couple of pasta's, a sandwich and a pizza. 

There were 5 of us and the restaurant was super accommodating. We hung out for almost 3 hours.. the servers were all over the refills, the service was very good and friendly

La Barra is owned by Labriola.. and the pizza doesn't disappoint. All of the food was top notch and the pricing reasonable.

Wishing there was a bit more ambiance (but that didn't help the Grotto, which used to be here, so...maybe these guy's got it right)

I love their food and their service. Bartenders are fantastic. Our favorite is Danny and Batina. Based on food and service they should have a 5 star rating. My problem with this place is their inconsistent hours. We live close by and half of the time we come here they are closed before their scheduled hours. I understand that some nights are slow but it's not good for business. One night me and 2 other people tried coming in on a Saturday night and there was another group of 4-5 also attempting to come here and we were turned away. We stopped coming here spontaneously because of this. We now call to make sure they are open before we go.

What happens when you take an awesome cafe and an amazing donut shop and think about pizza. That's what you got with Pizza Barra now LaBarra and I simply had to find out after hearing about this place and my affinity for Stan's donuts!

But I'm left perplexed by this place after two visits. 

First Visit
After arriving back in Chicago, I spun into this place on my way home. It was late and though my energy was high, I thought takeout was a better option so I called in a takeout. Upon arriving 25 minutes or soafter the call, I was met with absolute coldness. No hi, no how can we help you, nothing. After a few minutes of standing there, I asked the pizza maker "if this is where I go for a takeout". Annoyed, he went to get the hostess. After a few minutes, she emerged and took my name. I spent the next 20 minutes feeling like an intrusive burden to the entire team: distant employees that showed little interest in services, friendliness, or just basic human interest.

Taking my deep dish pizza, I lost my appetite for how I was treated. Not angry but disheartened. The next day, my kids snacked on a piece and said it was really good.

Second Trip
We returned to LaBarra after my kids said they really wanted to try it. Given my first trip was late in the evening plus a take out, I reluctantly agreed.

This time, the service was better. Not exceptional but nowhere near the first trip. In fact, Mike the pizza maker made the trip worth it from a service level.

As for the pizza, we did a margarita pizza and a deep dish. The margarita pizza was not good at all. I've had better fast food wood fire than this pizza. The deep dish, on the other hand, was good. The crust is that of Pequod's and is exceptional especially mixed with a strong cheese and sauce, but then things get a bit off. The dough has an odd flavor and works in an odd way of crossing out of the traditional Chicago deep dish crust into an artisan bread in a way that I think focaccia meets deep dish.

My mind went back and forth between I Love It to I Hate It. With one bite, yum. With the next, yuck. After going back and forth, I am leaning more toward the latter. And that is the tale of two cities with this place: service and food.

Will I return? Doubtful. There are too many great places out there when it comes to pizza in Chicago.

So I came here on a Saturday night with my family.  To be fair, a good portion of our party arrived late, so that might account for a bit of the confusion, but the restaurant wasn't too crowded, so I'm not sure.  Anyway, my sister had requested within our reservation that we not be seated at a high-top table, because my grandma could not sit in one of those chairs.  Prior to being seated, the hostess asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside.  We opted to sit outside, but when we were led to our table, it was a high-top.  This led to an uncomfortable situation that we had tried to prevent, but we were quickly relocated to an indoor table.

In terms of food, I really enjoyed the Margherita Pizza, and my wine was tasty too.  The service was kind, and the atmosphere was modern and cool, especially when they had live music playing.  However, the music played after the live music was SO loud!  I'm not sure if they're going for a club sort of vibe, but judging from how not crowded the bar was when we left around 10:30, I don't think the loud music was necessary.  It certainly hindered our conversation, and I'm not sure I can recommend this spot for a meal where the customers want to actually chat comfortably with one another.

This is no longer pizza barra!!! Different menu. Different chef. Different owner. 

The waiter informed us that they made these changes less than a week ago. We met up some friends who claimed the loved pizza barra and that we had to try it. Needless to say we were a bit taken back and hoped it was as good. Right off the bat we were a bit disappointed because the new chef didnt like the chick pea fries and they were no longer available. However the food we got was not bad. For apps we got some fried risotto balls. The waiter said there would be 4, but only 3 came. We also got the burrata which was also a small portion. Most ppl share appetizers. For the price, they should include more. Enough so that 2 order would suffice 4 people. And to top it off, they weren't anything great. 

We patiently waited 40 minutes for our deep dish pizza. Now those of you who follow me...all 3 of you...know that i love pizza. And this place met my expectations. This was some seriously good deep dish. We got the Popeye and added goat cheese. Crust was good. Heavy, but not gross. Caramelized crust. All good. However it was $33. Not bad for the portion I suppose. 4 of are 1/2 of a large. 

Bottom line. Yes. Go. It's good. Appetizers aren't that great. Order early for the deep dish and indulge in it. 

Enjoy.

We came on a weekday in the afternoon so we didn't have issues with service or wait time. 
I LOVE this style pizza it's NOT so greasy and the crust was crispy on the outside with a little bit of chew on the inside! I want to come back and try their other pizzas!
I docked them 1 star because we asked for a side of marinara to dip the delicious pizza crust in and it was sub par. HEY LE BARRA!...MELTED GARLIC BUTTER IS DELICIOUS ON EVERYTHING! 
More importantly, my favorite dish the clams and linguine was just meh... It needed some lemon or a zing of something.

I really wanted to love this place since they have a great patio and cool decor but with all the pizza competition in and around Chicago, pizza barra just came up short. I'll start with the pros, the drinks were great but took kind of a while to get. Again the patio is beautiful and the bar has a really cool vibe. Atmosphere and crowd was very mixed but we went for an early dinner on Saturday so I'm assuming that's why. Service was okay, nothing I would go crazy over but then again not terrible either. 

As for the cons, our table was uneven which is my biggest pet peeve. The table wasn't set and we had to request plates, ect. We started with Bruschetta and it was good but a little bland. Then we had pizza which just didn't amaze me to be honest. Since I live closer to the city I'm used to some seriously amazing pizza, this place just couldn't compete. Thin crust was pretty boring and so thin that the toppings just poured off. 

At the end of our meal our server gave us coupons I think because we sat on the patio and they never turned the heat on (it was pretty chilly) so that was nice. We will most likely come back just to the bar for drinks and appetizers.

La Barra has a great outdoor space with a full menu of flatbreads, sides and apps to choose from. 

The only issue was with our server who was *laying it on pretty thick* if you know what I mean. He made comments about how we should drink more and try and joke with us while we were trying to still decide on food, order or catch up together. If he could take it down a notch that would be great. 

Food: The calamari was just ok and the brussels sprouts were good! I'd definitely come back to try more of their pizza, though.

I have been to La Barra several times since the opening. The first time was on the outdoor patio. It was nice but I am only 4'11" and do not like sitting on a bar stool. We were quickly moved to a lucky empty table. Most people would prefer to sit on the terrace patio, which is quite nice, but do not want to sit at a bar stool. Really! 

Second, I was there on a Sunday afternoon, with my cousin after a  concert. I ordered two different items, the braciole and the chicken small plates and they were "out of them." Really? On a Sunday at 5 pm? We were disappointed.

The third time, we tried to come for small plates and a glass of wine, after a concert on a Saturday night, around 10:15pm. We were told, "After 10pm, we only serve pizza." Really?  I have had their meat sausage pizza and it is very, very salty. Not good pizza, in my repertoire. Probably left over and not purchased?

My daughter and I tried La Barra one more time and when we checked in for Open Table, the two young women at the front were giggling and totally ignoring us. I told her we were 10 minutes late and I had an Open Table reservation.  

We ordered several small plates and they were decent. The arrancini, the chicken sambucca, the charred parmesan salad and the green salad were great. We both had glasses of red wine. We left by 8:00. When I arrived home, Open Table wanted to know why we missed the reservation? Those hostesses did NOT check me into Open Table.  I called the manager and complained. He told me to make another reservation for this evening and he would take care of it. Really?

Most restaurant managers are more than gracious and would offer a free drink, appetizer, dessert for my trouble. I usually turn it down, anyway. However, this manager was not very friendly or accommodating over the phone.  I told him that he needs to keep tabs on the front end for a courteous welcoming staff for people coming into the restaurant.

Too many issues in my five visits. I predict this restaurant won't make it. High priced, too much trouble. Very loud music so conversations are impossible  I'm done.

Bf and I decided to check this place out since it is 5 minutes away from where we live. It was a Saturday evening around 8PM and it was gorgeous outside. When we arrived there was a wait, however, we asked the hostess if we could see if there were any seats available at the bar and we told her it was our first time here. She immediately told us to go check it out since they have 2 bars and an outdoor patio. 

We decided to sit at the bar on their outdoor patio. We ordered a beer and a mule. Which took about 5 minutes to get. Granted, I got my beer first and my bf had to wait another 5 minutes to get his mule. Being a bartender myself, I can understand when the patio is busy including the bar, your drinks can take a little bit to make. However, it just seemed like the bartender had forgotten about my bf's drink...

The bar outside can seat about 10 people and there were 8 sitting there. Bf & I wanted some apps but we didn't get serviced from the bartender for about 20ish minutes after we had received our drinks. So by the time the bartender asked if we needed anything, we ordered our apps and dinner right away.

We ordered one of their meat apps and eggplant with mozz. Both were yummy. When the pizza arrived I wasn't impressed. I didn't really care for their sauce that they use or how much cheese they put on the pizza (the don't put that much cheese on their pizza, some spots on the pizza weren't covered by cheese, kind of like a flatbread style almost) the bf and I actually prefer Aurellios pizza way better! 

After finally checking out this place, we most likely wont be back...

I attached the picture of "Ravioli del giorno" to the review. This was the FIRST time I have ever eaten or ordered food from this place. Food delivered with no difficulty, but the pasta dish we ordered arrived looking like leftovers. I had a couple people over and was embarrassed by this dish. Luckily, I made a joke to my guests about the situation and they surmised that the restaurant must have sent a doggy bag accidentally. When I called and spoke with the manager Brad, he reassured me that these five measly raviolis were not leftovers but in fact what I had ordered. "That's how it's supposed to be. Maggiano's charges more." Is this really how La Barra represents itself in their restaurant? It was nearly $80 for two 14" pizzas and this small ravioli dish. Will NOT be returning and will NOT recommend.

Outside seating is a most, the view and the fresh air combined with a good wine or beer is always a pleasure. Pizzas are very tasty, but the pasta plate that we order the proportions were as for an appetizer and definitely was lacking some flavor, perhaps some salt while cooking will solve the problem. Will go back but perhaps just for some pizza and beer, if not it can get really pricey.

My friends and I had a fun experience here last Saturday for our Galentine's Night Out! I had made a reservation over a month ago and we were seated right away. My only real issue is that our server, while super friendly, was very overwhelmed which caused him to be somewhat slow. Also, we were all in agreement that they should have bread on the table, but alas, they did not. 

Pretty much everyone I was with ordered their own 10 inch pizza since everyone wanted their own thing. Even being the smallest pizza, they were pretty big and most people didn't finish. My one friend got pasta and liked it but thought the prosciutto made it a bit salty. 2 of our party had the tomato bread soup and loved it, but beware, the portion is quite large!

I had wanted to try a few different things so I skipped the pizza. I had their vegetable tray with the brussel sprouts, cauliflower and artichokes. Some were served hot while one was served cold which was a strange choice. The portions were bigger than I thought and I couldn't finish. I also had the arugula and cheese salad, which was really good but it almost had TOO much arugula. Maybe add another type of lettuce or some veggies in there. 

The highlight for me was their bruschetta of the day. I love bruschetta and always order it and on Saturday it was burrata, pesto, peppers and FRIED CAPERS. I am obsessed with capers and never knew such a thing existed. My friend and I shared this as it was 2 large pieces, but I could have eaten it all myself. The capers were the perfect addition! 

My friends liked their drinks. They gave my one friend an option to "upgrade" her glass of wine which brought it to a hefty $17 per glass. They let my other friend try samples of beer before she ordered which was nice too and they split the checks for us. Our waiter seemed hesitant when I asked because he had gone through his schpiel about it being a shared plates place, but we knew we weren't sharing to a split check was best.

By the time we left, the place was packed. They do offer $5 valet but we parked ourselves. I can't wait to go back in the summer and eat on their gorgeous patio!
Great atmosphere...there was a man singing live so the entertainment was fun..the pizza was really good as well. We had the pan pizza... Big enough to share between two people.

This place is great. Opted for meat instead of pizza, but we were not disappointed. 

The meat portions are on the small side, but fulfilling nonetheless. Between 2 people we got 3 meat plates and an appetizer and was just enough food.

Cheesecake was good and enough for 2 people.

Service was very attentive and friendly.

Atmosphere is pleasant. Business casual or casual. Great after work place. Big bar and nice patio. Inside is great too.

Only change I would make is I wish they provided complimentary bread at the table.

I was fortunate enough to try a wide variety of food from this restaurant. I attended a private event. 

The restaurant was very clean and tidy! The waiters were kind and attentive. 

Surprisingly pizza wasn't the best. Their chicken and salmon were favorites of everyone at my table.

Ive been going to Pizza Barra since they opened up. The service, quality of food is hands down amazing.
The fact that they're open late in middle of suburbia alone is a reason to check them out.

Pizza - My favorite is the Mitch's italian beef 
Pasta is good too! 
Live entertainment on the wknds. 

Great place for a date!

It's a newer restaurant opened by Labriola.  It's in the same shopping center.  We have stopped in here before for a company outing - but more recently for a simple lunch with a couple buddies.  The pizza is fantastic.  Everything is from scratch - so its about 20 minutes for a regular pie and a full 40+ for their version of the stuffed pizza (not sure what they call it).  We got the regular pizza - but I'm already looking forward to trying their stuffed pie.  

The only recommendation is to call ahead if you're in a hurry and you want to have the stuffed pizza.

The best pizza I've ever had in my life
But very fucking expensive , bring your link card

So for the most part, we enjoyed the food.  Our appetizers were good - many unique choices as well as small plate offerings.  Our party of four also ordered a pizza, which was well-made and flavorful.  We were definitely satisfied with the food, as well as the many drink options.  

Where I dock this place a few stars is the service.  Our waitress was inattentive throughout the evening.  It took forever to even get a server to take our drink order.  Then we wondered if she was ever going to return for our food order.  We had to track her down for water refills, and we all probably would've ordered another round of drinks as well as dessert if she ever came back.  After waiting and waiting and waiting (and watching the clock tick), we decided it was time to go and requested our check when we finally spotted our waitress in the vicinity.  Oh well....their loss.
Last Saturday, we returned to Pizza Barra and I must say that the Russo sausage pan pizza is very good. The only thing I would address is that the sausage needs to be a bit more flavorful.

I really enjoy going to this restaurant with groups of people. We usually go the shared plates route and it's always great! 

I recommend starting with the Antipasti tasting- we like the burrata, sopresatta, roasted brussel sprouts, cauliflower, and celery with dates! Yum! 

For pizza we have really enjoyed the Pomodorini and the Salsiccia. Both are delicious. The baby arugula salad is also great!

I went here on a Monday around lunch time with my dad. We were seated right away and the server was quick to greet our table. He was knowledgeable about the menu and gave us his recommendations. Since it wasn't very crowded at that time, he recommended getting the pizzas which he mentioned would take 15 to 20 minutes to cook. I decided to go with the Garganelli pasta and my dad decided to order the Pizza Barra Supreme thin crust.

The service was great, the waiter kept asking if we wanted our waters refilled even though the glasses were full. The pizza was done within 20 to 30 minutes and came out first. My Garganelli pasta came out 5 minutes after the pizza. I am giving 3 stars because the food wasn't up to my expectations. The pasta was disappointing. It wasn't cooked enough and it felt chewy and hard. The sauce wasn't memorable and I've had better pasta elsewhere. My dad's supreme pizza was good except the pizza was so thin that the toppings kept falling off and it just made it super messy to eat. I have had better pizza at other places such as Pizzeria Uno in Chicago or Schaumburg which are worth the drive. Is it worth $30 for a 16" thin crust pizza? No because I can go to Giordano's in Oak Brook to get a deep dish for the same price. I just wish the pasta tasted better and that the pizza crust would be thicker then I would come back and try their food again.

I really liked this place. I got the promodrini pizza and it was delicious. I love any pizza that has arugula and lemon oil. I got the avocado toast for an appetizer and that was delicious. I wouldn't recommend bringing kids due to the wait for the pizza. This is a great place for doing get together or meeting up with friends. I will definitely come back.

Outstanding artisan coal fired pizza! I highly recommend the buratta! The pizza is large and big enough to share... I recommend getting a side of sauce to dip your crust in because the warm, fluffy, and crispy crust is hard to leave behind. Well lit and clean. Great service. The water service is on point! Ample seating and an outdoor patio. Bar is nice sized with 4 tv's and plenty of stool seating! Can't wait to return!

The ambiance and concept are great.  I want to like this place.  
I like the idea of small plates for sharing as appetizers.  I love the patio. The only negative about the ambiance is that is a little too loud inside.

However, I have now been here 4 times and twice have had mishaps with the pizza.

The deep dish was burned to a crisp on one occasion and the another time the dough was not risen and resulted in an inedible pizza. I am not sure if they ran out of dough and made some extra dough because they were busy, but I would not recommend the deep dish because you never know what you are going to get.  When you wait 45 minutes for a pizza offering to make another is not an acceptable solution.

Hopefully they step it up.

It's a good sign when you sit down, peruse the menu and immediately start talking about your next visit before you've even eaten anything.

We came here on a Thursday night to celebrate my husband's birthday, so he got to do the deciding. We're big fans of the Labriola cafe so hearing that there was a new full-service pizza/small plates oriented restaurant sounded pretty awesome, and Pizza Barra did not disappoint.

I dig the decor and atmosphere - a little old school pizza joint, a little cozy industrial bar, a little steakhouse ... hard to explain but it works.

We started with the fried provolone thingies (they were kind of like little empanadas) and the bruschetta of the day - fava beans, burrata and heirloom tomato. It's hard to go wrong with fried cheese pockets, but man, that bruschetta was amazing. Two crispy pieces of bread with ooey-gooey-super-creamy burrata and the freshest most perfect tomato. The fava beans were tasty but kind of an afterthought.

We also ordered a double dough pepperoni pizza. It was delicious. High quality ingredients, perfectly spiced sauce, awesome cheese, great pepperoni, all on a delicious crust. 

The menu all looks really good and someday I will come back and eat everything -- because from the veggie small plates to the desserts I want all of it except the olives, sorry olives. The drink menu - including classic cocktails, lots of wine and a good beer selection - also looks stellar.

Our waiter was on top of things, friendly, explanatory, a little jokey and on top of refills and any other needs we might have. 

All around an excellent restaurant and an excellent experience I want to repeat over and over.

I live right across the street, so was excited to see a new restaurant finally open up after Grotto left years ago. I went on opening night and have been back already. I think the truly standout items are the pasta... I've had the rigatoni with meat sauce and garganelli with peas/prosciutto and they were probably the best pasta I've had in the suburbs.... Perfectly cooked and so much more flavor, better sauce and texture than Volare across the way. 

I've tried two of their signature coal fired pizzas and wasn't the most impressed... I've had better coal fire before, but the crust was amazing. I haven't tried the thin or Chicago style yet. 

The small plates they offer all look pretty good as well, I liked the flank steak/polenta plate. Meat was fork tender!

I think this is a fun place to get a drink after work, or get a nice meal. The music was rather loud even during dinner time, but was noticeably not as loud the second time I went... The wait staff is very nice, but a little slow (likely just getting to know process, menu..), but I think these small things will work themselves out ultimately.

Stopped in for lunch--shared a pizza (excellent), and salad (excellent)

Chef ---please put the chick pea fries on the lunch menu!!!!!

Moving away from Chicago to Minneapolis, makes you appreciate good pizza. Pizza Barra is everything I love about Chicago pizza and more! 

First, the decor. You are greeted by a modern, yet old school vibe at the bar. When you walk to the back of the restaurant, you notice a beautiful patio on the water perfect for those summer nights. 

We started with a variety of cheeses and meats that were a very large portion for the 6 of us. We ordered 2 of the artesian pizzas, the buratta and the salsiccia. The salsiccia had this yummy savory cream sauce that I am still dreaming about. Both pizzas had the best crust I've ever had. Doughy but crispy at the same time. We ended by trying a variety of desserts that were all outstanding. 

All in all, a very fun dining experience that makes you feel like you're in Chicago, in Oakbrook. Great overall vibe. Will definitely be returning!

Why did I wait so long to come here!!! 
Went on Saturday evening around 7:30 and we got sat in the dining room area. When I first sat down, before even trying anything, I said, I can't wait to come back here. Our waitress is great, she went over the specials and the menu and really explained some great options.
We ordered the Rigatoni Pasta to share and it was amazing! Delicious and great for sharing. We also wanted to compare the pan pizza to our favorite local place in Oakbrook Terrace and we were really impressed on how good the pizza was. It was loaded with tomatoes, but they tasted great on the pan pizza. The crust was thicker but very crunchy and full of flavor.
I cannot wait to go back and try out some appetizers and some of the veggies options that they have on their menu. I ordered to drink the Moscow Mule and it was very delicious!
I took some coupons walking out for grub hub, as well as 20% entire purchase if dining before 3pm. This place is awesome and I really cannot wait to return.

The menu is always changing! And NOT in a good way!!
Every time I come in, it's is smaller portions and same prices
On top of that they ARE ALWAYS out of something, if I order the seafood salad they are out, order the charcuterie and they are out of the good meats and cheeses...pathetic
Don't EVER order the calamari absolutely no flavor and the server noticed I didn't eat..I put it all the way to the end of the table after having one bite... didn't care was still charged...
She brought me Moscato instead of prosecco... Close but NO..then I was never offered a second drink
And I'm just not impressed..
When they first opened I was, but no not anymore

I'm struggling on this one - between 3 and 4 stars - and while my negativity typically shines through, I figured I'd err on the positive side today.

I've dined at Pizza Barra twice now (never carry-out). 

Similarities 
Service: Both times, I dined here with a group of four, and had spotty service. The first time, we waited and waited for food. We ordered an appetizer that came out with three servings (a big pet peeve - if the app doesn't say the servings, and there are four people, I believe it should be recommended that we either order another, or add another piece to the order). For lunch, the service was far too slow. The second time, we waited several minutes at the front desk before finally just walking in, to find the hostess chatting at the bar and unaware she had a line waiting for tables. In this time, the others ate half of their pizza before my salad arrived - but - our server DID recommend adding a fourth serving to the same appetizer.
Pizza: It was fantastic both times. There's something to be said about that chewy, wood fire grilled dough that makes you feel less guilty, and not overly stuffed. It's not easy to pick up (the middle is a bit doughy) but overall it's delish.

Differences
Salad: Both times, I ordered the Baby Arugula salad. The first time, I literally cleaned the plate. I actually went to the grocery store that night and bought the ingredients, because it was so delicious. The second time I ordered, it didn't get brought out until well after the pizzas arrived, and it didn't taste nearly as good - less ingredients, more arugula. Bummer!

We're close to this location for work, so hopefully the third time is the charm when it comes to service. There isn't anything comparable around the area - but should the service fall short a third time, we'll skip on Pizza Barra and just stick to LaBriola.
This spot has the best deep dish in. It was a large group of us 12 of us. The hostess and waiter went out of there way to help us out. The food was filling and I really enjoyed the atmosphere.
Great Italian drinks and food. The sauces are done to perfection. The dessert will send you to the gym. Forgot the name of my pizza :( but it was memorable.

Had the Danny's Special deep dish pizza-so good!  Carmelized crust, great sauce and cheese. Could only eat two pieces, so filling. Doreen was a great server, also had the Buratta and tomato salad. Highly recommend!

Service is the worst!!!! In an area with many options, they will have to make customer service corrections....otherwise they won't last! Pizza was decent; ordered Chicago Pan Pizza 1/2 Italian sausage for my boyfriend and my half with giardinara. We won't be back unless we order the pizza to go well in advance.

Staff lacks the know how of what the restaurant offers. Menu is bit complicated, server assistance is required here. Ordered Mac and cheese, you would guess that does not have much of ingredients, it came out as a pasta dish with marinara. Oh well it got worse as the appetizers and pizza's orders came through. The toppings were messed up - no jellyfish no seafood came out as octopus on them. Half portion toppings were spread out on other half. The artisan pizza crust was good. The outdoor seating overlooks a pond, restaurant has ample parking and seating.

Service is extremely slow - the appetizers and pizzas arrived at the same time.

Modern look to the restaurant and bar space - well hidden secret.  Menu a bit limited and the music volume level is much too loud to permit any level of normal conversation in the restaurant.

Visited on a Saturday night, so perhaps this venue was in club mode.

Great food! Cool atmosphere and reasonable prices. Pizza is awesome.
Nice change of pace for Italian food.

Despite the average reviews I previously read on Yelp, I Decided to try La Barra yesterday (a Tuesday night) for a girls night/birthday dinner for myself. I made reservations on Open Table and they were ready for us when we arrived. The hostess asked us if we wanted to sit outside, unsure because it was a bit chilly out, we decided to check it out anyway. So glad we did! The outdoor patio is heated (keeps you VERY warm) and is decorated so cute! Streams of little lights on the ceiling, overlooks the pond with the fountain in it, and great ambiance. The bar area is huge with a large flat screen TV and there are a lot of high table tops as well as regular tables to sit at. The waiter was very friendly, a little slow but we didn't mind because we were all taking, catching up, and having a great time. We ordered the eight finger cavatelli, braciole (both recommendations from our waiter and they were both DELICIOUS!), we also got the beets (love beets but these were average), Brussels sprouts which were yummy, and a Margherita pizza that was so good that even my friends husband who is from Italy (just moved to the US a few months ago) even said it was really good and wants to eat there again! 

Also, the server brought out a chocolate piece of cake with a candle in it for my birthday for free. That too was delish! 

I am so impressed with LaBarra and glad I didn't listen to the negative reviews. Perfect for a little date night. girls night, or any night! Food is seriously delicious (pasta is homemade),  hostess and server were friendly and the ambiance is on point :) Can't wait to eat there again soon!

The service was really spotty. Not sure if our server was new, but he literally had to look at us pointing out what we wanted on the menu because it didn't seem like he was familiar with anything. Food was fine. Nothing special. Average pizza for average prices.

Worst. Service. Ever. From start to finish, the service was so bad it was comical. Arrival: 4 adults, 7:45 reservation, on-time arrival, beautiful night out, outdoor seating requested. Hostess: "Do you still want an outdoor table?" Me: "Yes." Hostess: "That will be an hour wait." Me: "We have a reservation. What are our options?" Hostess: "We have a table ready for you inside. We can move you outside when a table opens up in an hour." Me: "Ok." The host stand then proceeds to ignore us for the next 10 minutes despite no other parties waiting. They finally seat us inside without acknowledging the delay. As they seat us, I remind them we would like to be moved outside as soon as something opens up.

After they finally seat us, our waiter comes over, and I let him know we would like to be seated outside as soon as a table opens up. He tells us about the pasta special, a tortellini with chicken. I ask if it can be served without chicken as one of our party is vegetarian. The waiter is unsure. Here is a partial list of other things the waiter doesn't know and doesn't find out for us:  what is the bruschetta of the day, anything about the preparation of any of the verdure (vegetable antipasti), the preparation of and accompaniments for the Whole Roasted Red Snapper Livornese, what the "meatball pie" is.

Example 1: Me: "What is the bruschetta of the day?" Waiter: "I missed the tasting session today, so I'm not sure." Me: "Uh, ok."

Example 2: Me: "Can you tell me what the whole red snapper is served with?" Waiter: "I have never seen it before, so I don't know." Me: "So should I order something else?" Waiter: "Yes."

Example 3: Wife: "I'll have a small deep dish meatball pie***." Waiter: "You want a deep dish pizza with meat balls?" Wife: "The deep dish pizza on the menu called 'Meat Ball Pie.'" Waiter: "Show me which one." Wife [pointing]: "The one right there." Waiter: "Okay. Do you want 14-inch, 12-inch, or 10-inch?" Wife: "The small one." Waiter: "So, the 10-inch?" Wife: "Yes. That is the smallest one."

***  SIDE NOTE: The menu has only five deep dish pizza offerings, each with a specific name. One of them is called "Meat Ball Pie." There are three sizes. Seems just about as straightforward as it could be.

We remind the waiter we would like to be seated outside as soon as a table opens up and ask him to check periodically. No further word from the waiter on this until we remind him an hour after we arrived. (In the meantime, we have seen two other tables move outside.) We ask him how much longer the wait will be, and he tells us "it will be about an hour." I remind him that is what they told us an hour ago. No other word about this from anyone at the restaurant.

About 20 minutes after we are seated, the waiter takes our antipasti order. The food arrives with reasonable promptness. As the server is sitting plates on the table, he bangs down the marinara sauce so it splashes all over the table and splatters the white shirt of one of our party. The server doesn't notice. By the time we figure out what happened, he is gone. When the waiter returns, we tell him what happened and ask for club soda. The waiter doesn't apologize, but disappears and returns with club soda -- and black paper napkins. Seriously? Black paper napkins to rub onto a white shirt? Still no apologies or any offer to make anything right. Ever.

About 10-15 minutes after we are done with our antipasti, we finally get our waiter's attention so we can place our dinner order. This is about an hour or so after we are seated. When the waiter can tell me nothing about the red snapper and doesn't offer to check, I order the I order the Paccheri with clams. The other three members of the party order pizza.

Our party is now sitting at an empty table chatting away. About 20 minutes later (around 9:00 or 9:05), a server comes over and plops the Paccheri with clams down onto the table. No explanation. No comment about the other orders. No offer of parmesan or pepper. After about 10 minutes, we are able to flag down the waiter to see when the pizzas might arrive and find out whether I can get some parmesan. He doesn't seem to know how long the pizzas will be. Rather than entrust the waiter with my dinner to take it back to the warmer, I decide to go ahead and eat it. But no bowl for the clam shells. I steal a plate from a neighboring table. The food is fine, but certainly not memorable. I am done eating around 9:20 or so. The pizzas finally arrive 20 minutes later - 40 minutes after my dinner was served.

No apologies, nothing taken off the bill, no acknowledgment that they never got us outside, bland meatballs, average food.  One star.  At best.

I ordered carry out from here last night. I had been eyeing them since they opened. What really drew me in was the picture on their website of their Chicago pan pizza. I am a huge fan of Lou Malnatis "the Lou," and was drawn to The Popeye, hoping that it would be a good substitute seeing as there are no Lou's near me, and this is a five minute drive if that.
I was not disappointed! The Popeye was everything I dreamed it to be! I especially liked the charred cheese crust at the top. So good!!! The girl who took my order over the phone was a doll and was just as nice in person 
The spinach, mushrooms and chunky tomatoes were a great combination and curves quite tasty the next day! I can't say how the deep dish crust us made, but I do know that I now have my go to for traditional Chicago deep dish!

Everything was great from the service to the food!!

The Quattro formaggi pizza was amazing! The mix of the cheeses, truffle honey, balsamic glaze, and sopressata was such a delicious and unexpected mix of flavors!

Great atmosphere, beautiful patio for summer! Great addition to the Oakbrook promenade!
Excellent service and 5 stars on both the pepperoni sausage deep dish and veggie pizza. Both are amazing and can't wait to go back!!!

We have been there twice. The first time we sat at the Bar. We got there kind of late, maybe 9PM (after a movie across the street) and it took a while for the Bartenders to decide it they wanted to wait on us. I explained it was our first time there and before I could ask what they recommend she said, well here are the menus, let me know if you have questions. When she came back to see what we wanted we were asking about the deep dish pizza, they made a huge effort to try to talk us into the thin crust. It seemed strange so I asked if they were closing??? We ordered the grilled Cesar Salad and a Pizza Bara Supreme Pizza. 

The Salad was horrible. I have had Grilled Cesar Salads before and in fact even make them at home, this was the "very middle" of the romaine heart, this thing could not have been more than an inch in diameter and it was sooo soaked in dressing that it was completely limp. There were three pieces on the plate and where about as crisp as a cooked noodle. I asked if this was normal and they said yes. 

The pizza arrived after about an hour and it was good, basically the pizza recipe if a knock off from Pequod's Pizza in Chicago. Kind of a cornmeal crunchy crust (not doughy) and they let the cheese and sauce run over the side of the crust and caramelize on the top. The pizza was very juicy (more tomatoes than sauce) We really liked the pizza so we thought we would let the iffy service go and give it another try. 

The next time we came back we with a larger group. There were three adults and three children. We ordered Calamari (very small pieces mostly breading) and asked if we could get a regular Cesar Salad (not grilled). The brought out a big bowl of sliced romaine lettuce with almost no dressing.  We ordered three deep dish pizzas. It took a little over an hour to see the pizzas come up and we could see the waitress just staring at them in the window by the kitchen. We had a good view of the kitchen as they sat us at the first table in the dining area, right by the Bus Area and the Bathrooms, so we saw when the waitress called over a manager to decide if they should serve our pizzas. They brought them over and sure enough, they were burnt, not caramelized burnt. We had to accept the pizzas because it was late, we had been waiting for an hour and we had three hungry 9 and 10 years old kids to feed. It would have been ok it is was just a little extra burnt around the edge of the crust, but because the pizza was overcooked it was really dry. 

After we paid the bill and were walking out, we asked the waitress why they served those pizzas, she said it was the managers decision. (this is why after dropping off the pizzas we never saw her again, someone else brought the check and we had to ask bus people for refills on drinks) When we asked the manager for some consideration, maybe a coupon to come back, and he actually said..."We get complaints about the pizza being burnt all the time, this is how they are supposed to be cooked". 

We won't be back!!!!!!!!!! We have had similar experiences at their sister restaurant - Labriola Caf. They are both Beautiful Restaurants with really bad execution.

PIzzas are great. Service was slow -
Pizza could take 25-30 minutes. And for some reason the appetizers came at their own pace.
But food is good - would go again. Probably when we are not very hungry.

Ok, the food was really good. I will give them that, they just need to really work on service. Wow. Our server spent the whole time explaining how slammed he was and complaining about the kitchen. I admit my friends are a little high maintenance, they've served at high-end restaurants, so they have a certain expectation when it comes to service, and this guy was not delivering. He didn't know any of the ingredients in the food, what is saba that is listed in this pasta? "I don't know." How many small plates is a good amount for a small group? "I don't know." This pasta is spicy, do you know what's in it? "I don't know." Alrighty then. 

Also the bar does not have ginger ale, and committed the sin of mixing sprite and coke together, this is not ginger ale. I know this is what bartenders do in a pinch, but when we ask specifically if you have ginger ale, don't say yes if you're just going to mix up some strange concoction and call it ginger ale. If I had wanted jameson with sprite and a splash of coke I would have ordered it that way.

We stopped in on a Saturday evening and it was busy. 30 minute wait at 5:45. Fortunately, we had a reservation. Large restaurant but nice atmosphere and bar area. Pizza is priced in the high side but very good, and not greasy. Recommend getting a large and sharing. We ordered a 10, 12 and 16 inch for four people. Way too much, but everybody got they wanted. Get one of the artesian pizzas which are unique and you can't readily find elsewhere. Service is where they need to work out the kinks. Table wasn't ready for our reservation. Pizza (thin crust) took 35 minutes and the wrong order was initially brought out. If you're going to the movies like we were, allow enough time. Service was friendly so  given time they should hopefully figure it out. There's a patio which will be nice in the warmer months.

There were soo many people here so we figured we would see what the hype is all about. Everyone in our party ordered something different, we ordered a bruschetta to share, and we received something that was not at all bruschetta and really thought that they made a mistake and brought it to the wrong table. My pizza was nothing really special. I'm pretty disappointed with my first time experience here and considering how many competing restaurants are around the area, I can't see myself coming back.

Seriously!!!!!  We order two pan pizza's because of the hungry hound review. They tell us an hour. We give them the phone number we called from (caller id shows the same number). We show up an hour later. THEY RAN OUT OF DOUGH!!!!!!!!  A pizza place at 6:00 pm on a Sunday ran out of dough. They say they tried to call us but had the wrong number written down. So rather than making two thin crust pizzas with the same ingredients.... I guess there was plenty of thin crust dough...they did nothing. 

So why would I give them 4 stars.  It's because of what happened next. 

The manager was completely sincere and apologetic. She admitted they screwed up. They offered to make us pizzas (the same pizzas we ordered just on thin crust) immediately. It would take 30 minutes and if we waited at the bar our drinks and an appetizer was on the house. Oh and they comped the pizzas. That was a classy move for any place, but especially a pizza place. 

The polenta and braciole appetizer was outstanding. It's the best braciole and sauce I've ever had. It's my favorite beef dish and they nailed it. Sorry mom.  

The pizzas were great. Try the Italian beef pizza. It's really really good. 

They did a great job making a great first impression. We will be back.

This is a relatively new restaurant, so while the service is a gigantic mess (never refilled waters or asked if we wanted another drink.... Wrong food delivered after a 75 min wait after placing order... 2 forks for 4 diners and no response to first two requests for more... Dirty dishes never bussed...) it will likely improve when they have more experience and work out the kinks. Tons of people walking around with ear pieces eyeballing the diners - not enough workers actually doing anything. We were in a large dining room with about 20 tables and only one busboy who clearly took a 30 min break while we were there because he disappeared for a long time. 

One can suffer less than mediocre service for a good slice of pie, and this is why I gave it 3 stars. The Arancini was delicious - everything else was just OK, but not worth the wait.  The pizza was less than average.  My family of 4 dropped $200 and my kids wanted to eat when we got home. 

To be fair, we always thought LaBriola was just OK - very beautiful place to be and presentation outstanding, but the end product is blah to our taste. If you like them, then perhaps Pizza Barra will be to your taste too. (same owner, I believe).

Really enjoyed Pizza Barra today for lunch! My son and I were hungry after a long meeting, and it was the first place we saw. The lovely server offered the steak sandwich as the special, and I was so tired that I went with that. My son ordered  a cheese pizza. Both were DELICIOUS! The steak sandwich with portobello mushrooms, onions, and cheese was so flavorful and perfectly prepared. I told my son that it was the best steak sandwich I've ever had! Would definitely return to Pizza Barra with friends or family!
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the outside dining space.  Will definitely be back.  A little odd how staggered all the food was that we ordered but it ended up working out fine.

The only thing good was the patio.

First off, the bruschetta changes daily. Our server told us the daily one was a yellow tomato with arugula. They delivered a mushroom and cheddar cheese one. My boyfriend is allergic to mushrooms. I told the waiter, he said oh they changed it. I had to insist they remake what we ordered.

Then, the specialty pizza arrives. It was so-so. 2nd piece in- and there was a little squiggly black hair on the pizza. 

Called the waiter, he offered to remake it. I said ok, I couldn't eat the one we had. And then he didn't remake it. Brought our check about 10-15 mins later. Didn't charge us for the pizza, but charged for the wrong bruschetta (they did bring correct one... After the gross hair pizza).

Just awful experience and treated us like it was our fault.

I want to like this place, I really do.

But, I do not. It has a great location, beautiful interior, and a covered patio overlooking a pond.

The problem is pizza, service, and common sense. 

There are an indoor and out door bar; my friend asked me, "Why does it take a half hour to get a beer?" 

We ordered a 10" pizza, too much sauce and when the host brought the thin crust it looked like char coal. The kicker was no napkins.

This place could be something special. It starts with customer service and attention to detail. 

On my previous visit on a busy Friday evening; the Italian beef pizza was and service were both good. I hope this place gets straightened out.

The interior design is very cool.  The service is between 1-2 stars, a thin cheese pizza took 40 mins and the other pizza was our well before.

The Rosemary pizza was bland and dry.  The thin pizza was ordinary.

Nice atmosphere.  Waiter was very rude to my friend.  Not sure why?  He kept wanting to upsell - alcohol in particular.  He acted like he was in a hurry.  It was a slowish Wednesday night.  Maybe he was a manager?  Kind of bullied us.  Maybe we were too slow?
Food was ok.  Looked better than it tasted.  Crust lacks any flavor. The food also lacked flavor.  It really looked good.

The word 'Barra' must mean 'and a hell of a lot more' because their entrees, appetizers and side dishes are far beyond any pizza place I know of.

Pizza Barra offers the excellence you would expect from Labriola (who owns them) in a new, and very cool, format. The pizzas are gourmet in many ways except price.

The outdoor patio is a perfect fit. You can hang out for a long time enjoying the food and drink without that sluggish / heavy feeling some Italian / pizza places tend to have.

Try the squid ink with mussels pasta dish, get a pizza or two to share and you won't be disappointed.

It's great for pizza and a hell of a lot more!

Busy tonight but not too busy ...positive energy
Pizza outstanding music getting ready to start

This is now my second time here and both times service from start to finish was poor . We were sat at a table then left there with absolutely no one stopping or even looking our way for about 15min. No water , nothing was given to us . We finally flagged someone down and got a big explanation which still got us slow undeserving service . Also one of the managers (skinny tall fellow )is worth nothing and frankly deserves a demotion . Just not doing his job ,period . Thank god their pizza is great otherwise they would be out of business .
The pizza was expensive,  and just ok. This is formatted more like a sit down and order restaurant than like a traditional pizza place.  Not great for lunch because it takes so ooooooo long.

If you are lucky enough to get the food you order, you'll be thrilled!  But the service is so bad that 2 out of 7 entrees were forgotten and only delivered after asking about them twice. By the time those dishes got to the table, 5 of us were already done eating. Many of our drinks and desserts were also forgotten.  And every time we inquired about a missing dish, we were questioned about whether we really ordered it. And each time, the waitress referenced her notepad again and realized we had indeed ordered correctly and she was wrong.
I really wish they could get the service together because the food really was fabulous. I'd suggest getting an extra pizza for the table in case the entrees you order don't show!

Good: 1) Spacious waiting area
           2) Calamari and zucchini were delicious
           3) Pizza was good enough, not great though
Bad: 1) Reservations were "lost," what was the point of making one?
        2) Service was bad; the server didn't even try to do a good job
        3) Items were missing from our order; i.e. dips for appetizers
        4) Bathrooms were dark; this is a restaurant, not a bar
        5) Soap dispensers in bathrooms were empty, no excuse for that
        6) Needless to say, I won't ever come back here nor would I recommend this place.

Great pizza any style your heart desires!  Great bar in the middle of the restaurant and always a nice bartender.  Tv's all around. Great place.
             Mike P

Me and my family LOVE the deep dish pizza here. The fried zucchini had good favors but was way to salty. we sat down and ate there the 1st time we went. We didn't like the atmosphere and the tables are small, which made use fell acquired when eating. And it was way to loud in there.
I am 29 years old and I know how to have a go time but the volume in there was on a whole nother level. We couldn't really here each other talking, it was just a lot of back in forth screaming. But the Deep dish pizza is soooo good we order it to go and enjoy in the comforts of our home.
He said he wants Pizza Barra for Fathers Day! lol

We tried the pan pizza and the chocolate cake (take out). The tomatoes seemed canned. The crust was soaking wet and mushy on the bottom. Aside from the frosting, the chocolate cake was not tasty. This is one of the few times our leftover pizza was thrown out and not saved.

We went for New Years to eat and see the band they had that night.  We really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere . . . TERRIFIC service . . . nice casual place to just have a good time with family and/or friends!

I really wanted to like this place. The outside patio and food were good. This poor service ruined the whole experience. It started from a hostess that we had to wait for when the restaurant wasn't even busy. She wasn't interested in her job or helping us. The server took our order and never came back he was too busy with larger tables and multiple brought our order, boxed us up and the check. What a waste of time and money its oblivious that no one there cares about there job.

Last night my husband and I visited Pizza Barra for the first time.
The food was amazing and the service was spot on.
The out door patio was pretty impressive.
We will definitely recommend this restaurant to our friends and family.
Hats off to the staff!

Waiter was great; food better than average.  Enough TVs.  Artisan Pizza was very very good, but only available in 16".
Easy parking - will be great in the summer with the huge deck.

My fiance, his parents, and I came here last weekend to try the pizza. We wanted to possibly have our rehearsal dinner here for our wedding. We asked to speak to the manager, who was very helpful, though I almost fell out of my chair when I saw the pricing!!!

We were finally seated at a table and put our orders in at 7:15. We each ordered a 10 inch pizza, hoping to share with one another. Two of us had ordered thin crust, while the other two ordered the pan pizza. The waiter warned us that it would be at least a half hour wait since the pan pizzas take longer to cook.

From that point on, we waited, and waited, and waited.........It was 8:30 and still no pizza. The waiter came by maybe a couple times apologizing and letting us know that he kept asking for our pizzas. He continued to explain that Saturday nights are "very busy." We ended up waiting over an hour and a half. We finally asked for the check so we could leave. A different manager spoke to us, apologizing for the inconvenience. She did give us a gift card and the "dinner" was on the house. 

I'm normally not one to write reviews, but I had to for Pizza Barra. Not only did we not get our food, but other people were complaining about waiting a long time for theirs. On the way out, I overheard one waiter complaining to a waitress about how nothing makes sense, and a manager telling the cook, "That has mushrooms all over it!" in an angry tone. It was very obvious that the staff were flustered. I understand things happen, but it made for a very uncomfortable and unpleasant experience. Considering what this place charges, you would think their service would be up to standard.

I am not sure what other people are seeing in this place. The service was just fine, but the pizza was blah. In fact, one of our two pies was even burned a bit to where I would have been embarrassed to serve it to my friends and family if I had made it. I would definitely not expect to be served this at a restaurant. Honestly, if you are looking for pizza, there are fair better options (a bit pricey too, in my opinion).

I have been here twice and ordered carry out once. The pizzas and everything I have tried are excellent. Love the zucchini strips small plate. That is big enough to share with 4 people. 
Since Connie's left the area, I feel we have not had a good deep dish pizza place around that has a convenient way to pick up for carry out. 
That being said, my only complaints are that there is not an area that is close to the restaurant that is reserved for carry out pick up parking and that the deep dish I ordered for pick up was not very warm. I was not late picking it up either. That left me a little disappointed. I have had two great experiences eating at the restaurant so why would pick up be different? 
Both times we dined in we had excellent service. Our wait staff was knowledgable and offered tastes of beers if we weren't sure. 
This is a good place for families so if you are looking for a quiet Italian restaurant this is not it. The times that I was there the dining room was filled with young kids and the bar had a lot of loud TVs blasting sports. Pick your poison. What do they call this, an "energized" atmosphere? I'm guessing that if you are looking for a quieter experience go early.
I love how bright and comfortable the restaurant is and such a big change from how it looked before! I'm sure patio dining this summer will be very popular! 
I will definitely return!

A MUST visit if you love high quality, fresh and unique food!! So much more than just great pizzas- the menu has something for everyone and after trying multiple small dishes, we can't wait to come back to try more!! Staff is attentive(Frank is a gem behind the bar) and the atmosphere/ decor is warm and inviting. You'll kick yourself if you want a great dining experience in DG/ Oak Brook and you don't come here!!! One of the best new secrets in town, but not for long!

Had a reservation and arrived 10 arrived early. Hostess informed us that it would be closer to our reservation. Saw walk ins seated before us while we waited an additional 30 minutes. Informed the hostess to cancel my reservation. Very disorganized and would not go here again. Pizza is probably good, but I wouldn't know. What's the point of having reservations when walk ins get first priority?

My wife and I ate there last evening 12/4/15 on the recommendation of Steve Dolensky review naming them as having the best deep dish pizza in the suburbs.
Steve doesn't know what he is talking about. This is the worst deep dish I have eaten in the last 30 years.  We ordered the 12" inch supreme. The vegetables were undercooked, the pie was smothered in stewed tomatoes, the edges were supposed to be Carmelized cheese but we're burnt to a crisp and unchewable. The pie was also smothered in black olives which gave it a bitter taste.
This was a terrible deep dish. I would strongly recommend you take a pass on pizza Barra.

I have to start with the defining part of my experience last Saturday. They had live "entertainment" in the form of a "singer" in the bar. Besides being unbearably loud and effectively preventing any conversation with my dining companions, he was beyond awful. Every moment he was butchering songs was torture. 

The pizza was excellent; we tried one of the wood-fired and one Chicago-style deep dish and both were among the best I've had in some time. Service was acceptable but not great, but it was the Saturday night rush, so it's to be expected.

Our server was very patient with our table. We took awhile to place an order and even then we had questions for the chef due to food allergies. The Quattro formagi was delicious and my friend said the gluten free pizza was great too. Will definitely return.

We absolutely LOVE this place, definitely 5 stars for the pizza, both deep dish AND thin crust. Unfortunately we placed an order for delivery, live .5 miles away from the place (delivery in convenience of life and my family's schedule) was promised a 30-45 minute deliver time for my thin crust pizza on a Monday night. Has been an hour and 15 mins and still no signs of a delivery guy, called 3 times and was told the pizza would be here in seconds, and still have nothing. 

Such a bummer for a place we have enjoyed every week since it has been opened.

*** please do not let this deter you from trying pizza Barra. The staff and food are phenomenal

Pizza is GREAT! But the service sucks! I'm quite surprised by this since this is a Labriola owned restaurant.  Stopped in for lunch during the week and it was busy but it was mostly groups of people out with co-workers.  We didn't get any silverware, waited for ever with refills & the wait staff was no where to be found. You would think they were bringing out the food right?  Nope....the  kitchen does that so I'm not even sure what the waitresses were doing the whole time. It was so bizarre. But the pizza was excellent (tried a thin crust) and we also got calamari. Which was also pretty good. Thank god the manager was walking around because he is the one who pretty much waited on us.

Definitely won't be back. For the 2nd time coming to the bar and ordering to go, the food had taken an extremely long time. Thought the first time was growing pains of a new restaurant but unfortunately had the same experience twice.  Good luck...

I've been here a few times now and ordered each of the pizza types.  The Chicago thin is a good pizza that compares well with the gold standard: Q's.  The sauce is flavorful and the crust crispy.  The deep dish is also good and the sausage is great to have.  The build your own is nice and they have a good selection of toppings.  The coal-fired offerings are an odd lot.  I really didn't find any of them to my liking.  That being the case I ordered a simple cheese version.  The pie was good, but not spectacular.

Born and raised in Chicago. Best deep dish pizza! We were pleasantly surprised at how AMAZING the pizza tasted! It is a must try for all pizza lovers! Looking to schedule future parties there in the future.

Customer service is awful. Went at 9 pm on a Tuesday night with my daughter. The place was empty, maybe two tables eating. Saw at least 5 employees sitting around but no1 would take our order.
