Then when a server arrived, I requested a hockey game to be played on one of the 3 tv's I saw. The game never came on so I inquired. The waitress said that the carry out guy was too busy! No joke! Also, while we were eating no1 came by to ask how we were doing.  Absurd, and won't return. These pizza joints are a dime a dozen, go to a different one!

Had high hopes for this new place, but between the horrific service and outrageous prices, I just don't think this place will make it.  Agree with others that the interior is nice and the food was good, but it's just not worth the frustration of "worst in class" service and feeling ripped off from paying too much (including having to pay full price for soft drink refills which is pretty much unheard of).  I would point you to their website to check prices yourself but they don't apparently have one.  Another sign this place isn't here for the long haul.  It's unfortunate.

They are so nice! I learned about them when one of their coworker came in to give to Salon Sophia to give us a pizza to try. WE LOVED IT!!! The crust was crunchy just right and the sauce and topping DELICIOUS!

Service was awful. Bumbling through .
The tomato soup was thick marinara in a bowl and i couldn't even swallow a spoonful. 
Took 40 minutes for our food 40. And te place was pretty much empty. 
Pizza order was wrong and they forgot to make thick crust. Both were thin 
One pizza was good but not great and second pizza ground beef was so poorly seasoned we didn't like it at all .
Cheese pizza was also pretty boring 
Nice manager , comfused waitress...just okay pizza. You can do takeout if need be.

Edit: my family has tried this place again and it has improved ! Hooray !

Really wanted to love the spot...its sibling la briola is wonderful. Space is large industrial chic. Inviting outdoor patio. Food? Needs an overhaul. Fried calamari was greasy and room temperature, though quite tender. Pasta was wonderful. Pizza, their raison d'etre? Actively horrid. Clam and pancetta pizza, which sounded delightful, was a sodden, greasy gloppy mess, with an undercooked crust. And expensive. While I could see clams, I couldn't taste them. Doubt we'll be back....
Although the food was good our pizza was over cooked and a bit dry! Our service was terrible!! Not sure if we would return because of it! It's too bad...
Love the restaurant love the food love the service. I come here quite often to get my sugar fix and they always accommodate!

My friend and I decided to go to Baker's Square on Wednesday for the free pie promotion. We walked in, didn't see anyone, and waited to be greeted. Eventually a girl came out of the side kitchen and told us she'd be with us in a minute, so we waited some more time. 

Finally we sit down and before we can even settle in, our server Debbie rushes towards and nearly screaming asked us what we would like to drink. She brings back the drinks and still screaming rushes us to order. We were not ready so we asked for a few more minutes so she disappeared for 10 minutes. She eventually came back and we ordered our food. I asked her about the potato pancakes they have as a side and she said, "DON'T ORDER THOSE," still screaming obviously. Apparently, they were supposed to be discontinued- which I understand but telling a guest NOT TO ORDER THOSE, is not as nice as saying unfortunately, those were discontinued. 

We finally order as Debbie is itching to get away from the table, mind you, there were only a few tables in the whole place, and she again disappears. The food was decent but took forever, even though the place was practically empty. And when the food arrived she slammed it onto the table. A little while into our dinner, another table is sat right next to ours and here comes Debbie shouting at them as well. She is shouting to the point that we had to pause conversation until she walked away from the table next to ours! 

We finish our food and wait for her to come back to see if we needed anything else, but instead, she drops the check off. We asked to pay separately and for a slice of pie to go and she looked peeved! She comes back, two checks and a pie slice in hand, and slams it on the table. 

Baker's Square is good, I love the food and pies but the service there is outrageous. As we were sitting, we saw people come in and stand their confused as they waited to be greeted. Debbie inattentive, not very friendly, and way too loud. You can really tell that none of the staff cares at all. Management really needs to retrain their staff and pay attention to the reviews on here.

I can't comment on the food, but that is because the group of five people I was with left after sitting in a booth for 15 minutes without a single employee talking to us.

There was a huge group of employees talking in a circle by a shabby looking lunch counter, and the ginger-haired manager with an earpiece was one of them. They looked like they were too busy talking about their divorces or other life disappointments. Some blonde lady and her small child were in the circle of fun, too. I am not sure if these managers and employees were confused as to where they were, but they definitely were not in the mood to work. There were a bunch of other customers standing up front who also hadn't been helped. We decided to cut our losses and go to Colonial.

The worst part was multiple employees made eye contact with us, but they just went back to picking their wedge or talking amongst themselves. There were less than ten people seated and more than ten employees, so I can't imagine how this place makes any money-especially when a huge percentage of their sales just walked out the door.

Baker's Square-just close down if you don't want to be bothered with customers.

I had a lunch meeting with my friend last week here. The food was great! Waitress seems slow but friendly. The only thing i dont really like to this place is their bathroom is so dirty! It is smelly and dirty toilet seats! I can smell it from outside before entering the bathroom! When I used to live in Naperville this used to be nice place. I think the bathroom should be clean!

Is the proof in the pudding or the PIE?  wait a minute wheres the Pudding  under all this whip cream?  does bakers square make the cut?  well see....in my review

This was a last minute decision as me and wifey went to bed bath and beyond and the bakers square is across the street. I must admit I was excited to try something different..
Ill start off by saying the place is very clean, and the menu has ALOT of selections..I asked the waitres if the coffee was good,, she said ohh yea very good,, considering we are from costa rica which carries top of the line coffee, I thought wed try it..This coffee was WELL BELOW  the 2.50 /person they charge,, one thing I will say is bakers square  is VERY pricey  and although the food was tasty, the portions are VERY SMALL...AND ANOTHER company nickel and dimming you for each item you put on , I asked for the order of  hasbrowns , and I kid you not I was gone in 4 spoons charged me 49 cents for onions.

The order: I felt like breakfast I had the 7.89 4 pick  3 eggs  hashbrowns, chocolate pancakes, and  strawberry crepes.  Wifey had for 9.79 3 chicken tenders ,fries ,and veggies  all real small portions ,, and my wife doesn't eat a lot.., add 3.99 for a small house salad and pie..

The outcome:  my breakfast was similar to what I ordered at nikkarys see review below, and wanted to compare.  The eggs were good, and even DECENT amount , the hashbrowns  were SMALL, the crepes  were SMALLER, and the beef patty was good...clocking my 7.79 advertised order to over 13 bucks with the add ons..still SMALL...

Wifey, said hers was good  but just small...we had 2 slices of pie I had the French silk, I was NOT impressed I thought they made the pies fresh  .. they do not they have them ordered from popin fresh...The waitress asked me how the meal was, the service was just OK, felt like we wernt very welcomed. 

The verdict:  This place is good taste  waaay overpriced for SMALL portions...I received the bill I spotted an error,, the waitress said the computer just charges 29 cents more for the extra egg, when the menu says completely different , the waitress should not of asked me what I thought because as she did I was honest ,, and that almost started an argument about how THEIR pies are the best and they sell to other companies,  my wife back in the day worked for CoCos who made their own pies  FRESH  ...people these pies are NOT fresh...my pie was not at all presented  well.. So I get to the register and explained to the assistant manager,, and she credited the 20 cents....they don't have good customer service at all.....

Final THOUGHT:   we will not be going here again.. I don't care if this place has award winning pies they are not fresh, and the service and also management are not humble...I will spend my money elsewhere and get better value...can anyone say  Shinto..??  lol

Where was the welcome? I think the host can try to acknowledge people as they stand there waiting for a table which took too long! It seems like one of the biggest and rudest gestures. But then, it doesnt end there. 
The waitress was friendly but slow. Not sure if the kitchen means to make a table order half way through and leave other items pending. So while my daughter happily ate her pancake, my son sat there watching her enjoy it while he waited for his. My husband waited a while for his whip cream too. 
The whole visit was long and dreadful. I feared asking for ketchup or anything. I thought it would just take too long to get.
 I think this was our first and last visit here. Most staff there need people skills. You never tell a customer, "ok, just wait. They have me running around everywhere." It is your job!

Going on about what Idabela V. said below, we had Debbie as well and she was VERY loud when the restaurant was almost empty. We sat and ordered, the food came out at different times, she completely forgot about our pies until I had to reminder TWICE and then I had to wait 10 minutes to pay.

Service was not timely.  Took too long to get seated.  Took too long to take the initial drink order.  After waiting for an extended period of time, had to remind the waitress to bring our drinks.  Serving 101. Failed

My family and I have been coming here for YEARS (I'm talking at least 15 years.) 
1. Great food, great selection, many combination offers. Affordable. 
2. Free pie night on Wednesday. (Buy your meal, you get a free slice of pie to go with it.)
3. Employees are nice, easy to talk to, good at their jobs, attentive, and they care about their customers. (They actually know our order by heart, we come every week) 
4. The restaurant is clean, with a nice layout and fairly comfortable. 
5. It's in a nice location, right by the mall and so many other shops and businesses. 
6. You can place a pie order and pick it up all year round. 

Basically, go here. :)
food is ok. Pancake not so sweet which is good. Salad not so fresh. I want to try the pie, which looks yummy.

Came here for my boyfriends birthday breakfast (mainly because he is a huge pie lover) 
HORRIBLE IDEA. Service was absolutely TERRIBLE. I was appalled.
We were sitting for about 30-40 mins before our order was even taken. Our waitress was unfriendly and cool, until the very end, when I'm sure she was sensing my irritation. 
We did not get our food until an hour and a half after we arrived at the restaurant. The food was slightly warm at best, as if it had been sitting for awhile, and when it was FINALLY delivered, the waitress attempted to make a joke that it had taken so long because I had gone to the pie counter...!!! 
Speaking of the pie counter--On top of all of this, I tried to go up to the counter to get a slice of pie (from a pie I had ALREADY preordered and purchased) to be delivered to our table for the Birthday we were trying to celebrate, and they were so unorganized they were completely incompetent of doing this.  Not able or willing to understand. It was unbelievable. 
Nearing the two hour mark, and after eating the food that was worse than my college's cafeteria, we asked to have the pie to go, and left.  
This was my first and most definitely LAST time ever going to Baker's Square.  
DO NOT GO HERE. I would give it zero stars if I could.
Thank goodness my boyfriend was understanding for a ruined birthday morning.

The food at this place is actually delicious. The veggies and potatoes are juicy and fresh in the skillets. The pancake batter they use is something special because the cakes are super tasty . The menu is small so if you like a menupedia to chose from then you'll be disappointed. I'm not sure about lunch food quality. I only ate breakfast here twice. 

What made me laugh is the employee who rang us out at the register. I asked her split the check down the middle, so she called up another employee and this woman gave me an elaborate response about how it's not possible to split down the middle because she would need to use the calculator on her phone and then her manager will see her on the phone and she will get in trouble so the only way she can split it is to charge us per the seat. Note: If you want to evenly split the check then be sure to bring your own calculator!

I just called to ask if they had a certain pie and was told in a very rude tone that she had 10 customers waiting and couldn't answer my question?  I just wanted to know before I made the drive if they had a certain pie.  Guess I will take my business elsewhere.  I don't care how good your pies are, the service is HORRIBLE!
Wanted to update my review. I wasn't happy with the food but the owner sent me a coupon for another try and I'm satisfied. I will continue to only get my pies at bakers square.

I've been going to this location for years since my kids love it. I've never had a terrible experience. The food is average, reasonably priced and the pie is always great. I almost always have breakfast. Today I had their pick 4 breakfast special. I got 2 eggs, country style potatoes, bacon (for my little one) and a strawberry crepe. All that for 7.00 or so. I love their country potatoes, they are well seasoned and just delish. The service there is either hit or miss. They have the sweetest servers and then there's the average. Today I had average, she wasn't very friendly, she did her job though but I've had better. I heard her ask all of her tables if they had room for pie, but she didnt ask me and just brought me my check . I LOVE Their apple pie and I either get a slice to eat there or to go. Today I was planning on getting 3 slices, one for me and my daughters. It would have been nice to get asked, I'm not sure why she didnt ask me, I had to asl her for pie. And I bought a french silk pie to go. 
I will always eat at Bakers Square, their pie is just too good. Yum

I love baker square pies !  The one by my house closed so this is the closest one.  The service here is terrible.  I walked in and the lady asked if I wanted to dine in or carry out.  I told her carry out so she didn't say anything and walked away.  So I stood in line at the cashiers area waiting to be helped.  Then the lady at the counter asked "what do you want?" In an impatient tone of voice.  I don't know what was wrong with the employees here.   I told her I wanted to place an order to go and asked to see a menu.  She gave me this mean look and threw a menu on the table for me to look at.  If it wasn't for the pie I would have walked out and ordered a salad somewhere else.  I waited about 20 minutes for a salad.  The restaurant wasn't even busy.  I will never go to this location again.  What a disappointment.   Horrible attitude.  They need better training. No wonder a lot of locations closed.   Well after writing the review above I received a message from the customer relations person Matt.  It's nice that they monitor the review but they really need to do something about it.  I read some previous ones and a lot of it complained about the service.  The food is great there.   I am giving it an extra star because at least they are trying to improve.

We stopped in tonight after eating dinner across the street because we wanted dessert. 

When we came in it was hard to figure out where to go. There was a check out counter with several people in line, a large table displaying pies right in the middle of the waiting area, two large parties who looked like they were leaving on the booths, and on the other side of this large assembly, an unmanned hostess stand. We didn't spot said hostess stand until a few people cleared out, and then it was hard to navigate to it because of the displays and people. 

Once we got to the hostess stand we waited a couple of minutes before a supervisor came and seated us. She handed us menus and took our drink orders, which seemed odd, but we played along. When she came back with our drinks we ordered our pie slices with her, and I was just assuming she was both supervisor and waiter on top of hostessing. I found out I was wrong when our actual waiter came over and threw our plates on the table and walked away. I'd love to tell you this gentleman's name, but he never gave it to me. 

We were then ignored for the next 40 minutes when he finally came back and asked if we'd like our check. We'd planned on purchasing a pie to go, but I just couldn't bring myself to interact with this man any longer than we had to, so we just told him yes. 

Now it was our turn to clutter up the entranceway, while we waited several minutes for someone to come to the register so we could pay. Everyone in the building seemed to be doing several jobs at once and I'm not sure if it's because they were short staffed or if it was bad management. 

The pie was great though. Normally we buy whole pies for the holidays and I think from now on we're going to stick to that pattern and get our date night pie elsewhere.
Decent breakfast. Everything seemed freshly made.Would Like to try other pies made at this place.

In search of a pumpkin pie at 8pm thanksgiving night, we stumbled upon bakers square. They closed right at 8 and when we got to the door at 8:02 it was locked. Devastated, my dad called saying we re right out front we see people inside we just need a pie to go. The wonderful young manager let us in and we were in and out in no time. What a wonderful way to end thanksgiving night. Thank you!!

Been a customer here for many years, and have to say that corporate management is making awful menu decisions lately.  

Most recently they actually stopped offering oat bran bread as a choice of bread for sandwiches.  Seriously how hard is it to buy a loaf of oat bran bread and stick it on a shelf with the other bread?!  The other bread options (wheat, rye, white) just don't do it for me, so won't be coming back here for sandwiches anymore.

They also discontinued the apple walnut salad sandwich which was always a favorite of my mom's, and prior to these last two bad decisions they also discontinued the Shrimp Feast where you used to be able to get 13 fried shrimp.

Although the interior of the restaurant is generally clean and comfortable, service is usually below average, and the menu.... Well it used to be good but now I just have a hard time finding anything worth eating here anymore other than the pies!  From what I can tell corporate management ignores feedback so not expecting improvement in the menu anytime soon.  Vote with your wallet, as they say!

I love this place, and am very disappointed I live far enough to where I cannot enjoy this place as often as I'd like to.  Honestly I'm not a Pie guy, but i love the food they serve whether it's breakfast or lunch or dinner. The best thing in the menu in my opinion is the homemade Mac and cheese. It has bacon, bread crumbs , different kinds of cheese sauces and for a little extra you can add a fried chicken breast. It's never packed so you'll get your food quickly and if you check the paper you'll find coupons occasionally.

I frequent the Square about four times a month. With that said, I'm an expert at this place - because I've been going here for about 10-20 years - even prior to the remodel.  I've been going solid  - for the last five years.  I had quit going prior to that because of a bad server.   No matter what time of day it's a good place for food!  The breakfast is amazing, not a bad dish on the menu...and don't get me started about the pie - it's to DIE for!!!  I'm a big fan of the pot pie, which is my all time favorite.  I LOVE the flakey top crust and the Turkey Pot Pie is my favorite comfort food.  I generally go on the weekend and our server for about five years is Terry!!  She is by FAR the best in the place.  When she is serving our table  - your experience is top notch!  They have an awesome 8oz steak for about $11 bucks and it's always cooked to your order.  They are little light on the serving for the fries, but can you ever have enough fries - so if they short you just tell them about it and they will bring you out some more. I don't really ever remember having to send anything back...It's that good.  I've given this place a five stars because overall the food is great, service is superb and it's consistent and always clean.  They have great sourdough toast and the country fried steak and gravy are to die for.  The salad and fruit is always super fresh.  They have reasonable combo meals with the PIE - the strawberry rhubarb is my favorite - alamode - heated just a little with the ice cream on the side.  I've eaten here at Thanksgiving too - and It's pretty AWESOME!!!   

The only down side however is the manager always seems to have an attitude - and he's a complete jerk - but I just try to avoid him.  Keep him away from the customers and away from the register  - and you will be fine.  That's always been my only complaint.  I don't have to give you his name - because if you go there  - you will be able to tell right away who he is.  Be particular too about the server - because they are not created equal.  Ask for Terry first, then Jennifer and you should be fine for breakfast  - in the evening it's a crap shoot, but the food is always good.

Who doesn't love Bakers Square's pies?! There are all kinds of varieties so I dunno if it's possible! The service at this Bakers Square has been excellent. The waitresses have always been very polite and very attentive. Both attributes I can appreciate!

The food on the otherhand, it's not bad... Not the best but not bad. I feel like they have changed the menu every time I go back in and it's stuff that is not too intersting. But, that's a small price to pay for the pie. And yes, I know I can just purchase the pie to go but, the Limeade is pretty good. So I can live with alright food, good limeaid and fantastic pie each time the mood strikes for Bakers Square!

The food here is adequate for the price. Nothing outstanding, but nothing awful, either. The problem with this restaurant is the service. It is always hit or miss. They should change the name of this restaurant to "Las Vegas", since you will always gamble on the service. Some of the wait staff are excellent. The Latino gentleman (Marcellino?) is an example of a great waitperson. It's unfortunate Baker's Square can't clone him. Other waitpersons here act as if they are doing you a favor waiting on you. That attitude can extend to the hosts as well. Today, I asked the host (the guy who looks like he has a dead animal growing out of the top of his head) for some assistance paying our bill, and he told me I had to wait in line for the cashier rather than offer assistance himself. There were ten people in line in front of me, but the host couldn't be bothered. Instead, he stood there the entire time twirling flowers in his hands (it is Mother's Day today) watching the counter staff be overwhelmed. Quite a bad overall image. Inconsistent service is a sign of apathetic management and reflects poorly on the overall image of the restaurant.  This is an issue that can be easily solved if management teaches employees to be motivated to assist customers. That's the difference between a successful restaurant, and the restaurant you patronize only as a last resort, if at all.
Food here is bad.Server was nice she was just training.Food here is bad.the bathrooms were a tad outdated and musty.The food here is bad.

Eating at Bakers Square is the culinary equivalent of visiting your elderly granny.  I was dragged here by some coworkers and from the moment I stepped through the door I had flashbacks to my childhood trips downstate to visit my granny, doing anything to stave off boredom while she watched Lawrence Welk and napped.  In my grannies defense her cooking was a lot better than the slop at Bakers Square

LOVE THE FOOD HERE! (especially the pies) Who doesn't love Bakers Square!

I was very happy to find out that they still do the free pie day on Wednesdays after 8pm...if you order any drink, you get a free slice of pie! Hubby and I have already been here twice just to get the free pies after 8pm on Wednesday nights. 

I also really love their new flatbread salads and sandwiches--a great low carb option for lunch or dinner.

Love Benedict...yummmm
its a bit out of my way, but i just love the Eggs Benedict here. The wait staff is attentive and very friendly. And once in a while, i have room for a slice if my favorite pie, Lemon Supreme.

I have always loved Baker's Square and was so disappointed when all the Baker's closed near where I live. It was my favorite place to meet friends over my lunch hour and I felt kind of lost when they closed the Wheaton, Villa Park and Downers Grove locations.

Last weekend I was at a class in Aurora and on my way I passed this Baker's Square. I daydreamed about their stir fry salad throughout the class and decided to stop on my way home, even though I was by myself.

I was nicely greeted, asked if I preferred a booth or a table (booth!) and was seated right away. The restaurant was pretty crowded at 1:30 on a Saturday. It was bright and sunny inside, clean and looked much nicer than the locations I used to go to. My waitress was very pleasant, was patient with my excitement that they still have my stir fry chicken salad, and even was willing to ask the cook to prepare it like I used to ask the Wheaton location to prepare it for me (no mushrooms, light on the sauce, no dressing). She was very kind and accomodating. It came out very quickly, with tons of chicken and colorful vegetables over the lettuce and was even better than I remembered it. I was in heaven! They now serve foccacia bread on the side and that was good too. 

They had changed their menu quite a bit in the past couple of years but still had my standby choices- the stir fry chicken salad and the chicken caesar salad. I think that little pie flip thing with pictures is genious- I wonder if people ever leave without ordering some kind of pie after looking through all those pictures and descriptions! 

I ordered a piece of triple berry pie for me and a slice of strawberry rhubarb for my husband to go and they were nice sized pieces.

My server brought me my pie and check quickly. 

I was certainly not disappointed. I know it's a chain and so maybe I'm lame for thinking it's so awesome, but I am not ashamed!  :)

We went to this place not too long ago.  I really wanted to like it, but there was nothing god about it.  The service was ok, not horrible but not outstanding.  The food however was not worth what we paid.  They claim they have great pies, but our pie had no flavor, nothing great.  We won't be returning to this place.

We walked past 5-6 dirty tables while Employee's Were folding children's menus.. Took 10 minutes to see our server walked two different people told us that our server would be with us in a minute, and they noticed us sitting and sitting... Pie was good that's why we gave you two stars.. Coffee was old and had a chemical flavor the. coffee pot that was laid on our table for our convenience ( or server not tty o be bothered with us? was filthy!!!..... After we were done we set another 10 to 15 minutes looking for our server for our check to leave finally had to ask another server for us to find Stanley.. He was present but he was extremely unattentive....... Once in awhile we have a craving for delicious pie but its so sad whenever we go to this location it has filthy tables filthy utensils or coffee pots and noticeably bad service every time... It doesn't help when you see so many employees just standing around having a good time with each other.. Instead of taking care of business.

I have to say that this place is great, fairly priced and clean!!!! 
The food is good, the service is good and of course the PIE IS GOOD!

There are not many Baker's Squares around anymore and this one is so well cared for, the management cares and the waitstaff works really hard to make sure that you have what you need.  The menu is simple but pretty darn YUMMY, we love going here!

This place is not worth the trip. To begin with our server Sammy was horrible.  Were do I even begin with this story. She was rude and inattentive,  she literally put down our menu and asked us to order. She never once checked on us throughout the evening and charged me three dollars for a drink and never refilled it. She seemed on edge this entire time we were there and I couldn't wait to get the check. 

The food was not worth the money and most definitely not worth the calories.  It makes sense why most baker squares have closed if the normal experience was even close to this

One of the last few locations open that I know of...!  I hope this store stays open for a long time because no pies remind me of 'home' like Bakers Square pies.  

Favorite Pies:
When picking up pies for parties, we usually get banana cream pie or strawberry pie (huge berries!).  If we have a craving for sweet, nothing beats the oh-so-yummy french silk.

Atmosphere and Service:
This weekend I dined in for an afternoon catch up session with a friend.  We were intrigued by some of the new menu items, but in the end enjoyed sodas and pie slices.  (I had a pomegranate limeade and a peanut butter cream pie.  Odd pair, but still tasty!). The waitress was friendly and patient. Overall, it was the perfect casual place to relax and chat.

Why Not 5 Stars?
I gave a rating of 4 stars instead 5 because the place felt a little worn down and could benefit from some newer furniture or/and decor.

Ok so yesterday me and my parents decided to have breakfast here because last time we came the good and the service was very good. So with out hesitating we came here again for another delicious breakfast. Well, it turns out that we were wrong! The service was awful. The lady who waited us was grouchy and seemed like didn't care at all of what she was doing. Anyway, I could care less if she gave us good service or not because it's her reputation after all, but what I was looking forward was some delicious food. She comes takes our order and for this one I order the egg white veggie omelet(something supposedly healthy) so I wait and the food comes out, then I see my omelet and it's draining oil by the gallon! Then I grab a napkin and try to take some oil out of it by pressing down on it and letting the napkin absorb all the oil. So when I do that, I see a big puddle of oil forming on the plate of how much oil was coming out of it! And did I mention it was a "healthy" egg white omelet? Well I think she must of got the wrong order cause I did not order eggs and veggies soaked in oil! Never coming back to this place again! A bakers square just closed down by my house I hope they close this one as well. People don't need plates full if oil and free pie Wednesday won't compensate this disgusting food!

I wasn't a fan of Baker's Square a few years back, besides the pies. But their menu has vastly improved. I love the quisches - especially the (sadly discontinued) cheddar apple quische!

 The four square breakfast is a GREAT deal, where you can pick 4 menu items for $6.95 - which is amazing for someone as indecisive as me.  So I can have an omelette AND crepes without having to spend big for 2 meals and end up with leftovers I'd probably have to throw away.

I've also been impressed with the decor at this Baker's Square - MUCH nicer than Baker's Square of old, which are now mostly all gone.

French silk pie yum!!!
This is the last bakers square in a 15 to 20 mile radius that I know of... next one in lagrange and another one by kingery rt 83.

You get a free slice of pie with any entree purchase on Wednesdays! SCORE!!! I love me some pie!!!! =)

The French Apple Cheese Cake Pie is a slice of heaven!!!!!   Num num num num!!! 

3 stars cuz the service sucked, and the butternut squash soup was kinda gross. 

Open till midnight on weekends! I think 10 or 11 every other night.

They remodeled and I've been there since about three times. You feel like they've upgraded their hygiene standards as well. I just feel bad for them because almost no one ever is in there for dinner.

This really is worth your time, not only because of the way awesome pies, but also because they have some good stuff on their menu that doesn't taste prefabricated, oversalted, or uncared for.

Very friendly staff who try. Get some pie if nothing else.. I don't want them to close and have to go all the way to Butterfield in DG for pie for goodness sakes! ;oP

Also, don't wait to be noticed, that's the wallflower way. If you want service make sure you step forward and get it.

While wee like the restaurant their online program stinks.   I joined the online program and received an online coupon for buy one get one free. What stinks is that they wouldn't accept a copy with the coupon code from my iPhone or iPad.   The cashier was very snooty and said us MUST be a printed copy so she could staple it to the bill.   "we don't do that electronics stuff".   Well Bakers Square needs to get with the times, really?   I don't have access to a printer, the code was clearly displayed and yet NOPE!   And NOT the least bit nice about it either.

I think I will skip the free offer, unenroll from their online program and spend my money someplace else.   

So Bakers Square, when you decide to join the current world, text me.
Very good selections. Very nice service at a reasonable price. Waitress was very helpful.

They supposedly upgraded this location?? The menu is the same as others. Their hostess, possible manager has a personality of a dead fish! She was very unfriendly and uninviting! We weren't even greeted, we had to make a move to get noticed. I remember when Baker's Square was a decent place to grab a bite, now most of them are terribly managed, dirty and very disorganized!
I heart Bakers Square. I just don't like the Naperville one. Their service isn't very good. Food is decent but its a chain.

I come here pretty frequently for breakfast with my girlfriends. They get packed on Sunday mornings so here are a few tips...
- They don't take reservations
- Call 30 minutes before you arrive to put your name on the list. I do this every time and wait about 5 minutes before our table for 4 is ready
- They have complimentary coffee for people waiting
- There is a good amount of seats while you wait but there are almost always people standing also

The food is always yummy. They give you great portion sizes. Sometimes the service is a little slow, but with a packed house I think they do just fine.

The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the coffee. It's not the best IMO. Otherwise a great place for a good meal.

This review is based on one visit.  After having one breakfast at the Marriott I decided that I would venture out going forward.  This restaurant came up on my Yelp search for breakfast in the area.  This place is easily seen from Butterfield but is on an interior road.

I entered the restaurant and really liked the dcor.  It was large but quaint and cozy without being hot.  Someone really put the time and effort into this place.  I was greeted and seated immediately. I opened the menu and observed what looks to be a typical breakfast menu but I did notice that they had several poached egg dishes.

I was greeted by my server and was given a coffee pot just for my table.  I placed my order and a short while later my food arrived.  The food looked good and tasted good also.  I had eggs, hash browns, bacon, Canadian Bacon and pancakes. I even got a to-go cup for my coffee.  I know breakfast is hard to screw up so I wish I could have had the chance to eat lunch here.     

Overall, The food was good, the service was good and the prices were fair.

Exceptional customer service! I had a bad experience with the Bolingbrook location and refused to take my family- group of 15 there! Called Downers location and the manager Suzanne was a breath of fresh air--very accommodating and made sure my group was well taken care of. The waiters, especially Lauren Mason was also very nice a patient. Nothing but good things to say about this staff and my vist on 10/15/16! Thanks again!!

SN. see my review on the Bolingbrook location..total opposite of this one!

I ordered the Apple/ Walnut pancakes and they were OK but nothing special.  You can order real maple syrup for a $1.50 up charge which I appreciate.  Service was very slow even though few tables were occupied.  I'm glad that my fellow diner and I were not in a big hurry.
Honey Jam is OK but you can do better at most neighborhood diners.

Best breakfast place in the area. The hostess was friendly and accurate with wait times. Our sever Lauren was awesome. She was very friendly and checked on us multiple times. Our food was excellent and was served quickly. I highly recommend Honey Jam for breakfast or lunch. We will definitely be back!

The food is just ok but this is a great family restaurant, which is what earned this place 4 stars. They have free, self-serve coffee as you wait. And it's delicious! We were seated pretty fast on a Saturday morning for 3 adults and 2 children. And yes it was crowded. 

Debbie was our server and she was great! She engaged the children and offered to take their food orders first so they wouldn't get too antsy. How thoughtful! And their food arrived in perfect time! Debbie offered us coffee to go as well. 

Our food didn't take long either. All of the staff is extremely friendly, which just made it such a great experience. I would come here again just for the experience! 

FYI: it has its own parking lot.
I have been going here for about four years now, and I still go back at least twice a month,  food it's excellent and the service is wonderful,  Suzanne and Hanah are always great!!

First time to eat at Honey JAM. I was pleasantly amazed by the dining experience. First, the decor and ambiance are wonderful. Service was outstanding. The menu is unbelievable, tremendous variety and makes your mouth water. Most important the food was simply delicious. Overall, a great experience. I recommend this restaurant to all, and the prices were reasonable. Definitely going back many times, this will become my favorite eating place.

I had high hopes for this restaurant that I understand is part of the Portillos chain. The menu is typically priced for breakfast fare- about $9 for an omelette with hash browns (or grits/fruit) & toast (or pancakes). I had the worst omelette I've ever had. With the choice of 3 ingredients, I chose pepper jack cheese, spinach, and bacon. The very dry mixture was fairly tasteless with the cheese poured on top. The pancakes were ok- clearly from a mediocre mix. The hash browns were luke warm and under-done. I'd recommend plenty of other places in this same area for breakfast and avoid this one.

Haven't eaten here for a long time, being loyal to my favorite breakfast place. Not so great some of the reviews also kept me away, but it was time to see myself if anything changed, so there!
The restaurant was packed but atmosphere calm. The service was very good, our waitress smiling and very pleasant. Our food came out fast , coffee thermos on the table let me have refills (too many) on demand. 
My BFF ordered Ham & Egg Croissant, hard to screw up (unless someone REALLY wants to). I got Biscuits & Gravy. It suppose to be "freshly baked biscuits", too bad the menu doesn't specify what day they were fresh . Gravy was very bland but kudos to perfectly cooked poached eggs. 
Will I return? Hmm...

I had no idea that Honey Jam was owned by Portillo's but it makes sense since they are located literally across the street from a Portillo's.  Service was great; our waitress was efficient, friendly, and very helpful!  My friend wanted to order the chicken and waffles but our waitress warned him beforehand not to order it and I thank her for that!  

Food was so-so, not the best breakfast food I've had but it did the job.  I ordered the Philly skillet (of course I got a skillet) and my friend got the Meat and Two Eggs.  Our food came out almost immediately after ordering which makes me a bit skeptical of how fresh it is.  My skillet was alright but was definitely lacking flavor, it was mostly made up of onions and peppers and little bits of thinly sliced beef.  I think he was satisfied with his dish since you really can't screw up scrambled eggs and sausages.  

Honey Jam is a step up from IHOP but can't compare to my favorite Egg Harbor Cafe.
Great service thanks to Jorge. You made our experience fantastic. And to Hannah for visiting our table to make sure everything went well.  I highly suggest the Dutch baby it's worth the 25 min wait.

Stopped in for the first time and was excited to try this place. Ordered the strawberries and cream cheese french toast with the Philly skillet. The presentation was poor and the meat tasted very cheap. The waiter was nice and told his manager we weren't pleased with anything we ordered. Manager didn't come over to talk to us. If the manager doesn't care, neither do we.

Went here in June 2014 on trip to Chicagoland and it wss very good.  So we decided to return again in March 2016 (twice in 2 days).

My wife and I have each ordered a different thing each of our 3 times here, which means we have combined to have 6 different entrees, the commonality between them is that all were expertly prepared and presented.

I would highly recommend the Banana-Blueberry Crunch Cakes or the Breakfast Burrito.

Service is fast and friendly.

I remember really liking Honey Jam about 3 years ago, so I decided to meet up with a friend here one Saturday morning for Breakfast. I honestly don't remember why I liked this place. 

Don't get me wrong: the ambiance of the restaurant itself is cozy. It feels like you're in a really large cottage dining with a large family with the way the place is designed inside and their decoration choice. When it comes to the food itself, I just wasn't impressed at all. 

My friend got the potatoe pancakes which ended up looking exactly like hash brown patties served with sour cream and applesauce. I felt so bad because she was super excited to have potatoe pancakes since she hadn't had them in a long time. I just couldn't believe the small portion compared to the price. I was embarrassed that I even suggested the place when I saw her plate. 

I got an omelette which was just bland and mediocre at best. There was just nothing exciting about this experience at all. Maybe we caught them on an off day, but I don't think I'd ever give them a second try. Especially since we dropped a pretty penny for food that just wasn't very good at all. 

I've been to way better breakfast places - I would recommend going somewhere else if you're craving a good breakfast.

There are not enough competing brunch spots in that area to go to  so Honey Jam Cafe will have to do. For how cute it is inside, the service could be better and same goes with the food. I would say it is more inconsistent than anything. 

I've been here about 4 or 5 times, and each time I leave feeling underwhelmed with what I ate. Especially my most recent experience. Our waitress was kind and friendly but forgot about us a lot, and that isn't the first time this has happened here. 

The sweet foods are way better than their savory dishes. I made the mistake of ordering a skillet the last time; it was NOT good at all. The potatoes were overcooked, dry and bland, and the toppings were not mixed well in the skillet. All the spinach was shoved to one side, like a mini salad on the left of the skillet. There was hardly any cheese and the tomatoes were not fresh and did not compliment the skillet like you would expect. I was severely disappointed with the dish. I dowsed it with hot sauce and ketchup to try to get more flavor and salvage the skillet.  The crepes my friend ordered were actually very tasty and I would definitely order those again. 

I've also ordered french toast and the cinnamon roll french toast in the past and thoroughly enjoyed those dishes in the past. 

I haven't tried their lunch items and maybe I will. It's a good spot to meet with people, the decor is nice, and the ambiance is chill.

Wasn't my favorite... a huge fan of Portillos and was happy to hear they had a breakfast spot.

Went out of my way to come here and well... it wasn't very good.

We eat at a different breakfast spot at least 6x/month and as you all know I either review a spot when I'm exceptionally pleased or disappointed.   

Son ordered off the children's menu and had a better plate than mine.  I'm shocked there's more than one location.  

I ordered the country fried steak and hash browns with eggs... just... not great.

The eggs were requested fried / over-hard and they came out slimey, "plasticy" and undercooked (the yolk especially).

The chai tea latte was the best thing I had the opportunity to taste... as little as it was for the price. 

Not a good experience, but it looks as if I'm not alone on how it went. 

The quantity in high ratings are here, but if you look at the reviews of those who are disappointed you will see how it all ties together. There's nothing here for a true Foodie, buy if you enjoy saying you ate at the place owned by Portillos... do you.

As expected nothing less than great everything. It was my first time at this location when I used to frequent the Bolingbrook location. The staff was friendly and our server was so great and came by once in a while to check in on us. Food is a no brainier here. I highly recommend omelettes or a Benedict or skillet with the marbled rye toast. Fresh and satisfying portions. I hope this place is open forever.

A perfect place for breakfast and brunch,almost crowded on weekends. I have been to many breakfast joints but never ever tasted some good waffles and French toast that i had here..
I have ordered Monkey waffle(with peanut butter,chocolate chips,chocolate syrup topped with banana and whipped cream) and Red Velvet French Toast with cream cheese, strawberry and chocolate sauce.. 
Trust me both were far beyond my expectations.. It was a heavenly experience.. 
Oh !! how can I forget the Sanfrancisco Chicken melt, the chicken was tender and juicy. Loved it !!!!
I must say this place don't deserve less than 5 but the service was not good.

Poor, lackadaisical service. I don't need much by the way of staff, but this kid was off. Made confident, but poor suggestions. If what he recommended were the better options on the menu, I don't want to know what the rest is like.

Too many better options in this area to waste your time here.

Honey Jam is part of the Portillos" family of restaurants. It serves breakfast and lunch with a brisk takeout service.  If you ordered coffee with your meal, they offer a "to go" cup which our server, Lauren ( who I noticed was mentioned in another review), says makes a great hand warmer.  My family and I usually go for breakfast.  However diners do have the option of ordering off the lunch menu even as early as 8:00 am.  I can vouch for this as sometimes a BLT with soup and onion rings does the trick for me.  The quality of the food is excellent and prices are comparable to other neighborhood places.  What puts it over the top is the service. Ask for Lauren  she is efficient, professional, and her smile will definitely have you smiling too.  She is a "people person" and you can tell she enjoys what she is doing!
P.S. Indulge in a muffin version of Portillos' chocolate cake.  It is so worth it! P.S.

I ordered the potato pancakes and eggs, I got 2 tiny frozen Mc Donalds looking hash browns, what a joke, $10 for a few frozen potatoes, just a hint, you make hash browns, it's basically that pressed in a pancake people, wtf, worst breakfast ever for a place that busy. I won't be back. If you can't make a potato pancake, don't put it on the menu.

Hello. Today on November 14th, at 12:15 pm was my first time dining in at Honey Jam and I had one of the worst experiences of my life. Our server rolled his eyes at us ( my boyfriend and I) when we repeated the order to him and still brought us the wrong order ( which was repeated twice). We let that go. He then brought us our check. As first time diners here we left the money on the table and exited the restaurant. As we were pulling out of the restaurant, Susan the manager ran after us and loudly in front of two other customers outside stated " YOU DID NOT PAY THE BILL." I stated right away that we did pay the bill and the money was on the table. There was no apology on her end a nothing else was said. She went back inside. I own my own business and can tell you that CUSTOMER SERVICE is huge. One, we received bad service from the server who made us feel uncomfortable anytime we asked for any additions. Two, not one person told us that the bill was to be paid up front. Three, before the general manager of a restaurant made such a huge assumption to tell us "we didn't pay our bill", should have checked the table first. Four, when I did call back to tell her how I felt, I received a very dry not so genuine apology.
Great service, quick breakfast food! The food was average, but better than other quick diners. Would recommend. Cold brew coffee was my favorite

The weekend line for breakfast would probably be what you'd expect.  You can easily expect to wait 30 minutes to an hour.  Lots of families and lots of kids.  Not a bad thing, but be prepared.

Service is okay.  Considering their typically swamped, it's not a surprise that they're running around like crazy, but again, be prepared to wait on simple things like refills on water and other beverages.

The food is on par with IHOP or Denny's.  You get better options, but the quality of the food is practically the same.  The only bonus is you get bigger portions, but you're also paying for them, so that definitely evens out.

Solid time out, good with families.  I have yet to try the lunch menu, but I'd imagine that it falls in line around the same quantity and quality.

The host seated us right away. I noticed immediately that the air conditioning had it cold in there, and I had to go back to the car to grab a jacket.  I heard a person at a nearby table comment that she was cold. 
My daughter and I both wanted breakfast, so we were focused on the breakfast options. The menu has a lot of choices, so there should be something for everyone. My daughter got an eggs benedict, and I got an omelet. My daughter loved her eggs benedict. She also got a side of chocolate chips pancakes. She really loved what she got. My omelet was decent. It was a little heavy on the ham and needed more cheese. All in all in was good. My hash browns were cold, but my pancakes were nice and fluffy. The prices are pretty standard for the area. 
The dcor is very quaint. The restaurant was clean. 
My waitress was friendly. She checked on us twice to see if we were ready to order. She was a little slow in bringing the check though. 
I would come here again.

Been excited to try this place an offshoot of Portillo's. 3 locations so far. Country version of Walker Bros. I like it! Warm, friendly inside. Initial service was very slow, nobody at the door to greet me. After that the service was excellent. Coffee was delicious. Eggs benedict and hashbrowns with hollandaise on the side. The eggs were huge and cooked perfectly, the hashbrowns were brownd just the way i liked them.

Had a working breakfast yesterday, it was quite packed even the parking lot was full on a weekday @ 7am. I asked the hostess if i could get some coffee and she said there are coffee pots on the table and we can help ourselves(minus points ). Everyone ordered their wide selection of breakfast options, i had the oldfashioned oatmeal. The portion sizes are huge but not the best. Another negative there is no butter on the tables, toast is prebuttered.

first visit to the honey jam cafe,my husband and I were throughly impressed our server Debbie was delightful, she commented that she loves her job, and it showed she was prompt, and very professional. the next time we are in the Downers Grove area we will visit this establishment again and I will be sure to request Debbie be our server.

This is one of the best cafes in Chicago.  It was very friendly and the service was outstanding.  The prices were really good for what you got.  I got the skillet and I wish I had a fridge in my hotel, so I could've taken what I couldn't eat back to it to eat later.  The portions were very good sized.  This is a good stop for a breakfast/brunch place if you are in the area.

Wonderful place to grab some lunch. I had a Mexican style omelet which was cooked to perfection. The pancakes are to die for. The fresh orange juice was on point. Staff is always friendly and there is ample seating and parking but typically there is a wait. I highly suggest stopping by this location for some Sunday brunch! Very family friendly which is a huge plus!

I'm a huge fan of weekend brunching. And I like to splurge and spoil myself a little bit when it comes to brunch.  

Cozy and homey, I like the ambiance of this place.  My recommendation is that you arrive there before 10am.  After that, you're really stuck waiting for a good 45 mins to an hour.

I'm going to gush about their waffles and french toast.  My favorite waffle has to be their Belgium Sundae waffle.  They serve a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream on top with chocolate sauce.  Mmmmm.  And the their strawberry cream cheese french toast is like magic.  So good.  I also really like their corned beef hash.  Overall, quality food, reasonable price.  Go get your breakfast on!

Great breakfast place out in the suburbs, I used to favor Blueberry Hill Cafe which is still a great place but after coming here, this might be my new favorite breakfast place and they have real amazing iced chai tea which is not offered in most places I have been to. I'm not a coffee drinker so having Iced Chai tea is always a bonus for me!

My first visit. We were seated quickly, but not asked to order for about 15-20 mins. The waitress messed up our orders. Some of the food wasn't hot/fresh. Someone I was with said this was her experience on a previous visit also. The waitress also disappeared for long periods of time and just wasn't on point. I had a philly steak skillet which was DELICIOUS, but she added cheese when I don't eat cheese and asked her not 2 add it. She offered to remake it but it took 30mins to get the 1st orders. I also had the specialty apple & cinnamon pancakes. DIDN'T LIKE THEM!!!! Prices weren't too bad. $50 for 4 people.  It was just an ok spot.

I've been eating at honey jam Caf in Downers Grove for about six months, and each time I walk in to be greeted by my name. I've met the manager a few times I believe her name is Suzanne, she's always coming over to see if everything is OK at my table. I didn't have this one instance once,I have gotten a Cobb salad, and the chicken they used was a very tasty, so I notified my server Kristina and without hesitation she brought me a chicken breast on a plate and had asked me to try this. I was so delighted with that but I did reach out to the manager and let her know what she had done. So I definitely recommend going to honey jam

While visiting Chicago we stumbled across this cute little cafe....and so glad we did! The service was awesome. Not realizing that they close at 230pm, we arrived at 210pm. They welcomed us as if we were the first to arrive for the day.  Fast service, good food. Can't beat it!

Went for a weekday breakfast, so there was no wait. It's a big place with plenty of seating. We were welcomed by a very pleasant server who was attentive without being intrusive. She was honest about the coffee being on the light side so we ordered an americano coffee instead of the filter coffee. It was a lot better. My sister and I ordered the two egg breakfast which was pretty standard. Hash browns were cold though which was disappointing. My mother ordered the Challah bread French toast which were very good. Overall it was a wasn't a bad experience since we had a nice place to sit and chat and weren't made to feel we had to rush out after our meal. Pricing was fine and food came quickly. Sometimes it's more about the overall experience than the food!

3.5 stars. I've been here many, many times since there's not too many brunch places in the burbs so it's unfortunate that service and food are both inconsistent. 

Sometimes you get a super friendly waiter, sometimes you're stuck with a sourpuss who's unhappy to be working. 

Food is okay, not bad but not really good either. Can't put my finger on it but something about the food here just isn't on point. I definitely prefer the food at blueberry hill to the food here-it's much tastier.

Ambience is really nice though. There's a fireplace and it feels kind of like you're at a cozy cottage.

When the food is right, it is fantastic. However, I have yet to visit Honey Jam and have every meal at the table arrive as what was ordered. On one occasion, they had to make my fiancee's meal three times before he received what he asked for. They kept putting bacon where he had asked for broccoli, and he doesn't eat pork. If you order your food to-go, make sure you check it while you're still in the restaurant!

The service is friendly and prompt like 80% of the time. Unfortunately, on our last visit, we were seated by the hostess, and waited over ten minutes before we were acknowledged by a server. Even then, she wasn't ready to even take drink orders (for our table of three) and had to return to the table several minutes later. She did not apologize for our wait, and behaved as if we hadn't been waiting ten minutes to order coffee. I understand that she may have been busy, but a manager also passed our table several times while we were waiting and he neglected to acknowledge us as well. A table adjacent to ours (with a different server) had ordered their meals before we had even been greeted.

If it hadn't been for our intense hunger and faith in the actual food, we probably would have left. We all felt better after receiving our food (and having one meal re-made into what was ordered), but the next time I chose a brunch spot, it wasn't Honey Jam. I will probably return eventually, but there is plenty to choose from out here.

Absolutely love this place! I've been here quite a few times and it still remains my all time comfort brunch place. 
Their skillets and waffles are delicious!
Warm and cozy ambiance :)

Was driving by and thought we'd check it out. Pretty busy even in the early afternoon. Was seated quickly, service was good, attentive, no problems. Food was good, decent price, would definitely come back if we were in the area.
Love this place! It's so cute and cozy! The food is always great and everyone is very upbeat and friendly :) I also love the honey pot shaped coffee mugs. Ended up buying one after my first visit.

This place was just okay. The staff wasn't rude but not noticeably friendly, the wait was about 20-25 minutes at 10am on a Saturday which is not bad for a breakfast joint. The parking lot was slammed; we had to park next door at Brickhouse.

Once we got seated, we ordered and received our food in about 10 minutes which was crazy. Don't get me wrong, we were happy about this since we had somewhere to be. The only problem is that we then didn't see our waitress for about 25 minutes.

The food itself was bland. I got a skillet and my husband got eggs, bacon, hashbrowns and pancakes. I'm easy to please on breakfast since I love almost all of it, but I was disappointed by the lack of flavor in this meal. It wasn't BAD, but not the meal I was looking forward to.

All the things I like in a breakfast restaurant. First they leave a pot of coffee which saves me from having swivel head thinking "where the heck is she with more coffee?"  A large water glass. See above. Extra napkins (without having to ask for them). AND the French toast combo was more than generous. Great tasting cinnamony French toast. Solid sausage patties. Great eggs. And good hash browns. The side of fruit was a little heavy on the under ripe melon but whatever. Very prompt and pleasant service.
Best place in the burbs for breakfast!! Food is yummy and delicious and consistent every time.  I do wish the Batavia location was still open.  The staff is friendly.

I slyly suggested Honey Jam to my friends, talking up the fact that they have oatmeal because they're trying to eat healthy. Fast forward to this past Sunday and the oatmeal portion of the menu was completely ignored.

Can you blame us?

With decadent things like strawberry cheesecake french toast, amazing egg skillets, and banana bread baked goods, we ignored the doctors' prescribed diets in favor of delicious expanding waistlines.

Okay, that was dramatic, no? Maybe a little overly-so? 

In a nutshell, the food is amazing, and if you can't find something you like, you're probably too picky. 

The service was excellent. Prices are pretty fair. Glasses were refilled often.  
The food came out quickly, and we did not have to wait for our table. Why? Well, I called ahead. They don't do reservations, but if you call ahead and put your name on the list, when you get there they happily seat you almost as soon as you walk in.

Maybe I shouldn't tell you that. 

Damnit.

Owned and operated by new management- so the prices have gone up. For my favorite breakfast item, I used to pay ~$9, now its ~$13. The food doesn't taste the same anymore either. When I expressed by disappointment to the manager about the 2 separate increases in price over a 2 month span, she shrugged her shoulders and said "I don't make the prices". This is a sad day. I loved this place and I doubt I will be visiting it again.

Ironically, majority of the awesome wait staff has happily transferred over to Butterfields near Oak Brook. Definitely recommend checking them out.

Came in today for a quick breakfast, short wait and let me say it was worth the wait. My waitress was beyond friendly and quick to answer all my questions. I love going out to eat and sometimes can picky but this place really delivers!!!!! Also the staff is just running and making sure all customers are taken care of with a smile. The inside is spotless and well maintained . I can't wait to bring in some clients and really impress them.

I returned to the Honey Jam at the invitation of the chief operating officer (Kirk Mauriello) and had a totally different experience from my last (bad) one.  Kirk met me there on a Saturday and it was a pleasure talking to him. The food was good and service excellent; the kitchen distraction (noise) I had previously complained about has been rectified and I was glad to give the restaurant a second chance.
Staff is friendly. Breakfast is tasty. Wait staff is always nice to my son. I've been here several times and always enjoy it.

I have been on a mission to find quality breakfast spots, and I think I have found one of the best in the state in Honey Jam Cafe.

Even though they don't do reservations, we only had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. Our waitress greeted us promptly. I had the Pecan Belgian Waffles with a side of biscuits and gravy, and both were excellently prepared and the taste was wonderful. 

Anyone and everyone should try Honey Jam Cafe. You will not be disappointed.

By far the quickest service I've ever had at a sit down restaurant.  We ordered breakfast and they brought it within 5 minutes.  Good food and great atmosphere.  Feels like a giant log cabin.  Lots of space and good for kids too.  Our baby seat fit in the booth.

Very delicious and original... Definitely worth trying.... There is a line for a reason... 

Seasoned right, cooked perfectly to order... This is not your average Dennys or cracker barrel and ooh they have good coffee
Great breakfast and service!! Also, the general decor and ambience of the restaurant is top-notch!!!
It is good. A typical brunch place. Nothing too fantastic. The French Toast is delicious

Love the food here! Although I'm not in love with the wait times. I rarely come here because I refuse to wait an hour or more just to get some breakfast and it's such a shame and that's for a party of 2! 

The times we have visited here, the service was good and the food was even better. Something needs to be done about the wait times though, maybe think about allowing reservations? Otherwise we most likely won't be going anymore. It's almost become a definite cross off our list because we know we shouldn't even waste our time driving past to check the wait time.

We major in breakfast. This place is great. The fresh squeezed oj is delicious. The biscuits are rich and light and perfect. One of us had a bacon waffle and pronounced it good. Another built her own skillet and could not finish it. I really enjoyed the Greek frittata and substituted fresh fruit for hash browns. The server was really personable and super efficient. This is a really good place for breakfast.

We've been wanting to check this place out for what seems like forever!  We finally got a chance to and were not disappointed in the food at all!  Maybe a little in the pricy range for a breakfast place, however...

My dad got 2 Eggs any style w/ sausage links and hash browns and toast for $7.75.  Of course, this was a fine breakfast meal that my dad enjoyed; however, he agreed that we've never paid this much for such a simple dish with such simple ingredients.  

My mom ordered the Spinach Scrambler - homemade crepes filled w/ scrambled eggs, sauted spinach, bacon and cream cheese which was served with a side of hollandaise sauce for $8.45.  Mom enjoyed the dish so much that she actually finished both crepes!  

The boy ordered Steak & Eggs which consisted of Black Angus Ranch Cut steak cooked to order and served with two eggs any style for $13.95.  Of course, the meal was very good and he enjoyed it.  Though he has had the same cut of steak at other breakfast places for much less.

I asked for a half order of the Biscuits & Gravy (Flaky biscuits topped with a creamy
country sausage gravy with two eggs any style - Hash browns not included - $7.45).  Instead of getting a half order everything was priced out at ala carte.  This made it even more expensive.  If I had known this, I would have just taken the full order!  

They were really busy and though they told us it would be an hour wait it was only 20 minutes.  It seemed like the front of the house was having a hard time managing who was attempting to pay their bills and check in for a table.  The food was good; don't get me wrong.  We were really disappointed in the prices!  In comparison to other breakfast places for the cost of this type of food it just shouldn't cost as much to the consumer!

I can not believe how this place turned from so good to so bad in a months time. the potatoes are not crispy and soggy. The ham does not taste the same. The service got slow and they look confused and always seem to be apologizing for the new owner. His plan must be to turn it into one of his other low grade restaurants.  

I wish Dick Portillo did his research before he sold to this group.
Great breakfast and brunch spot. Get a coffee and the Julian Benedict. Your whole day is set up for success after that.

I came here on Easter, it was packed but expected.  the wait time wasn't too bad.  the menu is loaded with different choices for everyone such as vegan, weight watchers etc..

The service was great and the staff actually knew the menu. They were very friendly and knowledgeable. 

I had the banana foster French toast and it was the best hands down, in my opinion.  I'm definitely making plans to head back there for Mothers Day.

Went back multiple times and it was ok experiences.  On Sunday 10/12/14 @ 8AM they were out of corn beef to make corn beef hash skillet!!?? ON A SUNDAY morning?  Who was prepping the kitchen?  That was crazy as every table around us, and our table included,  wanted this dish!  I am also disappointed with the food of late.
 
A couple of times  food came out luke warm or just not tasty!!! I read the ownership has recently changed - perhaps that is the reason to the lowering of standards.

Visiting the area for the first time, we were told to try this (breakfast/lunch only) restaurant for a great breakfast. The exterior parking lot, building site and inside restaurant interior was very welcoming-we were initially excited and really impressed. We were greeted right away and our waitress Debbie was very prompt, friendly, knowledgeable, and 'Johnny on the spot'. She gave us a few minutes to peruse the menu as there were lots of breakfast entre' choices. All the while, there was this woman standing at the booth behind us who was talking in a normal to loud voice to 2 customers seated behind us. Sounded like she knew them as she was talking, and talking, and talking, and talking...(not whispering)..about a family wedding??? As our waitress Debbie came back, we were ready to order. We placed our breakfast order and whew, the lady finally left. As we were waiting for our food and conversing, the lady came back and began talking, and talking and talking some more. She apparently had no clue how RUUD it was to disturb our dining experience. Our waitress was wonderful, and our food came in a timely manner BUT, I'm sorry to say, the food was not hot at all. The coffee was good, my pancake was light and fluffy but the main entre' was average to below average portion for the price we paid. My friends eggs were not cooked as ordered and the hash browns we both had were WAY over crisp. The meals were just OK at best but there are so many other dining options in the area, I would not recommend this place-we were truly disappointed and will not be back when visiting the area again. We were told Portello's (across the road) sold this business to the current owners. *******As we left disappointed but ready to pay our bill, I asked one of the employees if the lady (who was still at the table there and just wouldn't shut up) was an employee and (lo' and behold) I was told she was the GENERAL MANAGER!!! Enough said!!!!

It took over 45 minutes to get our food. Then when my breakfast burrito finally arrived, the server told me all the guacamole was bad and it had to come without. What I later discovered was that the side of fruit was also bad as well. My daughters corned beef hash was in large clumps of corned beef - not missed as a hash. The food was horrible and service just as bad. I will not be back.

Very cute cafe! We came here for brunch on a Saturday. It is a super busy place! They said our wait time for 2 people was 30-35 minutes, but I think we only waited for 15 minutes which isnt so bad. 

This place is really adorable. I ordered the countryside skillet which was really tasty. Love all the ingredients. It also came with a side of pancakes. That is a lot of food! I also ordered their home-squeezed orange juice. I ordered a large but the cup was pretty small so imagine how small a small cup of OJ is. My husband ordered one of their croissants sandwiches. He thought his was okay.

Overall, decent experience and enjoyed the food. Would come back again. 

If you're curious how the name came to be, Honey is actually what the owner calls his wife. JAM is the first initial of the owner's three sons - Joseph, Anthony, Michael.

Loved it at first, but then it was just ok. Food came out cold, but im not one to complain. 
Its happened twice. So i'd have to say, im over it.

Wow, wonderful breakfast place!

Fast prompt service.

Great to go service!

The white chocolate Belgium waffles were amazing!  The house coffee is also excellent!  

If you need to eat breakfast stop in here! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!

I've been to Honey Jam before and enjoyed it. But my last trip there was pretty disappointing, I'm not sure if it was just a bad day or if Honey Jam has slipped in quality.

Our meal didn't start off that well.. the "host" lead us to our table, but he didn't even make eye contact or say follow me or anything. He just walked off, when he noticed we weren't following he waved our menus over to follow him, he lead us to our booth and tossed the menus down on the table and walked off. He didn't say a word to us.  It was a Sunday morning, I get it.. I was tired too... But I just I thought it was more odd than rude and it just started our meal off on a sour tone.

Our Server comes, and she was great. Very polite and nice. We ordered, I had the Greek Frittata and my girlfriend had the Tuscan omelette and we split a side of bacon.....Our food was then served to us quickly.... too quickly. After we ordered less than 5 minutes passed before we got our food. We both commented on how quick it was... we soon found out why.
The hash brown sides that we both had with our orders were completely under cooked.. parts were just raw hashed potatoes.  Just looking at them you could tell they were under cooked, only a few parts of the top of the hash brown were even slightly browned. The rest was just a white mush of under cooked potatoes.   Our Frittata and Omelette were lukewarm, mushy and bland.. with the way they tasted and the quick turnaround for our order I'm assuming they were premade and kept warm and not made to order. Another small thing that bothered us is that we had pancakes for our side, and while most tables were getting fresh warm syrup from the kitchen our waitress grabbed an already used, sticky syrup from another table that was less than a quarter full... she wiped it down right in front our table before setting it down

I give one star for the pancakes we had as a side... they are pretty good.

And I give one star for always being able to get a quick table here. The times I've been here have been during busy Sunday mornings and there has never been a wait. 

Bottom line is that when there are so many other great breakfast places around, with better quality and cheaper prices, there's no real reason to go out of your way to go to Honey Jam.

This time my honey and jam experience was disappointing! And usually I luv this place . The menu changed, especially in the waffle section! I feel like they change cooks. It wasn't tasty, it was jus bleh. I wish I didn't come here now, regret. Me and my sister were so excited to get our fav dishes and they don't even have them even more. Honestly pls get the old menu back

I was really looking forward to beat the lineup on a busy weekend brunch hours but the effort wasn't all rewarding.

The menu has good breakfast options with a few twists but nothing to write home about. Coffee is kept warm and service with a smile isn't enough to forget about jazz elevator music playing in the background.

Nothing too exciting with the dish presentation on poorly executed egg benedict. Homemade hash browns would probably bring a much better signature to most items on the menu.

Had the raisin French toast and OMG!!! Do freaking good. The service was good the wait was long, but they overestimated the time making it feel shorter. Coffee pot on the table instead of waiting for someone to "warm" up your coffee every ten minutes. Just a great place. Little dark, but the food is amazing!

Don't get me wrong - the food is good, and we come here pretty regularly. But, I'm never really feel like I have a "Wow!" experience. 

I think it's more about the management of the chain, than the food or service. On the menu, substitutions are discouraged and stated in a way that makes me feel like they have a "take it or leave it" attitude to my meal. 

Also, getting any information about what I'm eating is more difficult than hacking into the CIA databases. Once, I asked our server if she could tell me the portions of the ingredients in my breakfast skillet. She was suspicious that I was some sort of spy for the owners, and she told me that she was risking her job to give me the list. All I wanted to know was how many calories the dish had so that I could make a responsible choice in the portion of food that I ate.  She did smuggle the information to us (Cold War style), and we gave her a 40% tip. 

We don't come here as often as we once did, but what does tip the scale in their favor is the ability to call ahead to add our name to the wait before we arrive. 

It's a good place, but the owner's attitude toward their customers could be better.

Very disappointed with the overall service and quality of food. Something has changed here. The food was way overpriced as well. I couldn't believe how much they raised their prices. Too many other options in the area to have to come here again.

Wow wow weee wow! Me and my gf (she is gluten free (so GF^2)) sooo we were wurried she wood git a tummy acke if wee eight hear but nope! Mr dick had GF pancake so it's okay. Wow it was yummy. I love Dick.,. Portillo!!!

Fantastic breakfast! They have a wide variety of French toast varieties, several Benedicts (I had the Caprese, it was amazing!), as well as standard breakfast choices. Their sausage gravy is the best in the area as well, so don't skip that option! Our server, Bertha, was prompt, friendly, and on point. I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area.

You know I love me some Portillo's, so I ventured in to Honey Jam Cafe hoping that the Portillo's name would hold some ground.  

Verdict:  They didn't have anything that was close to the crack that is the dipped beef, BUT they were pretty good.  

I realized walking in to the place that I LOVE corporate (or REALLY TINY) breakfast places.  I know those are opposites, but hear me out.  I either need it to be big and bold and clean or tiny and cozy and clean.  Either way, I need it to be clean.  I'm not used to that in a breakfast place (maybe this leads to my hatred of breakfast?) because they are usually the same old things in a different dirty location.  Not Honey Jam, my friends.  They are big, and fancy, and clean.  And they have plenty of seating, lots of servers (Who are actually nice! Imagine that!), and good food.      

We tried the regular everyday breakfast (you know...eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast, etc.) and the breakfast burrito.  Both were pretty decent.  Everything was fresh and tasty...the only real gripes were the bacon (meh...it was good, but not AWESOME) and the burrito needed some more oomph of some sort (not sure what...just SOMETHING).  I'm honestly happy that they had a Mexican section at all (on the menu, not in the restaurant.) because that's the only breakfast food I will eat, and that they also had a lunch menu (which had some Portillo's goods on it!).

Overall, I'm still on the search for the breakfast place that WOWs me, but this'll do in the meantime.
