We really enjoyed our meal at this restaurant. I actually enjoyed my husband's meal more than my own. He ordered the rueben with onion rings. It was delicious. The sandwich was perfect. The onion rings were also really good. The corn beef had a great flavor. I ordered the patty melt. It was ok. There weren't enough onions and the meat just tasted greasy. The homemade chips were really good tasting. The coffee was blah. The strawberry cream cheese French toast was amazing. It tasted really fresh. Not too sweet.

I have tried to eat here 4 times and I have not gotten a table. The last time I called ahead for seating to reserve a table and I was still unable to be seated because they did not write my name down on the list. The wait is outrageous and I am not longer interested in eating here.

Fresh-squeezed OJ, yummy coffee and BACON WAFFLES.

What else could you want?

I was curious about this place for a while, since it is located on my way to work. 

Finally, we came in Mother's Day afternoon around 1:30pm. The restaurant was still crowded!!! But we got our seat after 15 minutes wait.  The first thing I notice was the diversity of the customers, which we enjoyed it.  The servant Debbie was nice.  

My husband order neutella  (typo, LOL) banana crepe and I ordered skillet (countryside). Very very good.  

We will come back again during weekend, for sure. ~~~

Breakfast is breakfast, usually.  Scramble eggs and bacon or an omelette typically are not going to differ from place to place so what it really boils down to is location, ambience, and service. The location is easy to get to. Parking can be a challenge when it's really busy. The dining room is cozy and inviting.  Wait wasn't bad for a busy Saturday morning. Service was great. Even though she had a full section, she was attentive. She even bought a to go coffee for us when we were cashing out. Food which I had the Denver omelette was awesome. The wait time was not bad for the food considering the place was at capacity.

Came here last weekend on a Friday morning with two of my girl friends. The restaurant was pretty full for a Friday morning. The atmosphere is very homey. The waitress was  friendly. There was two of us who ordered coffee and the waitress brought us an insulated carafe filled with hot coffee. Easy access. 
I ordered the corn beef hash skillet with pancakes and they were delicious. The menu has breakfast and lunch options. I like that they have specialty pancakes and French toast. One of my friends ordered tiramisu pancakes.  Definitely going to go back for those!
After we packaged up left overs (portions are pretty big) the waitress asked us of any of us wanted a coffee to go! How nice and thoughtful! What a great nice gesture.

Okay, so my boyfriend and I came in here awhile ago and the food was fantastic but the service was originally absolutely horrible...but Saturday morning we decided to give it another chance, and I'm really glad we did. 

We had an amazing server (Christina) who really was able to balance how busy she was with great and courteous service. She was friendly, fast, and very accommodating. Even though the place was packed (and I heard that it was actually considered 'slow') she was able to have a bit of small chat with us and engage in a bit of our conversation without sacrificing service or being considered rude. Her performance alone will make us return again. We sat for what was probably considered "longer" than typical for the restaurant since it was a very high and quick turnover but we never felt rushed in the least bit. I'm not sure if they tip pool at this restaurant or not but she truly made us have a great morning and she deserves the recognition for it. 

I've always seen the place absolutely packed, so if you're looking for a 'quiet' breakfast experience for your 90 year old grandma, that's just not going to happen. But if you do want good food with a twist and fast, then you're in the right place.  

As for the food...it was delicious as to be expected. We had a morning with no kids so we completely wanted to enjoy ourselves and holy crap did we gorge. I'm almost positive I gave myself diabetes after this trip (no offense to anyone who does struggle with that ailment). I had a latte with caramel (it's caramel sauce, not syrup-which I completely prefer), the old man had a freakin' pot of coffee-which initially didn't taste right and Christina was more than happy to bring us a new one. 

We started with monkey bread...yeah, that's right, they have monkey bread. And it was our breakfast 'appetizer'. It. Was. Delicious. Get it. Eat some of it, take the rest home and have it the next day (which is what I'm doing right now, it reheats great). 

Also, please don't judge me...I ordered the banana bread french toast, a side order of biscuits/gravy AND had half of the old man's hash browns. To be honest I ate the biscuits/gravy and then took most of the banana bread french toast home since it was sooooo absolutely rich and delicious and would freeze great for my kid's breakfast Monday morning (besides, I have monkey bread! woot). Two people who had walked by asked what I had ordered...I suggest you order it too. It was very VERY rich and covered with bananas. 

The old man ordered a regular order of french toast which he completely enjoyed as well, the shredded hash browns were cooked perfectly (not greasy, and amazingly crispy). 

Our total bill was $39.99 which we didn't think was horrible given the fact that we did order two "special" items, but I do completely agree with some of the items on the menu being overpriced- the regular order of biscuits & gravy with two eggs was like $8 which I mean, I can make for $2 at home but it's not necessarily about the 'price', you eat out for the experience. 

When we went their electrical system had basically gone down and they had to manually do credit card slips, which wasn't that big of a deal and they seemed to handle it all very well. (A lot of places completely lose their minds when they have to do anything "manually" because they have no clue how to use the machines to do it) 

All in all we were extremely happy with our experience and would definitely go back and hopefully be able to request her the next time we are able. Oh and be prepared to park in some ridiculous spot, the lot fills up very quick!

I loved honey jam cafe. The food was really good, though I only went for brunch. They had us sit by the fireplace which was perfect since it was really cold and snowing outside. It was packed and took us about 20 mins to get seated. Service was good but the noise level was a little high.

I did not have high expectations when we went because I was disappointed that the place I had wanted to eat was not open, so anything else seemed unappealing to me at that point. Fortunately, I am extremely happy to say I truly enjoyed my experience at Honey Jame Cafe!

The service was not bad. The food came really fast and tasted good, so I definitely think the kitchen deserves 5 stars. I had the Monkey Waffle. It was delicious and I 100% recommend it. The atmosphere was cozy and warm. The reason I did not give 5 stars is because other aspects of the service (waiter, cashier) left something to be desired. They were quite slow, and there were several errors. Overall, I would recommend this place to a friend. I fully intend to return next time I am in the area nad hungry.

I met a group for 5 girls for brunch here on a Saturday and at 11am - we were quoted 40 minutes but we probably waited about 20-25 minutes for a table.

The place is really cozy with a big fireplace in the middle and a really nice atmosphere. Our server was super friendly and on top on everything! I love how they set a pot of coffee and water on your table so your coffee never gets empty. I can only imagine it's much easier for the servers too. I think every breakfast place should do this!

I opted for the english muffin with veggies and poached egg on top. I subbed hash brown for fruit because the menu said you could do that, but I was charged 75 cents. O_0   I love me some strong coffee but I found the coffee to be a little bitter but the food was really delicious!

I couldn't work up excitement about this place - just cause the serivce and decor was .... so average and balh. So I will detail my lunch.

I had the "strawberry cheesecake french toast". $9 a pop.

It's 3 pieces of thick bread- with crusty crust. Honestly, a little too crusty as it didn't get wet enough with the sauce.It annoyed me to work my way past the hardness of the crust. 
There was maybe 3 strawberries on it- ok, I would have liked more strawberry flavor.  I am a big fan of the strawbery. Red fruit is the best.

Each piece has a layer of the "cheesecake" sauce on it- making the inside of the bread nice and wet with tasty flavor.  Once i got to the inside, the moistness was great and I enjoyed it.

I don't think it was much of a cheesecake flavor - more sugary - but it was good anyway.

I love Portillo's Italian Combo and Burgers, Barnelli's Ribs, and even Luigi's Lasagna, but one word I could use to describe HJC is underwhelming! Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and since my sister got married last night, I decided I need a veggie filled omelet to soak up the hang over that I had. I haven't had a hang over since Operation Iraqi Freedom. Not really, but I don't drink that much and I was starving.

The coffee was mediocre...but since it was just myself and my dining companion we were seated after about a ten minute wait.  I knew I wanted a veggie omelet so I went with the aforementioned sans cheese adding jalapeno!

 My first problem was having gourmet pancakes but no whole grain/buckwheat/pumpkin? COME ON HJC! If you want this Elite Yelpers' approval you've got to get everyone's tastes covered! What if I wanted pancakes and had a gluten allergy? I went with the buttermilk cakes and blueberries? $2 for an antixoxidant boost? C'mon HJC!

There are many options around Yorktown Mall for breakfast and this area as well. Red Apple Pancake House in Carol Stream is my favorite by far, but Jam N Jelly in Darien, Juicy-0 (which is adjacent to this place almost), and Blueberry Hill would be better options! 

I won't be back here. Not saying I don't love the restaurant group, but my non fluffy omelet, mediocre buttermilk pancakes, and coffee for the high price? And the lack of options! 

I feel terrible posting this review that is so negative, but I only want quality in my breakfast, not quantity which I feel is the focus at HJC!

This is my new favorite place because of their DELICIOUS chicken salad salad (chicken salad on top of a salad with yummy fruit) I think it's called Shannon's Gourmet Chicken Salad with Fruit. YUM! And it comes with the delicious lemon poppyseed muffin you get with the salads at Portillos! Also, the coffee was really excellent. Service was great. As other reviewers say, be prepared to wait. The only bummer was that tables are very close together so it's almost impossible to walk through the restaurant to get to the restrooms. But the food is SO good!

Went to Honey Jam with my wife and daughter.  There is plenty of sitting areas in case you need to wait.  We came in after noon and only waited about 10 minutes.
They had these little stands to hold the infant car seats which I thought was very nice.   It's the first "infant friendly" place I've been to, or at least been to since I've become a father... I probably never noticed before lol.  That said, they don't have a changing table in the mens' room.  Although this made it easier to ask my wife to change the diaper instead :)

But enough about that, let's get to the food.  I noticed some Portillo's mainstays on the menu (like the chopped salad, and poppyseed muffin).  But of course I went for the breakfast.  I always say I want to get crepes but then I feel like it's not gonna fill me up.  So today I tried the banana fosters crepes.  They were so sweet, basically a dessert.  But,  that is what I ordered, so what can I say.  They were good, but I think next time I will have to try one of those gourmet pancakes.

My wife wasn't in the mood for brunch, so she ordered the chicken salad.  It was pretty tasty.

Anyway, I'll probably go back.  The service was pretty good and we were in and out fairly quickliy
Pretty decent place. Decent service. Decent food. Nothing really stood out. I wouldn't mind going here again but I'm a jerk and like to be wowed. I would've be just as happy going to IHOP.
I'm a native Chicagoan who relocated to CA 2 years ago. This is my go-to brunch place when I'm home! I love their decadent, dessert-like breakfasts!

Solid breakfast option. Food is good and but a little over priced, you pay a premium for coffee and oj. Omelette $10 coffee $2.50 oj $3.50. If you go during weekend breakfast you will wait and parking is limited for the amount of customers they attract. Service was good staff was friendly but that wait for a table was the killer. Not a quick option on the weekends.

It's equal parts cruel and enticing to watch the flatscreen set up in the corner of the Honey Jam lobby. It can be painful to watch delicious looking items flash on the screen like bananas foster crepes, skillets a plenty, Belgian waffles overflowing with fresh fruit and whipped cream, all while waiting for your table. But then your buzzer goes off and you get over it. 

So, yeah, if you want breakfast on Saturday or Sunday morning, prepare to wait a bit. Our party of four waited about 30 minutes this past Sunday at 9:30 am. Once we were seated by the ever-so-friendly host, we read the details of many of the menu items we just saw on the aforementioned screen. Our server Sabrina was really great - very efficient and offered a recommendation for (almost) every category of breakfast eat.

I chose the very berry Belgian waffle - a perfectly formed circle of carb topped with light and airy whipped cream and a boatload of berries: strawberries, blackberries and blueberries. Pair this crave worthy meal with a glass of freshly squeezed OJ and I left one full and happy camper. 

Other points to note: Prices are reasonable, tables are set close together and the parking lot can be a hot mess. Wear your patient pants if you're heading to breakfast on Saturday or Sunday!

Their vege and cheese omelet is awesome and comes with tasty hash browns and toast or yummy pancakes. I've always ordered an English muffin until the other day when I had the fluffy, flavorful pancakes. I'm more of a Starbucks espresso drinker, but I could drink Honey Jam's coffee until I'm floating west on Butterfield Road. While their prices are definitely not low, the $8.75 for the omelet meal is similar to nearby places for a similar breakfast meal, and I think Honey Jam trumps all the neighboring others.

Great new place in a location that has seen its share of places come and go.  It's part of the Ditka restaurant group and the quality throughout shows.  Great atmosphere done with the class of the Ditka restaurants with the casualness of your favorite bar.    Great place to come for happy hours after work or for dinner to enjoy good food good service and good friends.  Limited menu but the quality of the food is great  i had the fish tacos and they were great. Definitely coming back.  Thanks Coach Mike for opening this one up!

Cheers!

John

Maybe 3.5 stars.  We visited for a late supper and had a burger and a whitefish special along with the Brussels sprouts salad.  The salad may have been the most flavorful dish, and it was tasty and filling.  The whitefish was good, the burger was OK, but the Cheddar and bacon flavors were drowned out by other ingredients.   Fries were excellent, and the coffee was top-notch.   

No service issues whatsoever.  Our server was friendly, skillful, informative, and prompt.  We were well taken care of.   

Their desktop Web site clearly shows US Route 66, which they have re-labeled as US Route 89.  There is a US Route 89 which goes north and south just east of the Rockies.  Seems like kind of a clueless renumbering.

Went for dinner on a Wednesday night. Place wasn't that busy and service was pretty slow. Took a long time before I even got a bowl of soup. The inside of the restaurant was very nice and casual. Was a bit loud though and imagine it would be even worse on a Friday/Saturday night. 

I will start by saying that I compete in BBQ competitions and was interested in trying their recommended items from the "Smokehouse" section of the menu. I ordered the Trio (Pulled Pork, Ribs, Brisket). First was the Pulled Pork.... The meat itself was very tender and had a great taste. The bark on the pork was horrible. Burnt/bitter taste. I imagine it may be the wood they use or the fact that it was simply just not smoked properly. Let a very bad aftertaste. The brisket had a great taste as well as the bark on it however it was very dry. Probably sat on the warmers too long. The ribs were also a tad on the dry side and the tops were burnt from being in the heat too long. Another bad aftertaste.

My wife ordered the 89 Burger. She loved it and said it was very juicy and tasty. The fries are also very good. I guess I should have gone the burger route instead.

Now I get that the place borders Hinsdale and is close to Oak Brook but Westmont and Clarendon Hills are middle working class neighborhoods. The pricing is a bit outrageous and I imagine that comes from being a "Ditka Restaurant Group" company. I did not expect the "house and/or well" vodka to be Stoli and cost $8 per drink. Most restaurants charge between $4-6 for a well drink. My wife and I usually order just two drinks each with dinner when we go out and between the alcohol and food, the bill was $88.00. For that price I could go to a steak house and get bread, soup, salad and steak for the same price per person. I don't think any place that has been in this location has lasted more than 3-4 years and I do not expect this one to last either in my opinion. Not the right neighborhood for this type of $$$ and sorry to say but if anyone knows good BBQ, this is NOT the place to go.

Heard this place opened up and was affiliated with ditkas and wanted to try it out. Let me start out by saying service was top notch, from the hostess to one server, who we then asked to switch tables, to a different server. They were knowledgable and polite and I'm a pretty hard critic. For starters we had the salad and the chicken wings. The Sonoma coast chicken salad was pretty good, just enough dressing, chicken cut from the whole breast, and good ratios of bacon, corn, and avocado. The chicken wing rub was on the spicy side, which I like.

For an entree I had the pork chop which came with steamed spinach and some sort of apple mango chutney and bourbon glaze sauce which was very well executed. My girl got the ribs which honestly were not good at all. Tasted like sulfur and you have to love a very deep smoked flavor to think they are good. 

For dessert I had a cup of the vanilla bean ice cream and a coffee. Typical but good whole cream and flavorful ice cream. 

If the ribs were better I would have given 5 star but they were pretty below average. I still highly recommend. They also have a full bar and flat screens everywhere to watch the game. Ps our server "V" is the man.

Wow!  Could it be?  Has this jinxed location finally found a reason for being?  Normally, I don't review a place unless I've eaten there more than once.  And I don't usually do a breakfast-specific review for a restaurant that specializes in lunch/dinner.  BUT, brunch was so freakin' awesome.  While the brunch menu is limited, I think the options are sufficient.  It would be nice to see a takeoff or version of eggs benedict, but they have personalized omelettes!

Started out with bloody marys, mine being a virgin.  I think it's the Ditka bloody Mary mix, but it works for me and the Hub!  Just the perfect blend of spicy and flavorful, not too sweet and just enough kick to start the day.  The Hub an original and it came with h'ordeuvres!

So, when I go somewhere for brunch for the first time, I try to keep it simple...so I got the steak & eggs.  The Hub got the Pot Roast Hash.  Our meals came with toast.  But our waitress brought out fresh syrup with  jellies.  We were confused because neither of us ordered pancakes, but our waitress said that's just the way they do their setup.  I took it as a sign and ordered a side of buttermilk pancakes.

OK, so where do I begin?  How about kitchen, fantastic, front of the house needs work?  The kitchen alone still makes the experience worthwhile!   My eggs were over easy, my steak wasn't a leather-looking shoe sole but a real skirt steak cooked perfectly.  The potatoes were well-done, as requested, mixed with colorful peppers and seasoned perfectly!  The Hub's pot roast hash was equally delicious.  The roast tasted like it was braised in wine and was tender and juicy!  And the pancakes were huge and tasted like the pancakes from the olden days...light and fluffy, sweet but not too much.

Now, this place has only been open a few monthes (Memorial Day, 2016), so I think they're still working out the bugs in the service department.  But the kitchen is so right on, the lack of quality service can easily be overlooked.  What I do find surprising is the staff.  For a Ditka-related venture, they're awfully young and inexperienced, even though they've only been open a few monthes.  But that must be because of the location.  But I guess time will tell!  I just hope this doesn't ruin the chances of this potential awesome kitchen sticking around!!

FYI, the prices MAY sound a bit high when you look at the menu for the first time, BUT in comparison to other breakfast places in the area, I think they are extremely reasonable!!  We will ABSOLUTELY be back for lunch and/or dinner AND definitely breakfast again!  We will see how they handle the front next time!

I really enjoyed my experience here, We sat in a booth near the bar and it was a Tuesday night and we got seated right away around 6pm. Our waitress put in the order for my daughters food right away and I really liked that this was a family restaurant able to serve my 4 year old chicken fingers and fries, and they had crayons. Thats always a plus, when as a mom I don't have those packed in my purse. 
I decided to go for the burger of the week, the pulled pork nacho's on a burger with no bun.
The presentation and flavor of this burger was impeccable. I would go back here any time for  dinner or lunch. As well as trying the Saturday or Sunday Brunch, I want to go back. They also have outdoor seating with patio umbrella's and it's just a cute nice place right off of route 83.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this place.  The drinks (try the cherry bourbon specialty cocktail amazing!), and food.  I would highly recommended the beef brisket too.

If you are looking for authentic bbq and cocktails, this is the place.

We just missed Ditka he was there for the opening yesterday.

They have big screen TVs for games, but it's more then that, the food is amazing and special shout out to Tony he is an amazing waiter! We will be back.

Like a revolving door, this space has certainly seen it's share of restaurants since Cucina Roma closed it's doors a while ago.  But given my recent visit here, while it's not exactly my kind of place, the food was quite good and given it's Ditka heritage, it has some very strong points going for it.

When you pull open the door, the smell of BBQ greets you.  The space is a bit sparse for my liking.  Lots of wood and brick, but there is nothing warm about it.  It reminded me of a lunchroom or a college bar, loud and functional but not particularly inviting.  But the smell . . .oh that smell got me to thinking ribs right away even though I ended up with the fish tacos.

My friend is a devout Ditka fan so when she saw the Ditka shortrib nachos on the menu, you can bet that is what we started with.  Those things could have been our entire meal and we ordered a small.  Piled high with cheese and other nacho like things, this plate was devoured by the two of us (did I say the food was quite good?)

Next up were our entrees.  I had the fish tacos (two to an order with a nice piece of fish in each) and my friend had one of their entree salads that was so big that she had enough to take home for another meal.  Everything was quite tasty.

Service was just okay but very friendly.  I suspect our server was new as he hadn't really found his cadence for the right balance of when to approach the table but that will come with time.  And I think we had a manager acting as food runner on the night we were there which worked out great as the food came up quickly and was properly prepared.

Plenty of TV's for you to catch your favorite game on and if I were to go again, I think I might order the BBQ as the table next to us had two full racks and they smelled and looked great.  

Plenty of parking and they even have a small patio area which was full on the night we were there.  All in all, a nice addition to the area.

This location has been like musical chairs over the years. But I think Grill 89 may just stick. Atmosphere is rustic wth lots of wood. Very welcoming. Menu has something for everyone and is priced well. I had the brisket sandwich. Smoked flavor was evident and the BBQ sauce was additive to the dish. Came with a mixed green salad (or fries) for $12.25. The Mrs had the tilapia tacos which she enjoyed. Nice selection of local craft beers. Service was excellent--thanks to Victor for his Recs. Only disappointment was no sighting of "the coach."  Guess we will have to return and try again!

I waffled really hard between three and four stars on this. For reasons (listed below) I ended up going with three. 

Your Need To Knows: Ample bar room. Imagine it would be fun for a group of people coming to watch a game (nice TV location/diversity). Bar food was great. If there's a hot game going on I imagine it could get loud, but in slower times, noise level is manageable. There's pretty decent parking options. 

Call ahead about handicap accessibility. In the front room, all the tables seemed to be elevated. Not good for wheelchair users. There was a back room that I would assume would have more normal tables - but if this is a concern of yours, definitely ask ahead. 

Pricing is average. It's expensive, but you get decent portions, and it's pretty in line with the area. Same goes for drinks - there's a nice drink selection and some fun, clever mixed drinks but the prices won't wow you. 

The pot roast nachos are delicious. The fries were spectacular. Pulled pork was great. Brisket was also quite good. Our party found the ribs to be rather "eh" - they seemed dry and overdone. This may be something of the style they're prepared in, but I would look at other options.

Waitstaff were sweet and pleasant, but not prompt. It was very quiet when we were there and it took quite a bit of time to get an order in, and food also took a while. I wasn't impressed.

All in all: good burgers. Great pulled pork. The bar food/apps are diverse and interesting, and probably worth checking out. But it's decidedly average, all things considered. It's spendy for a casual place (especially a sports bar, even if you're billing yourself as some sort of grill house) and when your premiere items are only average (ribs, I'm looking at you) it's not really a place I would want to visit regularly. Maybe fun for an event or a game for the atmosphere, but as a regular dinner spot: not a hit.

I wish this restaurant was around when I lived just down the street.  What a fun, lively and comfortable place.  Super solid food...the tortilla soup was killer, very nice staff and an energy that makes it fun.  As the Cubs finally overcame the goat curse, here's hoping that Grill 89 will finally be a successful mainstay in a space known for flops.  Keep cooking up a storm!!!

Want to have an intimate or important discussion over dinner? This is not the place for that. When this was Jimmy's Island Grill you could carry on and discourse with verbosity and clarity of aural transmission through the atmosphere to your partner across  the table. No more. To communicate here you should plan on text messaging your table mates. Or may I suggest sign language ? Semaphore? Morse Code? Smoke Signals? For myself I use mental telepathy. I just saw a couple using charades. 

Enough dwelling on the yelling. 5 stars because of the food and the service staff. The staff here moves with military precision and are attentive and even funny. Extremely knowledgeable of the food and drink menus. We have Nancy tonight and she's no better than the others. Which is to say she is outstanding and proof that in procedural uniformity excellence can be the result. 

Tonight I'm having nachos, cornbread, platter sized chocolate chip cookie with ice cream and strawberry smash cocktail. 

Parking is good. They have a iPhone app for easy  take out convenience.  

You will be eating mighty fine when you get your chow at Grill 89. 

Take that to the bank.

This place was good, just not great. I think it was over sold to me. Everything was advertised as "amazing" and nothing I had there for that classification. The pork nachos were really good, but not better than I have had at other places.  The fish tacos were good. I would certainly order them again, but I can get as good tacos anywhere. The Burger of the month was ordered by my boss and that was easily the best meal of all of ours. Cooked to perfection with great flavor. But again, something that I could get pretty much anywhere. The two other people I was with loved their food so maybe I'm Just a tad more critical. I would probably return and recommend that you try this place for sure. I hope they add more menu items. Not an incredibly exciting menu. Needs more variety.

Made a reservation there for my party of 7 for Labor Day.  

When we arrived our server was off to the side dancing by himself while my guests sat and waited for our drink and app order to be taken.  

The service continued to be non-existent...waited for the appetizer...waited for the server to take our dinner orders...waited for the food...waited for the desserts...waited for the bill.  I would like to say that it was very busy and they were understaffed, but we were there at 4pm and there was one other table of customers.  There were staff members just standing around in the "open kitchen" work area.  Not a good thing.  

The food is extraordinarily mediocre at best.  We have had the nachos at Ditka's in Oakbrook and expected them to be the same quality here.  Didn't happen.  The fish tacos were o.k. The salmon was fatty and greasy (how does that happen?)  The pork chop plate has a spinach side that was so salty and garlic-y that it tasted like it was soaked in brine. The chicken plate was typical with the same mashed potatoes that everyone else got and poultry gravy.  The filet meals were fine.

The "Our Coconut Cake" was such a disappointment.  Tough crust, very little custard filling and lots and lots and lots and lots of oily whipped cream.  

The location is the kiss of death.  Most of the restaurants that have come and gone there lasted on average for two-three years.  I don't even think Ditka (#89) can pull this one off.

Dropped some serious $$$ there.  The experience was embarrassing.  And yet, the guy kept on dancing....

Had the BBQ combo of ribs and brisket a few times and it's right on. The got a descent menu and a nice selection of craft beer. Good scene with plenty of TVs to see the games. Plenty of seating for groups.

Da Coach is just a WINNER!!! Everything he puts his name on is great, if you eat anything at all you have to try the POT ROAST NACHOS hands down the best tasting appetizer in town you could make it your meal it huge plate. Nice location close to home friendly staff!!

I wanted to give this restaurant a better rating, I really did. But after stopping in for a late lunch today, I was pretty underwhelmed. I think the menu has potential to be a really good restaurant, but poor execution makes it fall short. 

My boyfriend ordered the steakhouse burger, cooked medium. It was more rare than medium; the burger, mushrooms and onions were bland. The accompanying French fries were a bit mushy. Certainly not what you'd expect from a $12 burger.

I had the fish tacos, and our friendly server offered options to the rice and beans side, so I opted for the Brussels sprouts. The tacos were unremarkable - the fish was properly cooked, but the jalapeo slaw had virtually no jalapeo taste at all. The tacos were coated with oil, which made for messy eating. I don't quite understand the point of putting oil on the outside of a taco. But the Brussels sprouts were disgusting. They were burnt - literally black on the outside - and drowning in olive oil, and no evidence of the Parmesan that was promised in the menu. To add insult to injury, we were up charged an extra $2 for bitter, burnt veg. Had I realized this before my boyfriend paid the check I would have spoken up. Don't get me wrong - I have no problem paying extra to go "off the menu," but paying $15 for two small, bland tacos and burnt veggie makes me feel like a schmuck. 

Service was adequate, but we finished our beers before we finished eating and the server never came back to see if we wanted more beer or a glass of water. Like I said, the service was nothing special. Definitely not what we would expect for a $45 lunch. 

We are starting to think this restaurant space has a curse - it has opened and closed under different names and styles more times than we can count. Hopefully "da coach" hasn't fallen victim to a jinxed location. 

We'll stick with Ditka's in the future. The locations in the city and the burbs never disappoint.

Ditka restaurant should get a penalty for
Dirty bathrooms, so so service and food. 
We were a party of 10; restaurant was not crowded. One in our party came in late. She had to wait 20 minutes for her drink and a glass of water. 
Server indicated brisket sandwich was outstanding. Sandwich was almost impossible to eat due to it being served on thick ciabatta. Chile was not hot and grilled chicken was flavorless. 
Server in training was very friendly.

OK let's deal with the 500 llb gorilla

This building is the kiss of death to all food establishments, but let's face it if Ditka's can't make it work who can...... But still some attention to detail needed

We went recently and thankfully there was a decent wait, sign of good things.

Menu looks good, kind of in the same vein as Bakersfield who must be a bit put out.

We love places with a vibe and this place has got energy of a weekend.

Servers (after a wait longer than estimated) were great

We visit the main Ditkas often and would say that the pulled pork nachos were not as good as in the main restaurant up the street and not sure why.  The Nachos seemed different and end product was not as sloppy as the other place.

The real shock was that my teen meat eating daughter ordered a medium RARE steak.  It came out well done... Yes, Ditkas steak house produced a steak about three temperatures north of requirement.  That's a big first for us who sped every Christmas Eve at the main restaurant who never put a foot wrong in our experience.

My daughter was starving but we sent it back and after we had all finished they brought out her second steak Cooked medium WELL 

She couldn't wait any longer so she ate it.

Having said all that and yes it is a surprise for a Ditka brand, the staff handled it very well.  The waitress was suitably apologetic and the manager did the same, comped her meal and gave us a desert for free.

So, of course we will be back and we'll will enjoy watching this place shine.  Want to try the place adjoining it which is also Ditkasb


So we are here July 31 for second visit

I have to say it hasn't upped our star rating the opposite.

Beer great, service great, ingredients great, ambience lively

This time tonight I ordered pork chop, medium 

It is amazing to think we are talking about Ditkas but it was massively over cooked again  and dry to the bone as George Thorogood almost sang !  I think my granny was less cremated than my chop. 

I did not even complain this time, worst complaints are the one you don't get .

I hope it does well, I really do !

Totally solid. Food -pot roast nachos-really good. 
They try to rush you through and the ambiance is lacking, but other than those things they are a definite positive addition to neighborhood.

Overall I had a good experience here. The appetizers were good and so were the drinks. Service was wonderful. Only thing holding me back from giving it 5 stars was the flavor of the ribs. I ordered the  smoked baby back ribs as my entree and they tasted like they were left in the smoker for years. The smokey flavor was way too over powering but if you're into that flavor then go for it!!

WE WERE INVISIBLE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Sucks!
Service Sucks!
Atmosphere SUcks!
Waitstaff SucKs!
Bartenders SUCK!!!
Did I say this place SUCKS? !!!!!!!!!
WE WERE INVISIBLE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
So we walk in last night around 7:00.  It wasn't that crowded.  The hostess told us that a lot of the seating was reserved but we could have full service at the bar.
YEAH... RIGHT!
We sat at the bar, and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited.....
I was amazed that all the bar staff apparently went to the same school of, "Completely and Totally IGNORE all customers, at All Costs".  They wouldn't even acknowledge your presence!  It was as if you didn't even exist!!!!
UNBELIEVABLE!
WE WERE INVISIBLE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
We finally received a beer and a glass of wine after about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, no one EVER came back to take our food order....
THEY DIDN'T CARE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
And of course, there were apparently the bar regulars that came after us, and got food and drinks served to them instantaneously. 
AND... I'M SURE... THEY'RE ALL THE PEOPLE THAT POSTED POSITIVE REVIEWS !!!! 
We scraped up enough money for the two drinks to slam on the bar and walked out.  
The best part was when someone asked how our service was as we walked out.  "You're kidding me, I said".  "We could barely get served drinks, and no one will even wait on us".  "We're out of here, have a nice night".
Did I say this place SUCKS? !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
WE WERE INVISIBLE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My boyfriend and I love this place and always can't wait to go back. Last night, Saturday night, we had to wait a while for a table, which is understandable without a reservation. No problem for us, but the nice manager comped our dessert anyway (skillet cookie is the bomb). We love the pot roast nachos appetizer (sounds weird but it's amazing, trust me) and usually split the brisket sandwich with a side of pimento mac and cheese... the sandwich is plenty for two people. Awesome food, big portions, nice people. We will definitely be back regularly :)

Great place to watch the game with the family. Drinks and entrees are reasonably priced, and the atmosphere and noise level were perfect - energetic, but not loud to the point that we couldn't hear each other at the table. I recommend the pot roast nachos, brussel sprout salad, and salmon (the honey glaze on the salmon was delicious). The one area where the restaurant could improve on is their vegetarian entree options. Otherwise, Grill 89 is great, and my family will definitely go back.

Great menu!  Very happy with this addition to the area.
I have become a frequent dinner.  My wife even loves it and she is pretty picky.

Pretty awesome, huge portions on entrees (not so much on apps). Good staff! Pulled pork was amazing, brisket is awesome, their ribs also rock! Great beer/wine/drink selection for a place like this. A must try!

Excellent food and wonderful accommodating staff.  Cannot go wrong with this well managed establishment.  

Mark
Great Mini Ditkas!! Very welcoming and amazing food!! BBQ was flavorful and brisket tender. Make sure you see Ashley--Awesome bartender/server!!!
Great burgers. We had the steakhouse & I had two sides - spinach (good) and Brussels Sprite (too salty). Nachos were good. Very attentive service. Really really noisy & loud.

I'm not that impressed. I got fish tacos. And one of the tacos had no fish. And I asked the girl who took my order if the shells were flour or corn she said flour. They were clearly corn which I hate. I said what kind of beans does it come with? She said pimento... Um. That's not even a possibility. They are black beans. I told them no tomato on my husbands burger and there it was big as life. Even on the receipt it said no tomato. So for prices that are higher than average for this area, I'm not impressed.

An offshoot or an addition to the Ditkas restaurant group, this restaurant has a lot to live up to. More casual than Ditkas Restaurants, they have a large bar area with plenty of screens for your favorite sports. The restaurant area is casual and friendly. We started off with chili and Brussels Sprout Salad, both were flavorful. I hate Brussels Sprouts but liked the salad. My wife had the Grill burger which is  half pound cheese burger with the usual topping. It was done just like she likes. I had the Smokehouse combo. Half a rack of ribs, 4 slices of beef brisket and pulled pork. You can also add pork belly or chicken. The West Texas 18 hour Beef Brisket was slightly dried out but the dryness was more than made up with its excellent smoke taste. The ribs were excellent, tender, not dried out with an excellent rub adding to the  flavor. The pulled pork also had a good smoke taste at the ends of the strings of pork. Grill 89 smoked offerings are better than most of the BBQ and Smoke Houses in Chicago. Fries are fresh cut and are excellent, crispy on the outside and tender in the inside. We finished of our dinner with the Sugar Cookie Skillet. Cookie is chewy with topped with ice cream and thick, stiff, freshly made whipped cream.

I am not one to give 5 stars out easily. This restaurant earned it, from the food to the service. As for the service thank you Kelly for a delightful time as you serviced us. I recommend Grill 89 to anyone and everyone that likes American bar food. I am looking forward to trying everything else on the menu.

I had very high hopes for this place. I will start off by saying the food was great. Unfortunately the staff not so much. The hostess stand had multiple women just chatting loudly not even acknowledging customers. Our server was nice but rushed me !!!! Took my plate from me while I was still eating and chewing ! For a $50 dollar meal for two I expect to enjoy my time and not feel rushed. Weird how my card was held by more then one server made me feel uneasy. Might try again for the food but could get better customer service elsewhere.

Having been to and enjoyed all Ditkas locations it was good to see a new location.  Unfortunately this place has a long way to go.  We ordered wings that never came , an egg white omelette that came with regular eggs, and a salad with dressing on the side thar came with missing ingredients, dressing on it , and dressing on the side.  The manager was nice enough but the hair in the wings I ordered after the fact was the last opportunity for redemption.   Wished it was better but unfortunately won't be back until it's ready for prime time.   The managing partner was excellent and did make it right.  He is a great Ditka's rockstar for sure.  Had to go to him to get it right but a class act.

Newly opened restaurant with some major bugs to work out. Very attentive, helpful waitress made me think about adding a third star but the dry "18 hour" brisket and long wait for food items to come out kept it at two stars. If I come back at all it won't be for a while and I hope they get their act together.
Really enjoyed dining at Grill 89. Great food and friendly service. The highlight of the evening was meeting the coach. I highly recommend it.

A new casual dining Ditkas was the perfect place to watch COPA  we stared with the awesome smoked habnero wings  just right on the heat with a blue cheese dipping sauce and a delightful and colorful selection of veggies. The corn muffins were superior; moist sweet and savory presented with piped whipped butter.  The  brisket was completely amazing best that I have eaten and I lived in Texas for a few years. I ate every bit of the coleslaw. My husband loved the signature pork chop and raved about the neck bone gravy. The abundant portions yet we ordered the warm chocolate chip cookie a must with lavazza coffee. I can't wait to return.

Brisket melt sandwich was fantastic.  One of the best sandwiches I ever tasted.  Service, unfortunately, was not so good.  I went there on a Sunday, late afternoon, and was seated at an outside table.  It took approximately 10 minutes for someone to approach my table to offer something to drink, took my order and never returned with my drink.  Then, the manager was passing my table and asked if I had been helped.  When he found out that no one had brought my drink he brought another waitress over to wait my table.  She was helpful, however, after serving my food, I only saw her again when she gave me my bill.  Even then, she didnt return to pick up the payment so I brought it inside and handed it to the manager.  I overheard that the manager was just transfered there, recently, so hopefully he can improve the service there.

Was seated right away despite being 1/2 hour early to our reservation. Staff was fast and attentive. I ordered the grill burger, my fianc had the BBQ combo. Both of us enjoyed the food very much. My burger was cooked perfectly. Only complaint was that the drinks were a little pricey, but most cocktail drinks are at restaurants. Will definitely be coming back!

Tuesday evening our twosome was seated promptly. Service was prompt and friendly and the food was delicious. Fish tacos, tortilla soup, and a turkey dip on focaccia. The restaurant was full by the time we left. It is obvious this restaurant has just opened as they have boxes lining the front window, but it was definitely worth the trip.

Sat at bar and service was bad. Not busy but the bartender didn't know how to multitask. We put a beer bottle or glass on the edge of the bar, which is the universal sign that we want another , and  we were ignored for quite a long time. However, I give 5 stars to Bobby the bar back!  He was awesome! Not going back.

Wonderful service. Not rushed. My daughter is a fan so she took Mom. We drove 40 min and yes I would do it again. The pot roast nachos are amazing and rich in flavor. The Mahi Mahi tacos were perfect. We shared all dishes and I would definitely do that again... Made is more fun engagement. Yep we had the crazy cookie thing for dessert... Yep it awesome but caused much guilt!

The first time we dined here, the place was brand new and the service was stumbling and awkward but the bad experience was punctuated by a mistake in the kitchen where they used balsamic vinegar on ice cream instead of chocolate sauce. Unfortunately, the combo made my daughter Ill and she vomited before we even left the restaurant. It was very difficult to get anyone's attention or even an apology for this. The staff are so green. It's unclear who is in charge although the place seems to be crawling with employees. Nobody there could appreciate a mistake like that could actually result in a serious health event for some people and it was basically shrugged off by everyone. I feel that if someone vomits because of a kitchen mistake that's an epic fail (we are eating in Westmont and not the Third World, after all!). I went again months later, under protest, with a friend who told me it had gotten better. This time I ate half a salad wondering what the chewy white stuff was. I ended up pulling out pieces and constructed part of a white paper cone. My waitress brought over a colleague who announced it was some packaging from the vegetables. Nobody apologized but they did offer me another salad and I wasn't charged extra for extra ingredients at least. I'm not planning another visit. A prerequisite for working in a full-service restaurant should be that you have at least eaten at a full-service restaurant. I'm not even sure if these people have been to a Burger King drive thru.

Not worth it. Ambience is strange in there and food is just average. Wait staff is nice but overbearing. J Alexander's right up the block is a much better option for relatively the same price as this place which is burgers and basics.

Good food. Friendly staff. But so noisy that you cannot have a conversation even in a booth. I was dining with a hearing impaired friend and she complained about the loud noise. I hope this can be corrected so I can give 89 more stars.

Was good.  Would go back.  Had the dip-dip-dip appetizer all three were good but homemade crackers or bruschetta toast i think would be a better option than the tortilla chips.  Turkey dip sandwich was very good as were the fries.  Didn't get the dipping sauce, was like a smokey thick tomato soup, au jus would be better but really didn't need anything though.  Too full for dessert, next time.

The menu has a nice variety.  Everything we tried was excellent.  The pot roast nachos were great.  The cornbread muffins were amazing.  The chili was excellent had a great smokey flavor and plenty of meat with hearty flavor. The service was excellent.  The only downfalls were they served Pepsi products instead of Coke, and we seated outside next to a very obnoxious table of about 6 adults that was rather unpleasant.  But a really good menu can't wait to go back and try different items.

Stopped in for lunch with my dad.  Food was terrific as was the service.  We had the Turkey Dip and the Pulled Pork Sandwich both with fries.  The Turkey Dip comes with a tomato based dipping sauce that packs a little punch.  Very enjoyable.  The Pulled Pork had a jalapeno slaw on top that was just right.  We will both be back!

For a new restaurant, Grill 89 is well on the way to serving up great food for the area. After a few visits, I have been impressed with the fresh flavors in the soups and salads, which are well worth trying. Our server Felicia (a gem) was energetic and spot-on with food and drink selections for both of us. (The brisket melt sandwich with a sweet and slightly spicy sauce might be my new favorite!) Both the chicken and salmon topped salads were flavorful and done just right. The kitchen has been responsive to specific requests and menu alterations. We've tried a selection of beer and wine from the list, and have been pleased with the range of choices. We expect to be back to try some other choices from the drink and food menu!
Loved this place! Got the cornbread, Caesar salad and pulled pork... Super good food and the service was excellent!

Great place to eat..We visited for the first time today and were not disappointed. Ditka's entry into this casual dining and small plate offerings will not disappoint. Friendly and attentive staff that added to the whole experience. Great Romaine salad which is large large enough for two people. The pulled pork plate with corn bread, whipped potatoes, a deviled egg and a choice of two BBQ sauce choices was moist and tender.  The rotisserre chicken was done perfectly, juicy and flavorful with side of asparagus and whipped potatoes. A slice of Coconut Cream Pie
topped off what was a great meal and first time experience. 5 Stars to our server Morgan and 5 Stars to Paul, Manager/Partner who introduced himself and made us feel like we were long time customers. We visit Ditka's in Oak Brook frequently and now have another place to add for a different kind of atmosphere. We will be back to try the many more offerings on menu.
Great Experience..

Went there on a Sunday Afternoon. There were 4 people sitting at the bar and maybe 15 others at the tables. Got seated quickly at a high top table. Servers seemed uninterested.After a few minutes young kid finally takes our 2 drink order. Waiting about 20 minutes later to order another wine. Server walks to bartender for 2 wines. He walks away. 2 wines sat at the bar for 15 more minutes while  the server dissappeared. Granted the distance is about 10 feet to deliver our drinks. Finally another server strolled t o the bar and saw the drinks and receipt sitting there and brought them over laughing. Not very appealing when the wine now has sweat on our glasses from sitting there. The Place was 90% empty.There was a guy standing around who was probably the manager,but he seemed only interested in the bartender. Paid our tab and left. Ditka must only be a silent partner. Not surprised this has been a,few different establishes. .wanted to like it. Never got to the food. Total Dissapoinment!!  Won't be back or recommend,,  Kiddie land Employees.

I didn't have a chance to try the food.  We walked in at 6:20 pm on a Friday night (party of 2) and the unfriendly hostess immediately asked us if we had a reservation.  We didn't and she told us it was an hour wait.  I get that if you walk into a restaurant on a weekend night and there is a big crowd waiting around the hostess stand or at the bar waiting to be seated.  There were empty tables, obviously reserved for reservations and the bar was 3/4 full but no 2 seats together. The hostess offered to seat us at a high top table for 6 and we would be seated in the middle between 2 couples with no opportunity to have a private conversation.  She saw us try to figure out 2 seats at the bar but didn't offer to help.  This place is a casual restaurant. They obviously only want people with reservations.  Very uninviting place... Need to get their act together!

We did carry out so I can't comment on service or ambiance. The food was good, but have had better BBQ. The brisket was a bit dry. I thought portions were ok, but pricey. Two burgers, brisket and three fries and no drinks $45 and change

I ordered the Sonoma coast chicken salad and it only came out with lettuce, chicken, and croutons- it was missing 5 ingredients!  The food was still tasty, but the server was too busy to notice and check back and we had already waited a long long time for our food.  I would like to try it again and hope I get the entire salad next time when the place is a little more established.

Eat here!!!!!! The food is outstanding mexican cuisine. I had the tortilla soup which left me wanting more. My husband had the Carne Asada platter which he approved of. The service was quick, the waitress was friendly, the restaurant was nice ans clean. Everything was great!!!!! Definitely worth eating here. We will be coming back!

Not bad for my first time here. It's located in an area that's hard to make it since it's somewhat hidden. I had a taco salad which was pretty well made. The tacos looked very good and I will have to try them next time. Until next time, I cannot comment on anything else

Great value - love the chunky tasty guacamole and flaky chips - recommended  to add a jalapeo for 60 cents.  Chicken tacos require salsas to spice them up.  Good rice and beans. We do carry out only.  For desert the choco flan is great but not always available.  Parking is plentiful if a little tricky - especially at night - right off busy Wolf Road - hard to tell where the curb is - lighting is very poor (hint hint)!

This place is pretty darn good, love the home made chips!  Fresh and warm and good salsa.  You can see the chips being made in the back.  I have been here twice and the food is always excellent.  The only knock I would give this place, sometimes it seems they seat you and bring you menus sometime they don't so unclear if you go to the counter to order or not.  If it was not for that, I would give this place 5 stars.

Came here for lunch and was disappointed. The line to get food was long, and our wait was even longer. From entering the restaurant to getting out food took about 40 minutes! 

Quesabroso is clearly short staffed. They had only four people working there total on a Friday during lunch hour. One at the register, two in the kitchen, and one running food. 

The food itself was just okay. The portion of rice & beans was small, and I felt the whole meal was overpriced for what it was. There's definitely better Mexican joints for lunch.

Wow... Tortillas with flavor? YES
One street taco  with carn asada, one with El Pastor, rice and homemade refried beans made up my taco platter. 
El Pastor has just the right marinade and spicy juiciness. 
The beef was good, but the El Pastor was better!
I ate in, so I received chips (home fried) and salsa (made here too) 
Horchata with a little is was a GREAT accompaniment. Lots of rich cinnamony flavor. 
A little confusing when you come in, but they have take out AND table service. Food came out quick and hot. 
I'm coming back here before the trip back to Cali!

It was a rainy day, and dinner was many hours away, so before I did some shopping I stopped here for lunch.

Whether it's lunch, dinner, or maybe sitting in traffic on 290 one more second will make you explode, go to Quesabroso.

The Tortilla Soup is practically a meal in itself.  It's very flavorful and topped with chunks of avocado, tortilla strips, and melty, stringy cheese.

The Street Taco (steak with cilantro and onion) was good, but honestly I'd come back for more tortilla soup and the delicious, complimentary chips and salsa.  It seems most Mexican restaurants only get one right, chips OR salsa.  Quesabroso does both well.  The chips were super fresh, and I couldn't get enough of the green salsa.  I washed it all down with a horchata and headed back out into the rain.

Quesabroso is a casual restaurant, it isn't a divey tacqueria, or is it an upscale restaurant serving Latin cuisine.  It's the Goldilocks of Mexican food, it's juuuuust right!  The interior, done mostly in greens, gray and brown, and the rock en Espanol playing softly, sets the stage for a casual, comfortable, an authentic, dining experience.

I've been coming here since before they moved next door.  Their food is good and reasonably priced. I've had their tacos, enchiladas, flautas, nachos, they have recently added Flan (yum!). 
My only issue is consistency. 
Sometimes I get a steak taco and its fully seasoned. Its fantastic! 
Sometimes, its like they forgot to add even salt and pepper. :(

Same with the guacamole. 
Sometimes, its mainly avocado with some onions, cilantro and tomatoes. Yay!
Sometimes its ALL onions and barely any avocado. :(

The food is good enough to be worth the gamble. So, if you go on a night where they happen not to be on their "A" game, give it another try before you dismiss them.

How Delicious! That's the translation of Quesabroso. 

It's been about 2 years since I've been frequenting this place with Heather H. I've always known it was here since I used to go to the Greek Deli that used to be next door. Well, now, the Greek Deli closed and Quesabroso got that space as well so they've expanded.

I love their chips and salsa, with about 3 orders of their salsa. I just can't get enough. Their entrees are really good too, I rarely get tacos here. To be hones, the tacos could be a little bit better. 

For entrees I've tried their chicken with mole, enchiladas, flautas or the carne asada which is my favorite. I mean, who doesn't love a big piece of meat! 

Last time I was there it was lunch time, Angela P, her son and I, I've only been there during dinner. We got sat and then we were able to grab baskets of chips and salsas on our own. I had to ask the lady for a bigger cup than the 2 oz. plastic containers she had out. She didn't mind and grabbed one for me. 

I ordered the pollo con mole, I remember it being very sweet but I also ordered two grilled jalapenos on the side. Well the flavor of the mole, chicken and grilled jalapenos combined is like no other! Sweet, savory and spicy. I finished the whole plate and didn't feel guilty at all. They even took the bone out of the chicken. How nice.

We got up throughout our lunch and got two more basket of chips, you know, since we had my friends son with and he really really loved them. ;)

I think I'll be going for lunch more. H? :)

Great authentic Mexican food! My fianc and I just moved here from Texas and we have yet to find a good Mexican restaurant, until now! Salsa is amazing and food is fresh, cheap, and delicious. Location and building is weird but I Definitely recommend this place.
I am still dreaming about their steak fajitas 4 weeks later.  My friends loved the tortilla soup.  I can't wait to go back!
Delicious chicken mole enchiladas! This place is in a tiny strip mall and the parking is limited but it is well worth a stop!

The only reason I'm rating Quesabroso 3 stars, is specifically due to their significantly reduced portion sizes. When I first started coming here I was very content with the food. I didn't mind paying a little extra for better quality food; however, my most recent visits have been consistently under portioned. Which is very disappointing considering the food is delicious. This is why I would've initially given it 4 or 5 stars, but I don't think restaurants should compromise downsizing portions. All the while,  they're charging customers full prices( in comparison, to all the other local Mexican restaurants). The only reason I've continued to come back, is because of the taste and quality in their food. However, I really wish they'd add more meat/ steak to their tacos and Tortas. To give you a better idea, the street tacos have 2 corn tortillas with 2 ounces of steak. Then, they load it with garnishes to compensate for the small portion of meat. Which is notable, when your getting a lot more tortilla than meat in every bite. I mean at the very least, an equal ratio of meat to tortilla would be appropriate. As a consumer, if I'm paying $2.75 per Taco at least serve 3-3.5 ounces of meat that's reasonable. But only 2 ounces, that's pretty ridiculous, a rip off and disappointing. I've worked in the culinary/ hospitality industry for over a decade. I know the business and that's why I can assure you that it's 2 ounces. 
Also, I've ordered their steak torta's a few times. Again very good in taste, but a very tiny portion of meat to bread ration. They use about 2 ounces of steak/ meat in the torta's. Which should usually have about 4 ounces of meat. This is my primary complaint and dislike about Quesabroso. I'm surprised no other reviewers have had the same compliant. I've considered calling their management to bring it to their attention. Because, the overall experience and consistency in quality and taste is there. The only element missing is the reasonable portions. 
By the way, the chips and salsa are fantastic! They're complimentary which is a plus; along with, the freshness and crispy texture! 
Hopefully, in the near future I can update my review and add another star or two. Fingers crossed.

I come here for lunch regularly.  I order the vegetarians tacos, and they are $2.50 and have about half a haas avocado.  The owners are super friendly, it's never crowded and you don't have to shout over other shouting lunching employees.  I always leave feeling healthy, relaxed and super satisfied for less than your garden variety burrito bowl.
I love coming here for Mexican food. Clean place and food is great! Since they have expanded they have been really busy which is great!

Omg this place has the best food
Defiantly high quality ingredients 
Not you average tacos

Quesabroso is like many of the small Mexican food places in the w-burbs offering quality food at a reasonable price. You know the places I mean - Taco Grill and Salsa Bar, Taqueria el Pulpo, Los Burritos Tapatios, Taco Express.

 This place serves up tasty authentic Mexican fare, but steers clear of ingredients that may scare off its non-Hispanic clientele (such as lengua, tripa and cabeza). That doesn't affect me much, as I'm one of the aforementioned scared eaters. Still, when I see those items on the menu, I do feel like the rest of the food might be a little more authentic. But hey, that's just my theory.

I was greeted upon sitting down with a place of still-warm from the fryer tortilla chipas and a bowl of salsa verde. The salsa was good, but mild. For an extra kick, they offer Cholula with lime table side. A carry-out order was offered a choice of salsas (hot or mild). I'm not sure why I didn't get a choice. Not a big deal, though.

I ordered a-la-carte: one taco, one tostada and one sope with a variety of ingredients (pollo, steak and al pastor). The tostada and sope came with sour cream, refried beans, lettuce and tomato, while the soft corn tacos were dressed more typically Mexican, with cilantro and onion. My favorite of the bunch was the pollo tostada. The taco al pastor was also excellent, though I saw no evidence of a vertical spit. The sope was less successful -- a little doughey for my taste. Still, the steak on top was plentiful and well-flavored. Next time I'll get it on a tostada instead.

I think this is my new favorite non-regional Mexican outside of the city. The food is solid, the portions are large and the bill is small. It's a winning combination.

Had the Pollo en Mole and it was out of this world!

Great space, bright, not much parking. 

A wonderful value for your $.

Excellent food and good value. Salsa verde is amazing and has inspired me to start making my own. The decor is nice and the owners and staff are very friendly. Great for the family to dine in quick or order to go. Lunches here get very busy.

I have eaten here twice and I must say I am impressed, this food is really good.  The chips and salsa are amazing because the chips are fresh baked and delicious.  The salsas are quite good indeed both the green and the red.  
The first time I had a steak burrito and and Al Pastor taco, I loved the steak as it was cooked right and really tasty and not chewy.  The Al Pastor was quite good in it's own way.
I just went here again today and I have the Chimichanga which was out of this world good!  I ordered it with the hot sauce applied, which is a really tasty red sauce that is oh so good!

Not much to look at but the food was delicious. One of the few places I've eaten when you have avocado it is actually good size pieces of avocado. The tortilla soup was extremely flavorful. Homemade chips made the nachos even better. Decor and no ice tea make it a four but otherwise the food was great!! We will certainly be back!

Ordered combo fajitas, grande nachos, 3 taco dinner and gauc to go.

It took 30 minutes!!!

The gauc had NO flavor! The fajitas were good. That 3 taco dinner only had 2 tacos.

Never going back to this place!!!

I love this place. The food is fresh and flavorful. I frequently order a steak tostada. 

The tortilla chips are freshly fried. 

The staff is great. There is only one cook, and he is very friendly. Their servers are all attentive and kind.

I love me some Quesabroso!

I lived in Cicero for two years and never thought I would miss seeing a Mexican place every few blocks until I moved down the street from Quesabroso. The only other "Mexican" around is Taco Bell.  sad face.

Every time I come here, I try something new. Each time it just gets better! First, it gives me a place to grab a couple of churros. I can never get too many churros. Second, the flautas! Apparently, I love mexican phallic shaped foods. None the less, I could live on their flautas and churros. It doesn't get any better!

Food is good, but took some of us 45 minutes to an hr to get our food. A couple suggestions to the management:
1. Get ticket number cards to place at the table, so the food runner can find the correct customer.

2. Get tubs to assist person cleaning tables , so they do not need to make multiple trips or wipe table crumbs onto the floor.

3. Do not place takeout orders before dine-in.

4. Appetizer order should come out before main dish; Not with and 45 min after ordering.
Best Chicken burrito I have ever had. Period.
One of the best Mexican restaurants in the area hands down. I would choose here over anywhere else any day. The alpastor is a definite MUST! So is the green salsa yum, everyone come!
No words..just good. It seems like a family owned place. Crave the homemade tortilla chips (I think they are homemade). The meat is fantastic. The salsa is addictive.

I have now been here 3 times in the last 7 days. Yes I am currently obsessed. I'm in the middle of a move and have no food at my apartment or my house. The owner already remembers me and we'll probably be on a first name basis by the end of the month. The second time my friend and I showed up, he gave us tortilla soup on the house and it was excellent! I've never had avocado in it before and now I won't be able to go without it again.

The chips and salsa are awesome; both the red and the green. My friends and I keep finishing both containers. I would honestly get chips and salsa takeout on its own. 

I've had the carne asada, cheese enchiladas with mole and the steak enchiladas with red salsa. All were fantastico! The mole was sweeter than others I've had, but I loved it. 

This has definitely become my go-to Mexican joint and it should be yours, too. If you live or work near Wolf and 22nd Street, check out Quesabroso!

Great place for a casual authentic Mexican meal. Very casual, you place your order at the counter and they deliver it to your table. Very nice service and will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. They have recently upgraded to the space next door giving them the room they need to serve the large lunch crowd I usually see during the week. I personally love the Chorizo burrito and their chicken enchiladas are wonderful.

There are very few good Mexican places in the area (I work in the area) that I have found.  I do like the couple that run the place (literally only a nice man and woman) and they work very hard.  The food is okay but I would say good for the area and I like to support this locally owned place and the free chips and salsa so I bump it up from 2 to 3 stars.
I've eaten here a few times and it's been great every time. Their new space is great. I had the 3 taco dinner with pastor, steak,and chorizo. The pastor was the highlight. Tons of flavor.

We were made aware of this place via Yelp and we're so happy that we were!  Really good food at a fair price.  The service is a little slow only because they are so busy and did I say the food was very good.  They are looking to get their liquor license so we'll be drinking Margarita's soon - hopefully!

I have worked at two different offices in this area, and at both places, Quesabroso is my lunch group's favorite lunch spot. I love their chips and salsa -- always so fresh! Their guacamole is also very good. I always get a steak torta and have never been disappointed. If you're there at lunchtime on a weekday, be prepared to wait a little bit for your food because they're always packed!

Went to lunch here yesterday and I ordered the chicken nachos, my husband ordered a steak burrito with extra meat.  You get a lot of food for the price you are paying which is great.  The chips are more gourmet than just chips you buy from the store, which are out of a bag; there light and fluffy, however, some of them are a little too greasy for my liking.  The only other negative aspect about the place would be it isn't the cleanest place in the world, the tables and chars are sticky and I almost didn't want to sit down and eat just because of that.  I'm glad I did stay and ate though because it was very good, I would go back just wish it was a little cleaner.

Also, free chips and salsa!

I always pass the 4 storefront building off of Wolf Rd. but never went in here as I mistook this as a Chipotle-like Mexican restaurant that's geared towards gringos, ala high prices for small portions.  That couldn't have been any further from the truth.  

Decided to patronize Quesabroso from all the positive reviews as that many yelpers can't be wrong.  Inside was absolutely immaculate!  Probably the most upscale taqueria interior I've ever seen.  Place looked as it was run by a husband-wife team which is always a good sign.  They have the kitchen visible enough to where you can see the guy cook the food and all the food near him look quite fresh.  They had aluminum foil pans of tortilla chips, which might suggest that they make their own chips.  

I got the Milanesa (breaded steak) torta and they really packed in a lot of ingredients for $5.49, especially the guacamole.  Very delicious!  Also got the al pastor burrito and again, top notch!  The hot sauces were perfect as they weren't too hot or too mild, just right.  My uncle couldn't believe how big of a steak they give you for the $9.99 carne asada dinner and that it was a ribeye and not a thin piece of flank steak.  

Excellent place!!!

Modern on the inside, divey on the outside.  This place has pretty tasty tortilla soup which is served with fresh sliced avocado and giant strips of crunchy fried tortillas.  I sort of expected the consistency to be thicker, but realized later that if you let it sit long enough, the tortillas in the bottom will soak up soup and give it that nice chunky chili-ish consistency that I've grown to love in tortilla soup.

The chips and salsa (free and self serve?) were quite tasty and seem to be real tortillas fried up in the back. 

The only disappointing thing was the dessert.  I was really looking forward to the tres leches cake (that was on special today) but it almost seemed like the cake part was dry... which is really surprising considering it's literally soaked with sweetened milk. I mean, I know it's usually tough to keep it from getting overly soggy, but this cake had a very dry consistency despite the milk and in my opinion needed an extra dollop of whipped cream on top.

Cake mishap aside, I'll totally try this place again... and next time order something with more substantial!
Nice for a happy hour! They have excellent apps and dishes and good drinks. The atmosphere is perfect for after work drinks. I would suggest this place to anyone looking for a good time!

We go here for lunch from work all the time.  It can get crazy busy right at noon but the line always moves fast and it is so worth it.

The pork tacos with cilantro and onion are great and the two salsas are good...spicy but not too spicy.

We had high hopes based on the past reviews. I took my 3 kids there (10, 14, and 16) for a quick dinner. Service was efficient. The place smelled like a bathroom. The chips and salsa were good and homemade. The rice was dry and bland. We had steak tacos which were decent.  My son had a burrito and he said all he could taste was the steak (which was tasty), but he'd like more to taste in his burrito.  My daughters cheese quesadillas were bland.    All food was in general mediocre. The place smelled.  Not worth returning. Disappointed.
I love this place.fresh guacamole,fresh chips,fantastic fajitas!  BYOB and sit and enjoy!

Discovered this gem in 2012 and have been back many times.  Amazing food!!  Everything we have tried has been fantastic.  The chips are addicting!  The carne asada is amazing.  Definitely a favorite for Mexican food!!

Basic Mexican American food prepared fresh.  Passed this place daily for years now and finally stopped in.  And now when we feel like Mexican we come here.  Chips are fried here and doesn't come from a bag.  Food prepared quickly so you can make that quick stop for delicious food.  I order the carne asada everytr me.  Guacamole is fresh.  Tortilla soup is very tasty.  They have a bustling take out business.
Authentic Mexican food, served very quick! But it is high quality and delicious for a very reasonable price, and they have coke in a glass bottle, you don't see that very often anymore...

I eat here 3-4 times per week. Expensive for a taco place ($2.50 for a standard $1.60 taco), but VERY good food. The man and woman that own/operate the location are very nice.

Free chips and salsa (unofficially all you can eat) that you grab on your own.

I went here a few days ago as I was coming back from Oak Brook Mall and at first I was pushed away because of the curb appeal.  The restaurant sign is nice and big but they should've used a bolder design/style.  The strip mall it is located in looks bland and old, but that's not the restaurant's fault.  In fact, that's the only tiny strip mall you will see if you stopped and looked around.  Opposite of it is a gated golf course and all around it are residential areas.  STILL, don't be put off by the bland and walk on in, you will like it!

Actually I turned around because I was turned off, but then I thought that the surroundings should not be a judge of what's inside and what they have to offer.

I walked in and the decor was actually pretty modern.  It's like night and day when you walk in, I was taken back.  There are little annoyances like being able to see into the kitchen which did not match the rest of the place, the mismatched bulbs, that cheap, plastic cactus that should be thrown into the trash, etc.  But overall it's a good design.

Once you sit down (you pick your own seat) you will be greeted by a lady who is probably the owner of the place.  She isn't actually dressed professionally but she's got an apron so I guess that counts for something.  But what really matters is that she's nice.  Not that "Super attentive waiter who wants a tip" nice but the "I'm here to serve you food like your mom or friendly aunt" nice.

So she asked me if I wanted mild or hot sauce and I chose hot.  Two minutes later she gave me a menu, some nachos, and hot sauce in a professional white tea cup and saucer.  (I can't call it hot sauce because it wasn't sauce, it was more of a watery type, but still good)  So their tools are professional, but their service style is that of an average Mexican restaurant, you know, the ones that don't stand out.  But hey, as long as the service is good, then I'm fine with it.  I was satisfied with the service for what it offered.  If you are looking for the "tip waiter" experience, then go somewhere else.  There ain't no sweet talkin' here :D

BTW, the nachos were a bit too oily but the "sauce" was good. 

I ordered the Mixed Fajitas with flour tortillas.  There is also choice of corn.  I typically substitute the guacamole for sour cream but I wasn't asked for that option.  Maybe next time.  I got my food after a 10 minute wait, so that was good.  It was served on the sizzling pan and for the most part mirrored professional restaurant tools.  The food tasted great.  The chicken had the right amount of seasoning, the steak was cooked well done even though I didn't ask.  That's the way I like it though :D  The veggies were cooked just right as the tomatoes tasted like tomatoes, which is usually a miss at most places.  The tortillas were cooked right, but nothing spectacular. 

So overall the food was good, above average, but nothing spectacular.  For a restaurant in that location it was great.  If I go by that area I will stop in again.

BTW they serve canned or bottled drinks, no fountain machines.

I really want to give this place a 5 star, reason you might ask, the people that run this place I think are a married couple and are super nice every time I've walked in.
