I've only had the tacos when here, the steak is grade a quality meat, the Al Pastor (marinated pork) tacos are also good, the only down fall of this place which I have to agree with the April C. the portions are huge, the tacos are super packed with meat, they sometimes almost over do it with seasoning.  

I've worked in Mexican restaurant for 10 years, so I think I could tell which places are good and authentic and which ones are not.  This place is authentic and decent, if they were to tweak a couple of things here and there, this place would probably be the best Mexican place around this area.  

Final thought, if you want quality food for a good price and you like huge portions this is the place to go.  Have nothing bad to say about the place, it's clean and service is good, food is served nice and hot.  But can't give it a 5 star yet, hope this place makes it in the long run.  

Gotta be honest, you can tell this is probably the first place these people have owed by the popcorn machine in the corner, but I think they can make it.  If Quesabroso is reading this, get rid of the popcorn machine it sticks out like a sore thumb, and if you ever want anymore suggestion on how to make your place better send me a message.

We came here for dinner and were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was! The chips were homemade, crispy, hot and just amazing! The best chips we have had out... We ordered a chicken chimichanga with mole sauce and fajitas. We also had a bowl of the tortilla soup - which was great! This had great flavor and homemade crispy tortilla chips on top. The mole sauce was definitely homemade, which I probably wouldn't order again because it was very sweet, but the chimichanga was great. The chicken was very moist and flavorful. The fajitas were also great!
Another bonus: They sell Mexican Coca-cola w/ cane sugar. We had a great experience here! 
Oh yes, the service was fantastic as well. Great Job, Quesabroso!
My coworkers and I love this place for lunch. Great fresh chips and salsas. My pick is the al pastor chimichanga.

I've been going to this place since it opened years ago. I absolutely love it. Since then I've brought friends and business associates there for lunch. The quality is really spectacular and despite the small staff, service has always been very good. I typically get their Quesa Broso Carne Asada or their Bistec a la Mexicana- both are so juice and flavorful for a cut of meat that can be notoriously hard to cook with any precision. I've also had their Pollo con Mole, which is outstanding. The mole (negro) is made per order and is just fantastic! The portion size is large and their chips are made fresh every day. 

This is one of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to for the size, menu and cost. I highly recommend it!

We love this place. Quiet. Small. And authentic flavors . Tried almost everything on the menu 5 star on everything except for the burrito. For me thats a 3 star. The steak is very tasty. Haven't tried chicken nor beef. Hooked on the steak.

Excellent Platter called Quesa Broso, chicken Enchilada was brilliant. Chicken steak was big and tasty. This place could have been even better if they served a mexican beer with the food. Will definitely go back to try other dishes :)
I love this place. When I am at my brother's and they suggest mexican I always say yes cus this is the place they order from.

We eat here at least three times a month! The taco's are the best around and the carne  is quit tasty! The guacamole could do with a little less onion but over all the food here is great! The prices are good and the staff is always friendly! They have done some remodeling and added beer and margaritas to the menu  since they switched ownership. Keep up the good work!!

It took me a while to get it.  Que sabroso!  How delicious!  Very apropo. Guacamole is fantastic. Large chunks of avocado, freshly made, tomatoes, cilantro. Fresh fried homemade chips - seems like from flour tortillas.  I had a torta.  The milanese.  Refried beans, cheese, avocado.  The bread was freshly baked, soft and delicious.  The meat was a little on the thin side and seemed over cooked.  My husband had the tortilla soup.  It chocked full of tortilla strips, had a smoker tasting broth, had cheese, avocado and sour cream.  He said it was really good.  Service was a little on the slow side, for being the only customers in the store.  However, they seemed to have several 'to go' orders they were working on.  We also tried their churros.  I asked for them after my dinner, but I don't think they heard me.  So I got them with my dinner.  They were drizzled with chocolate and served with a small glass of liquid chocolate on the side.  They were okay, a little too greasy and not really a standout.  Nice presentation on all the dishes.  I would definitely come back her again.
Went there today for the 1st time pretty good food. I will go back. In and out restaurant pretty good for Oakbrook.

I eat here at least once a week. The service is always great. This is the perfect place for lunch. I have never had any complaints about the place. The steak is amazing. The chicken is well seasoned and very flavorful. The pork and chorizo is also great. The ground beef is lacking in flavor, but everyone that goes there knows to get the steak instead. They also offer free tortilla chips and homemade salsas. Anyone could easily get filled up with $6.

Amazing pizza! One of my favorite places to eat and have a couple drinks. 
I order at AL's and then go next-door have a few drinks and they deliver the pizza to me right at the bar.
My only complaint is that it's cash only. 
However there is an ATM in the bar.

We went to this place after we saw it being featured on chicagos best pizza on YouTube, and it was near our house. Half of the building is the pizza place and the other half is a bar. Both are separate businesses but you could get your pizza served to you at the bar.

Als pizza sells only pizzas, which kind of makes it great that way. Ingredients in the pizza taste original and fresh. They don't carry and sides, but the bar next door sells food too.

We went on a Friday and it was packed. Wait for pizza was about an hour but you can call ahead. Known for the thin crust pizza. I would definitely recommend this place!

Just had Al's pizza for the 1st time this evening and i must say, i was pretty impressed but the reviews made it seem much better than it was. I can honestly say this is a 4 star pizza establishment for the area but would have some tough competition it they were on the south side of Chicago. We ordered a 10" sausage and a 16" sausage, mushroom & black olive and the smaller pizza was cooked perfect and the large pizza was a bit soggy. I am willing to bet the 16" was soggy due to the mushrooms but obviously the crust cannot hold up to many toppings. I will say i kept eating the pizza because the cheese/sauce were good and the toppings were fresh. If i was to critique anything about the pizza, i would say the crust was my least favorite part since it was lacking flavor and couldn't withstand 3 toppings. I would like to see a crisper crust and maybe not as bendable at the bottom. 

If you plan to dine in make sure you ask the prices on the cans of pop as i didn't realize it was $1.50 otherwise, i wouldn't have ordered so many. Other than that, my experience was pretty good and would recommend this place if you pass by.

We had a potluck at work & everyone bought or cooked food. Me being lazy I ordered pizzas! I ordered 1 small sausage/mushroom, 1 16in cheese, 1 16in sausage. My team loved it. They'd eaten it before so they suggested I order from here. 

My sausage/mushroom was good. The cheese was a little too thick for me. Sausage & mushrooms were tasty. The crust & sauce were good too. I enjoyed it. But I think the pizza was more of a 3.5 to me. 

Service is the reason for the 4 stars. I called at 930am to open & they were there taking orders, they don't open until 11. He said I could pick up at 1120. I got there at 1130 the food was READY!!!! They were friendly during pick up too. SERVICE IS DEFINITELY A 5. That's how I came up with 4 stars. 

Definitely a good eat in Warrenville!!!!!

Al's is the best of the burbs in my eyes. Pizza is my thing and most places in the burbs wouldn't get past a three star rating. 

They do one thing: pizza. I'm telling you that is always a sign of a place to try because all of their energy goes into making the best pizza and they nail it.

First Timer Process
1. Cash Only
2. Order when you walk in
3. Grab drinks after ordering from fridge and sit down 
4. Eat and then pay on way out
5. If you have kids, they will give them a sucker on the way out if you okay it. If you tell them to make the kids do something, they'll tell the kids something responsible or funny they must do before eating it. They tell my two they must agree to clean their rooms. Kids love it.
6. Tip them and see how the family operates!

What to Eat
1. Get a cheese, sausage, pepperoni. They do it right! 2. I'm a cheese only fan for my first adventure at pizza places

Tip: call and ensure they are open. Because they are a true mom and pap place, closing hours vary
Tip: Order a 14" or more. I noticed the 10" to be a different, less fulfilling exprience in terms of crust 
Tip: if you dive in as soon as it hits your table, you'll burn the roof of your mouth. It comes out of the oven and right to your table in less than a minute. However, it is best HOT so pull a couple of pieces to your plate and wait roughly 60-90seconds. Separate a couple more piEces on the pizza sheet while waiting. You'll then be good to go the rest of the way. Trust me!

Left or right? 

Al's Pizza left, Towne Tap right.  

6;15 on a Saturday evening.. Al's was busy so we went right,  we got a table for 6 at the Towne Tap, ordered three pizza's from Al's and they brought them to our table. Lot's of folks do that.

Best thin crust pizza? I don't know.. but it's in the team picture. (love Vito and Nicks)

We ordered three 16 incher's, a sausage, a pepperoni and and Canadian bacon. Strangely, it was an all meat night *shrug*.... that works for the carnivore in me. We asked for them all "well done"

Did I mention? Bring Cash! They don't take no stinkin' plastic (there is an ATM machine.. just in case)

So we had plenty of space and great pizza (well done in more than one sense!) It was a toss up for me between the sausage and pepperoni as my favorites, they pile on the pepperoni, but the sausage has great flavor. I ate a ton of both.. and also, to be fair; a bunch of Canadian bacon.. (No one can say that I don't lead a balanced life, can they?) We almost finished all three pizza's

Oh! and they have a great new parking lot n the back! That's a relief.

Never have had a bad experience or pizza from here. I wish I lived closer since my favorite pizza spot in my town closed down a few years back. But I will occasionally make the drive for that amazing thin crust pepperoni and green peppers.

I definitely prefer hand tossed or deep dish to thin and crispy pizza, but this was some great thin and crispy pizza. 
This place reminds me of the pizza place I used to go to in New York.  The staff is cool and the food is good. The vibe is very laid back, which I like.  The suburbs have enough pretentious restaurants trying to impress basic people in to paying too much for crummy food.... this place is the real deal and that makes me very happy.  
Crispy crusts with enough substance to not feel like cheese and crackers. Generous toppings and good cheese. 

I'll be back.

Amazing Pizza. Lived up to Yelp reviews and ratings. Loved engagement factor by the staff. 5 stars on all aspects.

Good job Al's Pizza !!!

Felt the need for a pizza one night and found this place based on the Yelp reviews, decided to give it a try. 

The pie does not disappoint!

Thin cracker like crust is crisp, flaky and delicious!

The sauce is the star, tomato rings through without any adverse acidity. I would say it is in my top 3 pizza sauces.

Get the Al's special it never disappoints!

It's cash only so you can't rely on plastic.

Cash and check only, limited hours, no delivery, they sell pizza ONLY......HOWEVER, this is the best pizza in this area!!! We've had Al's 3-4 times so far and the pizza is excellent, not greasy, and perfect amount of toppings. We usually call our order in about 30 minutes before we plan to arrive and it's always ready or coming out of the oven when we arrive.

If you're looking for great tasting thin crust pizza with no frills, you need to give Al's a try.

The best way I can describe this place is:  Much like visiting Hawaii for the first time, it's akin to a cult indoctrination.  For a few years now and from more than a few friends I have heard, "Al's...the best pizza in the 'burbs."  Repeated like a manta, ingrained for years from a young age; unwavering in it's declarative nature.  I get it now.

Much like I judge a Thai spot by its ability to nail Tom Yum, jalapeno (I prefer hot banana peppers but that doesn't seem to be a thing in the Midwest) and pepperoni are my barometer for pizza.  Get that simple yet difficult combo right and the sky's the limit.  Al's not only got it right, they killed it.  Juggling knives, on fire while walking a balance beam kind of killed it.  With one visit, we have a new pizza place. (FULL DISCLOSURE: We carried out but our cash out service was pleasant and obviously the food was incredible.  Bring cash because you're going home hungry if you don't, jerk.)

My wife and I were born and raised in NY so to us this is just pizza.  But not just any pizza.  Al's...the best pizza in the 'burbs.

It's a very nice choice for a tavern style pizza right in my town. I like the fact that it's a family owned/run business. The pizzas are on point with the thin crisp crust and loaded with toppings. Plus, the place is attached to a bar. What more can you ask for?

Cheese pizza really good. Ordered it with extra sauce! Only down fall is that there's not any options for non-pork eaters besides veggies. Would be nice if they had chicken or beef option. Nevertheless, the cheese pizza was really good and probably would have been amazing with a chicken option!!

Best thin crust pizza I've had to date. Cheese has a lot of flavor. Very old school dining area, which makes you feel like you're at home. Prices are more than reasonable, especially for the taste. Only serves pizza and packaged drinks. There is a bar as well downstairs. If you're thinking of going,  you really should! Well worth the trip. Can't wait to go back.

Place only accepts cash!!! So don't forget to stop at an atm before going.

Found this place on Chicago's best. My dad has this thing where he wants to try EACH and EVERY place on Chicago's best just to see if they overly exaggerated and see if it really is worth it. Well this hole in the wall place had THE perfect pizza! Bar area was small dining area small also. Nothing to write home to mom about as far as decor , but the pizza did not leave us disappointed!!! They got less stars because they got our order wrong and when I had to get my own ice ( wasn't much left) it didn't taste so good. The guys working there were fantastic! Great attitudes, even when our order was messed up they quickly fixed it and went back to being so upbeat. Def pick up a pizza, or buy one frozen from them but don't pass on tasting a little goodness .  enjoy.

We do love Al's but we don't buy from them often because of the cost and lack of options.  It is nice that they have the traditional sausage and pepperoni, however there are some people who cannot have that.  I don't want to have to pay the cost of toppings to get a veggie pizza.  Can you put something like ground beef or regular beef as a topping?  

This is the kind of pizza that my mother made.  The crust is traditional, plain.  That is because the sauce is the thing which should shine, along with the fresh toppings.  That crust is just a vehicle to get to your mouth, so don't fancy it up.  If I wanted a grilled cheese on my pizza, I know were to go.  Besides that is not pizza anyways.  

There is one thing that I am not a fan of is the Cash Only.  Many times I am running around on Saturday and want to stop by to pick up a pizza for dinner.  If I don't make a stop at the bank's ATM, I forget.  Then I end up at the grilled cheese pizza place or playing dominos.  If they would just give us working mothers a break and put a credit card sales in there, our day would be awesome.  Besides it makes me wonder when a business is all cash.  Their pizza's are not that cheap so the extra 3.2% for a credit card sale bank charge.  Why not?

Before I moved to this area, I used to have a bit of a marital issue - my husband and I couldn't agree on the same place to order pizza from.  He's definitely pickier, didn't seem to like most of the options, and downright hated the one I liked the most.  Well, thanks to Al's, we're finally on the same page in the pizza department.  Definitely one of the best thin crust pizzas around. When my parents come to visit, they're always asking if we can order a pizza from there.  

They are a cash or local check only establishment and they do not deliver.  Depending on who answers, the person on the phone can be pretty abrupt, sometimes sounds downright annoyed. I don't mind, it's nothing but friendliness when I walk in. You can call to pick it up or call to have it ready for you to eat in their building.  I find that when I show up at the time they say the pizza will be ready, it's usually not ready. Sometimes I even get these perplexed looks like I'm showing up right after I hang up the phone.  I usually tack another 10 minutes on to the time estimate, and unless there's some sort of issue going on, it's good to go.

There are not a lot of meat options for people who can't eat pork. I have a friend who gets really sick when she eats pork, and their menu doesn't have options I've seen her get at some other places (chicken, ground beef - which I've personally never had on a pizza, etc).  One time she was over and they did put chicken on the pizza for her though, which she really appreciated.  Of course, a pizza doesn't have to have meat anyway... or so I've heard.
Best in the burbs. Ordered giardiniera on the pizza got giardiniera on the pizza. They do not skimp on the toppings. Great crust. Good work, keep it up.

Pizza is very good, mom & pop place.  Not sure who the heck answered the
Phone, most of the time it's the young boys, this lady had a real bad attitude, I told her to wait a second, I wanted to make sure no one else wanted more pizza, her Words exactly, REALLY, why can't people be just a little patient?!?!? I swear little customer service 101 wouldn't hurt!!!  As long as you don't get the lady it's all good,

When Christoper Columbo sailed his Pontiac Mayflour into Warrenville Rock in 1492, some dude named Al jumped out and immediately noticed there were no good pizza joints in the area.  The following day he salvaged all the spilt May Flour and opened Al's Pizza.

The pizza was the best in the land.  

I just had some for the first time in about 20 years and it is beyond awesome, being thin enough, tasty enough, and dog gone it, people like it.

Highly recommend

I can't say enough about this Pizza..    SO tasty and the crust and sauce is wonderful...  I grew up on this pizza.   its been around at least 35 years..   maybe longer.....
Sadly we live a long distance from them now.. so we only get them a couple times a  year.. but when we DO go we always order EXTRA.. if freezes well and heats up in the oven well!!  
if your in the area and are hungry for some great pizza  STOP IN!!   
They can be busy cause they do alot of take out orders... so calling ahead is always best.

I live on the southside and know thin crust pizza, my wife, 3yr old son and myself came here on a sun afternoon after shiopping and ordered a large thin, sausage, pepperoni and green pepper ZAA. after we ordered they instructed us drinks were in the cooler and that we could pay when we were done and have a seat so we did. 

The place is old school but nice, cozy was not too busy also things to color on at the table to keep my son occupied, ahhh finally the ZAA  it looked and smelled excellent. lots of pepperoni. I excitedly try to take a bite but its hotter than well u no. 

The crust is crispy but tender and chewy kinda like a biscuit almost, ingredient ratio is good the cheese to sauce ratio is good the flavor is good. it's very reasonable bill was like $25 large pizza 4 drinks. yay we will be back and you should too.

Pretty tasty pizza, but be prepared to wait. You would be well advised to call in your order - wait times on Saturday were pushing an hour, and even though the place may not seem full, they're doing a brisk carry out business which extends those wait times. The pizza itself comes out nicely well done, which I like, and with tons of toppings and nice crispy crust. I would liken this to my personal favorite for pizza, Amato's, maybe slightly crispier crust, and slightly less cheese. I probably like Amato's a little better, but it's awfully close, honestly. They kind of have table service, in that they bring the pizza out to you, but you order at the counter and otherwise are kind of on your own. Which is fine, it's just a no-frills kind of place. And prices are pretty reasonable too, for what you get. I'd definitely come back, but like I said, I'll definitely call in my order ahead of time.

Note, cash only, so be prepared.

One of the best thin crust pies you can get in the Chicagoland area.  The "Boys" in the kitchen are always friendly and make a consistently good pizza.  They get their cheese from up in Wisconsin, if you get in there early enough you'll see em shredding the blocks themselves.  

If you tip you'll get a "Say thank you boys..." "Thanks!" in unison from everyone.  Probably the main reason I tip (beyond the great tasting pie).

I think one of the reason the pizza is so good here is the freshness of the ingredients, and their skill at getting the sauce all the way to the edge, and then folding a little crust over it- never a dry bite.

Go here.  Bring cash as it's cash only.  Go next door for a drink while you wait, there's a bar attached.  It's worth it.

It's not everyday that I'm impressed by a pizza, but Al's pizza made its way to the top of my list.  We ordered a 16" peperoni and jalapeno pizza for dinner and it was delicious.  The crust was nice and thin and the sauce was awesome!  It was loaded with cheese making the pizza quite greasy, but that's how I like it.  

There's a bar next door that you can enter via doorway from Al's Pizza.  If you want to grab some drinks with dinner, Al's will bring your pizza next door for you.  How convenient!

The people working here were nice and friendly.  There's a $5 off $20 coupon on their website that you can print out, making it a great deal!  http://alspizzainc.com/Menu.php

Plenty of parking all around the restaurant, especially with the huge lot in the back.

CASH ONLY!!
That is all i got, 6 stars is more appropriate

After moving to Warrenville, this is our go to pizza place. The only downside is the inconvenience of having to pay with cash so we always have to stop at the ATM prior to picking up our pizza or eating there. The pizza, however, is worth the trouble! Just the thought of their pizza makes my mouth begin to water. The boys in the kitchen do an outstanding job and they do not skimp on the sauce, cheese, and toppings.
One door leads to pizza, the other door leads to a bar, either way its all good. Thin crust pizzas are made to order and tasty while each table has kiddie place mats are entertaining for all ages

I am from Chicago, and though there are many great pizza choices there, nothing compares to Al's. My fianc (also from Chicago) and I tried Al's on a whim one evening because it's nearby to my apartment. Wow were we blown away!! It was a Saturday night, and it was pretty crowded, so we decided to get a pepperoni pizza to go. The wait was worth it because once we got back to my place and dug in, we both agreed that we have never had better pizza (and we ate almost the whole pizza in one sitting). Even writing this review makes my mouth water. If you haven't tried Al's yet, you have to make it a priority. Best. Pizza. Ever.

Al's is a hidden gem.  One of the best in the country.  I'm all about pizza.  The debate between New York style, Chicago Deep Dish or stuff crust doesn't apply to me.  They are all different foods in my opinion. 

Al's does pizza only and they do it right.  Plain and simple.  Cash only.  Always a good sign of a pizza shop.  

For the record Pittsburgh has the best pizza.  Fiori's in Brookline if you are ever in the area

I remember a long long long time ago, my mom brought home Al's pizza as worked in the corporate buildings near by and it left a lasting impression. Fast forward at least 7 years, i now live in the area and was so excited to try it again.

My memory did not fail me. This pizza was just as amazing as I remember. Can't wait to have my next carry out. They do not skimp on the toppings at all either.

If you've read my other reviews on local pizza establishments, you know the drill. I can't find great pizza in the burbs. I'm trying. I'm not insanely picky. I've found good ones on the way, but I'm not there yet.

However, after trying Al's Pizza last weekend, I'm getting closer. 

I saw the amazing reviews and was intrigued. It didn't event bother me that the place is cash only and mildly resembles a shanty. I wanted good pizza, and I wanted it now. So we ordered a large cheese and sausage and headed over to pick it up. The pizza smelled amazing and the whole ride home was a struggle not to tear into the box.

When we opened up the pizza, I was impressed. Sure, it's cut into squares (WHYYYY) and maybe not as cheesy as I'd like, but it looked good. When we sampled it, I was even more impressed! The sausage is high quality and plentiful, and the crust had a nice crispness. The sauce is extraordinarily robustly flavored and sort of drowns out the cheese and toppings, but it, too, tasted fresh. Husband devoured his share, and we had definitely some left over.

Is it the best pizza I've ever had? Nah. Is it probably the best pizza I've had to date in this area? Sure is. And until I can find a place that makes enormous, cheesy, triangular, foldable slices of delicious, perfect, pizza, I'm going to return to Al's for more.

If your looking for a non-chain family owned pizza place in the 'burbs your search has ended.   

When we first moved to Naperville 8 years ago, I was looking for a go to place for thin crust pizza.  Al's was exactly what I was looking for.

Thin Crust Pizza Only.  Cash Only!  The guys making the pizza are fantastic.

We ordered from Al's for the first time over the weekend and the pizza here was DELICIOUS! We only had to wait about 25 minutes to pick it up and every one there was very friendly. I'm positive we'll be making frequent orders to Al's in the near future.
Absolutely incredible service,  we'll maintained  property,  but their pizza is amazing.  A+

We moved to the area from the city about six months ago. Al's/ Towne Tap has become our favorite haunt in the area. Its got a cozy "local's only" vibe, though the staff at the counter and bar are always as welcoming as can be. 

But the main event is the pizza, of course. I grew up in the Chicagoland area and feel personally obligated to spread the gospel of the better, lesser known style of Chicago pizza-  tavern style thin crust, square cut. Listen up New Yorkers and other haters! Al's serves up one of the best in class. For me, this pie is up there with the greats- Vito & Nick's and Well's Brothers in Racine. The thin, flavorful crust has a crunch from edge to center, always a golden brown on the bottom. The tasty toppings are judiciously applied. And like all the great Chicago- style pies, Al's uses a fresh, juicy, garlicky Italian sausage. Get it!

Wouldn't have found Al's if I hadn't gone to an event at the adjoining bar (Towne Tap), but I am glad I did! Yummy thin crust with a lot of flavor (and I'm intrigued by the fact that they offer shrimp as a topping option?) 

Seating area is small but it seems that a lot of people order and then bring it to the bar (they will even come over and call you to say it's ready). I did like in Al's seating space that there's a sign saying that children must be seated and supervised by a parent. The space is not big enough to bear hyper, ill-restrained kids.

Oh, btw, CASH ONLY!!

Overall, whether you take it to go or eat it there, Al's Pizza is A-1!
Been going here for almost 35 years. By far the best thin crust pizza I've ever had. It's not cheap but worth the price.

Tried Al's Pizza for the first time tonight and I am one happy customer. I love love love their mushroom pizza.  Cannot say it is the quickest or cheapest pizza around but this will not prevent me from ordering in the future - pizza was great!  Definitely try it out.

If you like thin, delicious pizza crust, there is nothing like the taste of Al's--a small, non-assuming family restaurant right on the river in Warrenville. Their pizza is fabulous, with great fresh ingredients. Patrons can order from their kitchen, pay in advance and then sit either in the small family dining area or the connected Towne Tap bar next door and wait for pizza right from the oven. Yum.

Simple, delicious thin crust pizza. Nothing fancy, especially regarding the small dining area, but always the best! Call ahead by 20 minutes or so on Friday or Saturday and get a jump on the throngs. There is a bar next door, and you can have your pie "delivered" there if all the tables are full at Al's. Reasonable, delicious, abundant toppings and NEVER greasy! I think I will head there again this weekend! YUMMMMM!!!

Al's Pizza does not screw around. The crust is the perfect chewy-crispy and ever so slightly soggy in the center. They'll load it down and then some, with super fresh toppings that seem above par for this style pizza joint. Seriously, they're using high end quality meats and cheeses, and fresh chopped veggies. PS - it's worth the wait.

Very rude ignorant staff who doesn't understand customer service. First time visitor. Maybe you should tell your customer its cash only. Response:  Do you expect us to tell everyone who's calls its cash only? We've been open for 56 years. You should of visited our website...  When a caller asks if you offer apps it should be clear they have never been to your establishment. The cashier and a very rude gentlemen who was making the pizza's made this experience horrible. When you treat your customer like that , you can have the best pizza in the world but will always be a hole in the wall because you don't know the basics of running a business. Shame on you Al's Pizza. You lost a new neighbor.

We just LOVE this place.  The pizza is the BEST.  We love to head there on a friday night, the staff has been there for years.  It is like a little blast from the past.  They have an honor system for the canned beverages, a juke box and a brightly lit seating area.  (within Al's) We usually order and then sit in the Town Tap.  It reminds us of a little Wisconsin bar.  This restaurant has been a Warrenville staple for so many years.  They take cash only but there is an atm conveniently located.  It is really a throw back and we LOVE that about Al's!   Order the Sausage and Mushroom and it won't disappoint!  BEST in the west!
Everyone was right, this place is GREAT.  Huge fresh cut veggies, house made sausage, and perfect sauce.  Worth the visit to the atm to get the cash!!

I'm one of those guys who loves to eat pizza with a knife and fork. That being said, Al's does thin pizza right!

I love how this is the town tap. Love hole in the wall places like this. This is definitely a top thin crust option in the area for me!

Awesome pizza... New to the area and still remodeling and was craving pizza... This one was one of the best pizza's I have ever had.  
Only takes cash!!!

BEST.PIZZA.EVER!!!!!!!!!  Delicious thin crust, so crispy and flaky with the most generous amount of toppings you will ever get!  Best atmosphere, tons of fun and connected to a bar?!!! Hello, best of both worlds!  I love Al's Pizza!  and the owner Lynn is amazing :)

Pure awesome. For some reasons I was not eating this pizza everyday of my life. The Al is the way forward. I would get it well done but that's my preference. Grab a beer next door and relax in beautiful Warrenville.

Als has the best staff, approachable, friendly, and accommodating. They make the best vegetarian pizza I have ever had! Also, the dining room has a large jukebox with the option to select tunes from your phone. All of the old photos and nostalgic atmosphere is enough to make any pizza lover remember their childhood.

Went there with family last night.  Had 16 inch pepperoni and Italian sausage and also 16 inch  pineapple and Canadian bacon pizzas.  Outstanding on both.  Plenty of toppings, sauce and cheese.  Good pizza.

This is one of those experiences where you feel like you really shouldn't be giving them a five star... but you sit and ponder, and try to find a reason to dock a star... and really, there isn't one!

1.  The thin crust pizza is very good.  Did you grow up on Totino's?  It's like a gourmet crust version of Totino's!  Crispy thin, but better flavor!

2.  The toppings are fresh and delicious.  From the tasty and generous cheese, to the mushrooms, to the rolled sausage... it was all given in generous portions and tasted great!

3.  The staff were amazingly friendly, even in the midst of a rush of pizza orders.  After reading a few Yelp reviews about bad service, we prepared for a "pizza nazi" kind of moment... but they joked around with us, talked about how long they've been open, and were just good down to earth neighborly folks.  

Verdict:  Great pizza that's been open since 1959... it definitely feels like on of those "everybody knows your name" local places, but as two newbies, we really enjoyed the excellent pizza and superb service.  Looking forward to going back!

Came here with a couple friends after work and I was impressed. Dining situation is a little unusual in that you have to get your plates and napkins, but I have no complaints and yes...The Towne is in the same building!

All this place is offers is thin crust pizza, but an EXCELLENT thin crust pizza. Heavy on cheese, sauce and toppings and all quality. 

They only take cash, but definitely worth it!

Consistently the best pizza around. It's cash only but thats ok. This place is a gem. 
And it's located in a tap house so you can enjoy a cold beer and watch the hawks, bulls, bears, or white sox( boo cubs) while you have your pie.

Can a grown man who is heterosexual use words like "yummy" and "tasty" and make up words like "supercrunchious"?  This man can. And does to describe the texture of the crust at Al's Pizza and the outstanding toppings and taste of this luscious pie! Outstanding. And it is even better when eating an Al's pizza at the little dive bar next door while sucking down some cold suds watching sports and listening to some tunes from the jukebox pipe through the dive bar speakers that work when they wanna. Gimme more!
My husband and I had the chicken Parmesan and mostaccioli and meatballs, both were amazing!! Their marinara sauce was excellent and the chicken was so tender!
What could be better besides great pizza and cheap beer. I love this place. Little bit of a dive atmosphere however it only adds to the overall ambience of the evening out

I have been looking for real pizza since moving here from NY. And finally found this place. Great thin crust, great taste, and happy to pie cut it for us. And the people were great too. This place is the real deal. And the folks at the Towne Tap next for were great too.

Tried Al's special with cheese, sausage, green peppers, and olives.  The pizza joint was pretty busy at 6:00, I should've called ahead to avoid the 35 minute wait, but the time estimate was dead on.  The dudes working here were pretty cool, and really care about their establishment.  They only accept cash, so you'll have to use an atm machine in the bar it's connected to if you only brought plastic.

Now on to the pizza.  The biggest stand out from the ingredients was the sauce.  The acidity level was perfect for this type of pizza and is really what separated it from others.  The taste and texture of this pizza resembles a good homemade pie, but other than that I expected a bit more considering the other high ratings and somewhat pricy pizzas for the size.  A few have claimed it's the best pizza in Chicago, I'd have to disagree with that bold statement.  I thought the toppings were pretty average, although the green olives were a good choice and the rolled sausage wasn't bad.  That being said, it's a nice homemade style change up from other pizza establishments, just not top ranked quality like others have claimed.

Didn't you see, cash only. We don't want to stand around for five minutes while you explain why they should take your check. lol I should know better than try and sneak a piece on the way home. I hate burning the roof of my mouth... But the wonderful waft of delicious pie got the best of me.

The pizza was amazing. That's all that really needs to be said. The restaurant shares a building with a bar and I'm fairly positive that they are collectively owned, but I didn't enter the bar so I'm not sure. They did however serve pizza to people in there. I sat in the public dining area and while it's not the nicest place, the pizza is well worth it. You order at the counter (and warning CASH ONLY) and they bring the pizza out to you. The staff working the kitchen didn't seem the friendliest to newcomers at first, but when we payed they were awesome and even gave us coupons telling us to come back. Don't let the looks of the place deter you, the pizza is completely worth it.

My Wife and I were traveling and read the reviews about Al's Pizza.  They were dead on.  We walked in and were greeted by the guys working.  You can see everything that is going on.  Leo was the front guy and he was amazing.  We were taking it all in when a guy walks in with his young daughter.  We told them to go ahead of us.  Leo called the little girl by name and she gave him a high five.  Leo said "You guys want the 12" cheese?"  The guy said that they did indeed.

Another guy comes in to pick up an order and sure enough Leo called him by name.  The guy picked up his order and we were ready to place our order. We got the Al special 12" for the two of us.  The pop and bottled water are self serve and on the honor system.  You keep track of what you drink and pay when you leave.  

The pizza was piping hot when it arrived to us by Leo.  He advised us to be careful that it was very hot.  The toppings were fresh and plentiful.  When we left we were given a coupon for a free 12" cheese pizza with the purchase of a 14".  We were leaving town the next day so we passed it along to the hotel staff. 

This place is so laid back and friendly that I felt like I was at a friends house eating dinner.  This is a must stop at place.

Hands down some of the best thin crust pizza in the Chicago area. Compares to aurelios in flavor. Very rustic dining area, hasnt changed in the 25 years I've been coming. Cash only, fine in our carry out.
Great pizza, incredible even, but, the bar staff was quite vulgar. I would really enjoy a meal without so many H-bombs and dangits thrown around.

I completely agree with the comment that 5 stars doesn't seem to be enough.  This is my all time favorite pizza, only wished I lived closer, so I could come more often. Friendly, family run business, totally worth checking out!

Best thin crust pizza around!  

We went there after reading reviews on Yelp and have returned several more times.  

It is an experience to eat there.  Kind of a throwback to an earlier time.  Cash only (although they do have an ATM next door at the bar).  It seems that most of the customers know the staff and each other.  But, for newbies, everyone was very friendly and helpful.  And did I mention that the pizza was fantastic!?!
cash only/online coupons must be printed - unable to scan off of phone. good pizza. nothing more to say.

If you want pizza, this is where you should come.  If you want something else, go next door.  Seriously.  This is a *pizza* place.  And that is it.

Order your pizza at the bar at the front.  They don't have a million toppings but they have the things you need - pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, and onion.  That is really all you need.  Go sit down and then wait.  If you're smart, you can call ahead so you can skip the waiting part.  

Anyway, the crust on this pizza is thin but not too thin and just right crispy.  An excellent amount of cheese and the right amount of toppings.  The sauce is tomato-y without being too acidic or too sweet - it's probably my favorite pizza sauce pretty much anywhere.

It's not a high service place - you grab your own drink and then the server will just bring your pizza out and if you need something else, you go back to the bar for it.  But it works well.  It's cash only so keep that in mind.  It's also pretty small and the hours can be kind of odd but it is well, well worth it.

I grew up on this stuff.  I live in California now.  Decades have passed, and I still haven't found a pizza as good as Al's.  When I was a kid, Al's used to deliver.  One time someone played a practical joke on our family by ordering a pizza.  When the delivery guy showed up at our door, we were happy to see him, paid for it, tipped him, and dug right in!

Al's Pizza hasn't changed in 20+ years. If you like greasy, thin crust pizza you want to go to Al's. DELICIOUS! Small eating area that has expanded into the former barber shop in front of building. If you want a barley beverage there is an interconnecting tavern next door or you can eat in the bar too. The pizza is just as good today as it was 20 years ago. Only negative is that they don't accept credit cards so bring cash if you want to eat there.
Cozy cute and so good !
Great pizza but a bit pricy. Be sure to order by inch size 10", 12", 14" or 16". For some reason they don't like the terms small, medium, large and XL and they get snippy when you use them.

Yes!  This place is the real deal.  The location is odd, the restaurant itself is confusing (one door is for the pizzeria the other is for the bar - they seem to be two separate businesses).  But the cash-only thin crust pizza is perfection!  The pepperoni is better than the sausage, comparatively, but they also have green olives...possibly the world's greatest pizza topping.  

I would compare this place to Rosati's.  Similar in concept and look to their thin crust.  But better in every way.  I love me some Rosati's, but Al's is the winner!  I typically eat 5-6 of their small cut pieces on my way home with take-out.  It's too good to wait.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out.  But bring cash - any restaurant that is cash only and still in business is likely a winner in my book.  Tasty enough that they can call the shots on that one.
Pizza is amazing! Sauce is great but the staff here is pretty bad. These guys like to make inappropriate comments when they think nobody is listening. Probably related to the owners

How does one describe excellence? It's simple really: Als Pizza! Seriously though, I drive 18 miles to Warenville to get this pizza. I have never had a bad experience. The best thin crust pizza I have ever had.

Great thin crust pizza, best in the area for sure. Call ahead take out is great, but if you decide to stay expect a hole in the wall place with old booths and a bar in the back. It's also cash only. The pizza is amazing though, definitely try it!

Ordered a to go half cheese and half pepperoni and bacon.

I was expecting more after all the reviews, but still very good thin crust.  The only thing I could complain about is the fact the crust was flimsy and the bacon undercooked.  As far as best in the area, it depends on what you consider the area to be.  Ach n Lous in Aurora has the same taste with a more crisp crust.  I must say though, even with the bacon being undercooked, the fact they used real strips instead of crumbled bits will insure I try this place again.

Best thin pizza in the area! If you want thin, this is the place to order from. Dine in and carry out only, as well as cash only. Staff is really funny as well! I can't wait to make it back! Connected to the Towne Tap bar, which is the local Warrenville watering hole!

In the battle of Al vs. Arnie, I don't know who I would choose! Both very good Warrenville local joints!!!

It's not a traditional pizza place.  You walk in, order, and seat yourself in a small dining area that has about 10 tables.  The thin crust pizza has the perfect ratio of sauce, cheese and toppings.  I have never been disappointed by them.  The service can be a bit abrasive, but I think that's the style they're going for.  They are extremely busy on Friday nights so I would recommend ordering ahead of time.
Great pizza for carry out. Definitely one of our favorite thin crust pizzas in the area.

This pizza is da bomb!  Crisp thin crust, delicious cheese and generous toppings. The guys there know what they're doing and they do it well.  Carry out or eat in at the Towne Tap next door. BEWARE if you eat in on Fridays-the owner will not hesitate to call you out if you DARE sit at a fish fry table so get there early or late on Friday or carry out because it gets pretty crowded.

What a find!  Talk about some good thin crust pizza.  I get a little nervous every time I suggest trying a new pizza place to my wife because I end up being held responsible for the outcome whether it's a hit or miss.  Al's was a home run.  We've dined here several times, and each time it's better than I remember it being the last time.  I highly recommend the sausage topping.  The location is a bit odd and kind of makes you forget that you're actually in Chicagoland, but that only adds to the charm of this place.  I almost prefer getting takeout because I kind of have a tendency to burn my mouth when dining in because I can't resist taking a bite as soon as the pizza comes out of the oven.  Don't forget to bring cash!

Shut your mouth....if you haven't been here - get here.   There is nothing like down home great pizza.   The "rural' feel is a great escape from chain-restaurants.   If you could close your eyes and open them up at Al's...you'd swear you're somewhere else.   Mom and the boys - treat you well - with respect and make you feel at home.   The get your own place settings and pick from the fridge beverages are old school - this even includes the cash only policy!  I wouldn't have it any other way.   The bar next door offers a friendly place to grab the adult beverage but don't miss out on dinner in the back room.  Just feels like I'm family....

Best pizza around, I drive out from Carol Stream.  I like getting there 10 minutes before my pizza is done so I can grab a beer at the bar next door.  If you want they will serve you your pizza in the bar.  Great home town hole in the wall pizza.

Very over priced ....... For a soggy pizza
Very very expensive

Reviewed by the Naperville 
~ Food Dude ~

My husband and I love Al's!  The pizza is consistently amazing and is the best thin crust pizza around, period  We fancy ourselves as thin crust pizza connoisseurs and have found that if you ask for them to cook it well done, it gives it that extra bit of crispiness without burning it.  As others have said, they accept cash only at Al's as well as the adjoining Towne Tap (although Towne Tap has an ATM if you're low on cash).  There is ample seating at Al's but we like to have the boys from Al's bring our pizzas to Towne Tap.   Yum.

Finally made it too Al's last night. Fantastic pizza! Best in the burbs IMHO. We had two pizzas. One half cheese/half pepperoni the other Itl Sausage, Mushroom, and Pepperoni. The toppings were of excellent quality and in huge quantity. The bast part of this pizza though is the crust! Finally, a decent thin crust in the burbs!

The staff / service was fantastic! It was more like what you would get in a small town pizzeria. This is now our default Pizza Joint.

Note - Cash Only!!!!

I grew up in WeGo, so when I moved to Warrenville, I knew nothing of this place.  I sure was missing out.  Even if it wasn't insanely close to my home, I would still go out of my way to get it.  It must be the sauce.  They always get it right, and pie cut on request which I love.  Sausage and mushroom pizza with extra sauce is a must!  Plus, the bar next door sells beer so you can grab a beer while you wait (if you don't pick up), grab a six pack to go, and take your pizza and have a fantastic night!  No delivery, but I'm okay with that since delivery men can ruin a pizza experience fast.  Love love love Al's.
Can't add much more to the other stellar reviews.  But possibly the best thin crunch in the 'land.  Cheesy! Crunchy! Great sauce and sausage.  Bring cash and an appetite!

Al's is one of those pizza places that has been around for a long time. And after you have their pizza you will know why. Really great tasting, well made pizza. We ordered a large saugage and onion pizza and were so impressed by how good it was!

They accept cash or checks so don't forget your checkbook. The staff was really friendly in this humble mom and pop restaurant. I remember that this place was there 25 years ago, so they have some history to them. But I hope they don't change a thing. In this day and age of nationwide bland pizza places and California Pizza's overpriced, undersized fare, it is so refreshing to find a place like Al's. And now that my kids are taking classes across the street at Clay Space, we plan on having a lot of Al's pizza!

Keep up the great work, Al's!

OK, I am a Warrenville guy! But thin crust pizza is my thing. Their double crust pizza is a nice change of pace. Even the Hawaiian pizza is real good. It was My buddy Jeff that got me eating it. Yeah, I did call him a couple of name's.  1/2 pizza sauce and 1/2 barbecue sauce, is what makes it work. Oh, and do not bring your credit card. It's cash only BuB.

We have been driving by this little pizza place forever & finally went in. Best thin crust I've had in a long time!  Cash only, get-your-own-can-of-pop out of the fridge or a beer @ the bar next door.  Get it to go, though. MAJOR attitude by the woman who seems to run things. She wasn't very friendly & didn't make a good impression for our first time there! I definitely think this will be our go-to place for pizza from now on. Very reasonably priced too. YUM!
Great thin crust pizza. Great little pizza joint connected to the Towne Tap bar.

First I must confess...I grew up on Al's pizza. Perfect thin crust and traditional toppings. The sauce and cheese they use are out of this world. This is a family run business for two generations. It proves that if it ain't broke...don't fix it. There is seating available or you can sit in the Towne Tap (connected) and they will bring it to you. Be aware though that it is cash (or local checks) only. No plastic accepted. A must for those that love good old fashioned pizza.

The traditional dry wings...ridiculous!  We get them to go a lot and meet up with friends there.  Service is good with the right server, otherwise not so much.  Did I mention the dry rub wings.  Appetizers stink unfortunately, but the rest of the food is good (especially those wings).  Not a fancy place, great for kids and watching games.  Would recommend.  Cool local sports bar/restaurant in south Naperville.

I'm not too impressed with Bottoms Up. Not like I expected a great meal or food, but i thought that the mini hotdog appetizers were rather gross. Also, was pretty annoyed that when my friend hosted a party here, there was an automatic 6% gratuity charged, even though we had separate tabs. I didn't notice and then I tipped the waitress on top of that - which I would not have done, as I did not think she was very pleasant.

What a place for food and drinks at fair prices for a great location. I'm seeing about 28-36 age range of the crowd here which is really mature compared to DT Naperville. The servers are pretty non existent but the food makes up for it.

Nice patio with several tables and bags.  Food was good.  Have the chicken ranch sandwich and it was delish!  Service was good, we sat at the table for a while after eating and waitress brought a pitcher of water so we didn't run out.  Will definitely be back!
This is a staple for me and my fiancee and my sister and her husband for the spicy garlic wings alone. Great selection of beers and drinks and a nice patio to sit out and enjoy on a nice day/night.
Seriously, the food here is fantastic! Best wings I've had in forever! Spicy bbq and spicy garlic are on point! Fun crowd, and a great tv setup for games!

Great bar & grill. We stopped for lunch after kayaking nearby and it was perfect. The patio was open, clean and wait staff was friendly. I had the grilled chicken sandwich with sweet potato gayer tots and it was amazing. I highly recommend for a reasonably priced, casual lunch or early dinner.

The 1/2 price wings special is now Mondays and Wednesdays.  They have a wide variety of wings types and flavors:  grilled, naked (fried without coating or spices), boneless, regular, barbeque, and several types of spicey and others.  We have brought people there and they have all raved about "the best wings ever."  We've had other appetizers such as calamari and potato skins that were good, too.  They have wonderful sandwiches as well.  Try their chicken philly on french bread - GREAT!  If you like wraps, they have those, too!  
They have a ribs special on Thursdays and a fish special on Fridays.  The bartenders and servers are the best!  The only thing we would change is they don't currently have pizza.  
Oh yes, and I would like the many tvs all around to have closed captioning.  
All around, it's the best place in town.

Nice sports bar. If you want somewhere to go watch a game....this is the place to be!

Lots of tables and booths, a nice big bar and tons of TV's. This is your causal corner bar food and casual dress code. I had a chicken wrap and it was OK. I would like to possibly try a burger next time! Boyfriend had wings and he was happy with them!

Service was good, our waitress was super nice and attentive. I would love to come here in the fall for a Bears game!!
Very good food and drinks, perfect portion sizes, nice to sit outside but very slow service
Nice but slow service every time we have gone.  Menu is uninspired, food tastes blah.  Drinks seem watered down.  The location means we should go there every week, but we generally avoid it.

I had been here a few times in the past - once in a while I'd score some coupons from this place in the clipper.  I like their wings... it's a nicer atmosphere, and pretty much a sports bar, but on the nicer end.  I've tried both kinds of wings, and I believe they have a wing special on Sundays, at least they used to.

A few friends from the gym and I planned on getting together so I called the week of our outing asking if we could reserve a table for 10 people.  I spoke with the manager and she said it was fine.  Our table for 10 was on a Friday night at 7:30.  The place was somewhat crowded, no wait to get seated though for the others.  Our table was all ready for us when I walked in.  Samantha was our server, she provided great service and gave us all separate checks with no problem.  I scored 10% checking in on yelp here so that always makes me happy as it's a nice surprise when I haven't checked in on yelp previously.

We stayed a few hours, the place kinda cleared out the later it got, which was odd being a Friday night in Naperville, but this place isn't downtown and in a strip mall.  This place also brings an older crowd rather than young and rowdy so we really appreciated that for our group too.

I will continue come here when I want to escape the crazy of downtown Naperville!

One of the best places to be treated well in the SW burbs!  Lauren. Julie, Katie. Dave. Mel. Becca, Brianna, Dee Dee, Kendra, Kelly. etc., care about their customers.  A bit more country music would be preferred (much more country!), however, tough to please everyone. Very nice mix of t.v. programming available.  Bottomline: Bottoms Up is terrific!!

Place is nice inside, but food is mediocre. Ordered a shot of grey goose and it was really watered down. Not like at home I get a kick, here you can notice a difference, not worth the money for booze.

Grilled wings are da BOMB!  The place is a lot larger than it appears from the outside.  They have a patio too, which I would love to experience when the weather's better.  Service is good, nothing to write home about.  Took off a star because of the nachos...trust me, don't waste your appetite on the nachos, and stick with the wings.

From the very beginning of this suggestion, I was leery. My Yelp family didn't recommend Bottoms Up, so I was fearful to visit. Though, it was a close restaurant and suggestion from a friend, so tried it we did.

I loved the set-up. Lots and lots of TV's, decent-sized patio, long bar. 

For appetizers we started with the nacho's and onion rings. The nacho's tasted like you'd get them from a ballpark. Baseball vendor cheese, canned toppings, etc etc. Though, the quantity was huge for the price. The onion ring's were fantastic, but the sauce on the side was quite odd.

Trying to play it safe, I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap. It was just fine, though hard to mess up. The french fries were awesome! Hubby thought the burger was just ok. Trying to get a box for leftovers was quite the ordeal; we asked 3 different servers and waited 10 minutes for the box.

I have to agree with a previous reviewer though (Tom C.). They totally charge for extra sauce! We requested ranch with our onion rings and didn't get it, and I also requested a side for my wrap. At the end, we were charged for 3 ranch sides, when we only used one! Based on the incredibly slow service, it wasn't worth the complaint, but what an odd thing to overcharge!

Drinks were priced fairly well. If you check in on Yelp you'll get 10% off your bill, but reader beware: it's on a VERY limited amount of items. I always check the fine print - there was none - but the 10% off was only for the food. Quite sketchy if you ask me.

All in all, this seems like a lovely place for a drink on the patio. Skip the food though!

I've been to bottoms up a handful of times now. I grew up not far from this bar, so my husband and I have stopped in a few times and met my parents for food and drinks.

I know others haven't enjoyed it as much as I have, but I like the vibe! The couple servers I've had we're both super friendly and helpful. They definitely made me feel like I was welcome and in a close niche neighborhood bar.

The drinks are just your usual suspects, but they have deals for every night of the week. Most recently I was there on a Wednesday and they had $3 coronas...not bad if you ask me!

My family raves about the dry rub wings at Bottoms Up and I have to agree...they are de-lish! Other than that I've only tried their chips and salsa, but the salsa has a nice bite to it which is always welcome :)

I enjoy the neighborhood and always appreciate a drink with goos company so I will for sure be back into Bottoms Up!
What a fun sports - and bonus - they have great food.  Katy is a phenomenal mixologist and Dave makes everything look effortless.  Becca is soooo welcoming.
Only about two waitresses are actually friendly towards me. I've been several times to try out the atmosphere and food. Food is gross and it's an uncomfortable atmosphere.

We stopped by Bottoms Up for lunch on a random weekday and we had a really good experience. I think the worst aspect about this place is the location. It would be so cool if it was closer to downtown Naperville. 

So, when we went it was pretty empty, so we were seated immediately. We really enjoyed the decor. It is perfect for a sports bar and there are plenty of TVs. Our server was very efficient and knowledgable about the menu. We ended up ordering wings for my husband and I and grilled cheeses for our boys. Our food was served pretty fast. 

We really liked the wings. They were seasoned and cooked really well, I would say they are in the upper echelon of sports bar wings. The wings came with fries, which were decent. Our boys loved the grilled cheeses, but it's hard to mess up a grilled cheese : ) 

Anyway, we will definitely visit Bottoms Up again.

Ive been to bottoms up close to 5 times now, and we have ordered various items off the menu. The ladies are nice and attentive, the atmosphere is great with numerous TVs. But the food and the bar. Sigh. Appetizers are below average. Queso dip tasted like a can of Hormel and melted Velveeta . Other nacho items are to stay away from as well. For a 8$ price tag Id rather make my Velveeta at home.  I could not finish my on the rocks margarita, they only serve lime as I was told by my server and it tasted like pure tequila. I had told the server it was too strong and she must of added a very watered down margarita mix. 3/4 still full on the table when we left for a hefty  $7 price tag, in a high ball glass no less. Beers were 7.25 
On a lighter note, the sandwiches and fries are good, Stay away from the alcohol and appetizer.

I've been to Bottoms Up more times than I can remember. This is a solid sports bar...

The drink specials are really good on Tuesdays and Thursdays, and some buddies and I will usually roll in after work for a drink or two and to catch the game. I haven't had much of their food, but I've heard it's good. 

The service is really good too. The bartenders are all really nice and are attentive to your party. 

I would highly recommend stopping in to Bottoms Up if your looking for a nice sports bar. The only reason I don't give it a 5-star review is I think they could improve their draft and bottle selections. The selections of spirits are good for the most part.

Food and atmosphere was great! The wings were so hot and great tasting both traditional and grilled. 15$ buckets are never a bad idea! Wouldn't take the 10% off coupon from yelp because wings were on special tonight. Should probably specify this on the coupon!

I'm not quite sure why this place is getting dogged as badly as it is. It's perfectly just okay!

I came here on a Sunday night for the $0.50 wings. We sampled a bunch of different kinds - all were pretty decent. And totally worth $0.50. Hahah that doesn't sound like a compliment but it is.

The decor is nice - updated. There's darts for people like me and Golden Tee for the golfer crew. My biggest complaint is that the noise level gets kind of crazy, but if you're at a bar, suck it up.

Had just moved to Naperville and this was the first place we ate near our new home. Good atmosphere and friendly people. The food was average bar food like wings, nachos, etc. My husband ordered the pulled pork sandwich and wasn't all too pleased with it. The meat was dry. I ordered the nachos off of the appetizers. The portion size was huge and they were delicious. The prices were decent. I believe they had specials on drinks as well. Would probably go again just to meet and drink with friends.

The worst establishment for food and drink in Naperville that I've dined at. Bad service. I once waited so long for someone to greet us we left. Another visit it took several minutes. We gave it numerous chances. While the service improved we came to learn that the food is terrible. Seriously, where do they find these ingredients? I enjoyed the food at the Neuqua cafeteria more than I did here. Nothing on the menu taste that fresh. I'm not sure they have a chef. 

Also, the feel there is strange. It's as if someone finished their basement painted the walls white and put up a bunch of flat screens. It lacks character.

I get sad when I think about how far this restaurant is from Downtown Naperville, as I'm sure it'd get much more foot traffic had it been closer. However, it is nice for those that are looking to stay AWAY from the foot traffic of DTN and have a quieter sports bar to check out. 

Our waiter recommended the Chicken Philly Cheese which was delicious. It comes with a different kind of sauce, rather than the au jus that the Philly cheese steak comes with. 

Sweet potato fries: YES.

We came here around 10 on a Saturday night and they still served us dinner! It wasn't crowded to the point that the experience was unpleasant - everything was just right. I will be back next time I'm in Naperville!

Went to Bottoms Up for a birthday with six guests on a Monday night. It was slow but I believe our total bill was $115 before tip. The atmosphere was clean and plenty of TVs to go around. Chicken Philly and sweet tots were actually really good and I would recommend both to anyone going for the first time.

They took care of our birthday guest with two pieces of cake to share around. Very nice of them even. Only knock was drink specials. $2.50 for domestics is decent but no specials on tap or specialty drinks besides shots. 

Will go here again when in the area and I know if this place was downtown Nville it would be packed.

Great atmosphere, food is good and service is good. Try the wings they are really good. Only problem is, no matter how many wings you order 6, 12,18 or 24 you get 1 cup of sauce. If you want more because you ordered more than just 6 wings (which I would recommend because they are really good) you have to pay another 50 cents!!  Stupid!!!  I would definitely suggest eating here but if you order the wings, order them in increments if 6 so you get enough sauce, Stupid!!!  I just decided to not order another drink which they would have made more on than a little cup of dressing/sauce!!  Stupid!!!

I would recommend the restaurant, they get most things right. If you do visit, just tell the owner he is insulting his patrons with trying to cut corners on the wing sauce!

I come here for the Grilled Wings.  They are great and half price on Wednesdays.  It has become a weekly requirement.  I have been getting the hot dry rub with their fire sauce on the side.  Paradise...  No more BWW for me.

The food selection could use some help, we live in the area and would go here much more often if the food was better.  About 4 - 6 months ago the wings were much larger and more flavorful.  My wife is admittedly a picky eater but she simply refuses to go back.  Food quality decline is a bad sign, hopefully this place can improve.

This was my first time back home in a while, and I was taken here as it's a favorite spot of my father. 

While the service could have been better, it is something that can easily be improved in the future. My biggest knock was lack of a main viewing screen. This would have been nice to enjoy the Packers-Giants game to go along with my beer and wings.

The bar has a good selection but the wings are the saving grace. The dry rub hot wings were delicious and salvaged my experience. All in all it is an ok bar that gets the job done, but until it gets some of the service issues, best to just order the wings for takeout.
Waters down drinks! Ordered Kettle One and Tonics and they were just tonic without even a hint of Kettle One. Not the first time.

We stopped by Bottoms Up for a bite to eat on a Sat night and we had a really good experience. We had Beer and sampled from the appetizers.  Everything was great and our waitress Kelly E was very attentive to us.  

Try the fish tacos and wings-yumbo:)

Really a sub par excuse for a sports bar.  Showed up this past Saturday at 530 PM for the final game of the playoffs for the Blackhawks.  730 start time for the game.  I showed up as we were having a big party (10+ people) to watch and cheer on the hawks, so I wanted to ensure that we had a table big enough to handle our group.  I arrived and the young ladies at the front were more than accommodating and helped assemble the tables to host my group.  While waiting for my group, I had a few drinks and something to eat.  At about 700 PM, I was still waiting for everyone to arrive.  The place was getting crowded and more and more patrons showed up to watch the game.  The owner comes over and asks if the rest of my group was showing up.  I explained yes, they would be there any minute.  Then proceeds to tell me that if they didn't show up soon, he would have to take the tables and give them to other people.  I was very taken back by this statement.  First, I find it a bit offensive that people show up to a place for a big game for the Hawks a half an hour before a huge game and expect to be seated.  This is a bar, not a restaurant, maybe plan ahead as I did?  Second, after this was stated to me (as he never identified himself as the owner) I asked out extremely slow and disorganized server who he was.  She stated he was the owner.  I then asked is it his nature to turn business away, since I am about to leave since he was so rude and threatened to take the tables I reserved by showing up two hours before the game?  She of course didn't have a response and never saw him again, because I would have like to explained to him what had transpired and worked under better terms.  Turns out that we had 20 people there eating and drinking, double the original group. If you want to go somewhere with extremely disorganized and lack of detailed servers and an owner who hassles the patrons and hides in the back, this is your place.  Don't say I didn't warn you!

Service isn't so good for the rate there charging us for drinks. Wings are very decent tho, I'd compare them to BWW quality, and are a deal on half off days. Kind of a weird place to come on weekdays tho with all the middle aged men approaching there mid life crisis. Ehhh

I have read all the reviews and I'm quite surprised at the low ratings.  Maybe the reviews are older and the place has improved.  I went there last week with a group of 12 (6 adults, 6 young teenagers). We went to watch the UFC fights and the staff quickly combined tables so our group could sit together.

Our waitress was pleasant and responded to all of our needs. The food was delivered quickly.  I had a hamburger and although I don't like when burgers are well-done, they were still able to keep the burger juicy.  The waitress said they do not use frozen patties and use fresh beef (always a plus).  The people around me stated they enjoyed their food as I noticed one person had a wrap.

I will say that the waitress was sometimes forgetful about bringing out certain things like mustard, Equal for unsweetened tea; but rather than get bent out of shape about it, I reminded her and it was brought out.

I went there again last night and sat at the bar to watch the college football games.  The bartenders werre responsive and freindly.

I need to go back on a Sunday to try the wings.  I'm a big fan of the wings at Crosstown Pub in Naperville so I want to see how these stack up.

My boyfriend and I end up here a little more than we would like--but there are some weekends when Downtown Naperville is too crowded, or the weather is so nasty we wan't to stay close to home. The atmosphere is good and they usually have seats, which is great. There's always the appropriate game on and the staff is attentive.

The only negatives I have are that some of the TV resolutions are messed up that the games can look a little funny (first world problem, I know.) 

But also, my boyfriend and I both noticed they water down their drafts. You can see it and taste it, so we order bottles or well drinks instead.

I stopped by the Bottoms Up on a Sunday evening at about 7pm.  Although the place was nearly empty, the bar maid was friendly and told me about specials that weren't listed.  I got the grilled wings which were very good.  I'll stop back again just for the grilled wings!

Not bad.  $.50 wing deals on Sundays!  And I got $3.00 domestic drafts as well... It is a little loud, not bad.  Certainly not as bad as other people would lead you to believe.

The decor is a little odd for a sports bar.  It feels like the owners were going for a upscale-lounge type of feel, then at the last moment a sports-crazed uncle bought in and demanded they spring for like 25 plasma screens.

The lack of a central viewing screen isn't ideal, for a sports bar.  You need a projector or some gigantic screen for premier games to be shown to pull off the proper sports venue.

Try the spicy garlic wings.  They were the most similar to traditional Buffalo-style flavor, if that's what you're looking for.

I've been to Bottom's Up a handful of times now and as a sports bar it's excellent. Today, a Sunday, we got in and out less than 30 minutes. We  ordered 18 boneless wings of mixed variety plus drinks. As advertised, this is a sports bar, so there are people talking and TVs playing loudly. 

I don't write yelp reviews too often but have used yelp reviews all over the country while traveling for work. The one-star rating this place currently has is misleading; there are much worse places to go in the area. 

The weekly specials are great and one of the main reasons we go there. Sunday is $.50 wings, $4.50 Bloody Mary's and a beer special I can't remember. The staff has been willing to change up TV channels for different games and races and there was an enthusiastic crowd for the most recent Bears game. Every booth has a TV over it so you never have a bad view of the game.

Both boneless and bone-in wings are great. Though they don't have many flavors, the BBQ and spicy garlic are excellent in both styles. The outside of the boneless are crispy while the inside is fluffy and delicious. I would take these over BWW any day, and if they had more flavors they could better rival Cross Town; the taste of BU's wings already do. 

It would be nice if the crowd were larger and more youthful on Saturday nights, but on game day it's a great spot to post up, have a beer and eat wings.

Another bland sports restaurant/bar in the suburbs. Not a thing special about the place. Average decor, average service, average menu, average prices. Where's the differentiator? I would probably only go back if it was most convenient or I was in a pinch.

We really had high hopes for this place and gave them numerous chances.  Unfortunately, the service and food continues to be terrible.  We have encouraged management to really focus on the gold mine of a neighborhood they are in, but they insist that they want to compete with downtown Naperville bars.  Never gonna happen.  They are very anti- family and have now put a sign on their Golden Tee game that it is for adults only.  Really??  So, when it takes 45 minutes to get wings my 11 year old can't play Golden Tee??  They needed to do some market research before moving into this neighborhood and learn that families would be their main source of business.
This is a review update.  Service has improved.  Food remains good "sports bar" food.  In addition to full NFL package they also have all UFC.  Again, very glad they have set up shop nearby to me.

Kind of a "family" sports bar if there's such a thing.

Been there about 4 times and was never disappointed.  Always got quick service and the burgers and sandwiches are above average.  Drink specials are good too.  Very nice selection of draft beers.  The sweet potato tater tots are awesome!
Nice location. Great wings. Rest of the menu is adequate. Love the craft beer selections on draft in a sports bar. Service isn't very good unless you are on the bar top.

An absolute disappointment. Do not eat here if you want to have a healthy digestive system. Ordered Malibu chicken sandwich.Undercooked (pink) with canned mushrooms.yuk! Feels very much like buffet food without the sneeze shield! The manager was in the restaurant with what appeared to be his two year old son. Waitress was friendly enough but the food was horrible. Will be surprised if it lasts another six months! Save your money and but banquet frozen entrees for an equal dining expererience!

Bad service! Why would someone invest money into starting a business only to ignore paying customers? Maybe they want to go out of business.  Better go there soon as this place won't last long! Avoid.
Garbage! The service is bad, the food is not great, trust me go somewhere else it's not worth your time.

Good wings, decent service, horrible management.  I doubt I will go back there again.   

Went to watch Thursday night football. The TV at the bar showing the football game did not work the entire second half.  To top it off, they had the MLB network on although no baseball games on and would not switch to football. They also had the USC game on 2 sets.   

The "manager" said same thing happened last week and had something to do with the karokee machine they were setting up....  well, at least they understand the problem.

I suggested changing one of the TV's to the game and she said it was bascially over anyway.  I commented that this is suppose to be a sportsbar.   I also told her I wanted nothing (no free beers, no comps, nothing) but to improve the experience for future visits and she just walked away.  

I really did want to like this place,  I had been here weekly for the past few months and really like their wings.  But every visit, it something else.  No chairs at the table one week (and they would not let us get the on our own), the lights in front on the TV in the bar area (which everyone complains about), slow service (not horrible, but slow) and of course, most importantly, a manager that does not realize that the restaurant is a sports-oriented restaurant.

Bottom line for Bottoms Up, this is no Crosstown Pub, which is better in almost every facet (except parking).  I wish is was, but it is not.....

The Pro's:

This visit was a Saturday afternoon, around 4:00pm, so the crowd was light, and the noise level was low.  Tracy, our server, was very prompt and attentive. NO service issues today!
My burger with bacon and hot peppers was excellent. Their seasoned fries are thin and hot.  Wife's chicken ceasar wrap was good, as well.

17 televisions!
All new remodel in 2011.

The Con's:

Yes, we have been here before when the noise was very overbearing, but it was during Notre Dame v Michigan and we EXPECTED it loud!  The place does have a lot of hard surfaces, but I cannot see them changing it much.

If you are on the older end of the scale, eat early and get home, as the place does become a younger-crowd sports bar after about 10pm, and the DJ starts the music.

Summary:

We will continue to go there, and the haters can stay away.

Nice place. They are on the right idea of a sports bar in Naperville. It may just be to far off the beaten path to reach its full potential. Place was new and clean, the service was great too. The lay out of the place works really well. All those other people probably went there after they had just opened and they were working the kinks out. My advice is to Try it for yourself for a game or beers with your friends.

I so want to like this place since it is in my neighborhood but after many trips there with friends and family I have to say it is pretty bad in a number of ways.
