1.  Surrounded by neighborhoods but not family friendly.  Kids are not allowed to play the games as it upsets the "regulars." I have gone there enough to be a regular.

2.  Service is consistently slow and awful.  You will wait forever to get more drinks, get your food, etc.  just not sure what the waitresses are doing.  We waited over an hour to get burgers.  If something is wrong they will charge you for the replacement.  Poor management.

3.  Food is just not good and not available late night.

Gets two stars since I can walk home from this place.

Sitting in Bottoms Up enjoying the bears game.  Thought I would check out the net to see if it is a local business.  Saw some bad reviews.  Must say I'm surprised.  This is a very nice place.  Clean, friendly, full of tvs, and the food and drink is fresh, and reasonably priced.  I have also been pleased with our service from the moment we walked in ask throughout the game.

Try it, you'll like it!

Went to this place Saturday Night with a group of friends. Great mix of people in their 20's and 30's. T.Vs were everywhere playing sports.  The DJ had the dance floor packed and was playing a perfect mix of dance music.  Food was great.  Everything was Awesome! Can't wait to go back.

The worst.  It's too bright in there, the tvs are WAY too small and the bar TVs cannot be seen because of the light fixture cords that hang from the ceiling.  They need at least 2 very large TV"s to make a focal point in the place.  The service was awful.  BTW it was a Thursday night while the Hawks were on so it wasn't "slammed".  Im bummed because we need a hangout south on Washington, but this isn't it.

Was very apprehensive after reading other reviews but decided to give this place a try since it is so close to home. Went to watch the Bears-Lions game for MNF and the Giants-Cards playoff game. Went early in case of crowds, but not a problem. Place was empty at 6:30, however it did fill up pretty good by 8:00pm. They had $3 pint beers as the special, which is pretty good. Had the wings with spicy bbq sauce and they were very good. Nice and meaty, large size wings. Also ordered a combo plate of mushrooms, onion rings, loaded potato skins and mini-tacos. The plate came with a variety of sauces and had more than enough for two people to share.  The service was very good. Had Angela as our waitress and we never went thirsty or for want of anything else.  The food was delivered in a reasonable amount of time, even after the place filled up. Honestly, for watching a game on TV and having some snacks, I think this place is perfect. Am I going to take my family here for dinner on a Saturday night? No, probably not.  By the way, this place is not in "downtown Naperville.  More like 4-5 miles directly south.

After standing at the entrance for 5 min waiting to be seated we decided to just sit down at a booth. You'd think a waitress would come over after a while to see if we needed anything. Nope. We went over to the bar and got our own drinks three times. The bartender was rude and seemed like we were wasting her time.  Staff seemed untrained. When they first opened I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and thought maybe since they've just opened they're still trying to get things together. It's been a while now and honestly it's gotten worse.
Maybe I came in bad timing, but completely dead, no people, couple drunks, and nobody seems to care. Doesn't make me wanna return.

I have a complete 180 view of many of the negatives written here.  Food is good -- wraps and burgers are the best, but the corned beef stands out (it's real corned beef, not processed meat).  I've always found the service to be quick and the prices are very reasonable.  It's a great neighborhood place and a nice change of pace from both the dreary chain restaurants and the overpriced specialty establishments that are the norm in Naperville.

I enjoy the atmosphere the service is great  ... Most importantly the food is reasonably priced and delicious. My family and I have eaten there many times an we definitely plan on returning again an again an again. Ps. The Christmas decorations are a nice touch : )

Had lunch here with a friend and it was great. Very clean but I would expect as restaurant just opened not long ago. We were greeted and sat right away. The waitress Diana was great. Very friendly and on point. We both had the Country Fried Steak and Eggs. "Very good" It's the best I have had in the suburbs. Everything was fresh and we were served pretty fast being that the restaurant was very busy. Price was fair compared to other breakfast restaurant in the area that are much higher. I would have given 5 stars but I didn't like that you have to pay at the front entrance. When its very busy the line to leave will back up. I hope they chance this process. Overall I will go back. 

Ask for Diana Q she was amazing and so friendly. :)

The service was so slow.  To be fair, many kids were off school today, and perhaps they were not expecting this, but it took the waitress over 20 minutes to take our order, then 30 more minutes to get our food.  When our food finally came, only three of the four meals were prepared.  My daughter's breakfast was clearly never submitted to the kitchen because it took another 10 minutes to get hers.  It would have been nice if the manager had come to apologize or offer a discount, but that never happened.  We will not be back.

On a regular day, should you come here, it looks as if they have many egg dishes, but the pancake and waffle selections are pretty limited.

do not come here. Especially if you have children. The service was very slow. From initially waiting to be seated, when there was no one else even there, to waiting over 20 minutes for our order to be taken. It was not a speedy breakfast.  we actually had to go find our waitress to ask how long it would be for our breakfast to come because the service was so poor.

our order was not served correctly, the eggs were inedibly undercooked the pancakes tasted like cardboard, and the bacon appeared to have been microwaved.  portions of our orders were not served at all, and had to be brought out in a to go box as we left.

there are many breakfast choices in Plainfield, skip this one.

This was our first visit to Broken Yolk since it opened, and we will definitely not be back. My husband and I both ordered omelettes. It was pretty clear they used a boxed liquid egg. They were so thin, flat, rubbery, and tasteless. 

My omelette had mushroom, onion, and green peppers in it. They were diced into tiny little pieces and there was nothing to hold them into the eggs. It was a tasteless explosion all over my dish. I'm not joking when I say it was like they made an egg pancake (only hard and thin), cooked it on both sides, then added the veggies once it was done, and sandwiched it all together. They topped it with completely bland "salsa" - which was actually pico de gallo, and added sour cream. It was the only flavorful part of the dish.

Our kids ordered pancakes, and my oldest son asked if we could go back to our normal breakfast place because his pancakes were thin and hard, and didn't have much flavor. I was expecting so much more from a nice looking, newly opened breakfast joint. I was so, so disappointed.

I would have given it one star, but the fruit that came with my order was large, delicious, and it seemed pretty fresh. That was the only good thing about this place.

Just another breakfast place!  There was nothing special about the food, service or the decor.  
It was one of those places that you say okay, I tried it and wasn't impressed.

I don't think I will be going back.

I met some friends for breakfast yesterday after one of them suggested it. Apparently it's a chain from California and a lot of the food has a Mexican aspect. Pricing was comparable to other restaurants and service was decent. I like that you can order a half or full carafe of juice instead of only by the glass. I had a meal that was toast, eggs, bacon and hashbrowns. The toast and bacon were ok and the hashbrowns were really good. I didn't care for the eggs. I got them scrambled and they just tasted a little off. They also have a reward card you can sign up for. My friend had a credit loaded on for her birthday month so that was nice!

I have been here twice for breakfast. The first time I came I had the  Golden State Benedict,  a toasted English muffin with sliced grilled tomato, avocado, Applewood-smoked bacon which I swapped for Canadian bacon and two poached eggs topped with Hollandaise sauce and Sriracha. 
The  second time I had the  Border Benedict with poblano sauce and carne asada over corn cakes. Both were very good but the Border Benedict was delicious!!! There was plenty of steak, the salsa was flavorful and the combination of the sweet corn cakes was perfect. I had home fries both times and those great also. 
My son had the good morning burger, beef patties with 2 over easy eggs, bacon, cheese, lettuce and tomatoes. It was a huge monster and he devoured the entire thing and said it was great! My girls had pancakes from the kids menu. 
Overall this is a great breakfast place, there are so many things on their menu that I want to try. The service is ok and the restaurant is bright and airy. 
This is a must try if you live in the area.

Love it! Nice and friendly service. I ordered the wellness wrap, and it came with super fresh fruit, the wrap was made with egg whites, spinach and feta cheese and it was awesome. I love the menu, it was difficult to chose what to order, everything looked delicious.
Food was excellent. Atmosphere and service was also great. I got the "mom omelet" with no sour cream and it was delicious. Great price for the size of the mimosa as well! Will definitely be back.

My young lad and I visited an hour into their official opening morning today for breakfast. Going in on the first day can be kind of a crap shoot, but The Broken Yolk Cafe had their act together for us! We were greeted quickly, and shown to a booth right away. 

Broken Yolk moved into a former Bob Evans, and there is no trace of country left in this place. They renovated the space into a clean, modern, but still warm and friendly restaurant. And they were playing solid 70s rock. Thumbs up all around for the ambiance. 

Their menu has a lot of good options, especially if you're a fan of Mexican-inspired breakfasts.They have an entire section dedicated to South of the Border offerings, and some of those flavors seep into other areas of the menu as well. My kid ordered their breakfast tacos, which come with rice and black beans. I opted for the chicken and waffles. 

The food came out quickly, but not so quick that you wonder if they have all of the components for every meal sitting under a heating lamp in the back. The portions were generous, but not obscene. 

And what about that food? My chicken and waffles were as good or better than any I've had anywhere. And I (shamefully?) order chicken and waffles whenever it's presented to me as an option.

I have to admit, I was skeptical of breakfast tacos. I've had breakfast burritos and breakfast quesadillas before, but never breakfast tacos. The kid offered me a bite, and I went for it. WOW. The flavors of the tacos were fresh and bright; it's like this is how eggs were always supposed to be served. Everything just came together perfectly in a magical bite. think the Mexican breakfast options are where this place may shine the brightest (and remember what I just said up there about the chicken and waffles). 

Oh, and on top of all of that? Their coffee's really good. And they have an espresso bar that I didn't try, but the signage they have on the tables makes it look very appealing. Also looking awesome, but untried is lunch. They have myriad sandwiches, wraps and burgers that look like they would be outstanding for a noontime repast. OH, and they also offer boozy drinks for grown ups who need some liquid relaxation with their first meals.

I'll for sure be back for some Mexicanesque breakfast the next day I can. And I'll have a 13-year-old who is willing to wake up at 6:30 to join me. That should tell you all you need to know about the wonder of Broken Yolk.

Went here on a Saturday morning.   I ordered an omelette and my wife order the ham scramble.  The ham looked and taste like shaved deli ham.  Even though was expecting ham of the bone, it still tasted good.  Food overall was pretty decent.  The service was pretty good.

Where they get knocked down is the food handling.   I ordered a biscuit with my breakfast.  I was sitting in a both facing the line.  When my food came up, one lady grab the ticket and my plate and asked for the biscuit.   I watched as the passed the biscuit down the line by 4 different waitresses, all handling the biscuit with their bare hands.   Based on this and the better options in the area, I will probably not be back.

This place is near my house and my family and I frequently go to pancake houses so I was eager to try out this new place. I have read a couple of other reviews and the ones that took time to write the review in some detail are spot on. The decor is contemporary and updated. Nicely lit for a cozy atmosphere. Music was playing and where one review said 70's Rock was playing, I enjoyed 80's classics like David Bowe, Duran Duran, and First Order (spoiler on my age). 

I was greeted right away and seated in my choice of table or booth. There are TV's in your line of site. My waitress was attentive and prompt. I usually order a pancake combo but I assume they know how to make that. I ordered the Stuffed French Toast as I was intrigued about the taste. I wasn't disappointed. I enjoyed the splash of caramel and bananas were fresh. I also order eggs and bacon (an additional $2 for making it a combo). The eggs were as expected, the bacon seemed a tad over cooked.  

Another review I read mentioned the Mexican inspired dishes so out of curiosity I checked to see who was cooking and it appeared to be a few Mexican men. That should bode well when ordering the Mexican style breakfast or lunch. 

On exit, the cashier was AWOL and the hostess was busy sitting new customers so I waited several minutes to pay. One customer noticed I was standing there longer than usual and told the Hostess to take my money before they were to be seated. So for that reason I couldn't give 5 stars. If the cashier had to leave the station for a length of time they should made sure someone was there to step in.

I had been wanting to try this place for a while and finally got around to it.  The decor was nice and modern.  There is alot of seating.  The tables seemed small to me or maybe the menus were big or maybe too much stuff on the table but  it was very awkward for my husband and i to look at our menus sitting across from eachother.  The waitress was pleasant and attentive.  There drink cups are huge.  The food was nothing special especially for the price.  I had a turkey wrap and it was just not impressive.  The veggies didnt seem super fresh or flavorful all i really tasted was the mayonnaise.  The sweet potatoe fries were pretty good.  My husband got the tomatoe soup which was good but did have a kick and the chicken fried steak.  The chicken fried steak tasted kinda soggy and like something out of the freezer not freshly prepared.  The gravy in it was good.  It tasted alot like Bob Evans gravy.  The scrambled eggs were eggs nothing stood out about them.  The fruit was a nice size and pretty good.  The home fried potatoes looked to be freshly cut and good.  The blueberry muffins were probably the best thing there.  They were very good.  There was a couple things on the menu I think I will come back and try and hopefully update my review with more stars.  I would say 2 1/2 stars if it was an option.

Went here again to give it a second chance after my first impression was not the best. 2nd wasn't any better. Eggs are overcooked and do not taste good at all. Waitress split our checks without us asking, which was nice of her.... Except that she completely split it wrong. Mentioned it when going to pay and they couldn't fix it? Really it's that hard to swap some items? 

Don't think I'll give them a third chance.

Yuck.
I think the omelets are pre made then whatever ingredients you choose are tossed on then folded over. Consistency of rubber.
How do you mess up coffee? Bitter and way too strong. 
French toast was barely battered...so basically it was sauted bread.
Came here after it first opened and it was rough, decided to give it one more try thinking it was just a tough opening but nope...it will not get a chance to get a third strike. Sorry

Sunday morning, Fourth of July weekend, what to do when hungry? I know, let's try this new place in Plainfield called Broken Yolk. Well, guess what? It was great! From the minute we walked in the door and the staff were smiling and happy to the moment we left we were very pleased. 

I usually get omelets so I figured let's see how they do. Green peppers were diced, onions were as well. The bacon was crispy and not burnt at all. Hash browns and English muffin were just right too. Also the orange juice was ice cold and very refreshing. 

My wife had the winning dish however and I will be ordering it next time as well.  The Tiki Toast, three pie slice sized pieces of Hawaiian bread drizzled in caramel sauce and powdered sugar with strawberries and blueberries.  

As I said, everyone there was friendly and the service was excellent. For being open only three weeks they have certainly started off on the right foot. 

They have a frequent diner card too.

This was, at one point a Bob Evans, although disappointed when it closed, I have to say Broken Yolk Cafe is now my favorite breakfast location.

It is clean and staff is efficient, and our food took about 15 - 20 min from order to table on a busy Sunday morning (3 adults).

They have a wonderful variety including huge fluffy omlettes (I recommend the Mom), standard eggs & bacon, Nutella crepes, french toast, biscuits. Many dishes have a mexican flair, with just the right amount of kick.

Side choices including mexican rice or refried beans, hash browns, homefries or fresh fruit.  

Great place for a family or group of friends. One visit our party had 7 and they were very accommodating.

My husband and I visited this Broken Yolk Cafe in Plainfield, IL this past Sunday for Breakfast. 

I had an absolute Horrific Experience! 

My pancakes were overcooked, cooked so tough, that I needed a Steak knife in order to cut them. 

Had to send those back! So while waiting for those to come back out redone, my entire plate of hash browns along with my bacon became all cold! Then had to request those two be reheated again! 

I couldn't enjoy not one iota of my very 1st meal my time at this so- called 'Hot and New" Restaurant Establishment! 

Never Again!!!!!
Nutella crepes with bananas-really good! Three large slices , good enough for sharing.

I'll break it down for you yolks. The food is not yolking around I this place. I had the California breakfast burrito the other day and it was huge and stuffed with filling. I'd get it again. Before then I had the blueberry pancakes with eggs and shiz. The pancakes were good too. They yolked around with me a bit as I was being seated telling me I was sitting in the VIP booth, but it was just that funky little booth right in front of the seating area. 

They are very customer friendly here and really want you to enjoy your dining experiences. At my last visit the wait was getting a bit long so they came out with muffins and water for all of us who were waiting. They also started performing a few acts for Cirque du Yolkie which was nice. They kept trying to involve me in the show but I had to tell them no because I cannot take part in any other showcases because I'm a Blue Man from the act downtown called Blue Man Troupe. Now that I think of it, I need to talk to my agent about this. Isn't it called Blue Man Group.....oh boy! If you are reading this and you read a story about a person who blue their head off, it was me.

I love going to breakfast places that have fun & unique names! The menu is definitely unique and they have many different menu items that I can't wait to go back and try. The staff is friendly and the food is good. Our waitress was very attentive and was always on top of refilling our coffee cups!

Love this place!!  Great food. Great ambiance for breakfast and lunch!  Highly recommend the Tiki Toast. Yum!!  

Never have waited for a table and the hostesses and servers are very friendly and quick. 

Gotta try it!!!

Sweet potato pancakes are unique and very good. I hadectje border Benedict. I liked it but it's on sweet cakes and I guess I am not a huge fan of sweet cakes.  The steak was great along with the "hash browns". 

I like this place, a few items have a So Cal twist.  I'd recommend a side of the pablano sauce and put it on everything. It's not spicy, but lots of flavor.

Where to begin?  
Ok, I ordered an omelet. Cheese omelette. It was the flattest omelette I've ever seen. Onions must have been cooked on the grill prior to making the omelette, because all I tasted was onions. 
The cheese wasn't hot either, like it was at some point, but not anymore. Now it was luke warm and congealed. 
The English muffin was good.  And my mom LOVED her Cobb salad!
My husband had the chicken fried steak, he said it was decent. Unfortunately he didn't stop burping up the hash browns until eight hours later! 
Now, I rarely say anything about the "ambiance ". Of restaurants, I mean who really gives a crap as long as the food is good!
They play all 80's music. Not a mix of 80's music. The kind of 80's music I listened to at parties.  Like Van Hagar and Guns N Roses. Now, I didn't see a lot of 80's lounge lizards here. You know who was here?? OLD people. Hell, I was with my 82 year old mom.   Ever try to have a nice quiet breakfast with your little 82 year old mom while listening to Sweet Child O' Mine??? IT SUCKS!! I'm certain her hearing aids were dead, because she never once complained about the music, and trust me, this is the woman that complains about any music that isn't from the big band era. And the music is pretty loud. 
Look, I grew up in the 80's, i get it, but seriously if I had  to endure one more freaking hair ballad while I ate my flat omelette I was going to shove the fork in my ears and deafen myself!!
I just can't imagine the other blue hairs were digging the music either. 
Every rose has its thorn and every town has a shitty breakfast place, this is it.

Had breakfast with a friend here the other day.  Decent breakfast.  I just had 2 scrambled eggs with bacon, and my friend had some sort of Hawaiian french toast that she loves. The waitress was extremely attentive and came over quite frequently.  Very clean and modern looking.  I'd go back.

We were anticipating the opening since we lost the Bob Evans where this restaurant now stands.  I must say I was impressed mainly because of the service.  Being brand new you might expect the staff to be a bit disorganized but that wasn't the case at all.  Great service and took no time at all to get,a really fresh breakfast.  The Nutella Crepes and Eggs Benedict were both great.  Perfectly cooked.  The only negative was perhaps the presentation and serving of their biscuits and gravy.  They put bacon on the biscuits under the gravy which made the bacon mushy and undesireable.  I will not let that stop me from returning because everything else was great, and good value for the money as well.

Today, our family enjoyed the greatest breakfast we have ever had. The Tiki French Toast (Hawaiian bread dipped in egg batter, griddled to a golden brown color, topped with strawberries, blueberries, caramel drizzle and shredded coconut) was crazy good and likely to be a fan favorite of Broken Yolk Cafe diners. 

As a world renowned connoisseur of Corned Beef Hash, the CBH I had today was the best I have ever eaten. Perfectly cooked, everything was crispy and not the standard soft & mushy version you get at most places.   The CBH was done correctly. Get it. 

The Broken Yolk Cafe in Plainfield has elevated the breakfast and lunch experience of us foodies in Plainfield and South Naperville. The staff is great. The food is excellent. The prices are more than excellent for the quality and quantity of food you received. 

And, for those mature diners who enjoy a little mimosa or a beer with their meal, or a bloody mary to chew on after a long night, rejoice.  Our prayers have been answered.

First round: When trying a new place for breakfast I use eggs benedict as my bench mark, it's something complicated yet simple and if a restaurant can make it well then they are worth a second visit (imo). I didn't completely adhere to this ritual trial however, I ordered the "border benedict" which features carne asada instead of Canadian bacon, a cornbread muffin(?) Instead of an English muffin and a poblano sauce (more on this later). 

The eggs, perfectly poached and I emphasize perfectly. This alone is a very promising sign because you would be surprised how often poached eggs miss the mark. The carne asada was good! I was a little skeptical when I saw it on the menu but it had good flavor, the meat is seasoned but not overbearingly, you still taste delicious meat. It's cut up into smaller pieces than I expected but there was a good amount of it. 

The cornbread muffin was a little too sweet for me but cornbread is always subject to opinion. It was still an interesting sub for the standard English muffin and arguably did a better job soaking up sauce, yolk and meat juice. 

The sauce, while by no means bad, was not what I was expecting. I may had misread the description but I was expecting a hollandaise with pureed poblano mixed in. I'm pretty sure that the base of the sauce was not hollandaise, it was more of a creamy, smooth salsa but... it didn't taste as boldly 'pablano' as I was hoping it would. The peppers could be roasted before being added which would up thier presence but with the sauce not fulfilling my desire for hollandaise or pablano left the dish tasting like it was missing something. On its own the sauce is good but I feel for this dish it could be improved.

For sides I got the home fries, thin sliced potatoes fried in butter, which were very good and the Spanish rice which was also good, maybe could use a touch more spice (there are hot sauces on the table) but still tasty. 

Coffee was a good temperature, not too strong but not weak, good flavor, pretty much what you would expect from a breakfast place. They have flavored creamers if that's your thing.

Over all it was a eggcellent meal, fair portion size and well prepared, and warrants a return visit. Round 2 of review can be expected in a week or two.

The best way to describe the breakfast food at this restaurant is edible. Compared to other Diners and Breakfast focused eateries in the Naperville/Plainfield area, The Broken Yolk is far behind. IHOP is the closest comparison. Service was inattentive, but I guess it's understandable since they recently opened.

Got some coupons in the mail and the pictures of the food piqued our interest. I read the fine print that can't use coupons on the weekend. That didn't stop us as we were kid free and determined thro eat an adult meal without cutting up anyone else's food.


Glad we made it. Nice place. Cute decor. Friendly staff. Menu was expansive and diverse. We didn't get too creative and opted for some Benedicts. One traditional and another with Carne asada. Both were very good. Sauce on both was excellent.

Only reasons not 5 stars were that my coffee went dry a few times and I asked for grilled tomato on my Benedict and it came out just raw.

Nothing special that I can't prepare at home. Patio seating is nice but waiting times and prices are unreal for eggs. Perhaps having some breakfast mimosas could ease the pain for the prices. Although for restaurants flipping tables is a most, it looks that they want you out before you have the first bite. I don't think on repeating soon.

I'll start by saying that the place is very clean & the decor is quite nice. The staff is friendly & we were seated immediately. They were playing rock music such as Bon Jovi & Def Leppard, which made me very happy. :)  I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately I don't think we will be going back. We had a party of 3 - my mother, my 8 yr old son & myself. I ordered the Border Benedict but was not thrilled with it, as it hardly had any taste even after I tried adding salt, pepper & finally hot sauce - definitely not a normal condiment for me at breakfast.  Maybe it is just me, but the pablano sauce does NOT go with the sweet corn cakes at all.  My son's order was incorrect when we received it but the waiter quickly fixed it - he ordered kids scrambled eggs, fries & bacon but ended up with a mickey mouse pancake, eggs & fries. He didn't like it & said the eggs didn't taste like anything, the whipped cream made his fries soggy & the bacon was cold. He is usually not picky, so I was pretty surprised by this.  My mom ordered an omelette with cheese & corned beef, again it was virtually tasteless. 
I was excited about the menu because it had some different items listed, many with a southwestern flair, however everything we tried was mediocre at best. I cannot recommend. :(

I had the Chiliqueilles. I have an aversion to eggs so I opted for the chicken with verde sauce. They were great. You could tell that they were made fresh, not scooped out of a casserole pan. Beans and rice were great too. (I like spicy so I did have to add hot sauce). Shared biscuits and gravy with my daughter.....biscuits are huge but gravy lacks flavor. We are from the south so we are particular about our biscuits and gravy.
Horrible horrible service! I won't be back. Food was good but the service just totally turned me off.
Have been here for breakfast several times and love this place. Great food! Great service! Will definitely be back again

What a great new breakfast spot, deserving of my 400th review. (Thanks for the heads up Courtney C.) It's good to see the old Bob Evans breakfast counter crew has some place to go once again. I had the privilege of meeting the brain child and franchisee developer John out of San Diego. This is their 19th location and only has this one location in Chicagoland for now. Expanding in Cincinnati and Florida currently. This is a scratch made kitchen and they have a heavy influence of Mexican dishes. Some unique items are available. I may have had a little hick up with some medium rare bacon being served, but they promptly suggested they would be happy to replace it. It wasn't necessary, as I was taking it home and will be heating it up again anyway. You may want to request the sausage or bacon be served on the side, as they smother it with gravy atop the large fluffy biscuit. They were generous and offered 3 on the house gift cards for a smoothie, waffle and pancakes. I gave the pancake card to a friend at the counter, who I hadn't seen in awhile from the Bob Evans morning crew. Power outlets with USB for charging your cell phone at the counter is a great idea. Free Wi-Fi means I'll be hanging out here charging my phone and doing business in the morning. Get here early if you want a counter seat during the week. Be sure to give a call if you're coming on the weekends for breakfast, as they'll be happy to put your name on the list. I love what they've done with the inside, the place really needed a makeover.

We had the best experience!  I took my kids this am, the staff was wonderful and the food was delicious!  The kids food was a great amount and the menu had a great variety.   I was really impressed with the entire experience.  We will definitely return.

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.Their chicken vegetable soup was good and contained more chicken than I have ever had in a restaurant.  The tomato basil was another story.  It is my favorite soup but it was so spicy that I could not eat it.  I am leery of restaurants that use excessive spice.  Maybe Californians like it but here in the Midwest,  let the customers add hot sauce if they want it.  It is on the table.  I am just plain tired of spicy foods so I have to think twice about going here again.

This place is staffed to the gills, and the wait staff are always punching something into their termiinals, but it still takes forever to flag one of them down for a coffee refill.  Prices are higher than the mom-and-pop ('greek diner') breakfast places that abound, and those are a better choice.  The menu seems to be trying too hard, with Southwestern and Mexican spins on breakfast items.  If you just want corned beef hash, this isn't your place.
Best breakfast place in the Suburbs! Gotta try the Border Benedict if you love Benedicts you never had one like this!

Love this place. I have been here twice and each time it was great. They grind their own coffee which is solid. The border crossing is delicious with the refried beans which are great too! The biscuits are made fresh as well. The food is not the best I have ever had, but pretty damn good. Both times our servers had great service. Jessica was on top of the coffee situation as well.
So glad you opened here!  We keep coming back!  Denise and Diane are great servers. It's good food fast. Huge portions and tasty. Love the California burrito. Highly recommend!!!

A bit disappointed because my expectations were so high based on the other reviews. We did go on Father's day shortly before 8am.
We had 6 ppl and only had to wait 5 minutes. Coffee was served up right away and our server Diana was friendly and cheerful. This place is relatively new and nice, bright and clean inside.
The reason for only 3 stars was disappointed by some of our food. I got the mom omlet which sounded and looked amazing. However...it was served up cold. It was like they took the eggs and just folded in icey cold ingredients front the fridge :(
The same happened with the Machaca my dad ordered. 
The kids menu french toast came out great and so did the biscuits and gravy.
We will have to try and give this place another try and maybe chalk it up to being busy for a Sunday holiday.

Breakfast had no flavor. Service is slow. Had to ask if they used liquid eggs because the omelette felt rubbery  the server said no the eggs are cracked early in the morning and put into buckets and mixed with something  but couldn't tell me what that something was because she didn't know. Did not taste fresh and pretty sure all the vegetables in the omelette were frozen. OJ is definitely not fresh squeezed
Average at best. Toast was not great.  We left with an oil taste in our mouth.  Gross.  We will not be back.  We got poached eggs and hash brown and eggs Benedict.  Gross!

We have been to most breakfast places in the area and decided to try someplace new.  There was a decent wait, but not unexpected on a Sunday morning.  After sitting, our server came pretty promptly to see if we would like something to drink.  Then it took a good 10 minutes to get the 2 chocolate milks and a coffee.  Both of my kids, who are chocolate milk connoisseurs, said the milk did not taste like chocolate milk, but rather plain old white.  I had a "make your own omelette".  It was horrible.  I agree with other reviewers it was crazy thin, like a crepe, folded over the ingredients I requested inside my omelette.  And it was rubbery.  Something smelled and tasted really weird.  I wasn't sure which ingredient it was, but think it was the bacon.  Worst omelette I have ever had.  Thought it was pretty hard to mess up breakfast.  Both of my kids had pancakes, and were definitely not fans.  With the number of decent breakfast places in the area, we will not be back.

Was excited to see a breakfast spot opening up near my house. If you are going to have a name Broken Yolk you better have good eggs!?! One of the worst Omelettes I have eaten. Hash browns very greasy. Daughter had pancakes and they were out of a box. I hope they get new cooks. Hate to see a new establishment close.

My husband's breakfast -- eggs, toast, potatoes -- was fine. My breakfast -- eggs Benedict was not very good at all. The eggs were ok but the sauce was definitely not hollandaise and the meat was very smoky ham, not Canadian bacon. Coffee refills were few and far between. We will not be back.

What a great place.  Reading the menu with fun food title names like "Cisco Kid", followed by "Duncan Renaldo", is an enjoyable as the food is.  I agree with another reviewer about the coffee being a bit disappointing, and some of the background music can be annoying.  But the food is very good, and they've  introduced a Southern California vibe to Illinois that almost makes you feel like you've been there.

Gotta say...good food, nice value, super attentive staff. Successful launch. This is a great breakfast stop and is FAR superior to others in the area. If it continues after the launch is complete, this will become a regular stop on my agenda. Well done folks and welcome to Plainfield.
Excellent food. Excellent service. Great staff. Very accommodating! Love the southwestern choices.
Excellent food at reasonable prices....this was my first visit and i will definately be back...Diana was a great server

We live in the area and have been waiting for a decent breakfast place. I really wanted to like this place, but I've had as many bad meals as good ones. We haven't gone for lunch so this review is just based on breakfast. These are the things I've ordered. Border Benedict was really good, very nice contrast between the spicy flavor of the sauce and the sweet corn of the muffin. Baja Breakfast Tacos were tasty, but they were served on a single tortilla which simply fell apart and they were unable to eat as a taco. Biscuits and gravy were really creamy sauce poured over a biscuit. The biscuit itself was OK but the "gravy" was not the typical sausage gravy you would find in the south. It was just some tasteless creamy sauce. The Sun Up Breakfast Sandwich was disgusting. The eggs were fried to death, and there was maybe one piece of bacon on the entire sandwich. There was one square of American cheese in the middle of the sandwich-the rest of the bread was plain. The Machaca was very tasty but how hard can you mess up scrambled eggs with chorizo? Today I ordered the BLT. Don't expect your traditional triple decker club, it's just two pieces of bread with lettuce, tomato, and barely more than one piece of bacon. I didn't even eat it, just sent it back. I like hash browns very crispy. My usual ordering instructions are "cook 'em till you think they're burnt then cook them again" FAIL! Got a little brown on the top and mushy potato. So turned me off. Unable to get really well cooked home fries either. Fresh fruit is good, but they just serve REALLY big chunks of fruit that almost need their own plate. The wait staff is really nice and accomodating - they took off meals I didn't like and gave us coupons to use in the future, but we haven't used any of them (they're only good during the week) and I'm finding fewer things on the menu I want to try or go back to. Very disappointed and I guess I'm going back to cooking breakfast at home.

I have been waiting for someone to open in the location that Bob Evans had.  The Broken Yolk is a refreshing change to the other so called "breakfast places" in the Plainfield/ Naperville area. 
Why is it a refreshing change?  Awesome wait staff. Friendly professional hostess, an owner that by all accounts, is committed to customer satisfaction. I did not find that in some of the other places  I used to go to.
 I have to the yolk three time since they opened and each time the food seems to get even better.
I had the chicken fired steak the first day. I have had  it many times at other places, but this place knows what fresh really means. The meat was tender, the homestyle fries were perfection.The eggs were perfectly done, not greasy as in some other places. Even the iced tea was perfect.
The second time I tried the waffles and chicken. Once again fresh, Huge portions of chicken and the waffle was just right.
Today I had the Corned beef hash and eggs. This was some of the best corned beef hash I have ever had. You can really taste the corned beef, not like some places that drown it in salt and grease. The eggs were once again scrambled just the way I like them. I can't say enough about the home style potatoes. 
I have to mention that they have a rewards program which is nice. 
This will be my go to restaurant. This is one place where you can truly get "excited" about.

The establishment used to be Bob Evans, which was one of the breakfast places my family and I frequented when still around.  We were saddened when the doors closed but was pleasantly surprised when Broken Yolk popped up to replace it.  I'm happy to say that the food was excellent.  The Tiki french toast is highly recommended and will quickly become a staple. The food is fresh and very tasty.  The decor is a huge improvement.  Everyone greets you wherever you turn. With this much positive reviews you would think I would of rated higher but the only draw back, which is often the case, was the server.  Our particular server was not on point at all.  She hardly brought us refills.  When we tried to order a single item as takeout for our oldest who opted to wait at home, her reaction was one of annoyance.  The tables she was serving wasn't even full so it unfortunately isn't much of an excuse about things being too busy.  Most establishments realize that it comes down to the server that can make or break your experience. If this wasn't the case then at least my family would frequent the local China buffet.   Return visits are based on food, price and the experience.  We are hoping Broken Yolk will succeed but it will depend if they throw out some bad eggs in the process. No pun intended.

This place is awesome. Their sandwiches are huuuuuuge. You can definitely go lighter and split a sandwich with someone, or save it foor later, and you will still be filled. You def wanna try the hot lunch bar. I dig the pierogis. The people are very friendly. I always enjoy stopping by.

This is a near perfect Polish Deli thriving on the "old school" concept.. As you wait your turn, everyone rubs elbows, shoulders, bellies and butts. No one is afraid to step in front of you, let alone stamp on your foot.

Why? Because this is a typical Polish Deli...the interior is a little bigger than a matchbox and a tad smaller than a box of animal crackers. Szela's attracts a crowd of customers and your patience will be tested. The store only has two small isles, one of which is the congested deli counter.

However the food quality is not typical..."it's better" than most Polish Delis I've encountered, and blows away the popular "wanna-be" and scam "chain delis" in Naperville.

This is a Deli that understands the dynamics of a properly crafted sandwich...

Wow, this place is amazing. First of all, it's super small, so don't expect a bunch of fresh produce and stuff like that. 

They have a section of prepackaged goods that are all Polish. Lots of pickles and stuff like that. They also have a good selection of bread from a local Polish bakery.

The best part is the deli. Towards the back of the store there is a hot food section that usually features about 10 different items such as: hunter's stew, pierogies, stuffed cabbage, polish sausage, etc. There is some really good stuff there and you can get a 3-entree plate for a pretty reasonable price.

The second part of the deli is cold stuff behind the counter. There are cold salads and relishes, deli meat, and a wide variety of sausages.

Then you have the sandwich makers. On the wall behind the deli counter is a board with a great selection of sandwiches, both hot and cold. I usually get the Italian and it is amazing.

On top of the deli counters there is usually a bunch of different pastries that look incredible.

Obviously, I'm not going to go here for all of my shopping needs, but this is my favorite lunch spot in town!

Some of the best sandwiches around! Prices have gone up since they opened. If anyone drives past this place to go to subway you need to get a mental evaluation. I would say the prices are compatible with chain resturant but you get about 6 times the toppings. YES 6 times!! I get the European club Everytime and I just can't change it up. It does help to call ahead and place an order if you are in a hurry.

My coworker brought paczkis a few weeks ago and we are still talking about them today! I have never tasted better paczkis! The ones I had a fresh cream taste with real fruit like strawberries.  The filling was not too sweet, like I have had in the past.   They tasted really fresh and had the perfect amount of cream and fruit... soooooo tasty! Next time I go to Bolingbrook, I will make sure to stop by.

I love this place. A great selection of imported European food and fresh deli items and sandwiches. The staff are beyond exceptional and go out of their way to help you. They even carried items out to my car that I purchased for a catered event. Cooked food is great.

The only negative thing would be how cramped the store is especially when they have lots of customers. 

A message to the owners....time to expand because your store is so small and gets very cramped. The store next door is available......grab that capitalist attitude!

Love this place, I don't really go for shopping but the sandwiches are the draw. They have an awesome menu all made fresh. The hot food bar can be hit or miss and I wish the food there was a bit more fresh but it is still good for a quick pickup. If you don't mind a bit of a wait the hand made fresh sandwiches are really worth it. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The pastries are good too just haven't had a chance to try too many. Wish they were open later as this would be a consistent dinner spot for me as well. If you are in the mood for a great lunch spot check this place out.

The best European sandwich locally. $5.75 for a giant sandwich packed with triple quantity of meat, cheese, mayo/misc. stop by here and grab a menu. About a good 15 minute wait for lunch is the downside but worth it!
Went there and solo small.  Not much of a grocery.  Prices were high too.  Don't really know what people go there for.
Great selection of sandwiches!  They are huge and the prices are extremely reasonable.  The workers are very friendly and helpful.   Best deli in the burbs by far.

We stopped in today for some pierogis.  All they had are frozen except some on the hot food station.  Bulk dill pickles and kraut.  The bread we bought could have been fresher.  Give them a try.

Location: They are in the back of the strip mall just West of Weber and South side of Lily Cache.  Google Earth has them in the middle of the street about a half block West of where they really are.

Great selection of imported items, I feel VERY "at home" here when I walk in.....and everyone there is SO nice, I have 2 small children that can make my shopping experience a nightmare, but the staff there is always so nice to them and they don't give me the "you're crazy for shopping with these 2 kids" look. Authentic kielbasa, pierogi, potato pancakes, etc. I went here for ALL of my Easter dinner needs. They also get breads, etc. from a Polish Bakert in Hickory Hills, that stuff is freshhhhh!!!!

Great Polish Deli! etc
Nice selection of homemade goodies - all authentic. I really like their polish sausage and the rye bread. They have a great meal deal offering 3 selections from about 8 for $5. (Polish sausage, meatballs, sauerkraut ... etc) Very good pork sandwiches too!

I grew up in the land of the Polish Deli.  So when I moved out to Bolingbrook, I did not know where to go to cover my head cheese and vinegar cravings.  (Our Jewel doesn't sell head cheese).  So when Michelle L. suggested this new place, I was over there in a heartbeat!  Of course they had head cheese, and a full deli chock full of good polish imports!  Not only that, the baked goodies they had came from my favorite bakery in my old neighborhood!  They also had a heated selection of lunch-on-the go items, such as some very tasty cheese perogi, and cabbage rolls.  Also, agreeing with Michelle, their prices for non-import items were extravagantly high.
I was surprised to find Szela's in Bolingbrook after living here for 3 years.  I tried several sausages and was happily pleased.  I shop there regularly for sandwich meat.

Being in the industry I understand the importance seeing what your guests like or don't like on their visit to your establishment. That being said, I'm happy to say that my wife and I LOVED our visit!  We were able to brave the small swarm of bees outside this Saturday afternoon and started with a couple of cocktails and the Brussel sprout appetizer which was really well executed.  My wife ordered the breaded chicken and I had the Widowmaker sandwich.  She loved her perfectly cooked chicken breasts and the smashed potatoes were spot on. The sage cream sauce was an awesome way to tie the dish together.  My sandwich was nice in size and super tasty, but if I order again I will request more of the jalapeo and onion mixture as it really added great flavor. 

The food was great, our server (sorry I'm HORRIBLE with names) did a really nice job. She was fast, informative (explained every special and where the products were sourced from) and attentive.  

Thanks for a great experience and we look forward to coming back again. Kudos to the kitchen for nicely thought out plates and great execution, and to the service as well.

My Mushroom Gyro was wonderful. The fries were stick-like, a bit overdone on the outside yet still a bit mushy on the inside. The Iced-tea was wonderful. The price was a bit high for a small veggie sandwich and fries ($15.19 with tax) plus tip of $3.25. For Lunch. I picked one of the most economical items on the menu. I actually thought there would be a more "reasonably priced" lunch menu but there was not. 

Here's why I didn't rate 5 stars... When we walked in we noticed that it was VERY loud. It was the music. It was just loud and hit us when we walked in the door. I said to the hostess "is there a quiet place to sit", she said "it's a small place this is the seating we have". Okay... We'll try it. My friend I was with was having a hard time hearing me and by the time we left, her ears felt as if she was at a concert... It was just soooo loud. I have a health issue that keeps me from talking loudly so I asked the waitress again about the noise (explained my health issue) and she said she'd talk to the bartender about turning the music down (but it for some reason it seemed unlikely he'd turn it down - I'm not sure as she didn't get that far...) She walked away then came back quickly and suggested we sit at the booth in the back which may be more quiet. I checked it out and sure enough, it WAS more quiet. Just this one booth straight back from the entrance. We thought about sitting outside but it was chilly and breezy... So we moved and sat at the booth... 

Sadly this booth was TIGHT on both sides of the table... I'm not a little person (5'10") and my legs struggled to find a comfortable spot. Food came out rather slowly but we weren't in a rush (except for to get out of the booth) so that was fine. Again, I thought my sandwich was really good! I might get it again but just carry out or go when it's warmer so I can sit outside instead. Glad to have this restaurant in town but I think it'd be nice if the calmed it down with the noise just a bit.

I waffled back and forth between 3 and 4 stars for this spot.  I came here solo while on business travel on a slow Monday night.

The high point here is service.  My waiter was welcoming, friendly, and responsive, and took my order quickly.  My food came out VERY fast so obviously the kitchen/wait staff are working closely together and doing a good job of it.  The food was still piping hot so I knew it was fresh out of the kitchen the instant it was ready.  As soon as I was done eating, my plate was whisked away, I was offered dessert (declined) and my check was promptly brought out.

Where this place missed the mark was the quality of food compared to the price paid.  I got the salmon and for $24 for a plate, I would have either expected a lot more food or much better final product.  The salmon fillet was overcooked and slightly chewy.  The pieces of bacon that were in it were also chewy - neither crispy nor soft, but in that awful middle region that no one likes.  The sauce and flavoring was good, as was the butternut squash puree under it, also I loved the caramelized onions, there just wasn't enough of this other stuff.

The ambiance is also not bad; it can get a bit noisy in there due to the all-wood finishes.  Not necessarily a great date spot but good for small groups or double-dates.

I've only been to Joliet on business so I would say Sovereign is targeting an otherwise underserved market by going for the more high-end dining, because I'm here on business expensing my meals and this is more than double what I've paid for any other meal while in the Joliet area without driving closer in to Chicago.  I think they need to pick up the food quality if they want to earn more business.

I'm so happy I got to finally try this place out. We were finally in the area and I've had Sovereign on my bookmark list for a while. The outside of the place looks like you may have made a wrong turned and pulled up to your great-grandmother's house. This is a good thing. 

Walking in, I already felt comfortable because it does feel like you are dining in someone's home. The mismatched plates and other charming decor add to the feeling that you are having a dinner party with friends. We stopped for lunch so we ordered from the lunch menu, naturally. 

Both the pork sandwich and the chicken and artichoke sandwich were absolutely delicious. We also tried a small plate of their wings and the spice was so good on them. I loved that I could choose my side, and opted for green beans, instead of the usual fries. Everything that we ordered tasted so fresh and just tasty. Oh, and I can't forget their impressive drink menu-they will definitely have a beer or cocktail that you will love. I had a cider that was so good. Next time I'll try one of their crafted cocktails. I will definitely be back for dinner!

Not that this place needs another 5 star review, but it is a culinary Gem surrounded by mediocrity and bud light. This bar restaurant makes visiting Plainfield worthwhile, as dining here is sure to be a memorable experience. 

Starting with the interior they must have brought in an urban architect. The creative space and bar layout can be social while staying intimate. The acoustics keep the background music at a reasonable level, allowing patrons to have conversations unlike the few loud, lackluster  bars on the street.

Food is amazing any they now source their own cows from a local farm. I enjoyed the Widowmaker pork belly sandwich, which lives up to its name with super-hot jalapenos. The eclectic mix of craft beers and creative cocktails cannot be beat within a 20 mile radius surrounding the restaurant. Vegetarians will also love this place. I have never had a better side of kale in my life. Green beans were also super fresh. 
The mixologist bartender was super knowledgeable mentioning booze trends, and schooling our party on various of vodka ingredients. 

The unisex bathrooms will make you look twice, and the black restroom fixtures simulate peeing into the abyss....
Enjoy, eat, drink, this Sovereign establishment.

3 stars...
Trendy place in Plainfield, this town has grown up!
Started out with the fried Brussels for the group, and they disappeared quickly... Not too greasy and with a good sprouty flavor.
Ordered the Caesar salad and it was a bit dry and average on flavor. The highlight for me was the featured tacos...pulled pork on corn tortillas with crema and cilantro as well as a mole topping...very tasty!
25 beers on draft and a large offering of "craft" cocktails.... Beware everything "craft" is pricey!
Ambiance is medieval bario and prices are above expectation.
Ok place, but nothing on the menu that would make me come back...this joint does not make the list.

Earning high marks for this place is the beer list, brussel sprout appetizer, and cool exterior and interior. What you can also appreciate is that sovereign gives you a large choice of sides for your meals, other than just 'fries'. Those brussel sprouts were nothing short than amazing. The pork belly sandwich was also pretty decent.

Negatives would be that my wife's mushroom gyro sandwich really makes a vegetarian regret their life choices. Truly off putting is the loudness factor. My wife and I were sat at a table in the front room of the house and there is zero sound insulation. Sitting next to us was a table of 8 chatty trixies out for a birthday. My wife and I nearly had to scream at each other to get two words across in conversation. 

If I was to return, I'd make sure to simply order the sprouts appetizer non-stop and garner a spot at the bar.

Sovereign has amazing food (farm to table) and a wonderful craft beer list, but I have to give it a 1 star after an incredibly rude experience from the staff. I brought a friend here late at night after arriving from a flight and arrived shortly after 11 pm. The second I pulled into the restaurant, we saw two staff members smoking outside and we got out of the car. The staff members said nothing to us and rushed in to close and lock the door. They didn't speak to us or even mention that they were closing early.

I am not an unreasonable person. If a restaurant decides to close early because it is empty, that is totally acceptable. But to close and lock the door without saying one word to the potential patrons who simply came during opening hours? Completely disrespectful. I visit outer Chicago often and I will not be returning, despite having positive experiences in the past.

This establishment came highly recommended and did not disappoint.  I have sat at the bar and in the dining section and have received excellent customer service in both areas.  The bartenders and wait staff really make you feel welcomed and want you to come back and visit again.  I also noticed that in the dining section a manager walks around and casually asks if your dining experience is going well.  It is not instrusive at all and shows that they truly care about how you feel about their restaurant. 

Oh and the food and drink...well lets just say that it is AWESOME! I highly recommend building your own burger or the Widowmaker sandwich, both are mouthwatering.  Their tap list is quite impressive for they have craft beers that are hard to come by...someone has a good connection here :)  My only wish is that I lived closer and can frequent this place more often.  Whenever I am in the area I will be sure to stop in! Keep up the great work Sovereign!

Special tip: You can order a flight here...They will serve you 4 oz. pours of whatever you want.  I chose three when I went.  Also the ground brisket that is used to make their burgers is infused with BACON!

Sovereign is by far our favorite local restaurant! The food is fresh and delicious, and there is always somethings new to try on the menu.

It never feels too busy, and the service is great.

If I had to choose a negative, it would be that sometimes that items we try to order are not available because they didn't get the produce shipments in for it, but due to the farm-to-table nature of the restaurant, that it to be expected. 

Anyways, when that happens it forces us to branch out from the tried and true favorites and experience something new. 

I love the small plates and the flavorful vegetarian options they offer.

Overall, this place is superb, and well worth the spluge.

PS - The fried brussel sprouts are AMAZING :)
We found this place on the way back from Starved Rock State Park. The service was really good, food was delicious. Really liked everything about the place.

Amazing experience from start to finish. We sat outside around the fire pit while we waited for our table. Dan was our server outside and we actually waited for one of his tables to open up inside because he was so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu (both drinks and food).
He recommended the sprouts for an appetizer and they were delicious! All of our meals were absolute perfection...filet mignon, pork chop, chicken. Next came the desserts...key lime pie and Oreo pie...OH MY!! We were also sitting by the bar and one of the bartenders was an absolute master at his craft and lots of fun to watch (and never touched any of the garnishes with his fingers, always used a pick). Thank you for a wonderful experience - looking forward to many returns!

Delicious! I've heard good things about this place from some of my friends in both Chicago and the burbs and I've been wanting to try it out. I was not disappointed.

My group and I sat at a high top in the bar area on a 90 degree day, it was somewhat hot indoors but that didn't stop us from having a great time.

Our server Ryan was very knowledgeable and had a great attitude. He recommended some of his favorites on the menu.

We started with the Brussels sprouts appetizer which was a standout, along with the Caesar salad. We then got the dig on swine which was by far the best pork shank any of us have ever eaten. Next was the Wiccan chicken which was also very good, the mashed potatos on the side were very flavorful. 

We will definitely be back.

Excellent burger w fresh broccoli cooked perfectly.  Sat outside on their deck and received excellent service from Greg.

The fantasma tequilla drink was quite tasty.

We came here for the first time for our anniversary. Overall, the meal was solid. We both got the Soverign Burger- he added a fried egg and cheese to it, I had it with just onion, lettuce, and tomato. 

When my husband bit into his burger he went "Oh my God....... that is GOOD." The meat itself just had incredible flavor. For sides we got the garlic broccoli, which was just ok, kind of cold. It wasn't bad but wouldn't order to again. 

I also ordered a Bloody Mary.  I will admit, after reading all the awesome reviews for them on here I was super excited and had high expectations. I was a little disappointed once I got it.. I prefer a spicy bloody Mary and this was rather sweet and had a different flavor to it than I am used to. The side car was delicious, but not worth the extra money.

Our server was great and very attentive. Cool atmosphere and perfect if you like craft beer!

All in all we enjoyed our experience and will be back soon to try more stuff!

We have been back several times and the food is always amazing!!! My favorite dish is the Wiccan chicken!!!! Check it out! Love the patio during the summer as well! My BF always gets the Bloody Mary and it looks so good (not a lover of it, so I can't account for the taste).

I really liked this restaurant.  I felt it was a little pricey but i think you get what you pay for here.  The food was fresh and delicious and the burger was huge.  I loved the garlic mashed potatoes. The service was friendly, knowlegable and good but did leave a little too much time between visits to our table.

Let's be honest... You're not hitting this place up for a "lite" meal! Now, we're not trendy people by any means, but we didn't feel out of place in this somewhat trendy place either!

We all opted for items off of the specials menu. We were not disappointed by any means. We also tried a variety of strange and unusual mixed drinks too (we shared them all so we could try a bunch lol!). Some of them were ok, others (one with egg in it!) we won't likely order again, but we were adventurous enough to try them! The boys also had a variety of the craft beers that they have on hand.

A couple of us ordered the Hawaiian Opa (Moon fish) with pan seared green beans (I'm not fancy enough to call them haricot vert). The fish was perfectly seared on the outside and cooked with this mouth watering sauce. I wish I could remember what it was! Then I could continue to make you drool by describing it!

The boy got  the Pork Destroyer... Don't even ask how many ways they were able to put pork on this sandwich! It was ridiculous! There was bacon jam, pulled pork, pork loin?, and some other things I am failing to remember! Let's just say that when we left we were food drunk! You might think that I'm lying and that we were wasted on above mentioned drinks (which we may have been if we hadn't eaten), but it was the food that sent us overboard!   

Our server was super knowledgeable in all things Sovereign offered! This was quite useful as we asked her a ton of questions! We will definitely be back!

I went in a little nervous because I had heard such great things about it but knew it was pricey and smaller portions than we gluttonous souls are used to. I'm so glad I gave it a chance. Every part of my meal was delicious. Craft beer list is extensive. I had the meatloaf and was so pleased. And was full. I also tried the brisket risotto and the widow maker sandwich from other members in my party and both were so tasty. Even the French fries were delicious. We can't wait to go back and try more new things. You can really tell they put a lot of care into the farm to table style.

I also loved how they carried the farmhouse vibe throughout, down to the china we ate off of.

My wife and I were celebrating and decided after many accolades from friends and family and a well known craft beer destination we would try Soverign.  This place has a nouveau country diner style and a comfort food theme.  

We did their brussel sprouts appetizer which was fantastic as was their beer list.  I ordered the market ribeye sourced from a few miles down the road and my wife had the market fish. I have to say both were unimpressive.  I like salt as much as the next guy but I have never tasted a steak as salty as that ribeye(and I love cured meats).  What a shame.  The fish was better but still did not impress. 

If I ate there again I would definately stick to the regular menu favorites....

*The best* restaurant/bar in the history of existence.  Dakota is leading a crew of not only capable, but passionate and impressive professionals who deliver a service experience that is stellar and consistent!  The flavors of each dish and cocktail are impeccable, and the 25 taps of craft beer are certain to have something for each  connoisseur's palate.

Dreamcicle Pie is proof that Happiness has a flavor. 

If you miss Sovereign on your way through Plainfield, I feel sorry for you.  Cheers!!

Love this place.  The cocktails and beer selection are seasonal and fantastic.  The specials are always worth taking a look at (and usually worth ordering.  Any risotto is superb).  The appetizer wings are kill and I'm a big fan of the pork shank.  The fiance and I love coming here.  It does get a bit cramped at times but the atmosphere is very fitting for the type of food they serve.

Great atmosphere. My husband & I went for lunch, he had a burger that he really enjoyed,  I had a chicken sandwich with artichokes and it was very good! We each had a craft beer. The selection is great. The prices are fair and the service was prompt. We ate inside because the outside was full but they do have a very nice outside deck.

Now this is my place for a good hangout. This is my go to bar when I don't go to the city...good food, good selection on brews. And if you're not into the ales, they have some wine on tap.

Try their pork belly sandwich. Compliments well a good IPA. 

Free parking. Plenty of seating with tv's all around. Staff seemed pretty cool.

You may want to call ahead for hours since I showed up once before 10pm...even though they advertised closing at midnight.

Stopped in here last night for dinner. We got there early as they don't take reservations and it can get busy, especially on a Friday night.

Our server was great and very knowledgable about drinks and food on the menu.

We started with the Brussels and Flow and sausage plate. I haven't had Brussels sprouts since I was a child and my mom made me eat them. These were perfectly roasted and the red chili sauce was the perfect dipper. I have a whole new mindset on sprouts! Sausage plate was amazing- three types of sausage links served with a Dijon and red cabbage. 

I ordered the Dig on Swine. Probably the best pork I've ever had. Ever. Sweet potatoes may have had a tad too much butter (Sounds silly, I know). The kale had lots of garlic on it so I forgot I was eating kale. Thank goodness.

Two people in my party ordered the stew and enjoyed it. It was tomato based. And my father in law enjoyed his steak.

I only wish this place had more room so it didn't seem as cramped. But, we'll be back!

Went to Sovereign for lunch today and enjoyed three dishes and two unique beers. This is the best restaurant in the southwest suburbs. If you have never been here, you are missing out.
(Not sure why I would tell you this, because now getting a table on a weekend evening will get even harder.)
I have now eaten here more than 40 times, and it has never once disappointed. Never once.
All of the ingredients are amazingly fresh. They don't even have a freezer or a microwave on the premises. How many restaurants can say that?
Today I had the Chicken Wings, which I get pretty much every time I eat here. They are the best I've ever had anywhere...every time. Perfectly cooked, succulent, sweet, tangy, with just a bit of spice. Amazing!
I also get the small plate tacos almost every time, because DAMN!, they are also amazing. Unlike the wings, they change the ingredients periodically. This time they were chorizo beef with cilantro, onion, and a special sauce. Delicious! 
I do miss the pork tacos with pineapple and radish, but they'll be back. Can't wait. I've just finished eating and my mouth is watering just thinking about them.
And lastly, I had the pork belly. The pork belly. All I can say is that it rivals the pork belly from Publican in Chicago, and that is high praise. It was ridiculously tender, juicy, with just the right amount of fat. Perfect pork belly is a thing of beauty. (...more mouth watering going on here) 

I can't wait to go back and try the new hanger steak and hash that they just added to the menu. It sounds amazing.

I've tried to like this place. Been there 3 times including my anniversary special dinner. The Fried Brussel Sprouts with sweet chili sauce is the best thing here. Ordered the blue fish special 10/24/15 and the fish was fishy and putrid while the wife had the burger which was delicious (the one bite I had). Went back twice since then to have the burger for myself and was very disappointed. The meat came thin in 2 patties both cooked into oblivion both times and my Brussels were never put in until I asked right before the burgers came out (easily comped us a small plate for free)
Conclusion:
Servers are nice...place is way cleaner than previous owner (bin #8 something)...beer selection is decent (better 1st two trips then the last one on 8/27/16)...consistency seems to be an issue reading how everyone gushes about the burger (if a software consultant can cook a burger better than a chef)...a bit overpriced to be disappointed 3 times in a row...probably won't be back

Came here back in January for my birthday on a Thursday. It's really nice inside- dark, dimly lit, lots of wood, pretty view of downtown Plainfield. We had reservations so we were seated quickly. Our server was very nice and informative and patient answering questions and making recommendations. He seemed to really enjoy what he was doing. When we got there (around 4pm) it was quiet with regular restaurant level noise and murmur. By the time we left (630pm-ish) the restaurant had gotten busier and the volume had gone up. The crowd went from older people, people on dates, and families to younger groups. Not a bad thing, just plan your arrival time accordingly.
I'm going to be honest- I cannot remember if there was specifically a kids' menu. I double checked online and I didn't see one on the site. But I do remember I ordered my son a grilled cheese sandwich with fries. He gobbled as much as his tiny tummy could take (he was only 13 months old at this point) but I will say I took a bite and it was delicious. We were seated in a corner by the windows up front. My son had a view of the bar and he was completely entertained watching the bartender the whole time. 
My mom and I ordered a drink that the server described as their take on the Moscow Mule and it was DELICIOUS. My brother asked if they had anything along the lines of Dos Equis and not only could the server make a recommendation but my brother enjoyed it.
We ordered the Sausage Fest and the Brussel & Flow to start. It was all delicious. I loved the Sausage Fest (that's what she said) and I'm pretty hesitant about sausages (that's what she said...ok I promise I'm done). The Brussels sprouts were amazing. I didn't even use the chili sauce they came with because standalone they were great.
I got the Wiccan chicken. The portion was HUGE. The breading was perfect, the mashed potatoes were on point. I was happy to take left overs because I basically went straight fat kid and smashed it later that night. 
Overall very pleased. Even my dad and brother who are pretty standoffish with anything slightly out of the norm enjoyed it.

I had decided to come here based on the Yelp reviews.  I came later on a Saturday evening, and it was still packed.  First good sign.  Thankfully I didn't have to wait long for a table.  When we say we were served room temp purified water in a nifty bottle.  Cool idea!  

For a drink I ended up ordering this cocktail (can't remember the name) it was a cream based with lime juice and smokey tequila.  Yes, it had a smoky flavor.  It was so odd... But yet really good!  And it was served with a cucumber slice!  It all came together nicely. 

For dinner my partner and I ordered the Wiccan Chicken.  This meal was amazing!!  The chicken was perfectly breaded and fried.  It was just right.  Nice and light, not greasy.  The mashed potatoes was smooth as butter and the Dijon sage cream sauce on top sealed the deal. 

For dessert, I had a dreamsicle pie and my partner had a cookies and cream pie.  Both were awesome!  Only thing that slightly annoyed me was the price of the pie slice was high for what it was. 

I will definitely return to this establishment and hopefully they won't be out of the meatloaf everyone raves about!!!

Service was good, but food wasn't quite what I expected.  Although certainly not bad, it wasn't to my palate.  Interesting atmosphere and quaint decor.

A little pricy for me.  Not sure if I would go back.

Tasty tasty. Celebrated my birthday here with my husband recently. Started with the chicken wings- great sauce, nice and crispy. The husband agreed. I had the breaded chicken entree with garlic mashed potatoes and green beans. Totally hit the spot. Everything tasted super fresh and homemade like comfort food should.  Tried a few interesting beers- they will give taster portions if you ask- not sure I saw those on the menu though. Would go back if I ever find myself in that area again.

Was on a biz trip in Joliet/Channahon area, when I stumbled upon this yelp find. Great food  & friendly staff. I went at around 3pm on Tues and enjoyed their fish entre- excellently flavored and great, fresh veggie sides.

This is a great place that follows the Farm-to-table concept. I have visited a couple of times. The menu changes seasonally and is full of lovely surprises. They serve decent portion sizes which allows you to order a couple of things instead of just getting stuck with one huge entre! The wings are great and so are their bloodymarys!! They call it the Bloody Selena and that is  phenomenal- right from the presentation to the flavor and taste. They serve a Habanero beer to chase it down. My bloody Selena experience is one to remember. Their drinks menu also has a great variety. Although this place may lack vegetarian variety. The have their own parking and have very friendly staff.

This place is top notch. A rotating beer tap that changes frequently keeps bringing the beer snob in me back pretty frequently. The food is very good too. It is a farm to table restaurant so the food is local and fresh. I have not had a bad item there. The brussel sprouts are to die for (and u don't like brussel sprouts). Some other favorites are the tacos, risotto and the wings. The wings come with a celary and blue cheese salad...yum yum. Highly recommend at a decent price.
I love sovereign!!! Great food - farm to fork. Always fresh and delicious. The menu changes seasonally. I go at least once a month. It's just that good. The atmosphere is awesome as well!

First time trying this place and my boyfriend and I really enjoyed it. Great service and the food was very tasty. My only critique is the potions on the tacos were kinda sad. 8.00 for teeny tiny little tacos. He put the plate down, I ate them in not even 1 minute. He came back shocked how fast I ate them...I was like I'm they were smaller then the palm of my hand haha. Other than that we had awesome wings and are for sure going to try their cocktails next time we stop in. Great Atmosphere and quality food.

Wow! The food is amazing!!

We came here to try something new not really knowing what to expect, we were not disappointed! The building from The outside does not really give off the look of a restaurant so make sure you don't miss it! The parking lot is nice and big so no need to worry about finding a spot!

We were greeted by the hostess at the door and promptly sat at what seemed like the furtherest table in the restaurant. But it was actually a really nice spot! Lots of fun decorations to look at and not to much noise around us, and we were not forgotten about ;) 

The speciality drinks were awesome! I tried a few and liked them, also many many different beers to try...the food menu is not super big but it does not need to be! They have specials from each section that change all the time! I got the enchiladas and they were to die for!!! I am craving them now thinking about it! Boyfriend got the filet and it was melt in your mouth good!

I can not wait to come back and try the tacos (I heard those were very good too!)

Sovereign won't be around too long. A new, holier-than-thou list of rules, condescending wait staff and laughable price points. Hey, I get it. We all want to be cool kids. But refusing to make my wife a grilled cheese sandwich as a vegetarian option shows you where their head is at (mainly up their ass). 

I'll resist the urge to go into their portion sizes, lack of any real atmosphere, and poor interpretation of farm - to-table concepts. Save yourself the trouble, go to Whole Foods, buy $50 worth of fancy food, light a $20 on fire, and you'll still be ahead both taste - wise and financially.

Go across the street to TCC Wine and Cheese or down to Moe Joe's. #neveragain
