I met a few friends here for lunch and I was really impressed with Sovereign.  I had their version of a cuban sandwich  and it was very tasty.  I didn't have a cocktail but the ones served to my dining partners looked great and they really enjoyed them.  The highlight of our visit was the brussel sprouts appetizer - I think I'm going to come back just for those!  I love the farm to table concept and the variety of craft beers.  This is a great spot in an area that has really stepped up it's restaurant game lately.

Few places take real appreciation for the food they produce. This is one of those places where they really care about quality and service. The food was amazing. I wish I found out about this place sooner. I went for lunch and I'm going back for dinner. 

Definitely try the pork belly sandwich called "The Widow Maker." It was well sized and I still devoured it in 2 mins.

Rating is for drinks on the patio only. Didn't get a chance to try food. Great craft beer and creative cocktail menu. Lots of local options to pick from and can create your own flight. Sat on patio and had great service from Greg. He was super knowledgeable about the menu. Place is pretty small so I can see where the wait would be long on the weekends. Food menu looked great. Will go back to try the food next time.

Finally tried sovereign tonight. The widow maker is amazing, the sovereign burger is amazing,  hell everything we had was amazing. The craft beer selection can't be beat. Service was spot on. We will definitely will be back.
This is the gem of Plainfield IMHO. Food is excellent. Casual atmosphere and good beers to boot.
Fresh food, awesome service!! Loved the widow maker and the craft beers! Great place if your wanting to try something new in the suburbs! Nothing frozen fresh from their garden to your table.
Informative staff. Love the burgers. I have never been disappointed. Been there probably 10 times. Brussel sprout  appetizer is fantastic! Really!

I had the widow maker, pretty good. It could have tasted better, I thought it was a bit bland. My wife had the Cuban, that was tasteless. But, the Brussel Sprout appetizer was so good! Get that thing!! I never enjoyed Sprouts that much before now. The beer selection is pretty da-weet! 

It is loud, but get over it. Don't be a Chauncey and enjoy a lively bar with better than average acoustics. The placement is good for people watching because Plainfield is full of freaks. I saw two people walking together holding hands, I'm pretty sure they were conjoined twins....or married and in love. There was also a bearded lady, or maybe just a hipster with a beard. You can't really tell these days. Oh, wait, there was also a Benjamin Button type thing going on, but instead the child being old but young looking this child was young but young looking. The freaks owners insisted it was a "child" but we all know what's going on in Plainfield. 

In short, beers are good, food is decent, and I'm hilarious.

Wow! Oh my this food is amazing! We got wings as an appetizer and even though I'm not a fan of bone in wings I loved these! Spicy and not at all creepy looking like bone in wings tend to be. I also had a few of these AMAZING pear drinks served with a pear and brie cheese (can't tell you what it is but more on that later)! I ordered the Wiccan Chicken which came out with a HUGE portion and I bit in and was in heaven. Like it was beyond words the best chicken and mashed potatoes of my life. Our server was a total doll, sweet, accommodating and a fantastic server. He explained the farm to fork experience if you are into it then this is for you. I don't understand the significance of it. I live in the country it just seems obvious to me.

What I didn't like. There were hornets outside. My dining companion is allergic and there were so many we had to move inside even though it was a beautiful day. The vegetable sides! I hated the green beans my server graciously offered something else. I was told to try the Kale which I hated. I didn't want to complain again so I gave both to my dining companion who happily gobbled them down. 

Now for the last bad point. I have been raving about my experience here and was very disappointed to learn that the drink menu is not online! All things considered I could look aside my grumbles and give the place a five star rating if they included the drink menu on their website and made it a little more user friendly! Wink wink ;)

I've been back a few times since my first review and my experience this weekend prompted me to update. With the menu always changing and them having different things at lunch and dinner, I've yet to find my "favorite" dish here. However, we stopped in Saturday night for a friend's birthday and I definitely think it was my best experience so far. We did have an hour wait for a group of 5 which sucked, especially because we didn't end up being seated til after 9 but what can you do. 

I started with the house salad, which is always good here. The soup was a spicy chicken and it was AMAZING. I could have eaten 3 bowls of it. So good. We also had the frites with egg on top which was very delicious. My friend and I split the banana cream pie for dessert which was the perfect ending. Service was good and they split our check which was awesome.

Only complaint this visit: my friend wanted the fruit salad and was told they only serve it at lunch even though online it is on their dinner menu. I've noticed their online menu and the in person menu are often different. Also, I am missing their delicious sourdough bread! I hope it comes back.

I love the fact that Soverign is a farm-to-table restaurant, but, because of this, the menu is a little lackluster. When I tried ordering brussel sprouts as an appetizer they weren't ready yet because they were shipped in that morning. I appreciate the freshness but it cuts back on an already-small menu.  I ordered the Klinger Wants Home with a side of salted green beans. Overall, it was very delicious and the spicy mayo gave it its kick. My favorite part of my lunch was the bloody mary. It comes garnished with a hot wing, celery, pickle, cheese and meat. It burns in the best way possible. Only 3/5 stars for the price as well. For three eating lunch it was $75. Good first experience but I'm not dying to go back.

This place is a gem. The food was excellent, the brews were excellent, the service was excellent and the establishment was excellent. Seriously. Check them out, they're good for the soul. (And your belly)
Absolutely love the food and the atmosphere of Sovereign!

I have been eagerly awaiting the opening of Sovereign for months.  I am always nervous that my expectations will leave me disappointed with a new restaurant.... Not a chance at Sovereign!!

My buddy and I met for lunch on a Monday so it was relatively empty which is fine with me.  We sat near the bar and were immediately met by our server.  I couldn't drink but my friend (who is as close to a beer sommelier as I know) studied the beer menu and was very pleased with the selections and uniqueness of their offerings.
I ordered a cream soda....

The lunch menu is a sandwich heavy sampling of the dinner menu (I know this cuz I've had a copy of the dinner menu on my desk for weeks!!!). 

We chose to both start with the SOD (soup of the day for those that never worked in the industry) which was cream of mushroom.  The soup flavor was outstanding.... However, it was served Luke warm.  I found this small screw up odd given the previous reviews commenting this problem.  Cmon guys, turn up the crock pot!!!!  B-

We then split the wings A++.  The risotto (hen of the woods mushroom and pecorino) A+++++++.  And the tacos A.  We both were extremely pleased with the service, food and  the ambiance.   We are now eager to try the dinner selections very very soon!!

This restaurant is an oasis in will county.  Anyone who considers themselves a foodie must give Sovereign a spin, and be prepared to give your tastebuds a ride!

I look forward to doing dinner at sovereign soon!!

Holy Yummy. Great staff...super friendly and knowledgeable. Menu is small and precise - the do not recommend substituting. Liquor is all small batch. I could not order my usual Maker's Mark Manhattan and instead ordered a Yellow Jacket which is Koval Bourban, honey and lemon. A very nice and appropriate substitute. Mom had some small batch vodka and was happy. 

Mom ordered a Pork shank with pured sweet potatoes and kale. She described it as "outrageous" and had enough leftovers for a second meal. I had a pork sandwich which was cooked to perfection and served on an artisan bun. Good flavor combo and great size. I'll have the other half for lunch tomorrow and I will be happy. 

Speaking of leftovers... Eco friendly recyclable packaging made me happy. 

Come try them out...priced higher than I expected for Plainfield but not terrible.

The restaurant may not be the biggest fan of Yelp, but I appreciate Yelp leading me to their doors!  We ate there around mid-late afternoon on a Saturday and given how bustling it was then, I could definitely see it filling pretty well during dinner hour.  

We ordered off the lunch menu, which was probably a little more than the average we pay, but not out of range of what we'd expect for a place that has something a little more interesting or unconventional to offer.  I loved the seasonally shifting menu and many locally sourced items.  I had the "Bird and the Bee" wings and a side of asparagus - both were good, and it probably sounds weird, but I especially loved the asparagus.  I have mad love for asparagus, order it whenever I see it in a restaurant, and theirs just had the perfect tenderness and flavor.  Husband had the Paradise by Dashboard Light which was a meatloaf with elk, bison and boar, and loved it all.  I ordered my drink off the seasonal drink menu, with the server's recommendation, and was a big fan of that as well. 

There are so many interesting choices I can't wait to try next time.  They have posted some amazing looking specials to their social media accounts (Facebook, Instagram) as well.

First trip here and would absolutely come back. Beer selection was good and reasonably priced and the food was very solid. I ordered the pork and jalapeo sandwich and it was amazing. The garlic mashed potatoes were top notch as well. For me the biggest compliment I can give is that the food needed absolutely 0 seasoning and was packed with flavor. I highly, highly recommend!

Was told hour wait, after a hour 15 I went and asked how much longer, short guy in tight jeans insisted that we stay and that we will have a table in 30 min...that didn't happen!! Ended up waiting for 2 hour to spend $40 on 4 drinks that were terribly made. Not very friendly either! Make sure to wear your tight jeans and hipster clothes!!

Food is always fantastic. Expensive, but fantastic. Almost impossible to walk out of there spending less than $100. Decor is great, bar staff generally friendly, servers are young, very talkative.

But AMAZING food. AMAZING beers. Great addition to Plainfield. I just really wish I could afford to come here more often or know how to avoid some of the loud servers on staff.

I called Sovereign while on a business trip and asked if they could surprise my wife and her friends with a drink and dessert when they arrived. She had been taking care of our 4 boys, oldest being 7, for 4 days. Meanwhile, I've been at a conference in Palm Springs. Her parents were babysitting to give her a well deserved break.

Luckily the person who answered my call was Dale, one of the owners. He said it might be hard because Saturdays are super busy. However, Dale went above and beyond to work with me and he came up with a plan to make it work.

Not only does Sovereign have killer food and drinks, a great vibe and friendly wait staff, they go out of their way to help  their customers. I couldn't be more appreciative of Dale's help. There's no question that the next time we're deciding where to eat in downtown Plainfield, Sovereign will get my vote.

This place had a cool atmosphere, the server was very intelligent about her recommendations. Food was outstanding, I had a BBQ burger with smoked bacon and fried onions.  The burger was good.  Mashed potatoes were some of the best I've ever had. Wife had tortilla chicken soup, delicious and a very good enchilada.  We will definitely be returning here regularly!

This place is so welcome in the land of chain restaurants in the area.  Sovereign got it right.  Fresh, real food.  Everything has a bit of a flair to it but trust the chef, it all works together beautifully.  The brussel sprouts are AH-MAZING with the thai chili dipping sauce.  YUMMO.  I've had burgers, sandwiches, wings and they are all fantastic.  So happy to be able to support  a small business!

I really hope the owner is reading this...

A solid 5!!! I've been to many bars and this one blows all others out of the water. The ambiance is phenomenal. You have your bar, romantic tables with light and lots of mason jars, and a gorgeous patio. The only downside is noise, but we were seated next to the bar. Please install some dampeners and it will be great!

Food was delicious. Got fried brussel sprouts and they were very good; add just a little longer in the fryer for crisper inside. My hubby had Porky's revenge and loved it. Plenty flavorful. I had the Widowmaker and it was the most amazing sandwich ever. Every little detail was perfect: gooey cheese, fresh, crispy bread, and tender meat. Mashed potatoes were to die for as well. 

Beer selection is very good, and our waiter (Walter I think) was phenomenal and accommodating.

Once again a solid 5 stars!!!!

The restaurant's atmosphere is very avant-garde and the service excellent. I had high hopes for the food and though it was presented beautifully it lacked passion and seasoning. The ingredients were fresh but  to put it simply, the food was uninspired and bland.

Delicious! The area the restaurant is in is very cool area. Lots of bars & restaurants to walk around & see. The food here is very fresh, farm to table & the dishes a delicious! I had a portabella mushroom gyro with feta on Noni bread. Was delicious! My husband had the organic strip steak. The flavor was excellent as well as quality. Would definitely go back again!

I love this place so much. My only regret is that we don't often have a babysitter and don't get to come here as much as we would like. (I suppose I could bring my child, but what fun would that be?!)

The food is always delicious and the service has always been excellent. I love that the menu changes often, as it should when fresh, local ingredients are being offered. I love that the setting is not too stuffy. I like when places really focus on the food and not on the silverware and place settings, because I don't care as much about that. The drink list is also great. I love all the whiskey cocktails and the draft beer selection is great!

This place is amazing. I have had lunch 3 times so far and everytime I received excellent service.  Solid find in downtown Plainfield. The wait staff is very polite and know the menu very well.  The food was amazing. I enjoyed the unique takes on standard grub. I have had there famous tacos, and Widow Maker sandwich.  No complaints except tacos are very small. If they added another taco and charge an extra $2.00 it would be worth it. (Its just my personal opinion)
Prices are fairly high for lunch time but I don't mind paying. Good food, fresh, healthy,  and good service, worth the extra coin. 
Beer is great, many to choose from with detailed descriptions.  Finally a place that dosent sell garbage beer!!!! No Corona,  MGD, Miller you know what I'm talking about. 
They have there own parking lot, so far I have not had any issues parking. 
Very clean bathrooms.......
I'm looking forward to trying many of there other items on menu, including beers. 
Great place weather you eat alone; with a friend or group.

Amazing! The atmosphere, food, and service were all too-notch! My son will be attending Lewis and we will definitely be visiting Sovereign each time we visit him at school!! Dakota was very helpful at the bar--advised my meal choices, gave me samples of beer to try, and was very friendly the whole time. I had wings (WONDERFUL) and the phat beet salad, which was delicious. 
Keep doing what you're doing Sovereign. I wouldn't change a thing.

I LOVED Sovereign!

Our server was awesome in recommending some of his favorite entrees and appetizers. I started off with their 'Repentless' cocktail infused with strawberry koval bourbon and basil - one of my favorite drinks I've ever had! My boyfriend and I then split the small plate tacos with chorizo and potatoes (SO DELICIOUS), risotto (flavor changes daily and I highly recommend) and brussel sprouts. I got the Wiccan Chicken that I ate every bite of - so tasty! My boyfriend got the Widow Maker and loved it.

If you're in the Plainfield area or a nearby suburb, I highly recommend. They even have a cute patio outside for the warmer weather months.

I ate there with a party of 4 tonight....one thing I can say is that it was hot as heck. We were asked if we wanted a seat indoors or outside and seriously think we would have been better sitting outside. The food was mediocre for the price....this is plainfield, not naperville or the city. We had to ask multiple times for water and our waitress only checked on us once. I'm really surprised by all of the good reviews! We were that at 5pm on sat and the restutant was not full.
Awesome food, great craft beer selection and very friendly staff! Every entree we tried has been incredible and the dessert is the best I've ever had!

Not at all what I expected.  This is a casual spot with a great selection of beer and good food. 

Special cocktails as well. The bar tenders were super knowledgeable about their beers. 

Food wise again not what I expected but very good.  The Brussels Sprouts are a must order. Wings were good as well with a nice spice to them.

Our group ordered risotto  (good), meatloaf (good), beet salad (meh) and fish special (good).

They seem to serve a lot of burgers which look delicious. Definitely getting one next time there.

I recommend checking this place out next time you are in downtown Plainfield.
The food was great but with the average price of everything else on the menu being about $25 we were a little shocked to get the bill and see the steak and potatoes were $40

This place is my new favorite suburban place.   The beer listvery expansive and though I've had a couple of visits here, I have yet to try a cocktail because the beer list is so big.

The food is good.  Though be fairly warned that if you order anything involving peppers, it will be near overwhelming as terms of spice content goes.  I have a fairly high tolerance for spice and here have been a few dishes I've tried (Bahn mi and Pork Belly Sandwich) that have pushed me to the limits of what I find acceptable heat level in a dish.

That aside, I haven't been disappointed with any of my meals here.  The price points on the menu are near the high end of reasonable, but you don't get disappointed on the downside because relative to anything that is in the area this place does food and beer the best.
Drinks and food were fabulous. Loved to farm to table, small craft distillery and brewery environment. Seasonal menu that changes every season. Knowledgeable staff and can't wait to go back.

First time trying Sovereign and was not disappointed.  We decided to give it a try after getting a late start on Saturday night (8:00pm).  We were able to get seated right away outside on their deck.  Our server was very attentive the whole night and gave excellent recommendations.  The menu was somewhat limited, but considering the seasonality and local suppliers of the ingredients, still found a few alternatives that sounded good.  With a hearty appetite, she suggested one of the main entrees instead of the small plates.  I went with the Shank and it was delicious.  We were told that it would take 20 minutes which was fine considering the specialty drink menu.  The meat literally fell off the bone.  And the kale and sweet potato pure complimented the meal perfectly.  My wife had the chicken with garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.  Great comfort food.  This is the first time in a while that there was nothing left on either of the plates except for the bones from the shank.  It's a little pricey but worth it.  The atmosphere was good as well, filled but not overly crowded.  Definitely will be back.
The Brussel sprouts are AMAZING!! Service it great and options for vegans and vegetarians are available.

"Things we do not support : Yelp"
what does this mean?
 I don't remember seeing this on my Dec 30, 2014 visit. I'm highly disappointed to hear this  Did something  horrible happen on Yelp since my visit?   
i know there is a love/hate relationship between restauranteurs and yelpers, but this is pretty public and blatant.  My rating stands, but  if the proprietors feel such contempt for my honest (Yelp) praise of this establishment, should i take down my review?

Nice place although more of a hipster feel than I expected for downtown Plainfield, the brussel sprouts were my favorite thing of the evening. 

We were not told of any specials for the evening and maybe the place doesn't do specials. There were No prices (that I noticed) on the drink menu except for the beers. We asked our waitress multiple times for some additional sauce for the Brussel Sprouts. Every time she said sure by it never showed up. At least we weren't charged for it. 

I would return but probably more for special occasions rather than an everyday dinner.
Most amazing food ever!!! Defiantly coming back. Excellent service, excellent food. The menu was amazing. Can't say enough!
I've never had a bad meal yet here. Love how the menu changes. The BEST thing is that it's all local farmers! Huge selection of craft beers! Only negative is that it's SUPER noisy.

Food- Average.  Nothing to rave about.
Pricing- Inline/Good
Atmosphere- Good, for the most part
Service- Not very good.  Had a wishy/washy opinion....said everything was good.

I will not be going back.  Not only was the food average (at best), the patio was full of bees, flys, etc.  They were all over our food.

Sorry sovereign, our last date.

A great place for me and my husband to eat due to it having many vegan and vegetarian options.  We love this place!
-Above was my original review.  I would now like to add that my last two trips to Sovereign have not been pleasant.  During one trip the waitress argued with us about our orders and then was incorrect in what she said and had to take our meals back to then have our ordinal original orders made. Then,  after my last trip there,  I had mild food poisoning as did anther person at my table. I'd like to give it another shot since I enjoyed it so much the first couple of times that I ate there,  but I'm apprehensive about returning.
Amazing food. Do yourself a favor and save room for the pie of the day! Service was great but parking can get a little tricky.

The wife and I were totally disappointed with the $12.00 brisket and bacon burger. Neither of us could taste any bacon or brisket. It sounds way better than it tastes. Bubba burgers taste better. Also the service was really slow for a Sunday afternoon.

A very enjoyable dining experience. This is a very small restaurant that doesn't take reservations, so be prepared to wait for a table. We waited about 75 minutes which put us at our table around 9:15. However, while waiting we enjoyed the Brussels sprouts appetizer and gourmet beers, wine and cocktails. For dinner, we had the meatloaf, Wiccan chicken, tacos and risotto. All meals were very tasty and full of unique flavors. For dessert, we had cookies n cream pie and orange dreamscicle pie. Those were very good as well. Our tab for four was around $200, but we enjoy our food and beverage. I would go back.

I wanted to fall in love with Sovereign so I could brag to my friends about this awesome gastropub in downtown Plainfield.  But I left Sovereign with the feeling that there isn't much to brag about.

Sovereign took the old Bin 48 space, so if you are familiar with that old restaurant, you know it's beautiful in here.  It's dimly lit, with wood floors and a dark wood bar and tables.  The bar is at the center of the restaurant, and surrounded by several tables.  The restaurant is small though.  By the time we left on Friday night around 7:00 p.m., there was a good amount of people waiting for a table.

We received great service at Sovereign.  There's a strange misconception that Sovereign is a "hipster" joint.  Just because a restaurant has a farm-to-table menu concept, hosts a great craft beer menu, and some employees may have beards, mustaches, or unique hairstyles does NOT make it "hipster."  Sovereign is trendy and modern.  From what I could tell, the patrons were locals in their 40s-50s.  We were definitely the younger ones here.  It's also family friendly - they have kid's cups with lids.

Anyway, our server was patient with us when ordering and also was able to describe and suggest beers to us.

The chocolate caramelized churro stout caught my eye, but I wasn't sure I would enjoy a whole glass.  I asked for a sample, which they will provide, but samples are a fraction of the cost of the whole beer.  I'm not being a cheap ass, but I'm used to several establishments allowing you to try a shot glass-size of beer free of charge.  Sovereign's samples are 5 oz., and my one sample was $4.  It was worth trying, and it's actually an excellent beer, but I would steer clear of ordering anything you're hesitant about.  Sovereign isn't about sampling beer.  Luckily, I would trust our server to make recommendations if needed.

The farm-to-table menu concept seems new to some suburbanites, especially Plainfieldians who likely flock to the local Red Robin for their burgers on the weekends.  We both had the burger, for the reason that it is made with brisket and bacon, but I didn't really like it.  The patty was dry, the BBQ sauce with it was watery, the cheese was kind of melted off of the burger, so I didn't see the "wow" factor here.  They also nickle and dime you for each topping.  

We also shared an order of the truffle fries.  They were delicious, but for $10 I would have expected more.  I know this is a gastropub serving items with quality ingredients, but I couldn't really get past the price on the fries.

When the bill came, it was paperclipped to a paper "mission statement," which stated that Sovereign supports all people, races, etc.  Then I saw something curious:

"Things We Do Not Support;  Yelp."

No further explanation on that one.  For a new establishment, I find this really awkward and kind of defensive.  Was it meant to be funny?  My knee jerk reaction was that it was condescending.  This isn't downtown Chicago - most of the reviews of Sovereign - most of the FIVE STAR reviews - are from Yelpers in & around the Plainfield area.  Is that not like looking a gift horse in the mouth?  Most of the reviews here are positive, which had convinced me to try Sovereign instead of leaving it hidden in my "bookmarks" list forever.

I get it though, kind of.  Some of the negative reviews about the food and price point are from people who probably haven't frequented many restaurants of a similar concept/price point.  To that I say, read the menu online before you go!  However, owners should have thick enough skin that they don't need a silly little mission statement.  One of them fought back against an admittedly psychotic sounding review, but they ended up sounding just as arrogant and childish.

A friend of mine was here recently and had the pork belly sandwich.  He raved about it.  So, if you're still intrigued by Sovereign I would say skip the burger and give that a try instead.  And while you're at it, trust your server to make a great beer recommendation.

I do kind of want to go back and try the cocktails...we'll see.

Ahhhhh local. Seriously, Plainfield was thirsty for a little hipster place such as this. Throw some craft beers, some local fare, and a nice modern design to the menu and room, and the thirst has been quenched. 

They give no shits about Yelp, though, as mentioned on their menu. They take their restaurant seriously, a labor of love. Crazy right? They actually give a s*$% about their craft. I watch these guys on Facebook and they even closed down to restock. Refreshing. 

Once again we ate too much and rolled home. Pork belly, burgers, truffle fries with an egg on top, scallops. You guys are fatasses. They don't really have a website and the menu varies as the supply changes. This shouldn't stop you though. 

GO. Now. Before it gets so popular, you can ever get in. Can I still invest?

Wow this place is amazing... I had the burger and my dad had a shank of pork. Wow that was the best burger I've ever had... The Bloody Mary was the best I've ever had the spices where perfect... I am  coming back. Service was great!

Went in late December with a friend to suss out the hype.  Made reservations, but it wasn't busy when we arrived.  I'm happy to see a place like this in the area - we needed more than a Chili's or Chipotle!  

Food was great, and I love that it's as local as possible.  

As for the "anti-Yelp" thang, some of you are REAL bent over that - get real.   While Yelp is often reliable, places like Sovereign, that aren't  your traditional place, tend to get slammed for stupid stuff by people who want a regular cheeseburger with greasy fries and then don't get it.  COME ON.  Know your venue when you choose. 

I'll be back.  LOTS.

Widow maker sandwich. F-ing phenomenal. Server (Chad) was awesome, even though he was super busy, we never felt rushed and took the time to explain the menu.  Everything was fresh. Nothing disappointed. Will be back soon.  Thanks!

Dinner around 7pm on a Monday. Climate inside was humid and stagnant. Ordered fried brussel sprouts to start. Good concept, but because of how they are prepared, many of the sprouts taste overcooked and bitter. Wife had a burger.  It's big but flavorless. Red onion and tomato were cut much too thick making it difficult to keep the burger together. I had the staff favorite widow maker sandwich. Sounds good on paper but the pork belly is flavorless and tough to chew.  Overall the food was very bland. Lastly, there was really obnoxious speed metal/punk rock playing loudly on the speakers which made the atmosphere unpleasant.  I understand you're a hipster gastro-pub, but people should feel relaxed while dining not on edge from the intense music.
Sovereign has delicious food, tasty beverages and phenomenal service! I highly recommend it for any occasion!

Too many times gastropubs under-deliver and are overly pretentious. This is not the case with Sovereign. Great food, inventive cocktails, and as an English teacher...I enjoy the creative names for the menu items.

Disclaimer: I want to give this place 3.5 stars. Ok that being said: our food was really, really good drinks also delicious but no too hip on the service. I have special dietary restrictions and asked the server for a drink with little to no sugar. His response: yea we don't really have anything on the menu for that. Then I asked for one of their drinks but without the soda and he told me I butchered the drink and if I didn't like it he wouldn't replace it. I also can't have gluten he was impatient about that. But my burger though was melt in your mouth delicious so I'll probably be back.

My husband and I were really looking forward to trying this place, but we were really disappointed with most aspects.  I'll try to be concise here:

Food: Menu is pretty small, but there is nothing inherently wrong with that. I ordered a burger, hubs ordered a spicy pork sandwich, "The Widow Maker". The burger was was billed as a house-ground bacon and brisket blend; I just didn't care for it much. It tasted kind of pork-y, but not in a good way, and it was actually 2 smallish patties stacked on top of one another so they slid all over the place. The ground pork also means you can't get this cooked below "done." I had fries with it, and they were clearly house-made, but not well executed. They were dark brown, greasy, and limp, and had a bitter taste to them. I think their fry oil was old and/or not hot enough. Hubby said his sandwich was OK, it was a little light on the filling compared to the amount of bread, and the jalapenos were just thrown in a pile on each half so there was one or two spicy bites and the rest didn't have heat. The pork itself was pretty good, he liked the kale side he ordered (I was tried the kale and thought it was pretty plain).

Drink: This was one of the most disappointing aspects. My husband was really, really looking forward to a large craft brew list, but we were a little confounded by their choices. The day  we dined, there were 25 drafts, and 15(!!) of them were stouts or porter. That's a lot of dark, heavy beer! And not what either of us usually drinks with a meal. Most of the other 10 were sours, with some really high-alcohol barleywine types mixed in. And one rye flavored with pepper. Almost every beer they offered was being served in a 10oz snifter because they were all that heavy. I really respect that they choose mainly local and all craft, but within those parameters there are still lots of great red or amber ales, pilsners, pale ales, IPAs, etc to be had. I ended up trying a Blood Orange Gose, which was interesting but really tart, and hubs had one stout and something else in a snifter that he wasn't super happy with.

Ambiance: They did a great job with the building, it's and old house with a cool feel. Loved the music they had playing in the background. Unfortunately, we were seated in a long, narrow room (converted sunroom, maybe? Lots of pretty windows) with a screaming toddler at either end of the room. Now, I can't really fault the restaurant for that- it's just bad luck- but it totally killed the vibe. 

Service: The gentleman that served us was nice enough, but he never told us about any specials even though several items on their menu are rotating market price options, and there seemed to be big gaps between his visits to our table. He just didn't seem to be very enthusiastic about... anything. Sigh...

TL;DR Food was lackluster, beer list was way too specific. About $50 for 3 beers and 2 sandwiches, before tip. We won't return.

Went back tonight with a party of 8. I gathered all of my coworkers together for a night out. Sovereign was my choice after my last amazing dining experience there. Once again, impeccable service, amazing food & perfect ambiance. Thanks, Sovereign, for becoming my very favorite restaurant in downtown Plainfield. :)

Pretty good.  I've been to their original location in St. Charles many times years back.  I believe it's the same owners or a franchise.

Ordered the breakfast burrito which is available all day.  The thing is huge and tastes great.  They have fresh sauces / salsas which I believe they make in-house.

Definitely worth a try

I have really turned the corner on this place. I went from thinking it was mediocre to craving chilaquiles constantly and eating here at least once a week. I am a chilaquiles evangelist. I tell everyone about them. Now I am telling you. They are absolutely fantastic. The salsa is so flavorful and the chips are actually CRUNCHY while covered in sauce. Combined with the rich egg yolk, it has become my favorite thing to eat.  My mouth is watering because I am waiting for my takeout while I write this review.


Oh also the horchata is some of the best I have ever had. Very spice rich. I still don't love the burrito, but I just think it's just not the right thing to order.
My favorite place! Great people and great food! The flan- AMAZING. I like the guisado de lomo is my favorite.

I've been here quite a few times in the past 2 years and it's pretty hit or miss. Some days the food is great and some days not great. However, today was good. I ordered steak tacos w/ onion and cilantro for myself, chicken nachos for the bf, steak tacos for my oldest and for the pickiest eater, my youngest, a cheeseburger meal...yes, this taco joint has cheeseburgers. 

I don't always order horchata but today I decided to. Their horchata isn't bad really. A little too sweet this time but still not bad. 

The cashier is usually very nice and the tables and seats were clean every time I've been there. The prices are decent for tacos and nachos.

I had always wanted to try this place out and we finally did. I ordered the combo platter which included a taco, tostada and tamale. My fiance ordered the flautas platter. The chicken was ok. I prefer white chicken breast but did notice some dark chicken mixed in as well. Their rice and beans were delicious and their horchata was a little too much on the sweet side for me. Food came out quick as there weren't many people there. Only major downfall is that they don't give you complimentary chips and salsa when dining in like most other restaurants do!

This is the best authentic Mexican food in the Naperville area. The food is fresh and made to order. Their steak tacos are the best I've ever had outside of the city. I don't know what they put in their chips but they are cooked to perfection without being greasy or salty. Their salsas are homemade and delicious every time. The place is always clean and the staff is friendly. We drove over an hour to get some tacos. That's how good it is!

The steak tacos were amazing, literally melt in the mouth good. My boyfriend had the steak burrito, it wasn't as good. There are no chips and salsa like at the usual Mexican places and also it's different because you order when you walk in, instead of waiting for somebody at the table. Overall, worth the trip if you're craving tacos near Naperville but not if you're thinking of making a long drive just to try this place.

******Naperville location only**********

Trash. I just had a tamale. When I opened the wrapper I could smell smoke. When I tasted it , tasted like smoke. Guacamole and chips is alright, can get that anywhere. Everyone at the company I work for won't touch this place and its walking distance. I promise if you know Mexican food u won't like this place. 

By the way..all the photos listed here....they must have had family night and really tried their best on presentation. Dude the food never looks that good. My job has catered (employees complain everytime) and the food NEVER EVER looks that good. I think the owners had a night where all the employees took pics of their food because its the one time it would be done right. TRASH

After a few months of debating, our office of about 12 ordered based on the decent reviews. The food was ok, however, the orders were completely messed up. We were missing sides, missing entire orders, and given items we didn't even order. One order, for example, was for their Enchilada for $8.95 which included rice, beans, and a tortilla. What we received was only 3 enchiladas.

Maybe for smaller scale orders, Jalapeno Grill would be a good bargain. However, after this corporate lunch, I won't be going back for another dip.

Am I delirious? Reading the positive reviews on this place baffles me. I live in Saint Charles, but work in Naperville. After a lackluster experience and food at the St Charles location, I thought I'd give the Naperville location a shot for lunch.....I should have trusted my instincts and avoided it.

Generally, reviews for restaurants are either really good or really bad. I almost never write reviews (if that gives you any indication). I ordered a pork burrito for takeout. After nearly 30 minutes, I got my to go order (there were 2 people in front of me). Upon opening my burrito, I was shocked at the size--about twice that of a Chipotle burrito. First bite? Gagtastic. The pork was sauted in onion (good)--a bit salty--however, there was literally about a pound of:

-cold refried beans
-cold and raw onions
-cold lettuce
-liquid sour cream

To salvage this damn thing, I had to squeeze out the cold fixin's like a tube of toothpaste.

This is so odd because the place appeared to be run my Latinos! I guess I was spoiled in California with authentic Mexican food. This was simply atrocious and I would highly not recommend. 

The only saving grace was that I only lost $7 bucks out of the arrangement. I ate about 1/4 of what I paid for--terrible flavor, bad service, and a trash can in my cubicle filled with food that could have fed a small village....what's not to love?

Avoid.

This has become my go to taco place in the Naperville/Aurora area. Yeah, it's a little pricier compared to what I would expect to pay in a Mexican restaurant---- but the higher price is reflected on the quality of the food. Plus their prices is comparable to other restaurants in the area. 

I had an obsession with their fish taco--- so amazing!!-- it was fried fish (cod or tilapia?) and some sort of slaw that was just--- addictive. For some reason, the last time I had it--- it didn't agree with me--- probably getting old or whatever. Luckily, my bff ordered their shrimp taco which I got to try and now that's my go to taco. I haven't tried any of their other tacos... so I can't speak for  them. 

Their guacamole 2.5/5 is okay. Not amazing.. but hits the spot if I'm craving it. It doesn't have a lot of flavor or kick to it... and I don't like the quasi pureed texture. Their horchata is pretty good 4/5. Their flan is amazing but inconsistent 4/5... you have a 75% chance of it being amazing... and 25% chance of it being okay. 


Definitely worth a try if you're in the area!

The only reason that I take the time to review this little lunch meal was that I suffered for the next 12 hours from it ....

Lunch close to job site. We had chile relleno burritos, which are one of my favorite treats. Impossible to taste anything in the burrito because abundance of cheap, old, raw onions. It is truly hard to mess up fast mexican food. Poor ingredients will do it, as will careless kitchen work.

I was pretty satisfied with this place, my bf wasn't 100% pleased but I think we have some pretty decent Mexican food places around here and this being one of them. Speedy and big portions, very flavorful! I enjoyed everything very much. I got enchiladas and chips and guacamole, and never able to Finnish it all! Good place though, worth a stop if ur cruising by

The food was very good.  I would rate the food at 4 - 5 stars. However the service was bad enough to warrant a 2 - 3 star reduction and I ordered it to go!

First I called and placed the order and they told me it would be ready in 10 - 15 minutes.  I arrived 15 minutes later, and they told me they had no phone orders but they can have it ready in 5 minutes.  10 minutes later, they gave me the wrong burrito, ground beef, instead of steak.  It took them another 10 minutes to bring out the right one.  I was trying to grab a quick lunch, but it took me almost 40 minutes and made me late for my meeting.

Go to St Charles location. First time at Naperville and was awful.  They put sopping wet lettuce in burrito and had no flavor for burrito and water was running down arms and dripping on floor. I know it wasn't from the meat because the other half of burrito on plate looked like it was in a swimming pool. Clear water cover whole plate. By far worst burrito I've ever had. I'd rather have gone to Taco Bell. At less at TB you know what you're getting nothing great.

This is a hidden gem in Naperville! The food is very delicious and prepared as you order. I mean they FRY you chips for you right when you order it! Delicious! 

Also, you will not have a problem with cold food here! It's served fresh off the grill super hot. We ordered some tacos al pastor and sope. The pastor is just delicious and super juicy. This is a must go. Very authentic Mexican food. Would come back a million times.

Food was ok.. service was terrible, ordered veggie burrito they gave me veggie burrito with meat which I found out after taking a few bites, which was unacceptable being a vegetarian. Server was almost unapologetic about it.. NEVER AGAIN.

$3.50 for mediocre chips and salsa which are free at almost all Mexican restaurants, only free refills on pop and no other drinks, undersized burritos, and WAAAYYYYY to much salt used in preparing the food. Add in the low quality of service and you get a place that is not worth going to again.

Ok. So since my husband got ham enchiladas and I got something that looked like american cheese on my taco salad...I steered clear for over a year. I gave it several attempts and always ended up with a weird texture or the wrong type of food.

However...my husband started going back to this place in the last few months and was singing a different tune. "This place got it together." He would come here when I was at class, knowing that I didn't want to go there ever. It was always his Jen-is-out-of-town-meal (or out-at-class meal, whatever). He kept raving about how it's finally good and now he prefers it.

So FINALLY about a week ago, we were craving some Mexican. He instantly popped out "Jalapeo Grill!"and I finally gave in, despite the ghosts of my prior experiences telling me not to. I simply allowed my husband to order something for me, and we both went home with the pastor enchiladas dinner.

WOW. Talk about a turnaround. These enchiladas were large, filling, and above all, flavorful! The food wasn't bland. The shells were tough. The meat wasn't cold. And the pork was actually pork (not ham)! This meal was huge, and yet I plowed through it and ate the entire thing, simply because I couldn't stop. Delicious!

Ok, so do I take back my previous reviews? No. Those experiences were not favorable and the reviews were truthful. However, I think that places make mistakes and maybe they were still training their staff/getting their bearings in their new location. I'm glad they've learned from their mistakes, because now there are some damn good enchiladas less than a mile from my house!

If I could do half stars, I would do 3 and a half stars. Really good food, but there were some things about my experience that I would have changed if I had a choice.

Not going to lie, I'm an idiot when it comes to knowing the difference between different Mexican dishes. I barely know what the difference between an enchilada versus  tostada versus burrito. So. When I wasn't exactly sure what I wanted, and there was no one in line, the lady at the counter was pretty annoyed with me. Which I found ridiculous. 

Prices are a little high for what you get. Tacos are about 2 dollars per taco. Guacamole is pretty reasonably priced. The plates are a touch high in my opinion in regards to price versus proportion. 

Otherwise the food was good. I enjoyed my enchilada, tacos, and guacamole. The chips were fresh out of the oven which was amazing. Their food was pretty good considering its a walk in place where you can take out food within minutes.

Tasty food and a restaurant that is easy on your pocketbook - a welcome oasis after spending your hard-earned cash in the surrounding home improvement stores. Your food is made to order and therefore piping hot when it arrives. Definitely returning to try everything else on their menu

I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place already. It's a really good casual place with good food, nice atmosphere, & reasonable prices.
I usually come here for lunch as it's close to work & it's that kind of place anyway. 
Today I had the chick tortilla soup, yum, & chicken fajita burrito. (Yup I was very hungry)  the burrito was delish. 
One minor thing, I wish they'd wait on you. Here you place your order at the counter & they bring it out to you. Not a biggie especially for lunch but it's always nice to be waited on.
Just had theeeeeeee worst chicken sandwich in my life! I might as well have been eating rubber. No way near done! The cashier was a little rude as well.

This place is owned by the same family that owns the St. Charles location which is my favorite Mexican place in the burbs. The food here is the same great quality but the menu is more take-out centered. I was a bit disappointed that they don't carry the "puerco pibil" dish here but maybe they will in the future. Wednesday is $4 Margaritas, so I will need to come back soon

Anytime I can find Barbacoa, a well made margarita, and some form of rich ice cream dipped in cinnamon and sweet confection sauce (in this case, Fried Ice Cream) on the menu you can COUNT ME IN!

Growing up in Texas, everyone knows what it takes to make a good Tex-Mex meal. For starters, cheese! In addition, they serve Barbaco. Barbacoa is a slow cooked meat somewhat similar to pot roast, but very tender and very juicy. It's the Mexican way of BBQ, which is slow cooked to produce mouth watering heaven. In the Midwest, restaurants serving barbacoa are few and far between. In my conclusion, Jalapeo Grille offers a good menu and a great first experience sure to delight most foodies that can appreciate great Tex-Mex from the South.

PS., Add some grilled jalapeos for your Vitamin C intake!

The first time I came here I probably would have given it 15 stars, after a second visit I'm thinking I was just over-impressed.

The guac here is great and a pretty good price. Their menu is vast and they serve breakfast all day. You order at the counter then someone brings your food. This is where I'm deducting a star. Both times the service was slow. Don't get me wrong, I know it's not a restaurant but I was expecting a little more. Most recently we had to remind the girl we ordered guac when she brought our entrees. I would have preferred having chips and guac to eat before the food came out. I would definitely recommend their quesadillas and enchiladas. My boyfriend had their tamale last time and he couldn't even eat it because it was so dry.

I wouldn't mind going back here for breakfast some day!

Odd place. I have a hard time visiting an establishment that boasts "authentic mexican food" but features hot dogs, Italian beefs, burgers, and even grilled cheese sandwiches on their menu. Nonetheless, I'm a fan of Mexican food, so I thought I'd give this place a shot.

The first time I went, I got my standard two taco platter with the rice and beans. The tacos were al pastor with onion and cilantro only. The al pastor was awful. Very terrible tasting quality and bland. The rice had corn in it and the refried beans clearly came from a can and were warmed in a microwave. It was edible, but I wasn't very impressed.

I ended up here a second time, this time getting my usual but swapping the al pastor for chicken. ACK! Chewy, chewy chicken... it was so gross. The beans were barely warm, and again... corn in my rice. I managed to choke most of it down, as I was famished but had a terrible stomachache later that evening.

 It's overpriced and the quality of food isn't that great, but with limited lunch options in the area, sometimes you have to make do.

Visiting from out of town and needed a quick lunch. Food was good and about what we expected given the "order at the counter" decor and approach.  If this was a sit-down order Mexican place it might be three stars, but it is good value for the money. 

I got the Mole Enchiladas with rice and beans and the quality was consistent with what you would get at a moderate sit down.

I had lunch here with friends and it was a very pleasant experience. I didn't realize they serve authentic type Mexican food. For some reason, prior to eating here, I thought it was a tex-mex type of restaurant. Anyway, the service was fast and friendly. I had flautas with ground beef in them and they were really good. The rice and beans were tasty as well. One of my friends had the taco salad, which was huge and the ingredients looked fresh. However, the cheese on the taco salad was cut up American cheese??? What?? That was strange, but he said the salad was really good, so who am I to judge...lol. Anyway, I will definitely visit this place again and probably bring my family to try them out.

Awesome tacos! Best on 59!

Great service. 

The daily drink specials are also an added bonus. 

This place is a must try.

Just ordered take out and the food is perfect! We have been on a Mexican food kick lately and Jalepeno Grill ALWAYS hits the spot! The ground beef quesadilla is amazing as is the chicken giant burrito. I don't go there without getting a shrimp taco. It's my favorite! Try eating in or getting takeout, you will be so happy!

After coming here several times, I am finally certain I won't eat here again. Chicken tacos were just okay but they charged us for extra meat we didn't ask for, and forgot to give us several items that we did pay for. All items were soggy and the beans weren't really beans at all, just soup. Don't even think about trying the breakfast, absolutely disgusting! Customer service is terrible. Staff read negative reviews while customers were in line waiting for their food, which is awkward and unprofessional. Cashier was too busy flirting with the cook to get the order right. Even though this place is across the street I won't be going back. There are too many authentic Mexican restaurants in the area to waste money here.
Today was my 2nd time here, and I really liked it here.  Great pork burrito and I love the chips served nice and hot.  The lady at the cash register could be a little friendlier.  I will be back.
Tacos are great here! They also have very good non-meat options for lent! Flan & horchata is also awesome. Prices are also decent.
Been here several times and it never disappoints...always quick service and the tacos al pastor are fantastic!

Great guacamole, good beans and rice. The tacos I tried didn't wow me (chicken and tilapia). They were a little messy and lacking flavor. The folks who work there were very nice and everything tasted very fresh. But I'd probably go back to Totopos before here again simply for the tacos.

Will definitely be coming back again,I don't know why took so long to finally come here. I would order the Chimichanga and the steak! 
Food came out quick & hot.
The place is clean & immaculate and even the bathrooms smell good & fully stocked with paper towels & soap.

Place has great tacos and the chips and guac were good. Would like to see more specials on certain days or on tacos. Overall I've been here quite a bit and do like it from time to time. I would recommend checking it out.

I really like this place. I've been here twice and don't know why I wasn't here before. It's a hidden gem. Their chips and guacamole are very good. Chips are nice and warm. I ordered same platter both times because it was so good...the enchilada platter. Comes with plenty of food. 

Both times we have been here, someone comes around to see how the food was. Overall pretty good service. 

Haven't tried their margaritas. Will have to try soon. They have drink specials and I think weds is their margarita special for $4 per margarita I believe. 

Also serves breakfast all day! Always a plus for me! 

I will be back!

I've been here a couple times and nothing seems to make me want to go back. 

First time I went, my order was incorrect. I wanted a grilled chicken sandwich and they gave me a fried chicken breast was originally a fried chicken breast. It was if they tried to peel off the fried portion and put it on a bun trying to pass it off as grilled. They also gave both of my orders fries when I had wanted chips and salsa. So I got some greasy and sleazy fries and no chips & salsa. I normally like fries so I tried to eat them, but neither myself nor my husband could stomach them since they were so greasy. Unfortunately I was already home before I noticed this flawed order. This was within the first couple weeks they opened so I decided to try them again...

Second time I went in I decided on a couple tacos with chips and salsa. The tacos are nothing to write home about and maybe on the bland side. The salsa is really horrible though, its very watery and almost sweet. 

Overall, I don't think I will be back anytime soon, if at all.

Right now, I'll give 4-4 1/2 stars. This is another new Mexican restaurant that's popped up in the Fox Valley area. VERY tasty as the other reviews have already stated. I went on a couple of Saturdays ago since I saw a review here. It's in a mall that basically is a ghost town. This place just opened not long ago. I've been twice and I can say that this place has the following:

- Good value for what you pay for. I've ordered the regular burrito and let me tell you, you get your money's worth (the picture I posted is a regular chicken burrito). I looked at some other plates coming out (discretly I might add) and the servings looked like a very solid value.

- VERY friendly people. It has a "neighborhood Mexican Diner" type of feel to it. Not too big or small. My order was served pretty quickly and fresh. These people didn't know me from Adam yet they treated me as if they knew me. 

- While there weren't many people in during my visits, I noticed MANY empty plates. History has taught me that dining establishments and empty plates are a good sign. So they must be doing something right. 

Stay tuned. So far, so good. I think I have anoter Mountain King in the making. They're circling the wagons and the "Famous One" is about to go the route of General Custer and Lieutenant General Cornwallis. I'd only say leave the Italian beef and the like alone. I never tried theirs, but when I go to a Mexican restaurant, I'm not think about those foods.
Super delicious!  Love their tort a milensa! Horchata is a must and the service is great!

NAPERVILLE LOCATION--- NEW CHEFS OR MANAGER NEEDED--- ASAP!!  I work down the street and had really high hopes for them. I gave this place 3 chances it got worse each time. The cooks are so sloppy and careless and it shows how sloppy the food is. Most of my coworkers also had an unpleasant experience at this place. Steak tacos fatty and steak tasted old. Steak Torta the second time was very fatty and extremely greasy. Third time the worst steak torta I ever saw. This was the sloppiest torta I wish I took a picture it was so bad!  I threw the plate full of slop in the garbage it was inedible and my coworker had to dump grease out of her taco salad yuck!

Good down-home food, friendly people, and you can get a few things on the menu you don't see elsewhere around Naperville (like huaraches and pozole). I like the tacos, enchiladas, and tostadas, and the pozole during the winter months is great for warming up.

I really want to be in love with this place and I honestly don't want to see it go which is why I'm writing this. My family have only gotten burritos, chips and salsa and guacamole from here and when they first opened everything was PERFECT. As time has gone on things have started to change.. The past two times we have ordered burritos some of the ground beef has been chewy, when we order without beans or whatever it is they're still on there, the cheese wasn't melted, and we didn't get any chips with our guacamole. Again, I'm writing this because I would love to see this place succeed!!!!
I would like to add though that I have never had an issue with the service, they have been nothing but friendly every single time!

Why can't I give this establishment a negative star?  Horrendous service even though it's not a full-service type of restaurant.  I survey their website prior to visiting the restaurant noting that they have a lunch special (not really as I later found out) in regards to a Torta w/ fries.  I wanted to confirm that their torta came with avocado as their site suggested.  The girl behind the counter gave me an accusatory look of "no, you're full of crap trying to weasel free avocado."  Really!!! How can that be your attitude toward a first time customer!!!

Whatever, nbd, I guess.  So I asked for the Torta "Lunch Special" with avocado (1$ charge) clearly stating LUNCH SPECIAL.  She was obviously not aware of the lunch special and assume platter (beans and rice) and overcharged me.  I assumed that they do a torta lunch special to include fries instead of rice/beans because...the torta already contain beans.

Hopefully, their chicken tortas are not as bad as their other items.  Stringy bad tasting chicken on a torta that falls apart oh too easily.  Beans and rice were somehow disappointingly old tasting/bad as well.

I pulled up the site on my phone and showed it to the girl regarding both the special/avocada...of which instead of honestly owning up to her mistake, she gave me a BS spiel of store policy to change without notice.  Thanks, lying biznitch.  And no, this was not miscommunication.  She was perfectly fluent in english.

SOO GOOD.  My boyfriend and I loves this place.  We live close by and do take out.  The food is delicious and consistent.  

The chorizo and eggs are yummy and the tacos never dissapoint.  (my favorite are the fried fish tacos)

The inside is always clean and the staff is friendly

Good food, decent atmosphere, but semi inconvenient with the location- especially when it's construction time. May go there again when the construction is over and done with. Tried the combo platter and it was worth the price of $9 something.

Never had a bad experience at The Jalapeo Grille, either at the Naperville location or at their St. Charles location. The food is soooo good. I love the tacos, the chicken quesadillas, the burritos. Just great, authentic Mexican food every time.
I always judge a mexican place by their chicken tacos, and this place has the best ones. Not only delicious but also huge! Everything else I've had there is also excellent especially the enchiladas.

This was my first time here nice little clean restaurant friendly waitress, I had the chicken tacos on flour tortilla and order of guacamole. The food was outstanding and the service was very good this just might be my new go to place for comfort Mexican food!!!!! I will definitely go back

Went here with my nephew while I was house sitting for my sister-in-law. Had the guacamole and a tongue burrito. The guac was delicious and a generous portion, definitely got my money worth. The tongue burrito was so good. The tongue was cooked to perfection and flavorful.nothing to complain about this place. The hot sauce wasn't really spicy but I'm guessing they are playing to the demographic. I only rate them a 4 because I only ate there once and haven't tried anything else on the menu but will definitely be back. The service was also exceptional.

Ive been here a few times over the past two years, but it seems my recent visit has turned into a fastfood joke, when i ordered my chimichanga with extra beef i waited for it to be made when I started eating it turned out to be some strange mix of shredded chicken and beef basically giving me some blended mess for i guess to save money. I made this aware to the waitress/cashier she reiterated to me that I ordered with extra beef and then after she at first didnt believe me I showed her that im eating chicken on my place which then. I waited another 30 min while to remade it. I didnt get some chips and salsa while a wait as a courtesy and after nearly an hour I finally got my food, and this time it was cut with a massive amount of cheese not extra beef. so if you go here just expect corner nowadays will be cut here and they make sure to nothing to make you visit welcoming when they make you wait forever for them to fix their mistakes.


\\

I have been to this location as well as their St. Charles location many times. Every time we go the food is great!

Their burritos are good, as well as their chicken nachos,and I usually get the chicken tacos with rice and beans. Delicious!!
Real good Mexican food ... Good on pricing the pozole on the weekends it's real good ... Recomended....

Have been coming here since they opened and have tried a handful of their offerings.   I really like their Fajita plate and have had it at least a dozen times now.  
The tacos are good as well.  Be cautious of the Tripas if you're not familiar with what Tripas is.

The place is well lit, and clean.  They have some booze on premises but I've never had any.    

I hope they stay in business, as personally I think they are better than the spot a little bit down the road that is almost never open.
Food was good. I would never order a margarita again. Tasted like an over iced slushy with a pinch of tequila.

Great casual mexican fare, reasonably priced and delicious.  We fed our family of five for $32 including drinks and everybody loved their food.  I had the ceviche and it was fantastic.  Highly recommend.

Very good chicken tacos, not greasy like most places and you will get so full off of even 1 taco because they are so packed with meat and cheese! 

Also horchata here is much better than most places! Not too sweet and not too watery! 

I love their salsa verde too!!!!

Very nice, clean interior! You will actually enjoy dining in as compared to other typical Mexican joints. 

I hope this place makes it! Always seems like its empty but only reason is probably their location... So spread the word and give this place a try!!!!

I ordered a chorizo and egg breakfast burrito for pick-up from there this morning.  the burrito is, no joke, at minimum 1/2 pound and definitely tasty.  but my problem was the grease seeping through the foil wrapper AND paper bag then onto my new car seat -which I am now displeased about my morning food choices.  my suggestion to Jalapeo Grille is that if you know your food is greasy, take the necessary precautions by providing efficient packaging.

Went in from a recommendation from someone who's recently been there.

The girl at the check out was super nice and helpful.

I got the steak platter which came with rice and beans.  Enough for 2-meals. Absolutely everything was delicious, steak very tender, tortillas piping hot sauce was spicy, rice and beans were great and even the hot sauce she gave me on the side was really good and spicy too. I had a rice water too which topped everything off very nicely.

Will definitely be back.

Pass...ordered the steak burrito and a chicken quesadilla and both came out very greasy...like un-eatable greasy.  Couldn't pick up the burrito without getting your hands soaking wet and the quesadilla was laying in a pool of grease when it came to me.

I really wanted to like Jalepeno Grill, but unfortunately it was pretty awful. We ordered Chips and Guac, a chicken tostada, steak taco, pork tamale, talapia taco, and steak burrito.

The Chips and Guac was very good. We were excited that everything was going to follow suit. We were wrong. 

I actually enjoy hole in the wall Mexican food. I love a good late night run to El Burrito Mexicano in Lisle.  In my opinion, this is a step below that.
The fish taco was a product of the microwave. The chicken taco was full of brown meat. The steak was even a step below El Burrito's. The tamale was okay compared the the rest of our order.

I suggest that you drive past JG and just go Chipotle. The staff is nice, but nice doesn't fill my belly.

Most authentic Mexican food you will find in Naperville!  They even make chilaqilles!  I live their green tomatillo sauce! If you don't like real spice don't get it with red sauce.  Shrimp tacos are the best!

It is odd that they sell hot dogs and hamburgers, but I try and stay away from that.

We had lunch here on a business trip on 6/19/13. It was delicious. I had the best chile rellenos of my life. The guacamole is amazing. The tortillas and tortilla chips are fresh made. It's a family run restaurant and definitely has that feel to it. I thoroughly enjoyed it and I wish it wasn't 1,000 miles away from me.

This is base one one visit. We had the enchiladas with chicken. The taste was there but the texture was missing. They were almost soup like. We had it with the green sauce which was good. I would like to have seen them be a less overflowing with sauce. I will visit again. Also we ordered cheese burgers for the kids but they forgot to put the cheese. Serves me right for ordering cheese burgers at a Mexican place.

My partner and I have been to The Jalapeno Grille twice now and were very satisfied both times.  I had the fish tacos and she had steak tacos.  They were both delicious.  The guacamole was also very good.  I hope this place is around for a long time.

Had a craving for some guacamole and decided to check this place out....first I was going to get the chips but instead looked at the menu and saw  that the quesadilla came with Avocado...perfect! I pick up my lunch and get back with just enough time to eat before a meeting, open the box and guess what no Guac!? I called back and they told me that it no longer comes with it even though it's on the printed menu and the website....now here is another thing who charges $4 for a plain quesadilla? This isn't a fancy sit down place or anything!? 
The girl on the phone was nice and apologized for the "misprint" and offered for me to drive back for my side of Guac.....let's just say I am glad Mexican Grill is open again on the next plaza.

Update***

I have been contacted by the business and offered to remedy the situation next time. While I do think the menu should be updated I appreciate the customer service approach and what I did have in terms of their food was tasty.
Very good food, generous portions for the price.  Love to go here for lunch during the week.  Tacho Burrito is my favorite.

Just went here yesterday for the first time and it was awesome.  For some perspective, my two go-to Mexican restaurants would be Jalisco's or El Taco Grande.  Two very different restaurants, but both really good- Jalapeno Grille falls perfectly right between the two.  Not nearly as greasy as Jalisco's (and not quite as cheap), and not as fancy (or expensive) as El Taco Grande.  The food was really good  and definitely reasonably priced (chips+salsa, jalapeno poppers, 2 fish tacos, 3 steak tacos, and 2 fountain drinks ~$24.00),.  And the woman taking orders & serving food was awesome.  Can't wait to go back!
My fiancee and I have been here now a few times. Always takeout.  Needless I am very pleased with the food and service.  This is our go to take out Mexican.

This is one pretty amazing Mexican restaurant. I ordered the Chicken Burrito which was huge, juicy and very VERY delicious. Coupled with the green "salsa" or sauce, I thought I was in heaven. The chips are crisp and warm, just as they should be. I recommend everyone try this place!

Great food and place for Naperville! Happy that it opened up in our local area. Fresh chips & salsa and tortilla soup are my regular fixes. But the steak tacos are to die for yummo. One of my fav local hangouts!

My husband and I have eaten here twice and both times were consistently great. Burritos are huge and their sauces are amazing. Had chips and salsa today- chips were super fresh and warm, salsa equally fresh. I had their fish tacos which were very flavorful. I hope they get more business! We need a good Mexican take-out place that's authentic to stick around!

Great food, good portion size and fair prices. Usually get the steak and chicken, but both are very good. We usually go here at least once a week and the food is very consistent. Staff is friendly, too. 

Been living in Naperville for about 3+ years now and this is by far my favorite spot for Mexican food!

Ok I originally gave this place 3 stars but after a return visit I realized I was being way to generous.  I ordered a ground beef burrito and was served one of the most disgusting things I've ever eaten.  I took six bites and each one contained gristle.  I ended up dumping out the burrito and saw what looked like Alpo...the meat was gray and only vaguely looked like beef.  If I could give negative stars the Jalapeo Grille would get a -5.

My husband and I live near by and we have been waiting for a good Mexican restaurant to come to the area. And let me tell you are experience at the Jalepeno Grille was very good. We decided to try it last night about 5 pm. The waitress barely speaks English and doesn't understand the menu but the place was empty so there was no rush. My husband and I both chose the Enchilada Verde Platter and I had to pull the plate from my husband before he embarrassed us by licking the plate. It was a good size portion so I brought most of mine home and let me tell you, it was delicious today too. Nice warm chips and salsa - it was just yummy. I hope they stay consistent. The male owner (it appeared) was gracious and very helpful when we asked about items on the menu. And he smelled deliciously of limes! The only thing missing is alcohol - a margarita would have made it 5 stars.
Our favorite place for Mexican food.  Try one of the breakfasts, which they serve all day long.
Been here a few times recently and really love the tacos and the burrito with steak and jalapenos was really good I haven't had any problem with incorrect orders

ANY one who gave this place more than two stars had to be either the owner, a relative, or a stock holder.   One of us ordered a steak burrito....evidently ground sirloin is steak....we also ordered the combo platter....tostado, taco and tamale.   The tostado and taco were dumped on top of each other and as a result melded into one unappitizing lump....you couldn't tell one thing from the other.  The tamale was quite cooked enough.  The entire thing was blah.  We should have gone to Taco Bell...as bad as that is...its better than this stuff.

I had an itch for fish tacos for several days. I have not had fish tacos since i was in Cabo San Lucas in May, 2011.I walked into the Jalapeno Grill not expecting to have fish tacos, but they were on the menu. I asked if I could get the fish tacos with the meal (rice and beans), and the cashier said yes. She then asked what type of fish would I like, tilapia or cod? I almost fell over. I  get my choice of fish??? I chose tilapia and they were the best fish tacos I have had in a very long time.

after having been to the st charles location several times, i was super excited to have the jalapeno grille open up a second restaurant right near my home.  they've only been open 2 weeks now and i've already been in three times.  if you want authentic, homemade mexican food, this is the place for you!  i have loved everything i've had there.  from lengua tacos, to chile rellenos, taquitos and huarache.  you can't go wrong here!

The food is delicious and as fresh as it gets short of having a garden and live animals in the back.  I normally do not like guacamole from restaurants, however, the guacamole from this place is amazing!  I actually think it is better then my homemade guacamole.  It is made fresh for each customer.  The chips are also fresh and hot!  The tacos are amazing, I love the cilantro on them.  The flan is also homemade by the owner and is delicious.  It's a great family owned restaurant! Very friendly service!

They opened up a week ago and we finally tried it tonight.  They have only been open a week and half.  Cashier was friendly and helpful.  You can order your food for dine-in or to go.  Nice cafe type dining room but I took my food to go. My food was made fresh...I waited maybe 10 minutes tops.  They have a great menu, from breakfast to dinners....I wanted to order everything.  We settled on Burritos, Tamales, steak Tacos, beans, rice, Quesadillas and of course we HAD to have Guacamole & chips.  The food was fresh, hot and delicious.  Portions were large enough for leftovers (lunch for work tomorrow)!  Can't wait to eat there again!!
Wonderful food! The potato pancakes were amazing.  Will eat here again when we visit this area!

September 3rd was our daugther Baptism celebration. My expectation of having a great celebration had failed on very beginning. That day no one met us and welcomed to our table. I had 45 people waiting behind without a knowing where to invite my guests. As fact, no waiters that would know that as well. I went to office, bar and kitchen to find out where is our table, but unfortunately there was no person who would help. They kind of dissapeared. So I started to invite people for a our daughter pictures. I hoped that was first and last mistake and they took my request seriously to fix situation. NO WAY, IT DID NOT HAPPEN.
Additional cons:  
- no understading how to serve a rectangular tables for 18 people - we had 3 tables  ( middle part of the table was missing a 50% of all meals , they just filled left and right sides - unacceptable ) 
- no one served alcohol beverages except my HUSBAND ( I must ask for a tip for him, but about that later)
- hot food was given in very small amount. I did not get my potato and holubci because it was nothing on that plate. I asked for additional. They brought meal to wrong table. 



Last thing , PAYMENT !!!!!!!!!
You will BE FORCED to pay everything including GRATUITY of 19% (that was never discussed with us). 
Would anyone pay $931 gratuity for all above service? We tried to negotiate that  to 10% of gratuity, but NO WAY. OWNER SAID " If you don't know how restaurant business work and you never been to any restaurant before, I want to let you know that , AUTOMATIC SERVICE FEE is NOT NEGOTIABLE". 
They call police and said we do not want to pay our bill, despite we refuse to pay only 9% of gratuity. 

 VERY BED EXPERIENCE.

The food was very delicious! Beet salad was excellent. It wasn't a typical pickled beet. It must have been baked then chilled and shredded. It was mild in flavor. All other food was great. I ordered the cabbage rolls and they were very good. Everyone else enjoyed their meal.
However... The service was slow and our server was absent for long periods of time when we needed something. I think their business is slow due to the fact they are new and the service is slow.
I would give them another chance
Because the food was so good.

Luv this place!  We sat in the bar area for both lunch and dinner. Upscale potato pancakes are awesome. Stew with puff pastry and stuffed cabbage also excellent. We had prompt service from cheerful servers and enjoyed speaking with owner. Wished signage was mentioned Ukrainian cuisine/lunch/dinner for greater appeal. Try it!
Bad expirience.after waiting for a while we got our food and :salat was old and smelled bad like something was rotten.golubci were heated in a microwave and it looks like 2 days old

Vary bad experience. Bad organization of work, total mess with waiters and orders. Worst banquet hall I ever been. Worst of all - owners do not care of their customers. 
We've been to our friend's BD in hope of getting new food experience. No chance here!

I went for lunch today and ordered potato pancakes and cabbage pierogis. The potato pancakes are served with sauted mushrooms in between. The pancakes are very crisp and delicious. The pierogis are amazing as well and served with sour cream. I also ordered a cappuccino which is served with latte foam art on top. It is presented nicely, but it is not strong enough. As a vegetarian, I was glad to see that good vegetarian options are offered.

OMG! Ukraine style restaurant! i'm impressed! Yes, Food was so delicious. Service was excellent. The girl who served us, had her smile on mo matter what. So happy to see this kind of restaurant in business!

Horrible  service, food was not very good. Spent over 1 and 1/2 hours, server forgot the appetizer despite being reminded. Never filled water glasses. Had to go to Wendy's after leaving to get something to eat
